title: Reward Depends on Intentions
content: Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) said: 'What we do is rewarded based on why we do it. If someone moves to a new place for money or to get married, that's what they moved for.'

title: Receiving Divine Revelation
content: 'Aisha asked about how Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) received messages from God. He said that sometimes he heard a clear sound in his head, like a bell ringing. This was the hardest kind to understand. Sometimes an angel came and talked to him directly. 'Aisha saw this happen on a cold day when she noticed sweat dripping from his forehead.

title: Prophet Muhammad's First Revelation
content: Aisha said that the Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) started receiving messages from Allah through good dreams. He would go to a cave called Hira, where he would pray for many days before returning home. One day, while in the cave, an angel came and asked him to read. The Prophet (ﷺ) replied that he couldn't read. The angel squeezed him three times, then said 'Read in the name of your Lord, who has created all things.' The Prophet (ﷺ) returned home, feeling scared. He told his wife Khadija what had happened. She reassured him that Allah would never disappoint him. Later, they visited a cousin named Waraqa, who was an old Christian man and could read Hebrew. Waraqa confirmed that the angel Gabriel was real and that anyone with a message like the Prophet's would be rejected by their people.

title: The Prophet Receives a Warning
content: The Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) was walking outside when he heard a voice from the sky. He looked up and saw an angel sitting on a chair between the sky and the earth. The Prophet (ﷺ) got scared and went home, asking his family to wrap him in blankets. Allah then revealed some important verses of the Quran: 'O Muhammad (ﷺ), get up and warn people about Allah's punishment.' After this, the Prophet received more revelations from Allah.

title: How the Prophet Received Revelation
content: Ibn 'Abbas said that Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) used to struggle with receiving revelation. When he received it, his lips would move quickly as if he was reciting the Quran. Ibn 'Abbas did the same when explaining this to Said bin Jubair. This is why Allah said in the Quran: 'Do not rush to recite the Quran.' It means that Allah will collect the revelation and give the Prophet the ability to remember it by heart and recite it correctly. When Gabriel comes, the Prophet listens carefully. After Gabriel leaves, he remembers what was revealed and recites it as Gabriel did.

title: Prophet Muhammad's Generosity
content: Ibn Abbas said that Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) was the most generous person. He became even more generous in Ramadan when Gabriel, an angel, would teach him the Quran every night. Gabriel met him for this purpose each evening of Ramadan.

title: Heraclius Meets Abu Sufyan
content: Abu Sufyan was on a business trip to Sham with some merchants from Quraish. They had a truce with the Romans, so they went to meet Heraclius in Jerusalem. Heraclius asked his translator to ask Abu Sufyan about the Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ). Abu Sufyan said he was related to the Prophet and that he belonged to a good family. Heraclius asked if anyone else claimed to be a prophet before him, and Abu Sufyan said no. He also asked if any of the Prophet's ancestors were kings, and Abu Sufyan said no. Heraclius then asked about the Prophet's followers: were they rich or poor? Abu Sufyan said they were poor. Heraclius asked if his followers increased or decreased in number, and Abu Sufyan said they increased. He also asked if anyone who became Muslim would leave Islam, but Abu Sufyan said no. Heraclius then asked what the Prophet taught them to do, and Abu Sufyan said he taught them to worship Allah alone and not associate anything with Him. He also taught them to pray, speak the truth, be chaste, and keep good relations with their kin. Heraclius was impressed by Abu Sufyan's answers and thought that the Prophet would soon conquer his empire. He even wanted to meet the Prophet himself and wash his feet! Heraclius then asked for a letter from the Prophet, which was delivered by Dihya to the Governor of Busra and forwarded to him. The letter invited Heraclius to Islam and warned him that if he rejected it, he would be committing a sin. Heraclius read the letter and there was a big commotion in his court. He realized that the Prophet's message was spreading quickly and that even the King of Byzantine was afraid of him.

title: The Five Pillars of Islam
content: Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) said: There are five main things in Islam. They are: 1. To say that there is no one worthy of worship except Allah, and Muhammad (ﷺ) is His messenger. 2. To pray together with others at the right times. 3. To give a part of your money to help those who need it. 4. To visit Mecca for pilgrimage if you can. 5. To fast during the month of Ramadan.

title: What Makes Up Faith
content: The Prophet (ﷺ) said that having faith is made up of more than sixty parts. One part of faith is being modest and respectful towards yourself and others.

title: What makes a Muslim
content: The Prophet (ﷺ) said: A Muslim is someone who doesn't hurt others with their words or actions. And a Muhajir is someone who gives up everything Allah says not to do.

title: Best Kind of Muslim
content: Some people asked the Prophet about who is a good Muslim. He said that it's someone who doesn't hurt others with their words or actions.

title: Good Deeds in Islam
content: A man asked the Prophet what good deeds or qualities of being a Muslim are. The Prophet (ﷺ) said: 'Feed those who need food, and greet people you know and don't know.'

title: Wishing Good for Others
content: The Prophet (ﷺ) said: You won't truly believe in Islam until you want good things to happen to your Muslim brother just like you want them to happen to yourself.

title: Love for the Prophet
content: The Prophet (ﷺ) said: 'You won't truly believe in Allah until you love me more than your family.'

title: Love for the Prophet
content: The Prophet (ﷺ) said: 'You won't truly believe in me until you love me more than your family and everyone else.'

title: Three Qualities of Faith
content: The Prophet (ﷺ) said: If someone has these three things, they will have a strong faith. First, Allah and the Prophet are more important to them than anything else. Second, when they love someone, it's because they want to please Allah. Third, they hate going back to not believing in Allah as much as they hate being thrown into Hell.

title: Love for the Ansar
content: The Prophet (ﷺ) said, 'Loving the people of Madinah is a sign that you have faith. Hating them is a sign that you are hypocritical.'

title: Pledge of Allegiance
content: One night, the Prophet gathered some companions and said: 'Promise me you will not worship anyone but Allah. You won't steal or have sex outside marriage. You won't kill your children or spread false rumors about someone. And when I tell you to do something good, you'll follow my order.' The Prophet (ﷺ) added: 'If you keep these promises, Allah will reward you. If you break one of them and get punished in this life, that punishment can forgive the sin. But if you break a promise and Allah doesn't punish you now, He will decide what to do with you later.' The companions promised to follow these rules.

title: Protecting Faith in Hard Times
content: The Prophet (ﷺ) said: 'Soon, the best thing a Muslim will have is sheep. They'll take them to mountains and valleys to escape troubles with their faith.'

title: Allah's Messenger is Merciful
content: 'Aisha said that when Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) ordered the Muslims to do something, he would give them tasks that were easy for them. The Muslims replied, 'We are not like you, Allah has forgiven your past and future sins.' This made Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) angry. He said, 'I am more afraid of Allah than all of you, and I know Him better than all of you do.'

title: Three Qualities of Faith
content: The Prophet (ﷺ) said that a person will feel happy with their faith if they have three qualities. First, they love Allah and the Prophet more than anything else. Second, they befriend someone because they want to please Allah, not for any other reason. Third, they dislike going back to being an unbeliever after Allah has helped them leave it behind, just as much as they would hate being thrown into fire.

title: People Saved from Hell
content: The Prophet (ﷺ) said, 'When people enter Paradise and others go to Hell, Allah will order those who believed with even a small amount of faith to be taken out of Hell. They will be blackened but then washed in a river that brings them back to life like a plant growing near water.'

title: Interpreting a Dream
content: Abu Said Al-Khudri said the Prophet said: 'I had a dream. In it, people were wearing shirts that covered some of their chests, but others were even shorter. Umar was shown with a shirt he was dragging on the ground.' The people asked him what this meant. He replied, 'This is about faith and how it affects people's lives.'

title: Haya' is Part of Faith
content: 'Abdullah bin 'Umar said that the Prophet passed by an Ansari man who was scolding his brother for being shy. The Prophet (ﷺ) said, 'Leave him alone because shyness is a part of faith.'

title: Fight Until They Believe
content: Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) said: 'I have been told to fight people until they say there is no god but Allah and Muhammad (ﷺ) is His Messenger. They must pray correctly and give a certain amount of money to those in need. If they do this, their lives and property will be safe from me, except for what Islam requires. Then, only Allah can judge them.'

title: Best Deeds According to Allah
content: Someone asked the Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) what is the best thing to do. He said believing in Allah and him is the best. The person then asked about the next good deed. The Prophet (ﷺ) replied that participating in a holy war for Allah's cause is next. When asked again, he said performing a good Hajj pilgrimage to Mecca is the next best.

title: Leaving out a Muslim
content: Sa'd asked the Prophet why he left out a man from receiving Zakat. The Prophet (ﷺ) said it was because he might be thrown into Hell by Allah, even though Sa'd thought him to be a true believer.

title: Good Deeds in Islam
content: 'Abdullah bin 'Amr asked the Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ): What are some good things to do in Islam? The Prophet (ﷺ) replied, 'Feed those who need food and greet people you know and don't know.'

title: Women in Hell-fire
content: The Prophet (ﷺ) said that he was shown the Hell-fire and most of its people were women. They were ungrateful to their husbands and did not appreciate the good things done for them. If a woman's husband treated her well, but she didn't like something about him, she would say 'You've never been kind to me'.

title: Treat Your Slaves Kindly
content: Abu Dhar was wearing a nice cloak. His slave was also wearing one like it. I asked Abu Dhar why they were dressed the same way. He said he had insulted someone by calling their mother bad names. The Prophet (ﷺ) told me, 'You still have some old habits from before Islam. Your slaves are your brothers and Allah has put them under your care. So, feed them what you eat and dress them in what you wear. Don't ask them to do things they can't handle. If you do, help them.'

title: Two Muslims Fighting
content: Al-Ahnaf bin Qais was going to help a man named 'Ali Ibn Abi Talib. Abu Bakra stopped him and said, 'I heard the Prophet say that when two Muslims fight with swords, both will go to Hell.' Al-Ahnaf asked, 'What about the one who gets killed?' The Prophet (ﷺ) replied, 'He wanted to kill his friend.'

title: Companions Ask About Forgiveness
content: 'Abdullah said the companions asked Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ): 'Who among us hasn't done something wrong?' Allah replied, 'Worshipping others besides God is a great wrongdoing.'

title: Signs of a Hypocrite
content: The Prophet (ﷺ) said: A hypocrite shows three things. Firstly, he always lies when he talks. Secondly, if he makes a promise, he never keeps it. Thirdly, if you trust him with something, he will not return it.

title: Characteristics of Hypocrisy
content: The Prophet (ﷺ) said: A person who has these four qualities is a hypocrite. If someone has one of these qualities, they are showing hypocrisy. The qualities are: 1. Breaking promises when trusted. 2. Lying when speaking. 3. Not keeping agreements. 4. Being very rude in arguments.

title: Forgiveness on Qadr Night
content: Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) said: If you pray sincerely during the night of Qadr, hoping for a reward from Allah and not to show off, then all your past sins will be forgiven.

title: Participating in Holy Battles
content: The Prophet (ﷺ) said, 'If someone fights for Allah's cause and only because they believe in Him and His Messenger, then Allah will reward them. They might get some money or be taken to Paradise if they die as a martyr. I wish I could join every group going for Jihad, even though it would be hard for my followers. I want to die fighting for Allah and be brought back to life, die again, and be brought back to life again, all so I can fight for Him.'

title: Forgiveness in Ramadan Prayer
content: Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) said: Whoever prays at night during Ramadan with a true heart and hoping for Allah's reward, their past sins will be forgiven.

title: Fasting in Ramadan
content: Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) said: If someone fasts during Ramadan with a true heart and hopes for Allah's reward, their past sins will be forgiven.

title: Easy Way to Follow Islam
content: The Prophet (ﷺ) said: 'Religion is easy. If you overdo it, you'll get tired and stop. Don't be extreme. Try to do your best and be happy with the reward. Worship Allah in the morning, afternoon, and at night.'

title: Prophet Muhammad's Prayer Direction
content: When the Prophet came to Medina, he first stayed with his relatives from Ansar. He prayed facing Jerusalem for 16 or 17 months. But he wanted to pray towards Mecca instead. One day, he led a prayer in Mecca and some people were praying behind him. After that prayer, one of those who had prayed with the Prophet went to another mosque where people were still praying towards Jerusalem. He told them, 'I just prayed with the Prophet facing Mecca.' The people at this other mosque immediately changed their direction to face Mecca too. Some Jews and Christians liked it when the Prophet prayed towards Jerusalem, but they didn't like it when he started praying towards Mecca. Al-Bara' said that before changing direction, some Muslims had died or been killed, and they weren't sure what to do about their prayers. Allah then sent a message saying that He wouldn't make their faith (prayers) invalid.

title: Islam Forgives Past Sins
content: Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) said: If someone becomes a Muslim with a true heart, Allah will forgive all their past wrongs. Then, for every good thing they do, they get a reward of ten to seven hundred times more. But for any bad thing they do, it stays as it is - unless Allah forgives them.

title: Good Deeds are Rewarded
content: Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) said: If you follow Islam closely, your good actions will be rewarded many times over. For each good thing you do, you'll get a reward of up to 700 times. But if you do something bad, it will be recorded as it is.

title: Praying with a Balanced Heart
content: 'Aisha told me that the Prophet came while she was sitting with a woman who prayed too much. He asked, 'Who is this?' and Aisha said it was her. The Prophet (ﷺ) said, 'Do good deeds that are easy for you to do. Allah doesn't get tired of giving rewards, but you will get tired if you overdo it.'

title: Leaving Hell through Faith
content: The Prophet (ﷺ) said: If someone says 'There is no god but Allah' with faith in their heart equal to a tiny grain of barley, they will be saved from Hell. If the faith is like a small wheat grain, they will also be saved. And if it's as small as an atom, they too will escape.

title: Umar and a Jewish Man
content: 'Umar bin Al-Khattab met a Jew who said, 'If this verse was in our book, we'd celebrate the day it was revealed.' The verse is: 'Today I have perfected your religion for you, completed My favor upon you, And have chosen for you Islam as your religion.' (5:3) 'Umar asked when and where this verse came to the Prophet. The Jew said he didn't know. 'Umar replied, 'I do. It was a Friday at Arafat during Hajj'.

title: A Man Asks About Islam
content: A man from a place called Najd came to the Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ). He had messy hair and was speaking loudly, but we couldn't understand what he was saying. When he got closer, we realized he was asking about being a Muslim. The Prophet (ﷺ) said: 'You need to pray five times a day.' The man asked if there were any more prayers to do. The Prophet (ﷺ) replied, 'No, but you can choose to do extra prayers if you want.' He then told the man: 'You must fast during Ramadan.' The man asked again if there was anything else he had to do. The Prophet (ﷺ) said, 'No, but you can give extra charity if you want.' Finally, the Prophet said the man had to pay a certain amount of money as charity. The man asked if that was all. The Prophet (ﷺ) replied, 'No, but you can choose to give more if you want.' The man then left and said: 'I will do exactly what I'm supposed to do, nothing less or more.' The Prophet (ﷺ) said: 'If he's telling the truth, then he'll be successful'.

title: Reward for Attending Funeral
content: Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) said: If you attend a Muslim's funeral with good intentions and stay until the prayer is finished, you get two rewards. If you only pray at the funeral but leave before it's buried, you still get one reward.

title: Abusing a Muslim
content: The Prophet (ﷺ) said, 'Abusing a Muslim is wrong and killing one is not being a believer.'

title: Finding the Night of Decree
content: 'Ubada bin As-Samit said: The Prophet (ﷺ) went out to tell us when the night of Al-Qadr is, but two Muslim men argued. He said, 'I forgot because of their argument. Maybe it's better for you that I didn't remember. Look for it in the 7th, 9th or 5th nights of the last ten days of Ramadan.'

title: Gabriel Teaches Faith and Islam
content: One day the Prophet was with some people. Gabriel came and asked what faith is. The Prophet (ﷺ) said: 'Faith means believing in Allah, His angels, meeting Him, His messengers, and resurrection.' Then Gabriel asked about Islam. The Prophet (ﷺ) replied: 'Islam is worshipping only Allah, praying perfectly, giving charity, and fasting during Ramadan.' Gabriel then asked about perfection. The Prophet (ﷺ) said: 'Perfection is worshipping Allah as if you see Him. If not, think He's watching you.' Gabriel asked when the Day of Judgment will come. The Prophet (ﷺ) replied that nobody knows except Allah. He told Gabriel to leave, but he couldn't be seen again. The Prophet (ﷺ) said Gabriel was teaching people about their religion.

title: Heraclius Understands Islam
content: 'Abdullah bin 'Abbas told me that Abu Sufyan said Heraclius asked him: 'Are the followers of Muhammad (ﷺ) increasing or decreasing?' He replied, 'They are increasing.' Heraclius said this is how faith grows until it's complete. He also asked if anyone leaves Islam after joining it. Abu Sufyan said no one does. Heraclius said that when true faith enters your heart and you're completely happy with it, nobody will be unhappy about it.

title: Forbidden Acts in Islam
content: Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) said: 'Some things are clearly right or wrong. But there are also some actions that are not clear and most people don't know about them. If you avoid these unclear actions, you will be safe in your faith and reputation. If you do these unclear actions, it's like a shepherd who grazes near someone else's private land - he might get caught at any time. Every leader has protected areas, and the protected area of Allah on earth is what He has forbidden. Be careful! The heart is a part of our body that can be good or bad. If it becomes good, the whole body becomes good too. But if it gets spoiled, the whole body gets spoiled as well.'

title: Welcome to Islam
content: Ibn 'Abbas invited me to stay with him for two months. He told me about a group from the tribe of Rabi'a who visited the Prophet. They asked how they could get to the Prophet safely, as there was an enemy tribe in between. The Prophet (ﷺ) welcomed them and said they would not be ashamed or regret their visit. They asked what good deeds they should do so they could tell others back home. The Prophet (ﷺ) told them to believe in Allah alone, pray regularly, give charity, fast during Ramadan, and share a fifth of any war spoils with the poor. He also told them which drinks were allowed and which were not. The Prophet (ﷺ) listed four things they should remember: 1. Believe that only Allah is worthy of worship, and I am His Messenger. 2. Pray on time every day. 3. Give to those in need during Ramadan. 4. Share one fifth of any war spoils with the poor. He also told them not to drink from four types of containers: Hantam, Dubba', Naqir Ann Muzaffat or Muqaiyar.

title: Reward Depends on Intention
content: 'Umar bin Al-Khattab reported that the Prophet said: The reward of our actions depends on what we intend. If someone moves to a new place because of Allah and His message, their move is for Allah and His message. But if they do it for money or to get married, then their reason was what they moved for.

title: Spending on Family
content: The Prophet (ﷺ) said: If a man helps his family with the intention of pleasing Allah, it is like giving charity for him.

title: Reward for Spending for Allah
content: Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) said: 'You will be rewarded for anything you spend for God's sake, even if it's just a small amount given to your wife.'

title: Jarir's Pledge of Allegiance
content: I gave my promise to the Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) that I would: offer my prayers correctly, give Zakat (charity), and be honest with every Muslim.

title: Jarir's Advice to Muslims
content: Ziyad bin'Ilaqa said that Jarir got up on the pulpit after Mughira died. He praised Allah and told people to be careful, but calm until a new leader comes. He reminded them to ask forgiveness for their late leader because he liked forgiving others. Jarir then talked about his own pledge of allegiance to the Prophet. He said that when he gave his pledge, the Prophet asked him to be honest with all Muslims. Jarir promised to do this and then asked for Allah's forgiveness.

title: Losing Honesty Before Doomsday
content: The Prophet (ﷺ) was speaking to a group when a Bedouin asked him about the Hour of Judgment. The Prophet (ﷺ) kept talking, and people wondered if he had heard the question or not. When he finished speaking, he said, 'Where is the person who asked about the Hour?' The Bedouin stood up and said, 'I am here.' The Prophet (ﷺ) replied, 'When honesty disappears, wait for the Hour of Judgment.' The Bedouin asked how that would happen. The Prophet (ﷺ) said, 'When those in power are not honest or fair, then the Hour is near.'

title: Prophet's Reminder about Ablution
content: The Prophet (ﷺ) joined us on a journey. We were doing our ablutions for prayer but not washing our feet properly. He said loudly: 'Don't forget to wash your heels, or they'll be punished in the fire.'

title: Date Palm Tree
content: Ibn Umar asked Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) what tree has leaves that never fall. He said it is the date palm tree.

title: Date Palm Tree
content: Ibn Umar said that the Prophet asked him to name a tree whose leaves never fall. He thought of the date palm tree and told the Prophet, who confirmed it was indeed the date palm tree.

title: A Stranger Asks the Prophet
content: One day, a man came to the mosque on his camel. He tied it up and said 'Who is Muhammad (ﷺ)?' We pointed him out to the Prophet, who was sitting with us. The man asked the Prophet, 'Are you the one sent by God to all people?' The Prophet (ﷺ) replied, 'Yes.' The man then asked about prayer: 'Has God told you to pray five times a day?' Again, the Prophet said 'Yes'. He also asked about fasting during Ramadan and giving charity to those in need. The Prophet (ﷺ) answered 'Yes' each time. Finally, the man said he believed everything the Prophet had been sent for, and that he himself was a messenger from his own people.

title: Messenger's Letter to Chosroes
content: Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) gave a letter to someone. He was told to deliver it to the Governor of Bahrain. The Governor sent it to Chosroes, who read it and then tore it up. Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) said, 'May Allah punish them and scatter them.'

title: Prophet's Silver Ring
content: The Prophet (ﷺ) wanted to write a letter but knew the rulers wouldn't read it unless it was sealed. So he got a silver ring made with his name and title on it, 'Muhammad (ﷺ) Allah's Messenger (ﷺ)'.

title: Three Men in the Mosque
content: Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) was sitting with some people in the mosque when three men came. Two of them stood in front, while one went away. After a while, two of them found seats and sat down. The third man left. When Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) finished speaking, he explained what happened to these three men. One of them turned to Allah and was forgiven. Another felt ashamed of his actions and was also forgiven. But the third man ignored Allah and walked away, so Allah ignored him too.

title: Protecting Each Other
content: One day, the Prophet was riding his camel. A man was holding its reins. The Prophet (ﷺ) asked what day it was and we didn't answer because we thought he might give it a new name. He said it was the day of sacrifice. We confirmed that. Then he asked which month it was and again we were quiet, thinking he might change the name. He said it was Dhul-Hijja. We agreed. The Prophet (ﷺ) then told us that our blood, property, and honor are safe with each other. This is true on this special day in this holy month in our city. Those who are here should tell those who aren't so everyone understands.

title: Prophet's Preaching Style
content: The Prophet (ﷺ) chose a good time to teach us so we wouldn't get tired. He didn't always talk about important things, giving us breaks in between.

title: Make Islam Easy for People
content: The Prophet (ﷺ) said: 'Help people understand Islamic rules. Don't make it hard for them. Give them good news about their faith, and don't scare them away.'

title: Abdullah's Preaching Schedule
content: Abu Wail said that Abdullah used to give a talk every Thursday. A man asked him if he could preach daily, but Abdullah said no. He explained that he didn't want to bore the people and was choosing the right time for his talks.

title: Allah's Messenger Explains Faith
content: Muawiya said he heard the Prophet say: 'If Allah wants to help someone understand Islam, He makes them wise. I'm just a helper, but the good things come from Allah. Remember, Muslims will always follow Allah's teachings and won't be harmed by those who go their own way until Judgment Day.'

title: Date Palm Tree Resembles a Muslim
content: Ibn Umar was with the Prophet. Fresh dates were brought to him from a palm tree. The Prophet (ﷺ) said, 'Among trees, there's one that looks like a Muslim.' Ibn Umar wanted to say it was the date palm tree but kept quiet. Then the Prophet said, 'It is the date palm tree'.

title: Two Things to Envy
content: The Prophet (ﷺ) said, 'Don't wish you were someone else unless it's two things. First, a person who has money and uses it for good. Second, someone who understands the Quran well and teaches others about it.'

title: Moses and Khadir's Story
content: Ibn Abbas disagreed with Hur about who Moses' companion was. He said it was Al-Khadir. Ubai bin Ka'b passed by them, so Ibn Abbas asked him if he knew anything about the Prophet mentioning this story. Ubai said yes. The Prophet (ﷺ) said that while Moses was sitting with some people, a man came and asked him if anyone was more knowledgeable than him. Moses said no. Then Allah sent a message to Moses saying Al-Khadir was more learned. Moses asked how to find him, so Allah told him to look for a fish in the sea. When they found the fish, they would meet Al-Khadir. They went back and retraced their steps, but forgot the fish. The servant boy reminded them about it, and they went back again. When they found the fish, they met Al-Khadir.

title: Prophet's Blessing for Knowledge
content: The Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) embraced me and said to Allah: 'Give him knowledge of the Quran'.

title: Ibn Abbas Meets the Prophet
content: One day, I, Ibn Abbas, rode a donkey to Mina. The Prophet (ﷺ) was praying there. There were no walls in front of him. As I walked past some people who were praying, I let my donkey loose and joined their row. No one stopped me.

title: Prophet Muhammad Helps a Child
content: When I was five years old, the Prophet took water from a bucket and threw it on my face to clean me up.

title: Moses and Khadir's Story
content: Ibn Abbas and his friend Hur had a disagreement about who Moses' companion was. They asked Ubai bin Ka'b if he knew anything about it. He said yes, and told them what the Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) said: A man came to Moses while he was with some other Israelites and asked, 'Is there anyone more knowledgeable than you?' Moses said no. Then Allah sent a message saying that Khadir, one of His servants, was more learned than Moses. Moses wanted to meet Khadir, so Allah gave him a sign - a fish. When the fish disappeared, Moses had to go back to where he lost it and there he would find Khadir. Moses went looking for the fish in the sea with his servant boy. The boy said he forgot the fish because Satan made him forget. Moses realized that was what they were searching for. They went back and found Khadir.

title: Guidance Like Rain
content: The Prophet (ﷺ) said: 'Imagine a big rain falling on the earth. Some areas are fertile and absorb the water, making plants grow. Other areas hold the water but don't let it go to waste - people use it for drinking, feeding their animals, and growing crops. But some land is barren and can't even keep the water. It's like a person who understands Allah's message, learns from it, and teaches others. And it's also like someone who ignores Allah's guidance and doesn't benefit from it.'

title: Signs of the End Times
content: Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) said: 'Some signs that the Day of Judgment is near are when knowledgeable people die and no one knows their knowledge. When people become ignorant about what's right. When people drink alcohol freely. And when people have sex outside marriage openly.'

title: Signs of the End Times
content: I heard the Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) say: 'Some signs that the Day of Judgment is near are: People will know less about God's teachings. Many people will be ignorant of what is right and wrong. Immorality will become more common. There will be many women, but fewer men, so one man may have to take care of 50 women.'

title: Prophet's Dream About Knowledge
content: Ibn Umar said the Prophet had a dream where he was given a cup of milk. He drank it all and then gave what was left to Umar. The companions asked him about the dream, and he said it meant knowledge.

title: Forgotten Hajj Rituals
content: During his last Hajj, the Prophet stopped at Mina to answer questions. A man forgot and had his head shaved before slaughtering a sacrifice animal. The Prophet (ﷺ) said it's okay, go slaughter now. Another person did the same with throwing pebbles at Jamra. The Prophet (ﷺ) said do it now, there's no harm. That day, if someone asked about doing something before or after its time, the Prophet would say 'do it now, no problem'.

title: Slaughtering and Sacrifice
content: Ibn Abbas asked the Prophet about two things. One person had slaughtered an animal before throwing stones at the Kaaba. The Prophet (ﷺ) said it was okay. Another person had shaved their head before sacrificing an animal. Again, the Prophet said it was fine.

title: Knowledge and Ignorance
content: Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) said: 'Religious knowledge will disappear. People will become ignorant about their faith. Hard times will come, and there will be more fighting and killing.' Someone asked, 'What is fighting?' The Prophet (ﷺ) gestured with his hand to show someone being killed.

title: Prayer During an Eclipse
content: Asma' came to Aisha while she was praying. She asked what had happened to the people. Aisha pointed up at the sky, and Asma' saw that everyone in the mosque was praying too. Aisha said 'Glory be to God'. Asma' asked if there was a sign. Aisha nodded yes. Asma' stood up for prayer with the others until she almost fainted. After the prayer, the Prophet came out and praised God. He said he had seen something amazing in his vision, including Paradise and Hell. He told them they would be tested in their graves, like the test of a man who claims to be a prophet but is not. They will be asked about him. A faithful believer will say 'He is Muhammad (ﷺ), God's Messenger, who brought us clear signs and guidance. We believed in him.' The angels will then let the believer sleep peacefully. But someone who doesn't really believe or is unsure will just repeat what they heard others saying.

title: Welcome to Islam
content: Abu Jamra was an interpreter for Ibn 'Abbas. A group from the tribe of Abdul Qais came to the Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ). They asked, 'Who are you?' The Prophet (ﷺ) said, 'You're welcome. You won't be ashamed or regret this.' They explained they couldn't come often because of a rival tribe and asked what good deeds to do. The Prophet (ﷺ) told them four things to believe in: 1) Allah is the only one worth worshipping. 2) Muhammad (ﷺ) is His messenger. 3) Pray regularly. 4) Give money to those who need it during Ramadan. He also said to fast during Ramadan. And, give one-fifth of any spoils you get from battles to help others. The Prophet (ﷺ) told them not to use four things: special pots for making strong drinks.

title: Divorce due to Foster Sibling
content: `Uqba bin Al-Harith married a woman. Later, another woman said she had nursed `Uqba and his wife at the same breast. `Uqba didn't know this before. He went to Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) in Medina for guidance. The Prophet (ﷺ) told him it's not right to keep her as a wife if they are foster siblings. So, `Uqba divorced her and she married another man.

title: Umar's Visit to the Prophet
content: I, Umar, had a friend from Bani Umaiya who lived near me in Medina. We took turns visiting the Prophet. One day, my friend came back and was excited. He knocked on my door and said something big had happened. I went to see Hafsa, but she didn't know what was going on. So I asked the Prophet if he had divorced his wives. He said no. I was relieved and said 'Allah is Great'.

title: Short Prayers for Everyone
content: A man told the Prophet that he couldn't attend congregational prayer because the Imam made it too long. The Prophet (ﷺ) said, 'Some of you make others dislike praying together. When leading a group in prayer, be kind and keep it short, especially for those who are sick, weak or busy.'

title: Lost Things and Their Owners
content: Zaid bin Khalid asked the Prophet about lost things. He said to recognize what a lost item is made of, remember its container, and announce it for one year. If no one claims it, you can use it. A man asked about a lost camel, but the Prophet got angry and said camels have water containers and can find food until their owner finds them. For a lost sheep, the Prophet said it might belong to someone else or be eaten by a wolf.

title: The Prophet's Anger and Patience
content: Some people asked the Prophet questions he didn't like. They kept asking even when he got angry. He said, 'Ask me anything you want.' A man asked who his father was. The Prophet (ﷺ) replied that his father was Hudhafa. Another man stood up and asked again. This time the Prophet said his father was Salim, a freed slave of Shaiba. When Umar saw the Prophet's anger, he apologized on behalf of everyone.

title: Who is My Father?
content: One day the Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) came out and Abdullah bin Hudhafa asked him, 'Who is my father?' The Prophet (ﷺ) replied, 'Your father is Hudhafa.' The Prophet (ﷺ) told them to ask anything they wanted. Umar then said three times, 'We accept Allah as our Lord, Islam as our religion, and Muhammad (ﷺ) as our Prophet.' After that the Prophet became silent.

title: Prophet's Manners at Door
content: When the Prophet wanted to enter a house, he would knock on the door three times and say 'As-salamu alaykum' (peace be upon you). If he said something, he would repeat it three times.

title: Prophet's Way of Speaking
content: When the Prophet spoke, he repeated what he said three times so people could understand. When he wanted to enter a room, he knocked on the door three times and said hello.

title: Prophet's Reminder about Ablution
content: Once Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) joined us on a journey. We were late for the Asr prayer and didn't wash our feet properly during ablution. He called out loudly, 'Don't forget to clean your heels, it's not safe from the fire.'

title: Double Reward for Three
content: Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) said: A person who believes in Jesus or Moses and then in Muhammad (ﷺ) will get a double reward. Also, a slave who is good to their master and Allah will be rewarded twice. And a master who teaches a female slave good manners, educates her, frees her, and then marries her will also get a double reward.

title: Women Donate Alms
content: Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) was walking with Bilal. He went to the women because he thought they hadn't heard his message. He told them to give alms, so some of the women gave their jewelry and rings. Bilal collected it in his cloak.

title: Who Will Get Your Help
content: Abu Huraira asked the Prophet: 'Who will be lucky enough to get your help on Judgment Day?' The Prophet (ﷺ) said: 'I thought you would ask me this question because I know how much you love learning from Hadiths. The person who will get my help is someone who truly believes in their heart that there's no one worthy of worship except Allah.'

title: Knowledge Will Be Lost
content: Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) said, 'God does not take away knowledge by removing it from people. Instead, He takes it away through the death of wise men. When no more wise men are left, people will choose leaders who don't know much about Islam. These leaders will give answers without being sure, and they'll go astray. They'll also lead others astray.'

title: Women's Day with the Prophet
content: Some women asked the Prophet to set aside a day just for them. He agreed and one day he said: 'If a woman's three children die, they will protect her from going into Hell.' A woman then asked, 'What if only two of my children die?' The Prophet (ﷺ) replied, 'Even two children will protect their mother from going into Hell'.

title: Children and Sinful Age
content: Abu Huraira said that the three children mentioned in a previous Hadith had not yet reached the age of puberty, so they were not considered capable of committing sins.

title: Aisha's Question About Judgment
content: Aisha asked the Prophet about what happens on Judgment Day. He said that everyone will be judged and punished for their actions. Aisha reminded him of a verse in the Quran that says people will get an easy reckoning. The Prophet (ﷺ) explained that this means only presenting accounts, but if someone is questioned about their account, they will be punished.

title: Mecca's Sanctity Explained
content: Abu Shuraih said that the Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) said: 'Allah made Mecca a holy place, not people. Muslims should not fight or cut down trees there. The Prophet (ﷺ) fought in Mecca only because Allah allowed it for a short time. Now, its holiness is still the same as before. Those who are present should tell those who are absent about this.'

title: Protect Your Blood and Honor
content: The Prophet (ﷺ) said: 'Your blood, property, and honor are safe with each other. This is like the sacredness of this month. Tell those who are not here what you have learned.' He repeated: 'I have told you Allah's message clearly.'

title: Don't Lie Against Me
content: Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) said to Ali: 'If you tell a lie about me on purpose, you will go to Hell.'

title: Lying about the Prophet
content: Abdullah bin Az-Zubair asked his father, 'Why don't I hear any Hadith from you that you heard directly from the Prophet?' His father replied, 'I was always with the Prophet. He said,

title: Lying about the Prophet
content: Anas said that the Prophet said: 'If someone tells a lie about me on purpose, they will go to Hell.'

title: Don't Lie About the Prophet
content: Salama said he heard the Prophet say: 'If someone says something I never said, they will go to Hell-fire.'

title: Using the Prophet's Name
content: The Prophet (ﷺ) said: Use my name when naming yourselves, but don't use 'Abul Qasim' as a nickname. If you see me in a dream, it's really me because Satan can't pretend to be me. And if someone lies about me on purpose, they'll go straight to Hell.

title: Ali's Answer on Laws
content: Abu Juhaifa asked Ali if he had any book apart from the Quran. Ali said no, except for Allah's Book or what a Muslim understands by heart. Abu Juhaifa asked about a paper in Ali's hand. Ali said it was about three things: paying money to families of those killed, freeing captives from enemies, and not punishing a Muslim like an enemy who is killed.

title: Mecca's Sanctuary Protected
content: In the year of Mecca's conquest, a man from Bani Laith was killed by Khuza'a. They told the Prophet about it. He rode his camel and said: 'Allah stopped fighting in Mecca. But He allowed me to fight here for a short time. Mecca is now a safe place again. No one can start a fight here after I'm gone, except in self-defense. If someone is killed, their family can choose between blood money or revenge. A man from Yemen asked the Prophet to write this down. Then a Quraish man said it's okay to pick Al-Idhkhir grass for homes and graves.

title: Abu Huraira's Story
content: I'm Abu Huraira. I've told many stories about the Prophet. But there's one man who has told even more: Abdullah bin Amr. He used to write down what he heard, but I never did that.

title: Prophet's Final Wish Denied
content: When the Prophet was very sick, he asked for paper to write a message. But his companion Umar said they already had Allah's Book and that would be enough. The other companions started arguing, so the Prophet told them to leave him alone. Unfortunately, this meant he couldn't write the message he wanted to.

title: Wake Up for Prayer
content: One night, Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) got up and said, 'God is great! Many troubles have come tonight. And many secrets have been revealed.' He told his wives to wake up the other women in the house so they could pray. He reminded them that someone who looks rich now might be poor in the next life.

title: Importance of This Night
content: One day, the Prophet led us in a late-night prayer. After it was over, he asked: 'Do you understand how special this night is?' He said no one alive on earth tonight will be here after 100 years.

title: Prophet's Night Prayer Routine
content: Ibn Abbas stayed with his aunt Maimuna, who was the Prophet's wife. The Prophet (ﷺ) went to the mosque for the night prayer and came back home. He prayed four rakats, then slept. Later, he woke up and asked if Ibn Abbas had slept. The Prophet (ﷺ) got up again for another prayer. I stood next to him on his right side and we prayed seven rakats together. After a while, the Prophet left for the morning prayer.

title: Abu Huraira's Story
content: People say I've told many stories about the Prophet. If it wasn't for two verses in the Quran, I wouldn't have shared any of them. The verses are: 'Those who hide the truth and guidance we sent down... Most Merciful.' Our friends from Mecca were busy with business, while our friends from Medina were busy with farming. But I stuck to the Prophet, happy with what I needed for food. I attended events they didn't go to and memorized things they forgot.

title: Remembering Hadiths Easily
content: Abu Huraira told me he was worried about forgetting the Prophet's teachings. He asked the Prophet for help. The Prophet (ﷺ) said, 'Take off your shirt.' Abu Huraira did this and then the Prophet put his hands on the shirt as if filling them with something. Then he poured what was in his hands onto the shirt. After that, Abu Huraira never forgot anything.

title: Abu Huraira's Two Kinds of Knowledge
content: I learned two important things from the Prophet. I've already shared one with you, but if I told you the second one, my life would be in danger.

title: Don't Kill Each Other
content: During his last Hajj, the Prophet told me to keep quiet and listen. Then he said: 'Do not go back to disbelief by killing each other.'

title: Moses Meets a Wise Man
content: Moses was asked who the most learned person in the world was. He said it was him. Allah told Moses that there was someone even wiser than him, at the meeting point of two seas. Moses and his servant boy went to find this man with a fish in a basket. When they reached the place, the fish jumped out of the basket and swam into the sea. They followed the fish for a night and a day until it stopped swimming. There, they met a man covered in a cloak. Moses greeted him and introduced himself. The wise man, Al-Khadir, asked how people greet each other in Moses' land. He then told Moses that he couldn't stay with him because Moses wouldn't be patient enough to learn from him. They got on a boat with the crew, who recognized Al-Khadir and let them travel for free. A sparrow dipped its beak into the sea, showing how little knowledge is lost when two people share it. Al-Khadir then removed a plank from the boat, which sank. Moses was angry that Al-Khadir had damaged the boat. They continued their journey until they found a boy playing with other children. Al-Khadir took hold of the boy's head and killed him. Moses was shocked and asked why he had killed an innocent child. They then came to a town where people refused to give them food, but Al-Khadir fixed a wall that was about to collapse.

title: Fighting for Allah's Cause
content: A man asked the Prophet what kind of fighting is in Allah's cause. He said that someone who fights to make Islam stronger, fights in Allah's cause.

title: Prophet's Advice on Hajj
content: I saw the Prophet near a place called Jamra. People were asking him questions about their Hajj rituals. One man asked, 'I slaughtered my animal before walking around it.' The Prophet (ﷺ) said, 'Walk around it now and there is no problem.' Another person asked, 'I got my head shaved before slaughtering my animal.' The Prophet (ﷺ) replied, 'Slaughter your animal now and there's no issue.' When people asked about doing things at the wrong time during Hajj, the Prophet would say, 'Do it now and there's no harm'.

title: Prophet's Answer about Spirit
content: I was walking with the Prophet in Medina. He was resting on a palm leaf. Some Jews passed by and asked him, 'What is the spirit?' The Prophet (ﷺ) didn't answer right away. I thought he was thinking deeply. After a moment, he said, 'The spirit's knowledge is with my Lord. You have only been given a little bit of knowledge.'

title: Aisha's Secret Story
content: Ibn Az-Zubair asked me about something Aisha told me in secret. I said she told me that the Prophet once said, 'If my people were not still close to their old ways, I would have changed the Ka'ba.' He wanted to add two doors: one for going in and one for going out. Later, Ibn Az-Zubair did what the Prophet suggested.

title: Prophet's Advice to Ali
content: Abu at-Tufail said that Ali mentioned something. The Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) said: 'Do not go to your wives until you have prayed the night prayer.'

title: Muhammad's Promise to Muadh
content: Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) was riding with his companion Muadh. He called out to Muadh and said, 'O Muadh!' Muadh replied, 'Here I am! O Allah's Messenger (ﷺ).' The Prophet (ﷺ) said this three times. Then he told Muadh that if someone says there is no god but Allah and Muhammad (ﷺ) is His messenger, sincerely from their heart, they will be saved from Hell-fire. Muadh asked if he should tell others about it so they can have good news. The Prophet (ﷺ) replied that people would rely too heavily on this promise.

title: Paradise is for the Pure
content: Anas told me that the Prophet said to Mu`adh: 'Anyone who worships only Allah will go to Paradise.' Mu`adh asked, 'Should I tell others about this good news?' The Prophet (ﷺ) replied, 'No, because people might rely on it too much'.

title: Women's Hygiene after Wet Dreams
content: Um Salama asked the Prophet about women taking a bath after having a wet dream. The Prophet (ﷺ) said yes, if she notices any discharge. Um Salama then asked if women get these discharges. The Prophet (ﷺ) replied yes, and explained that this is why children often look like their mothers.

title: Date Palm Tree
content: The Prophet (ﷺ) asked his companions to guess the name of a tree that never loses its leaves. Everyone thought about different trees in the desert, but I was shy and didn't say date palm tree. The Prophet (ﷺ) then said it was indeed the date palm tree.

title: Prophet's Advice on Ablution
content: Ali had a problem with getting a discharge. He asked Al-Miqdad to ask the Prophet about it. The Prophet (ﷺ) said that after this happens, Ali needs to do wudu (ablution).

title: Assuming Ihram for Hajj
content: Abdullah bin Umar said: A man asked the Prophet where to put on Ihram. The Prophet (ﷺ) replied, 'People from Medina should do it at Dhil-Hulaifa, people from Syria at Al-Juhfa, and people from Najd at Qarn.' Some think he also said for Yemen to do it at Yalamlam.

title: What a Muhrim Should Wear
content: A man asked the Prophet what clothes he should wear if he was going to perform Umra or Hajj. The Prophet (ﷺ) said: 'Don't wear a shirt, turban, trousers, head cloak, or anything scented with perfume. If you don't have shoes, use Khuffs (thick socks) but cut them short so your ankles show.'

title: Prayer after Using Bathroom
content: Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) said: If someone uses the bathroom, their prayer is not accepted until they do a new ablution. A man asked Abu Huraira what 'using the bathroom' meant. Abu Huraira replied that it means passing gas.

title: Abu Huraira's Reminder
content: I went to the mosque with Abu Huraira. He washed his hands and face. He said he heard the Prophet say: 'On Judgment Day, my followers will be called Al-Ghurr-ul-Muhajjalun because of washing their faces. If you want more light on that day, wash your face often.'

title: Passing Wind During Prayer
content: My uncle asked the Prophet about a person who thinks they passed gas during prayer. The Prophet (ﷺ) said: 'They should not leave their prayers unless they can hear or smell something.'

title: The Prophet's Sleep and Prayer
content: Ibn Abbas said the Prophet slept until he was snoring. Then he got up to pray. Ibn Abbas stayed overnight in his aunt Maimuna's house, who is also the Prophet's wife. The Prophet (ﷺ) slept for a while, then woke up and performed wudu (ablution) from a hanging water skin. He stood up for prayer, and Ibn Abbas did the same ablution and joined him on the left side. The Prophet (ﷺ) moved him to his right and prayed. After that, he lay down again until he started snoring. Later, the Mu'adh-dhin came to tell him it was time for prayer. The Prophet (ﷺ) went with him without performing another wudu.

title: Prophet's Prayer Routine
content: Usama bin Zaid said: The Prophet (ﷺ) went from Arafat to a mountain pass. He got off his camel, urinated, and washed his face but didn't do it perfectly. I asked him if it was time for prayer. He said the place of prayer is ahead. He rode some more until they reached Al-Muzdalifa. He got off again, washed his face properly this time, and led the Maghrib prayer. After that, everyone made their camels kneel down. Then the Prophet led the 'Isha' prayer without praying in between.

title: How to Perform Ablution
content: Ibn Abbas performed ablution. He washed his face with a handful of water, then rinsed his mouth and nose. Next, he washed his right forearm, left forearm, and head with wet hands. Finally, he poured water over each foot up to the ankles and washed them thoroughly.

title: Protecting Marriage and Family
content: The Prophet (ﷺ) said: When a man wants to have sex with his wife, he should say 'In the name of Allah. O Allah! Keep us safe from Satan and protect our child from Satan if we have one.' If they are meant to have a child, Satan will not harm it.

title: Prophet's Prayer Before Using the Toilet
content: When Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) went to use the toilet, he would say: 'O Allah, I ask for Your protection from evil and bad things.'

title: Prophet's Blessing for Ibn Abbas
content: One day, the Prophet went to a bathroom and I, Ibn Abbas, put water there for him to wash his hands. He asked who did it, and when he found out it was me, he said, 'God, make my friend Ibn Abbas knowledgeable about Islam'.

title: Going to the Bathroom
content: When you go to an open space to use the bathroom, do not face or turn your back towards the direction of prayer. Instead, face east or west.

title: Facing the Qibla When Answering Nature
content: Abdullah bin Umar said that people told him not to face the Qibla or Jerusalem when sitting for the bathroom. He replied, 'I saw the Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) doing this while I was on our house's roof. He was behind a screen.'

title: Wives' Nighttime Routine
content: Some of the Prophet's wives went to a big open area at night to use the bathroom. Umar would tell the Prophet that his wives should cover themselves, but the Prophet didn't do it. One night, Sauda, one of the Prophet's wives, was recognized by Umar when she wasn't covered. This made Allah reveal rules about women covering themselves in public.

title: Going Out for Nature
content: Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) told his wives they could leave the house to answer their call of nature.

title: Allah's Messenger Prays Outside
content: I went to the roof of Hafsa's house for a job. I saw Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) answering nature, facing Syria. His back was away from the direction we pray towards.

title: Allah's Messenger Prays
content: I went up to the roof of our house and saw Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) sitting on two bricks while answering nature's call. He was facing Jerusalem.

title: Allah's Messenger Goes to the Bathroom
content: When Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) went to the bathroom, I and another boy would go with him. We'd bring a container of water so he could wash himself.

title: Allah's Messenger Goes to the Toilet
content: Whenever Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) went to use the toilet, I and another boy would go with him carrying a container of water.

title: How the Prophet Went to the Bathroom
content: When Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) went to answer nature's call, I and another boy used to carry a cup of water for cleaning and a small stick with us.

title: Cleanliness When Using the Bathroom
content: When you drink water, don't breathe into the cup. When you go to the bathroom, don't touch your private parts with your right hand and don't use it to clean yourself after using the toilet.

title: Cleanliness after Using the Bathroom
content: The Prophet (ﷺ) said: When you go to the bathroom, don't hold your private parts with your right hand. Also, when drinking from a cup, don't breathe into it.

title: Prophet's Private Hygiene
content: Abu Huraira followed the Prophet to the toilet. The Prophet (ﷺ) didn't look around while he was there. Abu Huraira brought some stones for cleaning and put them down next to him. When the Prophet finished, he used those stones.

title: Prophet's Hygiene Habits
content: The Prophet (ﷺ) went out to the bathroom and asked me to bring three stones. I found two but couldn't find a third, so I brought him a piece of dried dung instead. He took the two stones and threw away the dung, saying it was dirty.

title: Prophet's Ablution Method
content: Ibn Abbas said the Prophet washed his body parts only once for ablution.

title: Prophet's Ablution Practice
content: The Prophet (ﷺ) washed his hands, face, arms, and other parts of his body twice during ablution.

title: Prophet's Ablution Method
content: Humran said that 'Uthman bin 'Affan performed ablution by washing his hands three times. He then rinsed his mouth and nose, washed his face and forearms up to the elbows three times, and passed his wet hands over his head. Finally, he washed his feet up to the ankles three times. The Prophet (ﷺ) said that if someone performs ablution like this and prays two rak'ats without thinking of anything else, their past sins will be forgiven. 'Uthman also said that the Prophet taught him another method: if a man performs perfect ablution and then prays the compulsory congregational prayer, Allah will forgive his sins between that prayer and the next one.

title: Cleaning after Ablution
content: The Prophet (ﷺ) said: When you do ablution, clean your nose by putting water in it and then blowing it out. If you use stones to clean yourself, use an odd number of stones.

title: Proper Ablution and Cleanliness
content: When you perform ablution, put water in your nose and then blow it out. If you use stones to clean yourself, use an odd number of stones. When you wake up from sleep, wash your hands before washing for ablution because you don't know where they were during sleep.

title: Protect Your Heels
content: The Prophet (ﷺ) joined us on a journey. We were late for the Asr prayer and washing our feet quickly. He said loudly, 'Don't forget to wash your heels.' He repeated this twice.

title: Uthman's Ablution
content: I saw Uthman bin Affan perform ablution. He poured water over his hands and washed them three times. Then he rinsed his mouth, nose, and face with water from the container. Next, he washed his forearms up to his elbows three times. After that, he passed his wet hands over his head and washed each foot three times. Uthman said that he saw the Prophet performing ablution like this. The Prophet (ﷺ) said: 'If someone performs ablution like mine and prays two rak'at without thinking of anything else, their past sins will be forgiven.'

title: Clean Your Feet for Paradise
content: Abu Huraira said to us: 'Make sure you wash your feet properly. The Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) said, 'Protect your heels from Hellfire.'

title: Abdullah bin Umar's Habits
content: I asked Abdullah bin Umar about four things I saw him do that his companions never did. He said, 'What are they?' I told him I never saw him touch the corners of the Kaaba except the two facing south. I also noticed he wore shoes made from tanned leather and dyed his hair with a red dye called Hinna. When in Mecca, people assume Ihram when they see the new moon crescent, but Abdullah didn't do this until the 8th day of Dhul-Hijja. He said that's because Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) never touched those corners except the ones facing south. He also saw Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) wearing shoes without hair and performing ablution while wearing them, so he liked to wear similar shoes. And he dyed his hair with Hinna just like Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) did. Finally, Abdullah didn't see Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) assume Ihram until they set out for Hajj on the 8th day of Dhul-Hijja.

title: Washing a Dead Body
content: When the Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) washed his dead daughter's body, he told them to start washing from her right side. They should wash those parts of the body that are washed during ablution (washing for prayer).

title: Prophet Muhammad's Daily Habits
content: The Prophet (ﷺ) liked to start from the right side when putting on shoes, combing his hair, washing or cleaning himself, and doing other things.

title: Prophet's Miracle with Water
content: Anas bin Malik said: I saw the Prophet when it was time for Asr prayer. The people looked everywhere for water to wash their hands and faces, but couldn't find any. Then a pot of water arrived. The Prophet (ﷺ) put his hand in the pot and told everyone to wash their hands and faces from it. I saw water coming out from under his fingers until all of them had washed.

title: Value of Prophet's Hair
content: Ibn Seereen said to `Abida, 'I have some hair from the Prophet.' `Abida replied, 'If I had one hair from him, it would be more valuable than all the world and everything in it'.

title: Abu-Talha Takes Messenger's Hair
content: When the Prophet had his head shaved, Abu-Talha was the first to take some of his hair.

title: Washing Utensils After Dogs
content: Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) said: If a dog drinks from something you used to eat or drink from, it is necessary to wash that thing seven times.

title: Helping a Thirsty Dog
content: The Prophet (ﷺ) said that once a man saw a dog eating mud because it was very thirsty. The man took his shoe and filled it with water, then kept pouring the water for the dog until its thirst was gone. Allah liked what he did so much that He let him enter Paradise.

title: Hunting with Dogs
content: I asked the Prophet about hunting dogs. He said: 'If you let your dog go after a game and it catches it, you can eat it if the dog doesn't eat any of it first. But if the dog eats some, don't eat the game because the dog hunted for itself.' I also asked what to do if my dog hunts with another dog. He said: 'You can't eat the game in that case because you only mentioned Allah's name when sending your own dog out, not the other one.'

title: Waiting for Prayer in Mosque
content: Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) said: A person is still in prayer until they leave the mosque. They must not go to the bathroom or pass wind while waiting for prayer.

title: Leave Prayer for Sound
content: My uncle said the Prophet said: Do not leave your prayer unless you hear a sound or smell something.

title: Ali's Question about Ablution
content: Ali had a problem with urine that came out when he was not urinating. He felt too shy to ask the Prophet about it, so he asked his friend Al-Miqdad to ask instead. The Prophet (ﷺ) said Ali should do wudu (ablution) after this happens.

title: Washing after Intercourse
content: Zaid bin Khalid asked 'Uthman about a man who had sex but no ejaculation. 'Uthman said, 'He should wash his hands and face like for prayer, and then wash his penis.' He heard this from the Prophet. Zaid also asked Ali, Az-Zubair, Talha, and Ubai bin Ka'b, and they all agreed with 'Uthman.

title: Forced Intercourse and Ablution
content: Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) sent for an Ansari man who was dripping with water. He asked if they had made him rush during intimacy. The man said yes. The Prophet (ﷺ) told him that if he's forced to hurry or doesn't ejaculate, he needs to take a bath.

title: Allah's Messenger Answers Nature Call
content: Usama bin Zaid said: When the Prophet left Arafat, he went to a mountain pass to answer nature. After finishing, Usama poured water and helped him with ablution. Then Usama asked the Prophet if they should pray now. The Prophet (ﷺ) replied that there's a prayer place ahead in Al-Muzdalifa.

title: Prophet's Ablution Routine
content: I was with the Prophet on a journey. He went to use the bathroom and I poured water for him when he finished. Then he washed his face, arms, and hands. He also washed his head by rubbing it with wet hands.

title: Prophet's Night Prayer
content: Abdullah bin Abbas stayed overnight at his aunt Maimuna's house. The Prophet (ﷺ) and his wife slept on a cushion. The Prophet (ﷺ) woke up, rubbed his face with his hands, and recited the last ten verses of Surah Al-Imran. He then performed ablution from a hanging water-skin and stood up to pray. Abdullah bin Abbas did the same and joined the Prophet in prayer. The Prophet (ﷺ) placed his hand on Abdullah's head and ear, prayed six sets of two rak'at each, and one witr rak'a. After waking up for Fajr prayer, he led the congregation.

title: Solar Eclipse Prayer
content: I visited Aisha during a solar eclipse. People were praying and she was also praying. I asked her what was wrong with the people, and she pointed to the sky and said 'God is great'. I asked if this was a sign, and she nodded yes. So I stood up for prayer too, but then I fell unconscious. After the prayer, the Prophet praised God and said he had seen something amazing. He told us that when we die, angels will come to ask what we know about him. A believer will say 'He is Muhammad (ﷺ), the Messenger of God, who brought clear truth and guidance.' The angels will let them sleep in peace because they believe. But a hypocrite or someone who doubts will just repeat what others said.

title: Abdullah bin Zaid's Ablution
content: A man asked Abdullah bin Zaid to show him how the Prophet used to wash for prayer. Abdullah got water and washed his hands twice, then rinsed his mouth three times and washed out his nose with water three times. He washed his face three times, then his arms up to the elbows two times. Next, he put wet hands on his head, starting from the front and moving to the back, and did it again. Finally, he washed his feet up to the ankles.

title: Prophet's Ablution Method
content: `Abdullah bin Zaid showed `Amr bin Abi Hasan how the Prophet washed his hands. He poured water over his hands three times, then rinsed his mouth and nose with water from a pot. Next, he washed his face three times, his forearms twice, and passed his wet hands over his head once. Finally, he washed his feet up to his ankles.

title: Prophet's Ablution and Prayer
content: The Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) came to us at noon. We gave him water for washing his face and hands. After he washed, we used the remaining water to moisturize our skin. He then prayed two sets of prayers: one in the morning and another in the afternoon. There was a stick in front of him as a barrier. The Prophet (ﷺ) asked for a cup with water and washed his hands and face in it. He threw some water out of the cup and said, 'Drink from this cup and pour some water on your faces and chests'.

title: Companions Fought Over Water
content: When the Prophet performed ablution, his companions almost fought over the remaining water. This happened because he used a lot of water during his ablution.

title: Prophet's Blessing and Ablution
content: My aunt took me to the Prophet. She said he had a disease in his legs. The Prophet (ﷺ) put his hands on my head and prayed for good health. Then he washed his face, arms, and other parts of his body. I drank from the remaining water. I stood behind him and saw a special mark between his shoulders.

title: Prophet Muhammad's Ablution
content: Abdullah bin Zaid poured water on his hands from a container. He washed them and then rinsed his mouth with one handful of water. He cleaned his nose by putting water in it and blowing it out, three times. Then he washed his hands up to the elbows twice. Next, he passed wet hands over his head, both forward and backward. Finally, he washed his feet up to the ankles. This is how Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) performed ablution.

title: Prophet's Ablution Method
content: Abdullah bin Zaid showed how the Prophet washed his hands three times. Then he rinsed his mouth and nose with water from a pot, blowing it out three times. Next, he washed his face three times. He then washed his forearms up to the elbows twice and passed wet hands over his head once. Finally, he washed his feet up to the ankles.

title: Men and Women Abluted Together
content: 'Abdullah bin 'Umar said that during the time of Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ), men and women used to perform ablution together.

title: Allah's Messenger Visits Jabir
content: Jabir was sick and unconscious. Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) came to visit him. He washed his hands, face, and the rest of his body, then poured some water on Jabir. Jabir became conscious and asked who would inherit from him since he had no family. Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) said nothing, but soon after, a message from Allah was revealed telling people how to divide their inheritance.

title: Miracle of Water for Prayer
content: It was time to pray. Some people near the mosque went home to wash their hands and faces. Others stayed behind. A small pot with water was brought to the Prophet. The pot was too small for one person's hand, but everyone washed themselves from it. There were over eighty people there.

title: Prophet washes hands in tumbler
content: Abu Musa said the Prophet asked for a container with water. He washed his face and hands in it, then threw some water back into it.

title: Prophet's Ablution Method
content: When the Prophet came to visit us, we gave him a brass pot with water. He washed his face three times, then his forearms up to the elbows twice. Next, he rubbed his wet hands over his head from front to back and then brought them forward again. Finally, he washed his feet up to the ankles.

title: Prophet's Last Days at Home
content: When the Prophet was very sick and weak, he asked his wives to let him stay in my house for treatment. They agreed. He came with two men supporting him, including Abbas. I later found out that the other man was Ali. When he arrived, he ordered us to pour seven big containers of water over him so he could give advice to the people. We poured the water into a metal tub and kept pouring until he signaled for us to stop. Then he went outside to talk to the people.

title: How to Perform Ablution
content: My uncle asked Abdullah bin Zaid how the Prophet performed ablution. He filled a pot with water and washed his hands three times. Then he rinsed his mouth and nose by putting water in them and blowing it out. Next, he washed his face three times. After that, he washed his arms up to the elbows twice. He then put water on his head from front to back and back to front. Finally, he washed his feet up to the ankles.

title: Prophet's Water Use
content: Anas said the Prophet asked for water. A small container was brought to him with a little water in it. He put his fingers into the water and I saw water coming out between them. Anas thought that about 70-80 people could use this water for their ablution.

title: Prophet's Water Usage
content: The Prophet (ﷺ) used to take a bath with between one and five Mudds of water. He also performed ablution with just one Mudd of water.

title: Prophet's Socks and Hadith
content: Sa'd bin Abi Waqqas said the Prophet used to pass wet hands over his socks. Abdullah bin Umar asked Umar about it, and Umar confirmed it was true. He also said that if Sa'd narrated a story from the Prophet, there's no need to ask anyone else for confirmation.

title: Prophet's Ablution After Using the Toilet
content: Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) went out to use the toilet. I followed him with a container of water. When he finished, I poured some water and he washed his hands and face.

title: Prophet's Wet Hands
content: My father said he saw the Prophet passing wet hands over his socks.

title: Prophet's Daily Routine
content: My father said he saw the Prophet passing wet hands over his turban and socks.

title: Removing Socks After Ablution
content: My father told me that the Prophet was on a journey. He wanted to take off his socks after washing them, but the Prophet said to leave them as they were. The Prophet (ﷺ) then put his wet hands over them.

title: Prophet's Prayer After Eating
content: Abdullah bin Abbas said the Prophet ate a piece of cooked mutton. He then prayed without washing his hands again.

title: Allah's Messenger Prays Without Ablution
content: My father said he saw the Prophet take some cooked mutton and then leave it to pray without washing his hands again.

title: Prophet's Prayer After Eating Saweeq
content: I went with the Prophet to a place near Khaibar. We reached there in time for the afternoon prayer. The Prophet (ﷺ) asked for food, but all we had was saweeq. He ordered it mixed with water and we ate together. After eating, he stood up for the evening prayer. Before praying, he rinsed his mouth with water and so did I and others. Then he prayed without washing again.

title: Eating Before Prayer
content: Maimuna said: The Prophet (ﷺ) ate a piece of mutton from the shoulder. Then he prayed without washing his hands again.

title: Prophet drinks milk
content: Ibn Abbas said that the Prophet drank some milk. Then he rinsed his mouth with water and said, 'This milk has fat in it.'

title: Don't Pray When Drowsy
content: Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) said: If you feel sleepy while praying, go to bed. It's not safe to pray when you're drowsy because you might ask for something bad instead of forgiveness.

title: Sleeping During Prayer
content: The Prophet (ﷺ) said: If you feel sleepy while praying, stop and rest until you can understand what you are saying or reciting.

title: Prophet's Ablution for Prayer
content: Anas said the Prophet used to wash his hands and face before every prayer. I asked Anas what they did, and he said they would use the same water until they needed to wash again.

title: Prophet's Prayer After Eating
content: I went with the Prophet to Khaibar after it was conquered. We stopped at As-Sahba' for the prayer. The Prophet (ﷺ) led us in the afternoon prayer and asked for food. We ate saweeq, a type of food. Then he got up for the evening prayer. Before praying, he rinsed his mouth with water but didn't repeat his ablution.

title: Two People Being Tortured
content: The Prophet (ﷺ) was walking through a graveyard when he heard two people being tortured. He said they were not being punished for a big sin. One person had not cleaned himself properly after using the bathroom, and the other had spread lies about friends. The Prophet (ﷺ) took a green leaf from a palm tree, broke it in half, and put one piece on each grave. He hoped this would make their punishment less severe until the leaves dried up.

title: Prophet's Hygiene Habits
content: Anas bin Malik said the Prophet used to go outside to answer nature's call. He would bring water for the Prophet to clean himself with.

title: Two People Being Tortured
content: The Prophet (ﷺ) saw two graves. He said these people were being punished for small things. One person didn't clean himself properly, and the other spread false rumors between friends. The Prophet (ﷺ) took a date palm leaf and split it into pieces. He put one piece on each grave. Someone asked him why he did this. He replied that he hoped their punishment would be lighter until the leaves dried out.

title: Respect in the Mosque
content: A Bedouin man was making water in the mosque. The Prophet (ﷺ) told everyone to leave him alone until he finished. When the man had finished, the Prophet asked for some water and poured it over the urine.

title: Clean the Mosque
content: A man went to the mosque and urinated on the floor. The people tried to catch him, but the Prophet told them to leave him alone. Instead, they were asked to pour water over the spot where he had urinated. The Prophet (ﷺ) said that Muslims are here to make things easy, not hard.

title: Walking around the Ka'bah
content: Anas bin Malik said that the Prophet told his companions to walk around the Ka'bah seven times. He did this himself when he visited the mosque in Makkah.

title: Prophet's Response to a Child
content: A child was brought to the Prophet. The child urinated on his garment. The Prophet (ﷺ) asked for water and washed the stain away.

title: Prophet Muhammad Cares for Child
content: Um Qais brought her young son to the Prophet. He took the child and held him on his lap. The child wet himself on the Prophet's clothes, so he asked for water and poured it over the spot without washing it.

title: Prophet's Ablution at Dumps
content: The Prophet (ﷺ) went to a place where people threw their waste. He urinated while standing and then asked for water. I brought him the water, and he washed his hands and face with it.

title: Prophet's Hygiene Habits
content: I was with the Prophet. We walked to a place where people threw their waste. He stood behind a wall and went to the toilet. I left, but he called me back. I stood close to him until he finished.

title: Abu Musa's Urination Rule
content: Abu Musa said that if someone urinates on their clothes, they should cut off the dirty part. Hudhaifa disagreed and said that the Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) used to urinate while standing.

title: Washing Stained Clothes
content: A woman asked the Prophet what to do if she got her period in her clothes. He said: 'Take the stained area, rub it with your hands, and wash it in water. Then rub it again to remove all blood stains. After that, you can use it for prayer.'

title: Prayer During Menstruation
content: Fatima came to the Prophet and said she had bleeding from her uterus that wouldn't stop. She asked if she should stop praying. The Prophet (ﷺ) said no, because it's not a normal period. He told her to pray as usual until her real period starts, then stop. When it finishes, wash off the blood and start praying again.

title: Washing Prophet's Clothes
content: I, Aisha, used to wash the Prophet's clothes after he had a wet dream. Even when there were still water spots on them, he would go for prayer.

title: Washing Semen from Clothes
content: I asked Aisha about clothes that have semen on them. She said she used to wash those clothes for the Prophet and he would pray while there were still water spots visible.

title: Washing Prophet's Soiled Clothes
content: `Amr bin Maimun said he heard Sulaiman bin Yasar talking about clothes that got dirty with semen. `Aisha told him she used to wash those clothes of the Prophet and he would go for prayer while there were still water spots on them.

title: Washing Prophet's Clothes
content: I used to wash the Prophet's clothes after he had a wet dream. Even then, I could still see spots on them.

title: People from a tribe visit Medina
content: Some people came to Medina but didn't like the climate. The Prophet (ﷺ) told them to drink milk and urine from his camels to get better. They did this, but then they killed the camel's shepherd and took all the camels. When the Prophet found out, he sent men to catch them. They were punished by cutting off their hands and feet and branding their eyes with hot metal. The Prophet (ﷺ) put them in a place called Al-Harra where they asked for water but didn't get any.

title: Prophet's Early Prayer Place
content: Before a mosque was built, the Prophet prayed at sheep-folds.

title: Mouse in Cooking Butter
content: Maimuna asked the Prophet about ghee where a mouse had fallen. He said to take out the mouse and throw away the ghee near it, but use the rest.

title: Ghee with a Dead Mouse
content: Maimuna asked the Prophet about ghee that had a dead mouse in it. He said to take out the mouse and throw away the ghee around it, then use what's left.

title: Wounds on Judgement Day
content: The Prophet (ﷺ) said, 'When a Muslim gets hurt while fighting for Allah, the wound will still be there on the Day of Resurrection. It will have blood flowing from it and smell like musk.'

title: Last but First on Judgement Day
content: Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) said: 'We Muslims will be the last people to come in this world, but we'll be the first ones judged on the Day of Resurrection. Also, when you're not near a flowing water source, don't urinate in still water, because you might need to wash your hands or body in it later.'

title: Prophet's Prayer Interrupted
