content: The Prophet (ﷺ) was praying at the Kaaba. Abu Jahl and his friends were nearby. They planned to put camel intestines on the Prophet's back while he was prostrating. One of them brought the intestines and waited for the right moment. When the Prophet was in prostration, they put the intestines on his back between his shoulders. The Prophet (ﷺ) didn't move until Fatima came and threw the intestines away. He then said three times, 'God, punish Quraish.' This made Abu Jahl and his friends worried because they knew that prayers were answered quickly in Mecca. The Prophet (ﷺ) then asked God to punish seven specific people: Abu Jahl, `Utba bin Rabi`a, Shaiba bin Rabi`a, Al-Walid bin `Utba, Umaiya bin Khalaf, `Uqba bin Al Mu'it, and one more person whose name the Prophet forgot. He said he saw these men's dead bodies in a well at Badr.

title: Prophet Spits on His Clothes
content: Anas said the Prophet once spat in his own clothes.

title: Drinks That Cause Intoxication
content: The Prophet (ﷺ) said: 'All drinks that make you drunk are forbidden to drink.'

title: Treating the Prophet's Wound
content: Abu Hazim asked Sahl bin Sa'd about treating the Prophet's wound. Sahl said he knew better than anyone else alive. Ali used to bring water in his shield and Fatima would wash the blood from the Prophet's face. Then, they would burn a straw mat and fill the wound with it.

title: Cleaning Teeth with a Siwak
content: My father said he visited the Prophet. The Prophet (ﷺ) was holding a siwak and cleaning his teeth. He made a retching sound while doing this.

title: Prophet's Night Routine
content: The Prophet (ﷺ) used to clean his mouth with Siwak when he got up at night.

title: Giving Siwak to Older Person
content: The Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) said that he had a dream where he was cleaning his teeth with a toothbrush called Siwak. Two people came, one older and one younger. He gave the Siwak to the younger person first, but then someone told him it should be given to the older person instead.

title: Before Going to Sleep
content: The Prophet (ﷺ) said to me: 'When you go to bed, do a prayer-like ablution. Lie on your right side and say:

title: Prophet's Bathing Routine
content: When the Prophet took a bath after being ritually impure, he first washed his hands. Then he performed a prayer-like ablution. Next, he put his fingers in water and gently rubbed his hair roots. After that, he poured three handfuls of water over his head and finally rinsed his whole body with water.

title: Prophet's Bathing Rituals
content: Maimuna said that the Prophet performed ablution for prayer. He washed his private parts and poured water over his body, but didn't wash his feet first. Then he withdrew from the bathing area and washed his feet separately.

title: Sharing One Bath Pot
content: The Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) and I used to take a bath from the same pot called 'Faraq'.

title: Aisha's Bathing Routine
content: Abu Salama asked Aisha about the Prophet's bathing method. She brought a small pot of water and washed herself, pouring it over her head while a screen hid her from view.

title: Bathing with a Sa' of Water
content: Abu Ja`far and his father were with Jabir bin `Abdullah. People asked Jabir about taking a bath. He said, 'A Sa' of water is enough.' A man said, 'I need more than that.' Jabir replied, 'Even the Prophet only used a Sa' when he had more hair than you and was better than you.' Then Jabir put on his clothes and led the prayer.

title: Prophet Muhammad's Bathing Practice
content: The Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) and his wife Maimuna used to take a bath together from the same pot.

title: Prophet Muhammad's Wudu
content: Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) said: 'When I wash my head for prayer, I pour water over it three times.' He gestured with both hands to show how he does this.

title: Prophet's Water Ritual
content: Jabir bin Abdullah said the Prophet used to pour water three times on his head.

title: Prophet's Bathing Routine
content: Jabir bin Abdullah told me that his cousin Hasan asked him about bathing after Janaba. Jabir said the Prophet used to take three handfuls of water, pour it on his head, and then wash his body with more water. When Hasan said he was hairy, Jabir replied that the Prophet had even more hair than him.

title: Prophet Muhammad's Bath Routine
content: Maimuna said: I helped the Prophet with his bath. He washed his hands two or three times. Then he poured water on one hand and cleaned himself. Next, he rubbed his hands in the dirt to clean them. After that, he rinsed his mouth, blew out water from his nose, and washed his face. He also washed both arms and then poured water over his body. Finally, he washed his feet.

title: Prophet's Bathing Routine
content: When the Prophet had a bath after being intimate with his wife or having a wet dream, he would ask for some perfume. He would rub it on one side of his head first and then the other, before rubbing the middle part with both hands.

title: Prophet's Bathing Routine
content: Maimuna helped the Prophet with his bath. He washed his hands first by pouring water from his right hand onto his left, then rinsed them. Next, he cleaned himself privately and rubbed his hands on the ground to clean them again. He washed his face, mouth, and nose, and poured water over his head. After washing his feet, a towel was offered but he didn't use it.

title: Prophet's Bathing After Intimacy
content: Maimuna said the Prophet took a bath after intimacy. He cleaned his private parts with his hand, then rubbed it on the ground and washed it. Next, he did a prayer ablution and finally washed his feet.

title: Sharing One Pot of Water
content: The Prophet (ﷺ) and I used to take a bath together from the same pot. We would wash our hands in turn, one after the other.

title: Washing Hands First
content: When the Prophet took a bath after intimate contact, he washed his hands first before washing the rest of his body.

title: Sharing One Pot After Bath
content: Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) and I would use the same pot of water to clean ourselves after a private bath.

title: Sharing a Single Pot
content: The Prophet (ﷺ) and one of his wives used to take turns bathing from the same pot of water. This happened after they had become ritually impure, which means they needed to clean themselves before praying again.

title: Allah's Messenger Takes a Bath
content: Maimuna helped Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) get ready for his bath. He washed his hands twice or three times, then cleaned himself with water from his right hand to his left. Next, he rinsed his mouth and nose by putting water in them and blowing it out. After that, he washed his face, arms, and head three times, and finally poured water over his body.

title: Allah's Messenger Takes a Bath
content: Maimuna bint Al-Harith said: I prepared water for the bath of Allah's Messenger (ﷺ). He washed his hands once or twice, then poured water over his private parts with his right hand. Next, he rubbed his left hand on the ground and washed it. He rinsed his mouth and nose by blowing out the water. Then, he washed his face, arms, head, and body. After that, he washed his feet. I offered him a towel, but he didn't take it.

title: Aisha's Story about Prophet Muhammad
content: Aisha said that she used to put perfume on the Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ). He would then visit his wives and later go for a special prayer, but the smell of the perfume was still there in the morning.

title: The Prophet's Visits to His Wives
content: Anas bin Malik said the Prophet used to visit all his wives in a round during the day and night. There were eleven of them. I asked Anas if the Prophet had enough strength for this, and he replied that we thought the Prophet was given the strength of thirty men.

title: Prophet's Advice on Ablution
content: Ali had a problem with his urine. He asked someone to ask the Prophet about it. The Prophet (ﷺ) said, 'After washing your private part, do wudu (ablution)'.

title: Muhammad's Morning Routine
content: Aisha told me that she had perfumed the Prophet. He then went around his wives and had sex with them all. After this, he took a bath and became a Muhrim (a person in a state of ritual purity).

title: Muhammad as a Muhrim
content: I remember looking at the Prophet's hair while he was in a state of Ihram. His head hair had some scent on it, near his parting.

title: Prophet Muhammad's Bath Routine
content: When Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) needed to wash after sex, he first washed his hands and did a prayer ablution. Then he took a full bath and rubbed his hair until it was wet all over. He poured water three times on the rest of his body.

title: Prophet Muhammad's Bathing Routine
content: When Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) needed to clean himself after intimacy, he first washed his hands and did a prayer ablution. Then he took a full bath, rubbing his hair until it was wet all over. He poured water three times on the rest of his body.

title: Prophet's Ablution Routine
content: Maimuna said: The Prophet (ﷺ) had water for washing after being in a state of ritual impurity. He used his right hand to pour water over his left, twice or three times. Then he washed himself and rubbed his hands on the ground or a wall, twice or three times. Next, he rinsed his mouth, washed his nose by putting water in it and blowing it out, then washed his face, arms, and poured water over his head. He washed his body completely before washing his feet.

title: Prophet's Prayer When Dirty
content: Abu Huraira said that the Messenger of Allah came out for prayer. But when he stood up to lead, he remembered he was dirty from a private matter. He told us to stay where we were and went to wash himself. After washing, he returned with water still dripping from his head. Then he said 'God is great' and led us in prayer.

title: Prophet's Bathing Routine
content: Maimuna helped the Prophet with his bath. She covered him with a cloth so he could wash in private. He washed his hands, then poured water over them to clean between his fingers. Next, he cleaned his private parts and rubbed earth on his hands to get rid of any dirt. Then he rinsed his mouth, nose, and face. After that, he washed his forearms, head, body, and finally his feet.

title: Cleaning after a Bath
content: When Aisha was unclean from menstruation, she washed her hair three times with both hands. Then she used one hand to clean the right side of her head and the other hand for the left side.

title: Moses and the Stone
content: The Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) said: The people of Bani Israel used to take baths together. They would look at each other while naked. Moses took a bath alone, but they thought he had a hernia. One day, Moses put his clothes on a stone and went out to bathe. But the stone ran away with his clothes! Moses followed it, shouting 'My clothes!' The people saw him and realized he didn't have any problem. They were surprised. Moses caught up to the stone and started beating it. Even today, you can still see six or seven marks on that stone from how hard Moses hit it.

title: Job's Experience with Locusts
content: Prophet Job was taking a bath naked. Golden locusts started falling on him. He collected them in his clothes. His Lord asked, 'Don't you have enough?' Job said, 'Yes, but I still need Your blessings.'

title: Um Hani Meets the Prophet
content: Um Hani went to see Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) in Mecca after it was conquered. She found him taking a bath, and Fatima was hiding him from view. The Prophet (ﷺ) asked who she was, and Um Hani said her name.

title: Prophet's Ghusl Ritual
content: Maimuna screened the Prophet while he was taking a bath after having sex. He washed his hands first, then poured water from his right hand over his left and cleaned himself. Next, he rubbed his hand on the ground and did an ablution like for prayer, but didn't wash his feet yet. Finally, he poured more water over his body, moved away, and washed his feet.

title: Women and Wet Dreams
content: Um Sulaim asked the Prophet: 'Is a woman required to take a bath after having a wet dream?' The Prophet (ﷺ) replied, 'Yes, if she notices any discharge.'

title: Prophet's Reaction to Impurity
content: The Prophet (ﷺ) met me in a street of Medina. I was not clean after using the bathroom. So I left him and went to wash myself. When I came back, he asked where I had been. I said I wasn't feeling well, so I didn't want to sit with him. He said, 'God is great! A good person never gets dirty.'

title: The Prophet's Visits to His Wives
content: The Prophet (ﷺ) used to visit all his wives in one night. At that time, he had nine wives.

title: Prophet's Reaction to Impurity
content: The Prophet (ﷺ) met me when I was in a state of impurity. He took my hand and we sat down together. I went home, had a bath, and came back. When I returned, he asked me where I had been. I told him about taking a bath because of being impure. The Prophet (ﷺ) said, 'It's amazing! A true believer never becomes impure.'

title: Prophet's Sleep and Ablution
content: Abu Salama asked Aisha if the Prophet used to sleep after becoming Junub. She said yes, but he would always perform ablution before going to bed.

title: Sleeping after Ablution
content: Umar asked the Prophet if someone who is impure can sleep. The Prophet (ﷺ) said yes, as long as they do ablution first.

title: Prophet's Sleep Time Hygiene
content: When the Prophet wanted to sleep after using the bathroom, he would wash his private parts and do a prayer ablution like for regular prayers.

title: Sleeping after Ablution
content: Umar asked the Prophet if someone who is Junub can sleep. The Prophet (ﷺ) said yes, as long as they perform ablution first.

title: Sleeping After Wudu
content: `Umar told the Prophet that he had become unclean at night. The Prophet (ﷺ) said to him: 'Wash yourself, then do a complete ablution and go back to sleep'.

title: Sexual Intercourse with a Woman
content: Abu Huraira said the Prophet said: When a man has sex with a woman from behind, she must take a bath afterwards.

title: Sexual Intercourse and Ablution
content: Zaid bin Khalid asked `Uthman about a man who had sex with his wife but didn't finish. `Uthman said he should wash himself, then do an ablution like for prayer. This is what Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) taught him. Zaid also asked other companions, and they all agreed.

title: Washing after Intercourse
content: I asked the Prophet about a man who has sex with his wife but doesn't finish. He said: 'He should wash where their bodies touch, do wudu (ablution), and then pray.' Abu Abdullah added: 'Taking a bath is better and it's what he was told last'.

title: Hajj and Menstruation
content: `Aisha said she had her period when they reached Sarif. The Prophet (ﷺ) came to her while she was crying. He asked what was wrong, and she told him about her period. He said it's something Allah has made for women. So she did everything pilgrims do, except walking around the Ka'ba. The Prophet (ﷺ) sacrificed some cows on behalf of his wives.

title: Combing Hair During Menses
content: Aisha said that even when she was on her period, she would still comb the Prophet's hair.

title: Women Serving Men During Menses
content: A man asked me if a woman on her period could serve him. I said yes, and that it's okay for anyone else to do the same. My wife Aisha used to comb the Prophet's hair while she was on her period, even when he was in the mosque.

title: Prophet Muhammad's Quran Reading
content: The Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) would sit on my lap and read the Quran even when I was menstruating.

title: Prophet's kindness to Um Salama
content: Um Salama was sleeping under a blanket with the Prophet. She got her period and went to change clothes. The Prophet (ﷺ) asked if she had gotten her period, and when she said yes, he called her back and let her sleep next to him again.

title: Bathing Together During Menses
content: The Prophet (ﷺ) and I used to take a bath from the same pot when we were impure. When he was in his period, he would tell me to wear an extra dress. He would also touch me gently during prayer while I had my period.

title: Taking a Bath Together
content: Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) and I used to take a bath from the same pot when we were in a state of ritual impurity. During my period, he would tell me to wear an undergarment and then gently touch me. When he was in isolation for prayer, he would bring his head close to mine and I would wash it while I was still on my period.

title: Prophet's Bathing Routine
content: The Prophet (ﷺ) and I would take a bath from the same pot when we were in a state of ritual impurity. During my period, he'd tell me to wear an extra dress and then hug me. When he was in isolation for prayer, he'd lean his head near mine and I'd wash it while still on my period.

title: Prophet's Kindness to Aisha
content: Aisha said that when the Prophet wanted to touch her during her period, he would ask her to wear a long garment called an Izar. He would then touch her gently.

title: Wearing a Long Garment
content: When the Prophet wanted to be close to one of his wives during her period, he would ask her to wear a long garment called an Izar.

title: Women's Role and Duties
content: Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) went to a prayer place. He saw the women and said, 'Give charity, because most of those in Hell are women.' They asked why. He replied, 'You often curse and don't thank your husbands. I see that you're less intelligent and less good at following Islam than men. A wise man can be misled by some of you.' The women asked what was wrong with their intelligence and faith. Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) said, 'Isn't it true that two women's testimony is equal to one man's?' They agreed. He said, 'This shows a lack of understanding. Don't women miss prayers and fasting during their periods?' They agreed again. He said, 'This shows a weakness in following Islam.'

title: Aisha's Hajj Experience
content: I went on Hajj with the Prophet. When we arrived at Sarif, I got my period. The Prophet (ﷺ) asked me why I was crying. I said I wished I hadn't come for Hajj this year because of my period. He said that getting periods is something Allah has made happen to all women. So, do what other pilgrims do, but don't walk around the Ka'ba until you're clean.

title: Prayer During Bleeding
content: Fatima bint Abi Hubaish asked the Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ): 'I have bleeding and can't pray. What should I do?' The Prophet (ﷺ) replied, 'Don't stop praying because it's not your normal period. When you start your real period, stop praying. Then when it ends, wash yourself and go back to praying'.

title: Washing Stains During Menses
content: Asma' bint Abi Bakr asked the Prophet: 'What should we do if our clothes get stained with menstrual blood?' The Prophet (ﷺ) replied: 'If your clothes are stained, rub the spot and wash it with water. Then you can pray normally.'

title: Cleaning Garments During Menses
content: When a woman got her period, she would clean the blood stain on her garment by rubbing it off and washing it thoroughly. Then she would pour water over the rest of the garment to make sure it was clean. After that, she could pray in her usual clothes.

title: Prophet's Wife Does I'tikaf
content: One of the Prophet's wives did a spiritual retreat with him. She had bleeding between her periods, so she would see blood and put a dish under it to catch it. Aisha saw something similar once.

title: Aisha's Experience in I'tikaf
content: Aisha was with the Prophet during a special time of prayer and fasting. She noticed she had bleeding and discharge, so she used a dish to sit on while praying.

title: Aisha's Mother Does Itikaf
content: One of the Prophet's wives did a special prayer while she was having her period. She was doing this because it was a time for extra devotion and connection with Allah.

title: Women's Clothing During Menses
content: I, Aisha, and my friends used to wear just one dress. When we got our periods, the dress would get stained with blood. We'd use our saliva to clean the stain and then rub it off with our nails.

title: Mourning for the Dead
content: Um-`Atiya said: We were told not to mourn a dead person for more than three days. If it was a husband, we could mourn for four months and ten days. During this time, we couldn't wear perfume or colored clothes, except for simple Yemen cloth. We also couldn't put kohl in our eyes or go with the funeral procession.

title: Bath after Menses
content: A woman asked the Prophet about bathing after her period. He told her to use a cloth with musk scent to clean herself. She asked how, and he said 'Purify yourself'. I helped her by showing her to rub the cloth on the soiled area.

title: Bathing after Menses
content: An Ansari woman asked the Prophet how to clean herself after her period. He said to use a cloth with musk on it and wipe her private parts three times. The Prophet (ﷺ) felt shy, so his wife Aisha explained what he meant.

title: Aisha's Hajj Experience
content: I, Aisha, was with the Prophet during his last Hajj. I had planned to do both Hajj and Umra together, but I got my period and wasn't clean until the night of Arafa. The Prophet (ﷺ) told me to undo my hair, comb it, and postpone the Umra. I did that and finished the Hajj. Later, at a place outside Mecca called Al-Hasba, the Prophet ordered his servant Abdur Rahman to take me to Tan'im so I could put on Ihram for Umra instead of doing it with Hajj.

title: Assuming Ihram for Umrah
content: We set out to perform Hajj on the first day of Dhul-Hijja. The Prophet (ﷺ) said, 'If you want to do an Umrah, you can.' Some people did an Umrah and others did a Hajj. I was one of those who did an Umrah. But then I got my period and kept bleeding until the day of Arafat. I told the Prophet about it. He said, 'Postpone your Umrah, wash and style your hair, and do a Hajj instead.' I did that. Later, he sent his brother with me to Tan'im, where I did another Umrah.

title: Angel's Role at Conception
content: The Prophet (ﷺ) said that when a baby is formed in the womb, an angel is appointed by Allah. This angel says prayers to Allah about the child, asking if it will be male or female, and whether it will have a good or difficult life. The angel also asks how much provision (food) the child will need and what its age will be when it dies.

title: Last Hajj Instructions
content: Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) told us what to do when we arrived in Mecca. If you came for Umra and didn't bring an animal, finish your Ihram (special state). If you brought an animal, don't finish until you slaughter it. Those who came for Hajj should complete it. Aisha got her period while menstruating and had assumed the Ihram for Umra only. The Prophet (ﷺ) told her to undo her hair and assume the Ihram for Hajj instead. She did this and completed the Hajj. Later, she was allowed to do a separate Umra from Tan'im.

title: Fatima's Question About Bleeding
content: Fatima bint Abi Hubaish had bleeding between her periods. She asked the Prophet about it. He said, 'This is from a blood vessel, not your normal period. Stop praying when you get your real period. When it ends, take a bath and start praying again.'

title: Prayer During Menses
content: A woman asked Aisha if she should pray the prayers she missed while on her period. Aisha said that when they were with the Prophet, women got their periods and didn't have to make up those prayers.

title: Prophet's kindness during menses
content: Um-Salama was with the Prophet under a blanket when she got her period. She got up and put on clothes for women who have their period. The Prophet (ﷺ) asked if she had gotten her period, and she said yes. He then took her back under the blanket. The Prophet (ﷺ) would kiss Um-Salama even when he wasn't eating or drinking during Ramadan. They also shared a bath after intimate moments.

title: Um Salama's Story
content: I was lying with the Prophet under a blanket when I got my period. I left quietly and put on clothes for women who have their periods. The Prophet (ﷺ) asked me if I had gotten my period, and I said yes. He then called me back to sleep with him under the blanket.

title: Women's Role in Prayer
content: Hafsa said that women were not allowed to go out for prayer. A woman told her about her sister who helped the Prophet with medical care and other tasks during battles. The Prophet (ﷺ) said that women should participate in good deeds, but menstruating women should stay away from the praying area.

title: Fatima's Menstrual Bleeding
content: Fatima bint Abi Hubaish asked the Prophet about her persistent bleeding. She said it made her dirty and she didn't know when her periods would start again, so she couldn't pray. The Prophet (ﷺ) replied that this was just a blood vessel problem. He told her to stop praying only on the days of her usual period, then take a bath and continue praying.

title: Yellow Discharge Not Menses
content: Um `Atiya said: We never thought yellowish discharge was a period. It's not something to worry about.

title: Um Habiba's Menstrual Issue
content: Um Habiba had bleeding between her periods for seven years. She asked the Prophet about it. He said she should take a bath after her regular period ends, and that this bleeding was from a blood vessel. So she took a bath before every prayer.

title: Safiya's Journey Continues
content: I told the Prophet that Safiya had her period. He asked if she had done a special walk around the Kaaba with me. I said yes. The Prophet (ﷺ) then let Safiya leave

title: Leaving after Tawaf
content: Ibn Abbas said: A woman can go back home if she gets her period after walking around the Kaaba. Ibn Umar used to say she shouldn't leave, but later he said it's okay because the Prophet allowed women to leave after walking around.

title: Leaving after Tawaf Al-Ifada
content: Ibn Abbas said: A woman can go back home if she gets her period after walking around the Kaaba. Ibn Umar used to say she shouldn't leave, but later he changed his mind and said it's okay because the Prophet allowed women to leave.

title: Praying During Menses
content: The Prophet (ﷺ) told me: 'Stop praying when your period starts. When it finishes, wash the blood off and start praying again.'

title: Funeral Prayer for a Mother
content: The Prophet (ﷺ) stood by the middle of a woman's body during her funeral prayer. She had died while giving birth to her child.

title: Maimuna's Story About Prayer
content: Maimuna, the wife of the Prophet, said that when she was on her period, she would sit near the mosque where he prayed. He would pray on a special sheet and sometimes his clothes would touch her while he was in prostration.

title: Lost Necklace on Journey
content: I, Aisha, lost my necklace during a trip with the Prophet. He stopped to search for it. The people were thirsty because there was no water. Abu Bakr scolded me and hit me gently. The Prophet (ﷺ) slept with his head on my thigh. When dawn came, we still had no water. Allah revealed a new rule: Tayammum. We all performed Tayammum. Then, the camel I was riding moved slightly, and the necklace was found underneath it.

title: Prophet Muhammad's Special Gifts
content: The Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) said: I have been given five special things. Allah made me strong and my enemies were afraid of me for a month. The earth is our place to pray, so we can pray anywhere when it's time. We are allowed to take the spoils of war, which was not allowed before me. I will help people on Judgment Day by asking Allah to forgive them. And I was sent to guide all people in the world, not just one group.

title: Lost Necklace and Prayer
content: Aisha borrowed a necklace from Asma' but it was lost. The Prophet (ﷺ) sent someone to find it and they did. When prayer time came, there was no water for washing hands. They prayed without washing their hands and told the Prophet about it. He got a message from Allah that said it's okay to pray like this when you can't wash your hands.

title: Prophet Muhammad Meets a Man
content: The Prophet (ﷺ) was walking from Bir Jamal. A man greeted him, but the Prophet didn't respond until he cleaned his face and hands with some dust from a mud wall. Then he greeted the man back.

title: Praying when dirty
content: A man told `Umar that he was in a state of impurity but had no water to clean himself. `Ammar reminded `Umar of a time they were both on a journey and became impure together. They didn't have water then either, so `Ammar rolled around on the ground and prayed. He told the Prophet about it, who said that would be enough. The Prophet (ﷺ) showed how to clean himself by lightly touching the earth with his hands, blowing off the dust, and wiping his face and hands.

title: Tayammum When Water Is Not Available
content: Ammar said that if there's no water for wudu, tayammum is enough. Shu'ba showed how to do it: he gently touched the ground with his hands, blew off the dust, and then wiped his face with them.

title: Ammar's Prayer After Dirt
content: `Umar was with `Abdur Rahman bin Abza. `Ammar said to `Umar, 'We were on a journey and became impure. I cleaned myself by rolling on the ground and then prayed.'

title: Dusting Hands in Prayer
content: 'Ammar told 'Umar that he rolled in dust and went to the Prophet. The Prophet (ﷺ) said, 'Just wiping your hands on dust is enough for you.'

title: Walking around the Ka'bah
content: Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) said to Ammar, 'You were one of those who used to walk around the Ka'bah naked.'

title: Tayammum Demonstration
content: Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) showed us how to do Tayammum. He put his hands on the ground and then rubbed them over his face and the back of his hands.

title: The Prophet's Journey
content: The Prophet (ﷺ) was traveling with his companions. They stopped to rest and sleep at night. The heat of the sun woke them up. Umar bin Al-Khattab was one of the first to wake up. He saw that people were still sleeping, so he said 'Allahu Akbar' loudly. This woke up the Prophet. People told him what had happened while they slept. The Prophet (ﷺ) said it was okay and they should leave. They traveled some more and then stopped again. The Prophet (ﷺ) asked for water to perform ablution. He led the people in prayer after that. A man who hadn't prayed with them explained he was Junub (ritually impure) because there was no water. The Prophet (ﷺ) told him to use earth for Tayammum instead. People complained about thirst, so the Prophet sent Ali and another person to find water. They met a woman sitting on her camel with two bags of water. She agreed to go with them to meet the Prophet. When they arrived, the Prophet helped her dismount and used her water to give everyone a drink. He also gave some water to the man who was Junub. After that, he gave her food and she went back home. Her relatives asked her what had delayed her, and she told them about meeting the Prophet. She said it seemed like he might be either a great magician or Allah's true Apostle. The Muslims left her village alone, but eventually she and her people converted to Islam.

title: Prayer Without Water
content: Abu Musa asked Abdullah bin Masud, 'If someone can't find water for prayer, should they skip it?' Abdullah replied, 'If you allow them to use Tayammum (dry ablution), they'll do it even if water is available and cold.' Abu Musa then mentioned what Ammar said to Umar, but Abdullah wasn't satisfied with that statement.

title: Praying without water
content: Shaqiq bin Salama was with Abdullah and Abu Musa. Abu Musa asked Abdullah about praying when no water is available after becoming impure. Abdullah said not to pray until water is found. Abu Musa mentioned the Prophet's words to Ammar, who was told to perform Tayammum instead of prayer. Abdullah agreed that performing Tayammum would be enough. However, he added a reason for his opinion: if people were allowed to perform Tayammum even when water is available, they might prefer it over cold water.

title: Tayammum in Extreme Situations
content: Abdullah and Abu Musa were discussing a situation where someone becomes impure but can't find water for a month. They asked if they could perform Tayammum (cleaning with earth) and pray. Abdullah said no, because people might do it even when water is available but cold. Shaqiq said he didn't want to perform Tayammum in such a case. Abu Musa mentioned that the Prophet's companion Ammar did something similar, rolling himself in dust like an animal. The Prophet (ﷺ) said that would have been enough and lightly touched the earth with his hand once. Abdullah said `Umar wasn't satisfied with Ammar's story.

title: Prayer When No Water
content: The Prophet (ﷺ) saw a man sitting alone and not praying with others. He asked the man why he wasn't praying with everyone else. The man said he was unclean and there was no water to wash himself. The Prophet (ﷺ) told him to use clean earth instead, which would be enough for his prayer.

title: Gabriel's Journey with the Prophet
content: Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) said: Gabriel came to me in Mecca. He opened my chest and washed it with Zamzam water. Then he brought a tray of wisdom and faith, poured its contents into my chest, and closed it. Gabriel took my hand and we went up to the first heaven. The gatekeeper asked who we were, and Gabriel said 'Gabriel' and 'Muhammad (ﷺ) is with me'. We entered the first heaven and saw Adam sitting with people on his right and left. He laughed when he looked at his right side and cried when he looked at his left. Gabriel explained that those on Adam's right were in Paradise and those on his left were in Hell. We went up to the second heaven, then met Idris, Moses, Jesus, and Abraham. Each of them welcomed me as a pious brother or son. Then we reached a place where we heard the sound of pens writing. Allah told me that He had ordered my followers to pray 50 times a day. I went back to Allah and asked for a reduction, which was reduced to 25 prayers. But Moses said this would still be too much for my followers. So I went back to Allah again and asked for another reduction, which was reduced to 12.5 prayers. Again, Moses said this would be too hard for my followers. So I went back to Allah one more time, and He said that the 5 daily prayers are equal in reward to 50 prayers. Gabriel took me up to a tree called Sidrat-il-Muntaha, which was surrounded by beautiful colors. Then we entered Paradise, where I saw small houses made of pearls and earth made of musk.

title: Prayer was first two Rak'ah
content: Allah taught us to pray. At first, we prayed with only two parts of prayer, whether at home or traveling. We still pray like this when we're on a journey. But for those who stay in one place, the number of prayers increased.

title: Menstruating Women in Eid Gatherings
content: Um Atiya said: We were told to bring our menstruating and veiled women to the Muslim gatherings on Eid days. They should stay away from their prayer area. A woman asked, 'What if I don't have a veil?' The Prophet (ﷺ) said, 'Share your companion's veil with her'.

title: Praying with one garment
content: Jabir prayed wearing only one set of clothes. He was asked if he usually prays like this. Jabir said he did it to show someone that, in the time of the Prophet, they sometimes wore just two garments.

title: Jabir's Prayer Habit
content: I saw Jabir bin Abdullah praying in just one piece of clothing. He said he had seen the Prophet doing the same.

title: Prophet's Simple Prayer Habit
content: The Prophet (ﷺ) prayed wearing only one garment. He would cross its ends over his body.

title: Prophet Muhammad's Prayer
content: I saw the Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) offering prayers in a single garment. He had wrapped its ends around his shoulders while praying at Um-Salama's house.

title: Allah's Messenger Prays
content: Umar bin Abi Salama saw the Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) offering prayers in a house. He was wearing one garment wrapped around his body with its ends crossed over his shoulders.

title: Um Hani Meets the Prophet
content: Um Hani visited the Prophet after he conquered Mecca. She found him taking a bath with his daughter Fatima nearby. The Prophet (ﷺ) greeted her warmly and asked who she was. Um Hani said it was her, and the Prophet welcomed her. After finishing his bath, the Prophet prayed eight times while wearing just one garment. Um Hani then told the Prophet that someone had threatened to kill a person she had given shelter to. The Prophet (ﷺ) promised to protect this person.

title: Prayer in One Garment
content: A man asked the Prophet about praying with only one garment on. The Prophet (ﷺ) said, 'Do you all have two garments?'

title: Prayer Garment Should Cover Shoulders
content: The Prophet (ﷺ) said: When you pray, make sure your garment covers your shoulders. Don't pray in a single piece of clothing that doesn't cover them.

title: Praying with One Garment
content: Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) said: If you pray wearing only one garment, make sure to cross its ends over your shoulders.

title: Praying in a Single Garment
content: Jabir bin Abdullah asked about praying in one piece of clothing. He said he traveled with the Prophet and once found him praying at night while wearing a single garment that covered his shoulders. The Prophet (ﷺ) asked Jabir what brought him there, then noticed his garment and asked if it was tight or loose. If it's large enough, wrap it around your body. If it's too short, tie it around your waist.

title: Men's Prayer Attire
content: When the Prophet prayed with men, they wore their lower garments tied around their necks like boys do. The Prophet (ﷺ) told women to keep their heads down until men sat properly while praying.

title: Prophet's Ablution in the Open
content: I was traveling with the Prophet. He told me to take a container of water. I took it and he went far away. He answered nature's call, wearing a Syrian cloak. The cloak was tight so he pulled his hands out from under it. I poured water over them and he washed for prayer. Then he dried his hands on his socks and prayed.

title: Prophet Muhammad Helps Build Kaaba
content: Jabir bin Abdullah said that the Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) was helping to build the Kaaba in Mecca. He was wearing a long cloth called an Izar, and his uncle Al-Abbas suggested he put it over his shoulders instead of carrying stones with it on his waist. The Prophet (ﷺ) did this, but then he fell unconscious.

title: Praying in One Garment
content: A man asked the Prophet about praying with only one garment. The Prophet (ﷺ) said, 'Do you have two garments?' A man then asked Umar a similar question. Umar replied, 'If Allah makes you rich, wear proper clothes for prayer. Otherwise, you can pray in an Izar (lower body covering) and a Rida (upper body covering). You can also wear: an Izar with a shirt, or a Qaba' (long coat), or trousers with a Rida, or trousers with a shirt, or trousers with a Qaba', or a Tubban (a type of long coat) with a Qaba', or a Tubban with a shirt.'

title: What a Muhrim Should Wear
content: Ibn Umar asked the Prophet: 'What should someone who is in Ihram wear?' The Prophet (ﷺ) replied, 'He shouldn't wear shirts, trousers, or a hooded cloak. He shouldn't wear clothes with saffron stains or perfume marks. If he can't find sandals, he can wear socks made of thick fabric or leather, but they must be cut short so they don't cover his ankles.'

title: Forbidden Postures
content: Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) forbade two things: wrapping yourself in a garment so tightly that you can't move your hands out or lift the end, and sitting with your knees close to your stomach and feet apart while wrapped in one piece of clothing without covering your private parts.

title: Forbidden Sales
content: The Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) forbade two kinds of sales. One is when a buyer agrees to buy something just by touching it without seeing or checking it properly. The other is when the seller throws an item towards the buyer and they can't see, touch, or check it. He also forbade buying or selling with only one part of a garment.

title: Abu Bakr's Announcement
content: Abu Huraira said that Abu Bakr sent him to Mina with other announcers. They made a public announcement: 'No non-Muslim can perform Hajj after this year.' The Prophet (ﷺ) then sent Ali to read a message from Allah, saying the same thing.

title: Jabir's Prayer Style
content: I visited Jabir bin Abdullah while he was praying. He was wrapped in a single garment and his extra cloth was beside him. I asked, 'Abdullah, why do you pray like this?' He said, 'Yes, I did it on purpose so people can see me pray like the Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) (SAW) used to.

title: Conquering Khaibar and Marrying Safiya
content: Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) went to conquer the town of Khaibar. He rode quickly through its streets, saying 'Khaibar is ruined.' The people came out for work, but some were worried because they knew a battle was coming. We conquered the town, took prisoners and collected the spoils. A man asked the Prophet for a slave girl from the captives, and he gave him Safiya bint Huyai. But then another man said she should be with the Prophet, so Dihya brought her back. The Prophet (ﷺ) told Dihya to choose another captive instead of Safiya. He freed Safiya and married her. On their way back, Um Sulaim helped prepare Safiya for marriage. In the evening, she was sent to the Prophet as his bride. The Prophet (ﷺ) invited everyone to bring food, and they had a meal together. This was like a wedding celebration.

title: Women Attend Early Morning Prayer
content: Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) used to pray the early morning prayer. Some women who believed in Allah would cover themselves and join him for this prayer, then go back home without being recognized.

title: Prophet's Prayer Distraction
content: The Prophet (ﷺ) prayed wearing a special garment with patterns. During the prayer, he looked at these patterns. After finishing his prayer, he said to take this garment away and bring him another one without patterns because it distracted him from his prayer.

title: Remove Pictures from Prayer Area
content: Anas said that Aisha had a thin curtain with pictures in her home. The Prophet (ﷺ) told her to take it away because the pictures distracted him during prayer when he walked around her house.

title: Prophet's Reaction to Silken Cloth
content: The Prophet (ﷺ) was given a silken cloth as a gift. He wore it while praying. After finishing his prayer, he took it off quickly and said, 'This is not what pious people wear.'

title: Prophet's Prayer in Mosque
content: Abu Juhaifa saw the Prophet in a red tent. He saw people taking water from Bilal, who had washed the Prophet's hands and face for prayer. The Prophet (ﷺ) came out, wrapped his red cloak around him, and led the people in two short prayers. He used a small stick as a marker to show where he was praying.

title: The Prophet's Pulpit
content: Abu Hazim asked Sahl bin Sa'd about the pulpit in the mosque. Sahl said it was made from tamarisk wood from a forest. A slave prepared it for the Prophet. When it was put up, the Prophet stood on it and led the people in prayer. He recited from the Quran, bowed down, and then got down to prostrate on the ground. He did this twice. This is what Sahl knows about the pulpit.

title: Prophet's Injury and Prayer
content: The Prophet (ﷺ) fell off a horse and hurt his leg or shoulder. He said he wouldn't go to his wives for one month. He stayed in an attic room with stairs made of date palm trunks. His companions came to visit him, and he led them in prayer while sitting down. They were standing up. After the prayer, he explained that when the imam says 'Allahu Akbar', everyone should say it too. When the imam bows or prostrates, you should do the same. If the imam prays standing up, you should pray standing up too. After 29 days, the Prophet came down from the attic room and his companions asked him about his promise to stay away from his wives for a month. He said that a month is 29 days.

title: Allah's Messenger Visits Anas
content: Anas' grandmother Mulaika invited the Prophet for a meal. He ate and said, 'Let's pray.' Anas washed his prayer mat and the Prophet stood on it. The orphan and Anas prayed behind him, with their grandmother standing behind them. The Prophet (ﷺ) led two short prayers.

title: Praying at a Special Place
content: Maimuna said that the Prophet used to pray at Khumra.

title: Aisha's Sleeping Position
content: Aisha said she used to sleep in front of the Prophet. Her legs were facing his direction when he prayed. When he prostrated, he gently pushed her legs aside so she wouldn't be disturbed. She would move back and then stretch out again when he stood up.

title: Prophet's Prayer with Aisha
content: Aisha said that the Prophet prayed while she was lying on a bed between him and the direction he faced during prayer.

title: Prophet's Prayer with Aisha
content: The Prophet (ﷺ) prayed while his wife Aisha was lying between him and the direction he faced during prayer on their bed where they usually slept.

title: Praying in Hot Weather
content: When we prayed with the Prophet, some of us would put our clothes' ends on the ground when prostrating because it was very hot.

title: Praying with Shoes On
content: Anas bin Malik said the Prophet prayed while wearing his shoes. He confirmed this when asked by Sa'id bin Yazid Al-Azdi.

title: Praying after Urinating
content: Jarir bin Abdullah was seen urinating. He then washed his hands and face, dried them on his socks, and prayed. When asked about it, he said the Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) did the same. His friends agreed with him because they knew Jarir had become a Muslim very late in life.

title: Helping the Prophet with Ablution
content: I helped the Prophet with washing his hands and feet. He then put on special socks called Khuffs, made sure they were clean, and prayed.

title: Imperfect Prayer
content: Hudhaifa saw someone praying. The person was bowing and prostrating incorrectly. When the prayer ended, Hudhaifa told him he hadn't prayed properly. He said that if this person died, they would die following a way of prayer different from Muhammad 's (ﷺ).

title: Prophet's Prayer Posture
content: When the Prophet prayed, he would spread his arms apart so widely that you could see the white skin under his armpits.

title: Protection for Those Who Pray
content: The Prophet (ﷺ) said: If someone prays like us and faces the same direction as us when praying, and eats meat from animals we have slaughtered, they are a Muslim. They will be protected by Allah and His Messenger. Don't betray Allah by hurting those who are under His protection.

title: Fight Until They Say Allah
content: Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) said: 'I've been told to fight people until they say there's no one worthy of worship except Allah.' If they say this, then we'll pray with them, face the same direction during prayer, and eat food that's been slaughtered like ours. Their blood and property will be safe from us, unless it's a matter of Islamic law. Then their final judgment will be up to Allah.

title: Turning during Toilet
content: The Prophet (ﷺ) said: When you go to the toilet, do not face or turn your back to the direction of prayer. Instead, face east or west. If there are toilets facing the direction of prayer, turn yourself while using them and ask for Allah's forgiveness.

title: Sexual Relations During Umra
content: I asked Ibn Umar about a man who did Tawaf around the Kaaba for Umra but didn't do the Sa'i between Safa and Marwa. He said, 'When the Prophet came to Mecca, he did Tawaf around the Kaaba, prayed behind the station of Abraham, then did the Sa'i between Safa and Marwa.' Ibn Umar told me to follow the Prophet's example. I asked Jabir bin Abdullah the same question, and he also said not to be with your wife until you've finished the Sa'i.

title: Sex after Umra Tawaf
content: I asked Ibn Umar if a man can have sex with his wife after doing the Umra Tawaf around the Kaaba, but not the Safa and Marwa walk. He said no, because when the Prophet did this, he also walked between Safa and Marwa before having relations with his wives.

title: Prophet's Prayer in the Ka'ba
content: Someone came to Ibn 'Umar and said, 'The Prophet (ﷺ) is entering the Ka'ba.' Ibn 'Umar went there but found the Prophet had come out. He asked Bilal if the Prophet prayed inside. Bilal said yes, he prayed two units between two pillars on the left side. Then the Prophet came out and prayed two more units facing the Ka'ba.

title: Entering the Ka'ba
content: Ibn Abbas said that when the Prophet entered the Ka'ba, he prayed in every corner of it. He didn't finish praying until he left the Ka'ba. Then he prayed a two-rak'at prayer facing the Ka'ba and said, 'This is our direction to face during prayer'.

title: Prophet's Qibla Change
content: Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) prayed facing Baitul-Maqdis for a while. He wanted to face the Ka'ba instead, so Allah sent a message saying it was okay to change direction. The Prophet (ﷺ) faced the Ka'ba and people followed him. Some Ansar were still praying towards Baitul-Maqdis, but they changed their direction too.

title: Praying on Horseback
content: Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) used to pray while riding his horse. He'd walk around it when he wanted to pray a regular prayer, but if he needed to pray a compulsory prayer, he'd get off and face the direction of the Kaaba.

title: Prayer Changes Explained
content: The Prophet (ﷺ) prayed and people asked if he had changed the prayer. He said there was no change, but he performed two extra prostrations to show what he meant. If he forgot something, they should remind him. If someone is unsure about their prayer, they should do what feels right and complete it with two extra prostrations.

title: Umar's Three Agreements with Allah
content: My friend Umar told me that he had agreed with the Prophet in three things. First, Umar said to the Prophet, 'Let's use Abraham's station as our prayer place sometimes.' The Prophet (ﷺ) received a message from Allah saying we can do that. Second, Umar asked the Prophet to tell his wives to cover themselves when they're around men because people say good and bad things about them. So Allah revealed a verse telling women to wear veils in front of men. Third, Umar said to the Prophet's wives, 'If you leave him, he'll get better wives than you.' And then Allah revealed a verse saying that.

title: Fajr Prayer Direction Change
content: During the Fajr prayer at Quba', someone came and said that Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) had been ordered to pray facing the Ka'ba. The people were told to turn their faces towards Mecca.

title: Prophet's Zuhr Prayer
content: The Prophet (ﷺ) offered five rak'at in the Zuhr prayer. Someone asked if he had increased the number of rak'at. The Prophet (ﷺ) said, 'What do you mean?' They replied that he had prayed five rak'at. So he bent his legs and performed two prostrations.

title: Respect the Qibla during Prayer
content: The Prophet (ﷺ) saw some spit on a mosque wall near the direction of prayer. He didn't like it and got up to clean it with his hand. He said that when you pray, God is listening to you or standing between you and the direction of prayer. So, don't spit towards the Qibla. Instead, spit to your left or under your foot. You can also spit into a corner of your cloth and then fold it up.

title: Spitting During Prayer
content: Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) saw sputum on the wall of a mosque. He cleaned it and said to people: 'When you pray, don't spit in front of you because Allah is facing you.'

title: Cleaning up after Prayer
content: Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) saw some mucus or spit on the mosque wall near the direction of prayer. He wiped it away.

title: Prophet Muhammad's Manners
content: The Prophet (ﷺ) saw some spit on the mosque wall. He picked up gravel and cleaned it off. Then he said, 'When you want to spit, don't do it in front of me or to my right side. You can spit either on your left side or under your foot.'

title: Prophet Muhammad's Mosque Etiquette
content: One day, the Prophet saw some spit on a mosque wall. He picked up some gravel and cleaned it off. Then he said: 'When you need to spit, don't do it in front of me or to my right side. Spit either to your left or under your left foot.'

title: Prophet's Mosque Etiquette
content: Abu Huraira and Abu Sa'id said: The Prophet (ﷺ) saw some spit on the mosque wall. He picked up some gravel to clean it. He said, 'When you need to spit, don't spit in front of me or to my right. Spit either to your left or under your left foot'.

title: Prophet Muhammad's Mosque Etiquette
content: Abu Huraira and Abu Sa'id said that the Prophet saw some spit on a mosque wall. He picked up gravel to clean it, then said: 'When you need to spit, don't do it in front of me or to my right side. Spit either to your left or under your left foot.'

title: Spitting Etiquette
content: The Prophet (ﷺ) said: Don't spit in front of you or on your right. You can spit either on your left or under your foot.

title: Prayer Time: Spit with Care
content: When a Muslim is praying, they are talking to God in private. So, they should not spit in front of them or to their right side. They can either spit on their left side or under their foot.

title: Prophet Cleans Mosque Floor
content: Abu Sa'id said the Prophet saw spit on the mosque wall near the direction of prayer. He cleaned it with gravel, then told people not to spit in front or to his right side. It's okay to spit on their left side or under their left foot.

title: Spitting in the Mosque
content: The Prophet (ﷺ) said that spitting in a mosque is wrong. To make up for it, you should cover the spit with soil.

title: Prayer Etiquette
content: When you pray, don't spit in front of you. You're talking to Allah privately. Don't spit on your right side because there's an angel there. It's okay to spit on your left or under your foot and then cover it up.

title: Prophet's Advice on Spitting
content: One day, the Prophet saw spit on a mosque wall facing the Qibla. He scraped it off with his hand and said: 'When you pray, your Lord is between you and the Qibla. So don't spit towards the Qibla. Spit either to your left or under your foot.' Then he showed us how to fold a cloth and spit into it.

title: Allah's Messenger Sees Us
content: Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) said: 'Do you think I'm facing the right direction? By Allah, I can see what you're doing from behind me. Your prayers and bowing are not hidden from me.'

title: Prophet's Prayer Observation
content: The Prophet (ﷺ) led us in prayer. After the prayer, he stood on a high platform and said, 'I can see you from behind when you pray or bow down.'

title: Rasulullah Orders a Horse Race
content: Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) ordered a horse race. The trained horses ran from Al-Hafya' to Thaniyat Al-Wada'. Untrained horses ran from Al-Thaniya to the Bani Zuraiq mosque. Abdullah bin Umar was one of those who took part in the race.

title: Allah's Messenger and Charity
content: Some goods came to the Prophet from Bahrain. He ordered them to be spread out in the mosque. It was a big amount of goods, but he didn't even look at it before prayer. After prayer, he sat by the goods and gave some to everyone he saw. Al-`Abbas asked for some because he had paid ransom for himself and his brother `Aqil. The Prophet (ﷺ) told him to take some, but Al-`Abbas struggled to lift it and asked for help. The Prophet (ﷺ) refused each time Al-`Abbas asked. Finally, Al-`Abbas threw some of the goods and managed to lift what was left on his shoulders. He walked away with it. The Prophet (ﷺ) watched him go before getting up himself.

title: Prophet visits Abu Talha
content: I was with the Prophet in the mosque. He asked me if I came from Abu Talha. I said yes, for a meal. Then he told his friends to get up and we all went together.

title: Adultery: Husband's Right
content: A man asked the Prophet if he should kill someone caught with his wife. The Prophet (ﷺ) saw them later in the mosque, taking oaths to deny or confirm adultery.

title: Prophet's Prayer in My Home
content: One day, the Prophet came to my house. He asked where I wanted him to pray. I pointed to a spot. The Prophet (ﷺ) said 'Allahu Akbar' and we stood behind him. He prayed two short prayers.

title: Prayer in a Home
content: Itban bin Malik said: I had weak eyesight and led my people in prayer. When it rained, water flowed between me and them, so they couldn't come to our mosque. I asked the Prophet to pray at my house. The next day, he came with Abu Bakr. He stood up and said 'Allahu Akbar', and we prayed behind him. We then had a meal together. Someone called Malik bin Al-Dukhaishin a hypocrite because he helped those who didn't love Allah or the Prophet. But the Prophet said not to say that, as saying 'None has the right to be worshipped but Allah' for Allah's sake only is enough.

title: Starting from the Right
content: Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) used to start doing things with his right hand whenever it was possible. This included washing himself, combing his hair, and putting on shoes.

title: Pictures in Churches
content: Um Habiba and Um Salama told the Prophet about a church they saw in Ethiopia. It had pictures inside. The Prophet (ﷺ) said, 'When someone important dies there, they build a place for worship near their grave with these pictures. On the Day of Resurrection, people like this will be considered the worst by Allah.'

title: Prophet's First Mosque in Medina
content: When Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) arrived in Medina, he stayed with a tribe called Banu `Amr bin `Auf for fourteen nights. He then sent for another tribe, Bani An-Najjar, and they came to him with their swords. The Prophet (ﷺ) was sitting on his horse with Abu Bakr behind him when he dismounted at the house of Abu Aiyub. The Prophet (ﷺ) liked to pray whenever it was time, even in sheep-folds. He ordered a mosque to be built near this house. Some people from Bani An-Najjar were asked about the price of the land, but they said they wouldn't sell it except to Allah. There were graves and uneven ground on the land, so the Prophet had them dug up and leveled. The date-palm trees were cut down and used as a wall for the mosque, with two stone walls built beside it. While building, the companions recited some poems and the Prophet said, 'There is no good except in the Hereafter.' He asked Allah to forgive both the Ansars and emigrants.

title: Prophet's Prayer in Sheep Fold
content: Anas said that the Prophet prayed in a sheep fold. He also said that this happened before a mosque was built.

title: Praying with a Camel
content: Nafi' said he saw Ibn 'Umar praying. He had his camel in front of him as a barrier. Ibn 'Umar said he remembered the Prophet doing the same thing.

title: Sun Eclipse Prayer
content: Abdullah bin Abbas said that the sun went dark. The Prophet (ﷺ) prayed for an eclipse and said he had seen Hellfire. He never saw anything as bad as what he saw today.

title: Pray at Home, Not in Houses
content: The Prophet (ﷺ) said to Ibn Umar: 'Some of your prayers should be at home. Don't turn your houses into places where you just sit and pray.'

title: Don't Enter Damaged Places
content: Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) said: Don't go into places where Allah's punishment has happened. If you do go in, be sad. If you're not sad, don't go in because Allah might punish you too.

title: Pictures in Churches
content: Um Salama told the Prophet about a church she saw in Ethiopia. It was called Mariya and had pictures inside. The Prophet (ﷺ) said, 'When a good person dies there, they build a place to worship near his grave and put more pictures in it. Allah considers them very bad.'

title: Prophet's Last Warning
content: When the Prophet was near death, he put a cloth on his face. He took it off because he felt hot and short of breath. Then he said: 'May God curse Jews and Christians for building places of worship over their Prophets' graves.' The Prophet (ﷺ) warned us about what they had done.

title: Prophet's Last Moments
content: When the Prophet was near death, he put a cloth on his face. He felt hot and took it off. He said: 'May Allah curse Jews and Christians for building places of worship over graves.'

title: Allah's Curse on Jews
content: Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) said: 'May Allah be unhappy with the Jews. They built places of worship near the graves of their Prophets.'

title: Five Special Gifts
content: Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) said: 'I have been given five special gifts that were not given to any other Prophet. These are: Allah made me strong and my enemies feared me for a month. The earth is a place where I and my followers can pray, anywhere we want. We can also use the ground to make Tayammum (clean ourselves) when there's no water. Booty from battles is allowed for us. I was sent to guide all people, not just one nation. And on Judgment Day, I will have the right to ask Allah to forgive my followers.'

title: A Slave Girl's Innocence Proved
content: A slave girl from an Arab tribe was accused of stealing a red leather scarf with precious stones. She said she was innocent and that the kite had taken it. The people searched her, even looking in private places. Later, the kite dropped the scarf back where it belonged. The slave girl told them what happened and they believed her. She became Muslim and would often visit me, reciting a poem about how Allah protected her from false accusations.

title: Sleeping in the Mosque
content: Abdullah bin Umar said he used to sleep in the mosque of the Prophet when he was young and not married.

title: Ali's Anger and Dust
content: Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) went to his daughter Fatima's house but didn't find her husband Ali there. He asked where Ali was, and Fatima said they had a disagreement and he left without sleeping at home. The Prophet (ﷺ) sent someone to look for him, who found Ali asleep in the mosque covered in dust. The Prophet (ﷺ) gently cleaned off the dust and called out to Ali, 'Get up! O Aba Turab.'

title: As-Suffa Men's Clothing
content: Abu Huraira saw seventy men at As-Suffa. They didn't have shirts or jackets. Some wore only loincloths, while others had sheets wrapped around their necks. These sheets sometimes reached their knees or ankles and they would hold them in place with their hands so nothing was exposed.

title: The Prophet Repays Jabir's Debt
content: Jabir bin Abdullah visited the Prophet in the mosque. The Prophet (ﷺ) told him to pray two units of prayer. He also paid back a debt he owed Jabir and gave him some extra money.

title: Praying in the Mosque
content: Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) said: When you enter a mosque, pray two units of prayer before sitting down.

title: Angels Pray for You
content: When you're praying at home or in a special prayer area, angels ask Allah to forgive your sins as long as you don't pass gas. They say, 'Allah, please forgive him' and 'Be kind to him'.

title: Mosque in the Time of Prophet
content: In the time of the Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ), the mosque was made from mud bricks. Its roof was palm leaves and its pillars were palm stems. Later, Abu Bakr didn't change it. Then Umar expanded it using mud bricks, palm leaves, and wooden pillars. Finally, Uthman built a bigger mosque with stone walls and teak wood roof.

title: Abu Sa'id's Story
content: Ibn Abbas told me and his son Ali to visit Abu Sa'id. We found him in a garden taking care of it. He put on his cloak, sat down, and started telling us what happened when the mosque was built. The Prophet (ﷺ) saw Ammar carrying two heavy stones while everyone else was carrying one. The Prophet (ﷺ) gently brushed off the dust from Ammar's body and said, 'May Allah be kind to Ammar.' Ammar replied, 'I seek refuge with Allah from trouble.'

title: Preparing a Pulpit
content: Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) sent someone to tell a woman to ask her carpenter slave to make a wooden pulpit for him to sit on.

title: Woman Builds Pulpit for Prophet
content: Jabir said a woman asked the Prophet if she could build something for him to sit on. He said yes, and she had a carpenter make a pulpit for him.

title: Building a Mosque
content: 'Uthman bin 'Affan said, 'You've talked too much.' He remembered the Prophet saying, 'Whoever builds a mosque, Allah will build for them something similar in Paradise'.

title: Carrying Arrows in Mosque
content: Jabir bin Abdullah said that a man walked through the mosque with arrows. The Prophet (ﷺ) told him to hold them by their heads.

title: Respect Arrows in Mosques
content: The Prophet (ﷺ) said: When you walk through our mosques or markets with arrows, hold them by their heads. This is to prevent hurting a Muslim.

title: Hassan bin Thabit's Question
content: I asked Abu Huraira if he heard the Prophet say: 'O Hassan, speak on my behalf. O Allah, help him with Your Spirit.' He said yes.

title: Prophet Watches Ethiopian Play
content: I saw the Prophet at my door. Some Ethiopians were playing in the mosque with their spears. The Prophet (ﷺ) was hiding me from view so I could watch them play.

title: Prophet Muhammad watches Ethiopians play
content: I was at home when I saw the Prophet. He was standing near my house and letting me see some Ethiopian men playing with spears in the mosque. They were showing off their skills.

title: Barirah's Freedom and Wala'
content: Aisha helped Barirah get her freedom. She asked Aisha to pay for it, but then her masters said they wanted something in return. Aisha talked to the Prophet about this. He said that if she bought Barirah, freeing her would be okay. The master's claim of Wala' (allegiance) wouldn't matter. The Prophet (ﷺ) also warned against making rules not found in the Quran.

title: Allah's Messenger Helps a Friend
content: I was in the mosque with Ibn Abi Hadrad. I asked him to pay me back some money, but we were arguing loudly. The Prophet (ﷺ) heard us and came into the room. He said, 'Kab, calm down.' Then he told Ibn Abi Hadrad to pay half of what he owed me. I agreed to that, so Ibn Abi Hadrad paid me.

title: The Prophet Visits a Servant's Grave
content: A black man used to clean the mosque. He died. The Prophet (ﷺ) asked about him and was told he had passed away. He said, 'Why wasn't I informed?' He went to the man's grave and prayed for him.

title: Prophet bans Riba and Alcohol
content: When the verses about usury were revealed, the Prophet went to the mosque. He recited them in front of everyone and then stopped people from trading with interest or selling alcohol.

title: Cleaning the Mosque
content: Abu Huraira said a man or woman used to clean the mosque. He then told us about something the Prophet said.

title: Prophet Overpowers a Demon
content: Abu Huraira said the Prophet told him that one night a big demon from the Jinns came to interrupt his prayers. Allah helped the Prophet defeat it. He wanted to tie it to a mosque pillar so everyone could see it, but he remembered Solomon's prayer in the Quran: 'Forgive me and give me power.' The demon was sent away.

title: Thumama bin Uthal Converts
content: The Prophet (ﷺ) sent some men to Najd. They brought a man called Thumama bin Uthal back with them. The Prophet 's (ﷺ) men tied him to a mosque pillar. The Prophet (ﷺ) came and told them to let him go. He went to a nearby garden, washed himself, and then came back into the mosque. There, he said 'There is no God but Allah' and 'Muhammad (ﷺ) is His Messenger'. Thumama had now become Muslim.

title: Sa'd bin Mu'ad's Injury
content: During the battle of Al-Khandaq, Sa'd bin Mu'ad was hurt in his arm. The Prophet (ﷺ) built a tent to take care of him in the mosque. Another tent belonged to Banu Ghaffar, and their tent started getting blood from Sa'd's tent. They asked, 'What is happening in your tent?' They found that Sa'd's wound was very bad, and he died in his tent.

title: Um Salama's Story
content: I was sick and told the Prophet about it. He said I could do a special walk around the Ka'ba while riding a camel, behind the other people doing the same. So I did that. While I was walking, the Prophet was praying near the Ka'ba and reciting a chapter from the Quran called 'Wat-tur wa kitabin mastur'.

title: Two Friends and the Lights
content: Anas bin Malik told us that two friends of the Prophet left him one dark night. Two lights appeared in front of them, guiding their way. Each friend was accompanied by a light until they reached their homes.

title: The Prophet's Choice
content: The Prophet (ﷺ) gave a sermon and said Allah offered him a choice: to have the world or what is in the Hereafter. He chose the latter. Abu Bakr cried when he heard this. I thought, 'Why is Abu Bakr crying?' But then I realized it was the Prophet himself who made that choice. The Prophet (ﷺ) said, 'Abu Bakr has been very kind with his wealth and company.' He added, 'If I had to choose a close friend from people, it would be Abu Bakr. But our friendship as Muslims is enough.' The Prophet (ﷺ) ordered all mosque doors closed except the one for Abu Bakr.

title: Abu Bakr's Special Place
content: When the Prophet was ill, he sat on a pulpit with a cloth on his head. He thanked Allah and said: 'No one has helped me more than Abu Bakr with my life and property. If I had to choose a close friend, it would be Abu Bakr, but being brothers in Islam is even better.' He then ordered that all the small doors of the mosque should be closed except for Abu Bakr's.

title: Prophet's Visit to Mecca
content: Ibn Umar said the Prophet arrived in Mecca and sent for a man named Uthman. He opened the gate of the Kaaba, and the Prophet, Bilal, Usama, and Uthman went inside. They closed the door behind them and stayed there for an hour before coming out. Ibn Umar asked Bilal if the Prophet had prayed while they were in the Kaaba. Bilal said yes, but didn't say where exactly.

title: Thumama bin Uthal's Story
content: Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) sent some horsemen to Najd. They brought a man named Thumama bin Uthal from the Bani Hanifa tribe. The Prophet 's (ﷺ) men tied him to a pillar in the mosque.

title: Umar Scolds Two Men
content: I was in the mosque when someone threw a stone at me. It was Umar bin Al-Khattab. He said, 'Get those two men.' When I brought them, he asked, 'Who are you?' They said they were from Ta'if. Umar said, 'If you lived here, I would punish you for being loud in the mosque where Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) prayed.'

title: Messenger Helps with Debt
content: Ka'b bin Malik asked his friend Ibn Abi Hadrad to pay him back money in the mosque. Their voices were loud, so Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) heard them from inside his house. He came out and said 'O Ka'b bin Malik!' Ka'b replied 'Here I am.' The Prophet (ﷺ) gestured for Ka'b to ask his friend to pay half of what he owed. Ka'b did this, then the Prophet told Ibn Abi Hadrad to get up and pay it.

title: Night Prayer Instructions
content: Ibn 'Umar asked the Prophet how to pray at night. The Prophet (ﷺ) said: 'Pray two rak'at, then two more, and keep going like that. If you think dawn is near, pray one last rak'at. This will be your witr prayer for all the others.' Ibn 'Umar added: 'The Prophet (ﷺ) wanted us to end our night prayers with an odd number of rak'at'.

title: Night Prayers with the Prophet
content: A man came to the Prophet while he was giving a sermon. The man asked how to pray at night. The Prophet (ﷺ) said, 'Pray two parts of prayer at a time: two, then two, and so on.' If you think dawn is near, pray one part and that will be enough for all your prayers.

title: Three Men in the Mosque
content: Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) was sitting with some people in the mosque. Three men came in. Two of them stood in front, and one went away. One found a place to sit, another sat behind, and the third left. After Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) finished speaking, he said: 'Let me tell you about these three. One turned to Allah and was accepted. The second felt shy, so Allah showed mercy. The third turned his back on Allah, and Allah ignored him too.'

title: Prophet Muhammad's Resting Position
content: I saw Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) lying flat on his back in the mosque with one leg crossed over the other. Some people, like Umar and Uthman, did the same when they were resting.

title: Abu Bakr's Mosque
content: I saw my parents follow Islam when I grew up. The Prophet (ﷺ) visited us often. My father Abu Bakr wanted to build a mosque in our courtyard, so he did. He prayed and read the Quran there. Many pagan women and children watched him, surprised. They were worried their families might be influenced by the Quran.

title: Prayer in Congregation is Better
content: The Prophet (ﷺ) said: When you go to the mosque for prayer, Allah rewards you more. For each step towards the mosque, He gives you a higher level and forgives one sin. The angels ask God to forgive you while you're waiting for prayer. They keep saying 'Forgive him' until you finish praying.

title: Prophet's Hand Clasping
content: The Prophet (ﷺ) clasped his hands together by interlacing his fingers.

title: Prophet's Hand Clasping
content: The Prophet (ﷺ) clasped his hands together by interlacing his fingers.

title: Abdullah's Future Condition
content: Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) said to Abdullah bin Amr: 'What will happen to you when the worst people are left?'

title: Faithful Friends Support Each Other
content: The Prophet (ﷺ) said that a good friend is like strong bricks in a wall. They help each other. He showed us how to hold hands, with fingers interlaced. Then he led a prayer and forgot some of it. He stood up, put his hand on the mosque's pillar, and leaned against it. People thought the prayer was shorter than usual. A man asked if the Prophet had forgotten or shortened the prayer. The Prophet (ﷺ) said no, and then finished the rest of the prayer. He did two prostrations, saying 'God is great' each time.

title: Places of Prayer on the Way
content: Musa bin 'Uqba said he saw Salim bin Abdullah praying at certain places. He told Musa that his father used to pray there too, and had seen the Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) praying in those exact spots. Nafi' also prayed at these places. When asked about one specific mosque called Sharaf Ar-Rawha, Salim agreed with Nafi' that it was a good place for prayer.

title: Ibn Abbas Meets Prophet Muhammad
content: One day Ibn Abbas rode a donkey to the mosque in Mina. He was still young and had just become a man. The Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) was praying there, without any wall in front of him. Ibn Abbas walked past some people in the row and stopped his donkey to let it eat grass. Then he got off and joined the prayer without anyone stopping him.

title: Prophet's Eid Prayer Setup
content: When the Prophet came out on Eid day, he would order a short spear to be placed in front of him. He would then pray facing it with people behind him. This was also done when traveling.

title: Prophet's Prayer at Al-Batha'
content: My father said the Prophet led us in prayer. He prayed a two-rak'at Zuhr prayer and then a two-rak'at Asr prayer. A short spear was placed in front of him as a barrier. Women and donkeys walked past it while he prayed.

title: Space around Prophet's Prayer Area
content: Prophet Muhammad 's (ﷺ) prayer area was just big enough for a sheep to walk through and its back against the wall.

title: Mosque Pulpit Space
content: Prophet Muhammad 's (ﷺ) pulpit was very close to the mosque wall. There wasn't enough space for a sheep to walk through between them.

title: Prophet's Prayer Setup
content: The Prophet (ﷺ) used to have a tree planted in front of him. He would pray behind it.

title: Prophet's Prayer at Midday
content: Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) came to us during the hot part of the day. He washed his hands and face with water, then led us in prayer. During the prayer, a stick was placed on the ground in front of him. Women and donkeys walked past it.

title: Prophet Muhammad's Bathroom Routine
content: When the Prophet went to the bathroom, I and another boy would follow him with a stick or spear and a water container. When he finished, we'd give him the water to wash his hands.

title: Prophet Muhammad's Midday Prayer
content: Abu Juhaifa said: The Prophet (ﷺ) came out at midday and prayed two sets of prayers. He first prayed the noon prayer, then the afternoon prayer. A stick was placed in front of him to mark a boundary. After praying, he performed ablution. People took the remaining water from his ablution and used it to clean themselves.

title: Salama's Prayer Habit
content: I used to go to the mosque with Salama bin Al-Akwa'. He always prayed behind a pillar near where the Qurans were kept. I asked him, 'Why do you like to pray there?' He said, 'The Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) used to pray in that same spot.'

title: Companions Rush to Prayer
content: Anas saw many important companions of the Prophet quickly going to the prayer pillars before the Prophet arrived for the Maghrib prayer.

title: Prophet's Prayer in Ka'ba
content: Ibn Umar said the Prophet entered the Ka'ba with Usama bin Zaid, 'Uthman bin Talha, and Bilal. He stayed there for a long time. When they left, Ibn Umar was the first to enter the Ka'ba. He asked Bilal where the Prophet prayed. Bilal said he prayed between the two front pillars.

title: Prophet in the Ka'ba
content: Abdullah bin Umar said that Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) entered the Ka'ba with Usama, Bilal, and others. He closed the door and stayed inside for a while. When Bilal came out, Abdullah asked him what happened. Bilal said that the Prophet prayed with one pillar on his left and one on his right, and three pillars behind him. The Ka'ba had six pillars at that time.

title: Abdullah's Prayer in Ka'bah
content: When Abdullah entered the Ka'bah, he would walk ahead and leave the door behind. He'd stop about three cubits from the opposite wall where the Prophet used to pray. Bilal told me this happened. Ibn 'Umar said it doesn't matter where you pray inside the Ka'bah.

title: Praying Behind an Object
content: The Prophet (ﷺ) used to pray with his camel sitting in front of him. If the camel moved, he would put its saddle in front and pray behind it. This shows that we should always pray behind something when praying.

title: Women's Role in Prayer
content: Aisha said: Do you think we women are the same as animals? The Prophet (ﷺ) would pray while lying on his bed. I didn't want to stand in front of him, so I quietly got out of bed when he prayed.

title: Respecting Prayer Space
content: Abu Sa`id Al-Khudri was praying on a Friday. A young man from Bani Abi Mu'ait wanted to pass in front of him, but Abu Sa`id pushed him away with his hand. The young man complained to Marwan about Abu Sa`id's behavior. Abu Sa`id explained that the Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) said: 'If someone is praying and someone tries to walk in front of them, they should push them away. If they don't listen, use force because they are a devil.'

title: Passing in front of a prayer
content: Zaid bin Khalid asked Abu Juhaim about something Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) said. Abu Juhaim replied that the Prophet said: 'If someone knew how bad it is to pass in front of another person who is praying, they would rather wait for 40 days/months/years.'

title: Women and Prayer Spaces
content: Some people told me that prayer is cancelled if a dog, donkey, or woman walks in front of the person praying. I said this was unfair to women. I saw the Prophet praying while I lay between him and the direction he faced during prayer. When I needed something, I would quietly leave without disturbing him.

title: Prophet's Night Prayer
content: The Prophet (ﷺ) used to pray while I was sleeping in front of him. When he wanted to pray at night, he would wake me up and we would both pray together.

title: Aisha's Sleeping Position
