content: I used to sleep near the Prophet. My legs were facing him when I slept. When he prostrated, he would gently move my feet so they wouldn't be in his way. And when he stood up, I could stretch out my legs again. We didn't have lamps at home back then.

title: Women's Prayer Rights
content: Aisha said: The Prophet (ﷺ) told me that things that stop prayer are a dog, a donkey, and a woman. I was surprised when he compared us to animals. But then I remembered seeing the Prophet pray while I lay between him and the direction of Mecca. When I needed something, I would quietly get up from his feet without disturbing him.

title: Prophet Muhammad's Night Prayer
content: The Prophet (ﷺ) used to get up at night and pray. I would lie across the bed between him and the direction of prayer, so he could still face it while praying.

title: Praying with a Baby
content: Abu Qatada said that the Prophet was praying. He had Umama, his granddaughter, in his arms. When he bowed down to pray, he gently put her down. When he stood up again, he picked her up and held her on his neck.

title: Prophet's Garment Falls
content: Maimuna bint Al-Harith said her bed was next to the Prophet's praying place. Sometimes his clothes fell on her while she lay in bed.

title: Prophet's Prayer During Menses
content: Maimuna said that the Prophet used to pray while she slept next to him during her period. When he prostrated, his clothes would touch her.

title: Women in Prayer
content: Aisha said: You've made women like dogs and donkeys. I saw the Prophet praying while I was lying between him and the direction of Mecca. When he wanted to bow down, he gently pushed my legs so I could move.

title: Prophet Mocked by Quraish
content: Abdullah bin Mas'ud said that the Prophet was praying near the Kaaba. Some Quraish people were sitting nearby and one of them suggested getting camel waste to put on the Prophet's back while he was in prostration. One man went and got it, and when the Prophet prayed, they put it between his shoulders. The Quraish laughed so much that they fell over each other. A passerby told Fatima, who came and removed the waste. When the Prophet finished praying, he asked Allah to punish the Quraish. He named eight specific men and said Allah's curse was on them.

title: Gabriel's Prayer Example
content: `Umar bin `Abdul `Aziz delayed his prayer. `Urwa bin Az-Zubair told him, 'Remember what happened in Iraq with Al-Mughira bin Shu`ba? Gabriel came and showed Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) the five daily prayers: Fajr, Zuhr, Asr, Maghrib, and Isha. Gabriel prayed each one at its usual time, and Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) followed his example. `Urwa said Aisha told him that Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) used to pray Asr prayer when it was still daylight.

title: Gabriel's Prayer Example
content: `Umar bin `Abdul `Aziz delayed his prayer. `Urwa told him that Al-Mughira in Iraq once delayed prayers too. A man named Abi Mas`ud went to Al-Mughira and reminded him of a story about Gabriel. Gabriel came to the Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) and showed him how to pray at different times: Fajr, Zuhr, Asr, Maghrib, and Isha. The Prophet (ﷺ) followed Gabriel's example. `Urwa said that his friend Bashir told him this from his father Abi Mas`ud. Aisha also said that the Prophet prayed Asr prayer when the sun was still shining inside her home.

title: Allah's Messenger Teaches Abdul Qais
content: A group from the tribe of Rabi'ah came to Allah's Messenger (ﷺ). They said they could only visit him during sacred months, so he asked them to take something good back home and share it with those who stayed behind. He told them to believe in one God, that he is His messenger, pray on time, give charity, and if they won a battle, give him one-fifth of the spoils. He also said not to use certain utensils for making drinks.

title: Jarir's Pledge of Allegiance
content: I gave the pledge to Allah's Messenger (ﷺ). I promised to pray properly, pay my charity on time, and give good advice to every Muslim.

title: Prayers and Fasting for Protection
content: Hudhaifa was with Umar. Umar asked him about a Hadith from the Prophet. Hudhaifa said, 'I know it.' Umar said, 'You're very bold.' Hudhaifa explained that troubles come from family, money, children and neighbors. But they can be forgiven by praying, fasting, giving to charity, and doing good deeds. Umar asked about a great trouble that would spread like the sea. Hudhaifa said it wouldn't affect him because there's a door between them. When asked if he knew what this door was, Hudhaifa replied that Umar himself was the door.

title: Forbidden Kiss and Prayer
content: A man kissed a woman without permission. He told the Prophet about it. The Prophet (ﷺ) said that Allah revealed a new rule: Muslims must pray five times a day, at dawn and dusk, and in some parts of the night. Good actions can cancel out small mistakes.

title: Deeds Most Loved by Allah
content: Abdullah asked the Prophet which deed is most loved by Allah. The Prophet (ﷺ) said to pray at the right times. Abdullah asked what's next, and the Prophet said to be good to your parents. He asked again, and the Prophet said to join in fighting for Allah.

title: Bathing Away Sin
content: Abu Huraira said he heard the Prophet say: 'If you had a river at your door and took a bath in it five times a day, would you still see any dirt on you?' They replied, 'No.' The Prophet (ﷺ) explained that this is like performing the five daily prayers, which wash away evil deeds.

title: Anas Remembers the Prophet's Prayer
content: Anas said that he couldn't find people praying like they did during the time of the Prophet. Someone told him, 'But the prayer is still the same.' Anas replied, 'You're doing it differently now.' He was sad because he thought this change would lead to the prayer being forgotten.

title: Prayer Etiquette: Where to Spit
content: When you pray, remember that you're talking directly to Allah. So, when you spit, do it under your left foot or to the left side of your body, not in front of you or to your right.

title: Proper Prostration and Spit
content: The Prophet (ﷺ) said: When you do prostration, make sure to do it correctly. Don't put your arms flat on the ground like a dog would. If you need to spit, don't spit in front of you or to the right while praying because you're talking to God.

title: Pray when it's cooler
content: The Prophet (ﷺ) said: If it's very hot, pray the Zuhr prayer a bit later. The heat is like the fire of Hell.

title: Pray at Cooler Times
content: Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) said: If it's very hot outside, pray the Zuhr prayer when it gets a bit cooler. He said this is because the heat is like the fire of Hell.

title: Pray When It's Cooler
content: Abu Dhar said the Prophet told him to wait before praying. He said the heat is like Hell-fire getting angry. In very hot weather, pray when it's a bit cooler and shadows appear.

title: Hot Weather and Prayer
content: The Prophet (ﷺ) said: When it's very hot, wait a bit before praying. The heat is like the fire of Hell. It gets angry when it's too hot or cold. Allah lets it take two deep breaths - one in summer when it's hottest, and one in winter when it's coldest.

title: Delaying Prayer in Heat
content: The Prophet (ﷺ) said: In very hot weather, delay the noon prayer until it cools down a bit. He explained that the heat is like the fire of Hell, which complains to Allah about its own destruction. Allah allows the fire two breaths: one when it's hottest in summer and another when it's coldest in winter.

title: Pray Zuhr When Cooler
content: The Prophet (ﷺ) said: 'When it's a bit cooler, pray the Zuhr prayer. The heat is like the fire of Hell.'

title: Praying in Hot Weather
content: We were on a journey with the Prophet. The person who calls for prayer wanted to call people to pray. The Prophet (ﷺ) said, 'Wait a bit.' He said it again after some time. The Prophet (ﷺ) said, 'Wait until we see the shadows of hills.' He explained that very hot weather is because of the fire of Hell. When it's really hot, pray when it cools down.

title: Asking Questions to the Prophet
content: One day, when it was almost midday, the Prophet came out and prayed Zuhr. He stood on a raised platform and talked about the Day of Judgment. He said that there would be many amazing things. He then invited people to ask him questions. Many people started crying. The Prophet (ﷺ) kept saying 'Ask me.' A man named Abdullah bin Hudhafa asked, 'Who is my father?' The Prophet (ﷺ) replied, 'Your father is Hudhafa.' Then `Umar got down on his knees and said, 'We are pleased with Allah as our Lord, Islam as our religion, and Muhammad (ﷺ) as our Prophet.' After that, the Prophet fell silent. He had just seen Paradise and Hell-fire in front of him.

title: Prophet Muhammad's Prayer Times
content: Abu Barza said that the Prophet used to pray Fajr when it was still light enough to see people around him. He would recite between 60 and 100 verses of the Quran during this prayer. The Prophet (ﷺ) prayed Zuhr as soon as the sun began to decline at noon, and Asr when a person could travel from one end of Medina to the other and still find the sun hot. He didn't mind delaying Isha until one third or half of the night.

title: Praying in Hot Weather
content: When we prayed with Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ), we would lower ourselves to the ground on our clothes to stay cool because it was very hot.

title: Prophet's Prayer Times
content: Ibn Abbas told us that the Prophet prayed eight times for the Zuhr and Asr prayers in Medina. He prayed seven times for the Maghrib and Isha prayers there too. Aiyub thought it might have been because of rainy nights, but Anas wasn't sure.

title: Prayer Time in Aisha's Room
content: Aisha said that the Prophet used to pray Asr prayer when there was still some sunlight left in her room.

title: Praying at the Right Time
content: Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) used to pray Asr prayer when there was still sunlight in my room and no shadow had appeared yet.

title: Prophet's Asr Prayer Time
content: The Prophet (ﷺ) used to pray the Asr prayer when there was still sunlight in my room and no shadow had appeared yet.

title: Prophet's Prayer Times
content: Saiyar bin Salama asked Abu Barza about the Prophet's prayer times. Abu Barza said: 'The Prophet (ﷺ) prayed Zuhr at midday when the sun had just started to go down. He prayed Asr when it was still hot outside, so a person could walk from one end of Medina to the other after praying. The Prophet (ﷺ) liked to delay Isha and didn't like sleeping before it or talking after it. After Fajr prayer, he would leave when people could see each other's faces. During Fajr, he would recite between 60 to 100 verses.'

title: Praying with Bani Amr
content: Anas bin Malik said: When we prayed the Asr prayer, people would often go to visit the tribe of Bani Amr bin Auf. They would find them still praying the Asr prayer.

title: Anas' Prayer Time
content: Abu Umama told Abu Bakr that they prayed Zuhr with Umar bin Abdul Aziz. Then they went to Anas and found him praying Asr. Abu Umama asked, 'Which prayer are you offering?' Anas replied, 'The Asr prayer. This is the time when we used to pray with the Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ).'

title: Prophet's Asr Prayer Time
content: The Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) used to pray the afternoon prayer when the sun was still high. If someone went to a place outside Medina, they would arrive while the sun was still high. This place is about four miles from the city.

title: Praying at Quba Mosque
content: Anas bin Malik said: We used to pray the Asr prayer. Then if someone went to Quba mosque, they would arrive while the sun was still high in the sky.

title: Missing the Asr Prayer
content: Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) said that if someone intentionally misses the afternoon prayer, it is like losing their family and property.

title: Early Asr Prayer Important
content: We were in a battle with Buraida on a cloudy day. He said to offer the `Asr prayer early, because the Prophet said that if you miss this prayer, all your good deeds will be cancelled.

title: Praying Before Sunrise
content: Jarir said the Prophet saw the full moon and said you will see God like you see this moon. You won't have trouble seeing Him. So pray before sunrise and sunset if you can, especially the prayers of Fajr and Asr. The Quran says: 'Praise your Lord morning and evening.'

title: Angels Visit Humans at Night
content: Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) said: Angels come to visit us at night and during the day. They gather together before dawn and afternoon prayers. The angels who stayed with us overnight go up to heaven and Allah asks them, 'How are my slaves?' The angels answer, 'We left them praying and we found them still praying'.

title: Prayer Before Sunset
content: The Prophet (ﷺ) said: If you can pray one part of the afternoon prayer before sunset, finish your prayer. If you can pray one part of the morning prayer before sunrise, finish your prayer.

title: God's Blessing to Muslims
content: My father told me that the Prophet said: 'Your time on earth is like the time between the afternoon prayer and sunset. The people who got the Torah worked with it until midday, then they were tired and each one got a certain amount of gold. Then the people who got the Gospel did the same thing until the afternoon prayer, and each one got the same amount of gold. We Muslims got the Quran and we followed it until sunset, and each one of us got twice as much gold as them. The other two groups said to God: 'You gave them more than us.' God asked: 'Did I take something from you?' They said no. Then God said: 'This is my gift to whoever I want.'

title: Three Faiths Compared
content: The Prophet (ﷺ) said, 'Imagine three groups of people: Muslims, Jews, and Christians. They are like workers hired by a man to work from morning till night. The first group worked until midday and said they didn't need payment. The second group came in and finished the day's work for the same pay as the first group. Then another group came and did the rest of the work, getting paid for both groups' work.'

title: Praying with the Prophet
content: Rafi' bin Khadij said: We used to pray Maghrib prayer with the Prophet. After finishing, one of us could leave and still see as far as an arrow shot from a bow can reach.

title: Prophet's Prayer Times
content: Jabir bin Abdullah said the Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) used to pray Zuhr at midday. He prayed Asr when the sun was still bright, Maghrib after sunset, and Isha at different times. If people gathered for Isha prayer early, he would too. If they were late, so was he. The Prophet (ﷺ) also prayed Fajr when it was dark.

title: Praying Maghrib with the Prophet
content: Salama said: We used to pray the evening prayer with the Prophet when the sun disappeared from the horizon.

title: Prophet's Prayer Routine
content: Ibn Abbas said the Prophet prayed seven times together and eight times together.

title: Don't Confuse Prayer Times
content: The Prophet (ﷺ) said, 'Do not let Bedouins confuse you about the name of your evening prayer. They call it Isha', but its real name is Maghrib.'

title: Importance of a Special Night
content: One night, the Prophet led us in prayer. After finishing, he said: 'Do you know how special this night is? Nobody here tonight will be alive in 100 years.'

title: Prophet's Prayer Times
content: We asked Jabir about the Prophet's prayers. He said, 'The Prophet (ﷺ) prayed Zuhr at midday, Asr when it was still hot outside, and Maghrib after sunset. If many people came to pray Isha, he would offer it early. But if fewer people came, he would delay it. And he would pray Fajr before sunrise.'

title: Prophet's Delayed Prayer
content: One day the Prophet delayed the late-night prayer. This was when Islam was still new. The Prophet (ﷺ) didn't come out to pray until his friend Umar told him that everyone else had gone home to sleep. Then he came out and said, 'I know you were all waiting for me to lead the prayer.'

title: Abu Musa Visits the Prophet
content: I traveled with my friends to a place called Baqi. The Prophet (ﷺ) was in Medina at that time. We would visit him every night after the 'Isha prayer, but one evening he was busy and we had to wait until late at night. He then led us in prayer. After praying, he said: 'Stay! Don't go yet. You have a good news. It's because of Allah's blessing that you're the only ones who prayed at this time.' We left feeling happy after hearing what the Prophet said.

title: Sleep Before Isha Prayer
content: Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) disliked sleeping before the late-night prayer and talking after it.

title: Prophet's Delayed Prayer
content: One day, Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) delayed the evening prayer. Umar reminded him that it was late and the women and children had gone to sleep. The Prophet (ﷺ) then came out and said, 'Only you are waiting for this prayer.' In Medina, where they lived, people usually prayed earlier in the night. The Prophet 's (ﷺ) evening prayer would often be between when the sky lightens up at sunset and a third of the way through the night.

title: Prophet's Delayed Evening Prayer
content: One day, the Prophet was busy and the evening prayer was delayed. People slept and woke up multiple times before he led the prayer. He said, 'You've all been waiting for this prayer.' Abdullah bin Umar didn't think it was wrong to pray earlier or later, unless he might fall asleep and miss the prayer. The Prophet (ﷺ) sometimes slept before leading the evening prayer. Another time, the Prophet delayed the evening prayer so much that people fell asleep multiple times. Then, Umar stood up and reminded him of the prayer. When the Prophet led the prayer, water was dripping from his head, and he put his hand on it in a specific way. He said, 'If I thought it would be hard for my followers, I would have made them pray at this time.'

title: Prophet Muhammad's Late Prayer
content: One day, the Prophet was busy and prayed late. His followers slept and woke up several times waiting for him to pray. The Prophet (ﷺ) came out and said that everyone on earth had been waiting for his prayer. Abdullah bin Umar said he didn't mind praying early or late unless he thought he might fall asleep and miss the prayer. Sometimes, he would sleep before the evening prayer. Ibn Abbas said that once the Prophet prayed so late that people slept and woke up multiple times. Then, Umar reminded the Prophet of the prayer. The Prophet (ﷺ) came out with water on his head and put his hand on it. He said if he thought it was hard for his followers, he would have made them pray at a different time.

title: Prophet's Midnight Prayer
content: The Prophet (ﷺ) delayed the late-night prayer until midnight. He then prayed and said, 'You waited for this prayer, so you were in prayer all that time.'

title: Prayer Times and Seeing Allah
content: One night, a man named Jarir was with the Prophet. The Prophet (ﷺ) looked at the moon and said that we will see our Lord in the same way we can see the moon. He told us to pray before sunrise and before sunset if we can. Then he read this verse from the Quran: 'Praise Allah morning and evening'.

title: Pray Asr and Fajr
content: My father said that the Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) said: 'If you pray the two cool prayers of Asr and Fajr, you will go to Paradise.'

title: Fasting and Morning Prayer
content: Anas said that Zaid bin Thabit told him: 'When we were fasting with the Prophet, we would eat a meal before dawn. Then we would stand up for morning prayer.' Anas asked Zaid how long it took between eating and praying. Zaid replied, 'It was just enough time to recite 50-60 verses from the Quran.'

title: Prophet's Morning Routine
content: Anas bin Malik said that the Prophet and Zaid bin Thabit ate together in the morning. After finishing their meal, the Prophet stood up to pray Fajr prayer. Anas said it took just enough time to recite fifty verses of the Qur'an between eating and praying.

title: Taking Suhur and Fajr Prayer
content: Sahl bin Sa'd used to eat with his family before dawn. He would hurry so he could pray with the Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) when it was time for morning prayer.

title: Women's Attendance at Fajr Prayer
content: Believing women would attend the early morning prayer with the Prophet. They wore veils to cover themselves and after praying, they would go home. It was dark so nobody could see them.

title: Morning and Asr Prayer
content: Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) said: If you can pray one part of the Fajr prayer before sunrise, you have prayed the morning prayer. And if you can pray one part of the Asr prayer before sunset, you have prayed the Asr prayer.

title: Prayer in Its Proper Time
content: The Prophet (ﷺ) said, 'If you can pray one part of a prayer on time, that's the whole prayer'.

title: Prayer Times and Sun
content: The Prophet (ﷺ) said to pray after Fajr prayer when the sun is up. He also said not to pray after Asr prayer until the sun sets.

title: Prayer Times to Avoid
content: Ibn Umar said the Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) said: 'Do not pray when the sun is rising or setting.' If you see the edge of the sun, wait until it's high in the sky. And if you see the edge of the sun disappearing, wait until it sets completely before praying.

title: Prayer Times to Avoid
content: Ibn Umar said the Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) said: 'Don't pray when the sun is rising or setting.' If you see the edge of the sun, wait until it's high in the sky. If you see the edge of the sun disappearing, wait until it sets completely before praying.

title: Forbidden Actions
content: Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) forbade two types of sales and two types of clothing. He also said it's not allowed to pray after the morning prayer until the sun rises, or after the afternoon prayer until the sun sets. Additionally, he forbade wearing a single garment in such a way that private parts are exposed, and two other kinds of sales called 'Munabadha' and 'Mulamasa'.

title: Praying at Sunrise/Sunset
content: Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) said: Don't try to pray when the sun is rising or setting.

title: Prayer Times
content: Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) said: After the morning prayer, you can't pray again until the sun is up. And after the Asr prayer, you can't pray again until the sun sets.

title: Two Rak'ats After Asr Prayer
content: Muawiya said that the Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) never prayed two rak'ats after the afternoon prayer when he was with him. He had actually forbidden this practice.

title: Prayer Times to Avoid
content: Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) said: Do not pray after the morning prayer until the sun is fully up. Also, do not pray after the Asr prayer until the sun sets completely.

title: Praying at Any Time
content: Ibn Umar said: I pray as my friends do. I don't stop people from praying day or night, except during sunset and sunrise.

title: Praying after Asr Prayer
content: The Prophet (ﷺ) never missed praying two rak'at after the Asr prayer. He only prayed while sitting when standing became too hard for him. He usually did this at home, not in the mosque, so it wouldn't be difficult for his followers.

title: Prophet's Prayer Routine
content: Aisha told me that the Prophet never missed two prostrations after the Asr prayer at her house.

title: Messenger's Prayer Routine
content: Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) never missed two rak'at before the Fajr prayer and after the Asr prayer. This was true when people were watching, and also when no one was around.

title: Prophet's Evening Prayer
content: When the Prophet came home after the afternoon prayer, he would pray two units of prayer.

title: Leave Asr Prayer on Time
content: I was with Buraida on a cloudy day. He said to me, 'Offer the afternoon prayer earlier.' The Prophet (ﷺ) said, 'If someone misses this prayer, their good deeds will be cancelled out.'

title: Prophet's Midnight Prayer
content: My father told me that we were traveling with the Prophet. Some people said they wanted him to rest during the last part of the night. The Prophet (ﷺ) said he was worried they would sleep and miss the morning prayer. Bilal said he would wake them up, but he too fell asleep. The Prophet (ﷺ) woke up when the sun started rising. He asked Bilal if he had slept much, and Bilal said no. The Prophet (ﷺ) said Allah can take our souls at any time. He told Bilal to get up and call people for prayer. The Prophet (ﷺ) then performed ablution and prayed when the sun was bright.

title: Missing Asr Prayer
content: Jabir bin Abdullah said that on the day of Al-Khandaq, Umar came to the Prophet after sunset. He had missed his afternoon prayer because he was busy cursing the disbelievers of Quraish. The Prophet (ﷺ) said he hadn't prayed either. They went to a nearby place called Buthan and performed ablution together. Then they offered their delayed afternoon prayer after sunset, followed by the evening prayer.

title: Remembering Forgotten Prayers
content: The Prophet (ﷺ) said: If you forget a prayer, pray it when you remember. There's no other way to make up for it. He also said: 'Pray to remember Allah'.

title: Umar's Delayed Prayer
content: Jabir said that Umar was late for the Asr prayer on the day of Al-Khandaq. He cursed the disbelievers from Quraish and didn't pray until sunset. Later, he went to Buthan who prayed Asr after sunset, then Maghrib.

title: Prophet's Prayer Times
content: Abu-l-Minhal's father and he went to Abu Barza. His father asked about the Prophet's prayer times. Abu Barza said, 'The Prophet (ﷺ) prayed Zuhr when the sun was at its peak. He prayed Asr while it was still hot outside. The Prophet (ﷺ) liked to pray Isha late and didn't like to sleep before it or talk after it. After morning prayer, he'd return home in daylight. He recited 60-100 verses of the Quran during this time.'

title: Waiting for Prayer
content: Al-Hasan said he was late because his neighbors invited him. He reminded us that the Prophet once led a prayer at midnight and told us, 'You were praying as long as you waited.' This means people are rewarded for being patient and doing good things.

title: Prophet's Important Night
content: One night, the Prophet prayed and said: 'Do you understand how special this night is? None of you will be alive in a hundred years.' People misunderstood him. He meant that when one century passes, it won't matter who lives then.

title: Sharing Food with the Prophet
content: Abdur Rahman bin Abi Bakr said that the Prophet told him to take in more guests who were poor. The Prophet (ﷺ) himself took ten of them. Abu Bakr took three men and stayed with the Prophet for a long time, eating supper together. When he went back home, his wife asked why he was late. He said they had refused to eat until he came. But when he got there, they said they didn't want food yet. Abu Bakr's family ate but he swore not to because of his anger. However, the food kept increasing and everyone ate their fill. When Abu Bakr saw this, he realized it was a miracle from Allah. He took some food back to the Prophet and they all shared in eating it.

title: Bilal's Call to Prayer
content: Anas said that people suggested using fire or a bell to signal when it was time for prayer. They mentioned the Jews and Christians, who use these kinds of signals. The Prophet (ﷺ) ordered Bilal to call out twice for Adhan (the start of prayer) and once for Iqama (when everyone is ready).

title: Introducing Call to Prayer
content: When Muslims first arrived in Medina, they would gather for prayer but didn't know when it was time. They thought about using a bell like Christians or a trumpet like Jews, but `Umar suggested having someone call out for prayer instead. The Prophet (ﷺ) agreed and asked Bilal to be the one to make the announcement.

title: Bilal's Adhan Instructions
content: Anas said that Bilal was told to say the call to prayer twice and only once say 'Come for prayer' except when saying it before prayer starts.

title: Prayer Time Announcement
content: When there were many Muslims, they wanted to know when it was time for prayer. Some suggested lighting a fire or ringing a bell. The Prophet (ﷺ) ordered Bilal to say the call to prayer twice and the final call once.

title: Bilal's Adhan Instructions
content: Anas told us that Bilal was ordered to say the words of the call to prayer twice. But he only had to say the words for getting ready for prayer once.

title: Satan Runs Away from Prayer
content: When the Adhan is called, Satan runs away and makes a loud noise to avoid hearing it. He comes back when the Adhan ends, but then he runs away again when the Iqama is called. After the Iqama finishes, he returns once more. During this time, he tries to distract the person praying by making them remember things they didn't think of before and causing them to forget how much they've prayed.

title: Raise Your Voice in Adhan
content: Abu Sa`id said to his friend, 'When you're with your sheep or in the wilderness and it's time for prayer, shout out the call to prayer. If anyone hears it - human, jinn, or animal - they'll be a witness on the Day of Resurrection.' He heard this from the Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ).

title: Waiting for Morning Prayer
content: Anas said the Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) never attacked a town before morning prayer. If he heard the call to prayer, he would wait. One day, they reached Khaibar at night and in the morning, there was no call to prayer. The Prophet (ﷺ) rode his horse, and I rode behind Abi Talha. When we saw the people of Khaibar, they shouted 'Muhammad (ﷺ)! By Allah, Muhammad (ﷺ) and his army.' The Prophet (ﷺ) said, 'Allah is greater! Allahu-Akbar! Khaibar is ruined. Whenever we approach a town to fight, evil will be the morning for those who have been warned'.

title: When You Hear the Call to Prayer
content: Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) said: When you hear someone calling for prayer, repeat what they are saying.

title: Muawiya Recites Adhan
content: Isa bin Talha heard Muawiya say the call to prayer. He said 'I testify that Allah is one God' and 'I testify that Muhammad (ﷺ) is Allah's Messenger (ﷺ)'.

title: Muawiya's Prayer Before Salat
content: When a Mu'adhdhin called out for prayer, Muawiya would say 'There is no power or strength except with Allah.' He said this because the Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) had also said it.

title: Prayer after Adhan
content: When you hear the mosque call to prayer, say: 'O Allah, Lord of this perfect call and regular prayer, give Muhammad (ﷺ) a special place in Paradise. Raise him to a high rank that You promised.' If you do this, I will be allowed to pray for you on Judgment Day.

title: Rewards for Prayer Times
content: Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) said: If people knew how much reward they get from saying the prayer call and standing in the front row during prayers, they would even draw lots to get that chance. They would also hurry to pray at the right time of the day if they knew how much reward it gives. And they would come early for morning and night prayers, even crawling if needed.

title: Ibn Abbas on Prayer at Home
content: One rainy day, Ibn Abbas gave a sermon. When the muezzin called for prayer, Ibn Abbas told him to say 'Pray at home.' The people were surprised. Ibn Abbas said this was done by someone better than him, and it's allowed.

title: Break Your Fast Early
content: My father said that the Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) said: 'Bilal calls out the prayer at night. Keep eating and drinking until Ibn Um Maktum calls out the prayer.' Ibn Um Maktum was a blind man who only called out the prayer when someone told him it was morning.

title: Prayer Before Fajr Congregation
content: When the Mu'adh-dhin calls for Fajr prayer and it's getting light, the Prophet tells us to do a two-rak'a prayer first before joining the main congregation.

title: Two Light Rak'ats Before Fajr
content: Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) used to pray two short prayers between the call to prayer and when it's time to start the morning prayer.

title: Eat Before Fajr Prayer
content: Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) said: 'Keep eating and drinking until Bilal's Adhan is followed by Ibn Um Maktum's Adhan'.

title: Bilal's Adhan and Dawn
content: The Prophet (ﷺ) said that Bilal's call to prayer should not stop you from eating before dawn. He calls out at night so people can wake up for late-night prayer. It doesn't mean it's already morning when the sky starts to lighten, like this (points upwards). The real dawn spreads across the horizon, not just appears in one spot.

title: Eat before Fajr Prayer
content: Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) said to his wife Aisha: 'Bilal calls the Adhan at night. Eat and drink until Ibn Um Maktum calls the Adhan.'

title: Eat Before Fajr Prayer
content: Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) said to Aisha: 'Bilal calls for prayer at night. Eat and drink until Ibn Um Maktum calls for prayer.'

title: Prayer Between Adhans
content: Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) said three times: 'There is a prayer between the two calls to prayer.' He added, 'For anyone who wants to pray'.

title: Praying Before Maghrib
content: When the Mu'adh-dhin called out for prayer, some companions of the Prophet would go to the mosque pillars. They'd pray two rakats before the Maghrib prayer. There was usually a short time between the call and when they stood up to pray.

title: Morning Prayer Routine
content: Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) used to pray two quick prayers after the morning call to prayer had finished. He would lie on his right side until it was time for the main morning prayer.

title: Prayer Between Two Calls
content: Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) said: 'There is a prayer between the two calls to prayer. There is another prayer between the two calls.' He added, 'For anyone who wants to pray'.

title: Teach Your Families Prayer
content: I visited the Prophet with some men from my tribe. We stayed with him for twenty nights. He was kind to us. When he saw we missed our families, he said: 'Go back and stay with your families. Teach them about Islam and how to pray. One of you should call people to prayer when it's time. The oldest among you should lead the prayer.'

title: Waiting for Cooler Weather
content: We were on a journey with the Prophet. A Mu'adh-dhin wanted to call out for prayer but the Prophet said, 'Wait.' He kept saying that until the shadows of hills were as long as the hills themselves. The Prophet (ﷺ) explained, 'This heat is because of Hell's fire'.

title: Prayer on a Journey
content: Two men went to see the Prophet. They were planning a trip and asked about prayer. The Prophet (ﷺ) said: 'When you leave, say the call to prayer (Adhan), then get ready for it (Iqama). The older one of you should lead the prayer'.

title: Prophet's Advice to Young Companions
content: We stayed with the Prophet for twenty days. He was kind and merciful. When we missed our families, he asked about them. Then he told us to go back home and teach our families about Islam. He said to pray like you've seen me praying. When it's time for prayer, one of you should call out the Adhan and the oldest person should lead the prayer.

title: Praying on Cold Nights
content: Ibn Umar told us that one night it was very cold. He gave the call to prayer and then said, 'Pray at your homes'. This is what the Prophet used to tell the person who gives the call to prayer to say when it's raining or very cold.

title: Allah's Messenger Prays
content: My father said he saw the Prophet at a place called Al-Abtah. Bilal came and told him it was time for prayer. Then, Bilal brought a short stick and planted it in front of the Prophet to signal the start of prayer.

title: Bilal's Prayer Call
content: My father said he saw Bilal making the prayer call. He turned his face from side to side while saying it.

title: Praying with Calmness
content: My father said the Prophet heard people making noise during prayer. He asked what was happening and they said they were rushing to pray. The Prophet (ﷺ) told them not to hurry for prayer, but instead come calmly when it's time. If you miss some of the prayer, join in with the others and finish what you missed later.

title: Pray with Calmness
content: When you hear the call to prayer, go calmly and quietly. Pray as much as you can, but don't rush. If you miss a part of the prayer, finish it when you can.

title: Stand for Prayer
content: When the prayer call is made, don't start praying until you see me standing in front of you.

title: When to Stand for Prayer
content: My father said that the Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) said: 'If you hear someone call out for prayer, don't start praying until you see me standing in front of you. Then stand up calmly and pray.'

title: Prophet Muhammad's Prayer Routine
content: Abu Huraira said the Prophet went out of the mosque when it was time to pray. He stood at his usual spot, but then left us waiting. We stayed in our places until he came back with water dripping from his head - he had taken a bath.

title: Allah's Messenger Misses Prayer
content: Abu Huraira said that when it was time to pray, the call for prayer was made. People stood up straight and got into position. But Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) went back because he wasn't clean after using the bathroom. He told everyone to stay where they were and went home to wash himself. After washing his head, he came back and led the prayer.

title: Umar's Delayed Prayer
content: Jabir bin Abdullah said: On the day of Al-Khandaq, Umar came to the Prophet and said, 'I couldn't pray until sunset.' The Prophet (ﷺ) was with someone who had just broken their fast. They went to Buthan together. The Prophet (ﷺ) performed ablution and prayed Asr after sunset, then Maghrib.

title: Prophet's Delayed Prayer
content: Anas said the Prophet was talking to someone in a corner of the mosque when the prayer call went out. He didn't lead the prayer until some people had fallen asleep while sitting.

title: Man Interrupts the Prophet's Prayer
content: Anas bin Malik said that when the prayer call was made, a man came to the Prophet and stopped him from praying.

title: Burn Houses of Absentees
content: Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) said: 'If I ordered someone to burn the houses of people who don't come to prayer, many would attend. Even if they got just a small piece of meat, they'd come for the night prayer.'

title: Prayer in Congregation
content: Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) said that praying together is 27 times better than praying alone.

title: Congregation Prayer is Better
content: The Prophet (ﷺ) said that praying with others in a group is 25 times more valuable than praying alone by yourself.

title: Reward of Congregational Prayer
content: Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) said: The reward for praying in a group is 25 times more than praying alone. If you go to the mosque with the intention of praying, your sins are forgiven and you get one degree closer to Allah for every step you take towards the mosque. When you pray, angels ask Allah to bless and forgive you until you leave the prayer area.

title: Benefits of Fajr Prayer
content: Abu Huraira said he heard the Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) say that praying in congregation is better than praying alone. He said the angels of the night and day come together for Fajr prayer, which is very important. The Quran says that reciting it during Fajr time is witnessed by Allah.

title: Congregational Prayer Reward
content: Abdullah bin Umar said that praying with others is rewarded much more than praying alone. The reward is twenty-seven times greater.

title: Abu Ad-Darda's Concern
content: Salim told me that his mother Um Ad-Darda' said: 'My husband Abu Ad-Darda' came home angry. I asked him, 'What's wrong?' He replied, 'I don't see people following Muhammad 's (ﷺ) teachings anymore, except when they pray together.' This happened near the end of Abu Ad-Darda's life during Uthman's rule.

title: Reward for Prayer Distance
content: The Prophet (ﷺ) said, 'Those who pray from far away get a great reward. Then those who are next farthest and so on. Someone who waits to pray with the Imam gets more reward than someone who prays and goes to bed.'

title: Removing Obstacles
content: Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) said that a man saw a thorny branch on the road and removed it. Allah was pleased with this action and forgave him for it. The Prophet (ﷺ) also mentioned five types of people who are considered martyrs: those who die from certain illnesses, drowning, or being buried alive. He also talked about the rewards of performing certain actions in prayer, such as saying the Adhan, standing at the front of the congregation, praying early, and attending night and morning prayers.

title: Removing Obstacles
content: Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) said that a man was walking and saw a thorny branch on the path. He removed it. Allah liked what he did and forgave him for it. The Prophet (ﷺ) also said that five types of people are considered martyrs: those who die from plague, stomach problems, drowning, being buried alive, or killed while fighting for Allah's cause. If people knew how good it is to call the prayer time and stand at the front of the congregation, they would do anything to get that reward. They would even rush to pray early in the day if they knew how much good it does. And they would crawl to the mosque at night if they knew how much reward they get for praying together.

title: Removing an Obstacle
content: The Prophet (ﷺ) said that a man removed a thorny branch from the road. Allah was pleased and forgave him for it. The Prophet (ﷺ) also said that five types of people are considered martyrs: those who die from certain illnesses, drowning, being buried alive, or fighting in Allah's cause. He added that if people knew how much reward is given for saying the Adhan, standing at the front of prayer, praying during the day, and attending night and morning prayers, they would do whatever it takes to get this reward.

title: Reward for Walking to Mosque
content: The Prophet (ﷺ) said to the people of Bani Salima: 'For every step you take towards the mosque, you get a reward.' He didn't want them to move their homes because he thought it would leave their old houses empty.

title: Reward for Walking to Mosque
content: Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) said: 'For every step you take towards the mosque, there is a reward.' The people of Bani Salima wanted to move closer to the Prophet's house. He told them not to leave their homes empty and said that they would still get a reward for walking to the mosque.

title: Hypocrites Miss Fajr and Isha
content: The Prophet (ﷺ) said: The two prayers that are hardest for hypocrites to attend are the early morning prayer (Fajr) and the night prayer (Isha). If they knew how much reward is in these prayers, they would come even if it meant crawling. The Prophet (ﷺ) wanted to order the call-maker to start the prayer, then find someone to lead the people in prayer, but he was so angry that he almost ordered a fire to be lit to burn down the houses of those who didn't leave for prayer yet.

title: Leading Prayer in Congregation
content: Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) said to two people: When it's time for prayer, call out the Adhan and then the Iqama. The older person should lead the prayer.

title: Angels Pray for You
content: When you're at your prayer spot and not doing something private, angels ask Allah to forgive and be kind to you. They keep praying until you leave the spot or start a new activity.

title: Seven People Who Will Find Shade
content: The Prophet (ﷺ) said that Allah will give shade to seven people on a very hot day. These are: a fair leader, a young person who has always been kind and respectful of Allah, someone who loves going to the mosque to pray, two friends who only care about each other because they love Allah, a man who says no to a woman who wants him to do something wrong, a secret giver of charity, and someone who remembers Allah in private and cries.

title: Prophet Muhammad's Ring
content: Anas was asked if the Prophet wore a ring. He said yes. One night, the Prophet delayed the late-night prayer until midnight. After praying, he faced his companions and said, 'The people prayed and went to sleep, but you stayed up in prayer.' Anas remembered seeing the sparkle of the Prophet's ring.

title: Going to the Mosque
content: The Prophet (ﷺ) said that Allah will give a special place in Paradise to those who go to the mosque for prayer every morning and afternoon. This is because of their regular attendance at the mosque.

title: Prophet's Warning on Prayer
content: Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) saw a man praying two extra rakat after the prayer call. When he finished his own prayer, people gathered around him and the Prophet asked the man, 'Is it four rakat in Fajr prayer?' He repeated this question twice.

title: Prophet's Prayer When Sick
content: Aisha and her friends were talking about prayer. She said the Prophet told them to get Abu Bakr to lead the prayer when he was too sick to do it himself. The Prophet (ﷺ) gave this order three times, but they thought Abu Bakr would be too emotional to lead the prayer. Finally, Abu Bakr led the prayer while the Prophet sat beside him. Later, the Prophet got a bit better and came out with two men helping him. He sat next to Abu Bakr during the rest of the prayer.

title: Prophet's Illness and Move
content: When the Prophet was very sick, he asked his wives if he could stay in my house to recover. He got permission and came out with help from two men - Al-`Abbas and another man. The other man was `Ali Ibn Abi Talib.

title: Ibn Umar's Prayer Advice
content: One very cold and stormy night, Ibn `Umar called the Adhan for prayer. Then he said, 'Pray in your homes.' He added that on nights like this, Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) used to tell the Mu'adh-dhin to say, 'Pray in your homes'.

title: Praying at Home
content: Itban bin Malik was a blind man who led his tribe in prayer. He asked the Prophet to pray at home when it's dark and raining outside, so he wouldn't have trouble finding his way. The Prophet (ﷺ) went to Itban's house and prayed there.

title: Ibn Abbas on Prayer at Home
content: One day, Ibn Abbas told us to stay home and pray. The people were surprised because they wanted to go to the mosque. Ibn Abbas said that he didn't want them to be sinful by not praying or to get muddy going to the mosque.

title: Rainy Day Prayer
content: Abu Sa'id Al-Khudri said: A cloud came and it rained. Water leaked into our mosque, which had a roof made of palm tree branches. The prayer call was made. I saw the Prophet praying in the water and mud. Even his forehead got dirty with mud.

title: Praying at Home with the Prophet
content: Anas said a man from Ansar told the Prophet he couldn't pray in congregation. The man was very fat and invited the Prophet to his house for food. He spread out a mat, washed one side with water, and the Prophet prayed two units of prayer on it. Someone asked Anas if the Prophet used to pray at midday. Anas said no, but he did that once.

title: Eat Before Prayer Time
content: Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) said: When it's time for the evening prayer and food is ready, eat first before going to pray.

title: Eat Before Maghrib Prayer
content: The Prophet (ﷺ) said, 'When your food is ready, eat before you pray the evening prayer. Don't rush through eating.'

title: Eat Before Prayer Time
content: Ibn Umar said that the Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) said: 'When you're eating and it's time for prayer, finish your meal first. Don't rush to leave until you've finished.' Ibn Umar followed this advice even when he heard the Imam start praying.

title: Eat Satisfied Before Prayer
content: The Prophet (ﷺ) said: If you're eating and the prayer starts, wait until you're full before getting up to pray.

title: Eating Before Prayer
content: My father said he saw the Prophet eating a piece of meat. He was called to pray, so he put down his knife and stood up to pray without washing first.

title: Prophet's Home Life
content: Al-Aswad asked Aisha what the Prophet did in his home. She said he took care of his family and helped them when needed. When it was time for prayer, he would leave to pray.

title: Malik's Prayer Style
content: Abu Qilaba said Malik bin Huwairith came to the mosque. He prayed in front of Abu Qilaba and said his goal wasn't to lead prayer, but to show how the Prophet prayed. Abu Qilaba asked, 'How did the Prophet pray?' Malik replied, 'The Prophet (ﷺ) would sit for a moment after prostrating, before standing up after the first part of the prayer.'

title: Prophet's Illness and Prayer
content: The Prophet (ﷺ) became sick. He told his companions to ask Abu Bakr to lead the prayer. Aisha said Abu Bakr was too emotional for this job. The Prophet (ﷺ) repeated the order, saying they were like Joseph's companions, who had been in a similar situation. Eventually, Abu Bakr led the people in prayer while the Prophet was still ill.

title: Abu Bakr Leads the Prayer
content: When Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) was ill, he asked Aisha to tell Abu Bakr to lead the people in prayer. But Aisha thought that Abu Bakr would cry too much and no one could hear him. So she suggested telling Umar to lead instead. However, when Hafsa repeated this message, Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) said 'Stop! You are like Joseph's companions.' He then asked them again to tell Abu Bakr to lead the prayer.

title: Prophet's Final Prayer
content: Anas bin Malik told me that during the Prophet's illness, Abu Bakr led the prayer on a Monday. When people stood up to pray, the Prophet looked out from behind his curtain and smiled. His face was shining like the Quran. We were about to see him, so Abu Bakr joined the row thinking he would lead the prayer. The Prophet (ﷺ) signaled us to finish the prayer without him. He let the curtain fall and died on that same day.

title: Prophet's Absence from Prayer
content: The Prophet (ﷺ) didn't leave his house for three days. The people waited for him to lead the prayer, but Abu Bakr led it instead. Meanwhile, the Prophet lifted a curtain and showed his face. He signaled to Abu Bakr to continue leading the prayer, then hid again behind the curtain. We didn't see him until he passed away.

title: Abu Bakr Leads Prayer
content: When the Prophet was very ill, he asked his friends to tell Abu Bakr to lead the people in prayer. They said Abu Bakr would cry if he read from the Quran. The Prophet (ﷺ) told them again to ask Abu Bakr to lead the prayer. He reminded them that women are like the companions of Joseph.

title: Prophet Muhammad's Prayer Leadership
content: When Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) was ill, he asked Abu Bakr to lead the people in prayer. When Abu Bakr saw the Prophet come out, he wanted to leave but the Prophet signaled for him to stay. The Prophet (ﷺ) sat beside Abu Bakr and Abu Bakr followed his lead in the prayer.

title: Abu Bakr Leads Prayer
content: Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) went to make peace with a group. When it was time for prayer, the caller asked Abu Bakr to lead the prayer. The Prophet (ﷺ) arrived while people were praying and stood in their row. They clapped hands to show respect. Abu Bakr didn't look away from his prayer but when they kept clapping, he saw the Prophet. The Prophet (ﷺ) signaled him to stay where he was. After the prayer, the Prophet asked Abu Bakr why he left. Abu Bakr said it wasn't right for him to lead prayer in front of the Prophet. The Prophet (ﷺ) then explained that if someone needs help during prayer, they should say 'Praise be to God'. He also said clapping is not allowed because it's for women.

title: Teach Your Family to Pray
content: We were young men who stayed with the Prophet for about twenty nights. He was very kind and told us: 'When you go home, teach your families to pray at certain times. One of you should call out the prayer announcement and the oldest person should lead the prayer.'

title: Prophet's Prayer in a Home
content: Ibn Malik invited the Prophet to his home. The Prophet (ﷺ) asked if he could enter and Ibn Malik said yes. He then asked where he should pray, and Ibn Malik showed him a place. The Prophet (ﷺ) stood up to pray, and Ibn Malik and others followed behind him. After finishing the prayer, they all said 'Taslim' together.

title: Prophet's Illness and Prayer
content: Aisha told me about the Prophet's illness. He became very sick and asked if people had prayed yet. We said no, they were waiting for him. He asked us to put water in a trough so he could take a bath. After taking a bath, he tried to get up but fainted. When he recovered, he asked again if the people had prayed. They hadn't, so he took another bath and tried to stand up but fainted again. This happened three times. The Prophet (ﷺ) then sent for Abu Bakr to lead the people in prayer because they were waiting for him. Abu Bakr was leading the prayer when the Prophet came out with two men helping him, including Al-Abbas. When Abu Bakr saw the Prophet, he wanted to step aside but the Prophet signaled for him not to do so and asked them to make him sit next to Abu Bakr instead. The people were following Abu Bakr's lead in prayer while the Prophet prayed sitting down.

title: Prayer While Sitting
content: When the Prophet was ill, he prayed at home while sitting. Some people prayed behind him standing up. He signaled them to sit down too. After the prayer, he said: 'Follow the Imam. When he bows, bow with him. When he stands up, stand up with him. Say 'Allah heard those who praised Him' when he says it. And say 'Our Lord, all praise is for You' after that. If the Imam prays sitting down, you pray sitting down too.'

title: Following the Imam's Lead
content: Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) rode a horse and fell off. He hurt his right side. He prayed while sitting down. We also prayed behind him, sitting down. After the prayer, he said: 'When the leader prays standing, we should stand too. When he bows, we should bow. If he says

title: Prophet Muhammad's Prayer Example
content: When the Prophet said 'Allah hears who praises Him', none of us bowed down to pray until he did, and then we followed his example by bowing down after him.

title: Respect the Imam
content: The Prophet (ﷺ) said to Abu Huraira: 'If someone stands up before the Imam, they might be turned into a donkey. Their head could become like a donkey's and their face too.'

title: Leading Prayers in Quba'
content: Ibn Umar said that when the first Muslims arrived at a place called Al-'Usba in Quba', they were led in prayer by Salim, who was a slave of Abu Hudhaifa. He knew more of the Quran than anyone else.

title: Listen to Your Leader
content: The Prophet (ﷺ) said: 'Always listen and obey your leader, even if it's someone you don't think is important. Even if a person who looks like an old raisin was made the leader.'

title: Leading Prayer Correctly
content: Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) said: If the Imam leads the prayer correctly, both he and you will get a reward. But if he makes a mistake in the prayer, you'll still get your reward for praying, but his sin will be his own.

title: Following a Leader in Prayer
content: 'Ubaid-Ullah bin Adi went to 'Uthman bin Affan while he was under siege. He said, 'You're the leader of all Muslims and you see what's happening. We follow our prayer leader, but we're worried about doing something wrong.' 'Uthman replied, 'Prayer is the best thing we can do. If people are good, be like them. If they're bad, don't follow their bad actions.' Az-Zuhri said it's not a good idea to pray behind someone who acts like a woman unless there's no other choice.

title: Obey Your Leader
content: The Prophet (ﷺ) told Abu-Dhar to listen and obey their leader, even if they are from a different background or look unusual.

title: Ibn Abbas Visits Maimuna
content: One night, I stayed with my aunt Maimuna. The Prophet (ﷺ) came to her house after the late-night prayer and prayed four times while sitting down. He then slept. Later, he woke up, stood for prayer, and I stood next to him on his left side. He moved me to stand on his right side. He prayed five times and then two more times. After that, he went back to sleep until it was time for the morning prayer.

title: Ibn Abbas' Night at Maimuna's
content: One night I slept at my aunt Maimuna's house. The Prophet (ﷺ) was there too. He washed his face and hands for prayer, then stood up to pray. I joined him on the left side, but he moved me to stand next to him on the right. He prayed thirteen prayers. Then he fell asleep. When he slept, he made loud breathing sounds. Later, a caller came to wake the Prophet for morning prayer. The Prophet (ﷺ) got up and prayed without washing his hands again.

title: Prophet's Night Prayer
content: Ibn Abbas was visiting his aunt Maimuna. The Prophet (ﷺ) stood for the night prayer. Ibn Abbas joined him and stood on his left side, but the Prophet gently moved him to stand on his right.

title: Mu`adh's Prayer Experience
content: I prayed with the Prophet at night. Then I led my people in prayer afterwards.

title: Mu`adh's Prayer Criticism
content: Jabir bin `Abdullah said that Mu`adh bin Jabal would pray with the Prophet and then lead his people in prayer. One night, he led them in the 'Isha' prayer and recited Surat Al-Baqara. Someone left during the prayer, so Mu`adh criticized him. The Prophet (ﷺ) heard about this and told Mu`adh, 'You're making things too hard for the people.' He said it three times and then ordered Mu`adh to read two shorter chapters from the Quran instead.

title: Shorten Your Prayer
content: A man complained to the Prophet that someone was making prayer long. The Prophet (ﷺ) said: 'Some of you make people dislike praying. If you lead prayer, keep it short because there are weak and old people who may get tired.'

title: Leading Prayer for Others
content: When you lead people in prayer, make it shorter. Some of them are weak, sick, or old and might struggle with a longer prayer. But if you're praying alone, you can pray as long as you want.

title: Shorten Prayer for Others
content: A man told the Prophet that he missed morning prayer because the Imam made it too long. The Prophet (ﷺ) became angry and said, 'When you lead people in prayer, be kind to those behind you. Shorten the prayer for the weak, old, and poor.'

title: Mu'adh's Prayer Advice
content: Jabir said that a man was driving two camels at night. He saw Mu'adh praying and joined him. Mu'adh recited Surah Al-Baqara. The man left, but later complained to the Prophet about Mu'adh. The Prophet (ﷺ) asked Mu'adh three times if he was testing others. He suggested that Mu'adh should have read a different surah for people who might be weak or struggling.

title: Prophet's Short Congregation Prayer
content: The Prophet (ﷺ) used to lead a short prayer in congregation. He made sure it was done correctly and properly.

title: Prayer and Crying Child
content: My father told me that the Prophet said: When I'm praying, I want to pray for a long time. But if I hear a child crying, I stop my prayer because it's not right to trouble the mother.

title: Praying Behind the Prophet
content: Anas bin Malik said: I never prayed behind an Imam who led a prayer that was shorter and more complete than one led by the Prophet. The Prophet (ﷺ) would shorten his prayers when he heard a baby crying, so the mother wouldn't be worried.

title: Prayer for a Crying Child
content: The Prophet (ﷺ) said: When I start praying, I want to pray for a long time. But when I hear a child crying, I stop the prayer. This is because I know that if the mother hears her child crying, she will get upset.

title: Prophet Shortens His Prayer
content: The Prophet (ﷺ) said that when he starts praying, he wants to pray for a long time. But if he hears a baby crying, he stops the prayer because it might make the mother upset.

title: Mu'adh Prays with Prophet
content: Jabir bin Abdullah said that Mu'adh would pray with the Prophet and then lead his people in prayer.

title: Prophet Muhammad's Prayer Order
content: When Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) was ill, someone came to tell him about the prayer. He asked them to ask Abu Bakr to lead the people in prayer. I (Aisha) said that Abu Bakr would cry and not be able to read from the Quran. The Prophet (ﷺ) told me to ask Abu Bakr again. I did this three or four times, until he finally said 'Tell Abu Bakr to lead the prayer.' Abu Bakr led the prayer, but then the Prophet got better and came out with two men's help. When Abu Bakr saw him, he wanted to stop leading the prayer, but the Prophet signaled for him to keep going. The Prophet (ﷺ) sat beside Abu Bakr and Abu Bakr continued to say 'Allahu Akbar' so everyone could hear.

title: Prophet's Illness and Prayer
content: When Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) was very sick, Bilal came to him for prayer. He asked Bilal to tell Abu Bakr to lead the people in prayer. I, Aisha, said to Bilal that Abu Bakr is a kind person and might not be able to make everyone hear him. So I suggested telling Umar to lead instead. But the Prophet again told Bilal to ask Abu Bakr to lead the prayer. Just then, Abu Bakr was about to start praying when the Prophet felt a bit better and came into the mosque with two people helping him. When the Prophet saw Abu Bakr leading the prayer, he signaled for him to continue. The Prophet (ﷺ) sat next to Abu Bakr while he stood up to pray, and everyone else followed Abu Bakr.

title: Short Prayer and Prostration
content: Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) prayed two rak'at instead of four. Dhul-Yadain asked if the prayer was reduced or forgotten. The Prophet (ﷺ) checked with the people, who said it was true. He stood up, added the remaining two rak'at, finished his prayer, and said 'God is great'. Then he did two prostrations.

title: Prophet's Prayer Mistake
content: Abu Huraira said the Prophet prayed only two rak'at of Zuhr prayer instead of four. Someone told him he had made a mistake. He then prayed two more rak'at and finished with the usual way of saying 'peace be upon you'. After that, he did two prostrations.

title: Allah's Messenger's Last Illness
content: When Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) was very sick, he asked Aisha to tell Abu Bakr to lead the people in prayer. Aisha said that Abu Bakr would cry and not be able to make everyone hear him. She suggested telling Umar to lead instead. But Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) insisted that Abu Bakr should lead the prayer.

title: Straighten Your Rows
content: The Prophet (ﷺ) said: 'Make sure your rows are straight. If you don't, Allah might change the way you look.'

title: Straighten Your Rows
content: Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) said to his followers: 'Make your rows straight. I can see you from behind.'

title: Stand Closer in Prayer
content: Anas bin Malik said that the Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) told us to straighten our rows and stand closer together when we were about to pray. He was looking at us from behind his back.

title: Martyrs and Prayer Rewards
content: The Prophet (ﷺ) said that people who die from drowning, plague, a stomach disease, or being trapped by a falling building are considered martyrs. He also said that if people knew how much reward they get for praying at the right time for Zuhr prayer, they would hurry to do it. If they knew about the rewards for praying together in Isha and Fajr prayers, they would join even if it meant crawling there. And he mentioned that if people knew how great the reward is for standing in the front row during prayer, they would draw lots to be there.

title: Martyrs and Rewards
content: The Prophet (ﷺ) said that people who die from drowning, plague, a stomach disease, or being buried alive by a building are considered martyrs. He also said that if people knew how much reward they get for praying at the right time for Zuhr prayer, they would hurry to do it. If they knew how much reward they get for praying together in Isha and Fajr prayers, they would even crawl to join them. And he said that if people knew how great a reward is given for standing in the front row during prayer, they would draw lots to be there.

title: Follow the Imam in Prayer
content: The Prophet (ﷺ) said: When the Imam leads you in prayer, follow him. Bow when he bows and say 'Rabbana-lakal hamd' if he says 'Sami`a l-lahu liman hamidah'. If he prostrates, do the same. And sit together with him during seated prayers. Make sure your rows are straight for a perfect prayer.

title: Straighten Your Rows in Prayer
content: The Prophet (ﷺ) said: 'Make your rows straight. It's very important for a good prayer.'

title: No Standing Together in Prayer
content: I came to Medina and people asked me if I noticed any changes since the time of Allah's Messenger (ﷺ). I said, 'The only thing I've noticed is that you don't stand together in your prayers anymore.'

title: Straighten Your Rows
content: The Prophet (ﷺ) said to his followers: 'Make your rows straight. I can see you from behind.' Anas explained that they used to stand close together, with each person's shoulder against the next and their feet together.

title: Ibn Abbas Prays with the Prophet
content: One night, I prayed with the Prophet. He stood on my left side during prayer. Then he caught hold of my head and moved me to his right side. After that, we finished praying and went to sleep. Later, a man came to call us for the next prayer. The Prophet (ﷺ) got up without washing his hands first.

title: Anas' Prayer Experience
content: One night, an orphan and I prayed behind the Prophet in my house. My mother was standing behind us by herself.

title: Prophet's Prayer Position
content: Ibn Abbas was standing to the left of the Prophet during prayer. The Prophet (ﷺ) gently moved him to stand on his right side and signaled for him to move behind him instead.

title: Prophet's Night Prayer
content: The Prophet (ﷺ) used to pray in his room at night. People saw him and followed him for two or three nights. But then he stopped praying in the night, because he was worried that it might become a rule.

title: Prophet's Prayer Mat
content: The Prophet (ﷺ) had a special mat. He used it to pray during the day and as a curtain at night. Some people would gather behind it at night and pray together with him.

title: Praying at Home
content: Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) made a small room in Ramadan. He prayed there for a few nights and some companions joined him. When he found out, he sat down. In the morning, he told them to pray at home if possible, because that's best.

title: Prophet's Injury During Prayer
content: The Prophet (ﷺ) rode a horse and fell off. He hurt his right side. On that day, he prayed sitting down. We followed him and also sat to pray. When the prayer was finished, he said: 'When an Imam prays, follow them. If they stand up, you should stand up too. Bow when they bow and raise your heads when they do. Prostrate when they prostrate. And if they say

title: Following the Imam in Prayer
content: When Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) fell off a horse and got hurt, he led a prayer while sitting. We also prayed sitting with him. After finishing the prayer, he said: 'When the leader of the prayer says

title: Following the Imam in Prayer
content: When an Imam leads a prayer, you must follow him. Say 'Allahu Akbar' when he says it. If he bows down, bow with him. When he says 'God has heard who praises Him', say 'Our Lord, all praise is for You'. Prostrate if he prostrates and pray sitting together if he prays sitting.

title: How the Prophet Prayed
content: My father told me that when the Prophet started praying, he would raise his hands up to his shoulders. He did this when saying 'Allah is great' before bowing down and again after standing up from bowing. But he didn't do it during prostrations.

title: Allah's Messenger's Prayer Style
content: When the Prophet stood for prayer, he would raise his hands up to his shoulders. He did this when saying 'Allahu Akbar' (God is great) before bowing and when standing up from bowing. But he didn't do it while prostrating. He would say 'Sami'a l-lahu liman hamidah' (God hears who praises Him).

title: Malik bin Huwairith's Prayer
content: Abu Qilaba saw Malik bin Huwairith praying. He said Takbir and raised his hands when he started, bowed down, and stood up after bowing. Malik said the Prophet did the same.

title: Allah's Messenger Prays
content: I saw Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) open his prayer with a big gesture. He raised his hands to his shoulders when saying 'God is great'. He did the same for bowing and saying 'God is great' again. When he said 'God hears who praises Him', he raised his hands, then said 'Praise belongs to You, our Lord.' But he didn't raise his hands when prostrating or lifting his head.

title: Ibn Umar's Prayer Style
content: When Ibn Umar started praying, he would raise his hands when saying 'Allahu Akbar'. He also raised his hands before bowing down and again after the second prayer. Ibn Umar said that the Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) did this too.

title: Prayer Positioning Order
content: Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) ordered people to place their right hand on their left forearm while praying. Abu Hazim knew this order came from the Prophet himself.

title: Prophet Sees Our Prayers
content: The Prophet (ﷺ) said: 'You see me facing the direction of prayer. But Allah knows everything about your bowing and praying, even when I'm not looking directly at you.'

title: Proper Bowing and Prostrations
content: The Prophet (ﷺ) said: 'When you bow or prostrate, do it correctly. I can see what you're doing from behind me.'

title: How the Prophet Prayed
content: The Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ), Abu Bakr, and Umar would start their prayers by saying 'All praise is to Allah, Lord of the Worlds'.

title: Prophet's Silent Pause
content: Abu Huraira said the Prophet used to be quiet for a short time between saying 'Allah is great' and reading the Quran. Abu Huraira asked, 'What do you say during this pause?' The Prophet (ﷺ) replied, 'I ask Allah to forgive me, separate me from my sins like day and night are separated, clean me from sins as white clothes are washed clean, and wash away my sins with water, snow, and hail.'

title: Eclipse Prayer Description
content: The Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) offered a special prayer during an eclipse. He stood for a long time, then bowed down low and stayed that way for a while. He stood up straight again and kept standing for a long time. Then he bowed down low once more and prostrated himself on the ground. This happened several times. After finishing the prayer, the Prophet said that Paradise was very close to him, but Hell was also near. He saw a woman who had locked up a cat and starved it to death.

title: Prophet's Prayer Routine
content: Abu Ma'mar asked Khabbab if the Prophet used to read the Quran in his noon and afternoon prayers. Khabbab said yes, he knew because of how the Prophet's beard moved when he prayed.

title: Standing after Bowing
content: Al-Bara said: When we prayed with the Prophet and he stood up from bowing, we stayed standing until we saw him prostrate on the ground.

title: Solar Eclipse Prayer
content: During a solar eclipse, the Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) prayed. His friends asked him why he had taken a step back while praying. He said he was shown a glimpse of Paradise and wanted to bring some fruit from it, but if he did, they would have eaten from it forever.

title: Prophet's Vision in Mosque
content: The Prophet (ﷺ) led us in prayer. Afterward, he stood on the pulpit and pointed to the direction of the Qibla. He said, 'When I started leading you in prayer, I saw Paradise and Hell on the wall facing the Qibla.' He repeated this three times.

title: Don't Look Up During Prayer
content: Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) said to his companions, 'Why are some people looking up during prayer?' He became serious and said, 'They should stop doing this. If they don't, their eyesight will be taken away.'

title: Looking Around During Prayer
content: I asked the Prophet about looking around during prayer. He said, 'This is a way Satan takes away from your prayer.'

title: Prophet's Prayer Disrupted
content: The Prophet (ﷺ) prayed with a cloth that had marks on it. He said the marks distracted him from his prayer. He asked someone to take this cloth and get another one from Abu Jahm.

title: Respect in Prayer Time
content: Ibn Umar said that once the Prophet was leading a prayer and saw someone had spat towards the direction of the mosque's Qibla. He scratched it off with his foot. After finishing the prayer, he reminded everyone to be mindful that Allah is always in front of them during prayer, so they should not spit in that direction.

title: Prophet's Visit During Fajr Prayer
content: Anas said: The Prophet (ﷺ) suddenly appeared while the Muslims were praying. He smiled and then went back to Aisha's house. Abu Bakr thought he wanted to join them, but the Prophet signaled for them to finish their prayer. After they finished, the curtain fell and the Prophet died later that day.

title: Sa'd's Defense Against Accusations
content: The people of Kufa complained to Umar about Sa'd. They said he didn't pray properly. Umar sent for Sa'd and asked him about the complaints. Sa'd said, 'I prayed with them just like the Prophet taught us.' He explained that he would sometimes prolong the first two parts of the night prayer and shorten the last two parts. Umar believed Sa'd was telling the truth. Then Umar sent someone to ask the people of Kufa about Sa'd. Everywhere they went, people praised him. But in one mosque, a man named Usama said that Sa'd never led the army himself, never divided the war spoils equally, and wasn't fair with his judgments. Sa'd prayed for three things: 'If this man is lying, may Allah give him a long life, make him poor, and test him.' And it happened. The man got older, poorer, and was often in trouble.

title: Prayer without Fatiha
content: Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) said: If you don't read Al-Fatiha in your prayer, it's not a valid prayer.

title: Prayer: How to Pray Correctly
content: Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) entered the mosque. A man followed him and prayed. He then greeted the Prophet, who said, 'Go back and pray again.' The man did this three times. When he asked for help, the Prophet explained how to pray: 'When you stand up to pray, say a prayer to start. Then read from the Quran. Bow down until you feel comfortable. Stand up straight. Prostrate until you feel comfortable. Sit calmly. Do the same in all your prayers.'

title: Sa'd's Prayer Style
content: Jabir bin Samura said that Sa'd used to pray like the Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ). He would shorten his prayer a bit, but not take anything away from it. In each prayer, he would say two long rak'ahs and then two shorter ones.

title: Prophet's Prayer Routine
content: My father said that the Prophet used to say Zuhr prayers. He would read Al-Fatiha and two other Suras in the first two rak'at of Zuhr prayer. In one rak'a, he would read a long Sura, and in the next, a shorter one. Sometimes you could hear his voice clearly. For 'Asr prayer, he would also read Al-Fatiha and two more Suras in the first two rak'at. He would take longer to finish the first rak'a of 'Asr prayer. In Fajr prayer, he would take longer for the first rak'a and shorter for the second.

title: Prophet's Prayer Routine
content: Abu Ma'mar asked Khabbab if the Prophet used to read the Quran in his Zuhr and Asr prayers. Khabbab said yes, he knew because of how the Prophet's beard moved when he prayed.

title: Prophet's Prayer Routine
content: Abu Ma'mar asked Khabbab if the Prophet used to read the Quran in his Zuhr and Asr prayers. Khabbab said yes, he knew because of how the Prophet's beard moved when he prayed.

title: Prophet's Prayer Routine
content: My father said the Prophet used to read Al-Fatiha and another Surah in the first two rak'at of Zuhr and Asr prayers. Sometimes we could hear a verse or two from him.

title: Ibn Abbas' Mother Remembers
content: My mother Umu-l-Fadl heard me reciting a part of the Quran. She said that my recitation reminded her of something special. It was the last time she had heard Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) recite this part in prayer, during the evening prayer.

title: Zaid bin Thabit's Question
content: Marwan bin Al-Hakam asked Zaid bin Thabit why he recited short Suras in the Maghrib prayer. Zaid said he heard the Prophet reciting one of two longer Suras.

title: Reciting Surah at-Tur
content: My father told me that the Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) recited Surah at-Tur in his Maghrib prayer.

title: Abu Huraira's Prayer Habit
content: I prayed behind Abu Huraira one night. He recited a verse from the Quran and then prostrated. I asked him why he did that, and he said he used to do it when he prayed with the Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ). He told me he would keep doing it until he meets the Prophet again.

title: Prophet's Journey Prayer
content: The Prophet (ﷺ) was on a journey. During the first two parts of the late-night prayer, he recited 'Wa t-teeni wa z-zaitun'.

title: Abu Huraira's Prayer Habit
content: I prayed with Abu Huraira one night. He recited a verse from the Quran and then prostrated. I asked him, 'What are you doing?' He said, 'When the Prophet recites this verse, he also prostrates. I will keep doing it until I meet him.'

title: Prophet's Beautiful Recitation
content: Al-Bara heard the Prophet reciting 'wa t-teeni wa z-zaitun' during the night prayer. He never heard a sweeter voice or better way of recitation than the Prophet's.

title: Umar's Concern About Sa'd
content: `Umar told Sa'd that people were complaining about him. They said he was praying too long in the beginning and too short at the end of his prayer. Sa'd explained, 'I'm following what the Prophet did.' `Umar agreed with Sa'd.

title: Prophet's Prayer Times
content: My father and I asked Abu Barza about the right times for prayers. He said, 'The Prophet (ﷺ) used to pray Zuhr when the sun was low at noon. The Asr prayer was when it was still sunny outside. For Maghrib, I forgot what he said. The Prophet (ﷺ) never delayed Isha until late in the night and never slept before it. He prayed Fajr when you could see someone sitting next to you. He would read between 60 to 100 verses during one or two sets of prayer.

title: Reciting the Quran in Prayer
content: When we pray, the Quran is read. If the Prophet recited it loudly for us, we should do the same when praying with you. But if he prayed quietly, we should also be quiet. You can just read 'Al-Fatiha' (the first chapter of the Quran) or add more verses to your prayer.

title: Barrier Between Devils and Heaven
content: The Prophet (ﷺ) went to a market with some companions. A barrier was put between the devils and news from heaven. Fire started being thrown at them. The devils asked their people what was wrong, and said they couldn't hear news from heaven or see fire. Their people sent others to find out what was happening. Those who traveled east found the Prophet praying with his companions near a place called Nakhla. They heard the Quran and knew it was the barrier between them and heaven's news. The devils' people believed in the Quran and stopped worshiping idols.

title: Praying Out Loud
content: Ibn Abbas said that the Prophet recited prayers out loud when he was supposed to and quietly when he wasn't. He read 'Your Lord is not forgetful' and 'Be like me, I'm a good example for you'.

title: Reciting Mufassal Suras
content: A man came to Ibn Mas`ud and said he recited the short chapters of the Quran at night in one prayer position. Ibn Mas`ud replied that this was too fast, like reading poetry. He then told the man which 20 short chapters the Prophet used to read together in each prayer position.

title: Prophet's Prayer Routine
content: My father said the Prophet used to read Surah Al-Fatiha followed by another chapter in the first two parts of the prayer. In the last two parts, he only read Surah Al-Fatiha. Sometimes you could hear a few words from the next chapter. The Prophet (ﷺ) would take longer on the first part than the second. He did this in the noon, afternoon, and morning prayers.
