title: Allah's Messenger's Prayers
content: Abu Ma`mar asked Khabbab if the Prophet used to read from the Quran during his noon and afternoon prayers. Khabbab said yes, because he saw the Prophet's beard move as he recited.

title: Prophet's Prayer Routine
content: My father said that the Prophet used to read Al-Fatiha and another Surah in the first two rakats of the Zuhr and Asr prayers. Sometimes you could hear a verse or two, and he would take his time in the first rakat.

title: Prophet's Prayer Style
content: My father told me that the Prophet used to take his time in the first part of the noon prayer and make it shorter in the second part. He did the same thing in the morning prayer.

title: Say Amin with the Imam
content: When the Imam says 'Amin', you should say it too. If your 'Amin' matches the angels', all your past sins will be forgiven.

title: Saying 'Amin' Forgives Sins
content: Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) said: If you say 'Amin' and the angels in heaven also say it at the same time, all your past sins will be forgiven.

title: Forgiveness for Saying Amen
content: Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) said: When the Imam says 'not the path of those who earn Your Anger nor of those who go astray', say 'Amen'. The person whose saying 'Amen' coincides with the angels will have all their past sins forgiven.

title: Bowing in Prayer
content: Abu Bakra said he saw the Prophet in a mosque. The Prophet (ﷺ) was bowing down to pray. Abu Bakra also bowed before joining his row of people praying. He told the Prophet about it, and the Prophet said: 'May Allah increase your love for good things. But don't do that again.'

title: Praying with Ali in Basra
content: I prayed with my friend Ali in the city of Basra. He reminded me how we used to pray when our Prophet was alive. In every prayer, Ali said 'Allahu Akbar' (God is great) when he stood up and again when he bowed down.

title: Abu Huraira Leads Prayer
content: When Abu Huraira led us in prayer, he said 'Allahu Akbar' when we bowed and stood up. After the prayer, he said: 'My prayer is more like the Prophet's than yours.'

title: Ali's Prayer Style
content: Imran bin Husain and I prayed behind Ali. When he prostrated, he said 'Allahu Akbar' (God is great). When he sat up, he said 'Allahu Akbar'. And when he stood for the third part of the prayer, he said 'Allahu Akbar'. After the prayer, Imran took my hand and said, 'This prayer was like Muhammad 's (ﷺ).'

title: Prayer at Muqam Ibrahim
content: I saw a person praying by the Kaaba. He said 'Allah is great' every time he bowed, stood up, or sat down. I asked Ibn Abbas about it and he said: 'Isn't this the Prophet's prayer?'

title: Prayer with Twenty Two Takbirs
content: I prayed behind a Sheikh at Mecca. He said twenty two Takbirs during the prayer. I told Ibn Abbas that he was wrong. Ibn Abbas scolded me and said, 'This is how Abul-Qasim prays.' The Prophet (ﷺ) used to say Takbir when starting the prayer, bowing down, standing up straight, prostrating, and raising his head from prostration. He did this throughout the whole prayer.

title: Prayer Positioning
content: I prayed with my father. I put both hands between his knees. He said not to do that. The Prophet (ﷺ) told us not to put our hands there, but instead place them on our own knees while praying.

title: Perfect Prayer is Important
content: Hudhaifa saw a man not praying correctly. He said to him, 'You haven't prayed properly and if you die like this, you won't be following the way of Muhammad (ﷺ)'.

title: Prophet's Prayer Postures
content: The Prophet 's (ﷺ) bowing and prostrations were about the same length. He also sat between two prostrations for a similar amount of time. But standing after bowing was roughly equal to these periods.

title: Prophet Teaches Proper Prayer
content: One day, the Prophet entered a mosque and met a man who prayed quickly. The Prophet (ﷺ) told him to pray again because he didn't do it correctly. The man asked for help, so the Prophet explained how to pray properly. He said: 'When you stand up to pray, say

title: Prophet's Prayer in Bowing
content: When the Prophet prayed, he would say 'You are perfect, Allah. Our Lord, we praise You.' Then he would ask Allah to forgive him.

title: Prophet's Prayer Habits
content: When the Prophet said 'Allah heard those who praised Him', he would say 'Praise is for You, our Lord'. When bowing down and standing up from it, he would say 'God is great'. He also said 'God is great' after two prostrations.

title: Responding to the Imam's Prayer
content: When the leader of prayer says 'Sami`a l-lahu liman hamidah', you should say 'Allahumma Rabbana laka l-hamd'. If your words match the angels' at that moment, Allah will forgive all your past sins.

title: Abu Hurairah's Prayer Routine
content: Abu Hurairah said his prayer is like the Prophet's. He would recite a special prayer after the last part of Zuhr, Isha and Fajr prayers. In this prayer, he would ask Allah to forgive believers and curse disbelievers.

title: Qunut in Maghrib and Fajr Prayers
content: Anas said that the prayer before going down for prostration was recited in both evening and morning prayers.

title: Prophet's Prayer and Angels
content: We were praying behind the Prophet. When he stood up from bowing, he said 'God has heard who praised Him.' A man behind him said, 'Praise is for You, our Lord, many good and blessed praises.' The Prophet (ﷺ) asked, 'Who said that?' The man replied, 'I did.' The Prophet (ﷺ) said, 'Thirty angels were competing to write it down first. When he stood up straight after bowing, his back was in its natural position.

title: Anas Demonstrates the Prophet's Prayer
content: Anas showed us how the Prophet prayed. When he stood up after bending down, he would stay standing for a long time. We thought he had forgotten to go down in prostration.

title: Prophet's Prayer Rhythm
content: Al-Bara' said the Prophet's bowing, prostrations, standing after bowing, and time between two prostrations were all equal in length.

title: Malik's Prayer Demonstration
content: Abu Qilaba said Malik bin Huwairith showed us how the Prophet prayed. He stood up and recited from the Quran, then bowed perfectly. After that, he straightened up for a moment before sitting down.

title: Abu Huraira's Prayer Style
content: Abu Huraira said he would say 'Allahu Akbar' when standing for prayer and on bowing. He would then say 'Sami`a l-lahu liman hamidah' (God hears the one who praises Him) and before prostrating, 'Rabbana wa laka lhamd' (Our Lord, all praise is Yours). He repeated this in every rak'a until he finished the prayer. After finishing the prayer, Abu Huraira said his prayer was similar to the Prophet's prayer.

title: Prophet Muhammad Leads Prayer
content: The Prophet (ﷺ) fell from a horse and hurt his right side. When it was time for prayer, he led the prayer sitting down. We followed him and prayed while sitting too. After the prayer, he said: 'When the Imam says Takbir, we say Takbir too. When he bows, we bow. And when he prostrates, we do the same.'

title: Seeing Allah on Judgment Day
content: Some people asked the Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ): 'Will we see our Lord on the Day of Resurrection?' He replied, 'Do you have any doubt in seeing the full moon on a clear night? Or the sun when there are no clouds?' They said no. He said, 'You will see Allah in the same way.' On Judgment Day, people will be gathered and told to follow what they used to worship. Some will follow the sun, some the moon, and others other deities. Only Muslims will remain with their hypocrites. Allah will come to them and say, 'I am Your Lord.' They will agree. Then Allah will call them again and a bridge called As-Sirat will be laid across Hell. I (Muhammad (ﷺ)) will cross it first with my followers. Nobody except prophets can speak then, saying, 'O Allah! Save us.' There will be hooks in Hell that look like thorns of Sa'dan. They will catch people according to their deeds. Some will fall and stay in Hell forever, others will get punished or taken out when Allah decides to show mercy. Those who worshipped only Him will be recognized by the marks of their prostrations and taken out. The Water of Life will make them grow like seeds on a riverbank. When all judgments are finished, one man will be left between Hell and Paradise. He will ask Allah to turn his face from the fire because it has dried him. Allah will ask if he wants anything else. He will say no. Then Allah will turn his face from the Fire and let him see Paradise's charm. He will stay quiet for a while, then ask to go to the gate of Paradise. Allah will remind him of his promises not to ask for more than what was given. The man will promise again not to ask for anything else. Allah will let him enter Paradise, where he can request as much as he likes until all his desires are fulfilled.

title: Prophet's Prayer Position
content: When the Prophet prayed, he kept his arms away from his body so you could see the white skin under his armpits.

title: Imperfect Prayer
content: Hudhaifa saw a man not doing his bowing and prostrations correctly during prayer. He told the man that he hadn't prayed properly. Hudhaifa also said, 'If you had died while praying like this, you would have died following a way other than the Prophet Muhammad 's (ﷺ).'

title: Prophet's Prostration Instructions
content: The Prophet (ﷺ) was told by Allah to prostrate on seven parts of his body. These are: the forehead and nose, both hands, both knees, and both feet. He should not tuck in his clothes or hair while praying.

title: Prostration on Seven Bones
content: The Prophet (ﷺ) said: We have been told to prostrate on seven parts of the body. When we do this, we should not fold our clothes or push back our hair.

title: Praying Behind the Prophet
content: We used to pray with the Prophet. When he said 'God hears whoever praises Him', we didn't bow down until his forehead touched the ground.

title: Prostration on Seven Bones
content: The Prophet (ﷺ) said: 'I have been told to prostrate on seven parts of my body. These are my forehead, nose, both hands, both knees, and the toes of both feet. When I pray, do not gather your clothes or hair together.'

title: Gabriel and the Night of Qadr
content: Abu Sa'id told me that one day he asked the Prophet about the Night of Qadr. The Prophet (ﷺ) had been in seclusion for the first ten days of Ramadan, then Gabriel came and said it was ahead of him. He did I'tikaf again for the second ten days, and Gabriel came again to say it was still ahead of him. On the 20th day of Ramadan, the Prophet gave a sermon. He told his companions that he had been shown the Night of Qadr but forgot its date. It's in one of the odd nights of the last ten nights. The Prophet (ﷺ) said he saw himself prostrating in mud and water in a dream.

title: Women's Prayer in Mosque
content: During prayer, women were told not to lift their heads from prostration until men had sat up straight. They would tie their clothes around their necks because they were small.

title: Prophet's Prostration Instructions
content: Ibn Abbas said the Prophet was told to prostrate on seven bony parts of his body. He should not pull up his clothes or hair while doing so.

title: Prostration on Seven Bones
content: Ibn Abbas said that the Prophet told him to prostrate on seven parts of his body. He also said not to tuck in his hair or clothes while praying.

title: The Prophet's Prayer
content: The Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) used to say 'You are perfect, O Allah, our Lord. We praise You. Forgive me' when he bowed and prostrated in prayer. He was following what the Quran taught him.

title: Malik bin Huwairith's Prayer
content: Malik bin Huwairith said to his friends, 'I'll show you how the Prophet used to pray.' He stood up and started with Takbir. Then he bowed for a while, stood up again, prostrated, and sat up for a while. This is how our Sheikh `Amr Ibn Salama prayed too. Malik bin Huwairith said they came to the Prophet after embracing Islam. The Prophet (ﷺ) told them: 'When you go back home, pray at these times. When it's time for prayer, one of you should call out the Adhan and the oldest person among you should lead the prayer.'

title: Malik bin Huwairith's Prayer
content: Abu Qilaba said that Malik bin Huwairith showed his friends how the Prophet used to pray. It was not time for a big group prayer, so he stood up and said 'Allahu Akbar' (God is great). He bowed down, then stood up again for a while, and then prostrated himself. After getting up from prostration, he sat still for a bit. Malik bin Huwairith said that when they came to the Prophet after becoming Muslim, he told them how to pray at different times of the day. When it was time for a big group prayer, only one person should call out the Adhan (the prayer announcement), and the oldest person in the group should lead the prayer.

title: Prophet's Prayer Time
content: Al-Bara' said the Prophet's time in prostrations and bowing was about the same as his sitting between two prostrations.

title: Anas' Prayer Style
content: Anas said to Thabit, 'I want you to pray like I saw the Prophet praying.' Anas would stand up straight for a long time after bowing down. You might think he forgot to prostrate. He'd also sit between two prostrations for a long time. It seemed like he forgot the second prostration.

title: Straight Prostrations
content: The Prophet (ﷺ) said, 'When you pray, be straight in your prostrations. Don't put your forearms on the ground like a dog does.'

title: Prophet's Prayer Habit
content: I saw the Prophet praying. In every odd rak'at, he would sit for a moment before standing up to continue his prayer.

title: Malik bin Huwairith's Prayer
content: Abu Qilaba said that Malik bin Huwairith led them in prayer. He said he was showing them how the Prophet prayed. Abu Qilaba described Malik's prayer: he pronounced 'Allahu Akbar' clearly, sat up after the second bow, and then stood up again.

title: Abu Sa'id's Prayer Style
content: Abu Sa'id led a prayer. He said 'Allahu Akbar' loudly when he got up from prostrating, and also when he went down to prostrate again. He did the same at the end of the second part of the prayer. Abu Sa'id said that he saw the Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) doing the same.

title: Ali's Prayer Style
content: Imran and I prayed behind Ali bin Abi Talib. He said 'Allahu Akbar' when he prostrated, stood up, and finished the prayer. After it was over, Imran took me by the hand and said, 'He prayed like Muhammad (ﷺ)'.

title: Prayer Posture from Ibn Umar
content: Abdullah bin Abdullah saw his friend Abdullah bin Umar sitting in prayer with his legs crossed. He, a young boy at the time, did the same. But when Abdullah bin Umar found out, he told him not to do it that way. Instead, you should keep your right foot up and bend your left leg while praying.

title: Prophet's Prayer Posture
content: I was with some of the Prophet's companions. Abu Humaid said he remembered the Prophet's prayer better than us. He saw the Prophet raise his hands to his shoulders when saying 'Allahu Akbar'. When bowing, the Prophet placed his hands on his knees and straightened his back. In prostration, he put his hands on the ground with his forearms up. His toes were facing the direction of the Kaaba. During the second rak'a, the Prophet sat on one foot and kept the other raised. In the last rak'a, he pushed one foot forward and sat on his buttocks.

title: Prophet's Prayer Behavior
content: The Prophet (ﷺ) led us in Zuhr prayer. After the second rak'a, he stood up without sitting down. The people followed him. When almost finished with the prayer, he said 'Allahu Akbar' while sitting and prostrated twice before saying 'Assalamu alaikum'.

title: Prostration after Zuhr Prayer
content: The Prophet (ﷺ) led us in the midday prayer. He stood up instead of sitting for a moment. At the end, he prayed twice while still sitting down.

title: Prophet's Prayer Guidance
content: Abdullah said the Prophet looked back and said, 'When you pray, say: All compliments, prayers, and good things come from Allah. Peace be on you, O Prophet, and Allah's mercy and blessings are with you. Peace be on us and on all good people who serve Allah.' He also said to say: There is no god but Allah, and Muhammad (ﷺ) is His servant and messenger.

title: Prophet's Prayer for Refuge
content: The Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) used to say a prayer in his daily prayers. He would ask Allah for protection from four things: the punishment of being buried alive, the troubles caused by the false Messiah, and the problems of life and death. He also asked for protection from sinning and being in debt. Someone asked him why he often asked for protection from debt. The Prophet (ﷺ) replied that a person who owes money is not honest and breaks promises easily. Aisha, the Prophet's wife, heard him say this prayer seeking refuge from the troubles of the false Messiah.

title: Prophet's Prayer for Protection
content: The Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) used to pray: 'I seek refuge with You from the punishment of the grave and from the troubles caused by a false messiah. I also seek refuge with You from the troubles of life and death.' He would say this many times in his prayers. Someone asked him, 'Why do you often ask for protection from debt?' The Prophet (ﷺ) replied, 'A person who owes money always tells lies and breaks promises.'

title: Abu Bakr's Prayer Request
content: Abu Bakr asked the Prophet to teach him a prayer he could say during his daily prayers. The Prophet (ﷺ) told Abu Bakr to say: 'O Allah, I have been very unfair to myself. Only you can forgive sins. Please forgive me and be merciful to me. You are the one who forgives and shows mercy.'

title: Prophet's Prayer Guidance
content: When we prayed with the Prophet, we said 'Peace be on Allah from His slaves and peace be on so and so.' The Prophet (ﷺ) said, 'Don't say that. Instead, say: Greetings to God, blessings and good things. Peace be upon you, oh Prophet, and God's mercy and blessing. Peace be upon us and on all good servants of God.' He also told us to say one of two prayers: I bear witness that there is no god but Allah, and I bear witness that Muhammad (ﷺ) is His servant and Messenger.

title: Prophet Muhammad's Prayer
content: Abu Sa'id Al-Khudri saw the Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) prostrating during prayer. He noticed mud on his forehead from where he had touched the ground.

title: Women Leave Before Men
content: After finishing his prayers, the Prophet would stay for a bit before getting up. This was so that women could leave before men who had finished praying.

title: Praying with the Prophet
content: Ibn Malik said that when he prayed with the Prophet, they would finish their prayer together by saying 'Taslim'.

title: Prophet's Visit to a Home
content: Mahmud bin Ar-Rabi' said he remembered the Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ). He also remembered when the Prophet came to his house and took some water from a bucket. The Prophet (ﷺ) then spat out the water on Mahmud. Another man, Itban bin Malik, told how he led his tribe in prayer. Sometimes it was hard for him to get to the mosque because of rain or bad eyesight. He asked the Prophet if he could come to his house and pray there instead. The Prophet (ﷺ) said yes. Next day, the Prophet came with Abu Bakr after sunrise. They were invited into the house. The Prophet (ﷺ) asked where he should pray. Itban pointed to a spot in the house. The Prophet (ﷺ) stood up for prayer, and they all followed him. After finishing the prayer, the Prophet and his followers sat down together.

title: The Prophet's Visit to Itban
content: Itban bin Malik had weak eyesight and sometimes rainwater flooded the path to his tribe's mosque. He asked the Prophet for help, and the next day, the Prophet came with Abu Bakr after sunrise. The Prophet (ﷺ) asked where he should pray in Itban's house, and then led a prayer with Itban and others following behind him.

title: Praying Out Loud
content: Ibn Abbas told me that in the time of the Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ), people used to say praise to Allah out loud after their group prayers. Ibn Abbas said that when he heard them saying these praises, it meant the group prayer was over.

title: Recognizing the Prophet's Prayer
content: Ibn Abbas said he could tell when the Prophet had finished his prayer because he would hear him say 'Allahu Akbar' loudly.

title: Prayer for the Poor
content: Some poor people came to the Prophet and said that rich people get more rewards because they can afford to perform Hajj, Umra, fight in battles, and give charity. The Prophet (ﷺ) told them a way to catch up: after every prayer, say 'God is perfect', 'Praise be to God', and 'God is greater' thirty-three times each.

title: The Prophet's Daily Prayer
content: After every prayer, the Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) would say: 'There is no god but Allah. He has no partner and all power belongs to Him. He is worthy of praise and in control of everything. O Allah, nobody can stop what You give, and nobody can take away what You keep. No one's hard work can help them against Your will.'

title: Prophet's Prayer Position
content: After finishing a prayer, the Prophet would face us.

title: Rain and Faith at Hudaibiya
content: After a rainy night, the Prophet led us in prayer. He asked if we knew what Allah had said. We said we didn't know. He said that Allah said some people believed in Him and others did not. Those who thought the rain was from Allah's mercy believed in Him, but those who thought it came from a star did not believe in Allah.

title: Prophet's Midnight Prayer
content: The Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) delayed the night prayer until midnight. Then he came to us and prayed. After praying, he faced us and said: 'You were waiting for the prayer, so you prayed as long as you waited.'

title: Praying in the Same Place
content: Ibn Umar and Al-Qasim prayed at the same spot where they had their regular prayers. Some people thought Abu Hurairah said it was wrong for an Imam to pray optional prayers there, but that's not true.

title: Prophet stays after prayer
content: After finishing his prayer, the Prophet would stay at his place for a while. He was waiting for the women to leave before he went home himself.

title: After Prayer, Prophet Stays
content: Um Salama said the Prophet stayed at his place after finishing prayer. He waited for women to leave before he went home.

title: Prophet Muhammad forgets gold
content: I prayed behind the Prophet at Medina. After prayer, he quickly got up and left to his wife's house. The people were surprised by how fast he walked. He came back and said: 'I remembered some gold at home. I didn't want it to distract me from praying, so I told someone to give it away for charity.'

title: Leaving a Prayer Area
content: Abdullah said that we should not think it's necessary to leave our prayer area from the right side only. He saw the Prophet often leaving from the left side after finishing his prayer.

title: No Garlic in the Mosque
content: During a battle at Khaibar, the Prophet said to Ibn Umar: 'If you eat garlic, don't come into our mosque.'

title: Garlic and the Mosque
content: Jabir said that the Prophet told him to stay away from the mosque if he ate raw garlic. When asked what he meant, Jabir thought it was just about eating raw garlic, not cooked garlic.

title: Garlic and Onions in Mosque
content: The Prophet (ﷺ) said that people who eat garlic or onions should not come to the mosque. He also didn't want to eat food with strong smells, but told his companions to go ahead and eat it.

title: Eating Garlic Near the Prophet
content: A man asked Anas about what the Prophet said about eating garlic. Anas replied that the Prophet said: 'If you eat this plant, don't come near us and don't pray with us.'

title: Prophet's Funeral Prayer
content: Sulaiman Ash-Shaibani heard Ash-Shu`bi say that a man who was with the Prophet saw him lead a funeral prayer. The people stood behind him in a row. When asked, Ash-Shu`bi said he got this information from Ibn `Abbas.

title: Friday Bathing is Compulsory
content: The Prophet (ﷺ) said that every Muslim who has reached puberty must take a complete bath before going to the mosque on Friday.

title: Ibn Abbas' Night at Maimuna's
content: One night I slept at my aunt Maimuna's house. The Prophet (ﷺ) also slept there. He woke up for prayer late at night and washed his face with a small amount of water from a hanging skin. Then he stood up to pray, and I got up too. We prayed together. After praying, the Prophet lay down and fell asleep. I heard him breathing until it was time for Fajr prayer. The Mu'adh-dhin came to wake him up, and we went to pray without washing our faces again.

title: Allah's Messenger Eats with Anas
content: Anas' grandmother invited the Prophet for a meal. He ate and then said, 'Let's pray.' Anas brought out a worn-out mat and sprinkled water on it. The Prophet (ﷺ) stood on it and prayed two short prayers. An orphan was in front of him, and his grandmother stood behind them.

title: Ibn Abbas at Mina
content: Ibn Abbas came to the prayer in Mina on a donkey. He was still young and had just become an adult. The Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) was leading the prayer, but there wasn't a wall behind him. Ibn Abbas let his donkey go and joined the row of people praying. Nobody stopped him.

title: Prophet Muhammad's Late Prayer
content: One day, Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) delayed the night prayer. Umar told him that women and children had gone to sleep. So, he went out and said: 'You are the only ones praying this night prayer.' At that time, only people from Medina were praying at night.

title: Ibn Abbas at Eid Prayer
content: Abdur Rahman bin Abis asked Ibn Abbas if he had ever attended the Eid prayer with the Prophet. Ibn Abbas said yes, but it was hard for him to do so because of his young age. The Prophet (ﷺ) went to a special spot near Kathir bin As-Salt's house and gave a sermon. He then walked towards the women and reminded them to give charity. A woman would take off her necklace and put it in Bilal's garment. After that, the Prophet and Bilal went home.

title: Prophet's Delayed Prayer
content: One day, the Prophet was late with the night prayer. Umar told him that women and children had gone to sleep. The Prophet (ﷺ) went out and said, 'No one is waiting for this prayer except you.' In those days, people only prayed in Medina between sunset and a third of the night.

title: Women's Nighttime Mosque Visit
content: The Prophet (ﷺ) said to Ibn Umar: If your women ask permission to go to the mosque at night, allow them to go.

title: Women's Role in Prayer
content: Um Salama said: When I finished my prayer with a sign of respect, the Prophet and men would stay at their places. The women would get up first when he got up.

title: Women Leaving Fajr Prayer
content: After the Messenger of Allah finished the morning prayer, women would leave quietly, wrapped in their clothes and not easily recognized because it was dark.

title: Prophet's Prayer and Children
content: My father told me that the Prophet said: 'When I stand for prayer, I want to pray longer. But when I hear a baby crying, I shorten my prayer because I don't want to cause trouble for its mother.'

title: Women's Attendance at Mosque
content: Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) would have stopped women from going to the mosque if he knew what they were doing. This is because the women of Bani Israel had been forbidden from attending the temple.

title: Women Leave Before Men
content: When the Prophet finished his prayer, women would quickly leave. He would stay for a bit before getting up, so men wouldn't talk to them on their way out.

title: Prophet's Prayer in a House
content: The Prophet (ﷺ) prayed at the house of Um Sulaim. Anas and an orphan stood behind him, with Um Sulaim standing behind them.

title: Women's Prayer in the Dark
content: Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) used to pray Fajr prayer when it was still dark. The believing women would go back home after praying and nobody could see them because of the darkness, or they couldn't recognize each other.

title: Respect Your Wife's Mosque Visit
content: My father told me that the Prophet said: If your wife asks to go to the mosque, don't stop her from going.

title: Prophet's Prayer in Um Sulaim's House
content: The Prophet (ﷺ) prayed at the home of a woman named Um Sulaim. I was there with an orphan boy, and we stood behind him while Um Sulaim stood behind us.

title: Women Leaving After Prayer
content: When Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) finished his prayer, the women would quickly get up and leave. He would stay for a bit before getting up himself, so the women could go home without being followed by men.

title: Friday is Our Day
content: Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) said: 'We Muslims are the last to come, but we will be first on Judgment Day. The people before us had holy books. They disagreed about which day was special for them. Allah guided us to choose Friday as our special day. The Jews celebrate tomorrow (Saturday), and the Christians celebrate the day after that (Sunday).'

title: Friday Prayer Preparation
content: Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) said: If you're going to the Friday prayers, take a bath.

title: Friday Prayer and Bathing
content: One day, `Umar bin Al-Khattab was giving a sermon on Friday. A companion of the Prophet came in. `Umar asked him, 'What time is it?' The man said he had been busy and only heard the Adhan to know when to come. He hadn't taken a bath because he thought that wasn't necessary. `Umar replied,

title: Bath Compulsory on Friday
content: Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) said that every male Muslim who has grown up must take a bath on Fridays.

title: Friday Bathing and Grooming
content: Abu Sa'id said the Prophet said: 'Every male Muslim who has grown up must take a bath on Friday. He should also clean his teeth with Siwak and use perfume if he has it.'

title: Friday Prayer Rewards
content: Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) said: If you take a bath on Friday like when you're ritually impure and then go to prayer early, it's as if you've sacrificed a camel. Going in the second hour is like sacrificing a cow. In the third hour, it's like sacrificing a ram with horns. In the fourth hour, it's like sacrificing a chicken. And in the fifth hour, it's like giving an egg. When the Imam starts speaking, angels come to listen.

title: Umar and Friday Prayer
content: Abu Huraira said that one day while Umar was giving a speech on a Friday, a man came into the mosque. Umar asked him why he hadn't started praying yet. The man replied that he had just finished washing his hands for prayer when he heard the call to prayer. Umar then reminded him of something the Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) said: 'When you go out for Friday prayer, take a bath.'

title: Friday Prayer Forgiveness
content: The Prophet (ﷺ) said: If you take a bath on Friday, clean yourself as much as possible, use some oil or perfume from your home, and go to the mosque without separating people who are sitting together. When you pray, do what Allah has written for you, and be quiet while the Imam is giving the sermon. Your sins from this Friday until the last one will be forgiven.

title: Friday Bath and Perfume
content: Ibn Abbas was asked about a Hadith that said the Prophet told people to take a bath on Friday, wash their heads, and use perfume. Ibn Abbas agreed with taking a bath but wasn't sure if using perfume was necessary.

title: Bath on Friday
content: Ibn Abbas asked the Prophet if he should take a bath before going to the mosque on Fridays. The Prophet (ﷺ) said yes, but Ibn Abbas didn't know if he should use perfume or oil if he had it at home.

title: Silken Cloak and the Prophet
content: `Umar bin Al-Khattab saw a silken cloak being sold at the mosque. He suggested to the Prophet that he buy it for special occasions. The Prophet (ﷺ) said, 'This will be worn by someone with no reward in the afterlife.' Later, the Prophet gave `Umar a similar cloak. When `Umar asked why, the Prophet replied, 'I didn't give this to you to wear.' So `Umar gave it to his pagan brother in Mecca.

title: Clean Your Teeth Before Prayer
content: Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) said: 'If it was easy for my followers, I would have told them to brush their teeth with Siwak before every prayer.'

title: Use a Toothbrush Before Prayer
content: Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) said, 'I have told you many times to use the Siwak before prayer. It is good for your teeth and mouth.'

title: Prophet's Night Prayer Routine
content: When the Prophet got up for night prayer, he would clean his mouth first.

title: Using a Siwak for Cleaning
content: `Abdur-Rahman bin Abi Bakr was cleaning his teeth with a Siwak. The Prophet (ﷺ) saw him and I asked `Abdur-Rahman to give me the Siwak. He gave it to me, so I divided it in half, chewed on one part, and then gave the other half to the Prophet. He used it to clean his teeth while resting against my chest.

title: Friday Fajr Prayer
content: The Prophet (ﷺ) used to recite two parts of the Quran in his Friday morning prayer. The first part is from Surah Sajda, which starts with 'Alif, Lam, Mim, Tanzil'. The second part is from another chapter called Ad-Dahr, which begins with 'Hal-ata-ala-l-Insani'.

title: First Friday Prayer After Prophet
content: Ibn Abbas said the first Friday prayer after the Prophet's mosque was at the mosque of Abdul Qais tribe in Jawathi, Bahrain.

title: Being a Guardian
content: Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) said that all of us are guardians. This means we're responsible for our families and the things under our care. The leader is in charge of his people, just like a man takes care of his family, a woman looks after her husband's home, and a servant protects his master's belongings.

title: Take a Bath Before Prayer
content: Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) said: When you come for the Friday prayer, take a bath.

title: Bathing on Fridays
content: Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) said that every Muslim who has grown up must take a bath on Friday.

title: Friday: A Day of Guidance
content: Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) said that Muslims are the last people to come with a message from Allah. Before us, Jews and Christians had their own scriptures. They disagreed about which day was most important. Allah chose Friday as our special day. It's also when we should take care of ourselves by washing our bodies every seven days.

title: Friday and Cleanliness
content: Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) said: We Muslims are the last people to come with a message from Allah. But on the Day of Judgment, we will be first in line. The Jews had their scripture before us, and we got the Quran after them. They disagreed about which day is special - Friday. So, Allah told us what to do on Fridays. On Saturdays, it's the Jews' turn, and on Sundays, it's the Christians'. Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) said that every Muslim must take a bath at least once a week.

title: Women Allowed in Mosque
content: The Prophet (ﷺ) said: Women can go to the mosque at night.

title: Umar's Wife Prays in Mosque
content: One of Umar's wives prayed at the mosque twice a day. Someone asked her why she did this, knowing Umar didn't like it. She said, 'What can stop him from stopping me?' They reminded her that the Prophet said, 'Don't stop women from going to mosques'.

title: Ibn Abbas' Rainy Day Advice
content: On a rainy day, Ibn Abbas told his caller to prayer: 'After saying I testify that Muhammad (ﷺ) is Allah's Messenger (ﷺ), don't say come for the prayer. Instead, tell people to pray in their homes.' The man did as he was told, but others didn't like it. Ibn Abbas said this was done by someone better than him (the Prophet). He explained that Friday prayer is compulsory, but he didn't want people to have to walk in the mud and slush.

title: Cleanliness is Important
content: Some people used to walk from far away to visit the Prophet. They were covered in dust and sweat when they arrived. One of them came into my house, where the Prophet was sitting with me. He told this man to clean himself before visiting.

title: Friday Bathing Advice
content: I asked Aisha about taking a bath on Fridays. She said the people used to go straight from work to the mosque, so they were told to take a bath first.

title: Prophet's Friday Prayer Time
content: The Prophet (ﷺ) used to pray on Fridays after the middle of the day.

title: Anas bin Malik's Prayer Habit
content: We used to pray on Fridays early in the morning and then take a nap in the afternoon.

title: Prayer Time in Hot or Cold
content: The Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) used to pray earlier when it was very cold. When it was extremely hot, he would delay the prayer until later.

title: Dust of Jihad Saves
content: The Prophet (ﷺ) said: If someone fights for Allah and gets dust on their feet, they will be saved from Hell-Fire.

title: Prayer: Walk to the Mosque
content: Abu Huraira said that the Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) said, 'When a prayer starts, don't rush to join it. Instead, walk calmly and pray whatever part of the prayer you can catch up with. Then complete any part you missed.'

title: Stand Up for Prayer
content: The Prophet (ﷺ) said: Do not stand up to pray unless you see me. Be calm and serious when praying.

title: Friday Prayer Forgiveness
content: The Prophet (ﷺ) said: If you take a bath on Friday, clean yourself well, and use oil or perfume. Then go to the mosque for prayer without pushing in front of others. Pray as much as is required and be quiet when the Imam gives his talk. Your sins from this Friday until the last one will be forgiven.

title: Respect in Prayer Positions
content: Ibn Umar said the Prophet forbade someone from making another person get up to sit in their place during prayer. This rule applies not just on Fridays, but for any prayer time.

title: Adhan for Jumua Prayer
content: In the time of Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ), Abu Bakr and Umar, the call to prayer for Friday was given when the leader sat on the pulpit. Later, during the rule of Uthman, a third call to prayer was added in Az-Zaura', which is a place in Medina's market.

title: Uthman Increases Friday Prayers
content: When there were many people in Medina, Uthman decided to add two more calls to prayer before the Friday sermon. In the time of the Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ), only one person called out to prayer and did so after the Imam had sat down.

title: Muawiya's Adhan Response
content: Abu Umama said he saw Muawiya on a pulpit repeating the Adhan. When the Mu'adh-dhin said 'God is great, God is great', Muawiya said it too. When the Mu'adh-dhin said 'I testify that there's no god but Allah', Muawiya agreed. When the Mu'adh-dhin said 'I testify that Muhammad (ﷺ) is Allah's Messenger (ﷺ)', Muawiya agreed again. After the Adhan finished, Muawiya said he remembered hearing the Prophet say the same things on this pulpit.

title: Uthman introduces second Adhan
content: One day, Uthman bin Affan introduced a new way of calling the Adhan on Fridays. Before that, people only heard it after the Imam sat down to lead prayer. As more and more people came to the mosque, he decided to call the Adhan twice.

title: Friday Prayer Changes
content: During the time of Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ), Abu Bakr and Umar, people would hear the call to prayer for Friday after the imam sat on the pulpit. But when more people came during Uthman's rule, he added a third call to prayer at Az-Zaura', and this new way continued.

title: The Pulpit's Wood
content: Some people asked Sahl bin Sa'd about the wood of the pulpit. He said he knew what it was made from and had seen it when the Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) sat on it for the first time. The Prophet (ﷺ) sent a message to an Ansari woman, asking her to get some wood from her slave-carpenter. She got him to make it from tamarisk trees in the forest. The woman sent the pulpit to the Prophet, who put it where he prayed. I saw the Prophet praying on it, then bowing and standing up. He stepped back, got down, and prostrated near the foot of the pulpit before getting back up again. After finishing his prayer, he faced the people and said, 'I did this so you can follow me and learn how to pray'

title: Prophet's Pulpit Story
content: Jabir bin Abdullah said the Prophet used to stand near a date palm tree while giving sermons. When a pulpit was built for him, we heard the tree making a loud cry like a pregnant camel in labor. The Prophet (ﷺ) got down from the pulpit and put his hand on the tree.

title: Bath Before Friday Prayer
content: My father told me that the Prophet said: 'If you're coming to the Friday prayer, take a bath first.'

title: Prophet's Sermon Style
content: Ibn Umar said the Prophet used to give a sermon while standing. He would then sit down and stand up again, just like people do today.

title: Prophet Muhammad Teaches
content: The Prophet (ﷺ) sat on a high place and his companions sat around him.

title: Eclipse and Prayer
content: Asma' bint Abi Bakr visited Aishah during a solar eclipse. People were praying, so Asma' asked Aishah what was happening. Aishah pointed to the sky. When the prayer finished, the Prophet spoke. He said he had seen things no one else had: Paradise and Hell. He told people they would be tested in their graves like the test of the Antichrist. The angels will ask each person about him. If you believe in him, you'll say he's the Messenger who brought evidence and guidance. Then you can rest. But if you don't know or just repeat what others said, you'll face punishment.

title: Giving to those in need
content: Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) received some property and gave it to some men. He ignored others who were unhappy about this. Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) said, 'I may give to one person but not another, even if the one I ignore is dearer to me. But I give to people who are impatient and don't have enough. I leave those who are patient and content with what they already have. `Amr bin Taghlib was one of them.' `Amr said that Allah's Messenger 's (ﷺ) words were more precious to him than the best camels.

title: Allah's Messenger's Night Prayers
content: One night, the Prophet went out to pray in the mosque. Some men joined him. The next morning, people talked about it and more came to join him the following night. This kept happening for four nights. On the fourth night, so many people came that the mosque was full. The Prophet (ﷺ) prayed Fajr prayer, then faced the people and said: 'I know you were coming to pray with me at night, but I didn't want this prayer to become compulsory because some of you might not be able to do it.'

title: Prophet Muhammad's Night Prayer
content: After a prayer one night, the Prophet stood up and said a phrase called 'Tashah-hud'. Then he praised Allah. He said: 'What comes next?'

title: Allah's Messenger's Sermon
content: Al-Miswar bin Makhrama said that one day Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) got up to give a speech. After saying 'Tashah-hud', he said: 'Now, let us continue'.

title: Prophet's Last Gathering
content: The Prophet (ﷺ) stood on the pulpit and said: 'Come to me.' People gathered around him. He then said, 'From now on, the Ansar will decrease in number, while others will increase. If someone becomes a leader among us and has power over people, they should be kind to those who are good and forgive those who make mistakes from their group (the Ansar).'

title: Prophet's Sermon Style
content: The Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) used to give two speeches and sit in between them.

title: Angels Record Friday Congregants
content: When it's a Friday, angels stand at the mosque gate. They write down the names of people who come to pray in the order they arrive. The first person is like offering a camel as a sacrifice. The next one is like offering a cow, then a sheep, then a chicken, and finally an egg. When the Imam comes out for prayer, the angels stop writing and listen to the sermon.

title: Praying in the Mosque
content: Jabir bin Abdullah said that a man came into the mosque while the Prophet was giving a speech on Friday. The Prophet (ﷺ) asked him, 'Have you prayed?' The man said no. The Prophet (ﷺ) told him to get up and pray two units of prayer.

title: Praying in the Mosque
content: Jabir said that a man came into the mosque while the Prophet was giving a speech. The Prophet (ﷺ) asked him, 'Have you prayed?' The man said no. So the Prophet told him to pray two units of prayer.

title: Prophet Prays for Rain
content: One Friday, while the Prophet was giving a talk to his followers, a man stood up and asked him to pray for rain because many animals were dying from thirst. The Prophet (ﷺ) raised his hands and prayed to Allah for rain.

title: Prophet's Prayer Brings Rain
content: The Prophet (ﷺ) was giving a speech on a Friday when a Bedouin stood up and said, 'Our food is running out and our children are hungry. Please ask Allah for rain.' The Prophet (ﷺ) raised his hands to the sky. At first, there were no clouds. But as soon as he lowered his hands, big clouds gathered. It started raining that day and every day until the next Friday. A week later, another man stood up and said, 'Our homes are destroyed and our animals have drowned. Please ask Allah to protect us.' The Prophet (ﷺ) raised both his hands and said, 'O Allah, please make it rain around us, not on top of us.' He pointed in different directions, and the clouds went away from Medina. But a nearby valley stayed flooded for a month.

title: Respect the Imam's Speech
content: The Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) said: When an Imam is giving a speech and you ask your friend to be quiet so they can listen, it is not a good thing to do.

title: Friday's Special Hour
content: Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) said: 'There is a special time on Friday when you pray and ask Allah for something. If you get it, He will definitely give it to you.'

title: People Leave Prayer for Camels
content: Jabir bin Abdullah said: We were praying with the Prophet. Some camels carrying food arrived from a far place. People started looking at the camels and left the mosque. Only twelve people stayed with the Prophet. Then this verse was revealed: 'When people see something interesting, they quickly leave their prayer to look at it.'

title: Prayer Routine of Prophet Muhammad
content: Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) used to pray four rak'at before and after the Zuhr prayer. He also prayed two rak'at at home after Maghrib and 'Isha prayers. However, he never prayed after Jumuah prayer until he left the mosque, then he would pray two rak'at at home.

title: Friday Meal for the Community
content: There was a woman who had a farm. She grew a special vegetable called Silq near streams. On Fridays, she would pick the Silq roots and cook them with barley powder in a pot. The cooked roots were like meat. After our Friday prayer, we would visit her and eat this meal together. We looked forward to Fridays for this food.

title: No Afternoon Naps on Fridays
content: Sahl said: We never took a nap in the afternoon or ate food until after we had prayed on Friday.

title: Early Friday Prayer Routine
content: Anas said we used to pray on Fridays early in the morning and then take a nap in the afternoon.

title: Praying on Fridays
content: We used to pray with the Prophet and then take a nap in the afternoon.

title: Fear Prayer in Battle
content: Shu'aib asked Az-Zuhri if the Prophet ever led a prayer during a fight. Az-Zuhri said Salim told him that Abdullah bin Umar was part of a battle with the Prophet in Najd. They faced the enemy and lined up. The Prophet (ﷺ) stood to pray, but one group stayed with him while the other faced the enemy. The first group bowed and prayed two times, then left their place for the second group. The Prophet (ﷺ) prayed one time with the second group, bowed and prayed two more times, and finished his prayer.

title: Praying in Battle
content: Ibn `Umar said the Prophet told him that when Muslims are fighting and outnumbered by their enemies, they can pray while standing or riding a horse. When they're facing their enemies, they can also pray while standing.

title: Prophet's Leadership in Prayer
content: The Prophet (ﷺ) led a special prayer called 'fear prayer'. He stood with the people behind him. He said 'Allahu-Akbar' and they repeated it. Then he bowed, and some of them bowed too. Next, he prostrated, and those who were praying with him also prostrated. For the second part of the prayer, some people left to watch over their friends who were still praying. When more people joined in, they all prayed together, bowing and prostrating.

title: Umar's Delayed Prayer
content: Jabir bin Abdullah said that on the day of the Khandaq, Umar came to the Prophet. He was angry with the disbelievers from Quraish and said he hadn't prayed Asr yet because the sun had set. The Prophet (ﷺ) replied that he too had not prayed yet. They went to Buthan, did ablution, and then prayed Asr after sunset. After that, they prayed Maghrib.

title: Praying at Bani Quraiza
content: After the battle of Al-Ahzab, the Prophet said to his companions that they should only pray 'Asr prayer at Bani Quraiza. Some people were on their way and had not yet reached Bani Quraiza when their prayer time came due. They decided what to do: some wanted to wait until they got to Bani Quraiza, while others said it was okay to pray right where they were. When the Prophet found out about this, he did not blame anyone for their decision.

title: Conquering Khaibar
content: Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) prayed Fajr prayer when it was still dark. He rode and said, 'God is great! Khaibar is ruined.' The people of Khaibar came out to see what was happening. They thought the Prophet's army had arrived. But the Prophet's army defeated them in battle. Many warriors were killed, but some women and children were taken as prisoners. One woman named Safiya was captured by a man named Dihya Al-Kalbi. Later, she became one of the Prophet's wives.

title: Umar's Silk Cloak
content: `Umar bought a silk cloak and showed it to the Prophet. The Prophet (ﷺ) said this type of cloth is for people who don't have a good life after death. Later, the Prophet sent `Umar another silk cloak. `Umar asked the Prophet why he had sent him this if it was not allowed. The Prophet (ﷺ) told `Umar to sell it and use the money for himself.

title: Abu Bakr Dislikes Music
content: The Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) came to my house. Two girls were singing songs about a war that happened before Islam. The Prophet (ﷺ) lay down and turned away. Abu Bakr arrived and said, 'Why is music near the Prophet?' The Prophet (ﷺ) told him to leave them alone. When Abu Bakr wasn't looking, I signaled for the girls to go. It was Eid day and some people were playing with shields and spears. I asked if I could watch. The Prophet (ﷺ) made me stand behind him and we watched until I got tired. He asked if I was happy now.

title: Prophet Muhammad at Home
content: Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) came to my house. Two girls were singing a story about the war between two tribes. The Prophet (ﷺ) lay down, but Abu Bakr arrived and complained. He said music was from Satan. The Prophet (ﷺ) told him to leave them alone. When Abu Bakr left, I signaled the girls to go. It was Eid day and people were playing with shields and spears. I asked if I could watch, so the Prophet stood behind me and we watched together. He kept saying 'Carry on!' until I got tired. Then he asked if I was satisfied.

title: Sacrificing on Eid Day
content: The Prophet (ﷺ) said: 'First, we pray. After the prayer, we slaughter our animals in Allah's name. If you do this, you are following our traditions.'

title: Abu Bakr's Complaint
content: Abu Bakr visited me at home. Two young Ansari girls were singing about the Battle of Buath. Abu Bakr said, 'There should be no music in the house of the Prophet!' It was a special day and the Prophet replied, 'Every nation has its own special days like this one.'

title: Eating Dates on Eid Day
content: Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) never went to pray on Eid day without eating some dates. He also used to eat an odd number of dates before praying.

title: Sacrificing Animals on Eid
content: The Prophet (ﷺ) said to Anas: 'If you slaughter an animal before the Eid prayer, you need to do it again.' A man stood up and said he wanted meat for his family. He mentioned that some of his neighbors were struggling to afford food. The Prophet (ﷺ) thought this was true. Then the man added that he had a young goat which was more precious to him than two sheep. The Prophet (ﷺ) allowed him to sacrifice the goat instead.

title: Sacrifices on Eid Day
content: The Prophet (ﷺ) said: If someone prays with us and slaughters their animal like we do, Allah will accept their sacrifice. But if they slaughter before the prayer, it's not a proper sacrifice. A man came to the Prophet and said he had already slaughtered his sheep before coming for the prayer. The Prophet (ﷺ) told him that was just eating meat, not a sacrifice. The man asked about offering a goat instead of two sheep, and the Prophet said yes, but only for this one person.

title: Prophet's Id Prayers
content: The Prophet (ﷺ) would go to a special place for the big Eid prayers. He would pray first and then stand in front of everyone, still sitting in their rows. After that, he would give a speech or advice if needed. If he wanted to send an army on a mission or make a decision, he would do it after the prayer. The people followed this way for a long time until I went with Marwan, the Governor of Medina, for one of the Eid prayers. When we arrived at the special place, there was a platform made by Kathir bin As-Salt. Marwan wanted to get on that platform before praying. I stopped him and said it wasn't right because the Prophet did things differently. Marwan said people didn't sit to listen after the prayer, so he gave his speech before praying.

title: Prayer on Eid Days
content: The Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) used to pray first and then give a speech after the prayer on both Eid al-Adha and Eid al-Fitr days.

title: Id Prayer Rules
content: Jabir bin Abdullah said the Prophet went out on Eid and prayed first. Then he gave a speech. Ata told me that Ibn Abbas sent a message to Ibn Az-Zubair saying the Adhan (call to prayer) was never used for Eid prayers in the Prophet's time. The speech usually came after the prayer. Jabir said the Prophet stood up, prayed, then gave his speech. After finishing, he went to the women and taught them while leaning on Bilal's arm. They put their charity in Bilal's cloth.

title: Id Prayer Rules
content: Jabir bin Abdullah said the Prophet went out on Eid day and prayed first. Then he gave a speech. Ibn Abbas sent a message to Ibn Az-Zubair saying there was no Adhan (call to prayer) in the Prophet's time, and the speech came after the prayer. Jabir said the Prophet stood up, prayed, then gave his speech. After finishing, he went to the women and preached to them while leaning on Bilal's hand.

title: Id Prayer Rules
content: Jabir bin Abdullah said the Prophet went out on Id day and prayed first. Then he gave a speech. Ata told me that Ibn Abbas sent a message to Ibn Az-Zubair saying the Adhan (call to prayer) was never used for Id prayers in the Prophet's time. The speech came after the prayer. I asked Ata if an Imam should go to women and preach after the prayer and speech, he said yes.

title: Prophet's Id Prayer Routine
content: Jabir bin Abdullah said the Prophet went out on Eid and prayed first. Then he delivered a speech. Ibn Abbas told Ibn Az-Zubair that in the Prophet's time, there was no call to prayer for Eid prayers. The Khutba (speech) came after the prayer. Jabir also said the Prophet stood up to pray, then gave his speech. After finishing, he went to the women and preached to them while leaning on Bilal's hand.

title: Id Prayer with the Prophet
content: Ibn Abbas said he prayed Id with the Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ), Abu Bakr, Umar, and Uthman. All of them prayed before giving a speech.

title: Two Id Prayers First
content: Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ), Abu Bakr and Umar used to pray the two special prayers before giving a speech.

title: Prophet's Eid Prayer
content: The Prophet (ﷺ) offered a two-rak'at prayer on the Day of Id ul Fitr. He didn't pray before or after it. Then he went to the women with Bilal and told them to give charity. They started giving their jewelry.

title: Sacrificing on Eid Day
content: The Prophet (ﷺ) said: 'First, pray. Then slaughter your sacrifice.' If you slaughtered before praying, it's just meat for your family and not a true sacrifice. A man from the Ansar said he had already sacrificed but had a young goat that was better than an older sheep. The Prophet (ﷺ) told him to use this goat instead of his first one, but it wouldn't be enough for anyone else.

title: Ibn Umar's Injury
content: Sa'id bin Jubair was with Ibn Umar when he got hurt in Mina. A spear head pierced his foot and it stuck to the saddle. Sa'id helped him get free. Al-Hajjaj came to visit and asked who did this. Ibn Umar said, 'You did.' Al-Hajjaj asked how. Ibn Umar replied, 'Because you allowed people to carry arms on a day when they usually didn't, and in the Haram area where it was not allowed before'.

title: Ibn Umar and Al Hajjaj
content: Al-Hajjaj visited Ibn Umar. He asked how Ibn Umar was. Ibn Umar said he was fine. Al-Hajjaj then asked who had hurt him. Ibn Umar replied that it was the person who allowed carrying arms on a day when they should not have been carried.

title: Sacrifices on Eid Day
content: On the day of Eid al-Adha, the Prophet said: 'First, pray. Then go back and slaughter your animals.' If you slaughter before praying, it's just meat for your family. It won't be considered a sacrifice. My uncle Abu Burda did this, but he had a young goat that was better than an older sheep. The Prophet (ﷺ) said to him, 'Slaughter the goat instead of the first one. This goat will not count as a sacrifice for anyone else after you.'

title: Good Deeds on First Ten Days
content: The Prophet (ﷺ) said that no good deeds done on any other days are better than those done in the first ten days of Dhul Hijja. Some companions asked, 'What about Jihad?' The Prophet (ﷺ) replied that even Jihad is not as good as fighting for Allah if you put yourself and your belongings at risk.

title: Talbiya during Hajj
content: Anas bin Malik was asked about how people used to say Talbiya when they were with the Prophet. He said that people would say it and no one objected, and also say Takbir (Allahu Akbar) without anyone objecting.

title: Women's Role on Eid Day
content: Um Atiya said: On the day of Eid, we were told to go out and bring our young girls and women who are having their periods. They would stand behind the men and say 'Allahu Akbar' with them, pray together, and hope for good things and forgiveness on that day.

title: Prophet's Prayer on Eid Days
content: Ibn Umar said that on the days of Eid al-Fitr and Eid al-Adha, a spear was placed in front of the Prophet as a marker for prayer. Then he would pray.

title: Praying with a Marker
content: The Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) used to go to the Musalla. A stick called an 'Anaza was carried and planted in front of him. He would pray facing this stick as a marker.

title: Women's Roles on Eid Day
content: Our Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) told Um 'Atiyya to bring mature girls and young women who stay at home to join the celebration. Hafsa added that menstruating women should not come near the prayer area.

title: The Prophet's Advice to Women
content: Ibn Abbas went with the Prophet on a special day. The Prophet (ﷺ) prayed, then gave a speech. After that, he talked to the women and told them to give money to help others.

title: Sacrifice on Eid Day
content: The Prophet (ﷺ) went to the graveyard in Medina on Eid day. He prayed two Rak'ahs and then said, 'First we pray, then we slaughter our sacrifice.' If you slaughtered before praying, it's for your family only. One man had already slaughtered but had a better goat. The Prophet (ﷺ) told him to slaughter that one too.

title: Ibn Abbas Joins Eid Prayer
content: Ibn Abbas said he joined the Prophet on an Eid day. He was young at the time and couldn't have joined if not for that. The Prophet (ﷺ) prayed near a mark close to Kathir bin As-Salt's house, then gave a speech. After that, he went towards the women with Bilal. The Prophet (ﷺ) told them to give charity and Ibn Abbas saw the women putting their jewelry into Bilal's clothes. Then the Prophet and Bilal returned home.

title: Prophet's Advice on Eid Day
content: The Prophet (ﷺ) stood up for the Eid prayer. He prayed first and then gave a speech. After finishing his speech, he went to the women with Bilal's help. They were putting their rings in a cloth that Bilal was holding out. The Prophet (ﷺ) asked them if they were keeping their promise. Only one woman said yes. So, he told them to give some of their belongings as charity. The woman kept giving her rings and other things to be given away.

title: Women's Roles on Eid Day
content: Hafsa bint Seereen said a woman asked the Prophet about women going out for Eid prayer without veils. The Prophet (ﷺ) said it was okay if they shared a veil, and all women should participate in good deeds and gatherings with believers. Hafsa asked Um-`Atiya if menstruating women could also go out. Um-`Atiya said yes, but they should stay away from the main prayer area.

title: Women's Role on Eid Day
content: Um-`Atiya said: We were told to go out for the Eid prayer. Women who have their periods, girls who are old enough, and young women who stay at home should come with us. They can join in our Eid prayer, but they must not stand near where we pray.

title: Prophet's Sacrifice on Eid
content: The Prophet (ﷺ) used to slaughter animals at the special place of prayer during the festival of sacrifice.

title: Sacrificing on Eid Day
content: The Prophet (ﷺ) said that if someone prays with us and sacrifices like we do, they follow our tradition. If you sacrifice before the prayer, it's just a normal sheep. Abu Burda did this by mistake because he thought it was time to eat. The Prophet (ﷺ) told him it was just a normal sheep. Then Abu Burda asked about sacrificing a young goat instead of two sheep. The Prophet (ﷺ) said yes, but only for Abu Burda.

title: Sacrifice on Eid Day
content: On the day of Eid, the Prophet prayed and then gave a speech. He said that anyone who had already slaughtered their sacrifice before praying should do it again. A man from the Ansar stood up and explained that he had slaughtered his animal early because his neighbors were very poor. He offered to slaughter a young goat instead of two sheep. The Prophet (ﷺ) allowed him to use the goat as a sacrifice.

title: Sacrifice on Eid Day
content: Jundab said the Prophet prayed and gave a talk. Then he slaughtered his sacrifice. He told people who had already slaughtered to kill another animal instead. And those who hadn't yet, should slaughter their sacrifice mentioning Allah's name.

title: Prophet's Return on Eid Day
content: Jabir bin Abdullah said the Prophet used to leave the Eid prayer through a different route than he took when coming in.

title: Abu Bakr and the Prophet
content: `Aisha said that on special days in Mina, Abu Bakr saw two young girls playing a tambourine near her. The Prophet (ﷺ) was resting nearby. Abu Bakr scolded them, but the Prophet told him to leave them alone because it's a time for celebration and fun. Another time, `Aisha watched slaves performing in the mosque. `Umar scolded them, but the Prophet said they should be left alone because they are safe.

title: Abu Bakr and the Prophet
content: On the days of Mina, Abu Bakr came to Aisha. Two young girls were beating a tambourine near her. The Prophet (ﷺ) was lying covered with his clothes. Abu Bakr scolded them. The Prophet (ﷺ) uncovered his face and said, 'Leave them alone. These are special days.' Aisha also told that once the Prophet was screening her from the sun. She saw some black slaves in the Mosque. Umar scolded them. The Prophet (ﷺ) said, 'Don't scold them. They're safe.'

title: Prophet's Eid al-Fitr Prayer
content: Ibn Abbas said the Prophet went out and prayed a two rakat prayer on Eid ul Fitr. He didn't pray any other prayer before or after it, and Bilal was with him.

title: Night Prayer with Allah's Messenger
content: A man asked the Prophet about praying at night. The Prophet (ﷺ) said to pray two Rak'at, then two more, and so on. If you're worried it will soon be time for Fajr prayer, just pray one Rak'ah as a Witr (final) prayer for all your previous prayers. When I'm in a hurry, I say Taslim after the first two Rak'at and the last odd Rak'ah.

title: Ibn Abbas Spends Night at Maimuna's
content: Ibn Abbas stayed overnight at his aunt Maimuna's house. The Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) and his wife slept in the same bed. At midnight, the Prophet woke up, washed his face, and read ten verses from Surah Al-Imran. He then performed ablution and prayed two rakats five times with Ibn Abbas beside him. After that, he laid down until it was time for Fajr prayer. The Mu'adhin came, so the Prophet stood up and prayed two more rakats as a sunnah before performing the Fajr prayer.

title: Night Prayer: Two Rak'ats
content: The Prophet (ﷺ) said to pray two rak'ats of night prayer, then two more. If you want to finish quickly, pray one rak'a as witr for all the previous ones.

title: Prophet's Night Prayer
content: The Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) used to pray 11 rak'at at night. Each of his prostrations lasted long enough for someone to read 50 verses before he got up. He also prayed 2 extra rak'at before the morning prayer, then lay down on his right side until it was time to get up and pray.

title: Praying Before Fajr
content: I asked Ibn 'Umar about praying two rak'at before the morning prayer. He said the Prophet used to pray in sets of two, then one rak'ah witr at the end. He also prayed two rak'at right after the Adhan for the morning prayer.

title: Prophet's Witr Prayer Timing
content: The Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) offered a special prayer called witr at different times of the night. Sometimes it was after the late-night prayer, and sometimes as close to dawn as possible.

title: Prophet's Night Prayer
content: The Prophet (ﷺ) used to pray at night while I was asleep. When he wanted to pray the witr prayer, he would wake me up and we would pray together.

title: Last Prayer of the Night
content: The Prophet (ﷺ) said to make Witr your last prayer at night.

title: Praying Witr While Traveling
content: I was traveling with Abdullah bin Umar to Mecca. When I saw it was almost dawn, I got off my camel and prayed the witr prayer. Abdullah asked me where I had been. I said I got off because of the approaching dawn. He said, 'You should follow the example of the Prophet.' I agreed. He then told me that the Prophet used to pray witr while riding a camel.

title: Prophet's Prayer on His Mount
content: Ibn Umar said the Prophet used to pray extra prayers on his mount, facing in the right direction. He also prayed a special prayer called witr while sitting on his mount.

title: Qunut in Fajr Prayer
content: Anas was asked if the Prophet recited Qunut in his morning prayer. He said yes, but only for a month. The Prophet (ﷺ) recited Qunut after bowing down for some time.

title: Qunut: A Special Prayer
content: Asim asked Anas about the Qunut prayer. Anas said it was definitely recited by the Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ). Asim asked when, and Anas replied it was before bowing during prayer. But another person had told Asim that Anas said it was after bowing. Anas said this person was mistaken. The Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) did recite Qunut for one month after bowing, asking Allah to punish those who broke a peace treaty with him.

title: Prophet's Prayer for Punishment
content: Anas bin Malik said the Prophet recited a special prayer in Fajr for one month. He asked Allah to punish the tribes of Ral and Dhakwan.

title: Qunut Prayer in Two Prayers
content: Anas said that the Qunut prayer was recited during Maghrib and Fajr prayers.

title: Prophet's Prayer for Rain
content: The Prophet (ﷺ) went to pray for rain. He turned his cloak inside out before praying.

title: Prophet's Qunut Prayer
content: When praying, the Prophet would say: 'Save Ayish bin Abi Rabi'a. Save Salama bin Hisham. Save Walid bin Walid. Help weak believers. Punish Mudar tribes with famine like Joseph's time.' He also asked Allah to forgive Ghifar and save Aslam tribes.

title: The Prophet's Prayer for Help
content: When the people refused to accept Islam, the Prophet prayed to Allah: 'Send a famine on them like the seven years of famine in Joseph's time.' A year later, a severe famine struck and food was scarce. People were eating rotten meat and hides. Abu Sufyan went to the Prophet and said, 'Your tribe is suffering. Please pray for them.' In response, Allah revealed a verse: 'The sky will bring forth smoke that can be seen clearly... On the day when We seize you with great force.'

title: Ibn Umar's Poetic Verse
content: My father told me that Ibn Umar said he heard the Prophet praying for rain. When he finished, water started flowing from every roof gutter. The verse was from Abu Talib: 'A white person who prays for rain and takes care of orphans and widows.'

title: Ibn Umar's Poetic Verse
content: My father told me that Ibn Umar said he heard the Prophet reciting a poem by Abu Talib. The poem described someone who prays for rain and helps orphans and widows. When Ibn Umar was praying with the Prophet, he remembered this poem. He thought of it again when looking at the Prophet's face while he prayed for rain. The Prophet (ﷺ) didn't stop praying until water started flowing from every roof.

title: Umar Asks for Rain
content: When there was a drought, Umar would ask Al-Abbas to pray for rain. He would say: 'We used to ask the Prophet to pray for rain and it would rain. Now we're asking his uncle to pray.' Then it would rain.

title: Prophet's Prayer for Rain
content: Abdullah bin Zaid said the Prophet turned his cloak inside out to pray for rain during Istisqa.

title: Prophet Prays for Rain
content: The Prophet (ﷺ) went to a place called Musalla. He faced the direction of the Kaaba and wore his cloak inside out. Then he prayed two short prayers, asking Allah to send rain.

title: Prayer for Rain on Fridays
content: One Friday, a man entered the mosque where the Prophet was giving a speech. He stood in front of the Prophet and asked him to pray for rain because animals were dying and roads were blocked. The Prophet (ﷺ) raised his hands and said 'O Allah, give us rain!' Three times. At first, it rained heavily and we couldn't see the sun for a week. But then another man came on a later Friday and stood in front of the Prophet again. He asked him to pray that the rain would stop because animals were dying and roads were blocked. The Prophet (ﷺ) raised his hands and said 'O Allah, make it rain around us, not on us.' And the rain stopped.

title: Prayer for Rain
content: One day, a man entered the mosque on Friday while the Prophet was giving a sermon. The man stood in front of the Prophet and said, 'Please pray to Allah for rain because animals are dying and roads are blocked.' The Prophet (ﷺ) raised his hands and prayed three times: 'O Allah, give us rain!' A big cloud appeared from behind a nearby mountain, and it rained heavily for a week. The next Friday, another man entered the mosque through the same gate while the Prophet was giving a sermon. He stood in front of the Prophet and said, 'Please pray to Allah to stop raining because animals are dying and roads are blocked.' The Prophet (ﷺ) raised his hands and prayed: 'O Allah, rain on the mountains, hills, valleys, and places with trees, but not here!' The rain stopped, and people came out walking in the sun.

title: Prophet's Prayer for Rain
content: A man asked the Prophet to pray for rain because there was a drought. The Prophet (ﷺ) prayed and it started raining heavily, making it hard to get home. A week later, another man stood up and asked the Prophet to stop the rain. The Prophet (ﷺ) said 'O Allah, make the rain go around us, not on us.' The rain continued but only outside Medina.

title: Prophet Prays for Rain
content: A man came to the Prophet and said that livestock were dying and roads were blocked due to heavy rain. The Prophet (ﷺ) prayed for Allah to send rain, and it rained from Friday to the next Friday. The same man came again and asked the Prophet to pray for the rain to stop. The Prophet (ﷺ) stood up and prayed, 'O Allah, let the rain be on the hills, valleys, and places with trees.' After this prayer, the clouds cleared away from Medina.

title: Rain for Drought
content: A man came to the Prophet and said, 'There's a drought. Please ask Allah for rain.' The Prophet (ﷺ) prayed and it rained from one Friday to the next. Then the man came back and said, 'Houses are falling down and roads are blocked.' So the Prophet prayed again, asking Allah to send rain to mountains, plateaus, valleys, and places with trees. The clouds left Medina like clothes being taken off.

title: Prophet Prays for Rain
content: A man told the Prophet about his livestock dying and people going hungry. He asked the Prophet to pray for rain. The Prophet (ﷺ) prayed, asking Allah to send water.

title: Praying for Rain
content: A man came to the Prophet and said, 'Livestock are dying and roads are blocked. Please ask Allah for rain.' The Prophet (ﷺ) prayed for rain, and it rained from one Friday to the next. Another man came and said, 'Houses have fallen down, roads are closed, and animals are suffering.' The Prophet (ﷺ) said, 'Let the rain fall on mountains, plateaus, valleys, and where trees grow.' The clouds left Medina like clothes being taken off.

title: Famine Afflicts Quraish Tribe
content: Ibn Mas`ud told me that when the Prophet prayed for Allah to punish Quraish because they delayed embracing Islam, a severe famine hit them. Many people died and they had to eat dead animals. Abu Sufyan went to the Prophet and said, 'You teach us to be kind to our families, but your community is being destroyed.' The Prophet (ﷺ) recited some verses from Surah Ad-Dukhan, which talked about a day when smoke would fill the sky. After the famine ended, people went back to not believing in Allah again. This was what the verse meant. Later, at the Battle of Badr, Allah punished them severely. Another time, the Prophet prayed for rain and it poured down heavily for seven days. People complained about the rain, so the Prophet asked Allah to make it rain around them, not on them. The clouds moved away from him and rained on the surrounding areas.

title: Prophet's Rain Prayer
content: One Friday, Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) was giving a sermon. People stood up and asked him to pray for rain because there was no water, the trees were dry, and animals were suffering. The Prophet (ﷺ) said 'O Allah, give us rain' twice. Suddenly, dark clouds appeared in the sky and it started raining. After praying, he went home but it kept raining until the next Friday. When he gave another sermon, people asked him to stop the rain because houses had collapsed and roads were blocked. The Prophet (ﷺ) smiled and said 'O Allah, make the rain go around us, not on us.' And that's exactly what happened - it rained outside Medina but not a single drop fell inside.

title: Prophet Prays for Rain
content: The Prophet (ﷺ) went out with the people to ask Allah for rain. He stood up and asked Allah for rain, then turned his back on the crowd and showed them his cloak inside out. It started raining.

title: Prophet Prays for Rain
content: The Prophet (ﷺ) went out to ask Allah for rain. He faced the direction of the Kaaba and prayed. He turned his cloak inside out, then he stood up and prayed two times. In each prayer, he read from the Quran out loud.

title: Prophet's Rain Prayer
content: One day, the Prophet went out to pray for rain. He faced the right direction and asked Allah for water. Then he turned his cloak inside out and led us in a two-part prayer. During this prayer, he read from the Quran aloud.

title: Prophet's Prayer for Rain
content: Abbad bin Tamim said his uncle told him that the Prophet prayed for rain. He stood up and offered a two-rak'at prayer, then put his cloak inside out to show he was humble.

title: Prophet's Prayer for Rain
content: The Prophet (ﷺ) went to a place called Musalla. He faced the direction of the Kaaba and prayed two short prayers. Then he turned his cloak inside out, with one side on top of the other.

title: Prophet's Prayer for Rain
content: The Prophet (ﷺ) went to a place called Musalla to pray for rain. When he was about to start praying, he faced the direction of the Kaaba and turned his cloak inside out.

title: Rain after a Bedouin's Plea
content: A bedouin came to the Prophet on a Friday and said his livestock, children, and people were dying from thirst. The Prophet (ﷺ) raised his hands in prayer for rain, and the people joined him. They didn't leave the mosque when it started raining. It rained until the next Friday, when the same man returned and said travel was difficult because of all the water.

title: Raising Hands in Prayer
content: Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) never raised his hands for prayer unless it was for Istisqa', a special prayer to ask for rain. When he did raise his hands, you could see the white skin under his arms.

title: Rain Prayers of the Prophet
content: Aisha said: When it rained, the Messenger of Allah would say, 'O Allah, let this rain be strong and bring fruit'.

title: Prophet's Prayer for Rain
content: During a time of famine, a Bedouin stood up in the mosque and asked the Prophet to pray for rain. The Prophet (ﷺ) raised his hands towards the sky, but there were no clouds. Then clouds gathered quickly, and it started raining on that day and the next few days. A week later, the same Bedouin stood up again and asked the Prophet to pray for more rain. This time, the Prophet said 'O Allah! Bring rain around us, not on top of us.' The clouds moved away from Medina, but a nearby valley continued to flow with water for a month.

title: Prophet Fears Strong Winds
content: Anas said the Prophet looked worried when a strong wind blew. He thought it might be a sign that Allah was unhappy with him.

title: Victory with the West Wind
content: The Prophet (ﷺ) said: I was given victory thanks to a strong wind called As-Saba. The people of 'Ad were destroyed by another strong wind, Ad-Dabur.

title: Signs of the Last Day
content: The Prophet (ﷺ) said: The Hour will not come until there are no more wise people to teach. There will be many earthquakes, time will pass quickly, and problems will increase. People will kill each other, and there will be a lot of money.

title: Blessing Regions
content: Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) said to Allah, 'Please bless our Sham and Yemen.' People asked him to also bless their Najd region. He said it again, then added, 'There will be earthquakes and troubles from that area, where Satan's power comes from.'

title: Rain in Al-Hudaibiya
content: After leading the morning prayer at Al-Hudaibiya, the Prophet asked his followers if they knew what Allah had said. They replied that only Allah and the Prophet knew. The Prophet (ﷺ) then explained: 'Allah says some of His worshippers believed, while others did not believe. Those who said it rained because of Allah's blessing are true believers. But those who said it rained because of a star do not truly believe in Allah, even though they think they do.'

title: Five Secrets of Allah
content: Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) said that there are five things only Allah knows. Nobody else knows: what will happen tomorrow; who is pregnant and when they will give birth; how much wealth someone will gain the next day; where a person will die; and when it will rain.

title: Sun Eclipse Prayer
