content: One day, Abu Bakra was with the Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ). The sun went dark because of an eclipse. The Prophet (ﷺ) stood up and led us in a short prayer to ask for Allah's mercy. He said that eclipses happen when the moon or sun are blocked from the sun, not because someone has died. When we see an eclipse, we should pray until it ends.

title: Sun and Moon Eclipses
content: Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) said: The sun and moon don't go dark because someone has died. They are signs from Allah. When you see them, stand up and pray.

title: Sun and Moon Eclipses
content: Ibn Umar said that the Prophet said: The sun and moon do not go dark because of someone dying or being born. They are two signs from Allah. When you see them, pray.

title: Sun Eclipse During Ibrahim's Death
content: One day, during the lifetime of Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ), a solar eclipse happened on the same day his son Ibrahim died. People thought it was because of Ibrahim's death. The Prophet (ﷺ) said: 'The sun and moon don't change their path because someone is born or dies.' He told us to pray when we see an eclipse and ask Allah for help.

title: Sun Eclipse Prayer
content: During a solar eclipse, the Prophet led people in prayer. He stood up and prayed for a long time, then bowed down for a while. He stood up again and prayed some more, but this time for less time than before. He bowed down once more and then prostrated himself. He did the same in the second part of the prayer as he had done in the first. When the eclipse ended, the Prophet gave a sermon. He said that the sun and moon are signs from Allah, and they don't change because someone is born or dies. If you see an eclipse, remember Allah and say 'Allahu Akbar' (God is great). Pray and give charity to those in need.

title: Sun Eclipse Prayer
content: When the sun went dark during the time of Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ), a message was sent out to gather people for a prayer together.

title: Sun Eclipse During Prayer
content: Aisha said: One day during the Prophet's lifetime, a solar eclipse happened. The Prophet (ﷺ) went to the Mosque and people followed him. He started praying and read from the Quran for a long time. Then he bowed down for a long time, stood up and said 'Allah heard who praised Him'. He didn't prostrate yet. Instead, he read again from the Quran, but this time it was shorter than before. He bowed down again, then said another prayer and prostrated. This happened four times. The sun came back out before he finished praying. After that, he stood up and praised Allah. He said: 'The sun and moon are signs of Allah. They don't change because someone is born or dies. When you see them, hurry to pray.'

title: Sun Eclipse and Prayer
content: Aisha said: One day when the sun was covered by an eclipse, the Prophet stood up to pray. He said 'Allahu Akbar' and recited a long passage from the Quran. Then he bowed down for a long time. After standing up, he said 'Sami'a l-lahu Lyman Hamidah', which means 'Allah hears those who praise Him'. He then recited another passage, but shorter than the first one. He bowed down again, this time for a shorter time. Then he prostrated and stayed in that position for a while. In the second part of the prayer, he did the same as in the first part. After finishing the prayer, he said 'Assalamu alaikum' to everyone. By then, the sun had come out from behind the eclipse. The Prophet (ﷺ) told his companions: 'The sun and moon are two signs of Allah's power. They don't hide because someone is born or dies. When you see them hiding, hurry up and pray.'

title: Sun and Moon Signs
content: Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) said: The sun and moon are two signs from Allah. They do not go dark because someone has died, but to remind His followers of Him.

title: Punishment in the Grave
content: `Amra bint `Abdur-Rahman told us that a Jewish woman came to ask Aisha about something. She said, 'May Allah protect you from being punished in your grave.' Aisha asked the Prophet if people would be punished in their graves. The Prophet (ﷺ) replied yes after seeking protection from Allah. Later, during an eclipse, the Prophet rode out and led his followers in a special prayer. He stood up for a long time, then bowed down twice, each time shorter than before. After finishing the prayer, he delivered a sermon and told people to ask Allah to protect them from being punished in their graves.

title: Punishment in the Grave
content: `Amra bint `Abdur-Rahman narrated: A Jewish woman visited `Aisha and said, 'May Allah protect you from punishment in your grave.' `Aisha asked the Prophet about this. He replied that people will be punished in their graves. One day, a solar eclipse happened while the Prophet was out. When he returned, he led the prayer for the eclipse. People stood behind him. The Prophet (ﷺ) prayed for a long time, bowing and prostrating several times. After finishing the prayer, he delivered a sermon and told people to seek refuge with Allah from punishment in their graves.

title: Sun Eclipse Prayer
content: When the sun was eclipsed during the Prophet's lifetime, he called for a group prayer. He performed two bows in one part of the prayer, then stood up and did it again. After that, he sat down and finished praying. The eclipse ended by the time he finished.

title: Sun Eclipse Prayer
content: The sun went dark during the Prophet's lifetime. He led a special prayer for this event. He stood still for as long as it would take to read Surah Baqarah, then bowed down for a while. After that, he stood up again and bowed once more. Then he prostrated twice. The sun came back out by the time he finished praying. The Prophet (ﷺ) said, 'The sun and moon are signs of Allah's power.' He told people to remember Allah when they see these events. Some people asked him about what happened during his prayer. They saw him move forward and then step back. The Prophet (ﷺ) explained that he had seen Paradise and Hellfire in a vision. In the vision, most of the people in Hell were women because they are often ungrateful to their husbands and others who do good things for them.

title: Solar Eclipse and Prayer
content: Asma' bint Abu Bakr visited Aisha during a solar eclipse. People were praying outside. Asma' asked Aisha what was happening, and she pointed to the sky and said 'God is great'. Asma' joined in the prayer but fainted from standing too long. After the prayer, the Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) came out and thanked God. He said he had seen something amazing - a sign that people would be tested after they die. The angels will come to each person's grave and ask who Muhammad (ﷺ) was. A true believer will say he was a messenger with clear signs and guidance. The angels will then let them rest peacefully. But someone who is not sure or pretending to believe will just repeat what others said without knowing it himself.

title: Free Slaves During Eclipse
content: The Prophet (ﷺ) ordered people to set free their slaves during a solar eclipse.

title: Punishment in the Grave
content: A Jewish woman visited Aisha and asked a question. She then said to Aisha: 'May Allah protect you from punishment in the grave.' Aisha asked the Prophet if people would be punished in their graves. The Prophet (ﷺ) replied by asking for God's protection, which means he agreed it could happen. Later, during an eclipse, the sun hid behind clouds. The Prophet (ﷺ) rode out and led a prayer with his followers. He stood up for a long time, bowed down low, then stood again. He did this twice, each time standing less long than before. After finishing the prayer, he gave a sermon and told people to ask Allah for protection from punishment in the grave.

title: Punishment in the Grave
content: A Jewish woman visited Aisha and asked her a question. She then said, 'May Allah protect you from punishment in the grave.' Aisha asked the Prophet about this. The Prophet (ﷺ) replied that people will indeed be punished in their graves. One day, during an eclipse, the sun hid behind clouds. The Prophet (ﷺ) rode out to lead his followers in prayer. He stood up and prayed for a long time, then bowed down low. He stood up again, but for a shorter time. Then he bowed down once more and finally prostrated himself on the ground. After finishing the prayer, the Prophet gave a sermon and told people to ask Allah to protect them from punishment in the grave.

title: Sun and Moon Signs
content: Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) said, 'When you see the sun or moon being hidden, it is a sign from Allah. Pray at that time.'

title: Sun Eclipse During Prophet's Time
content: During a solar eclipse in the Prophet's lifetime, he stood up to pray with his companions. He recited a long passage from the Quran, then bowed for a while. After standing up, he recited another passage that was shorter than the first. He bowed again and performed two prostrations. The Prophet (ﷺ) prayed a second rak'a like the first. Then he said: 'The sun and moon eclipsing are not because of someone's life or death. They're signs from Allah for His believers to show respect. When you see them, hurry up and pray.'

title: Sun Eclipse: What to Do
content: Abu Musa said the Prophet saw a solar eclipse. He got up and went to the mosque. He prayed with a very long standing, bowing, and prostrating. Then he said that these signs from Allah don't happen because of someone's life or death. They're to remind us to remember Allah, pray to Him, and ask for forgiveness when we see them.

title: Sun Eclipse is a Sign
content: When the sun or moon disappear, it's not because someone has died. The Prophet (ﷺ) said that these are signs from Allah and we should pray to Him until they return. When this happened, he led us in prayer and then gave a talk praising Allah.

title: Prophet's Prayer During Eclipse
content: Abu Bakra said the sun eclipsed during the Prophet's lifetime. The Prophet (ﷺ) then performed a two-rak'at prayer.

title: Sun Eclipse During Prophet's Time
content: Abu Bakra said: One day during the Prophet's lifetime, a solar eclipse happened. The Prophet (ﷺ) went to the mosque and led everyone in prayer for two units (rak'at). When the sun came out again, he said that eclipses are signs from Allah, not caused by someone dying. He told us to pray and ask Allah for help until the eclipse is over.

title: Prophet's Actions During Eclipse
content: The Prophet (ﷺ) led us in prayer. He performed two sets of four bowing movements during the solar eclipse. The first set was longer than the second.

title: Eclipse Prayer: Prophet's Actions
content: During an eclipse, the Prophet recited the Quran loudly during a special prayer. After finishing the prayer, he said 'Allah is greater' and bowed down four times. He then stood up, said a short prayer, and continued reading from the Quran. In this special prayer, there are four bows and four prostrations in two parts of the prayer.

title: Eclipse Prayer Explained
content: The Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) led a prayer when the sun was eclipsed. He recited the Quran loudly during the prayer. When he finished, he said 'Allah is greater' and bowed down four times. After each bowing, he stood up and said 'God hears whoever praises Him'. Then he prostrated himself four times in two parts of the prayer. This was how he prayed for an eclipse.

title: Prophet's Prostration at Mecca
content: The Prophet (ﷺ) recited a chapter of the Quran called Surat an-Najm in Mecca. He prostrated while reading it, and those with him did the same. But one old man didn't - he just took some small stones or earth and touched his forehead with them instead. Later, I saw that man being killed because he didn't believe.

title: Friday Prayer Routine
content: Abu Huraira said that on Fridays, the Prophet would recite Alif Lam Mim Tanzil-As-Sajda in the first part of the prayer and Hal ata `alal-insani (Surat ad-Dahr) in the second part during the Fajr prayer.

title: Sa'd's Prostration is Optional
content: Ibn Abbas said the Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) saw him prostrate while reciting a certain prayer. However, Ibn Abbas explained that this prostration was not required.

title: Prophet recites Surat-an-Najm
content: The Prophet (ﷺ) read a chapter from the Quran called Surat-an-Najm. He prostrated while reading it, and everyone else did too. One man thought he could just look at some dirt and say that was enough for him to pray. Unfortunately, I later saw this man being killed because he didn't believe in Islam.

title: Prophet's Prostration During Recitation
content: Ibn Abbas said the Prophet prostrated while reading a chapter of the Quran called An-Najm. He was not alone - many Muslims, non-Muslims, and even some jinn (supernatural beings) also fell to their knees in prayer.

title: Prostration in Recitation
content: I asked Zaid bin Thabit about prostration. He said he once recited Surah An-Najm in front of the Prophet, but the Prophet didn't perform a prostration.

title: Zaid bin Thabit's Story
content: I recited the Quranic chapter An-Najm to the Prophet. He did not perform a prostration, even though it contains a verse that requires a prostration.

title: Abu Huraira's Prayer
content: Abu Salama saw Abu Huraira reading a chapter from the Quran. While he was reading, Abu Huraira got down on his knees in prayer. Abu Salama asked him, 'Did you just pray?' Abu Huraira said, 'I wouldn't have prayed if I hadn't seen the Prophet praying like that too.'

title: Prophet's Prostration in Prayer
content: Ibn Umar said: When the Prophet recited a Sura that included a prostration, he would bow down. We did the same. But sometimes some of us couldn't find space to prostrate because it was too crowded.

title: Prophet's Prostration in Sajda
content: When the Prophet recited Surat As-Sajda, he would prostrate. We also prostrated with him. Some of us couldn't find a place to put our foreheads down.

title: Prostrating During Sermon
content: `Umar bin Al-Khattab was on the pulpit one Friday and read Surah Nahl. When he reached a verse that says to prostrate, he got down from the pulpit and bowed down. The people also followed him in bowing down. The next week, `Umar said,

title: Abu Huraira's Prayer Habit
content: I prayed behind Abu Huraira one night. He recited a special prayer and prostrated. I asked him what he was doing. He said, 'I did this when praying with the Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ). I will keep doing it until I meet him again.'

title: Prostrating During Recitation
content: Ibn Umar said: When the Prophet recited a Sura that included a prostration, he would get down and prostrate. We also got down to prostrate, but some people didn't have enough space.

title: Shortened Prayers During Travel
content: The Prophet (ﷺ) stayed for nineteen days and prayed shorter prayers. When we traveled for the same amount of time, we shortened our prayers too. But if we stayed longer, we prayed the full prayer.

title: Traveling with the Prophet
content: Anas said they traveled from Medina to Mecca with the Prophet. They prayed two parts for each prayer until they returned to Medina. Anas asked if they stayed in Mecca, and Anas replied that they stayed there for ten days.

title: Prayer at Mina
content: I prayed with the Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ), Abu Bakr, and Umar in a place called Mina. Our prayer was only two parts. Later, when Uthman became leader, he also started praying with just two parts. But then he changed his mind and prayed the full prayer.

title: Prayer at Mina
content: The Prophet (ﷺ) led us in prayer at Mina. He performed two parts of the prayer during a time of peace.

title: Prayer at Mina
content: `Abdur Rahman bin Yazid and his friends prayed four rak`at behind Ibn `Affan in Mina. Abdullah bin Mas`ud heard about it and said, 'We belong to Allah and we will return to Him.' He also mentioned that he had prayed two rak`at with the Prophet at Mina, and later with Abu Bakr and `Umar when they were leaders. He wished that two of their four rak`at would be accepted by Allah.

title: Prophet's Change of Plans
content: The Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) and his friends arrived in Mecca on the morning of the 4th day of Dhul-Hijja. They were going to do Hajj, but the Prophet told them to change their plans and instead go for Umra. Only those who had a sacrifice with them could still do Hajj.

title: Women's Travel Restrictions
content: The Prophet (ﷺ) said that a woman should not travel for more than three days without being with her husband or a close male relative who is like a brother to her, such as a father or uncle. This means she can't travel alone.

title: Women's Travel Restrictions
content: The Prophet (ﷺ) said: A woman should not travel for more than three days without a male relative who is not her husband or close family member.

title: Women's Travel Rules
content: The Prophet (ﷺ) said: A woman who believes in Allah and the Last Day cannot travel alone for a day and night. She must be with a family member she can trust, like her husband or brother.

title: Shortened Asr Prayer
content: Anas bin Malik said he prayed four rak'at of Zuhr prayer with the Prophet in Medina. Then they prayed two rak'at at Dhul-Hulaifa, shortening the Asr prayer.

title: Prayer Rulings for Travelers
content: When the Prophet first told us to pray, each prayer was only two parts. Later, he said travelers could still do their prayers in two parts, but people who were not traveling had to complete all four parts of the prayer.

title: Delaying Maghrib Prayer
content: Ibn Umar said he saw the Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) delaying his Maghrib prayer when traveling. He would pray it with the Isha' prayer together. Ibn Umar did the same when in a hurry, praying both prayers at once. One time, he delayed the Maghrib prayer because he heard about his wife's death. When reminded that the prayer was due, he said to wait and eventually prayed both Maghrib and Isha' together.

title: Delaying Maghrib Prayer
content: Abdullah bin Umar said he saw the Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) delaying the Maghrib prayer when they were in a hurry during a journey. He would pray the Maghrib and Isha prayers together. Abdullah also did this when he was in a hurry, as his son Salim narrated. One time, Abdullah delayed the Maghrib prayer because he had just heard about his wife's death. His son reminded him to pray, but Abdullah said to wait until they traveled a bit further. Then he prayed and said it was how the Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) used to do when in a hurry.

title: Prophet's Prayer on His Mount
content: Abdullah bin 'Amir said his father saw the Prophet praying while riding a mount. The Prophet (ﷺ) prayed in any direction the mount took him.

title: Prophet Muhammad's Night Prayers
content: Jabir bin Abdullah said the Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) used to pray extra prayers while riding a horse. He would face a direction other than the usual direction of prayer, which is towards the Qibla.

title: Praying on a Journey
content: Ibn Umar prayed and said his late-night prayer while riding his camel named Rahila. He said the Prophet used to do the same when traveling.

title: Praying on a Mount
content: `Abdullah bin `Umar would pray wherever he was traveling. He'd follow the direction of his mount to face towards Mecca. The Prophet (ﷺ) did the same when he traveled.

title: Prophet's Prayer on His Mount
content: 'Amir bin Rabi'a saw the Prophet praying extra prayers by moving his head. He did this in any direction he faced, but not during regular prayer.

title: Prayer During Travel
content: Abdullah bin Umar would pray at night while riding his animal during a journey. He didn't worry about facing the right direction. The Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) used to pray on his mount in any direction, but only for extra prayers, not the required ones.

title: Prophet's Prayer Routine
content: Jabir bin Abdullah said the Prophet used to pray extra prayers on his mount facing east. When he wanted to pray the required prayer, he would get off and face the direction of the Qibla.

title: Anas bin Malik Prays Incorrectly
content: I was with Anas bin Seereen when we met Anas bin Malik after he returned from Sham. We were at a place called 'Ain at-Tamr. I saw him praying while riding his donkey, but his face was turned to the left of the direction of prayer. I asked him about it and he said: 'If Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) had not done this, I wouldn't have either.'

title: Traveling with the Prophet
content: Ibn Umar went on a trip and said he never saw the Prophet pray extra prayers when traveling. The Quran says, 'Follow the good example of the Prophet'.

title: Prophet's Prayer During Travel
content: Ibn Umar said: I went on a journey with the Prophet. He never prayed more than two parts of prayer when we were traveling. Abu Bakr, Umar, and Uthman also did the same.

title: Prophet's Morning and Night Prayers
content: Um Hani said she saw the Prophet taking a bath in her house on the day of Mecca's conquest. He prayed eight units of prayer, but his prostrations and bowing were perfect. On another occasion, Abdullah bin Amir's father saw the Prophet praying extra prayers at night while riding his camel, facing whatever direction it was going.

title: Praying on a Mount
content: Ibn Umar said that the Prophet used to pray extra prayers while sitting on his mount. He would face any direction and use signs to show he was praying. Ibn Umar did the same thing.

title: Prophet's Prayer Routine
content: When the Prophet was in a hurry on a journey, he would combine his Maghrib and Isha prayers together.

title: Prayer Times on Journeys
content: When traveling, the Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) would combine some of his daily prayers. He would pray Zuhr and Asr together, and Maghrib and Isha together.

title: Prayers Together on Journeys
content: Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) used to pray the Maghrib and 'Isha prayers together when he was traveling.

title: Delaying Maghrib Prayer
content: Abdullah bin Umar said he saw the Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) delaying the evening prayer. When traveling quickly, he would pray both the evening and night prayers together. First, he would call for the evening prayer and pray three times, then wait a short while before calling for the night prayer and praying two more times.

title: Prayer Timing on Journey
content: When Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) went on a trip before midday, he would wait until the time for the afternoon prayer. Then he would pray both the noon and afternoon prayers together. If it was already late in the day, he would first pray the noon prayer and then continue his journey.

title: Traveling and Prayer Times
content: When the Prophet went on a trip before noon, he would wait until it was almost time for the evening prayer. Then he would stop his journey, get off his camel, and pray both the midday and evening prayers together. If they were close to each other, he would first pray the midday prayer and then continue his journey.

title: Prophet's Prayer Timing
content: When the Prophet went on a trip before noon, he would wait until it was time for the 'Asr prayer. Then he would stop and pray both Zuhr and 'Asr prayers together. If he started his journey when the sun began to decline, he would first pray the Zuhr prayer and then continue his travel.

title: Prayer During Illness
content: Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) prayed in his house while sitting because he was ill. The people were praying behind him standing up, but he gestured for them to sit down too. When the prayer finished, he said: 'When the Imam (the person leading the prayer) bows, you should bow too. And when he stands up, you should stand up as well.'

title: Prophet's Injury and Prayer
content: The Prophet (ﷺ) fell off a horse and hurt his side. We went to check on him when it was time for prayer. He prayed while sitting, but we stood up to pray behind him. He said that the person leading the prayer should be followed, so if he says 'God is great', we should say it too. If he bows down, we should bow down with him. When he stands up, we should stand up with him. And when he says 'God hears whoever praises Him', we should say 'Our Lord, all praise is for You'.

title: Prayer While Sitting
content: Imran bin Husain had a problem with piles. He asked the Prophet about praying while sitting. The Prophet (ﷺ) said that if you pray standing, it's best. If you pray sitting, you get half of what someone gets who prays standing. And if you pray lying down, you get half of what someone gets who prays sitting.

title: Prayer Position Rewards
content: Imran bin Husain had a medical condition that made it hard for him to stand. He asked the Prophet about praying while sitting. The Prophet (ﷺ) said, 'It's better to pray standing up. If you pray sitting down, you get half of what someone who stands gets. And if you pray lying down, you get half of what someone who sits gets.'

title: Praying with a Problem
content: Imran bin Husain had a health issue called piles. He asked the Prophet about praying while having this problem. The Prophet (ﷺ) said, 'You can pray standing up if you're able to. If not, you can pray sitting down. And if that's still hard, then you can pray lying on your side.'

title: Allah's Messenger's Night Prayer
content: I never saw the Prophet pray at night while sitting. He only did this in his old age. When he wanted to bow, he would get up and read thirty or forty verses standing before bowing.

title: Prophet Muhammad's Final Prayers
content: When Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) was very old and weak, he would pray while sitting down. He would read the Quran while sitting, then get up to read more when there were about thirty or forty verses left. After that, he would bow his head and prostrate on the ground twice. When he finished praying, he would look at me (Aisha) if I was awake and talk to me. If I was asleep, he would lie down.

title: Prophet's Night Prayer
content: When the Prophet got up at night to pray, he would say: 'All praise is for you, Allah. You hold the heavens and earth and everything in them.' He would repeat this three times. Then he would say: 'You are the light of the heavens and earth. All praise is for you. You are the truth, and your promise is true. Meeting you is true, and your word is true. Paradise and Hell are real. Prophets like Muhammad (ﷺ) are truthful, and the Day of Resurrection is true.' He would then say: 'I surrender to you, Allah. I believe in you and depend on you. Forgive me for my past and future sins, and whatever I've kept hidden or revealed. You are the one who brings people forward or backward. There's no power except with you.'

title: Dreams and Seeking Refuge
content: My father told me that when he was a young man, he slept in the mosque where the Prophet used to pray. One night, he had a dream about two angels taking him to a fire pit with people inside. He recognized some of them. In his dream, he said 'I seek refuge with God from the Fire.' Then another angel appeared and told him not to be afraid. When my father woke up, he told Hafsa about the dream. She passed it on to the Prophet. The Prophet (ﷺ) said that my father was a good person and wished he prayed at night more often. After that, my father didn't sleep much at night.

title: Dreams and the Prophet
content: Salim's father told us that when he was a young man, he would sleep in the mosque where the Prophet used to pray. One night, he had a dream that two angels took him to a fire that looked like a well with two poles in it. He saw people inside and they were familiar to him. He started saying 'I seek refuge with God from the Fire.' Then another angel appeared and told him not to be afraid. When Salim's father woke up, he told his wife Hafsa about the dream. She passed on the story to the Prophet. The Prophet (ﷺ) said that Salim's father was a good person and wished that he would pray at night.

title: Prophet's Fajr Prayer Routine
content: Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) used to pray 11 rak'at. He would take a long time in prostration, so much that you could recite 50 verses of the Quran before he stood up. Before Fajr prayer, he would do two extra rak'at and then lie down on his right side until it was time for the main prayer.

title: Prophet's Absence from Night Prayer
content: The Prophet (ﷺ) got sick and didn't pray at night for one or two nights.

title: Gabriel's Absence Explained
content: Jundab bin Abdullah said that Gabriel didn't visit the Prophet for a while. A Quraish woman thought, 'Maybe Satan has left him.' Then Allah sent a message: 'Don't worry, Muhammad (ﷺ), I haven't abandoned you or rejected you.'

title: Wake Up for Prayer
content: One night, the Prophet got up and said, 'How wonderful is Allah! Tonight, many troubles have been sent to us. And tonight, many good things have been given to us.' He told his companions to wake up the women who were sleeping in their homes, so they could pray. He wanted them to know that being rich or wearing nice clothes doesn't make you safe from punishment if you don't follow Allah's rules.

title: Prophet's Night Prayer Request
content: One night the Prophet came to me and my wife Fatima. He asked if we would pray at night. I said, 'Our souls are in Allah's hands. If He wants us to wake up, He will.' The Prophet (ﷺ) left without saying anything more. Later, I heard him say, 'People can be very stubborn'.

title: The Prophet's Humility
content: The Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) used to stop doing good things he loved because he was worried people would follow him and it would become a rule. He never prayed in the morning, but I do offer this prayer.

title: Allah's Messenger Prays at Night
content: One night, the Prophet prayed in the mosque and people followed him. The next night, more people came to pray with him. But on the third and fourth nights, even more people showed up, and still he didn't come out to them. In the morning, he said that he had seen what they were doing, but he was worried that praying at night might become a rule for everyone. This happened in the month of Ramadan.

title: The Prophet's Long Prayers
content: The Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) used to pray for a long time. His feet and legs would swell from standing. Someone asked him why he prayed so long, and he said, 'I'm just being thankful.'

title: David's Prayer and Fasting
content: Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) told me that David loved to pray. He would sleep for half the night, then wake up and pray for one third of the night. Then he'd go back to sleep for a short time. Sometimes David would fast every other day.

title: Prophet's Favorite Deed
content: I asked Aisha which deed the Prophet liked most. She said it was doing something good all the time. I asked when he used to wake up for prayer at night. She said he woke up when he heard a rooster crow.

title: The Prophet's Night Routine
content: Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) never stayed awake late at night in my house. He would always sleep during the last hours of the night.

title: Prophet's Morning Prayer Time
content: Anas bin Malik said that the Prophet and Zaid bin Thabit ate their morning meal together. After finishing, they stood up for prayer. We asked Anas how long it took between eating and praying. He replied that it was about the time it takes to read fifty verses of the Quran.

title: Abdullah's Tahajjud Prayer
content: I prayed with the Prophet one night. He stood for a long time. I thought about sitting down and leaving him, but that didn't feel right.

title: Prophet's Tahajjud Prayer Routine
content: When the Prophet got up for late-night prayer, he would clean his mouth with a stick called Siwak.

title: Night Prayer Explained
content: A man asked the Prophet how to pray at night. The Prophet (ﷺ) said: 'You pray two sets of two rak'at, then keep going like that. When you think dawn is near, finish with one rak'a as a special prayer called witr'.

title: Prophet's Night Prayer
content: Ibn Abbas said that the Prophet's night prayer usually had 13 units of prayer.

title: Aisha Describes Prophet's Night Prayer
content: I asked Aisha about the night prayer of Allah's Messenger (ﷺ). She said it was either seven, nine or eleven rakat, plus the two extra rakat for Fajr prayer.

title: Prophet's Night Prayer
content: Aisha said that the Prophet used to pray 13 rakat at night. This included a special prayer called witr, and two extra rakat for the morning prayer.

title: Prophet Muhammad's Fasting Habits
content: Sometimes the Prophet would not eat for many days. We thought he wouldn't fast that whole month. Other times, he would fast so much we thought he'd never stop fasting. If you wanted to see him praying at night, you could find him praying. And if you wanted to see him sleeping, you could find him sleeping too.

title: Satan's Three Knots
content: Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) said: Satan puts three knots at the back of your head when you're asleep. He says, 'Stay asleep, the night is long.' When you remember Allah, one knot is undone. When you do wudu (ablution), another knot is undone. And when you pray, the third knot is undone. If this happens, you wake up feeling good and energetic. Otherwise, you wake up feeling lazy and with a bad heart.

title: Ignoring Quran and Prayer
content: The Prophet (ﷺ) saw a dream where someone's head was crushed with a stone. He explained that this person had learned the Quran but didn't follow it, and also ignored their daily prayers.

title: Sleeping through Fajr Prayer
content: A man was mentioned to the Prophet. He had slept all night and didn't wake up for morning prayer. The Prophet (ﷺ) said, 'Satan put urine in his ears'.

title: Allah's Messenger's Nightly Visit
content: Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) said: Our Lord comes down to the nearest Heaven every night when most of the night is left. He asks if anyone wants to pray, make a request, or seek forgiveness.

title: Prophet's Night Prayer Routine
content: I asked Aisha about the Prophet's night prayer. She said he slept early and woke up towards the end of the night to pray, then went back to bed. When it was time for prayer, he got up. If he needed a bath, he took one first. Otherwise, he washed his face and hands and went out to pray.

title: Ramadan Prayer of the Prophet
content: I asked Aisha about the Prophet's prayer in Ramadan. She said he never prayed more than eleven rakats, even during Ramadan. He would pray four rakats, then another four, and finish with three. I asked if he slept before praying witr, and he said his eyes sleep but his heart stays awake.

title: Prophet's Night Prayer
content: I, Aisha, never saw the Prophet sitting while reciting the Quran during night prayer. When he was old, he would sit and read until about thirty or forty verses were left. Then he would stand up and finish reading those remaining verses before bowing.

title: Bilal's Good Deed
content: One day after the morning prayer, the Prophet asked Bilal what good deed he had done since becoming a Muslim. Bilal said that every time he washed his face and hands for prayer, he prayed as much as was written for him to pray.

title: Do Good Deeds Consistently
content: A woman from the tribe of Bani Asad was with me. The Prophet (ﷺ) came to my house and asked who she was. I said her name, and that she doesn't sleep at night because she's praying a lot. The Prophet (ﷺ) said: Do good deeds as much as you can. Allah will reward you for them, but only if you keep doing good.

title: Don't Stop Night Prayer
content: Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) told me not to be like someone who used to pray at night but then stopped praying at night.

title: Take Care of Your Body
content: Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) said to me: 'I've been told you pray all night and fast during the day.' I replied, 'Yes, that's true.' He said, 'If you keep doing this, your eyesight will weaken and you'll feel tired. Remember, your body needs rest and so does your family. So, take breaks from fasting and sleeping. Pray for a while, then sleep.'

title: Night Prayer for Forgiveness
content: The Prophet (ﷺ) said: 'If you wake up at night and say this prayer:

title: Abdullah bin Rawaha's Faith
content: Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) said that his brother Abdullah bin Rawaha didn't say bad things about him. He said, 'Among us is Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) who reads the Quran when it's morning. He showed us the right path after we were confused. We believe what he says will happen. And at night, he prays so much that his body doesn't even touch his bed. Meanwhile, the non-believers were sleeping deeply.'

title: Ibn Umar's Dream and Prayer
content: Ibn Umar said he had a dream where he was holding silk cloth that took him to any part of Paradise. He also saw two angels trying to take him to Hell, but another angel stopped them. When Hafsa told the Prophet about this dream, he said Ibn Umar is a good person and wished he prayed at night. After that, Ibn Umar started praying at night. The companions told each other their dreams, saying Laylat al-Qadr was on the 27th of Ramadan. But the Prophet said they all agreed it was in the last ten nights of Ramadan.

title: Ibn Umar's Dreams and Advice
content: Ibn Umar said he had a dream where he was holding a piece of silk cloth that took him to any part of Paradise he wanted. He also saw two angels trying to take him to Hell, but another angel stopped them. When Hafsa told the Prophet about this dream, he said Ibn Umar is a good person and wished he prayed at night more often. After hearing this, Ibn Umar started praying at night. The companions of the Prophet used to tell each other that they had dreams where Laylatul Qadr was on the 27th of Ramadan. But the Prophet said their dreams agreed on one thing: it's in the last ten nights of Ramadan. So if you're looking for it, search for it then.

title: Ibn Umar's Dreams and Prayer
content: Nafi' told me that Ibn 'Umar said he had a dream where he held a piece of silk cloth. It flew with him to any part of Paradise he wanted. He also saw two angels trying to take him to Hell, but another angel stopped them. Hafsa shared this dream with the Prophet, who said Ibn 'Umar was a good man and wished he prayed at night. After that, Ibn 'Umar started praying at night. The companions told each other their dreams about Laila-tul-Qadr being on the 27th of Ramadan. The Prophet (ﷺ) said they all agreed it was in the last ten nights of Ramadan, so if you want to find it, look for it there.

title: Prophet's Tahajjud Prayer
content: Aisha said that the Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) got up at night for prayer. He prayed eight times while standing and then two times while sitting. Before dawn, he prayed two more times, always doing this.

title: Prophet's Sleeping Position
content: After praying two extra prayers before dawn, the Prophet would lie down on his right side.

title: Prophet's Morning Routine
content: After praying a special morning prayer, the Prophet would talk to me if I was awake. If not, he would sleep until it was time for the main Fajr prayer.

title: Prophet's Behavior After Prayer
content: After praying two extra prayers, the Prophet would talk to me if I was awake. If not, he would go to sleep.

title: Prophet's Morning Prayer Habit
content: The Prophet (ﷺ) was very regular in offering two extra rak'at of prayer before dawn. He did this more than any other voluntary prayer.

title: Prophet's Night and Morning Prayers
content: Aisha said that the Prophet used to pray 13 rakats at night. When he heard the morning prayer call, he would add two more short prayers.

title: Prophet's Fajr Prayer Routine
content: The Prophet (ﷺ) used to pray two small sets of prayers before the morning prayer. He made them so short that I wondered if he even recited a basic prayer.

title: How to Make Istikhara Prayer
content: When you want to make a decision about something important, the Prophet taught us to do this prayer. First, pray two extra times, then say: 'I ask for your guidance and power. You know what's best, not me. I don't understand everything. O Allah, if this is good for my life and future, make it easy for me and bless me with it. If it's bad for me, keep it away from me. Instead, guide me to something better.' Then tell Allah about your specific need.

title: Prayer in the Mosque
content: When you enter a mosque, don't sit down until you've prayed two times.

title: Prophet Muhammad's Prayer
content: Anas bin Malik said that the Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) led us in a prayer with two parts. He then left after finishing the prayer.

title: Prayer Times with the Prophet
content: Abdullah bin Umar said: I prayed two rakats with the Messenger of Allah before the noon prayer, and two rakats after the noon prayer. We also prayed two rakats after the Friday, evening, and night prayers.

title: Prayer During Sermon
content: When you come to the mosque for a sermon, if the Imam is already speaking or has just started, you should pray a two-rak'at prayer first before listening to the sermon.

title: Prayer in the Ka'ba
content: Someone told Ibn 'Umar that the Prophet had entered the Ka'ba. Ibn 'Umar went to check and found the Prophet outside, with Bilal by the gate. He asked Bilal if the Prophet prayed inside the Ka'ba, and Bilal said yes. The Prophet (ﷺ) prayed between two pillars in the Ka'ba, then came out and prayed again in front of it. The Prophet (ﷺ) also advised Abu Huraira to pray Duha prayer after sunrise, which is a two-rak'aat prayer. Itban saw the Prophet and Abu Bakr praying together after sunrise.

title: Prayer Times with the Prophet
content: Ibn Umar said he prayed two rak'at before and after Zuhr prayer. He also prayed two rak'at after Maghrib, Isha', and Jumua prayers in his house. His sister Hafsa told him that the Prophet used to pray two light rak'at after dawn.

title: Prayer Times with the Prophet
content: Ibn Umar said: I prayed two rakats before and after the noon prayer. After the sunset and night prayers, I also prayed two rakats in my house. My sister Hafsa told me that the Prophet used to pray two light rakats after dawn.

title: Combining Prayers Together
content: Ibn `Abbas said that he prayed with the Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) eight units of prayer together for Zuhr and Asr, and seven units together for Maghrib and Isha. I asked Abu Ash-sha'tha' if this meant the Prophet was praying Zuhr late and Asr early, or vice versa. He agreed it seemed likely.

title: Duha Prayer in Islam
content: Muwarriq asked Ibn Umar if he offered the Duha prayer. Ibn Umar said no. Muwarriq asked about his father, Umar, and Abu Bakr, but they also didn't pray it. When asked about the Prophet, Ibn Umar said he didn't think the Prophet prayed it.

title: Prophet's Morning Prayer
content: Um Hani said she saw the Prophet enter her house on the day of Mecca's conquest. He took a bath and prayed eight times in the morning. She had never seen him pray so lightly before, but he still bowed and prostrated perfectly.

title: Aisha's Practice of Early Morning Prayer
content: I never saw the Prophet offering a special prayer in the morning. I always offer it myself.

title: Prophet's Advice to Abu Huraira
content: My friend, the Prophet, told me to do three things. I will keep doing them until I die. These are: fast for three days every month, pray in the morning, and pray before going to sleep.

title: Praying at Home with the Prophet
content: An Ansari man told the Prophet he couldn't pray with him because he was too fat. The Prophet (ﷺ) went to his house and they washed a mat together. They prayed two times on it. Later, someone asked Anas if the Prophet ever prayed in the morning. Anas said no, except that one time.

title: Prophet's Night Prayers
content: Ibn 'Umar said: The Prophet (ﷺ) used to pray extra prayers. He would pray two Rakat before the Zuhr prayer and two after it. After Maghrib, he'd pray two Rakat at home. After Isha', he'd also pray two Rakat at home. Before Fajr, he'd pray two Rakat, but no one could enter his house then. Hafsa told me that the Prophet would pray two Rakat after hearing the Adhan and when it was daylight.

title: Prophet's Night Prayer Routine
content: Ibn 'Umar said the Prophet used to pray extra prayers. He would pray two Rakat before Zuhr, two after Zuhr, two after Maghrib in his house, two after Isha' in his house, and two before Fajr. Nobody could enter the Prophet's house when he prayed before Fajr. Hafsa told me that the Prophet also prayed two Rakat after the Adhan was made.

title: Prophet's Prayer Routine
content: Aisha said that the Prophet never missed praying four units of prayer before the midday prayer and two units before the morning prayer.

title: Pray Before Maghrib Prayer
content: The Prophet (ﷺ) said: 'Pray before the compulsory prayer at sunset.' He repeated this three times. On the third time, he added: 'If you want to pray now, you can do so.' He did not like people thinking it was a special rule.

title: Abu Tamim's Prayer Habit
content: Marthad bin Abdullah asked Uqba bin Amir if it was okay to pray two units before the Maghrib prayer. Uqba said they used to do this during the Prophet Muhammad 's (ﷺ) lifetime. Marthad asked why they didn't continue doing it, and Uqba replied that he was too busy with work.

title: Allah's Messenger Visits a Neighbor
content: Mahmud bin Ar-rabi' remembered Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) visiting his neighbor 'Itban bin Malik. 'Itban had weak eyesight and it was hard for him to lead prayers in the mosque during rainy season. He asked Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) to come to his house and pray there instead. Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) agreed and came with Abu Bakr the next morning. They prayed two rak'at, and when neighbors heard that Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) was there, they gathered at 'Itban's house. Some people said 'Itban was a hypocrite because he talked to them. But Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) defended him saying whoever says 'None has the right to be worshipped but Allah' for Allah's sake will be saved from Hell.

title: Allah's Messenger Visits a Neighbor
content: Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) went to visit a man named Malik. When he arrived, Malik offered him a drink of water from a well in his house. The Messenger asked where he wanted to pray, and Malik showed him a place. They prayed there together. After the prayer, they had a meal called 'Khazir'. Some people started talking badly about Malik, saying he was a hypocrite. But Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) defended him, saying that if someone says 'There is no god but Allah' for God's sake, then God will save them from Hell.

title: Pray at Home, Not Graves
content: Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) said to Ibn Umar: 'Some of your prayers should be in your homes. Don't turn them into empty buildings where people only go to pray.'

title: Abu Said Remembers the Prophet
content: I, Quza'a, heard Abu Said say four things. He said he heard the Prophet. Abu Said fought in twelve battles with the Prophet.

title: Travel for Three Mosques
content: The Prophet (ﷺ) said: Don't travel unless it's to three mosques. These are Al-Masjid-Al-Haram, the Mosque of Allah's Messenger (ﷺ), and the Mosque of Jerusalem.

title: Better to Pray Here
content: Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) said: 'One prayer in my mosque is better than one thousand prayers in any other mosque except for the Grand Mosque.'

title: Ibn Umar's Duha Prayer
content: Ibn Umar only prayed the Duha prayer twice: when he arrived in Mecca and walked around the Ka'ba, then prayed two units of prayer behind Maqam Ibrahim. He also prayed at Quba mosque every Saturday. Ibn Umar said that the Prophet used to visit Quba sometimes walking and sometimes riding a horse. Ibn Umar did what his companions did and didn't stop anyone from praying at any time except during sunrise or sunset.

title: Ibn Umar's Duha Prayer
content: Ibn Umar only prayed the Duha prayer twice: when he arrived in Mecca and walked around the Ka'ba, then prayed two units of prayer behind Maqam Ibrahim. He also prayed at Quba Mosque every Saturday. Ibn Umar said that the Prophet used to visit Quba sometimes walking and sometimes riding a horse. Ibn Umar only did what his companions did and didn't stop anyone from praying at any time except during sunrise or sunset.

title: Prophet's Visit to Mosque of Quba
content: Ibn Umar said the Prophet used to go to the Mosque of Quba on Saturdays. He sometimes walked and sometimes rode a horse. Ibn Umar did the same thing.

title: Prophet's Visit to Mosque of Quba
content: Ibn Umar said the Prophet sometimes walked and sometimes rode a horse to the Mosque of Quba. He would then pray two times in the mosque.

title: Paradise near the Prophet's home
content: The Prophet (ﷺ) said that between his house and the pulpit is a garden in Paradise.

title: Prophet's House and Pulpit
content: The Prophet (ﷺ) said: 'There is a special garden between my house and where I preach. It's like the gardens of Paradise. And from there, I lead prayers by a special fountain called Al-Kauthar.'

title: Prophet's Advice on Travel
content: Abu Sa'id Al-khudri said the Prophet taught him four important things. He said: A woman should not travel with anyone except her husband or a close relative. It is not allowed to fast on two special days: Eid al-Fitr and Eid al-Adha. You cannot pray between Fajr and sunrise, or between Asr and sunset. Only travel to three mosques: the Grand Mosque in Mecca, the mosque in Jerusalem, and the Prophet's Mosque.

title: Abdullah bin Abbas' Night
content: Abdullah bin Abbas spent a night at his aunt Maimuna's house. He slept on the bed, and the Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) (SAW) slept next to him with his wife. The Prophet (ﷺ) woke up around midnight, rubbed his face to remove sleep, and recited the last ten verses of Surah Al-Imran. Then he performed ablution from a water container and stood for prayer. Abdullah bin Abbas did the same as the Prophet and joined him in prayer. The Prophet (ﷺ) put his hand on Abdullah's head and ear, then prayed two sets of four rak'at and one witr rak'a. After that, he lay down until the Mu'adh-dhin called for prayer, and he prayed two light rak'at before going out to pray Fajr.

title: Greeting the Prophet while Praying
content: When we greeted the Prophet during prayer, he would answer us. But when we returned from Ethiopia and greeted him again during prayer, he didn't respond. After finishing his prayer, he said: 'In prayer, one is busy with something more important'.

title: Praying in Silence
content: Zaid bin Arqam said: When the Prophet was alive, we would talk while praying. We'd share our needs with each other. But then a verse was revealed that said, 'Be careful about your prayers.' After that, we were told to stay quiet during prayer.

title: Prophet Leads Prayer
content: The Prophet (ﷺ) went out to help two tribes get along. When it was time for prayer, Bilal asked Abu Bakr to lead the people in prayer because the Prophet was delayed. Abu Bakr agreed and led the prayer. Meanwhile, the Prophet arrived and stood in the front row. The people clapped, but Abu Bakr didn't look around until he saw the Prophet. He waved for Abu Bakr to stay where he was, but Abu Bakr raised his hands in praise to Allah and stepped back. The Prophet (ﷺ) then took over and led the prayer.

title: Greeting in Prayer
content: Abdullah bin Mas'ud said: We used to greet each other with 'As-salamu alaikum' during prayer. The Prophet (ﷺ) heard us and said, 'Say

title: Men and Women in Prayer
content: The Prophet (ﷺ) said that when something happens during prayer, men should say 'Subhan Allah' to get the Imam's attention. Women should clap their hands instead.

title: Men's and Women's Praise
content: The Prophet (ﷺ) said that when men want to praise Allah, they should say 'Subhan Allah' (God is perfect). When women want to praise Allah, they can clap their hands.

title: Prophet's Visit During Prayer
content: Abu Bakr was leading the morning prayer on a Monday. The Prophet (ﷺ) suddenly appeared at the door of Aisha's house, looking at the people standing in rows and smiling. Abu Bakr thought the Prophet wanted to join them for prayer. But the Prophet just waved his hand to let them finish their prayer, then went back inside.

title: Juraij's Prayer and Son
content: Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) said that a man named Juraij was praying in his hermitage when his mother called him. He said, 'My mother is calling me while I'm praying.' She called again, and he said the same thing. His mother said, 'Don't die until you see prostitutes.' A shepherdess came to graze her sheep near his home and gave birth to a child. People asked whose child it was, and she said it was Juraij's. When brought to him, Juraij asked the child who its father was. The child said 'the shepherd'.

title: Prophet's Advice on Prostrating
content: The Prophet (ﷺ) talked about a man who flattens the earth when he prostrates. He said, 'If you need to do that, do it once.'

title: Praying in Hot Weather
content: We used to pray with the Prophet. When it was very hot outside, if someone couldn't put their face on the ground, they would spread out their clothes and pray over them instead.

title: Aisha's Experience During Prayer
content: I used to sit with my legs stretched out towards the direction of the Prophet's prayer. When he prostrated, his body touched me and I moved my legs away. When he stood up, I put my legs back in that position.

title: Prophet Muhammad's Prayer Experience
content: The Prophet (ﷺ) was praying when Satan tried to interrupt him. Allah helped the Prophet and he felt strong enough to stop Satan. The Prophet (ﷺ) thought about tying Satan to a mosque pillar, but then remembered what Prophet Solomon said in his prayer. Allah made Satan leave with his head down.

title: Abu Barza's Prayer and Animal
content: We were fighting at Al-Ahwaz. I was near a river when I saw a man praying with his animal's reins in his hands. The animal was struggling, so the man followed it while still praying. A Khawarij fighter said, 'God should punish this old man.' When the prayer finished, Abu Barza said, 'I heard you. I fought alongside the Prophet in six or seven battles and saw how kind he was. I'd rather keep my animal than let it go back to its stable because it would be a hassle'.

title: Eclipse Prayer and Vision
content: One day, a solar eclipse happened. The Prophet (ﷺ) stood up for prayer. He recited a long Surah, then bowed down for a while. After that, he stood up and read another Surah. He bowed again, then prostrated twice. When the prayer was over, he said: 'These eclipses are signs from Allah. If you see them, pray until they're gone.' The Prophet (ﷺ) saw many things promised to him by Allah. He saw Paradise and wanted to pick some grapes. But when he saw Hell, he retreated. In Hell, he saw a man named `Amr bin Luhai.

title: Spitting During Prayer
content: The Prophet (ﷺ) saw some sputum on the wall in front of the mosque. He was upset and said that during prayer, Allah is in front of everyone. So people should not spit or expectorate towards the Qibla. If you need to spit, do it to your left.

title: Prayer Etiquette
content: When you're praying, remember that you're talking to your Lord in private. So, don't spit in front of Him or on the right side of your body. Spit instead under your left foot on the left side.

title: Women's Prayer Position
content: When praying with the Prophet, women were told not to lift their heads until men had sat down. This was because they wore short waist-sheets tied around their necks due to a shortage of cloth.

title: Greeting the Prophet while praying
content: I used to greet the Prophet when he was praying. He would always return my greeting. But one time I greeted him while he was praying and he didn't respond. After finishing his prayer, he said that during prayer, a person is too busy with more important things.

title: The Prophet's Greeting
content: Jabir bin Abdullah was sent on a task by the Prophet. After finishing it, he greeted the Prophet but didn't get a response. He thought maybe the Prophet was angry with him for not coming quickly. So he greeted again and still got no answer. Feeling even more sorry, he greeted once more. This time the Prophet smiled and said, 'I wasn't greeting you because I was praying.' The Prophet (ﷺ) was on his camel, facing away from the direction of the Kaaba.

title: Abu Bakr Leads Prayer
content: Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) went to a group of people who were arguing. He was late and the prayer time came. Bilal asked Abu Bakr to lead the prayer because Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) was delayed. Abu Bakr agreed. During the prayer, the people clapped when they saw Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) arrive. Abu Bakr stopped praying and looked back at Allah's Messenger (ﷺ). The Prophet (ﷺ) signaled him to continue. After the prayer, Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) told everyone that clapping is for women. He said if something unusual happens during prayer, say 'Subhan Allah'. Then he asked Abu Bakr why he didn't finish leading the prayer when he was signaled to.

title: Hands in Prayer
content: Abu Huraira said that the Prophet told him not to keep his hands on his hips during prayer.

title: Hands in Prayer
content: Abu Huraira said that it is not allowed to pray with your hands on your hips.

title: The Prophet's Quick Action
content: I prayed with the Prophet. After finishing prayer, he quickly went to his wives and then came back out. People looked surprised because of how fast he moved. He said that during prayer, he remembered some gold at home. He didn't want it there overnight, so he ordered someone to give it away.

title: Satan's Behavior During Prayer
content: When the muezzin calls for prayer, Satan runs away to avoid hearing it. When the muezzin finishes, Satan returns. He does this again when the imam says 'come to prayer'. After that, Satan stays and reminds the person praying of things they usually forget. If someone prays without remembering how many units they prayed, they should sit down and do two prostrations.

title: Reciting the Quran in Prayer
content: Abu Huraira said that people thought he was telling too many stories about the Prophet. One day, he met a man who had been to the Prophet's evening prayer. Abu Huraira asked him which part of the Quran the Prophet had read during the prayer. The man didn't know. Abu Huraira knew the answer and told him what the Prophet had read.

title: Prophet's Prayer in Mosque
content: Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) led us in a prayer. He stood up after two rak'at without sitting down. We followed him, and when he finished the prayer, he said 'Allahu Akbar' (God is great) before saying 'Salam' (peace be upon you). Then he performed two prostrations while sitting.

title: Prophet Muhammad's Prayer Routine
content: During a Zuhr prayer, the Prophet stood up after the second rak'a without sitting. He then performed two prostrations and finished the prayer with Taslim.

title: Extra Rak'at in Zuhr Prayer
content: 'Abdullah asked the Prophet if he had done something extra in his Zuhr prayer. The Prophet (ﷺ) said, 'What do you mean?' He replied, 'You prayed five rak'ats.' So the Prophet did two prostrations after finishing the prayer.

title: Prayer Reduced by Prophet
content: The Prophet (ﷺ) led us in Zuhr or Asr prayer and finished it. Dhul-Yadain asked if the prayer was shorter now. The Prophet (ﷺ) asked his companions if they agreed it was shorter. He then added two more rakats and performed two prostrations.

title: Two Rak'at Prayer
content: Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) offered a prayer with two rak'ats. Dhul-Yadain asked if the prayer was shorter or forgotten. The Prophet (ﷺ) stood up and added the remaining two rak'ats, performed Taslim, said Takbir, and did two extra prostrations.

title: Prophet's Evening Prayer
content: The Prophet (ﷺ) offered the evening prayer. He only prayed two rak'at. Then he stood near a piece of wood in front of the Mosque and put his hand on it. Abu Bakr and Umar were there, but they didn't say anything to him because they respected him so much. Some people who were in a hurry left. One man asked the Prophet if the prayer had been shortened or if he had forgotten something. The Prophet (ﷺ) said neither was true. The man said again that the Prophet must have forgotten. So the Prophet added two more rak'at, finished his prayer, and then performed a special prostration.

title: Prophet's Forgotten Sitting
content: During a prayer, the Prophet stood up for a third time without sitting first. After finishing the prayer, he performed two prostrations and said 'Allahu Akbar' (God is great) before ending the prayer.

title: Satan's Behavior During Prayer
content: When the call for prayer starts, Satan tries to leave quietly so he can't hear it. When the call ends, he comes back. He does this again when the second call is made. During prayer, Satan tries to distract you and make you think of things that weren't on your mind before. If you're not sure if you prayed three or four times, sit down and do two prostrations as a reminder.

title: Satan's Tricks During Prayer
content: When you're praying, Satan tries to confuse you. He makes you forget how many parts of the prayer you've done. If this happens, sit down and do two special prostrations called Sahu.

title: Two Rak'ats After Asr Prayer
content: Kuraib was sent by Ibn Abbas and others to ask Aisha about the two rak'at prayer after Asr. They were told that she offered these prayers, but it was said that the Prophet had forbidden them. Kuraib asked Aisha, who then sent him to Um Salama for an answer. Um Salama said she heard the Prophet forbid the prayer, but saw him offering it after Asr. The Prophet (ﷺ) explained that he missed offering this prayer earlier and these two rak'at were for those missed prayers.

title: Abu Bakr Leads Prayer
content: Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) went to help people who were arguing. He was late for prayer time and Bilal asked Abu Bakr to lead the prayer. Abu Bakr said yes, but when Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) arrived, he motioned for Abu Bakr to stop praying. Then Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) took over and led the prayer. Afterward, he told everyone not to clap during prayer, only women can do that. He also asked Abu Bakr why he didn't continue leading the prayer when signaled to.

title: Asma' Sees People Praying
content: I visited Aisha while she was praying. Many people were also praying around her. I asked what was happening, and she pointed upwards with her head. I asked if there was a sign, and she nodded yes.

title: Prayer During Illness
content: During his illness, the Prophet prayed sitting in his house. Some people were standing behind him, but he signaled them to sit down too. After the prayer, he said: 'Follow your leader. When he bows, bow with him. When he stands up, stand up with him.'

title: Death in Paradise
content: Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) said: Someone came to me from Allah and told me that if one of my followers dies only worshipping Allah, they will go to Heaven. I asked, 'Even if they did something wrong like having an affair or stealing?' He replied, 'Yes, even then'.

title: Dying on the Right Path
content: Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) said: If someone dies while worshipping other gods besides Allah, they will go to Hell. I asked him, 'And if someone dies only worshipping Allah?' He replied, 'They will enter Paradise.'

title: Seven Orders and Prohibitions
content: Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) told us to do seven things. He ordered us to follow a funeral procession when it passes by, visit someone who is sick, accept an invitation to eat or stay with someone, help people who are being treated unfairly, keep our promises, say hello back when someone greets us, and reply to someone who says 'Alhamdulillah' (praise be to Allah) after sneezing by saying 'Yarhamukallah' (may Allah have mercy on you). He also told us not to use silver plates or cups, wear gold rings, or wear clothes made of silk.

title: Rights of a Muslim
content: Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) said: A Muslim has five rights on other Muslims. They are to say 'as-salamu alaykum' back, visit someone who is sick, follow the funeral procession, accept an invitation, and reply when someone says 'alhamdulillah'.

title: Abu Bakr's Grief
content: Abu Bakr came to the Mosque on his horse. He got down and didn't talk to anyone until he reached me. Then he went straight to the Prophet, who was covered with a blanket. Abu Bakr uncovered the Prophet's face and kissed him. He started crying and said, 'My parents be sacrificed for you, O Prophet.' He told everyone that Allah wouldn't punish the Prophet twice. The Prophet (ﷺ) had died as written in his fate. Later, Abu Bakr came out and saw Umar speaking to people. Abu Bakr asked Umar to sit down but he refused. Then Abu Bakr recited a prayer saying there's no God but Allah and Muhammad (ﷺ) is His Messenger. People listened to Abu Bakr and left Umar. Abu Bakr said that if anyone worshipped the Prophet, then the Prophet was dead. But if someone worshipped Allah, Allah would never die. He read from the Quran: 'Muhammad (ﷺ) is just a messenger who has passed away like many others before him.'

title: Abu Bakr's Emotional Farewell
content: Abu Bakr came to the mosque on his horse. He got down and went straight to the Prophet, who was lying under a blanket. Abu Bakr uncovered the Prophet's face and kissed him. Then he started crying and said, 'My parents are sacrificed for you, O Prophet.' He told people that Allah wouldn't punish the Prophet twice. The Prophet (ﷺ) had died as it was written. Abu Bakr then stood up to speak. He recited a prayer saying only Allah is worthy of worship. People listened to him instead of 'Umar, who was talking at the same time. Abu Bakr said, 'Those who worshipped Muhammad (ﷺ) should know that he's gone. But those who worshipped Allah will always have life.' He read from the Quran: 'Muhammad (ﷺ) is just a messenger like many others before him.'

title: Uthman's Death and the Prophet
content: Um Al-'Ala', an Ansari woman, said to Kharija bin Zaid: 'We got Uthman bin Maz'un in our share when the emigrants were distributed among us. He fell ill and died. We gave him a bath and dressed him in his clothes. The Prophet (ﷺ) came.' Um Al-'Ala' said: 'May Allah be merciful to you, O Abu As-Sa'ib! I testify that Allah has honored you.' The Prophet (ﷺ) replied: 'How do you know that Allah has honored him?' Um Al-'Ala' said: 'I don't know anyone else who would get such honor from Allah.' The Prophet (ﷺ) said: 'Death came to him. I wish him good, but I don't know what Allah will do with me though I am His Messenger.'

title: Jabir's Father is Martyred
content: My father was killed in battle. I uncovered his face to cry and people told me not to. But the Prophet didn't stop me. My aunt Fatima started crying too, so the Prophet said: 'It doesn't matter if you cry or not.' The angels were covering my father's body with their wings until we moved him.

title: Prophet's Prayer for Najashi
content: Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) went to a prayer place. People stood behind him in rows. He said four special phrases, then gave a funeral prayer for An-Najashi who had just died.

title: Prophet's Companions Were Martyred
content: The Prophet (ﷺ) said that Zaid took the flag and was killed. Then Jafar took it, but he too was killed. Abdullah bin Rawaha then took the flag, but he also died. The Prophet (ﷺ) was very sad about this. Later, Khalid bin Al-Walid took the flag without being chosen to lead first, and he won a great victory.

title: Visiting a Dead Friend
content: One day, a man died. The Prophet (ﷺ) used to visit people who had passed away. He was not told about this man's death until the next morning. When he found out, he went to the grave and said a prayer.

title: Mercy and Paradise
content: The Prophet (ﷺ) said, 'If a Muslim's three children die before they are old enough to understand Islam, Allah will reward him with Paradise because of his kindness towards them.'

title: Women's Request for a Day
content: Some women asked the Prophet to set aside a day just for them. He spoke with them and said that if three of their children died, those children would protect them from Hell Fire. A woman then asked about what would happen if only two children died, and the Prophet replied that even two children would be enough protection.

title: Children Protecting Mothers
content: Some women asked the Prophet to teach them about a good deed. He said that if a woman's three children die before they reach puberty, those children will protect her from going into Hell Fire. A woman asked if two children would be enough, and the Prophet replied yes, even two children would help protect their mother.

title: Children Dying in Islam
content: The Prophet (ﷺ) said: No Muslim will go to Hell if their three children die. Allah's promise is that everyone must cross the bridge above the lake of fire.

title: Be Patient, Fear Allah
content: The Prophet (ﷺ) passed by a woman sitting beside her husband's grave. He told her to fear Allah and be patient.

title: Washing a Dead Body
content: When the Prophet's daughter died, he told us to wash her body with water and Sidr leaves. We washed her three or five times if needed, then applied some camphor at the end. After finishing, we told him and he gave us his waist-sheet to shroud her in.

title: Caring for the Dead
content: Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) came to us while we were washing his daughter. He said: 'Wash her with water and a plant called Sidr, three or five times. Add camphor at the end.' When we finished, he gave us a cloth to wrap her body in.

title: Bathing a Dead Child
content: When washing a dead child, start with the right side. Wash the parts that are washed during ablution in the same way.

title: Washing a Deceased Child
content: When the Prophet's daughter died, Um 'Atiyya and others washed her. The Prophet (ﷺ) told them to start washing from her right side, just like they do when washing for prayer.

title: Washing and Shrouding a Deceased
content: Um 'Atiyya said: The Prophet 's (ﷺ) daughter died. He told us to wash her body three or five times, or more if needed. When we finished washing, he asked us to tell him. We did, and then he took off his cloth and used it to shroud her.

title: Washing a Dead Body
content: Um 'Atiyya said the Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) told her to wash his daughter's body three or five times with water and Sidr. After washing, she should be wrapped in a shroud made from his own waist-sheet.

title: Washing the Dead Body
content: The Prophet 's (ﷺ) daughter died. He said to wash her body with water and a special tree called Sidr. You can do this three, five or more times if you think it necessary. When finished, put some camphor on her last. Then wrap her in a shroud made from his own waist-sheet.

title: Um 'Atiyya's Hair Story
content: Um 'Atiyya said she and others had tied the Prophet's daughter's hair in three braids. They took out her hair, washed it, then tied it back up in three braids.

title: Washing the Prophet's Daughter
content: Um 'Atiyya told us that when the Prophet came to her while they were washing his daughter's body, he said: 'Wash her three times or more with water and Sidr. Then put camphor last. When you're done, tell me.' After finishing, Um 'Atiyya said, she informed him. He gave them a cloth to wrap the body in and didn't say anything else.

title: Braiding the Prophet's Daughter
content: Um 'Atiyya said: We braided the hair of the Prophet's daughter into three parts. One braid was in front, and the other two were on the sides of her head.

title: Washing a Deceased Child
content: One of the Prophet's daughters died. He told us to wash her with Sidr water three or five times, and in the last washing, add camphor. When we finished, he asked us to get his waist-sheet so we could shroud her. We braided her hair into three sections and let them fall at the back of her head.

title: Allah's Messenger Buried
content: Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) was wrapped in three white pieces of cloth from Yemen. There was no shirt or turban on him when he was buried.

title: Man Dies in Arafat
content: A man fell off his camel and died. The Prophet (ﷺ) said to wash him with water and a special tree's leaves, then cover him with two pieces of cloth. Don't put perfume on him or cover his head. He'll be raised from the dead saying 'Labbaik' like a pilgrim.

title: Man Dies at Hajj
content: A man was traveling with the Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) at Arafat. He fell off his camel and died. The Prophet (ﷺ) said, 'Wash him with water and Sidr leaves. Wrap him in two pieces of cloth. Don't use perfume or cover his head.' On Judgment Day, Allah will bring him back to life, and he'll say 'Labbaik' (I'm here).

title: Killed by his Camel
content: A man was killed by his camel while we were with the Prophet. He was a Muhrim, which means he had special restrictions for pilgrimage. The Prophet (ﷺ) said to wash him with water and Sidr leaves, then wrap him in two pieces of cloth. Don't put perfume on him or cover his head. Allah will bring him back to life on Judgment Day, and he'll be saying 'I'm here, I'm ready' (Labbaik).

title: Man Falls from Camel
content: A man fell off his camel and died while the Prophet was at Arafat. The Prophet (ﷺ) said to wash him with water, use Sidr leaves, put two pieces of cloth on him, and don't perfume or cover his head. He will be raised up on Judgment Day saying 'Labbaik'.

title: Prophet's Decision on Hypocrite
content: Ibn Umar told me that when Abdullah bin Ubai died, his son asked the Prophet for a shirt to bury him in and for a prayer. The Prophet (ﷺ) gave him the shirt but said he would pray after being informed. When it was time, Umar stopped him saying Allah had forbidden praying for hypocrites. The Prophet (ﷺ) explained that even if he prayed 70 times, Allah wouldn't forgive them. He then prayed anyway, and soon received a revelation: 'Don't pray for any of them when they die'.

title: Prophet Visits Abdullah's Grave
content: Jabir said the Prophet came to the grave of Abdullah bin Ubai after he had been buried. The body was taken out, and the Prophet put his saliva on it and dressed it in his shirt.

title: Prophet's Burial Shroud
content: The Prophet (ﷺ) was wrapped in three pieces of cotton cloth. No shirt or turban was used for his burial.

title: Wrapping the Prophet's Body
content: When the Prophet passed away, he was wrapped in three pieces of cloth. No shirt or turban was used for his burial.

title: Burial Shroud for the Prophet
content: Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) was wrapped in three white pieces of cloth when he died. No shirt or turban was used.

title: Abdur-Rahman's Fear of Reward
content: Sa'd's father said that when Abdur-Rahman bin Auf was given his meal, he said: 'Mus'ab bin Umair died as a martyr and he was better than me. He only had a simple black dress to be wrapped in. Hamza also died as a martyr and he was better than me too - he didn't even have a shroud. I'm worried that the reward for my good deeds might come early, while I'm still alive.' Then Abdur-Rahman started crying.

title: Abdur-Rahman's Fear of Reward
content: Abdur-Rahman bin Auf was fasting when a meal was brought to him. He said Mus'ab bin Umair, who had been killed in battle, was better than he and had been wrapped in his special cloth. When they covered his legs, his head got uncovered. Abdur-Rahman also remembered Hamza, another martyr, who was better than him. He thought that maybe the reward for his good deeds had already come in this life. This made him sad and he left his food.

title: Martyr Mus'ab's Burial
content: We emigrated with the Prophet to follow Allah's command. Some of us died and didn't get any reward in this world. One of them was Mus'ab bin Umair, who was killed on the day of the Battle of Uhud. We only had his shirt to bury him in. The Prophet (ﷺ) told us to cover his head but leave his feet uncovered. He then ordered us to put some leaves over his bare feet.

title: The Prophet Accepts a Gift
content: A woman brought a special cloak to the Prophet. He accepted it and wore it as his waist-sheet. A man saw him wearing it and asked for it, but others told him not to ask because the Prophet needed it. The man said he wanted it so he could use it as his shroud when he died.

title: Following Funeral Processions
content: Um 'Atiyya said: We were told not to walk with funeral processions. However, it was not made a strict rule for us to follow.

title: Mourning for a Child
content: Um 'Atiyya's son died. She asked for perfume and put it on her body after three days. She said, 'We're not allowed to mourn more than three days, except for our husbands.'

title: Mourning Period for Women
content: Um Habiba asked for perfume and scented her cheeks and arms. She said this because the Prophet taught that a woman who believes in Allah should not mourn more than three days for anyone except her husband, who she can mourn for four months and ten days.

title: Mourning for the Dead
content: Zainab bint Abi Salama asked Um Habiba about mourning. Um Habiba said she heard the Prophet say a woman should not mourn more than three days, except for her husband. She should mourn him for four months and ten days.

title: Women's Mourning Period
content: Zainab bint Abi Salama said Um Habiba told her that the Prophet said: 'A woman who believes in Allah and the Last Day should not mourn a dead person for more than three days, except for her husband. For him, she can mourn for four months and ten days.'

title: Patience in Calamity
content: The Prophet (ﷺ) passed by a woman crying beside her husband's grave. He told her to be strong and patient. She said she didn't know him, but later found out it was the Prophet. When she visited him at home, she apologized for not recognizing him earlier. The Prophet (ﷺ) said that patience is most important when you first face a problem.

title: The Prophet's Grief for a Child
content: Usama bin Zaid told us that the Prophet's daughter asked him to come because her child was very sick. The Prophet (ﷺ) sent back a message saying: 'Whatever Allah takes is His decision, and whatever He gives is also His decision. Everything has a limited time in this life.' She asked again for his help, swearing that he would come. This time, the Prophet got up with some of his friends to visit her. When they arrived, the child was dying. The Prophet 's (ﷺ) eyes started to water when he saw the child. Sa'd asked him why and the Prophet said: 'It is mercy from Allah in our hearts.'

title: The Prophet's Grief at a Funeral
content: One of the Prophet's daughters had died. We were walking around her grave when I saw him sitting there, crying. He asked if anyone among us had not slept with their wife that night. Abu Talha said no, so the Prophet told him to go down into the grave. Abu Talha went down and joined his daughter.

title: Crying at Funerals
content: Ibn `Umar said to `Amr bin `Uthman, 'Shouldn't we stop people from crying when someone dies? The Prophet (ﷺ) said that the dead person is punished by their family's crying. Ibn `Abbas agreed with this. He told a story about how he and Umar traveled together. They saw some travelers under a tree, one of whom was Suhaib. When Umar died, Suhaib came to his funeral and cried. Ibn `Umar said that the Prophet said the dead person is punished by their family's crying. But Aisha disagreed with him. She said the Prophet actually meant that non-believers are punished more because of their family's crying. She pointed out that the Quran says 'no one bears another's burden'. Ibn `Abbas then said, 'Only Allah makes us happy or sad.'

title: Crying at a Funeral
content: A man's daughter died in Mecca. Some people went to her funeral. Ibn Umar and Ibn Abbas were there too. A man sat next to them. Ibn Umar said, 'We shouldn't cry because Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) said the dead person is punished by their relatives' crying.' Ibn Abbas agreed. He told a story about when he was traveling with Umar.
