They saw some people in a forest. One of them was Suhaib. Umar asked Ibn Abbas to call him over. When Umar died, Ibn Abbas told Aisha what had happened. She said Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) didn't say believers are punished by their relatives' crying. He actually said non-believers get more punishment because of their family's crying. Aisha reminded them that the Quran says no one has to bear another person's burden. Ibn Abbas then said only Allah makes people cry or laugh.

title: Crying at a Funeral
content: `Abdullah bin `Umar and Ibn `Abbas were attending the funeral of one of `Uthman's daughters in Mecca. A man sat between them and mentioned that crying at funerals was forbidden because Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) said, 'The dead person is tortured by the crying of his relatives.' Ibn `Abbas explained that this was a saying of `Umar, but then he told a story about how `Umar used to say it. When Suhaib came to visit `Umar after he was stabbed, `Umar reminded him of Allah's Messenger 's (ﷺ) words. Later, when `Umar died, Ibn `Abbas told Aisha what had happened and she corrected them, saying that the Prophet actually said that a non-believer is punished by his relatives' weeping, not a believer. She also mentioned that the Quran says, 'No burdened soul will bear another's burden.' Finally, Ibn `Abbas said, 'Only Allah makes one laugh or cry.'

title: Weeping Over the Dead
content: The Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) passed by a Jewish woman's grave. Her family was crying over her. He said that she is being punished in her grave, even though they are mourning for her.

title: Umar's Final Words
content: Abu Burda said his father told him that when Umar was stabbed, Suhaib started crying. Umar said to him, 'Don't you remember what the Prophet said? He said that the dead person is punished because of the living who cry.'

title: Lying about the Prophet
content: I heard the Prophet say: If someone tells a lie about me on purpose, they will go to Hell. He also said that people who are being mourned for in life are punished more because of those mourning them.

title: Wailing Over the Dead
content: The Prophet (ﷺ) said that a person who has died is punished in their grave because of the crying and wailing done by those who are still alive for them. This means that our loud mourning can actually cause harm to the deceased.

title: Martyrs are Honored by Angels
content: During the Battle of Uhud, my father was brought to the Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ). He had been hurt badly and his body was covered with a sheet. I wanted to see him, but people stopped me from doing so. The Prophet (ﷺ) gave an order and my father's body was moved away. At that time, he heard a woman crying loudly. He asked who she was, and they said it was someone related to 'Amr. He told her to stop crying because the angels had been covering my father with their wings until his body was taken away.

title: Warning Against Ignorant Behavior
content: The Prophet (ﷺ) said, 'If someone slaps their face, tears their clothes, and follows the old ways of ignorance, they are not one of us.'

title: Prophet's Advice on Charity
content: 'Amir bin Sa'd's father was ill. The Prophet (ﷺ) visited him and asked about his health. He said he wanted to give some of his wealth in charity because he had no other family except a daughter. The Prophet (ﷺ) told him not to give two-thirds or half, but just one-third. He said it's better for the inheritors to be wealthy rather than poor. The Prophet (ﷺ) also said that any good deed done for Allah's sake will get a reward, even if it's just helping his wife. 'Amir bin Sa'd asked if he would be left alone after his companions had gone. The Prophet (ﷺ) replied that if he was, his good deeds would help him and maybe he would live a long time to benefit some people and harm others. He then prayed for the safe return of Amir's companions.

title: Abu Musa's Last Words
content: Abu Musa was very ill. He fainted and couldn't talk to his wife. When he woke up, he said: 'I'm not like those people Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) is not proud of.' He also said that Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) doesn't approve of a woman who cries loudly, shaves her head, or tears off her clothes when something bad happens.

title: Don't Follow Ignorant Ways
content: The Prophet (ﷺ) said: If someone hits people's faces, tears their clothes, and acts like the people of ignorance, they are not one of us.

title: Not from Our Community
content: The Prophet (ﷺ) said, 'If someone hits people's faces, tears their clothes, and follows old ways of ignorance, they are not one of us.'

title: Prophet Muhammad and the Women
content: When Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) heard that two of his friends had died, he sat down and looked sad. I was watching him from behind a door. A man told him that some women were crying loudly for their loved ones. The Prophet (ﷺ) asked him to tell them to stop. But when the man went back, they didn't listen. The Prophet (ﷺ) told him to go again and remind them. When the man came back a third time, he said the women still wouldn't listen. So the Prophet ordered him to gently put some dust in their mouths as a reminder to respect his words.

title: Messenger Recites Qunut
content: When the people who recited the Quran were killed, the Prophet recited a special prayer called Qunut for one month. I never saw him as sad as he was on this day.

title: Abu Talha's Son Passes Away
content: One of Abu Talha's sons fell ill and died. When his father wasn't home, the mother washed and prepared him for burial. She told Abu Talha that their son was resting peacefully. Abu Talha thought she meant he was sleeping. In the morning, he took a bath and got ready to leave when his wife told him the truth. He went to pray with the Prophet and shared what had happened. The Prophet (ﷺ) said, 'May Allah bless you with good children.' Later, it was said that they had nine sons who all memorized the Quran.

title: Patience in Hard Times
content: The Prophet (ﷺ) said that true patience is when you face a problem for the first time and deal with it calmly. It's not about how long you can wait, but how you react at the very beginning of a difficult situation.

title: Allah's Messenger Visits Ibrahim
content: We went with Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) to a blacksmith named Abu Saif. His wife was the mother of his son, Ibrahim. The Prophet (ﷺ) took Ibrahim and kissed him and smelled him. Then we entered their house, and Ibrahim was very sick. The Prophet (ﷺ) started crying. Abdur Rahman said, 'You're crying too?' The Prophet (ﷺ) replied, 'This is mercy.' He cried more and said, 'Our eyes are shedding tears, but our hearts are sad. We won't say anything that doesn't please Allah. O Ibrahim, we'll miss you so much.'

title: Visiting a Sick Friend
content: The Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) visited his friend Sa'd bin 'Ubada when he was sick. He went with some other friends, including Abdullah bin Mas'ud and Sa'd bin Abi Waqqas. When they arrived, they found many people around him. The Prophet (ﷺ) asked if Sa'd had died yet. They said no. The Prophet (ﷺ) started crying, and everyone else began to cry too. He told them that Allah doesn't punish you for feeling sad or crying, but He does get angry when people wail loudly over someone who has passed away. This can cause trouble for the person who has died.

title: Prophet's Reaction to Martyrs
content: When the Prophet heard that his friends Zaid, Ja`far, and Abdullah had been killed in battle, he sat down looking sad. I was watching from behind a door when a man came and said, 'The women of Ja`far are crying.' The Prophet (ﷺ) told him to stop them from crying. But the man went back and said they wouldn't listen. He went again, but still they didn't obey. The Prophet (ﷺ) then said, 'Put dust in their mouths.' I was angry with the man for not following the Prophet's order.

title: Women Who Did Not Wail
content: Um 'Atiyya said that when people gave a pledge of allegiance to the Prophet, one condition was not to wail. Only five women did not break this rule: Um Sulaim, Um Al-`Ala', and three others - possibly the daughter of Abi Sabra and the wife of Mu`adh.

title: Respect Funeral Processions
content: The Prophet (ﷺ) said: When you see a funeral procession, stand up until the coffin goes ahead of you or is put down.

title: Respect a Funeral Procession
content: If you see a funeral procession and you're not part of it, stand up until the coffin is put down or the procession goes ahead of you. Don't let them leave before you.

title: Abu Huraira's Funeral Advice
content: We were walking with a funeral procession. Abu Huraira grabbed Marwan's hand and sat down before the coffin was put in place. Then, Abu Sa'id came and took Marwan's hand, saying 'Get up.' He said that Abu Huraira knew the Prophet had forbidden us to do this. Abu Huraira agreed with him.

title: Respect a Funeral Procession
content: The Prophet (ﷺ) said, 'When you see a funeral procession, stand up. Anyone who walks with it should not sit down until the coffin is put down.'

title: Stand Up for Funerals
content: Jabir bin Abdullah said the Prophet stood up when a funeral procession passed. He told us to stand up whenever we see a funeral procession, whether it's of a Muslim or not.

title: Standing for Non-Muslim Funerals
content: Two men, Sahl bin Hunaif and Qais bin Sa'd, were sitting in Al-Qadisiya. A funeral procession passed by them, so they stood up. They were told it was a non-Muslim under Muslim protection. They said the Prophet (ﷺ) also stood for a Jewish funeral. When asked why, he replied, 'Is it not a soul?'

title: Standing for Non-Muslim Funerals
content: Two men, Sahl and Qais, were sitting in Al-Qadisiya when a funeral procession passed by. They stood up to show respect. Someone told them it was a non-believer's funeral under Muslim protection. Sahl and Qais said they remembered the Prophet standing for a Jew's funeral. When asked why, he replied that it's because it's a soul.

title: What a Funeral Says
content: When a funeral is ready to be carried, the Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) said that if the person who died was good and honest, their body will say 'Take me quickly'. But if they were not good, it will say 'This is bad, where are you taking me?' Everything can hear this except humans. If we could hear it, we would faint.

title: Caring for the Deceased
content: The Prophet (ﷺ) said: When a person dies, hurry up to wash and prepare their body. If they were good people, you're helping them reach a better place. And if they weren't good, you're stopping something bad from happening in your own lives.

title: What the Deceased Says
content: The Prophet (ﷺ) said, 'When a funeral is ready to be carried, if it was a good person, it will say,

title: Funeral Prayer for Najashi
content: Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) led a funeral prayer. I was in the second or third row of people praying with him.

title: Prophet's Prayer after An-Najashi
content: Abu Huraira said the Prophet told his friends that An-Najashi had passed away. The Prophet (ﷺ) then led a prayer, and people stood behind him in lines. During the prayer, he said 'Allahu Akbar' four times.

title: Prophet's Visit to a Grave
content: Ash-Shu`bi said he was told by Ibn `Abbas that the Prophet went to a grave alone, made people stand in rows and said 'Allahu Akbar' four times.

title: Prophet's Funeral Prayer
content: Jabir bin Abdullah said: The Prophet (ﷺ) told us to come and offer a funeral prayer for a good man from Ethiopia who had died. We lined up in rows, and the Prophet led the prayer. I was in the second row.

title: Prophet's Reaction to a Secret Burial
content: One day, the Prophet passed by a grave of someone who had been buried at night. He asked when it happened and was told 'yesterday'. He said, 'Why didn't you tell me?' They explained they didn't want to wake him up. The Prophet (ﷺ) stood up and led us in a funeral prayer.

title: Praying near a grave
content: One of the Prophet's companions said that when they passed by a grave, the Prophet led them in prayer. He was asked who told him this and he replied it was Ibn Abbas.

title: Reward for Walking with a Funeral
content: Ibn `Umar was told that Abu Huraira said, 'If you walk with the funeral procession, you'll get a reward.' Ibn `Umar thought this reward was too big. Aisha agreed with Abu Huraira and said she heard the Prophet say something similar. Ibn `Umar said they had lost many rewards like this.

title: Reward for Accompanying a Funeral
content: Ibn Umar was told that Abu Huraira said, 'If you walk with a funeral procession, you'll get a reward.' Ibn Umar thought this was too much. Aisha confirmed what Abu Huraira said, saying she heard the Prophet say something similar. Ibn Umar replied, 'We've lost many rewards like this'.

title: Reward for Attending Funerals
content: The Prophet (ﷺ) said: If you attend a funeral and pray for the person who has died, you will get a reward. If you stay with the body until it's buried, your reward is even greater.

title: The Prophet Visits a Grave
content: Ibn `Abbas said that the Prophet came to a grave. The people told him it was buried recently. He led us in prayer for the person who died.

title: Prophet's Advice on Death
content: The Prophet (ﷺ) heard that the King of Ethiopia had died. He told Abu Huraira to ask Allah for forgiveness for his brother, who was the king. The Prophet (ﷺ) then led them in prayer at a special meeting place.

title: Death of An-Najashi
content: Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) heard about the death of King An-Najashi. He told Abu Huraira to ask Allah for forgiveness for his brother, who had passed away. The Prophet (ﷺ) then led a prayer at the Musalla, saying 'Allahu Akbar' four times.

title: Stoning for Adultery
content: A Jew brought a man and woman to the Prophet. They had committed adultery. The Prophet (ﷺ) ordered them to be stoned near the mosque where people pray for funerals.

title: Prophet's Warning Against Idolatry
content: The Prophet (ﷺ) said when he was ill: 'God curses the Jews and Christians for turning their Prophets' graves into places to pray.' Aisha, his wife, thought that if this didn't happen, people might start praying at his grave too.

title: Funeral Prayer for a Newborn
content: I led the prayer for a woman who died during childbirth. The Prophet (ﷺ) stood up in the middle of her coffin.

title: Funeral Prayer Behind Prophet
content: I led a funeral prayer for a woman who died during childbirth. The Prophet (ﷺ) stood behind the coffin, not at one end or the other, but in the middle.

title: Funeral Prayer for Najashi
content: Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) learned that a man named An-Najashi had died. He took us to the Musalla and we stood in rows. The Prophet (ﷺ) said four times 'Allahu Akbar' (God is great) as part of the funeral prayer.

title: Funeral Prayer for Najashi
content: Jabir narrated that the Prophet offered a funeral prayer for As-Hama An-Najash and said 'Allahu Akbar' four times.

title: Funeral Prayer with Ibn Abbas
content: Talha bin Abdullah prayed behind Ibn Abbas at a funeral. Ibn Abbas recited Al-Fatiha and said it's the way Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) taught us to pray during funerals.

title: Praying near a grave
content: Sulaiman Ash-Shaibani heard Ash-Shu`bi say that he was told by someone who traveled with the Prophet. This person said they prayed behind the Prophet when he led them in prayer at a grave separate from others.

title: The Prophet's Respect for a Servant
content: Abu Huraira said that a black man or woman used to clean the Mosque. When they died, the Prophet didn't know about it. Later, he asked what had happened and was told they had passed away. He was upset because no one had informed him. They explained that people thought him insignificant. The Prophet (ﷺ) then went to his grave and said a prayer for him.

title: What Happens in the Grave
content: When a person dies, two angels come to them. They ask what the person thought of Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ). The person says they believed he was Allah's slave and messenger. Then the angels tell them they have been given a place in Paradise instead of Hell. A non-believer or hypocrite will say they don't know what to say because that's what others said. But it won't help them, and they'll be hit with an iron hammer between their ears.

title: Moses and the Angel of Death
content: Abu Huraira told us that the angel of death came to Moses. Moses hit him hard with his hand, injuring one of his eyes. The angel went back to Allah and said, 'You sent me to a man who doesn't want to die.' Allah healed the angel's eye and told him to go back to Moses. He was to ask Moses to put his hand on an ox's back. As many hairs as were under his hand would be the number of years he would live. The angel did this, then went back to Moses. Moses asked, 'What will happen after that?' Allah said, 'Then you will die.' Moses replied, 'Let it be now.' He asked Allah to bring him close to the Sacred Land, just a stone's throw away.

title: Prophet's Funeral Prayer
content: Ibn Abbas said that one night the Prophet asked his companions who a man was. They told him the man had been buried earlier that night. The Prophet (ﷺ) then led them in a funeral prayer for the man.

title: Prophet's Reaction to Pictures
content: When the Prophet was ill, his wives talked about a church in Ethiopia called Mariya. Um Salma and Um Habiba had visited it and described its beauty and pictures. The Prophet (ﷺ) raised his head and said that people who make places of worship at graves and put up pictures are the worst in Allah's sight.

title: Burial of the Prophet's Daughter
content: We were at a funeral for the Messenger's daughter. The Messenger sat near her grave and I saw him crying. He asked if anyone had not slept with their wife that night. Abu Talha said he hadn't, so the Messenger told him to get down into the grave with his wife. Abu Talha did this.

title: Burial of Uhud Martyrs
content: Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) took two martyrs from the Battle of Uhud. He wrapped them in one cloth and asked which one knew more Quran. The one who did was buried first. Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) said, 'I will be a witness for you on Judgment Day.' They were buried with their blood still on their bodies and no washing or funeral prayer was performed.

title: Prophet's Words After Uhud
content: The Prophet (ﷺ) went to a funeral and prayed. He then stood on the pulpit and said: 'I will show you the right path, just like my predecessors did. I can see a special spring now, and I have been given keys to all the world's treasures. I'm not worried that you'll worship other gods after I'm gone, but I'm afraid you might fight over worldly things.'

title: Burial of Martyrs at Uhud
content: Jabir bin Abdullah said that the Prophet buried two martyrs from Uhud in one grave.

title: Burying Martyrs with Their Blood
content: The Prophet (ﷺ) said to bury martyrs in the ground with their blood. This was on the day of the Battle of Uhud, and he did not wash them first.

title: Burial of Uhud Martyrs
content: Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) wrapped two martyrs in one cloth. He asked which one knew more Quran. The one who knew more was buried first. Then he would say, 'I'm a witness for these.' They were buried with blood on their bodies. No funeral prayer or washing was done.

title: Burial of Uhud Martyrs
content: Jabir bin Abdullah said: The Prophet (ﷺ) wrapped two martyrs from the battle of Uhud in one cloth. He would ask which one knew more of the Quran. When he found out, he would put that person first in the grave. Then he would say, 'I am a witness to these.' He ordered them to be buried with blood on their bodies. The Prophet (ﷺ) did not pray for them or wash their bodies.

title: Mecca's Sacred Status
content: The Prophet (ﷺ) said that Mecca was already a sacred place before he came and will be after him. He allowed fighting there for a short time, but only with permission to do things like picking up fallen objects or cutting trees. Al-Abbas asked if it was okay to cut Idhkhir plants for goldsmiths and graves, and the Prophet agreed. Abu Huraira also said that it's okay to use Idhkhir for goldsmiths and houses.

title: The Prophet Visits a Hypocrite
content: Jabir bin Abdullah said that the Prophet came to visit Abdullah bin Ubai after he had died. He was taken out of his grave and placed on his knees. The Prophet (ﷺ) spat some saliva on him and put one of his own shirts on him.

title: Jabir's Father Warns Him
content: My father called me at night before the Battle of Uhud. He said he thought he would be the first to die in battle. He told me that after him, I was the most important person to him, except for the Prophet. He also reminded me to pay off his debts and to treat my sisters kindly. The next morning, he was killed in the battle. Six months later, I dug him up from where he was buried with another man. His body had not decayed much, except near one ear.

title: Jabir's Father's Burial
content: Jabir said: A man was buried with my father. I didn't like this, so I dug up my father and gave him a separate grave to be buried in.

title: Burial of Martyrs at Uhud
content: Jabir bin Abdullah said the Prophet collected two martyrs from Uhud and asked which one knew more Quran. He put the one with more knowledge first in their grave. The Prophet (ﷺ) said he would be a witness for them on Judgment Day. They were buried with their blood still on their bodies, without being washed.

title: The Prophet Meets a Boy
content: Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) went with Umar to meet a boy named Ibn Saiyad. They found him playing near some hills. The Prophet (ﷺ) asked the boy if he believed that Muhammad (ﷺ) was Allah's Messenger (ﷺ). The boy said he thought Muhammad (ﷺ) was a messenger for people who couldn't read or write. Then the Prophet asked the boy if he thought he, Ibn Saiyad, was a messenger from Allah. The Prophet (ﷺ) said no, and explained that he only believes in Allah and His messengers. Umar wanted to kill the boy because he might be the Antichrist, but the Prophet stopped him. Later, the Prophet visited the boy again with another man, Ubai bin Ka'b. This time, the boy was lying under a sheet, talking quietly. The Prophet (ﷺ) didn't want to wake him up, so he hid behind some palm trees. When the boy's mother saw the Prophet, she told her son that Muhammad (ﷺ) had come. The boy got up and the Prophet said that if his mother hadn't disturbed him, the boy would have revealed who he really was.

title: The Prophet meets a boy
content: Ibn `Umar said: One day the Prophet went with some people to meet a boy named Ibn Saiyad. They found him playing near some hills. The Prophet (ﷺ) gently touched his shoulder and asked, 'Do you believe I am Allah's Messenger (ﷺ)?' Ibn Saiyad replied, 'You are a messenger for those who can't read.' Then he asked the Prophet if he believed he was a messenger from Allah. The Prophet (ﷺ) said no. He told Ibn Saiyad that some people visit him as true believers and others as liars. The Prophet (ﷺ) said this confused Ibn Saiyad. He then asked Ibn Saiyad to guess what the Prophet had been thinking about him. Ibn Saiyad replied, 'The smoke.' The Prophet (ﷺ) said, 'You will be ashamed of this idea.' Umar wanted to kill Ibn Saiyad but the Prophet stopped him. If Ibn Saiyad was the Antichrist, they couldn't defeat him. And if he wasn't, there's no need to harm him. Later, the Prophet went back with Ubai bin Ka'b to visit Ibn Saiyad again. He wanted to hear what Ibn Saiyad would say before seeing him. The Prophet (ﷺ) saw Ibn Saiyad lying under a sheet and heard his murmurs. His mother told Ibn Saiyad that the Prophet was there. When he got up, the Prophet said that if she hadn't disturbed him, Ibn Saiyad might have revealed more about himself.

title: The Prophet Visits a Sick Boy
content: A young Jewish boy was serving the Prophet. He got sick and the Prophet went to visit him. The Prophet (ﷺ) sat by his head and asked the boy to become Muslim. The boy looked at his father, who told him to obey the Prophet. So the boy became Muslim. When he left, the Prophet said: 'Praise Allah for saving this boy from Hell-fire'.

title: Ibn Abbas' Family Struggles
content: My mom and I were poor. I was a child, and she was a woman who needed help.

title: Funeral Prayer for Every Child
content: The Prophet (ﷺ) said that every child is born with the true faith of Islam. If a child cries after birth, their parents should offer a funeral prayer, even if they are not Muslim. This applies to all children, including those born to non-Muslim parents. The only exception is if the child was stillborn.

title: Children Born with True Faith
content: Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) said: Every child is born with the natural instinct to worship only Allah. But parents often teach them to follow other religions, just like a newborn animal is complete and not damaged. The Quran says that humans are created to worship Allah alone, and this is the true path of Islam.

title: Abu Talib's Last Moments
content: When Abu Talib was close to death, the Prophet went to visit him. He found Abu Jahl and Abdullah bin Abi Umaiya with him. The Prophet (ﷺ) said to Abu Talib, 'Uncle, say: There is no god but Allah.' But Abu Jahl and Abdullah disagreed, saying, 'Abu Talib, are you going to leave the family's old faith?' They kept arguing until Abu Talib refused to say 'There is no god but Allah'. The Prophet (ﷺ) said he would ask Allah to forgive him unless told not to. Later, Allah revealed a verse that stopped the Prophet from praying for forgiveness for non-believers.

title: Torture in the Grave
content: The Prophet (ﷺ) saw two graves where people were being punished. He said they were being tortured for small things: one person didn't clean himself properly, and the other spread lies between friends. The Prophet (ﷺ) took a date palm leaf, split it into two pieces, and put one on each grave. He hoped this would reduce their punishment until the leaves dried out.

title: Predestination and Good Deeds
content: Ali was with a group of people walking behind a funeral in Baqi-I-Gharqad. The Prophet (ﷺ) joined them and sat down, surrounded by the others. He had a small stick in his hand and started scraping the ground with it. Then he said: 'Each person has a place in either heaven or hell, and it's decided whether they'll be happy or unhappy.' A man asked, 'Should we just follow what's written for us? If someone is lucky, they'll do good things, and if they're unlucky, they'll do bad things?' The Prophet (ﷺ) replied: 'Good deeds are easy for those who are lucky, and bad deeds are easy for those who are unlucky.' He then read a verse from the Quran: 'Those who give charity and are careful about Allah will be rewarded well by Allah'.

title: Falsely Swearing by Other Religions
content: The Prophet (ﷺ) said: If someone swears falsely saying they are a Jew or Christian, then that's what they really are. And if someone kills themselves with a metal object, they'll be punished in the same way in Hell. A man who killed himself was not allowed into Paradise because he had rushed to his own death.

title: Falsely Swearing by Other Religions
content: The Prophet (ﷺ) said that if someone intentionally swears falsely by saying they are a Jew or another non-Muslim religion, then they become what they claimed. If someone uses an iron object to harm themselves and dies, they will be punished with the same iron in Hell. The Prophet (ﷺ) also said that Allah forbids Paradise for anyone who harms themselves quickly.

title: Suicide is a Sin
content: The Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) said that if someone kills themselves by strangling or stabbing, they will keep doing the same actions in Hell forever. They will be stuck in this cycle of harm to themselves.

title: Abdullah bin Ubai's Funeral Prayer
content: When Abdullah bin Ubai died, the Prophet was asked to lead his funeral prayer. I, Umar, stood up and started telling the Prophet about all the bad things Abdullah had said. The Prophet (ﷺ) smiled and told me to leave him alone. He said he had been given a choice and chose to pray anyway. If he knew asking for forgiveness would forgive Abdullah's sins, he would have done that instead. After the prayer, two verses from Surah Bara' were revealed, saying not to pray for those who rebel against Islam.

title: Paradise or Hell is Decided
content: The Prophet (ﷺ) saw two funeral processions go by. People praised the first person and spoke badly of the second. The Prophet (ﷺ) said, 'It has been decided for both.' Umar asked what was meant. The Prophet (ﷺ) replied that praising someone means Paradise is theirs, and speaking badly of someone means Hell is theirs. He added that people are witnesses on earth for Allah.

title: Umar's Rule on Paradise
content: Abu Al-Aswad came to Medina when there was an epidemic. He sat with Umar bin Al-Khattab, who saw three funeral processions pass by. People praised the first two deceased and spoke badly of the third one. Umar said that it's been confirmed for each of them. Abu Al-Aswad asked what he meant. Umar explained that if four people say a Muslim is good, Allah will give him Paradise. They asked about three people testifying, and Umar said yes. Then they asked about two people, and Umar said yes too.

title: What Happens in the Grave
content: When a faithful person dies and is buried, angels come to their grave. The person says 'There's no god but Allah' and 'Muhammad (ﷺ) is Allah's Messenger (ﷺ)'. This is what Allah says: He will keep those who believe strong.

title: The Prophet's Visit to Badr
content: Ibn Umar said the Prophet looked at the people who were killed in the Battle of Badr. He asked if they had found what Allah promised them. Someone told him that he was talking to dead people, but the Prophet said they could not reply even if you heard better than them.

title: The Prophet's Words Come True
content: Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) said to his wife Aisha: 'Now people understand that what I was telling them was true. Allah says, 'You can't make the dead hear or benefit from it, and you can't make deaf people listen.'

title: Punishment in the Grave
content: `Aisha asked the Prophet about punishment in the grave. He said it's real. After that, he always prayed to be safe from it.

title: Trial in the Grave
content: Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) stood up and gave a sermon. He talked about what will happen to people when they die. The Muslims got excited and started shouting loudly.

title: What Happens in the Grave
content: When someone dies and is buried, two angels come to them. They ask what they thought of the Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ). A good person will say he was a slave of Allah and His Messenger. The angels then show him his place in Paradise instead of Hell Fire. He can see both places. If someone was not honest or did not believe, they will be asked the same question. But if they said what others said without thinking, they will be hit with iron hammers and everyone near them will hear their cry.

title: Prophet's Warning to the Jews
content: Abu Aiyub said that one day after sunset, the Prophet went out and heard a loud noise. He said, 'The Jews are being punished in their graves.'

title: Seeking Refuge from Grave Punishment
content: The Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) asked Allah to protect him from being punished in the grave.

title: Seeking Refuge from Harm
content: Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) used to say: 'I seek your protection, Allah. Protect me from the punishment in the grave and from the fire of Hell. Keep me safe from troubles during life and death, and from the harm caused by Al-Masih Ad-Dajjal.'

title: Punishment for Small Sins
content: The Prophet (ﷺ) saw two graves and said the people inside were being punished. He explained that one person was spreading false information, and the other wasn't taking care of his body by not urinating in a proper place. To help them, he put a piece of palm leaf on each grave and said their punishment would be reduced until the leaves dried out.

title: Death and the Afterlife
content: When someone dies, they are shown their place in life twice a day. If it's good, they see Paradise. If it's bad, they see Hellfire. Then they're told, 'This is where you'll stay until Judgment Day'.

title: What the Deceased Says
content: When a funeral is ready to be buried and people carry it on their shoulders, if the person who died was good, they will say 'Keep going.' If they were not good, they will say 'This is terrible! Where are you taking me?' People can hear them, but only animals can hear their voices. If humans heard them, they would fall down.

title: Paradise for Parents
content: The Prophet (ﷺ) said: If a Muslim's three children die before they reach puberty, Allah will forgive them because of His mercy to them.

title: Paradise Has a Nurse
content: Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) said that Ibrahim, his son, will have a nurse in Paradise when he dies.

title: Children of Pagans
content: Ibn Abbas asked the Prophet about children born to people who didn't believe in Allah. The Prophet (ﷺ) said that since Allah created them, He knows what kind of actions they would have done if they had lived.

title: Prophet's Answer About Pagans
content: Abu Huraira asked the Prophet about the children of people who don't believe in one God. The Prophet (ﷺ) said, 'Allah knows what kind of actions they would have done.'

title: Child's Natural Faith
content: The Prophet (ﷺ) said: A child is born with a natural faith in Islam. Their parents then teach them to worship other gods, just like an animal gives birth to a healthy baby that isn't damaged.

title: Prophet's Dream Interpretation
content: The Prophet (ﷺ) asked his companions if anyone had a dream after the morning prayer. One day, he said he had seen two men take him to Jerusalem. They showed him three scenes: one man's cheek being torn off for lying, another man's head being crushed for not following the Quran, and people in a hole like an oven who were committing adultery. He also saw people in a river of blood who were dealing with usury. The Prophet (ﷺ) was then taken to a garden where he met Abraham and his children. Two angels, Gabriel and Michael, explained each scene: lying would lead to punishment on the Day of Resurrection, not following the Quran would have similar consequences, adultery and usury are sins, and the two houses represented believers and martyrs.

title: Abu Bakr's Final Moments
content: Aisha visited Abu Bakr when he was ill. He asked her about the Prophet's shroud and burial day. She told him it was three white pieces of cloth, no shirt or turban. He asked what day it was; she said Monday. He hoped to die between morning and night. He looked at his worn-out garment with saffron stains and ordered Aisha to wash it, add two more clothes, and use them for his shroud. She said the old one was worn out, but he replied that a living person needs new clothes more than a dead one. The body's pus is what needs covering. Abu Bakr died on Tuesday night and was buried before morning.

title: Giving Alms for a Dead Mother
content: A man asked the Prophet if giving alms on behalf of his mother would still be rewarded. The Prophet (ﷺ) said yes, it will be rewarded.

title: Allah's Messenger's Final Moments
content: When Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) was ill, he kept asking 'Where am I now? Where will I be tomorrow?' Aisha was waiting for her turn to care for him. When it was her time, Allah took his soul while she held him in her arms and chest. He was buried in their home.

title: Prophet's Warning about Graves
content: When he was ill, the Prophet said that Allah curses Jews and Christians for building places of worship on graves of their prophets. He didn't want his own grave to be made special, so it wouldn't be used as a place for people to pray.

title: Umar's Final Words
content: `Amr bin Maimun saw `Umar being stabbed. He asked `Abdullah bin `Umar to tell Aisha that he sends his greetings and wants to be buried with the other companions. Aisha agreed, but said she had thought of keeping this place for herself. When `Umar learned this, he told `Abdullah to ask Aisha if she would allow him to be buried there when he dies. He also asked her to pay her respects to him and his family. If she agrees, bury me here. If not, take me to the Muslim graveyard. I think anyone who was happy with Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) is suitable for the caliphate. Whoever you choose after me, listen to them and obey them. `Umar mentioned some names, including `Uthman, `Ali, Talha, Az-Zubair, `Abdur-Rahman bin `Auf, and Sa`d bin Abi Waqqas. A young Ansari man came in and said that Allah is pleased with `Umar's actions as a leader. He was given glad tidings of martyrdom. `Umar replied, 'I wish all my good deeds would cancel out my bad ones. I recommend my successor to be kind to the early Muslims who left their homes for Islam, to protect their honor and belongings. Be fair to the Ansar, who were already in Medina when we arrived. Treat them well and accept their good actions.' `Umar also said to follow rules with non-Muslims, keep their contracts, fight for them, and don't overburden them.

title: Respect the Dead
content: Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) said: 'Don't speak badly about someone who has died. They've reached their final destination based on what they did in life.'

title: Abu Lahab's Curse
content: Ibn Abbas said that Abu Lahab once said to the Prophet: 'You will all be cursed.' Then Allah revealed a verse saying: 'Cursed are the hands of Abu Lahab. He is also cursed'.

title: Mu'adh's Mission to Yemen
content: The Prophet (ﷺ) sent Mu'adh to Yemen. He told Mu'adh to invite people to say that only Allah is worthy of worship, and he is Allah's Messenger (ﷺ). If they agree, teach them to pray five times a day and night. And if they agree again, tell them to give some money from their wealth to the poor.

title: Enter Paradise Easily
content: A man asked the Prophet what he could do to enter Paradise. The Prophet (ﷺ) said: 'Worship Allah alone, pray regularly, give Zakat (charity), and be kind to your family.'

title: Paradise for a Bedouin
content: A man came to the Prophet and asked what he could do to enter Paradise. The Prophet (ﷺ) said: 'Worship Allah alone, pray five times a day, give some money to those in need, and fast during Ramadan.' The man promised to do these things. When he left, the Prophet pointed to him and said: 'If you want to see someone from Paradise, look at this man'.

title: Prophet's Advice to Delegation
content: A group from the tribe of Abdul Qais visited the Prophet. They said they couldn't visit him often because another tribe, Mudar, was in between them. The Prophet (ﷺ) told them to do four things: believe only in Allah, pray regularly, give charity, and share one-fifth of any war spoils with the poor. He also asked them not to use certain cups for making drinks that might be haram.

title: Abu Bakr's Decision to Fight
content: When the Prophet passed away and Abu Bakr became leader, some Arabs stopped following Islam. 'Umar told Abu Bakr that he shouldn't fight them because the Prophet said: 'Fight people until they say there is no god but Allah.' Abu Bakr disagreed and decided to fight those who didn't pay their Zakat (a required charity). He said he'd even fight for a small goat if they refused to give it. 'Umar thought this was a good decision and that Allah had guided Abu Bakr.

title: Abu Bakr Decides to Fight
content: When the Prophet passed away and Abu Bakr became leader, some Arabs stopped following Islam. Umar asked Abu Bakr why he wanted to fight them, reminding him of a message from the Prophet: 'Fight people until they say there's no god but Allah.' Abu Bakr replied that he'd fight those who don't pay their required charity (Zakat) and taxes. He said if they refused to give even a small amount of money, he'd fight them for withholding it. Umar agreed with Abu Bakr's decision.

title: Jarir's Pledge of Allegiance
content: I gave the Prophet a promise to pray regularly, give money to those in need, and advise other Muslims wisely.

title: Camels and Sheep on Judgement Day
content: The Prophet (ﷺ) said that on the Day of Resurrection, camels will come to their owners in good health. If the owner didn't pay Zakat (charity) for them, they would hurt him with their feet. Sheep will also come in good health if Zakat was paid. One right of animals is to be milked while water is nearby. The Prophet (ﷺ) warned that he won't help anyone who comes to him on Judgement Day carrying a sheep or camel over their neck. They'll say 'Please help me, Muhammad (ﷺ)!' but the Prophet will reply 'I can't help you because I taught you Allah's message.'

title: Wealth without Zakat
content: Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) said: If someone is given wealth by Allah and doesn't pay their Zakat, on the Day of Judgement their wealth will be like a poisonous snake. The snake will wrap around their neck and bite their cheeks, saying 'I'm your wealth.'

title: Hoarding Money is Bad
content: One day, we went out with Abdullah bin Umar. A bedouin asked him about a verse from the Quran: 'Those who keep money without giving to charity will be punished.' Abdullah said, 'If someone keeps money and doesn't pay the required charity, they'll face trouble. But these verses were revealed before we knew how much charity was needed. When Allah told us how much charity is due, He made paying it a way to purify our wealth.'

title: Zakat on Property and Animals
content: Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) said: No Zakat is needed for property worth less than five Uqiyas of silver. Also, no Zakat is due for less than five camels or less than five Wasqs of grain.

title: Abu Dhar's Disagreement
content: I met Abu Dhar in a place called Ar-Rabadha. I asked him why he was there, and he said he had been arguing with Muawiya about the Quran verse 'They who hoard up gold and silver and spend them not in the way of Allah.' Muawiya thought it only applied to people from other religions, but Abu Dhar disagreed. They argued and Muawiya complained to Uthman. Uthman told Abu Dhar to come to Medina, but when he arrived, many people acted like they didn't know him. Uthman said Abu Dhar could stay nearby if he wanted.

title: Abu Dhar's Warning to Hoarders
content: I was sitting with some people from Quraish when a man came and stood in front of us. He greeted us and said, 'Tell those who hoard wealth that they will be punished.' He said a stone would be heated and put on their breasts until it comes out through their shoulders. After saying this, he sat down by the pillar. I followed him and sat beside him. I didn't know who he was, so I asked if people disliked what he had said. He replied that they don't understand anything. When I asked who his friend was, he said, 'The Prophet (ﷺ).' I asked, 'What did the Prophet say to you?' He said, 'He told me not to love having as much gold as the mountain of Uhud unless I spend it all for Allah's cause. These people collect wealth but don't understand what's important. The Prophet (ﷺ) doesn't ask them for help or advice until he meets Allah.'

title: Abu Dhar's Conversation
content: I was sitting with some people from Quraish when a man with rough hair and clothes came in. He greeted us and warned those who hoard wealth: 'A hot stone will be put on their breasts, moving back and forth until it comes out.' The people didn't like what he said, so I followed him and sat beside him. I asked if the people had misunderstood him. He replied that his friend, the Prophet, had told him something similar. When I asked who his friend was, he said: 'The Prophet (ﷺ) once asked me about the mountain of Uhud.' I thought he wanted to send me on a task, so I answered yes. The Prophet (ﷺ) then said: 'I don't want as much gold as the mountain of Uhud unless I spend it all except for three Dinars.' He added that these people don't understand and collect wealth, but he doesn't need their advice or wealth until he meets Allah.

title: Two Types of Envy
content: Ibn Mas`ud said he heard the Prophet say: 'There's no good envy except in two cases. One, a person has wealth and uses it correctly. Two, a person is given knowledge and uses it wisely to help others.'

title: Charity from Honest Earnings
content: Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) said: If someone gives charity using money they have earned honestly, Allah will accept it. He will take the gift in His hand and make its reward bigger. It's like taking care of a young horse until it grows as big as a mountain.

title: Charity will become scarce
content: The Prophet (ﷺ) said: 'People, give charity now. A time will come when someone will walk around looking for people to help, but no one will accept it. If they had given yesterday, the person would have taken it, but today they don't need it.'

title: Wealth and the Day of Judgment
content: The Prophet (ﷺ) said, 'The Day of Judgment will not come until people have so much wealth that one person has too much and is worried. He wants to give some money as charity, but no one accepts it because they don't need it.'

title: Poverty and the Day of Judgment
content: Two people came to the Prophet. One complained about being poor, and the other said there were too many robberies. The Prophet (ﷺ) said that soon caravans would travel from Medina to Mecca without guards. He also said that before the Day of Judgment comes, a person will walk around with something to give to charity but won't find anyone to take it. On the Day of Judgment, each person will stand in front of Allah and be asked if they were given wealth and if they had a messenger. They'll look left and right and see only Hell-fire. The Prophet (ﷺ) said that even giving half a date in charity can save you from this fate. If you can't give something, say a kind word to someone.

title: Future Hard Times Ahead
content: The Prophet (ﷺ) said: 'In the future, people will have so little money that someone with a lot of gold to give as charity won't be able to find anyone who needs it. Because there will be very few men and many women, one man may even have to look after forty women.'

title: Giving Charity with Good Intentions
content: Abu Mas'ud said: When the Quran mentioned helping those in need, we used to work as porters. A man came and gave a lot of charity. People thought he was showing off. Another man gave a small amount of food. They said Allah doesn't need that little bit. Then the Quran said: 'Don't criticize people who give what they can afford. And don't criticize those who can only give a little.'

title: Giving Charity in Need
content: Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) told Abu Masud that when he ordered them to give charity, they would work as porters and earn a Mudd of grain. They would then give it away as charity. This was during hard times, but now some people have much more wealth.

title: Give Charity to Save Yourself
content: The Prophet (ﷺ) said: 'Save yourself from Hell-fire by giving even half a date in charity'.

title: Generosity to Daughters is a Shield
content: A woman with two daughters came to me asking for help. I only had one date left, so I gave it to her and she divided it between them without eating anything herself. Then the Prophet came in and I told him what happened. He said that if someone treats their children kindly when they're struggling, those children will protect them from going to Hell.

title: Charity When You're Healthy
content: A man asked the Prophet which charity is best. The Prophet (ﷺ) said: 'Give when you have money and are healthy, not when you're sick or poor. Don't delay giving until you're close to death and then try to decide who gets what.'

title: Who Will Die First?
content: Aisha's friends asked the Prophet who would die first. He said to measure their hands with a stick. Sauda had the longest hand, but later they found out that it meant helping others in need. Zainab was actually the first to die and she loved helping people.

title: Giving Charity with Good Intentions
content: The Prophet (ﷺ) said: A man wanted to give charity. He went out and gave it to a thief by mistake. The next day, people said he had given it to a thief. He said, 'Praise be to Allah.' He decided to give more charity. He did the same thing again and gave it to an adulteress by mistake. People said the same thing again. He said, 'Praise be to Allah' and gave even more charity. This time he gave it to a rich person by mistake. Again, people said he had given it to someone who didn't need help. The man said, 'Praise be to Allah.' Someone then told him that his charity might have helped the thief not steal again, the adulteress stop her bad behavior, and the rich person use their wealth for good.

title: Ma'n's Complaint to the Prophet
content: My grandfather, my father, and I promised to follow Allah's Messenger (ﷺ). He arranged for me to get married. One day, I went to see him with a problem. My father had given some gold coins to be used for charity, but he kept them in the mosque. I took the money from there and brought it back to him. He said he didn't mean to give it to me. So, I took the issue to Allah's Messenger (ﷺ). The Prophet (ﷺ) said: 'Your father will get a reward because of his good intention. Whatever you took is yours.'

title: Seven People Under God's Shade
content: The Prophet (ﷺ) said that seven people will be protected by Allah on a very hot day. They are: a fair leader, a young person who has always worshiped Allah, someone whose heart is connected to the mosque, two friends who love each other for Allah's sake, a man who says no to an attractive woman who wants him to do something wrong, a person who gives charity secretly so nobody knows how much he gave, and someone who remembers Allah alone in private and cries.

title: Give Charity Before It's Late
content: The Prophet (ﷺ) said: 'You should give to charity now because one day people will not accept it. If you offer something, they'll say,

title: Charity from a Woman's Home
content: Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) said: When a woman gives food from her home to help someone in need without wasting it, she gets a reward for what she gave. Her husband also gets a reward because he earned the money that bought the food. The person who received the food also gets a similar reward. No one's reward is reduced because of this.

title: Charity from the Wealthy
content: The Prophet (ﷺ) said that giving charity is especially good when it's done by someone who has a lot of money. He also said to start helping your family first.

title: Giving is Better Than Taking
content: The Prophet (ﷺ) said: Giving to others is better than taking from them. First, give to those who depend on you. If you're rich, the best charity is what you give after paying your own expenses. And if you don't ask people for help, Allah will provide for you and make you independent.

title: Giving is Better Than Taking
content: The Prophet (ﷺ) said: Giving to others is better than receiving. Start by helping your family and loved ones. The best charity comes from people who have extra money after their needs are met. If you don't ask for help, Allah will give you what you need and make you independent.

title: Giving is Better than Asking
content: Ibn Umar heard the Prophet on a pulpit talking about charity. He said that giving to others is better than asking for help from them. The person who gives is in a stronger position than the one who asks.

title: Prophet's Charity Distribution
content: The Prophet (ﷺ) offered the Asr prayer and then went home. He had some gold from charity that he didn't want to keep overnight, so he got it distributed immediately after returning home.

title: Prophet's Id Prayer
content: The Prophet (ﷺ) went out for the special prayer on a special day. He prayed two parts of the prayer and then walked around to the women with Bilal. He reminded them to give charity, and some women gave their jewelry.

title: Helping Those in Need
content: My father told me that when a beggar came to the Prophet or he was asked for something, he would say to his companions: 'Help this person and recommend them. You will get a reward for it.' The Prophet 's (ﷺ) words would then bring about what Allah wanted.

title: Don't Hoard Your Money
content: The Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) said to Asma: 'Do not keep your money for yourself. If you do, Allah will stop giving you blessings.' He also told Abda the same thing: 'If you hoard your money and count it, Allah will take away His blessings from you'.

title: Spend Your Money Wisely
content: Asma' bint Abu Bakr went to the Prophet and he said: 'Don't keep your money locked away. If you don't spend what you have, Allah won't give you more blessings. Spend as much as you can afford for His sake.'

title: Umar's Question about Afflictions
content: Hudhaifa said that the Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) told him that a person's wrongdoings towards their family, neighbors, and others can be forgiven by praying, giving charity, doing good deeds, and telling people to do what is right. When 'Umar asked Hudhaifa about a big affliction that would spread like waves of the sea, Hudhaifa said he didn't need to worry because there was a barrier between him and it. 'Umar asked if the barrier would be broken or opened, and Hudhaifa said it would be broken. When 'Umar asked if it would ever be closed again, Hudhaifa said yes. Later, people were too afraid to ask what the barrier meant, so they asked Masruq to ask Hudhaifa. Hudhaifa said that the barrier was actually 'Umar himself.

title: Reward for Good Deeds
content: Hakim bin Hizam asked the Prophet: 'Will I get a reward for doing good like giving to charity, freeing slaves, and being kind to family before becoming Muslim?' The Prophet (ﷺ) replied: 'You became Muslim with all those good deeds still counting.'

title: Women's Charity from Husband's Food
content: Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) said: When a woman gives some food to charity without wasting her husband's money, she gets a reward. Her husband also gets a reward for what he worked hard for, and the person who stored the food gets a reward too.

title: Honest Storekeeper is Charitable
content: The Prophet (ﷺ) said that a Muslim storekeeper who follows his boss's orders and pays the correct amount with kindness, is considered one of two people doing good deeds.

title: Charity from Husband's House
content: The Prophet (ﷺ) said that if a woman gives charity using her husband's money without wasting it, she and her husband will both get a reward. She gets a reward for giving, and he gets one because his earnings paid for the gift.

title: Charity from Home Meals
content: The Prophet (ﷺ) said: When a woman gives food from her home for Allah's cause without using her husband's money, she gets a reward. Her husband also gets a reward because of his work and the person who stores the food gets a reward too.

title: Two Angels Visit Daily
content: Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) said: Two angels come to us every day. One says, 'O Allah, reward those who give in charity.' The other angel says, 'O Allah, punish those who are stingy and don't want to share with others.'

title: Miser and Almsgiver Compared
content: The Prophet (ﷺ) said that a miser and an almsgiver are like two people wearing heavy iron cloaks. When the almsgiver wants to give charity, their cloak gets bigger and covers them completely. But when a miser tries to spend money, their cloak stays tight and doesn't get any wider.

title: Giving in Charity
content: The Prophet (ﷺ) said that every Muslim must give charity. When asked what to do if someone has no money, he replied: 'Work and earn something, then give some of it away.' If they can't work, help those who need it. And if they can't even do that, be good and avoid bad actions - this is also a kind of charity.

title: Prophet's Response to Charity
content: Um 'Atiyya said a sheep was sent to her as charity. She gave some of it to Aisha, who then had nothing left to eat. The Prophet (ﷺ) asked Aisha for food and she told him about the sheep. He said, 'Bring it in, it has arrived.'

title: Zakat on Camels and Silver
content: Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) said: There is no Zakat for less than five camels. Also, there is no Zakat for less than five Awaq of silver (22 Fransa Riyals of Yemen or 200 Dirhams). And there is no Zakat for less than five Awsuq of food-grains. For gold, there is no Zakat for less than 12 Guinea English. For silver, there is no Zakat for less than 22 Fransa Riyals of Yemen.

title: Zakat for a Young Camel
content: Abu Bakr wrote to me about Zakat. If someone has to give a one-year-old she-camel as charity, but they only have a two-year-old she-camel instead, it's okay. The collector of charity will take the two-year-old camel and return 20 Dirhams or two sheep to them. If someone doesn't have a one-year-old she-camel, but has a two-year-old he-camel, they can give that as charity too, but they won't get anything back.

title: Women's Charity on Eid
content: Ibn Abbas said: The Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) led the prayer for Eid. Then he went to the women and told Bilal to help him. He asked them to give in charity, so they took off their jewelry like earrings and necklaces.

title: Zakat Payments Explained
content: Abu Bakr wrote to me about what the Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) taught. He said that when paying Zakat, we should not mix money from different people together. We also shouldn't split shared property just because of Zakat.

title: Zakat for Shared Property
content: Abu Bakr wrote to me about what the Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) taught. If two people own a property together, they should pay the Zakat together and it will be considered that both of them have paid their share.

title: Emigration and Good Deeds
content: A Bedouin asked the Prophet about moving to a new place. The Prophet (ﷺ) said it's hard work. He asked if the Bedouin had camels and paid their tax. The Bedouin said yes, so the Prophet told him: 'Work far away from home, and Allah will not waste any of your good actions.'

title: Zakat Rules for Camels
content: Abu Bakr wrote to me about Zakat. If someone has to pay for a four-year-old camel but doesn't have one, they can give a three-year-old camel and two sheep or twenty Dirhams instead. If they don't have a three-year-old camel but do have a four-year-old one, the collector will take it and give them twenty Dirhams or two sheep back. The same rules apply for other types of camels: if someone has to pay for a three-year-old camel but doesn't have one, they can give a two-year-old camel with two sheep or twenty Dirhams; and if they don't have a two-year-old camel but do have a three-year-old one, the collector will take it and give them twenty Dirhams or two sheep back. If someone has to pay for a two-year-old camel but doesn't have one, they can give a one-year-old camel with twenty Dirhams.

title: Zakat Rules for Muslims
content: Abu Bakr wrote to me: When collecting Zakat, follow these rules. If someone asks you for more than what's written here, don't pay it. For 24 or fewer camels, give one sheep as Zakat. For every five extra camels, add another sheep. If you have between 25 and 35 camels, give a Bint Makhad. Between 36 and 45 camels, give a Bint Labun. Between 46 and 60 camels, give a Hiqqa. Between 61 and 75 camels, give a Jadha. Over 76 camels, give two Bint Labuns for every 40 extra camels. For sheep, if you have between 40 and 120, give one sheep as Zakat. If you have more than 120 sheep, give two sheep for the first 100, then one sheep for each extra 100. If you have less than 40 sheep, don't pay Zakat, but can choose to give something. For silver, if it's worth over 200 Dirhams, give 2.5% as Zakat.

title: Zakat: Choosing Animals
content: Abu Bakr wrote to me about what Allah said. The Prophet 's (ﷺ) rule is that you can't take an old or damaged animal, or a male goat, as Zakat unless the collector wants it.

title: Abu Bakr's Decision to Fight
content: Abu Bakr said he would fight people if they didn't pay him the Zakat money. He wanted even a small goat that was paid during the Prophet Muhammad 's (ﷺ) lifetime. Umar agreed with Abu Bakr and thought it was Allah's will.

title: Abu Bakr's Decision to Fight
content: Abu Bakr said he would fight for Zakat if people didn't pay it. He wanted even a small goat that was paid during the Prophet's time. Umar thought Allah helped Abu Bakr make this decision and knew it was right.

title: Mu'adh's Mission to Yemen
content: When Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) sent Mu'adh to Yemen, he said: 'You're going to people who already know about God. First, invite them to worship only God. When they understand that, tell them to pray five times a day and night. If they start praying, remind them to give Zakat - take some money from the rich and give it to the poor. If they follow these rules, take their Zakat but don't take their best belongings as payment.'

title: Zakat Rules for Wealth
content: Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) said: You don't have to pay Zakat on less than five units of dates. You also don't have to pay Zakat on less than five units of silver or five camels.

title: Paying Zakat is Important
content: Abu Dhar visited the Prophet. The Prophet (ﷺ) said: 'Whoever owns animals like camels or cows and doesn't give them their due Zakat, those animals will be bigger and fatter on the Day of Resurrection. They'll hurt him with their hooves and horns. They'll keep coming back to punish him until Allah finishes judging people.'

title: Abu Talha Donates a Garden
content: Anas bin Malik said that Abu Talha had many date-palm gardens in Medina. He loved one garden called Bairuha, which was near the Prophet's Mosque. The Prophet (ﷺ) used to visit and drink from it. When the Quran said 'You won't be good unless you give something you love', Abu Talha offered his beloved garden for charity. He asked the Prophet what to do with it. The Prophet (ﷺ) suggested giving it to his relatives and cousins.

title: Women's Role in Charity
content: One day, the Prophet went to a special place for prayer. After praying, he gave a speech and told people to give money to help others. He said, 'Give alms.' Then he went to the women and said, 'You should also give alms, because I have seen that most of those who go to Hell are women.' The women asked why this was so. The Prophet (ﷺ) replied, 'Women often complain and don't show gratitude to their husbands. You are not as smart or good at following rules as men. Some of you can even trick wise men into doing wrong things.' After he left, a woman named Zainab came to the Prophet's house. She said she had wanted to give some jewelry as charity, but her husband Ibn Mas'ud thought it was more important for him and their children. The Prophet (ﷺ) agreed with Ibn Mas'ud, saying that they deserved it more than anyone else.

title: No Zakat on Horses and Slaves
content: Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) said: There is no charity tax on a horse or a slave that belongs to a Muslim.

title: No Zakat for Slaves and Horses
content: The Prophet (ﷺ) said: There is no charity to pay on a Muslim's slave or horse.

title: Pleasures of the World
content: The Prophet (ﷺ) sat on a pulpit and we were around him. He said, 'I'm worried about you being tempted by wealth and its beauty.' Someone asked, 'Can good things lead to bad?' The Prophet (ﷺ) was quiet for a moment. Then he wiped his sweat and said, 'Good never leads to evil. Wealth is like food near water that can be poisonous or make animals sick. But if an animal eats some, feels the sun, then goes again, it's okay. Wealth is good when shared with the poor and needy. If you take it unfairly, your wealth will accuse you on Judgment Day.'

title: Zainab's Question about Zakat
content: Zainab was in the mosque when she heard the Prophet say to women, 'Give charity even from your jewelry.' She asked her husband Abdullah if it would be okay to use some of the zakat money for him and the orphans she took care of. He said she should ask the Prophet herself. Zainab went to the Prophet with another woman who had a similar problem. They asked Bilal to ask the Prophet about their situation, but not to tell him they sent them. The Prophet (ﷺ) asked who these women were, and when he found out it was Zainab, he said yes, it's okay for her to use zakat money for her husband and orphans. He even said she would get a double reward: one for helping family members and another for giving charity.

title: Spending on Other People's Children
content: Zainab's mother asked the Prophet if she would get a reward for spending money to feed Abu Salama's children, who were also her grandchildren. The Prophet (ﷺ) said, 'Yes, you will get a reward for what you spend on them'.

title: Refusal to Give Zakat
content: Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) ordered a person to collect charity. The person came back and said that Ibn Jamil, Khalid bin Al-Walid, and Abbas bin Abdul Muttalib refused to give it. Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) said that Ibn Jamil was poor but made rich by Allah's blessing. He should have given charity. Khalid kept his armor for fighting in the cause of Allah, so he shouldn't be asked. But Abbas, who is the Prophet's uncle, must pay double charity.

title: Contentment through Patience
content: Some Ansari people asked the Prophet for help. He gave them what he had. They kept asking until there was nothing left. The Prophet (ﷺ) said, 'If I still had something, I wouldn't keep it to myself.' He taught that if you don't ask others for things, Allah will make you happy with what you have. If you try to be independent, Allah will help you become self-sufficient. And if you're patient, Allah will give you patience.

title: Earn Your Living Honestly
content: Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) said, 'It's better for you to get a rope and cut wood from the forest. Carry it on your back and sell it. Don't ask someone for help, in case they refuse.'

title: Sell Wood, Save Your Face
content: The Prophet (ﷺ) said: It's better to cut wood and carry it on your back to sell. Allah will forgive you because of this. Instead of asking others for help, which they might not give.

title: Hakim's Gift of Charity
content: Hakim bin Hizam asked the Prophet for help three times. The Prophet (ﷺ) said that charity is like a sweet fruit: if you take it without being greedy, you'll be happy with it. If you take it greedily, you won't be happy and will always want more. The Prophet (ﷺ) said the hand that gives is better than the hand that receives. Hakim promised the Prophet he would never accept anything from anyone else again. When Abu Bakr and then `Umar asked him to take his share of war booty, he refused both times.

title: Giving to the Needy
content: Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) would give me things. I'd say, 'Give it to someone poorer than me.' He said, 'Take it if you're given something without asking or wanting more. If not, don't go looking for it.'

title: Asking for Help on Judgment Day
content: The Prophet (ﷺ) said that a man who keeps asking others for things will come to the Day of Resurrection with no good deeds on his face. On that day, people will be sweating so much that their sweat will reach up to their ears. They'll ask Adam for help, then Moses, and finally Muhammad (ﷺ). Muhammad (ﷺ) will pray to Allah to judge between them fairly. He'll go as far as holding the door handle of Paradise and then Allah will give him a special position. Everyone present will praise Allah.

title: Asking for Help on Judgement Day
content: The Prophet (ﷺ) said: A person keeps asking others for help until they come to the Day of Resurrection with no good deeds on their face. On that day, the sun will be very close and everyone will sweat a lot. They'll ask Adam for help, then Moses, and finally Muhammad (ﷺ). He'll pray to Allah to judge between them and lead them to Paradise. When he reaches the door, Allah will give him special permission to help others.

title: Who is a Poor Person
content: The Prophet (ﷺ) said that a person is not poor just because they ask for food from others. A person is truly poor when they have nothing and are too ashamed to ask for help.

title: Three Things Allah Hates
content: Al-Mughira bin Shu'ba said the Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) said: Allah dislikes three things in us. We should not talk too much about useless things or gossip about others. We should also be careful with our money and not waste it. And we should only ask questions when we really need to know something, not just out of curiosity.

title: Leaving out a Muslim
content: Sa'd bin Abi Waqqas was with the Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) when he gave some money to a group of people. Sa'd saw a man who seemed like a good person, but the Prophet didn't give him any money. Sa'd asked the Prophet why he left this man out. The Prophet (ﷺ) said that the man might only be a Muslim, not necessarily a true believer. Sa'd kept asking because he thought the man was sincere, and the Prophet repeated his answer three times. Finally, the Prophet explained that sometimes people who are Muslims can still go to Hell if they don't follow their faith properly.

title: Who is a Poor Person
content: Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) said: A poor person is not someone who asks for food from others. It's the one who doesn't have enough money to meet his needs, and people don't know about it so they can give him charity.

title: Better to Work Than Ask
content: The Prophet (ﷺ) said: 'It's better for someone to take a rope and go to the mountains in the morning. They cut wood, sell it, eat from the money they get, and give some of that money as charity. This is better than asking others for help.'

title: Prophet's Visit to Tabuk
content: The Prophet (ﷺ) went on a journey with his companions. When they arrived at Wadi-al-Qura, he saw a woman in her garden. He asked his friends how much fruit was in the garden. They estimated it would be about 600 kilograms. The Prophet (ﷺ) said to the woman, 'Check what your garden will yield.' Later, when they reached Tabuk, the Prophet warned them that there would be strong winds at night and told those with camels to tie them up. A man didn't listen and was blown away by the wind. The King of Aila sent a gift to the Prophet - a white mule and some clothes. He also wrote to say that his people would stay in their place and pay taxes. When they returned to Wadi-al-Qura, the woman said her garden had yielded 600 kilograms, just like the Prophet estimated. Then he told his friends, 'I want to go back to Medina quickly. Anyone who wants to come with me should hurry.' When they arrived in Medina, the Prophet saw a mountain and said it was a good place. He asked his friends which family from Ansar (a group of people) was the best. They said yes, so he told them that Bani-n-Najjar and Bani Sa`ida were good families.

title: Prophet's Estimate and Journey
content: We went to battle with the Prophet. When we arrived at Wadi-al-Qura, there was a woman in her garden. The Prophet (ﷺ) asked his companions how much fruit was in the garden. He estimated it would be ten bags of food. The woman said that's exactly what she got. The Prophet (ﷺ) then wanted to leave quickly and told us to hurry up if we wanted to go with him. When he saw Medina, he said 'This is Taba.' He also said that the Ansar families of Bani-n-Najjar, Bani Sa'ida, and Bani Al-Harith are good people.

title: Zakat on Irrigated Land
content: The Prophet (ﷺ) said that if a farm gets water from rain or nearby streams, you must give one-tenth of its crops as Zakat. If the farm has a well, you must give one-twentieth.

title: Zakat Rules for Dates and Silver
content: The Prophet (ﷺ) said: You don't have to give Zakat if you have less than five Awsuq of dates, or less than five camels, or less than five Awaq of silver.

title: Muhammad's Children and Charity
content: Abu Huraira said that dates were often brought to the Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ). A big pile of them would collect in front of him. One day, his grandsons Al-Hasan and Al-Husain were playing with the dates. One of them put a date in his mouth. The Prophet (ﷺ) saw this and took the date out. He said, 'Don't you know that Muhammad 's (ﷺ) children should not eat food given to others as charity?'

title: Prophet's Rule on Selling Dates
content: The Prophet (ﷺ) said it is not allowed to sell dates until they are ripe. Someone asked what that meant and the Prophet replied, 'Until there is no risk of them rotting'.

title: Prophet's Rule on Selling Fruits
content: The Prophet (ﷺ) said that it is not allowed to sell fruits until they are ripe and healthy. This means you can't sell unripe or spoiled fruits.

title: Prophet forbids selling unripe fruits
content: Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) said that it is not allowed to sell fruits until they are fully ripe. He explained that 'fully ripe' means when they turn red.

title: Giving Charity and Taking Back
content: Umar gave a horse to help people in need. He saw it for sale later and wanted to buy it back. The Prophet (ﷺ) said, 'Don't take back what you've given away.' So Umar never bought things he'd given as charity, and if he did by mistake, he would give them away again.

title: Giving Charity to Others
content: I gave a horse to help people in need. But the person I gave it to didn't take care of it. I wanted to buy it back because I thought he would sell it cheaply. So, I asked the Prophet about what to do. He said: 'Don't try to get your money back. If you do, it's like eating something you've thrown up.'

title: Eating Charity Food
content: Abu Huraira said that Al-Hasan bin Ali took a date from charity food and put it in his mouth. The Prophet (ﷺ) told him to spit it out, saying they don't eat things given as charity.

title: Using Charity Animals Wisely
content: Ibn Abbas said the Prophet saw a dead sheep given to Maimuna's servant. He asked why they couldn't use its skin. They replied it was already dead. The Prophet (ﷺ) said only eating its meat is forbidden.

title: Barira's Freedom and Gift
content: `Aisha wanted to buy a slave-girl named Barira. She planned to set her free. But the girl's masters said that if she was freed, they would still own her. `Aisha told this to the Prophet. He said it's okay for her to buy Barira because when someone is freed, their loyalty belongs to them, not their previous owners. Later, some meat was given as charity for Barira. The Prophet (ﷺ) said that while the meat was a gift for Barira, it was also a gift for him and `Aisha.

title: Prophet visits Aisha's home
content: The Prophet (ﷺ) went to see Aisha. He asked if she had any food. She said they only had a piece of mutton that Um 'Atiyya had sent as charity. The Prophet (ﷺ) said, 'It has reached its destination and is now a gift for us.'

title: Prophet's Gift and Charity
content: Anas said the Prophet was given some meat. He had already given it to Barira as charity. The Prophet (ﷺ) said, 'This meat is still a gift for Barira, but we consider it a present from us.'

title: Inviting People to Islam
content: Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) said to Mu'adh when he sent him to Yemen: 'Invite people to say that only Allah is worthy of worship and Muhammad (ﷺ) is His messenger. If they agree, tell them to pray five times a day. If they agree with this, tell them to give some money from their rich to the poor. If they do this, don't take their best things. Be careful not to hurt someone who is being treated unfairly because Allah will hear their complaint.'

title: Blessings for Giving Charity
content: Abdullah's father went to the Prophet with some money he wanted to give as charity. The Prophet (ﷺ) said, 'God bless Abdullah's family.' A man from a Jewish tribe borrowed money from another Jew and couldn't pay it back. He put the money in a piece of wood and threw it into the sea. When the other Jew found the wood, he took it home for firewood. But when he cut the wood, he found the money inside.

title: Compensation for Accidents
content: Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) said: If someone is killed or hurt by an animal, a fall into a well, or mining work, there's no payment. But if you find treasure, take one-fifth of it.

title: Collecting Zakat and Checking Accounts
content: The Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) appointed a man named Ibn Al-Lutbiya to collect charity from the people of Bani Sulaim. When he came back, the Prophet checked his account with him.

title: People from Uraina Tribe
content: Some people from the Uraina tribe came to Medina. They didn't like the climate there. The Prophet (ﷺ) allowed them to take milk and medicine from the camels given as charity, but they killed the shepherd and took all the camels. The Prophet (ﷺ) sent men to catch them. When they were brought back, their hands and feet were cut off, and hot metal was put in their eyes. They were left in a stony area at Medina.

title: Tahnik for Abdullah
content: I took my friend Abdullah to the Prophet. He was branding camels with a hot tool. I asked him to do Tahnik for Abdullah, which means putting some date juice in his mouth. The Prophet (ﷺ) did it.

title: Zakat-ul-Fitr for All Muslims
content: Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) ordered that every Muslim, whether a slave or free person, male or female, young or old, must pay one Sa' of dates or barley as Zakat-ul-Fitr. This payment should be made before people go to the Eid prayer.

title: Zakat al-Fitr Explained
content: Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) made it compulsory for all Muslims to pay one Sa' of dates or barley as a charity before the Eid prayer, whether they are slaves or free, male or female.

title: Giving Fitr Charity
content: Abu Sa'id said: We used to give one Sa' of barley as charity for each person before Eid prayers.

title: Zakat al-Fitr Explained
content: Abu Sa'id Al-Khudri said: We used to give one Sa' of food or one Sa' of dried grapes as charity before Eid. This was a way to help those in need.

title: Zakat al-Fitr Explained
content: The Prophet (ﷺ) ordered Muslims to give one Sa' of dates or barley as charity before Eid. People thought two Mudds of wheat was equal to this amount.

title: Giving Fitr Charity
content: Abu Sa'id Al-Khudri said: When the Prophet was alive, we used to give one Sa' of food or dates or barley or dried grapes as charity before Eid. Later, when Muawiya became the leader, he decided that one Mudd of wheat is equal to two Mudds of any other item.

title: Pay Zakat Before Eid Prayer
content: The Prophet (ﷺ) told people to pay their Zakat before going to the Eid prayer.

title: Giving Food for the Poor
content: During the time of the Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ), we used to give one Sa' of food as charity. The food was usually barley, dried grapes, cheese, or dates.

title: Zakat al-Fitr Explained
content: The Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) said that every person, man or woman, free or slave, must give one Sa' of dates or barley as charity before the Eid celebration. This is called Zakat al-Fitr. The people later started giving half a Sa' of wheat instead. Ibn Umar used to give dates for his family and others, even when there was not enough in Medina, he would give barley instead. He also gave Zakat al-Fitr on behalf of his children.

title: Zakat al-Fitr Explained
content: Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) made a new rule: every person must give one Sa' of barley or dates as charity. This applies to all people, young and old, free and slaves.

title: Al-Fadl and the Woman
content: Abdullah bin Abbas said: My brother Al-Fadl was riding behind the Prophet. A woman from the tribe of Khath'am came, and Al-Fadl looked at her. She looked back at him. The Prophet (ﷺ) turned Al-Fadl's face away. The woman asked the Prophet, 'My father is old and weak. Can I do Hajj for him?' The Prophet (ﷺ) said, 'Yes, you can.' This happened during the last Hajj.

title: Riding to Hajj
content: Ibn Umar saw the Prophet riding his camel at Dhul Hulaifa. When it stood up straight, he started saying 'Labbaik'.

title: Jabir's Story about the Prophet
