content: Abu Musa said that the Prophet said: 'When people from Ash`ari tribe were short of food during battles or at home, they would put all their remaining food on one sheet and divide it equally among themselves using a bowl. These people are like my friends, and I am with them.'

title: Zakat on Shared Property
content: Abu Bakr wrote to Anas that the Prophet said: When people own sheep together, they must share the Zakat equally.

title: Prophet's Advice on Slaughtering
content: My grandfather was with the Prophet at Dhul-Hulaifa. The people were hungry and caught some camels and sheep. When the Prophet arrived, he ordered them to stop cooking and redistribute the animals. He said ten sheep are equal to one camel. A runaway camel was shot with an arrow, stopping it. The Prophet (ﷺ) said if you lose control of these animals, shoot them with an arrow. My grandfather asked how to slaughter without knives. The Prophet (ﷺ) said use anything that causes blood to flow, but don't use teeth or fingernails, as they're not sharp enough.

title: Eating Dates Together
content: The Prophet (ﷺ) said that you should not eat two dates at the same time unless your friends allow it.

title: Eating Dates in Groups
content: Jabala said: We were very hungry during a time of famine in Medina. Ibn Az-Zubair gave us dates to eat. One day, Ibn Umar passed by and said: Don't eat two dates together unless you ask your friend first. The Prophet (ﷺ) had forbidden eating two dates at the same time without permission.

title: Freeing a Shared Slave
content: Ibn `Umar said that the Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) said: 'If you free your share of a slave who is owned with others, and you can pay for the other owners' shares at the right price, the slave will be completely free. Otherwise, he will only be partially freed.'

title: Free a Slave Completely
content: If you free a slave who is owned by two people, you must pay the rest of his price to set him completely free. If you don't have enough money, estimate how much he's worth and let him work until he earns enough to be fully free.

title: Boat Seats and Rules
content: The Prophet (ﷺ) said: Imagine people on a boat. Some sit near the top, some near the bottom. When those at the bottom need water, they have to go up, which troubles those above them. They suggest making a hole in their part of the ship so they can get water without bothering others. But if everyone agrees to do this, the whole boat will sink. If those at the top stop them, both groups will be safe.

title: Guardians and Orphan Girls
content: `Urwa bin Az-Zubair asked Aisha about a verse in the Quran. The verse said: 'If you think it's hard to be fair with orphan girls, then marry other women.' Aisha explained that this was about guardians who had control over an orphan girl's wealth and property. They might want to marry her for her money or beauty without giving her a good dowry. So Allah said they couldn't marry these girls unless they treated them fairly and gave them what was right. Later, people asked again about marrying orphan girls, so Allah revealed more verses saying: 'Allah tells you what to do with women.' This included the first verse Aisha explained. It meant that guardians could only marry their orphan girls if they were fair and just.

title: Preemption in Shared Properties
content: Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) allowed people to buy a share of land from someone else if they wanted it. But once the land is divided and boundaries are set, this right does not exist anymore.

title: Preemption in Shared Property
content: Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) said: When you own a property with others, each of you has the right to buy the other person's share first. But if the land is divided and borders are marked, this right no longer exists.

title: Buying with Cash or Credit
content: Sulaiman asked Abu Minhal about buying something partly in cash and partly on credit. Abu Minhal said they did this, then Al-Bara' bin Azib passed by and confirmed it was done the same way elsewhere. They went to the Prophet and asked what to do with it. The Prophet (ﷺ) said: 'Keep what you paid in cash, but leave what was given as a loan'.

title: Money Exchange with the Prophet
content: I asked Abu Minhal about buying something partly with cash and partly on credit. He said he did it with a partner. Al-Bara' bin Azib passed by and we asked him too. He said he and his partner Zaid did the same, then went to the Prophet. The Prophet (ﷺ) told them: 'Take what was paid in cash and leave what was on credit'.

title: Rental Agreement with Jews
content: Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) rented land to the Jews from Khaibar. They had to work on it and grow food. In return, they would get half of what they grew.

title: Prophet's Sacrificial Kid
content: Uqba bin 'Amir told the Prophet about a kid that was left out of the sheep given to distribute among his companions. The Prophet (ﷺ) said, 'Sacrifice it on your behalf'.

title: Prophet Muhammad Blesses Abdullah
content: `Abdullah's mother took him to the Prophet. She asked him to take a pledge from `Abdullah, but the Prophet said he was too young for that. Instead, he put his hand on `Abdullah's head and prayed for Allah's blessing for him. Later, when `Abdullah grew up, people would meet him in the market and say, 'The Prophet (ﷺ) blessed you.' They asked him to be their partner, and sometimes he won a camel load of foodstuff.

title: Prophet Blesses Young Abdullah
content: Abdullah's mother took him to the Prophet. She said, 'Make my son promise to follow Islam.' The Prophet (ﷺ) said, 'He is too young for that.' He put his hand on Abdullah's head and asked Allah to bless him. Later, people would meet Abdullah in the market and say, 'The Prophet (ﷺ) blessed you, so be our partner.' Abdullah would join them, and sometimes he would win a lot of food to take home.

title: Freeing a Shared Slave
content: The Prophet (ﷺ) said: If you free part of a slave that belongs to you and someone else, you must pay the rest of its price if you can afford it. Then give your partners their share of the money and set the slave free.

title: Free a Shared Slave
content: If you own a slave with someone else and you free your share of the slave, you must also free the whole slave if you have enough money. If not, find work for the slave to earn his freedom without overworking him.

title: Prophet's Change of Plans
content: When the Prophet and his friends arrived in Mecca on the fourth day of Dhul-Hijja, he told them to change their plans. They had come for Hajj only, but now they could do 'Umra too and then go home to their wives. Some people were surprised and said, 'But what about our bodies?' The Prophet (ﷺ) gave a speech and said that if he knew then what he knows now, he wouldn't have brought a sacrifice with him. Suraqa bin Malik asked if this was just for them or forever, and the Prophet said it's forever. Meanwhile, Ali bin Abu Talib arrived from Yemen and wanted to follow the Prophet's plan. The Prophet (ﷺ) told Ali to keep his original plans and share the sacrifice.

title: Prophet's Change of Plan
content: When Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) and his companions arrived in Mecca on the fourth day of Dhul-Hijja, he told them to change their intention from Umra (a smaller pilgrimage) to Hajj. He said they could finish their Ihram (special state for pilgrimage) after performing Umra and then go back to their wives. Some people were surprised and asked if they should still go to Mina while they had semen in their bodies. The Prophet (ﷺ) gave a sermon, saying he was more afraid of Allah than anyone else and would have done things differently if he knew what he knows now. He said the permission to change plans was for everyone, not just that time. Meanwhile, Ali bin Abu Talib arrived from Yemen and wanted to follow the Prophet's plan. The Prophet (ﷺ) told him to keep his Ihram and share a sacrifice with him.

title: Prophet's Advice on Slaughtering
content: My grandfather was with the Prophet in a valley. They had some animals they wanted to eat. The people were rushing to cook them, but the Prophet told them to stop and distribute the food fairly. One of their camels escaped, so the Prophet said it's okay if an animal gets away sometimes. My grandfather asked the Prophet how to slaughter the animals without knives. The Prophet (ﷺ) said they could use reeds or anything that would make blood flow, as long as they mentioned Allah's name while slaughtering. But he warned not to use their teeth or fingernails.

title: Prophet Muhammad's Simple Life
content: Anas said the Prophet mortgaged his armor for barley. I brought him some bread with melted fat on it. He told me that the Prophet's family had only enough food for one meal a day, and they were nine people.

title: Prophet Muhammad's Debt
content: The Prophet (ﷺ) bought food on credit. He used his armor as a guarantee for the loan.

title: Muhammad bin Maslama Kills Ka'b
content: The Prophet (ﷺ) asked who would kill Ka'b bin Al-Ashraf because he had harmed Allah and the Prophet. Muhammad (ﷺ) bin Maslama volunteered to do it. He went to Ka'b and said he needed a loan of food grains. Ka'b suggested that Muhammad (ﷺ) mortgage his women or sons, but Muhammad (ﷺ) refused. Instead, he promised to come back with some men and they would mortgage their arms to Ka'b. When they returned, they killed Ka'b. Then they told the Prophet what had happened.

title: Riding and Drinking from Mortgaged Animals
content: The Prophet (ﷺ) said: You can ride a borrowed animal because you're paying for it. And you can drink milk from an animal that's been given to someone else as long as it's still theirs.

title: Using a Mortgaged Animal
content: Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) said: You can ride an animal that is being used as collateral as long as you feed it. If the animal gives milk, you can drink it if you pay for its food.

title: Allah's Messenger Buys Food
content: Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) bought some food from a Jewish man. He used his armor as collateral to pay for it.

title: Oath in Cases of Doubt
content: Ibn Abu Mulaika wrote to Ibn Abbas. Ibn Abbas said the Prophet decided that when someone is accused, they must take an oath to prove their innocence.

title: False Oath and Allah's Anger
content: Abdullah bin Mas'ud said that if someone takes a false oath to get something from someone else, they will meet Allah while He is angry with them. The Quran confirms this: 'Those who trade their faith for worldly gain and break their promises...will face a painful punishment.' (3:77) Al-Ash'ath bin Qais came to us and said that the story was true. He had taken someone to court over a well, but the Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) told him to bring two witnesses or let the other person take an oath. Al-Ash'ath said he knew the defendant would lie to get out of trouble. The Prophet (ﷺ) then warned: 'Those who tell lies to get something from others will meet Allah and He will be angry with them.' This is confirmed by the Quranic verse.

title: Taking False Oaths
content: Abdullah bin Mas'ud said that if someone takes a false oath to get something from another person, Allah will be angry with them. This is based on a verse in the Quran: 'Those who trade Allah's promise for a small gain and break their oaths...will face a painful punishment.' A man named Al-Ash'ath bin Qais came to Abdullah and said that he had done this himself. He took a case about a well to the Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ), but didn't have enough witnesses. The Prophet (ﷺ) told him to get two witnesses or let the other person take an oath instead. Al-Ash'ath said that the other person would just lie in their oath. The Prophet (ﷺ) then said that taking a false oath to get something from someone else is wrong and will make Allah angry with you.

title: Freeing a Slave is Liberating
content: The Prophet (ﷺ) said that if someone frees a Muslim slave, Allah will save all parts of their body from Hell. A man named Sa'id told this story to `Ali bin Al-Husain and because of it, he freed his slave for 10,000 Dirhams or 1,000 Dinars.

title: Best Deeds and Actions
content: Abu Dhar asked the Prophet what is the best thing to do. The Prophet (ﷺ) said, 'Believe in Allah and fight for His cause.' Abu Dhar then asked about freeing slaves. The Prophet (ﷺ) said, 'Freeing a slave who costs a lot and is loved by their owner is best.' If that's not possible, help someone weak or unable to work. If you can't do that, don't harm others. This will be considered a good deed for your own benefit.

title: Freeing Slaves During Eclipses
content: The Prophet (ﷺ) ordered us to set free our slaves when there is a solar eclipse.

title: Freeing Slaves During Eclipses
content: Asma' bint Abu Bakr said that the Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) ordered people to free their slaves when there is a lunar eclipse.

title: Freeing a Slave's Share
content: The Prophet (ﷺ) said: If someone frees a slave who belongs to two people, they must pay the full price of the slave if they are rich. The value of the slave is calculated first.

title: Freed Slave's Share
content: If you own a shared slave and have enough money to buy him completely, get an honest person to estimate his price. Give your partners their share of the money and free the slave. If you don't have enough money, free the slave partially.

title: Freeing a Shared Slave
content: Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) said: If you free part of a slave that belongs to multiple owners, you must make sure the whole slave is freed if you have enough money. If not, the freed person will help pay for the rest of the slave's price according to their share.

title: Freeing a Slave's Share
content: The Prophet (ﷺ) said: If you free part of a slave and have enough money to pay for the rest of their price, you should give that money to their owners. This way, the slave will be completely free.

title: Freeing Shared Slaves
content: Ibn `Umar said that if a slave belongs to more than one owner and one of them decides to free their share, the freed person should use their money to pay for the rest of the slave's price. The other owners get back their share of the money, and the slave is set free.

title: Freed Slave Gets Reward
content: The Prophet (ﷺ) said: 'If you free a slave that belongs to a group of slaves owned by several people, the one who freed it gets the reward.'

title: Freed Slave's Remaining Price
content: The Prophet (ﷺ) said: If you free a slave who is owned by many people, you must pay the rest of his price from your own money if you have enough. Otherwise, estimate how much he still owes and help him work without being overworked until he can pay the rest.

title: Forgiveness for Thoughts
content: The Prophet (ﷺ) said that Allah accepted his prayer to forgive the thoughts in people's hearts unless they act on those thoughts or say them out loud.

title: Migration's True Purpose
content: Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) said: 'Good deeds are rewarded based on our intentions. If someone moves to a new place for Allah and His message, that's what their move is about. But if they do it for money or to get married, then that's why they moved.'

title: Abu Huraira's Slave Returns
content: Abu Huraira and his slave were on their way to meet the Prophet. They got lost, but the slave came back while Abu Huraira was with the Prophet. The Prophet (ﷺ) said, 'Your slave is here.' Abu Huraira wanted the Prophet to witness that he had freed him. This happened when Abu Huraira recited a poem about leaving the land of disbelief.

title: Abu Huraira Frees His Slave
content: I was on my way to the Prophet. I had a slave who ran away from me. When I met the Prophet and became Muslim, my slave showed up again. The Prophet (ﷺ) said, 'Here is your slave.' I decided to free him for Allah's sake.

title: Abu Huraira Becomes Muslim
content: Abu Huraira and his slave were on their way to meet the Prophet. They got separated. When Abu Huraira's slave arrived, Abu Huraira said to the Prophet, 'I want you to know that I'm freeing my slave for Allah's sake.'

title: The Boy's True Father
content: Sa'd took a boy to the Prophet. He said the boy was his brother 'Utba's son. But Abu bin Zam'a said, 'No, he is my brother.' The Prophet (ﷺ) looked at the boy and saw that he looked like 'Utba. So he said, 'The boy belongs to you, Abu bin Zam'a.' The Prophet (ﷺ) also told Sauda to cover herself when she was near the boy because he thought the boy might be her son.

title: Freed Slave Sold by Prophet
content: Jabir bin Abdullah said: A man told us that his slave would be free after he died. The Prophet (ﷺ) called for the slave and sold him. The slave died in the same year.

title: Freed Slaves: No Selling
content: Ibn Umar said that the Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) forbade selling or giving away a freed slave's rights. These rights are what the former owner gets from the slave after they're set free.

title: Barirah's Freedom
content: I bought a slave named Barirah. Her masters said I had to keep her tied to them after she was freed. I told the Prophet about this problem. He said, 'Free her now and her freedom will be yours.' So, I set her free. The Prophet (ﷺ) then spoke with Barirah and asked if she wanted to stay with her husband or leave him. She chose to leave him because she valued her freedom more.

title: Giving Up Ransom
content: Some Ansar men asked the Prophet for permission to give up some of Al-'Abbas' ransom. The Prophet (ﷺ) said, 'Don't leave even one Dirham.'

title: Hakim's Good Deeds Accepted
content: My father told me that Hakim bin Hizam used to set free one hundred slaves and give away one hundred camels before Islam. When he became a Muslim, he did the same again. He asked the Prophet, 'What about my good deeds from before?' The Prophet (ﷺ) said, 'You brought those good deeds with you when you became a Muslim.'

title: Returning Captives to Hawazin
content: Some people from the tribe of Hawazin came to the Prophet. They asked him to return their belongings and family members who were captured. The Prophet (ﷺ) said, 'I have other people with me who also want a share in this matter.' He told them they could choose either their belongings or their family members back. The Prophet (ﷺ) had been waiting for over ten days for them to make a decision. When it became clear that he wouldn't return both, the Hawazin people chose to get their family members back. The Prophet (ﷺ) then stood up and praised Allah. He said, 'These people have come to us saying sorry. It's logical to return their family members.' He asked if anyone wanted to do this as a favor or keep their share of the war booty instead. Everyone agreed to return the captives willingly. The Prophet (ﷺ) sent them back to check with their leaders and confirm everyone was in agreement.

title: Returning Captives to Hawazin
content: Some people from the tribe of Hawazin came to the Prophet. They asked him to return their properties and family members who were being held as prisoners. The Prophet (ﷺ) stood up and said, 'I have other people with me who also want a share in this matter. You can choose either your properties or your family members back.' He had been waiting for them for over ten days. When they realized he wouldn't return both, they chose to get their family members back. The Prophet (ﷺ) praised Allah and then said, 'These people have come to us with regret. I think it's a good idea to return their family members. If you want to do this as a favor, you can. Or if you prefer to keep your share of the war booty, that's okay too.' Everyone agreed to return the captives. The Prophet (ﷺ) asked them to go back and discuss it with their leaders. After checking, the leaders told him everyone had agreed to let the captives go free.

title: Battle of Bani Mustaliq
content: Ibn 'Aun wrote to Nafi'. Nafi' replied that the Prophet suddenly attacked Bani Mustaliq without warning. They were busy watering their animals and didn't expect an attack. Many of their men were killed, and women and children were taken captive. The Prophet (ﷺ) took a woman named Juwairiya on this day. Ibn 'Aun's letter was based on what Ibn 'Umar told Nafi', who was in the army that attacked Bani Mustaliq.

title: Coitus Interruptus with Allah's Messenger
content: Abu Sa'id told me that during the battle of Bani Al-Mustaliq, some men asked Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) if they could use a method to avoid having children. He said it was better not to do so and explained that every person Allah has destined to be born will come into existence.

title: Bani Tamim's Loyalty
content: Abu Huraira said he loved the people of Bani Tamim after hearing three things from the Prophet. The Prophet (ﷺ) said they would be strong against a false prophet called Ad-Dajjal. When charity came from them, the Prophet said it was from their own people. Aisha had a slave girl from that tribe and the Prophet told her to free her because she was related to Ishmael.

title: Treating Slaves with Kindness
content: The Prophet (ﷺ) said: If someone has a slave and takes care of them well, teaches them good things, and then sets them free and marries them, they will get two rewards from Allah.

title: Treat Your Slaves Kindly
content: I saw Abu Dhar wearing a cloak. His slave was also wearing one. We asked him why they both wore the same type of clothes. He said, 'A man complained to the Prophet that I insulted him. The Prophet (ﷺ) asked me if I called his mother an insulting name. He told me, 'Your slaves are like your brothers. Allah has given you authority over them. So, feed them what you eat and dress them in what you wear. Don't make them do too much work they can't handle. If you do, help them.'

title: Honest Slave Gets Double Reward
content: Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) said that if a slave is honest and faithful to their master, and worships Allah perfectly, they will get a double reward.

title: Double Reward for Good Treatment
content: The Prophet (ﷺ) said, 'If you have a slave and teach her good manners, improve her education, then set her free and marry her, you will get two rewards. If the slave obeys Allah's laws and their master's rules, they will also get two rewards.'

title: Double Reward for Good Deeds
content: The Prophet (ﷺ) said that a good person gets twice the reward. Abu Huraira added that he would have liked to die as a servant, but only after doing his duty in battle, making the pilgrimage to Mecca, and taking care of his mother.

title: Good Worship Brings Comfort
content: The Prophet (ﷺ) said: Goodness and comfort come to the person who worships God with a pure heart and serves their master honestly.

title: Double Reward for Good Service
content: The Prophet (ﷺ) said: If someone serves their master honestly and worships Allah properly, they will get a double reward.

title: Slave's Double Reward
content: The Prophet (ﷺ) said: A slave who worships God well and is good to their master will get a double reward for it.

title: Proper Titles for the Prophet
content: The Prophet (ﷺ) said: Don't say 'Feed your lord' or 'Give water to your lord'. Instead, say 'Feed your master' or 'Help your guardian'. Also, don't call a servant 'my slave', but say 'my lad' or 'my boy'.

title: Freeing a Shared Slave
content: The Prophet (ﷺ) said: If you free your share of a shared slave and have enough money to pay the rest of his price, then set him completely free. Otherwise, he is freed but not fully.

title: Guardianship and Responsibility
content: Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) said: Everyone is a guardian and responsible for what they care for. A ruler is in charge of people, a man looks after his family, a woman takes care of her home and children, and a slave is responsible for his master's belongings. We are all guardians and accountable for our responsibilities.

title: Punishment for Adultery
content: The Prophet (ﷺ) said: If a slave girl commits adultery, she should be punished with lashes. If she does it again, she gets more lashes. If she keeps doing this, the Prophet said to sell her.

title: Punishment for Adultery
content: Abu Huraira and Zaid bin Khalid said the Prophet said: If a slave commits adultery, punish her with lashes. If she does it again, lash her again. If she keeps doing it, sell her.

title: Treat Your Servant Kindly
content: The Prophet (ﷺ) said: When your servant brings you food, don't just eat and leave him. Give him a little bit of what you're eating, so he can enjoy it too.

title: Being Responsible as Guardians
content: Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) said: Everyone is a guardian and responsible for what they are in charge of. A leader is responsible for his people, a man is responsible for his family, a woman is responsible for her home, and a servant is responsible for his master's property. Even children are responsible for taking care of their parents' belongings.

title: Fighting and Avoiding Faces
content: The Prophet (ﷺ) said: When two people fight, they should not hit each other's faces. If someone hits another person, they must avoid hitting their face. This is a rule from Allah's Laws, which are true and strong.

title: Freeing a Slave Woman
content: `Aisha's slave woman, Barirah, asked for her help to be freed. `Aisha said she would pay the amount needed for freedom and keep control of Barirah after that. But Barirah's masters refused, saying they wanted control over her even if she was freed. `Aisha told the Prophet about this. He said, 'Buy her and free her. The one who frees a slave gets to keep control.' Then he added, 'If people make rules that are not in Allah's laws, those rules don't count. Allah's laws are true and strongest'.

title: Aisha's Slave-Girl Purchase
content: Aisha wanted to buy a slave-girl and set her free. The girl's owners said that if she freed the slave, they would get control over any future marriage or relationship with the slave. Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) told Aisha not to worry about this condition - when you set someone free, you have the right to decide what happens next.

title: Barirah's Freedom and Conditions
content: Aisha had a friend named Barirah who was being freed by her masters. They wanted to keep control over her after she was free, which is not allowed in Islam. Aisha asked the Prophet for help. He said that if they agreed to give up their claim on Barirah's loyalty (Wala'), he would pay them the money and set her free. But the masters refused. The Prophet (ﷺ) then told everyone that any conditions not mentioned in Islamic law are not valid, even if there are many of them. He reminded people that when someone frees a slave, the slave's loyalty belongs to their new owner.

title: Barirah's Freedom from Slavery
content: Barirah went to Aisha for help. She wanted to be free. Aisha said she would pay Barirah's price and set her free if her masters agreed. But they refused unless they kept control over her after freedom. Aisha told the Prophet about this. He said, 'Buy Barirah and free her. The one who frees her gets control.'

title: Barirah's Freedom and Wala'
content: `Abdul Wahid told me that he was a slave of `Utba. When `Utba died, his sons sold him to Ibn Abu `Amr who freed him. The sons said that `Abdul Wahid's loyalty should be theirs. Barirah came to Aisha and asked her to buy her freedom. But her masters wouldn't sell unless they kept her loyalty. Aisha didn't need it, but the Prophet found out and told her to buy Barirah anyway. He said that when freeing someone, you can agree on whatever conditions the owner wants. So, Aisha bought Barirah's freedom and her owners said she had to stay loyal to them. The Prophet (ﷺ) then said that the one who frees a slave gets their loyalty, no matter what conditions are set.

title: Respect Gifts from Neighbors
content: The Prophet (ﷺ) said to Muslim women: Don't look down on gifts from your female neighbors. Not even if it's just the legs of a sheep.

title: Aisha Describes Ramadan
content: My aunt Aisha said to me: 'We used to see the crescent moon three times in two months. We didn't have fires at home because we only ate dates and drank water. Our neighbors from Ansar would give us milk, and the Prophet would share it with us.'

title: Accepting Invitations and Gifts
content: The Prophet (ﷺ) said, 'I will accept an invitation to eat, even if it's just a sheep's trotter. I will also accept a gift, no matter how small, like a sheep's arm or trotter.'

title: The Prophet's Pulpit is Built
content: The Prophet (ﷺ) asked a woman to tell her carpenter slave to prepare wood for a pulpit. He cut the wood from tamarisk trees and built it. When finished, he sent it to the Prophet, who placed it in its current position.

title: Abu Qatada's Onager Hunt
content: My father was with some of the Prophet's friends on their way to Mecca. They were all in a special state for pilgrimage, but my dad wasn't yet. He was busy fixing his shoes when he saw an onager (a type of wild donkey). His friends didn't tell him about it because they thought he should have seen it first. My dad got angry and rode the horse to catch the onager. He forgot his whip and spear, so his friends wouldn't help him get them. My dad was angry again, but then he remembered what he needed. He picked up the whip and spear and rode the horse again. He killed the onager and brought it back. His friends ate some of it, but they weren't sure if it was allowed while they were in this special state for pilgrimage. When they met the Prophet, my dad showed him a piece of the onager's leg. The Prophet (ﷺ) ate it all.

title: Prophet Muhammad Drinks with Us
content: One day, the Prophet visited our house and asked for a drink. We gave him milk mixed with water from our well. Abu Bakr was sitting next to him on his left side, Umar in front of him, and a Bedouin on his right side. After drinking, Umar said, 'Here is Abu Bakr.' But the Prophet gave the remaining milk to the Bedouin and said twice, 'Start from the right side.' This is how we should serve guests.

title: Catching a Rabbit
content: Anas said we went hunting at Mar-al-Zahran. We chased a rabbit but got tired. I caught it and gave it to Abu Talha, who killed it. He sent two of its legs to the Prophet. The Prophet (ﷺ) accepted them. Anas confirmed that the Prophet ate from the meat.

title: Receiving a Gift in Ihram
content: Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) was given an onager at Al-Abwa' or Waddan. He rejected it because he and his companions were in the state of Ihram, which means they couldn't accept any gifts.

title: People Looked Forward to Gift Days
content: My friends would wait for the days when I was in charge of sending gifts to the Prophet. They wanted to make him happy by giving him presents.

title: Prophet Muhammad Rejects Mastigar
content: Ibn Abbas's aunt sent the Prophet some food: dried yogurt, butter, and a mastigar. The Prophet (ﷺ) ate the yogurt and butter but left the mastigar. Ibn Abbas said that if eating mastigar was wrong, it wouldn't have been eaten in front of the Prophet.

title: Sharing Food with Companions
content: When a meal was brought to the Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ), he would ask if it was given as charity or a gift. If it was charity, he would tell his friends to eat it. But if it was a gift, he would quickly share it with them.

title: Meat Given in Charity
content: Some meat was brought to the Prophet. People said it had been given as charity to a man named Barirah. The Prophet (ﷺ) said, 'It was meant for charity to Barirah, but we can eat it too.'

title: The Prophet's Advice on Freedom
content: I wanted to buy Barirah and set her free. But her masters said I had to give them control over her after she was freed. The Prophet (ﷺ) told me, 'Buy her and set her free. She will be under my protection.' When some meat was given to Barirah as charity, the Prophet said it was a gift for us too. After that, Barirah's husband was given a choice: stay with his wife or leave her. We don't know if he was a slave or a free man.

title: Prophet Muhammad's Visit
content: The Prophet (ﷺ) visited Aisha and asked if she had food. She said there was some mutton that Um 'Atiyya had sent to someone in need. The Prophet (ﷺ) said the mutton had already reached its destination.

title: Gifts for the Prophet
content: Some people used to send gifts to the Prophet on a certain day when it was my turn. The other wives of the Prophet complained about this, so I told him about their problem. He didn't say anything.

title: Wives of Prophet Muhammad
content: Prophet Muhammad 's (ﷺ) wives were divided into two groups. One group included Aisha, Hafsa, Safiyya, and Sauda. The other group was led by Um Salama. Some people knew that the Prophet loved Aisha, so they would send gifts to her house first. Um Salama's group thought this wasn't fair and decided to ask the Prophet to change the way gifts were given. They asked him to tell everyone to send gifts to his current location, not just to Aisha's house. But he didn't say anything. His wives kept asking Um Salama to talk to him again. Finally, when she met him on her own day, he said: 'Don't make me uncomfortable about Aisha. The revelations from Allah don't come to me in any bed except hers.' Um Salama apologized for causing trouble. Then his other wives asked Fatima (his daughter) to ask the Prophet to treat them all equally. But when she went to him, he said: 'Do you love who I love?' She said yes and came back to tell her mothers that the Prophet didn't want to change things. They then sent Zainab to talk to him again. She was angry and said some harsh words, including criticizing Aisha in front of her face. But Aisha stood up for herself and replied to Zainab until she stopped talking. The Prophet (ﷺ) looked at Aisha and said: 'She's indeed the daughter of Abu Bakr'.

title: Anas and Perfume Gifts
content: 'Azra bin Thabit visited Thumama bin Abdullah. He gave 'Azra some perfume and said Anas wouldn't refuse gifts of perfume. Anas confirmed: The Prophet (ﷺ) didn't reject perfume gifts.

title: Returning Captives to Hawazin Tribe
content: When the Prophet met with a group from the Hawazin tribe who wanted their family members back, he stood up and praised Allah. He then said that it was okay for people to return the captives as a favor or keep them until they received their share of war booty.

title: Returning Captives to Hawazin
content: When the Prophet met with delegates from the tribe of Hawazin, he stood up and praised Allah. He said: 'Your people have come back to us, wanting their prisoners returned. If you want to give them back as a kindness, that's okay. Or if you prefer to keep what we captured in battle, we'll make sure you get your share from the very beginning.' The people agreed to return the captives willingly.

title: Allah's Messenger Accepts Gifts
content: Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) accepted gifts from people and would give something back in return.

title: Giving Gifts to Family
content: An-Nu`man's father took him to the Prophet and said he had given a slave to his son. The Prophet (ﷺ) asked if he had given all his sons something equally valuable. When An-Nu`man's father said no, the Prophet told him to take back the gift.

title: Father's Gift for Son
content: 'Amra bint Rawaha did not want my father to give me a gift without asking Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) to witness it. My father went to the Prophet and said he had given me a gift from his wife, but she wanted him to ask the Prophet to be a witness. The Prophet (ﷺ) asked if he gave gifts like this to all his sons. He said no. The Prophet (ﷺ) told my father to be fair and just with his children.

title: Prophet's Last Illness
content: When the Prophet was very sick, he asked his wives to let him stay in Aisha's house for treatment. They agreed. He came out with two men supporting him because he couldn't walk properly on his own. One of these men was Al-Abbas and the other was Ali bin Abi Talib.

title: Don't Take Back Your Gift
content: The Prophet (ﷺ) said, 'If someone takes back a gift they already gave to someone else, it's like a dog that swallows its own vomit.'

title: Giving Charity
content: Asma asked the Prophet if she could give charity with her own money. He said, 'Give in charity and don't be stingy.' If you're not generous, Allah won't give you anything back.

title: Give Charity with an Open Heart
content: Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) said: Give charity when you can. Don't give it reluctantly or just to please others, because Allah might then only give you a little in return. And don't be stingy with your money, or Allah will take less from you.

title: Manumitting a Slave Girl
content: Maimuna told Kuraib that she freed a slave without asking the Prophet. When it was her turn to be with him, she said, 'I've freed my slave.' He asked if it's true and she said yes. The Prophet (ﷺ) then said, 'You could have given her to one of your relatives for more reward'.

title: The Prophet's Journey Decisions
content: When the Prophet wanted to travel, he would randomly choose which of his wives could join him. Each wife had a specific day and night to go with him. Sauda gave up her turn so that Aisha could go instead, hoping to please the Prophet. Maimuna freed one of her slaves, but the Prophet said she would have been rewarded more if she had given the slave to one of her relatives.

title: Giving to Neighbors
content: I asked the Prophet which of my two neighbors I should give a gift to. He said: 'Give it to the one who lives closer to you'.

title: Prophet Rejects Gift While Ihram
content: Abdullah bin Abbas said that As-Sa'b bin Jath-thama gave the Prophet some meat from an onager while he was at Al-Abwa' or Waddan. The Prophet (ﷺ) was in a state of Ihram and did not accept the gift. When As-Sa'b looked sad, the Prophet explained that they couldn't take gifts because they were in Ihram.

title: Zakat Collector's Mistake
content: The Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) appointed a man from the tribe of Al-Azd to collect Zakat. When he returned, he said some people gave him presents instead of Zakat money. The Prophet (ﷺ) said it's not right to take things that aren't yours, especially from charity. He warned that if someone takes something they shouldn't, they'll have to carry it on their neck on the Day of Judgment. If it's a camel, it will make noise; if a cow, it will moo; and if a sheep, it will bleat. The Prophet (ﷺ) then prayed to Allah, asking if he had done his job correctly.

title: Prophet's Promise to Jabir
content: The Prophet (ﷺ) told me he would give me a lot of money when the funds from Bahrain came. But before that happened, he passed away. When the money arrived, Abu Bakr asked people with claims against the Prophet or promises from him to come forward. I went to Abu Bakr and reminded him about the Prophet's promise. He gave me three handfuls of money.

title: Prophet Muhammad's Gift
content: Makhrama was unhappy because the Prophet didn't give him a cloak. He asked his son to go with him to see the Prophet. The Prophet (ﷺ) said, 'Call Makhrama.' When he came out wearing one of the cloaks, he said, 'We kept this for you, Makhrama.' Makhrama was happy and said so.

title: Fasting During Ramadan
content: A man came to the Prophet and said he had broken his fast during Ramadan by having sex with his wife. The Prophet (ﷺ) asked if he could free a slave, but the man said no. He also couldn't fast for two months or feed sixty poor people. An Ansari brought some dates, so the Prophet told the man to take them and give them to someone poorer than him.

title: Jabir and the Date Palms
content: My father was killed in battle. His creditors wanted their money back. I told the Prophet about it. He asked them to accept some fruit from my garden instead, but they refused. The Prophet (ﷺ) said he would come back tomorrow. Next morning, he walked between the date palms and prayed for blessings on the fruit. I picked the fruit and paid off all the debts. There was still plenty left over. I told the Prophet what happened. He asked Umar to listen. Umar said, 'We know you're a messenger of Allah.'

title: The Prophet's Share with a Boy
content: A boy was sitting next to the Prophet. The Prophet (ﷺ) had some milk and water left in a container. He offered it to the old men on his left, but the boy said no. 'I won't let anyone have my share before me,' he said. The Prophet (ﷺ) then gave the container to the boy.

title: Selling a Camel to the Prophet
content: Jabir bin Abdullah sold a camel to the Prophet on a journey. When they arrived in Medina, the Prophet told Jabir to go to the mosque and pray two units of prayer. Then he weighed out the payment for the camel in gold and gave some extra money. Some of this money stayed with Jabir until it was taken by soldiers going to Syria during a battle.

title: The Boy and the Prophet's Drink
content: The Prophet (ﷺ) was given a bowl of milk and water. A boy sat on his right side, while old men were on his left. The Prophet (ﷺ) asked the boy if he could give it to the others. But the boy said no, 'I won't let anyone take my turn.' So the Prophet gave the bowl to the boy instead.

title: Debt and Being Kind
content: The Prophet 's (ﷺ) companions wanted to fight a man who was demanding back some money he lent to the Prophet. But the Prophet said, 'No, let him speak his mind.' He then told them to buy an old camel and give it to the man as payment.

title: Returning Captives to Hawazin
content: Some leaders from the tribe of Hawazin came to the Prophet and asked for their property and family members back. The Prophet (ﷺ) said he would give them one or the other, but not both. The Hawazin chose to get their family members back. Later, the Prophet stood up in front of his followers and suggested they could choose to return the captives as a favor. The people agreed to do this willingly.

title: Returning Captives to Hawazin
content: Some people from the tribe of Hawazin came to the Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ). They asked him to return their property and family members who were taken as captives during a battle. The Prophet (ﷺ) said he would give them one choice: either take back their property or their family members. He waited for over ten days, but they didn't come. When they finally arrived, they chose to get back their family members. The Prophet (ﷺ) then told the Muslims that these people had come with regret and wanted to return their captives as a favor. He asked if anyone wanted to do this voluntarily, or wait until they received their share of war booty from Allah. The people said they would willingly return the captives as a kindness.

title: Lending and Repaying Debt
content: The Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) took a camel on credit from someone. The owner came back for it, but the Prophet said that if you have a right to something, you can ask for it back. He then gave the owner an even older camel and said that the best person is the one who pays their debts in a fair way.

title: The Prophet's Camel Ride
content: Ibn `Umar was on a journey with the Prophet. His father's camel kept going ahead of the Prophet, so his father said to him, 'Don't let the Prophet's camel go ahead.' The Prophet (ﷺ) told him, 'Sell me this camel.' Umar said it was for the Prophet, and he bought it. Then the Prophet gave it back to Ibn `Umar and said, 'You can do what you want with it'.

title: The Prophet Buys a Camel
content: Ibn 'Umar was on a journey with the Prophet. He had a difficult camel to ride. The Prophet (ﷺ) asked his companion, 'Umar, to sell him the camel. 'Umar sold it, and then the Prophet said, 'This camel is for you'.

title: No Silk for the Prophet
content: One day, `Umar saw a silk cloak being sold at the mosque. He told the Prophet, 'Why don't you buy it and wear it on Fridays?' The Prophet (ﷺ) replied, 'This is worn by someone who will not go to heaven.' Later, some silk cloaks were brought, and the Prophet sent one to `Umar. `Umar said, 'You said I couldn't wear this kind of cloth!' The Prophet (ﷺ) said, 'I didn't give it to you to wear.' So, `Umar gave it to his brother in Mecca.

title: The Prophet Visits Fatima
content: The Prophet (ﷺ) went to see his daughter Fatima. He didn't go inside her house. Ali asked him why, and the Prophet said he saw a decorated curtain on her door. He told Ali that he doesn't care about worldly things. The Prophet (ﷺ) then told Ali to ask Fatima to give the curtain to some poor people who need it.

title: Prophet Muhammad's Gift
content: The Prophet (ﷺ) gave me a nice silk dress as a gift. I wore it, but when he got angry with me, I cut it into pieces and shared it among my wives.

title: Prophet's Reaction to Silk Gift
content: Anas said the Prophet was given a thick silk cloak. The Prophet (ﷺ) usually told people not to wear silk, so they were happy when he got it. He said, 'Even in Paradise, Sa'd bin Mu'adh's handkerchiefs are better than this.' This gift came from a Christian man named Ukaidir.

title: Prophet's Reaction to Silk Gift
content: Anas said the Prophet was given a thick silk cloak. He usually told people not to wear silk. The Prophet (ﷺ) said, 'Muhammad 's (ﷺ) life is in Allah's Hands. Sa'd bin Mu'adh's handkerchiefs in Paradise are better than this.' This gift came from Ukaidir, a Christian from Dauma.

title: Poisoned Food and Mercy
content: A Jewish woman brought a poisoned sheep to the Prophet. He ate from it, but when asked what to do with her, he said no one should be killed. The poison affected his mouth.

title: Sharing Food with Companions
content: Once, the Prophet was traveling with 130 people. He asked if anyone had food to share. A man had some wheat mixed with water. A tall pagan came by with sheep. The Prophet (ﷺ) asked him if he would sell or give a sheep as a gift. The pagan said he'd sell one. The Prophet (ﷺ) bought a sheep and it was slaughtered. He ordered the liver and other organs roasted. Everyone got a piece of the meat, including those who were absent. They ate their fill and still had leftovers.

title: Prophet's Advice on Luxury
content: Ibn Umar said that one day, his friend saw a fancy silk cloak for sale. He asked the Prophet to buy it so he could wear it when meeting important people or on Fridays. The Prophet (ﷺ) said, 'This is worn by someone who will not go to heaven.' Later, the Prophet got some similar cloaks and sent one to Ibn Umar. When Ibn Umar received it, he was confused because the Prophet had said something bad about silk cloaks. He asked the Prophet what to do with it. The Prophet (ﷺ) replied, 'I didn't give it to you to wear yourself, but to sell or give to someone else.' So, Ibn Umar sent the cloak to his brother in Mecca before his brother became Muslim.

title: Keep Good Relations with Your Mother
content: My mother was not a Muslim when the Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) came to our town. I asked him if I should be kind to her, even though she wasn't following Islam. He said yes, that I should still treat her well.

title: Don't Take Back Gifts
content: The Prophet (ﷺ) said: If someone takes back a gift they were given, it's like swallowing something that has come up. Don't take back what people have given you as a gift.

title: Don't Follow Bad Examples
content: The Prophet (ﷺ) said that we should not follow people who do bad things. If someone takes back what they said or did, it's like a dog throwing up and then eating its own vomit again.

title: Don't Buy Back Charity
content: Umar bin Al-Khattab gave a horse to help others. The person he gave it to didn't take care of it. Umar wanted to buy the horse back, but the Prophet said: 'Don't do that, even if you can get it for one coin. A person who takes back something they gave as charity is like an animal that eats its own vomit.'

title: Keeping Good Relations
content: My mother was a non-Muslim. I asked the Prophet if I should be kind to her and he said yes, keep good relations with her.

title: Umra for Those Who Are Allowed
content: Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) gave a verdict that Umra is allowed only for those who are invited to perform it.

title: Umra is Permitted
content: The Prophet (ﷺ) said that Umra, a visit to the Kaaba, is allowed. Abu Huraira told me this, and Jabir also said he heard it from the Prophet.

title: Prophet's Quick Response
content: Medina was frightened. The Prophet (ﷺ) borrowed a horse from Abu Talha called Al-Mandub and rode it. When he returned, he said they saw nothing to be afraid of. The horse was very fast.

title: Aisha's Coarse Dress
content: I visited Aisha. She was wearing a cheap dress worth five Dirhams. Aisha said: 'Look at my slave-girl who doesn't want to wear this in the house. When Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) was alive, I had a similar dress that no woman wanted to borrow from me if she wanted to look nice for her husband.'

title: Good Animals for Charity
content: Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) said: 'A good animal is one that gives a lot of milk. A she-camel that has just given birth and gives lots of milk is very good. So are sheep that give milk twice a day.'

title: Emigrants and Ansar Share Land
content: When the emigrants came to Medina, they had no land. The Ansar gave them some of their own land on one condition: the emigrants would give half of what the land produced each year, work on it, and take care of everything needed for farming. Anas's mother gave date-palms to the Prophet, who then gave them to his slave-girl Um Aiman. After fighting against Khaibar, the emigrants returned some gifts they had received from the Ansar. The Prophet (ﷺ) also returned Anas's mother's date-palms. He replaced the old trees with new ones from his own garden for Um Aiman.

title: Forty Virtuous Deeds
content: Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) said that there are forty good actions. The best of these is to set a she-goat free. If someone does one of these good deeds, hoping for Allah's reward and being sure they will get it, then Allah will let them into Paradise because of it. Some people tried to count the other good deeds but couldn't even list fifteen.

title: Cultivate Your Own Land
content: Some people had extra land and wanted to give it to others to work on. They said they would get one-third, one-fourth, or half of the crops. The Prophet (ﷺ) said: 'If you have land, use it yourself, give it to a family member, or leave it uncultivated.'

title: Emigration and Good Deeds
content: A bedouin asked the Prophet about emigration. The Prophet (ﷺ) said it's difficult. The bedouin had camels, but didn't use them for good. He paid Zakat on them, lent them to others, and milked them when they were watered. The Prophet (ﷺ) told him: 'Do more good deeds than just being a merchant, and Allah will never forget your actions.'

title: Renting Land is Not Kind
content: Ibn Abbas told Tawus that the Prophet went to a land with lots of greenery. He asked who owned it, and was told someone had rented it out. The Prophet (ﷺ) said it would have been better for the owner to give it away for free instead of charging rent.

title: Abraham Migrated with Sarah
content: Prophet Abraham migrated to a new town with his wife Sarah. The people gave her a servant girl named Hajar. When they returned, Sarah told Abraham that the people had humiliated their host by giving her a slave instead of treating her well.

title: Giving Charity is a Gift
content: Umar asked the Prophet if he could buy back a horse he had given to charity. The Prophet (ﷺ) said, 'No, you should not get something back that you gave away.'

title: Prophet Muhammad's Defense of Aisha
content: Some people lied about Aisha. Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) asked Ali and Usama for advice on what to do. They said keep her, she is good. Another man said she was too young and simple-minded to lie. The Prophet (ﷺ) said he wanted revenge against the person who hurt his family's reputation.

title: Muhammad visits Ibn Saiyad
content: Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) Muhammad (ﷺ) and his companion Ubai bin Ka'b went to a garden where a man named Ibn Saiyad lived. When they arrived, the Prophet hid behind some date-palm trees so he could listen secretly to what Ibn Saiyad was saying before he saw him. Ibn Saiyad was lying on his bed, wrapped in a soft blanket, and talking quietly to himself. His mother saw the Prophet hiding and said to Ibn Saiyad, 'This is Muhammad (ﷺ).' When she did this, Ibn Saiyad stopped talking. The Prophet (ﷺ) then said that if his mother had left him alone, he would have revealed who he really was.

title: Aisha's Divorce and Marriage
content: Aisha said to the Prophet: 'I was married to Rifa'a but he divorced me. I then married Abdur-Rahman, but he is unable to have children.' The Prophet (ﷺ) asked her if she wanted to marry Rifa'a again, but only if she had a complete sexual relationship with her current husband.

title: Divorce due to Suckling
content: `Uqba married a woman. Another woman said she had suckled `Uqba and his wife when they were young. `Uqba didn't know this, so he sent someone to ask about it. They couldn't confirm the story. He went to the Prophet in Medina for advice. The Prophet (ﷺ) told him that since both of them were suckled by the same woman, it was not right for `Uqba to keep his wife. So, `Uqba divorced her and she married another man.

title: Judging People's Deeds
content: Umar bin Al-Khattab said: In the past, Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) would sometimes get new guidance from God. Now that's no longer happening. We judge people based on what they do in public. If someone does good things publicly, we trust them and don't ask about their private actions. But if someone does something bad, even if they say it was a mistake, we won't believe them.

title: Funeral Processions and Paradise
content: Anas narrated that a funeral procession passed by the Prophet. People praised the deceased, so the Prophet said, 'It's confirmed they're going to Paradise.' Another procession went by, and people spoke badly of the person who died. The Prophet (ﷺ) said, 'It's confirmed they're going to Hell.' Someone asked him, 'Why did you say both?' He replied, 'The people's words are accepted as a witness on earth, because believers are Allah's witnesses here'.

title: Umar's Rule of Paradise
content: Abu Al-Aswad was in Medina where many people were dying from a disease. He sat with Umar, who saw three funeral processions go by. People praised the first two deceased, and Umar said 'Paradise has been affirmed' for each one. But when he saw the third procession, people talked badly about the person who died. Umar said 'Hell has been affirmed'. Abu Al-Aswad asked him what he meant. Umar explained that the Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) had a rule: if four people say good things about someone after they die, Allah will put them in Paradise. If three people do, it's still possible. And even if two people speak well of them, it can happen. But no one asked the Prophet what would happen if only one person said something good.

title: Visiting a Relative
content: Aflah asked Aisha if he could visit her. She didn't let him in at first. He said she should allow him because they're related - his brother's wife nursed her as a baby, and that makes them family. Aisha asked the Prophet about it, and he agreed with Aflah. So Aisha allowed Aflah to visit her.

title: Prophet's Foster Relationship
content: The Prophet (ﷺ) said that he cannot marry Hamza's daughter because she is like his sister due to their foster relationship.

title: Visiting a Married Woman
content: `Aisha was with the Prophet in her house when she heard someone asking Hafsa permission to enter. `Aisha thought it might be Hafsa's foster uncle, so she asked the Prophet if that was true. The Prophet (ﷺ) agreed. Then `Aisha asked if their foster uncle would be allowed to visit her if he were alive. The Prophet (ﷺ) said yes, because in Islam, foster relations are treated like blood relatives.

title: Fostership and Suckling Period
content: The Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) came to my house. He saw a man there and asked who he was. I said, 'My foster brothers.' The Prophet (ﷺ) said, 'Be sure about your foster brothers. Fostership only counts if it happens when you're still a baby (before two years old).'

title: Woman Repents After Punishment
content: In the battle to conquer Mecca, a woman stole something. The Prophet (ﷺ) ordered her hand to be cut off as punishment. Later, she was truly sorry and got married again. She would visit Aisha and they would ask the Prophet for help with things.

title: Unmarried Man's Punishment
content: Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) ordered a man who had sex outside marriage to be given 100 lashes and sent away for one year.

title: Gift to My Son
content: My father gave me some money. My mother asked him to make the Prophet a witness that he did this for her. My father took me to the Prophet and said, 'This is my son.' The Prophet (ﷺ) asked if I had brothers. My father said yes. Then the Prophet said, 'Don't ask me to be a witness for something unfair.'

title: Best Generations After the Prophet
content: The Prophet (ﷺ) said: 'The best people are those who lived during my time. Then came those after them, and then those after that group.' He also said: 'After you, there will be some people who are dishonest and not trustworthy. They will give evidence without being asked to, make promises they don't keep, and become very overweight.'

title: Best Generations and Oaths
content: The Prophet (ﷺ) said: 'My generation is the best. Then come those who follow us, then those who follow them. After that, people will appear whose words are not trustworthy. They swear an oath before giving a witness. We used to get beaten for swearing by Allah's name or His promise.'

title: Prophet's Answer on Sins
content: Anas asked the Prophet about big sins. The Prophet (ﷺ) said: 'Don't worship anyone except Allah. Respect your parents. Don't kill someone unless it's allowed by law. And don't lie in court.'

title: Greatest of Sins
content: The Prophet (ﷺ) asked his companions if they wanted to know about the biggest sins. They said yes. He replied that two big sins are: worshiping anyone other than Allah and not taking care of your parents. The Prophet (ﷺ) sat up straight and warned them strongly against lying in court, repeating this warning several times.

title: Prophet's Kindness to a Reciter
content: The Prophet (ﷺ) heard someone reciting the Quran in the mosque. He said, 'May Allah be kind to him.' The man had reminded the Prophet of some forgotten verses from the Quran. Later, the Prophet performed his night prayer at home and heard another person praying in the mosque. He asked Aisha if it was that person's voice. When she said yes, he prayed for mercy for the man.

title: Eat Before Morning Prayer
content: The Prophet (ﷺ) said to eat and drink till you hear the next call to prayer. Bilal calls people to pray early in the night, but a blind man named Ibn Um Maktum waits until it's actually dawn before calling people to pray.

title: Prophet Muhammad Receives Garments
content: My father Makhrama and I went to the Prophet. He had some new clothes. My father stood at the door and called out to him. The Prophet (ﷺ) heard my father's voice and came out with a garment. He said, 'This is for you' and told my father about its good qualities.

title: Women as Witnesses
content: Abu Sa'id asked the Prophet: 'Is a woman's witness equal to a man's?' The women agreed it was. The Prophet (ﷺ) said, 'This is because of the difference in men and women.'

title: Divorce due to breastfeeding
content: `Uqba bin Al-Harith had married Um Yahya. A slave woman said she suckled `Uqba and his wife. `Uqba told the Prophet, who turned away. `Uqba went back and told him again. The Prophet (ﷺ) said it's not right to keep her as a wife if she breastfed both of them. He ordered `Uqba to divorce Um Yahya.

title: Divorcing a Foster Sister
content: `Uqba bin Al-Harith married a woman. Later, another woman said she had suckled `Uqba and his wife as babies. `Uqba went to the Prophet for advice. The Prophet (ﷺ) told him to divorce his wife because they were considered foster brother and sister.

title: Aisha's Innocence Proved
content: When the Prophet wanted to go on a journey, he would draw lots among his wives and take one with him. One time, the lot fell on Aisha. She traveled with the Prophet in a howdah, but when she got off to answer nature's call, her necklace was missing. The people carrying her thought she was still inside and left without waiting for her. Aisha found her necklace later and went back to the camp, but everyone had already left. She waited until morning, then Safwan bin Mu'attal saw her sleeping and woke her up. He took her to the army's resting place, where they were accused of wrongdoing by some people led by Abdullah bin Ubai. Aisha was ill for a month while the accusations spread. When she recovered, she went out with Um Mistah to answer nature's call and heard the rumors about herself. She went back home and asked her parents what was happening. They told her that women often get accused of wrongdoing when they are loved by their husbands. Aisha was sad and didn't sleep for two nights and a day. The Prophet (ﷺ) consulted his companions, Ali and Usama, but they said he should keep her as his wife because she had a good reputation. Barirah, the slave girl, testified that Aisha was innocent except for being young and sometimes sleeping. The Prophet (ﷺ) went to the pulpit and asked people to support him in punishing Abdullah bin Ubai. Sa'd bin Mu'adh offered to kill him if he was from the Aus tribe or follow the Prophet's order if he was from the Khazraj tribe. But Sa'd bin 'Ubada defended his tribe, saying they couldn't kill him. The two tribes were about to fight when the Prophet intervened and calmed them down. Aisha was still sad and crying when the Prophet came to her and said that if she was innocent, Allah would soon declare it. If she had sinned, she should repent and ask for forgiveness. Aisha's mother asked the Prophet to talk on her behalf, but he said he wouldn't believe her if she denied the accusations or believed her if she confessed falsely. Aisha then compared herself to Joseph's father, who said patience was best in such situations. She turned away from her bed, hoping Allah would prove her innocence. Suddenly, the Prophet got a revelation that declared Aisha's innocence. He was sweating and smiling when he told Aisha the news. Abu Bakr stopped helping Mistah bin Uthatha because of his role in spreading the accusations, but later Allah revealed a verse forgiving those who forgive others. The Prophet (ﷺ) also asked Zainab bint Jahsh about Aisha, and she said she knew nothing except goodness about her.

title: Praising Others with Care
content: Abu Bakra said a man praised another in front of the Prophet. The Prophet (ﷺ) said, 'You're hurting your friend's feelings by praising him too much.' He repeated this several times and then said, 'If you must praise someone, say what you think about them. Say something like,

title: Don't Overpraise Someone
content: The Prophet (ﷺ) heard someone giving a lot of praise to another person. He said, 'You have hurt this person by praising them too much.'

title: Ibn Umar's Experience
content: Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) called me when I was 14 years old to meet him before the battle of Uhud. He didn't let me join the fight, but two years later at the age of 15, he allowed me to participate in the battle of the Trench. Later, a Caliph named `Umar bin `Abdul `Aziz said that being 15 is when children become adults and started paying soldiers who reached this age.

title: Friday Bathing is Compulsory
content: The Prophet (ﷺ) said that people who have grown up must take a bath on Fridays.

title: False Oath Brings Anger
content: Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) said: If someone takes a false oath to get something that belongs to another Muslim, Allah will be angry with them when they meet Him. This happened to Al-Ash'ath who took a Jew to the Prophet for a dispute over land. The Prophet (ﷺ) asked for evidence and then told the Jew to take an oath. But Al-Ash'ath was worried this would happen. And it did. Allah revealed: 'Those who trade their faith for worldly gain will face Allah's anger'.

title: Lying to Get Something
content: Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) said: If someone tells a lie to get something that belongs to another Muslim, Allah will be angry with them when they meet Him. Al-Ash'ath said this happened to him. He had a dispute over land with a Jewish man who wouldn't give it back. The Prophet (ﷺ) asked if he had any proof. Al-Ash'ath said no. Then the Prophet told the Jew to take an oath, but Al-Ash'ath was worried the Jew would lie and take his property unfairly. This is what Allah revealed: 'Those who trade their faith for a little gain will be punished.'

title: The Prophet's Verdict
content: Ibn Abbas said that the Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) gave his decision based on a person's oath in court.

title: False Oaths and Punishment
content: Abdullah bin Masud said: If someone takes a false oath to get something that doesn't belong to them, Allah will be angry with them when they meet Him. The Quran says: 'Those who trade their faith for worldly gain and break their oaths... will face a painful punishment.' Al-Ashath bin Qais came to us and said, 'What is Abdullah saying?' We told him what we heard. He said, 'He's telling the truth. This verse was revealed because of me. I had a dispute with someone and our case went to the Prophet. The Prophet (ﷺ) said,

title: False Oaths and Punishment
content: Abdullah bin Mas'ud said that if someone takes a false oath to get something they don't deserve, Allah will be angry with them when they meet Him. The Quran says those who trade their promise to Allah for some gain will face a painful punishment (3:77). Al-Ash'ath bin Qais came to Abdullah and asked what he was saying. Abdullah explained that the verse in the Quran was revealed about him. He had been in a dispute with someone, and when they went to the Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ), the Prophet said to produce two witnesses or take an oath. Abdullah said the defendant would surely lie, but the Prophet warned that taking a false oath for property is wrong. Allah then revealed the verse confirming what the Prophet had said.

title: Hilal Accuses His Wife
content: Ibn Abbas said: Hilal accused his wife of having an affair with Sharik. The Prophet (ﷺ) told him to prove it, or he would be punished. Hilal asked if someone should look for proof when they see their wife with another man. The Prophet (ﷺ) again told him to prove it, and then mentioned the law about Lian from the Quran.

title: Three People Allah Will Not Forgive
content: Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) said there are three people who will not be forgiven by Allah. They are: a man who has extra water but doesn't give it to travelers, a man who makes a promise to a Muslim leader only for what he can get from him, and a man who buys something after the afternoon prayer without checking if the seller is telling the truth.

title: Lying to Get Something
content: The Prophet (ﷺ) said, 'If someone takes a false oath just to get something that doesn't belong to them, Allah will be angry with them when they meet Him.'

title: Taking Oaths in Order
content: The Prophet (ﷺ) asked some people to take an oath. They rushed forward quickly. The Prophet (ﷺ) then decided that they should draw lots to see who would take the oath first.

title: False Oath and Usury
content: A man in the market made a false promise about his goods. He said he had been offered more money than he really was. Allah revealed a verse saying that people who lie to get more money will be punished. This person is also called a usurer, which means they eat interest on loans.

title: False Oaths and Allah's Anger
content: Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) said: If someone takes a false oath to get something that belongs to another person, Allah will be angry with them when they meet. This is what the Quran says in Surah Imran, Verse 77: Those who break their promises and take false oaths will face a painful punishment.

title: False Oaths Bring Anger
content: The Prophet (ﷺ) said that if someone takes a false oath to get something from another person, Allah will be angry with them when they meet. This is what the Quran says: 'Those who trade their faith for worldly gain and break their promises will face painful punishment.' A man named Al-Ash'ath was involved in this situation.

title: What Islam Requires
content: A man asked the Prophet about what it means to be a Muslim. The Prophet (ﷺ) said you must pray five times a day and night, every 24 hours. The man asked if there were more prayers he had to do. The Prophet (ﷺ) said no, but you can choose to pray extra if you want. He also told him that during Ramadan, he should fast from food and drink. The man asked about fasting other days, and the Prophet said no, but you can choose to fast extra if you want. Then the Prophet talked about giving money to help those in need. The man asked if there was anything else he had to give, and the Prophet said no, but you can choose to give more if you want. The man left saying he would only do what the Prophet told him to do.

title: Swearing Oaths to Allah
content: The Prophet (ﷺ) said, 'If you need to make a promise, swear by Allah or stay quiet.' Don't swear by anyone else but Allah.

title: Don't be fooled by tricks
content: The Prophet (ﷺ) said: When you come to me with a problem, some of you might speak more convincingly than others. If I make a mistake and give the wrong person something because they spoke well, it's like giving them something that will bring harm. Don't take it.

title: Heraclius Recognizes Muhammad's Qualities
content: Abu Sufyan told Abdullah bin Abbas that Heraclius asked him about what Muhammad (ﷺ) taught. Abu Sufyan said Muhammad (ﷺ) ordered them to pray, tell the truth, be chaste, keep promises, and pay back debts. Heraclius agreed these were qualities of a prophet.

title: Signs of a Hypocrite
content: Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) said: A hypocrite shows three signs. Firstly, they lie when speaking. Secondly, they are not honest with what is trusted to them. Thirdly, they do not keep their promises.

title: Abu Bakr Pays Debt
content: After the Prophet died, Abu Bakr said to the people: 'If you have a claim against the Prophet or he promised you something, come and tell us.' Jabir bin Abdullah went to him. The Prophet (ﷺ) had promised Jabir three amounts of money. Abu Bakr counted out five hundred gold pieces for each amount.

title: Moses' Prayer Period
content: A Jewish man asked me about Moses. He wanted to know which of two prayer periods Moses completed. I didn't know, so I went to Ibn Abbas, a wise Arab scholar. He said Moses finished the longer and better period. Ibn Abbas also told me that prophets always keep their promises.

title: Asking People About Islam
content: Ibn Abbas said: 'You Muslims ask the people of other scriptures for information. But your Quran is the latest message from Allah and it's not been changed. Allah told you that these people altered their own scriptures to get benefits. So, isn't the knowledge in your Quran enough to stop you asking them? I've never seen anyone from those scriptures asking about what was revealed to you.'

title: Following Allah's Orders
content: The Prophet (ﷺ) said: Imagine people on a boat. Some sit at the top and some at the bottom. The ones below have to walk past those above to get water, which annoys them. One person from the lower part starts making a hole in the boat with an axe. When asked why, he says it's because they're troubled by him coming up for water. If they stop him, everyone will be safe. But if they let him do what he wants, everyone will sink.

title: Uthman's Death and Burial
content: Um Al-Ala said that when the Ansar drew lots to decide who would host the emigrants, Uthman bin Mazun was chosen. He stayed with Um Al-Ala and her family, but he got sick and died. They wrapped his body in clothes, and the Prophet came to their house. Um Al-Ala said, 'I testify that Allah has blessed you.' The Prophet (ﷺ) asked, 'How do you know this?' Um Al-Ala replied, 'I don't know.' The Prophet (ﷺ) said, 'As for Uthman, he has died, but I wish him well. Yet, even as a Messenger, I don't know what will happen to him.' Um Al-Ala said she would never again praise anyone's piety after this. She was sad because of the Prophet's words.

title: The Prophet's Journey Planning
content: When the Prophet wanted to travel, he would draw lots among his wives. He'd choose one wife for each journey. Each of his wives had a special day and night when she was with him. But Sauda gave her own turn to Aisha so that the Prophet could spend time with her.

title: Value of Leading Prayer
content: Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) said: If people knew how good it is to lead the prayer and stand in the front row, they would do anything to get that chance. They would even draw lots for it if needed. People would run to pray at noon if they knew its value. They would crawl to pray at dawn and night if they understood its importance.

title: Prophet's Prayer Dispute
content: There was a disagreement between some people from the tribe of Bani `Amr bin `Auf. The Prophet (ﷺ) went to help them make peace. When it was time for prayer, he didn't arrive on time. Bilal called out to pray, but the Prophet still wasn't there. He asked Abu Bakr to lead the prayer instead. Abu Bakr agreed and started praying with the people. Meanwhile, the Prophet walked into the rows until he reached the front row. The people clapped loudly, which was unusual during prayer. Abu Bakr didn't normally look around while praying, but when he saw the Prophet standing behind him, he stopped and waited for the Prophet's signal. The Prophet (ﷺ) beckoned him to continue praying where he was. After Abu Bakr finished his part of the prayer, he stepped back and let the Prophet lead the rest of the prayer. When they finished, the Prophet told them that clapping during prayer is only allowed for women. If something unexpected happens during prayer, men should say 'Subhan Allah' (Glorified be Allah) to get everyone's attention. He also asked Abu Bakr why he didn't continue leading the prayer when the Prophet signaled him to do so. Abu Bakr explained that it was not fitting for him to lead prayer in front of the Prophet.

title: Abdullah bin Ubai's Dispute
content: Anas said the Prophet went to see Abdullah bin Ubai. He rode a donkey and Muslims walked with him on a salty road. When they arrived, Abdullah told the Prophet to leave because of his donkey's smell. An Ansari man defended the Prophet by saying his donkey's smell was better than Abdullah's. This made one of Abdullah's friends angry, and he argued with the Ansari man. They started fighting with sticks, shoes, and hands. The Quran says: 'If two groups of believers fight, make peace between them.'

title: Telling Good News is Not Lying
content: Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) said: 'If someone helps people by sharing good news or saying something kind, they are not lying.'

title: Mediation in Quba
content: Sahl bin Sa'd told us that the people of Quba were fighting with each other. They even threw stones at each other. When the Prophet heard about it, he said, 'Let's go and help them make peace.'

title: Aisha's Story About Marriage
content: Aisha said that if a woman is worried her husband might be unhappy with her or want to leave her because of something, like getting older, and she asks him not to divorce her but instead take care of her as he likes, there is no blame on them if they agree to this.

title: Bedouin's Son and the Law
content: A bedouin came to the Prophet. He said, 'Judge between us according to Allah's Laws.' The other man agreed. The bedouin explained that his son had an affair with another man's wife. People told him to stone his son to death, but he paid a ransom instead - 100 sheep and a slave girl. Scholars later said the son should get 100 lashes and be exiled for a year. The Prophet (ﷺ) said: 'I will judge according to Allah's Laws.' He ordered the bedouin to take back the slave girl and the sheep. The son got 100 lashes and one year exile. Then, the Prophet told someone named Unais to stone the other man's wife to death.

title: Bedouin's Son and the Law
content: A man from the desert came to the Prophet. He said, 'Judge us according to Allah's laws.' His opponent agreed. The bedouin explained that his son had worked for this man and had an affair with his wife. People told him to stone his son to death, but he paid a ransom instead - 100 sheep and a slave girl. Scholars later said the son should be lashed 100 times and exiled for a year. The Prophet (ﷺ) agreed with them. He then told someone to go and stone the woman to death.

title: Don't Add New Rules
content: Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) said to Aisha: If someone invents a new rule that's not in the Quran or Hadith, it's not accepted.

title: Peace Treaty at Hudaibiya
content: After a peace treaty with the people of Hudaibiya, Prophet Muhammad 's (ﷺ) companion Ali wrote it down. He included 'Muhammad (ﷺ), Allah's Messenger (ﷺ)' in the document. The pagans said this would be strange if he were truly a prophet. They wouldn't fight him then. Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) asked Ali to erase it, but Ali refused. So, Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) erased it himself and made peace with them. As part of the deal, he and his companions could enter Mecca with their swords in cases for three days.

title: Prophet Muhammad's Treaty with Mecca
content: When the Prophet wanted to visit Mecca in a special month, the people of Mecca wouldn't let him in. They made him promise not to stay longer than three days. A document was written with their agreement. But they didn't want it to say 'Allah's Messenger (ﷺ)' because they didn't believe he was a prophet. The Prophet (ﷺ) agreed to change it and wrote: 'This is what Muhammad (ﷺ) bin Abdullah has agreed upon.' He promised not to bring arms into Mecca, and no one from Mecca could go with him unless they wanted to stay in Mecca themselves. When the three days were over, the people of Mecca asked the Prophet to leave. The Prophet 's (ﷺ) companions argued about who should take care of a young girl whose father was Hamza, the Prophet's uncle. The Prophet (ﷺ) said she should be given to her aunt, because an aunt is like a mother. He also praised his companions: Ali was like a brother to him, Ja'far looked like him and had good character, and Zaid was their brother in faith.

title: Hudaibiya Peace Treaty
content: On the day of Hudaibiya, the Prophet made a peace treaty with the polytheists. The three conditions were: 1. He would return any person from the polytheists who came to him. 2. The polytheists wouldn't send back any Muslims who went to them. 3. The next year, he and his companions could come to Makkah for three days with their swords and other weapons. Abu Jandal was brought to the Prophet, but since he was a Muslim, the Prophet returned him to the polytheists.

title: Prophet Muhammad's Visit to Ka'ba
content: Ibn Umar said that the Prophet went to visit the Ka'ba in Mecca. But the people of Quraish stopped him from going inside. So, he made a sacrifice and had his head shaved at Al-Hudaibiya. He agreed with them that next year he would visit the Ka'ba again and only bring a sword for protection. The Prophet (ﷺ) kept this promise and visited the Ka'ba the following year. He entered Mecca as agreed and stayed there for three days. Then, the people of Quraish told him to leave, so he did.

title: Abdullah and Muhaiyisa Visit Khaibar
content: Two men, Abdullah bin Sahl and Muhaiyisa bin Mas'ud, went to the town of Khaibar. They had a peace treaty with the Muslims.

title: Girl's Tooth Compensation
content: Anas said: A girl's tooth was broken by Ar-Rabi', the daughter of An-Nadr. Her relatives asked for compensation and forgiveness, but were refused.
