content: 'Umair went to 'Ubada bin As-Samit in Hims. He asked about the Prophet's words on Paradise. Um Haram said she heard the Prophet say, 'The first group of my followers who go on a naval expedition will get Paradise.' She asked if she would be among them and the Prophet replied yes. Later, he said the first army to invade Caesar's City would be forgiven their sins. When Umair asked again, the Prophet said no.

title: Fight with the Jews
content: Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) said: You will fight with the Jews until some of them hide behind stones. The stones will tell you where they are, so kill them.

title: Fight with the Jews
content: Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) said: The Day of Judgment won't come until Muslims fight against the Jewish people. If a Jew hides behind a rock, the rock will say to the Muslim, 'There's a Jew hiding here, kill him'.

title: Fighting People in Strange Shoes
content: The Prophet (ﷺ) said: 'One of the signs that the Day of Judgment is near will be when you fight against people wearing shoes made from animal hair. Another sign will be fighting against people with broad faces, who look like they have shields on their faces.'

title: Fighting the Turks
content: Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) said: The Day of Judgment will not come until Muslims fight against the Turks. They have small eyes, red faces, and flat noses. Their faces look like shields covered with leather. It will also happen when you fight people who wear shoes made from hair.

title: Signs of the End Times
content: The Prophet (ﷺ) said that before the Day of Judgment, there will be a battle with people wearing shoes made from hair. Another sign is fighting against people whose faces look like shields covered in leather. They will have small eyes and flat noses.

title: Battle of Hunain: The Prophet's Leadership
content: A man asked Al-Bara', 'Did you all run away on the day of the battle?' He replied, 'No. Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) didn't run away. His young companions were attacked by archers and they started to retreat towards him. The Prophet (ﷺ) was riding a white mule, led by Abu Sufyan bin Al-Harith. He got off the mule, prayed for victory, and said, 'I am the true Prophet, son of Abdul Muttalib.' Then he organized his companions into rows.

title: Battle of Al-Ahzab
content: On the day of the Battle of Al-Ahzab, Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) said to Allah: 'Fill their homes and graves with fire. They kept us busy so much that we couldn't pray until sunset.'

title: Prophet's Prayers for Protection
content: The Prophet (ﷺ) used to say: 'O Allah, save Salama bin Hisham. O Allah, save Al-Walid bin Al-Walid. O Allah, save `Aiyash bin Rabi`a. O Allah, protect weak Muslims. O Allah, be harsh on the Mudar tribe. O Allah, bring them years of famine like those in Prophet Joseph's time.'

title: Prophet's Prayer Against Enemies
content: Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) prayed for the defeat of Al-Ahzab. He said, 'O Allah, you who sent down the Book and are quick to judge, defeat Al-Ahzab, O Allah, defeat them and shake their strength.'

title: Prophet's Prayer Disrupted
content: One day, Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) was praying near the Kaaba. Some men from Quraysh sent someone to bring the stomach contents of a slaughtered camel and threw them over him. His daughter Fatima came and removed them. The Prophet (ﷺ) then said, 'God, destroy these people!' He mentioned six specific men: Abu Jahl, Utba, Shaiba, Al-Walid, Ubai, and Uqba.

title: Cursing the Jews
content: Some Jewish people came to see the Prophet. They said something bad about him. I, Aisha, cursed them. The Prophet (ﷺ) asked me what was wrong. I told him what they had said. He replied that he had already answered them with the same words.

title: Allah's Messenger Writes to Caesar
content: Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) wrote a letter to the leader of Rome. He said: 'If you don't accept Islam, you will be responsible for the sins of your people.'

title: Praying for Guidance
content: Some people from the tribe of Daus came to the Prophet and asked him to pray against their family because they refused to follow Islam. The Prophet (ﷺ) prayed, 'O Allah, guide the people of Daus and help them become Muslim.'

title: Prophet Muhammad's Seal
content: Anas said the Prophet wanted to write a letter to the Byzantine ruler. He was told they wouldn't read it unless it had a seal. So, the Prophet got a silver ring and stamped on it 'Muhammad (ﷺ), Apostle of Allah'.

title: Prophet's Letter to Khusrau
content: The Prophet (ﷺ) sent a letter to Khusrau through his messenger. The Governor of Bahrain was supposed to give it to Khusrau, but when he read the letter, he tore it up. The Prophet (ﷺ) then prayed for Allah to punish them severely.

title: Caesar Meets the Prophet
content: Abdullah bin Abbas said that Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) sent a letter to Caesar with Dihya Al-Kalbi. The letter invited Caesar to become Muslim and promised safety for him and his people if he accepted Islam. When the letter reached Caesar, he asked Abu Sufyan about Allah's Messenger (ﷺ). Abu Sufyan told Caesar about the Prophet's family, saying that he was his cousin. Caesar then asked Abu Sufyan questions about the Prophet's teachings and behavior. Abu Sufyan replied that the Prophet taught people to worship only Allah, pray, give charity, be chaste, keep promises, and return what is entrusted to them. Caesar said that these were the qualities of a true prophet and that he would soon conquer the earth. He then asked for the letter and read it. The letter invited Caesar to become Muslim and promised safety for him and his people if he accepted Islam.

title: Caesar Meets the Prophet
content: Abdullah bin Abbas told us that the Prophet sent a letter to Caesar with Dihya Al-Kalbi. The letter invited Caesar to become Muslim. Caesar was grateful for his victory over the Persians and had walked from Hims to Jerusalem as a sign of thanks. When he received the letter, he asked if any Arabs from the Quraish tribe were present. Abu Sufyan bin Harb was in Sham with some merchants from Quraish. Caesar's messenger found them and took Abu Sufyan to meet Caesar. They met in Ilya (Jerusalem), where Caesar sat on his throne surrounded by dignitaries. He asked Abu Sufyan about the Prophet's family, and Abu Sufyan said he was related to him as a cousin. Caesar then asked if anyone else had claimed to be a prophet before the Prophet. Abu Sufyan said no. Caesar asked if the Prophet was truthful or not, and Abu Sufyan said yes. He also asked about the Prophet's followers: were they rich or poor? Abu Sufyan said they were poor. Caesar then asked if anyone who became Muslim would leave Islam, but Abu Sufyan said no. He also asked if the Prophet broke his promises, and Abu Sufyan said no. Finally, he asked what the Prophet ordered them to do: worship Allah alone, pray, give charity, be chaste, keep promises, and return what was entrusted to them. Caesar then read the letter from the Prophet, which invited him to become Muslim and promised a double reward.

title: Giving the Flag to Ali
content: On the day of the battle of Khaibar, the Prophet said he would give the flag to someone who would get Allah's help for victory. His companions wanted to know who it would be. The Prophet (ﷺ) asked for Ali, but was told Ali had eye trouble. So, the Prophet made Ali come in front of him and spat on his eyes. Ali's eyes were cured right away. Then the Prophet said to Ali: 'Fight with them until they become Muslim.' He also told Ali to be patient and invite the enemy to Islam, telling them what Allah wants from them. The Prophet (ﷺ) said that if just one person becomes Muslim because of you, it will be better than getting many red camels.

title: Prophet Muhammad's Battle Strategy
content: Anas said: When the Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) went to fight, he never attacked people until it was almost morning. If he heard someone call out for prayer, he would wait. But if he didn't hear the call, he would attack after dawn. We arrived at Khaibar one night.

title: Prophet Muhammad's Advice
content: Anas said: The Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) told us to walk around the Kaaba seven times. He also said that if someone forgets a prayer, they should pray as soon as they remember it.

title: Prophet Muhammad at Khaibar
content: The Prophet (ﷺ) went to a place called Khaibar. He didn't attack people at night. When it was morning, the Jews came out with their bags and tools. They saw the Prophet and said, 'Here's Muhammad (ﷺ) and his army!' The Prophet (ﷺ) said, 'Allah is Greater' and that Khaibar would be defeated because when we approach an enemy, they will have a bad day.

title: Fight for the Right Faith
content: Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) said, 'I have been told to fight people until they say there is no god but Allah. If someone says this, I will protect their life and property according to Islamic law. Their final reward will be with Allah.'

title: Allah's Messenger's Secret Plans
content: When the Prophet wanted to go on a battle trip, he would sometimes pretend that he was going somewhere else. This way, his enemies wouldn't know where he was really heading.

title: Concealing the Enemy's Path
content: When the Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) planned to go on a trip called a Ghazwa, he would sometimes not tell people where they were really going. This was until the big journey to Tabuk in very hot weather. He had to travel through a desert and fight against many enemies. So, he told the Muslims about their destination so they could prepare for battle. The Prophet (ﷺ) usually set out on trips on Thursdays.

title: Prophet's Travel Preference
content: The Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) went to the Ghazwa of Tabuk on a Thursday. He often preferred to travel on Thursdays.

title: Prophet's Prayers in Medina
content: Anas said the Prophet went to a mosque in Medina and prayed four times. Later, he went to another place called Dhul-Hulaifa and prayed again. He heard his companions reciting a prayer for Hajj or Umra.

title: Hajj: Leaving Ihram Early
content: We were traveling with the Prophet. We wanted to do Hajj only. But he told us who didn't have an animal for sacrifice, to walk around the Ka'ba and between Safa and Marwa, then stop being in a state of Ihram. On the day we would slaughter animals, beef was brought to us. I asked what it was. Someone said the Prophet had already sacrificed a cow on behalf of his wives.

title: Prophet's Fasting in Ramadan
content: Ibn Abbas said the Prophet went on a trip during Ramadan. He kept fasting until he reached a place called Kadid, then broke his fast.

title: Don't Burn People with Fire
content: Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) told us to look for two men from Quraish. If we found them, he said to burn them with fire. But then he changed his mind and said: 'Instead of burning them, if you catch them, just kill them.'

title: Obedience to the Ruler
content: The Prophet (ﷺ) said: It's necessary to listen and follow what the ruler says, unless it goes against Allah's rules. If a rule from Allah is broken, don't follow it.

title: Following the Prophet's Leadership
content: Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) said: 'We are the last but will be the first to enter Paradise. If you obey me, you're obeying Allah. If you disobey me, you're disobeying Allah. The leader is like a safe place for Muslims to seek protection. If the leader orders good and rules fairly, he'll get a reward. But if he does wrong, he'll be responsible.'

title: Following the Prophet's Leadership
content: Abu Huraira said he heard the Prophet say: 'We will enter Paradise last but first in line.' He also said, 'Whoever follows me is following Allah, and whoever disobeys me is disobeying Allah. If you follow your leader, you're following me, and if you don't, you're not. A leader is like a safe place where Muslims should find protection. If the leader tells people to do good and rules fairly, they'll get rewarded for that. But if they do bad things, they'll be responsible.'

title: Pledge of Allegiance in Hudaibiya
content: When we arrived at Hudaibiya the next year, not even two men agreed on which tree was where we gave our pledge of allegiance. This was because of Allah's mercy. The Prophet (ﷺ) asked us to give a pledge, but it wasn't for fighting or dying. He wanted us to be patient.

title: Abdullah bin Zaid's Pledge
content: Abdullah bin Zaid said that a man came to him and told him that Ibn Hanzala was asking people to pledge allegiance for death. Abdullah refused to give his pledge of allegiance to anyone after the Prophet.

title: Salama's Pledge of Allegiance
content: Salama gave the Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) a pledge to follow him. He then moved away and the crowd thinned out. The Prophet (ﷺ) asked Salama again, 'Will you give me your pledge?' Salama said he had already given it once. The Prophet (ﷺ) said, 'Do it again.' So Salama gave his pledge for the second time. Later, Salama asked Abu Muslim why they made this pledge. Abu Muslim replied that they pledged to follow him even after death.

title: Ansar's Loyalty to Prophet
content: On the day of the Battle of the Trench, some Ansar said they had sworn to fight for Islam until they died. The Prophet (ﷺ) replied, 'There is no life after death in this world. So, God, please bless and honor both the Ansar and Emigrants.'

title: Migration Has Passed
content: My brother and I asked the Prophet to take our pledge for migrating. He said migration was no longer possible. We asked what he would accept instead, and he said Islam and fighting in Jihad.

title: Migration Has Passed
content: Mujashi's brother and he went to the Prophet. They asked him to take their pledge for migration. The Prophet (ﷺ) said, 'Migration has ended.' They then asked what they should pledge instead. He replied, 'I will take your pledge for Islam and fighting in a holy war'.

title: Obedience to Allah is Key
content: A man asked me about a wealthy person who joins the army leaders on battles. He does things that are hard for us to do, should we follow him? I said I didn't know what to say, but I remembered when the Prophet was with us. He would only give one order at a time until it was done. If you're unsure about something, ask someone who knows. But soon there will be no one left to ask. The life now is like a pond that has used up all its fresh water and only muddy water remains.

title: Paradise is Under Swords
content: Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) said: 'If you have to fight the enemy, be patient. Know that Paradise is near those who are ready for battle.' He then prayed: 'God, defeat the unbelievers and give us victory'.

title: Paradise is Under Swords
content: Abdullah bin Abi Aufa wrote a letter to Umar. He said that the Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) waited until the sun was not too high in the sky before saying, 'If you face the enemy, be patient.' He added that Paradise is under the shade of swords.

title: Prophet Muhammad Helps a Camerl Owner
content: Jabir bin Abdullah went on a trip with the Prophet. The Prophet (ﷺ) met Jabir while he was riding a tired camel. The Prophet (ﷺ) asked why the camel was tired, and Jabir said it had worked hard. The Prophet (ﷺ) prayed for the camel, and it started moving faster than before. He then offered to buy the camel from Jabir, who agreed. But when the Prophet arrived in Medina, Jabir's uncle scolded him for selling the camel too cheaply. The Prophet (ﷺ) asked if Jabir had married a young or older woman. Jabir said he had chosen an older woman because she could help take care of his younger sisters. When the Prophet got back to Medina, Jabir took the camel and its price to him.

title: Fear in Medina
content: Anas bin Malik said that there was a feeling of fear at Medina. The Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) rode Abu Talha's horse to see what was happening. When he returned, he said they didn't find anything wrong, but the horse was very fast.

title: Allah's Messenger Helps People
content: Anas bin Malik said that one day the people were scared. The Prophet (ﷺ) rode a horse belonging to Abu Talha and went out alone, riding fast. Then others followed him on their horses. When he came back, he told them not to be afraid and said that this horse was very quick. From then on, no other horse ran as fast.

title: Giving to Allah's Cause
content: Umar bin Al-Khattab gave a horse for use in Allah's work. Later he saw it being sold. He asked the Prophet if he could buy it back. The Prophet (ﷺ) said, 'Don't buy it and don't take back your gift of charity.'

title: Umar's Gift Horse
content: Abdullah bin Umar said that Umar gave a horse to be used for Allah's cause. But later, he saw the horse being sold. He asked the Prophet what to do. The Prophet (ﷺ) told him not to buy it and not to take back his gift.

title: Prophet's Wish to Fight
content: The Prophet (ﷺ) said: If I didn't think it would be hard for my followers, I wouldn't stay behind any group of soldiers. I don't have enough camels to carry them, and it's not easy for me that they stay behind me. I wish I could fight for Allah and die as a martyr, then come back to life again and do it all over.

title: Giving in Jihad
content: I went on the Tabuk journey with the Prophet. I gave a young camel to help in the fight, which made me happy. Later, I had a worker who argued with someone else and they got into a fight. One of them bit the other's hand and pulled out his front tooth. The injured person took the other to see the Prophet, but he refused to get involved, saying, 'Don't expect him to put out his hand for you to bite.'

title: Qais Prepares for Hajj
content: When Qais bin Sa'd Al-Ansari was planning to go on a pilgrimage, he brushed his hair before leaving.

title: 'Ali Takes the Flag
content: 'Ali was sick during a battle. He didn't want to miss it, so he joined the Prophet. The Prophet (ﷺ) said someone loved by Allah and him would take the flag tomorrow. 'Ali arrived unexpectedly. The Prophet (ﷺ) gave him the flag instead. 'Ali led the army to victory.

title: Fixing the Flag's Position
content: Al Abbas told Az-Zubair that the Prophet ordered him to place the flag in a specific spot.

title: Prophet Muhammad's Gift
content: Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) said, 'I was sent with messages that are easy to understand but have big meanings. I've been given power over my enemies, and while sleeping, I was given the keys to the world's treasures.'

title: Abu Sufyan Meets Heraclius
content: Ibn Abbas told me that Abu Sufyan was in Jerusalem. The Roman Emperor Heraclius called him to meet. He asked for a letter from the Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ). When he read it, there was a big commotion around him. People were shouting and making noise. They asked Abu Sufyan and his friends to leave. On their way out, Abu Sufyan said, 'The people are now aware of who Ibn Abi Kabsha is. The Roman Emperor is afraid of the Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ).'

title: Asma Prepares Food for the Prophet
content: Asma was preparing food for the Prophet when he planned to leave Mecca. She couldn't find anything to tie the food bag and water container with, so she asked Abu Bakr if she could use her belt. He said yes, but told her to cut it in two pieces. Asma did this and used one piece to tie the water container and the other for the food bag.

title: Food from Sacrificed Animals
content: During the time of Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ), we would take meat from sacrificed animals to Medina as food for our journey.

title: Prophet's Simple Meal at Khaibar
content: Suwaid bin An-Nu'man went out with the Prophet during a campaign. They reached a place called As-Sahba'. The Prophet (ﷺ) asked for food, but all they had was Sawiq (a type of barley). They chewed it and ate it, then drank water. After eating, the Prophet washed his mouth, and everyone else did too. Then they offered their prayer.

title: Food Shortage in Madinah
content: One day, the people's food supply ran out. They asked the Prophet for permission to kill their camels for meat. He agreed. When 'Umar found out, he was worried about what they would eat after the camels were gone. So, he went to the Prophet and asked him the same question. The Prophet (ﷺ) said, 'Tell everyone to bring any remaining food they have.' They brought it all and the Prophet blessed it with a prayer. Then people filled their containers from the food until they were full. After that, the Prophet said, 'I swear there is no one worthy of worship but Allah, and I am His Messenger'.

title: Jabir's Journey to the Sea
content: Jabir bin Abdullah and his group of three hundred men were traveling. They carried their food on their shoulders, eating only one date each day. A man asked Jabir how they could be satisfied with just one date a day. Jabir said that when they reached the sea shore, they found a huge fish washed up. They ate as much of it as they wanted for eighteen days.

title: Aisha's Umra Concern
content: Aisha told the Prophet that her companions were going back with rewards for both Hajj and Umra. She was only getting reward for Hajj. The Prophet (ﷺ) said, 'Let your brother take you to Tan'im so you can do an extra Umra.' He waited at a high point in Mecca until Aisha returned.

title: Prophet's Order for Aisha
content: The Prophet (ﷺ) told me to let Aisha sit behind me on the animal and then she could do a special Umra from Tan'im.

title: Reciting Talbiyah on the Way
content: I was riding a camel with Abu Talha. The Prophet 's (ﷺ) companions were reciting 'Talbiya' out loud for both Hajj and Umrah.

title: Prophet Muhammad Rides Donkey
content: Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) rode a donkey with a velvet-covered saddle. Usama bin Zaid rode behind him on the donkey.

title: Prophet Enters the Ka'ba
content: On the day of the Conquest of Mecca, Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) rode his camel into the city with Usama behind him. Bilal and Uthman were also with them. They stopped in front of the mosque, and the Prophet ordered Uthman to bring the key for the Ka'ba. The door was opened, and the Prophet went inside with Usama, Bilal, and Uthman. He stayed there for a while. When he came out, many people rushed to enter the Ka'ba. Abdullah bin Umar was the first to go in and found Bilal waiting at the door. Abdullah asked Bilal where the Prophet had prayed, and Bilal pointed to the spot. But Abdullah forgot to ask how many prayers the Prophet had performed.

title: Daily Acts of Charity
content: Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) said: We must give thanks to Allah every day the sun rises. This means being fair in our judgments, helping others with their animals or luggage, speaking kindly, going to pray on time, and removing obstacles from paths.

title: Don't Travel with Quran
content: Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) told Abdullah bin Umar not to travel to a country that is against Islam while carrying copies of the Quran.

title: Prophet Muhammad at Khaibar
content: The Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) arrived at Khaibar in the morning. The people were leaving their homes carrying tools over their shoulders. When they saw him, they ran to a fort for safety. The Prophet (ﷺ) raised his hands and said, 'God is greater! Khaibar will be destroyed.' We found donkeys and cooked them for food. But then we heard that God and the Prophet forbade eating donkey meat. So, we threw away all the pots with their contents.

title: Respect Allah in Prayer
content: Abu Musa and his friends were with the Prophet during Hajj. When they stood on high places, they would shout 'There's no God but Allah!' Their voices could be heard from far away. The Prophet (ﷺ) said, 'Be careful how loud you are. You're not calling a deaf person or someone who can't hear you. Allah is always listening and very close to us.'

title: Jabir's Prayer on Hills
content: When we went up a hill, Jabir said, 'Allah is greater.' When we came down, he said, 'Glory be to Allah'.

title: Walking Up and Down
content: Jabir said that when they went up a place, they would say 'Allahu Akbar' (God is great). And when they went down, they would say 'Subhan Allah' (Glory be to God).

title: Returning from Hajj
content: When the Prophet returned from a trip to Mecca or Medina, he would say 'Allahu Akbar' three times. If he walked through mountains or open land, he said: 'There is no god but Allah, alone and all-powerful. All power belongs to Him, and He deserves all praise. We are returning, repentant, worshiping, praying, and praising our Lord. Allah kept His promise, gave victory to His servant, and defeated the enemy.'

title: Reward for Traveling Muslims
content: Abu Burda was traveling with Yazid. Abu Burda asked Yazid why he fasted when they were on a journey. Yazid said he had heard the Prophet say that if someone is ill or traveling, they get the same reward as if they were doing good things at home.

title: Prophet's Trust in Zubair
content: During the Battle of the Trench, the Prophet asked for a volunteer to scout ahead. Az-Zubair offered three times. The Prophet (ﷺ) said that every prophet has a special helper, and his helper is Az-Zubair.

title: Traveling Alone at Night
content: The Prophet (ﷺ) said, 'If people knew how safe I know traveling alone to be, no one would travel by themselves at night.'

title: Usama bin Zaid's Answer
content: Usama bin Zaid was asked about the Prophet's speed during his last Hajj. He said the Prophet rode at a normal pace, but when he found an open road, he went faster.

title: Abdullah bin Umar's Journey
content: I was traveling with Abdullah bin Umar to Mecca. He got news that his wife Safiya was very sick, so he walked faster. When it got dark, we stopped and prayed Maghrib and Isha prayers together. Abdullah said, 'The Prophet (ﷺ) used to delay the Maghrib prayer when he was in a hurry on a journey, and pray both prayers together.'

title: Travel is a Test
content: Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) said: 'Traveling can be hard. It makes it difficult to sleep, eat, and drink properly. When you finish your work, go back to your family quickly.'

title: Umar's Gift Horse
content: `Umar gave a horse to help the Prophet. He saw it being sold and wanted to buy it back. The Prophet (ﷺ) said, 'Don't buy it. You can't take back what you gave as charity.'

title: Don't Buy Back a Gift
content: Umar bin Al-Khattab gave a horse to someone for Allah's cause. He wanted to buy it back because he thought the person would sell it cheaply. The Prophet (ﷺ) said, 'Do not buy it, even if you can get it for one Dirham. If someone takes back their gift, it's like a dog eating its own vomit.'

title: Take Care of Your Parents
content: A man asked the Prophet for permission to go fight in a battle. The Prophet (ﷺ) asked if his parents were still alive. When he said yes, the Prophet told him to take care of them instead.

title: Cutting Necklaces from Camels
content: Abu Bashir was with the Prophet on a trip. The Prophet (ﷺ) sent a message saying: 'Don't let camels wear necklaces around their necks, cut them off.'

title: Traveling with a Mahram
content: The Prophet (ﷺ) said that it's not allowed for a man to be alone with a woman. A woman should only travel with a close family member, like her husband or father. If a man is going on a trip and his wife wants to go on Hajj, he can take her.

title: Hatib's Letter to the Meccans
content: 'Ali told me that Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) sent him and two others to a place called Rawdat Khakh. They were looking for a woman with a letter. When they found her, she said she didn't have any letter. They asked her again and threatened to take off her clothes if she didn't give it to them. She took the letter out of her hair. The letter was from Hatib bin Abi Balta'a to some Meccan pagans. It told them about Allah's Messenger 's (ﷺ) plans. When they got back, Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) asked Hatib what he had done. Hatib said he did it because he didn't have any relatives in Mecca, but the other Muslims did. He wanted to help his friends by giving them information, not because he didn't believe in Islam. Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) said that was true. 'Umar wanted to kill Hatib, but Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) said no. He reminded everyone that Hatib had fought at Badr and maybe Allah had already forgiven him.

title: Prophet's Kindness at Badr
content: On the day of the battle of Badr, prisoners were brought to the Prophet. One prisoner was Al-Abbas, who had no clothes on. The Prophet (ﷺ) looked for a shirt for him and found one belonging to Abdullah bin Ubai. He let Al-Abbas wear it, even though it meant taking off his own shirt.

title: Ali Receives the Flag
content: The Prophet (ﷺ) said he would give the flag to someone who loved Allah and him. Everyone wondered who it would be. The next morning, they all hoped it was them. The Prophet (ﷺ) asked for Ali, but he was sick with an eye problem. The Prophet (ﷺ) cured Ali's eyes by spitting on them and praying for healing. Then he gave Ali the flag. Ali said, 'Should I fight until they become Muslim?' The Prophet (ﷺ) replied, 'Go patiently, then invite them to Islam and tell them what is required of them.'

title: Those Who Enter Paradise
content: The Prophet (ﷺ) said that Allah is surprised by people who will go to Heaven while wearing chains. This means they were punished for their sins, but still got into Heaven because of Allah's mercy and forgiveness.

title: Double Reward for Good Actions
content: The Prophet (ﷺ) said that three people will get a double reward. One is someone who teaches and educates their slave girl well, then sets her free and marries her. Another is a person from the scriptures who believes in Islam. The third is a slave who obeys Allah's rules and is kind to their master.

title: Attacking Enemy at Night
content: The Prophet (ﷺ) was asked if it's okay to attack the enemy at night. He said that women and children are part of their group, so they should be protected too. He also mentioned that 'Hima' is only allowed for Allah or His Messenger.

title: Prophet Disapproves Killing Women
content: During a battle, the Prophet saw a woman who had been killed. He said it's not right to kill women and children.

title: No Killing Women or Children
content: During one of the battles led by Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ), a woman was found dead. He said that women and children should not be killed.

title: Don't Burn People
content: Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) sent us on a mission. He told us to find two people and burn them with fire. But then he said, 'It's Allah who punishes with fire.' So, if we found them, we should just kill them.

title: Ali's Punishment of People
content: Ali burned some people. Ibn Abbas heard about it and said he wouldn't have done the same thing because the Prophet said, 'Don't punish anyone with Allah's punishment.' He would have killed them instead because the Prophet said, 'If a Muslim stops being a Muslim, kill him'.

title: Eight Men from 'Ukl Tribe
content: Anas bin Malik told us that eight men from the tribe of 'Ukl came to the Prophet. They didn't like the weather in Medina, so they asked for milk. The Prophet (ﷺ) suggested joining a herd of camels and drinking their milk and urine as medicine. They did this until they got better. Then they killed the camel's shepherd and took the camels. After that, they stopped believing in Islam. When the Prophet found out what happened, he sent men to catch them. Before sunrise, they were brought back. The Prophet (ﷺ) had their hands and feet cut off. He then used hot nails to blind them. They asked for water but didn't get any until they died.

title: Ants and the Prophet
content: Abu Hurairah said he heard the Prophet say: 'An ant bit a prophet. He wanted to burn the ants' home, but Allah told him not to because just one ant had bitten him.'

title: Dhul-Khalasa Destroyed
content: The Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) told Jarir to destroy a house called Dhul-Khalasa. He went with 150 horsemen from the tribe of Ahmas. The Prophet (ﷺ) touched Jarir's chest and prayed for him to be strong and guided. Jarir destroyed the house, sent a message back to the Prophet, and said it was ruined. The Prophet (ﷺ) asked Allah to bless the horses and men who helped.

title: Prophet Burns Date Palms
content: Ibn Umar told us that the Prophet burnt the date-palms of Bani An-Nadir as punishment for their disobedience and refusal to follow Islamic law.

title: Abu Rafi' is Killed
content: Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) sent some men to kill Abu Rafi'. One man went into the enemy's fort, pretending to look for a lost donkey. He took the keys and opened the gate at night. When everyone was asleep, he killed Abu Rafi' with his sword. Then he came out, acting like someone who had just helped. The next day, the women started crying loudly. The man went back to Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) and told him what happened.

title: Killing Abu Rafi`
content: Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) sent some Ansar to a man named Abu Rafi`. One of them, `Abdullah bin Atik, went into his house at night and killed him while he was asleep.

title: Waiting for Battle Advice
content: Abdullah bin Abi Aufa wrote a letter to Umar. I read it as his clerk. The Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) said: 'Don't wish to fight the enemy, ask Allah for safety instead. But when you do face them, be patient and remember that Paradise is under the swords.' He then prayed: 'O Allah, defeat them and give us victory over them'.

title: Waiting for Battle
content: Abdullah bin Abi Aufa wrote a letter to Umar. I read it as his clerk. It said that the Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) waited until the sun was low in the sky before he stood up and told people not to want to fight the enemy, but when they did, be patient. He reminded them that Paradise is near when we are ready for battle. Then he prayed: 'God, you send down your book and move clouds. Defeat our enemies and give us victory.'

title: Be Patient in Battle
content: The Prophet (ﷺ) said: 'Don't wish to fight the enemy. But when you do meet them, be patient.'

title: No Kings After Khosrau
content: Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) said: 'Khosrau will be destroyed. There won't be a new ruler like him. Caesar will also be destroyed and no one like him will come after. You'll use their wealth to help people in need.' He then said, 'War is about being dishonest'.

title: The End of Khosrau and Caesar
content: Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) said: 'Khosrau's kingdom will be destroyed. There won't be another like him. The same thing will happen to Caesar's kingdom. You will use their wealth for Allah's work.' He also said, 'War is a time of trickery'.

title: Allah's Message on War
content: Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) said: 'War is about being honest and truthful.'

title: Deception in War
content: Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) said: 'In war, honesty is not always the best policy. Sometimes you must be deceitful to protect yourself and others.'

title: Muhammad bin Maslama Kills Ka'b
content: Jabir said the Prophet asked who would kill Ka'b bin Al-Ashraf because he had hurt Allah and the Prophet. Muhammad (ﷺ) bin Maslama volunteered to do it. The Prophet (ﷺ) agreed, so Muhammad (ﷺ) went to Ka'b and pretended to ask for charity. He kept talking to Ka'b until he could kill him.

title: Killing Ka'b bin Ashraf
content: Jabir said the Prophet asked who wanted to kill a Jewish man named Ka'b bin Ashraf. Muhammad (ﷺ) bin Maslama volunteered and the Prophet agreed. Then, Muhammad (ﷺ) bin Maslama asked if he could say what he liked about his plan. The Prophet (ﷺ) gave him permission.

title: Muhammad visits Ibn Saiyyad
content: Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) Muhammad (ﷺ) went to visit a man named Ibn Saiyyad. He was accompanied by Ubai bin Ka'b. They found Ibn Saiyyad in a garden with date palms, hiding behind some trees. Ibn Saiyyad was covered in a blanket and making strange noises. His mother saw Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) and told her son who got up. Muhammad (ﷺ) said that if his mother had left him alone, the truth would have been clear.

title: Prophet Muhammad in Battle
content: I saw the Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) on the day of the battle of the Trench. He was carrying earth and his hairy chest was covered with dust. He recited some verses from Abdullah bin Rawaha: 'We wouldn't be guided, give charity or pray without Allah.' The Prophet (ﷺ) raised his voice while saying these words.

title: Prophet's Kindness to Jarir
content: After I became Muslim, the Prophet never hid from me. Whenever he saw me, he would smile and welcome me. One day, I told him that I couldn't ride horses well. He gently patted my chest with his hand and said, 'May Allah make you strong and guide you to what is right'.

title: Prophet Muhammad's Kindness
content: After I became Muslim, the Prophet never hid from me. When he saw me, he would smile and welcome me. One day, I told him that I couldn't ride horses well. He gently patted my chest with his hand and said, 'God, make him steady and guide him.'

title: Treating the Prophet's Wound
content: Some people asked Sahl bin Sa'd about what medicine was used to treat the Prophet's wound. He said, 'I know it better than anyone else.' Ali would bring water in his shield and Fatima would wash the blood off the Prophet's face. Then they put some ash from a burnt mat into the wound.

title: Treat People with Kindness
content: The Prophet (ﷺ) told Mu`adh and Abu Musa to be gentle when dealing with people in Yemen. He said, 'Don't be harsh on them, give them good news, and love each other.'

title: Uhud: The Prophet's Warning
content: The Prophet (ﷺ) appointed Abdullah bin Jubair as the commander of a group of archers. He told them to stay in their place, even if they saw the enemy retreating. If they won, they should still wait for the Prophet's signal before taking any action. But the archers got excited and went after the enemy, leaving their post. They were defeated and had to return. The Prophet (ﷺ) was left with only 12 men, while the enemy killed 70 Muslims. Later, Abu Sufyan asked if the Prophet was present, but he ordered his companions not to answer. When Abu Sufyan asked again, the Prophet told them to say 'Allah is Higher and more Sublime'. Finally, Abu Sufyan boasted about their victory, but the Prophet replied by saying 'Allah is our Helper'.

title: Prophet's Bravery and Generosity
content: One night, the people of Medina were scared because they heard a loud noise. The Prophet (ﷺ) was riding Abu Talha's horse, which was very fast. He told them not to be afraid and said he had found this horse to be quick.

title: Protecting the Prophet's Camels
content: I was on my way to Al-Ghaba when I met a slave of `Abdur-Rahman bin `Auf. He told me that some people from Ghatafan and Fazara had taken the Prophet's camels. I shouted for help, sent three cries, and rushed after them. When I caught up with them, I started throwing arrows at them, saying 'I'm the son of Al-Akwa`'. I saved the camels before they could drink water. When I returned with the camels, the Prophet met me and said, 'You have gained power over your enemy, so forgive them.' He added that those people were now being entertained by their own folk.

title: Al-Bara's Story of Hunain
content: A man asked Al-Bara if he had fled on the day of the battle of Hunain. Al-Bara replied, 'No, Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) did not flee.' He said that Abu Sufyan was holding his mule's reins when they were attacked. The Prophet (ﷺ) dismounted and said, 'I am a prophet, I'm telling the truth. My father is Abdul Muttalib.' On that day, nobody was braver than the Prophet.

title: Sa'd's Judgment on Bani Quraiza
content: Abu Sa'id Al-Khudri said that when the tribe of Bani Quraiza agreed to accept a judgment, the Prophet sent for Sa'd. Sa'd came riding a donkey and sat next to the Prophet. The Prophet (ﷺ) told him that the people were ready to accept his decision. Sa'd said that he thought those who fought should be killed, and their children and women taken as prisoners. The Prophet (ﷺ) then said that Sa'd had made a judgment similar to Allah's own judgment.

title: Prophet Enters Makkah
content: When the Prophet entered Makkah in a year when he conquered it, he was wearing a helmet. When he took it off, someone told him that Ibn Khatal was hiding behind the curtains of the Ka'bah. The Prophet (ﷺ) said, 'Kill him'.

title: Khubaib's Martyrdom
content: Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) sent a group of ten men as spies to Mecca. They were led by 'Asim bin Thabit and included Khubaib-al-Ansari. The infidels from the tribe of Hudhail followed them and found their camp. When they saw each other, 'Asim and his companions went up a high place. The infidels surrounded them and said, 'Come down and we will not kill you.' But 'Asim refused, saying, 'I will not come under the protection of infidels.' They threw arrows at him and six others were martyred. Three men came down, including Khubaib and Ibn Dathina. The infidels captured them and sold them as slaves in Mecca. Khubaib was bought by the sons of Al-Harith bin 'Amir. He had killed Al-Harith on the day of Badr. When it was time for him to be killed, he borrowed a razor from his owner's daughter to shave his pubes. He then took her son and sat him on his thigh, with the razor in his hand. She got scared, but Khubaib reassured her that he would not harm her son. One day, she saw him eating grapes while chained in irons. When they took him out of the Sanctuary to kill him, Khubaib asked for permission to offer two rak'at prayer. He prayed and then said, 'O Allah, kill them all.' The owner's son killed him. Allah fulfilled the invocation of 'Asim bin Thabit on that day. The Prophet (ﷺ) informed his companions about their martyrdom.

title: Help Those in Need
content: The Prophet (ﷺ) said: 'Free people who are being held captive. Feed those who don't have enough food. Visit people who are sick.'

title: Ali's Understanding of Knowledge
content: I asked Ali if he knew any special messages from Allah that aren't in the Quran. He said no, but people can understand things better with Allah's help so they can understand the Quran and other rules like paying money to families of those killed, freeing prisoners, and not killing a Muslim for killing an infidel.

title: Ansari Men Ask for Ransom
content: Some Ansari men asked the Prophet if they could keep some of their nephew Al `Abbas' ransom money. The Prophet (ﷺ) said, 'Don't leave a single Dirham.' Later, Al `Abbas came to the Prophet with some wealth from Bahrain and said he had paid his own and his brother's Aqil's ransom. The Prophet (ﷺ) gave him some of it.

title: The Prophet's Prayer at Badr
content: Jubair said he heard the Prophet reciting Surat-at-Tur during his Maghrib prayer after the Battle of Badr.

title: Killing an Enemy Spy
content: Salama bin Al-Akwa' said: An enemy spy came to the Prophet while he was traveling. The spy sat with the Prophet's companions and talked, then left. The Prophet (ﷺ) told his companions to chase and kill him. Salama killed the spy. After that, the Prophet gave Salama some of the spy's belongings, in addition to his share of the war spoils.

title: Protecting Non-Muslims
content: Umar told his successor to take care of people who aren't Muslims. He said they should keep the agreement made with them, help them stay safe, and not ask for more than they can give.

title: Thursday and the Prophet's Illness
content: Ibn Abbas said Thursday is a special day. He started crying because on this day, the Prophet was very sick. The Prophet (ﷺ) asked for something to be written down so that his companions would never go astray after him. But they disagreed about what he wanted written. They said the Prophet was too sick to talk. The Prophet (ﷺ) told them to leave him alone and let him die in peace. Before he died, the Prophet gave three important orders: get rid of non-Muslims from Arabia, be kind to visitors from other countries like he had been, and do something else that Ibn Abbas forgot.

title: Umar and the Silken Cloak
content: Ibn Umar said that one day, Umar saw a beautiful silken cloak being sold in the market. He brought it to the Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) and suggested he wear it on special occasions like Eid festivals or when meeting delegations. The Prophet (ﷺ) replied that this kind of cloth is worn by people who will not have any reward in the afterlife. Later, the Prophet sent Umar a similar silken cloak, saying he could sell it or use it to meet his needs.

title: Umar meets Ibn Saiyad
content: The Prophet (ﷺ) went with Umar and some companions to a boy named Ibn Saiyad. He was playing outside with other boys. The Prophet (ﷺ) touched Ibn Saiyad's back and asked, 'Do you believe I am the Messenger of God?' Ibn Saiyad said, 'I believe you are the Messenger for those who don't know how to read.' Then he asked the Prophet, 'Do you believe I am a messenger from God?' The Prophet (ﷺ) replied, 'I believe in God and His messengers.' The Prophet (ﷺ) then asked Ibn Saiyad what he saw. Ibn Saiyad said many people visit him, but some are true and some are false. The Prophet (ﷺ) said this was confusing for him. He told the Prophet that he knew something about a man called Ad-Dukh. The Prophet (ﷺ) said this was not right to say. Umar wanted to kill Ibn Saiyad, but the Prophet stopped him, saying if Ibn Saiyad really was the bad person, they couldn't stop him, and if he wasn't, then killing him wouldn't help.

title: The Prophet Warns About Dajjal
content: Ibn Umar told us that the Prophet went to a garden with Ubai bin Ka'b. They were looking for Ibn Saiyad, who was lying in bed covered with a blanket. The Prophet (ﷺ) hid behind some palm trees so he could hear Ibn Saiyad before he saw him. Ibn Saiyad's mother saw the Prophet and told her son, 'Saf!' He got up. The Prophet (ﷺ) said that if his mother had left him alone, he would have revealed more about himself. Then the Prophet stood up and praised Allah. He talked about Dajjal, saying, 'I'm warning you about him.' He said no prophet warned their people without talking about Dajjal. Noah even warned his people about him. The Prophet (ﷺ) said, 'You should know that Dajjal is one-eyed, and Allah is not one-eyed.'

title: The Prophet Warns About Dajjal
content: One day, the Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) went to a garden with his companion Ubai bin Ka'b. They were looking for a man named Ibn Saiyad. When they arrived, the Prophet hid behind some palm trees so he wouldn't be seen first. Ibn Saiyad was lying in bed, and his mother saw the Prophet hiding. She told her son, 'Saf!' (his name). The Prophet (ﷺ) then stood up among the people and praised Allah. He warned them about a man called Ad-Dajjal, saying he would come one day. The Prophet (ﷺ) said that no prophet had ever forgotten to warn their people about Dajjal. He also said that Dajjal is a one-eyed man, but Allah is not one-eyed.

title: Prophet's Stay During Hajj
content: Usama bin Zaid asked the Prophet where he would stay during his Hajj. The Prophet (ﷺ) replied that if 'Aqil had left any house, they would stay there. Instead, they planned to stay at Khaif Bani Kinana, a valley where Quraish and Bani Kinana made an agreement against Bani Hashim.

title: Umar's Advice to Hunai
content: Umar told Hunai, a freed slave, to be fair with Muslims. He said, 'Don't treat them badly and don't make them angry. The prayers of those who are treated unfairly are answered by Allah. Let everyone graze their animals, even if they have just a few. But don't let the livestock of `Abdur-Rahman bin `Auf or `Uthman bin `Affan drink from it. If their animals die, they can use their own farms and gardens to help themselves. But if someone with just a few camels or sheep loses their animals, they will come to me asking for help. It's better to let them have water and grass than to give them money from the Muslims' treasury. These people think I'm being unfair to them. This land is theirs, and they fought for it before Islam came. If I didn't use some of this land for animals that are used in battles for Allah, I wouldn't take any of their land for myself.'

title: Counting Muslim Men
content: The Prophet (ﷺ) told us to list the names of all men who had become Muslims. We found 1,500 men. But then we wondered if we should be worried about being attacked because there were so few of us. The Prophet 's (ﷺ) followers went through hard times and sometimes they even prayed alone in fear.

title: Leave for Hajj Together
content: A man told the Prophet that he was going to war and his wife wanted to go on a pilgrimage. The Prophet (ﷺ) said, 'Go back with your wife and do the pilgrimage together'.

title: A Muslim's True Faith
content: Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) was on a battle trip with his companions. He said one of them was from the people of Hell Fire, but he fought bravely and got hurt. When someone told him the man had died, the Prophet said he would still go to Hell Fire. Later, it turned out the man was alive but badly injured. At night, he lost patience and took his own life. The Prophet (ﷺ) was informed and said 'Allah is Great!' He declared himself a slave of Allah and His Messenger. Then he ordered Bilal to announce that only a true Muslim can enter Paradise, and Allah supports Islam even with someone who disobeys.

title: Prophet's Sermon After Battles
content: The Prophet (ﷺ) delivered a sermon. He talked about the flags being taken by four people: Zaid, Ja`far, Abdullah bin Rawaha, and Khalid bin Al-Walid. Each of them was martyred after taking the flag. The Prophet (ﷺ) said he didn't want those who were martyred to stay alive with us.

title: Betrayal of the Ansar
content: Some tribes came to the Prophet and said they had become Muslim. They asked for help fighting their own people, so the Prophet sent 70 men from Medina to support them. However, these tribes betrayed the Muslims and killed them at a place called Bi'r-Ma'una. The Prophet (ﷺ) then prayed against these tribes in the mosque for one month. A verse from the Quran was read about this event, but it was later removed.

title: Prophet's Stay After Conquest
content: When the Prophet conquered a town, he would stay there for three days.

title: Prophet's Umra Journey
content: Anas said the Prophet went on a special pilgrimage. He started from Al-Ji'rana and gave out money to people after a battle in Hunain.

title: Ibn 'Umar's Lost Horse
content: Nafi' said that Ibn 'Umar's horse ran away and was taken by the enemy. Later, when Muslims defeated them, the horse was returned to Ibn 'Umar while the Prophet was still alive. Another time, a slave of Ibn 'Umar escaped and joined the Byzantines. After Muslims conquered them, Khalid bin Al-Walid brought the slave back to Ibn 'Umar after the Prophet had passed away.

title: Khalid Returns a Slave
content: Nafi' told us that a slave of Ibn `Umar ran away and joined the Byzantine army. Khalid bin Al-Walid caught him and brought him back to his owner, Abdullah bin `Umar. Later, one of Ibn `Umar's horses also escaped and went with the Byzantines. Khalid found it and returned it to its owner.

title: Khalid Returns Ibn Umar's Horse
content: Ibn Umar was riding a horse when the Muslims fought against the Byzantines. Khalid bin Al-Walid, who was leading the Muslim army, had been appointed by Abu Bakr. The enemy took Ibn Umar's horse away, but after they were defeated, Khalid returned it to him.

title: Jabir Invites the Prophet
content: Jabir said to the Prophet, 'I've slaughtered a sheep and ground some barley. I'd like you to join me for food.' The Prophet (ﷺ) replied loudly, 'People of the Trench, Jabir has prepared a meal, come along!'

title: Allah's Messenger and Um Khalid
content: Um Khalid visited the Prophet with her father. She was wearing a yellow shirt. The Prophet (ﷺ) said, 'Good, good!' Um Khalid played with the seal on the Prophet's back. Her father scolded her. The Prophet (ﷺ) told him to leave her alone. Then he prayed for her: 'Wear this dress until it wears out, and then wear it again.' Um Khalid lived a long time wearing that yellow shirt.

title: Al-Hasan and the Date
content: Abu Huraira told us that Al-Hasan bin 'Ali took a date from charity food. The Prophet (ﷺ) said to him, 'Don't eat it! We don't eat what's given in charity.'

title: Don't Carry Excess on Judgment Day
content: The Prophet (ﷺ) stood up and talked about carrying too much wealth or burdens. He said it's a great sin to carry something that will distract you from your prayer on the Day of Resurrection. If someone is carrying sheep, horses, camels, gold, silver, or clothes, they'll ask him for help when he can't assist them because his job was to teach Allah's message.

title: Karkara's Fate After Death
content: Abdullah bin Amr said that a man named Karkara took care of the Prophet's family and belongings. When he died, the Prophet said, 'He is in Hell.' People went to check on him and found a stolen cloak from the war booty where he was buried.

title: Prophet's Advice on Hunger
content: My grandfather was with the Prophet at a place called DhulHulaifa. The people were hungry and they got some camels and sheep as food. But the Prophet was still behind them, so they quickly started cooking. When he arrived, he told them to take the pots off the fire. He then divided the food among them, saying that ten sheep are equal to one camel. One of the camels escaped, but a man shot an arrow at it and stopped it. The Prophet (ﷺ) said that some animals can behave like wild beasts, so if they run away, you should deal with them in the same way. My grandfather asked him, 'What if we meet our enemies tomorrow and don't have knives? Can we use sticks to slaughter our animals?' The Prophet (ﷺ) replied, 'If you use a stick to kill an animal and it bleeds a lot, and you say Allah's Name while doing it, then you can eat its meat. But do not use your teeth or nails to kill the animal.' He explained that using a tooth is like using a bone, which is forbidden, and that Ethiopians use their nails to slaughter animals.

title: Dhul-Khalasa Destroyed
content: Jarir bin Abdullah told me that the Prophet said to him, 'Won't you help me get rid of Dhul-Khalasa?' It was a house where the tribe of Khatham used to stay. Jarir took 150 good horsemen from his tribe and went there. He told the Prophet he couldn't ride horses well, so the Prophet touched his chest with his hand. The Prophet (ﷺ) prayed for him: 'O Allah, make him strong and guided.' Jarir destroyed the house and sent news back to the Prophet. When the messenger arrived, he said, 'The house is now black like a dirty camel.' So the Prophet prayed five times for blessings on the horses of the men from Ahmas.

title: No More Migration
content: After Mecca was conquered, Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) said: 'There's no need to move again. Now it's all about fighting for Islam with good intentions and answering the call when needed.'

title: Mujalid's Pledge to Islam
content: Abu Uthman took his brother Mujalid to the Prophet. He said, 'This is my brother and he wants to give you a promise to follow Islam.' The Prophet (ﷺ) replied, 'There's no need for migration now that Mecca has been conquered. But I will accept his pledge to follow Islam'.

title: Pledge of Allegiance
content: Mujashi took his brother Mujalid to the Prophet. He said, 'This is my brother and he wants to pledge allegiance for migration.' The Prophet (ﷺ) replied, 'There's no more migration after Mecca was conquered, but I'll take his pledge for Islam instead'.

title: Migration After Conquering Mecca
content: `Ata' and `Ubai bin `Umar visited Aisha near a mountain. She said, 'There is no more migration after Allah helped the Prophet win control of Mecca'.

title: Hatib's Letter and Forgiveness
content: Sa'd bin 'Ubaida told Abu Talha that he knew what made Ali want to fight. He said, 'I heard Ali say that the Prophet sent him and Zubair to a place called Ar-Roudah. They were looking for a letter from Hatib. The lady they asked had the letter hidden in her hair. When they found it, they took it back to the Prophet. The Prophet (ﷺ) then spoke with Hatib. Hatib said he hadn't become a disbeliever and his love for Islam was growing. He explained that he wrote the letter because he didn't have any family or property in Mecca like others did, so he wanted to help them take care of it. The Prophet (ﷺ) believed him. Umar wanted to punish Hatib, but the Prophet said maybe Allah had forgiven everyone who fought at Badr.

title: Ibn Zubair Remembers
content: Ibn Az-Zubair asked Ibn Ja`far if he remembered when they went to meet the Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) together with Ibn Abbas. Ibn Ja`far said yes, and Ibn Az-Zubair reminded him that the Prophet made Ibn Abbas and him ride with him while leaving Ibn Ja`far behind.

title: Receiving the Prophet
content: I went with some boys to meet Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) at a place called Thaniyatal-Wada.

title: Returning from Jihad
content: When the Prophet returned from a battle, he would say 'God is Great' three times and add: 'We're returning if God wills. We want to be sorry for what we did, worship Him, thank Him, and bow down to our Lord. God kept His promise and helped His servant, and only He defeated the enemy tribes.'

title: Prophet's Journey to Medina
content: Anas bin Malik was with the Prophet on his way back from Usfan. The Prophet 's (ﷺ) camel slipped and he fell off, taking Safiya bint Huyay with him. Abu Talha jumped down to help them. He covered Safiya with a garment and fixed the camel so they could ride again. When they got close to Medina, the Prophet said, 'We're returning with repentance and worship.' He kept saying this until he entered the city.

title: Prophet's Journey with Safiya
content: Anas and Abu Talha were traveling with the Prophet. His wife Safiya was riding behind him on a camel. The camel slipped, and they both fell down. Abu Talha helped Safiya up and covered her with his garment. He fixed the camel's condition so they could continue their journey. When they got close to Medina, the Prophet said, 'We're returning, being sorry for what happened and praising Allah.'

title: Jabir's Journey with the Prophet
content: I was traveling with the Prophet. When we arrived in Medina, he told me to go into the Mosque and pray two units of prayer.

title: Prophet's Morning Prayer
content: When the Prophet returned from a journey in the morning, he would go to the Mosque and pray two times before sitting down.

title: Prophet Muhammad's Arrival in Medina
content: When Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) arrived in Medina, he slaughtered a camel or a cow. He bought a camel from Jabir for two Uqiyas of gold and one or two Dirhams. When they stopped at Sirar, he ordered a cow to be killed and its meat was eaten. Later, when they arrived in Medina again, the Prophet told Jabir to go to the mosque and pray two times. He also gave Jabir the money for the camel.

title: Jabir's Return from Journey
content: When I came back from a trip, the Prophet told me to pray two units of prayer. We were near Medina, at a place called Sirar.

title: Ali Loses His Camels
content: I, Ali, had two camels that were attacked by Hamza. He cut off their humps and opened their bellies. I was upset and went to the Prophet (peace be upon him). He noticed my sadness and asked what was wrong. I told him about my camels. The Prophet (ﷺ) (peace be upon him) put on a cloak, took me and Zaid with him, and walked to Hamza's house. When they let them in, the Prophet (peace be upon him) scolded Hamza for what he did. But Hamza was drunk and didn't understand. He looked at the Prophet (peace be upon him), then down at his knees, then up again, and finally said 'Aren't you my father's slaves?' The Prophet (ﷺ) (peace be upon him) realized Hamza was drunk and left.

title: Fatima's Inheritance Dispute
content: After the Prophet passed away, Fatima asked Abu Bakr for her share of inheritance from the wealth he had gained without fighting. Abu Bakr said that the Prophet's property was meant to be used for charity and not inherited. Fatima got angry and stopped speaking to Abu Bakr. She kept asking him for her share until she died six months later. Abu Bakr refused to give her the property, saying he wouldn't leave any of the Prophet's traditions behind. Later, 'Umar gave some of the Prophet's property to Ali and Abbas, but kept Khaibar and Fadak under his control.

title: Fatima's Inheritance Dispute
content: After the Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) passed away, his daughter Fatima asked Abu Bakr to give her a share of the wealth he had collected during battles. Abu Bakr said that the Prophet had said their property wouldn't be inherited and would instead be used for charity. Fatima was unhappy with this decision and stopped talking to Abu Bakr until she died six months later. She kept asking for her share, but Abu Bakr refused, saying he didn't want to leave any of the Prophet's traditions behind. Later, when Umar took over, he gave some of the property to Ali and Abbas, but kept Fadak and Khaibar under his control, saying they were meant for charity.

title: Umar's Decision on Fai
content: Malik bin Aus was at home when the messenger of Umar came to him. He went with the messenger and met Umar, who was sitting on a bed made of date-palm leaves. Umar told Malik that some people from his tribe had come to see him and he wanted Malik to take a gift for them and distribute it among their families. Malik didn't want to do this job but Umar insisted. While they were talking, Yarfa' came in and asked if Umar could see `Uthman, `Abdur-Rahman bin `Auf, Az-Zubair, and Sa`d bin Abi Waqqas. Umar said yes and they came in. Later, Yarfa' came again and asked to admit `Ali and `Abbas. They also came in and greeted Umar. `Abbas asked Umar to judge between him and `Ali about the property of Bani An-Nadir, which Allah had given to His Prophet as Fai. Umar said he would talk to them about this matter. He recited some Holy Verses that explained how Allah's Apostle gave a special favor to his followers from the Fai booty. Umar then told `Ali and `Abbas that when Allah took His Prophet unto Him, Abu Bakr became his successor and managed the property in the same way as Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) used to do. Then Allah took Abu Bakr unto Him and Umar became his successor, managing the property for two years before handing it over to `Ali and `Abbas on a condition that they would manage it in the same way as Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) and Abu Bakr used to do.

title: Prophet's Instructions to Abdul-Qais
content: Some people from the tribe of Abdul-Qais came to the Prophet. They said they couldn't visit him because there were other tribes in between them. The Prophet (ﷺ) told them: 'I want you to do four things and not do four others. Do these: believe in Allah, pray regularly, give charity, and fast during Ramadan. Don't use certain cups for making drinks.'

title: Prophet Muhammad's Will
content: The Prophet (ﷺ) said: 'My family should not take any money from my belongings. Whatever I leave behind will be used for charity, except for the expenses of my wives and workers.'

title: Aisha's Story of Barley
content: When the Prophet passed away, Aisha had no food in her house except some barley on a shelf. She ate it for a while and measured how much was left. Eventually, all the barley was gone.

title: Prophet's Last Possessions
content: The Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) did not leave any belongings behind when he passed away. He left his arms, a white mule, and some land that he had given to charity.

title: The Prophet's Sickness
content: When the Prophet got very sick, he asked his wives if he could be treated in my house. They said it was okay.

title: Prophet's Final Moments
content: Aisha said the Prophet died in her house while leaning on her chest. He was too weak to use a Siwak, so Aisha chewed it and then cleaned his teeth with it.

title: Prophet's Wife Visits Mosque
content: Safiya visited the Prophet while he was in a special period of prayer during Ramadan. When she left, the Prophet walked with her to the gate of the mosque near Um Salama's house. Two men greeted him and then passed by. The Prophet (ﷺ) said to them, 'Don't hurry!' They thought he meant they should stay because his wife was with him. He explained that he was worried Satan might put bad thoughts in their minds.

title: Prophet's Prayer Position
content: I went to Hafsa's house and saw the Prophet answering nature's call. He was facing a direction called Sham, with his back towards the Qibla (the direction of prayer).

title: Prophet Muhammad's Prayer Time
content: Aisha said that the Prophet used to pray Asr prayer when the sun was still shining in her home.

title: Prophet Warns of Trouble
content: The Prophet (ﷺ) stood up and gave a sermon. He pointed to Aisha's house in the east and said three times, 'Trouble will come from here.' Then he added, 'And it will also come from where Satan is strongest, which is to our east.'

title: Foster Relations are Forbidden
content: Aisha told me that the Prophet was with her when someone asked to enter Hafsa's house. She said, 'Is this man asking permission?' The Prophet (ﷺ) replied, 'I think he is Hafsa's foster uncle.' He explained that what is forbidden because of blood relations is also forbidden because of foster relationships.

title: Abu Bakr's Letter to Bahrain
content: When Abu Bakr became the leader, he sent Anas to Bahrain. He wrote a letter for him and used the Prophet's ring to seal it. The ring had three lines: 'Muhammad (ﷺ)', 'Apostle', and 'Allah'.

title: Prophet's Old Shoes
content: Anas showed us two old shoes. They were made of worn-out leather and had pieces of leather straps on them. Anas said these were the Prophet's shoes.

title: Aisha Remembers Prophet's Garments
content: Aisha showed us a worn-out woolen blanket and said the Prophet was wearing it when he passed away. Abu Burda also saw another thick sheet and a special type of garment called Al-Mulabbada.

title: Fixing a Broken Cup
content: Anas bin Malik said that when the Prophet Muhammad 's (ﷺ) cup broke, he fixed it with a silver wire. I saw the cup and drank from it.

title: Ali's Concern for Fatima
content: `Ali bin Al-Husain and his brother Al-Miswar were returning to Medina after the death of their uncle Husain. Al-Miswar asked `Ali if he needed anything, but `Ali said no. Al-Miswar then asked about the sword of the Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ), which he was worried people might take from `Ali by force. When `Ali wanted to marry the daughter of Abu Jahal in addition to Fatima, the Prophet had given a sermon saying that Fatima would face challenges because of jealousy. He praised one of his good son-in-laws and said that he never made something lawful become unlawful or vice versa.

title: Ali's Letter to Uthman
content: Ali told his son to take a letter to Uthman. The letter had rules about how to spend the Prophet Muhammad 's (ﷺ) charity money. When Ali's son gave the letter to Uthman, he said they didn't need it and sent it back. Ali was unhappy with this.

title: Fatima's Request to the Prophet
content: Fatima told Aisha she needed a servant. When the Prophet came home, Aisha asked him about it. He said, 'I have something better for you.' He then told them to say three phrases before bed: 'Allah is greater' 34 times, 'all praise is for Allah' 33 times, and 'glorified be Allah' 33 times.

title: Naming Children after the Prophet
content: Jabir said that a man from the Ansar wanted to name his newborn son Muhammad (ﷺ). He took the boy to the Prophet and asked for advice. The Prophet (ﷺ) said, 'You can name your child Muhammad (ﷺ), but don't use my nickname Al-Qasim.' The Prophet (ﷺ) explained that he was known as Al-Qasim because he distributed things fairly among the people.

title: Prophet's Advice on Naming
content: Jabir bin Abdullah told us that a man had a son named Al-Qasim. The Ansar said, 'We won't call you Abu-al-Qasim.' The man went to the Prophet and asked what he should do. The Prophet (ﷺ) said, 'The Ansar did well. Name your child after me, but don't use my nickname. I am also called Qasim.'

title: Allah's Gift of Understanding
content: The Prophet (ﷺ) said to Muawiya: If Allah wants to help someone, He teaches them about Islam. Allah is the One who gives, and I am a distributor of what He gives. This Muslim nation will keep winning until Allah's order comes.

title: Don't Waste Allah's Money
content: Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) said: Some people use money given to them for good causes in a wrong way. They will be punished on the Day of Judgment.

title: Horses Bring Good Rewards
content: The Prophet (ﷺ) said, 'Horses are always a source of good. They bring rewards and wealth until the Day of Resurrection.'

title: Khosrau and Caesar Will Fall
content: Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) said: When the ruler Khosrau is defeated, there will be no one like him after that. The same thing will happen to Caesar. I swear by God, you will spend their wealth fighting for Allah.

title: No More Khosrau or Caesar
content: Jabir bin Samura said that the Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) said: When a great leader like Khosrau is defeated, there won't be another one after him. The same will happen to Caesar. I swear by God, you will use their wealth for Allah's cause.

title: Booty is Allowed
content: Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) said to Jabir bin Abdullah: 'I have been allowed to take booty'.

title: Paradise for Those Who Fight
content: Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) said: If someone fights for Allah and only wants to help others, He will either take them to Paradise if they die or bring them back home with what they earned as a reward.

title: Prophet's Military Expedition
content: The Prophet (ﷺ) said to his followers: 'If you're married but haven't had sex yet, or if you've built a house but it's not finished, or if you have animals that are about to give birth, don't come with me on this trip. I'm going on a holy military expedition.' He went and reached the town at almost time for the afternoon prayer. He said to the sun: 'Stop setting down!' The sun stayed still until he won the battle. Then they collected the spoils of war, but fire came to burn them. It didn't work. The Prophet (ﷺ) said: 'Some of you must have stolen from the spoils.' One man from each tribe shook hands with him as a pledge of loyalty. A man's hand got stuck on top of the Prophet's. He said: 'The theft is in your tribe. All men from your tribe should give me their pledge of loyalty.' Two or three more men's hands got stuck, and he said they were guilty. They brought a gold head to replace what was stolen, and fire came to burn the spoils. It worked this time. The Prophet (ﷺ) explained that Allah saw how weak we were, so He allowed us to take booty in war.

title: Umar's Plan for Conquered Lands
content: Umar said he would have shared the land of every town he conquered among his fighters if it weren't for future Muslims who haven't been born yet. He was inspired by how the Prophet distributed the land after conquering Khaibar.

title: Fighting in Allah's Cause
content: A man asked the Prophet about three types of fighters. One fights for money, another to be famous, and a third to show bravery. The Prophet (ﷺ) said that only one type is fighting for Allah: those who want Islam to be stronger.

title: Prophet Distributes Silk Cloaks
content: Some silk cloaks with gold buttons were given to the Prophet. He gave them to his friends and kept one for Makhrama. Later, Makhrama came with his son Al-Miswar and asked the Prophet to come to him. The Prophet (ﷺ) brought a cloak to Makhrama and put some gold buttons in front of him, saying 'I saved this for you' twice.

title: Giving Date Palms to the Prophet
content: People used to give some of their date palms to the Prophet as a gift. He would return these favors after conquering Bani Quraiza and Bani An-Nadir.

title: Az-Zubair's Will and Debt
content: Az-Zubair was killed in battle. He called his son Abdullah and said, 'Today someone will be killed as an oppressor or as a victim. I think I'll be the victim. My biggest worry is my debt.' Az-Zubair asked Abdullah to sell their property and pay off his debts. He wanted one-third of what's left for his sons. If there's anything extra after that, it should go to his sons too. Az-Zubair had a lot of money from war booty, but he was worried about the debt. When he died, his son Abdullah counted the debt and found out it was 2 million and 200 thousand dirhams. They sold some land for 1 million and 600 thousand dirhams. They called people to come and claim their money from Az-Zubair's estate. Someone owed him 400 thousand dirhams, but he forgave the debt. Abdullah paid off all of his father's debts using the money from selling the land. He kept some of the land for himself. When he finished paying the debts, Az-Zubair's sons asked him to divide their inheritance among them. But Abdullah said no, not until they announced in four Hajj seasons that anyone with a claim against Az-Zubair should come forward. After four years, they distributed the inheritance among his wives and children. Each of his wives got 1 million and 200 thousand dirhams.

title: Uthman's Reward for Staying Behind
content: Ibn `Umar said that `Uthman didn't join the Badr battle because his wife, who was one of the Prophet's daughters, was ill. The Prophet (ﷺ) told him that he would get a reward and share from the war booty just like someone who had fought in the Badr battle.

title: Returning War Prisoners
content: When a group from the Hawazin tribe came to the Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) after they had become Muslims, they asked him to return their stolen properties and prisoners. The Prophet (ﷺ) said he would give them one of two options: either their war prisoners or their wealth. He had been holding onto these things for over ten days after returning from Ta'if. When the people realized they wouldn't get both back, they chose to have their prisoners returned. The Prophet (ﷺ) then stood up and asked if anyone wanted to return the captives as a favor. If so, they could do it without any compensation. But if someone preferred to keep his share of the war booty, he should give up his prisoners and the Prophet would compensate him from the first war spoils Allah gave them. The people agreed willingly to return the captives. However, the Prophet didn't know who had agreed and who hadn't, so he asked them to go back and tell their leaders about it. When they returned, their leaders informed the Prophet that everyone had agreed to let the prisoners go.

title: Returning War Prisoners
content: When a group from the Hawazin tribe came to the Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) after they had become Muslim, they asked him to return their properties and prisoners. The Prophet (ﷺ) said he would give them either their wealth or their prisoners back. He had been waiting for over ten days since returning from Ta'if. The people chose to have their prisoners returned. The Prophet (ﷺ) then stood up and said it was logical to return the captives as a favor. He asked if anyone wanted to keep their share of the war booty instead, but all the people agreed to return the prisoners willingly.

title: Canceling an Unwise Oath
content: Abu Musa invited a man to eat chicken with him. The man said he wouldn't eat it because chickens eat dirty things and he had taken an oath not to eat them. Abu Musa asked the Prophet how to cancel an oath. They went to the Prophet who said he couldn't provide them with camels, but then some camels were brought as booty. He gave them five camels with white humps. When they returned home, they felt bad about getting the camels because they had asked for help and the Prophet had taken an oath not to give it. They went back to the Prophet and said he must have forgotten his oath when he gave them the camels. The Prophet (ﷺ) explained that Allah provided them with the camels, not him. He also said if he takes an oath but finds something better to do, he will do what's best and make up for the oath.

title: War Booty Distribution
content: Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) sent a group to Najd. Abdullah bin Umar was with them. They got many camels as spoils of war. Each person got 12 or 11 camels, and an extra one on top.

title: Prophet Muhammad's Generous Share
content: The Prophet (ﷺ) gave extra money to some members of his team when he sent them on a mission. This was in addition to the share they got with the rest of the group.

title: Migrating to the Prophet
content: Abu Musa and his brothers traveled from Yemen to join the Prophet. They sailed to Ethiopia with over 50 men, where they met Ja'far bin Abu Talib and his companions. The Prophet (ﷺ) told them to stay in Ethiopia until he conquered Khaibar. After conquering Khaibar, the Prophet gave them a share of its spoils, but only to those who fought with him.

title: Abu Bakr Helps Jabir
content: Jabir said the Prophet told him he would get a lot of money if they had some from Bahrain. But when Bahrain's property came, Abu Bakr asked people to come forward with any claims against the Prophet. Jabir went to Abu Bakr and reminded him about what the Prophet promised. Abu Bakr gave him three handfuls of money. Jabir went back to Abu Bakr twice more because he didn't get his money. Finally, Abu Bakr scooped up some money and asked Jabir to count it - it was 500 dirhams. Then Abu Bakr told Jabir to take double that amount.

title: Being Just in Distribution
content: Jabir bin Abdullah said that when the Prophet was sharing spoils at Al-Ji'rana, someone told him to be fair. The Prophet (ﷺ) replied, 'I would feel unhappy if I wasn't being fair'.

title: War Prisoners of Badr
content: The Prophet (ﷺ) talked about the prisoners from Badr. He said that if Mut'im bin Adi were alive, he would have freed them because of him.

title: The Prophet's Kinship
content: Jubair and Uthman went to the Prophet. They said, 'You gave a share to Bani Muttalib but not to us.' The Prophet (ﷺ) replied, 'Bani Muttalib and Bani Hashim are the same family.' He didn't give any share to Bani Abd Shams or Bani Naufal.

title: Two Young Boys Kill Abu Jahl
content: Abdur-Rahman bin Auf was standing in a row on the day of the battle of Badr. He saw two young Ansari boys who wanted to fight Abu Jahl because he insulted the Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ). When they saw Abu Jahl, they attacked him with their swords and killed him. They went back to the Prophet and said they had killed him. The Prophet (ﷺ) asked if they had cleaned their swords, but they hadn't. He then told them that the dead man's belongings would go to Mu'adh bin 'Amr bin Al-Jamuh.

title: Abu Qatada's Story at Hunain
content: We went on a journey with the Prophet to fight against the enemy. When we faced them, the Muslims ran away. I saw an enemy attacking a Muslim, so I hit him from behind with my sword. The enemy grabbed me tightly, but then he died and let go of me. After the battle, the Prophet sat down and said that anyone who killed an enemy and has proof can keep their spoils. I stood up to ask for a witness, but no one came forward. The Prophet (ﷺ) repeated his statement three times, and each time I stood up again. Finally, he asked me what had happened. I told him my story. A man then said that the spoils belonged to him, so he offered to give them to me instead. But Abu Bakr disagreed, saying the Prophet wouldn't agree to this. The Prophet (ﷺ) agreed with Abu Bakr and gave the spoils to me. I sold the armor for a garden in Bani Salima, which was my first property after becoming Muslim.

title: Hakim's Gift of Wealth
content: Hakim bin Hizam asked the Prophet for something and got it. The Prophet (ﷺ) said, 'Wealth is like green fruit. If you take it without being greedy, you'll be blessed with it. But if you're greedy, you won't be blessed.' Hakim promised not to ask anyone else for anything after the Prophet. When Abu Bakr and Umar became Caliphs, they asked Hakim for some money, but he refused both times.

title: Umar's Vow and Captives
content: Umar told the Prophet that he had vowed to stay in I'tikaf for one day before Islam. The Prophet (ﷺ) said Umar should keep his vow.
