After a battle, Umar took two women as prisoners of war and left them in Mecca houses. When the Prophet freed all captives without payment, they came out walking freely. Umar told his son Abdullah to set free those two women.

title: Gifts and True Faith
content: Some people received gifts from the Prophet. Others were unhappy about this. The Prophet (ﷺ) said, 'I give to some people so they don't leave Islam or lose patience. I give others a chance to be happy with what Allah has given them.' `Amr bin Taghlib was one of those who trusted in Allah's goodness.

title: Helping Quraish to Stay
content: The Prophet (ﷺ) said: 'I give things to the people of Quraish so they can stay with Islam. They are still close to their old ways.'

title: The Prophet's Distribution of Wealth
content: Anas bin Malik said: The Prophet (ﷺ) received some wealth from the Hawazin tribe. He gave many camels to Quraishi men, which made some Ansari men unhappy. They thought it was unfair that they were not getting as much. When the Prophet found out what they had said, he called them together and asked about their complaint. They explained that they felt left behind because they had recently fought against non-Muslims and still had blood on their swords. The Prophet (ﷺ) replied that he gave more to those who were still close to being non-Muslims, so they could be happy with the wealth they received. He told them that what they would get in return for following him was better than any wealth. The Ansari men said they were satisfied, but later they did not remain patient.

title: Giving to the Poor
content: Jubair bin Mut'im said that when he was with the Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) on their way back from Hunain, some bedouins started begging for things. They took his outer garment and wouldn't return it. The Prophet (ﷺ) stood up and said, 'Give me my garment back. If I had as many camels as these trees, I would give them to you.' He added that he was not a miser or a liar or a coward.

title: Prophet Smiles at Bedouin
content: I was walking with the Prophet when a bedouin came and pulled his outer garment very hard. The Prophet (ﷺ) smiled and gave him some money as a gift.

title: Unequal Distribution of Spoils
content: At the Battle of Hunain, Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) gave some people more camels than others. A man complained that this was unfair and not pleasing to Allah. I told him I would tell the Prophet about it. He said that if he and his followers didn't act justly, who else would? He reminded us that even Moses had faced greater hardships but remained patient.

title: Carrying Date Stones
content: Asma bint Abu Bakr used to carry date stones from a land given by the Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ). The land was about two-thirds of a Farsakh away from her house, which is a long distance. This land was taken as war booty from the Bani An-Nadir.

title: Jews and Christians in Hijaz
content: Ibn Umar said that Caliph Umar forced all Jews and Christians to leave the land of Hijaz. After conquering Khaibar, Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) thought about making them leave too. But they asked him to stay if they could work hard and get half of the fruits from the land. Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) agreed, saying 'We'll keep you here as long as we want.' They stayed until Caliph Umar's time, when he made them move to Taima and Ariha.

title: Taking Food from Enemy
content: We were fighting near Khaibar. Someone threw a bag with food fat towards me. I ran to get it, but when I turned around, the Prophet was standing behind me. I felt embarrassed in front of him.

title: War Booty in Battles
content: Ibn Umar said: During our holy battles, we would find honey and grapes as spoils of war. We ate them right away and didn't store any for later.

title: Prophet's Decision on Donkey Meat
content: During the battle of Khaibar, we were hungry and ate donkeys' meat. The Prophet (ﷺ) announced that all pots with donkey meat should be thrown away. Some people thought it was because no one had taken their share of the spoils yet. Others believed he made eating donkey meat forever forbidden.

title: Umar's Letter to Magian Leaders
content: I was with Jabir and Amr when Bajala told us about a letter from Umar bin Al-Khattab. He said, 'One year before his death, Umar wrote:

title: Umar's Letter to the Magians
content: I was sitting with Jabir and Amr when Bajala told us about a letter from Umar bin Al-Khattab. He said, 'One year before Umar died, he sent a message saying: Cancel all marriages between close relatives.' Umar also didn't make the Magians pay the tax until Abdur-Rahman bin Auf confirmed that the Prophet had done it in Hajar.

title: Prophet's Warning to the Ansar
content: The Prophet (ﷺ) sent Abu 'Ubaida to Bahrain to collect taxes. When he came back with money, the Ansar (helpers) heard about it and went to see the Prophet after morning prayer. The Prophet (ﷺ) smiled when he saw them and said, 'I think you've heard that Abu 'Ubaida brought some money?' They replied, 'Yes.' He said, 'Be happy! I'm not worried about your poverty, but I fear you'll become too comfortable like other nations before you. You'll compete with each other for wealth, just like they did, and it will destroy you like it destroyed them'.

title: Umar's Advice to Al-Hurmuzan
content: Umar sent Muslims to fight against non-believers. When Al-Hurmuzan converted, Umar asked for his advice on fighting other countries. Al-Hurmuzan said that the enemy is like a bird with four parts: head (Khosrau), two wings (Caesar and Faris). If one wing breaks, it can still fight. Umar sent Al-Mughira and others to fight Khosrau. When they arrived, an interpreter asked who they were. Al-Mughira explained that they were Arabs who used to suffer from hunger and poverty. Their Prophet told them to fight until the enemy worships Allah or pays tax. If a Muslim dies in battle, he goes to heaven. An-Nu'man criticized Al-Mughira for waiting too long before attacking.

title: Umar's Advice to Al-Hurmuzan
content: `Umar asked Al-Hurmuzan about fighting the pagans. Al-Hurmuzan said that if you attack Khosrau, you will be stronger. `Umar sent a group of Muslims to fight Khosrau. When they arrived, the enemy's representative came out with 40,000 warriors. One of them asked who they were and what they wanted. Al-Mughira explained that they were Arabs who used to suffer from hunger and poverty. They had a Prophet who told them to fight for Allah or pay tribute. If they died fighting, they would go to Paradise. If they lived, they would become the enemy's masters. An-Nu'man was criticized for delaying the attack. He said that if he fought with the Prophet, he wouldn't be blamed for waiting.

title: Gift from the King
content: We went on a trip with the Prophet to Tabuk. The king of Aila gave him a white mule and a cloak as a gift. The Prophet (ﷺ) wrote back to the king, saying he could keep control over his country in peace.

title: Umar's Advice to Muslims
content: Some people asked Umar bin Al-Khattab for advice. He said, 'Follow the rules made by our Prophet and take care of your families' needs by collecting taxes from those who live under Muslim rule.'

title: Ansar and Quraish Share
content: The Prophet (ﷺ) called the Ansar to give them land from Bahrain. They said no unless their Quraishi brothers also got some. The Prophet (ﷺ) said it would be theirs if Allah wanted. But when the Ansar kept asking, he told them to wait patiently until they met him at a special place.

title: Abu Bakr Helps Jabir
content: Jabir said the Prophet told him: 'If Bahrain's money came in, I would give you this and that.' After the Prophet died, Abu Bakr asked Jabir to come. Jabir said, 'The Prophet (ﷺ) promised me this and that.' Abu Bakr said, 'Take as much as you can with both hands.' Jabir scooped up money and counted it. He got 500 gold pieces. Then he got another 1000 gold pieces from Abu Bakr.

title: Abu Bakr Helps Jabir
content: Jabir said the Prophet told him: 'If Bahrain's money comes, I'll give you some.' After the Prophet died, Abu Bakr asked Jabir to come. Jabir said, 'The Prophet (ﷺ) promised me some money from Bahrain.' Abu Bakr said, 'Take as much as you can with both hands.' Jabir scooped up 500 gold pieces and then another 1000. Meanwhile, a lot of money came in from Bahrain. The Prophet (ﷺ) told people to spread it out in the mosque. Al-Abbas wanted some for himself and his brother Aqil. He took a big amount but couldn't lift it. He threw away some money, but still couldn't lift it. The Prophet (ﷺ) watched him with surprise until he left. When Al-Abbas was gone, the Prophet stayed there till all the money was gone.

title: Killing a Treaty Holder
content: The Prophet (ﷺ) said: If someone kills a person who has a peace agreement with Muslims, they will not be able to smell the scent of Paradise. This is even if you can smell it from as far away as forty years.

title: Prophet's Warning to Jews
content: The Prophet (ﷺ) came out of the Mosque and said, 'Let's go to the Jewish place.' We went there. He told them, 'If you become Muslims, you'll be safe here. The earth belongs to Allah and me. I want to move you from this land. If someone owns a house or property, they can sell it. Otherwise, know that the earth is for Allah and his Messenger.'

title: Thursday: A Special Message
content: Ibn Abbas said that the Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) was ill and asked for a scapula bone to write something on. The people thought he might be confused, but he told them to leave him alone. Then he gave three instructions: get rid of all non-Muslims from the Arabian Peninsula, give gifts to foreign guests as he used to do, and then he mentioned a third thing that Ibn Abbas didn't explain.

title: Conquering Khaibar
content: When Khaibar was conquered, a poisoned sheep was given to the Prophet as a gift. He ordered all the Jews who were there to come before him. They agreed to tell the truth if asked. The Prophet (ﷺ) asked them about their father and they said they had lied. He told them he could always know when they were lying. Then he asked, 'Who will go to Hell?' They said they would be in it for a short time, but then the Muslims would replace them. The Prophet (ﷺ) disagreed, saying that wouldn't happen. He asked again if they would tell the truth and they agreed. He then asked if they had poisoned the sheep. They admitted they had. When asked why, they said they wanted to see if he was a prophet or not.

title: Qunut in Prayer
content: I asked Anas about saying a special prayer during the bowing part of the prayer. He said it should be said before you bend down. I told him someone was claiming the opposite, and he said that person is wrong. Anas then told me that the Prophet once prayed for evil to befall a group called Bani-Sulaim after they bowed down. The Prophet (ﷺ) had sent 40 or 70 men who knew the Quran to another tribe, but they fought with them and killed them, even though there was a peace agreement between the two groups. I never saw the Prophet as sad and worried as he was about those men.

title: Um Hani Visits Prophet
content: I went to see the Prophet on the day of Mecca's conquest. He was taking a bath with his daughter Fatima screening him. I greeted him and he asked who I was. I said it was me, Um Hani. After bathing, he stood up and prayed eight times while wearing one garment. Then I told him that my brother Ali had given asylum to someone I didn't want harmed. The Prophet (ﷺ) said we would protect the person I had granted asylum.

title: Medina's Sanctuary Rules
content: Ali said: 'We only have one book to read - the Quran. There's also a paper with rules about fighting, camel ages for charity or compensation, and that Medina is a safe area between two mountains. Anyone who breaks these rules or causes trouble in Medina will be cursed by Allah, angels, and people. No good deeds from them will be accepted. If a freed slave chooses friends other than their real masters, they'll also be cursed. Muslims must protect each other's safety in Medina.'

title: Murder at Khaibar
content: Two men, Abdullah and Muhaiyisa, went to Khaibar. When they returned, Muhaiyisa found Abdullah dead in his blood. He buried him and came back to Medina with the other sons of Masud. The Prophet (ﷺ) asked them to swear who killed Abdullah, but they said it was impossible since they didn't see anything. The Prophet (ﷺ) then suggested that the Jews could take an oath to clear themselves, but the Muslims refused to believe their oaths. So, the Prophet paid the blood money for Abdullah's death.

title: Abu Sufyan Meets Heraclius
content: 'Abdullah bin 'Abbas said that Abu Sufyan told him about a meeting with the Roman Emperor, Heraclius. Some traders from Quraish had gone to Sham (a region in modern-day Syria) and were allowed to trade there because of a peace agreement made by Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) with the people of Quraish.

title: Prophet Muhammad was Bewitched
content: Aisha said that the Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) was bewitched. He started to think he had done something he hadn't actually done.

title: Six Signs of the Hour
content: I went to the Prophet during a battle. He said: 'Look out for six things that will happen before the end times come. My death, you conquering Jerusalem, many people dying from a sickness like sheep get sick, having so much money that even if someone gets a lot of it, they won't be happy with it, a disaster that no family in Arabia will escape, and then you making peace with the Byzantines, but they'll break their promise and attack us under 80 flags. Each flag will have 12,000 soldiers.'

title: Abu Bakr Announces New Rules
content: Abu Bakr sent me to tell people that after this year, no non-Muslim can go on Hajj. Also, from now on, people must wear clothes when walking around the Kaaba.

title: Four Signs of Hypocrisy
content: Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) said: If someone has four bad habits, they will be a hypocrite. These are: they lie when they speak, break their promises, go back on their word, and behave badly in arguments. If someone has just one of these habits, but stops doing it, they won't be considered a hypocrite.

title: Medina is a Sanctuary
content: Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) said: 'Medina is a safe place from the mountain of Air to so and so. If someone introduces new ideas or sins here, they will be cursed by Allah, angels, and all people. Their good deeds won't be accepted. If a Muslim betrays another Muslim's safety, they will also be cursed. A freed slave who chooses friends other than their original masters without permission will also be cursed and their good deeds won't be accepted.'

title: Abu Huraira's Warning
content: Abu Huraira asked the people what would happen if they couldn't collect taxes from non-Muslims living in a Muslim area. Someone asked him how he knew this would happen, and Abu Huraira said it was because of something the Prophet had said. The people asked him to share the statement, and he replied that it meant Allah's protection for these non-Muslims would be taken away. This would make their hearts bold, so they wouldn't pay the taxes they were supposed to.

title: Abu Wail's Story
content: I asked Abu Wail if he fought in the Battle of Siffin. He said yes and told me about a friend, Sahl bin Hunaif. Sahl was blamed for not being brave enough during the battle. Sahl said that people should blame their own bad ideas, not him. He said that on another day, Abu Jandal's Day, he had been very scared but followed the Prophet's orders. They kept their swords ready and were frightened by something. But it turned out to be easier for them, except during this battle.

title: Umar and the Hudaibiya Treaty
content: Abu Wail said that Sahl bin Hunaif was in Siffin. He stood up and said, 'We should blame ourselves.' They were with the Prophet on the day of Hudaibiya. If they had been asked to fight, they would have fought. But then Umar came and said, 'Are we right and our opponents wrong?' The Prophet (ﷺ) said, 'Yes.' Umar said, 'Our killed people are in Paradise and their killed people are in Hell.' He said, 'Yes.' Umar said, 'Then why should we accept hard terms about our religion? Shouldn't we wait for Allah to judge between us and them?' The Prophet (ﷺ) said, 'I am the Messenger of Allah. Allah will never lower me.' Umar told Abu Bakr what he had said. Abu Bakr said, 'He is the Messenger of Allah. Allah will never lower him.' Then a new chapter from the Quran was revealed. The Prophet (ﷺ) recited it to Umar. Umar asked, 'Was Hudaibiya a victory?' The Prophet (ﷺ) said, 'Yes.'

title: Visiting a Non-Muslim Mother
content: Asma's mother came to visit her. Asma asked the Prophet if she should be kind to her mother, who was not Muslim yet. The Prophet (ﷺ) said yes, it's good to be kind to her.

title: Prophet Muhammad enters Mecca
content: When the Prophet wanted to visit Mecca for a special prayer called Umra, he sent someone to ask the people of Mecca if it was okay. They said he could come in, but only for three days and with no weapons. He couldn't preach Islam to them either. The Prophet 's (ﷺ) friend Ali wrote down an agreement between them. But when the Meccans saw what Ali had written, they asked him to change it. They wanted it to say 'Muhammad (ﷺ) bin Abdullah' instead of 'Muhammad (ﷺ), Apostle of Allah'. The Prophet (ﷺ) said that was true - he was Muhammad (ﷺ) and a messenger of God. He made Ali erase those words. When the three days were over, the Meccans told Ali to leave with the Prophet. So they left Mecca.

title: Prophet's Back Insulted
content: The Prophet (ﷺ) was in a prayer position on the ground. Some people from Quraish came and threw camel intestines on his back while he was still praying. His daughter Fatima removed them, then cursed the person who did this. The Prophet (ﷺ) asked Allah to punish the leaders of Quraish, naming five men. Later, I saw all these men killed in a battle.

title: Betrayers will be Recognized
content: The Prophet (ﷺ) said that on the Day of Resurrection, every person who betrays others will have a flag. This flag will help people recognize them.

title: Betrayers will be Identified
content: The Prophet (ﷺ) said that on the Day of Resurrection, every person who betrays others will have a flag. This flag will show who has betrayed others.

title: Betrayers on the Day of Judgement
content: The Prophet (ﷺ) said: 'On the Day of Resurrection, every person who betrays others will have a flag. The size of the flag will show how big their betrayal was.'

title: No More Migration
content: After conquering Mecca, the Prophet said: 'There's no need to leave your homes now. Instead, be prepared for battle whenever it comes. If you're called to fight, go right away.' He also said: 'Mecca has been a safe place since God created the world and will stay that way until Judgment Day. No one was allowed to fight here before me, but I made an exception just for a short time during the day. So, Mecca remains a safe place forever. Don't cut down its thorny bushes or chase its animals. If you find lost property, announce it publicly so others know about it. And don't uproot its grass.' Al-Abbas asked if this included Idhkhir plants, which are used for gold and houses. The Prophet (ﷺ) said: 'No, not even Idhkhir.'

title: Bani Tamim and the Prophet
content: Some people from Bani Tamim came to the Prophet. He said, 'Good news! You're blessed.' They asked for more, so he told them about good things. But they refused. Then people from Yemen came and accepted the good news. The Prophet (ﷺ) started talking about creation and Allah's Throne. Just then, someone shouted that my camel had escaped. I got up to go, but I wish I hadn't left because I missed what the Prophet said.

title: The Prophet's Good Tidings
content: Imran bin Husain visited the Prophet. He tied his camel outside and went in. The people of Bani Tamim came to see the Prophet. He said, 'Good news for you!' They asked him to give them something else. Then some Yemenites arrived and the Prophet said, 'Good news again! Bani Tamim didn't accept it.' The Yemenites accepted the good news and asked about creation. The Prophet (ﷺ) explained: 'First, there was only Allah. He created His Throne above water. He wrote everything in a Book in Heaven and made the heavens and earth.' While they talked, someone shouted that Imran's camel had escaped. Imran left to find it but couldn't see it because of the heat.

title: The Prophet's Story of Creation
content: One day the Prophet stood up and talked to us about how creation started. He explained everything in detail, including what happens when people go to Paradise or Hell. Some of us remembered what he said, but others forgot.

title: Don't Disbelieve in Allah
content: Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) said that Allah says: 'When a person disbelieves in Me, they should not do so. Saying I have a son is wrong and thinking I won't recreate them like I did before is also wrong.'

title: Mercy Overpowers Anger
content: Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) said: When God finished creating the world, He wrote in a book with Him: 'My mercy is greater than My anger.'

title: Avoid Taking Land Unjustly
content: Abu Salama had a problem with some people over a piece of land. He went to Aisha and told her about it. She said, 'Don't take the land, because the Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) said that if someone takes something unfairly, they will be punished by having it wrapped around their neck seven times down into the earth.'

title: Consequences of Taking Land Unjustly
content: The Prophet (ﷺ) said: If someone takes land that doesn't belong to them, on the Day of Resurrection they will be punished by being pushed down into the seven layers of earth.

title: Months are Sacred
content: The Prophet (ﷺ) said: 'Time has gone back to how it was when Allah created the world. A year has 12 months, and four of these months are special. Three of them - Dhul-Qa'da, Dhul-Hijja, and Muharram - come one after another. The fourth is Rajab, which is between Jumada-ath-Thaniyah and Sha'ban'.

title: Taking Land Unjustly
content: Sa'id bin Zaid was in court with a woman named Arwa. She said he took something that belonged to her. Sa'id said, 'I remember the Prophet saying: If someone takes land unfairly, on Judgment Day their neck will be wrapped around it seven times.'

title: Sun's Journey at Sunset
content: The Prophet (ﷺ) asked me where the sun goes at sunset. I said I didn't know. He explained that it travels to prostrate under Allah's Throne, then is allowed to rise again. But one day it will be refused permission and ordered to return from which it came, rising in the west instead.

title: Day of Resurrection
content: The Prophet (ﷺ) said, 'On the Day of Judgment, the sun and moon will lose their light.'

title: Eclipses are Signs of Allah
content: Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) said: The sun and moon do not go dark because someone dies or is born. They're signs from Allah. If you see an eclipse, pray.

title: Eclipses are Signs from Allah
content: Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) said: The sun and the moon are two signs of Allah. They don't go dark because someone is born or dies. If you see an eclipse, praise Allah by praying.

title: Solar Eclipse and Prayer
content: One day, a solar eclipse happened. The Prophet (ﷺ) stood up to pray. He said 'God is great' and read from the Quran for a long time. He bowed down low, then stood up again and said 'God hears those who praise Him'. He read some more from the Quran, bowed down again, and then prayed on his stomach. He did it all twice. When he finished praying, the eclipse was over. The Prophet (ﷺ) told people to remember that solar and lunar eclipses are signs of God's power. They happen because of God's will, not because someone is born or dies. If you see an eclipse, go pray.

title: Sun and Moon Eclipses
content: Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) said: The sun and moon do not go dark because of someone dying or being born. They are signs from Allah. If you see an eclipse, pray.

title: Wind and Victory
content: Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) said: 'I have been given victory with the help of a strong east wind. The people of Ad were destroyed by a strong west wind.'

title: Prophet Muhammad's Reaction to Clouds
content: Aisha said the Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) would get worried when he saw a cloud in the sky. He would pace back and forth, go outside and come back inside, and his face would change color. If it rained, he would feel better. Aisha knew this was how he reacted to clouds. The Prophet (ﷺ) said, 'I'm not sure what's going on. It might be like a situation mentioned in the Quran where people thought a cloud would bring them rain, but it actually brought harm.'

title: Muhammad's Night Journey
content: The Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) was in a state between sleep and wakefulness at the House. An angel recognized him as the man lying there. A golden tray with wisdom and belief was brought to him, and his body was opened from throat to abdomen. His heart was filled with wisdom and he was washed with Zamzam water. Al-Buraq, a white animal smaller than a mule but bigger than a donkey, took him on a journey with Gabriel. They went through seven heavens, meeting prophets like Adam, Jesus, and Abraham along the way. At each heaven, they were asked who they were and if Muhammad (ﷺ) had been sent for. Each time, it was said that he was welcomed and his visit was wonderful. In the seventh heaven, Muhammad (ﷺ) saw Allah's House where 70,000 angels pray every day. He also saw a special tree with four rivers at its root. Fifty prayers were ordered for him, but he went back to Moses who advised him to reduce the number of prayers because it would be too hard for his followers. So, Muhammad (ﷺ) asked Allah to reduce the number of prayers five times until it was finally reduced to five. When he came back to Moses, he said that Allah had made it five and he accepted it.

title: Human Creation in the Womb
content: Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) said: A human being is formed in the mother's womb over 40 days. Then it becomes a thick blood clot for another 40 days, and then a piece of flesh. An angel writes four things about him: his good deeds, how he will live, when he will die, and whether he will be blessed or wretched. After that, the soul is given to him. A person may do good until they are almost in Paradise, but what was written for them makes them do bad things like those who go to Hell. Similarly, someone may do bad deeds until they are almost in Hell, but what was written for them makes them do good things like those who go to Paradise.

title: Allah's Love for a Person
content: The Prophet (ﷺ) said, 'If Allah loves someone, He tells Gabriel to love them too. Then Gabriel makes an announcement in Heaven that this person is loved by Allah, so everyone there should love them as well. As a result, the people on earth also start loving them.

title: Angels Share Heaven's Secrets
content: I heard the Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) say that angels come down from heaven and talk about things that have been decided. The devils listen to this, go back to earth, and tell fortune-tellers what they heard. The fortune-tellers then add their own lies.

title: Angels at Mosque Gates
content: The Prophet (ﷺ) said that every Friday, angels stand at the mosque gates to write down the names of people as they arrive for prayer. When the Imam sits on the pulpit, the angels stop writing and listen to the sermon.

title: Umar Disapproves of Poetry
content: One day, Umar visited the Mosque while Hassan was reciting a poem. Umar didn't like it. Hassan said to Abu Huraira, 'Did you hear the Prophet say I could respond with poetry? He even asked Allah for help.' Abu Huraira replied, 'Yes, that's true'.

title: Gabriel is with You
content: The Prophet (ﷺ) told Hassan: 'Make fun of the non-Muslims. Gabriel is helping you.'

title: Gabriel's Procession Seen
content: Anas bin Malik saw a cloud of dust in the Bani Ghanim lane. He said it was because Gabriel had passed by, leading a procession.

title: How Allah Speaks to the Prophet
content: Al Harith bin Hisham asked the Prophet how he received messages from Allah. The Prophet (ﷺ) said that sometimes an angel comes with a loud voice, like a bell ringing. When this goes away, he remembers what the angel said. This is the hardest way for him. Sometimes the angel appears as a man and talks to him directly.

title: Spending for Allah's Cause
content: Abu Huraira heard the Prophet say: 'If you give two things to help others in Allah's name, the guards at Paradise will call out to you. They'll invite you to come inside.' Abu Bakr said that person will never be unhappy or poor. The Prophet (ﷺ) hoped he would be one of them.

title: Gabriel's Greeting to Aisha
content: Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) said to his wife Aisha: 'This is Gabriel. He sends greetings to you.' Aisha replied, 'Greetings to him. May Allah have mercy and blessings on him.' She then asked the Prophet, 'You see what I don't see?'

title: Gabriel's Visits to the Prophet
content: Ibn Abbas said that one day Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) asked Gabriel why he didn't visit them more often. In response, a verse from the Quran was revealed: 'Angels don't come down without Allah's permission. He knows everything that has happened and will happen.'

title: Gabriel Read the Quran
content: Ibn Abbas said that Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) asked Gabriel to read the Quran in different ways. Gabriel read it seven times, each time with a slightly different dialect.

title: Prophet Muhammad's Generosity
content: Ibn Abbas said that the Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) was very generous. He became even more generous in Ramadan when he met Gabriel every night to study the Quran together. When they met, the Prophet would give more than anyone else could.

title: Gabriel Led the Prophet in Prayer
content: `Umar bin `Abdul `Aziz delayed the Asr prayer. `Urwa said Gabriel came down and led the Prophet's prayer. `Umar asked him to be sure of what he was saying. `Urwa explained that Bashir bin Abi Masud told him Ibn Masud heard the Prophet say Gabriel came down, led his prayer, then prayed with him four more times.

title: Paradise for those who worship Allah
content: Abu Dhar said the Prophet told him that Gabriel said: 'Anyone from your followers who dies without worshipping anything except Allah will go to Paradise. Even if they committed sins like having an affair or stealing, it won't stop them from going to Paradise.'

title: Angels Visit Heaven Daily
content: Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) said that angels go up and down to heaven at different times. Some come during the day and some at night. They all meet together before morning and evening prayers. The angels who stay with us overnight tell Allah about how we were praying when they left. If you say 'Amin' during prayer, and the angels in heaven also say it at the same time, your past sins will be forgiven.

title: Prophet's Warning on Pictures
content: I made a pillow with pictures for the Prophet. He came and stood near it. I asked him what was wrong, but he didn't say anything. Then he asked me about the pillow. I said it was for him to rest on. He said that angels don't enter homes with pictures. He also told me that making pictures is a sin and those who do will be punished on Judgment Day.

title: Angels Don't Enter Homes
content: I heard the Prophet say that angels of mercy don't enter a house with a dog or a picture of an animal or person inside.

title: Angels Don't Enter Pictures
content: Zaid bin Khalid told us that the Prophet said: 'Angels of Mercy won't enter a house with pictures.' Later, we saw Zaid's house had a curtain with pictures. We asked Ubaidullah if this was allowed. He said Zaid excepted embroidery on clothes. But we didn't hear him say that.

title: Gabriel's Visit to the Prophet
content: Salim's father told us that Gabriel promised to visit the Prophet. But Gabriel didn't come. Later, he said: 'Angels like me don't enter a house with pictures or dogs inside.'

title: Forgiveness in Prayer
content: When an Imam says 'Allah hears him who praises Him' during a prayer, you should say 'O Allah! Our Lord! All the praises are for You'. If your words match what the angels say, your past sins will be forgiven.

title: Waiting for Prayer
content: When you're waiting for prayer time, you are considered to be praying. The angels ask Allah to forgive and show mercy to you, until you stop praying or leave the place, or break your ablution by passing gas.

title: The Day of Judgment
content: I heard the Prophet reciting a Verse on the pulpit. It says: 'They will call out to Malik.' Abdullah also read it as 'Mali'.

title: Trouble from My Tribe
content: Aisha asked the Prophet if he had ever faced a harder day than the Battle of Uhud. The Prophet (ﷺ) said his tribe caused him trouble, especially when they didn't accept his message at Aqaba. He was very sad and continued on to Qarnath-Tha-alib. While there, he saw Gabriel in a cloud. Gabriel told the Prophet that Allah had heard what his people were saying about him. An Angel of the Mountains appeared and said, 'Do whatever you want with them.' The Prophet (ﷺ) refused, hoping instead that their children would grow up to worship only Allah.

title: Gabriel's Wings
content: I asked Zir bin Hubaish about a verse in the Quran. He said Ibn Mas`ud told us that the Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) saw Gabriel with 600 wings.

title: Prophet Muhammad Saw a Green Carpet
content: Abdullah said that the Prophet had seen a green carpet spread across the sky's horizon. This was one of the signs of Allah that he saw, and it is mentioned in the Quran as 'The Greatest'.

title: Aisha's Story About Muhammad
content: Aisha said: If someone says they saw Allah, that's not true. What Muhammad (ﷺ) really saw was Gabriel in his real form, covering the whole sky.

title: Gabriel's True Form
content: I asked Aisha about a verse in the Quran. It says Gabriel came close to the Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ). I asked her what it meant by 'close'. She said Gabriel usually looked like a normal man when he visited the Prophet, but on this occasion, he appeared as himself - really big and covered the whole horizon.

title: Gabriel and Michael in a Dream
content: The Prophet (ﷺ) saw two men in his dream. One said he was Malik, the gatekeeper of Hell's Fire. The other man said he was Gabriel. And this third person said he was Michael.

title: Angels Curse a Refusing Wife
content: Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) said: If a husband asks his wife to join him in bed and she refuses, the angels will be unhappy with her until morning.

title: Prophet Muhammad Receives Revelation
content: Jabir bin Abdullah said that he heard the Prophet say: 'I was walking when I suddenly heard a voice in the sky. When I looked up, I saw an angel sitting between the sky and the earth. I was so scared that I fell to the ground and went home, telling my family to cover me with a blanket. Then Allah sent a message: 'Get up! Warn people about Me! Tell them to be clean and pure, and leave their idols.'

title: Prophet's Night Journey
content: During his night journey to heaven, the Prophet saw Moses. Moses was a tall man with curly hair and brown skin. He looked like someone from the Shan'awa tribe. The Prophet (ﷺ) also saw Jesus, who was of medium height with fair skin that had some redness in it. His hair was straight. The Prophet (ﷺ) saw Malik, the gatekeeper of hellfire, and Ad-Dajjal (the false messiah). The Prophet (ﷺ) recited a verse from the Quran to remind us not to doubt meeting these people. The angels will protect Medina from Ad-Dajjal.

title: What Happens After Death
content: When someone dies, they will be shown their final destination twice a day. If they are going to heaven, they will see where they will live in heaven. If they are going to hell, they will see where they will stay in hell.

title: Majority in Paradise and Hell
content: Imran bin Husain said the Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) said: 'I looked at Paradise. I saw that poor people are most of its inhabitants. I also looked at Hell. Most of its people are women.'

title: Prophet Sees Umar in Paradise
content: The Prophet (ﷺ) was with his companions when he fell asleep. In his dream, he saw himself in a beautiful place called Paradise. He saw a woman washing her hands and face near a big house. The Prophet (ﷺ) asked who the house belonged to. Someone said it belonged to Umar. The Prophet (ﷺ) remembered that Umar had expressed concerns about women. So, the Prophet quickly left the area. When Umar heard what the Prophet had seen in his dream, he was sad and said, 'Do you think I'm worried about this because of you, O Messenger of Allah?'

title: Paradise Tents for Believers
content: The Prophet (ﷺ) said, 'In Paradise, a believer's tent is like a big pearl. It's thirty miles high and on each corner of the tent, there are families that others can't see.'

title: Allah's Reward for the Pious
content: Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) said that Allah told him He has prepared special rewards for His good slaves. These rewards are beyond what anyone can imagine or see. The Quran says, 'No one knows what joy is waiting for them as a reward for their good deeds.'

title: People of Paradise
content: Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) said that those who enter Paradise first will be very beautiful. They won't need to spit or blow their noses, and they'll use gold utensils and combs with silver. Their sweat smells like musk. Each person will have two wives who are extremely beautiful. No one in Paradise will argue or hate each other. Everyone's heart will feel the same, and they'll praise Allah morning and evening.

title: First People to Enter Paradise
content: Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) said: The first people to enter Paradise will be like a full moon. Those who come next will be like the brightest star. They'll have no disagreements and each person will have two beautiful wives. Their hearts will be united, and they'll praise Allah morning and evening. They won't get sick, blow their noses, or spit. Their dishes and combs are made of gold and silver, and they use aloeswood for fuel. Even their sweat smells like musk.

title: 70,000 Enter Paradise Together
content: Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) said: 'About 70,000 of my followers will enter Paradise at the same time. Their faces will shine like a full moon when it's bright.'

title: Prophet Muhammad and Silk
content: Anas bin Malik said the Prophet was given a beautiful silk cloak. He usually told people not to wear silk. When they saw the cloak, he said: 'I swear by Allah, Sa'd's handkerchiefs in Paradise are better than this'.

title: Sa'd's Handkerchiefs in Paradise
content: Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) was given a beautiful silken garment. He said that Sa'd bin Mu'adh's handkerchiefs in Paradise are better than this one.

title: Paradise is Better
content: Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) said: A small space in Paradise is better than the whole world and everything in it.

title: Paradise's Huge Tree
content: The Prophet (ﷺ) said: There is a tree in Paradise. If someone rides under its shade for one hundred years, they still wouldn't be able to cross it.

title: Paradise's Big Tree
content: The Prophet (ﷺ) said: 'There is a huge tree in Paradise. A rider can travel for 100 years under its shade. The verse 'In shade long extended..' (56.30) describes this tree. A small area in Paradise is better than the whole world.

title: Paradise's Big Shade Tree
content: The Prophet (ﷺ) said there is a huge tree in Paradise. A rider can travel under its shade for 100 years. The Quran says, 'In shade long extended...' (56:30). Even a small spot in Paradise, like the size of an arrow bow, is better than the whole world.

title: Entering Paradise Together
content: The Prophet (ﷺ) said that those who enter Paradise first will be like the full moon in brightness. The next group to enter will be as bright as a star. They won't have any disagreements or jealousy among them, and everyone will have two wives from the houris. These women are so beautiful that you can see through their legs.

title: Prophet's Promise to His Son
content: After his son Ibrahim died, the Prophet said that there is a special nurse for him in Paradise who will take care of him.

title: Paradise's High Places
content: The Prophet (ﷺ) said: People in Paradise will look at others who have higher places there as we see a bright star far away on the horizon. They are rewarded more than others. The people asked, 'Are these special for prophets?' The Prophet (ﷺ) replied, 'No! These high places belong to those who believed in Allah and His messengers.'

title: Paradise has Eight Gates
content: The Prophet (ﷺ) said that Paradise has eight gates. One of these gates is called Ar-Raiyan. Only people who fast will be allowed to enter through this gate.

title: Wait for Cooler Weather
content: The Prophet (ﷺ) was on a journey. He said to wait and perform the Zuhr prayer when it's cooler outside. He repeated this until the shade from hills appeared. Then he said, 'Delay the prayer because hot weather is like Hell getting hotter.'

title: Delay Zuhr Prayer
content: The Prophet (ﷺ) said: 'Wait for the heat to go down before praying Zuhr. The strong sun is like the fire of Hell getting stronger.'

title: Hell Fire's Complaint
content: Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) said: The Hell Fire told Allah that its parts were eating each other. Allah allowed it to take two big breaths, one in winter and one in summer. This is why we feel very hot in summer and very cold in winter.

title: Cooling Fever with Zamzam Water
content: Ibn Abbas said to me when I had a fever: 'Use Zamzam water to cool it down. The Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) said that fever is like the heat of Hell, so use cold water to calm it.'

title: Cooling Down Fever
content: The Prophet (ﷺ) said: 'Fever is caused by the heat of Hell. Use water to cool it down.'

title: Cooling Down Fever
content: Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) said to his wife Aisha: 'Fever is a sign of the heat from Hell. Use water to cool it down.'

title: Abating Fever with Water
content: The Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) said to Ibn Umar: 'Fever is caused by the heat of Hell. Use water to reduce it.'

title: Hell Fire Compared to Our Fires
content: Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) said, 'Our everyday fires are just one part of the Hell Fire. There are 69 parts more, and each is as hot as our fire.'

title: The Gatekeeper of Hell
content: Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) was on the pulpit. He read from the Quran: 'They will call out to Malik.' Malik is the angel who guards the entrance to Hell.

title: Don't just advise others
content: Usama said he wouldn't openly advise the ruler 'Uthman. He would secretly tell him what was right and wrong, because he heard the Prophet say: A person will be thrown into Hell on Judgement Day. Their insides will come out and they'll walk around like a donkey at a millstone. People in Hell will ask them why they didn't do good deeds or stop bad ones when they were in charge. The person will say, 'I told you to do good and avoid evil, but I didn't follow my own advice.'

title: Prophet Cured of Magic
content: The Prophet (ﷺ) had magic done to him. He thought he was doing things that weren't real. One day, he prayed for a long time and then said he got a message from Allah on how to cure himself. In his dream, two people came to him. They asked each other what was wrong with the Prophet. One of them said he had been bewitched by Labid bin Al-A'sam. The Prophet (ﷺ) found out where this man lived and what he used for magic: a comb with hair stuck on it and some pollen from date-palms. He went to the well where these things were kept, but didn't take them out because he was cured already. He didn't want people to do the same thing and cause trouble.

title: Satan's Knots at Night
content: The Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) said: Satan ties three knots on the back of each person's head while they sleep. He says 'Sleep longer' at each knot. If you wake up and praise Allah, one knot is undone. If you wash your hands and face for prayer, another knot is undone. And if you pray, all knots are undone. You'll feel good in the morning, or low and tired.

title: Satan's Urine in the Ears
content: Abdullah told the Prophet that a man slept through the morning. The Prophet (ﷺ) said, 'That person has Satan's urine in his ears.'

title: Protect Our Family
content: The Prophet (ﷺ) said: 'When you have sex with your wife, say:

title: Pray at Right Times
content: Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) said: When the top of the sun appears in the morning, don't pray until it's fully up. And when its bottom disappears at sunset, wait until it's completely gone. Don't try to pray during sunrise or sunset because the devil is present there.

title: Prayer Times and Satan
content: The Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) said: When the top of the sun appears in the morning, don't pray until it's fully up. And when the bottom of the sun sets, don't pray until it's completely gone. Also, don't try to pray at sunrise or sunset because the devil is between those times.

title: Respect During Prayer Time
content: The Prophet (ﷺ) said: If someone tries to walk in front of you while you're praying, stop them. If they insist, stop them again. If they still try to push past, use gentle force to prevent them. This person is like a devil.

title: Abu Huraira's Zakat Story
content: Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) put Abu Huraira in charge of collecting charity during Ramadan. A man took some food without permission, so Abu Huraira caught him and said he would take him to the Prophet. The thief said that if Abu Huraira recited a certain verse from the Quran before sleeping, he would be protected by Allah until morning. But the Prophet said that the thief was actually telling the truth, even though he himself was Satan.

title: Don't Ask Satan's Question
content: The Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) said: 'Satan comes to you and asks questions like

title: Ramadan: Gates Opened
content: When Ramadan comes, the gates of Paradise are open and the gates of Hell are closed. The devils are also chained up during this time.

title: Moses and his Attendant
content: Prophet Moses told his servant, 'Bring us food.' The servant said, 'Do you remember when we went to the rock? I forgot the fish because Satan made me forget it.' Prophet Moses didn't get tired until he reached a place Allah had ordered him to go.

title: Allah's Messenger points to East
content: I saw the Prophet pointing towards the east. He said that problems will come from there, where Satan appears on the side of the head.

title: Protect Your Children at Night
content: When it gets dark, keep your children close to you. The devils are active then. After an hour or so, you can let them play freely again. Close the doors of your home and say 'Bismillah' (in God's name). Cover your dishes and utensils, saying 'Bismillah' as well. If you don't have a cover, use something to protect them.

title: Prophet's Night Visit
content: One night, I visited the Prophet while he was in a special state of prayer. After talking with him, I got up to leave. He wanted to walk me home, which was near Usama bin Zaid's house. Two men from Ansar saw us and quickly left. The Prophet (ﷺ) told them not to go, saying it was just me, his wife Safiya. They apologized, saying they didn't think he would be with her. The Prophet (ﷺ) explained that Satan can enter people's minds like blood flows through their bodies, and he worried Satan might put a bad idea in their heads.

title: Anger and Seeking Refuge
content: Two men were arguing in front of the Prophet. One man got very angry and his face turned red. The Prophet (ﷺ) said, 'I know a phrase that can calm him down.' He told them to say: 'I seek refuge with Allah from Satan.' If they did, all his anger would go away.

title: Protecting Offspring from Satan
content: The Prophet (ﷺ) said: 'When a man has sex with his wife, he should say:

title: Prophet Overpowers Satan
content: The Prophet (ﷺ) was praying. When he finished, he said that Satan had tried to stop him from focusing on his prayer. But Allah helped the Prophet to resist him.

title: Satan's Behavior During Prayer
content: Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) said: When the prayer call is made, Satan runs away. He comes back after the call ends. When it's time to start praying, he runs off again. After you finish praying, he tries to distract you and make you remember something else. This can make you forget how many prayers you've done. If this happens, do two prostration movements to correct yourself.

title: Satan touches newborns
content: The Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) said that when a baby is born, Satan tries to touch them with his fingers. But he couldn't touch Jesus, the son of Mary, because he touched something else instead.

title: Abu Darda's Question
content: Alqama visited Sham and asked who was there. They said Abu Darda was present. Abu Darda asked if the person protected by Allah from Satan, as mentioned by the Prophet, was among them. Mughira said that person was Ammar bin Yasir.

title: Angels Talk to Devils
content: The Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) said: 'While angels talk about things that will happen on earth, devils hear what they say and tell a fortune-teller. They add many lies to the truth.'

title: Yawning is from Satan
content: The Prophet (ﷺ) said: Yawning comes from Satan. If you yawn, try to stop it as soon as possible. If you say 'Ha' while yawning, Satan will laugh at you.

title: Satan's Deception at Uhud
content: After the battle of Uhud, Satan shouted to the Muslims. He said, 'Be careful of those behind you.' The front and back rows of Muslim fighters started fighting each other, thinking they were enemies. Hudhaifa saw his father being attacked by another Muslim. He shouted for help, but the fighter didn't stop. They killed Hudhaifa's father. Hudhaifa then asked Allah to forgive the killer.

title: Looking Around During Prayer
content: I asked the Prophet about looking around during prayer. He said that Satan takes away part of your prayer when you do this.

title: Good Dreams Come from Allah
content: The Prophet (ﷺ) said: A good dream is from Allah. A bad dream comes from Satan. If you have a bad dream and it scares you, spit on your left side to protect yourself. Then ask Allah for protection from its evil.

title: Reward for Saying Allah is One
content: The Prophet (ﷺ) said: If you say 'There's no one worthy of worship but Allah. He has no partners and all power belongs to Him' a hundred times in a day, it's like freeing ten slaves. You'll get good deeds and bad ones will be forgiven. Satan won't bother you from morning till evening. Only someone who does more than this is better.

title: Umar Meets the Prophet
content: One day, Umar asked to visit the Prophet. Some women from the Quraish tribe were there with him. They were talking loudly and asking for more help. When Umar arrived, the women quickly stood up and hid themselves. The Prophet (ﷺ) was smiling when he let Umar in. Umar said, 'May Allah always keep you happy.' The Prophet (ﷺ) replied, 'I'm surprised by these women. As soon as they heard your voice, they wanted to hide.' Umar told them, 'You should be afraid of the Prophet, not me!' They said, 'Yes, because you are scarier than him.' The Prophet (ﷺ) then said to Umar, 'By Allah, whenever Satan sees you taking a certain path, he follows another one'

title: Wash Your Nose After Sleep
content: When you wake up and wash your face for prayer, make sure to put water in your nose and blow it out three times. This is because the devil stays at the top of your nose while you sleep.

title: Abu Sa'id's Advice on Adhan
content: Abu Sa'id said to his father: 'When you call the Adhan, speak loudly so that anyone who hears it - human or Jinn - will be a witness for us on Judgment Day.' He learned this from the Prophet.

title: Kill Snakes for Safety
content: The Prophet (ﷺ) said: 'Kill snakes that can harm people. These include snakes with two white lines on their back and those with short tails. They can damage your eyesight and cause miscarriages.' Abdullah bin Umar was told by Abu Lubaba not to kill a snake, but he replied that the Prophet had ordered them to do so. Later, the Prophet prohibited killing snakes that live in houses.

title: Kill Harmful Snakes
content: The Prophet (ﷺ) told people to kill snakes that can harm their eyesight and cause miscarriages. He said to kill the ones with two white lines on their back, those with short tails, and any snake living outside homes. However, he later said not to kill snakes living in houses.

title: Abu Lubaba and Zaid see Ibn Umar
content: Ibn 'Umar said that Abu Lubaba and his brother Zaid bin Khattab saw him.

title: Best Property in Hard Times
content: Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) said: 'In the future, people's best possessions will be their sheep. They'll graze on mountains and places where it rains to protect their faith from problems.'

title: Disbelief is in the East
content: Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) said that most people who don't believe in God are from the east. People who own horses and camels often think they're better than others, but they forget about their faith. They're proud and arrogant. On the other hand, people who take care of sheep are humble and gentle.

title: Belief is in Yemen
content: Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) pointed to Yemen and said that true faith is found there. He also warned against being harsh and cruel, saying these qualities belong to the tribes of Rabi'a and Mudar, who were loud and at the back of their camels.

title: Angels and Devils Around Us
content: The Prophet (ﷺ) said: When you hear roosters crowing, ask Allah for blessings. This means the rooster has seen an angel. But when donkeys bray loudly, seek protection from Satan. This means they have seen a devil.

title: Protect Your Children at Night
content: When it's evening or nighttime, keep your children close to you because the devils are active during this time. Wait for an hour to pass, then let them go outside. Close all doors and say 'Bismillah' (in the name of Allah), so that Satan can't enter.

title: Lost Israelites: A Cursed Fate
content: The Prophet (ﷺ) said that a group of Jews were cursed and turned into rats. If you put camel milk in front of them, they won't drink it, but if you give them sheep milk, they will drink it. I told Ka'b about this Hadith from the Prophet.

title: Prophet's view on Salamanders
content: Aisha said the Prophet called salamanders troublemakers. He never told her to kill them. Sa'd bin Abi Waqqas thought the Prophet ordered to kill them, but Aisha disagreed.

title: Prophet Orders Killing of Lizards
content: The Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) ordered Um Sharik to kill salamanders.

title: Kill the Two-Lined Snake
content: Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) said: 'If you see a snake with two white lines on its back, kill it. It can cause blindness and miscarriage.'

title: Killing a Certain Snake
content: Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) ordered that a snake with a short or cut tail should be killed. This snake can cause blindness and abortion.

title: Killing Snakes in Islam
content: Ibn Umar used to kill snakes. But then he learned from the Prophet that most snakes should not be killed. The Prophet (ﷺ) once pulled down a wall and found a snake skin. He said, 'Find the snake.' They did and the Prophet told them to kill it. Later, Ibn Umar met Abu Lubaba who reminded him of another rule: only kill two types of snakes - those with short tails or those with white lines on their backs. These snakes cause harm.

title: Killing Snakes in Islam
content: Ibn Umar used to kill snakes. But then he learned from the Prophet that most snakes should not be killed. The Prophet (ﷺ) saw a snake's skin and said, 'Find the snake.' They found it and the Prophet told them to kill it because of its bad effects. Later, Ibn Umar met Abu Lubaba who reminded him of another rule: only kill two types of snakes - those with short or damaged tails and white lines on their backs.

title: Ibn Umar and Snakes
content: Nafi' told us that Ibn 'Umar used to kill snakes. But when Abu Lubaba said the Prophet had forbidden killing them in houses, Ibn 'Umar stopped doing it.

title: Ibn Umar and Snakes
content: Nafi' said that Ibn 'Umar used to kill snakes. But when Abu Lubaba told him that the Prophet had forbidden killing snakes in homes, he stopped doing it.

title: Animals That Can Be Killed
content: The Prophet (ﷺ) said that five types of animals can be killed even in a sacred area. These are the rat, scorpion, kite (a bird), crow, and rabid dog.

title: Animals to Kill in Ihram
content: Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) said: It is not wrong for someone wearing Ihram clothes to kill a scorpion, a rat, a dog with rabies, a crow, or a kite.

title: Protect Your Home at Night
content: The Prophet (ﷺ) said: 'Cover your pots and containers. Tie up your water bottles. Close your doors and keep your children close to you when it's dark outside. The Jinns come out at night and might take things from your home. When you go to bed, turn off the lights so a rat can't knock them over and start a fire.'

title: Snake in the Cave
content: Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) was with us in a cave. The Quranic chapter Al-Mursalat was being taught to us there. A snake came out of its hole, and we tried to catch it. But it went back into its hole before we could get it. Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) said, 'The snake is safe from your harm, and you are safe from its harm.'

title: Tying Up a Cat
content: The Prophet (ﷺ) said that a woman went to Hell because she had tied up her cat. She didn't give it food and didn't let it hunt for itself, so the cat suffered.

title: Prophet's Reaction to an Ant Bite
content: The Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) said that one of the prophets was resting under a tree when an ant bit him. He ordered his luggage to be moved away from the tree and then had the ants' home burned down. Allah sent him a message saying, 'Wouldn't it have been enough just to burn the single ant that bit you?'

title: Fly in Your Drink
content: The Prophet (ﷺ) said: If a fly falls into your drink, dip it out and take it back. One of its wings has a sickness, but the other wing has medicine to cure it.

title: Forgiveness for a Good Deed
content: Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) said: A prostitute saw a thirsty dog near a well. She took off her shoe and used it to get water for the dog. Because of this kind act, Allah forgave her.

title: No Dogs or Pictures
content: The Prophet (ﷺ) said: Angels do not enter a house that has either a dog in it or pictures on its walls.

title: Allah's Messenger Orders Dogs Killed
content: Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) ordered that dogs should be killed. Abdullah bin Umar was present when this order was given.

title: Dogs and Good Deeds
content: The Prophet (ﷺ) said: If you keep a dog for no good reason, it takes away some of your good actions every day. But if the dog helps with farming or protects animals, that's okay.

title: Dogs in the Home
content: Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) said: If you keep a dog that doesn't help with work or protect your animals, you will lose some of your good deeds every day.

title: Adam's Height and Greeting
content: Allah created Adam. He was very tall - 60 cubits high. Allah told Adam to go to a group of angels and greet them. Adam said, 'Peace be upon you.' The angels replied, 'Peace and mercy of Allah be upon you.' From then on, people have been getting shorter.

title: Paradise: The First Group
content: Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) said that the first people to enter Paradise will shine like a full moon and stars. They won't have body waste, their combs are made of gold, and their sweat smells good. They'll use aloes-wood in their homes and be with beautiful houri wives. All of them will look alike and be very tall, sixty cubits high.

title: Bathing after Nocturnal Discharge
content: Um Salama asked the Prophet if a woman needs to take a bath after getting nocturnal discharge. The Prophet (ﷺ) said yes, if she notices any water coming out. Um Salama smiled and asked another question: Why do children look like their mothers? The Prophet (ﷺ) replied that's because of the discharge.

title: Abdullah bin Salam Meets the Prophet
content: Anas said that Abdullah bin Salam came to the Prophet when he arrived in Medina. Abdullah asked him three questions: What will be the first sign of the end times? What food will people eat in heaven? Why do children look like their parents and grandparents? The Prophet (ﷺ) said, 'Gabriel just told me these answers.' Abdullah said, 'Gabriel is an enemy to the Jews.' The Prophet (ﷺ) explained that the first sign of the end times will be a big fire that brings people from far away. He said the first food in heaven will be a special part of fish liver. And he explained how children get their looks from their parents and grandparents. Abdullah then said, 'I believe you are the Messenger of Allah.' The Jews knew Abdullah was smart and kind, so they told the Prophet about him. They said, 'He is the most learned person among us.' The Prophet (ﷺ) asked them what would happen if Abdullah became a Muslim. The Jews said, 'May Allah protect him from that!' Then Abdullah came out in front of them and said, 'I believe there's only one God, and Muhammad (ﷺ) is His Messenger.' The Jews were angry and said bad things about him.

title: Meat Does Not Decay
content: The Prophet (ﷺ) said that if it wasn't for the Israelis, meat would not go bad. He also said that if Eve hadn't disobeyed Allah, wives would never cheat on their husbands.

title: Treat Women with Kindness
content: The Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) said to Abu Huraira: 'Be kind to women. They are made from a curved part of the ribcage. If you try to straighten it, it will break. Leave them as they are and be gentle.'

title: Creation and Destiny
content: Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) said: 'When a person is in their mother's womb, they are formed over 120 days. Then an angel comes to write four things about them: what deeds they will do, when they will die, how they will live, and whether they will be happy or unhappy with Allah. After that, the soul is given to them. A person can start doing good deeds but then go back to bad ones. Or they can start doing bad deeds but then change to good ones. This shows what was written by the angel can change.

title: Angel's Role in Creation
content: The Prophet (ﷺ) said that Allah has a special angel in the womb. This angel says to Allah: 'It's just a drop of discharge', then 'a clot', and finally 'a piece of flesh'. If Allah wants to complete the child, the angel asks: 'Will it be a boy or a girl? Will they be happy with their faith or not? What kind of life will they have? How long will they live?' The angel writes down all this information while the baby is still in its mother's womb.

title: Will You Give Up Everything
content: The Prophet (ﷺ) said: Allah will ask someone in Hell, 'Would you give all the world's wealth to escape this punishment?' They'll say yes. Then Allah will remind them of a time when they had much less to offer - not worshiping others besides Him, but still refusing.

title: Adam's Responsibility for Murder
content: Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) said that when someone is killed unfairly, the first son of Adam shares some blame. He was the one who started killing others.

title: Similar Souls, Different Qualities
content: I heard the Prophet say that souls are like groups of soldiers. Those with similar qualities get along well together, but those who have different qualities don't agree and often disagree.

title: Warning about the Dajjal
content: Ibn Umar said that once the Prophet stood among people and praised Allah. He then talked about the Dajjal, warning them against him. The Prophet (ﷺ) said no prophet warned their followers without mentioning the Dajjal. He added that the Dajjal is one-eyed, but Allah is not.

title: The Story of Dajjal
content: Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) said: 'I'll tell you about the Dajjal. He's one-eyed and will bring things that look like Hell and Paradise, but what he calls Paradise is actually Hell. I'm warning you about him, just like Prophet Noah warned his people.'

title: Noah's Witness on Judgment Day
content: Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) said: 'On the Day of Resurrection, Allah will ask Noah if he delivered his message. Noah will say yes. Then Allah will ask Noah's people if they received a prophet. They'll say no one came to them. So Allah will ask Noah who can be a witness for him. He'll say I and my followers will stand as witnesses.' This is like what the Quran says: 'We made you a fair nation, so you can be witnesses on earth'.

title: The Day of Resurrection
content: We were at a meal with the Prophet. He liked a certain dish and ate some of it. Then he said, 'I will be in charge on the Day of Judgment.' He explained how Allah would gather all people together in one place where everyone could see each other and hear announcements. Some people would ask Adam to help them because he was created by Allah's hands and lived in Paradise. But Adam would say, 'My Lord is very angry with me too. I disobeyed Him once. Go to someone else.' They would go to Noah, but he would also say, 'I'm worried about myself. My Lord is even angrier than before. Go to the Prophet.' Finally, they would come to him and he would be allowed to intercede for them.

title: Walking Around the Kaaba
content: Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) recited a verse from the Quran. He said: 'Is there any of my companions who has not yet walked around the House (Kaaba)?'

title: Jibril Takes the Prophet to Heaven
content: Abu Dhar said that the Prophet was at Makkah when Jibril came down and opened his chest. He washed it with Zamzam water, then poured wisdom and faith into his heart. Jibril took the Prophet's hand and they went up to heaven. At the first gate, the gatekeeper asked who they were, and Jibril said 'Muhammad (ﷺ)' is with me. The gate was opened, and they went in. They saw Adam sitting on a throne, surrounded by people. Those on his right were happy, those on his left were sad. Jibril explained that these were the souls of Adam's children, some going to Paradise, some to Hell. Then they went up higher and met Idris, Musa, Isa, and Ibrahim. Each one welcomed the Prophet warmly. When they reached a certain point, the Prophet heard the sound of pens scratching. Jibril took him further until they reached the boundary of heaven, where they saw beautiful tents made of pearls and earth that smelled like perfume.

title: Prophet's Victory and the Wind
content: Ibn Abbas said that the Prophet told him: 'I was given victory with a strong east wind. The people of Ad were destroyed by a strong west wind.'

title: Ali Sends Gold to the Prophet
content: Ali sent a piece of gold to the Prophet. He divided it among four men: Al-Aqra', Uyaina, Zaid, and 'Alqama. The Quraish and Ansar were unhappy because they didn't get any. They said, 'The Prophet (ﷺ) gives money to people from Najd but not to us.' The Prophet (ﷺ) replied, 'I give them money to make friends with Islam.' A man came and scolded the Prophet, saying, 'Be afraid of God!' The Prophet (ﷺ) asked, 'Who would follow God's orders if I disobeyed Him?' Someone suggested killing the man, but the Prophet stopped it. When the man left, the Prophet said, 'Some of his children will read the Quran, but they won't understand its meaning. They'll leave Islam like an arrow goes through a target. They'll hurt Muslims but not harm idolaters.'

title: Walking Around the House
content: Abdullah said he heard the Prophet reciting: 'Is there anyone who remembers?'

title: Prophet Warns of Danger
content: The Prophet (ﷺ) visited Zainab bint Jahsh and seemed worried. He said, 'There is no God but Allah.' He warned the Arabs about a great danger that was coming close. He showed her how big an opening had been made in the wall to let Gog and Magog out. Zainab asked if they would be destroyed even though there were good people among them. The Prophet (ﷺ) replied, 'Yes, when bad people become more and more.'

title: Gog and Magog Barrier
content: The Prophet (ﷺ) said, 'Allah made a hole in the wall where Gog and Magog live. He used his own hands to make it.'

title: Adam's Answer on Judgment Day
content: Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) said: Allah will ask Adam to bring out people who will go to Hell. Adam will ask how many, and Allah will say nine hundred ninety-nine from every thousand people. At that time, children will look old, pregnant women will miscarry, and people will seem drunk but not be drunk. They'll be scared of Allah's anger. The Prophet 's (ﷺ) companions asked who the one person is among them. He said it's one of you, while nine hundred ninety-nine are from a group called Gog and Magog. The Prophet (ﷺ) said he hopes they're one-fourth, then one-third, then half of all people in Paradise. When he said that, his companions were very happy.

title: Judgment Day: What to Expect
content: The Prophet (ﷺ) said that on the Day of Judgment, people will be gathered without shoes, clothes, or being circumcised. He recited a verse from the Quran saying God's promise is to recreate creation again. The first person to wear clothes will be Abraham. Some of his companions will go to the left side (the Hell Fire), and he will try to save them by saying they didn't leave Islam after he died. He will quote Jesus, saying that if God punishes them, they are His slaves, but if He forgives them, He is all-powerful and wise.

title: Abraham's Father on Judgement Day
content: Prophet Abraham said to his father Azar: 'I told you not to disobey me.' His father replied, 'Today I won't disobey you.' But Prophet Abraham said, 'You promised not to be ashamed of me. Disgracing my father is the worst shame for me.' Then Allah said, 'Paradise is forbidden for those who don't believe.' Someone asked Prophet Abraham, 'What's under your feet?' He looked down and saw a dirty animal being thrown into Hell.

title: Prophet Muhammad Enters Ka'ba
content: Ibn Abbas said the Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) entered the Ka'ba and saw pictures of Abraham and Mary inside. He asked, 'Why are there pictures here? We know angels don't enter homes with pictures.' He also pointed out that Abraham was shown practicing divination by arrows.

title: Prophet Muhammad and Pictures
content: Ibn Abbas said the Prophet saw pictures in the Kaaba. He didn't enter until he ordered them to be erased. The pictures showed Abraham and Ishmael with arrows, but the Prophet said they never used divination by arrows.

title: Who is Most Honorable?
content: Some people asked the Prophet: 'Who is the most honorable person in God's sight?' He replied: 'Those who are the most righteous.' They said, 'We don't want to ask about that.' The Prophet (ﷺ) then said: 'If you must know, it was Joseph. He was a prophet and the son of Abraham, who was also a close friend of God.' They didn't want to ask more questions. So the Prophet said: 'You want to know about the Arabs' history? Those who were best in their old ways will be the best Muslims if they learn about our faith.'

title: Two People Visited the Prophet
content: Samura said: The Prophet (ﷺ) told me that two people came to him at night in a dream. They took him with them and they passed by Abraham, who was very tall - so tall that I couldn't see his head.

title: Abraham's Appearance
content: Ibn Abbas said that the Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) said: 'If you want to see Abraham, look at me.' He also described Moses as a man with curly hair and brown skin who rode a red camel with reins made of date palm fibres.

title: Abraham's Circumcision at 80
content: Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) said that Abraham had his circumcision done with a curved blade axe when he was 80 years old.

title: Abraham's Three Lies
content: Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) said that Abraham lied only three times. He was a truthful man and usually spoke the truth.

title: Abraham and Sarah's Journey
content: Abraham told a lie three times. Twice to get out of work for Allah when he said he was sick. The third time, he lied about his wife Sarah being his sister to the ruler of a land they were traveling through. The ruler wanted to take Sarah as a wife but couldn't touch her because she prayed to Allah to stop him. Eventually, the ruler gave Sarah Hajar as a servant instead. This woman Hajar was the mother of Ishmael and the ancestor of many Arabs.

title: Kill Salamanders
content: Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) ordered to kill salamanders. He said they blew fire on Abraham.

title: Understanding the Verse of Shirk
content: When the Prophet received the verse 'It is those who believe and do not confuse their belief with wrong', Abdullah asked, 'Who among us has not done something wrong?' The Prophet (ﷺ) replied that 'wrong' means joining others in worship with Allah. He reminded them of Luqman's advice to his son: 'Do not join others in worship with Allah, because it is a great mistake.'

title: Day of Resurrection Gathering
content: Some meat was given to the Prophet. He said that on the Day of Resurrection, all people will be gathered in one place. Everyone's voice and actions will be known. The sun will be close to them. People will ask Abraham for help with Allah. But Abraham will remember his mistakes and say 'Go to Moses'.

title: Zamzam Well's Origin
content: The Prophet (ﷺ) said that Allah is pleased with the mother of Ishmael. If she hadn't quickly filled her water bottle from Zamzam, it would have been a stream on the surface. Abraham brought Ishmael and his mother to Mecca. She had a water bottle with her and was feeding Ishmael.

title: Zamzam's Origin
content: The Prophet (ﷺ) said that Allah is pleased with the mother of Ishmael. If she hadn't quickly filled her water bottle from Zamzam, it would have been a stream on the ground. Abraham brought Ishmael and his mother to Mecca. She was feeding him and had a water bottle with her.

title: Ishmael's Mother and the Zamzam Well
content: Abraham brought Ishmael and his mother to a place near the Kaaba. They had no one else there, so Abraham left them with some food and water. The mother of Ishmael was worried because they were alone in the desert. She asked Abraham if Allah told him to leave them, but he said yes. She trusted that Allah would take care of them. When the water ran out, she looked for someone to help her, but there was no one around. So she went to a mountain and looked again, but still saw no one. This happened seven times as she walked between two mountains called Safa and Marwa. After this, an angel appeared to her near the Zamzam well and told her not to worry because Allah would take care of them. The angel dug into the ground with his heel, and water came out. Ishmael's mother was happy and started drinking from the well and giving milk to her son. Some people later found the well and settled there too.

title: First Mosques Built
content: Abu Dhar asked the Prophet: 'Which mosque was built first?' The Prophet (ﷺ) said: 'Al-Masjid-ul-Haram in Mecca.' Abu Dhar then asked: 'What about the next one?' The Prophet (ﷺ) replied: 'The mosque of Al-Aqsa in Jerusalem.' Abu Dhar asked: 'How long did it take to build between the two?' The Prophet (ﷺ) said: 'Forty years.' He added: 'When prayer time comes, pray there. It's best to do so on time.'

title: Medina's Sanctuary
content: Anas bin Malik said that when the Prophet saw the mountain of Uhud, he said: 'This mountain loves us and we love it.' He then prayed to Allah, saying: 'Abraham made Mecca a safe place. I make this area between these two mountains in Medina a safe place too.'

title: Rebuilding the Ka'ba
content: Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) said to his wife Aisha: 'When your people built the Ka'ba, they didn't use all of Abraham's foundations.' Aisha asked why it couldn't be rebuilt on those foundations. The Prophet (ﷺ) replied that he wouldn't do so because many people had recently stopped being disbelievers.

title: How to Send Blessings
content: Some people asked the Prophet how they should ask Allah for blessings on him. The Prophet (ﷺ) said: 'Say: O Allah, send your mercy on Muhammad (ﷺ) and his family, just like you sent it on Abraham's family. And send your blessings on Muhammad (ﷺ) and his family, just like you sent them on Abraham's family.'

title: How to Send Blessings
content: Ka'b bin Ujrah gave me a gift from the Prophet. I asked him how we should ask Allah for blessings on him and his family. He said, 'Say: O Allah! Send Your Mercy on Muhammad (ﷺ) and his family, just like You sent it to Abraham and his family. And send Your Blessings on Muhammad (ﷺ) and his family, just like You sent them to Abraham and his family.'

title: Protecting Children with Prayer
content: Ibn Abbas said the Prophet used to ask Allah for protection for his grandsons Hasan and Husain. He would say: 'Just like our ancestor Abraham, I seek refuge in Allah's perfect words from bad spirits, poisonous insects, and evil eyes that wish harm.'

title: Abraham's Faith and Doubt
content: Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) said that Abraham was unsure about how Allah brings people back to life. Abraham asked Allah to show him, but he already believed in Allah. He wanted to be even stronger in his faith. The Prophet (ﷺ) also mentioned Lot, who wanted a strong helper. If Abraham were imprisoned like Joseph, he would have accepted freedom without proving his innocence.

title: Prophet Muhammad Encourages Archery
content: The Prophet (ﷺ) passed by some people from the tribe of Aslam practicing archery. He said, 'Practice archery like your father Ishmael was a great archer.' One team stopped throwing because they thought he was on the other side. The Prophet (ﷺ) asked them to keep going and said, 'I'm with you all.'

title: Honorable People
content: Some people asked the Prophet who was the most honorable person. He said it's someone who is very scared of Allah. They didn't ask about that. Then they asked about family relationships, but he said no. Finally, they asked about Arab tribes. The Prophet (ﷺ) said that those Arabs who were good before Islam are still good in Islam if they understand its teachings.

title: Lot's Request for Help
content: Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) said: 'May Allah forgive Lot. He wanted a strong helper.'

title: Remember and Avoid Evil
content: The Prophet (ﷺ) recited a verse from the Quran: 'Is there anyone who will remember and avoid evil?'

title: Cutting the She-Camel's Legs
content: Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) said that a man was chosen to harm Salih's she-camel. This man was very respected and powerful in his community, just like Abdullah bin Zam'a's father Abu Zam'a.

title: Prophet Muhammad's Warning
content: When Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) arrived at Al-Hijr during a battle, he told his friends not to use the well's water. They said they had already mixed it with dough and filled their bags with it. The Prophet (ﷺ) then ordered them to throw away the dough and pour out the water.

title: Prophet's Order at Al-Hijr
content: Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) and his companions arrived at a place called Al-Hijr. They took water from its well to drink and make bread with it. The Prophet (ﷺ) then told them to pour out the water they had taken, feed their camels with the dough, and get water from another well that was used by a special camel.

title: Don't Enter Their Homes
content: Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) passed by a place called Al Hijr. He said to his companions: 'Do not go into the houses of those who were unfair to themselves, unless you are sad about what happened to them. You might suffer the same punishment.' Then he covered his face with a cloth while riding on his camel.

title: Don't Enter Ruined Homes
content: Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) said: Don't go into the old homes of people who were unfair to themselves. If you do, be sad, because you might get the same punishment they did.

title: Joseph's Family Line
