content: The Prophet (ﷺ) said that Joseph was the son of a good person. His father Jacob was also from a good family. His grandfather Isaac and great-grandfather Abraham were all respected people.

title: Who is Most Honorable?
content: Abu Huraira asked the Prophet: 'Who is the most honorable person?' The Prophet (ﷺ) replied: 'Someone who fears Allah.' People said, 'We don't want to ask about this.' The Prophet (ﷺ) said: 'Joseph, a prophet and son of prophets, was very honorable.' They said, 'No more questions.' The Prophet (ﷺ) said: 'Then you want to know where people come from? There are many origins. Those who were best in the past will be best now if they understand Islam'.

title: Prophet orders Abu Bakr
content: The Prophet (ﷺ) asked Aisha to tell Abu Bakr to lead the prayer. She said he would cry and couldn't do it. The Prophet (ﷺ) told her again, saying she was like the women who helped Joseph, and that Abu Bakr should still lead the prayer.

title: Prophet's Order to Lead Prayer
content: When the Prophet was ill, he told Abu Musa to ask Abu Bakr to lead the people in prayer. Aisha said Abu Bakr is kind-hearted and wouldn't be good for this job. The Prophet (ﷺ) asked again, comparing Aisha to Joseph's sisters who didn't want him to lead. He repeated his order, so Abu Bakr led the people in prayer while the Prophet was still alive.

title: Allah's Messenger Prays for Help
content: Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) said to Allah: 'Save Ayyash bin Abi Rabi'a from the unfair treatment. Save Salama bin Hisham. Send punishment on the people of Mudar tribe. Let them face years like those during Joseph's time'.

title: Lot's Wish for Help
content: Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) said: 'May Allah be merciful to Lot. He wanted someone strong to help him. If I were in prison like Joseph was, and then got a chance to leave, I would have taken it.'

title: Aisha's Story of Slander
content: I asked Um Ruman, Aisha's mother about the rumors against Aisha. She said an Ansari woman came to us and said 'Let Allah condemn so-and-so.' I asked her why she said that. The woman replied it was because he spread a false story. Aisha asked what story, then told me. Aisha asked if Abu Bakr and the Prophet had heard about it. The woman said yes. Aisha fell down unconscious when she heard this. When she came to, she got a fever and shaking body. The Prophet (ﷺ) came and asked what was wrong with her. I said she had a fever because of a story. Aisha stood up and said 'Even if I took an oath, you wouldn't believe me.' She compared herself to Jacob's sons who were accused by their brother. Aisha said Allah is the only one we can ask for help. The Prophet (ﷺ) left and then Allah revealed verses about this matter.

title: Prophets' Hope and Faith
content: 'Urwa asked Aisha about a Verse: 'Until when the prophets gave up hope for their people.' Aisha said, 'Their nations didn't believe them.' 'Urwa said, 'They were sure they were treated as liars.' Aisha agreed. 'Urwa asked, 'Does this mean the prophets thought Allah wouldn't help them?' Aisha said, 'No, it means their followers had faith but faced a long time of trials. They started to doubt, then Allah helped them when the prophets lost hope for their people's change of heart.'

title: Joseph's Family Line
content: The Prophet (ﷺ) said that Joseph was a son of Jacob, who was a son of Isaac, and Isaac was a son of Abraham. All these people were considered honorable.

title: Job's Experience with Gold Locusts
content: Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) said to Abu Huraira: Job was taking a bath when gold locusts fell on him. He put them in his clothes. His Lord called out, 'Job, do you not have enough wealth?' Job replied, 'Yes, but I need your blessings'.

title: Prophet Muhammad's Vision
content: The Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) came back to his wife Khadija. He was feeling anxious and his heart was beating fast. She took him to a man named Waraqa bin Naufal, who had become Muslim from being Christian. Waraqa asked the Prophet what he was seeing. The Prophet (ﷺ) told him about his vision. Waraqa said that it was the same angel who helped the Prophet Moses. If he lived long enough, Waraqa promised to support the Prophet strongly when the message of Allah came.

title: Meeting Aaron in Heaven
content: Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) told his friends about a special journey he took to the heavens. When he reached the fifth heaven, he met someone named Aaron. Gabriel said, 'This is Aaron.' The Prophet (ﷺ) greeted him and so did Aaron, saying, 'Welcome, O Pious Brother and Pious Prophet'.

title: Prophets in Heaven
content: Abu Huraira said that the Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) said: 'When I went up to heaven, I saw Moses. He was thin and had long hair like some men from the tribe of Shanua. I also saw Jesus. He was average height with a red face, as if he'd just washed his face. I look more like Abraham than any of his children do. Gabriel gave me two cups: one with milk and one with wine. He said, 'Choose what you want.' I chose the milk. Gabriel said, 'You've chosen what's natural, which is Islam. If you had chosen the wine, your followers would have gone astray'.

title: The Prophet's Comparison
content: The Prophet (ﷺ) said he was not better than Jonah. He mentioned his father Matta and talked about the night of his Ascension. He described Moses as a tall, brown man from the tribe of Shanu'a. Jesus was a curly-haired person of average height. The Prophet (ﷺ) also mentioned Malik, who guards the Hell Fire, and Ad-Dajjal.

title: The Prophet's Description
content: Ibn Abbas said the Prophet said: 'Don't say I'm better than Jonah.' He mentioned his father Matta. The Prophet (ﷺ) talked about a night when he went up to heaven. He described the prophets Moses and Jesus, saying Moses was tall with dark skin, like some people from the Shanu'a tribe. Jesus had curly hair and was average height. The Prophet (ﷺ) also talked about Malik, who guards the fire of Hell, and Ad-Dajjal.

title: Fasting on Ashura Day
content: When Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) came to Medina, he saw that the Jews were fasting on a special day called 'Ashura'. They said this was the day Allah saved Moses and destroyed Pharaoh's people. Moses used to fast on this day as thanks to Allah. The Prophet (ﷺ) said, 'I am closer to Moses than they are.' So, he also started fasting on Ashura Day and told Muslims to do the same.

title: Moses on Judgement Day
content: Abu Sa'id said that the Prophet said: On the Day of Resurrection, people will be unconscious. I'll wake up first and see Moses holding a pillar of Allah's Throne. I'll wonder if he woke up before me or was spared because he fainted at Mount Tur.

title: Meat Doesn't Decay
content: Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) said that if the Israelites didn't exist, meat would not go bad. He also said that if Eve hadn't disobeyed God, no woman would ever cheat on her husband.

title: Moses Meets a Wise Man
content: Moses and Ibn Abbas disagreed about who was the wise companion of Moses. Ibn Abbas said it was Al-Khadir. A man named Ubai bin Ka'b passed by them and they asked him if he had heard anything from the Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) about this companion. He said yes, and told them that once, while Moses was with some other Israelites, a man came to him and asked if there was anyone wiser than him. Moses said no. Then Allah sent a message to Moses saying Al-Khadir was indeed wiser. Moses wanted to meet Al-Khadir, so he was given a sign - a fish that would help him find his companion. When the fish disappeared, Moses went back and followed its tracks until he found Al-Khadir.

title: Moses Meets Al-Khadir
content: Ibn Abbas said that the Prophet told a story about Moses. A man from Bani Israel asked who was the most knowledgeable person. Moses said he was, but Allah scolded him for not giving credit to Him. Then He said there was someone at the sea who knew more than Moses. Moses wanted to meet this person and asked how to find him. Allah told him to take a fish in a basket and follow it. The fish would lead them to the man. They followed the fish, which swam into the sea like a tunnel. When they reached the place where the fish stopped, they met Al-Khadir. He was lying on his side with a garment covering him. Moses greeted him, and he asked how people greet in their land. Then Al-Khadir said some of Allah's knowledge that Moses didn't know, and vice versa. Moses wanted to follow Al-Khadir, but he warned him that he wouldn't be patient for things he couldn't understand. They traveled along the sea shore until a boat passed by them. The crew recognized Al-Khadir and took them on board without charging anything. On the boat, a sparrow dipped its beak into the sea, and Al-Khadir said this reduced Allah's knowledge as much as the water reduced. Then he took an adze and plucked a plank from the boat, making a hole in it. Moses thought this was wrong but didn't understand why. They left the sea and passed by a boy playing with other children. Al-Khadir took hold of the boy's head and killed him like he would pick fruit. Moses was shocked and said this was a horrible thing to do. Al-Khadir told him again that he couldn't be patient for things he didn't understand. They went on until they came to a village where people refused to give them food or shelter. But when they left, Al-Khadir touched the wall of their house, and it became stable again. Moses was confused and said this seemed unfair. Al-Khadir told him that this was the end of their time together and explained what had happened.

title: Why Al-Khadir was named
content: Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) said that Al-Khadir's name came from when he sat on a dry, white land. After that, the land grew green with plants.

title: Bani Israel's Warning
content: Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) said: The people of Bani Israel were told to enter a town with respect and say 'Repentance'. But they changed the words and crawled in on their hands and knees, saying 'A small grain is stuck in my hair'.

title: Moses' Shyness and Innocence
content: Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) said that Moses was a shy person who covered his body because of it. Some people accused him of having a skin problem, but Allah wanted to clear his name. One day, while Moses was alone, he took off his clothes and put them on a stone. The stone then ran away with the clothes! Moses chased after it, saying 'Give me back my garment!' He finally caught up to some people from Bani Israel who saw him naked but thought he was the best person created by Allah. They realized Allah had been telling the truth about Moses all along. To prove his innocence, Moses hit a stone with his stick and it still has marks today. This is what Allah meant when He said 'Don't be like those people who accused Moses wrongly.'

title: Prophet's Fair Distribution
content: The Prophet (ﷺ) gave some things to his followers. A man said it wasn't fair. I told the Prophet about this. He got very angry and said that Moses had been treated unfairly too, but he was patient.

title: Prophets were Shepherds
content: Jabir bin Abdullah said: We were with the Prophet picking fruit from trees. The Prophet (ﷺ) said, 'Pick the black ones because they are the best.' Some asked him, 'Were you a shepherd?' He replied, 'No prophet was ever a shepherd.'

title: Moses and the Angel of Death
content: Abu Huraira said that when the Angel of Death came to Moses, Moses hit him in the eye. The angel went back to Allah and said, 'You sent me to a person who doesn't want to die.' Allah told him to tell Moses to put his hand on an ox's back. For every hair under it, Moses would live for one more year. Moses asked what would happen after that. Allah said death would come eventually. Moses then said, 'Let it come now.' He also asked to be buried near the Sacred Land.

title: Comparing Ourselves to Prophets
content: Two people, a Muslim and a Jew, had an argument. The Muslim said, 'I swear by the One who loves Muhammad (ﷺ) more than anyone else.' The Jew replied, 'I swear by the One who loves Moses more than anyone else.' The Muslim got angry and hit the Jew. The Jew went to tell the Prophet what happened. The Prophet (ﷺ) said, 'Don't say I'm better than Moses. On Judgment Day, people will lose consciousness, but I'll be awake first. When I wake up, I might see Moses standing next to Allah's throne. But I won't know if he woke up before me or was spared from losing consciousness.'

title: Adam and Moses Argue
content: Abu Huraira said that the Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) said: Adam and Moses argued. Moses said to Adam, 'You made a mistake that got you kicked out of Paradise.' Adam replied, 'But you are Moses, chosen by Allah as His messenger and spoken to directly. You blame me for something that was already written in my fate before I was even created?' The Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) said twice, 'And so Adam won the argument.'

title: Prophet Sees Many People
content: The Prophet (ﷺ) came to us and said, 'I saw many people from different nations. They were so many that they covered the horizon.' Someone told him, 'This is Moses and his followers'.

title: Women's Levels of Perfection
content: Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) said: 'Many men reached a high level of goodness. But only three women achieved this level: Asia, Pharaoh's wife; Mary, the daughter of Imran; and Aisha. Aisha is like a special meal that stands out from all others.'

title: The Prophet's Humble Nature
content: The Prophet (ﷺ) said to Abdullah: 'Don't say I'm better than Jonah.'

title: Don't think you're better
content: The Prophet (ﷺ) said that no Muslim should say they are better than Yunus bin Matta. He mentioned Yunus' father's name when saying his full name, showing respect for him.

title: Respecting All Prophets
content: Abu Huraira said that a Jew was selling something and got offered a price he didn't like. He said, 'I swear by the One Who made Moses better than all people!' An Ansari man heard this and slapped him on the face. The Jew went to the Prophet and complained about being slapped. The Prophet (ﷺ) asked why it happened and was told the whole story. The Prophet (ﷺ) got angry and said, 'Don't think one prophet is better than another. When the trumpet blows, everyone will fall asleep except those Allah chooses not to. I'll be the first to wake up and see Moses holding Allah's Throne. I don't know if he woke up before me or not.'

title: Slapping a Jew in the Market
content: Abu Huraira said that one day a Jewish man was selling something. He didn't like the price he was offered, so he said 'I swear by God who gave Moses power over all people.' An Ansari man heard him and slapped him on the face. The Jewish man went to the Prophet and complained about being slapped. The Prophet (ﷺ) asked why it happened and the Ansari man explained. The Prophet (ﷺ) got angry and said: 'Don't say any prophet is better than another. When the trumpet blows, everyone will fall asleep except those God chooses not to sleep. I'll be the first to wake up, but I won't know if Moses woke up before me or not. And I don't think anyone is better than Yunus bin Matta.'

title: The Prophet's Humility
content: Abu Huraira said that the Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) said: 'No one should say I am better than Yunus bin Matta.'

title: David's Easy Recitation
content: Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) said: David was given a special gift. He could easily recite the Psalms. Before his animals were saddled, he would finish reading it. And he only ate food earned from his own work.

title: Moderate Fasting
content: Abdullah bin Amr told the Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) that he wanted to fast all his life and pray at night. The Prophet (ﷺ) asked if Abdullah really said this, and Abdullah said yes. The Prophet (ﷺ) told him not to do this because it's too hard. He suggested fasting for three days a month, which is like fasting for a year. Abdullah thought he could do more, so the Prophet suggested fasting every third day, then alternate days. This was how David used to fast, and the Prophet said there's nothing better than that.

title: Fasting for a Whole Year
content: The Prophet (ﷺ) told me to stop fasting every day and praying every night. He said it would make my eyes weak and I'd get bored. Instead, he suggested I fast three days a month. This is like fasting the whole year. If I wanted to do more, he said I could fast like David did - alternate days. But if there's an enemy attack, don't stop fighting.

title: David's Fasting and Prayer
content: Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) told me that David loved to fast on alternate days. He would sleep for half the night, pray for one-third of it, and then sleep again for a sixth of the night.

title: Reciting Surat-Sa'd
content: I asked Ibn `Abbas if we should pray when reciting a certain part of the Quran. He read it to me: 'David and Solomon were prophets, and so were others.' Then he said, 'Our Prophet is among those who should follow their example.'

title: Prostration in Sura-Sa'd
content: Ibn Abbas said the Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) used to prostrate when reciting Sura Sa'd. But this is not one of the required prostrations.

title: Prophet Muhammad and a Demon
content: Abu Huraira said the Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) said: A strong demon from the Jinns came to me. He wanted to stop my prayer, but I was able to defeat him. I caught him and thought about tying him to a mosque pillar so you could all see him. But then I remembered something Solomon said in his prayer: 'Give me power like no one else will have.' So I let the demon go and cursed him.

title: Solomon's Children
content: Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) said that Solomon told his companion he would sleep with 70 women and each would have a son who would fight for Allah. His companion said 'if Allah wills'. But one woman did get pregnant and gave birth to a half child. If Solomon had said 'if Allah wills', he would have had children who fought for Allah.

title: First Mosques Built
content: Abu Dharr asked the Prophet which mosque was built first. The Prophet (ﷺ) said Al-Masjid-ul-Haram was built first, then Al-Masjid-ul-Aqsa in Jerusalem. Abu Dharr asked how long it took between them and the Prophet replied 40 years. He also said that wherever you are when prayer time comes, you can pray there because all of earth is a place for worship.

title: The Prophet's Warning
content: The Prophet (ﷺ) said that people are like moths flying into a fire. He also told a story about two women who both claimed a wolf took their child. The judge, Solomon, was asked to cut the child in half, but the younger woman spoke up and said it was her child. She got to keep it.

title: Allah's Messenger's Wisdom
content: One day, Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) said that people are like moths and insects flying into a fire. He also told a story about two women who had children with them. A wolf took one child, and they both went to the king David for help. But then they went to his son Solomon, who wanted to cut the child in half. The younger woman begged him not to do it, so he gave her the child.

title: Companions' Doubts About Faith
content: Abdullah said the Prophet's companions were worried when they heard a verse about people mixing faith with wrong things. They asked, 'Who among us hasn't done that?' Allah then revealed another verse saying don't worship anyone else besides God, because it's very wrong to do so.

title: Belief and Wrongdoing
content: When the Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) received a verse that said 'Those who believe but mix faith with wrong', his followers were worried. They asked him, 'Who among us doesn't make mistakes?' The Prophet (ﷺ) replied, 'This verse isn't talking about making mistakes in life. It's about worshiping other gods besides Allah.' He reminded them of what Luqman told his son: 'Don't join others in worship with Allah. Worshiping other gods is a big mistake.'

title: Prophet's Journey to Heaven
content: The Prophet (ﷺ) talked about his journey to the heavens. He said Gabriel took him up to the second heaven and asked for the gate to be opened. Gabriel said, 'I'm Gabriel.' It was asked who he was with, and he replied, 'Muhammad (ﷺ).' They were asked if Muhammad (ﷺ) had been called, and Gabriel said yes. When they reached the second heaven, the Prophet saw John and Jesus. Gabriel said, 'These are John and Jesus.' The Prophet (ﷺ) greeted them, and they returned his greeting by saying, 'Welcome, O Pious Brother and Pious Prophet!'

title: Satan's Touch at Birth
content: Abu Huraira said that the Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) said: 'When a child is born, Satan touches it. This makes the baby cry because of Satan's touch, except for Jesus and his mother Mary. The Prophet (ﷺ) recited a prayer to protect them from evil.'

title: Best Women in Their Time
content: Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) said that Maryam, the daughter of Imran, was the best woman in her time. He also said Khadija is the best woman among our people.

title: Aisha's Superiority
content: The Prophet (ﷺ) said that Aisha is like a special meal called Tharid. Many men reached a high level of goodness, but only two women did: Mary, the daughter of Imran, and Asiya, the wife of Pharaoh.

title: Quraysh Women are Kind
content: Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) said that the women of Quraysh are the best. They take care of their children and protect their husbands' belongings. Mary, the daughter of Imran, never rode a camel.

title: Believe in Allah and Jesus
content: 'Ubada said the Prophet said: If someone says 'There is no God but Allah', 'Muhammad (ﷺ) is His Messenger', 'Jesus is Allah's slave and messenger, a word from Him to Mary and a spirit created by Him', and believes that Paradise and Hell are real, they will go to Paradise. They can even enter through any of its eight gates.

title: Prophet Muhammad's Story
content: Abu Huraira told us that the Prophet said: 'Only three babies spoke in their cradles. One was Jesus, one was a man from Israel called Juraij, and the third was a baby from Israel. His mother asked him to leave his prayer so she could talk to him, but he refused. Later, a woman came to seduce him, then went to a shepherd and had a child with him. She said the child belonged to Juraij, so people dismantled his home and kicked him out. Juraij prayed and asked the child who its father was. The child said it was the shepherd. People rebuilt his home in gold, but he refused, saying they should rebuild it in mud. A woman from Israel nursed her baby and asked Allah to make him handsome like a rider passing by. But the baby spat out her breast and said, 'No, don't make me like him.' He sucked again after a while. When people passed by with a slave girl, the mother asked Allah not to make her child like her. The baby spat out her breast again and said, 'Make me like her instead.' When she asked why, the baby replied that the rider was cruel, but the slave girl was falsely accused.

title: Meeting Prophets in Heaven
content: Abu Huraira said the Prophet told him that he met Moses on his journey to heaven. He described Moses as tall with long hair, like someone from a tribe called Shanuah. The Prophet (ﷺ) also met Jesus and said he was of average height with red skin. He looked like he had just washed. The Prophet (ﷺ) said he resembled Abraham more than any of his children did. On that night, the Prophet was given two cups: one full of milk and one full of wine. He chose the milk and drank it. Then someone told him that by choosing milk, he had chosen the right path for Muslims. If he had taken the wine, his followers would have gone astray.

title: Prophets I Saw in Heaven
content: Ibn Abbas said the Prophet told him that he saw Moses, Jesus, and Abraham on his journey to heaven. Jesus had red skin, curly hair, and a strong chest. Moses had brown skin, straight hair, and was very tall.

title: The Dajjal and Jesus
content: The Prophet (ﷺ) told the people about a man called the Dajjal. He said that Allah is not one-eyed, but the Dajjal is blind in his right eye. His eye looks like a grape that's bulging out. The Prophet (ﷺ) saw someone in his dream who was brown and had long hair falling between his shoulders. This person was circumambulating the Kaaba with two men. The Prophet (ﷺ) asked who this was and they said it was Jesus, son of Mary. Behind him, the Prophet saw another man with curly hair and a blind right eye. He looked like someone called Ibn Qatan. This second man was also walking around the Kaaba with someone else. The Prophet (ﷺ) asked again who this was and they replied that it was the Dajjal.

title: The Dajjal's Description
content: The Prophet (ﷺ) said that Allah is not blind in one eye. The Dajjal, a false messiah, will be blind in his right eye and it will look like a grape. One night, the Prophet saw Jesus, son of Mary, in a dream. He was a brown-skinned man with long hair between his shoulders. Water was dripping from his head as he walked around the Kaaba with two men. The Prophet (ﷺ) asked who this person was, and they said it was Jesus. Behind him, the Prophet saw the Dajjal. He had curly hair and was blind in one eye. He was also walking around the Kaaba with someone.

title: Jesus and the Dajjal
content: The Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) said that in a dream, he saw Jesus. He was described as having brown skin and straight hair. Water was dripping from his head. The Prophet (ﷺ) asked who he was, and people said 'He is the son of Mary.' Then the Prophet saw someone else - a man with red skin, curly hair, and one eye that looked like a grape. People told him this person resembled the Dajjal. They also mentioned a man named Ibn Qatan from the tribe Khuza'a who looked similar to the Dajjal.

title: Jesus is a Prophet
content: Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) said: 'I am the closest prophet to Jesus. All prophets are like brothers. There was no prophet between me and Jesus.'

title: Jesus and the Prophets
content: Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) said: 'I am close to Jesus in this life and the next. The prophets are like brothers, with different mothers but the same faith.'

title: Jesus Confronts a Thief
content: Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) said that Jesus saw a man stealing. He asked the man if he stole something. The man replied, 'No, I swear by Allah.' Jesus then said, 'I believe in Allah and my eyes are not good, so maybe I'm wrong about what I see'.

title: Don't Exaggerate My Praise
content: I heard the Prophet say, 'Do not praise me too much. The Christians praised Jesus a lot, but I am just a servant of Allah. Call me Allah's servant and His Messenger.'

title: Double Reward for Good Actions
content: Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) said that a person who teaches their slave good manners and educates them will get a double reward if they are later freed and married. If someone believes in Jesus and then believes in Allah, they too will get a double reward. A slave who obeys their masters and fears Allah will also receive a double reward. On the Day of Judgment, people will be resurrected barefoot, naked, and uncircumcised. Abraham will be dressed first, followed by some companions who will try to go in different directions. The Prophet (ﷺ) said that these people had left Islam during Abu Bakr's caliphate.

title: Jesus will come soon
content: Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) said: Jesus, the son of Mary, will come to Earth and judge people fairly. He will stop people from worshipping a cross and eating pork. There won't be any taxes for non-Muslims. Money will be so abundant that no one will want it. A single prayer to Allah is better than all the wealth in the world.

title: Jesus Descending Among Us
content: Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) said: 'What will happen when Jesus comes to our community and one of you is our leader?'

title: Dajjal's Deception and Death
content: Hudhaifa told 'Uqba bin 'Amr that the Prophet said: When Dajjal appears, he will have fire and water with him. What looks like cold water to people is actually fire that burns things. If you see this, fall into what looks like fire because it's really cool water. Hudhaifa also heard the Prophet say: A man from a past generation was asked about his good deeds when his soul was taken. He said he didn't remember doing anything good. But then he remembered helping people in business and forgiving poor debtors. So Allah let him into Paradise. The Prophet (ﷺ) also said: A man on his deathbed told his family to burn his body, crush the ashes, and throw them over the sea when a windy day came. But Allah gathered the man's particles and asked why he did this. The man said it was out of fear for Allah, so He forgave him. 'Uqba bin 'Amr also heard that the Israelis used to dig up graves to steal shrouds.

title: Dajjal's Fire and Water
content: Hudhaifa said he heard the Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) say: 'When Dajjal appears, he will have fire and water with him. What looks like cold water is actually fire that burns things. If you see this, fall into what looks like fire because it's really cool water.' Hudhaifa also said he heard the Prophet say: 'A man from a past generation died. The angel of death took his soul, but asked if he had done any good deeds. He couldn't remember anything. Then he remembered helping people with debts and forgiving those who owed him money. So Allah let him into Paradise.' Hudhaifa also said he heard the Prophet say: 'A man on his deathbed told his family to burn his body when he died, then crush the bones into powder and throw it in the sea on a windy day. But Allah brought back the pieces and asked why he did this. The man said he was afraid of Allah, so He forgave him.' `Uqba bin `Amr also heard the Prophet say that Israelis used to steal shrouds by digging up graves.

title: Dajjal's Fire and Water
content: Hudhaifa said he heard the Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) say: 'When Dajjal appears, he will have fire and water with him. What people think is cold water will actually be fire that burns things. If you see this, fall into what looks like fire because it's really cool water.' Hudhaifa also said the Prophet told a story about a man who died. The angel of death came to take his soul and asked if he did any good deeds. The man didn't remember anything but said he used to trade with people and forgive those who owed him money. Allah was pleased and let him into Paradise. Hudhaifa also heard the Prophet say that another man on his deathbed told his family to burn his body, crush his bones, and throw them in the sea. But Allah brought back all the pieces and asked why he did this. The man said it was out of fear for Allah, so He forgave him. `Uqba bin `Amr also heard the Prophet say that the Israelis used to steal shrouds by digging up graves.

title: Prophet's Warning about Graves
content: When the Prophet was dying, he would sometimes cover his face with a sheet and then take it off when he felt too hot. He said: 'May God be angry with the Jews and Christians for building places of worship near their prophets' graves.' This was to warn Muslims not to do what they had done.

title: Prophet's Warning about Graves
content: Before he died, the Prophet put a sheet over his face. When it got too hot, he would take it off. He said: 'May Allah be unhappy with Jews and Christians for building places of worship near their prophets' graves.' He meant to warn Muslims not to do what they did.

title: Prophets and Caliphs
content: Abu Huraira said the Prophet said: The Israelis had prophets who led them. When one prophet died, another took over. After me, there will be no more prophets but instead, many leaders (Caliphs) will come. People asked what to do, and the Prophet replied: First, obey the leader you choose. Respect their rights because Allah will ask them about how they treated those under their care.

title: Following the Wrong Ways
content: Abu Sa'id said that the Prophet said: 'You will follow the old ways of your ancestors so closely that if they go into a hole, you'll do the same. We asked him, 'Do you mean the Jews and Christians?' He replied, 'Who else could it be?'

title: Bilal's Prayer Call
content: Anas said that people suggested using a bell or fire to announce prayer time. They thought this was like what Jews and Christians did. But the Prophet told Bilal to call for prayer twice, then once more to get everyone ready.

title: Aisha's Dislike of Hands in Prayer
content: Aisha said she didn't like it when people kept their hands on their sides while praying. She knew that the Jews used to do this.

title: Muslims' Reward Compared
content: Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) said: 'Your time as Muslims is like the period between the Asr prayer and sunset. You are working from the Asr till sunset, just like laborers who work for two Qirats each during that time. The Jews worked for half a day for one Qirat, and the Christians worked from midday to the Asr prayer for one Qirat. Because of this, you will get double the reward. The Jews and Christians got angry because they thought they deserved more pay, but Allah said: 'Have I been unfair to you?' They said no. Then Allah said: 'This is My blessing that I give to whoever I choose.'

title: Umar's Complaint about Jews
content: Ibn Abbas heard Umar say, 'May Allah be unhappy with someone. He doesn't know that the Prophet said, 'May Allah be unhappy with the Jews because they melted fat and sold it.'

title: Convey My Teachings
content: The Prophet (ﷺ) said to Abdullah bin Amr: Share my teachings with others, even if it's just one sentence. Tell people the stories of the Bani Israel. If you lie about me on purpose, you'll go to Hell.

title: Dye Your Grey Hair
content: Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) said to his followers: 'The Jews and Christians don't dye their grey hair. We should do the opposite of what they do.'

title: Man Hurries Death with Knife
content: Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) said: A man got a wound and was very impatient. He cut his own hand with a knife, but the bleeding didn't stop until he died. Allah said that this man had hurried to die, so He won't let him enter Paradise.

title: Three Men Are Tested
content: Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) said that Allah sent an angel to test three men: a leper, a blind man, and a bald-headed man. The angel asked each of them what they wanted most in life. The leper wanted good skin and color, the bald man wanted good hair, and the blind man wanted his sight back. They were given what they asked for, along with animals to help them prosper. Later, the angel came to each of them disguised as one of them, asking for help. Two of them lied about how they got their new blessings, but the third told the truth and was rewarded by Allah.

title: Three Travelers in a Cave
content: Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) said that three people from the past were traveling together. It started raining and they took shelter in a cave. The entrance got blocked, so they prayed to Allah for help. Each one told a story of something good they had done. One man said he helped his worker by giving him cows instead of just paying him. He asked Allah to remove the rock if he did it out of fear for Him. A bit of the rock moved. The second man said he used to give milk to his parents every night, but one time he was late and they were asleep. He waited till morning before giving milk to his family. He prayed to Allah to move the rock if he did it out of fear for Him. The rock shifted a bit more. The third man said he wanted to be with his cousin, but she refused unless he paid her 100 gold coins. He gave her the money and left. But when they were together, she told him to wait until they got married. He left the money and went away. They all prayed to Allah to move the rock if they did it out of fear for Him. And Allah saved them.

title: Child's Prayer to Allah
content: Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) said: A woman was nursing her child. A rider passed by and she prayed that her child wouldn't die until he became like the rider. The child heard this and asked Allah not to make him like the man. Later, they saw a lady being teased by people. The mother prayed again that her child wouldn't become like her. But the child said, 'No, make me like her.' Then he said: The rider is an unbeliever, but the woman was falsely accused of something wrong and she trusted in Allah.

title: Forgiveness for a Good Deed
content: The Prophet (ﷺ) said: A dog was thirsty and going around a well. An Israeli prostitute saw it and gave it water from her shoe. Allah forgave her because of this good act.

title: Prophet forbids fake hair
content: Muawiya bin Abi Sufyan was speaking on a pulpit during Hajj. He held up some false hair and said, 'Where are the learned men of Medina? The Prophet (ﷺ) forbade this practice.' He reminded them that the Israelis were punished for doing the same thing.

title: Prophet's Description of 'Muhaddithun'
content: Abu Huraira said that the Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) said: Some people in the past could guess things that would happen later. If there are any like them among my followers, it is Umar bin Al-Khattab.

title: Man Repents for Murder
content: A man from the tribe of Bani Israel killed ninety-nine people. He wanted to know if he could still be forgiven, so he asked a monk. The monk said no, and the man killed him too. Another person told him to go to a certain village where his repentance might be accepted. On his way there, he died. When he was dying, he turned his body towards the village. This caused an argument between two groups of angels who were watching him. Allah decided to move the village he was going to closer and the one he left further away. Then the angels measured how far he was from each village. He was just a little bit closer to the village he was trying to get to, so he was forgiven.

title: Cows and Wolves Speak
content: One day, the Prophet said after morning prayer: 'While a man was driving a cow, he rode over it. The cow said,

title: Buying a Piece of Land
content: A man bought some land from another. When he dug it up, he found a jar filled with gold. He said to the seller, 'I only bought the land, not the gold.' The seller said, 'I sold you everything in it.' They took their case to a wise man who asked if they had children. One had a boy and one had a girl. The wise man said, 'Marry them and use the money for both of them. Give any extra to charity'.

title: Avoiding the Plague
content: Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) said: 'When a plague comes to a place, don't go there. If it reaches where you are living, stay put and don't try to leave.'

title: Patience in Times of Plague
content: I asked the Prophet about the plague. He said it's a punishment from Allah that affects whoever He wants. But for believers, it can be a mercy if they stay patient and trust Allah's plan. If someone stays in their country during an epidemic, believing nothing bad will happen unless Allah has written it, they'll get the reward of a martyr.

title: Usama and Allah's Messenger
content: The people of Quraish were worried about a woman from Bani Makhzum who had stolen something. They asked, 'Who can ask the Prophet to be kind to her?' Some said Usama bin Zaid was brave enough to do it. When Usama mentioned this to the Prophet, he said, 'Do you want to ask for mercy in a case where Allah's rules must be followed?' The Prophet (ﷺ) then stood up and gave a speech. He said that the reason some nations failed was because they were unfair. If someone rich stole something, they would forgive them. But if someone poor stole, they would punish them according to Allah's laws. The Prophet (ﷺ) said that even if his own daughter Fatima had stolen something, he would still cut off her hand.

title: Differing in Quran Recitation
content: Ibn Mas'ud heard someone reciting a verse from the Quran differently than how he remembered the Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) reciting it. He took this person to the Prophet and told him about it. The Prophet (ﷺ) said that both of them were right, but warned against differing in recitation, as previous nations had been destroyed because of their disagreements.

title: Prophet's Prayer for His Nation
content: The Prophet (ﷺ) talked about a prophet who was beaten by his people. The prophet had blood on his face and was cleaning it. He said, 'O Allah! Forgive my nation because they don't know any better.'

title: Forgiveness for a Good Son
content: Abu Sa'id said the Prophet told him about a man who had a lot of money. When he was dying, he called his sons and asked if he had been a good father to them. They said yes. He then said he had never done anything good and asked them to burn his body, crush it into dust, and scatter the dust on a windy day when no one would be around. His sons did what their father asked. But Allah gathered up all the pieces of his body and asked him why he wanted to be treated like that. The man said he was afraid of Allah's punishment. So Allah forgave him.

title: Death and the Afterlife
content: Hudhaifa told 'Uqba that he heard the Prophet say: A man died. Before he passed away, he asked his family to gather a lot of wood and make a big fire. When the fire had burned all his flesh, they were supposed to take his bones, grind them into powder, and scatter it in the sea on a windy day. But Allah gathered up the man's remains and asked him why he did that. The man said he was afraid of Allah. So Allah forgave him.

title: Forgiveness and Loans
content: The Prophet (ﷺ) said: A man gave loans to people. He told his servant, 'If someone is poor, forgive them.' Allah forgave him when he died.

title: Man's Sinful Deeds
content: A man kept doing bad things. When he died, his sons burned his body and crushed it into powder. They scattered the powder in the air. But Allah ordered the earth to collect all the tiny pieces of him. And there he was! Standing again. Allah asked him why he did what he did. The man said, 'I was afraid of You.' So Allah forgave him.

title: Punishment for a Cat
content: Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) said: A woman was punished because she locked up her cat and it died. She went to Hell because she didn't feed or give water to the cat, and she didn't let it go free.

title: Feeling Ashamed Matters
content: Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) said: 'If you don't feel ashamed for what you do, then just do it.'

title: Don't be ashamed to sin
content: The Prophet (ﷺ) said: 'If you don't feel guilty about something, then do it.'

title: Pride leads to Sinking
content: The Prophet (ﷺ) said: A man was walking with his dress dragging on the ground because of pride. He fell into a hole and will keep sinking until the Day of Judgment.

title: Friday Prayer is Important
content: The Prophet (ﷺ) said: We Muslims are the last people to receive God's message. Before us, other nations had their own scriptures. They disagreed about which day should be a special prayer day. The Jews chose Saturday and the Christians chose Sunday. But for us Muslims, every Friday we must wash our heads and bodies at least once a week.

title: Friday Prayer is Important
content: The Prophet (ﷺ) said: We Muslims will be the first to enter Paradise on Judgment Day. Before us, other nations had their own holy books and special days of prayer. They disagreed about which day was best for worship. The Jews prayed on Saturday, and Christians on Sunday. So Allah chose Friday as our special day. On this day, every Muslim should wash his head and body at least once a week.

title: Muawiya's Last Sermon
content: When Muawiya came to Medina for the last time, he gave a sermon. He showed us a tuft of hair and said that using false hair was wrong. The Prophet (ﷺ) had called this practice 'Az-Zur', which means lying or being dishonest.

title: Understanding Shu'ub and Qabail
content: Ibn Abbas explained that in the Quran, 'Shu'ub' refers to big groups of people, like nations. 'Qabail', on the other hand, means smaller tribes within those groups.

title: Who is most honorable?
content: Abu Huraira said that once the Prophet was asked who is the most honorable person. He replied, 'Those who are the most righteous and fear Allah.' They said they didn't want to know about that. The Prophet (ﷺ) then said, 'Then it's Joseph, a prophet of Allah.'

title: Prophet Muhammad's Tribe
content: Kulaib asked Zainab about the Prophet. She said he belonged to the Mudar tribe and was from An-Nadr bin Kinana's family.

title: Prophet's Advice on Wine Utensils
content: Kulaib was told by Rabiba that the Prophet forbade using four special wine utensils: Ad-Dubba, Al-Hantam, Al-Muqaiyar and Al-Muzaffat. Kulaib asked about the Prophet's tribe and was told he belonged to Mudar and came from An-Nadr bin Kinana.

title: People's Nature in Islam
content: Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) said: People are different. Those who were good before Islam can be good Muslims if they learn about their faith. The best people want to help others, not rule them. But the worst people pretend to be something they're not.

title: Different People, Different Natures
content: The Prophet (ﷺ) said: People are different. Those who were good before Islam can be good in Islam too if they learn about it. The best people want to rule but don't like the idea of ruling others. The worst people pretend to be something they're not.

title: Precedence in Leadership
content: The Prophet (ﷺ) said that the Quraish tribe has a special right to rule. Muslims follow other Muslims from their own tribe, and non-Muslims follow non-Muslims. People are different, but those who were good before Islam will still be good if they understand Islamic teachings. The best leader is someone who doesn't want power, until they're chosen.

title: Precedence in Leadership
content: The Prophet (ﷺ) said that the Quraish tribe has a special right to lead. Muslims follow other Muslims from their own tribe, and non-Muslims follow non-Muslims. People are different, but those who were best before Islam will still be the best if they learn about God's rules. The person most willing to give up power is usually the one who should be in charge.

title: Kinship with the Prophet
content: Ibn Abbas read a verse from the Quran: 'Be kind to me because of our family connection.' Sa'id bin Jubair explained it means being related to Muhammad (ﷺ). Ibn Abbas said that every house in Quraish had a connection to the Prophet, so this verse was revealed about them. It means: 'Quraish, be good to me and my family'.

title: Afflictions from the East
content: The Prophet (ﷺ) said: 'Troubles will come from the east. People who live in rural areas and take care of their camels and cows are often rude and don't show mercy to others. This is true for some tribes like Rabi'a and Mudar.'

title: Bedouins, Sheep Owners, and Wisdom
content: Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) said: 'Pride comes from rural areas. People who take care of sheep are calm. True faith is found in Yemen. Wisdom also comes from Yemen.'

title: Muawiya Warns Against False Narratives
content: Muhammad (ﷺ) bin Jubair was with a group from Quraish visiting Muawiya. Muawiya heard that Abdullah bin Amr said there would be a king from the tribe of Qahtan. Muawiya got angry, praised Allah, and said: 'I've heard some people narrate things not in the Quran or from the Prophet's teachings. These are ignorant people. Be careful of false hopes that lead others astray. I remember the Prophet saying: 'Ruling authority will stay with Quraish. Anyone who fights them will be destroyed by Allah, as long as they follow Islamic laws'.

title: Ruling Authority Remains
content: The Prophet (ﷺ) said that the authority to rule will always stay with the people of Quraish. Even if there are only two left, they will still have this power.

title: Uthman's Concern about Inheritance
content: Uthman bin Affan visited the Prophet and said, 'You gave property to Bani Al-Muttalib but not to us.' The Prophet (ﷺ) replied, 'Bani Hashim and Bani Al Muttalib are like one family in terms of their status'.

title: Abdullah visits Aisha
content: Abdullah bin Az-Zubair went with some women from the tribe of Bani Zuhra to visit Aisha. She was kind to them because they were related to the Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ).

title: Prophets Disciples
content: The Prophet (ﷺ) said the Quraish, Ansar, Julhaina, Muzaina, Aslam, Ashja', and Ghifar tribes are his followers. They have no one to protect them except Allah and His Messenger.

title: Aisha's Vow and Slaves
content: `Abdullah bin Az-Zubair thought `Aisha should not give all her money to charity. He asked some people from the Quraish tribe to ask her to stop, but she refused to talk to him. Eventually, her uncles helped mediate between them. As a result of this, `Aisha manumitted (freed) 40 slaves as an act of atonement for breaking her vow not to speak to `Abdullah bin Az-Zubair.

title: Writing Down the Quran
content: Uthman called four men: Zaid bin Thabit, Abdullah bin Az-Zubair, Sa'id bin Al-'As, and AbdurRahman bin Al-Harith. They were asked to write down the Quran in book form. If they disagreed with Zaid on a point, they should write it in the language of the Quraish tribe, since the Quran was revealed to them.

title: Prophet Encourages Archery
content: The Prophet (ﷺ) met some people from the tribe of Aslam practicing archery. He said to them, 'Keep throwing arrows, your father Ishmael was good at it.' The other team stopped because they thought he was on their side. But the Prophet said, 'I'm with you all, keep throwing.'

title: Claiming False Family
content: The Prophet (ﷺ) said: If someone says they are the son of a man who is not their real father, it's like denying Allah. And if someone claims to be part of a group when they're not, they'll go to Hell.

title: Don't Lie About Family
content: Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) said: Don't lie about your family. Don't say you had a dream when you didn't. And don't say something is from me if I didn't really say it.

title: Instructions for New Muslims
content: Some people from the tribe of Rabi'a came to the Prophet. They said they couldn't visit him easily because of a group of non-Muslims between them and Medina. The Prophet (ﷺ) gave them four instructions: believe in Allah, pray regularly, give charity, and share war spoils with Allah. He also told them not to use certain cups that held wine.

title: Allah's Messenger Warns of Afflictions
content: I was on the pulpit when Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) said, 'Troubles will start from this direction.' He pointed to the east. This is where Satan's evil influence comes from.

title: Prophet's Helpers
content: The Prophet (ﷺ) said that the tribes of Quraish, Al-Ansar, Juhaina, Muzaina, Aslam, Ghifar and Ashja' are his helpers. They have no one to protect them except Allah and His Messenger.

title: Prophet's Warning to Tribes
content: Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) was on the pulpit. He said: 'May Allah forgive the Ghifar tribe. May Allah protect the Aslam tribe. The Usaiya tribe disobeyed Allah and me.'

title: Prophet's Blessings for Two Tribes
content: The Prophet (ﷺ) said to Abu Huraira: 'May Allah protect the Aslam tribe and forgive the Ghifar tribe.'

title: Better Tribes of Arabia
content: The Prophet (ﷺ) asked if the tribes of Juhaina and others were better than some other tribes. A man said they had failed and lost, but the Prophet agreed with him that they are indeed better.

title: The Prophet's Response to Al-Aqra'
content: Al-Aqra' bin Habis told the Prophet that only robbers from certain tribes had pledged allegiance. The Prophet (ﷺ) said, 'Do you think those tribes are worse than others?' Someone replied, 'They were unsuccessful and losers.' The Prophet (ﷺ) agreed, saying, 'Yes, they are better'.

title: Qahtan's Descendant Warned
content: Abu Hurairah said the Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) said: The Day of Judgment won't come unless a man from Qahtan appears, using his stick to rule people with violence and oppression.

title: Prophet Stops Fighting Call
content: We were on a trip with the Prophet. A lot of people joined him from another city. One person was playing jokes and accidentally hit an Ansari man on his hip. The Ansari got very angry and called for help. So did the emigrant who hit him. The Prophet (ﷺ) came out and said, 'What's going on? Why are you calling like this?' He was told what happened. The Prophet (ﷺ) said, 'Stop this call. It's not a good way to behave.' A hypocrite named Abdullah bin Ubai said that the emigrants were gathering against them. `Umar suggested killing him, but the Prophet said, 'No, we can't kill our own companions. People might think I'm doing it.'

title: Don't Act Like Pagans
content: The Prophet (ﷺ) said: 'If someone hits their face or tears their shirt, or uses old ways of speaking, they are not one of us.'

title: Abu Huraira Remembers
content: Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) said that Amr bin Luhai was the father of Khuza'a.

title: The Prophet's Warning about Idols
content: Sa'id bin Al-Musaiyab told me that the Prophet said: 'I saw Amr bin Amir, a man from Khuza'a tribe, in Hell. He was the first to let animals go free for his false gods. Now he is being punished by dragging his intestines.'

title: Abu Dhar Converts to Islam
content: Ibn Abbas said: 'Do you want to know how Abu Dhar became a Muslim?' We said, 'Yes.' He said, 'Abu Dhar was from the tribe of Ghifar. He heard that a man in Mecca claimed to be a Prophet. He sent his brother to meet him but wasn't satisfied with what he learned. So, he went to Mecca himself. He drank Zam zam water and stayed in the Mosque. One day, Ali met him and asked if he was lost. Abu Dhar said yes. Ali took him home without asking any questions. The next morning, Abu Dhar went back to the Mosque to ask about the Prophet but no one told him anything. Ali found him again and asked what brought him to Mecca. Abu Dhar trusted Ali with his secret. He said he had heard a man in Mecca claimed to be a Prophet and sent his brother to meet him, but wasn't satisfied. Ali took him to meet the Prophet. When they entered, Abu Dhar asked the Prophet to explain Islam. The Prophet (ﷺ) did, and Abu Dhar became a Muslim right away. The Prophet (ﷺ) told him to keep it secret and go back home until he heard of their victory. But Abu Dhar said he would announce his conversion publicly. He went to the Mosque and said, 'I testify that there is no god but Allah, and Muhammad (ﷺ) is His Messenger.' The Quraish people got angry and beat him up. Al Abbas saw him and protected him. The next day, Abu Dhar did the same thing again. Again, Al Abbas saved him.

title: Better with Allah
content: The Prophet (ﷺ) said that the people from Aslam, Ghifar, Muzaina, and Juhaina are better in Allah's sight than the tribes of Asad, Tamim, Hawazin, and Ghatafan.

title: Ignorance of the Arabs
content: Ibn Abbas said: If you want to know about the ignorance of the Arabs, look at Surah Al-Anam after verse 130. It says that those who kill their children without knowing what they're doing are lost. They stop themselves from using what Allah has given them and make up lies against Him. This is a sign of great confusion and they were not guided.

title: Prophet Warns Tribe About Allah
content: When the Prophet received a message from Allah to warn his family and close relatives, he started calling out to different groups of people in Mecca. He said: 'O Bani Fihr! O Bani Adi!' which means 'You people from the tribe of Fihr, you people from the tribe of Adi'.

title: Prophet Warns His Tribe
content: When the Prophet received a message from Allah to warn his close relatives, he started calling out each tribe's name one by one.

title: Buy Yourself from Allah
content: The Prophet (ﷺ) said to the people of Bani Abd Manaf and Bani Abdul Muttalib: 'You should buy yourselves back from God. I won't be able to protect you in front of God, so take what you need from my property.'

title: Who is a Stranger?
content: The Prophet (ﷺ) asked the Ansar if there was anyone they didn't know. They said no, except for the son of their sister. The Prophet (ﷺ) said that the son of someone's sister belongs to them.

title: Abu Bakr and the Festival
content: During the festival days in Mina, Abu Bakr saw two girls beating drums near Aisha. He scolded them, but the Prophet uncovered his face and said, 'Leave them alone, these are special festival days.' Aisha also told that she was watching Ethiopians playing in the mosque when Umar rebuked them. The Prophet (ﷺ) said to leave them because they were safe.

title: Abu Bakr and the Drummers
content: During the festival in Mina, Abu Bakr saw two girls beating drums near Aisha. The Prophet (ﷺ) was lying down covered with his garment. Abu Bakr scolded the girls, but the Prophet uncovered himself and said to leave them alone because it's a special day for celebration. Later, Umar rebuked some Ethiopians playing in the mosque, but the Prophet told him to let them play because they are safe.

title: Hassan's Poetry Request
content: `Aisha said that Hassan bin Thabit asked the Prophet for permission to write satirical poetry about non-Muslims. The Prophet (ﷺ) said, 'I have family ties with them.' Hassan replied, 'I'll make you separate from them like a hair is removed from dough.' `Urwa said he criticized Hassan in front of `Aisha, but she defended him saying, 'Don't criticize him, he used to defend the Prophet with his poetry'.

title: Muhammad's Five Names
content: Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) said: 'My names are five. I am called Muhammad (ﷺ) and Ahmad. I will be the one who removes disbelief from the world, Al-Mahi. I will be the first to be resurrected after death, Al-Hashir. And there will be no prophet after me, so I am also known as Al-Aqib.'

title: Allah Protects the Prophet
content: The Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) said: 'Don't you wonder how Allah keeps me safe from the Quraish's insults and curses? They insult a man named Mudhammam and curse him, but I am actually Muhammad (ﷺ).'

title: Prophet's House Analogy
content: Jabir bin Abdullah said the Prophet said: 'My role is like a man who built a house but left one brick out. People enter and admire it, saying, 'If only that last brick was in place, this would be perfect.'

title: Prophet Muhammad's Place
content: Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) said: 'My role is like a house with one missing brick. People admire the house but wish for that one brick to be in place. I am that one brick, and I'm the last of the Prophets.'

title: Prophet Muhammad's Age at Death
content: The Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) died when he was sixty-three years old.

title: Don't Use My Nickname
content: The Prophet (ﷺ) was in the market when a man called out 'O Abu-l-Qasim!' The Prophet (ﷺ) told him, 'You can name yourselves after me, but don't use my special nickname.'

title: Follow the Prophet's Name
content: Jabir said that the Prophet told us to name ourselves after him, but not to use his special nickname as our own name.

title: Abu Huraira's Advice
content: Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) said, 'You can name yourselves after me, but don't call yourselves by my special nickname.'

title: As-Sa'ib's Story
content: I saw a man named As-Sa'ib when he was ninety-four years old. He said that he stayed healthy because the Prophet used to pray for him. His aunt took him to the Prophet and asked him to pray for her nephew, so the Prophet prayed for him.

title: Prophet's Blessing for a Sick Boy
content: My aunt took me to the Prophet. She said he was sick. The Prophet (ﷺ) put his hands on my head and blessed me. Then he washed his face, hands, and feet. I drank the water left over from his washing. As he stood up, I saw a mark between his shoulders.

title: Abu Bakr Meets Hasan
content: Abu Bakr prayed Asr prayer. He went out and saw Hasan playing with other kids. Abu Bakr picked up Hasan and said, 'My parents be sacrificed for you!' He thought Hasan looked like the Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ), not Ali. Ali was smiling.

title: Abu Juhaifa's Observation
content: I saw the Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) with Al-Hasan. He looked just like him.

title: The Prophet's Appearance
content: Ismail bin Abi Khalid said he saw Abu Juhaifa. Abu Juhaifa said the Prophet was white with a black beard that had some grey hair. He promised to give them 13 young female camels, but he died before they could get them.

title: Prophet Muhammad's White Hair
content: I saw the Prophet. He had some white hair under his lower lip and above his chin.

title: The Prophet's White Hairs
content: Abdullah bin Busr said that when the Prophet was old, he had a few white hairs between his lower lip and chin.

title: Description of the Prophet
content: Anas bin Malik said that the Prophet was a medium height person. He wasn't very tall or short. His skin had a rosy color, not too white or dark brown. His hair wasn't curly or straight. The Prophet (ﷺ) received his first revelation when he was 40 years old. He stayed in Mecca for 10 years and then moved to Medina for another 10 years. When the Prophet passed away, most of his hair was black, but there were a few white hairs.

title: Description of the Prophet
content: Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) was a normal-sized man. His hair wasn't curly or straight. He received his message from Allah when he was 40 years old. He lived in Mecca for ten years and then in Medina for another ten years. When he passed away, there were only about twenty white hairs on his head.

title: Prophet Muhammad's Physical Appearance
content: Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) was the most handsome person. He had a good-looking face and body. He wasn't very tall or short, just average height.

title: Prophet Muhammad's Hair
content: I asked Anas if the Prophet used to dye his hair. He said no, because he only had a few white hairs on his temples.

title: Prophet Muhammad's Physical Appearance
content: Al-Bara said that the Prophet was a bit taller than average with broad shoulders. He had long hair that reached his earlobes. Al-Bara once saw him wearing a red cloak and thought he was the most handsome man he had ever seen.

title: The Prophet's Face
content: Al-Bara' said the Prophet's face was not as bright as a sword. It was more like the brightness of the moon.

title: Prophet's Hands are Colder
content: Abu Juhaifa said the Prophet went to Al-Batha' at noon. He performed ablution, prayed two rak'ats of Zuhr and Asr prayers. A stick was planted in front of him. People passed by it. After praying, they touched their faces to his hands. I did the same. His hands felt colder than ice and smelled nicer than musk.

title: Prophet Muhammad's Generosity
content: Ibn Abbas said that the Prophet was very generous. He became even more generous during Ramadan when he met Gabriel every night to review the Quran together. Gabriel would meet him in the evening of each day in Ramadan and they would go over the Quran.

title: Prophet's Joy about Zaid
content: The Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) came to me in a happy mood. He said he had heard something good about his son Zaid and Usama, another companion. The Qaif saw their feet and thought they looked like father and son.

title: Allah's Messenger Smiles
content: Abdullah bin Ka'b said he heard Ka'b bin Malik talking. He had missed going to Tabuk with the Prophet. Ka'b said, 'When I saw Allah's Messenger (ﷺ), his face was happy. When he was happy, his face would shine like the moon.'

title: Prophet Muhammad's Generation
content: Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) said, 'I have been sent to the best of all generations since Adam.'

title: Muhammad's Hair Style
content: Ibn Abbas said that the Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) used to let his hair hang down. But then he saw how people from other religions, like Jews and Christians, parted their hair. He liked to follow them in things not mentioned in the Quran. So, he started parting his own hair.

title: Prophet's Good Manners
content: The Prophet (ﷺ) never used bad language. He said that the best people are those with good manners and character.

title: Allah's Messenger's Choices
content: When the Prophet was given two options, he chose the easier one if it wasn't against Islamic law. If it was against the law, he wouldn't do it. The Prophet (ﷺ) never took revenge for himself, but only when someone broke an important rule in Islam.

title: Prophet's Soft Palm and Sweat
content: Anas said: I never touched anything softer than the Prophet's palm. He also said that the Prophet's sweat smelled nicer than any perfume he had ever smelled.

title: Prophet Muhammad's Shyness
content: Abu Sa'id Al-Khudri said the Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) was more shy than a young woman who covers her face when she walks.

title: Prophet's Food Manners
content: Abu Huraira said the Prophet never complained about food. If he liked it, he ate it. If not, he left it alone.

title: Prophet Muhammad's Prostration
content: When the Prophet prostrated during prayer, he spread his arms wide apart. We could see the skin under his armpits because of how far they were apart.

title: Prophet's Prayer Style
content: Anas said the Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) did not raise his hands when praying, except when asking for rain. When he prayed for rain, he raised his hands very high so you could see the skin under his armpits.

title: Prophet's Prayer at Al-Abtah
content: I visited the Prophet while he was resting in a tent. Bilal came out to call for prayer, then brought out some water that the Prophet had used for ablution. People rushed to get some of the water. Bilal brought out a stick and the Prophet came out. He prayed two sets of prayers - one at noon and another in the afternoon. Women and donkeys were walking by while he was praying.

title: The Prophet's Clear Speech
content: `Aisha said that the Prophet spoke very clearly. If someone wanted to count his words, they could do so. She also said that a man came to her while she was praying and started telling stories about the Prophet. He left before she finished her prayer. If he had stayed, `Aisha would have told him that the Prophet didn't speak quickly like that.

title: The Prophet's Clear Speech
content: `Aisha said that the Prophet spoke clearly and slowly. If someone counted his words, they could do so easily. She also said that a man came to her while she was praying and started telling stories about the Prophet. He left before she finished her prayer. If he had stayed, `Aisha would have told him that the Prophet never spoke quickly.

title: Ramadan Prayer Routine
content: Abu Salama asked Aisha about the Prophet's prayer in Ramadan. She said he prayed 11 rakats, with four sets of four and one set of three. He would pray at night, but his heart stayed awake.

title: Angels Visit the Prophet
content: Sharik bin Abdullah said that Anas bin Malik told him about a night when the Prophet was in the Kaaba Mosque. Three angels came to the Prophet while he was sleeping. The first angel asked, 'Which one is he?' The second angel replied, 'He's the best of them.' Then Gabriel took charge and woke the Prophet up. They went together to Heaven.

title: Prophet's Journey with Companions
content: The Prophet (ﷺ) and his companions were traveling at night. They rested when dawn came, but the sun was high in the sky before they woke up. Abu Bakr got up first, followed by Umar. The Prophet (ﷺ) didn't wake up easily, so he woke up on his own. After a while, they stopped to pray. One man missed the prayer because he wasn't clean after using the bathroom. The Prophet (ﷺ) told him to use some clean earth to make himself clean again and then join in the prayer. The Prophet (ﷺ) ordered some of his companions, including me, to go ahead of him to find water. We were very thirsty when we met a woman carrying two water skins. She said there was no water nearby, but we asked her to come with us to meet the Prophet. When she saw the Prophet, she told him about the lack of water and that she had children at home who needed it. The Prophet (ﷺ) ordered her water skins to be brought and he rubbed them together so everyone could drink. We drank until our thirst was gone and filled up all our containers with water. But we didn't give any water to the camels yet. When the woman went back to her people, she told them about the Prophet's kindness. They were amazed and eventually became Muslims too.

title: Prophet's Water for Ablution
content: Anas said the Prophet was at Az-Zawra when a bowl of water was brought to him. He put his hand in it and water flowed between his fingers. Everyone used that water for ablution. Anas estimated around three hundred people were there.

title: Prophet Muhammad's Ablution
content: I was with the Prophet when it was time for the afternoon prayer. People were looking for water to clean themselves before praying, but couldn't find any. Then some water arrived and the Prophet put his hand in the pot. He told us to use this water to wash our hands and faces. I saw water coming out from under his fingers, so we all washed ourselves.

title: Prophet's Journey - Ablution Solution
content: The Prophet (ﷺ) went on a journey with some companions. They walked until it was time for prayer, but couldn't find water to wash their hands and face. One of them found some water in a pot and brought it back. The Prophet (ﷺ) used the little water to wash his hands and face, then stretched out four fingers into the pot. He told everyone else to come and wash their hands and faces too.

title: Prophet's Water Problem
content: When it was time for prayer, people whose homes were close to the mosque went inside to wash their hands and face. Others stayed outside. The Prophet (ﷺ) had a small pot of water brought to him. He put his hand in it, but he had to fold his fingers together because his hand didn't fit. Everyone then washed their hands and faces with that little bit of water. I asked Anas how many people were there, and he said eighty men.

title: Prophet Muhammad's Miraculous Water
content: Jabir bin Abdullah said that on the day of Al-Hudaibiya, many people were very thirsty. A small pot with some water was in front of the Prophet. When he finished his ablution, everyone rushed to him because they had no other water for drinking or washing. The Prophet (ﷺ) put his hand into the pot and water started flowing between his fingers like springs. Everyone drank from it and washed their faces.

title: The Prophet at Al-Hudaibiya
content: There were 1,400 of us on the day of Al-Hudaibiya. We used a well there for water. The Prophet (ﷺ) sat by the well and asked for some water to rinse his mouth. He then threw it out. After a short time, we drew more water from the well and drank our fill. Our animals also had enough to drink.

title: Prophet's Visit to Abu Talha
content: Abu Talha told Um Sulaim that the Prophet had a weak voice and he thought it was because of hunger. She gave him some bread, wrapped in a veil, and sent it with Anas to the Prophet. When they arrived, the Prophet asked if Abu Talha had sent food. He said yes, and then got up to go to their house. Um Sulaim brought out more bread and butter, and the Prophet broke the bread into pieces. He recited some verses from the Quran, and then invited ten men to eat. They ate and left, and this happened several times until about seventy or eighty men had eaten.

title: Miracles are from Allah
content: Abdullah said: We used to think miracles were good things. But you people think they're warnings. One day, we were traveling with the Prophet and we didn't have enough water. He asked us to bring what little water we had left. We brought a container with some water in it. The Prophet (ﷺ) put his hand in the water and said, 'Come and drink from this blessed water. The blessing is from Allah.' I saw water flowing from between his fingers. When he ate, we heard him praising Allah.

title: Paying off a father's debt
content: Jabir told me that his father had died with debts to pay. He went to the Prophet and said, 'I have nothing but my date palms' yield. The Prophet (ﷺ) came with him to help deal with the creditors. They measured out some of the dates and gave it to them as payment. What was left was just what they had been given.

title: Sharing Food with the Prophet
content: The companions who lived near the mosque were poor. The Prophet (ﷺ) said that if you have enough food for two people, take a third person to share it with. If you have enough food for four people, take a fifth or sixth person. Abu Bakr brought three people and the Prophet took ten. When Abu Bakr went home, his wife asked him why he was late. He said that the Prophet's guests were waiting for him to eat. They had refused to eat until he arrived. The Prophet (ﷺ) then invited them to eat and they all ate their fill. But there was still plenty of food left over. Abu Bakr took some of the leftover food back to the Prophet.

title: Prophet's Rain Prayer
content: During a drought in Medina, a man asked the Prophet to pray for rain. The Prophet (ﷺ) lifted his hands and prayed. Suddenly, clouds gathered and it started raining heavily. People waded through the water to get home. It rained until the next Friday, when another man asked the Prophet to stop the rain. The Prophet (ﷺ) smiled and said, 'Let it rain around us, not on us.' He looked up and saw the clouds parting, forming a circle around Medina.

title: Prophet's Pulpit and a Tree
content: Ibn Umar said the Prophet used to give speeches near a date palm tree. When he got a pulpit, he started using it instead. The tree began crying, so the Prophet went to calm it down by rubbing his hand on its trunk.

title: Prophet's Friday Sermon
content: Jabir bin Abdullah said the Prophet used to stand by a tree or date-palm on Fridays. An Ansari suggested making a platform for him, and he agreed. They built it, and when it was time for his sermon, he stood up. The date-palm tree started crying. The Prophet (ﷺ) got down from the platform and hugged the tree. It stopped crying. The Prophet (ﷺ) said the tree was sad because it missed hearing knowledge shared near it.

title: Prophet's Mosque Pulpit
content: Anas bin Malik told me that Jabir bin Abdullah said: The mosque had a roof made from date palm trunks. When the Prophet gave a sermon, he would stand next to one of these trunks until a pulpit was built for him. We heard one trunk making a loud noise like a pregnant camel in labor. When the Prophet put his hand on it, the noise stopped.

title: Prayers and Charity Help
content: One day, Umar asked Hudhaifa about what the Prophet said about big troubles. Hudhaifa replied that the Prophet said: 'When you have problems with your family, money, or neighbors, pray a lot, give to charity, tell others to do good things, and stop bad ones.' Umar was thinking of bigger troubles like wars and natural disasters. Hudhaifa told him not to worry because there's something between us and those big troubles that will keep them away. But when asked later what this 'something' meant, Hudhaifa said it was Umar himself.

title: Fighting the Turks
content: The Prophet (ﷺ) said that before the end of time, Muslims will fight against a nation wearing thick-soled shoes. They will also fight against the Turks who have small eyes, red faces, and flat noses. Their faces will look like shields. The best people are those who don't want to be leaders, but when they're chosen, they accept it. People's characters remain the same in Islam as they were before. One day, a Muslim might prefer to see the Prophet over having more family and wealth.

title: Fighting the Turks
content: The Prophet (ﷺ) said that before the Day of Judgment, Muslims will fight two groups: one wearing hairy shoes and another called the Turks. They'll have small eyes, red faces, and flat noses. The best people are those who don't want to be leaders but are chosen anyway. People's characters remain the same from before Islam; some were good then and are still good now. A time will come when a Muslim would prefer to see the Prophet than gain wealth and family.

title: Fighting the Turks
content: The Prophet (ﷺ) said: The Day of Judgment will not come until you fight a people who wear thick-soled shoes. You'll also fight the Turks, who have small eyes and red faces. Their noses are flat like shields. People's attitudes change over time. Those who dislike being in charge will be chosen to lead. In the past, some people were good, and they remain good Muslims. One day, a person might prefer seeing me rather than having more wealth and family.

title: Fighting the Non-Arabs
content: The Prophet (ﷺ) said, 'Before the Day of Judgment, you will fight against people from outside Arabia. They will have red faces, flat noses, and small eyes. Their faces will look like shields, and they wear shoes made of hair.'

title: Abu Huraira's Experience
content: I was lucky to spend three years with the Prophet. During that time, I tried my best to understand what he taught us. One day, he pointed with his hand and said, 'You will fight people who wear shoes with long hair on them.' He mentioned a place called Al-Bariz.

title: Fighting People Before Judgment Day
content: Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) said: 'Before the end of time, you will fight people who wear shoes with thick hair on them. You will also fight people whose faces are flat like shields.'

title: Jews Will Fight Muslims
content: Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) said: The Jews will fight against you. You will win and defeat them. Even a stone might say, 'There is a Jew behind me, kill him.'

title: Victory in Battle
content: The Prophet (ﷺ) said: A time will come when people go to war. They'll be asked if anyone knew the Messenger of Allah. They'll say yes, and then they'll win. They'll go to war again, and it'll be asked if anyone knew his companions. Again, they'll say yes, and then they'll win.

title: Poverty and the End Times
content: The Prophet (ﷺ) was in a city when two men came to him. One complained about being poor, and the other said he had been robbed by highwaymen. The Prophet (ﷺ) asked Adi if he knew Al-Hira. Adi said no, but he had heard of it. The Prophet (ﷺ) said that one day, a woman from Al-Hira would travel safely to Mecca and walk around the Kaaba, only fearing Allah. Adi wondered what would happen to the robbers who were causing trouble in their tribe. The Prophet (ﷺ) then said that if Adi lived long enough, he would see people carrying handfuls of gold or silver looking for someone to give it to, but finding no one. When a person meets Allah on Judgment Day, they will not need an interpreter. Allah will ask them if they were taught by a messenger and given wealth. They will say yes, then look left and right and only see Hell. The Prophet (ﷺ) said that even giving half a date in charity can save someone from the Fire. If you don't have a date, give a kind word.

title: Prophet's Warning to the Ummah
content: The Prophet (ﷺ) came out and led a prayer for those who died in battle. He then went to the pulpit and said: 'I will be your leader, but I'm watching from afar now. I have been given control over the world's riches. I'm not worried that you'll worship other gods with Allah, but I fear you might fight each other over worldly things.'

title: Prophet Sees Afflictions Coming
content: The Prophet (ﷺ) stood on a high building in Medina and said, 'Do you see what I see? I see sickness spreading through your homes like rain.'

title: Prophet's Warning about Gog and Magog
content: The Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) came to Zainab bint Jahsh in a state of fear. He said, 'There is no God but Allah.' He warned the Arabs that evil was coming close. He pointed to a hole made in the wall between Gog and Magog, as big as his two fingers. Zainab asked if they would be destroyed despite having good people among them. The Prophet (ﷺ) replied, 'Yes, if evil increases.' Later, he woke up and said, 'Praise be to Allah. Many treasures have been sent down, and many troubles have come.'

title: Protect Your Faith
content: Abu Sa'id Al-Khudri said to me: 'I see you like sheep. Take care of them and their food.' He reminded me that the Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) said, 'One day people will prefer sheep over other things because they can take them to safe places to protect their faith from problems.'

title: Afflictions Will Come
