content: Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) said: 'In the future, troubles will be so bad that sitting down will be better than standing up. Standing up will be better than walking, and walking will be better than running. If you see these troubles coming, try to find a safe place to hide in it. Missing one special prayer is like losing your family and everything you own.'

title: Facing Hard Times
content: Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) said: When hard times come, sitting down will be better than standing up. Standing up will be better than walking around. Walking around will be better than running away. If you see problems coming, they will catch up with you. Find a safe place and stay there.

title: Giving Rights and Asking Allah
content: The Prophet (ﷺ) said: 'Soon others will be given preference over you. You may not like some things that happen. The companions asked, 'What should we do?' He replied, 'Give what is rightfully yours to others and ask Allah for your rights.'

title: Quraish Will Cause Trouble
content: Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) said to his companions: 'This group from Quraish will cause problems for the people.' His companions asked, 'What should we do?' The Prophet (ﷺ) replied, 'It's best if the people stay away from them'.

title: Destruction of My Followers
content: Abu Huraira said that the Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) said: 'My followers will be destroyed by some young people from the Quraish tribe.' Marwan asked, 'Young people?' Abu Huraira replied, 'If you want to know their names, they are the sons of so-and-so and the sons of so-and-so'.

title: Good and Evil Times
content: Hudhaifa asked the Prophet about good times. He said there would be evil after that. Hudhaifa asked again, 'Will there be good after that evil?' The Prophet (ﷺ) replied, 'Yes, but with a little bit of evil.' Hudhaifa asked what this 'little bit' was. The Prophet (ﷺ) said some people would lead others away from his teachings. They would speak like us and look like us, but they would invite people to do bad things. If you see this happening, the Prophet told Hudhaifa to stick with the group of Muslims and their leader. If there's no group or leader, he should stay away from those who are different.

title: Hudhaifa Learns from the Prophet
content: My friends learned good things by asking the Prophet. I learned about bad things instead.

title: War Before Judgement Day
content: Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) said, 'There will be a war between two groups who believe in the same thing before the Day of Judgement.'

title: War Before The Hour
content: The Prophet (ﷺ) said that before the Day of Judgment, there will be a big war between two groups who believe in the same thing. Many people will die in this war. Also, about thirty false messengers will appear, claiming to speak for Allah.

title: Dhu-l-Khuwaisira's Warning
content: Abu Sa'id Al-Khudri said: We were with the Prophet when a man from Bani Tamim came and asked, 'Do justice.' The Prophet (ﷺ) replied, 'I would be in trouble if I didn't do justice. Umar wanted to kill him but the Prophet said, 'Leave him. He has friends who pray and fast, but their actions are weak. They recite the Quran but don't follow it. They will leave Islam quickly, like an arrow that goes through a body too fast for blood to stick to it. Look for a black man with one arm like a woman's breast or a piece of meat hanging loose. These people will cause trouble when there are disagreements among Muslims.' I heard this from the Prophet and saw Ali fight against them. He found the man described by the Prophet.

title: Warning about False Muslims
content: Ali said: I only tell you what the Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) taught me. I would never lie about him. If I share something between us, don't forget that war can be sneaky. The Prophet (ﷺ) said: In the end of time, some young people will use good words from the Quran to trick others into leaving Islam. They won't really believe in it. When you meet them, kill them. Anyone who kills them will get a reward on Judgment Day.

title: Persecution and Islam's Strength
content: We complained to the Prophet about being persecuted. He was sitting under the Ka'ba when we asked him to pray for us. He said that some people before us were tortured very badly, but they never gave up their faith. They were cut in half with a saw and had iron combs used on them to remove their flesh from their bones. But even then, they didn't leave Islam. The Prophet (ﷺ) said that Islam will always be strong and true, so much so that a traveler from Sana to Hadramaut wouldn't fear anything but Allah or losing his sheep to a wolf. He told us we're being too hasty.

title: Thabit's Good Deeds Saved
content: The Prophet (ﷺ) noticed Thabit was not at the mosque. A man went to find out why and met Thabit at home, looking sad. The man asked what was wrong. Thabit said a man had been speaking loudly over the Prophet, so all his good deeds were cancelled and he would go to Hell. The man told the Prophet about this. The Prophet (ﷺ) sent the man back to tell Thabit: 'You are not going to Hell, you will go to Paradise.'

title: Reciting Quran Brings Peace
content: A man was praying and recited Surat-al-Kahf. His animal got scared in the house. After he finished his prayer, a mist appeared over him. He told the Prophet about it. The Prophet (ﷺ) said: 'Keep reading the Quran, this is a sign of peace coming down.'

title: Abu Bakr's Night Journey
content: Abu Bakr visited my father and bought a saddle from him. He asked me to carry it with him. My father followed us to get the price of the saddle. Abu Bakr told my father about his night journey with the Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ). They traveled all night and the next day until midday, when it was too hot for anyone to be on the road. Then they saw a rock that had shade under it. They rested there and I made a comfortable place for the Prophet to sleep. I went out to guard him while he slept. A shepherd came with his sheep to the same rock. I asked him if he belonged to someone from Medina or Mecca. He said yes, and I asked if his sheep had milk. He said they did, so I asked him to milk some for us. He gave me a container of milk and I poured it into another container that was ready for the Prophet's drink and ablution. The Prophet (ﷺ) woke up, drank the milk, and then we left after midday. Suraqa bin Malik followed us, but I thought he had discovered us. The Prophet (ﷺ) told me not to worry because Allah is with us. He cursed Suraqa's horse so it sank into the ground. But then the Prophet blessed Suraqa and his horse was saved. Whenever Suraqa met someone on the way, he would say that he had looked for the Prophet in vain. This made people return, and Suraqa kept his promise.

title: Visiting a Sick Bedouin
content: The Prophet (ﷺ) visited a sick bedouin and said, 'No harm will come to you. May Allah heal you.' The bedouin replied, 'You say may Allah heal me? No, it's just a fever that comes with age and will take me to the grave.' The Prophet (ﷺ) agreed with him, saying, 'Yes, then let it be as you say'.

title: Man Returns to Christianity
content: A Christian man converted to Islam and helped write down the Quran. He then went back to being a Christian and said Muhammad (ﷺ) only knew what he had written for him. The earth kept throwing his body out of its grave, even after they dug it deeper. People realized this was not done by humans.

title: No More Khosrau or Caesar
content: Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) said: When the leaders of Persia and Rome die, no one will be left in their positions. He promised that we would use their wealth to help Allah's cause.

title: End of Khosrau and Caesar
content: Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) said to Jabir bin Samura: When the ruler Khosrau dies, there will be no one like him again. And when the ruler Caesar dies, there will be no one like him again. We will use their wealth for Allah's work.

title: Meeting with a Liar
content: Ibn Abbas said that Musailama, who was known to be a liar, came to Medina with his people. He told the Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) that he would follow him if he made him leader. The Prophet (ﷺ) went to meet him with Thabit bin Qais and carried a piece of a date palm leaf in his hand. He stood before Musailama and said, 'You can't have this piece of leaf.' He warned them that Allah will destroy those who reject Islam. The Prophet (ﷺ) thought that Musailama was the person he saw in a dream, wearing two gold bracelets on his arm. In the dream, he was told to blow off the bracelets, which symbolized two liars who would appear after him. One of them was Al-Ansi and the other was Musailama.

title: Musailama Meets the Prophet
content: Ibn Abbas said that Musailama came to Medina with his people. He wanted to be the Prophet's successor if he accepted Islam. The Prophet (ﷺ) went to meet him, carrying a piece of a date palm leaf. He stood before Musailama and his companions and said, 'You can't avoid your fate. If you don't accept Islam, Allah will destroy you.' The Prophet (ﷺ) thought that Musailama was the person from his dream who would bring false teachings.

title: Prophet's Dream Interpretation
content: Abu Musa said the Prophet told him: 'I had a dream where I moved from Mecca to a place with many date trees. I thought it was Al-Yamama or Hajar, but it turned out to be Medina. In my dream, I saw myself moving a sword that broke into pieces. This meant we would lose at Uhud. But when I picked up the sword again, it became whole and strong, which showed Allah helped us win and brought us together. I also saw cows in my dream, and they represented the believers who stood firm on Uhud. The good things Allah gave us after Badr were a blessing.

title: Fatima's Visit to the Prophet
content: One day Fatima came to visit her father, the Prophet. He welcomed her warmly and made her sit next to him. He told her a secret that made her cry. I asked her why she was crying, but she didn't tell me. Then he shared another secret with her that made her laugh. I noticed how quickly her mood changed from sadness to happiness. Later, when the Prophet passed away, I asked Fatima about what had happened. She told me that the Prophet said Gabriel had come twice this year to review the Quran with him. He thought this might mean his own death was near and she would be the first of their family to join him in heaven. The Prophet (ﷺ) also offered her a great honor: to be the leader of all women in Paradise or among believers. This made her happy, and I saw how quickly her sadness turned to joy.

title: Fatima's Secret with Prophet
content: Fatima came to visit the Prophet. He welcomed her warmly and made her sit next to him. Then he shared a secret with her, but she started crying. I asked her why she was crying, and then the Prophet shared another secret that made her laugh. I saw how quickly her mood changed from sadness to happiness. When I asked Fatima what the Prophet had told her, she said she wouldn't tell me. After the Prophet passed away, I asked her again about it. She explained that the Prophet was worried because Gabriel had reviewed the Quran with him twice this year instead of once. He thought this might mean he would die soon and Fatima would be the first from his family to join him in heaven. This made her cry. But then the Prophet told her she could be the leader of all women in paradise, which made her happy.

title: The Prophet's Secret Message
content: Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) was very ill. He called his daughter Fatima and told her something that made her cry. Then he told her another secret, and she started laughing. When I asked her what happened, she said the Prophet told her he would die soon. She cried because of this news. But then he secretly told her that she would be the first from their family to join him in heaven. This made her happy and she laughed.

title: Prophet's Secret to Fatima
content: When the Prophet was very ill, he called his daughter Fatima and told her two secrets. The first secret made her cry because she knew he would soon die. But then he told her another secret that made her happy: she would be the first of his family to join him after death.

title: Umar's Favoritism for Ibn Abbas
content: Sa'id bin Jubair said that Umar bin Al-Khattab treated Ibn Abbas very well. Someone told Umar, 'You're being unfair to him.' Umar replied, 'It's because of his knowledge.' Then Umar asked Ibn Abbas about a verse from the Quran: 'When Allah helps and Mecca is conquered.' Ibn Abbas said, 'This verse meant that the Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) would soon die, as Allah had already told him.' Umar said, 'I only understand what you know from this verse.'

title: Prophet's Last Gathering
content: When the Prophet was very sick, he came out of his house. He sat on a high platform and praised Allah. He said: 'More people will come to live here, but fewer Ansar will stay. They'll be like salt in food - not many, but important. If someone becomes powerful, they should help good people from the Ansar and forgive those who made mistakes.' This was his last meeting with everyone.

title: Prophet Muhammad's Son on Pulpit
content: The Prophet (ﷺ) brought his son Al-Hasan to the pulpit and said, 'This is my leader. I hope Allah will help him bring peace between two groups of Muslims.'

title: Prophet knew about Ja'far's death
content: The Prophet (ﷺ) had told us that Ja'far and Zaid were dead before we heard the news. He was crying because of it.

title: Prophet's Prediction of Carpets
content: Jabir said the Prophet asked if he had carpets. Jabir replied that they didn't have any, but the Prophet said they would soon get some. Jabir was hesitant to remove his existing carpets, so he told his wife to keep them in place. But she reminded him of the Prophet's words and he agreed to wait.

title: Sa'd bin Mu'adh's Umra
content: Sa'd bin Mu'adh came to Mecca for a special visit called 'Umra. He stayed with Umaiya, who often visited Sa'd in Medina. Umaiya suggested that Sa'd wait until midday when people are at home before visiting the Kaaba. Sa'd went around the Kaaba, but Abu Jahl saw him and asked who he was. Sa'd said it was him, and Abu Jahl said, 'You're safe to visit the Kaaba even though you've helped Muhammad (ﷺ)?' Sa'd said yes, and they started arguing. Umaiya told Sa'd not to shout at Abu Jahl because he's a leader in Mecca. Sa'd said that if Abu Jahl stops him from visiting the Kaaba, he'll ruin his trade with Syria. Umaiya kept trying to calm Sa'd down. Sa'd got angry and said that Muhammad (ﷺ) had said he would kill Abu Jahl. Umaiya went home and told his wife what happened. She said she believed Muhammad (ﷺ) never lies. When the non-Muslims were getting ready for a battle, Umaiya's wife reminded him of what Sa'd said. He decided not to go, but Abu Jahl convinced him to join them for a day or two. Unfortunately, Allah had other plans for Umaiya.

title: Abu Bakr's Weakness
content: Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) said: I saw people gathered together. Abu Bakr got up and drew some water from a well, but he struggled to do it. Allah forgive him. Then Umar took the bucket and was able to draw a lot of water easily. He kept drawing until everyone had enough to drink and their camels were also given water.

title: Gabriel Visits the Prophet
content: Abu Uthman told me that Gabriel came to see the Prophet while Um Salama was with him. Gabriel talked to the Prophet and then left. The Prophet (ﷺ) asked Um Salama who it was, and she said 'Dihya'. But later she realized it must have been Gabriel because the Prophet mentioned him in a sermon.

title: Jews and Stoning in Islam
content: Some Jews came to the Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ). They said a man and woman from their community had done something wrong together. The Prophet (ﷺ) asked what the Torah said about punishing them by stoning. The Jews said they would announce the crime and whip them. Abdullah bin Salam said this was not true, that the Torah actually says to stone them. The Jews brought out the Torah and read it. When they lifted their hand from a certain verse, the words about stoning were visible. The Prophet (ﷺ) then decided to follow what the Torah said and ordered both people to be stoned.

title: The Moon Was Split
content: Abdullah bin Masud said the Prophet once saw the moon split into two parts. The Prophet (ﷺ) asked people to bear witness to this event.

title: The Splitting of the Moon
content: Some people from Mecca asked the Prophet to show them a miracle. He then showed them that he could split the moon in two.

title: The Moon Was Split
content: Ibn Abbas said that during the time of the Prophet, the moon was split into two parts.

title: Two Companions and the Lamps
content: Anas said that two of the Prophet's companions left his house on a very dark night. They were guided by two lights, like lamps, in front of them. When they went their separate ways, each companion had one light with him until he reached home.

title: Some Followers Will Remain Victorious
content: The Prophet (ﷺ) said that some of his followers will stay on the right path until the end of time and still be successful.

title: Prophet's Promise to His Followers
content: Muawiya said he heard the Prophet say: 'Some of my followers will stay on the right path and no one can harm them. They won't be helped or opposed until Allah's final order comes.'

title: Prophet's Gift and Blessing
content: The Prophet (ﷺ) gave `Urwa one Dinar to buy a sheep. He bought two sheep with the money, then sold one for a Dinar. The Prophet (ﷺ) blessed `Urwa in his deals, so he made good profits from any purchase.

title: Prophet's Gift and Blessing
content: The Prophet (ﷺ) gave `Urwa one Dinar to buy a sheep. `Urwa bought two sheep with the money, then sold one for a Dinar. He brought back the Dinar and a sheep to the Prophet. The Prophet (ﷺ) asked Allah to bless him in his deals. This means that `Urwa would always make a profit from any trade he made.

title: Goodness in Horses
content: Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) said: There is always good in horses until the Day of Judgment.

title: Goodness in Horses
content: The Prophet (ﷺ) said: 'There is always goodness in horses.'

title: Horses and Reward
content: The Prophet (ﷺ) said: A horse can be kept for three reasons. It might help someone do good deeds in Allah's name, like keeping it loose to eat grass. If the horse breaks free and runs around, even its waste is a good deed. Or a horse might be kept so its owner can earn money honestly. But if someone keeps a horse just to show off or hurt others, it becomes a problem. The Prophet (ﷺ) was asked about donkeys too. He said that anyone who does something good, no matter how small, will see the reward. And anyone who does something bad will also see the punishment.

title: Prophet Muhammad Conquers Khaibar
content: The Prophet (ﷺ) arrived at Khaibar in the morning. The people of Khaibar came out with their tools, but when they saw the Prophet and his army, they went back to the fort quickly. The Prophet (ﷺ) raised his hands and said, 'Allah is greater! Khaibar will be conquered!' If we attack a town, it's bad news for those who are warned.

title: Remembering the Prophet's Words
content: Abu Huraira said to the Prophet: 'I hear many things you say but I forget them.' The Prophet (ﷺ) told him to spread his cloak. He did, and the Prophet scooped something from his hands into the cloak. Abu Huraira wrapped it around himself and never forgot what he heard.

title: Victory in Holy Wars
content: The Prophet (ﷺ) said: A time will come when a group of people go to war. They'll be asked, 'Is there anyone who knew the Prophet?' They'll say yes and win. Then another time, they'll be asked, 'Is there anyone who knew his companions?' Again, they'll say yes and win. Finally, they'll be asked, 'Is there anyone who knew the companions of the Prophet's companions?' And again, they'll say yes and win.

title: Best Followers of the Prophet
content: Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) said: The best people after me are those who live in my time. Then come those who follow them. He warned that later on, some people will give false testimonies without being asked to, and they will break their promises and be dishonest. They will also become very overweight.

title: Best Generations of People
content: The Prophet (ﷺ) said that the best people are those who lived during his time. Then come those who follow them, and then those who follow after them. Later, there will be people who give witness before taking an oath, and take an oath before giving witness.

title: Abu Bakr's Story
content: Abu Bakr bought a saddle from Azib for thirteen Dirhams. He asked Azib to tell Al-Bara' to carry the saddle, but Azib wanted Abu Bakr to share what happened when they left Mecca with Allah's Messenger (ﷺ). Abu Bakr said they traveled at night and during the day until midday. They looked for shade and found a rock where Abu Bakr cleaned it and made a bed for the Prophet. He asked the Prophet to lie down, then went out to see if anyone was following them. A shepherd came with his sheep, and Abu Bakr asked him about his owner. The shepherd said he belonged to a man from Quraish, which Abu Bakr recognized. Abu Bakr asked the shepherd for milk, which he gave them after cleaning his hands. They poured water on the milk container and gave it to the Prophet, who drank until Abu Bakr was pleased. Then they left Mecca while the people were searching for them. Suraqah bin Malik bin Ju`shum found them, but the Prophet said not to grieve because Allah is with them.

title: Abu Bakr in the Cave
content: I was hiding with the Prophet in a cave. I said to him, 'If one of our enemies looks down, he'll see us.' He replied, 'What do you think about two people when Allah is with them?'

title: Abu Bakr's Choice
content: Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) said to the people: 'Allah has given a person a choice between this world and what is with Him. This person chose what is with Allah.' Abu Bakr cried when he heard this, and we were surprised because of his tears. We later learned that Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) was talking about himself. He also said that Abu Bakr had been the most helpful to him in both companionship and wealth. If Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) could choose a close friend other than Allah, it would be Abu Bakr. However, their bond is based on Islamic brotherhood and friendship. The Prophet (ﷺ) ordered that all mosque gates should remain closed except the one leading to Abu Bakr.

title: Who Was Best During Prophet's Time
content: Ibn Umar said that when the Prophet was alive, people used to compare each other. They thought Abu Bakr was the best, then Umar, and then Uthman.

title: Prophet's Choice for Khalil
content: The Prophet (ﷺ) said he would have chosen Abu Bakr as his close friend if he had to choose one. But in reality, Abu Bakr is both his brother and companion in Islam.

title: Prophet's Choice of Companion
content: The Prophet (ﷺ) said: If I had to choose a special friend, it would be Abu Bakr. But the relationship between Muslims is even stronger and better.

title: Inheritance of Grandfather
content: The people of Kufa wrote to Ibn Az-Zubair asking about inheritance rules. He replied that a grandfather's share is the same as a father's if the father is not alive. Ibn Az-Zubair also said that Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) would have chosen Abu Bakr as his close friend if he had to choose one from all people.

title: A Woman's Visit to the Prophet
content: A woman visited the Prophet. He asked her to come back again. She said, 'What if I came and you weren't here?' The Prophet (ﷺ) said, 'If that happens, go see Abu Bakr instead'.

title: Allah's Messenger with Five Slaves
content: I saw the Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ). He was with five people who were servants of his household. Two women and Abu Bakr, a man who had converted to Islam, were also there.

title: Abu Bakr's Quarrel Resolved
content: I was sitting with the Prophet when Abu Bakr arrived. He had a quarrel with his brother, `Umar. Abu Bakr said he talked harshly to him and regretted it. The Prophet (ﷺ) forgave Abu Bakr three times. Later, `Umar realized his mistake and went to see the Prophet. But the Prophet was still upset until Abu Bakr apologized for `Umar's behavior. The Prophet (ﷺ) praised Abu Bakr for supporting him and said no one should harm him again.

title: Who is the Prophet's Favorite?
content: The Prophet (ﷺ) asked me to lead an army. I went back to him and said, 'Who do you love most?' He said, 'Aisha.' I asked, 'Among men?' He said, 'Her father, Abu Bakr.' Then he said, 'Then `Umar bin Al-Khattab' and named some other men.

title: Sheep and a Talking Wolf
content: Abu Huraira said he heard the Prophet say: 'A wolf took one of a shepherd's sheep. The wolf said to the shepherd,

title: Abu Huraira's Dream
content: I, Abu Huraira, heard the Prophet say: 'While I was sleeping, I saw a well with a bucket. I drew as much water as Allah wanted me to. Then Abu Bakr took the bucket and brought out some water, but he struggled a bit. May Allah forgive him for that weakness. The bucket got bigger, and then Umar took it over. He worked very hard until everyone had enough water to drink and their camels were satisfied.

title: Pride in Clothing
content: Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) said: Allah will not look at someone on the Day of Judgment if they walk with their clothes dragging behind them because of pride. Abu Bakr said, 'My clothes sometimes fall down.' The Prophet (ﷺ) replied, 'But you don't do it to show off.'

title: Reward for Good Deeds
content: Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) said: 'If someone spends two things in the way of Allah, they will be called from all doors of Paradise. If they pray, they'll be called from the prayer door. If they fight for Islam, they'll be called from the Jihad door. If they give charity, they'll be called from the charity door. And if they fast, they'll be called from the fasting door.' Abu Bakr said: 'If someone is called from all doors, they won't need anything else.' Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) said: 'Yes, and I hope you will be among them, Abu Bakr.'

title: Abu Bakr Becomes Caliph
content: 'Umar said that Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) had not died. But Abu Bakr came and kissed the Prophet, saying he was good in life and death. 'Umar then sat down when Abu Bakr spoke. Abu Bakr praised Allah and said that whoever worshipped Muhammad (ﷺ) was now dead, but whoever worshipped Allah would live on. He recited two verses from the Quran to support this. The people cried loudly. The Ansar wanted one of their own as leader, but Abu Bakr suggested 'Umar or Abu Ubaida should be their leader instead. They agreed and gave Abu Bakr their pledge of allegiance.

title: Abu Bakr Becomes the Leader
content: 'Umar said that Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) is not dead. Abu Bakr came and uncovered the face of Allah's Messenger (ﷺ), kissed him, and praised Allah. He said that whoever worshipped Muhammad (ﷺ), then Muhammad (ﷺ) is dead, but whoever worshipped Allah, then Allah is Alive and shall never die. The people wept loudly. Abu Bakr spoke to the Ansar and said that they should have one leader from them and one from the emigrants. 'Umar wanted to speak but Abu Bakr stopped him. Then Abu Bakr became the leader and the people gave their pledge of allegiance to him.

title: Who are the best people?
content: My son Muhammad (ﷺ) asked me, 'Who are the best people after the Prophet?' I said, 'Abu Bakr is one of them.' He asked again, 'And who else?' I said, 'Then `Umar.' My son was quiet for a moment. Then he asked, 'What about you, Father?' I said, 'I am just an ordinary person, not special like Abu Bakr and `Umar.'

title: Lost Necklace at Al-Baida
content: I lost my necklace on a trip with the Prophet. He stopped to help me find it. People got thirsty because there was no water nearby. Abu Bakr scolded me for making everyone wait, but I didn't move because the Prophet's head was on my lap. The next morning, we found no water and the Prophet received a message from Allah about how to clean ourselves without water. We used this method called Tayammum. Later, we looked under the camel I was sitting on and found the necklace.

title: Respect the Prophet's Companions
content: The Prophet (ﷺ) said: Do not criticize my friends. If you gave a lot of money for good causes, it wouldn't be as valuable as one of them giving a small amount of food to help others.

title: Abu Musa's Day with the Prophet
content: Abu Musa went to the mosque and found the Prophet. He wanted to stay close to him all day, so he followed him until they reached a place called Bir Aris. The Prophet (ﷺ) finished his ablution and sat by the well. Abu Musa greeted him and then went back outside to wait at the gate. When Abu Bakr came, Abu Musa let him in and told him that the Prophet gave him good news about going to Paradise. Then 'Umar arrived, and Abu Musa did the same thing for him. Later, 'Uthman came, but there was no room left by the well, so he sat opposite the Prophet.

title: Prophet's Visit to Uhud
content: The Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) went up a mountain called Uhud with three of his companions: Abu Bakr, Umar, and Uthman. The mountain started shaking under their feet. The Prophet (ﷺ) told the mountain, 'Stay firm, Uhud! You have only one Prophet, one truthful person, and two people who died fighting for Islam.'

title: Abu Bakr's Strength in Prayer
content: Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) was dreaming. He was by a well, drawing water from it. Abu Bakr and Umar came to him. Abu Bakr took the bucket and drew some water, but he struggled a bit. Then Umar took the bucket and it became very big in his hands. Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) had never seen anyone work as hard as Umar did. He drew so much water that people drank enough and their camels were satisfied.

title: Umar's Funeral Prayer
content: Ibn Abbas was standing with people praying for Umar who lay on his bed. A man behind him leaned forward and said, 'May Allah be merciful to you.' He often heard the Prophet say that he, Abu Bakr, and Umar were together or did something together. So he hoped Umar would join them. Ibn Abbas turned around and saw it was Ali bin Abi Talib speaking.

title: Pagans Hurt Prophet Muhammad
content: `Abdullah bin `Amr told me that the pagans did something very bad to the Prophet. They tried to hurt him while he was praying. One of them, `Uqba, put his cloth around the Prophet's neck and squeezed it tightly. Abu Bakr came and stopped `Uqba from hurting the Prophet. The pagans were angry because the Prophet said that Allah is his Lord and he brought clear signs from Allah.

title: Prophet's Dream about Paradise
content: Jabir said the Prophet told him: 'I had a dream where I entered Paradise. I saw Ar-Rumaisa', Abu Talha's wife, there. Then I heard footsteps and asked who it was. Someone said it was Bilal. Next, I saw a palace with a lady sitting outside. I asked whose palace it was. Someone replied it belonged to `Umar. I wanted to go in and see it, but I thought about how you might feel if I entered your home without permission. So I didn't go in.' `Umar said: 'I swear by my parents, I would never think badly of the Prophet's intentions.'

title: Allah's Messenger Sees Paradise
content: Abu Huraira said that one day Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) was with us. He fell asleep and saw himself in a beautiful place called Paradise. There, he saw a woman washing her hands and face near a big house. He asked who the house belonged to, and they told him it was for Umar. The Messenger remembered how proud Umar is and quickly woke up. When he woke up, Umar was crying. He said to Allah's Messenger (ﷺ): 'How could I think that you would offend my pride?'

title: Prophet's Dream about Milk
content: The Prophet (ﷺ) was sleeping and had a dream. In the dream, he was drinking milk and felt very happy. The milk was flowing through his fingers. After waking up, he gave some of the milk to Umar. When asked what it meant, the Prophet said that the milk represented knowledge.

title: The Prophet's Dream About Water
content: The Prophet (ﷺ) said, 'I had a dream where I was drawing water from a well with a bucket. Abu Bakr came and helped me draw some water, but it was weak. Then Umar came and the bucket got bigger in his hands. He worked hard until everyone had enough to drink and their camels were satisfied.'

title: Umar Meets the Prophet
content: Umar bin Al-Khattab asked to see the Prophet. Some women were talking loudly with him and asking for more money. When Umar arrived, they quickly covered their faces. The Prophet (ﷺ) smiled when he saw Umar. Umar said, 'May Allah always keep you smiling.' The Prophet (ﷺ) said that these women surprised him because they quickly put on veils when they heard Umar's voice. Umar told the women, 'You should fear the Prophet more than me.' They replied, 'Yes, because you are harsher and stricter than him.' The Prophet (ﷺ) then said to Umar, 'Satan always takes a different path from yours'.

title: Powerful Since Omar Embraced Islam
content: Abdullah said: We were strong after Umar became a Muslim

title: `Ali's Words for `Umar
content: When `Umar was dying, many people went to visit him. I was there too. Suddenly, `Ali took hold of my shoulder and said a prayer for `Umar. He said, 'I wish you were staying with Abu Bakr and you, O `Umar.' He explained that he often heard the Prophet say how he, Abu Bakr, and `Umar would do things together.

title: Prophet Ascends Uhud Mountain
content: The Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) went to the mountain of Uhud with Abu Bakr, Umar, and Uthman. The mountain shook under their feet. The Prophet (ﷺ) kicked it with his foot and said, 'Be strong, Uhud! You have a Prophet, a truthful person, and two martyrs on you'.

title: Ibn Umar's Respect for Omar
content: Ibn Umar asked me about some things related to Omar. He said that after the Prophet passed away, he never saw anyone as serious, hardworking and generous as Omar bin Al-Khattab.

title: Preparation for the Day of Judgment
content: A man asked the Prophet about when the Day of Judgment would come. The Prophet (ﷺ) asked him what he had prepared for that day. The man said he loved Allah and the Prophet. The Prophet (ﷺ) replied, 'You will be with those you love.' We were very happy to hear this because it means we can be with people we care about, like the Prophet, Abu Bakr, and Umar.

title: Prophets were not the only guides
content: The Prophet (ﷺ) said that some people from a nation before us received guidance without being prophets. He believed 'Umar was one of these people, who also received guidance among his followers.

title: The Wolf's Threat to Humanity
content: Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) said that a wolf attacked some sheep and took one away. The shepherd chased the wolf and got the sheep back. The wolf then told the shepherd, 'Who will protect you when I'm not there?' People were amazed by this. Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) believed what the wolf said and so did Abu Bakr and Umar.

title: Abu Sa'id's Dream
content: I, Abu Sa'id, was with the Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ). He told us about a dream he had. In his dream, people were shown to him wearing shirts that covered their chests and some that went down further. Umar was one of them, and his shirt was very long, dragging on the ground. We asked the Prophet what it meant. He said: 'Religion is like this.'

title: Umar's Words to Ibn Abbas
content: `Umar was hurt. Ibn `Abbas said, 'Don't worry, you've been with the Prophet and he liked you. You were also with Abu Bakr and he liked you too. And now you're with the Muslims, they like you as well.' `Umar replied, 'What I'm grateful for is Allah's favor to me. But what I'm worried about is leaving this world while still being punished by Allah. If I had all the gold in the world, I would trade it to be safe from Allah's punishment when I meet Him'.

title: Abu Bakr, Umar, and Uthman
content: I was with the Prophet in a garden in Medina. A man came to me and asked to open the gate. The Prophet (ﷺ) said, 'Let him in and tell him he will go to Paradise.' I opened the gate for him, and it was Abu Bakr. He thanked Allah when I told him what the Prophet said. Another man came and asked to enter. The Prophet (ﷺ) said, 'Let him in and tell him he will go to Paradise.' It was Umar this time. He also thanked Allah when I shared the good news. Then another man arrived, asking to come in. The Prophet (ﷺ) said, 'Let him in and tell him he will go to Paradise, but with a hardship that will come his way.' This person was Uthman. When I told him what the Prophet had said, he praised Allah and asked for His help.

title: Prophet with Umar's Hand
content: I was with the Prophet. He had `Umar bin Al-Khattab by his hand while we were together.

title: The Prophet Guards a Garden
content: The Prophet (ﷺ) entered a garden and told me to guard the gate. A man came in and asked permission to enter. The Prophet (ﷺ) said, 'Let him in and tell him he'll go to Paradise.' It was Abu Bakr. Another man came in and asked permission. The Prophet (ﷺ) said, 'Let him in and tell him he'll go to Paradise.' It was Umar. Then another man came in. The Prophet (ﷺ) waited a moment before saying, 'Let him in and tell him he'll go to Paradise with some trouble.' It was Uthman bin Affan. When Uthman entered, the Prophet covered his knees.

title: Talking to the Caliph
content: Two men, Al-Miswar and `Abdur-Rahman, told me to talk to `Uthman about his brother Al-Walid. People were talking badly about him. I went to see `Uthman when he was going for prayer. I said, 'I have something important to tell you.' He said, 'What is it?' I explained that Allah sent the Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) with the truth and that `Uthman followed him and participated in two important journeys. People were talking about Al-Walid. `Uthman asked if I had learned this from the Prophet directly. I said no, but everyone knew it. `Uthman said he also followed the Prophet and believed in what he was sent with. He said he never disobeyed the Prophet and that he treated Abu Bakr and `Umar the same way when they were Caliph. Then he became Caliph himself. He asked if this meant he had the same rights as them. I said yes. He then dealt with Al-Walid by calling him to be punished.

title: Respecting the Companions
content: Ibn Umar said: During the time of the Prophet, we thought Abu Bakr was the best. Then came Umar and then Uthman. But after that, we didn't think any other companion was better than the others.

title: Excuses for Uthman's Absence
content: `Uthman was asked about his absences from battles. He explained that he had been excused by Allah for fleeing at Uhud, because the Prophet's daughter was sick and needed him to stay with her. At Badr, he stayed with her instead of fighting. For the pledge of allegiance in Hudaibiya, the Prophet sent someone on his behalf because `Uthman was already gone.

title: Prophet on Uhud Mountain
content: The Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) went to the mountain of Uhud with Abu Bakr, Umar, and Uthman. The mountain started shaking. The Prophet (ﷺ) said, 'Be calm, Uhud.' He then stepped on it and said, 'You have a Prophet, a truthful person, and two martyrs.'

title: Umar's Last Days
content: `Amr bin Maimun saw `Umar a few days before he was stabbed in Medina. `Umar asked two men, Hudhaifa and `Uthman, if they had taxed the land too much. They said no, but `Umar warned them to check again. He said that if Allah kept him alive, he would make sure the widows of Iraq didn't need anyone's help after him. Four days later, `Umar was stabbed to death. When he died, his body was carried out and people praised him. A young man came to give him good news from Allah because of his time with the Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) and his fairness as a ruler. `Umar wished that all these good things would balance out his mistakes so nothing bad happened when he died. He asked for permission to be buried with the Prophet and Abu Bakr, but Hafsa said no. Then she gave permission after talking to Abdullah bin Umar. When `Umar died, people wanted him to appoint a successor. He recommended six men: Ali, Uthman, Zubair, Talha, Sa'd, and Abdur-Rahman. He told them to take care of the early emigrants and be kind to the Ansar. After `Umar was buried, his group met to choose a new leader. They reduced the candidates to three: Ali, Uthman, and Abdur-Rahman. Abdur-Rahman took an oath from both men that they would do what was best for Islam if he chose them as leaders. He then gave `Uthman the pledge of allegiance, followed by Ali and all the people in Medina.

title: Ali Given the Flag
content: Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) said he would give a flag to someone who would lead Muslims to victory. People thought about it all night, wondering who it would be. The next morning, they asked Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) and he said to bring Ali bin Abi Talib. Ali was sick with eye trouble, but the Prophet spat in his eyes and made him better. Then the Prophet gave Ali the flag. Ali asked if he should fight until the enemy was defeated. The Prophet (ﷺ) said to approach them calmly, invite them to Islam, and tell them about their duties towards Allah. He said that guiding one person to Islam would be better than having many camels.

title: Ali Joins the Battle
content: Ali stayed behind during a battle because he had eye trouble. He wanted to join the Prophet, so he left and caught up with him just before they won the day. The Prophet (ﷺ) said he would give the flag to someone who loved Allah and Him. Suddenly Ali appeared, and the Prophet gave him the flag. They won the battle under his leadership.

title: Ali's Nickname from the Prophet
content: A man told Sahl bin Sa'd that the Governor of Medina was calling Ali bad names near the pulpit. The Governor said 'Abu Turab', which means 'man with dust'. Sahl laughed and said only the Prophet had given Ali this name, and it was a name Ali loved. Sahl explained how the Prophet gave Ali this nickname: when Ali slept in the mosque, his blanket slipped off and he got dusty. The Prophet (ﷺ) found him and wiped away the dust, calling him 'Abu Turab' twice.

title: Ibn Umar Defends Two Leaders
content: A man asked Ibn Umar about two important leaders, 'Uthman and 'Ali. Ibn Umar talked about their good actions. The man seemed upset. Ibn Umar said, 'May Allah make you feel ashamed!' The man kept asking questions. Ibn Umar again mentioned the good things about 'Uthman and 'Ali. He said, 'These are true facts.' When the man got angry again, Ibn Umar told him to leave and do whatever he wanted against him.

title: Fatima's Request for a Servant
content: Fatima told Aisha that she was tired of working with the hand mill. When the Prophet came home, Aisha told him about Fatima's visit. The Prophet (ﷺ) said to Ali, 'Stay in bed.' He sat down between them and said, 'I can teach you something better than a servant. Before sleeping, say

title: Ali's Message to Iraq
content: Ali told the people of 'Iraq: 'Keep judging as you used to. I want everyone to be together in one group, or I will die like my friends did.'

title: Abu Huraira's Humble Life
content: People said I told too many stories from the Prophet. But I was close to him and just ate what I needed. I didn't wear fancy clothes or get served by others. Sometimes, I'd press my belly on rocks because I was hungry. If someone asked me to listen to a Quran verse, I'd go to their house for food. Ja'far bin Abi Talib was kind to the poor. He invited us to his home and shared what little he had. Even if it was just an empty butter container, we'd split it and eat what was left.

title: Ibn Umar's Greeting
content: When Ibn Umar met Ibn Jafar, he would say: 'Peace be with you. You are the son of someone who was given two wings.'

title: Umar Asks Allah for Rain
content: When there was a drought, Umar would ask his friend Al-Abbas to pray for rain. He'd say: 'We used to ask our Prophet to ask Allah for rain, and He would give us some. Now we're asking the uncle of our Prophet to do the same, so please give us rain.' And they would get rain.

title: Fatima Asks for Her Share
content: 'Aisha said that Fatima asked Abu Bakr to give her some of the Prophet's money. She wanted Fadak, a special place near Medina, and some of the money from Khaibar. Abu Bakr told her that Prophets don't leave property for their families. They can only use it for food if they need it. He said he would keep things as they were when the Prophet was alive. 'Ali spoke up and said he believed in Allah and the Prophet. He acknowledged Abu Bakr's leadership and explained why they should get some of the money. Abu Bakr replied that he loved to help the Prophet's relatives, even more than his own family.

title: Fatima's Inheritance Dispute
content: 'Aisha told me that Fatima asked Abu Bakr for her share of the Prophet's wealth. She wanted Fadak, some charity money from Medina, and a part of the Khaibar booty. Abu Bakr said the Prophet's message was clear: Prophets' property isn't inherited. Whatever is left becomes charity. But their families can use it to eat if they need to. He promised to keep things as they were during the Prophet's time. 'Ali spoke up, saying he believed in Allah and the Prophet, and acknowledged Abu Bakr's leadership. Abu Bakr said he loved helping the Prophet's relatives more than his own.

title: Respecting Fatima's Feelings
content: Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) said: 'Fatima is a part of me. If someone makes her unhappy, it makes me unhappy too.'

title: Prophet's Secret Message
content: The Prophet (ﷺ) called his daughter Fatima when he was ill. He told her a secret that made her cry. Then, he told her another secret that made her laugh. When I asked her about it, she said the Prophet had told her two things: first, that he would soon die from this illness; second, that she would be the first of his family to follow him after he died.

title: Prophet's Secret Messages
content: The Prophet (ﷺ) called his daughter Fatima when he was sick. He told her a secret that made her cry. Then, he told her another secret and she laughed. When I asked her about it, she said the Prophet had told her two things: he would soon die from this illness, so she cried. And he also told her she would be the first of his family to follow him after he died, so she laughed.

title: `Uthman Appoints Zubair
content: `Uthman bin `Affan was very sick with a bad nosebleed. He couldn't go on Hajj, so he made his will. A man from the tribe of Quraish came to him and said, 'Choose your successor.' `Uthman asked if the people had chosen someone already. The man didn't answer. Another man, Al-Harith, came in and also said, 'Choose your successor.' Again, `Uthman asked if the people had chosen someone, but this man stayed quiet too. Then `Uthman thought of Az-Zubair and asked if that was who the people wanted. The man said yes. `Uthman said, 'I think Zubair is the best choice, and I know he's the one Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) liked most.'

title: Uthman's Successor
content: Marwan bin Al-Hakam was with Uthman. A man came and said, 'Choose your successor.' Uthman asked, 'Has someone been chosen?' The man replied, 'Yes, it is Az-Zubair.' Uthman said three times, 'By Allah, he is the best of you all'.

title: Prophet Muhammad's Trusted Friend
content: The Prophet (ﷺ) said that every prophet had a close helper. My helper is Az-Zubair bin Al-'Awwam.

title: Az-Zubair's Journey to Bani Quraiza
content: During the battle of Al-Ahzab, I was with my father Az-Zubair. He went twice or three times to Bani Quraiza and back. When he returned, I asked him, 'Dad, why did you go there?' He said, 'The Prophet (ﷺ) asked me to bring news from Bani Quraiza.' The Prophet (ﷺ) then praised both of his parents, saying, 'May my father and mother be sacrificed for you'.

title: Az-Zubair's Bravery at Al-Yarmuk
content: During the battle of Al-Yarmuk, Az-Zubair's friends asked him to attack the enemy strongly. He agreed and fought bravely. The enemy hurt his shoulder twice in one place where he had an old wound from a previous battle at Badr. When Az-Zubair was a child, he used to play with the scars on his shoulder by putting his fingers into them.

title: Messenger's Companions in Battle
content: During a fight, the Prophet was left with only two companions: Talha and Sa'd.

title: Prophet's Companions in Battle
content: During a battle, the Prophet was left with only two companions: Talha and Sa'd.

title: Talha Protects the Prophet
content: Qais bin Abi Hazim saw that Talha's paralyzed hand was covering the Prophet to protect him from an arrow.

title: Prophet's Parents Sacrificed
content: On the day of the battle of Uhud, the Prophet mentioned his parents to me, saying 'Let my parents be sacrificed for you'.

title: Sa'd's Experience at Mosque
content: I was among a third of all the Muslims who stood for prayer

title: Sa'd bin Abi Waqqas' Story
content: Sa'd bin Abi Waqqas said: No one became a Muslim before I did. And for seven days, I was one of the top three Muslims in number.

title: Sa'd's Early Struggle
content: I heard Sa'd say he was the first Arab to fight for Allah. He and other companions fought alongside the Prophet, but they didn't have much food. They ate leaves from trees, which made their waste look like camel or sheep droppings. The Banu Asad tribe said Sa'd didn't understand Islam well. They complained to `Umar that Sa'd's prayers were not perfect.

title: Fatima's Concern about Marriage
content: Fatima told the Prophet that people thought he didn't care if his daughters married men from other tribes. She mentioned that Ali wanted to marry the daughter of Abu Jahl, a man who was once Allah's enemy. The Prophet (ﷺ) stood up and said: 'I know I married one of my daughters to a man before Islam and he kept his promises. Fatima is like a part of me, so I don't want her to be unhappy. It wouldn't be right for the daughter of the Prophet and the daughter of Allah's enemy to marry the same man.' Ali then cancelled the engagement.

title: The Prophet's Support for Usama
content: The Prophet (ﷺ) sent an army led by Usama bin Zaid. Some people criticized his leadership. The Prophet (ﷺ) said, 'You used to criticize his father's leadership too.' He added, 'Usama was worthy of leadership and one of my closest friends. Now, he is one of the people I love most after his father.'

title: A Qaif's Accurate Observation
content: Aisha said a man came to her while the Prophet was there. This man could tell people's family by looking at them. He looked at Usama and his father, Zaid bin Haritha, who were sleeping. The man said they had the same family features. The Prophet (ﷺ) liked what he said.

title: Usama Speaks to the Prophet
content: Some people from the Quraish tribe were worried about a woman who had stolen something. They said that nobody should talk to the Prophet except Usama bin Zaid, because he is very close to the Prophet. A woman from Bani Makhzumiya had indeed stolen something and no one dared to speak to the Prophet for her. But Usama spoke up and asked the Prophet to forgive her. The Prophet (ﷺ) said that if a respected person from the children of Israel stole something, they would usually let him go free. But if a poor person stole, they would cut off his hand. He even said that he would cut off the hand of Fatima, his own daughter, if she stole something.

title: Ibn Umar Meets a Stranger
content: One day, Ibn Umar was in the mosque. He saw a man walking slowly in one corner of the mosque. Ibn Umar wanted to meet him. Someone said, 'That's Muhammad (ﷺ) bin Usama.' Ibn Umar bowed his head and dug into the earth with his hands. He thought that if the Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) had seen this man, he would have liked him.

title: The Prophet's Love for Children
content: Usama bin Zaid told me that the Prophet used to hold him and Al-Hasan in his lap. He would say, 'O Allah, love them like I do.' A freed slave of Usama said that a man named Al-Hajjaj was seen praying with mistakes. Ibn Umar asked him to repeat his prayer. When Al-Hajjaj left, Ibn Umar said, 'If the Prophet saw him, he would have loved him.' The Prophet (ﷺ) had a special love for the children of Um Aiman, who was one of his nurses.

title: Ibn Umar's Dream and Prayer
content: Ibn Umar wanted to see a dream so he could tell the Prophet about it. He was young, unmarried, and slept in the mosque during the Prophet's time. One night, two angels took him to a place that looked like a well with walls on both sides. Ibn Umar saw some people he knew inside it. He said 'I seek refuge from Hellfire' three times. Another angel came and said 'Don't be afraid.' When Ibn Umar woke up, he told his wife Hafsa about the dream. She told the Prophet, who said 'Abdullah is a good man if only he prayed at night.' After that, Abdullah started praying more at night.

title: Ibn Umar's Dream and Prayer
content: Ibn Umar wanted to see a dream that he could tell the Prophet about. He slept in the mosque, where the Prophet often stayed. One night, Ibn Umar had a dream where two angels took him towards a fire that looked like a well with walls on both sides. In the fire, he saw some people he knew. He said 'I seek refuge from the fire' twice. Another angel came and told him not to be afraid. When Ibn Umar woke up, he told his wife Hafsa about the dream. She told the Prophet, who said that Ibn Umar was a good man if only he prayed at night.

title: Prophet's Praise for Abdullah
content: The Prophet (ﷺ) said to Hafsa: 'Abdullah is a good person.'

title: Prophet's Praise for Abdullah
content: The Prophet (ﷺ) said to Hafsa, 'Abdullah is a good man.'

title: Meeting a Pious Companion
content: A student named Alqama went to Sham and prayed. He asked Allah for a good friend. Then he met some people and sat with them. An old man, Abu Ad-Darda', joined him. Alqama said, 'I prayed for a good friend and you came.' Abu Ad-Darda' asked where Alqama was from. Alqama replied that he was from Kufa. Abu Ad-Darda' asked if there were people in Kufa who had special qualities. He mentioned three people: one who helped the Prophet, one who kept secrets for the Prophet, and one who recited a specific verse of the Quran in a certain way. Alqama then recited the verse as he heard it from his teacher Abdullah bin Masud.

title: Alqama Meets Abu Ad-Darda
content: 'Alqama visited a mosque in Sham. He said to Allah: 'Give me a good friend.' Then he sat with Abu Ad-Darda. Abu Ad-Darda asked, 'Where are you from?' Alqama replied, 'From Kufa.' Abu Ad-Darda asked if there were people in Kufa who knew secrets and had special protection from Satan. Alqama said yes to both questions. Abu Ad-Darda then asked about a man named Abdullah bin Mas'ud. Alqama confirmed he was one of them. Abu Ad-Darda asked how Abdullah recited a certain Quranic verse, which starts with 'By the night as it envelops'. Alqama replied that Abdullah added 'And by male and female'. Abu Ad-Darda said people in Sham tried to change what he had learned from the Prophet.

title: Abu Ubaida: The Trustworthy One
content: Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) said that every nation has a very trustworthy person. For the Muslim community, Abu Ubaida bin Al-Jarrah is that person.

title: Prophet's Trustworthy Man
content: The Prophet (ﷺ) told the people of Najran that he would send them a trustworthy person. All his companions wanted to be this person, but then he sent Abu 'Ubaida.

title: Prophet's Words About Hasan
content: Abu Bakra said he heard the Prophet talking at a gathering. The Prophet (ﷺ) looked at his audience and then at Al-Hasan, who was sitting next to him. He said that Al-Hasan might be able to bring peace between two groups of Muslims.

title: Prophet's Prayer for Love
content: The Prophet (ﷺ) used to take Usama and Al-Hasan with him. He would say, 'O Allah, I love them. Please love them too.'

title: Al-Husain's Head is Disrespected
content: Anas bin Malik said that 'Ubaidullah bin Ziyad put Al-Husain's head in a tray. He then started playing with a stick at Al-Husain's nose and mouth, saying how handsome he was. Anas replied that Al-Husain looked more like the Prophet than anyone else did. Al-Husain's hair had been dyed.

title: Prophet's Love for Al-Hasan
content: Al-Bara saw the Prophet carrying his grandson Al-Hasan on his shoulder and saying, 'O Allah, I love him. Please love him too.'

title: Abu Bakr's Kind Words
content: `Uqba bin Al-Harith saw Abu Bakr carrying his son Al-Hasan. Abu Bakr said, 'I wish my father were sacrificed for you! You look like the Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) and not Ali.' Meanwhile, Ali was smiling about this.

title: Take Care of the Prophet's Family
content: Abu Bakr told Ibn Umar to look after Muhammad 's (ﷺ) family.

title: Prophet Muhammad's Resemblance
content: Anas said that Al-Hasan bin Ali looked most like the Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ).

title: Killing Flies is Not Allowed
content: Abdullah bin Umar was asked if a Muslim can kill flies. He said the people of Iraq were asking about killing flies, but they had actually killed the Prophet's grandson. The Prophet (ﷺ) called his grandsons Hasan and Husain 'my two sweet basils' in this world.

title: Umar's Respect for Abu Bakr
content: Jabir bin Abdullah said that Umar would often say: 'Abu Bakr is our leader, and he freed Bilal'.

title: Bilal's Request to Abu Bakr
content: Abu Bakr bought a slave named Bilal. Bilal asked Abu Bakr, 'If you bought me for yourself, keep me. If you bought me for Allah, let me go and serve Allah.'

title: Prophet Teaches Ibn Abbas
content: The Prophet (ﷺ) hugged me and said to Allah: 'Teach him wisdom'.

title: Prophet's Tears for Martyrs
content: The Prophet (ﷺ) told people about the death of Zaid, Ja`far, and Ibn Rawaha before they knew. He said with tears in his eyes: 'Zaid took the flag and died as a martyr. Then Ja`far took it and died too. After that, Ibn Rawaha took it and was killed. Finally, Khalid bin Al-Walid took the flag and Allah gave us victory.'

title: Learn from Four Scholars
content: `Abdullah bin `Amr said that he loves Abdullah bin Masud because the Prophet said to learn the Quran's recitation from four people: Abdullah bin Masud, Salim (who was freed by Abu Hudhaifa), Ubai bin Ka'b, and Mu`adh bin Jabal.

title: Prophet Muhammad's Character
content: Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) never spoke badly about people. He said the person he liked most was someone with good manners and character. He also told his companions to learn the Quran from four specific people: Abdullah bin Masud, Salim who was a freed slave of Abu Hudhaifa, Ubai bin Khab, and Muadh bin Jabal.

title: Character is Most Important
content: Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) never spoke badly about people. He said the person he liked most was someone with good character and manners. He wanted us to learn the Quran from four special people: Abdullah bin Mas'ud, Salim who was freed by Abu Hudhaifa, Ubai bin Ka'b, and Mu'adh bin Jabal.

title: Meeting a Pious Companion
content: I was praying in Sham when I asked Allah for a good friend. An old man came and asked where I was from. I said Kufa. He asked if we had certain people there, like the Prophet's shoe carrier and someone who kept secrets. Then he asked me to recite a verse from Surat-al-lail. I did, and he said that's how the Prophet used to read it.

title: Hudhaifa Describes a Good Person
content: We asked Hudhaifa to tell us about someone who looks and behaves like the Prophet. He said, 'I know someone named Ibn Um Abd who is similar in appearance and behavior.'

title: Abu Musa's Story
content: My brother and I came from Yemen. We thought Abdullah bin Mas'ud was a relative of the Prophet because we often saw him and his mother visiting the Prophet's house.

title: Muawiya's Witr Prayer
content: Ibn Abu Mulaika told us that Muawiya prayed one rak'a of witr after the night prayer. A freed slave of Ibn Abbas was there and went to tell Ibn Abbas about it. Ibn Abbas said, 'Leave him alone. He was with the Prophet.'

title: Ibn Abbas Meets Muawiyah
content: Someone told Ibn Abbas that Muawiyah, the leader of the believers, only prayed one rak'a as witr. Ibn Abbas said, 'Muawiyah is a learned man who knows Islamic laws.'

title: Muawiya's Concern About Prayer
content: Muawiya said to the people: 'You offer a prayer that we, who were companions of the Prophet, never saw him offering. He even forbade it.' This was about the two extra prayers after the compulsory Asr prayer.

title: Respect Fatima
content: The Prophet (ﷺ) said: 'Fatima is a part of me. If someone makes her angry, it makes me angry too.'

title: Gabriel Greets Aisha
content: One day, the Prophet said to me, 'Aisha, Gabriel is greeting you.' I replied, 'Peace and blessings be on him. He sees things that I don't see.'

title: Women Who Attained Perfection
content: Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) said: 'Some men have reached the highest level of goodness. Among women, only Mary and Asiya have achieved this. Aisha is like a special meal that stands out from others.'

title: Aisha's Superiority Over Other Women
content: Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) said that Aisha is better than all other women. He compared her to a meal called Tharid, saying she is like the best food of all meals.

title: Ibn Abbas Visits Aisha
content: Aisha was sick. Ibn Abbas went to visit her. He said, 'You're going to join the truthful leaders, like the Prophet and Abu Bakr.'

title: Ali's Message to Kufa
content: When Ali sent Ammar and Hasan to Kufa, they were told to encourage people to fight. Ammar said: 'I know that Aisha is the Prophet's wife in this life and the next. But Allah wants to see if you will follow Him or her.'

title: Lost Necklace Found
content: `Aisha borrowed a necklace from Asma', but it was lost. The Prophet (ﷺ) sent some friends to look for it. When they prayed without washing their hands, the Prophet told them about Tayammum, a way to purify yourself when water is not available. Usaid bin Hudair said to `Aisha, 'Whenever you have a problem, Allah helps you and gives something good to the Muslims.'

title: Prophet's Visit Before Death
content: When Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) was very sick, he would visit his wives and ask 'Where will I be tomorrow?' He wanted to stay with Aisha. When it was her turn, the Prophet stopped asking about where he would go next.

title: Prophet's Wives and Gifts
content: The Prophet 's (ﷺ) wives would get gifts on the day it was their turn. Aisha's friends said to Um Salama, 'Tell the Prophet that people should send gifts whenever they want, not just on our turn.' Um Salama told the Prophet three times, but he ignored her until she repeated it a third time. Then he said, 'Don't trouble me by hurting Aisha. The Quran never came to me while I was with any other wife except her'.

title: Who Named the Ansar?
content: Ghailan bin Jarir asked Anas about the name 'Al-Ansar'. He said Allah gave it to them. The Ansar would tell stories of their tribe's good deeds and how they helped the Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ).

title: Aisha Remembers a Battle
content: Aisha said that the day of Bu'ath was a good thing for the Prophet. It happened when he arrived in Medina, and two tribes were fighting each other. Many leaders from these tribes had been hurt or killed. Allah brought about this battle so that the people of Medina could become Muslims.

title: Ansar Complain about Booty
content: On the day of Mecca's conquest, some Ansar said it was unfair that Quraish got a share of the loot when their swords were still wet with Quraish blood. The Prophet (ﷺ) called them and asked if this was true. They said yes. He explained that people would take the booty home, but he would stay with his Ansar friends. If they chose a route through a valley or mountain pass, he would follow.

title: The Prophet's Love for Ansar
content: The Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) said: 'If the people from Medina helped me by guiding me through a valley or mountain, I would choose their path. But if it wasn't for them helping me when I migrated to Medina, I would have been one of them.' Abu Huraira, who loved and respected the Prophet, agreed with him.

title: Allah's Messenger Helps a Friend
content: When the emigrants arrived in Medina, Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) created a friendship between Abdur-Rahman and Sa'd bin Ar-Rabi. Sa'd said to Abdur-Rahman, 'I'm rich among my people, so I want to share my wealth with you.' He also had two wives and suggested that Abdur-Rahman choose one of them to marry after she divorced him. Abdur-Rahman preferred not to do this. Instead, he went to the market and made some money by selling goods. The Prophet (ﷺ) asked him about a strong smell on his clothes and Abdur-Rahman said he had gotten married. When the Prophet asked how much Mahr (a gift given at marriage) he gave his wife, Abdur-Rahman replied that it was either a small amount of gold or its weight in value.

title: Abdur-Rahman's Marriage
content: Abdur-Rahman bin Auf met Allah's Messenger (ﷺ). He made a friendship between Abdur-Rahman and Sa'd, a rich man with two wives. Sa'd offered to share his wealth or let Abdur-Rahman choose one of the wives after a divorce. Abdur-Rahman went to market but came back with some goods instead. A few days later, he met Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) smelling like perfume. The Prophet (ﷺ) asked what it was and Abdur-Rahman said he got married to an Ansari woman. The Prophet (ﷺ) asked how much money he gave her as a gift and Abdur-Rahman said a small amount of gold or one gold coin. The Prophet (ﷺ) told him to have a simple wedding feast, even with just a sheep.

title: Prophet's Decision on Date Palms
content: Some people from Medina asked the Prophet to divide their date-palm trees between them and some new immigrants. The Prophet (ﷺ) said no. They then suggested that the immigrants work in their gardens and share the dates with them. The immigrants agreed to this plan.

title: Love for the Ansar
content: The Prophet (ﷺ) said: 'No one loves the people of Medina but a true believer. No one hates them but a hypocrite. Allah will love those who love the Ansar, and He will hate those who hate them.'

title: Love for the Ansar
content: The Prophet (ﷺ) said: 'Showing love to the Ansar is a sign of having faith. Hating them shows you are hypocritical.'

title: Prophet's Love for Ansar
content: The Prophet (ﷺ) saw women and children from the Ansar tribe coming forward. He stood up and said three times: 'By Allah, you are very dear to me.'

title: Ansari Woman Meets the Prophet
content: An Ansari woman came with her son to see Allah's Messenger (ﷺ). He spoke to her and said twice, 'You are very special people to me'.

title: Prophet's Prayer for the Ansar
content: Zaid bin Al-Arqam said: The Ansar asked the Prophet to pray that Allah would consider their followers as part of them. So, he prayed accordingly.

title: Ansari Followers' Request
content: Some people from the Ansar asked the Prophet to make their followers like them. The Prophet (ﷺ) prayed to Allah saying, 'Make their followers like themselves'.

title: Best Ansar Families
content: The Prophet (ﷺ) said the best homes of the Ansar are those of Banu An-Najjar, then Banu Abdul Ash-hal, then Banu Al-Harith bin Al-Khazraj, and then Banu Sa'ida. But he also said there is good in all their families.

title: Best Ansar Families
content: The Prophet (ﷺ) said that the best families in Madinah are Banu An-Najjar, Bani Abdul Ash-hal, Banu Al-Harith and Banu Saida.

title: Best Ansar Families
content: The Prophet (ﷺ) said, 'The best families of the Ansar are from Banu An-Najjar, then Banu Abdul Ash-hal, then Banu Al-Harith, and then Banu Saida. All Ansar families have good in them.' Sa'd bin Ubada asked Abu Usaid, 'Why did the Prophet put our family last?' The Prophet (ﷺ) replied, 'Being among the best is enough for you.'

title: Patience is a Virtue
content: A man from the Ansar asked the Prophet if he could be appointed to a position. The Prophet (ﷺ) said that others would be given preference, but he should be patient and meet him at Lake Kauthar on the Day of Resurrection.

title: Be Patient with Changes
content: The Prophet (ﷺ) told the Ansar: 'After I'm gone, others will be given more importance than you. Be patient and wait for me at our meeting place, which is the Lake of Kauthar.'

title: Ansar and Muhajirun Share
content: The Prophet (ﷺ) called the Ansar to give them land in Bahrain. They said no unless their brothers, who had migrated from Mecca, got a similar share. The Prophet (ﷺ) said if they didn't agree, be patient until you meet me, because after I'm gone, others will get preference over you.

title: The Life of the Hereafter
content: The Prophet (ﷺ) said: 'There is no life except in the next world. O Allah, help the Ansar and Muhajirun. Forgive the Ansar.'

title: Ansar's Pledge to Fight
content: During a battle called the Battle of the Trench, some people from Medina said, 'We promised Muhammad (ﷺ) we would fight for Islam as long as we live.' The Prophet (ﷺ) replied, 'O Allah, there is no life except the life after death. Please honor these people who have given their pledge and those who migrated to Medina with me.'

title: The Prophet's Prayer at Trench
content: The Prophet (ﷺ) came to us while we were digging a trench and carrying dirt on our backs. He said, 'God, there is no life except the life after death. Forgive the Emigrants and the Ansar.'

title: Guest of the Prophet
content: A man came to the Prophet. The Prophet (ﷺ) sent a message to his wives asking them for food, but they said they had nothing. Then the Prophet asked who would take care of this guest. An Ansari man offered to host him. He took the man home and told his wife to be generous with the Prophet's guest. She said she only had her children's meals left. The husband told her to prepare a meal, light a lamp, and let the children sleep early. She did as instructed but secretly went hungry instead of eating. In the morning, the Ansari man came back to the Prophet, who said that Allah was pleased with their kindness.

title: The Prophet's Kindness to Ansar
content: Abu Bakr and Al-'Abbas saw some people from the Ansar group crying. They asked why they were crying, and the Ansar said it was because they missed the time when the Prophet was with them. Abu Bakr told the Prophet about this, so he came out to talk to the Ansar. He stood on a platform and praised Allah. Then he said: 'Take care of the Ansar because they are my close friends who I trusted with secrets. They have done what they were supposed to do, but there's still more for them. Be kind to those who did good among them, and forgive those who made mistakes.'

title: Prophet's Advice to Rulers
content: When Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) was ill, he came out and sat on the pulpit. He praised Allah and said: 'People will increase in number, but the Ansar (a group of Muslims) will decrease. If you are a leader, be kind to good people and forgive those who made mistakes.'

title: Prophet's Trust in Ansar
content: The Prophet (ﷺ) said to Anas bin Malik: The Ansar are my close friends. I trust them with secrets. As time goes on, more people will come but the number of Ansar will decrease. So, appreciate the good ones among them and forgive those who make mistakes.

title: Softness in Paradise
content: Some of the Prophet's companions were admiring a soft silken cloth given to him as a gift. The Prophet (ﷺ) said, 'You like its softness? In Paradise, Sa'd bin Mu'adh has handkerchiefs that are even softer.'

title: Prophet's Reaction to Sad's Death
content: Jabir said the Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) said: The Throne of Allah shook when Sa'd bin Mu'adh died. Jabir also said he heard the Prophet say: The Throne of the Merciful God shook because of Sa'd bin Mu'adh's death.

title: Sa'd bin Mu'adh Makes a Decision
content: Abu Sa'id Al-Khudri said: Some people agreed to accept the decision of Sa'd bin Mu'adh. The Prophet (ﷺ) sent for him and said, 'Get up, Sa'd.' He came on his donkey and the Prophet said, 'These people have agreed to follow your decision.' Sa'd decided that the men should be killed and their women and children taken as prisoners. The Prophet (ﷺ) said, 'Your decision is like Allah's decision'.

title: Two Men Walk with Light
content: Anas said that two men left the Prophet on a very dark night. A light appeared in front of them. When they separated, the light went with each of them.

title: Learn Quran from Four
content: I heard the Prophet say to learn how to recite the Quran from four people: Ibn Mas'ud, Salim who was a slave freed by Abu Hudhaifa, Ubai and Mu'adh bin Jabal.

title: Allah's Messenger Praises Ansar Homes
content: Abu Usaid said that the Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) said: 'The best homes in Madinah are those of Bani An-Najjar, then Bani Abdul Ash-hal, then Bani Al-Harith bin Al-Khazraj, and then Bani Saida. But all Ansar homes have goodness.' Sa'd bin Ubada was surprised because the Prophet gave preference to some over others.

title: Learn from Abdullah
content: Abdullah bin Amr said that he still loves Abdullah bin Masud. He heard the Prophet say to learn Quran recitation from four people: Salim, Muadh bin Jabal, Ubai bin Kaab, and Abdullah bin Masud.

title: Prophet's Message to Ubi
content: The Prophet (ﷺ) told Ubai that Allah wanted him to recite a verse from the Quran. The verse was about people who don't believe in God. When Ubai heard his name mentioned, he started crying.

title: Four Companions Collected the Quran
content: Anas said that four men from the Ansar tribe collected the Quran in the lifetime of the Prophet. They were Ubai, Mu'adh bin Jabal, Abu Zaid, and Zaid bin Thabit. I asked Anas who Abu Zaid was, and he replied that he was one of his uncles.

title: Abu Talha Protects the Prophet
content: On the day of the Battle of Uhud, many people ran away. But Abu Talha stayed with the Prophet and protected him with his shield. He was a strong archer who broke two or three arrow bows that day. When someone passed by with arrows, the Prophet would say, 'Give them to Abu Talha.' The Prophet (ﷺ) sometimes looked at the enemy, but Abu Talha warned him not to do that because it made him an easy target. I saw Aisha and Um Sulaim helping people by carrying water skins on their arms and pouring water into their mouths. Meanwhile, Abu Talha's sword fell from his hand twice.

title: Abdullah bin Salam's Good Character
content: Sa'd bin Abi Waqqas said he never heard the Prophet say that anyone who walks on earth will go to Paradise, except for Abdullah bin Salam. The Quran was revealed to confirm that Abdullah bin Salam is a true believer.

title: A Man's Encounter with Islam
content: One day in the Mosque of Medina, a man named Abdullah bin Salam came in looking serious. People said he was one of the people of Paradise. He prayed two short prayers and left. I followed him and asked why people thought that. He said it wasn't right to say something you don't know for sure. He told me about a dream he had when he was alive, where he saw a beautiful garden with an iron pillar in the middle. The pillar went from the ground up into the sky, and there was a handle at the top. In his dream, someone helped him climb the pillar and hold onto the handle. When he woke up, he still felt the handle in his hand. He told this to the Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ), who said the garden was like Islam, and the handle was a promise of God's help. The Prophet (ﷺ) said Abdullah would stay Muslim until he died.

title: Abdullah bin Salam's Advice
content: When I arrived in Medina, I met Abdullah bin Salam. He invited me to his home for food and said: 'You're welcome to enter the Prophet's house.' He also warned me about a common problem here - people often take interest on loans. If someone owes you money and sends you something like chopped straw or barley instead of paying back, don't accept it.

title: Best Women in Islam
content: Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) said that the best women of his time were Mary and Khadija. He was saying this about them when they were alive.

title: Aisha's Story About Khadija
content: I, Aisha, never felt jealous of the Prophet's other wives as much as I did of Khadija. She died before he married me. But I often heard him talking about her and how Allah told him she would have a special palace in Paradise. When he sacrificed a sheep, he would give some meat to her friends.

title: Aisha's Story About Khadija
content: I, Aisha, never felt jealous of any woman as much as I did of Khadija. The Prophet (ﷺ) often talked about her. He married me three years after she passed away. His Lord told him that Khadija will have a special palace in Paradise called Qasab.

title: Aisha's Feelings About Khadija
content: I never felt jealous of the Prophet's other wives as much as I did of Khadija, even though I had never met her. The Prophet (ﷺ) often talked about her and when he slaughtered a sheep, he would send food to his friends who were like family to Khadija. Sometimes I said to him, 'You treat Khadija so well, it's as if there's no other woman in the world.' He replied, 'Khadija was special because she gave me children'.

title: Prophet's Promise to Khadija
content: I asked Abdullah bin Abi Aufa if the Prophet gave good news to his wife Khadija. He said yes, of a palace in Paradise called Qasab. It will have no noise and no tiredness.

title: Gabriel's Message to the Prophet
content: Abu Huraira said that Gabriel came to the Prophet. Gabriel said, 'Tell Khadija that Allah and I send our greetings.' He also told the Prophet to tell Khadija that she will have a special palace in Paradise with no noise or trouble.

title: Remembering Khadija
content: 'Aisha: Hala asked to enter the Prophet's room. He remembered how Khadija used to ask permission, and it made him sad. He said 'O Allah, let in Hala!' I felt jealous and said, 'Why remember an old woman like Khadija? She died a long time ago. Allah has given you someone better.'

title: Prophet Muhammad's Kindness
content: Jarir bin Abdullah said: Since I became Muslim, the Prophet never refused to see me. When he saw me, he would smile. He asked me to destroy a house called Dhul-Khalasa with 150 horsemen from the Ahmas tribe. We destroyed it and killed anyone we found there. Then we told the Prophet what happened. He blessed us and our tribe.

title: Satan's Deception at Uhud
content: After the pagans were defeated at the Battle of Uhud, Satan shouted to the Muslims. He told them to be careful about those behind them. The front row started fighting with the back row. Hudhaifa saw his father being attacked and shouted for help. Unfortunately, his father was killed. Hudhaifa said 'May Allah forgive you' and because of this, his father remained in a good state until he died.

title: Hind's Visit to the Prophet
content: 'Aishah said that Hind bint 'Utba came to visit the Prophet. She said she used to think his family was the lowest on earth, but now they were the highest in honor. The Prophet (ﷺ) agreed with her. Hind asked if it was wrong for her to take food from her husband Abu Sufyan's property to feed their children. The Prophet (ﷺ) said no, as long as she takes only what is fair and reasonable.

title: Zaid bin 'Amr meets the Prophet
content: The Prophet (ﷺ) met Zaid bin 'Amr in a valley. A meal was offered to the Prophet, but he refused it. It was then given to Zaid, who said, 'I only eat animals that are slaughtered with Allah's name.' Zaid used to criticize how Quraish people killed their animals, saying they should do it with Allah's name.

title: Zaid's Search for Truth
content: Zaid bin 'Amr bin Nufail went to a place called Sham. He wanted to know about the true religion to follow. He met a Jewish scholar and asked him about their religion. The Jew said, 'You can't join our religion unless you accept Allah's Anger.' Zaid replied, 'I don't want to be angry with Allah. Can you tell me of another religion?'
