title: Prophet Muhammad's Journey to Mecca
content: The Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) left Medina with 10,000 Muslim warriors in the month of Ramadan. It was eight and a half years after he moved to Medina. He and his companions were fasting, but when they reached Al-Kadid, a place near water between Usfan and Qudaid, he broke his fast. His companions also stopped fasting.

title: Prophet Muhammad's Fasting Example
content: The Prophet (ﷺ) went to Hunain in Ramadan. Some people were fasting and some weren't. The Prophet (ﷺ) got milk or water for his camel, then the others who weren't fasting told those who were to break their fast.

title: Traveling in Ramadan
content: Ibn `Abbas said that the Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) traveled during the month of Ramadan. He sometimes fasted and sometimes didn't, depending on his journey. When he reached a place called 'Usfan', he broke his fast by drinking water during the day so people could see him. This was to show that fasting is not always necessary when traveling.

title: Abu Sufyan Meets the Prophet
content: When Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) went to conquer Mecca, Abu Sufyan and some others came out to gather information. They saw many fires in a place called Marr-az-Zahran. The guards of Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) caught them and brought them back. Abu Sufyan became Muslim. When the Prophet was about to enter Mecca, he told Al-Abbas to keep Abu Sufyan standing on a mountain so he could see the Muslims passing by in groups. A group passed, and Abu Sufyan asked who they were. Al-Abbas said it was one tribe or another. Then came a big group that Abu Sufyan had never seen before. He asked again, and Al-Abbas said it was the Ansar led by Sa'd bin Ubada. The Prophet (ﷺ) then passed by with his companions, including Az-Zubair carrying the flag. When the Prophet met Abu Sufyan, he asked what Sa'd had said. Abu Sufyan told him that Sa'd said today would be a great battle and some rules in the Ka'ba would change. The Prophet (ﷺ) said Sa'd was wrong, but Allah would give the Ka'ba importance that day. He ordered his flag to be fixed at Al-Hajun. Meanwhile, Khalid bin Al-Walid entered Mecca from one side, while the Prophet entered from another. Two men were killed in this battle.

title: Reciting the Quran in Mecca
content: Abdullah bin Mughaffal saw the Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) over his camel on the day of the Conquest of Mecca. He was reciting a chapter from the Quran called Surat-al-Fath with a strong, shaking voice.

title: No Inheritance for Non-Muslims
content: Usama bin Zaid asked the Prophet where they would camp in Mecca. The Prophet (ﷺ) said he didn't know if Aqil had left any house for them to stay in. He then told Usama that a Muslim can't inherit from a non-Muslim and a non-Muslim can't inherit from a Muslim. Az-Zuhri was later asked who inherited Abu Talib's property, and he replied it went to Aqil and Talib.

title: No Inheritance for Non-Muslims
content: Usama bin Zaid asked the Prophet where they would camp next. The Prophet (ﷺ) said he didn't know if Aqil had left them a house to stay in. He then explained that no Muslim can inherit from a non-Muslim, and no non-Muslim can inherit from a Muslim. Az-Zuhri was later asked who inherited Abu Talib's property after his death. He replied that it went to Aqil and Talib.

title: Victory and Our Camp
content: Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) said: 'If we win a battle, our camp will be at Al-Khaif. This is where the non-Muslims made an agreement to not help the Prophet's family.'

title: Allah's Messenger's Plan
content: When the Prophet was planning to go on a trip to Hunain, he said that if Allah wanted, they would camp at Khaif Bani Kinana. This is where some people had made an agreement to follow their old ways.

title: Prophet Enters Mecca
content: When the Prophet entered Mecca during the Conquest, he was wearing a helmet. A man told him that Ibn Khatal was hiding behind the curtain of the Kaaba. The Prophet (ﷺ) ordered someone to kill Ibn Khatal.

title: Prophet Destroys Idols in Mecca
content: When the Prophet entered Mecca on the day of the Conquest, he saw 360 idols around the Kaaba. He started hitting them with a stick and said, 'The truth has come, and lies will not return'.

title: Removing Idols from the Ka'ba
content: When Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) arrived in Mecca, he refused to enter the Ka'ba because there were idols inside. He ordered them to be removed. The pictures of Abraham and Ishmael holding arrows for divination were taken out too. The Prophet (ﷺ) said that those who left these pictures knew they didn't use such arrows. Then the Prophet entered the Ka'ba, said 'Allahu Akbar' in all directions, and came out without praying inside.

title: Prophet Muhammad's Visit to Ka'bah
content: Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) rode his camel into Makkah with Usama bin Zaid behind him. Bilal and Uthman bin Talha were also with them. When they stopped in the Mosque, Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) asked Uthman for the key of the Ka'bah. He entered the Ka'bah with his companions and stayed inside for a while before coming out. Many people rushed to enter, but Abdullah bin Umar was first to go in. He found Bilal waiting by the door and asked where the Prophet had prayed. Bilal showed him the spot.

title: Prophet enters Mecca
content: During the year of the Conquest, the Prophet entered Mecca from a place called Kada, which is located at the top part of the city.

title: Entering Mecca after Conquest
content: During the year of the conquest of Mecca, the Prophet entered the city through its upper part, using a gate called Kada.

title: Prophet's Morning Prayer
content: Um Hani said the Prophet took a bath in her house after conquering Mecca. He then prayed an eight-rak'at prayer. Um Hani mentioned that she had never seen him pray such a light prayer, but he still performed perfect bowing and prostrations.

title: Prophet's Prayer in Worship
content: The Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) used to say these words when he bowed and prostrated: 'Glorified be You, O Allah, our Lord! All the praises are for You. O Allah, forgive me.'

title: Umar and Ibn Abbas Discuss a Verse
content: `Umar would often invite me to his house along with other old men who fought in the Badr battle. One day, they complained that I was too young to be there. `Umar said, 'You know what kind of person he is.' He then asked them about a verse from the Quran: 'When Allah helps and Mecca falls, people will enter Islam in crowds. So praise your Lord and ask for His forgiveness.' Some of them replied that they should praise Allah and repent if they were helped. Others said they didn't know what to say. `Umar then asked me about it. I said the verse was actually a sign that the Prophet's death was near, because Mecca had just been conquered. So we should testify to Allah's uniqueness, praise Him, and ask for forgiveness. `Umar agreed with my understanding.

title: Mecca's Sanctity Explained
content: Abu Shuraih said that `Amr bin Sa'id was sending troops to Mecca. Abu Shuraih told him a statement the Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) made after conquering Mecca. The Prophet (ﷺ) praised Allah and said: 'Mecca is a sanctuary chosen by Allah, not by people. It's not allowed for anyone who believes in Allah to hurt someone or cut down trees there. If someone asks to fight in Mecca because the Prophet was allowed to, say no, it's only allowed for a short time and that's over now.' Abu Shuraih said `Amr replied: 'I know this already. Mecca doesn't give protection to sinners, murderers, or people who cause harm and then run away.'

title: Selling Wine is Forbidden
content: Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) said in Mecca after the Conquest: 'Allah and His Prophet have made it forbidden to sell wine'.

title: Prophet's Shortened Prayers
content: Anas said: We stayed with the Prophet for ten days in Mecca. During this time, we shortened our prayers because we were traveling.

title: Prophet's Stay in Mecca
content: The Prophet (ﷺ) stayed in Mecca for 19 days. During this time, he prayed two units of prayer in each prayer session.

title: Shortened Prayers on Journey
content: Ibn Abbas said they stayed with the Prophet for 19 days during a journey. They offered shortened prayers during this time. If they stayed longer than 19 days, they would offer complete prayers.

title: Abu Jamila's Story
content: Abu Jamila said he lived during the time of the Prophet. He traveled with the Prophet to Mecca in a year when the city was conquered by Muslims.

title: Amr bin Salama's Story
content: I was at a place where many people passed by. They would tell me about Muhammad (ﷺ), saying he claims Allah sent him as a prophet and that he has received messages from Allah. I memorized these messages and felt like they were important. Many Arabs didn't accept Islam until after the conquest of Mecca. When my father returned from meeting Muhammad (ﷺ), he said he had come to our tribe for sure. The Prophet (ﷺ) told us when it's time for prayer, one person should call out to others and another person with good knowledge of the Quran should lead the prayer. They chose me because I knew more Quran than anyone else. At that time, I was a young boy wearing a small shirt. A woman from our tribe said they should cover my backside while I led the prayer. So, they bought some cloth and made me a new shirt. I had never been happier with anything before.

title: The Son of Zam'a's Slave
content: `Utba bin Abi Waqqas told his brother Sa`d to take care of a boy. He said the boy was his son. When the Prophet arrived in Mecca, Sa`d took the boy and another man named `Abd bin Zam`a with him. Sa`d said the boy's father had told him he was his son. `Abd bin Zam`a said the boy was his brother, born to their slave-girl. The Prophet (ﷺ) looked at the boy and saw that he looked like `Utba bin Abi Waqqas. He said the boy belonged to `Abd bin Zam`a because he was born on his father's bed. The Prophet (ﷺ) also told his wife Sauda to cover herself when she saw the boy, because of their resemblance. The Prophet (ﷺ) reminded everyone that a child belongs to the owner of the bed where they were conceived, and an adulterer should be stoned.

title: Fairness in Punishment
content: During the Conquest of Mecca, a woman stole. Her family asked Usama to ask the Prophet for mercy. The Prophet (ﷺ) was upset and said he wouldn't show favoritism in punishment. He explained that earlier nations were destroyed because they didn't treat rich and poor equally. If even his own daughter Fatima had stolen, he would have cut off her hand. The woman's punishment was carried out, but later she repented and got married.

title: Pledge of Allegiance after Conquest
content: Mujashi took his brother to the Prophet. He said, 'I want you to take a pledge from him to migrate.' The Prophet (ﷺ) replied, 'Migration is no longer needed.' Mujashi asked, 'What will you take his pledge for?' The Prophet (ﷺ) said, 'For Islam, believing in Allah, and fighting for His cause'.

title: Pledge of Allegiance
content: Mujashi took his brother to the Prophet after Mecca was conquered. He asked the Prophet to take a pledge from his brother for migration, but the Prophet said that those who had already migrated didn't need to anymore. Mujashi then asked what kind of pledge the Prophet would accept instead. The Prophet (ﷺ) replied that he would accept a pledge for Islam, believing in Allah, and fighting for His cause.

title: Abu Mabad's Pledge to Islam
content: Mujashi took Abu Mabad to meet the Prophet. The Prophet (ﷺ) said he couldn't migrate, but could pledge to be a Muslim and fight for Islam.

title: Abu Mabad's Pledge of Allegiance
content: Mujashi took Abu Mabad to meet the Prophet. The Prophet (ﷺ) said, 'Migration is no longer an option for you, but I can take your pledge to follow Islam and fight for it'.

title: Migration is Jihad
content: Mujahid asked Ibn Umar about migrating to Sham. Ibn Umar said, 'There's no migration now. Instead, join the fight for Allah and if you find a chance, stay there. Otherwise, come back.'

title: No Migration After Conquest
content: Abdullah bin Umar said: 'There is no migration after Mecca has been conquered.'

title: Migration and Worship
content: `Ubaid bin `Umar visited Aisha and asked her about the migration. She said that there is no need to migrate today because Islam has won. Believers can now worship Allah anywhere they want. However, there are still battles to fight for Allah's cause and good intentions.

title: Mecca's Protection Announced
content: After conquering Mecca, the Prophet said that Allah had made it a protected place since He created the world. It will stay this way until Judgment Day. No one was allowed to fight in Mecca before him or after him, except for a short time. People should not hunt animals there, cut down trees, or pick up lost things without announcing it loudly. Al-Abbas asked if they could still use Idhkhir grass for blacksmiths and homes. The Prophet (ﷺ) agreed.

title: Ibn Abi Aufa's Battle Scar
content: Isma'il saw a scar on Ibn Abi Aufa's hand. Ibn Abi Aufa said it was from the battle of Hunain, where he fought alongside the Prophet. Isma'il asked if he had been in other battles before that. Ibn Abi Aufa replied yes.

title: Al-Bara' Defends the Prophet
content: Abu 'Umara asked Al-Bara', 'Did you run away on the day of Hunain?' Al-Bara' said, 'No, the Prophet didn't run. Some people were in a hurry and Hawazin's archers shot arrows at them. At that time, Abu Sufyan was holding the Prophet's white mule by its head. The Prophet (ﷺ) said,

title: Al-Bara' on Hunain Battle
content: I was asked if I fled with the Prophet during the battle of Hunain. Al-Bara' said, 'The Prophet (ﷺ) did not run away. The enemy were good archers and he kept saying,

title: Al-Bara' on the Battle of Hunain
content: A man from Qais asked Al-Bara', 'Did you leave Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) behind during the battle?' Al-Bara' replied, 'No, he didn't flee. The people of Hawazin were good archers and ran away when we attacked them. We rushed after them but got hit by their arrows. I saw the Prophet riding his white mule with Abu Sufyan holding its reins. He said,

title: Returning Captives to Hawazin Tribe
content: Some people from the Hawazin tribe came to the Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ). They said they wanted to be Muslims and asked for their captured property back. The Prophet (ﷺ) stood up and said, 'There are two options: we can return your captives or give you back your property.' He had been waiting for them for ten nights after returning from a battle in Ta'if. The Hawazin people chose to have their captives returned. The Prophet (ﷺ) then asked the Muslims if they wanted to do the same as a favor, or wait until he gave them some of the captured wealth that Allah would give him later. The Muslims said they were happy to return the captives willingly. The Prophet (ﷺ) told them to go back and ask their leaders for permission, which they did. In the end, all the Hawazin people agreed to let their captives go.

title: Returning Captives to Hawazin Tribe
content: Some people from the Hawazin tribe came to the Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ). They had become Muslims and asked for their property and family members back. The Prophet (ﷺ) said, 'I have some of my companions here with me. I want you to choose between getting your property or your family members back.' He explained that he hadn't distributed the captured goods yet. The Hawazin tribe chose to get their family members back. The Prophet (ﷺ) then asked his companions if they were willing to give up their shares and return the captives as a favor. His companions agreed, so the Prophet returned the captives to their people.

title: Umar's Vow
content: When we came back from the battle of Hunain, Umar asked the Prophet about a promise he made before Islam. He had promised to stay in the mosque for prayer. The Prophet (ﷺ) told him to keep his promise.

title: Killing an Enemy in Battle
content: We were on a journey with the Prophet. When we faced the enemy, many Muslims ran away. I saw one of our men being attacked by a pagan. I hit the pagan from behind and cut off his armor. The pagan was so strong that I thought I would die. But he eventually died and let me go. Later, I followed Umar and asked him what was wrong with the people. He said it was because of Allah's order. We went back to fight and won. The Prophet (ﷺ) then said that anyone who killed an enemy and had proof could keep their belongings. I stood up to ask for a witness, but the Prophet repeated his question three times. Finally, I got up again. The Prophet (ﷺ) asked me what was wrong. I told him my story. A man said he had the enemy's belongings and offered to give them to me. But Abu Bakr said no, the Prophet wouldn't take away a brave fighter's reward. The Prophet (ﷺ) agreed with Abu Bakr. The man gave me the belongings and I used them to buy a garden in the land of Banu Salama.

title: Abu Qatada's Brave Act
content: During the battle of Hunain, I saw a Muslim man fighting with an enemy. Another enemy was hiding behind him to kill him. I stopped the hidden enemy and cut off his hand. He grabbed me tightly but I managed to push him away and kill him. The other Muslims were running away, so I fled too. I met Umar bin Al-Khattab and asked what was happening. He said it was Allah's order. Later, we returned to the Prophet. He said that whoever had proof of killing an enemy would get their spoils. But I couldn't find anyone to witness my act. So I told the Prophet about it. A man from his companions said he had the arms of the dead enemy and offered them as evidence. Abu Bakr disagreed, saying the spoils should go to a strong fighter like me, not a weak Quraishite. The Prophet (ﷺ) then gave me the spoils, which I used to buy a garden.

title: Prophet's Prayer after Battle
content: After the battle of Hunain, Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) sent Abu Amir to Autas. He was shot in the knee by an arrow and I went to help him. The killer ran away, but I caught up with him and killed him. When Abu Amir died, I returned to the Prophet and told him what had happened. The Prophet (ﷺ) prayed for forgiveness for both Abu Amir and me.

title: Effeminate Men Should Not Enter
content: Um Salama said the Prophet came to her while an effeminate man was with her. He was talking to Abdullah bin Abi Umaiya about a woman in Ta'if, saying she is very beautiful and has a lot of flesh. The Prophet (ﷺ) then said that these men should never enter their homes.

title: Conquering Taif's Fort
content: Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) besieged the city of Taif but couldn't conquer it. He said they would return to Medina if Allah wanted them to. The Companions were upset and asked if they should leave without winning. The Prophet (ﷺ) told them to wait until tomorrow, then ordered them to fight. Many got hurt, so he said they would return again the next day if Allah allowed it. This made the Companions happy, and the Prophet smiled.

title: Claiming False Parentage
content: Two men, Sa'd and Abu Bakra, told me they heard the Prophet say: 'If someone claims to be the son of someone other than their real father, knowing it's not true, they will not enter Paradise.'

title: Claiming to be someone else's son
content: Two men, Sa'd and Abu Bakra, told me that the Prophet said: 'If a person knows they are not their father's child but says they are, they will not enter Paradise.'

title: Prophet's Good Tidings
content: Abu Musa was with the Prophet when a bedouin came and said he wanted something. The Prophet (ﷺ) said, 'Be happy.' But the bedouin complained that the Prophet often says this. So the Prophet got angry and told Abu Musa and Bilal to accept the good news instead. Then the Prophet washed his hands in a bowl of water, took a mouthful, and spat it back into the bowl. He said, 'Drink some of it and pour some over your faces and chests.' They did what he said. Meanwhile, Um Salama called from behind a screen to save some water for her mother.

title: Prophet's Advice on Ihram
content: Ya`la bin Umaiya asked the Prophet about a man who wore perfume and a cloak while in a state of Ihram for Umra. The Prophet (ﷺ) said, 'Wash off the perfume three times, take off your cloak, then do the same actions you would do during Hajj.'

title: Ansar's Patience and Gratitude
content: After the Battle of Hunain, Allah gave the Prophet a lot of war booty. He shared it with those who had recently become Muslim, but not with the Ansar. They felt unhappy because they didn't get as much as others did. The Prophet (ﷺ) then spoke to them, reminding them that he had guided them to Islam and made them rich. He asked why they couldn't thank him for his kindness. But they said Allah and His Messenger already owed them many favours. The Prophet (ﷺ) told them it was okay if they felt this way, but reminded them of the great blessings they had received. He even joked that if he wasn't their leader, he would have chosen to be one of them. He encouraged them to be patient and remember that Allah's favour is not limited to one group.

title: Ansar's Concern About Distribution
content: When Allah gave the Prophet some war booty from the Hawazin tribe, he started giving some people 100 camels each. The Ansar were unhappy because they thought the Prophet was being unfair by giving more to the Quraish than to them. They said their swords were still dripping with Quraish blood. The Prophet (ﷺ) found out about this and gathered all the Ansar in a tent. He asked them what they meant, and they explained that some younger people had spoken out of turn. The Prophet (ﷺ) explained that he was giving more to new Muslims so they would be happy and stay with him. He said it's better for them to have him as their guest than to take wealth. The Ansar agreed to be patient, but they didn't remain so.

title: Ansar and War Booty
content: When the Prophet distributed the war booty to the people of Quraish, the Ansar became upset. The Prophet (ﷺ) said, 'Wouldn't you be happy if others get the wealth and you have me with you?' They agreed. He then said, 'If a group takes a path through a valley or mountain pass, I will take the same route as you Ansar.'

title: Prophet's Kindness to Ansar
content: On a day when the Prophet was fighting against the Hawazin tribe with many other Muslims, he called out to his friends from Medina (the Ansar group). They replied that they were ready to follow him. The Prophet (ﷺ) then got down from his mule and said, 'I am Allah's servant and His messenger.' After winning the battle, the Prophet gave some of the captured animals to the new Muslim converts and those who had recently moved from Mecca (the Muhajirin group). However, he didn't give any to the Ansar. They were unhappy about this, so the Prophet called them over and said, 'Wouldn't you be happy if others took some of the animals and you got to keep me with you?' He also promised that if they had to travel through a difficult path, he would choose a similar route for himself.

title: Helping Quraish People
content: The Prophet (ﷺ) gathered some Ansar people and said, 'Quraish still behave like they did before Islam. They've suffered a lot. I want to help them and make friends with them.' He asked if they'd be happy if the Quraish got wealth and he went home with them. They agreed. The Prophet (ﷺ) then said, 'If one group goes through a valley and another through a mountain pass, I'll choose the Ansar's path'.

title: Prophet's Reaction to Criticism
content: Abdullah told the Prophet that a man from the Ansar said he didn't think the Prophet was being fair with the war booty. Abdullah went to the Prophet and shared this, and the Prophet's face changed color. He said, 'May Allah be kind to Moses because he faced even harder situations, but he stayed patient.'

title: Prophet's Distribution of Booty
content: At the Battle of Hunain, the Prophet gave some people more than others from the captured goods. He gave Al-Aqra' and Uyaina each one hundred camels, and other Quraish members also received gifts. A man said this was not done for Allah's Pleasure. I told the Prophet about it. The Prophet (ﷺ) then said that Moses was troubled even more but remained patient.

title: Prophet Muhammad at Hunain
content: On the day of the battle of Hunain, many tribes came to fight against the Prophet. He had 10,000 men with him, but some companions fled. The Prophet (ﷺ) called out twice for help from the Ansar group. They answered both times, saying they were there for him. The Prophet (ﷺ) was riding a white mule and then got off. He said he was Allah's Slave and His Messenger. The infidels were defeated, and the Prophet took a lot of booty. However, he gave it all to the Muhajirin and Tulaqa, not to the Ansar. The Ansar complained that they were always called upon in difficult times but never got any share of the loot. The Prophet (ﷺ) heard this and gathered them in a tent. He asked why they were unhappy about not getting any booty. They said they were happy because they got to keep him as their guest. The Prophet (ﷺ) said if he had to choose, he would take the Ansar's path.

title: Prophet's Gift to Soldiers
content: The Prophet (ﷺ) sent a group of soldiers to Najd. I was with them. We got 12 camels each from the spoils, and an extra camel as well. So we returned home with 13 camels each.

title: Khalid's Decision to Kill Captives
content: Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) sent Khalid bin Al-Walid to the tribe of Jadhima. Khalid invited them to become Muslims, but they didn't say 'we have accepted Islam'. Instead, they said 'we've changed our religion.' Khalid kept killing some and taking others as prisoners. He gave each Muslim soldier a prisoner. When this happened, Khalid told everyone to kill their prisoners. But I, Salim's father, refused to do so, along with my companions. We told Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) what had happened. In response, he raised his hands and said twice, 'I am free from what Khalid has done.'

title: Obedience to a Good Order
content: The Prophet (ﷺ) sent a group of soldiers under the command of an Ansari leader. The commander got angry and ordered them to collect firewood and make a fire. But when they were about to enter it, they remembered the Prophet's teaching: 'Obey someone only if they give good orders.' They refused to go in and instead ran to the Prophet for help. When he heard what happened, he said that if they had entered the fire, they would have stayed there until the Day of Resurrection. He reminded them that obedience is required only when it involves doing something good.

title: Muadh and Abu Musa in Yemen
content: The Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) sent two friends, Muadh and Abu Musa, to help people in a place called Yemen. He told them to be kind and gentle with the people, and not make things difficult for them. When they were working, they would visit each other and say hello. One day, Muadh saw his friend Abu Musa sitting with some people around him. A man was tied up behind his neck. Muadh asked what was happening. His friend said the man had left Islam. Muadh said he wouldn't get off his mule until the man was punished. His friend agreed and ordered someone to kill the man. After that, Muadh got off his mule and talked to Abu Musa about how they recited the Quran.

title: Muadh and Abu Musa in Yemen
content: The Prophet (ﷺ) sent Muadh and Abu Musa to Yemen. He told them to be kind to the people, give good news, and not make things difficult. When Muadh visited his friend Abu Musa's province, he saw a man tied up. Muadh asked what was happening. Abu Musa said the man had left Islam. Muadh refused to get off his mule until the man was killed. Abu Musa agreed with this. The man was killed, then Muadh got off and asked Abu Musa about how he read the Quran.

title: Prohibition of Intoxicating Drinks
content: Abu Musa Al-Ash'ari was sent by the Prophet to Yemen. He asked about two drinks made there: one from honey and one from barley. The Prophet (ﷺ) said, 'These are all intoxicants and are forbidden'.

title: Prophet's Advice to Envoys
content: The Prophet (ﷺ) sent Abu Musa and Mu'adh on a mission. He told them to be kind, don't make things difficult for people, and give them good news. He also said they should obey each other. When they arrived in Yemen, Abu Musa asked the Prophet about two drinks made from barley and honey. The Prophet (ﷺ) replied that all intoxicants are forbidden. Mu'adh asked Abu Musa how he recited the Quran, and Abu Musa said he did it while standing, sitting, or riding a horse. Mu'adh preferred to sleep during the day and then pray at night, hoping for reward from Allah. One day, Mu'adh visited Abu Musa and saw a man chained up. He asked who the man was, and Abu Musa explained that he had turned back to being Jewish after becoming Muslim. Mu'adh said he would cut off his head.

title: Be Kind and Follow Orders
content: The Prophet (ﷺ) sent Abu Musa and Muadh to Yemen. He told them to be kind and make things easy for people, not hard. They should give good news and not push people away. The two men were to work together and follow each other's orders. Abu Musa asked the Prophet about a drink made from barley called Al-Mizr and one made from honey called Al-Bit. The Prophet (ﷺ) said all intoxicants are forbidden. Muadh asked Abu Musa how he recited the Quran, and Abu Musa said he did it while standing, sitting or riding. Muadh said he slept and then prayed at night, hoping for a reward from Allah. They visited each other in their tents. One day, Muadh saw a man chained to a post. He asked Abu Musa who the man was. Abu Musa said the man had turned away from Islam after becoming Muslim. Muadh said he would cut off the man's head.

title: Abu Musa's Hajj Journey
content: Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) sent Abu Musa to his people. When Abu Musa arrived, the Prophet was camping at Al-Abtah. The Prophet (ﷺ) asked if Abu Musa had made the intention to perform Hajj. Abu Musa said yes. The Prophet (ﷺ) asked what he meant by 'Labbaik'. Abu Musa explained that he expressed the same intention as the Prophet. The Prophet (ﷺ) asked if Abu Musa brought a Hadi (animal for sacrifice). Abu Musa said no. The Prophet (ﷺ) told him to do three things: walk around the Kaaba, run between Safa and Marwa, and end his state of Ihram. Abu Musa did what the Prophet said.

title: Invite People to Islam
content: Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) sent Mu`adh bin Jabal to Yemen. He said: 'When you meet the people of Scripture, tell them to believe in one God and that Muhammad (ﷺ) is His messenger. If they agree, ask them to pray five times a day. If they do this, ask them to give some money from their rich friends to help those who are poor. But be careful not to take too much from them. Remember, an oppressed person's prayer can reach Allah directly.'

title: Mu`adh Leads Fajr Prayer
content: When Mu`adh arrived in Yemen, he led the people in a morning prayer. He read from the Quran: 'Allah chose Abraham as a close friend.' A man in the crowd said, 'How happy his mother must be!'

title: Khalid's Companions in Yemen
content: Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) sent Khalid to Yemen with some companions. Later, he replaced Khalid with Ali bin Abi Talib. The Prophet (ﷺ) told Ali to let Khalid's friends decide: stay with him or go back to Medina. I chose to stay with Ali and got some gold from the war.

title: Ali and the Booty
content: The Prophet (ﷺ) sent Ali to Khalid to bring some of the captured wealth. I didn't like Ali because he had taken a bath after being with one of his slaves, who was part of the captured wealth. When we got back to the Prophet, I told him about it. He asked if I hated Ali and I said yes. The Prophet (ﷺ) replied that Ali deserved more from the captured wealth.

title: Ali's Gift to the Prophet
content: Ali sent a piece of gold to the Prophet. He divided it among four men: Uyaina, Aqra, Zaid, and Alqama or Amir. One companion said they deserved the gift more. The Prophet (ﷺ) asked if he wasn't trustworthy, receiving messages from Allah both morning and evening. A man with sunken eyes stood up and scolded the Prophet, saying 'Be afraid of Allah.' The Prophet (ﷺ) replied that he was most entitled to fear Allah. Khalid bin Al-Walid offered to kill the man but the Prophet refused, saying no one would be punished for their thoughts or prayers. He said some of this man's descendants would memorize the Quran beautifully but it wouldn't change them. They'd leave Islam like an arrow goes through a target.

title: Prophet's Advice to Ali
content: 'Ali had assumed the state of Ihram. The Prophet (ﷺ) asked him why he did that. 'Ali said it was with the same intention as the Prophet. The Prophet (ﷺ) told him to keep his current state and offer a sacrifice.

title: Ihram for Umra and Hajj
content: The Prophet (ﷺ) went to Mecca with his friends. He said that people who didn't have a special animal should only be in Ihram for Umra, not both Umra and Hajj. The Prophet (ﷺ) had a special animal with him. A man named Ali came from Yemen to do Hajj. The Prophet (ﷺ) asked him why he was in Ihram. Ali said he did it like the Prophet did. The Prophet (ﷺ) told Ali to stay in Ihram because they already had a Hadi.

title: Assuming Ihram for Umra and Hajj
content: Ibn Umar said: The Prophet (ﷺ) went to Mecca with the intention of performing both Umra and Hajj. We also went with him, intending to perform Hajj. When we arrived in Mecca, the Prophet told us that if someone didn't have a sacrifice (Hadi) with them, they should only be in Ihram for Umra. The Prophet (ﷺ) had brought a Hadi with him. Meanwhile, Ali bin Abi Talib came from Yemen and said he was there to perform Hajj. The Prophet (ﷺ) asked him why he was in Ihram when his wife was still at home. Ali replied that he was following the Prophet's example. The Prophet (ﷺ) told Ali to stay in Ihram because they already had a Hadi.

title: Dhu-l-Khalasa Destroyed
content: Jarir was asked by the Prophet to destroy a house called Dhu-l-Khalasa. He went with 150 riders, took it down, and killed anyone who was there. When he returned, the Prophet blessed them.

title: Dhu-l-Khalasa: A House Destroyed
content: The Prophet (ﷺ) asked Jarir to destroy a house in Yemen called Al-Ka`ba Al Yamaniya. He gave Jarir 150 horse riders from the Ahmas tribe. The Prophet (ﷺ) put his hand on Jarir's chest and prayed for him to be strong and guided. Jarir destroyed and burned down the house, then sent a message to the Prophet. When he returned, he told the Prophet that the house was completely gone. The Prophet (ﷺ) blessed the horses and men from the Ahmas tribe five times.

title: Prophet Muhammad Destroys Idol House
content: Jarir said the Prophet asked him to destroy a house in Yemen called Dhul-Khalasa. Jarir took 150 skilled horsemen from his tribe and went there. He burnt down the house, which had idols inside. When he arrived in Yemen, he met a man who used arrows for divination. Jarir told him to break the arrows and say 'There is no god but Allah', or else he would behead him. The man did as he was told. Jarir sent a messenger back to the Prophet with good news about destroying Dhul-Khalasa. When the messenger arrived, the Prophet praised the horses and men from Ahmas tribe.

title: The Prophet's Loved Ones
content: Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) sent Amr bin Al As to lead a group of soldiers. When Amr returned, he asked the Prophet who his favorite people were. The Prophet (ﷺ) said Aisha was one of them. Amr asked if it was from among men, and the Prophet replied that her father Abu Bakr was his favorite man. Amr then asked about the next person, and the Prophet mentioned Umar. He listed many other names, but Amr stopped talking because he didn't want to be seen as the last on the list.

title: Two Men from Yemen
content: Jarir met two men in Yemen named Dhu Kala and Dhu Amr. He told them about the Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ). They said, 'If what you're saying is true, then he has died three days ago.' Jarir went to Medina with them. On the way, they saw riders coming from Medina. The riders said, 'The Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) has died. Abu Bakr is now in charge and everything is fine.' The two men returned to Yemen. When Jarir told Abu Bakr what they had said, he wished they had come to visit him. Later, Dhu Amr met Jarir again and said, 'You've done me a favor. I want to tell you something: as long as Arabs choose their leaders, the country will be prosperous. But if power is taken by force, then rulers will become kings who get angry easily and are pleased with themselves.'

title: Abu Ubaida's Food Rationing
content: Jabir bin Abdullah said that the Prophet sent a group of 300 men to the sea coast, led by Abu Ubaida. They didn't have much food, so they collected all their supplies and rationed them out little by little. They only got one date each day until it was gone. Then they found a huge fish near the sea and ate from it for 18 days. After that, Abu Ubaida tested a camel's ability to fit under two ribs of the fish without touching them.

title: Abu Ubaida's Army Struggles
content: Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) sent a group of three hundred riders under Abu Ubaida to watch the Quraish caravan. They stayed at the seashore for half a month and were very hungry. They ate leaves from trees called Salam, and later found an animal called Al-`Anbar in the sea. They ate its meat and used its fat to heal their bodies. Abu Ubaida took one of its ribs and made a shelter under it. A man was told not to slaughter too many camels for food because it would not help the others.

title: Abu Ubaida's Fish Story
content: Jabir said we went on a trip with Abu Ubaida as our leader. We were very hungry and the sea brought up a huge dead fish called Al-`Anbar. We ate it for half a month. Abu Ubaida kept one of its bones standing upright, and a rider passed under it without touching it. When we got back to Medina, we told the Prophet about the fish. He said 'Eat it, because Allah provided this food for you.' Some people gave him some of the fish and he ate it.

title: No Pagan Hajj After This Year
content: During a Hajj, the Prophet made Abu Bakr in charge. On the day of Nahr, Abu Bakr sent him to tell people: 'No non-Muslim can do Hajj after this year. And no one should walk naked around the Kaaba.'

title: Last Suras Revealed
content: Al-Bara told us that the last complete Sura revealed was Baraa. The last part of a Sura to be revealed was from Sura-an-Nisa', which says: 'If someone has no family, they have no inheritance'.

title: Banu Tamim Refuse Good News
content: Some people from Banu Tamim came to the Prophet. He said, 'You have good news!' But they asked for more. The Prophet (ﷺ) looked unhappy. Then some people from Yemen came and he told them, 'The others didn't accept the good news.' They said, 'We do accept it, Messenger of Allah.'

title: Banu Tamim's Good Qualities
content: Abu Huraira said he always liked the Banu Tamim people because Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) told him three good things about them. Firstly, they will strongly oppose the Dajjal (a false prophet). Secondly, a slave-girl from their tribe was freed by Aisha because she was related to Ishmael. Thirdly, when their charity was collected, the Prophet said it was the charity of his people.

title: Disagreement Over Leadership
content: `Abdullah bin Az-Zubair said that a group of riders from Banu Tamim came to the Prophet. Abu Bakr suggested appointing Al-Qa'qa as their leader, but `Umar wanted Al-Aqra instead. They argued loudly until Allah revealed a verse saying: 'Don't be loud in front of Allah and His Messenger.'

title: Believe in Allah
content: Ibn `Abbas was asked about drinking Nabidh, a mixture of water and dates or grapes. He said that the Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) received visitors from a group called Abdul Qais. These visitors wanted to know what they should do to enter Paradise. The Prophet (ﷺ) told them to believe in Allah by saying there is no god but Him. He also ordered them to pray regularly, give money to those who need it, fast during Ramadan, and share one-fifth of the things they get from battles with others. The Prophet (ﷺ) forbade them from drinking four types of wine.

title: Order from the Prophet
content: Some people from a tribe called Rabi'a came to see the Prophet. They said they wanted to follow his teachings but couldn't visit him often because of other tribes blocking their way. The Prophet (ﷺ) told them to believe in one God, pray regularly, give money to those who need it, and give some of their war spoils to charity. He also told them not to use certain things that help make drinks with alcohol.

title: Two Rak'ats After Asr Prayer
content: A man named Kuraib was sent by Ibn Abbas and others to ask Aisha about offering two rak'ats after the Asr prayer. They had heard that she did this, but they thought it was forbidden by the Prophet. When Kuraib asked her, she said to ask Um Salama for an answer. Um Salama said she remembered the Prophet forbidding these two rak'ats. She told how one time the Prophet offered them and then came to her. A servant of hers stood up to remind him that he had forbidden this practice. The Prophet (ﷺ) beckoned her to wait behind, and when he finished his prayer, he explained that he had been busy with some people from the tribe of Abdul Qais who wanted to become Muslims. He said these two rak'ats made up for the ones missed after Zuhr prayer.

title: First Friday Prayer After Prophet
content: Ibn `Abbas said the first Friday prayer after the Prophet's mosque was at a mosque in a village called Jawathi, near Al Bahrain.

title: Thumama's Conversion Story
content: The Prophet (ﷺ) sent some soldiers to Najd and they brought back a man named Thumama. He was tied up in the mosque. The Prophet (ﷺ) asked him, 'What do you have?' Thumama said, 'If you kill me, it will be like killing someone who has already killed others. If you set me free, I'll be grateful. And if you want money, ask me what you need.' The next day, the Prophet asked him again and he gave the same answer. On the third day, the Prophet said, 'Release Thumama.' He went to a nearby garden, washed himself, and then came back into the mosque. Thumama said, 'I testify that there's no god but Allah, and Muhammad (ﷺ) is His Messenger!' He told the Prophet how he used to dislike him and his town, but now they were his favorites. The Prophet (ﷺ) was happy for him and told him to perform a special pilgrimage called Umra. When Thumama came back from Mecca, someone asked if he had become a Sabian. Thumama said no, he had converted to Islam with the Prophet's permission.

title: Prophet's Warning to Musailima
content: Musailima Al-Kadhdhab came to Medina and said he would follow the Prophet if given power. The Prophet (ﷺ) went to meet him with a stick in his hand. He warned Musailima that Allah's order cannot be avoided, and if he leaves Islam, he will be destroyed. The Prophet (ﷺ) thought Musailima was the person from his dream who wore gold bangles. In the dream, the bangles were blown away by the Prophet, meaning two liars would appear after him, which turned out to be Al Ansi and Musailima.

title: Prophet meets a false prophet
content: Ibn Abbas said that Musailima Al-Kadhdhab came to the Prophet during his lifetime. He wanted power after the Prophet's death and said he would follow him if given it. The Prophet (ﷺ) went to see him with Thabit bin Qais, holding a stick from a date palm tree. The Prophet (ﷺ) told Musailima: 'If you ask for this stick, I won't give it to you. You can't avoid Allah's order, but you will be destroyed if you leave Islam.' He also said that he thought Musailima was the person shown in his dream as a false prophet, and Thabit would answer any questions about him.

title: Two Gold Bangles
content: Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) was sleeping. He was given the wealth of the world and two gold bangles. He didn't like them, but he got a message from Allah to blow on them. So he blew on them, and they disappeared. The Prophet (ﷺ) thought this meant that two people would lie about him: the ruler of Sana and the ruler of Yamama.

title: Abu Raja's Story
content: Before the Prophet came, we used to worship stones. We'd find a better stone and throw away the old one. If no stone was available, we'd collect some earth and milk a sheep over it. Then we'd walk around it in prayer. In the month of Rajab, we stopped fighting and removed metal parts from our spears and arrows. When I heard about the Prophet's message, I was just a boy taking care of my family's camels. We ran to meet Musailima al-Kadhdhab, who claimed to be a prophet.

title: Abu Raja's Story of Idol Worship
content: I used to worship stones with my people. We would throw away old stones and take new ones, or collect earth if we couldn't find a stone. We'd bring a sheep, milk it over the earth, and walk around it in a circle. In the month of Rajab, we stopped fighting and removed iron parts from our spears and arrows. When I was a boy, I heard about the Prophet's message and ran to meet Musailima al-Kadhdhab with my family.

title: Prophet meets Musailima
content: Ubaidullah bin Abdullah told us that a man named Musailima Al-Kadhdhab came to Medina and stayed in the house of a woman. Her father was Al-Harith bin Kuraiz, and her son was Abdullah bin Amir. The Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) (ﷺ) went there with Thabit bin Qais, who was good at speaking. The Prophet (ﷺ) had a stick in his hand. He stopped in front of Musailima and talked to him. Musailima said, 'If you want, we won't fight against you for the leadership, but it will be ours after you.' The Prophet (ﷺ) said, 'No, I won't give you this stick. I think you're the person from my dream. Thabit bin Qais will answer your questions.' Then the Prophet left. Ubaidullah asked Ibn Abbas about the dream. Ibn Abbas said that someone told him the Prophet had a dream where two gold bangles were put in his hands, and he didn't like them. He was allowed to blow on them, and they flew away. The Prophet (ﷺ) thought these bangles meant two liars who would appear. One of them was Al-`Ansi, killed by Fairuz in Yemen, and the other was Musailima Al-Kadhdhab.

title: Prophet Meets Musailima
content: Musailima Al-Kadhdhab came to Medina and stayed in a house. Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) visited him with Thabit bin Qais. The Prophet (ﷺ) had a stick and spoke to Musailima. Musailima said he wouldn't interfere with the Prophet, but wanted rule after him. The Prophet (ﷺ) said no, because Musailima was probably the liar shown to him in a dream. He also mentioned that Thabit would answer for him. Then the Prophet left. Ibn Abbas explained the dream: two gold bangles were given to the Prophet, who blew them away as liars. One was Al-`Ansi and the other was Musailima.

title: Two Rulers Meet the Prophet
content: Hudhaifa told us that two rulers from Najran came to see the Prophet. They wanted to do something called Lian, but one of them said, 'If he's a true prophet and we do this, we'll never be successful.' They asked the Prophet to send someone trustworthy with them. The Prophet (ﷺ) agreed and chose Abu Ubaida bin Al-Jarrah to go with them.

title: Prophet Sends Honest Man
content: Some people from Najran came to the Prophet. They asked him to send someone honest to them. The Prophet (ﷺ) said he would send a trustworthy person. Everyone wanted to be chosen, but the Prophet sent Abu Ubaida bin Al-Jarrah.

title: Prophet's Honest Man
content: Anas said the Prophet said: 'Every group has a trustworthy person. The trustworthy person of our group is Abu Ubaida bin Al-Jarrah.'

title: Abu Bakr Pays Jabir's Debt
content: Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) told me that if the money from Al-Bahrain came, he would give me a lot of money. He said 'a lot' three times. But the money didn't come until after Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) died. When it finally arrived during Abu Bakr's rule, Abu Bakr asked people to tell him about any debts or promises they had with Allah's Messenger (ﷺ). I went to Abu Bakr and reminded him of what Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) said. Abu Bakr gave me some money. But when I asked for more, he didn't give it to me the first two times I asked. The third time, I told him that if he didn't give me the money, he would be like a miserly person. Abu Bakr said that being miserly is a bad thing and that he had intended to give me the money when he refused the first two times. Finally, Abu Bakr gave me five hundred dirhams and told me to take the same amount again.

title: Abu Musa's Visit
content: My brother and I came from Yemen to Medina. We stayed for a while thinking that Ibn Masud and his mother were related to the Prophet because they often visited him and were close to him.

title: Abu Musa and Chicken
content: One day Abu Musa visited the family of Jarm. I was with him when he invited a man to share his chicken lunch. The man refused, saying he thought chickens were unclean because they eat dirty things. Abu Musa said, 'Come on! The Prophet (ﷺ) used to eat chicken.' The man replied that he had taken an oath not to eat it. Abu Musa explained, 'I'll tell you about oaths. A group of people asked the Prophet for horses, but he refused. Then they asked again and he took an oath not to give them anything. Later, some camels were brought as spoils of war, and he gave five of them to us. We said,

title: Good News for Banu Tamim
content: Some people from the tribe of Banu Tamim visited the Prophet. He said to them, 'Be happy! Good things are coming.' They asked him for material gifts instead. The Prophet (ﷺ) looked unhappy. Then some visitors came from Yemen and the Prophet told them, 'Accept good news. Banu Tamim didn't believe me.' These new visitors said, 'We trust you, Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ).'

title: Belief is in Yemen
content: Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) pointed to Yemen and said, 'That's where you'll find true faith.' He then pointed east and said, 'Harshness and cruelty come from that direction. It's the home of Satan.' He was pointing at the tribes of Rabi'a and Mudar.

title: Yemenites Are Gentle People
content: The Prophet (ﷺ) said that people from Yemen are kind and humble. They have strong faith and wisdom. But some people, who own camels, can be proud and arrogant. And those who take care of sheep are usually calm and serious.

title: Belief and Afflictions
content: The Prophet (ﷺ) said: 'Faith is from Yemen. Troubles come from the east, where Satan's head faces.'

title: Yemenites are Good Learners
content: Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) said that people from Yemen have a kind and gentle nature. They also understand Islam well and are wise.

title: Ibn Masud Teaches Recitation
content: We were sitting with Ibn Masud when Khabbab came and asked if some young men could recite the Quran like him. Ibn Masud said he would let one of them read to us. 'Alqama was ordered to recite, but another man complained that 'Alqama didn't recite as well as they did. Ibn Masud said he would show them what the Prophet said about their generation and 'Alqama's. He then recited 50 verses from Surah Maryam. Khabbab thought 'Alqama had done a good job. Ibn Masud asked Khabbab if he liked 'Alqama's recitation, and Khabbab said yes. Then Ibn Masud noticed that Khabbab was wearing a gold ring and asked him when he would stop wearing it. Khabbab said he wouldn't wear it again after today and threw the ring away.

title: Prophet's Prayer for Guidance
content: Abu Huraira said that a man named Tufail came to the Prophet. Tufail said, 'The Daus people have disobeyed and refused to accept Islam. Please ask Allah to punish them.' But the Prophet said, 'No, I will pray for guidance for them instead. O Allah, guide the Daus tribe and bring them closer to You'.

title: Abu Huraira Joins Islam
content: I came to the Prophet and said, 'What a long night it's been.' I had just escaped from being a non-Muslim. On my way here, one of my slaves ran away. When I got to the Prophet, I became Muslim and sat with him. Then my slave appeared. The Prophet (ﷺ) said, 'Here is your slave.' I said, 'He's free because he belongs to Allah now,' so I set him free.

title: Umar Recognizes Adi's Faith
content: `Adi bin Hatim visited `Umar with a delegation. `Umar called the men one by one, saying their names. When he didn't call `Adi first, `Adi asked if `Umar knew him. `Umar said: 'You became Muslim when your people rejected it. You stayed true to Islam even when they ran away. You kept your promises when others broke theirs. And you accepted the truth when others denied it.' `Adi replied, 'I don't care about their opinions then.'

title: Assuming Ihram for Hajj and Umra
content: We went on a trip with the Prophet during the Farewell Pilgrimage. He told us to assume Ihram for both Hajj and Umra if we had an animal for sacrifice. I was menstruating when we arrived in Mecca, so I didn't do the special walk around the Kaaba or between Safa and Marwa. The Prophet (ﷺ) said I should undo my braids, comb my hair, and assume Ihram for Hajj only. After completing Hajj, he sent me to perform Umra instead of the one I missed. Those who assumed Ihram for Umra did two special walks, but those who combined Hajj and Umra did only one.

title: When Umra Ihram Ends
content: Ibn Abbas said that if someone does the walking around the Kaaba during an Umra, their special state of Ihram is finished. This is based on two things: a verse from the Quran (22:33) and what the Prophet told his companions to do during Hajjat-ul-Wada'. Some people thought this only applied after leaving Arafat, but Ibn Abbas allowed it before going to Arafat or after coming back.

title: Abu Musa's Hajj Question
content: I met the Prophet at Al-Batha'. He asked if I was doing Hajj. I said yes, and he asked how I intended to do it. I said I wanted to follow his example. The Prophet (ﷺ) told me to walk around the Ka'ba and between Safa and Marwa, then stop wearing my special clothes for pilgrimage. So I did that, and later a woman from the Qais tribe helped me remove lice from my hair.

title: Finishing the Hajj Ritual
content: Hafsa said that during a special Hajj year, the Prophet ordered all his wives to stop their special rituals. Hafsa asked him why he wasn't stopping too. The Prophet (ﷺ) replied that he had prepared his animal for sacrifice and couldn't finish his rituals until it was done.

title: Hajj for an Old Father
content: A woman asked the Prophet about her old father who couldn't ride a camel. She wanted to do Hajj on his behalf. The Prophet (ﷺ) said yes, it's enough if she does it for him.

title: The Prophet's Visit to Ka'ba
content: When the Prophet arrived in Mecca after conquering it, he rode his camel Al-Qaswa'. Bilal and Uthman bin Talha were with him. He stopped near the Ka'ba and asked Uthman for the key. Uthman brought the key and opened the gate. The Prophet (ﷺ), Usama, Bilal, and Uthman went inside the Ka'ba, then closed the door behind them. They stayed there for a while before coming out. People rushed to enter, but I got in first and saw Bilal standing by the gate. I asked him where the Prophet prayed, and he said between two front pillars. The Prophet (ﷺ) prayed with his back to the gate, facing the wall you see when you enter the Ka'ba.

title: Safiya's Menstruation During Hajj
content: During the Prophet's farewell pilgrimage, Safiya bint Huyai, one of his wives, got her period. The Prophet (ﷺ) asked if she would delay him and his group from leaving Mecca. Aisha replied that Safiya had already performed a prayer around the Kaaba in Mecca before getting her period. The Prophet (ﷺ) then told Aisha to let Safiya join them on their journey back to Medina.

title: Prophet Warns About Dajjal
content: The Prophet (ﷺ) was with us when we discussed Hajjat-ul-Wada'. We didn't know what it meant. The Prophet (ﷺ) praised Allah and talked about Al-Masih Ad-Dajjal, saying he will appear among you. He described him in detail. The Prophet (ﷺ) said this three times. Allah is not blind, but Dajjal is blind in one eye. Your blood and property are sacred to each other, just like on this day in this town during this month. The Prophet (ﷺ) asked if he had conveyed Allah's message clearly. We said yes. He then said 'O Allah, be our witness' three times. The Prophet (ﷺ) warned us not to fight with each other after he is gone.

title: The Prophet Warns About Dajjal
content: The Prophet (ﷺ) was with us when we discussed Hajjat-ul-Wada'. We didn't know what it meant. The Prophet (ﷺ) praised Allah and talked about Al-Masih Ad-Dajjal. He said, 'Allah's prophets warned their people about him.' The Prophet (ﷺ) mentioned that Dajjal will appear among you and have some qualities hidden from you. But your Lord is clear to you. The Prophet (ﷺ) repeated this three times. He said, 'Your blood and properties are sacred like the sanctity of this day in this town during this month.' The Prophet (ﷺ) asked if he had conveyed Allah's message correctly. We said yes. The Prophet (ﷺ) repeated his question three times and said, 'Allah be witness to it.' Then he warned us not to fight each other after he's gone.

title: Prophet's Journey to Hajj
content: Zaid bin Arqam said the Prophet fought in 19 battles. He only went on one pilgrimage after moving to Medina, and that was his last pilgrimage before he died. Before that, he had gone on a pilgrimage when he was still in Mecca.

title: Don't Fight Each Other
content: During the last Hajj, the Prophet told me to ask people to listen. He said: 'Do not become disbelievers by killing each other.'

title: The Sacred Months and Days
content: The Prophet (ﷺ) said: 'Time has gone back to its original shape when Allah created the world. The year is made up of twelve months, four of which are special. Three of these special months come one after another: Dhul-Qa'da, Dhul-Hijja, and Al-Muharram. The fourth special month is Rajab, named after a tribe called Mudar. It's between Jumaida and Sha'ban.' We asked him, 'Which month is this?' He said nothing for a while. Then he asked again, 'Isn't it Dhul-Hijja?' We replied, 'Yes.' He asked, 'Which town is this?' Again, he was quiet for a moment before saying, 'Isn't it Mecca?' We said, 'Yes.' He asked, 'What day is today?' This time, he waited even longer. Then he said, 'Isn't it the Day of Sacrifice?' We replied, 'Yes.' He said: 'Your lives, your belongings, and your honor are all sacred to each other, just like this special day in this city during this month. You will meet Allah one day and be asked about what you've done. Don't become disbelievers after me by hurting each other. Those who are here should tell those who aren't that they must respect each other's lives, belongings, and honor.'

title: Umar and the Perfect Religion
content: Some Jews said that if a certain verse was revealed to them, they would have made it an important day. Umar asked which verse they meant, and they said: 'This day I have Perfected your religion for you...' (5.3) Umar then told them where this verse was revealed - at Arafat while the Prophet was staying there.

title: Assuming Ihram for Hajj and Umra
content: Aisha said: We went on a trip with the Prophet. Some of us put on Ihram for Umra, some for Hajj, and some for both. The Prophet (ﷺ) put on Ihram for Hajj. Those who had assumed Ihram for Hajj or both Hajj and Umra didn't finish their Ihram until the day of sacrifice.

title: Giving to Charity
content: Sa'd was sick and worried about his daughter's future. He asked the Prophet if he should give a lot of money to charity. The Prophet (ﷺ) said no, it's better for Sa'd to leave some wealth for his daughter so she won't have to beg. The Prophet (ﷺ) also told Sa'd that any good deed he does will be rewarded by Allah, even if he stays behind in Mecca while his companions go to Medina.

title: Prophet's Head Shaved During Hajj
content: Ibn Umar said the Prophet had his head shaved during the last Hajj he performed.

title: Hajjat-ul-Wada' - Head Shaving
content: During the last Hajj, some of the Prophet's companions got their heads shaved. Others had their hair cut short instead.

title: Abdullah bin Abbas at Mina
content: Abdullah bin Abbas rode a donkey to the prayer area in Mina during Hajjat-ul-Wada'. He passed by some people praying and then got off his donkey. He joined them, standing in line with the others.

title: Usama Describes the Prophet's Speed
content: Hisham's father asked Usama about the Prophet Muhammad 's (ﷺ) speed during his Hajj. Usama said, 'He walked at a moderate pace. When he had space to walk quickly, he did.'

title: Praying Together During Hajj
content: Abu Aiyub said he prayed the Maghrib and Isha prayers with the Prophet during a special Hajj. The Prophet (ﷺ) combined these two evening prayers together.

title: Abu Musa Gets Camels
content: My friends asked me to ask the Prophet for some animals to ride on. We were going to a big battle together. I went to him and said, 'My friends need some animals to ride.' He said, 'No, you won't get any.' I was sad because he seemed angry with me. But then Bilal called out my name and told me the Prophet wanted to see me again. The Prophet (ﷺ) gave us six camels and said we could ride them. I took the camels back to my friends and said they were allowed to ride on them. Some of my friends didn't believe it, so I went with some of them to find someone who had heard the Prophet say this. We found those people and they told us the same thing.

title: Prophet's Deputy in Medina
content: The Prophet (ﷺ) went to Tabuk and left Ali in charge of Medina. Ali asked if he was leaving him with the children and women, but the Prophet said that being his deputy would be like Aaron helping Moses. He also told Ali that there wouldn't be a prophet after him.

title: Prophet's Advice on Fighting
content: Safwan bin Ya`la's father went to war with the Prophet. He said it was his best deed. A laborer and someone else got into a fight, and one bit the other's hand. The bitten person pulled their hand out, but the biter's tooth broke. They took this incident to the Prophet. He said that if the biter didn't leave his hand in the other's mouth, it wouldn't be fair for him to get compensation.

title: Ka'b bin Malik's Story
content: I'm Ka'b bin Malik. I was a companion of the Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) (peace be upon him). One day, he went to fight in a battle called Tabuk. He told me and some others that we had to go with him. But I didn't want to go. I said to myself, 'Maybe I can just stay behind.' So I stayed behind while the Prophet and his companions left for the battle. When they were gone, I thought about going after them, but then I thought again and decided not to go. This was a big mistake. The Prophet (ﷺ) came back and asked me why I didn't join him. I told him the truth - that I had stayed behind because I didn't want to go. He said I was telling the truth, and he forgave me. But for 50 days, no one would talk to me or my friends who also hadn't gone to the battle. We were like outcasts. Then Allah forgave us and we were welcomed back by the Prophet and our community.

title: Be Cautious of Their Fate
content: Ibn Umar said that the Prophet passed by Al-Hijr and told his companions not to enter the homes of those who were unfair to themselves. If they did, they should be sad, so they wouldn't suffer the same fate as them. The Prophet (ﷺ) covered his head and rode quickly to leave the area.

title: Don't Enter Their Homes
content: The Prophet (ﷺ) told his companions at Al-Hijr not to visit people who are being punished. He said they should be sad when visiting, so they don't get the same punishment.

title: Prophet's Hygiene Routine
content: Al-Mughira said the Prophet went out to answer nature's call. After finishing, I helped him with water. The event happened during the Tabuk war. The Prophet (ﷺ) washed his face. When he wanted to wash his arms, his sleeves were tight. He pulled them out and then washed his arms. Finally, he wiped his socks with wet hands.

title: Medina's Special Mountain
content: When we returned from the Tabuk trip with the Prophet, he pointed to Medina and said, 'This is our city. And look at Uhud mountain - it loves us and we love it.'

title: Excuse for Not Joining
content: When the Prophet returned from Tabuk, he said that some people in Medina were with him even though they didn't travel. They asked if this included those who stayed at home and he said yes, because their excuse was genuine.

title: Allah's Messenger Teaches Patience
content: Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) sent a letter to the ruler of Persia through Abdullah bin Hudhafa. The ruler gave it to his governor in Bahrain, who then handed it back to Khosrau. When he read the message, he tore it up. Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) prayed that the ruler and his people would be torn apart.

title: Persia's Ruler Will Fail
content: Abu Bakra said that during the battle of Al-Jamal, he remembered a word from the Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ). He had heard this before he was about to fight alongside his companions. The Prophet (ﷺ) had been told that the Persians had made a woman their leader. The Prophet (ﷺ) then said: 'A people ruled by a woman will never succeed.'

title: Receiving the Prophet
content: I went out with some boys to a place called Thaniyat-ul-Wada` to meet Allah's Apostle.

title: Receiving the Prophet
content: I went out with my friends to a place called Thaniyat-ul-Wada` to meet the Prophet when he returned from a battle in Tabuk.

title: Prophet's Last Moments
content: When the Prophet was very sick and close to death, he said to his wife Aisha: 'I still feel pain from eating food at Khaibar. Right now, it feels like my main blood vessel is being cut off because of that poison'.

title: Prophet's Recitation Habit
content: Um Al-Fadl bint Al-Harith said she heard the Prophet reciting Surat-al-Mursalat in Maghrib prayer. After that, he didn't lead them in any other prayer until his death.

title: Umar asks Ibn Abbas
content: `Umar let Ibn `Abbas sit with him. Someone said to `Umar, 'We have sons like him.' `Umar replied, 'I respect him because of his knowledge.' Then he asked Ibn `Abbas about a verse from the Quran: 'When Allah's help comes and Mecca is conquered...' Ibn `Abbas explained that it means the death of the Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ). `Umar said, 'I only understand what you understand.'

title: Thursday: The Prophet's Last Order
content: Ibn Abbas said the Prophet was ill on a Thursday. He wanted to write something important for us to remember, but his companions disagreed about what he should do. Some thought he might be confused or delirious. They went to ask him again, and he told them to leave him alone because his condition was better than they thought. Later, when he felt better, the Prophet gave three instructions: get rid of the non-Muslims from our land, treat foreign visitors with respect and kindness as we have done before, and... (Ibn Abbas forgot or didn't want to share the third instruction).

title: The Prophet's Final Request
content: When the Prophet was on his deathbed, he wanted to write down some important information for his companions. However, they disagreed about whether he should do this or not. Some thought it would be helpful, while others believed the Quran was enough. The argument got louder and the Prophet said, 'Leave me alone.' Unfortunately, because of their disagreement, he didn't get a chance to write down what he wanted to say.

title: Prophet's Final Words to Fatima
content: The Prophet (ﷺ) called Fatima when he was very ill. He told her something in secret and she cried. Then he told her something else in secret, and she started laughing. We asked her what happened, and she said the Prophet first told her that he would die from his illness. She cried because of this news. Then he told her that she would be the first member of their family to join him after death. This made her laugh.

title: Prophet's Secret Messages
content: The Prophet (ﷺ) called Fatima when he was very sick. He told her something quietly and she cried. Then he told her something else quietly, and she started laughing. When we asked her what happened, she said the Prophet first told her that he would die from this illness. She cried because of that. Then he told her that she would be the first in their family to join him after he died. She laughed at that.

title: Prophet's Last Choice
content: I, Aisha, heard the Prophet say that no prophet dies without being given a choice between living in this world or the next life. When he was sick and his voice was weak, I heard him recite: 'In the company of those on whom is the grace of Allah.' I thought to myself that he had been given this choice.

title: Prophet's Final Words
content: When the Prophet was very sick, he kept saying 'With the highest companion'.

title: Prophet's Last Moments
content: When the Prophet was healthy, he said that a prophet never dies without seeing their place in Paradise first. When he became ill and close to death, he looked up at the roof and asked Allah to be with the highest companion. Aisha thought this meant he wouldn't stay with them, but later understood it confirmed what he had told her before.

title: Prophet's Last Moments
content: Abdur-Rahman bin Abu Bakr visited the Prophet while Aisha was holding him. Abdur-Rahman had a fresh Siwak and was cleaning his teeth with it. The Prophet (ﷺ) looked at it, so Aisha took the Siwak, cut it, made it soft with water, and gave it to the Prophet. He cleaned his teeth with it. After brushing his teeth, he said three times: 'O Allah! Let me be with the highest companions.' Then he died. His head was resting between Aisha's chest and chin.

title: Prophet's Illness Treatment
content: When the Prophet was sick, he would read two special Quran chapters and then blow on himself. He'd also rub his hands over his body. When he got very ill, I did the same for him: reading those chapters, blowing on him, and rubbing his hands over his body.

title: Prophet's Final Prayer
content: I was with the Prophet before he died. He leaned on me and said: 'O Allah, forgive me. Give me your mercy. Let me meet the best people in heaven.'

title: Prophet's Warning about Graves
content: During his illness, the Prophet said that Allah curses the Jews for turning their prophets' graves into places of worship. Aisha said he didn't want his own grave to be made special because people might start praying there.

title: Prophet's Illness and Advice
content: When the Prophet was very sick, he asked his wives to let him stay in my house. They agreed. He came out with two men helping him walk because he couldn't walk properly on his own. One of these men was Ali bin Abu Talib. When he got to my house, he said, 'Let seven water skins be poured over me.' We put him in a big tub and poured water from these skins until he signaled us that we had done enough. Then he went out to the people and led them in prayer. He also warned against taking graves as places of worship, saying Allah's curse is on those who do this. I was worried when Abu Bakr took his place leading the people in prayer because I thought it would be bad for him.

title: Prophet Muhammad's Death
content: Aisha said that when the Prophet died, he was lying between her chest and chin. She never felt unhappy about anyone dying after him.

title: Ali Visits the Prophet
content: `Ali left the house of the Prophet when he was ill. People asked him how the Prophet was doing. `Ali said the Prophet had recovered with Allah's help. His uncle, `Abbas, took his hand and said, 'In three days, you'll be in charge of something else.' He felt that the Prophet would die soon because he knew what happened to their family when they were about to pass away. So they decided to ask the Prophet who should take over after him. If it was them, they'd know what to do. But if someone else got it, they'd tell them to look out for `Ali and his family.

title: Prophet's Visit During Fajr Prayer
content: One Monday morning during the Fajr prayer, Abu Bakr was leading the Muslims in prayer. Suddenly, Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) appeared at Aisha's door and looked at them while they were praying. He smiled. Abu Bakr thought the Prophet wanted to join the prayer and stepped back to let him through. The other Muslims were so happy to see the Prophet that they were about to stop praying. But the Prophet gestured for them to finish their prayer, then went inside and closed the door.

title: Prophet Muhammad's Final Moments
content: Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) was in my house when he passed away. He was leaning against me and I could feel his saliva mixing with mine. My friend Abdur-Rahman came in with a stick to clean teeth, called a Siwak. The Prophet (ﷺ) looked at it and I knew he liked it. I asked if I should get it for him and he nodded. It was too hard for him to use, so I softened it. He cleaned his teeth with it. There was a jug of water in front of him. He dipped his hand in the water and rubbed his face. He said 'There is no God but Allah' and 'Death can be painful.' As he died, he said 'With the best companion' three times.

title: Prophet's Last Days at Home
content: When the Prophet was very ill, he would ask Aisha where he would be tomorrow. His wives let him stay with whoever he wanted. He stayed with Aisha until he died. Aisha said that when the Prophet died, his head was against her chest and their saliva mixed together because she had been chewing a piece of wood to clean her teeth and then gave it to him.

title: Prophet's Last Moments
content: I was with my husband, the Prophet. He became sick and we would pray for him to be safe from harm. When he got worse, I started praying again. He looked up towards heaven and said 'With the highest companions.' My friend Abdur-Rahman brought a fresh palm leaf. I took it and chewed on it, then gave it to the Prophet to clean his teeth. He used it well and then handed it back to me. As he held my saliva in his mouth, his hand dropped down and he passed away.

title: Abu Bakr Announces Prophet's Death
content: Abu Bakr came to the Mosque on a horse. He dismounted and went straight to the Prophet, who was covered with a cloth. Abu Bakr uncovered the Prophet's face, bowed over him, kissed him, and wept. He said, 'Let my parents be sacrificed for you.' Abu Bakr told the people that if they were worshiping Muhammad (ﷺ), then he is dead. But if they were worshiping Allah, then Allah lives forever. Allah says in the Quran: 'Muhammad (ﷺ) is no more than an Apostle.' This Verse was revealed to remind them of this truth. When Abu Bakr recited it, everyone understood and started reciting it too.

title: Abu Bakr's Speech After Death
content: Abu Bakr came to the mosque on a horse. He got off and went straight to the Prophet, who was covered with a cloth. Abu Bakr uncovered the Prophet's face and kissed him. He said, 'Let my parents be sacrificed for you.' Abu Bakr told the people that the Prophet had died, but if they worshipped Allah, then Allah is alive and will never die. He recited a verse from the Quran: 'Muhammad (ﷺ) is no more than an apostle...' (3:144). The people listened to Abu Bakr and started reciting the verse themselves.

title: Abu Bakr's Words of Comfort
content: Abu Bakr came to the Mosque on a horse. He dismounted and went straight to Allah's Messenger (ﷺ), who was covered with a cloth. Abu Bakr uncovered his face, bowed over him, kissed him, and wept. He said, 'Let my parents be sacrificed for you. You will not die twice.' Abu Bakr told the people that if they worshipped Muhammad (ﷺ), he was gone, but if they worshipped Allah, Allah lives on. He recited a verse from the Quran: 'Muhammad (ﷺ) is no more than an apostle... Allah will reward those who are thankful.' The people listened and started to recite it too.

title: Kissing the Prophet's Body
content: After the Prophet died, Abu Bakr kissed his body.

title: Abu Bakr Kisses the Prophet
content: After the Prophet died, Abu Bakr kissed him. This was told by Aisha and Ibn Abbas.

title: Kissing the Prophet's Body
content: After the Prophet died, Abu Bakr kissed his body.

title: Prophet's Reaction to Medicine
content: During his illness, we poured medicine into the Prophet's mouth. He started pointing at us, meaning 'stop'. We thought he disliked medicines because patients usually don't like them. When he felt better, he said, 'I told you not to put medicine in my mouth.' Then he ordered everyone present to take medicine by pouring it into their mouths while he watched, except for his uncle Abbas who hadn't seen us do it.

title: Prophet's Will and Successor
content: Al-Aswad said that Aisha was told the Prophet had chosen Ali as his successor. Aisha replied, 'Who said this? I was holding the Prophet while he rested against me. He asked for a tray, then fell over and died. How could he have chosen a successor when I didn't even feel him go?'

title: No Will Left by the Prophet
content: Talha asked Abdullah bin Abu Aufa if the Prophet made a will. He said no. Talha then asked why people are told to make wills. Abdullah replied that the Prophet left a special will, which is Allah's Book.

title: Prophet Muhammad's Will
content: When Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) passed away, he left nothing in his will except a white mule that he used to ride and some weapons. He also gave a piece of land for charity so travelers could use it when they needed help.

title: Prophet Muhammad's Final Moments
content: Anas said that when the Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) was very sick and became unconscious, his daughter Fatima said, 'My father is so distressed!' The Prophet (ﷺ) replied, 'After today, my distress will be over.' When he passed away, Fatima said, 'Father, you're now with Allah. Your home is in Paradise.' She then told Anas to inform the angel Gabriel about her father's death. After the Prophet was buried, Fatima asked Anas if it made him happy to cover the Prophet's body with earth.

title: Prophet Muhammad's Last Words
content: When Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) was healthy, he said that no prophet is taken away until they are shown their place in Paradise and given a choice. When death came close while his head was on my lap, he became unconscious but then woke up. He looked at the ceiling and said 'O Allah, with the highest companions.' I thought this meant he wouldn't choose us to be with him. But later I realized that's what he used to say when he was healthy. His last words were 'O Allah, with the highest companion'.

title: Prophet's Stay in Mecca
content: The Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) stayed in Mecca for ten years. During this time, the Quran was being revealed to him. He then moved to Medina and stayed there for another ten years.

title: Prophet's Time in Mecca
content: The Prophet (ﷺ) stayed in Mecca for ten years. During this time, the Quran was being revealed to him. He then moved to Medina and stayed there for another ten years.

title: Prophet Muhammad's Age at Death
content: When Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) died, he was sixty-three years old.

title: Prophet Muhammad's Debt
content: The Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) died while his armor was being held by a Jewish man as payment for thirty measures of barley.

title: Usama Appointed Commander
content: The Prophet (ﷺ) chose Usama as the leader of a group going to Syria. Some Muslims talked badly about him. The Prophet (ﷺ) said, 'I've been told you're not happy with Usama. He's actually my favorite person.'

title: Allah's Messenger Defends Usama
content: Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) sent troops with Usama bin Zaid as their leader. People criticized his leadership. The Prophet (ﷺ) stood up and said, 'You used to criticize the leadership of Usama's father before me. By Allah, he deserved it. He was one of my closest friends, and now his son Usama is one of my closest friends too.'

title: Abu Al-Khair's Story
