content: I was asked when I migrated. I said we left Yemen and arrived at Al-Juhfa. A rider came and told me they had buried the Prophet five days before. I asked about Laylat al-Qadr, and he said Bilal told him it's one of the last ten nights in Ramadan.

title: Zaid's Ghazawat with the Prophet
content: I asked Zaid bin Al-Arqam how many battles he fought with the Prophet. He said seventeen. I then asked him how many battles the Prophet actually fought, and he replied nineteen.

title: Fighting with the Prophet
content: Al-Bara said he went on fifteen battles with the Prophet.

title: Buraida Fought with the Prophet
content: Buraida said he went on sixteen battles with the Messenger of Allah.

title: Responding to Allah's Messenger
content: I was praying in the mosque when the Prophet called me. I didn't answer because I was busy with my prayer. He said, 'Allah says to obey Him and His messenger when you're called.' Then he promised to teach me a special verse from the Quran before I left the mosque. He took my hand, but when it was time to leave, I reminded him of his promise. He said, 'Praise be to Allah, the Lord of all worlds' is a very important verse in the Quran.

title: Forgiveness for Saying Ameen
content: Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) said: When the leader says 'not the path of those who earn God's anger or those who go astray', you must say 'Amen'. If your 'Amen' is at the same time as the angels, your past sins will be forgiven.

title: Prophet Muhammad's Intercession
content: On the Day of Resurrection, believers will gather and ask someone to pray for them with Allah. They'll go to Adam, but he says he's not fit. He remembers his sin and feels ashamed. Then they'll go to Noah, who also says no. Next is Abraham, Moses, and Jesus, all saying they're not the right person. Finally, they come to Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) and ask him to pray for them. Allah gives permission, and when Muhammad (ﷺ) sees Him, he falls down in prayer. Allah tells him to raise his head, make a request, and it will be granted. Muhammad (ﷺ) praises Allah with words He teaches him and then intercedes for people to enter Paradise.

title: Greatest Sins in Islam
content: Abdullah asked the Prophet what is the greatest sin in Allah's sight. The Prophet (ﷺ) said it's to worship someone or something other than Allah, who created us all. Abdullah thought about this and then asked again, 'What's next?' The Prophet (ﷺ) replied that killing one of your own children because you don't want to share food with them is a great sin too. When Abdullah asked again, the Prophet said committing adultery with your neighbor's wife is another serious mistake.

title: Kam'a: A Cure for Eye Trouble
content: Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) said that Kam'a is like Manna. You don't need to work hard to get it. Its water can cure eye problems.

title: Entering the Town with Humility
content: The Prophet (ﷺ) told us that the children of Israel were asked to enter a town in a humble way. They should prostrate themselves and say 'Forgive our sins.' But they didn't do what they were told. Instead, they crawled into the town on their hands and knees. When they said 'Forgive our sins,' they added something extra: 'Like a grain of wheat in a hair'.

title: Abdullah Meets the Prophet
content: Abdullah bin Salam was working on a farm when he heard that the Prophet had arrived in Medina. He went to meet him and asked three questions: what is the first sign of the end times, what will be the first food eaten by people in Paradise, and how does a baby look like its parents? The Prophet (ﷺ) said Gabriel had just told him these things. Abdullah then accepted Islam and became a Muslim.

title: Umar's Respect for Scholars
content: Umar said that Ubai is the best at reciting the Quran and Ali is the best judge. But Umar also said that sometimes they leave out some of what Ubai says because Allah says in the Quran, 'When We change or forget a verse, We bring one that's better or similar.'

title: Lying to Allah is Wrong
content: The Prophet (ﷺ) said that Allah told him: 'When a person lies about Me and says I can't create them again, or when they say I have children, it's wrong. I am not like humans, I don't take a wife or have kids.'

title: Umar's Agreement with Allah
content: Anas said that Umar told the Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) that he agreed with Allah on three things. First, he suggested using Abraham's station as a place of prayer. Second, he asked the Prophet to tell his wives to wear veils when they visited him. The Prophet (ﷺ) then received a message from Allah about covering women. When Umar found out that some of the Prophet's wives were causing trouble, he told them to either stop or else Allah would give the Prophet better wives than them. One of the wives replied to Umar by saying that the Prophet didn't need advice from him. In response, Allah sent a message saying that if the Prophet divorced all his wives, Allah would give him even better ones.

title: Abraham's Foundations of the Ka'ba
content: Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) said to Aisha: 'When your people built the Ka'ba, they didn't use all of Abraham's original foundations.' Aisha asked him why he didn't rebuild it on those foundations. He replied that his people were still close to being non-Muslims, so he couldn't make changes.

title: Believe in Allah's Message
content: Abu Huraira said that the people of the Torah used to read it in Hebrew and explain it in Arabic to Muslims. The Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) said, 'Don't believe or disbelieve what they say. Instead, say: We believe in Allah and what He has sent us.'

title: Prophet's Qibla Change
content: The Prophet (ﷺ) prayed facing Jerusalem for a year and a half. He wanted to pray towards the Kaaba in Mecca instead. Allah sent a message, and the Prophet prayed towards the Kaaba. Some people followed him. When others saw them praying, they turned their faces towards the Kaaba while still bowed down. There were some men who had died before this change happened. We didn't know if their prayers towards Jerusalem were accepted or not. Then Allah sent a message saying that He would never make our faith (prayers) lost. He is very kind and merciful to all people.

title: Noah's Test on Judgement Day
content: Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) said: 'On the Day of Resurrection, Allah will call Noah. Noah will say,

title: Facing the Ka'ba in Prayer
content: Ibn Umar said that during a Fajr prayer at Quba mosque, someone came and told them to face the Ka'ba while praying. They then turned their faces towards the Ka'ba.

title: Anas Remembers the Past
content: Anas said that he is the only one left from those who used to pray facing both Jerusalem and Mecca as their direction for prayer.

title: Ibn Umar's Story at Quba'
content: Some people were praying in the morning at a place called Quba'. A man came to them and said that Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) had received a new message. The message was to face the Ka'ba in Mecca when praying, not Jerusalem as they were doing. They immediately turned their faces towards the Ka'ba.

title: Facing the Right Direction
content: Ibn Umar said that during a Fajr prayer at Quba mosque, someone came and told them to face the Kaaba in Mecca. At that time, they were facing Jerusalem, so they turned their faces towards the Kaaba.

title: Changing Our Prayer Direction
content: Al-Bara said we prayed with the Prophet for about a year and a half facing Jerusalem. Then Allah told him to turn our faces towards Mecca during prayer. The Quran says: 'Turn your face in the direction of the Sacred Mosque of Mecca'.

title: Facing the Ka'ba in Prayer
content: Some people were praying at Quba when a man came and said that new verses of the Quran had been revealed. The Prophet (ﷺ) was now supposed to face the Ka'ba in Mecca, so they turned their faces towards it while still standing in prayer.

title: Quba Mosque's Change of Direction
content: Ibn Umar said that during a Fajr prayer at Quba mosque, someone came and told the people that Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) had received new Quranic knowledge. He was ordered to face the Ka'ba in Mecca instead of Jerusalem. The people turned their faces towards the Ka'ba.

title: Interpreting Allah's Message
content: `Urwa asked Aisha about a verse in the Quran. He said it was okay to skip walking around Safa and Marwa during Hajj or Umra. Aisha disagreed, saying the verse was revealed because some people thought it was wrong to walk between these two mountains after becoming Muslim. They used to visit an idol near Qudaid instead.

title: Going Around Safa and Marwa
content: I asked Anas bin Malik about the old practice of walking around Safa and Marwa. He said that when Islam came, we stopped doing it because it was a pre-Islamic tradition. Then Allah revealed a message saying it's okay to walk between them during Hajj or Umra.

title: Dying with the Right Heart
content: The Prophet (ﷺ) said: 'If someone dies while still praying to something other than Allah, they will go to Hell.' I said, 'Then whoever dies without praying to anything else but Allah will go to Paradise'.

title: Equality in Punishment
content: Ibn Abbas said: The law of equality in punishment was given to the children of Israel. However, they did not have to pay blood money for their mistakes. Allah told us Muslims: 'Those who believe, the law of equality in punishment is for you when someone is murdered. If it's a free person killing another free person, or a slave killing another slave, or a woman killing another woman, then... If the family of the person who was killed forgives their relative (the killer), they can ask for reasonable payment instead of taking revenge. The killer must pay this money with gratitude. This is an act of mercy from Allah, easier than what came before us. But if someone goes against this law and takes revenge, they will face a severe punishment.'

title: Equality in Punishment
content: The Prophet (ﷺ) said, 'Allah's law is that the punishment for someone who kills another person should be equal.'

title: Equality in Punishment
content: Anas' aunt broke a girl's tooth. The family asked for forgiveness or compensation, but the girl's relatives refused. They went to the Prophet and said they only wanted equality in punishment. The Prophet (ﷺ) agreed with this law of Allah. Anas was worried that his aunt would be punished equally. But the Prophet said that Allah's law is clear: equality in punishment.

title: Fasting on Ashura
content: Before Islam, people used to fast on the 10th day of Muharram. When Muslims were told to fast in Ramadan, the Prophet said they could choose to fast on that day or not.

title: Fasting on Ashura Day
content: Before Ramadan fasting was made compulsory, people used to fast on the day of 'Ashura. But when Ramadan fasting became obligatory, it was up to each person whether or not to fast on that day.

title: Fasting on Ashura Day
content: Abdullah said that Al-Ash'ath came to him while he was eating. Al-Ash'ath mentioned that it was 'Ashura day. Abdullah told him, 'We used to fast on this day before Ramadan fasting was ordered. But when Ramadan fasting became compulsory, we stopped fasting on Ashura. So come and eat with me.'

title: Fasting on Ashura
content: Before Islam, the Quraish used to fast on a special day called 'Ashura. The Prophet (ﷺ) also used to fast on this day. When he came to Medina, he still fasted on Ashura and told Muslims to do the same. Later, when Ramadan fasting became compulsory, people stopped fasting on Ashura unless they wanted to.

title: Older Muslims and Fasting
content: 'Ata said he heard Ibn `Abbas explain a verse from the Quran. The verse says that older men and women who can't fast should feed one poor person for each day of fasting instead of fasting themselves.

title: Abrogation of Fasting Option
content: Ibn 'Umar said that Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) had given people a choice: either fast or feed a poor person for every day. However, this option was later cancelled.

title: Fasting during Ramadan
content: When the Quran said that people who can fast have a choice to either fast or feed a poor person for each day, it was allowed to pay money instead of fasting. But then another verse came and cancelled out this rule.

title: Cheating During Ramadan
content: When the rule to fast during Ramadan was revealed, people stopped having sex with their wives for a month. But some men broke this rule anyway. Allah knew they were cheating, but He accepted their apologies and forgave them.

title: Distinguishing Day from Night
content: Adi ibn Hatim took a white rope and a black one. He put them under his pillow at night, but the next morning he couldn't tell which was which. The Prophet (ﷺ) said that if Adi's pillow was wide enough for both threads to fit together, it meant day had turned into night.

title: Day and Night in Prayer
content: I asked the Prophet about two threads. He said they're not important to watch. Instead, he explained that one thread is like the darkness of night and the other is like the whiteness of day.

title: Fasting: A Clear Sign
content: Some people used to tie their legs with a white thread and a black thread when they wanted to fast. They would eat until the white thread was visible against the black one. But then Allah revealed that the sign is actually the start of dawn, not just when you can see the threads.

title: Entering Houses in Ihram
content: Before Islam, people would enter their houses from the back when they were in a state of Ihram. Allah revealed that this was not right. He said: 'It's not good to enter homes from behind. A true believer is someone who respects and follows Allah's commands, and stays away from what He forbids. You should enter your homes through their front doors.'

title: Ibn Umar's Principles
content: During a difficult time, two men asked Ibn Umar to come out and fight. He said no because Allah had forbidden the killing of his brother, Ibn Az-Zubair. They quoted a verse that says 'fight them until there is no more affliction'. But Ibn Umar explained that they fought until there was peace, not fighting. The worship should be for Allah alone, not for others. A man asked Ibn Umar why he performed Hajj one year and Umra another year, but didn't join the fight. Ibn Umar said Islam is based on five things: believing in Allah and His Messenger, praying five times a day, fasting during Ramadan, giving Zakat, and making the pilgrimage to Mecca. The man quoted a verse that says 'if two groups of believers fight each other, make peace between them'. But Ibn Umar explained that they did it when Islam was new and people were being persecuted. When Muslims became stronger, there was no more fighting or oppression. The man asked about `Uthman and `Ali. Ibn Umar said Allah may have forgiven `Uthman, but people don't like to think so. He said `Ali is the cousin of Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) and his son-in-law.

title: Ibn Umar's Wisdom
content: During a difficult time, two men asked Ibn Umar to join them in fighting. He refused because Allah had forbidden the killing of his brother, Ibn Az-Zubair. They quoted a verse that said 'fight until there is no more affliction'. Ibn Umar explained that they fought until the people were safe, but now some people want to fight again and make worship for other than Allah. A man asked him why he performed Hajj one year and Umra another year and didn't join the fighting. Ibn Umar said Islam has five main principles: believing in Allah and His Messenger, praying five times a day, fasting during Ramadan, giving charity, and visiting the House of Allah. The man quoted another verse that said 'if two groups fight, make peace between them'. Ibn Umar explained that they did this when Islam was new and people were being persecuted. But now there is no more persecution. When asked about `Uthman and `Ali, Ibn Umar said he thinks Allah has forgiven `Uthman but people don't like it. He also said `Ali is the cousin of the Prophet and his son-in-law.

title: Ibn Umar's Decision
content: During a difficult time for Ibn Az-Zubair, two men asked Ibn Umar to join them in fighting. He refused because Allah had forbidden killing his brother. They quoted the verse 'Fight until there is no more affliction', but Ibn Umar explained that they already fought until there was peace and worship was only for Allah. A man later asked him why he performed Hajj one year and Umra another, and left fighting. Ibn Umar said Islam has five main principles: believing in Allah and the Prophet, praying five times a day, fasting during Ramadan, paying Zakat, and making the Hajj pilgrimage. The man argued that the Quran says to fight if one group is oppressed, but Ibn Umar explained they fought when Muslims were few and faced persecution. He said he thinks Allah forgave 'Uthman, but people don't like it. As for 'Ali, he's the Prophet's cousin and son-in-law.

title: Spending for the Right Cause
content: Hudhaifa said that a verse in the Quran was revealed about spending money to help others in need, and not wasting it on things that can harm us.

title: Fidya: A Ransom to Allah
content: I was with Ka'b bin Ujra in the Kufa Mosque. I asked him about a verse from the Quran that says we can pay a ransom by fasting or giving food to the poor. He told me that once, lice were falling on his face and he went to see the Prophet. The Prophet (ﷺ) saw how bad it was and asked if Ka'b could afford to slaughter a sheep as a ransom for shaving his head. Ka'b said no, so the Prophet told him to fast for three days or give food to six poor people and then shave his head. Because of this, Allah revealed a verse in the Quran that says we can pay a ransom by fasting or giving food to the poor.

title: Hajj-at-Tamattu' Was Allowed
content: Imran bin Husain said that the verse about Hajj-at-Tamattu was revealed in the Quran. We performed it with the Prophet, and nothing was made against it until he passed away.

title: Don't Avoid Markets During Hajj
content: Before Islam, there were three big markets: `Ukaz, Mijanna and Dhul-Majaz. Muslims thought it was wrong to trade at these places during the Hajj season. But Allah said in the Quran that it's okay to buy or sell things from these markets during Hajj.

title: Going to Arafat
content: Before Islam, some Arabs stayed at Muzdalifa and others at Arafat. Allah told the Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) to go to Arafat and stay there, then move on from there. This is what Allah means in the Quran when He says: 'Then leave the place where all people leave'.

title: Hajj Rules for Pilgrims
content: If you want to go on Hajj from Mecca, you can walk around the Ka'ba first. But before going to Arafat, you need to be in a special state called Ihram. If you ride a camel or other animal, you must bring an animal for sacrifice. If not, you should fast for three days during your trip. If one of those days is the day of Arafat, it's okay if you break your fast then. When you get to Arafat, stay there from after the afternoon prayer until nightfall. Then move on to Jam' (also called Al-Muzdalifa). There, remember Allah and say special prayers before dawn breaks. After morning prayer, go to Mina. And keep doing what people normally do till you throw stones at a special rock.

title: Prophet's Daily Prayer
content: The Prophet (ﷺ) used to say: 'O Allah, give us good things in this life and good things in the next life. Protect us from the punishment of Hellfire.'

title: Most Hated Person
content: The Prophet (ﷺ) said, 'Allah dislikes the person who argues a lot.'

title: Ibn Abbas Reads the Quran
content: Ibn Abbas read from the Quran: 'When the prophets gave up hope and thought they were being denied help, Allah sent them support.' He then recited another verse: 'The prophet and his followers said,

title: Ibn Abbas Explains a Verse
content: Ibn Abbas said he recited the verse 'Respite will be granted' and then another part that says 'Allah's Help is near'. He told `Urwa bin Az-Zubair about it. `Urwa said Aisha explained that Allah never promised anything to the Prophet without him knowing it would happen. But sometimes, prophets faced so many problems that they thought their followers might think they were lying.

title: Ibn Umar's Recitation Habit
content: When Ibn Umar was reciting the Quran, he wouldn't talk to anyone until he finished. One day, I held the Quran for him and he started reading Surat-al-Baqara from memory. He stopped at a verse and asked if I knew why it was revealed. I said no, so he told me. It was about something specific. Then he continued reciting.

title: Ibn Umar's Respect for Quran
content: Ibn Umar wouldn't talk to anyone while reading the Quran. One day, he recited Surat-al-Baqara from memory and stopped at a verse. He asked if I knew why it was revealed like that. I said no, so he told me. It was about when to approach one's wife.

title: Jabir's Story About Wives
content: Some Jews said that if a man has sex with his wife from behind, their child will be born with crossed eyes. The Prophet (ﷺ) received a message from Allah saying: 'Your wives are like land for you to farm. You can use them as you need, whenever you want.'

title: Divorced Woman's Right to Remarry
content: Ma'qil's sister was divorced by her husband. He waited until she finished the time she had to wait before remarrying, then he wanted to marry her again. But Ma'qil didn't agree. So Allah revealed a verse saying: 'Don't stop them from marrying their former husbands.'

title: Uthman's Decision on the Quran
content: Ibn Az-Zubair asked Uthman about a verse in the Quran that said: 'Those who die and leave wives...' Uthman replied, 'This verse was cancelled by another verse. So why write it?' Ibn Az-Zubair said, 'Don't remove it from its place.'

title: Widow's Waiting Period
content: When a husband dies, his wife must wait for four months and ten days before marrying again. During this time, she can stay with her husband's family if they want her to. But the husband's will says she can leave their home if she wants to. Later, Allah changed the rules so that women don't have to live in their husband's house during this waiting period. They can now complete it wherever they like.

title: Pregnant Widow's Rights
content: Muhammad (ﷺ) bin Seereen was in a meeting with Ansar leaders. He talked about a story where Abdullah bin Utba said something about Subai'a bint Al-Harith. Abdur-Rahman disagreed, saying Abdullah's uncle didn't agree either. Muhammad (ﷺ) bin Seereen got upset and left the meeting. Later, he met Malik bin Amir or Auf and asked about Ibn Mas'ud's opinion on a pregnant widow whose husband had died. Malik said Ibn Mas'ud thought it was unfair to make her wait until she gave birth after her husband's death. He explained that a shorter Quran chapter for women was revealed later than the longer one, so the waiting period should be until she gives birth.

title: Prophet's Prayer Interrupted
content: On the day of Al-Khandaq, the Prophet said that the pagans stopped us from offering our main prayer until sunset. Allah will fill their graves and homes with fire.

title: Prayer Time: Speak or Be Silent
content: Zaid bin Arqam said that when he and his friends prayed, they used to talk to each other about their needs. But then the Quran told them to be quiet during prayer, especially for the middle prayer. Now they know not to speak while praying.

title: Prayer in Times of Fear
content: When asked about prayer during times of fear, Abdullah bin Umar said that the Imam leads a group of people in one rak'a. Another group stays between them and the enemy. Those who prayed first retreat and let those who haven't prayed yet take their place. The Imam finishes his prayer with two rak'at. Then each person offers the second rak'a alone, either standing or riding. If fear is too great, they can pray without facing the Qibla.

title: Uthman's Answer to Ibn Az-Zubair
content: Ibn Az-Zubair asked Uthman about a verse in Surat-al-Baqara. He said it had been replaced by another verse, so why was it still written? Uthman replied, 'Leave it as it is. I won't move anything from its original place.'

title: Abraham's Doubt and Faith
content: Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) said: 'We have more right to be in doubt than Abraham. He asked Allah,

title: Umar's Discussion on Faith
content: One day, Umar asked the Prophet's companions about a verse in the Quran. He said, 'What do you think this means:

title: Who is Truly Poor
content: The Prophet (ﷺ) said that a person who has very little food or money isn't necessarily poor. A truly poor person doesn't ask others for help and doesn't show their poverty to others. This is mentioned in the Quran, where it says 'They do not beg of people at all'.

title: Prohibition of Usury
content: Aisha said that when the verses about usury were revealed to the Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ), he read them out loud in front of everyone. Then he told people not to trade in alcohol.

title: Prohibition on Alcoholic Liquor
content: When the last parts of Surah Baqarah were revealed, the Prophet went to the mosque and read them out loud. He then told everyone that selling or buying alcoholic drinks was no longer allowed.

title: Prophet Prohibits Liquor Trade
content: Aisha said that when the Prophet read the last verses of Surat-al-Baqara in the mosque, he told people not to sell or trade alcoholic drinks.

title: Last Verses of Surah Baqara
content: Aisha said that when the last verses of Surah Baqara were revealed to the Prophet, he stood up and recited them to us. Then he told us not to sell or trade alcoholic drinks.

title: Last Verse Revealed to Prophet
content: Ibn Abbas said the last verse of the Quran revealed to the Prophet was about not taking interest on loans.

title: Abrogation of a Verse
content: Ibn Umar said that the verse 'Whether you show what is in your minds or conceal it' was cancelled out by another verse.

title: Abrogation of a Verse
content: Ibn Umar said the verse 'Whether you show what is in your minds or conceal it' was cancelled by another verse that followed it.

title: Understanding Clear and Unclear Verses
content: Aisha said that the Prophet recited a verse from the Quran: 'Some parts of the Book are clear, while others are not.' He explained that people with a misunderstanding of Islam might look for hidden meanings in unclear verses. They might even seek trouble by doing so. The Prophet (ﷺ) said, 'Those who follow unclear verses and cause trouble are those Allah has named as having deviated from the truth. So be careful around them.'

title: Satan Touches Newborns
content: Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) said that when a child is born, Satan touches it. The baby cries because of this touch, except for Jesus and his mother Mary. To protect them from evil, we can say a prayer: 'I seek Allah's protection for her and her family from Satan.'

title: Oaths and Property Rights
content: Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) said: If someone is asked to take an oath that might take something from another Muslim without a good reason, they will face Allah's anger. The Quran says those who break their promises for small gains will have no share in the afterlife.

title: Taking False Oaths
content: Abdullah bin Masud said the Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) said: 'If someone is asked to take an oath that could hurt a Muslim's property, and they lie in their oath, Allah will be angry with them.' The Quran says those who do this will have no share in the afterlife. Al-Ash'ath bin Qais was involved in a dispute over a well and the Prophet told him to either bring proof or let his cousin take an oath. Al-Ash'ath said he knew his cousin would lie, so the Prophet warned that taking a false oath could lead to Allah's anger.

title: Cheating in Business is Wrong
content: A man sold some goods and lied about the price he was offered. He wanted to cheat a Muslim. Allah revealed that people who do this are wrong, even if they get something small for it.

title: Two Women and a Lawsuit
content: Two women were working together in a house. One of them hurt her hand with an awl and blamed the other for it. They took their case to Ibn Abbas, who reminded them of what the Prophet said: 'If people just claimed things without proof, society would fall apart.' He told them to remind the accused woman about Allah and read this verse from the Quran: 'Those who trade their faith for a small gain will lose everything.' The woman confessed after being reminded. Ibn Abbas then explained that according to the Prophet's teaching, the person accused must take an oath in front of witnesses if there is no proof against them.

title: Abu Sufyan Meets Heraclius
content: Abu Sufyan was on a trip to Sham when he received a letter from the Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ). He took it to Heraclius, the Byzantine emperor. Heraclius asked Abu Sufyan about his family and if any of his ancestors were kings. Abu Sufyan said no. Heraclius then asked about the Prophet's followers: were they rich or poor? Abu Sufyan said poor. Heraclius thought this was a sign that the Prophet was truly special, as Apostles often come from noble families but their followers are usually from lower classes. He also asked if anyone had ever accused the Prophet of lying before he became a prophet, and Abu Sufyan said no. Heraclius then read a letter from the Prophet to him, inviting him to become Muslim. The people around Heraclius were upset by this, so they ordered Abu Sufyan and his companions to leave. On their way out, Abu Sufyan told his friends that even the king of the Byzantines was afraid of the Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ).

title: Abu Talha Donates Garden
content: Abu Talha had many date palm gardens in Medina. His favorite was Bairuha garden, which was near the Mosque of the Prophet. The Messenger would visit and drink from its water. When a verse from the Quran said that giving up something you love is important for being righteous, Abu Talha decided to donate his beloved garden to Allah's cause. He hoped it would be rewarded and kept safe with Allah. The Messenger praised him and suggested he share the garden among his family members.

title: Abu Talha's Garden Distribution
content: Anas said that Abu Talha gave some of his garden to Hassan and Ubai. But he didn't give any part to Anas, even though Anas was a closer relative to him.

title: Jews and Stoning in Islam
content: Some Jews brought a man and woman to the Prophet. They had done something wrong together. The Prophet (ﷺ) asked how they usually punished people who did this, and they said by beating them and blackening their faces with coal. He asked if they knew about stoning to death from the Torah, but they said no. Abdullah bin Salam told them to bring the Torah and read it. When they did, a teacher was reading from it, but he covered up a verse that talked about stoning to death. Abdullah bin Salam uncovered the verse and asked what it said. The Jews then admitted that this was the verse about stoning to death. Based on this, the Prophet ordered the man and woman to be stoned to death near the mosque.

title: Best of Peoples
content: Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) said that Muslims are the best people for others. We bring them to Islam, even if it means they have to wear chains on their necks until they accept our faith.

title: Two Tribes Were Saved
content: Jabir bin Abdullah said that a verse was revealed about two groups of people from our tribe. These groups were Banu Haritha and Banu Salama. The verse says Allah protected them when they were about to give up.

title: Muhammad's Prayer and Curse
content: Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) was praying Fajr. He said a prayer after bowing in the last part of the prayer. Then he cursed some people, saying 'O Allah, curse them.' After that, he said 'Praise is for You only.' Allah revealed a message to him: 'It's not your decision who to curse. They are wrongdoers.'

title: Prophet's Prayers and Invocations
content: Abu Huraira said that the Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) used to pray after bowing in prayer. He would say 'Allah hears who praises Him, all praise is for You, O our Lord.' Then he might say 'O Allah, save Al-Walid bin Al-Walid and Salama bin Hisham.' Sometimes he would ask Allah to punish the Mudar tribe with famine years like those of Joseph. He also used to curse certain Arab tribes in his morning prayers.

title: Battle of Uhud: A Turning Point
content: The Prophet (ﷺ) appointed Abdullah bin Jubair to lead the infantry during the battle. They lost and returned defeated. The Prophet (ﷺ) was calling them back, but only twelve men stayed with him.

title: Abu Talha's Sword Falls
content: During the battle of Uhud, Abu Talha fell asleep while fighting. His sword kept falling from his hand and he would pick it up again.

title: Abraham's Faith in Allah
content: Abraham said these words when he was thrown into a fire: 'Allah is enough for us. He takes care of everything.' The Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) also said the same thing when people told him that a big army was coming to fight him. But instead of being scared, his faith grew stronger and he said: 'Allah is enough for us. He takes care of everything'.

title: Abraham's Last Words
content: When Abraham was thrown into a fire, his last words were: 'God is enough for us. He will take care of everything.'

title: Wealth without Zakat is a Snake
content: Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) said: If someone has wealth but doesn't pay their required charity (Zakat), on the Day of Judgment, that person's wealth will be shown to them as a snake. The snake will wrap itself around their neck and bite their cheeks, saying 'I am your wealth.' This is what Allah says about people who don't share their blessings with others.

title: The Prophet Meets Abdullah bin Ubai
content: Usama bin Zaid rode with the Prophet on a donkey to visit Sa'd bin Ubada. They passed by a group where Abdullah bin Ubai was present, along with people of different religions. When they saw the dust from the donkey, Abdullah bin Ubai covered his nose and said, 'Don't cover us in dust.' The Prophet (ﷺ) greeted them and invited them to Islam, reciting the Quran. Abdullah bin Ubai told him to leave them alone and come back another time. But Abdullah bin Rawaha said, 'Bring it to us, we love hearing it.' The group started arguing until they were about to fight. The Prophet (ﷺ) calmed them down and left for Sa'd's house. There, he asked if Sa'd had heard what Abdullah bin Ubai said. Sa'd replied that Allah brought the truth when people wanted to make Abdullah their leader instead of the Prophet. So the Prophet forgave him. This was before the battle of Badr.

title: Hypocrites Stay Behind
content: Some people who pretended to be believers stayed behind when the Prophet went on a battle. They wanted to stay home and get praised for something they didn't do. When he came back, they made up excuses and took false oaths to look good.

title: Marwan's Question to Ibn Abbas
content: Marwan asked his gatekeeper to go to Ibn Abbas and say: 'If people who like what they've done and want praise for things they haven't, get punished, then we're all in trouble.' Ibn Abbas replied: 'What's this about? The Prophet (ﷺ) once asked the Jews a question. They hid the truth and gave him something else instead. They were happy with their secret. Then Ibn Abbas recited from the Quran: 'Remember when Allah made a promise to those who got the Scripture... Those who like what they've done and want praise for things they haven't.'

title: Prophet's Night Prayer Routine
content: Ibn Abbas stayed with his aunt Maimuna. The Prophet (ﷺ) talked to his wife and then went to sleep. He woke up during the last third of the night, looked at the sky, and said: 'The creation of the heavens and earth has signs for those who understand.' He performed ablution, brushed his teeth, and prayed 11 rakats. Bilal called out for prayer, and the Prophet prayed two sunnah prayers before leading the Fajr congregation.

title: Ibn Abbas Watches Prayer
content: One night, I stayed at my aunt Maimuna's house. She put a cushion for the Prophet in the right direction. He slept on it and woke up rubbing his face. Then he recited the last ten verses of Surat-al-`Imran. Next, he got water from a hanging skin, washed his hands and face, and stood to pray. I did the same and stood beside him. The Prophet (ﷺ) put his hand on my head and ear, then prayed two sets of two rak'ats each, followed by one rak'a for witr.

title: Abdullah's Overnight Visit
content: Abdullah bin Abbas stayed with his aunt Maimuna, the Prophet's wife. He slept on a cushion while the Prophet lay beside her. The Prophet (ﷺ) woke up in the middle of the night and prayed. He performed ablution from a hanging water skin and stood for prayer. Abdullah did the same and joined the Prophet. The Prophet (ﷺ) put his hand on Abdullah's head and offered eight rak'at, then one witr rak'a. Later, he got up again to offer two more rak'at before going out to lead the Fajr prayer.

title: Ibn Abbas' Night with Prophet
content: One night, Ibn Abbas stayed in the house of his aunt, who was married to the Prophet. He slept on a cushion, while the Prophet lay next to his wife on the same cushion. The Prophet (ﷺ) woke up at midnight and rubbed the sleep from his eyes. Then he recited the last ten verses of Surah Ali-Imran. After that, he washed his face with water from a hanging skin and performed ablution perfectly. He stood up for prayer, and Ibn Abbas did the same. The Prophet (ﷺ) put his hand on Ibn Abbas' head and twisted his ear. They prayed two sets of four rakats each, then one rakat witr. Later, when it was time to pray Fajr, the Prophet got up again, prayed a short prayer, and went out to lead the congregational prayer.

title: Marriage to an Orphan
content: There was a girl who was being taken care of by a man. He married her because she owned a date palm garden, not because he loved her. The Quran then said: 'If you're worried about treating orphan girls unfairly...' (4.3). This girl shared the date palm garden and his property with him.

title: Guardians and Orphan Girls
content: `Urwa bin Az-Zubair asked Aisha about a verse from the Quran. She explained that in the past, guardians were responsible for orphan girls' property and well-being. They would sometimes want to marry these girls because of their wealth or beauty, but they wouldn't give them a fair dowry. Allah forbade this behavior unless the guardian treated the girl fairly and gave her the same dowry as any other woman. Aisha said that people asked the Prophet about what to do after this verse was revealed. The Quran then said that men can marry women of their choice, but not orphan girls they want because of their wealth or beauty.

title: Guardians of Orphans
content: Aisha said: Allah says in the Quran that if a guardian is rich and takes money from an orphan's property, it's not right. But if he's poor, he can take what's fair for his work and time spent taking care of the child.

title: Division of Inheritance
content: Ibn Abbas said that if relatives, orphans, and the poor are present when dividing inheritance, then this verse is still valid and not cancelled out.

title: Prophet visits Jabir during illness
content: The Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) and Abu Bakr came to visit me at my home in Banu Salama. They found me unconscious, so the Prophet asked for water and washed his hands and face with it. He then poured some water on me to wake me up. When I came to, I asked him about what should happen to my wealth after I die. The Prophet (ﷺ) said something that reminded Allah to give a message about how people should divide their belongings among family members.

title: Inheritance in Islam
content: Before Islam, children got all the property. Parents only inherited if they made a will. Allah changed this law. Now, a son gets twice as much as a daughter. Parents get one-sixth each or one-third together. A wife gets one-eighth or one-fourth of the property. A husband gets half or one-fourth.

title: Inheriting a Widow's Choice
content: Before Islam, when a man died, his relatives could take control of his widow. They could marry her themselves, or give her to someone else in marriage, or leave her alone. This was unfair and harsh on the woman. The Quran then said that men cannot inherit women against their will, and must treat them kindly.

title: Inheritance and Brotherhood
content: Ibn Abbas explained the meaning of two verses in the Quran. The first verse said that everyone has a specific group or family who inherits from them. He said 'Mawali' means heirs. When the Emigrants came to Medina, they were considered brothers to the Ansari people due to a bond established by the Prophet. However, when another verse was revealed, this special inheritance through brotherhood was cancelled. Ibn Abbas explained that the second verse refers to helping and advising each other as allies. This does not mean that allies inherit from each other, but rather they can leave some of their property for each other in a will.

title: Seeing Allah on Judgment Day
content: Some people asked the Prophet if they would see their Lord on Judgment Day. He said it's like seeing the sun at noon or the full moon at night - no problem. On Judgment Day, each nation will be called to follow what they used to worship. Those who worshipped idols and other gods will go to Hell. The people of the Book (Jews and Christians) will be asked about their idols: Ezra for Jews and Jesus for Christians. They'll say they're thirsty and want water, but then they'll fall into Hell. Only those who truly worshipped Allah will remain. When there's no one left but them, Allah will come to them in a form they can see. He'll ask if they're waiting for Him, and they'll say 'yes' because they didn't worship anyone else.

title: The Prophet Loves to Hear Quran
content: Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) asked me to recite the Quran. I said, 'You already know it.' He replied, 'I like to hear others read it.' So I started reading Surah Nisa'. When I got to a certain verse, he stopped me and his eyes filled with tears.

title: Lost Necklace and Prayer
content: Asma's necklace was lost. The Prophet (ﷺ) sent some men to find it. They had to pray but couldn't wash their hands because there was no water. So they prayed without washing. Allah then revealed a new rule about this.

title: Obey Allah and His Messenger
content: Ibn Abbas said the Prophet appointed Abdullah bin Hudhafa as a commander. The Verse 'Obey Allah and Obey the Apostle and those of you who are in authority' was revealed about this event.

title: Sharing Water with Neighbors
content: Zubair and an Ansari man argued over a stream at Al-Harra. The Prophet (ﷺ) said to Zubair, 'Water your land first, then let the water flow to your neighbor.' When the Ansari said it was unfair because Zubair is the Prophet's cousin, the Prophet became angry and said, 'Water your land, but only give your neighbor as much water as his land can hold.' The Prophet (ﷺ) had already decided that both men should be treated equally. Zubair thought a verse of the Quran was revealed to support this decision: 'They won't truly believe until they accept you as their judge in all disputes.'

title: Prophets' Choice When Sick
content: I heard the Prophet say that no prophet gets sick without being given a choice: to stay in this world or go to the Hereafter. During his own illness, he said: 'I'm with those who have Allah's blessing - prophets, honest followers of prophets, martyrs, and good people.' This shows he was given the option.

title: Ibn Abbas' Family Situation
content: My mother and I were weak Muslims in Mecca who were being oppressed.

title: Ibn Abbas' Excuse for His Mother
content: Ibn Abbas was explaining a verse from the Quran. He said that his mother and he were among those people who didn't have to follow certain rules because they were weak - like old or sick people, women, and children.

title: Division Over Hypocrites
content: Some companions who fought in the Battle of Uhud didn't want to fight. This made Muslims disagree about what should happen to them. The Prophet (ﷺ) was asked about this and he said: 'Medina is a good place, it gets rid of bad things like fire gets rid of impurities from silver.'

title: Last Verse on Premeditated Murder
content: Some people in Kufa disagreed about a verse from the Quran. I asked Ibn Abbas about it and he said that this verse, 'Whoever kills a believer intentionally will go to Hell', was revealed last and nothing changed its meaning.

title: Killing a Man Who Said Peace
content: Ibn Abbas said that there was a man who had many sheep. Muslims came to fight him and he said 'Peace be on you'. But they killed him and took his sheep. Allah then revealed a verse saying: 'Don't say someone is not a believer just because they offer you peace.' The verse also says that some people only care about getting rich quickly.

title: Not All Believers Are Equal
content: The Prophet (ﷺ) said to me: 'Believers who stay at home are not the same as those who fight for Allah.' A blind man, Ibn Um Maktum, came and said he wished he could fight. The Prophet (ﷺ) was dictating a message from Allah, which made his thigh heavy on mine. Then Allah revealed an exception: people with injuries or disabilities.

title: Blindness Exemption from Jihad
content: When the Verse 'Not equal are those of the believers who sit at home' was revealed, the Prophet called for Zaid to write it down. Meanwhile, Ibn Um Maktum came and complained about his blindness. In response, Allah revealed an exception: 'Except those who are disabled by injury or blind or lame...'

title: Blind Man's Exception
content: When a verse about believers was revealed, the Prophet asked someone to write it down. He wrote: 'Not equal are those who stay home and those who fight for Allah.' A blind man, Ibn Um Maktum, said he couldn't fight because he was blind. The Prophet (ﷺ) then had another verse revealed that made an exception for people like him.

title: Believers at Home vs. Battle
content: Ibn Abbas said that not all believers are equal. Some stayed home and didn't go to the Badr battle, while others went to fight there.

title: Medina People Forced to Fight
content: I was part of an army that Medina's people had to create. I met Ikrima, a freed slave of Ibn Abbas. He strongly told me not to join the fight because some Muslims were with the pagans, making it harder for our Prophet (peace be upon him). Allah revealed a verse about this: 'Those who are taken by angels while doing wrong to themselves' (Surah An-Nahl 4:97).

title: Allah Excuses Some Women
content: Ibn Abbas said that the verse 'Except for weak ones' in the Quran means some women were excused from certain duties. His mother was one of those women who Allah forgave.

title: Prophet's Prayer for Safety
content: While praying at night, the Prophet said 'Allah hears those who praise Him.' He then prayed for safety of specific people: Aiyash bin Rabi'a, Salama bin Hisham, and Al-Walid bin Al-Walid. He also asked Allah to protect weak believers and bring severe punishment on the tribe of Mudar.

title: Wounded Man Exempt from Prayer
content: Ibn Abbas said that the verse 'Because of the inconvenience of rain or because you are ill' was revealed about a man named Abdur-Rahman bin Auf who had been hurt. This means if someone is sick or it's raining, they don't have to go for prayer.

title: Guardianship and Marriage
content: A man had an orphan girl under his care. She shared her inheritance with him, including a date-palm garden. He didn't want to marry her himself and also didn't want anyone else to marry her because they would share the property. So he stopped her from getting married. The Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) was asked about this situation and the Verse 4:127 was revealed in response.

title: Aisha Explains a Divorce Rule
content: Aisha said the Verse 'If a woman fears cruelty or desertion from her husband' is about a man who doesn't want his wife and wants to divorce her. But if she says, 'I set you free', this Verse was revealed.

title: Hudhaifa Warns of Hypocrisy
content: One day, Hudhaifa visited a group of people sitting with Abdullah. He said, 'People who are better than you have become hypocrites.' Al-Aswad replied by saying, 'I bear witness that Allah is one and only.' Then he recited a verse from the Quran: 'The hypocrites will be in the lowest depths of the Fire.' Abdullah smiled when he heard this. Hudhaifa sat down somewhere else in the mosque. Later, he threw a stone to get Al-Aswad's attention. When Al-Aswad went to him, Hudhaifa explained that people who were better than them had become hypocrites, but then they repented and Allah forgave them.

title: Prophet Muhammad's Humility
content: The Prophet (ﷺ) said to Abdullah, 'No one should say I am better than Jonah. He was a prophet who repented and was forgiven by Allah.'

title: Don't Compare the Prophet
content: The Prophet (ﷺ) said that anyone who says he is better than Jonah bin Matta is lying.

title: Last Surah and Verse Revealed
content: Al-Bara' said the last Surah to be revealed was Bara'a. The last verse revealed was about what happens when someone dies without any family left behind, and how Allah decides their inheritance.

title: Umar and the Perfect Religion
content: Some Jews told Umar that if a special verse was revealed to them, they would celebrate. Umar said he knew exactly when and where it was revealed - on Hajj Day at Arafat. He had been there himself.

title: Lost Necklace at Baida'
content: I was traveling with the Prophet. My necklace broke and I lost it in a dry place. The people stayed to help find it, but Abu Bakr said they should leave because there's no water. He scolded me and hit my sides. When dawn came, we still had no water. Then Allah revealed a verse that allowed us to clean ourselves without water. Later, I got down from my camel and found the necklace under its feet.

title: Lost Necklace at Al-Baida'
content: I lost my necklace in Al-Baida'. We were on our way to Medina. The Prophet (ﷺ) made his camel stop and lay down next to me, then fell asleep. Abu Bakr came and hit me hard because he thought I was holding everyone up for the necklace. But I didn't move because the Prophet was sleeping next to me. When the Prophet woke up, it was time for morning prayer. We looked for water but couldn't find any. Then this verse from the Quran was revealed: 'When you're getting ready to pray...'. Usaid bin Hudair said that Allah is blessing people because of Abu Bakr's family.

title: Al-Miqdad's Support for the Prophet
content: At Badr, Al-Miqdad said to the Prophet: 'We won't say what the children of Israel said to Moses. Instead, we'll go with you.' The Prophet (ﷺ) was very happy with this.

title: Killing in Three Cases
content: Abu Qilaba was sitting behind `Umar bin `Abdul `Aziz. People were talking about al-Qasama, saying the Caliphs allowed it. `Umar turned to Abu Qilaba and asked what he thought. Abu Qilaba said killing someone is only lawful in three cases: a married person who has sex outside marriage, someone who has killed another person without reason, or someone who fights against Allah and His Messenger. Anbasa said he had heard something similar from Anas. Abu Qilaba agreed with what Anas said. He told the story of some people who came to the Prophet. They didn't like the land's climate, so the Prophet gave them his camels to take care of. The people drank the camels' milk and urine, then killed the shepherd and took the camels. Abu Qilaba said they should be punished for killing someone and fighting against Allah and His Messenger.

title: Qisas and Compensation
content: Anas' aunt broke a girl's tooth. The Prophet (ﷺ) was asked to judge. He said the law is Qisas, but they chose compensation instead. This shows some people keep their promises and Allah helps them.

title: Concealing Revelation is False
content: Aisha said: If someone says that the Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) hid some of what was revealed to him, they are lying. Allah says in the Quran: 'Prophet, tell the people what has been sent down to you from your Lord.'

title: Unintentional Oaths
content: Aisha said a man made two promises by saying 'No, by Allah' and then 'Yes, by Allah'. The Verse (5.89) was revealed to show that Allah will not punish him for making these unintentional oaths.

title: Abu Bakr's Oath
content: Aisha said her father Abu Bakr never broke his promise. But if he took an oath to do something and then found a better choice, he would accept Allah's permission and do the better thing. He also did what was needed to make up for breaking his original promise.

title: Temporary Marriage in War
content: My student Abdullah and I were going to wars with the Prophet. We didn't have wives with us. We thought about cutting off our private parts, but that's not allowed. The Prophet (ﷺ) said we could marry a woman for a short time by giving her something as simple as a dress. He then reminded us of Allah's rules: 'Don't make things haram (forbidden) that Allah has made halal (allowed).'

title: Alcohol Prohibited in Medina
content: Ibn Umar told us that a verse about not drinking alcohol was revealed when there were five types of drinks available in Medina, none made from grapes.

title: Alcohol is Prohibited
content: Anas bin Malik was serving drinks to Abu Talha and others. A man came and said that alcohol had been forbidden. They immediately spilled the drink and never went back to it again.

title: Drinking Alcohol Before Prohibition
content: Jabir said that some people drank alcohol on the day of the Uhud battle. These people were later killed as martyrs, before alcohol was made haram (forbidden) by Allah.

title: Prohibition of Alcoholic Drinks
content: Ibn Umar said that he heard Umar say: 'The Prophet (ﷺ) told us that alcoholic drinks are made from grapes, dates, honey, wheat and barley. An alcoholic drink is something that makes you confused or unable to think clearly.'

title: Prohibition of Alcoholic Drinks
content: Anas said: We used to serve wine at Abu Talha's house. But then the Prophet announced that drinking alcohol is forbidden. When Abu Talha heard this, he told me to pour out the wine we had left. I did and saw it flowing through the streets of Medina. People were worried because some Muslims who died in battle still had wine in their stomachs. To reassure them, Allah revealed a verse saying there's no blame for what they ate before becoming Muslim.

title: The Prophet's Sorrowful Sermon
content: The Prophet (ﷺ) gave a sermon. He said, 'If you knew what I know, you would laugh little and cry much.' The companions were so sad that they covered their faces. One of them asked, 'Who is my father?' The Prophet (ﷺ) replied, 'So-and-so.' After this, Allah revealed a verse saying, 'Don't ask about things that might cause you trouble if you knew the answer'.

title: Don't ask silly questions
content: Some people were asking the Prophet questions just to be funny. They would say things like 'Who is my father?' or 'Where's my lost camel?' Allah then revealed a verse saying: 'Believers, don't ask about things that might cause you trouble if you knew.'

title: Idols and Sacred Animals
content: Sa'id bin Al-Musaiyab told me that in the past, there were special animals for idols. One was a camel called Bahira, whose milk was kept just for the idols. Nobody could milk it. Another was Sa'iba, which they would set free for their gods. They couldn't carry anything on its back. Abu Huraira said that the Prophet saw Amr bin 'Amir Al-Khuza'i in a dream, dragging his intestines in the Fire. He was the first to let animals go free for idols. There was also Wasila, a camel that gave birth to two female camels without a male in between. If this happened, people would set it loose for their idols. They had a special male camel called 'Ham' which they used for breeding. When its work was done, they let it go free and didn't make it carry anything.

title: Hell's Punishment for Disobedience
content: Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) said to Aisha: 'I saw Hell. It was eating itself up. I also saw Amr, dragging his intestines inside it. He started the practice of setting animals free as an offering to idols.'

title: Day of Resurrection
content: Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) said: 'On the Day of Judgment, you will be gathered before Allah. You'll be barefoot and without clothes. Some people from my followers will be taken to the left side (Hell). I'll ask,

title: Angels Will Guide Us
content: The Prophet (ﷺ) said: 'On the Day of Judgement, people will be gathered. Some will be taken to one side by angels, and I'll say what Jesus said:

title: Five Keys of the Unseen
content: Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) said: The five things only Allah knows are: when the Day of Judgment will come, where and how much rain will fall, what each baby in the womb will be like, where every person will die, and what they will do tomorrow.

title: Prophet's Prayer for Refuge
content: Jabir said the Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) received a verse from Allah saying He could send punishment from above. The Prophet (ﷺ) prayed, 'I seek refuge with Your Face.' When another verse came down mentioning punishment from below, he again prayed, 'I seek refuge with Your Face.' But when a third verse mentioned confusion and fighting among Muslims, the Prophet said, 'This is easier'.

title: Don't Confuse Your Faith
content: When the Prophet's companions read a verse that said 'don't confuse your belief with wrong', they asked each other, 'Which of us hasn't done something wrong?' Then another verse was revealed: joining others in worship to Allah is a huge mistake.

title: Jonah's Humility Praised
content: The Prophet (ﷺ) said to Ibn Abbas: 'No one should say I am better than Jonah. He was a prophet who repented and was forgiven.'

title: Prophet Muhammad and Jonah
content: Abu Huraira said the Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) said: 'No one can say I'm better than Jonah bin Matta.'

title: Prostration in Surah Sa'd
content: Mujahid asked Ibn Abbas about a verse in the Quran. He said yes to prostration and recited another verse. Then he explained that David was one of those prophets mentioned, and our Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) was also among them who were ordered to follow.

title: Prophet's Warning about Jews
content: The Prophet (ﷺ) said to Jabir bin Abdullah: Allah curses the Jews. They were not allowed to eat animal fat, so they melted it and sold it, then used the money.

title: Ghaira and Praise
content: `Abdullah bin Mas`ud said that Allah has a strong sense of pride. He forbids shameful actions, whether done openly or secretly. Allah loves praise more than anyone else, so He praises Himself.

title: The Sun Will Rise West
content: Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) said: The Day of Judgment will not come until the sun rises from the west. When people see this, everyone on earth will believe. But it won't help anyone who didn't believe before.

title: The End Times Will Come
content: Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) said, 'The Day of Judgment will not come until the sun rises from the west. When it does rise and people see it, they will all believe in Allah. But by then, it will be too late for anyone to benefit from believing.'

title: Allah's Sense of Pride
content: Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) said: 'God has more sense of pride than anyone. He forbids shameful actions whether done openly or secretly. God loves praise, and that's why He praises Himself.'

title: Slapping a Companion
content: A Jewish man came to the Prophet. He said someone from the Ansar had slapped him on the face. The Prophet (ﷺ) asked for the person and asked why he did it. The man said he overheard him saying something about Moses being above Muhammad (ﷺ), so he got angry and hit him. The Prophet (ﷺ) told him not to think he's better than other prophets. On Judgment Day, everyone will lose consciousness but he'll be awake first. He'll see Moses holding the Throne, but won't know if Moses is awake yet or still in shock from a past event.

title: Al-Kam'a's Natural Cure
content: The Prophet (ﷺ) said that Al-Kam'a is like a natural substance called Manna. It grows on its own without human help. The water from it can cure eye problems.

title: Abu Bakr and Umar's Dispute
content: Abu Bakr and Umar had a disagreement. Abu Bakr made Umar angry, so Umar left in anger. Abu Bakr followed him to ask for forgiveness from Allah. But Umar refused and closed the door on Abu Bakr. Abu Bakr went to see the Prophet while they were together. The Prophet (ﷺ) asked if someone was arguing with them. Meanwhile, Umar felt sorry for what he had done and came back. He told the Prophet about what happened. The Prophet (ﷺ) got angry, but Abu Bakr said he was more at fault. The Prophet (ﷺ) said, 'Don't leave my companion!' When people doubted him, Abu Bakr stood up for the Prophet and said he was telling the truth.

title: Israelites' Gate of Forgiveness
content: Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) said to his companion Abu Huraira: 'The children of Israel were told to enter a gate in prostration and say

title: 'Uyaina meets 'Umar
content: 'Uyaina went to see his friend 'Umar. He said, 'You don't give us enough food and you're not fair when judging.' 'Umar got very angry but his nephew Al-Hurr reminded him of a verse from the Quran that says, 'Be patient with people who are foolish.' 'Umar remembered this verse and didn't punish 'Uyaina.

title: Forgiveness and Righteousness
content: Abdullah bin Az-Zubair said that Allah ordered the Prophet to forgive people who behave badly towards him. This verse, 'Hold to forgiveness; command what is right', was revealed because of how people treated the Prophet.

title: Ibn Abbas Explains Surah Anfal
content: Sa'id bin Jubair asked Ibn Abbas about the Surah Al-Anfal. Ibn Abbas said it was revealed during the Battle of Badr.

title: Deaf and Dumb Animals
content: Ibn Abbas said that the people referred to in the Quran as deaf and dumb animals were from a tribe called Bani Abd Ad Dar. This verse is found in chapter 8, verse 22.

title: Abu Sa'id's Prayer
content: I was praying when the Prophet passed by me. He called out to me but I didn't go until I finished my prayer. When I went to him, he asked why I hadn't come sooner. He reminded me that Allah says in the Quran: 'Answer Allah and His Messenger when they call you.' The Prophet (ﷺ) then said he would tell me about a very important chapter of the Quran before leaving the mosque. I reminded him again, and he told me it was the first chapter: 'Praise be to Allah, the Lord of the worlds.' He also mentioned seven special verses that are often recited.

title: Abu Jahl's Challenge
content: Abu Jahl said to Allah, 'If the Quran is true, bring a storm of stones or punish us.' But Allah didn't punish them while Anas was with them. And He won't punish them when they ignore the Sacred Mosque in Mecca.

title: Abu Jahl's Challenge
content: Abu Jahl said to Allah, 'If the Quran is true, send stones from the sky or punish us.' But Allah did not punish them while Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) was with them. And He will not punish them if they ask for forgiveness and stop people from going to the sacred mosque.

title: Ibn Umar and the Verse
content: A man came to Ibn Umar while two groups of Muslims were fighting. He said, 'Don't you know what Allah says in His Book? If two groups of believers fight each other, we should follow Allah's rules.' Ibn Umar replied, 'I'd rather be blamed for not fighting because of this verse than for killing a believer on purpose.' The man quoted another verse that says to fight until there are no more people worshiping idols and Islam is the only religion. Ibn Umar explained that when Muslims were few, they had to fight to protect themselves from persecution. But now that Islam has spread, there's no need to fight. When the man asked about Ali and Uthman, Ibn Umar said Allah forgave Uthman and Ali is the cousin and son-in-law of the Prophet.

title: Fighting in Times of Trouble
content: Ibn Umar said that when the Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) fought against non-Muslims, it was because they were causing trouble. He didn't fight just to be in charge or rule over others. This is what he meant by 'fighting caused by afflictions'.

title: Fighting for Faith
content: Ibn Abbas said: When the Quran said that twenty Muslims can defeat two hundred non-Muslims, it became a rule that one Muslim should not run away from ten non-Muslims. Later, Allah made it easier and said that one hundred Muslims don't have to run away from two hundred non-Muslims.

title: Reducing the Enemy Number
content: Ibn Abbas said that when Allah revealed a verse saying '20 Muslims can defeat 200 non-Muslims', it became hard for Muslims. They were told not to run from battles unless there were at least ten non-Muslims. So, Allah made it easier by revealing another verse: 'If you have 100 good fighters, they will be strong enough.' When the number of enemies decreased, the Muslims' bravery also decreased.

title: Last Verse and Surah Revealed
content: Al-Bara narrated: The last verse revealed was about people who have no family left to inherit their wealth. It says Allah has the final say on this matter. Also, the last chapter (Sura) revealed was Baraatun.

title: Abu Bakr's Important Message
content: Abu Huraira said that Abu Bakr sent him to Mina on the Day of Nahr. He was with announcers who told people: 'No non-Muslims can do Hajj after this year.' They also said: 'People must wear clothes when walking around the Ka'ba.' Later, Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) sent Ali bin Abi Talib to recite a chapter from the Quran loudly in public. Ali did this at Mina on the Day of Nahr with Abu Huraira and others. He told people again that no non-Muslims can do Hajj after this year and that they must wear clothes when walking around the Ka'ba.

title: Abu Bakr's Important Message
content: Abu Huraira said that Abu Bakr sent him to Mina with announcers. They announced: 'No non-Muslim can do Hajj after this year.' And, 'No one should walk around the Ka'ba naked.' The Prophet (ﷺ) then sent Ali bin Abi Talib to recite a special chapter from the Quran loudly in public.

title: No Pagan Pilgrims After This Year
content: Abu Bakr sent Abu Huraira to announce during Hajj: 'No non-Muslim can perform Hajj after this year. And no one should walk around the Kaaba without clothes.'

title: Hudhaifa Describes Hypocrites
content: Zaid bin Wahb was with Hudhaifa. Hudhaifa said that only three people from the group described in a Quranic verse were left, and four hypocrites. A man asked about thieves who break into homes and steal things. Hudhaifa replied that these are not hypocrites, but wrongdoers. He said there are only four true hypocrites left, one of whom is an old man who doesn't feel cold water when he drinks it.

title: Zakat Money on Judgement Day
content: Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) said: 'On the Day of Resurrection, anyone's unpaid Zakat will appear as a bald-headed poisonous snake.'

title: Abu Dhar's Visit to Ar-Rabadha
content: I visited Abu Dhar in Ar-Rabadha and asked him what brought him there. He said he was at Sham when he recited a verse from the Quran: 'Those who save money but don't spend it for Allah will face a painful punishment.' Muawiya disagreed, saying this verse wasn't meant for Muslims like us. Abu Dhar replied that it's actually for both Muslims and people of the Scripture.

title: Zakat Makes Wealth Pure
content: 'Abdullah bin Umar said, 'This verse was revealed before we were told to give Zakat. When Allah made giving Zakat a rule, He used it to make people's wealth pure.'

title: Months of the Year
content: The Prophet (ﷺ) said, 'Time has come back to its original state. The year is twelve months. Four of these months are special: Dhul-Qa'da, Dhul-Hijja, Al-Muharram, and Rajab Mudar. These four months follow each other in a row: Dhul-Qa'da, then Dhul-Hijja, then Al-Muharram, with Rajab Mudar between Jumad ath-thani and Sha'ban.'

title: Prophet in a Cave
content: Abu Bakr was with the Prophet in a cave. They saw that the pagans were nearby. Abu Bakr said, 'If one of them looks down, he'll see us.' The Prophet (ﷺ) replied, 'What about Allah being with us? We're two, and He's the third.'

title: Ibn Abbas' Family Ties
content: When there was a disagreement between Ibn Az-Zubair and Ibn Abbas, I reminded Ibn Abbas that his father's family was connected to the Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ). His father, Zubair, married Asma, who was Aisha's sister. That made Aisha Ibn Az-Zubair's aunt. Abu Bakr, one of the closest companions of the Prophet, was Ibn Az-Zubair's maternal grandfather through his mother, Asma. And Safiya, a wife of the Prophet, was Ibn Az-Zubair's grandmother.

title: Ibn Abbas on Ibn Az-Zubair
content: I went to see Ibn Abbas in the morning. I asked him if he wanted to fight against Ibn Az-Zubair, who had taken power in Mecca. This would mean making fighting allowed in a place where Allah said it's not allowed. Ibn Abbas said no way, that would be wrong. He explained why Ibn Az-Zubair was entitled to lead: his father, Zubair, helped the Prophet; his grandfather, Abu Bakr, went into hiding with the Prophet; his mother, Asma', was a strong woman in Islam; his aunt, Aisha, was a respected wife of the Prophet; and his grandmother was the Prophet's wife Khadija. Ibn Abbas said he chose to support Ibn Az-Zubair even though his own relatives, Bani Umaiya, were also eligible to lead.

title: Ibn Abbas and Ibn Az-Zubair
content: We visited Ibn Abbas. He said, 'Are you surprised that Ibn Az-Zubair became the leader?' I thought to myself, 'I will support him and tell people about his good qualities.' I told him, 'Ibn Az-Zubair is related to the Prophet through his aunt's son and also through his father's side, which includes Abu Bakr and Khadija's brother. But he doesn't want me as a friend.' I said, 'If my cousins have to rule over me, it would be better if they did so than others.

title: Distributing Aid Unfairly
content: Abu Sa'id said that the Prophet received some aid and gave it to four men. He wanted to make them happy by giving them something. One of them complained, 'You haven't been fair.' The Prophet (ﷺ) replied, 'From this man's family, people will come who will leave Islam'.

title: Giving Charity with Pride
content: Abu Mas`ud told us: When we were ordered to give charity, some of us worked hard to earn something to give. Abu `Aqil gave half a special measure of food grains. Another person gave even more. The hypocrites said that Allah didn't need the charity from Abu `Aqil and that he was only showing off. But then Allah revealed: 'Some people criticize those who give charity freely, and those who can only give what they have.'

title: Giving in Charity
content: Abu Mas'ud said that the Prophet used to tell us to give alms. We would try hard to earn a little bit of food, like one Mud, to give away. Now some people have much more wealth and can give even 100,000 times more.

title: Abdullah's Funeral Prayer
content: When Abdullah bin Ubai died, his son came to the Prophet and asked for a shirt to bury him in. The Prophet (ﷺ) gave it to him and agreed to pray at his funeral. But Umar stopped the Prophet from praying, saying that Allah had forbidden this. The Prophet (ﷺ) said he would ask forgiveness more than 70 times as allowed by Allah's word. However, Umar still disagreed, saying Abdullah was a hypocrite. Despite this, the Prophet prayed at the funeral.

title: Umar asks for prayer
content: When Abdullah bin Ubai died, the Prophet was asked to lead a funeral prayer. I, Umar, jumped up and said, 'Prophet, do you pray for him? He said bad things about you.' The Prophet (ﷺ) smiled and told me to leave him alone. But then he said, 'I have been given a choice, and I chose to pray for him. If I knew that praying more than 70 times would forgive him, I'd do it.' So the Prophet prayed for him, but soon after, two verses from Surah Bara'a were revealed: 'Don't pray for those who die as rebels.'

title: Funeral Prayer for Hypocrites
content: Ibn Umar told us that when Abdullah bin Ubai died, his son came to the Prophet. The Prophet (ﷺ) gave him a shirt and said to shroud his father in it. Then he stood up to pray for the deceased, but Umar stopped him. He said, 'The Prophet (ﷺ) has been forbidden from praying for hypocrites.' The Prophet (ﷺ) replied that Allah had told him: 'Even if you ask forgiveness for them 70 times, Allah will not forgive them.' But then he added that he would still ask for forgiveness more than 70 times. Despite this, the Prophet prayed for Abdullah bin Ubai and they all followed him in prayer. Later, Allah revealed a verse saying that Muslims should not pray for hypocrites when they die.

title: Ka'b bin Malik's Truth
content: I heard Ka'b bin Malik say that he was glad Allah had guided him to Islam. He said that if someone else had spoken for him, he would have lied to the Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ). This would have made him like those who told lies when they were reminded of their mistakes.

title: Visitors in a Dream
content: Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) had a dream where two visitors took him to a town made of gold and silver. They met people who were half handsome, half ugly. The visitors told them to dip into a river, which made their ugliness disappear. The visitors said this was the Garden of Eden, where they would live. They also explained that the mixed-looking people were those who did good and bad things, but Allah forgave them.

title: Prophet's Visit to Abu Talib
content: When Abu Talib was dying, the Prophet visited him. With Abu Jahl and Abdullah bin Abi Umaiya present, the Prophet said to Abu Talib: 'Say that only Allah deserves worship.' They replied, 'Do you want to leave your family's faith?' The Prophet (ﷺ) said he would keep asking forgiveness for Abu Talib unless told not to. Then a verse was revealed saying it's wrong for the Prophet and believers to pray for forgiveness on behalf of non-believers, even if they're related.

title: Three Men's Repentance
content: Abdullah bin Ka'b said he heard Ka'b bin Malik talking about a verse. He wanted to give up all his money for Allah and the Prophet, but the Prophet told him to keep some of it.

title: Ka'b bin Malik's Story
content: I'm Ka'b bin Malik. I was one of three people forgiven by the Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ). I never missed a battle he went to, except two: Tabuk and Badr. When we returned from a journey, the Prophet would go to the mosque early in the morning and pray. He told others not to talk to me or my friends who stayed behind. People avoided us. We were worried that if we died, no one would say good things about us or offer a funeral prayer for us. But then Allah forgave us while the Prophet was with his wife Um Salama at night. She helped me and told the Prophet's companion to tell me I was forgiven. When the Prophet prayed in the morning, he announced that we were forgiven. He would smile when he was happy, like a full moon shining bright. We were one of three people whose case was delayed. Others who lied about staying behind and gave false excuses were described badly by Allah.

title: Ka'b bin Malik's Story
content: I'm Ka'b bin Malik. I stayed behind in the battle of Tabuk. I told the Prophet that I was telling the truth, and I never meant to lie. Allah revealed a verse saying He forgave the Prophet, those who migrated, and people who are honest.

title: Collecting the Quran
content: Abu Bakr asked Zaid bin Thabit to collect the Quran because many people who knew it by heart had been killed in battle. He said, 'If Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) didn't do this, why should I?' But Abu Bakr and Umar kept encouraging him until he agreed. They trusted Zaid because he was good at writing down the Quran for Allah's Messenger (ﷺ). Zaid started looking for written copies of the Quran on parchment, scapula, palm leaves, and in people's memories. He found two verses from Surah Tauba that no one else had.

title: Fasting on Ashura Day
content: When Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) arrived in Medina, the Jews were fasting on a special day called 'Ashura'. They said this was the day Moses defeated Pharaoh. The Prophet (ﷺ) told his friends, 'You have more right to celebrate this victory than anyone else, so fast on this day too.'

title: Hidden Acts in Public
content: Ibn Abbas said some people used to hide when they went to the bathroom or had sex with their wives in public. They were afraid of being seen by others. Allah revealed a verse about this behavior, saying 'They fold up their breasts' (11:5).

title: Ibn Abbas Explains the Verse
content: Ibn `Abbas was reading a verse from the Quran. I asked him what it meant when it said 'They fold up their breasts'. He explained that some people used to feel shy about being intimate with their wives or using the bathroom in public, so Allah revealed this verse.

title: Hiding from Allah
content: Ibn `Abbas said: Some people fold their arms and hide themselves from Allah. They even cover themselves with clothes to try and hide.

title: Allah's Promise to Spend
content: Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) said that Allah told him, 'Spend money and I will give you more.' He also said that His power is always full, no matter how much He gives. He reminded us of all the good things He has given since creating the universe. His balance of justice is in His Hand, and it helps Him decide who to lift up or lower.

title: Nearness to Allah
content: Ibn Umar was walking around the Kaaba when a man asked him if he had heard anything from the Prophet about something called An-Najwa. Ibn Umar said, 'The Prophet (ﷺ) told us that believers will be brought close to their Lord. The believer will come near until his Lord covers them with a screen and asks them to confess their sins. They will admit to doing wrong twice. Then Allah will say,

title: Allah's Mercy on Oppressors
content: Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) said: Allah gives time to those who do wrong things. But when He punishes them, He doesn't let them go free. This is what happens when Allah takes control of a community that has done many bad things.

title: Kissing Before Prayer
content: A man kissed a woman and then told the Prophet about it. The Prophet (ﷺ) received a message from Allah saying that praying correctly at different times of day can help remove small sins. The man asked if this was just for him, but the Prophet said it's for anyone who does something wrong.

title: Joseph's Family Line
content: Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) said: 'Joseph is from a noble family. His father was Jacob, his grandfather was Isaac, and his great-grandfather was Abraham.'

title: Honorable People in Allah's Sight
content: Some people asked the Prophet who were the most honorable. He said it was those who followed Allah's rules and feared Him. They didn't want to know that answer, so he told them about Joseph, a prophet and the son of another prophet and his grandfather Abraham. The people then asked about their own ancestry, and he said that those who were good in the past would be good in Islam if they understood it.

title: Aisha's Innocence Declared
content: After people spread false rumors about Aisha, the Prophet told her: 'If you're innocent, Allah will prove it. If you've done something wrong, ask for forgiveness and repent.' Aisha said she would be patient like Joseph's father was when he faced a similar situation. Then Allah revealed verses saying that those who spread lies are a group of troublemakers.

title: Aisha's Fever and the Prophet
content: I was with Aisha when she got a fever. The Prophet (ﷺ) said her fever might be because of what people were saying about her. I agreed it could be true. Then Aisha sat up and compared our situation to Jacob and his sons, who had disagreements. She said patience is best and that only Allah can help us.

title: Abdullah bin Mas'ud's Recitation
