content: Abu Wail said that Abdullah bin Mas'ud recited the verse 'Come to us'. He added, 'We read it as we were taught.'

title: Prophet's Prayer for Famine
content: The Prophet (ﷺ) said to Allah: 'Protect me from the Quraish.' He asked for seven years of famine, like what happened to Joseph. A year of severe hunger came and destroyed everything. People ate bones and saw smoke in the sky. Allah said: 'Watch for the day when the sky will be filled with smoke.' Then Allah said: 'We'll stop the punishment a little, but you'll return to disbelief.' The famine passed, as did the punishment from the Battle of Badr.

title: Prophet Lot's Situation
content: Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) said: 'May Allah have mercy on Prophet Lot. When his people caused him trouble, he wanted to find a strong protector. If I were imprisoned like Joseph was, I would try to escape. We would be more unsure than Abraham was when Allah asked him if he believed. Abraham said, 'Yes, but I want to believe even stronger.'

title: Apostles and Their People
content: `Urwa bin Az-Zubair asked Aisha about a verse in the Quran. She explained that it meant the Apostles were sure their people did not believe them, but thought they might be betrayed by Allah. `Urwa said this didn't make sense because the Apostles would never doubt Allah. Aisha clarified that the verse actually referred to the followers of the Apostles who believed in Allah and trusted their leaders, but faced a long period of trials before being helped by Allah.

title: Betrayal of the Prophets
content: `Urwa told Aisha that the prophets were betrayed by Allah. Aisha said it's impossible for Allah to betray them.

title: Five Keys to the Unseen
content: Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) said that only Allah knows five things: what will happen tomorrow, who is in a woman's womb, when it will rain, where someone will die, and when the Day of Judgment will come.

title: Date Palm Tree and Muslims
content: Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) was with his companions when he asked them to think of a tree that stays healthy all the time, never loses its leaves, and always produces fruit. I thought it might be the date palm tree, but I didn't say anything because Abu Bakr and Umar were quiet too. The Prophet (ﷺ) then said it was indeed the date palm tree. Later, I told Umar that I had thought of the same tree, but he asked me why I didn't speak up earlier. I replied that I didn't want to interrupt them, so they wouldn't think I was trying to answer first. Umar then said that if I had spoken up, it would have been more pleasing to him.

title: What Happens After We Die
content: When a Muslim dies, they will be asked two questions in their grave. They must say that only Allah is worthy of worship and that Muhammad (ﷺ) is His Messenger. This is what Allah promised to those who believe.

title: Ibn Abbas Explains Disbelief
content: When Ibn Abbas heard a verse from the Quran that said some people had turned away from Allah's favor, he explained it meant the disbelieving pagans of Mecca.

title: Angels and Heavenly Messages
content: The Prophet (ﷺ) said: When Allah decides something in heaven, the angels clap their wings in agreement with Him. The sound is like a loud noise on a rock. As they calm down, they ask each other what Allah said. They reply that it's true, and He is very powerful. Some devils try to listen in on this conversation. If one devil hears something, he might get burned before he can tell the next one below him. But if he does pass on the message, it will eventually reach the earth. A magician might hear this news and add many lies to it. When people remember what the magician said, they'll think it's true because of the original heavenly message.

title: Don't Enter Their Homes
content: When we went to the Battle of Tabuk and reached Al-Hijr, the Prophet said: 'Do not go into their homes unless you are sad. If you're not sad, don't go in. You might get what they got.'

title: Prophet's Advice on Prayer
content: Abu Sa'id was praying when the Prophet passed by. He called Abu Sa'id but Abu Sa'id didn't go to him until he finished his prayer. The Prophet (ﷺ) asked, 'Why didn't you come?' Abu Sa'id said, 'I was praying.' The Prophet (ﷺ) reminded him of a verse in the Quran that says: 'Respond to Allah and His Messenger when they call you.' Then he asked if he wanted to know which Surah is the best. When Abu Sa'id remembered it was time for the Prophet to leave the mosque, he asked again. The Prophet (ﷺ) said the best Surah is Al-Fatiha, which has seven repeated verses and is the main Quran given to him.

title: What's at the Heart of the Quran
content: Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) said, 'The main part of the Quran is seven special verses and Surah Al-Fatiha.'

title: People Who Changed Their Scripture
content: Ibn Abbas said that some people who had a book of scripture broke it into parts. They believed in some parts, but did not believe in the other parts.

title: Divided People Believe
content: Ibn Abbas said that Allah sent down a book to people who disagreed with each other. Some of them believed in it, but others did not believe. These people are the Jews and Christians.

title: Prophet's Daily Prayer
content: The Prophet (ﷺ) used to say: 'I ask Allah for protection from being poor, lazy, and old. I also ask for protection from the punishment in the grave, from the Dajjal, and from other troubles in life and death.'

title: Ibn Mas'ud's Favorite Surahs
content: Ibn Mas'ud said that Surat Bani Israel, Al-Kahf, and Mary are among the earliest chapters of the Quran revealed to the Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ).

title: Milk Chosen Over Wine
content: Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) was shown two cups: one with wine and the other with milk. He chose the milk. Gabriel said, 'Thank God for guiding you to the right path.' If he had chosen the wine, his followers would have gone astray.

title: Prophet's Night Journey
content: When the Quraish people did not believe in my night journey, I stood up inside the Kaaba. Allah showed me a special place of worship in Jerusalem. I started to tell them about its features while looking at it.

title: Tribe's Strength Measured by Children
content: In the time before Islam, if a tribe grew strong and had many children, we would say 'Amira, the children of so-and-so'.

title: The Day of Judgment
content: Some people brought cooked meat to the Prophet. He ate a piece and said he would be the leader on the Day of Resurrection. On that day, all humans from past and future will gather in one place. The sun will get very close to them, making it hard for them to bear. They will ask each other for someone to pray for them with Allah. Some people will go to Adam, saying 'You are our father.' But Adam says he disobeyed Allah and can't help them. He sends them to Noah, who also says he's too busy because of his own sins. Then they go to Abraham, but he sends them to Moses. Moses says he killed someone without permission and can't help them. They then go to Jesus, who also sends them to the Prophet. The people will come to him and say 'You are Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) and our last prophet.' He will pray for his followers with no sins, and they will enter Paradise through a special gate.

title: David's Recitation Made Easy
content: Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) said to Abu Huraira: David was given a special gift. His recitation of the Psalms became easy and quick for him. He could finish it before his servant even saddled his riding animal.

title: Angels and Prophets Worship Allah
content: Abdullah said that the verse in the Quran explains why people worship angels or prophets like Jesus. They want to get closer to Allah and hope for His mercy, but they also fear His punishment. The angels and prophets themselves only worship Allah. Some Jinn who were worshipped by Arabs became Muslims, but some humans stuck with their old ways of thinking. Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) said: 'Call on those you think are gods besides Him.'

title: Jinns Were Worshipped
content: Some Jinns were being worshipped by humans. They used to think these Jinns could help them reach God. But the Jinns actually wanted a way to get closer to God themselves. Some of these Jinns became Muslim and stopped being worshipped.

title: Muhammad's Journey to Heaven
content: Allah showed Muhammad (ﷺ) a real experience of going up to heaven as a test for people. This actually happened at night when Allah took Muhammad (ﷺ) on a journey through the heavens. The tree that is cursed and grows in Hell is called Az-Zaqqum, which is a very bitter tree.

title: Congregation Prayer Reward
content: The Prophet (ﷺ) said: A prayer in congregation is better than a single person's prayer. Angels of the day and night are present at Fajr (Morning) prayer time. The Quran recited during this time is witnessed by angels.

title: Prophets on Judgement Day
content: On the Day of Resurrection, people will kneel down. They'll ask their prophets for help. Each nation will follow its own prophet and say, 'Please pray to Allah for us.' But only Muhammad 's (ﷺ) prayer will be accepted. On that day, Allah will give him a special place of honor.

title: Prayer Before Prayer Time
content: Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) said: If you hear the prayer call and then say 'O Allah, Lord of this call and prayer, give Muhammad (ﷺ) a special place and honor him with what You promised, I will ask for your forgiveness on Judgment Day.'

title: Prophet Muhammad Destroys Idols
content: When Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) entered Mecca after its conquest, he saw 360 idols around the Kaaba. He started hitting them with a stick and said: 'Islam is true and disbelief is false.' Truth will always win over falsehood.

title: Prophet Muhammad Explains Spirit
content: I was with the Prophet on a farm. Some Jews passed by and asked him about the spirit. They wanted to know what it is. The Prophet (ﷺ) didn't answer them right away. I knew he was thinking deeply, so I stayed quiet too. After a while, Allah revealed an answer to him. Then the Prophet said: 'The knowledge of the spirit belongs to my Lord. You've only been given a little bit of knowledge.'

title: Praying in Secret
content: When the Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) was hiding in Mecca, he prayed with his friends. He would read the Quran loudly so they could hear it. But when the pagans heard him, they insulted the Quran and its message. Allah told the Prophet to pray quietly, not too loud or too soft. Just find a middle way.

title: Verse Revealed for Prayer
content: Aisha said that a verse of the Quran was revealed about making prayer to Allah.

title: Prophet's Advice on Tahajjud
content: One night, the Prophet visited Ali and Fatima. He asked them if they had prayed at night. Ali said, 'We only get up when Allah wants us to.' The Prophet (ﷺ) then read from the Quran: 'But man is more quarrelsome than anything.'

title: Moses and Al-Khadir's Journey
content: Ibn Abbas said that Nauf was wrong when he said Moses wasn't the same person as the companion of Al-Khadir. Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) told Ubai bin Ka'b a story about Moses. He asked, 'Who is the most learned person?' Moses said it was him. But Allah said, 'There's someone more knowledgeable than you.' This person was at the sea where two seas meet. Moses wanted to find this person and asked how. Allah said to put a fish in a basket and follow it. When they reached the rock, they fell asleep, and the fish got out of the basket and swam through the sea like a tunnel. The next morning, Moses was still tired, but his servant forgot about the fish. They continued their journey until they found Al-Khadir, who was covered with a garment. Moses greeted him, and Al-Khadir asked if that was how people greeted in Israel. Moses said he was Moses, and Al-Khadir asked if he was the one from the children of Israel. Moses wanted to learn from Al-Khadir, but Al-Khadir said Moses wouldn't be patient. He said they had some knowledge from Allah, but not all of it. Moses promised to be patient and follow Al-Khadir. They traveled along the sea coast until a boat passed by, and Al-Khadir got on board with Moses. When they were on the boat, Al-Khadir pulled out one of its planks, which made Moses think he was scuttling the boat to drown its people. Al-Khadir said Moses couldn't be patient. Then they got off the boat, and while walking on the shore, Al-Khadir saw a boy playing with other boys. He killed the boy, which made Moses angry because it was an innocent life. Al-Khadir said Moses still couldn't be patient. Moses then told him not to talk to him anymore if he asked any more questions. They came across people in a town who refused to feed them or give them shelter. But when they found a wall about to fall, Al-Khadir fixed it with his own hands. Moses was still upset because these people didn't treat them well. Al-Khadir said this was the end of their journey together and explained that Moses couldn't be patient.

title: Moses Meets Al-Khadir
content: One day, Moses was preaching to the people. A man asked him if there was anyone on earth more knowledgeable than him. Moses said no. But Allah told him that there was a slave of His who knew more. Moses wanted to meet this person and find out where he was. Allah said he was at the junction of two seas. Moses asked for a sign so he could recognize the place, and Allah said to look for a fish that would come alive in his basket. When the fish left the basket, Moses followed it and found Al-Khadir on a green carpet in the middle of the sea. They traveled together and came across a boat. The crew recognized Al-Khadir as a pious slave of Allah and said they wouldn't take him on board unless he paid the fare. Al-Khadir scuttled the boat, but then plugged the hole with wood so it wouldn't sink. Moses was upset and asked why Al-Khadir had done this. Al-Khadir said that Moses couldn't be patient with him. They continued their journey and found a boy playing. Al-Khadir killed the boy, which made Moses very upset. He asked why Al-Khadir had done such a thing. Al-Khadir explained that he was trying to protect the boy's parents from his evil ways. They then came across a wall that was about to fall down, and Al-Khadir set it straight with just one touch of his hand. Moses was amazed and asked why Al-Khadir had done this for free. Al-Khadir said they could have taken payment if they wanted to eat from it. As they continued on their journey, a king who took over every ship that passed by came into view. Al-Khadir didn't want the boat to be taken, so he scuttled it again and plugged the hole with tar this time. Moses was upset again, but Al-Khadir explained that he had killed an innocent boy to protect his parents from his evil ways. They were then compensated by being given a girl instead.

title: Moses meets Al-Khadir
content: Ibn Abbas said that the Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) said: 'One day Moses was giving a speech to his people. Someone asked,

title: What the Verse Meant
content: I asked my father about a verse from the Quran. He said it wasn't revealed about Al-Haruriyya, but about Jews and Christians who don't believe in Muhammad (ﷺ) or Paradise. Al-Haruriyya are people who promise to do something good but then break their promise. Sa'd used to call them 'evildoers'.

title: Fat Man on Judgement Day
content: Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) said: On the Day of Resurrection, a very fat man will come. He won't be given any weight in Allah's sight, not even as much as a mosquito's wing.

title: Death on Judgement Day
content: Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) said: On the Day of Resurrection, a black and white ram will be brought forward. It will be called out to people going to Paradise and Hell. They will look at it carefully and say 'Yes, that's Death.' Then the ram will be slaughtered, and it will be announced that those in Paradise will live forever without death, while those in Hell will also live forever without death.

title: Gabriel's Visits to the Prophet
content: Ibn Abbas said that one day the Prophet asked Gabriel why he didn't visit them more often. Gabriel replied, 'We angels only come when Allah tells us to. He knows everything about what has happened and will happen.'

title: Khabbab's Debt Dispute
content: I went to Al-'Asi bin Wail and asked for the money he owed me. He said, 'I won't give it to you unless you stop believing in Muhammad (ﷺ).' I replied, 'No, I'll never stop believing in him until you die and are brought back to life again.' He asked if that would really happen, and I said yes. Then he said, 'If that's the case, I'll have wealth and children there, and I can pay you then.' This is when the Quranic verse was revealed: 'Have you seen someone who doesn't believe in Our signs, but says they will be given wealth and children?'

title: Khabbab's Encounter with Al-'Asi
content: I was a blacksmith in Mecca. I made a sword for Al-'Asi bin Wail As-Sahmi. When I asked him to pay me, he said, 'I won't give it to you unless you stop believing in Muhammad (ﷺ).' I replied, 'I'll never stop believing in Muhammad (ﷺ) until Allah takes your life and brings you back to life again.' He said, 'If that happens, I'll have wealth and children.' Allah then revealed a message saying: 'Have you seen someone who disbelieves in Allah's signs but thinks they will get rich and have many children? Does this person know something about the future or has Allah made them promise not to be grateful?'

title: Khabbab's Debt Dispute
content: Khabbab was a blacksmith. Al-Asi owed him money. Khabbab went to ask for it back. Al-Asi said, 'I won't pay you until you stop believing in Muhammad (ﷺ).' Khabbab replied, 'I'll never stop believing in Muhammad (ﷺ) until Allah takes you away and brings you back.' Al-Asi said, 'Then wait till I die and come back. I'll be rich with children and can pay you then.' This verse was revealed: 'Do you see someone who doesn't believe in our signs? He says he will get wealth and children.'

title: Khabbab's Debt Problem
content: I was a blacksmith. Al-Asi Bin Wail owed me money. I went to him to ask for it back. He said, 'I won't pay you until you don't believe in Muhammad (ﷺ).' I said, 'I won't stop believing in Muhammad (ﷺ) even if you die and come back to life.' He said, 'Will that really happen? If so, I'll pay you when I'm resurrected, if I have money and children then.' This made Allah reveal a message: 'Have you seen someone who doesn't believe in Allah's signs but thinks they will get rich and have kids? Does this person know something we don't or did they promise Allah to be good? No! We'll write down what they say and add to their punishment. And when they die, we'll take everything they thought was theirs, and they'll face us alone.'

title: Adam and Moses Meet
content: Abu Huraira said that the Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) said: Adam met Moses. Moses said to Adam, 'You made people unhappy and got them kicked out of Paradise.' Adam replied, 'But Allah chose you for a special message and picked you for Himself. He even gave you the Torah.' Moses said, 'Yes, I did find that written in your fate before you were created.' But Adam's answer was stronger.

title: Fasting on Ashura Day
content: When the Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) arrived in Medina, he saw some Jews fasting on a special day called Ashura. He asked them why they were fasting and they said it was to remember when Moses won against Pharaoh. The Prophet (ﷺ) then told his followers, 'We are closer to Moses than these people, so let's also fast on this day'.

title: Adam and Moses Argue
content: Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) said: Adam argued with Moses. Moses blamed Adam for getting people out of Paradise because of his sin, making them unhappy. Adam replied that Allah chose Moses to receive His message and speak directly to him. He asked why Moses blamed him for something Allah had already decided before creating him. Adam's argument won over Moses.

title: Prophet's Early Learning
content: Abdullah said the Prophet learned by heart five old Suras: Bani Israel, Al-Kahf, Mariyam, Taha and Al-Anbiya. These were his first to memorize.

title: The Day of Judgement
content: The Prophet (ﷺ) said: 'On the Day of Resurrection, people will be gathered before Allah without shoes, clothes, or circumcision. This is a promise from Allah that He will keep. The first person to wear clothes on that day will be Abraham. Some of my followers will be taken away and I'll ask, 'Lord, these are my friends!' But it will be said, 'You don't know what new things they added after you left.' Then I'll say what Jesus said: 'I was a witness among them, but You see everything.' It will be said, 'These people never stopped being disbelievers since you left them'.

title: Adam's Warning on Judgment Day
content: The Prophet (ﷺ) said: On the day of judgment, Allah will call out to Adam. Adam will answer 'Here I am, Lord.' Then Allah will say, 'Take 999 from every thousand people and send them to the fire.' At that time, all pregnant women will have their babies, and children will be born with grey hair. People will look confused, but it's because of Allah's great punishment. The Prophet (ﷺ) said this, and his followers were very worried. They looked pale. The Prophet (ﷺ) reassured them: 'From Gog and Magog, 999 will go to the fire, and one from you will stay.' He compared them to a small hair on an animal. He hoped that Muslims would be a quarter of those in Paradise. His followers said 'God is great!' The Prophet (ﷺ) then said he hoped they would be one-third of those in Paradise, and again his followers said 'God is great!' Finally, the Prophet said he hoped they would be half of those in Paradise, and once more his followers said 'God is great!'

title: A Man's Changing Faith
content: Ibn Abbas said a man would visit Medina. If his wife had a son and his horses had babies, he'd say Islam is good. But if his wife didn't have a child and his horses didn't breed, he'd say Islam is bad.

title: Abu Dharr's Story
content: Qais bin Ubad said that Abu Dharr swore an oath. He said the Verse 'These two opponents dispute about their Lord' was revealed when Hamza and his friends went to fight at Badr, and so did Utbah and his friends.

title: Ali's Dispute with Allah
content: Ali said he will be the first to pray to Allah on Judgment Day because of a disagreement. Qais explained that this was about people who went to fight in the Battle of Badr, including Ali and others.

title: A Man Finds His Wife
content: 'Uwaimir found another man with his wife. He asked 'Asim what to do. 'Asim said he would ask the Prophet, but the Prophet didn't like such questions. 'Uwaimir insisted and went to the Prophet himself. The Prophet (ﷺ) said that Allah had a solution in the Quran. They followed this solution, called Mula'ana. If 'Uwaimir's wife had a black child with certain features, it would prove he was telling the truth. But if she had a red child, it would mean he lied. Later, she gave birth to a child matching the Prophet's description.

title: Marriage Dispute Resolved
content: A man asked the Prophet about what to do if he caught his wife with another man. The Prophet (ﷺ) said a law would be revealed, and it was. A couple involved in this situation got divorced. This led to a new rule: when a husband denies being the father of a pregnant wife's child, the child will inherit from her as her son.

title: Accusing a Wife of Adultery
content: Hilal accused his wife of having sex with Sharik. He took the case to the Prophet, who said Hilal must bring four witnesses or face punishment. Hilal asked if they should look for witnesses. The Prophet (ﷺ) repeated his message: find witnesses or be punished. Gabriel came down and revealed a verse from the Quran about accusing wives. The Prophet (ﷺ) recited it, saying that if one of them is lying, Allah will know. He sent for the woman and Hilal brought her. They took oaths to confirm the accusation. The Prophet (ﷺ) asked if anyone would repent. The woman took more oaths but hesitated at the fifth one. She said she wouldn't deny her family's honor and continued with the process. The Prophet (ﷺ) said to watch her, as a child born like Sharik's would prove her guilt. Later, she gave birth to a baby matching that description. The Prophet (ﷺ) said he would have punished her severely if Allah's law hadn't settled the case.

title: Accusing a Wife Unfairly
content: Ibn Umar said: A man accused his wife of having an affair and denied the child was his. The Prophet (ﷺ) told them to do a special prayer, as Allah had ordered. After that, he decided the child belonged with its mother. He also gave the couple a divorce.

title: Aisha Remembers Abdullah
content: Aisha said: One of the men who had more wealth was Abdullah bin Ubai bin Salul.

title: Aisha's Story of Slander
content: When Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) wanted to go on a journey, he would draw lots among his wives and take the one who got the lot. One time, I was chosen for a Ghazwa (a military campaign). When we returned, some people spread false rumors about me. They said I had done something wrong with my slave. But it wasn't true. I was innocent. The Prophet (ﷺ) asked Barira, his slave girl, if she knew anything about the situation. She said that I sometimes fell asleep and left food unattended, but that's all. The Prophet (ﷺ) then stood on the pulpit and asked for someone to help him against the man who had spread these false rumors. Sa'd bin Mu'adh was willing to kill the man, but another man from the Khazraj tribe disagreed. This led to a big argument between the two tribes. The Prophet (ﷺ) tried to calm them down, but I was so sad and upset that I didn't sleep for three days and nights. Finally, Allah revealed a verse that declared my innocence. Abu Bakr, who had been helping Mistah bin Uthatha because of his poverty, said he would no longer help him after the rumors were spread. But then Allah revealed another verse saying that those who are good and wealthy should forgive their relatives in need. Abu Bakr was so happy to be forgiven by Allah that he started giving Mistah aid again.

title: Aisha Accused: Aisha Falls
content: Um Ruman said that when Aisha was accused of something, she fell unconscious.

title: Aisha's Reminder to Muslims
content: Ibn Abi Mulaika said he heard Aisha say: 'When you make up a lie and repeat it, remember that Allah is watching.'

title: Ibn Abbas Visits Aisha
content: Ibn Abbas asked to visit Aisha when she was ill. She said she didn't want him to praise her too much. He told her he was a cousin of the Prophet and a respected Muslim, so she allowed him in. When he visited, Ibn Abbas said 'How are you?' Aisha replied that she was okay if Allah protected her. Then Ibn Abbas said that because she was married to the Prophet, who only married one virgin (Aisha), and proof of her innocence had come from God, she should feel safe. Later, Ibn Az-Zubair visited too. Aisha told him about Ibn Abbas's visit and how he praised her a lot. She wished she could just be forgotten.

title: Ibn Abbas Asks Aisha's Permission
content: Ibn `Abbas asked Aisha if he could enter. Al-Qasim then told us what Ibn `Abbas had said, but he left out one part: 'I wish I was forgotten and not seen'.

title: Hassan bin Thabit's Visit
content: Hassan bin Thabit asked Aisha for permission to visit her. She said she wasn't sure if it was a good idea because he had lost his sight as a punishment. Hassan then recited a poem saying that Aisha was a chaste and pious woman who didn't gossip about others. But Aisha replied, 'You're not like that'.

title: Hassan Visits Aisha
content: Hassan came to visit Aisha. He recited a poem about a good woman who doesn't talk badly about others behind their backs. Aisha replied, 'But you're not like that.' Hassan said, 'Why do you let someone like him enter your house when the Quran says some people are more guilty than others?' Aisha said, 'The worst punishment is being blind.' She also said that this person used to defend the Prophet against his enemies.

title: Prophet Muhammad's Defense of Aisha
content: Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) stood up to defend his wife Aisha. Some people had spread a false story about her, saying she was with another man. The Prophet (ﷺ) asked the people for their opinion on this matter. One man suggested chopping off the heads of those who made the accusation. But then someone else pointed out that if they were from a different tribe, he wouldn't want to harm them. Aisha's mother and father knew about the story but didn't feel as upset as Aisha did. They told her to be calm and not worry. The Prophet (ﷺ) sent a servant with Aisha to her parents' house. Her mother said that Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) already knew about the story, and so did Abu Bakr. Aisha was very sad and cried. When she returned home, the Prophet asked his maid-servant about Aisha's character. The maid said she didn't know of any fault in Aisha except that she slept during the day and let sheep enter her house to eat her dough. Some companions spoke harshly to the maid, but then they told her about the affair. She said she knew nothing against Aisha except what a goldsmith knows about pure gold. The man who was accused of being with Aisha denied it and said he had never uncovered any woman's private parts. He was later martyred in Allah's Cause. The next morning, Aisha's parents came to visit her, and the Prophet came after offering his Asr prayer. He praised and glorified Allah and told Aisha that if she had done something wrong, she should repent to Allah. An Ansari woman was sitting nearby, so the Prophet gave some advice. Aisha asked her father to answer for her, but he didn't know what to say. Then Aisha turned to her mother, but she also didn't know what to say. So Aisha testified that there is no god except Allah and that Muhammad (ﷺ) is His Messenger. She said if she told the truth about not doing anything wrong, it wouldn't help because people had already spoken badly of her. And if she confessed to doing something wrong when she hadn't, they would say she was guilty. Aisha compared herself to Joseph's father, who said patience is most fitting against what they were accusing him of. At that moment, Allah revealed a message to the Prophet, and we remained silent. Then the message was over, and I saw the signs of happiness on his face while he was removing sweat from his forehead and saying, 'Have good tidings O Aisha! Allah has revealed your innocence.'

title: Women's Veil in Islam
content: Prophet Muhammad 's (ﷺ) wife 'Aishah said: May Allah be merciful to the women who first left their homes. When Allah revealed a verse saying they should cover their bodies, faces and necks with clothing, these women tore their old clothes and used them to cover themselves.

title: Veiling in Islam
content: When the Prophet asked women to cover themselves, they cut their long shirts into pieces and used them as veils to cover their heads and faces.

title: Walking on one's face
content: A man asked Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) if non-believers will be gathered with their faces to the ground on Judgment Day. The Prophet (ﷺ) said, 'If Allah can make a person walk on their feet in this life, why not on their face in the next?'

title: Biggest Sins in Islam
content: Abdullah asked the Prophet, 'What is the biggest sin in Allah's sight?' The Prophet (ﷺ) replied, 'Setting up something equal to Allah as a god.' Abdullah asked again, 'What's next?' The Prophet (ﷺ) said, 'Killing your own child because you're afraid they'll take food from you.' Abdullah asked once more, 'What's next?' The Prophet (ﷺ) said, 'Having sex with someone else's wife.' Then the Quran confirmed this: 'Don't worship anything but Allah and don't kill unless it's to protect yourself. Don't have sex outside of marriage.'

title: Murdering a Believer
content: Al-Qasim asked Sa'id about repentance for intentionally killing a Muslim. He recited the verse 'Nor kill such life as Allah has forbidden except for a just cause.' Sa'id said he had already read this to Ibn Abbas, who explained that it was revealed in Mecca but later abrogated by another verse in Surat An-Nisa.

title: Killing a Muslim
content: Sa'id bin Jubair asked Ibn Abbas about the people of Kufa who disagreed on what to do with someone who kills a Muslim. Ibn Abbas said that the last verse revealed about this issue is in Surat An-Nisa', and it's still valid.

title: No Repentance for Murderer
content: Sa'id bin Jubair asked Ibn 'Abbas about a verse in the Quran. The verse says that some people will get Hell Fire as their reward. Ibn 'Abbas said, 'If someone kills a Muslim, no one can stop them from going to Hell.' Sa'id bin Jubair then asked about another verse. This verse says not to call on any god except Allah. Ibn 'Abbas said this verse was for the people who didn't believe in Allah before Islam.

title: Murdering a Believer
content: Sa'id bin Jubair asked Ibn 'Abbas about two verses from the Quran. One verse says that if someone intentionally kills a Muslim, they will go to Hell. The other verse says not to kill any living thing unless it's for a good reason. Ibn 'Abbas explained that when these verses were revealed, the people of Mecca said they had done wrong by worshipping other gods and killing animals Allah considered sacred. They also admitted to having sex outside marriage. Allah then forgave them if they repented, believed in Him, and did good deeds.

title: Ibn Abbas Explains Two Verses
content: Sa'id bin Jubair asked Ibn Abbas about two important verses in the Quran. The first verse says that if someone intentionally kills a Muslim, they will be punished. Ibn Abbas said this verse is still valid and has not been cancelled out by any other verse. The second verse warns against worshiping anyone or anything except Allah. Ibn Abbas explained that this verse was revealed specifically for the pagans.

title: Five Great Events
content: Abdullah said: Five important events have happened. They are the Smoke, the Moon splitting in two, the defeat of the Romans, a great disaster that will happen soon, and a constant punishment that people will face forever.

title: Abraham's Father on Judgment Day
content: Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) said: Abraham will see his father on the Day of Resurrection. His face will be dark because he used to cover himself with dust and ashes when he was sad or worried.

title: Abraham's Promise on Judgement Day
content: Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) said that Abraham will meet his father again after resurrection. He will ask Allah why he was not given a good place in Paradise, as promised. Allah will say that Paradise is only for believers.

title: Prophet Warns Quraish Tribe
content: When the Prophet received a message from Allah to warn his tribe, he went up to a mountain and called out to them. He asked if they would believe him if he told them an enemy army was coming to attack them. They said yes because they knew he always spoke the truth. The Prophet (ﷺ) then warned them about a great punishment. Abu Lahab, one of the Prophet's uncles, disagreed and said it was pointless gathering like this. Allah then revealed a message saying that Abu Lahab and his family would not be saved from punishment.

title: Prophet Muhammad Warns His Tribe
content: When the verse was revealed, Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) stood up and said to his tribe: 'Quraish people, take care of yourselves. I can't protect you from Allah if you disobey Him.' He also warned his relatives, including Abbas, Safiya, and Fatima, saying he couldn't save them from Allah's punishment if they disobeyed.

title: Abu Talib's Final Moments
content: When Abu Talib was dying, the Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) visited him. He found Abu Jahl and Abdullah bin Abi Umaiya with him. The Prophet (ﷺ) said to Abu Talib: 'Say that there is no god but Allah.' But Abu Jahl and Abdullah refused to say this. They wanted Abu Talib to stay with his old religion. The Prophet (ﷺ) kept asking Abu Talib to say the words, but he refused. When Abu Talib died, the Prophet prayed for forgiveness for him. However, Allah revealed a message saying that only those who believe can ask for forgiveness for others. This meant the Prophet couldn't pray for forgiveness for Abu Talib anymore.

title: Ibn Abbas Explains a Verse
content: Ibn Abbas said: The verse 'We will bring you home' in the Quran means to Mecca, our home city.

title: Smoke on the Day of Judgement
content: A man from the tribe of Kinda gave a speech about the Day of Resurrection. He said that smoke would cover everything and make hypocrites lose their senses, but believers would only feel like they had a cold. This scared some people, so they went to Abdullah Ibn Mas'ud for advice. He told them it's better to say 'Allah knows best' if you don't know something. The Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) was asked by Allah to share the Quran with others, and he said he didn't ask for anything in return. Some people from the Quraish tribe delayed accepting Islam, so the Prophet prayed for help against them. He asked Allah to send a famine like the one Joseph experienced, which happened and caused great suffering. People saw smoke between the sky and earth because of their hunger. Abu Sufyan came to the Prophet and asked him to pray for his family, who were struggling. Then Ibn Mas'ud recited a verse from the Quran that talks about smoke on the Day of Judgement. The punishment was stopped, but they went back to their old ways. Allah threatened them with a great punishment, which happened on the day of the Battle of Badr. Another verse says that the Romans were defeated, but later won again.

title: Children are Born Muslim
content: Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) said: 'No child is born without being a Muslim. Their parents then make them Jewish, Christian or Magian. Just like an animal gives birth to a complete creature, no part of it is missing.' He also recited this verse from the Quran: 'The true faith is to worship only Allah. This is how Allah created humans. There should be no change in this faith. It's the straight path, but most people don't understand'.

title: Companions' Concern About Faith
content: When the verse 'It is those who believe and confuse not their beliefs with wrong' was revealed, the companions of the Prophet were worried. They thought they might have mixed up their faith with bad things. The Prophet (ﷺ) said, 'This verse doesn't mean you've done that. Remember what Luqman told his son: 'Worshipping anyone but Allah is a big mistake.'

title: What is Belief and Islam?
content: A man came to the Prophet while he was sitting with people. He asked, 'What is belief?' The Prophet (ﷺ) said, 'Believe in Allah, His angels, His books, His messengers, and that you will meet Him again after you die.' The man asked, 'What is Islam?' The Prophet (ﷺ) replied, 'Islam means worshipping only Allah, praying regularly, giving charity to those who need it, and fasting during the month of Ramadan.' The man also asked about something called Ihsan. The Prophet (ﷺ) said, 'Ihsan means treating Allah as if you can see Him. If you can't do that, know that He sees everything you do.' The man then asked when the Day of Judgment would come. The Prophet (ﷺ) said he didn't know but could describe some signs that will happen before it comes. These signs include a slave woman giving birth to her master and people who are poor and naked becoming leaders. Only Allah knows when the Day of Judgment will be.

title: Five Keys to the Unseen
content: Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) said that there are five important things that only Allah knows. He then read a verse from the Quran, saying that only Allah knows when the Day of Judgment will come.

title: Allah's Reward for the Pious
content: Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) said that Allah promised His devoted followers amazing rewards they can't even imagine. These rewards are beyond what anyone has ever seen, heard, or thought of. If you want to read more about this, it says in the Quran: 'No one knows what happy surprises Allah has prepared for them as a reward for their good deeds'.

title: Allah's Reward for the Pious
content: The Prophet (ﷺ) said that Allah told him He has prepared amazing rewards for those who are good and obedient. These rewards are so great, no one can imagine them. They are more wonderful than anything we have ever seen or heard.

title: Prophet's closeness to believers
content: The Prophet (ﷺ) said: 'I am the closest person to every believer in this world and the next. If a believer dies with property, their relatives get it. But if they have debts or children who are poor, those people should come to me for help. I will take care of them.'

title: Calling Adopted Sons by Their Fathers
content: Abdullah bin Umar said: We used to call Zaid, who was a freed slave of the Prophet's, 'Zaid bin Muhammad (ﷺ)'. But then Allah revealed a verse saying we should call adopted sons by their father's name.

title: Anas and the Verse
content: Anas said that he thinks a certain verse of the Quran was revealed about his uncle Anas bin Nadr. This verse praises people who keep their promises to Allah.

title: Missing Verse in Surah Ahzab
content: Zaid bin Thabit said: When we collected the Quran's fragments into complete copies, I missed one verse from Surat al-Ahzab. It was a verse that Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) used to read. I asked many people about it but couldn't find it anywhere until I found Khuza'ima Al-Ansari. He was someone whose testimony was equal to two men in the eyes of Allah's Messenger (ﷺ). The missing verse said: 'Among the believers are those who keep their promises with Allah.'

title: Aisha's Conversation with the Prophet
content: The Prophet (ﷺ) came to me and said he had a message from Allah. He wanted to tell his wives something, but asked me not to decide right away. I should talk to my parents first. But I told him, 'I don't need to ask them because I want what Allah wants.'

title: Aisha's Decision on Divorce
content: When Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) was told to ask his wives if they wanted a divorce, he started with me. He said: 'Don't rush to answer unless you talk to your parents.' But I knew my parents wouldn't tell me to leave him. Then the Prophet read out some verses from the Quran: 'If you want this world and its pleasures, it's okay. But if you want a great reward in the next life...' I replied: 'I'm looking for Allah's pleasure, the Prophet's guidance, and the home of the Hereafter.' The other wives did the same as me.

title: Zainab's Secret Revealed
content: Anas said the verse 'But you did hide in your mind that which Allah was about to make manifest' was revealed because of Zainab and her husband Zaid. They had kept a secret.

title: Aisha's Change of Heart
content: I used to think badly of the women who married the Prophet. I thought it was strange for a woman to give herself to a man. But then Allah revealed a verse that said the Prophet could delay or choose which wife he wanted to be with at any time. When I read this, I felt happy because I knew my husband's wishes were being quickly accepted by Allah.

title: The Prophet's Permission
content: When the verse was revealed that allowed him to choose which wife he wanted to stay with, the Prophet would ask for permission from his current wife if he wanted to go to another one. Aisha said she used to say to him, 'If I could stop you from going, I wouldn't let you visit anyone else.'

title: Umar Asks for Veil
content: One day, Umar said to the Prophet: 'Some good and some bad people come to visit you. I think it's a good idea if your wives wear veils.' Then Allah sent down some verses about covering up.

title: Prophet Muhammad's Guests
content: When the Prophet married Zainab bint Jahsh, he invited people to a meal. They ate and stayed sitting and talking. The Prophet (ﷺ) showed them that it was time to leave, but they didn't get up. He got up and they followed him, except for three men who stayed seated. The Prophet (ﷺ) went back out, then left again. His friend Anas went to tell him the guests had gone home. The Prophet (ﷺ) came in with Zainab, but put a screen between himself and Anas. Later, Allah revealed a message: 'Believers, don't enter the Prophet's houses without permission.'

title: Prophet's Home Visits
content: Anas bin Malik said: I know this verse well. When the Prophet married Zainab bint Jahsh, she was living with him in his house. He invited people for a meal and they ate together. After eating, they started talking. The Prophet (ﷺ) went out and came back several times while they were still sitting and chatting. Then Allah revealed a verse saying: 'Don't go into the Prophet's houses unless he invites you.' If he does invite you, don't wait for food to be ready - just eat what is available. Instead, ask his family from behind a screen. So a screen was set up and people left.

title: Prophet's Wedding Banquet
content: I was sent to invite people to the Prophet's wedding banquet. Many groups came and ate, then left. I kept inviting until there were no more guests. The Prophet (ﷺ) said, 'Take away the leftover food.' Three men stayed behind chatting. The Prophet (ﷺ) went out to visit his wives, saying 'Peace be with you' to each one. They all replied in the same way. When he returned, he found three men still talking. He was shy and left again. As soon as he entered Aisha's home, a verse from the Quran was revealed.

title: The Prophet's Wedding Banquet
content: When the Prophet married Zainab bint Jahsh, he invited people to a big meal. After that, he visited his wives as usual in the morning. He greeted them and wished good for them, and they did the same back. When he returned home, he saw two men talking inside. He went out again, thinking they might be disturbing him. The two men quickly left when they saw the Prophet coming out. I'm not sure if I told him they were leaving or someone else did. Anyway, the Prophet came back in and closed the curtain between us. Then a verse from the Quran was revealed about covering ourselves from each other.

title: Sauda's Veil and Call of Nature
content: After the Prophet ordered women to wear veils, Sauda went out to answer nature. Umar saw her and said she couldn't hide from them. The Prophet (ﷺ) was inspired and when it ended, he told Sauda that women were allowed to go outside for their needs.

title: Aflah's Visit to Aisha
content: After a new rule was made about women visiting the Prophet, a man named Aflah asked Aisha for permission to visit her. She said she wouldn't let him in unless she checked with the Prophet first. The Prophet (ﷺ) came in and Aisha explained that it wasn't actually Aflah who had taken care of her as a baby, but his wife. The Prophet (ﷺ) told Aisha to let Aflah in because he was her uncle. He also reminded her that some rules apply to both blood relatives and those who raised you.

title: Greeting and Praying for the Prophet
content: Some people asked the Prophet how to pray for him. He said: 'Say: Allah, give blessings to Muhammad (ﷺ) and to the family of Muhammad (ﷺ), just like you gave blessings to Abraham. You are Praiseworthy and Glorious.'

title: How to Pray for the Prophet
content: Abu Sa'id Al-Khudri asked the Prophet: 'We know how to greet you, but how should we pray for you?' The Prophet (ﷺ) said: 'Say: Allah, bless Muhammad (ﷺ), your servant and messenger, as You blessed Abraham. And give peace to Muhammad (ﷺ), just like You gave peace to Abraham.'

title: Moses Was Shy
content: Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) said that Moses was a shy person. Allah's message says not to be like those who made Moses angry, but Allah proved Moses was right and he is respected by Allah.

title: Angels and Devils in Heaven
content: Allah's Prophet said: When Allah decides something in heaven, the angels show their agreement by moving their wings. They ask each other what Allah has ordered, and they say He has given a true and just order. The devils hear this and pass it down to those below them. Sometimes a fire can stop a devil from passing on the message, but sometimes he gets it through first. A magician then adds many lies to the message, making people think he was right because of what they heard from heaven.

title: Prophet Warns Quraish
content: One day the Prophet went to Safa mountain and said, 'Oh people of Quraish!' The whole tribe gathered around him. They asked, 'What's wrong?' He replied, 'If I told you an enemy is coming tomorrow or tonight, would you believe me?' They said, 'Yes, we trust you.' He warned them about a great punishment. Abu Lahab spoke up and said, 'May you be destroyed! What's the point of gathering us here?' Allah then revealed a verse: 'Abu Lahab will perish'.

title: Sun Sets in Prayer
content: Abu Dharr was with the Prophet in the mosque at sunset. The Prophet (ﷺ) asked Abu Dharr where the sun goes when it sets. Abu Dharr said he didn't know. The Prophet (ﷺ) explained that the sun moves and prostrates under Allah's Throne, as mentioned in the Quran: 'The sun follows its path for a set time. This is the decree of the All-Mighty, the All-Knowing.'

title: Sun's Movement Explained
content: Abu Dharr asked the Prophet about a verse in the Quran. The Prophet (ﷺ) said that the sun moves under Allah's Throne. He also explained that when the Quran talks about objects like trees and stars prostrating, it means they obey their Creator.

title: Allah's Messenger on Jonah
content: Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) said, 'No one is better than Jonah bin Matta.'

title: Don't Say Prophet is Better
content: The Prophet (ﷺ) said, 'If someone says I am better than Jonah bin Matta, they are lying.'

title: Prostrating in Surah Sa'd
content: Al-Awwam asked Mujahid about prostrating when reading Surat Sa`d. Mujahid said Ibn `Abbas was asked the same question and he replied, 'Follow the guidance of those Allah has guided.' Ibn `Abbas would actually perform a prostration when reading this Sura.

title: Prostration in Surah Sa'd
content: Al-Awwam asked Mujahid about prostrating while reading Surat Sa`d. Mujahid said he asked Ibn `Abbas, 'What makes you prostrate?' Ibn `Abbas replied, 'Look at the verse:

title: Prophet Overcomes a Demon
content: Abu Huraira said the Prophet told him that a demon came to disturb his prayer. But Allah gave the Prophet power over the demon. The Prophet (ﷺ) wanted to tie the demon to a mosque pillar so everyone could see it, but then he remembered Solomon's prayer: 'Forgive me and give me a kingdom.' The Prophet (ﷺ) let the demon go.

title: Abdullah bin Mas'ud's Advice
content: We met Abdullah bin Mas'ud and he said: 'If you don't know something, say

title: Can We Repent for Our Sins?
content: Some non-Muslims who had committed many murders and had a lot of forbidden relationships came to the Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ). They asked, 'Prophet, we want to know if we can make up for our past wrongdoings.' The Quran said: 'Do not worship anyone but Allah, do not kill someone unless you must, and do not have any forbidden relationships.' It also said: 'Tell those who did wrong, do not lose hope in Allah's mercy.'

title: Rabbi Meets the Prophet
content: A Jewish Rabbi came to see the Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ). The Rabbi said that Allah will gather all of creation on one finger, then say 'I am the King.' The Prophet (ﷺ) smiled and nodded in agreement. This confirmed what the Rabbi believed. The Prophet (ﷺ) then recited a verse from the Quran: 'On Judgment Day, the earth will be held by Allah's hand and the heavens rolled up with His right hand. He is Glorified and Exalted above all that people associate with Him.'

title: Allah's Power and Dominion
content: Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) said: 'One day Allah will hold the whole earth in His right hand. He'll roll up all the heavens like a scroll. Then He'll say,

title: The Prophet's Vision
content: Abu Huraira said that the Prophet said: 'When the trumpet blows for the second time, I will be the first to stand up. Then I'll see Moses sitting on a throne. I won't know if he was already there or got there after the trumpet blew.'

title: Forty Days Before Trumpet
content: Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) said: 'Between the two trumpet sounds, there will be a period of forty. The people asked Abu Huraira if it was forty days or years. He didn't answer. Then he said that everything in our bodies will decay except for one bone at the bottom, and Allah will rebuild our bodies from that bone.'

title: Abu Bakr saves the Prophet
content: I asked Abdullah bin Amr about a bad thing that happened to the Prophet. He said: The Prophet (ﷺ) was praying in front of the Kaaba when Uqba grabbed him and twisted his clothes around his neck. Abu Bakr came and pushed Uqba away from the Prophet. Then he said, 'Why are you hurting someone who says

title: Allah Hears Our Conversations
content: Ibn Mas`ud said: Some people from Quraish and Thaqif were in a house. They wondered if Allah hears their talks. Some thought He only hears some of what they say, while others believed that if He can hear part of it, He must be able to hear everything. Then the Quran revealed: 'Your ears, eyes, and skin will testify against you if you don't think Allah is listening.'

title: Three Men Discuss Allah's Hearing
content: Near the Kaaba, three men from different tribes gathered. One was from Quraish and two were from Thaqif. They had big bellies but not much sense. One said, 'Do you think Allah hears us?' Another said, 'Allah only listens when we speak loudly.' The third man disagreed and said, 'If He can hear loud voices, then He must also hear quiet ones.' Then Allah revealed a verse: 'Your ears, eyes, and skin will testify against you...' (41.22-23)

title: Kindness to the Prophet's Family
content: Ibn Abbas was asked about a verse in the Quran that says 'except to be kind to me for my kinship with you'. Sa'id bin Zubair thought it meant being kind to Muhammad 's (ﷺ) relatives. Ibn Abbas said, 'No, it means being kind to all your relatives.' The Prophet (ﷺ) had many relatives from the Quraish tribe.

title: Prophet's Prayer on the Pulpit
content: I heard the Prophet reciting a prayer when he was on the pulpit. He said: 'They will cry,

title: Five Important Events
content: Abdullah said: Five things have happened. They are: smoke, the Romans were defeated, the moon was split in two, we won against our enemies at Badr, and a punishment came upon them.

title: Famine and Disobedience
content: The Prophet (ﷺ) asked Allah to punish the Quraish for not listening to him. They suffered a famine so severe that people thought they saw smoke in the sky because of their extreme hunger. A man from the tribe came to the Prophet and asked him to pray for rain, which he did. It rained and helped them. But after the famine ended, they went back to their old ways of not believing in Allah. The Prophet (ﷺ) was sad about this and prayed for punishment.

title: Knowing What You Don't Know
content: Abdullah said that having knowledge means saying 'Allah knows better' when you don't know something. The Prophet (ﷺ) was told to say, 'I don't ask for payment for sharing the Quran.' When the Quraish were against him, he prayed for help from Allah, asking Him to make them suffer like Joseph's people did during a seven-year famine. They suffered so much that they ate bones and dead animals. They asked Allah to stop the punishment, saying they believed in Him. But if He stopped it, they would go back to their old ways. So Allah removed the punishment for now, but later punished them at Badr, as mentioned in the Quran: 'One day a thick smoke will fill the sky...Then we will punish them severely.'

title: Prophet's Prayer for Help
content: Abdullah said the Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) asked Allah to help him against his people, Quraish. They didn't believe in Islam and opposed him. The Prophet (ﷺ) prayed: 'O Allah, make them suffer a famine like Joseph had.' A year of drought came and everything was destroyed. People were very hungry and tired. They even ate dead animals. Abdullah then recited a verse from the Quran: 'On the Day when smoke will cover people, it will be a painful punishment.' He explained that this punishment would come back again on Judgment Day.

title: Prophet Muhammad's Message
content: Allah told Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) to say: 'I don't ask for payment for sharing the Quran. I'm not a liar.' When the Quraish people stood against him, he asked Allah to make them suffer like Joseph did, with seven years of famine. A year of drought came and destroyed everything. People ate bones and hides. Abu Sufyan went to Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) and said his people were in trouble. The Prophet (ﷺ) prayed for them and the famine ended. He warned them they would go back to their old ways. Abdullah recited a verse from the Quran: 'Watch out for the day when smoke comes from the sky.' He said, 'Will Allah forgive them or punish them again?'

title: Five Important Events
content: Abdullah said that five things have happened: Al-Lizam, the Romans were defeated, a strong earthquake occurred, the moon was seen split in two, and there was a big cloud of smoke.

title: Allah's Message about Time
content: The Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) said that Allah told him: 'Humans hurt me when they waste time. I am the one who controls everything, including day and night cycles.'

title: Marwan's Oath of Allegiance
content: Marwan was in charge of Hijaz. He gave a speech and mentioned Yazid as the next leader. `Abdur Rahman spoke up, so Marwan ordered him arrested. But `Abdur Rahman went to Aisha's house, where he couldn't be caught. Marwan said that Allah had revealed a verse about someone like `Abdur Rahman who didn't want his parents to forgive him. Aisha replied from behind a screen, 'Allah only revealed something connected to my innocence'.

title: Allah's Messenger and Clouds
content: I, Aisha, was with the Prophet. I never saw him laugh loudly, but he would smile sometimes. When he saw clouds or strong winds, his face showed concern. I asked him, 'Why do you look worried when people see clouds as a good sign?' He said, 'There's no guarantee that a cloud won't bring punishment. Some people were punished by a wind while they thought it would bring rain.'

title: Prophet Muhammad's Reaction to Clouds
content: I, Aisha, never saw the Prophet laugh loudly. He usually smiled. When he saw clouds or wind, his face showed concern. I asked him why he looked unhappy when people were happy about rain. He said that there was no guarantee of good weather. Some people had been punished by a storm while thinking it would bring rain.

title: Allah's Promise to the Womb
content: The Prophet (ﷺ) said that Allah created all living things. When He finished, the womb spoke up and asked for protection from people who don't take care of their family relationships. Allah promised that those who do take care of their families will be blessed, but those who don't will not receive His favors.

title: Walking around the Ka'bah
content: Abu Huraira said: The Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) said, 'If you want to recite a verse from the Quran, say: Would you then consider this as a favour to me, while it was you who emigrated for my sake?'

title: Reciting the Quran
content: Muawiya bin Abi Al-Muzarrad said that the Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) said: 'If you want to recite a verse, say: Would you then if you were given authority?'

title: Umar's Concern About the Prophet
content: One night during a journey, Umar was traveling with the Prophet. He asked the Prophet about something three times, but the Prophet didn't answer. Umar thought to himself, 'I've never seen the Prophet ignore me like this.' He got worried that Allah might have revealed some verses about him. So, he rode his camel faster and went ahead of the group. When someone called out to him, he went back to the Prophet. The Prophet (ﷺ) said, 'Tonight, a special chapter was revealed to me, and it's more important than anything in this world.' He then recited: 'We have given you a clear victory'.

title: Muhammad's Victory at Hudaibiyah
content: Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) was told that he had been given a clear victory. This referred to the peace treaty made with the people of Al-Hudaibiyah.

title: Conquest of Mecca
content: On the day of the conquest of Mecca, Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) recited Surat Al-Fath in a strong and pleasant voice. If someone could imitate his way of reading it, they would do so.

title: Prophet's Night Prayers
content: The Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) used to pray at night. His feet would get swollen because of it. Someone told him, 'Allah has forgiven you for your past and future mistakes.' He replied, 'Shouldn't I be thankful to Allah as a slave?'

title: Prophet's Late Night Prayers
content: Aisha said that the Prophet used to pray for a very long time at night. His feet would crack from standing so much. Aisha asked him, 'Why do you pray all night? Allah has forgiven your past and future mistakes.' The Prophet (ﷺ) replied, 'I want to be a thankful servant of Allah.' When he got older, he prayed while sitting down. If he wanted to bow his head in prayer, he would get up, read some more verses, and then bow down.

title: Muhammad's Role in the Torah
content: Abdullah bin Amr said that a verse from the Quran appears in the Torah. It says: 'We sent Muhammad (ﷺ) as a witness, to bring good news and warn people.' The Torah also adds that Muhammad (ﷺ) is Allah's slave and messenger. He depends on Allah and is kind, not harsh or loud. He doesn't return evil for evil, but forgives instead. Before taking him to heaven, Allah will guide people through Muhammad (ﷺ) by helping them say: 'There is no god but Allah.' This will open the eyes of those who can't see, ears of those who can't hear, and hearts of those who are hardened.

title: Horse Jumps During Quran Recitation
content: A man was reading the Quran in his home. His horse got scared and started jumping around. The next day, he told the Prophet about it. The Prophet (ﷺ) said that the calmness of the Quran made the horse behave like this.

title: Jabir's Account of Hudaibiya
content: One thousand four hundred people were with me on the Day of Al-Hudaibiya.

title: Prophet's Rules for Bathing
content: Abdullah bin Mughaffal said the Prophet forbade throwing small stones with two fingers when praying. He also said the Prophet forbade urinating near a place where people take a bath.

title: Thabit bin Ad-Dahhak's Story
content: Thabit bin Ad-Dahhak was one of the companions who took an oath under a tree at Al-Hudaibiya.

title: Abu Wail Remembers Siffin
content: Habib bin Abi Thabit asked Abu Wail about people who rebelled against Ali. Abu Wail said they were at a place called Siffin, where Ali agreed to settle the dispute using Allah's Book. Some people didn't want to agree and wanted to fight instead. Sahl bin Hunaif reminded them of a time when they could have fought but chose not to. He told them about what happened on the day of Al-Hudaibiya, when Umar was unhappy with a peace treaty and asked why they should give up their rights. The Prophet (ﷺ) said he was Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) and Allah would never forget him. This made Umar leave in anger, but then Sura Al-Fath (The Victory) was revealed.

title: Abu Bakr and Umar Argue
content: Two important people, Abu Bakr and Umar, were about to make a mistake. They argued loudly in front of the Prophet when some visitors from Bani Tamim came. One suggested Al-Aqra' bin Habis as their leader, while the other suggested someone else. Abu Bakr thought Umar was trying to oppose him. But Umar said he wasn't. Their voices grew loud again, so Allah sent a message: 'Don't speak louder than the Prophet.' After this, Umar spoke very quietly, and the Prophet would ask him to repeat what he said.

title: Prophet's Forgiveness for Thabit
content: The Prophet (ﷺ) missed his friend Thabit bin Qais and asked about him. A man went to find out what was wrong with Thabit, who was sitting at home feeling sad because he had spoken loudly during the Prophet's prayer. The loud speaking made all of Thabit's good deeds useless, and he thought he would go to Hell. But the Prophet told his friend to tell Thabit that he is actually going to Paradise.

title: Disagreement Over Governor
content: Some people from the tribe of Bani Tamim asked the Prophet to choose a leader for them. Abu Bakr suggested Al-Qaqa bin Mabad, but `Umar said Al-Aqra' bin Habis would be better. They argued loudly until the Quran was revealed: 'Don't rush into things.'

title: Hellfire's Question
content: Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) said: People will be thrown into the Hellfire. It will ask if there are more to come. But Allah will stop it by putting His foot on it, and then it will say 'Enough! Enough!'

title: Hell's Capacity Questioned
content: The Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) said: 'One day, Allah will ask Hell if it is full. Hell will say yes. Then Allah will put His foot on it and Hell will say 'Enough! Enough!'

title: Paradise and Hell Argue
content: The Prophet (ﷺ) said that Paradise and Hell argued. Hell said it got the arrogant and tyrants. Paradise asked why only weak people went in. Allah told Paradise it was His mercy for whoever He chose. Then Allah told Hell, 'You punish those I choose.' Each will have its fill. When Allah puts His foot on Hell, it says 'Enough!' and gets full. But Allah won't wrong anyone. For Paradise, Allah will create new people to live there.

title: Pray at Dawn and Dusk
content: One night, the Prophet was with us. He looked at the full moon and said: 'You will see God like you see this moon.' You won't have trouble seeing Him. So, try to pray before sunrise and before sunset if you can.

title: Prayer Praises After Salah
content: Ibn Abbas said that Allah told the Prophet to say praises after every prayer. This is from Allah's saying: 'After the prayers'.

title: Allah's Messenger Helps Um Salama
content: Um Salama told the Prophet that she was sick. He said to her: 'You can do the Tawaf of the Kaaba while riding behind others who are walking around it.' Um Salama did what he suggested, and at the same time, the Prophet was praying near the Kaaba, reciting a verse from the Quran.

title: The Prophet's Powerful Prayer
content: Jubair bin Mut'im said he heard the Prophet reciting a part of Surat at-Tur during his evening prayer. The verse talked about creation and the power of God. When Jubair heard it, he felt amazed by its strong argument.

title: What Muhammad Saw and Knew
content: I asked Aisha if the Prophet saw his Lord. She said that if someone told me he did, they would be lying. She then read a verse from the Quran: 'No vision can grasp Him, but His grasp is over all vision.' (6.103) She also read another verse: 'It is not fitting for a human being that Allah should speak to him except by inspiration or from behind a veil.' (42.51) Aisha said that if someone told me the Prophet knew what would happen tomorrow, they would be lying. She then read this verse: 'No soul can know what it will earn tomorrow.' (31.34) She also said that if someone told me the Prophet hid some of Allah's orders, they would be lying. Aisha read another verse: 'O Apostle! Proclaim (the Message) which has been sent down to you from your Lord..' (5.67) But she did say that the Prophet saw Gabriel twice in his true form.

title: Gabriel's Appearance to Muhammad
content: Abdullah told us that the Prophet saw Gabriel. Gabriel had six hundred wings. This happened after Allah gave Gabriel a message, which he then passed on to the Prophet.

title: Gabriel's Appearance to the Prophet
content: Ash-Shaibani asked Zirr about a verse in the Quran. The verse says Allah spoke directly to Gabriel, who then told the Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) what he heard. Zirr said Abdullah bin Mas'ud told him that the Prophet saw Gabriel with six hundred wings.

title: Prophet Muhammad Sees a Sign
content: Abdullah said that the Prophet saw something green on the horizon. This was one of the signs from Allah, which he had been told about in the Quran (53:18).

title: Who was Lat originally?
content: Ibn Abbas said that Lat was a man who used to mix food for pilgrims.

title: Forgotten Oaths and Gambling
content: Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) said: If someone takes an oath that includes the names of Lat and Uzza by mistake, they should say 'Only Allah deserves worship.' Also, if you invite a friend to gamble, give some money to charity as a way to make it right.

title: Why We Walk Between Safa and Marwa
content: `Urwa asked Aisha about the tradition of walking between As-Safa and Al-Marwa. She said that before Islam, people used to avoid this walk because they were afraid of an idol called Manat. Allah revealed a verse saying that these mountains are special signs from Him. So, Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) and his followers started performing the walk again.

title: Prophet's Prostration after Surah Najm
content: When the Prophet finished reciting Surat-an-Najm, he made a prostration. All Muslims, non-Muslims, and even Jinn (supernatural beings) followed his example and prostrated as well.

title: Prostration in Sura An-Najm
content: Abdullah said that the first chapter where a prostration was mentioned was Sura An-Najm. When the Prophet recited it, he prostrated and everyone behind him did too - except one man who took some dust in his hand and prostrated on it instead. Later, I saw this man killed as an unbeliever, and his name was Umaiya bin Khalaf.

title: Moon Split in Two
content: Ibn Masud told us that during the Prophet's lifetime, the moon was split into two parts. One part stayed above a mountain and the other went beyond it. The Prophet (ﷺ) said, 'See this miracle'.

title: Moon Split in Two
content: I was with the Prophet. The moon broke into two parts while we were there. He said, 'See this miracle.'

title: Moon Split in Two
content: Ibn Abbas said that during the time of the Prophet, the moon was split into two parts.

title: Prophet Shows a Miracle
content: Some people from Mecca asked the Prophet to show them a miracle. He showed them that he could split the moon in two.

title: The Moon Split in Two
content: Anas said that the moon was split into two parts. This happened while Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) was leading his followers in prayer.

title: Prophet's Recitation
content: The Prophet (ﷺ) used to recite a verse from the Quran: 'Is there anyone who will listen and learn?'

title: Prophet's Warning to Mankind
content: The Prophet (ﷺ) used to recite: 'Is there anyone who will listen and learn from this?'

title: Reciting the Quran
content: A man asked Al-Aswad about a verse in the Quran. He said he heard Abdullah bin Masud recite it as 'Fahal-min Muddakir', and that's how he, Al-Aswad, also remembered the Prophet (ﷺ) reciting it.

title: Reciting a Warning
content: Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) used to recite: 'Is there anyone who will listen and learn?'

title: Nations Were Destroyed Before
content: The Prophet (ﷺ) recited: 'We have destroyed nations like yours. Will anyone learn from this?'

title: Correcting the Recitation
content: Abdullah told me that he recited a verse called 'Fahal-min-Mudhdhakir' to the Prophet. The Prophet (ﷺ) said, 'It's actually Fahal-min Muddakir'.

title: Prophet's Prayer at Badr
content: Ibn Abbas said the Prophet was in a tent on the day of the Battle of Badr. He prayed, 'O Allah, keep your promise and make it clear that you are the only one to be worshipped.' Abu Bakr stopped him, saying, 'That's enough, Prophet. You've asked Allah strongly.' The Prophet (ﷺ) put on his armor and went out, reciting a verse from the Quran: 'Their multitude will run away and show their backs'.

title: Revelation of the Hour
content: I, Yusuf bin Mahak, was in Aisha's house. She said that a verse from the Quran was revealed to the Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) at Mecca when she was still a little girl. The verse says: 'The time for reckoning is near and it will be very hard.'

title: Prophet's Prayer at Badr
content: The Prophet (ﷺ) was in his tent on the day of the Battle of Badr. He said to Allah: 'Keep your promise and contract.' Abu Bakr stopped him, saying: 'That's enough, Messenger.' The Prophet (ﷺ) wore his armor and went out, reciting a verse from the Quran: 'Their army will run away and show their backs. But the Day of Judgment is coming soon.'

title: Two Gardens with Silver and Gold
content: Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) said: Two gardens have silver utensils and food. Two other gardens have gold utensils and food. The people in the Garden of Eden can see their Lord, but only if they want to because there is a special curtain over His face.

title: Paradise's Wonders
content: Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) said: In Paradise, there is a special building made from one big pearl. It's sixty miles wide and has four corners. Each corner has wives that no one can see in the other corners. The believers will visit them and enjoy their company. There are also two gardens with silver utensils and contents, and two more with gold ones. Nothing stops people in Paradise from seeing Allah except a special curtain over His face.

title: Paradise's Wonders and Pleasures
content: Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) said: In Paradise, there is a huge pavilion made of one big pearl. It's sixty miles wide. Each corner has wives that no one else can see. Believers will visit them and enjoy their company. There are also two gardens with silver utensils and contents, and two more with gold ones. Nothing stops people in Paradise from seeing God except a special curtain over His face.

title: Paradise's Big Shade Tree
content: Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) said: 'In Paradise, there is a huge tree. A rider can travel under its shade for 100 years without leaving it. If you want, you can say a prayer while standing in its shade.'

title: Ibn Abbas Explains Surahs
content: Sa'id bin Jubair asked Ibn Abbas about three surahs. He said that Surah Al-Tauba is a warning to the non-believers and hypocrites, exposing their wrongdoings. It keeps repeating 'some of them' until it seems like everyone will be mentioned. Ibn Abbas said that Surah Al-Anfal was revealed after the Battle of Badr. When asked about Surah Al-Hashr, he replied that it was revealed when the tribe of Bani an-Nadir left Madinah.

title: Ibn Abbas Explains a Verse
content: Sa'id asked Ibn Abbas about Surat Al-Hashr. He said, 'It's actually called Surat An-Nadir'.

title: Cutting Down Palm Trees
content: Ibn Umar said that Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) cut down the palm trees of a group called Bani An-Nadir near Medina. Allah then revealed a message saying it was okay to do this because He wanted to show shame to those who disobeyed Him.

title: Umar Describes the Booty
content: Umar said: The properties of Bani An-Nadir were given to the Prophet as spoils. These spoils didn't come from any battles fought by Muslims, with horses or on foot. They belonged only to the Prophet. He used some for his wives' living expenses and spent the rest on buying arms and horses for fighting in Allah's cause.

title: Tattoos and Beauty Practices
content: Abdullah bin Masud said that Allah curses people who get tattoos or have them done. He also curses women who remove hair from their faces or make spaces between their teeth to look more beautiful. This is because they change what Allah created. A woman named Um Yaqub asked Abdullah about this, saying she had read the whole Quran and didn't find anything about it. Abdullah said that if she had really read the Quran, she would have found it. He reminded her of a verse where Allah says to follow the Prophet's instructions. The Prophet (ﷺ) had forbidden these practices. When Um Yaqub said she saw Abdullah's wife doing these things, he told her to go and watch her. She did, but couldn't see anything wrong with his wife.

title: Allah's Messenger Curses False Hair
content: Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) said that Allah has cursed the woman who uses false hair. This means she will be punished for it.

title: Umar's Advice to His Successor
content: Umar said: I want my successor to take care of the early Muslims who were forced to leave their homes. He should also be kind to those Ansar who welcomed the Prophet in Medina and had already accepted Islam before he arrived. My successor should appreciate what is good about these people and forgive them if they make mistakes.

title: Guests and Hospitality
content: A man came to the Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ). He was tired and hungry. The Prophet (ﷺ) sent someone to his wives for help, but they didn't have anything. The Prophet (ﷺ) asked if anyone could take care of this guest so that Allah would be merciful to him. An Ansari man said he would do it. He went home and told his wife about the guest. She said she only had food for their children. The Ansari man said, 'When the children are asleep, we'll eat.' In the morning, the Prophet saw the Ansari man and said that Allah was pleased with him and his wife because of their kindness. Then Allah revealed a verse saying to give preference to guests even if you're in need.

title: Hatib's Letter to Mecca
content: Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) sent me and two others on a mission. We were told to find a woman traveling with a letter. When we found her, she said she didn't have the letter. We searched her hair braid and found it. The letter was from Hatib bin Abi Balta'a to people in Mecca, telling them about some of Muhammad 's (ﷺ) plans. When we showed this to Muhammad (ﷺ), he asked Hatib why he did it. Hatib explained that he wanted to help his relatives in Mecca by doing a favor for the people there. He said he didn't do it because he didn't believe in Islam or want to leave it. Muhammad (ﷺ) said Hatib was telling the truth. Some of his companions, like Umar, wanted to punish Hatib, but Muhammad (ﷺ) stopped them. He reminded them that Hatib fought at Badr and maybe Allah forgave him for what he did.

title: The Prophet's Pledge with Women
content: Aisha said the Prophet used to ask believing women who came to him for protection if they accepted a certain condition. If they agreed, he would say 'I accept your pledge of allegiance.' He never touched their hands during this process.

title: Women's Oath of Allegiance
content: Um Atiya and other women took an oath to follow Allah's Messenger (ﷺ). He reminded them not to worship anything except Allah, and not to mourn the dead. One woman was hesitant because she wanted to show respect by mourning a relative who had died. The Prophet (ﷺ) didn't stop her from doing this, so she went and came back to him. He accepted her promise to follow him.

title: Women's Oath to Allah
content: When believing women took an oath of allegiance to the Prophet, they agreed not to disobey him in any fair matter. This was one of the conditions set by Allah for them.

title: Pledge of Allegiance
content: The Prophet (ﷺ) asked us if we would promise to only worship Allah, not have illegal relationships, and not steal. He then read a verse about women. He said that whoever keeps their promise will get a reward from Allah. If someone breaks the promise and gets punished in this life, it's like making up for the mistake. But if they break the promise and aren't punished, only Allah knows what to do with them.

title: The Prophet's Eid Prayer
content: Ibn Abbas said he saw the Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) with Abu Bakr, Umar, and Uthman leading the Eid prayer. After they finished praying and giving a sermon, the Prophet got up and waved to the men to sit down. He then walked through them and reached the women's rows with Bilal. The Prophet (ﷺ) recited a verse from the Quran (60:12) asking if the believing women agreed to certain conditions, such as not worshiping anything except Allah and not stealing or killing their children. One woman said yes, and the Prophet asked if they would give charity. Bilal spread out his garment and the women threw in jewelry.

title: Muhammad's Names and Roles
