content: Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) said: 'I have many names. I am Muhammad (ﷺ), Ahmad, Al-Mahi who erases disbelief, Al-Hashir who gathers people on the Day of Resurrection, and Al-Aqib who brings good after other prophets.'

title: Salman and Faith
content: I was sitting with the Prophet when a verse from Surat Al-Jumu'a was read. It said Allah had sent him to other people too. I asked, 'Who are they?' The Prophet (ﷺ) didn't answer me at first. Then he put his hand on Salman, who was with us, and said that even if faith were in the highest star, someone from Salman's group would still find it.

title: Prophet's Advice on Knowledge
content: Abu Huraira said the Prophet said: Some people from this community will gain knowledge.

title: Leaving the Prophet for a Caravan
content: Jabir bin Abdullah said that a caravan of goods arrived in Medina on a Friday when we were with the Prophet. Everyone left him to go see the caravan, except twelve people. Then Allah revealed: 'When people see something good or fun, they often leave what's important and rush after it.'

title: Zaid bin Arqam's Story
content: I was on a trip with the Prophet. I heard Abdullah bin Ubai say, 'Don't give money to those who are with the Prophet, or they will leave him.' He said this would happen when we go back home. I told my uncle and Umar about it. They told the Prophet what I had heard. The Prophet (ﷺ) called me and asked about it. Then he sent for Abdullah bin Ubai and his friends. They swore they didn't say that. The Prophet (ﷺ) believed them instead of me. This made me very sad. My uncle said, 'You wanted the Prophet to doubt you.' But then Allah revealed a verse from the Quran that confirmed what I had heard. The Prophet (ﷺ) recited it to me and said, 'Zaid, Allah is confirming your words.'

title: Abdullah bin Ubai's Warning
content: I was with my uncle when I heard Abdullah bin Ubai say, 'Don't give money to those who are with the Prophet. They might leave him.' He also said, 'If we go back to Medina, the rich will chase away the poor.' I told my uncle about this and he told the Prophet. The Prophet (ﷺ) sent for Abdullah bin Ubai and his friends. They denied saying these things. The Prophet (ﷺ) believed them and didn't believe me. This made me very upset and I stayed at home. Then Allah revealed a verse that said, 'The hypocrites say: Don't give money to those with the Prophet.' It also said, 'The rich will chase away the poor.' The Prophet (ﷺ) sent for me again and recited this verse. He said, 'Allah confirmed what you said was true'.

title: Abdullah bin Ubai's Disloyalty
content: Zaid bin Arqam told the Prophet that Abdullah bin Ubai said not to spend money on those with the Messenger. He also said he wanted to go back to Medina if they did. Zaid informed the Prophet about this. The Ansar people blamed Zaid for it, and Abdullah denied saying these things. Zaid went home and slept. The next day, the Prophet called him and said that Allah confirmed what Zaid had said. A verse from the Quran was revealed because of this.

title: The Prophet and Abdullah bin Ubai
content: The Prophet (ﷺ) was on a journey with his companions. They were struggling to find food. Abdullah bin Ubai told some of the people not to help those who were with the Prophet, so they would leave him. He said that when they got back to Medina, the rich would chase away the poor. I, Zaid, went to the Prophet and told him what Abdullah had said. The Prophet (ﷺ) called Abdullah and asked him about it, but he denied saying it. People started to think I was lying to the Prophet, which made me very sad. Later, Allah confirmed my story in a verse of the Quran that says hypocrites will try to leave the Prophet's group. When the Prophet read this verse, he called out the people who were being accused and asked them to pray for forgiveness. They looked away.

title: Abdullah bin Ubai's Warning
content: I was with my uncle when I heard Abdullah bin Ubai say not to give money to the Prophet's companions, so they would leave him. He said that if we went back to Medina, the rich would chase away the poor. I told my uncle, and he told the Prophet. The Prophet (ﷺ) called me and asked about it. Then he sent for Abdullah bin Ubai and his friends, who swore they didn't say those things. The Prophet (ﷺ) believed them instead of me. I was very upset and stayed home. My uncle thought I wanted to be seen as a liar and make the Prophet dislike me. But then Allah revealed a verse that said hypocrites would pretend to be our friends. The Prophet (ﷺ) sent for me again, recited the verse, and said that Allah had confirmed my story.

title: Disputes in the Prophet's Army
content: A man from the emigrants kicked an Ansari man on the buttocks. The Ansari called for help, but the Prophet said it was a bad habit from before Islam. A leader among the hypocrites said he would expel the honorable people if they returned to Medina. Umar wanted to kill him, but the Prophet stopped him, saying that Muhammad (ﷺ) shouldn't kill his companions.

title: Prophet's Prayer for Ansar
content: Anas bin Malik was sad about the people who died in a battle. A friend of his, Zaid bin Arqarr, wrote to him that he had heard the Prophet say: 'God, forgive the Ansar and their children.' Some people asked Anas if this was true. He said yes, and added that the Prophet also mentioned their grandchildren.

title: No Favoritism in Islam
content: Jabir bin Abdullah said that during a battle, an emigrant kicked an Ansari on the buttocks. The Ansari called out for help to his fellow Ansaris, and the emigrant did the same to his fellow emigrants. When the Prophet heard this, he told them to stop calling out like this because it's not good. Abdullah bin Ubai said that if they went back to Medina, the stronger group would expel the weaker one. Umar bin Al-Khattab wanted to kill him, but the Prophet stopped him, saying people might think Muhammad (ﷺ) is killing his own companions.

title: Divorce During Menses
content: Abdullah bin Umar divorced his wife while she was on her period. He told the Prophet about it. The Prophet (ﷺ) got angry and said: 'Abdullah must take her back, keep her until she's clean from her period. Then if he wants to divorce her, he can do that when she's clean again before they have sex. That's how Allah says it should be.'

title: Pregnant Widow's Marriage
content: A man asked Ibn Abbas about a woman whose husband died when she was pregnant. She gave birth after 40 days and then got married to someone else. Ibn Abbas said this meant one of two waiting periods had ended. He sent his slave Kuraib to ask Um Salama, the Prophet's wife, for her opinion. She told them that a similar case happened with Subai'a al Aslamiya, who gave birth after 40 days and then got married again.

title: Marriage and Oaths
content: Ibn Abbas said: If a man tells his wife 'You are forbidden to me', he must make an act of atonement. Ibn Abbas also said that we should follow the example of Allah's Messenger (ﷺ).

title: Prophet's Honey Habit
content: Aisha said that the Prophet used to visit her and Hafsa. They agreed to tell him he smelled bad if he came to either of them after eating honey in Zainab's house. When this happened, they told him he smelled bad. The Prophet (ﷺ) replied that he had been drinking honey at Zainab's and wouldn't do it again. He made a promise not to eat honey there anymore.

title: Umar Asks About Prophet's Wives
content: Ibn Abbas wanted to ask Umar about a verse in the Quran. He respected Umar too much to ask him directly, so he waited until they were on their way back from Hajj. When Umar went to answer nature's call, Ibn Abbas asked him who the two wives of the Prophet were that argued with him. Umar said it was Hafsa and Aisha. Then Ibn Abbas told Umar how much he had wanted to ask him about this a year ago, but couldn't because of respect. Umar said it was okay to ask him anything if Ibn Abbas thought he knew something. Umar then explained that in the past, they didn't pay attention to women's opinions until Allah revealed new rules. He told Ibn Abbas how his wife had once suggested something and he got angry with her, but later realized she was right. She reminded him of how Hafsa argued with the Prophet every day, making him stay angry for a whole day. Umar went to talk to Hafsa and warned her about Allah's punishment and the Prophet's anger. He also talked to Um Salama, who told him he was interfering too much. When Ibn Abbas heard that the Prophet had isolated himself from his wives, he got worried and went to see him. The Prophet (ﷺ) was sitting in a room with a ladder leading up to it. Ibn Abbas told the Prophet what Umar had said about Hafsa and Aisha arguing with him. When he reached the part about Um Salama, the Prophet smiled. Ibn Abbas saw how simple the Prophet's living arrangements were and started crying. The Prophet (ﷺ) asked him why he was crying and Ibn Abbas replied that Caesar and Khosrau lived in luxury while the Prophet had to live in poverty. The Prophet (ﷺ) said it was better for them to enjoy this world and for us to have the Hereafter.

title: Umar Identifies Two Women
content: Ibn Abbas wanted to ask Umar a question. He said, 'Who were the two women who argued with the Prophet?' Before he could finish speaking, Umar replied, 'They were Aisha and Hafsa'.

title: Two Women Against the Prophet
content: Ibn Abbas wanted to ask Umar about two women who argued with the Prophet. He asked him during Hajj in a place called Zahran. Umar went to wash himself and Ibn Abbas followed him with water. When they were alone, Ibn Abbas asked Umar, 'Who were those two women?' Umar replied, 'They were Aisha and Hafsa'.

title: Wives' Jealousy and a Warning
content: Umar said to the Prophet's wives: 'If he divorced you all, Allah might give him better wives.' This made them angry. So, Allah revealed a verse in response.

title: Man from Quaraish
content: Ibn Abbas said that a verse in the Quran was about a man from the Quaraish tribe. This man had a mark on his body, like a sheep has a tag to identify it. The verse called him 'cruel' and 'base-born'.

title: Who Goes to Paradise
content: The Prophet (ﷺ) said: 'I can tell you about people who go to Heaven. They are those who may be weak or poor and others look down on them, but Allah helps them when they make a promise. I can also tell you about people who go to Hell. They are those who are violent, proud, and stubborn.'

title: Prophet's Description of Judgment Day
content: Abu Sa'id said the Prophet told him that on Judgment Day, Allah will show His power. All believers will bow down to Him in respect. But some people who bowed down in life just to look good or get praise won't be able to do it then. Their back will be stiff and they won't be able to bend.

title: Idols Worshiped by Arabs
content: Ibn Abbas said that the idols worshipped by Noah's people were also worshipped by the Arabs later on. The idol Wadd was worshipped by the Kalb tribe at Daumat-al-Jandal, Suwa' by the Hudhail tribe, Yaghouth by the Murad and Ghutaif tribes near Saba, Ya'uq by Hamdan, and Nasr by Himyar. These idols were named after some good people from Noah's time who died. Satan made their followers create statues at the places where these people used to sit, calling them by those names. People started worshipping these idols when the original worshippers had passed away and no one knew where they came from.

title: Devils Listen to the Quran
content: Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) went out with his companions. Some devils were trying to get news from Heaven, but they couldn't. They got hurt by flames sent down from Heaven. So they asked their friends what was happening. Their friends said maybe something big had happened. The devils traveled all over the world looking for it. When some of them met Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) on his way to a market, they heard him reciting the Quran with his companions. They listened and realized that was what had stopped them from getting news from Heaven. After hearing the Quran, the devils believed in it and said they would never worship anyone but their Lord.

title: First Surah Revealed to the Prophet
content: Abu Salama told me that he asked Jabir about the first surah revealed. Jabir said, 'I will only tell you what the Prophet (ﷺ) told us.' The Prophet (ﷺ) said he was in a cave and stayed there for a while. When he came out, he heard a voice calling him. He looked around but saw nothing. Then he looked up and saw something. He went to his wife Khadija and asked her to wrap him up and pour cold water on him. After that, the surah 'O you, wrapped-up! Arise and warn' (Surat Al Muddaththir) was revealed.

title: Prophet's Time in Hira Cave
content: Jabir bin Abdullah said the Prophet was alone in a cave called Hira.

title: First Surah of the Quran
content: I asked Aba Salama which Surah of the Quran was revealed first. He said it was Al-Muddaththir, also known as 'You who are wrapped up'. I had been told that another Surah, 'Read in the Name of your Lord', was also one of the earliest to be revealed.

title: Angel's Visit to Prophet
content: Jabir bin Abdullah said the Prophet told him about a time when he was walking and heard voices from above. He looked up and saw an angel sitting between the sky and earth. The Prophet (ﷺ) was scared, so he went home and asked his family to wrap him in clothes. Then Allah revealed a message saying 'Leave your idols before prayer is required'.

title: Muhammad Receives a Message
content: Jabir bin Abdullah said that he heard the Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) describe what happened when the messages from Allah stopped coming to him. The Prophet (ﷺ) said, 'While I was walking, I heard a voice from above. I looked up and saw an angel sitting between heaven and earth. I got so scared that I fell down. My wife wrapped me in blankets. Then Allah sent this message:

title: Prophet's Reaction to Revelation
content: Ibn Abbas said the Prophet used to move his tongue when he received a message from Allah. He did this to help him remember it. But then Allah told him not to rush and just listen carefully.

title: Prophet's Tongue and Revelation
content: Musa bin Abi Aisha asked Sa'id bin Jubair about a verse in the Quran. He said Ibn Abbas explained that when Allah was revealing the Quran to the Prophet, he would move his lips. The Prophet (ﷺ) was told not to do this because some words might be forgotten. When Allah says 'We will collect it' in your heart and 'make you recite it', it means they will help him remember and speak the words correctly. When the verse is revealed, the Prophet should follow its words so that Allah can explain them clearly.

title: Gabriel Reveals the Quran
content: Ibn Abbas said that when Gabriel came to the Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) with a new revelation, he would keep quiet and listen. When Gabriel left, the Prophet would recite what was revealed to him. Allah told the Prophet not to hurry when speaking about the Quran, but to wait for it to be collected in his mind first.

title: Snake Escapes in the Desert
content: One day, I was with the Prophet when he received a new chapter of the Quran. As we listened to it, a snake suddenly appeared and we tried to kill it. But it moved too fast and escaped into its hole. The Prophet (ﷺ) said, 'The snake has escaped from your harm, and you have escaped from its harm.'

title: Prophet Muhammad's Advice
content: Abdullah said the Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) told him to walk around the Kaaba seven times when he visited it for prayer.

title: Hell is like a Fort
content: Ibn Abbas said: The Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) said that Hell throws out huge sparks. We used to call big logs of wood 'Qasr' because they were as long as three cubits or shorter. We would use these logs for heating in winter.

title: Heating Logs and Ships
content: Ibn 'Abbas said: We used to collect long logs of wood for heating in winter. We called them Al-Qasr, which also means a castle or fort. The Quran compares these logs to yellow ropes on a ship's deck.

title: Snake in the Cave
content: I was with the Prophet in a cave when he received a new part of the Quran. He recited it to me directly. A snake suddenly appeared, and the Prophet told us to kill it. We tried to catch it but it escaped quickly. The Prophet (ﷺ) said, 'The snake escaped your evil, and you also escaped its evil'.

title: Life After Trumpet Sounds
content: Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) said: 'Between the two sounds of the trumpet, there will be a period of time. A man asked Abu Huraira how long it would last, and he refused to answer when told it was forty days or months. Then he said it was not that long. After this time, Allah will send rain from the sky, and people's bodies will grow back like plants do. The only part of a person's body that won't decay is a small bone at the end of their spine. This bone will be used to recreate them on the Day of Resurrection.'

title: The Coming of the Hour
content: Sahl bin Sa'd said he saw the Prophet pointing with his two fingers. He said this is like the time when he will come back and the Day of Judgment.

title: Reciting the Quran
content: The Prophet (ﷺ) said that someone who learns and memorizes the Quran will be with the good scribes in Heaven. If someone tries hard to learn the Quran, even if it's difficult for them, they'll get a double reward.

title: Day of Judgement
content: On the Day when all people will stand before God, some will be covered in their own sweat up to their ears.

title: Day of Resurrection
content: Aisha asked the Prophet: 'Will anyone go to Hell on the Day of Judgment?' The Prophet (ﷺ) replied: 'Yes, those whose accounts are questioned will be ruined.' Aisha said: 'But doesn't the Quran say that those who receive their records in their right hand will have an easy reckoning?' The Prophet (ﷺ) said: 'That's just the presentation of the accounts. Those whose records are questioned will still be ruined.'

title: Traveling Through Life
content: Ibn Abbas said: The verse 'You will travel from stage to stage' means moving from one state to another. This is about the Prophet's journey.

title: Prophet Muhammad's Arrival in Medina
content: Two companions, Mus`ab and Ibn Um Maktum, were the first to arrive in Medina. They taught us the Quran. Then came Ammar, Bilal, and Sa`d. Later, Umar brought 20 men with him. The Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) finally arrived. People in Medina were very happy to see him. Even children said, 'This is Allah's Messenger (ﷺ).' Before his arrival, I had learned Surah Al-Ala and other similar chapters of the Quran.

title: Prophet's Sermon on Kindness
content: The Prophet (ﷺ) was giving a sermon. He talked about a camel that someone had hurt. The person who did it was very strong and respected, but he still chose to harm the camel. The Prophet (ﷺ) said it's not right for anyone to treat their wife harshly like they would an animal. If you hit your wife, don't expect to sleep with her later. He also reminded them not to laugh when someone passes gas, because everyone does that sometimes.

title: Abu Ad-Darda' and Recitation
content: Alqama visited Sham with some friends. Abu Ad-Darda' heard they were there and came to them. He asked if anyone could recite the Quran. They said yes, so he asked who was the best reciter. They pointed at Alqama. Abu Ad-Darda' told Alqama to recite a verse from Surah Al-Lail (92:1-3). Alqama did and Abu Ad-Darda' said he had heard it like that from the Prophet, but others didn't think it was correct.

title: Abu Darda's Test of Knowledge
content: Some friends of Abdullah bin Masud came to visit Abu Darda'. They asked him if he knew anyone who could recite the Quran like Abdullah. Abu Darda' said, 'Who among you knows it by heart?' They pointed to Alqama. So Abu Darda' asked Alqama how he had learned Abdullah's way of reciting Surah Al-Lail. Alqama recited a verse from the Quran. Abu Darda' said, 'I heard the Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) recite it in the same way.' But some people wanted him to change it slightly.

title: Destiny and Good Deeds
content: We were with the Prophet at a funeral in Baqi Al-Gharqad. He said that every person has a place written for them in either Paradise or Hell. Some of us asked, 'Should we just wait for our destiny?' The Prophet (ﷺ) replied, 'Keep doing good deeds because it's easy to do what will lead you to your destined place.' He then recited a verse: 'Those who give charity and are faithful will find their path made easier. But those who are greedy will face trouble'.

title: Death is Written
content: One day, Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) was at a funeral. He took a small stick and started scraping the ground with it. He said, 'Each of you will go to either Hell or Paradise.' People asked him if they should just wait for their fate instead of working hard. The Prophet (ﷺ) replied, 'Keep doing good deeds because it's easy to do what leads you to your destiny.' Then he recited a verse from the Quran: 'Those who give charity and are faithful will get the best reward'.

title: Destiny is Written
content: Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) said to us: 'Each of you has a place written for them in either Paradise or Hell-Fire.' We asked, 'Should we just wait for our destiny?' He replied, 'No. Keep doing good deeds. Everyone will find it easy to do what leads them to their destined place.' Then he read from the Quran: 'We make smooth the path of those who give charity and believe in a great reward. And we guide them to an easy way.'

title: Destiny and Good Deeds
content: One day, Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) came to a funeral in Baqi Al-Gharqad. He sat down with his companions and started scraping the ground with a small stick. He said that every person has a place written for them either in Paradise or Hellfire, and their fate is also decided. A man asked if they should just follow what's written and not do good deeds. The Prophet (ﷺ) replied that those who are meant to be happy will find it easy to do good things, while those meant to be unhappy will easily do bad things. He then recited a verse from the Quran saying: 'Those who give charity and keep their duty to Allah will get the best reward.'

title: Destiny and Good Deeds
content: Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) was at a funeral. He picked up something and scraped the ground with it. He said that every person has their place in either Heaven or Hell already written for them. Some people asked if they should just rely on what's been written and stop trying to do good deeds. The Prophet (ﷺ) replied, 'Keep doing good deeds because you'll find it easy to do things that will lead you to your destined place. If someone is meant to be happy in the afterlife, they'll naturally want to act like a happy person. And if someone is meant to suffer, they'll easily fall into bad habits.' He then read from the Quran: 'Those who give charity and are kind to others will be rewarded'.

title: Muhammad's Night Prayer
content: Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) was sick and couldn't pray at night for two or three nights. A woman said to him, 'I think the devil has left you.' Allah then revealed a verse saying He had not abandoned or disliked Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ).

title: Muhammad's Friend is Not Forgotten
content: A lady asked the Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) about his friend who was late in giving him the Quran. The Prophet (ﷺ) received a revelation from Allah that He had not forgotten or disliked him.

title: Prophet's Night Prayer
content: During a journey, the Prophet recited Surat at-Tini waz-Zaituni in the first two parts of his night prayer.

title: The Prophet Receives Guidance
content: Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) would often go to a cave called Hira to pray. One day, an angel came to him and asked him to read. But the Prophet didn't know how to read. The angel held him tightly three times until he felt scared. Then the angel said, 'Read in the name of your Lord who created everything.' The Prophet (ﷺ) returned home with his wife Khadija, feeling shaken. He told her what had happened and she comforted him. She took him to see a wise old man named Waraqa who knew about angels. Waraqa confirmed that it was an angel who came to the Prophet and said he would support him if he were younger. But before long, Waraqa died and the Prophet didn't receive any more guidance for a while.

title: Prophet Muhammad Receives Revelation
content: Jabir bin Abdullah said that one day the Prophet was walking when he heard a voice from above. He looked up and saw an angel sitting on a chair between the sky and the earth. The Prophet (ﷺ) got scared and went home, saying 'Cover me! Cover me!' Then Allah revealed a message: 'Get up, warn people, praise your Lord, wash yourself clean, and leave false gods.' Abu Salama explained that 'false gods' meant the idols people used to worship before Islam. After this, the Prophet received more messages regularly.

title: Prophet Muhammad's First Revelation
content: Aisha said that Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) received his first message from God through dreams. An angel came to him and said, 'Read in the name of your Lord who created everything. He created man from a small clot.'

title: Prophet Muhammad's First Revelation
content: Aisha said that Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) received his first message from God through a dream. An angel came to him and said, 'Read!' The angel told him to read the words: 'In the Name of your Lord Who created everything.' He was also told that his Lord is very kind and generous, who taught people how to write with pens.

title: Prophet's Return to Khadija
content: The Prophet (ﷺ) came back to his wife Khadija and said, 'Cover me up.'

title: Abu Jahl Threatens the Prophet
content: Ibn Abbas said that Abu Jahl said he would step on the Prophet's neck if he saw him praying at the Kaaba. The Prophet (ﷺ) replied, 'If he does, angels will take him away'.

title: The Prophet's Message to Ubai
content: The Prophet (ﷺ) told Ubai that Allah had ordered him to say something specific: 'Those who don't believe in the Book and idols won't stop being disbelievers.' When Ubai asked if Allah mentioned his name, the Prophet said yes. Then Ubai cried.

title: The Prophet Recites to Ubay
content: The Prophet (ﷺ) said to Ubay, 'Allah wants me to read the Quran to you.' Ubay asked if Allah mentioned his name. The Prophet (ﷺ) said yes. When he heard this, Ubay started crying. Then the Prophet read a part of the Quran to him: 'Those who don't believe in the Scripture...'

title: Prophet Muhammad Teaches Quran
content: The Prophet (ﷺ) said to Ubai bin Ka'b, 'Allah wants me to teach you the Quran.' Ubai asked if Allah had mentioned his name. The Prophet (ﷺ) replied, 'Yes, by name.' Ubai was amazed and asked again, 'Has Allah actually mentioned my name?' The Prophet (ﷺ) confirmed it. Then Ubai started crying.

title: Horses and Reward
content: Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) said: Horses are kept for three reasons. One reason is to get a reward in the Hereafter by using them for Allah's Cause. If you tie your horse in a pasture or garden, it will be rewarded with good deeds for what it eats and drinks. Even if it breaks free and runs around, you'll still get rewards for its steps and waste. If it finds water on its own, that's okay too. But if you keep a horse just to show off or make others jealous, it becomes a burden of sins. If you use your horse to earn money without asking others for help and pay its Zakat, it will protect you. Allah also said: 'Anyone who does good, no matter how small, will see the reward. Anyone who does evil, no matter how small, will see the punishment'.

title: Donkeys and Good Deeds
content: Abu Huraira asked the Prophet about donkeys. The Prophet (ﷺ) said nothing had been revealed to him specifically about them, but there is a verse that covers everything: 'Anyone who does good, even as small as an atom, will see it. And anyone who does evil, even as small as an atom, will also see it.'

title: Prophet's Journey to Heaven
content: Anas said: The Prophet (ﷺ) was taken up to the heavens. When he came back, he told us about a river with banks made of tents of hollow pearls. He asked Gabriel what it was. Gabriel replied that it is called Kauthar.

title: What is Kauthar River
content: I asked Aisha about a verse in the Quran. She said that the Kauthar river is a special gift to the Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ). It's a river with many tents made of pearls and utensils as numerous as stars.

title: Ibn Abbas Explains Al-Kauthar
content: Sa'id bin Jubair asked Ibn Abbas about Al-Kauthar. Ibn Abbas said it's a special gift Allah gave to the Prophet. Sa'id then asked, 'But some people think it's a river in Paradise.' Ibn Abbas replied, 'The river in Paradise is part of that special gift'.

title: Prophet's Prayer with New Verse
content: When the verse 'Surat-An-Nasr' was revealed to the Prophet, he would say a prayer. In that prayer, he said: 'I believe in one God and praise Him only. O Allah, forgive me'.

title: Prophet's Prayer Phrases
content: The Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) often said 'Praise to Allah, our Lord. We praise You with Your blessings. Forgive me' when he bowed and prostrated during his prayers, following the order of the Quran.

title: Umar and Ibn Abbas Discuss Surah Ta-Ha
content: `Umar asked people about a verse from the Quran. They said it meant Muslims would conquer cities and palaces. `Umar then asked Ibn Abbas, who explained that this verse actually meant Muhammad 's (ﷺ) death was near.

title: Umar and Ibn Abbas
content: `Umar would often sit with old men who fought in the Battle of Badr. Some didn't like it when `Umar brought me to join them, saying 'Why bring this boy?' `Umar replied, 'Because you know how knowledgeable he is.' One day `Umar made me sit with them again and asked their opinion about a verse from the Quran: 'When comes Help of Allah (to you O Muhammad (ﷺ) against your enemies) and the conquest (of Mecca).' Some said they would praise Allah and ask for forgiveness when help came. Others stayed quiet. `Umar then asked me, 'What do you think?' I replied that it meant the sign of Prophet Muhammad 's (ﷺ) death, as the verse says: 'When comes the Help of Allah... You should celebrate the praises of your Lord and ask for His Forgiveness.' `Umar said he didn't know anything about it other than what I said.

title: Prophet Warns Tribe
content: Ibn Abbas said that when the Prophet received a message from Allah to warn his tribe, he went up a mountain and shouted to people. He asked if they would believe him if he told them an army was coming. They said yes because they knew he never lied. Then he warned them about a severe punishment. Abu Lahab got angry and left. As a result, Allah revealed a message saying that Abu Lahab's hands should perish.

title: The Prophet Warns Quraish
content: One day the Prophet went to a place called Al-Batha'. He stood on top of a mountain and shouted, 'O people!' The Quraish tribe gathered around him. He asked them if they would believe him if he told them an enemy was coming to attack them in the morning or evening. They said yes. Then he warned them about a big punishment that was going to come. Abu Lahab spoke up and said, 'Is this why you brought us here?' The Prophet (ﷺ) then received a revelation from Allah saying, 'Abu Lahab will be punished.'

title: Abu Lahab's Disapproval
content: Ibn Abbas said that Abu Lahab was angry and said to the Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ): 'You've gathered us here for this?' As a result, Allah revealed a verse saying: 'Abu Lahab will be punished'.

title: Allah's Warning Against Lying
content: The Prophet (ﷺ) said that Allah told him: 'When a person lies about Me, it means they say I won't bring them back to life again. But bringing someone back to life is not hard for Me. It was just as easy the first time as it would be now. When someone insults Me, it's when they say I have children. But I am the One and Only God, who doesn't need anyone else. I don't have a father or son, and there is no one like Me.'

title: Lying to Allah is Wrong
content: Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) said: Allah says that the son of Adam has no right to lie about Him. If he lies, it means he doesn't believe Allah can bring him back to life again like He did the first time. Also, if he says Allah has children, this is a big mistake because Allah is the One Who needs nothing and no one else is like Him.

title: Two Special Surahs in Quran
content: Zirr bin Hubaish asked Ubai bin Ka'b about the two special surahs. Ubai said he asked the Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) about them, and the Prophet replied that these surahs were already part of the Quran.

title: Ibn Mas'ud and the Quran
content: Zirr bin Hubaish asked Ubai bin Ka'b about a statement from Ibn Mas'ud. Ubai said he had asked the Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) about it, and the Prophet replied that those verses were revealed to him and he had recited them as part of the Quran.

title: Prophet's Time in Mecca
content: The Prophet (ﷺ) stayed in Mecca for ten years. During this time, the Quran was revealed to him. He then moved to Medina and stayed there for another ten years.

title: Prophet's Time in Mecca
content: The Prophet (ﷺ) stayed in Mecca for ten years. During this time, the Quran was revealed to him. He then moved to Medina and lived there for another ten years.

title: Gabriel Visits the Prophet
content: Abu Uthman told me that Gabriel came to see the Prophet while Um Salama was with him. The Prophet (ﷺ) asked her, 'Who is this?' She said it was Dihya al-Kalbi. When Gabriel left, Um Salama said she hadn't recognized him as anyone else until she heard the Prophet's sermon about the news of Gabriel.

title: Prophet Muhammad's Miracles
content: Abu Huraira said the Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) said: 'Every Prophet had a miracle to make people believe. What I have is God's message that He sends me directly. So, I hope my followers will be more on the Day of Judgment.'

title: Revelation Before Prophet's Death
content: Allah sent down many messages to the Prophet before he died. This was when most of the revelation happened, and then the Prophet passed away.

title: Prophet's Night Prayer Absence
content: The Prophet (ﷺ) fell ill and missed the night prayer for two nights. A woman came to him and said he was possessed by Satan. Allah then sent a message saying He had not abandoned or hated the Prophet.

title: Writing Down the Quran
content: Caliph Uthman asked Zaid bin Thabit and others to write down the Quran in a book. If they disagreed about any word, he told them to use the language of the Quraish tribe because the Quran was revealed in that dialect.

title: Perfume and Ihram Rules
content: Safwan bin Ya`la asked about a man who wore perfume while in Ihram. The Prophet (ﷺ) was inspired, then told the man to wash off the scent three times and remove his cloak. He also said the man should do all the things he would normally do during Hajj for his Umra.

title: Collecting the Quran
content: Abu Bakr sent for me after many of the Prophet's Companions were killed in battle. He and Umar were worried that too many people who knew the Quran by heart would die, and the Quran might be lost. They asked me to collect all the Quranic verses into one book. I was hesitant because the Prophet didn't do this, but Abu Bakr kept encouraging me until I agreed. I searched for written copies of the Quran on palm stalks, stones, and from people who knew it by heart. Eventually, I found the last verse of Surah Tauba with a man named Abi Khuzaima Al-Ansari. After that, the complete manuscripts of the Quran were kept by Abu Bakr, then Umar, and finally Hafsa, his daughter.

title: Uthman Compiles the Quran
content: Hudhaifa bin Al-Yaman was worried that Muslims in Sham and Iraq would disagree about how to read the Quran. He asked Uthman, the leader of the believers, to protect the nation by making sure everyone agrees on one version of the Quran. Uthman sent a message to Hafsa to send him all the copies of the Quran they had. They copied them carefully and made new versions in perfect Arabic. When they finished, Uthman sent one copy to each Muslim province and told people to burn any other copies they might have.

title: Collecting the Quran
content: Abu Bakr asked me to find and collect the Quran. I searched everywhere until I found two verses of Surah Tauba with Abu Khuza'ima Al-Ansari. These verses were: 'A Prophet has come from among you, he is sad when you are harmed.'

title: Not All Believers Are Equal
content: The Prophet (ﷺ) received a message from Allah saying that not all believers are equal. Some sit at home while others fight for Allah's cause. The Prophet (ﷺ) asked someone to bring him a board, inkpot, and scapula bone. He then dictated the message: 'Not equal are those Believers who sit...'. A blind man sitting behind him asked what he should do. In response, a new message was revealed from Allah saying that only disabled people or those fighting for Allah's cause are not equal.

title: Gabriel Taught the Prophet
content: Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) asked Gabriel to read the Quran in different ways. Gabriel read it once, then again and again, until he read it seven times.

title: Umar and Hisham's Recitation
content: `Umar bin Al-Khattab heard Hisham reciting Surat Al-Furqan differently from how he had been taught. He was about to stop him during prayer, but waited until Hisham finished. Then `Umar asked who taught him the Sura and Hisham said it was the Prophet. `Umar disagreed, so he took Hisham to the Prophet. The Prophet (ﷺ) told `Umar to release Hisham and recite Surat Al-Furqan himself. When he did, the Prophet confirmed that it had been revealed in different ways. He explained that the Quran can be read in seven different styles, and people should read it in a way that is easy for them.

title: Aisha's Advice on the Quran
content: A man from Iraq visited Aisha. He asked about the best type of shroud to wear for burial. Aisha said it didn't matter which one he chose. The man then asked to see her copy of the Quran so he could arrange its chapters in order, as people were reading them out of sequence. Aisha agreed and explained that it doesn't matter which part of the Quran you read first. She told him that the first thing revealed was a chapter about heaven and hell. Later, verses about what is allowed or not allowed were revealed. Aisha said if the first verse had been 'don't drink alcohol', people would have refused to give up drinking. If it had been 'don't have sex outside marriage', they would have refused to stop. When Aisha was a young girl, Muhammad (ﷺ) received a revelation that the Day of Judgment will be difficult and painful. Chapters Sura Al-Baqara and Surat An-Nisa were revealed while Aisha was with him. She then showed the man her copy of the Quran and dictated the correct order of its chapters.

title: Prophet's Early Earnings
content: The Prophet (ﷺ) said that the first chapters of the Quran he received were Surahs Al-Kahf, Maryam, Taha, and Al-Anbiya'. He considered them his old property.

title: Learned Surah al-A'la
content: Al-Bara' learned the Quranic chapter 'Glorify the Name of your Lord the Most High' before the Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) came to Medina.

title: Abdullah's Surahs
content: Abdullah told Shaqiq that the Prophet used to recite two surahs together in each prayer. Abdullah asked Alqama about these surahs, and Alqama said they are twenty surahs from the beginning of Al-Mufassal, ending with Ha Mim (the Smoke) and 'About what they question one another?'

title: The Prophet's Generosity
content: Ibn Abbas said the Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) was very generous. He became even more generous in Ramadan because Gabriel visited him every night during this month. When Gabriel came, the Prophet would read the Quran to him and be extremely kind.

title: Gabriel's Visit with the Prophet
content: Abu-Huraira said: Gabriel would often recite the Quran with the Prophet. One year, he did it twice. The Prophet (ﷺ) usually stayed in a special room for 10 days during Ramadan, but in his last year, he stayed for 20 days.

title: Learn the Quran from Four
content: Abdullah bin Amr said he loves Abdullah bin Masud because he heard the Prophet say to learn the Quran from four people: Abdullah bin Masud, Salim, Muadh, and Ubai bin Khab.

title: Abdullah bin Mas'ud's Knowledge
content: Abdullah bin Mas'ud gave a sermon to his friends. He said he learned over seventy chapters directly from the Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) (peace be upon him). He told them that even though he knew Allah's Book very well, he was not the best of their group.

title: Ibn Mas'ud Corrects a Man
content: 'Alqama said that Ibn Mas'ud recited Surat Yusuf in front of Allah's Messenger (ﷺ). A man disagreed with the way it was read, but Ibn Mas'ud said he had done it this way before and been praised by the Prophet. The man smelled of wine, so Ibn Mas'ud scolded him for lying about the Quran and drinking alcohol too. He then punished the man according to Islamic law.

title: Abdullah's Knowledge of the Quran
content: Abdullah said: 'I swear by Allah that I know where every chapter in the Quran was revealed. I also know who each verse was about. If there was someone else who knew the Quran better than me and they were somewhere I could reach on a camel, I would go to them.'

title: Who Collected the Quran
content: Anas bin Malik said that four men from the Ansar group collected the Quran during the time of the Prophet. They were Ubai bin Ka'b, Mu'adh bin Jabal, Zaid bin Thabit, and Abu Zaid.

title: Four People Knew Quran
content: When the Prophet died, only four people had collected all of the Quran. They were Abu Ad-Darda', Mu'adh bin Jabal, Zaid bin Thabit, and Abu Zaid. After Abu Zaid passed away, we took care of his collection because he didn't have any children.

title: Umar and Ubai's Quran Recitation
content: Ibn Abbas said that Umar told him: 'Ubai is the best of us at reciting the Quran, but we leave out some parts he says.' Ubai replied: 'I learned this from the Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ). I won't stop saying it no matter what.' Allah's message says: 'We never cancel or forget any part of our revelations. Instead, we replace them with something better or similar.'

title: Responding to Allah's Call
content: Abu Sa'id was praying when the Prophet called him. He didn't answer because he was in prayer. The Prophet (ﷺ) reminded Abu Sa'id of a verse that says, 'Give your response to Allah and His Messenger.' Then the Prophet asked if he wanted to learn about the best Surah in the Quran. Abu Sa'id said yes, and the Prophet told him it's Surat Al-Fatiha.

title: Healing with the Quran
content: We were on a journey when a slave girl came to us. Her tribe's chief had been stung by a scorpion and she asked if anyone could help him. One of our men went with her, but we didn't think he knew how to treat it. He recited the first chapter of the Quran (Al-Fatiha) over the chief, and the chief got better. The tribe's chief gave them 30 sheep as a reward and milk for us to drink. When we asked our friend if he really knew what he was doing, he said no. We didn't say anything until we reached Medina and told the Prophet about it. He said, 'How did he know that reciting Al-Fatiha could help?' Then he told us to share the reward with him.

title: Reciting Two Verses Daily
content: Abu Mas'ud said: Whoever recites two verses from the beginning of Surah Al-Furqan, 'Say, O people, I am sent to you as a messenger...' and 'And the fools among them have followed falsehood,' will be rewarded.

title: Reciting the Last Two Verses
content: The Prophet (ﷺ) said: If someone recites the last two verses of Surat Al-Baqara at night, it will be enough for them.

title: Protecting Yourself from Satan
content: Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) asked me to take care of the food for poor people during Ramadan. Someone came and stole some food, so I caught him and said I'd take him to Allah's Messenger (ﷺ). He begged me not to tell Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) about it and said that if I went to bed each night and recited a certain verse from the Quran (Ayat-al-Kursi), Allah would send an angel to protect me all night long, so Satan wouldn't be able to come near me until morning. When I told Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) what happened, he said that this person was telling the truth, even though he is actually lying and working for Satan.

title: A Man Reads Al-Kahf
content: A man was reading Surat Al-Kahf. His horse was tied nearby with two ropes. A cloud came down and covered him, getting closer until the horse started jumping in fear. The next morning, the man told the Prophet about this experience. The Prophet (ﷺ) said that it was a peaceful feeling called As-Sakina, which came because of the man's recitation of the Quran.

title: Umar Asks the Prophet
content: The Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) was traveling with his companion Umar. At night, Umar asked the Prophet a question three times, but he didn't answer. Umar thought to himself, 'The Prophet (ﷺ) is ignoring me!' So he rode ahead of the group and waited for the Prophet to call him back. When the Prophet did, he said that a new chapter from the Quran had been revealed to him. He recited it: 'We have given you a great victory.'

title: Reciting a Special Verse
content: Abu Said Al-Khudri said that a man told the Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) that he heard another man reciting 'Say He is Allah, (the) One' many times. The man thought it wasn't enough to just recite this verse once. So he went to the Prophet and asked about it. The Prophet (ﷺ) replied, 'This verse is as important as one-third of the whole Quran'.

title: Late Night Prayer
content: Abu Said's brother Qatada said a man prayed at night and read 'Say: He is Allah, (the) One'. The next morning he told the Prophet about it. The Prophet (ﷺ) replied that this was okay.

title: Reciting a Third of Quran
content: The Prophet (ﷺ) asked his companions if they could read one third of the Quran in one night. They said it was hard, so he explained that reciting Surat Al-Ikhlas (the chapter about God's oneness) is equal to reading one third of the Quran.

title: Prophet's Sick Day Routine
content: When the Prophet got sick, he would read two special chapters from the Quran and then blow on his body. If he was very ill, I would read these chapters and rub his hands over his body to get blessings.

title: Prophet's Bedtime Routine
content: When the Prophet went to sleep, he would first read three special chapters from the Quran: Al-Ikhlas, Al-Falaq, and An-Nas. Then, he would cup his hands together and blow over them. After that, he would rub his hands over different parts of his body, starting with his head, face, and front.

title: Angels Visit During Recitation
content: Usaid bin Hudair was reading the Quran at night. His horse got scared whenever he read. When he stopped, the horse calmed down. He tried to keep reading, but the horse got scared again. He took his son away from the horse and looked up at the sky. He couldn't see anything. The next morning, he told the Prophet about it. The Prophet (ﷺ) said, 'Keep reading!' Usaid explained that he stopped because of his son's safety. The Prophet (ﷺ) asked if he knew what he saw in the sky. Usaid said no. The Prophet (ﷺ) replied, 'It was Angels who came to listen to your voice. If you kept reading till dawn, they would have stayed there until morning.'

title: What the Prophet Left Behind
content: Shaddad bin Ma'qil and I visited Ibn Abbas. Shaddad asked him, 'Did the Prophet leave any books besides the Quran?' Ibn Abbas replied, 'No, he only left what's in the Quran.' We then visited Muhammad (ﷺ) bin Al-Hanafiyya and asked him the same question. He said, 'The Prophet (ﷺ) didn't leave anything except what's between the Quran's covers'.

title: Benefits of Reading Quran
content: The Prophet (ﷺ) said: A person who reads the Quran is like a fruit that tastes good and smells nice. If someone doesn't read the Quran, it's like a date that tastes good but has no smell. Someone who does bad things and reads the Quran is like a plant with a nice smell but a bitter taste. And someone who does bad things and doesn't read the Quran is like something that tastes bitter and smells nothing.

title: Life and Labor
content: The Prophet (ﷺ) said: 'Your life is like the time between Asr prayer and sunset. The Jews worked for one unit of weight until midday, then the Christians worked from midday to Asr prayer for the same amount. You Muslims work from Asr to Maghrib prayer for twice that amount. They said they did more but got less pay. Allah asked them if He was unfair. They said no. Then He said: 'This is My Blessing, given to whom I choose.'

title: No Will Left by the Prophet
content: I asked Abdullah bin Abi Aufa if the Prophet made a will. He said no. I was surprised because people are told to make wills, but the Prophet didn't. Then he explained that the Prophet did leave something - his Book.

title: Listen to the Quran
content: Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) said that Allah listens more carefully when a prophet recites the Quran in a nice voice. This means reading it out loud.

title: Prophets and Quran Recitation
content: The Prophet (ﷺ) said that Allah listens more carefully to a prophet who recites the Quran in a clear voice. This means a prophet who thinks the Quran is more important than worldly things, so they don't need many of them.

title: Two Types of Good People
content: Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) said that there are only two types of people you should try to be like. One is a person who knows the Quran and reads it at night. The other is someone who has money and gives some of it to help others both day and night.

title: Two Men to Admire
content: The Prophet (ﷺ) said: Don't wish to be like anyone except two people. One is a person who learns the Quran and reads it at night and day, so much that his neighbor hears him and wishes he could do the same. The other is someone who has wealth and uses it for good deeds. If you see them, you might think, 'I wish I had what they have, then I would act like them.'

title: Learn and Teach the Quran
content: The Prophet (ﷺ) said: 'Those who learn the Quran and teach it are the best among you.'

title: Learn and Teach the Quran
content: The Prophet (ﷺ) said: 'Those who learn the Quran and teach it are the best among you.'

title: The Prophet's Advice on Marriage
content: A woman told the Prophet she wanted to marry him. He said he didn't need another wife. A man asked if he could have her, but couldn't afford a gift. The Prophet (ﷺ) suggested giving her anything, even something small like an iron ring. The man said he knew some of the Quran by heart. The Prophet (ﷺ) agreed to let them get married because of that.

title: Marriage and Knowledge
content: A woman came to the Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ). She wanted to marry him but he didn't accept her right away. A man from his companions stood up and said, 'If you don't want her, I'll take her as my wife.' The Prophet (ﷺ) asked if he had anything to offer her. The man said no. So the Prophet told him to go home and see what he could find to give her. The man went back and said he still couldn't find anything. The Prophet (ﷺ) told him to try harder, even to look for something small like an iron ring. But the man still couldn't find anything. He offered to give her half of his waist sheet instead. However, the Prophet pointed out that if the woman wore it, the man would have nothing over his body, and if he wore it, she would have nothing over hers. The man sat for a while and then left. The Prophet (ﷺ) saw him going away and called someone to bring him back. He asked the man how much of the Quran he knew by heart. The man said he knew several Surahs. The Prophet (ﷺ) asked if he could recite them from memory, and the man said yes. Then the Prophet said, 'I'll marry this woman to you because you know so much of the Quran'.

title: Tying and Controlling Knowledge
content: Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) said that knowing the Quran is like having tied camels. If you keep them tied, you can control them. But if you let them go, they will run away.

title: Remembering the Quran
content: The Prophet (ﷺ) said, 'If you say you forgot a verse of the Quran, it means Allah made you forget it. Keep reciting the Quran because people's memories fade quickly, just like how camels move fast and leave their owners behind.'

title: Commit to the Quran
content: The Prophet (ﷺ) said: 'Be careful with the Quran. It's easy to forget it, like a camel trying to break free from its rope.'

title: Conquest of Mecca
content: Abdullah bin Mughaffal said he saw the Prophet reciting Surat-al-Fath on his camel when they conquered Mecca.

title: What are Mufassal Suras?
content: Sa'id bin Jubair said that the Mufassal Suras in the Quran are actually called Muhkam. Ibn Abbas also confirmed this, saying he learned these parts of the Quran when he was just ten years old.

title: Ibn Abbas Learns Quran
content: Sa'id bin Jubair said that Ibn Abbas told him: 'I learned all the clear and easy-to-understand chapters of the Quran during the lifetime of the Prophet.' Sa'id asked, 'What are these clear chapters?' Ibn Abbas replied, 'They are the ones that are not broken up into many sections.'

title: The Prophet's Kindness to the Reader
content: The Prophet (ﷺ) heard a man reading the Quran in the mosque. He said, 'May Allah be kind to him because he reminded me of some important verses from a certain chapter.'

title: Forgetting the Quran
content: Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) heard a man reading the Quran at night. He said that Allah should bless this man because he reminded him of some forgotten verses in certain chapters of the Quran.

title: Forgetting the Quran
content: The Prophet (ﷺ) said, 'When someone says they forgot some verses of the Quran, it's actually Allah who made them forget.'

title: Reciting the Last Two Verses
content: Abu Masud said the Prophet told him that if you read the last two verses of Surah Baqarah at night, it will be enough for you to protect yourself from harm until morning.

title: Umar and Hisham's Recitation
content: `Umar bin Khattab heard Hisham reciting Surat-al-Furqan differently from how he was taught. He thought Hisham was lying, so he took him to the Prophet. The Prophet (ﷺ) asked Hisham to recite again, and it sounded the same as before. The Prophet (ﷺ) said that's how it was meant to be read. Then he told `Umar to recite his way, and it was also correct.

title: Prophet's Mercy for Reciter
content: One night, the Prophet heard someone reciting the Quran in the mosque. He said, 'May Allah be kind to him because he reminded me of some verses from certain chapters that I had forgotten.'

title: Reciting Short Quranic Chapters
content: Abu Wail and his friends visited Abdullah in the morning. One of them said he had read all the short chapters of the Quran the day before. Abdullah replied, 'That's very fast! I remember how the Prophet used to recite the Quran. He would read eighteen short chapters from one group and two more from another group that start with Ha Mim.'

title: Gabriel's Visit to the Prophet
content: Ibn Abbas said: The Quran says 'Do not rush with reciting it.' When Gabriel came to the Prophet, he would move his tongue and lips. It was hard for him. We could see that he was being inspired by Allah. So Allah revealed a verse saying 'It is for Us to collect it in your mind and give you the ability to recite it from memory.' When Gabriel brought the Quran to the Prophet, he would listen carefully. After Gabriel left, the Prophet would recite what had been revealed.

title: Prophet's Prayer Style
content: I asked Anas bin Malik about the Prophet's prayer style. He said, 'He used to pray with long sounds a lot.'

title: How the Prophet Recited Quran
content: Anas was asked about how the Prophet recited the Quran. He said that it had a special way of pronouncing some sounds, like 'In the Name of Allah' and 'the Most Beneficent'. An example is: In the Name of Allah, the Most Beneficent, the Most Merciful - he would say this slowly.

title: Prophet Recites Quran While Riding
content: I saw the Prophet reciting the Quran while he was riding his camel. He was reading Surah Fath softly and in a gentle, vibrating voice.

title: Prophet's Praise for Abu Musa
content: The Prophet (ﷺ) said to Abu Musa: 'You have a beautiful voice, like the family of David.'

title: Prophet Muhammad's Request
content: The Prophet (ﷺ) asked Abdullah to recite the Quran. Abdullah said it had been revealed to him already. The Prophet (ﷺ) replied, 'I like to hear it from others.'

title: The Prophet Asks Abdullah to Read
content: Abdullah bin Mas'ud said the Prophet asked him to read the Quran. Abdullah said, 'You already know it.' The Prophet (ﷺ) replied, 'Yes, recite it anyway.' So Abdullah read Surat An-Nisa'. When he reached a certain verse, the Prophet stopped him and his eyes started crying.

title: Reciting the Quran in Prayer
content: Ibn Shubruma wanted to know how little of the Quran he could recite in prayer. He looked for a Surah with fewer than three verses, but couldn't find one. So he decided that you should always recite at least three Quranic verses in your prayers.

title: Abdullah's Fasting Routine
content: My father told me to get married. My wife said I didn't visit her since we got married. My father asked the Prophet about it, and he met with me. He asked how often I fasted and finished the Quran. I said every day and night. The Prophet (ﷺ) advised me to fast three days a month and finish the Quran in one month. I wanted to do more, so he told me to fast three days a week. Again, I wanted to do more. So, he suggested fasting like David, who fasted every other day, and finishing the Quran in seven days.

title: Prophet's Question about Quran
content: The Prophet (ﷺ) asked me how long it takes to recite the whole Quran. I said it takes me three nights and a day to finish it.

title: Reciting the Quran
content: Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) told Abdullah bin Amr to read the whole Quran in one month. Abdullah said he could do more, so Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) said to finish it in seven days at least.

title: Prophet Muhammad Loves Hearing Quran
content: I asked the Prophet if I should read the Quran to him. He said yes, even though he already knew it. So I started reading from Surat An-Nisa and reached a verse that says God will bring witnesses from each nation. The Prophet (ﷺ) stopped me there and his eyes filled with tears.

title: Prophet likes hearing Quran
content: The Prophet (ﷺ) said to Abdullah bin Masud, 'Recite the Quran to me.' Abdullah asked, 'Should I recite it when you already know it?' The Prophet (ﷺ) replied, 'I like to hear someone else read it'.

title: Warning about False Believers
content: Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) said that in the last days of the world, there will be young people who talk well but are not true Muslims. They won't stay Muslim for long and their faith will only be on their tongues. If you find them, kill them because those who do so will get a reward on Judgment Day.

title: Fake Muslims Will Appear
content: Abu Sa'id Al-Khudri said he heard the Prophet say: 'Some people will come who have good prayer and fasting, but their actions won't match what they do. They'll read the Quran, but it won't change them. They'll leave Islam like an arrow leaves its target, without a sign of where they went.'

title: Believers and Hypocrites Compared
content: The Prophet (ﷺ) said: A person who reads the Quran and follows it is like a citron - it tastes good and smells nice. Someone who doesn't read the Quran but still does good deeds is like a date - it's sweet to eat, but has no smell. A hypocrite who recites the Quran but doesn't act on it is like sweet basil - it smells nice but tastes bitter. And someone who neither reads nor acts on the Quran is like a colocynth - it tastes bad and smells bad.

title: Recite the Quran Together
content: The Prophet (ﷺ) said: 'Keep reading the Quran together as long as you agree on its meaning. But if you disagree, stop reading it for now.'

title: When to Stop Reciting Quran
content: The Prophet (ﷺ) said: 'Keep reading the Quran as long as you agree on its meaning. If you disagree about what it means, stop reading it for now.'

title: Reciting the Quran Correctly
content: Abdullah told the Prophet that he heard a man reciting a verse from the Quran differently than how the Prophet used to recite it. The Prophet (ﷺ) said, 'You both are right, keep reading.' He then added, 'The people before us were destroyed because they disagreed with each other.'

title: Three Men Ask About Worship
content: A group of three men visited the Prophet's wives. They asked how the Prophet worshipped Allah. When they found out, they thought their own worship was not good enough. One said he would pray all night forever. Another said he would fast every year and never break his fast. The third said he would stay away from women and never get married. The Prophet (ﷺ) came to them and said, 'You're the ones who said that? I am more careful about Allah than you are. But I still pray, I still fast, and I still marry. If someone doesn't follow my example in their faith, they don't belong with me.'

title: Marriage and Orphan Girls
content: 'Urwa asked Aisha about a verse in the Quran. She explained that it's about guardians who want to marry orphan girls for their wealth and beauty, but without giving them a fair dowry. The verse says if you can't be fair with one girl, then marry another woman instead.

title: Marriage and Fasting
content: 'Abdullah was with me at Mina. 'Uthman met him and said he wanted to talk about marrying a young woman to make 'Abdullah happy again. 'Abdullah didn't need that, so he signaled for me to join them. He told 'Uthman that the Prophet once said: 'If you can get married, do it. If not, fast regularly because fasting helps reduce your desire.'

title: Marriage and Fasting for Young Men
content: When I was young, we had no money. The Prophet (ﷺ) said to us: 'If you can get married, do it. Marriage helps you control your desires and be modest. If you can't marry, fast instead. Fasting reduces your desire for sex.'

title: Carrying Maimuna's Bier
content: 'Ata and Ibn 'Abbas went to the funeral of Maimuna. Ibn 'Abbas said, 'Be gentle when lifting her body. The Prophet (ﷺ) used to spend nights with eight of his wives, but not with Maimuna. So walk smoothly.'

title: Prophet's Marriage Arrangements
content: The Prophet (ﷺ) used to visit all his wives in one night. He had nine wives.

title: Marry for a Good Life
content: Ibn Abbas asked me if I was married. I said no. He told me to marry because the Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) had many wives and he was the best person in our nation.

title: Emigration and Intention
content: The Prophet (ﷺ) said: The rewards of our actions depend on our intentions. If someone moves to a new place for Allah's sake, their move is for Allah. But if they do it for money or to get married, then that's what it was really about.

title: No Castration in Islam
content: Ibn Masud said: We were fighting with the Prophet. We didn't have wives with us. So we asked him, 'Should we get castrated?' The Prophet (ﷺ) told us not to do that.

title: Brotherhood and Marriage
content: The Prophet (ﷺ) made 'Abdur-Rahman bin 'Auf a brother of Sa'd bin Ar-Rabi'. Sa'd had two wives, but he suggested that 'Abdur-Rahman take one wife and half his property. 'Abdur-Rahman didn't want this, so he went to the market and bought some food. After a few days, the Prophet saw him with yellow stains on his clothes and asked what they were. 'Abdur-Rahman said he had married an Ansari woman. The Prophet (ﷺ) asked how much Mahr (gift) he gave her. 'Abdur-Rahman replied it was as heavy as one date stone of gold. The Prophet (ﷺ) told him to celebrate with a banquet, even if it's just with one sheep.

title: Marriage is Allowed
content: Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) told Sa'd bin Abi Waqqas to let `Uthman bin Maz'un get married. If he hadn't, some people might have chosen not to marry at all.

title: Prophet's Advice on Marriage
content: The Prophet (ﷺ) stopped `Uthman from getting married. If he had allowed it, some of us would have chosen to be castrated instead.

title: Temporary Marriage in War
content: 'Abdullah said: We were going to battles with the Prophet. We didn't have wives with us, so we thought about getting married but then divorcing quickly. The Prophet (ﷺ) stopped us from doing that and allowed us to make a temporary marriage contract instead. He reminded us not to break any rules by saying, 'Don't stop yourself from good things Allah has made okay for you.'

title: Abu Huraira's Concern
content: Abu Huraira asked the Prophet about his fear of committing adultery. He couldn't afford to get married. The Prophet (ﷺ) kept silent three times before answering. Then he said, 'Your future is already written. You can choose to be castrated or not.'

title: Eating from Trees
content: I asked the Prophet what to do if we found a valley with trees. Some had been eaten by animals and some hadn't. He said, 'Let your camel eat from the ones that haven't been eaten yet.'

title: Prophet's Dream About Aisha
content: The Prophet (ﷺ) said to me: 'I had a dream about you twice. In the dream, someone was carrying you in a cloth made of silk and told me that you are my wife. When I looked closely, it was really you. If this is from Allah, He will make it happen'.

title: Marriage Advice from the Prophet
content: Jabir bin Abdullah was returning from a battle with the Prophet. He was riding his camel fast because it was slow. A rider came behind him and poked his camel with a spear, making it run faster. It was the Prophet himself. The Prophet (ﷺ) asked Jabir why he was in such a hurry. Jabir said he was newly married. The Prophet (ﷺ) asked if he had married a young girl or an older woman. Jabir said an older woman. The Prophet (ﷺ) suggested marrying a young girl so they could play together. When approaching Medina, the Prophet told his companions to wait and enter at night. He wanted women to comb their hair and those whose husbands were away to shave.

title: Marriage Advice from the Prophet
content: When I got married, the Prophet asked me about my wife. I said she was a mature woman. He asked why I didn't choose a younger one so we could play together.

title: Abu Bakr Refuses Marriage
content: The Prophet (ﷺ) asked Abu Bakr to marry him to Aisha. Abu Bakr said he was like a brother to the Prophet, but the Prophet said that in Islam, marriage is allowed between people who are related by faith.

title: Best Women According to Prophet
content: The Prophet (ﷺ) said that the best women are those who ride camels and come from the Quraish tribe. They take good care of their children when they're young and manage their family's money wisely.

title: Double Reward for Good Deeds
content: Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) said: A man who teaches and educates a slave girl, then frees her and marries her, will get two rewards. If someone from another faith believes in their own prophet and also believes in me, they too will get two rewards. And any slave who is good to their master and follows Allah's rules will also get double the reward.

title: Abraham's Three Lies
content: The Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) said: Abraham told lies only three times. One of those was when he met a cruel leader and his wife Sarah was with him. The leader gave Sarah Hajar to take care of her. Sarah said, 'Allah protected me from the cruel man and gave me Hajar to help me.' The Prophet (ﷺ) then said, 'Hajar is your ancestor, O people of Arabia.'

title: Prophet's Wedding to Safiyya
content: The Prophet (ﷺ) stayed in Khaibar for three days before going back to Medina. During this time, he married a woman named Safiyya bint Huyai. I invited the Muslims to join them for a meal, but we didn't have much food - just dates, dried yoghurt, and butter on leather sheets. Some people wondered if Safiyya was his wife or slave girl. They thought that if he made her cover herself, she would be like one of the Prophet's wives. But if he didn't make her cover up, then she wouldn't be considered a wife. So when they left Khaibar, the Prophet gave Safiyya space behind him on his camel and put a screen between her and the other people.

title: Manumitting Safiyya
content: Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) freed a slave named Safiyya and considered her freedom as her marriage gift.

title: Marriage without a Dowry
content: A woman asked the Prophet to marry her without giving him any money. The Prophet (ﷺ) looked at her carefully but didn't say anything. A man from his companions said, 'If you don't want her, I'll take her.' The Prophet (ﷺ) asked if he had any wealth to give to her. The man said no, so the Prophet told him to go home and see if he could find something. He came back twice, but couldn't find anything. Finally, he offered his waist sheet, saying he'd give half of it to her. The Prophet (ﷺ) said this wouldn't work because they'd both be naked. Later, when the man was leaving, the Prophet asked him how much of the Quran he knew. When the man replied that he knew a lot by heart, the Prophet married the woman to him for his knowledge of the Quran.

title: Abu Hudhaifa's Adopted Son
content: Abu Hudhaifa had a friend named Salim. He was a freed slave who used to be owned by an Ansar woman. The Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) (peace be upon him) had also adopted a son named Zaid. In the past, when someone adopted a boy, people would call him their own son and he would inherit from them. But then Allah revealed a message saying that adopted sons should be called by their biological father's name. If you didn't know your father, you were considered a freed slave and a brother in faith. One day, Abu Hudhaifa's wife came to the Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) (peace be upon him) and said, 'We used to think of Salim as our son.' The Prophet (ﷺ) told her what Allah had revealed about adopted sons.

title: Allah's Messenger Helps Dubaa
content: The Prophet (ﷺ) visited Dubaa bint Az-Zubair and asked if she wanted to go on Hajj. She said no because she was sick. He told her to plan to go on Hajj but say a prayer: 'O Allah, I'll finish my special clothes at wherever You stop me.'

title: Marriage and What Matters
content: The Prophet (ﷺ) said: A woman is married for four things. Her wealth, her family's status, how she looks, or her good character. So, marry a woman who has good character. Otherwise, you will lose out.

title: Allah's Messenger and Poverty
content: A man passed by Allah's Messenger (ﷺ). His companions said he was a good person: if he asked for someone to marry, she should be given to him; if he helped someone, his help should be accepted; and if he spoke, people should listen. Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) kept quiet. Then a poor Muslim walked by. The companions said the poor man was not good: if he asked for someone to marry, he shouldn't get married; if he helped someone, his help shouldn't be accepted; and if he spoke, people shouldn't listen. Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) said, 'This poor man is better than many others.'

title: Guardians and Orphan Girls
content: 'Urwa asked Aisha about a verse in the Quran. She explained that it's about an orphan girl who is being taken care of by her guardian, but he wants to marry her for her beauty and wealth instead of treating her fairly. The guardian is not allowed to marry her unless he gives her her full dowry. If he doesn't want to marry her because she's poor or ugly, then he can't marry her at all. Allah revealed a new verse saying that if the guardian wants to marry the orphan girl for her beauty and wealth, he has to treat her fairly and give her her full dowry. The Prophet (ﷺ) said that if there's any bad luck, it's in horses, women, or houses.

title: Three Things to Avoid
content: Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) said, 'Bad luck can come from a woman, a house, or a horse.'

title: Evil Omen Explained
content: Ibn Umar told me that the Prophet said: 'If something bad is thought to be a sign of trouble, it's usually about three things: your home, the woman in your life, or your horse.'

title: Bad Omens from Horses
content: Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) said: If there's a bad omen, it can be in a horse, a woman, or a house.

title: Women and Trials
content: The Prophet (ﷺ) said, 'After me, no greater test will come to men than dealing with women'.

title: Barira's Manumission
content: Aisha told me that three important rules were made because of Barira. First, when someone frees a slave, the slave gets to choose whether they want to stay with their family or not. Second, the freed slave belongs to the person who set them free. The Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) saw this and said it was true. Third, when he visited Aisha's home, he saw a cooking pot on the fire but didn't eat from it because it was food given to Barira as charity.

title: Marriage and Orphan Girls
content: Aisha said that the Verse 'And if you fear that you shall not be able to deal justly with the orphans...' is about a man who takes care of an orphan girl. He wants to marry her because she has money, but he treats her badly and doesn't manage her wealth fairly. If this happens, he should marry other women instead of her. The Verse also says that marriage between certain relatives is not allowed.

title: Foster Suckling Relations
content: `Aisha was with the Prophet when she heard someone asking to enter Hafsa's house. She told the Prophet, 'Someone is asking to come in.' The Prophet (ﷺ) said, 'I think it's Hafsa's foster uncle.' `Aisha asked, 'If he were alive, could he visit me?' The Prophet (ﷺ) replied, 'Yes, because foster relationships are like family ties.'

title: Prophet's Foster Niece
content: Ibn Abbas asked the Prophet about marrying Hamza's daughter. The Prophet (ﷺ) said she is his foster niece because her father, Hamza, was his brother.

title: Prophet's Marriage Decision
content: Um Habiba asked the Prophet to marry her sister. The Prophet (ﷺ) said he couldn't because marrying his step-daughter or foster niece was not allowed. He explained that he and Abu Salama were both suckled by Thuwaiba, making the daughter of Um Salama off-limits for marriage.

title: Prophet's Advice on Foster Siblings
content: The Prophet (ﷺ) entered Aisha's room and saw a man sitting with her. The man looked unhappy about something, so Aisha said, 'This is my brother.' The Prophet (ﷺ) asked her to be sure who the man was related to her, because foster siblings are only considered brothers or sisters if they were breastfed by the same woman.

title: Aisha's Decision About Visiting
content: Aflah, Aisha's uncle, came to visit her after a new rule was revealed about women wearing veils. Aisha didn't let him in at first, but when the Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) arrived, she told him what she had done. The Prophet (ﷺ) then told her to let Aflah enter.

title: Marriage and Family Laws
content: A man named Uqba married a woman. Then a black lady came to them and said she had suckled both of them as babies. The man thought she was lying, but the Prophet told him to divorce his wife because of this claim. The Prophet (ﷺ) said that if someone says they have suckled you with your partner, it's not allowed for you to marry or stay married to her. Ibn Abbas explained that there are seven types of marriages that are not allowed because of blood relations and seven more because of marriage relations. He also mentioned a verse from the Quran that lists who is not allowed as a spouse.

title: Marriage and Family Rules
content: Um Habiba asked the Prophet if he wanted to marry her sister. The Prophet (ﷺ) said he didn't know what to do with another wife. Um Habiba suggested marrying her sister, but the Prophet said it wasn't allowed because her sister's mother had nursed him as a baby, making her his stepdaughter.

title: Marriage to Two Sisters
content: Um Habiba asked the Prophet if he would marry her sister. He said it wasn't allowed for him to be married to two sisters at the same time. She then mentioned another woman, Durra, and the Prophet explained that she was his foster niece because Thuwaiba had nursed both of them. He told Um Habiba not to offer either of her daughters or sisters to him in marriage.

title: Marriage and Family Ties
content: Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) said that it is not allowed to marry a woman who has a close family relationship with you. This means you cannot marry your aunt or her sister.

title: Marriage Prohibition
content: Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) said: A woman and her paternal aunt should not marry the same man. Also, a woman and her maternal aunt should not marry the same man.

title: Marriage to Relatives
content: The Prophet (ﷺ) said that a woman cannot be married to a man and his paternal aunt or maternal aunt at the same time. This rule also applies if her husband's father is related to one of these women, because the relationship through milk (foster suckling) is just as strong as blood relation.

title: Marriage and Family Ties
content: The Prophet (ﷺ) said a woman cannot be married to two men who are related to her through blood or foster care. This includes her paternal aunt, maternal aunt, or the father of her husband. 'Aisha said that if something is not allowed because of family ties, it's also not allowed because of being raised together.

title: Marriage Arrangements Forbidden
content: Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) forbade a practice where someone marries their daughter to another person. Then the other person marries their own daughter back to the first person, without paying any money for the marriage.

title: Khaula and Aisha's Story
content: Khaula bint Hakim wanted to marry the Prophet. Aisha said it was strange for a woman to propose marriage. When Allah revealed a verse that let the Prophet choose which wife to be with, Aisha said she thought her Lord was being very kind to him.

title: Prophet's Marriage While in Ihram
content: Ibn Abbas said the Prophet got married when he was already in a state of Ihram, which means he had made a promise to Allah not to cut his hair or shave and to only perform certain actions during his pilgrimage.

title: Prophet Forbids Mut'a Marriage
content: Ali asked Ibn Abbas about the Prophet's actions during the battle of Khaibar. He said the Prophet forbade temporary marriages (Mut'a) and eating donkey meat.

title: Ibn Abbas on Marriage
content: A man asked Ibn Abbas about temporary marriage. He said it was allowed. A slave of his spoke up and said, 'Only in very hard times when women are scarce.' Ibn Abbas agreed with him.

title: Temporary Marriage Allowed
content: Jabir and Salama were in an army. The Prophet (ﷺ) came to them and said, 'You can now do temporary marriage.'

title: Temporary Marriage Allowed
content: Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) said to us: 'You are allowed to do temporary marriage. If a man and woman agree to marry temporarily, their marriage should last for three nights. They can choose to continue or separate after that.'

title: A Woman Asks the Prophet
content: Anas was with his daughter when a woman came to the Prophet. She asked if he wanted to marry her. Anas's daughter thought it was shameful, but Anas said this woman was actually showing respect by offering herself for marriage.

title: The Prophet Marries a Woman
content: A woman asked to marry the Prophet. A man said, 'If you don't need her, I'll take her.' The Prophet (ﷺ) asked what he had to offer. The man said he had nothing. The Prophet (ﷺ) told him to find something, even a small ring. But the man couldn't find anything. He offered his only garment, but it was too thin for both of them. So the man sat down and waited. When the Prophet saw him leaving, he called him back and asked how much of the Quran he knew by heart. The man said he knew some Suras. The Prophet (ﷺ) married the woman to him because of what he knew from the Quran.

title: Umar Proposes Hafsa to Uthman
