content: `Umar bin Al-Khattab asked `Uthman bin `Affan if he wanted to marry his daughter Hafsa. `Uthman said no, so `Umar then offered her to Abu Bakr, but he didn't say yes or no. Later, the Prophet married Hafsa. When `Umar met Abu Bakr again, Abu Bakr explained that he had kept quiet because he knew the Prophet was interested in marrying Hafsa.

title: Marriage and Widows
content: Um Habiba told the Prophet that people were talking about him wanting to marry Durra bint Abu-Salama. The Prophet (ﷺ) said, 'Even if I wasn't married to Um Salama, Durra's father is my foster brother, so she wouldn't be allowed for me to marry.' Ibn Abbas explained how to ask a widow to marry: you can say something like, 'I'm looking for someone to marry and hope Allah will help me find a good partner.' Al-Qasim said it's better to hint at your intention rather than saying directly. Ata added that when asking a widow, you should say something like, 'You're fit to remarry' or 'Allah will bring you good fortune.' The widow can respond but shouldn't make any promises. Her guardian also shouldn't promise her marriage without her knowledge.

title: Allah's Messenger Sees Aisha
content: Aisha: The Prophet (ﷺ) said to me, 'I had a dream where an angel brought you to me wrapped in cloth. He said you are my wife. I removed the cloth and it was really you.'

title: A Woman Seeks Marriage
content: A woman came to the Prophet and said she wanted to marry him. He looked at her but didn't say anything, so she sat down. A companion stood up and asked if he could have her hand in marriage instead. The Prophet (ﷺ) asked if he had any wealth to offer, but the man said no. He went home and tried to find something to give, even an iron ring, but couldn't. He offered his only garment, a waist sheet, saying he would give half of it to her. The Prophet (ﷺ) said this wouldn't work because she would be naked if she wore it, or he would be naked if he wore it. The man left, but the Prophet called him back and asked how much of the Quran he knew by heart. When the man replied that he could recite several suras, the Prophet agreed to let him marry her in exchange for what he knew of the Quran.

title: Types of Marriage in Pre-Islam
content: Aishah told the Prophet about four types of marriage that existed before Islam. One type was like today's marriage, where a man asks for a woman's hand and gives her a gift called Mahr. The second type was called Al-Istibda', where a husband would let his wife sleep with another man to have a child of noble breed. If she got pregnant, he could then sleep with her again. The third type was when a group of men would have sex with one woman, and if she got pregnant, they would all be called in and the child would follow whoever she chose as its father. The fourth type was prostitution, where many men would visit a woman and she would never refuse anyone. If someone got her pregnant, all the men involved would gather to see who the child's father was. When Islam came, these types of marriage were abolished except for the one we use today.

title: Guardianship and Marriage
content: `Aisha said: This verse is about a girl who has property under the care of a man. He has more right to her than anyone else, but he doesn't want to marry her himself. So, he stops her from marrying someone else, so he can keep all her property for himself.

title: Umar Finds a Husband
content: After her husband died, Umar suggested Hafsa marry his friend `Uthman. But `Uthman said no, so Umar asked Abu Bakr if he wanted to marry Hafsa.

title: Marriage and Divorce Laws
content: Ma'qil bin Yasar told Al-Hasan that a Verse of the Quran was revealed about him. He had married his sister to a man, but the man divorced her. When she finished her waiting period, he asked to marry her again. Ma'qil said no, because the man had already divorced her once. The man and his wife wanted to be together again, so Allah revealed: 'Do not prevent them.' (2.232) After this, Ma'qil let them get married again.

title: Guardians and Female Orphans
content: A man was taking care of a young woman who didn't have parents. He owned some property with her, but he didn't want to marry her himself. He also didn't want anyone else to marry her because then they would share the property. Allah said this is not allowed and that the guardian should let the woman get married if she wants to.

title: Prophet Marries Off a Woman
content: The Prophet (ﷺ) was sitting with his companions when a woman came to ask for marriage. He looked at her but didn't say anything. One of the men said, 'Let me marry her, O Prophet.' The Prophet (ﷺ) asked if he had any money or possessions. The man said no, not even an iron ring. He offered to tear his garment in half and give one piece to the woman. The Prophet (ﷺ) asked if he knew some of the Quran by heart. The man said yes. So the Prophet agreed to marry the woman to him, using what he knew of the Quran as her dowry.

title: Prophet's Marriage to Aisha
content: Aisha said the Prophet married her when she was six years old. He waited until she was nine years old, then they started living together as husband and wife. They stayed like this for nine years, until he passed away.

title: Prophet Muhammad's Marriage to Aisha
content: The Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) married Aisha when she was six years old. He started living with her as his wife when she was nine years old. They were together for about nine years, until the Prophet passed away.

title: Marriage and Quranic Knowledge
content: A woman asked the Prophet for marriage. A man offered to marry her but couldn't afford a dowry. The Prophet (ﷺ) asked if he knew any of the Quran by heart, and when he said yes, he agreed to marry the woman based on that.

title: Marriage with a Woman's Consent
content: The Prophet (ﷺ) said that a woman should not be married without her permission. If she is quiet when asked, it means she agrees to the marriage. This rule applies to both married women and virgins.

title: Consent of a Virgin
content: I asked the Prophet about a girl who doesn't say anything. He said that her silence means she agrees.

title: Khansa's Marriage Problem
content: Khansa's father married her off when she was already a grown woman. She didn't want the marriage and went to see the Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ). He said that this marriage was not valid.

title: Marriage to an Orphan Girl
content: A man named Khidam married a woman against her will. The Prophet (ﷺ) said: 'If you're worried about treating orphan girls unfairly, marry other women instead.' If someone asks the guardian of a woman for permission to marry her and the guardian stays silent or says they have some money, the marriage is valid.

title: Guardians and Female Orphans
content: 'Urwa bin Az-Zubair asked Aisha about a verse in the Quran. She explained that it was about guardians who wanted to marry female orphans because of their wealth and beauty, but without giving them a fair amount of money (Mahr). The Prophet (ﷺ) was asked for advice on this matter, and Allah revealed another verse saying that if a guardian wants to marry an orphan girl, he must treat her justly and give her the full Mahr. He can't just choose her because of her wealth or beauty.

title: The Prophet Marries a Woman
content: A woman asked the Prophet for marriage. He said he didn't need another wife at that time. A man then offered to marry her, but had no wealth or possessions. The Prophet (ﷺ) asked if he knew any of the Quran by heart. The man replied that he did, and the Prophet agreed to marry them.

title: Respecting Agreements and Engagement
content: The Prophet (ﷺ) said that if someone agrees to buy something from another person, they should not try to cancel the deal by offering more money. Also, a man should not ask for the hand of a woman who is already promised to marry his Muslim friend unless the first suitor gives up or allows him to ask her.

title: Beware of Suspicion
content: The Prophet (ﷺ) said: Don't suspect others. It's a lie. Don't spy on each other. Don't listen to bad talk about someone else. Be friends, not enemies. If your friend is already engaged to another Muslim brother, wait for him to marry her or give up his proposal before asking for her hand in marriage.

title: Be Kind to Others
content: The Prophet (ﷺ) said: Be careful with what you think about others. It's easy to get the wrong idea and spread false information. Don't spy on each other or listen to gossip. Treat your brothers with kindness and respect, not anger. If someone else has asked a girl to marry her, don't ask for her hand too - wait until the first person either marries her or gives up.

title: Umar Offers Hafsa to Abu Bakr
content: Abdullah bin Umar said: When Hafsa became a widow, Umar suggested that she marry Abu Bakr. He waited for a few days and then the Prophet asked for her hand in marriage. Abu Bakr told Umar that he didn't accept because he knew the Prophet wanted to marry Hafsa.

title: Eloquent Speech Can Be Powerful
content: Two men from the east came and gave speeches. The Prophet (ﷺ) said that some people's words can be like magic, making others agree to do something they didn't want to do in the first place.

title: Prophet visits newlywed couple
content: After I got married, the Prophet came to visit me. He sat on my bed, and our little girls were playing with tambourines and singing sad songs about their grandfather who had been killed in a battle. One of them said, 'We have a Prophet who knows what will happen tomorrow.' The Prophet (ﷺ) told them to stop saying that and go back to the old songs.

title: Abdur Rahman's Marriage Gift
content: Anas said that Abdur Rahman bin Auf married a woman and gave her some gold as a gift. When the Prophet noticed he was happy, he asked him about it. Abdur Rahman said he had given his new wife an amount of gold equal in weight to a small date stone.

title: The Prophet's Marriage Advice
content: I was sitting with the Prophet when a woman stood up and said, 'She has given herself in marriage to you. What do you think?' The Prophet (ﷺ) didn't say anything. She stood up again and asked the same question. He still didn't answer. Then she stood up for the third time and asked the same thing. A man got up and said, 'O Messenger of Allah, marry her to me.' The Prophet (ﷺ) asked him if he had any money or property. He said no. So the Prophet told him to go find something, even a small iron ring. The man went but couldn't find anything. Then the Prophet asked him if he knew some verses from the Quran by heart. The man said yes. The Prophet (ﷺ) then said, 'I'm marrying her to you because of what you know of the Quran.'

title: Marriage Advice from the Prophet
content: The Prophet (ﷺ) told a man to marry, even if he could only give his wife an iron ring as a gift.

title: Marriage Stipulations Matter
content: The Prophet (ﷺ) said: 'The most important things to agree on in marriage are those that let you be with your wife.'

title: Marriage and Sharing a Husband
content: The Prophet (ﷺ) said: A woman should not ask for her sister to be divorced so she can have everything. She will only get what was meant for her.

title: Marriage and Wedding Gifts
content: Abdur-Rahman bin Auf visited the Prophet. He had yellow marks on his body from perfume. The Prophet (ﷺ) asked him about them. Abdur-Rahman said he had married a woman from the Ansar tribe. The Prophet (ﷺ) asked how much money he paid for her. Abdur-Rahman replied that he gave her as much gold as a date stone weighs. The Prophet (ﷺ) told him to host a wedding feast, even if it's just with one sheep.

title: Prophet's Wedding Banquet
content: The Prophet (ﷺ) had a wedding banquet for his marriage to Zainab. He invited all the Muslims and provided them with good food. After the meal, he visited each of his wives' homes, saying a prayer for their well-being. They also said prayers for him. When he returned, he saw two men still sitting there, so he left again.

title: Marriage and Wedding Banquet
content: Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) saw a yellow perfume on Abdur-Rahman's clothes. He asked what it was. Abdur-Rahman said he had married a woman and given her a small amount of gold as dowry. The Prophet (ﷺ) told him, 'May Allah bless you. Even if you have only one sheep, hold a wedding feast.'

title: Prophet's Marriage to Aisha
content: When the Prophet married me, my mother took me home. There were some women from the Ansar there who said, 'You have a good marriage and blessings.'

title: Marriage Before Battle
content: Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) said: A man who is newly married and has not yet been with his wife should not go on a military expedition with me. He should stay behind to be with his new wife.

title: Prophet's Marriage to Aisha
content: The Prophet (ﷺ) wrote a marriage contract with Aisha when she was six years old. He married her and they lived together for nine years, starting when she was nine years old.

title: Prophet's Marriage to Safiyya
content: The Prophet (ﷺ) stayed in a place between Khaibar and Medina for three days. During this time, he married Safiyya bint Huyay. I invited the Muslims to a meal with no meat or bread. The Prophet (ﷺ) ordered us to spread out leather sheets and provided dates, dried yogurt, and butter on them. This was his wedding banquet. Some people asked if Safiyya would be considered the Prophet's wife or a slave girl he owned. They said she would be his wife if he kept her private, but just a slave if he didn't. When they left, the Prophet made space for Safiyya behind him on the camel and kept her hidden from view.

title: Aisha's First Meeting with Prophet Muhammad
content: When I got married to the Prophet, my mother took me to his house. The only thing that surprised me was when he came to visit me in the morning.

title: Getting Anmat from Allah
content: Jabir asked the Prophet: 'Have we received forgiveness?' The Prophet (ﷺ) replied: 'You will soon receive it.'

title: Marriage Ceremony Amusement
content: 'Aisha was helping a woman get ready for her wedding to an Ansari man. The Prophet (ﷺ) asked 'Aisha, 'Don't you have any fun activities during the marriage ceremony like the people of Medina do?'

title: The Prophet's Home Etiquette
content: Anas bin Malik said: The Prophet (ﷺ) used to visit my mother Um-Sulaim. One day, she wanted to give him a gift for his marriage with Zainab. She made a sweet dish and sent it with me. I took it to the Prophet and he asked me to invite some men. When they came, he ordered them to say 'Bismillah' (in the name of Allah) before eating. He served the food in batches, so everyone could eat from what was nearest to them. After they finished, some people left and a few stayed talking. The Prophet (ﷺ) went out, and I told him that those who had eaten were leaving. He returned and reminded us about how to behave when visiting his home: we should only enter when invited for a meal, not before or after eating. We should also leave without staying to talk.

title: Lost Necklace and Prayer
content: `Aisha borrowed a necklace from Asma', but it got lost. The Prophet (ﷺ) sent some companions to find it. They prayed without washing their hands first, as they didn't have time. When they told the Prophet about this, he said Allah revealed a new rule for situations like this. Usaid bin Hudair praised `Aisha, saying she always gets out of difficult situations easily and brings blessings to Muslims.

title: Protect Your Child
content: When a man has sex with his wife, he should say 'In the name of Allah. Oh Allah, keep Satan away from us and our child.' If they are meant to have a baby, then Satan will not be able to harm that child.

title: Anas Served the Prophet
content: I was ten years old when the Prophet came to Medina. My mother and aunts wanted me to help him often, so I served him for ten years. When he died, I was twenty years old. I knew about the rule of veiling women more than anyone else. This rule was first revealed after the Prophet married Zainab bint Jahsh. One day, the Prophet invited people to a meal and they ate together. But when it was time for them to leave, the Prophet got up and went out with me. We walked around until we reached Aisha's door. The Prophet (ﷺ) thought everyone had left, so he went back inside. I went with him. But when we got there, Zainab and her guests were still sitting. So the Prophet got up again and we walked around some more. This time, when we reached Aisha's door, the people had really left. Then the Prophet drew a curtain between us and the Verses of Al-Hijab were revealed.

title: Abdur-Rahman's Marriage and Mahr
content: Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) asked Abdur-Rahman about the amount of money he gave to his Ansari wife. Abdur-Rahman said he gave her as much gold as a date stone weighs. When they arrived in Medina, Abdur-Rahman stayed with Sa'd bin Ar-Rabi and was offered food and one of his wives. But Abdur-Rahman refused and went to the market instead. He traded goods and earned some yoghurt and butter, then married another Ansari woman. The Prophet (ﷺ) told him to give a banquet, even if it's just with one sheep.

title: Prophet's Wedding Banquet
content: The Prophet (ﷺ) did not have a better wedding feast for any of his wives than the one he gave when he married Zainab. That banquet had only one sheep.

title: Prophet Muhammad Marries Safiyya
content: The Prophet (ﷺ) freed a woman named Safiyya. He then married her. Her dowry was being set free, which is what the Prophet had already done for her. After their marriage, the Prophet gave a feast with a special sweet dish.

title: The Prophet's Wedding Celebration
content: The Prophet (ﷺ) married a woman named Zainab. He asked me to invite men for the wedding meals.

title: Marriage Banquet of Zainab
content: Anas said he never saw the Prophet give a better banquet than when he married Zainab. He gave a banquet with one sheep after marrying her.

title: Prophet's Banquet After Marriage
content: When the Prophet got married to some of his wives, he gave a banquet with food made from two Mudds of barley. A Mudd is about 1.75 kilograms.

title: Accept Wedding Invitations
content: Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) said: If you're invited to a wedding, go. It is a good thing to do.

title: Three Important Commands
content: The Prophet (ﷺ) said: 'Free captives, attend wedding invitations, and visit people who are sick.'

title: Prophet's Orders and Prohibitions
content: The Prophet (ﷺ) told us to do seven things. These are: visit people who are sick, go with the funeral procession when someone dies, say 'May Allah have mercy on you' if someone says 'Praise be to Allah', help people keep their promises, support those being treated unfairly, greet others when you meet them, and accept invitations to weddings. He also told us not to wear gold rings, use silver plates or cups, ride with cushions under your saddle, wear special linen clothes, or wear thick silk.

title: Abu Usaid's Wedding Guest
content: Abu Usaid invited the Prophet to his wedding. His wife served them food and a special drink made from soaked dates that she had prepared overnight for him after he finished eating.

title: Wedding Banquets for the Rich
content: Abu Huraira said that it's not good when only rich people are invited to a wedding banquet and poor people are left out. The Prophet (ﷺ) said that if someone refuses an invitation to such a banquet, they are disobeying Allah and His message.

title: Trotters are acceptable
content: The Prophet (ﷺ) said that if he is invited to eat trotters or given them as a gift, he will accept them.

title: Accept Marriage Invitations
content: Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) said to Abdullah bin Umar: 'If you're invited to a wedding or any other celebration, accept the invitation.' Abdullah bin Umar followed this advice and even went to these events while fasting.

title: Prophet's Love for Ansar
content: One day, the Prophet saw some women and children coming from a wedding party. He stood up quickly and said, 'By Allah, you (the Ansar) are my favorite people.'

title: Prophet's Disapproval of Pictures
content: I bought a cushion with pictures on it. The Prophet (ﷺ) saw it and didn't enter the room. I asked him what was wrong. He said, 'What is this?' I explained that I got it for you to sit and rest on. He replied, 'The people who made these pictures will be punished on Judgement Day. They'll be told to bring their pictures to life.' He also said, 'Angels of mercy don't enter homes with animal pictures'.

title: Abu Usaid's Guest
content: When Abu Usaid got married, he invited the Prophet and his friends. His wife prepared food for them. She soaked dates in water overnight. After the Prophet finished eating, she gave him a drink made from those soaked dates.

title: Prophet's Wedding Visit
content: Abu Usaid invited the Prophet to his wedding. His wife served him dates she had soaked in water overnight for the Prophet.

title: Women are like Ribs
content: Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) said: A woman is like a rib. If you try to make her perfect, she will break. So if you want to benefit from her, do it when she still has some flaws.

title: Respect Your Neighbors and Wives
content: The Prophet (ﷺ) said: If you believe in Allah and the Day of Judgment, don't harm your neighbors. Take care of your wives too - they are created from a curved rib. If you try to straighten it, it will break. So be gentle with them.

title: Respect Your Neighbour
content: The Prophet (ﷺ) said: Don't trouble your neighbour if you believe in Allah and the Day of Judgement. He also advised us to take care of women, because they are created from a rib and can be easily hurt. If you try to fix them, they might break, but if you leave them alone, they will stay crooked.

title: Prophet's Wives: Leisure Talk
content: Ibn Umar said that during the Prophet's lifetime, they avoided chatting freely with their wives in case a new message from Allah came. But after the Prophet passed away, they started talking freely again.

title: Being a Guardian
content: The Prophet (ﷺ) said that everyone is in charge of something or someone. A leader takes care of his people, a man looks after his family, a wife manages her home, and a servant protects his master's belongings. We are all responsible for what we're in charge of.

title: Women Describe Their Husbands
content: Aisha told a story about eleven women who sat together and promised not to hide any news about their husbands. Each woman described her husband in a unique way, highlighting his good qualities or flaws. One said her husband was like weak camel meat that's hard to get. Another said she wouldn't describe her husband because he had many bad traits. A third said her husband was too tall and might divorce her if she spoke about him. The fourth woman compared her husband to a calm night, neither hot nor cold. The fifth woman described her husband as lazy when at home but boastful when out. The sixth woman said her husband ate too much, drank all the liquid, and slept alone. The seventh woman said her husband was weak or foolish with many flaws. The eighth woman compared her husband to a soft rabbit. The ninth woman described her husband as tall, generous, and kind. The tenth woman said her husband was rich and powerful, with many camels at home. The eleventh woman praised her husband Abu Zar, saying he had given her many ornaments and made her happy. She also talked about his family's wealth and generosity. Aisha then told that the Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) said to her, 'I am like Abu Zar was to his wife Um Zar'.

title: Aisha's Age and Amusement
content: 'Urwa narrated that Aisha said: The Prophet (ﷺ) was watching the Ethiopians play with their small spears. He stood in front of me to block my view, but I kept looking until I left on my own. This shows how old a girl can be before she's too young to watch such things.

title: Umar and the Prophet's Wives
content: Ibn Abbas wanted to ask Umar about two wives of the Prophet who were mentioned in a Quranic verse. When they went on Hajj together, Ibn Abbas asked Umar, 'Who are the two wives?' Umar replied, 'Aisha and Hafsa.' Then Umar told Ibn Abbas that he used to visit the Prophet with his Ansari friend from Bani Umaiyya bin Zaid. They would take turns visiting the Prophet and sharing news about what was happening in Medina. One day, Umar's wife said that the wives of the Prophet would sometimes not talk to him for a whole day. This scared Umar and he went to Hafsa and asked her if it was true. She replied yes. Umar then warned Hafsa not to imitate Aisha's behavior, saying she was more charming than her and beloved by the Prophet. Meanwhile, there were rumors that the tribe of Ghassan was preparing to invade Medina. When Umar's Ansari friend came back from his visit to the Prophet, he told Umar that the Prophet had divorced his wives. Umar went to see the Prophet in seclusion and asked him if he had really divorced them. The Prophet (ﷺ) replied no. Umar then sat with a group of people near the pulpit but couldn't bear the situation and kept asking for permission to enter the Prophet's room. Finally, the slave gave him permission and Umar entered the room. He saw the Prophet lying on a bed made of date palm leaves and asked if he had divorced his wives again. The Prophet (ﷺ) replied no and smiled when Umar said that the men in Medina were overpowered by their women. When Umar sat down, he looked around the Prophet's house and saw only three hides. He then prayed for the Prophet to be given wealth, saying that the Persians and Romans had been made prosperous despite not worshiping Allah. The Prophet (ﷺ) sat up and said that these people had received rewards for their good deeds in this world. Umar apologized and asked for forgiveness. After twenty-nine days, the Prophet entered Aisha's room first and she chose him. He then gave his other wives an option to choose him as well.

title: Husband's Permission for Fasting
content: The Prophet (ﷺ) said: A woman should not fast without her husband's permission if he is at home.

title: Refusing a Husband's Invitation
content: The Prophet (ﷺ) said: If a man invites his wife to sleep with him and she refuses, the angels will curse her until morning.

title: Angels Curse a Disobedient Wife
content: The Prophet (ﷺ) said: If a woman stays away from her husband at night without sleeping with him, the angels will send bad feelings towards her until she returns to her husband.

title: Women's Fasting and Spending
content: Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) said: A woman can't fast extra prayers without her husband's permission when he is at home. She also needs his permission for anyone to enter their house. If she spends his money on charity, the husband gets half of the reward.

title: Poor People Enter Paradise
content: The Prophet (ﷺ) said that when he stood at the gate of Paradise, most people who entered were poor. The rich were stopped to have their accounts checked. At the gate of the Fire, most women went in.

title: Eclipse Prayer and Signs
content: A long time ago, during the Prophet's life, there was a solar eclipse. The Prophet (ﷺ) led people in prayer for this event. He stood up for a very long time while reciting some of the Quran from Surah Baqarah. Then he bowed down, stood up again, and prostrated several times. When the sun came back out, the Prophet finished his prayer. He told the people that the sun and moon are signs from Allah, and they don't go dark because someone is born or dies. If you see an eclipse, remember to pray to Allah. Some people asked the Prophet what he saw during the eclipse. He said he saw Paradise and Hellfire. In Paradise, he wanted to pick some grapes for his followers to eat forever. But in Hellfire, most of its inhabitants were women because they often don't thank their husbands or appreciate the good things done for them.

title: Majority in Paradise are Poor
content: The Prophet (ﷺ) said, 'I looked at Paradise and saw that most of its people were poor. I also looked at Hell Fire and saw that most of its people were women.'

title: Balance Your Fasting
content: Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) said to Abdullah: 'Don't always fast and pray at night. Sometimes fast, sometimes don't. Stand up for prayer at night, but also sleep. Your body needs rest, your eyes need sleep, and so does your wife.'

title: Be Good Guardians
content: The Prophet (ﷺ) said: You all have a responsibility to take care of others. A leader is responsible for the people under him. A man is in charge of his family, and a woman is responsible for her home and children. We are all guardians and must look after those we care about.

title: Prophet Muhammad's Oath
content: Anas said that the Prophet took an oath not to visit his wives for a month. He stayed in a room upstairs. On the 29th day, he came down. People asked him about his oath and he explained that the current month has only 29 days.

title: Prophet's Oath and Its Meaning
content: Um Salama narrated that the Prophet took an oath not to visit some of his wives for a month. But after 29 days, he went to see them in the morning or evening. When someone reminded him of his oath, he explained that a month can be 29 days.

title: Prophet Muhammad's Month of Silence
content: One morning, the Prophet's wives were crying. They each had family with them. I went to the mosque and saw it was crowded. Umar came in and greeted the Prophet, but he didn't answer. He greeted again, still no answer. The gatekeeper called him, and Umar entered the Prophet's room. Umar asked if the Prophet had divorced his wives. The Prophet (ﷺ) said no, he had taken an oath not to see them for a month. So the Prophet stayed away from his wives for 29 days before going back.

title: Don't Beat Your Wife
content: The Prophet (ﷺ) said: Don't beat your wife like you would a slave. If you do, don't have sex with her later the same day.

title: Prophet's Advice on False Hair
content: An Ansari woman told the Prophet that her daughter was losing hair. The husband suggested she wear false hair. The Prophet (ﷺ) said, 'No, Allah curses women who artificially lengthen their hair.' This is connected to a verse about a wife who fears her husband will divorce her and marry another woman. If this happens, the wife can ask her husband to keep her but not spend on or sleep with her.

title: Coitus Interruptus in Islam
content: Jabir said: We used to stop having sex during the time of the Prophet. He did not say it was allowed or forbidden, but we stopped doing it anyway.

title: Coitus Interruptus During Revelation
content: Jabir said: When the Quran was being revealed, we used to stop having sex with our wives before finishing. He added that they did this during the time of the Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) while the Quran was still being revealed.

title: Coitus Interruptus in Islam
content: Jabir said: When the Quran was being revealed, we used to stop having sex with our wives during that time. He added: We did this even when Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) (SAW) was alive.

title: Coitus Interruptus with Captives
content: Abu Sa'id Al-Khudri said: We had female prisoners from war and we would stop our sperm from reaching them. So, we asked the Prophet about it. He repeated his question three times, 'Do you really do that?' Then he said, 'There is no soul meant to exist but will be born until the Day of Judgment'.

title: Prophet's Journey with Aisha
content: When the Prophet went on a trip, he would choose one of his wives to join him. One time, the lot fell on Aisha and Hafsa. At night, the Prophet rode beside Aisha and talked to her. Hafsa asked Aisha to swap camels so they could see each other in this new situation. They agreed, but when they stopped, the Prophet went with Hafsa instead of Aisha. Aisha was left behind and got upset. She put her feet in some plants called Idhkhir and said, 'O Allah, send a scorpion or snake to bite me because I'm not at fault for this.'

title: Sauda gives up her turn
content: My friend Sauda let me have my turn with the Prophet instead of hers. He would give us both our special days to be with him.

title: Marriage and Waiting Period
content: When a man marries a young woman who has never been married before, he should stay with her for seven days. If he already has an older wife at home, he should be with the new wife first. When a man marries an older woman who has been married before, he should stay with her for three days. If he already has a young wife at home, he should be with the new wife first.

title: Marriage Rules for New Wives
content: When a man marries a new wife who is a virgin, he should stay with her for seven days and then take turns sleeping with his other wife. If the new wife is already married, he should stay with her for three days first.

title: The Prophet's Wives
content: The Prophet (ﷺ) used to visit all his wives in one night. At that time, he had nine wives.

title: The Prophet's Afternoon Prayer
content: After the afternoon prayer, the Prophet would go to his wives and stay with one of them. One day he stayed longer than usual with Hafsa.

title: Prophet's Last Days at Home
content: When the Prophet was very sick, he would ask his wives where he should stay the next day. He wanted to stay with me, Aisha. His other wives agreed it was okay for him to choose. So, he stayed with me until he died. I was happy to have him at my home on that last day.

title: Umar Warns Hafsa
content: One day, Umar visited his daughter Hafsa and said, 'Don't be fooled by the behavior of someone who is proud because Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) likes her.' He meant Aisha. Umar then told this to Allah's Messenger (ﷺ), and he smiled.

title: Lying About Gifts
content: Asma asked the Prophet: 'Is it wrong to pretend my husband gave me something he didn't?' The Prophet (ﷺ) replied: 'Pretending to have what you don't is like wearing two lies.'

title: Allah's Sense of Pride
content: Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) said: 'Allah is more protective of His honor than anyone else. He has forbidden us from doing bad things, like having affairs. Allah likes praise more than anyone else.'

title: Allah's Sense of Self-Respect
content: The Prophet (ﷺ) said to his followers: 'Allah has a strong sense of self-respect. He doesn't want His slaves to commit adultery or have sex with someone who is not married to them, just like He wouldn't want it done to Him.'

title: Allah's Sense of Self-Respect
content: The Prophet (ﷺ) said: Allah has a strong sense of self-respect. He is very proud and protective of Himself.

title: Allah's Sense of Pride
content: The Prophet (ﷺ) said: Allah feels proud when a believer follows His rules. But if the believer breaks one of Allah's rules, it makes Allah sad.

title: Asma' bint Abu Bakr's Story
content: When Az-Zubair married me, he had no property or slaves. I took care of his horse and drew water from the well. Our neighbors helped me bake bread because I didn't know how to do it myself. I used to carry date stones on my head from our land given by the Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) (SAW). One day, while carrying a load of date stones, I met the Prophet with some men. He offered for me to ride behind him, but I felt shy and remembered Az-Zubair's pride. The Prophet (ﷺ) noticed I was shy and continued on his way. When I told Az-Zubair about it, he said that seeing me carry date stones was more shameful than riding with the Prophet. Eventually, Abu Bakr sent a servant to help with the horse, making my life easier.

title: The Prophet's Wife's Jealousy
content: The Prophet (ﷺ) was at the house of one of his wives. A meal was sent from another wife, but their servant broke it while trying to hand it over. The Prophet (ﷺ) picked up the broken pieces and put the food back on them. He said that his wife had felt jealous. Then he kept the broken dish and gave a new one to his other wife.

title: Prophet Sees Umar's Palace
content: The Prophet (ﷺ) said he entered Paradise and saw a palace. He asked whose it was, and the angels said it belonged to Umar bin Al-Khattab. The Prophet (ﷺ) wanted to enter but didn't because he knew Umar would feel embarrassed if he did.

title: Umar's Sense of Pride
content: Abu Huraira said that the Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) was with him and other people. The Prophet (ﷺ) said he had a dream where he saw a woman washing her hands in front of Umar's palace. He asked who owned the palace, and someone told him it belonged to Umar. The Prophet (ﷺ) woke up and remembered how proud Umar is. So, the Prophet didn't go there. When Umar heard about this, he started crying in front of everyone. He said, 'How could I think you would offend my pride?'

title: Allah's Messenger Knows Our Feelings
content: Aisha asked the Prophet: 'How do you know when I'm happy or upset with you?' He said, 'When you're happy, you say

title: Aisha's Feelings About Khadija
content: I, Aisha, never felt as jealous of any other wife of the Prophet as I did of Khadija. The Prophet (ﷺ) often remembered and praised her. Allah also told him that Khadija would have a special palace in Paradise.

title: Prophet's Daughter Fatima
content: I heard the Prophet say from the pulpit: 'Banu Hisham asked me to let their daughter marry Ali. But I won't give permission unless Ali divorces my daughter, because she is like a part of me. What hurts her hurts me.'

title: Signs of the End Times
content: I heard Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) say: 'Some signs that the Day of Judgment is near are: People will stop learning about Islam, most people won't know much about their faith, many will have sex outside marriage, and drinking alcohol will become common. Fewer men will be born, but more women will live longer. Eventually, one man might look after 50 women.'

title: Respect Women's Space
content: Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) said: 'Be careful when entering women's areas. The husband's relatives are like death to you.'

title: Men and Women in Isolation
content: The Prophet (ﷺ) said: A man should never be alone with a woman who is not related to him. A man asked, 'My wife is going on Hajj and I'm away fighting.' The Prophet (ﷺ) replied, 'Go back and go with your wife for the Hajj'.

title: Prophet Muhammad's Love for Ansar
content: An Ansari woman visited the Prophet. He took her aside and said, 'You people are very dear to me.'

title: Prophet's Warning to Um Salama
content: Um Salama told us that a man was behaving strangely in her house. He said something rude about a woman, saying she had too much body fat. The Prophet (ﷺ) heard this and told Um Salama not to let the man come into their home again.

title: Prophet Muhammad and Aisha
content: Aisha said the Prophet was covering her with his cloak while she watched Ethiopians playing in the mosque. She kept watching until she was satisfied, showing how a young girl can enjoy amusement without harming her faith.

title: Women Allowed to Leave Home
content: One night, Sa'da went out of her house. Umar saw her and said, 'You can't hide from us!' She told the Prophet about this when he was eating dinner with me. Then Allah sent a message to him. After that, the Prophet said to women: 'Allah allows you to leave your homes for what you need.'

title: Respect Your Wife's Mosque Visit
content: The Prophet (ﷺ) said: If your wife asks to go to the mosque, don't stop her. Let her go if she wants to pray there.

title: Foster Suckling Relations
content: My uncle asked to visit me. I didn't let him in until I asked the Prophet about it. He said, 'He's your uncle, let him come.' I told him, 'I was breastfed by a woman, not a man.' The Prophet (ﷺ) replied, 'He's still your uncle, so let him in.' This happened after some rules were revealed about how women should dress and behave around men. These rules also apply to foster relationships.

title: Don't Describe Women
content: The Prophet (ﷺ) said: A woman should not look at or touch another woman to describe her to her husband as if he was seeing her himself.

title: Don't Describe Women
content: The Prophet (ﷺ) said: A woman should not look at or touch another woman so she can describe her to her husband as if he was seeing her himself.

title: Solomon's Prayer Request
content: Prophet Solomon said he would walk around his 100 wives tonight and they would each have a son who would fight for Allah. An angel told him to say 'If Allah wills' first, but he forgot. He still had relationships with them, but only one wife had a child - half a person. The Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) said that if Solomon had said 'If Allah wills', his wish might have been granted.

title: Returning Home at Night
content: The Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) disliked going to one's family at night after returning from a journey. He wanted people to rest and be safe before visiting their families.

title: Don't Return Home Late
content: The Prophet (ﷺ) said: When you're away from home for a long time, don't come back to your family at night. Stay with someone else until morning.

title: Marriage Advice from the Prophet
content: I was on a trip with the Prophet. I wanted to hurry back home because my wife and I were newly married. The Prophet (ﷺ) asked me why I was in such a rush. I told him we had just gotten married. He asked if she was a young girl or an older woman. I said she was an older woman. He said, 'Why not marry a younger girl who can play with you?' When we got close to Medina, the Prophet told us to wait until night before going home. This way, our wives could fix their hair and those whose husbands were away for a long time could take care of themselves. The Prophet (ﷺ) then reminded me to have children.

title: Entering the Home at Night
content: When you come home late at night after a journey, don't go straight to your family. First, the woman whose husband is not home should clean herself properly, and the woman with messy hair should comb it. Then, you can join your family.

title: Jabir's Ride with the Prophet
content: I was riding a slow camel back from a battle with the Prophet. A rider passed me and poked my camel with his spear, making it run fast. I looked back and saw it was the Prophet. He asked about my marriage and said, 'Why didn't you marry a young girl so you could play together?' When we got close to Medina, he told us to wait until nightfall before entering our homes. Some women were supposed to comb their hair and others shave their pubic hair.

title: Treatment of Prophet Muhammad
content: People disagreed about how Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) was treated on the day of Uhud. Sahl bin Sa'd said he was the only one left at Medina who knew what happened. Fatima washed his face to remove blood, and Ali brought water in a shield. A mat made from date palm leaves was burned and its ash was put into his wound.

title: Ibn Abbas Attends Eid Prayer
content: Abdur-Rahman bin Abis asked Ibn Abbas if he had attended the Eid prayer with the Prophet. Ibn Abbas said yes, but only because of his close relationship to the Prophet. He was too young otherwise. The Prophet (ﷺ) went out for the Eid prayer and then gave a sermon. After that, he went to the women and advised them to give charity. The women took off their jewelry and threw it into a collection being held by Bilal.

title: Abu Bakr Scolds Aisha
content: Aisha: Abu Bakr scolded me and poked my side. He was angry with me, but I didn't move because the Prophet's head was on my thigh.

title: Divorcing a Wife During Menstruation
content: Abdullah bin Umar divorced his wife while she was having her period. His father, Umar, asked the Prophet about this. The Prophet (ﷺ) said to Abdullah: 'Take your wife back and keep her until she's clean from her period. Then wait for her next period to finish. If you want to stay with her, you can. If you want to divorce her again, you can do that too - but don't have sex with her first.' This is what Allah has decided for women who are divorced.

title: Ibn 'Umar's Divorce Question
content: Ibn 'Umar divorced his wife while she was having her period. He told the Prophet about it. The Prophet (ﷺ) said to Ibn 'Umar, 'Take your wife back.' Ibn 'Umar asked if this divorce counted as one of the three allowed divorces. The Prophet (ﷺ) said yes, it does count.

title: One Divorce Counts
content: Ibn Umar said that if a man divorces his wife during her period, it counts as one legal divorce.

title: Aisha's Story About Marriage
content: I asked Az-Zuhri about the Prophet's wives. He said that 'Urwa told him that Aisha said: When the daughter of Al-Jaun was brought to the Prophet as his bride, she said, 'I seek refuge with Allah from you.' The Prophet (ﷺ) replied, 'You have sought refuge with The Great; return to your family'.

title: The Prophet's Visit to a Lady
content: The Prophet (ﷺ) went with us to a garden. We sat down between two walls while he went inside. He brought out a lady named Jauniyya and asked her to marry him. She said she couldn't marry an ordinary man because she was a princess. The Prophet (ﷺ) tried to calm her down, but she refused. He then told Abu Usaid to give her two white dresses and let her go back home.

title: The Prophet's Marriage Arrangements
content: The Prophet (ﷺ) married Umaima bint Sharahil. When she arrived, he gestured to her, but it seemed she was uncomfortable with that. The Prophet (ﷺ) told Abu Usaid to get her ready and give her two white dresses.

title: Walking around the Ka'bah
content: Sahl bin Sa'd said that the Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) used to walk around the Ka'bah seven times when he performed Umrah. He would start and end at the Black Stone.

title: Divorce During Menstruation
content: I asked Ibn 'Umar about a man who divorces his wife while she's on her period. He said, 'This happened to me. I divorced my wife when she was menstruating. The Prophet (ﷺ) told Umar to take her back and wait until she's clean before deciding if he wants to divorce her again.' I asked Ibn 'Umar if this counted as one valid divorce. He said, 'No, it doesn't matter how someone feels or what happens, a person is still responsible for their actions.'

title: Divorce and Adultery
content: Uwaimir asked `Asim about what to do if he saw his wife with another man. `Asim asked the Prophet, but the Prophet didn't like the question. Uwaimir went back to ask again. The Prophet (ﷺ) said that Allah had a rule for this situation. He called Uwaimir and his wife in front of everyone. They carried out a judgment called Lian. After it was done, Uwaimir said he couldn't keep his wife because she would be lying about him. So he divorced her three times.

title: Divorce and Marriage Laws
content: Aisha told the Prophet that her husband Rifa'a had divorced her. She then married another man named Abdur-Rahman, but he couldn't have children. The Prophet (ﷺ) said to Aisha: 'You can't go back to Rifa'a until you and Abdur-Rahman have a child together.'

title: Marriage after Divorce
content: A man divorced his wife three times. She then married another man who also divorced her. The Prophet (ﷺ) said she can't marry the first husband again unless the second husband has sex with her, just like the first husband did.

title: Allah's Messenger Gives Us a Choice
content: Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) gave us a choice: stay with him or get divorced. We chose Allah and the Prophet. Giving us this choice wasn't considered divorce.

title: Giving a Wife an Option
content: I asked Aisha about the Prophet's option for wives. She said the Prophet gave us this choice. I asked if it was like giving a divorce, and she said no. Later, Nafi' told me that Ibn 'Umar said: If you give your wife three divorces, she can't be with you again until she marries someone else and gets divorced by them.

title: Remarriage after Impotence
content: `Aisha said: A man divorced his wife. She married another man who couldn't satisfy her in bed. He also divorced her. Later, she asked the Prophet if she could marry her first husband again. The Prophet (ﷺ) said it's not allowed until the second husband has sex with her.

title: Marriage and Divorce
content: Ibn Abbas said that if a man says his wife is not allowed to him, it doesn't mean she's divorced. The Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) is a good example for us to follow.

title: The Prophet's Honey Incident
content: Aisha told me that the Prophet used to visit Zanab bint Jahsh and drink honey at her house. Hafsa and Aisha decided to trick him if he visited them, by saying they smelled something bad on him. The Prophet (ﷺ) visited one of them and said he had eaten honey at Zanab's house, but would never eat it again. This made Allah reveal a verse in the Quran, reminding the Prophet that He had made honey lawful for him.

title: Honey and the Prophet's Visit
content: Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) liked honey and sweet things. After his Asr prayer, he would visit his wives one by one. One day, he stayed longer with Hafsa than usual. I got jealous because I thought she was getting special treatment. I asked why this was happening and found out that Hafsa had received a gift of honey from her family. They made a syrup from it and gave it to the Prophet to drink. I didn't want him to get too fond of it, so I came up with a plan with my friends Sa'da and Safiyya. When the Prophet visited each of us, we would ask if he had taken some bad-smelling gum called Maghafir. He would say no, and then we would ask what was causing the bad smell on him. He would say Hafsa gave him honey syrup to drink. We would then joke that maybe the bees got their food from a certain tree. The Prophet (ﷺ) visited each of us, and we said our lines as planned. When he went back to Hafsa, she offered him more of the syrup, but he said no. I was happy that my plan worked.

title: Forgiveness for Unspoken Thoughts
content: The Prophet (ﷺ) said that Allah forgives his followers for any bad ideas they have in their minds as long as they don't act on them or say them out loud. If someone thinks about divorcing their wife but doesn't actually say it, the divorce is not valid.

title: Man Admits to Zina
content: A man from the tribe of Bani Aslam came to the mosque and told the Prophet that he had committed adultery. The Prophet (ﷺ) ignored him at first, but when the man gave four witnesses against himself, the Prophet called him over. He asked if the man was insane or married. When the man said yes, he was ordered to be stoned to death in a public praying area. When the stones hit him and he tried to run away, he was caught and killed.

title: Man Admits to Zina
content: A man from the tribe of Aslam came to the mosque where the Prophet was. He said, 'I have had an affair with a woman.' The Prophet (ﷺ) turned his face away from him. The man moved to the other side and repeated what he said. The Prophet (ﷺ) turned his face away again. This happened four times. When the man had admitted it four times, the Prophet called him over. He asked if the man was crazy. The man said no. Then the Prophet told his companions to stone him to death. The man was married. Some of the companions stoned him at a place in Medina where people gather for prayer during Eid. When they hit him with stones, he tried to run away but they caught him and kept stoning him until he died.

title: Man Admits to Zina
content: A man from the tribe of Aslam came to the Prophet in the mosque and said, 'I have committed adultery.' The Prophet (ﷺ) turned his face away. The man repeated this four times, moving each time to the side where the Prophet was facing. When he had done this, the Prophet asked if he was insane, but the man said no. Then the Prophet told his companions to stone him to death. This happened in Medina at a place called Musalla. They stoned him until he died.

title: Divorce for Un-Islamic Behavior
content: Ibn Abbas said that a woman came to the Prophet and complained about her husband's character. She didn't want to behave in a way that went against Islam if she stayed with him. The Prophet (ﷺ) asked her if she would give back the garden her husband had given her as part of their marriage agreement. She agreed, so the Prophet told her husband to take back the garden and divorce his wife once.

title: The Prophet's Order for Divorce
content: Thabit's wife was asked by the Prophet if she would return her husband's garden. She said yes and returned it. Then, the Prophet ordered Thabit to divorce his wife.

title: Wife's Garden and Divorce
content: Ibn Abbas told me that a woman came to the Prophet. She said she didn't blame her husband Thabit for anything, but she couldn't live with him. The Prophet (ﷺ) asked if she would give back his garden to him. She said yes.

title: Returning a Garden
content: Ibn Abbas said that the wife of Thabit bin Qais came to the Prophet. She said she was happy with Thabit's character and faith, but worried about being ungrateful for Allah's blessings. The Prophet (ﷺ) asked if she would return her garden to Thabit. She agreed and gave it back. Then the Prophet told Thabit to divorce his wife.

title: Walking around the Ka'aba
content: Jamila asked a question to a companion of the Prophet. He said: 'If I were standing at the Ka'aba, and I wanted to pray, I would walk around it seven times.'

title: Prophet's Response to Marriage Request
content: I heard the Prophet say that Banu Al-Mughira asked his permission for Ali to marry their daughter. He refused to give them permission.

title: Barra's Manumission and Charity
content: When Barra was freed, she had the choice to stay with her husband or leave him. The Prophet (ﷺ) said that the one who frees a slave gets the right to their loyalty. One day, the Prophet saw some meat cooking in a pot but only bread and soup were put in front of him. He asked why he didn't get the meat. They explained it was given as charity to Barra. The Prophet (ﷺ) replied that for her it's charity, but for us it's just a gift.

title: Barira's Husband
content: Ibn Abbas saw him as a slave. He was the husband of Barira.

title: Following Barira in Medina
content: Ibn Abbas said that a slave named Mughith was following his wife Barira through the streets of Medina. He was a slave from the Bani so-and-so family, who were married to Barira.

title: Barira's Husband Mughith
content: Ibn Abbas said that Barira's husband was a black slave called Mughith. He was owned by Bani so-and-so. Ibn Abbas remembers seeing him walking behind his wife in the streets of Medina.

title: Barira's Husband Mughith
content: Ibn `Abbas told me that Barira's husband was a slave named Mughith. He would often cry behind her, with tears falling from his beard. The Prophet (ﷺ) asked Abbas if he was surprised by how much Mughith loved Barira and she hated him. The Prophet (ﷺ) then asked Barira why she didn't go back to Mughith. She said the Prophet shouldn't order her to do so. He replied that he was only asking on Mughith's behalf. Barira said she didn't need him.

title: Barira's Freedom and Wala
content: Aisha wanted to buy Barira. Her masters said if she did, the right to her loyalty would be theirs. Aisha told the Prophet about this. He said, 'Buy her and free her. The right to her loyalty is for whoever frees her.' Some meat was given in charity to Barira. The Prophet (ﷺ) said, 'This is a gift to us as well as an act of kindness for Barira.'

title: Marriage to Non-Muslims
content: Ibn `Umar said that marrying a Christian or Jewish woman is not allowed for Muslims. He said this because they believe in partners with Allah, and one example of this is when a woman says Jesus is her Lord, but he's just a slave of Allah.

title: Marriage and Emigration
content: Ibn 'Abbas said: The pagans were divided into two groups. Some fought against the Prophet and Muslims, while others made a treaty with them and didn't fight. If a woman from the first group left to join the Muslims, she couldn't get married until her menstrual period ended and she was clean again. If her husband also joined the Muslims before she got married, she would be returned to him. Slaves who escaped from these pagans became free and had the same rights as other emigrants. But if slaves escaped from those who made a treaty with the Muslims, their owners were paid for them instead of returning them.

title: Wives of Companions
content: 'Umar divorced his wife Qariba. Then Mu'awiyya married her. Um Al-Hakam was divorced by 'Iyad bin Ghanm, and then she married Abdullah bin 'Uthman.

title: Women Emigrating to Medina
content: When women came to the Prophet as refugees, he tested them according to Allah's order. If they agreed to certain conditions and said it out loud, the Prophet would say: 'I accept your promise.' He never shook hands with any woman, only took their verbal pledge of allegiance.

title: Prophet's Oath and Injury
content: The Prophet (ﷺ) took an oath to stay away from his wives. At the time, he had hurt his leg. He stayed in a room above his house for 29 days. Then he came down and people reminded him that he had promised to stay away for one month. The Prophet (ﷺ) explained that a month is 29 days.

title: Ibn Umar's Advice on Divorce
content: Ibn `Umar said that if a husband and wife are in an 'ila' (a waiting period), he has two choices when it ends: keep her well or divorce her. If the four-month waiting period is over, the husband should be told to divorce his wife, but only if he says so himself.

title: Lost Animals and Found Money
content: A student asked the Prophet about a lost sheep. He said to take it because it could be for you or your brother, or maybe eaten by a wolf. When asked about a lost camel, he got angry and said its owner will find it with food and water. If someone finds money, remember what it's made of and where it was found, then announce it publicly for a year. If the owner comes forward, give it back. Otherwise, keep it as your own.

title: Prophet's Tawaf around Ka'ba
content: Ibn Abbas said the Prophet rode his camel for Tawaf. Every time he reached a corner, he pointed to the Black Stone and said 'Allahu Akbar'. The Prophet (ﷺ) also showed how big an opening was made in the wall of Gog and Magog by making a 90 with his thumb and index finger.

title: Friday's Special Moment
content: The Prophet (ﷺ) said, 'There is a special moment on Friday when a Muslim prays and asks Allah for something. If they do this at that exact time, Allah will answer their prayer.'

title: Prophet Punishes a Murderer
content: Anas bin Malik told us that a Jew attacked and hurt a girl. He took her silver jewelry and crushed her head. The Prophet (ﷺ) was shown the girl, who was dying. She couldn't talk. The Prophet (ﷺ) asked her who had hit her, but she shook her head to say no. Then he asked again, mentioning another person's name, but she shook her head again. Finally, he asked if it was a specific Jew, and she nodded yes. The Prophet (ﷺ) then ordered that the Jew be punished by having his head crushed between two stones.

title: Prophet's Warning about Affliction
content: Ibn Umar heard the Prophet say, 'Troubles will come from the East.' He pointed towards the East when he said this.

title: Waiting for Sunset
content: We were traveling with the Prophet. When the sun went down, he asked a man to get him some Sawiq drink. The man said, 'Do you want it now? It's still daytime.' But the Prophet kept saying, 'Get me some Sawiq.' Finally, the man got it for him and the Prophet drank it. Then he pointed east and said, 'When you see night coming from that direction, a fasting person can break their fast'.

title: Bilal's Call for Prayer
content: The Prophet (ﷺ) said that Bilal's call to prayer should not stop you from eating before dawn. He calls so people can rest during the night prayer, and he doesn't signal when morning comes yet.

title: Miser and Generous Person
content: Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) said: The miser and the generous person are like two people wearing iron cloaks from their chest to their neck. When a generous person gives money, the cloak gets bigger and covers more of their body. A miser tries to give money but the iron stays stuck to their body.

title: Best Families Among Ansar
content: Anas bin Malik said that the Prophet asked if he should tell them about the best families among the Ansar. They agreed, so he mentioned Banu- An-Najjar first, then Banu `Abdil Ash-hal, Banu Al-Harith bin Al-Khazraj, and finally Banu Sa`ida. He then moved his hand as if throwing something and said that there is good in all Ansar families.

title: The Coming of the Hour
content: Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) held up two fingers. He said that the time between his era and the Day of Judgment is very short, like the space between these two fingers.

title: Prophet's Calendar Explanation
content: Ibn Umar said the Prophet showed him his fingers to explain how the month of Ramadan can be either thirty days or twenty-nine. He held out ten fingers three times, then twice and once with nine fingers.

title: Faith is in Yemen
content: Abu Masud said the Prophet pointed to Yemen and said twice, 'Faith is there.' Then he pointed to the East and said, 'Those who are busy with their camels and ignore their religion will be stern and merciless. The tribes of Rabl'a and Muqar will show the two sides of Satan's head'.

title: Looking After Orphans
content: Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) said, 'I and someone who takes care of an orphan will be like this in Paradise.' He showed his middle finger and index finger apart to illustrate the closeness.

title: Black Child Born to Man
content: A man came to the Prophet and said, 'I have a black child.' The Prophet (ﷺ) asked him if he had camels. He said yes. The Prophet (ﷺ) asked about their color and he said red. Then he asked if there was a grey one among them. The man said yes. The Prophet (ﷺ) said maybe it's because of heredity. The man thought the same thing, so the Prophet agreed with him.

title: Divorce Due to Accusation
content: An Ansari man accused his wife of cheating. The Prophet (ﷺ) made them both swear an oath called Lian, and then separated them by divorce.

title: Hilal's Wife Accused
content: Ibn Abbas said that Hilal accused his wife of cheating on him. He went to the Prophet and asked for help, saying she had cheated. The Prophet (ﷺ) said, 'God knows if either of you is lying.' Then the woman stood up and gave her side of the story.

title: Disputing Marriage and Divorce
content: 'Uwaimir Al-Ajlani asked 'Asim bin Ad Al-Ansari what to do if he saw his wife with another man. 'Asim asked the Prophet, but he didn't like the question and thought it was shameful. When 'Uwaimir found out, he went back to the Prophet and repeated the question in front of everyone. The Prophet (ﷺ) said that Allah had revealed a law about this situation. He told 'Uwaimir to bring his wife, and they did a process called Lian. After it was done, 'Uwaimir realized he couldn't keep her as his wife because he would be lying. So he divorced her three times in front of the Prophet.

title: Lian: A Wife's Testimony
content: An Ansari man asked the Prophet about what to do if he saw his wife with another man. The Prophet (ﷺ) said Allah had given a verdict on their case, and they performed Lian in the mosque. After it was finished, the husband divorced her three times in front of the Prophet. Later, it became a rule that when a couple is involved in a case like this, they should be separated by divorce. In this case, the woman was pregnant and later gave birth to a child with black eyes and huge lips, which proved she had lied about being faithful.

title: Lian: A Test of Truth
content: Ibn `Abbas said that once Lian was mentioned to the Prophet. A man from a tribe came and complained that he had found his wife with another man. The other man, Asim, took him to the Prophet. The Prophet (ﷺ) asked them to tell what happened. The husband described the man he saw as brown, fat, and having much flesh on his calves. The Prophet (ﷺ) then said 'O Allah! Reveal the truth.' Later, the woman gave birth to a child who looked like the man she was accused of being with. The Prophet (ﷺ) made them carry out Lian.

title: Divorce for False Accusation
content: I asked Ibn Umar about a man who accuses his wife of adultery. He said the Prophet separated a couple from Bani Al-Ajlan because one accused the other of lying. The Prophet (ﷺ) asked them to repent, but they refused. So he divorced them. When the husband asked for his money back (the Mahr), it was said that if he lied about the accusation, he had no right to get his money back.

title: Lian: Accusation and Divorce
content: I asked Ibn Umar about a man who accuses his wife of cheating. He said the Prophet told them, 'Your accounts are with Allah. One of you is lying.' The husband said, 'What about my property?' The Prophet (ﷺ) said, 'If you're telling the truth, it was for our marriage. If you lied, you don't deserve it back.'

title: Divorced Wife Takes Oath
content: The Prophet (ﷺ) separated a woman from her husband who accused her of having an affair. He made them both take an oath to find out the truth.

title: Divorce through Lian
content: The Prophet (ﷺ) made an Ansari man and his wife go through a process called Lian. This is where they both swore to the truth of their situation, and then the Prophet separated them by giving them a divorce.

title: Lian Case: Child's Parent
content: The Prophet (ﷺ) made a couple undergo Lian. The husband said the child was not his. So the Prophet separated them and decided the child belonged to its mother.

title: Lian Case: Allah's Messenger Decides
content: Ibn Abbas said that a man named Asim bin Adi was involved in a case of Lian. A man from his tribe came to him and told him he had found another man with his wife. Asim took the man to Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) and explained what happened. The woman's husband described the other man as being brown, fat, and having curly hair. In contrast, the man who was accused of adultery was pale, thin, and lank-haired. Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) asked for the truth to be revealed. Later, the woman gave birth to a child that looked like the man she had been with. Based on this evidence, Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) ordered them to carry out Lian. A man from the gathering asked Ibn Abbas if this was the same lady that Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) said he would have stoned without witnesses. Ibn Abbas replied that it was not her, but another woman who was a Muslim but had a bad reputation.

title: Marriage and Divorce Laws
content: Aisha told the Prophet that her new husband was unable to have sex with her. The Prophet (ﷺ) said she couldn't go back to her first husband until she had tried to make a relationship work with her second husband.

title: Widow's Marriage Permission
content: Um Salama told us about a woman named Subai'a. She was pregnant and her husband had died. A man asked to marry her, but she said no. She wanted to wait until after she gave birth or finished the waiting period. After giving birth, she visited the Prophet and he said it's okay for her to get married now.

title: Marriage After Childbirth
content: Abdullah's father asked Ibn Al-Arqam to ask Subai'a Al-Aslamiya about a verdict from the Prophet. She said that after she gave birth, the Prophet told her she could marry again.

title: Remarriage after Husband's Death
content: Subai'a Al-Aslamiya had a child just days after her husband died. She asked the Prophet for permission to remarry, and he said yes. Later, `Aisha helped another woman who was being kept by her ex-husband's brother. The ruler of Medina, Marwan bin Al-Hakam, was told to return the woman to her father's house.

title: Fatima's Concern About Divorce
content: Aisha asked why Fatima was worried. Aisha said that a woman who gets divorced doesn't have the right to stay in her husband's home and get food from him.

title: Fatima's Concern About Divorce
content: Aisha asked, 'Why is Fatima worried? She doesn't think about Allah.' Aisha said this because a divorced woman isn't allowed to stay with her husband and get food from him.

title: Fatima's Divorce and Safety
content: Urwa asked Aisha about a woman whose husband had divorced her. Aisha said it was a bad thing she did. Urwa reminded Aisha of Fatima, who was in a difficult situation after her divorce. The Prophet (ﷺ) allowed Fatima to leave her house for safety.

title: Fatima's Divorce and Prophet's Advice
content: Urwa asked Aisha about a woman whose husband had divorced her. Aisha said it was a bad thing she did. Urwa reminded Aisha of what Fatima, the Prophet's daughter, had done. Aisha didn't want to talk about it. Urwa told Aisha that the Prophet allowed Fatima to leave her husband's house because she was in danger.

title: Aisha Disagrees with Fatima
content: 'Urwa said Aisha disagreed with what her daughter Fatima used to say.

title: Aisha Disapproves of Fatima
content: 'Urwa said Aisha disagreed with what her daughter Fatima used to say.

title: Leaving Mecca after Hajj
content: Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) saw Aisha standing at her tent. He asked if she had done a special walk around the Kaaba on the day of sacrifice. She said yes, so he told her to leave with him.

title: Ma'qil's Sister Divorced
content: Ma'qil married his sister to a man. The man later divorced her once.

title: Marriage after Divorce
content: Ma'qil's sister was divorced by her husband. He didn't contact her for a while, but then asked to remarry her when she was no longer in her waiting period. Ma'qil refused because he thought it wasn't fair. But Allah revealed a verse saying that if a woman is divorced and finishes her waiting period, her ex-husband can still ask to marry her again. The Prophet (ﷺ) told Ma'qil about this verse and he changed his mind.

title: Divorce During Menses
content: Ibn Umar divorced his wife while she was on her period. The Prophet (ﷺ) told him to take her back until she was clean again. If she got another period, he should wait for her to be clean before divorcing her. This is the time Allah has set for divorce. Ibn Umar said that if you divorce someone three times, they are no longer lawful to marry unless they have been with another man first.

title: Divorce During Menses
content: Ibn Umar divorced his wife while she was having her period. The Prophet (ﷺ) told Umar to tell Ibn Umar to take her back and then divorce her before the waiting period ended. I asked Ibn Umar if this divorce would still count, and he said no.

title: Mourning Period for Women
content: Zainab bint Abu Salama told me that Um Habiba, the wife of the Prophet, asked her for perfume when her father died. Um Habiba said she wasn't really using it, but remembered a rule from the Prophet: women shouldn't mourn more than three days unless their husband has passed away. In that case, they can mourn for four months and ten days. Zainab also told me about another woman who came to the Prophet with her daughter. The daughter's husband had died and she was sick in the eye. The Prophet (ﷺ) said no to applying kohl until four months and ten days were over. He explained that in the past, a widow would live in a small room, wear bad clothes, and not use perfume for a year after her husband died. When one year passed, she'd rub herself against an animal like a donkey or sheep, then be given dung to throw away before using perfume again.

title: Widow's Kohl Use Delayed
content: Um Salama said a woman lost her husband. Her relatives wanted to help with her eye problem. They asked the Prophet if she could use kohl, but he said no. In the past, widows stayed in their worst clothes or house for a year before they could do some things. The Prophet (ﷺ) said this woman couldn't use kohl until four months and ten days had passed.

title: Mourning Period for Women
content: The Prophet (ﷺ) said: A Muslim woman should not mourn more than three days. But if her husband dies, she can mourn for four months and ten days.

title: Mourning for the Dead
content: Um 'Atiyya said: We were told not to mourn for more than three days. This only applies if someone has lost their husband.

title: Mourning Period Rules
content: Um 'Atiyya said: We were told not to mourn for more than three days when someone dies. If it's a husband, the wife can mourn for four months and ten days. During this time, we couldn't put kohl in our eyes, wear perfume, or colored clothes, except for special Yemen-made clothes called 'Asb. But after taking a bath after our period ends, we could use incense. We also weren't allowed to follow funeral processions.

title: Mourning for a Dead Person
content: The Prophet (ﷺ) said: A woman who believes in Allah and the Day of Judgment should not mourn more than three days for someone who has died. If it's her husband, she shouldn't put kohl in her eyes, wear perfume or colored clothes, except for one special garment. She can use incense when she's clean from her period.

title: Widow's Rights After Husband Dies
content: When a man dies and leaves his wife behind, she has the right to stay in her husband's house for one year. But if she wants to leave, it's okay. She can go wherever she likes. The Quran says: 'Don't turn them out.' This means she doesn't have to stay with her husband's family if she doesn't want to. Later on, the rules of inheritance were revealed and this changed again. Now a widow has more freedom to choose where she wants to live during her period of mourning.

title: Mourning Period Explained
content: Um Habiba's father died. She wanted perfume to show respect. But she remembered the Prophet saying that a woman who believes in Allah should not mourn for more than three days, unless her husband has passed away. Then she can mourn for four months and ten days.

title: Prohibited Earnings
content: The Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) said it is not allowed to take money from selling a dog, or from someone who tells fortunes, or from someone who earns money by doing something wrong with their body.

title: Prohibited Practices
content: The Prophet (ﷺ) said to Abu Juhaifa: 'I curse the woman who gets a tattoo and the one who does it for her. I also curse those who take interest on loans and those who give it. It's not allowed to sell your dog or money earned from prostitution. And I curse people who make pictures.'

title: Prophet Forbids Slave Girl Prostitution
content: The Prophet (ﷺ) said that it's not allowed to earn money by forcing a slave girl into prostitution.

title: Accusing a Wife of Adultery
content: I asked Ibn 'Umar about what to do if a man accuses his wife of having an affair. He said the Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) separated a couple from Bani 'Ajlan when the husband accused his wife of adultery. The Prophet (ﷺ) asked them, 'Is one of you telling the truth?' They refused to say they were wrong. He asked again, but they still didn't admit it. So he divorced them. A man can't take back any money he gave her if he's lying about the affair.

title: Lian Case: Truth and Right
content: The Prophet (ﷺ) said to the people in a Lian case, 'Your accounts are with Allah. One of you is lying.' The husband said, 'My money!' The Prophet (ﷺ) replied, 'You can't take back any money. If you're telling the truth, the Mahr was for having sex with her. If you're lying, you have even less right to it'.

title: Spending for Family is Charity
content: The Prophet (ﷺ) said: When a Muslim spends money on his family to please Allah, it's considered charity for him.

title: Spend for Allah's Reward
content: Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) said: 'Allah says to you, son of Adam: Spend money, and I will give you more in return.'

title: Helping Widows and Poor
content: The Prophet (ﷺ) said that helping a widow or someone in need is like fighting for Allah's cause. It's also like praying all night and fasting every day.

title: Giving to Charity
content: The Prophet (ﷺ) visited me when I was sick. I asked if I could give all my money to help others. He said no, not even half or a third of it. He advised me to leave some for my family so they wouldn't be poor and have to ask others for help. He said that whatever I gave would still count as good deeds, even small things like feeding my wife.

title: Giving to Those in Need
content: The Prophet (ﷺ) said: 'It's best to give charity when you have a lot of money. Giving is better than taking, and take care of your family first. If someone asks for food, don't just think about yourself. A wife might say, 'Give me food or divorce me.' A slave might say, 'Feed me so I can serve you.' And a son might ask, 'What will happen to me if you die?'

title: Give Alms When Rich
content: Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) said: The best charity is to give when you have a lot of money. First, help your family and those who depend on you.

title: Prophet's Garden Sales
content: The Prophet (ﷺ) used to sell dates from the garden of Bani An-Nadir. He would store food for his family, enough to last a whole year.

title: Umar's Advice on Inheritance
content: Malik bin Aus visited Umar. Some people came to see him and then Ali and Abbas arrived. They asked Umar to judge between them about some property left by the Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) (peace be upon him). Umar said, 'The Prophet (ﷺ) did not leave any inheritance for his family. Whatever he had was given in charity.' He reminded them that Allah said, 'We do not leave anything behind when we die, but what we have is to be given to those who need it.' Umar explained how the Prophet used to give some of this property to his family and spend the rest on helping others. When the Prophet died, Abu Bakr took care of this property in the same way. Later, Umar did the same for two years after becoming the leader. Then Ali and Abbas came to him with a similar problem. He asked them to promise that they would manage the property as the Prophet and Abu Bakr did. They agreed, so he gave it to them on that condition.

title: Feeding Children from Others
content: Hind bint Utba asked the Prophet: 'Is it wrong to feed my children food from Abu Sufyan's property?' The Prophet (ﷺ) replied, 'No, as long as you take only what is fair and reasonable for your needs'.

title: Wife Giving Charity Without Permission
content: The Prophet (ﷺ) said: If a wife gives some of her husband's money without his permission, the husband will get half the reward for that act of charity.

title: Fatima's Complaint to the Prophet
content: Fatima told the Prophet that her hands were hurting from grinding grain. She had heard he got some new slaves, but when she arrived, he wasn't home. She talked to Aisha about it instead. When the Prophet came back, Aisha told him what Fatima said. The Prophet (ﷺ) then visited them at night and sat between them. He said that if they wanted something better than a slave, they should say 'God is perfect' 33 times, 'Praise be to God' 33 times, and 'God is great' 34 times before going to sleep.

title: Reciting Prayers Before Sleep
content: Fatima asked the Prophet for a servant. He said, 'There's something better than that.' He told her to recite three phrases before bed: 'God is perfect' thirty-three times, 'Praise be to God' thirty-three times, and 'God is greater' thirty-four times. `Ali said he never missed saying these prayers since then. Even on the night of a big battle, he still said them.

title: Prophet's Daily Routine
content: I asked Aisha what the Prophet did at home. She said he worked for his family and when he heard the call to prayer, he would go out.

title: Taking from Husband's Property
content: Hind bint Utba asked the Prophet if she could take some of her husband Abu Sufyan's property without his knowledge. The Prophet (ﷺ) said, 'Take what you need for yourself and your children, but only a fair amount.'

title: Women of Quraish: Best Mothers
content: Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) said that the women from Quraish who take care of their children and manage their family's belongings are considered the best mothers among camel riders.

title: Prophet Muhammad's Gift
