content: The Prophet (ﷺ) gave me a silk suit. I wore it, but he looked angry when he saw me in it. So I cut the suit and shared it with my family.

title: Marriage Advice from the Prophet
content: Jabir's father died leaving him with many young sisters. Jabir married a grown woman so she could take care of them. The Prophet (ﷺ) asked Jabir why he didn't marry a younger girl, saying it would be fun for both of them to play together and have each other's company.

title: Man Fasts in Ramadan
content: A man came to the Prophet and said he was ruined. He had sex with his wife while fasting during Ramadan. The Prophet (ﷺ) told him to free a slave as punishment, but the man couldn't afford it. Then he asked the man to fast for two months, but that was too hard. Finally, the Prophet suggested feeding 60 poor people, but the man said he didn't have enough money. Just then, a basket of dates arrived. The Prophet (ﷺ) told the man to give the dates away as punishment.

title: Spending on the Children
content: Um Salama asked the Prophet if she would get a reward in the Hereafter for spending money on Abu Salama's children and treating them like her own. The Prophet (ﷺ) said yes, she would be rewarded for what she spent.

title: Taking from Abu Sufyan
content: `Aisha told us that Hind asked the Prophet about taking some of her husband's money to support herself and their children. The Prophet (ﷺ) said, 'You can take what you need in a fair way.'

title: Debts and Funeral Prayers
content: Abu Huraira said: A man who died with debts was brought to the Prophet. The Prophet (ﷺ) asked if he had any money left to pay his debts. If there was, the Prophet would lead a prayer for him. But if not, he'd say to those present, 'Pray for your friend.' After the Prophet got help from Allah in battles, he said: 'I'm closer to believers than they are to themselves. So, if one of them dies with debts, I'll pay it off. If he leaves money, his family will get it'.

title: Marriage to Family Members
content: Um Habiba asked the Prophet if he would marry her sister. The Prophet (ﷺ) said it wasn't allowed because she was already his wife and he didn't want to share her with anyone else. Um Habiba then mentioned another woman, Durra, who was Abu Salama's daughter. The Prophet (ﷺ) said marrying her wouldn't be allowed either because she was his foster niece - Thuwaiba had nursed him and Abu Salama when they were children.

title: Help Those in Need
content: The Prophet (ﷺ) said: Give food to people who are hungry. Visit those who are sick. If someone is being held captive, pay their ransom so they can be free.

title: Muhammad's Family Went Hungry
content: Abu Huraira said that Muhammad 's (ﷺ) family did not eat enough food for three days in a row until he passed away.

title: Abu Huraira's Hunger Story
content: I was very hungry and tired. I met 'Umar bin Al-Khattab and asked him to read a verse from the Quran. He went home, explained it to me, and then I walked for a bit before falling down because of hunger. The Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) appeared beside me and said my name. I replied with respect. He took my hand and helped me up. Then he found out why I was hungry and took me to his house. He ordered a big bowl of milk, which I drank until I was full. Later, I told 'Umar what happened, saying that the Prophet had more right to help me than him. 'Umar said it would have been better for him if he had helped me himself.

title: Eat with your right hand
content: I was a young boy under the care of the Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ). When I ate from a dish, my left hand would go around it first. The Prophet (ﷺ) said to me: 'Remember Allah and use your right hand when eating. Take food from the side closest to you.' Since then, I have followed these instructions.

title: Eating with the Prophet
content: I ate a meal with the Prophet. I was eating from all sides of the plate. He said to me, 'Eat from the side that's nearest to you'.

title: Eat with Gratitude
content: Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) was eating a meal with his step-son Umar. He said to Umar, 'Remember Allah and eat from the dish nearest to you'.

title: Eating with the Right Hand
content: Anas bin Malik said that a tailor invited the Prophet to eat. The Prophet (ﷺ) went and saw how he was eating from different sides of his dish. After this, Anas liked to eat gourd. Umar bin Abi Salama said that the Prophet told him, 'Eat with your right hand'.

title: Prophet's Preference for Right
content: Aisha said the Prophet liked to start with his right side when doing things like washing his face, putting on shoes, and combing his hair. He also did this in all other matters whenever possible.

title: Prophet's Hunger is Met
content: Abu Talha thought the Prophet was hungry. He asked his wife Um Sulaim if she had food. She gave him some bread and he took it to the Prophet in the mosque. The Prophet (ﷺ) asked Abu Talha if he had brought food, and then he got up with everyone else. They went back to Abu Talha's house. The Prophet (ﷺ) said to bring out all the food they had. Um Sulaim brought out a skin of butter and some bread that was crushed into small pieces. The Prophet (ﷺ) blessed the food and said 'Admit ten men'. Ten men came in, ate their fill, and left. This happened three times until all 80 men were fed.

title: The Prophet's Generosity
content: The Prophet (ﷺ) was with a group of one hundred and thirty men. He asked if anyone had food to share. One man had some wheat flour, which he turned into dough. A pagan came with sheep for sale. The Prophet (ﷺ) bought a sheep from him and ordered it to be roasted. It was cut up into different parts: liver, kidneys, lungs, and heart. All the men present got some of these parts as food. Some were also given food that they didn't eat yet. The Prophet (ﷺ) put the leftover food in two big trays and everyone ate together until they were full. There was still some food left over.

title: Prophet's Final Moments
content: The Prophet (ﷺ) was with us when we ate two things to satisfy our hunger: dates and water. Then he passed away.

title: Eating Sawiq with the Prophet
content: We went to Khaibar with the Prophet. When we stopped at a place called As-Sahba', he asked for food, but all we had was sawiq (a type of barley). We chewed and ate it together. Then he asked for water and rinsed his mouth. We did the same. After that, he led us in prayer without washing his hands again.

title: Prophet's Food Preferences
content: Anas told us that the Prophet did not eat thin bread or a roasted sheep until he died. His baker was with him when Anas said this.

title: Prophet's Eating Habits
content: Anas said the Prophet did not eat from a big tray. He never ate thin bread that was well baked. He also didn't use a dining table to eat his meals.

title: Prophet's Wedding Banquet
content: The Prophet (ﷺ) stopped to get married to Safiyya. I invited some Muslims to join the celebration. He asked for special mats made of leather to be laid out. Then we put dates, dried yoghurt and butter on those mats. The Prophet (ﷺ) got married to Safiyya during a trip, and we served a sweet dish called Hais on one of those mats.

title: Abdullah's Mother Defends Him
content: Some people from Sham called Abdullah 'son of Dhatin-Nataqain' because his mother, Asma, had two waist-belts. She explained that she wore one belt to carry the water skin for Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) and another to carry his food container.

title: Prophet's Reaction to Food
content: Ibn Abbas' aunt gave the Prophet butter, dried yoghurt and a type of sweet food. The Prophet (ﷺ) invited everyone to eat this food on his tablecloth. People ate it, but the Prophet didn't eat any of it. If eating this food was wrong, people wouldn't have eaten it in front of him or asked him to share it.

title: Prophet's Prayer at As-Sahba'
content: Suwaid bin An-Nu'man said that when they were with the Prophet near Khaibar, it was time for prayer. The Prophet (ﷺ) asked people if they had food to share, but all they had was a type of barley called Sawiq. He ate some and so did we. Then he asked for water, rinsed his mouth, and led us in Maghrib prayer. We prayed too, but the Prophet didn't do ablution again after eating.

title: Eating Unfamiliar Food
content: Khalid bin Al-Walid went with the Prophet to his aunt Maimuna's house. They found a roasted animal there, which was from Najd. The Prophet (ﷺ) didn't usually eat new food without knowing what it is. He reached for the meat, but a lady said, 'Tell him what this is.' She explained that it was mastigure meat. The Prophet (ﷺ) pulled his hand back. Khalid asked if they couldn't eat it because it's forbidden. The Prophet (ﷺ) said no, but he didn't like eating food from their land. Khalid ate some of the meat while the Prophet watched.

title: Food Sharing is Generous
content: Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) said, 'Sharing food with others is a good deed. If you have enough for two people, share it with three. And if you have enough for three people, share it with four.'

title: Ibn Umar's Generosity
content: Nafi' said that Ibn 'Umar never ate a meal without inviting a poor person to join him. One day, Nafi' brought a poor man to eat with Ibn 'Umar. The poor man ate too much food. Ibn 'Umar then told Nafi', 'Don't let this man come into my house again.' He explained that he had heard the Prophet say, 'A true believer eats little, but an unbeliever eats a lot.'

title: Believers Eat Less
content: Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) said: A believer eats a little food and is satisfied. An unbeliever or hypocrite eats too much and never feels full.

title: Eating like an Unbeliever
content: Ibn Umar told Abu Nahik that the Prophet said: 'An unbeliever eats a lot.' Abu Nahik replied, 'But I believe in Allah and His Messenger.'

title: How Muslims and Non-Muslims Eat
content: Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) said: A Muslim eats a little food because they are satisfied. An unbeliever eats a lot of food because they are never satisfied.

title: Eating as a Believer
content: A man used to eat a lot. When he became Muslim, he started eating less food. The Prophet (ﷺ) said that a true believer eats just enough and is satisfied. A non-believer, on the other hand, eats too much.

title: Eating While Leaning
content: Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) said: I don't eat while leaning against something. He wanted people to sit properly and eat with dignity.

title: Eating in an Upright Position
content: Abu Juhaifa said the Prophet told a man who was with him not to eat while leaning. He should sit up straight when eating.

title: Eating a Rare Bird
content: Khalid bin Al-Walid brought a roasted bird to the Prophet. The Prophet (ﷺ) stretched out his hand to eat it, but was told it's a mastigure. He withdrew his hand because he doesn't like eating birds not found in their land. Khalid then ate the bird while the Prophet watched. An-Nadr explained that 'Al-Khazira' is made from bran and 'Al-Harira' is made from milk.

title: Prophet Visits a Blind Man
content: A blind man named Urban came to the Prophet. He said he couldn't lead his people in prayer because of heavy rain. The Prophet (ﷺ) promised to visit him and pray at his house. The next morning, the Prophet came with Abu Bakr. They prayed two rak'at together. After prayer, many men gathered for a meal. One man called Malik a hypocrite. But the Prophet said, 'Don't say that. If he says

title: Prophet Muhammad Eats Mastigures
content: My aunt brought roasted mastigures, Iqt, and milk to the Prophet. The mastigures were put on his plate. If it was not allowed to eat them, they wouldn't have been there. He drank the milk but only ate a little of the Iqt.

title: Friday Meal Tradition
content: Sahl bin Sa'd said: We loved Fridays because an old lady would cook a special meal with barley. After the Friday prayer, we would visit her and eat that meal together. This was our only food for the day until after the prayer.

title: Prophet's Prayer Without Wudu
content: Ibn 'Abbas said the Prophet ate some meat from a shoulder. Then he stood up and prayed without washing his hands and face again.

title: Prophet's Prayer Without Ablution
content: Ibn 'Abbas said that the Prophet took a bone with meat from a cooking pot and ate it. Then he prayed without washing his hands again.

title: Prophet's Journey to Mecca
content: Abu Qatada said: The Prophet (ﷺ) went out with us towards Mecca.

title: Hunting an Onager
content: I was with the Prophet's companions on a trip to Mecca. We were all getting ready for Ihram, but I wasn't yet. My friends saw an onager (a type of wild donkey) while I was busy fixing my shoes. They didn't tell me about it, so I spotted it myself and rode after it with my horse. But I forgot to take the whip and spear. When I got back, I asked my friends for them, but they refused to help me hunt it. I got angry and took them anyway. My horse chased the onager and hurt it badly. We brought it back when it had died. My friends ate some of its meat, but they were worried that it might be against the rules since we were in a state of Ihram. When we met the Prophet, we asked him about eating the meat. He saw one of the onager's legs and said, 'Do you have any of this meat with you?' I gave it to him, and he ate until the bone was clean.

title: Prophet's Prayer After Cutting Meat
content: Amr bin Umaiyya saw the Prophet holding a piece of mutton and cutting it with a knife. He was called for prayer, so he put down the meat and knife and stood up to pray without washing his hands again.

title: Prophet Muhammad's Table Manners
content: The Prophet (ﷺ) never criticized food he was offered. If he liked it, he ate it. If not, he left it.

title: Barley Flour in Prophet's Time
content: Abu Hazim asked Sahl if they used white flour during the Prophet's lifetime. Sahl said no, and Abu Hazim asked about sifting barley flour. Sahl replied that they didn't sift it, but instead blew off its husk.

title: The Prophet Distributes Dates
content: The Prophet (ﷺ) gave each of his companions seven dates. He also gave me seven dates. One of the dates was dry and hard, but I liked it because it took a long time to chew.

title: Sa'd's Early Life
content: I was one of the first seven people to become Muslim with the Prophet. We didn't have much food back then, so we ate leaves from trees like Habala or Hubula. This made our stool look like a sheep's. Now, some people from the Bani Asad tribe want me to learn Islam again from them, but I think it would be pointless.

title: Allah's Messenger and Flour
content: Abu Hazim asked Sahl bin Sa'd if the Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) ever ate white flour. Sahl said no, because he never saw it during his lifetime. Abu Hazim also asked about sieves, and Sahl said the Prophet didn't use one either. When Abu Hazim wondered how they could eat unsifted barley, Sahl explained that they would grind it, blow off the husks, and then bake it.

title: Abu Huraira's Story
content: Abu Huraira saw some people with a roasted sheep. They invited him to eat but he refused. He said that the Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) never ate even barley bread when he was hungry, not even before he died.

title: Prophet Muhammad's Eating Habits
content: The Prophet (ﷺ) never ate at a table or with small plates. He didn't eat thin bread either. They used leather sheets to eat on.

title: Muhammad's Family Goes Hungry
content: When Muhammad (ﷺ) arrived in Medina, his family didn't have wheat bread for three days straight until he died. They were hungry because of this.

title: Comforting Food for Sorrow
content: When one of my relatives died, I would cook a special food called Talbina. Then we'd make another dish and pour the Talbina on it. I'd tell the women to eat from it because Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) said that Talbina can help someone who's sick feel better.

title: Women's Excellence in Islam
content: Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) said that many men reached a high level of goodness. But only two women achieved this: Mary, the daughter of Imran, and Asiya, Pharaoh's wife. Aisha is considered better than all other women because she is like a delicious meal called Tharid.

title: Aisha's Superiority
content: The Prophet (ﷺ) said that Aisha is better than other women, just like Tharid food is better than others. He didn't explain what Tharid is.

title: The Prophet Eats Gourd
content: Anas went with the Prophet to a tailor's house. The tailor gave them food called Tharid. The Prophet (ﷺ) picked pieces of gourd from it, and Anas did the same. After that, Anas liked eating gourd.

title: Anas' Baked Bread
content: We visited Anas bin Malik. His baker was always there. Anas said, 'Eat! I never saw the Prophet eat well-baked bread or a roasted sheep.'

title: Eating Before Prayer
content: I saw the Prophet cutting a piece of mutton with a knife. He ate it and then went to pray without washing his hands again.

title: Prophet's Guidance on Food
content: I asked Aisha if the Prophet forbade eating meat from sacrifices after three days. She said he didn't, except when people were hungry and he wanted the rich to share with the poor. Later, we would save even a small part of meat for up to fifteen days. We, the family of Muhammad (ﷺ), only had white bread with meat soup for three days before he passed away.

title: Carrying Sacrifice Meat
content: Jabir said that during the time of the Prophet, they would take meat from sacrificed animals to Medina.

title: The Prophet's Daily Prayers
content: The Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) told Abu Talha to bring one of his boys to serve him. I was taken by Abu Talha on his riding animal and started serving the Prophet whenever he stopped. I often heard him say, 'I seek refuge with Allah from worries, sadness, helplessness, laziness, being stingy, cowardice, debt, and being treated unfairly.' We returned from a battle and the Prophet brought Safiyya as his war prize. He made her sit on a cloth behind him on his camel. When they reached As-Sahba', he prepared food and invited men to eat with them. This was their wedding banquet. The Prophet (ﷺ) then continued his journey and when he saw the mountain of Uhud, he said, 'This mountain loves us and we love it.' When they approached Medina, he prayed, 'Make the area between its two mountains a sanctuary like Abraham made Mecca holy. Bless their measurements of food and drink'.

title: Prophet's Advice on Luxury
content: Hudhaifa was thirsty and a Magian brought him water. When the Magian gave him the cup, Hudhaifa threw it back at him. He said he wouldn't have done that if he hadn't heard the Prophet say: 'Don't wear expensive clothes or drink from fancy cups. These things are for non-believers in this life and we'll be punished for them in the next.'

title: Good and Bitter Fruits
content: Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) said: A person who reads the Quran is like a citron. It smells good and tastes good. If someone reads the Quran but doesn't act on it, they're like a date fruit - no smell, but sweet taste. Someone who claims to be a Muslim but doesn't read the Quran is like an aromatic plant with a nice smell but bitter taste. And someone who doesn't read the Quran or claim to be a Muslim is like a colocynth plant - no smell and very bitter.

title: Aisha's Superiority in Islam
content: Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) said that Aisha is like Tharid food - the best among all kinds of food. This means she has a special status and importance in Islam.

title: Traveling is a test
content: Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) said: 'Travel can be hard. It stops you from sleeping and eating properly. When your job is done, go back to your family quickly.'

title: Barira's Freedom and Charity
content: Aisha wanted to buy Barira and set her free. But the people who owned Barira said that if she was freed, they would get some rights over her. Aisha told this to the Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ). He said it was okay for them to keep those rights because freeing a slave is a kind act. Barira was eventually freed. She had two choices: stay with her husband or leave him. One day, the Prophet visited Aisha's house while food was cooking on the fire. He asked if he could have lunch and was given some bread and extra food. The Prophet (ﷺ) noticed that meat was being cooked but said it was charity for Barira, not a gift to them.

title: Prophet Muhammad loved sweets
content: Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) liked eating sweet foods and honey.

title: Abu Huraira's Life with the Prophet
content: I used to go with Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) to help myself. I didn't eat bread or wear nice clothes. I didn't have a servant, so I'd carry stones on my belly and ask someone to read a Quran verse for me. This way, they would invite me home and feed me. Ja'far bin Abi Talib was very kind to poor people like us. He'd take us in and give us food from his house. If there wasn't any food, he'd give us an empty honey or butter skin to lick.

title: Allah's Messenger Eats Gourd
content: Anas said that Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) visited his slave who was a tailor. The Messenger was offered gourd to eat, and he started eating it. Anas liked eating gourd after seeing the Messenger eat it.

title: Guests at the Prophet's Table
content: Abu Shu'aib invited the Prophet and four other men to a meal. When another man followed them, the Prophet said it was okay if they wanted to admit him or not. The host chose to let him in. Later, the Prophet reminded his companions that guests can't take food from other tables, but can share with each other from their own table.

title: Eating Gourd with the Prophet
content: I was a young boy when I walked with the Prophet. He went into his tailor's house and saw food covered in gourd pieces. The Prophet (ﷺ) picked up the gourd to eat it. I started collecting the gourd for him too. When he finished, the tailor went back to work. Since then, I've loved eating gourd because of what I saw the Prophet do.

title: Prophet enjoys a meal
content: Anas bin Malik said that the Prophet went to eat at a tailor's house. The tailor served barley bread and soup with gourd and meat. The Prophet (ﷺ) picked the gourd pieces from around the dish, so Anas started liking gourd too.

title: Prophet's Simple Meal
content: Anas saw the Prophet being given soup with gourd and cured meat. He picked out the pieces of gourd from the soup and ate them.

title: Prophet's Sacrifice Rule
content: The Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) did not store meat from sacrifices for more than three days. He wanted the rich to share with the poor. Later, we would keep even small pieces of meat like trotters for up to fifteen days. The Prophet 's (ﷺ) family never ate wheat bread with meat or soup for three days in a row.

title: Allah's Messenger Eats with a Tailor
content: Anas bin Malik said that a tailor invited the Prophet to eat at his home. Anas went with the Prophet and saw him eating barley bread, soup made from gourd, and cured meat. The Prophet (ﷺ) picked up pieces of gourd from around the dish. Since then, Anas has liked eating gourd.

title: Eating Fresh Dates
content: I saw the Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) eating fresh dates with a type of cucumber called snake cucumber.

title: Abu Huraira's Night Prayer
content: I was a guest of Abu Huraira for seven days. He and his family would take turns staying awake at night, praying together. One day, the Prophet gave us dates as food. My share was seven dates, but one was not ripe yet. When the Prophet passed away, we were happy with just two simple foods: dates and water.

title: The Prophet Helps Jabir
content: Jabir had a debt to a Jew in Medina. The Jew wanted his money back but Jabir's land wasn't producing much. When the Prophet found out, he and some companions went to talk to the Jew. But the Jew refused to give Jabir more time. The Prophet (ﷺ) then walked around the garden with the Jew, trying to convince him. After eating some dates that Jabir offered him, the Prophet asked where Jabir's hut was and slept there for a bit. When he woke up, he told Jabir to pick some dates from his land to pay off the debt. This is exactly what happened, and Jabir paid back the Jew with extra dates left over. The Prophet (ﷺ) then said that he was Allah's Messenger (ﷺ).

title: The Blessed Date Palm Tree
content: One day, while sitting with the Prophet, fresh dates were brought to him. The Prophet (ﷺ) said, 'There is a tree that is as blessed as a Muslim.' I thought it was the date palm tree and wanted to say so, but there were ten of us present, and I didn't want to interrupt. So I kept quiet until the Prophet told me, 'It's the date palm tree'.

title: Protection from Poison and Magic
content: Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) said: If someone eats seven 'Ajwa dates in the morning, they will not be harmed by poison or magic that day.

title: Ibn Zubair and Famine
content: During a time of famine, Ibn Zubair gave us dates to eat. Abdullah bin Umar would pass by and say, 'Don't eat two dates together.' He said this because the Prophet had forbidden eating two dates at once in a group. Unless you ask your friends first.

title: Prophet's Simple Meal
content: I saw the Prophet eating fresh dates with snake cucumbers. He was enjoying them together.

title: Date Palm Tree Like a Muslim
content: The Prophet (ﷺ) said that there is a tree called the date palm tree. It's like a good Muslim because it gives shade and food to people.

title: Eating Fresh Dates
content: I saw the Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) eating fresh dates with snake cucumbers.

title: Um Sulaim's Porridge for Prophet
content: My mother Um Sulaim made porridge from barley grain. She sent me to the Prophet with it. I invited him, and he asked if his companions could join us too. When Abu Talha explained that it was just a simple meal, the Prophet came in and said 'Let ten people come.' They ate their fill, then another ten, and another ten after that. In total, forty people ate from the porridge before the Prophet finished eating.

title: Eating Garlic Before Prayer
content: Anas said that the Prophet told him not to come near the mosque if he had eaten garlic. This means you should not pray after eating garlic, so wait a bit before going to the mosque for prayer.

title: Avoid Garlic and Onion
content: The Prophet (ﷺ) said to Jabir: If you've eaten garlic or onion, stay away from us. Stay away from our mosque.

title: Collecting Al-Kabath
content: Jabir bin Abdullah was with the Prophet. They were collecting something called Al-Kabath at a place called Mar-Az-Zahran. The Prophet (ﷺ) said, 'Pick up the black ones because they are better.' Someone asked him, 'Have you ever looked after sheep?' The Prophet (ﷺ) replied, 'No prophet has ever looked after sheep before'.

title: Prayer at Khaibar
content: We were with the Prophet on a trip to Khaibar. When we stopped at As-Sahba', he asked for food and was given something called Sawiq. We ate it, then the Prophet stood up to pray. Before praying, he rinsed his mouth with water, so did we.

title: Prayer Without Ablution
content: We went to Khaibar with the Prophet. When we reached a place called As-Sahba', he asked for food and was given Sawiq, which we chewed and ate. He then asked for water and rinsed his mouth. We did the same. After that, he led us in prayer without washing again.

title: Eat and Clean Your Hands
content: When you eat, don't wipe your hands until you have licked them clean or someone else has licked them for you.

title: Prayer after eating
content: Jabir bin Abdullah was asked about washing hands after eating a cooked meal. He said it's not necessary to wash your hands again before praying. During the Prophet's time, they rarely got food like this and when they did, they used their palms, forearms, or feet to wipe their hands clean. After eating such meals, they would pray without washing their hands again.

title: Prophet's Gratitude After Meals
content: When the Prophet finished eating, he would say: 'Praise be to Allah for a lot of good in this food. It is blessed and not enough to make us forgetful or satisfied. Our Lord does not need it.'

title: After Meals, Praise Allah
content: When the Prophet finished eating, he would say: 'Praise be to Allah for giving us food and drink. His kindness can't be paid back or refused.' Sometimes he said: 'Thank You, our Lord, Your kindness can't be ignored, given up, or stopped.'

title: Respect Your Servant
content: When your servant brings food to you, ask them to join you or take some. They worked hard to cook it and were patient with its heat.

title: Prophet's Visit to a Home
content: Abu Shu'aib, an Ansari man, had a slave who was a butcher. He saw that the Prophet was hungry and invited him for a meal with four other men. But another person followed them without being invited. The Prophet (ﷺ) said it was okay if Abu Shu'aib wanted to invite this extra person or not.

title: Cutting Meat Before Prayer
content: Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) was cutting a piece of mutton with his hand. When it was time for prayer, he put the meat and knife down and stood up to pray without washing his hands again.

title: Eat Before Night Prayer
content: The Prophet (ﷺ) said, 'If food is ready and the call to prayer for night time prayer is made, eat your meal first.'

title: Ibn Umar's Prayer Time
content: Ibn Umar was eating his evening meal while listening to the Quran being recited during the late-night prayer.

title: Eat Before Night Prayer
content: The Prophet (ﷺ) said to Aisha: If the call for night prayer is made and food is ready, eat first before going to pray.

title: Zainab's Wedding and Veil
content: I, Anas, know about the order to cover women. One day, Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) married Zainab bint Jahsh in Medina. After a meal, some people stayed with him while others left. He got up twice to check if everyone had gone, but they were still there. Then he hung a curtain between us and the verse about covering women was revealed.

title: Prophet Blesses Newborn Son
content: My son was born. I took him to the Prophet. He named my son Ibrahim and gave him a date to suck on. The Prophet (ﷺ) asked Allah to bless my son. Then he returned my son to me.

title: Prophet's Reaction to Urine
content: A boy was brought to the Prophet. He wanted to do a special ritual for him called Tahnik. But the boy urinated on the Prophet. The Prophet (ﷺ) had water poured on the spot where the urine was.

title: Abdullah bin Az-Zubair's Birth
content: Asma' bint Abu Bakr went to Medina when she was about to give birth. She gave birth at Quba'. Then she brought her baby boy Abdullah to the Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) and placed him on his lap. The Prophet (ﷺ) asked for a date, chewed it, and put its juice in the baby's mouth. He then used a date to gently massage the baby's face. Many Muslims were happy because they thought this child would be blessed by Allah.

title: Abu Talha's Son and the Prophet
content: Anas bin Malik told us that Abu Talha had a sick child. When he was out, the child died. When Abu Talha came home, his wife Um Salaim said, 'He is quieter than usual.' They ate supper together and then went to sleep. In the morning, Abu Talha asked her to bury the child. He told the Prophet about it later. The Prophet (ﷺ) asked if they had slept together that night. Abu Talha said yes. The Prophet (ﷺ) prayed for blessings on them. Um Salaim soon gave birth to a boy. When the baby was old enough, Abu Talha took him to see the Prophet. The Prophet (ﷺ) took the child in his lap and gave him a date from Um Salaim's gift. He chewed it, spat some out, and put it into the child's mouth for Tahnik. Then he named the child Abdullah.

title: Slaughter an animal for the newborn
content: Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) said: 'When a boy is born, slaughter an animal to help him and ease his pain.'

title: No Fara' or 'Atira Sacrifices
content: The Prophet (ﷺ) said: Do not sacrifice the first offspring of camels or sheep. The pagans used to offer these as sacrifices to their idols. Also, do not slaughter a sheep during the month of Rajab.

title: No Sacrificing Firstborn
content: The Prophet (ﷺ) said: 'It's not allowed to sacrifice the first camel or sheep that is born. And it's also not allowed to slaughter a sheep during the month of Rajab.'

title: Killing Game with a Stick
content: Adi bin Hatim asked the Prophet about hunting. He said: If you kill an animal with a sharp stick, eat it if the stick's edge hit it, but not if its broad side hit it. If your dog catches an animal for you, eat it like it was slaughtered. But if another dog is there and might have helped, don't eat it.

title: Hunting with a Mi'rad
content: I asked the Prophet about hunting. He said, 'If you use the sharp edge of your Mi'rad and kill an animal, you can eat it. But if you hit the animal with the broad side of the Mi'rad, don't eat it because it's been beaten to death with a stick.' I asked, 'What if my trained hound catches an animal?' He said, 'If you let your dog go after an animal and say Allah's name, then you can eat what it caught. But if your dog eats some of the animal, don't eat it because the dog hunted for itself, not for you.' I asked another question: 'What if my hound finds another dog that has already caught an animal?' He said, 'Don't eat the animal because you only mentioned Allah's name on your own dog, not the other one.'

title: Hunting and Eating Game
content: Adi bin Hatim asked the Prophet: 'Is it okay to eat game hunted by our dogs?' The Prophet (ﷺ) said, 'Yes, even if they kill the animal.' Adi also asked about using a Mi'rad (a type of hunting tool) - the Prophet said, 'You can eat from an animal killed by piercing with the Mi'rad. But not if it's hit on the side.'

title: Eating in Non-Muslim Lands
content: I asked the Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) about eating from utensils used by people who don't follow Islam. He said if we can use our own utensils, that's best. If not, wash theirs before using them. When hunting with a bow and mentioning Allah's Name, what you catch is halal (allowed) to eat. The same goes for hunting with a trained dog after saying the prayer. But if you hunt with an untrained dog and get it before it dies, then slaughter it and eat it.

title: Throwing Stones is Forbidden
content: `Abdullah bin Maghaffal saw a man throwing stones with two fingers. He told the man that Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) had forbidden or disliked this action. Throwing stones won't help hunt animals or harm enemies, but it can cause injury. The next time `Abdullah saw the man throwing stones, he scolded him for not listening and decided not to talk to him.

title: Dogs as Pets are Bad
content: The Prophet (ﷺ) said that if you keep a dog just for fun and it doesn't help protect or hunt, your good deeds will be reduced by two Qirat each day.

title: Dogs in the House
content: Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) said: If you keep a dog just for company and not for hunting or guarding animals, your good deeds will be reduced by two small rewards each day.

title: Keeping Dogs as Pets
content: Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) said: If you keep a dog just for fun or companionship, your good deeds will be reduced by two small rewards each day.

title: Hunting with Trained Hounds
content: I asked the Prophet about hunting with my trained hounds. He said: 'If you let them chase game and say Allah's name, you can eat what they catch. But if your hound eats from it first, don't eat it. And if other dogs join in, don't eat it either.'

title: Eating Game Caught by Dogs
content: The Prophet (ﷺ) said: If you let a dog go after an animal and say 'In the name of Allah', and it catches and kills it, you can eat from it. But if the dog eats some of it, don't eat it because the dog caught it for itself. If many dogs are chasing the animal without saying 'In the name of Allah', and they catch something, don't eat it because you won't know which one killed it. If you throw an arrow at an animal and find it dead a few days later with just your arrow's mark on it, you can eat from it. But if the animal is found dead in water, don't eat from it.

title: Hunting and Eating Game
content: I asked the Prophet about hunting. He said that if I let my hound loose and it catches a game, I shouldn't eat it because the dog caught it for itself. If another dog is with mine, but I didn't mention Allah's Name on sending the other one, we can't eat the game either. But if we hunt with a sharp stick or piece of wood, we can eat the game if it was killed by the sharp edge, not the broad side.

title: Hunting with Trained Hounds
content: Adi Bin Hatim asked the Prophet: 'We hunt with these dogs.' The Prophet (ﷺ) said: 'If you send your trained dogs after a game and say Allah's Name, you can eat what they catch. But if the dog eats from the game, don't eat it. I'm worried that the dog caught it for itself. If another dog joins during the hunt, don't eat the game either.'

title: Eating in Non-Muslim Lands
content: Abu Tha'laba asked the Prophet: 'We live among non-Muslims and eat from their plates. We also hunt animals here. What is allowed for us?' The Prophet (ﷺ) replied: 'If you can use your own plates, don't eat from theirs. If not, wash their plates before eating. When hunting with a bow, say

title: Chasing a Rabbit
content: Anas bin Malik and his friends teased a rabbit at Marr Az-Zahran until it started jumping. They chased it, but Anas kept going and caught the rabbit. He brought it to Abu Talha, who sent its legs to the Prophet. The Prophet (ﷺ) accepted them.

title: Abu Qatada and the Onager
content: Abu Qatada was with the Prophet on a trip to Mecca. He saw an onager, so he rode his horse and took a spear from his companions. They refused to give it to him, but he took it anyway and killed the onager. Some of the Prophet's companions ate the meat, while others didn't want to eat it. When they asked the Prophet about this, he said that the onager was food given by Allah.

title: Prophet's Question About Food
content: The Prophet (ﷺ) asked Abu Qatada if there was any leftover meat from the animal they had sacrificed.

title: Hunting During Ihram
content: I was traveling with the Prophet between Mecca and Medina. Everyone in our group was in a state of Ihram, but I wasn't. One day, while riding my horse, I saw something that caught everyone's attention. It was an onager, a wild donkey-like animal. My friends didn't know what it was, so I told them. They said they wouldn't help me hunt it. I got down from my horse and took my whip to chase the onager. After killing it, I carried it back to our group. Some people ate some of it, but others refused. I asked the Prophet about it, and he said, 'Eat what's left, because Allah has given you this food as a gift.'

title: Jabir's Story: The Fish
content: We went on a campaign with Abu 'Ubaida as our commander. Our army was called the Army of the Khabat. We were very hungry. Then, the sea brought us a huge dead fish called Al- `Anbar. It was bigger than any we'd ever seen before. We ate from it for half a month. After that, Abu 'Ubaida used one of its bones to make an arch so people could ride under it easily.

title: Prophet's Army in the Desert
content: The Prophet (ﷺ) sent a group of three hundred soldiers led by Abu Ubaida to ambush a Quraish caravan. They were so hungry they ate desert bushes, and their army was called 'the Army of the Khabat'. The sea brought them a huge fish called Al-`Anbar, which they ate for half a month and used its fat to heal their bodies. One of its ribs was used as a bridge when a rider passed underneath it. A soldier slaughtered six camels due to hunger but Abu Ubaida later stopped him from doing so.

title: Eating Locusts with the Prophet
content: Ibn Abi Aufa said: We went on six or seven battles with the Prophet. During those times, we would eat locusts together.

title: Hunting in the Land of Scripture
content: I asked the Prophet about living among people who follow a different scripture. He said: 'If you have no choice but to eat from their plates, wash them first. When hunting with your bow, say Allah's Name while hunting and then eat what you catch. If you hunt with a trained dog, say Allah's Name when sending it out and eat the animal. But if you hunt with an untrained dog and catch the animal alive, slaughter it before eating.'

title: Prophet's Order on Khaibar
content: On the evening of the conquest of Khaibar, the Prophet asked why the army was making fires. They said it was for cooking donkey meat. He told them to throw away what was in the pots and break the pots. A man suggested throwing out the food and washing the pots instead of breaking them. The Prophet (ﷺ) agreed with this idea.

title: Prophet's Guidance on Slaughtering
content: We were with the Prophet in a place called Dhul-Hulaifa. Many people were very hungry. We got some camels and sheep as spoils of war. The Prophet (ﷺ) was behind us, so we quickly prepared to cook the animals. But the Prophet told us to turn the cooking pots upside down. Then he divided the animals among us. He said that ten sheep are equal to one camel. One of our camels ran away, but a man shot it with an arrow and stopped it. The Prophet (ﷺ) said that some animals can be wild, so if they run away, we should treat them like this. I asked the Prophet about slaughtering our animals without knives. He said that if we use any tool to cut their throats and say Allah's Name, we can eat from them. But we shouldn't use our teeth or nails to slaughter them. The Prophet (ﷺ) explained that a tooth is just a bone, and a nail is like the knife used by Ethiopians.

title: Zaid Refuses Pagan Meat
content: The Prophet (ﷺ) met Zaid bin Amr near Baldah. He offered Zaid a dish of meat from the pagans, but Zaid refused it. He said he only eats meat with Allah's name mentioned during slaughter.

title: Sacrifices Before Prayer
content: During the Prophet's time, some people sacrificed animals before the Eid prayer. When the Prophet finished his prayer, he saw they had already slaughtered their sacrifices. He said that anyone who had done this should sacrifice another animal instead. Anyone who hadn't yet sacrificed an animal should do so after mentioning Allah's Name.

title: Slaughtering a Dying Sheep
content: Ka'b's slave girl was taking care of some sheep near Medina. One sheep was dying, so she killed it with a stone to end its suffering. Ka'b said, 'Wait until I ask the Prophet if we can eat this meat.' He went to see the Prophet or sent someone to ask. The Prophet (ﷺ) allowed them to eat the sheep.

title: Eating Meat from a Dying Sheep
content: Abdullah told me that Ka'b had a slave girl who took care of his sheep on a small mountain near the market. One of the sheep was dying, so she used a stone to slaughter it and make it halal. When this happened, they asked the Prophet about eating the meat, and he said it's okay.

title: Slaughtering Animals Properly
content: Rafi' bin Khadij asked the Prophet: 'We don't have a knife.' The Prophet (ﷺ) said, 'If you use something that makes blood come out and say Allah's Name while doing it, you can eat the animal. But don't use a nail or your teeth to slaughter an animal. A nail is like a knife for some people, and a tooth is just a bone. If a camel runs away and you can't catch it, shoot it with an arrow.'

title: Eating Meat Slaughtered with Stone
content: Ka'b bin Malik said the Prophet was asked about a woman who killed a sheep with a stone. The Prophet (ﷺ) allowed her to eat it.

title: Eating Meat from a Dying Sheep
content: Muadh bin Sa'd was asked about a sheep that died after being slaughtered. The Prophet (ﷺ) said, 'It's okay to eat it.'

title: Meat Slaughtered Correctly
content: The Prophet (ﷺ) said: 'You can eat meat if it's cut with something that makes blood come out. But not if it's cut with a tooth or your nails.'

title: Mention Allah's Name on Meat
content: Some people brought us meat but didn't know if they said 'In the name of Allah' when slaughtering. The Prophet (ﷺ) told them to say it and eat the meat. A group of new Muslims asked him about this.

title: Slaughtering Animals for Food
content: I asked the Prophet about what to do when we go to war and don't have knives. He said, 'If you need to kill an animal quickly, use a sharp object that will make it bleed. If you mention Allah's Name while doing this, you can eat the meat. But don't use your teeth or nails to slaughter. The Prophet (ﷺ) explained that using these is not allowed because they are not proper tools for slaughtering. Later, we got some camels and sheep as war spoils, but one camel ran away. A man shot it with an arrow to stop it. The Prophet (ﷺ) said that some of the camels were wild, so if one ran away, you could use this method to catch it.'

title: Eating Horse Meat During Ramadan
content: Asma bint Abu Bakr said: We killed a horse during the time of the Prophet and ate it. This happened while he was alive.

title: Eating Meat Slaughtered in Medina
content: Asma' said that during the time of the Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ), she and her family ate a horse they had slaughtered at Medina.

title: Slaughtering a Horse in Islam
content: Asma' bint Abu Bakr said: We killed a horse during the time of Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) and ate it. He did not stop us from doing so.

title: Shooting Tied Animals
content: Anas and I visited Al-Hakam bin Aiyub. We saw some boys shooting at a hen tied up. Anas said, 'The Prophet (ﷺ) has forbidden hurting animals that are tied or trapped.'

title: Don't Tie Animals
content: Ibn Umar visited Yahya's son. The boy had tied a hen to kill it. Ibn Umar untied the hen and took it away. He said, 'Stop tying animals to hurt them. I've heard the Prophet say not to kill an animal after tying it.'

title: Cruelty to Animals Forbidden
content: Ibn Umar saw some young men shooting at a tied-up hen. They ran away when they saw him. Ibn Umar said, 'Who did this?' He then told me that the Prophet cursed anyone who hurts an animal while it's still alive.

title: Prophet's Ban on Two Things
content: Abdullah bin Yazid said the Prophet forbade two things: An-Nuhba and Al-Muthla.

title: Prophet Muhammad Eats Chicken
content: Abu Musa Al-Ash'ari saw the Prophet eating chicken.

title: Eating Chicken is Halal
content: Abu Musa was eating chicken with a group of people. A man didn't want to eat it because he thought chickens ate dirty things. Abu Musa said, 'I saw the Prophet eating chicken.' The man said, 'But I've taken an oath not to eat chicken.' Abu Musa told him about a time when he and his friends went to see the Prophet. They asked for horses but the Prophet said he couldn't give them any because he had nothing left. But then some camels came in as spoils of war, and the Prophet gave them five beautiful white camels with big humps instead. Abu Musa thought the Prophet had forgotten his oath not to give them mounts. So they went back to him and reminded him about it. The Prophet (ﷺ) said that Allah is the one who gives us what we need. If he takes an oath but then finds something better, he will do what's better and make up for the oath.

title: Eating Horse Meat in Islam
content: Asma' said: We killed a horse during the time of the Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) and ate it.

title: Donkeys' Meat Forbidden
content: On the Day of the battle of Khaibar, Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) made it clear that donkey's meat is not allowed to eat. However, horse flesh can be eaten.

title: Donkey Meat Forbidden
content: Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) made eating donkey meat haram on the day of the Battle of Khaibar.

title: Prophet forbids eating donkey meat
content: Ibn Umar said the Prophet told him not to eat donkey's meat.

title: Prohibited Marriage and Meat
content: Ali said that Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) prohibited temporary marriage and eating donkey meat during the battle of Khaibar.

title: Prohibition on Donkey Meat
content: Jabir bin Abdullah said the Prophet prohibited eating donkey meat during the Battle of Khaibar. He allowed eating horse flesh instead.

title: Prophet forbids eating donkey
content: The Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) said that it's not allowed to eat donkey meat.

title: Prophet forbids eating donkey
content: The Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) said it is not allowed to eat the meat of a donkey.

title: Prophet's Food Prohibitions
content: The Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) prohibited eating donkey meat. He also said it is not allowed to eat animals with sharp teeth, like some wild beasts.

title: Donkey Meat Forbidden
content: Someone came to the Prophet and said that donkeys had been eaten. Another person said they had been destroyed. The Prophet (ﷺ) ordered a message to be announced: 'Allah and His Messenger say you must not eat donkey meat because it is impure.' People stopped eating it right away.

title: Eating Donkey Meat
content: I asked Jabir bin Zaid about people saying the Prophet forbade eating donkey meat. He said Al-Hakam bin `Amr used to say that, but Ibn `Abbas didn't agree and recited a verse from the Quran: 'Say, I find nothing in what has been revealed to me that is forbidden unless it's carrion, blood or pork.'

title: Beasts with Fangs are Forbidden
content: Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) forbade eating meat from animals that have sharp teeth. Abu Tha'laba narrated this rule.

title: Using a Dead Sheep
content: Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) saw a dead sheep. He asked why its hide wasn't being used. They said it was dead. He replied, 'Only eating it is forbidden.'

title: Using Dead Animal Skin
content: The Prophet (ﷺ) passed by a dead goat. He said it's okay for its owners to use the skin if they need to.

title: Wounds on Judgement Day
content: Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) said: When someone is hurt while helping others for Allah, their wound will still be bleeding on the Day of Resurrection. The liquid coming out will look like blood but smell like musk.

title: Good and Bad Friends
content: Abu Musa said the Prophet said: A good friend is like a person carrying perfume. They might give you some or sell it to you, or just smell nice around them. But an evil friend is like someone blowing hot air with bellows. They might burn your clothes or make a bad smell.

title: Prophet Accepts Rabbit Gift
content: Anas bin Malik and some people were playing with a rabbit at Marr-az-Zahran. They chased it until they got tired, then Anas caught it. He brought the rabbit to Abu Talha, who killed it and sent its legs to the Prophet as a gift. The Prophet (ﷺ) accepted the gift.

title: Mastigure: Allowed or Not?
content: Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) said to Ibn Umar, 'I don't eat mastigure meat myself. But I'm not stopping others from eating it either.'

title: Mastigure in the Prophet's House
content: Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) and I went to Maimuna's house. They served a roasted mastigure. The Prophet (ﷺ) stretched out his hand, but someone said, 'Tell the Prophet what he is eating.' We told him it was mastigure. He pulled back his hand. I asked, 'Is it forbidden?' He said no, but it's not common in our land, so he doesn't like it. I ate some while the Prophet watched.

title: Mouse in Butter-Fat
content: Maimuna told us that a mouse fell into some butter-fat and died. The Prophet (ﷺ) was asked about it. He said to throw away the mouse and the butter-fat it touched, then eat the rest of the butter-fat.

title: Eating Food with Oil
content: If an animal like a mouse dies in oil or melted butter, the Prophet said to throw away the oil near it and eat the rest of the oil.

title: Mouse in Butter-Fat
content: The Prophet (ﷺ) was asked about a mouse that fell into butter-fat and died. He said to throw away the mouse and the butter-fat around it, then eat the rest of the butter-fat.

title: Don't Brand Animals
content: Ibn Umar told us that the Prophet forbade beating animals on their faces. He also didn't like branding them on their faces.

title: Tahnik for a Newborn
content: I took my brother to meet the Prophet. He was in a sheep pen at the time. I saw him branding a sheep on its ear while we were there to do Tahnik, which is a special prayer for newborns.

title: Slaughtering Animals for Food
content: Rait' bin Khadij asked the Prophet about slaughtering animals. The Prophet (ﷺ) said that if you use a sharp object to cut the animal's throat and say Allah's Name, it is okay to eat from it. But not with your teeth or nails. If an animal runs away during war, try to stop it with an arrow.

title: Slaughtering Animals on Journey
content: We were traveling with the Prophet. One of our camels ran away and a man stopped it with an arrow. The Prophet (ﷺ) said, 'Some camels are wild, so if one runs away and you can't catch it, shoot it with an arrow.' I asked him, 'What if we need to slaughter animals on a journey but don't have knives?' He replied, 'If you use something that makes the animal's blood flow out and say Allah's Name while slaughtering, you can eat it. But not if you use your teeth or nails - they're like knives.'

title: Sacrifice on Eid al-Adha
content: On Eid al-Adha, the Prophet said to offer prayer first and then slaughter the sacrifice. If someone slaughtered before prayer, it's just meat for their family, not a real sacrifice. Abu Burda had already done this with his six-month-old ram, but the Prophet told him to still slaughter it as a sacrifice, even though it wouldn't be enough for anyone else.

title: Sacrificing Animals on Eid
content: The Prophet (ﷺ) said: If you slaughter an animal before the prayer on Eid, it's just for yourself. But if you do it after the prayer, that's the right time and what Muslims usually do.

title: Prophet's Sacrifice Distribution
content: `Uqba bin 'Amir was given a six-month-old goat to sacrifice. He asked the Prophet if he could have a ram instead. The Prophet (ﷺ) said, 'Slaughter it as a sacrifice'.

title: Prophet Muhammad and Aisha's Hajj
content: The Prophet (ﷺ) entered Aisha's tent when she was at Sarif before going to Mecca. She had her period and was worried about not being able to do the Hajj rituals. The Prophet (ﷺ) asked what was wrong, and Aisha told him she had her period. He said that having a period is something Allah has decided for all women, so she could still do most of the Hajj rituals, but not walk around the Ka'ba. When they were at Mina, some beef was brought to Aisha as a sacrifice on behalf of the Prophet and his wives.

title: Sacrifice Before Prayer
content: The Prophet (ﷺ) said on Eid al-Adha: 'If you've already slaughtered your sacrifice before the prayer, you need to do it again.' A man stood up and said, 'This is a day when people want meat.' He mentioned his neighbors who had a six-month-old ram. The Prophet (ﷺ) allowed him to use that instead of two sheep as a sacrifice. Then the Prophet went and slaughtered two rams, and people started distributing their own sheep among each other.

title: Time Cycles Back to Original State
content: The Prophet (ﷺ) said: Time has gone back to how it was when Allah created the world. The year is twelve months, four of which are special. Three of these are in a row - Dhul-Qa'da, Dhul Hijja, and Muharram. The fourth one is Rajab Mudar, between Juma'da ath-thamj and Sha'ban. He asked us about the month, but we said we didn't know. He kept quiet for a while, then said it was Dhul-Hijja. He asked about the town, and we said we didn't know. Again, he kept quiet, then said it was Mecca. He asked what day it was, and we said we didn't know. This time, he said it was the Day of Nahr. The Prophet (ﷺ) said: Your lives, property, and honor are safe from each other, just like this day in this town in this month. When you meet Allah, He will ask about your actions. Be careful not to fight with each other after I'm gone. Tell those who weren't here what I said, so they can understand it better.

title: Slaughtering Sacrifices with the Prophet
content: Nafi' told us that 'Abdullah bin 'Umar used to slaughter his animals at the same place where the Prophet used to do it. The Prophet (ﷺ) would also bring camels and sheep as sacrifices to a special area for prayer.

title: Prophet Muhammad's Sacrifices
content: The Prophet (ﷺ) used to offer two rams as sacrifices. I also offered two rams, just like him.

title: Prophet Muhammad Slaughters Rams
content: Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) came to two rams with black and white spots. He slaughtered them himself.

title: Prophet's Sacrifice for Uqba
content: Uqba bin 'Amir was given some sheep to share with the Prophet's companions. He had one kid goat left, so he told the Prophet about it. The Prophet (ﷺ) said, 'Slaughter this goat as a sacrifice on my behalf.'

title: Sacrifice Before or After Prayer
content: My uncle Abu Burda slaughtered his animal before the prayer. The Prophet (ﷺ) said it was just a normal animal, not a sacrifice. My uncle then got another goat and slaughtered that one as a sacrifice. The Prophet (ﷺ) said this was okay for my uncle, but no one else could use it.

title: Sacrifice Before Eid Prayer
content: Abu Burda slaughtered a sacrifice before the Eid prayer. The Prophet (ﷺ) told him to slaughter another one instead. Abu Burda said he only had a Jadha'a left, which was better than an old sheep in his opinion. The Prophet (ﷺ) allowed him to use it as a replacement, but warned that it wouldn't be enough for anyone else after him.

title: Prophet Muhammad's Sacrifice
content: The Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) slaughtered two rams. One was black and one was white. He put his foot on their sides, said 'Allahu Akbar', and then killed them with his own hands while mentioning Allah's Name.

title: Hajj for Women
content: Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) entered my room at Sarif while I was crying. He asked me what was wrong. I said I had my period. He said it's a natural thing for all women, so do the Hajj rituals like other pilgrims but don't walk around the Ka'ba. He then slaughtered some cows as sacrifices for his wives.

title: Sacrifices on Eid Day
content: The Prophet (ﷺ) said: 'First, we will pray. Then we will slaughter our sacrifices. If you slaughtered before praying, it's just meat for your family. It's not a sacrifice.' Abu Burda said he had already done this and asked what to do. The Prophet (ﷺ) said: 'Slaughter another one to make up for it, but only you can do this once.'

title: Sacrifice Before Eid Prayer
content: The Prophet (ﷺ) said: If you slaughter a sacrifice before the Eid prayer, you must do it again. A man explained that he wanted to help his neighbors and had only one animal, called a Jadha'a, which was better than two sheep. The Prophet (ﷺ) allowed him to use this animal as a sacrifice. Then the Prophet slaughtered two rams.

title: Sacrifice on Eid Day
content: I saw the Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ). He said: 'If you slaughter a sacrifice before praying on Eid day, you must kill another one instead. If you haven't slaughtered your sacrifice yet, do it now.'

title: Sacrificing before Eid Prayer
content: One day the Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) offered the Eid prayer. He said, 'Don't slaughter your sacrifice until you finish the Eid prayer.' Abu Burda had already done it, but the Prophet said that was too early. Abu Burda asked if he could still slaughter his Jadha'a, a better sheep than two old ones. The Prophet (ﷺ) said yes, but it wouldn't be enough for anyone else.

title: Prophet's Sacrifice Method
content: The Prophet (ﷺ) used to sacrifice two special rams. They were black and white. He would put his foot on their sides and slaughter them with his own hands.

title: Prophet Muhammad Slaughters Rams
content: The Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) offered two rams as sacrifices. They were black and white. He slaughtered them with his own hands, saying 'In the name of Allah' and 'God is great'. Then he put his foot on their sides.

title: Aisha's Answer on Hadi
content: Masruq asked Aisha about a man who sent his Hadi camel to Kaaba but stayed in his city. He wanted the camel to be garlanded while he was still in a state of Ihram. Aisha replied that she used to prepare garlands for the Prophet's Hadi, and he would send it to Kaaba without considering it wrong to be with his wife until everyone finished their Hajj rituals.

title: Taking Sacrifice Meat
content: Jabir bin Abdullah said: During the Prophet's time, we would take meat from sacrifices to Medina. We often called it 'Hadi' meat.

title: Abu Sa'id's Decision
content: Abu Sa'id was not present when the Eid-al-Adha sacrifices were made. When he arrived later, some meat was offered to him. The people said it was from their sacrifices. Abu Sa'id refused to eat it and told them to take it away. He then went to his brother Abu Qatada and explained what had happened. His brother told him that a new rule had been decided while he was absent: the meat of sacrifices can be kept and eaten later.

title: Sacrifice Meat Should Not Be Kept
content: The Prophet (ﷺ) said that if you slaughter a sacrifice, you should not keep any of its meat after three days. The next year, people asked him what to do and he said: 'Eat the meat, share it with others, or store some for later. Last year was hard on everyone, so I wanted you to help those in need.'

title: Don't Eat Too Much Meat
content: We used to give some of the meat from our sacrifices to the Prophet at Medina. One time he said, 'Don't eat this meat for more than three days.' He didn't mean we couldn't eat it after that, but wanted us to share it with others.

title: Umar's Id Prayer Advice
content: Abu Ubaid, a freed slave of Ibn Azhar, saw Umar bin Al-Khattab on the Day of Eid-al-Adha. Umar led the prayer first and then gave a sermon to the people. He said: 'Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) has forbidden fasting on these two special days. One is when you break your fast, and the other is when you eat from your sacrificed animals.'

title: Uthman's Id Prayer
content: I saw Uthman bin Affan lead the prayer on a Friday. He said, 'Today you have two special days together. If you live in the suburbs and want to wait for the Friday prayer, you can. If you prefer to go home, I give you permission to do so.'

title: Ali's Id Prayer
content: I saw Ali bin Abi Talib offer the Id prayer before giving a sermon to the people. He said that the Prophet had forbidden eating more than three days' worth of meat from our sacrifices.

title: Eating Sacrifice Meat
content: Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) said to Abdullah bin Umar: 'Eat the meat of sacrifices for three days.' When Abdullah left Mina, he ate bread with oil instead of eating more sacrifice meat, because it's not allowed after those three days.

title: Drinking Alcohol in Life
content: Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) said, 'If someone drinks alcohol and doesn't ask for forgiveness before they die, they won't have it in the afterlife.'

title: Milk or Wine at Jerusalem
content: Abu Huraira said that when the Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) was taken on a journey by night, he was offered two cups in Jerusalem. One had wine and the other milk. He chose the milk. Gabriel then said that if he had chosen the wine, his followers would have gone off track.

title: Signs of the End Times
content: The Prophet (ﷺ) said: 'Some signs that our time is coming to an end are: People will not know much about Islam, knowledge will decrease, people will have many affairs outside marriage, and they will drink a lot of alcohol. There will be fewer men and more women, so much so that for every 50 women, there will only be one man to take care of them.'

title: Not Believers in Sin
content: Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) said: An adult who has sex outside marriage is not a Muslim at that time. A person drinking alcohol is also not a Muslim then. A thief stealing something while others watch him is not a Muslim either.

title: Prohibition of Alcoholic Drinks
content: Ibn Umar said that Allah prohibited alcoholic drinks before there was any wine in Medina.

title: Prohibition on Alcoholic Drinks
content: Anas said: The Prophet (ﷺ) forbade drinking alcohol. At that time, we rarely found wine made from grapes in Medina. Most of our drinks were made from dates - both unripe and ripe ones.

title: Prohibition of Alcoholic Drinks
content: Ibn Umar told me that one day, Umar stood on the pulpit and said: 'A new rule has been revealed. We must not drink things made from grapes, dates, honey, wheat, or barley. A drink is forbidden if it makes you feel confused.'

title: Abu Talha Discards Wine
content: Anas was serving Abu Ubaida, Abu Talha, and Ubai bin Khab with a drink made from dates. Someone told them that drinking wine is now forbidden. Abu Talha said to Anas, 'Pour it out!' So Anas threw the drink away.

title: Anas Discards the Wine
content: I was serving my uncles with a drink made from dates. They told me that alcoholic drinks were now forbidden, so I threw it away.

title: Prohibition of Alcoholic Drinks
content: Anas bin Malik said that the Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) prohibited drinking alcohol. At that time, people made alcoholic drinks from both unripe and ripe dates.

title: Drinks That Intoxicate
content: Aisha asked the Prophet about Al-Bit. He said that all drinks that make you drunk are forbidden to drink.

title: Drinks that Intoxicate
content: 'Aisha asked the Prophet about a drink made from honey called Al-Bit. The Prophet (ﷺ) said all drinks that make you drunk are forbidden. Anas bin Malik also reported the Prophet as saying, 'Don't mix drinks in Ad-Dubba' or Al-Muzaffat.' Abu Huraira used to add extra ingredients to these mixes.

title: Prohibition on Alcoholic Drinks
content: Ibn Umar said that one day, his father `Umar gave a sermon. He explained that Allah had forbidden drinking alcohol. Alcohol is made from five things: grapes, dates, wheat, barley, and honey. It's the kind of drink that makes you confused. `Umar wished the Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) had told us more about three important things before he passed away: how much family members can inherit from each other, what happens when there are no fathers or sons to inherit, and what kinds of interest on loans are not allowed.

title: What Alcoholic Drinks Are Made From
content: 'Umar said that alcoholic drinks are made from raisins, dates, wheat, barley, and honey.

title: Some People Will Misbehave
content: The Prophet (ﷺ) said: Some people from my followers will think that having sex outside marriage, wearing silk clothes, drinking alcohol, and playing music are okay. They'll stay in a mountain area and when their shepherd comes with the sheep at night, they'll tell him to come back tomorrow. Allah will destroy them during the night by making the mountain fall on them. The others who don't die that way will be turned into monkeys or pigs until the Day of Judgment.

title: Allah's Messenger at a Wedding
content: Abu Usaid invited the Prophet to his wedding. His wife served them food and drink. She had soaked dates in water overnight, then given it to the Prophet.

title: Prophet Allows Special Containers
content: Jabir said the Prophet forbade using certain containers. The Ansar said they couldn't live without them. The Prophet (ﷺ) then said, 'If you must use them, go ahead.'

title: Using Clay Jars for Food
content: The Prophet (ﷺ) forbade using certain containers that were used to make a drink that is not allowed. Someone said they couldn't find animal skins to use instead. The Prophet (ﷺ) then allowed them to use clay jars, but only if they weren't covered in a special liquid called pitch.

title: Prophet forbids two drinks
content: Ali said the Prophet told him not to drink Ad-Dubba' and Al Muzaffat. Another person, A'mash, also reported this.

title: Forbidden Containers for Drinks
content: Ibrahim asked Al-Aswad about containers the Prophet forbade to use. He said he asked 'Aisha, and she replied that the Prophet forbade using Ad-Dubba and Al-Muzaffat. Ibrahim then mentioned Al Jar and Al Hantam, but 'Aisha only spoke of what she knew.

title: Prophet forbids green jars
content: Abdullah bin Abi Aufa said the Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) forbade using green jars to store food or drink. He also said no to using white jars instead, so we should not use any colored jars.

title: Prophet Visits Friend's Wedding
content: Abu Usaid invited the Prophet to his wedding. The Prophet (ﷺ) was served by Abu Usaid's wife, who was also the bride. She told them that she had soaked dates in water overnight for the Prophet.

title: Prohibition of Intoxicating Drinks
content: Ibn Abbas told me that the Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) said: 'Any drink that makes you drunk is forbidden.' I asked him, 'What about good drinks?' He replied, 'Apart from what's allowed and good, everything else is not allowed and is unclean.'

title: Prophet Muhammad's Food Preferences
content: The Prophet (ﷺ) liked eating sweet foods and honey.

title: Abu Talha's Forbidden Drink
content: I was serving Abu Talha and his friends. They had a drink made from dates. When Allah made alcohol forbidden, I threw it away because it was like an alcoholic drink to us back then.

title: Prophet forbids certain drinks
content: Jabir said the Prophet told us not to drink alcohol made from raisins, dates that are still green, unripe dates, or fresh ripe dates.

title: Mixing Foods and Drinks
content: The Prophet (ﷺ) said that we should not mix ripe and unripe dates together. We also shouldn't mix dates with raisins to make a syrup. Instead, we should make separate syrups for each type of fruit. As long as the drink is fresh, it's okay to have it.

title: Milk and Wine Offered
content: Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) was given a bowl of milk and a bowl of wine on the night he was taken on a journey called Al-Mi'raj.

title: Messenger's Fasting Doubt
content: Some people were unsure if the Prophet was fasting on a certain day. I, Um Al-Fadl, sent him a cup of milk and he drank it to show he wasn't fasting.

title: Cover Your Food
content: Jabir bin Abdullah said that Abu Humaid brought a cup of food from Al-Naqi. The Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) told him, 'Why don't you cover it? Even with a stick.'

title: Covering Food and Drink
content: Abu Humaid brought milk to the Prophet. The Prophet (ﷺ) said, 'Why not cover it with a stick?'

title: Prophet's Journey from Mecca
content: The Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) came to Arabia with Abu Bakr. On their way, they met a shepherd and the Prophet was thirsty. Abu Bakr milked some milk into a bowl and the Prophet drank it. Meanwhile, Suraqa bin Ju'shum rode up on his horse, chasing them. The Prophet (ﷺ) asked Allah to be bad to him. But Suraqa asked the Prophet not to do that, and promised to leave them alone if he wouldn't. The Prophet (ﷺ) agreed.

title: Best Charity for Needy
content: Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) said: The best thing to give in charity is a new mother camel or goat that gives lots of milk. You should give it to someone who needs it, so they can take its milk once in the morning and once in the evening.

title: Prophet's Drink of Milk
content: Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) drank milk. He then rinsed his mouth and said it contains fat. The Prophet (ﷺ) explained that he was taken to a special tree, the Lote Tree. There, he saw four rivers: two coming out (the Nile and Euphrates) and two going in (two rivers in Paradise). He was given three bowls with milk, honey, and wine. He chose the bowl of milk and drank it. Allah said that he and his followers would be on the right path.

title: Abu Talha Donates Garden
content: Abu Talha had a big garden called Bairuha. It was near the Prophet's Mosque in Medina. The Prophet (ﷺ) used to visit it and drink its water. When the Quran said, 'You can't be good unless you give something you love,' Abu Talha decided to donate his garden. He asked the Prophet what he should do with it. The Prophet (ﷺ) said, 'It's a valuable thing.' But then he suggested that Abu Talha should give it to his family instead. Abu Talha did that and shared the garden among his relatives.

title: Allah's Messenger Drinks Milk
content: Anas bin Malik saw the Prophet drinking milk. He came to Anas' house and drank from a bowl of milk mixed with water from the well. Abu Bakr was sitting on his left, and a bedouin on his right. The Prophet (ﷺ) gave the remaining milk to the bedouin and said, 'The right one should have it first.'

title: Prophet's Visit to an Ansari
content: Jabir bin Abdullah said that the Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) and a companion visited an Ansari man. The Prophet (ﷺ) asked if he had water left from the night before, or they would drink directly from the skin. The Ansari man said he did have water, so he took them to his garden's shade and poured some into a bowl. He then milked a goat into it. The Prophet (ﷺ) drank first, followed by the companion.

title: Prophet Muhammad's Food Preferences
content: The Prophet (ﷺ) liked sweet foods like syrup and honey.

title: Drinking Water While Standing
content: Ali went to the mosque and drank water while standing. He said that some people don't like to drink in this way, but he saw the Prophet doing it too.

title: Ali's Prayer and Water
content: Ali prayed Zuhr prayer in Kufa. After the Asr prayer became due, he sat down to deal with people's affairs. He was given water to drink, wash his face, hands, head, and feet. Then he stood up and drank what was left of the water while standing. Ali said some people dislike drinking water while standing, but the Prophet did this.

title: Prophet drinks from Zamzam
content: Ibn Abbas said the Prophet stood and drank Zamzam water.

title: The Prophet Drinks Milk
content: Um Al-Fadl sent a bowl of milk to the Prophet while he was standing at Arafat. He took it and drank it. The Prophet (ﷺ) was riding his camel.

title: Sharing Food with a Guest
content: Anas bin Malik said that the Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) drank some milk mixed with water. A Bedouin was sitting on his right and Abu Bakr on his left. The Prophet (ﷺ) gave the drink to the Bedouin first, saying 'The right'.

title: Allah's Messenger and a Boy
content: Some people offered Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) something to drink. He drank while sitting next to a boy on his right and some older men on his left. He asked the boy if he could give the drink to the older men first. The boy said no, he wouldn't let someone else have his share before him. So Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) took the cup from himself and gave it to the boy.

title: Guests in a Hot Garden
content: The Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) and one of his friends visited an Ansari man. The man greeted them warmly and said he was too hot to talk because he was watering his garden. The Prophet (ﷺ) asked if he had any water stored overnight that they could use, as it would be more hygienic than drinking from the same bowl. The man said yes and poured some water into a bowl, then milked some goat's milk into it. The Prophet (ﷺ) drank first, then gave the bowl to his friend.

title: Throwing Away Alcoholic Drink
content: Anas was serving his uncles a drink made from dates. Then he heard that drinking alcohol is not allowed. His uncles told him to throw it away, so he did. The drink was made with both ripe and unripe dates.

title: Protect Your Home at Night
content: When night falls, stop your children from going out. The devils spread out at this time. Wait for an hour to pass, then let them go outside again. Close all doors and say 'In the name of Allah'. Cover your water containers and food utensils with something, even a cloth. Say 'In the name of Allah' while doing this. Turn off your lamps.

title: Before Going to Sleep
content: Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) said: When you go to bed, turn off the lights. Close your doors and cover food and drinks. Also, tie up water containers so they don't leak.

title: Bending Water Skins Forbidden
content: Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) told Abu Sa'id Al-Khudri that it's not allowed to bend the mouth of a water skin so people can drink from it.

title: Don't Drink Directly from Water Skins
content: Abu Sa'id Al-Khudri said that the Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) forbade drinking water by bending the mouths of water skins and drinking directly from them.

title: Forbidden Actions
content: Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) said: Do not drink directly from a water skin or leather container. Also, do not stop your neighbor from putting up a peg in their wall.

title: Don't Drink Directly from Water Skin
content: Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) said to Abu Huraira: Do not drink water directly from the mouth of a water skin. Instead, pour it into a container first.

title: Don't Drink Directly
content: Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) told Ibn Abbas not to drink water directly from a water skin's mouth. He said it's not allowed.

title: Personal Hygiene in Islam
content: When you drink water, don't breathe into the cup. When you go to the bathroom, don't touch your private parts with your right hand. And when you wash yourself after using the toilet, use your left hand.

title: Prophet's Drinking Habits
content: Anas used to drink water in small breaths. He said the Prophet did the same, taking three breaths while drinking.

title: Forbidden Luxuries
content: Hudhaifa was at Mada'in. He asked for water and got a silver cup from the chief of the village. Hudhaifa threw it away because he had told them not to use silver cups. The Prophet (ﷺ) said that Muslims should not wear silk or Dibaj clothes, nor drink from gold or silver cups. These things are for non-Muslims in this world, but for us in the next life.

title: Avoid Luxury Utensils
content: The Prophet (ﷺ) said: Do not drink from cups made of gold or silver. Also, do not wear clothes made of silk or Dibaj. These things are for non-Muslims in this life, but will be yours in the next life.

title: Drinking from Silver Utensils
content: The Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) said to Um Salama: 'If someone drinks from a silver cup, they are only filling their belly with Hell Fire.'

title: Seven Orders and Seven Prohibitions
content: Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) ordered us to do seven things. These are: visit the sick, follow funeral processions, say 'May Allah bestow His Mercy on you' if someone says 'Praise be to Allah', accept invitations, greet everyone, help those who are oppressed, and help others keep their promises. He also forbade us from seven things. These are: wearing gold rings, drinking from silver cups, using silken carpets on saddles, wearing certain types of cloth, wearing silk or Dibaj or Istabraq.

title: Prophet's Fasting on Arafat Day
content: Some people were unsure if the Prophet was fasting on a special day. To help them understand, someone sent him a container of milk and he drank it.

title: Prophet Marries an Arab Lady
content: The Prophet (ﷺ) met an Arab woman who was staying in the castle of Bani Sa'ida. He went to see her and she didn't recognize him. When he spoke to her, she said 'I seek refuge with Allah from you.' The Prophet (ﷺ) replied 'I grant you refuge from me.' They told her that this was the Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ). She then realized who he was and felt unlucky to have missed a chance to marry him. The Prophet (ﷺ) and his companions went to sit in a nearby shed and asked for water. Sahl, one of them, gave them a bowl of water to drink.

title: Prophet's Drinking Bowl
content: I saw the Prophet's drinking bowl with Anas. It had been broken and fixed with silver plates. The bowl was wide and made of Nadar wood. Anas said he gave water to the Prophet from it many times. There was an iron ring around the bowl, but Anas wanted to replace it with a silver or gold one. Abu Talha told him not to change what the Prophet had done.

title: Prophet's Blessing at Prayer
content: I was with the Prophet when it was time for the afternoon prayer. We didn't have much water, but he put his hand in a small container and spread out his fingers. He said, 'Come quickly! Those who want to pray can wash their hands.' I saw water coming out of his fingers. People washed their hands and drank from the water. I tried to drink more because I knew it was blessed. There were 1,400 men with me.

title: Calamities Bring Sin Forgiveness
content: The Prophet (ﷺ) said to Aisha: When a Muslim has trouble, Allah forgives some of their sins because of it. This includes even small troubles like getting hurt by a thorn.

title: Allah Forgives Our Suffering
