content: The Prophet (ﷺ) said: 'No Muslim gets hurt or feels pain - even from a small scratch - without Allah forgiving some of their sins.'

title: Allah Forgives Our Suffering
content: The Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) said: 'No sickness or pain affects a Muslim that Allah does not forgive some of their sins because of it.'

title: Believers and Hypocrites
content: The Prophet (ﷺ) said that a believer is like a young plant. Sometimes the wind bends it, but it always goes back straight. A hypocrite is like a tall pine tree that stays straight until it's suddenly pulled out of the ground.

title: Believers and the Wind
content: Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) said: 'A believer is like a young plant that bends when the wind blows. But when it stops, the plant becomes straight again. A true believer faces problems but stays patient until Allah makes things better. An evil person is strong and steady like a pine tree, but eventually breaks down when Allah wants.'

title: Allah's Goodness in Trials
content: Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) said: If Allah wants to help someone, He tests them with hard times and challenges first.

title: Allah's Messenger was sick
content: I never saw anyone as sick as Allah's Messenger (ﷺ). He suffered a lot from illness.

title: Prophet's Suffering and Reward
content: I visited the Prophet when he was sick with a high fever. I asked if it was because of his sickness, and he said yes. He explained that whenever a Muslim gets hurt, Allah takes away their sins like leaves falling from a tree.

title: Fever and Reward
content: I visited the Prophet when he was very sick with a high fever. I said to him, 'You have a lot of fever.' He replied, 'Yes, it's as much as two people would have.' I asked, 'Is it because you'll get double the reward?' He said, 'Yes, that's right. When any Muslim gets hurt, even slightly, Allah forgives their sins because of it.

title: Help Those in Need
content: The Prophet (ﷺ) said, 'Feed people who don't have enough food. Visit those who are sick. Set free anyone who is being held captive.'

title: Prophet's Orders and Bans
content: Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) ordered us to do seven things. He told us to walk around the graves of our loved ones when they die, visit people who are sick, and say hello to everyone we meet. He also said it is good to be kind to others. On the other hand, he forbade us from wearing certain types of jewelry like gold rings, and some kinds of clothes.

title: Prophet visits a sick friend
content: Jabir bin Abdullah fell ill. The Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) and Abu Bakr visited him while he was unconscious. The Prophet (ﷺ) performed ablution, then poured the remaining water on Jabir to help him feel better. When Jabir woke up, he asked the Prophet about what to do with his property after he dies. The Prophet (ﷺ) didn't answer right away because Allah had not yet revealed a verse about how to divide inheritance.

title: A Woman from Paradise
content: Ibn Abbas said to me, 'I can show you a woman who will go to Paradise.' I said, 'Yes, please do.' He told me about a black lady. She had epilepsy and her body would sometimes become uncovered. She came to the Prophet and asked him to pray for her. The Prophet (ﷺ) said, 'If you want, you can be patient and go to Paradise. If you want, I can pray for you to be cured.' She chose to be patient. But she also asked the Prophet to pray that she wouldn't become uncovered again. So he prayed for her.

title: Patience Brings Paradise
content: Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) said: Allah says that if He takes away a person's two favorite things - their eyes - and they remain patient, then Allah will let them enter Paradise as a reward for their patience.

title: Abu Bakr and Bilal's Fever
content: When the Prophet moved to Medina, Abu Bakr and Bilal got sick. I visited them and asked how they were feeling. When Abu Bakr had a fever, he would say: 'Death is closer than my shoes.' When Bilal felt better, he would wish for a peaceful night surrounded by nice grass and fresh water from a special place near Mecca. I told the Prophet about this, and he prayed to Allah: 'Make us love Medina as much as we love Mecca. Make it healthy and give us good food and water. Take away its sickness and bring us peace instead.'

title: The Prophet Visits a Dying Child
content: Usama bin Zaid and two other companions were with the Prophet. A message came from his daughter, saying her child was dying and asking him to come. The Prophet (ﷺ) sent a message back, saying that what happens is Allah's will, and we should hope for reward and be patient. His daughter asked again for him to come, so he got up and went with them. When they arrived, the child was on his lap, struggling to breathe. The Prophet (ﷺ) started crying. Sa'd asked why, and the Prophet said it's because of Allah's mercy in people's hearts.

title: Visiting a Sick Bedouin
content: The Prophet (ﷺ) went to visit a sick man. He said, 'Don't worry, if Allah wants it will be good for you.' The bedouin replied, 'You mean it's like a punishment?' The Prophet (ﷺ) said, 'Yes, that's right'.

title: Prophet visits a Jewish Boy
content: Anas said that a Jewish boy who worked for the Prophet got sick. The Prophet (ﷺ) went to visit him and told him to become Muslim, which he did. Later, when Abu Talib was very ill, the Prophet also visited him.

title: Prayer with an Imam
content: When some people visited the Prophet while he was ill, they prayed standing. He waved to them to sit down and led them in prayer sitting. After finishing the prayer, he said: 'Follow your leader in prayer. When he bows, you bow too. And when he stands up, you stand up. If he prays sitting, you pray sitting.' However, this was later changed as the Prophet led a prayer while sitting, and people prayed standing behind him.

title: Sa'd's Illness and Bequest
content: I was very sick in Mecca. The Prophet (ﷺ) came to visit me. I asked him about my will. I have a lot of money, but only one daughter. Can I leave two-thirds for charity and one-third for her? He said no. Then I asked if I could leave half for charity and half for her. Again he said no. Finally, I asked if I could leave one-third for charity and keep two-thirds. He agreed with that. He put his hand on my forehead, stomach, and face, and prayed to Allah to heal me and complete my journey.

title: Prophet's Fever and Reward
content: I visited the Prophet while he was very sick. I touched him and said, 'You're really ill.' He replied, 'Yes, I have a lot of fever.' I asked, 'Is it because you'll get extra reward?' He said, 'Yes. When a Muslim gets sick or has some trouble, Allah takes away his sins like leaves fall from a tree.'

title: Fever and Reward
content: I visited the Prophet when he was sick. I touched him and said, 'You have a high fever. Is it because you'll get a double reward?' He replied, 'Yes. When any harm happens to a Muslim, their sins are forgiven like leaves falling from a tree.'

title: Visiting a Sick Man
content: One day, the Prophet visited a man who was ill. He said to him, 'Don't worry, if you get better, it will be good for your sins.' The sick man replied, 'No, I just have a bad fever that will make me very old and then die.' The Prophet (ﷺ) said, 'Yes, that's true.'

title: The Prophet Visits Sa'd bin Ubada
content: The Prophet (ﷺ) rode a donkey with a saddle and Fadakiyya velvet covering. He let me ride behind him to visit Sa'd bin 'Ubada, before the battle of Badr. We passed by a group where Abdullah bin Ubai was present, but he hadn't yet become Muslim. The group included Muslims, polytheists, and Jews. When we approached, dust covered them, so Abdullah bin Ubai said,

title: Prophet visits Jabir when ill
content: The Prophet (ﷺ) came to visit me while I was sick. He was not riding a horse or a mule.

title: Shaving Head as Expiation
content: The Prophet (ﷺ) passed by me while I was cooking. He asked if lice on my head were bothering me. I said yes, so he ordered a barber to shave my head and told me to make an extra prayer for that.

title: Aisha's Headache
content: Aisha had a headache. The Prophet (ﷺ) said he wished she was still alive so he could pray for her forgiveness. Aisha joked that if she died, the Prophet would spend the rest of the day sleeping with one of his wives. The Prophet (ﷺ) said no, and explained why he didn't want to appoint Abu Bakr as his successor yet.

title: Fever and Reward
content: Ibn Mas`ud visited the Prophet while he had a very high fever. Ibn Mas`ud touched him and said, 'You have a lot of fever.' The Prophet (ﷺ) replied, 'Yes, as much fever as two people like you would have.' Ibn Mas`ud asked if that meant he would get double reward for his suffering. The Prophet (ﷺ) said, 'Yes, no Muslim gets hurt by sickness or anything else without Allah forgiving their sins. It's like a tree shedding its leaves - all the bad things are gone.'

title: Giving to Charity
content: I was very sick during Hajj. I asked the Prophet if I could give two thirds of my money to charity. He said no. Then I asked about giving half, but he still said no. Finally, I asked about giving one third. He told me that's too much and it's better for my family to have some money when I'm gone. He also said that anything I spend to please Allah will be rewarded, even if it's just food for my wife.

title: Prophet's Last Request
content: When the Prophet was on his deathbed, some people were with him. One of them was Umar. The Prophet (ﷺ) said, 'Let me write a message for you so you won't go astray.' But Umar said, 'The Quran is enough for us.' Some people wanted the Prophet to write something new, while others agreed with Umar. They argued and made a lot of noise. The Prophet (ﷺ) got upset and told them to leave.

title: Prophet's Blessing and Touch
content: My aunt took me to the Prophet. She said he was ill. The Prophet (ﷺ) touched my head and prayed for me to be well. He then washed his face, arms, and other parts of his body. I drank some water from what was left over. Then I stood behind him and saw a mark on his back that looked like a small button.

title: Don't Wish for Death
content: The Prophet (ﷺ) said: 'When something bad happens to you, don't wish to die. If you must wish for death, say:

title: Khabbab's Story: Rewards and Wealth
content: We visited Khabbab while he was sick. He had been burned on his body seven times to ease his pain. Khabbab said, 'Our friends who died before the Prophet passed away didn't get punished for enjoying life. But we have a lot of wealth and don't know how to use it except building houses. If the Prophet hadn't stopped us from wishing for death, I would wish for it.' We visited him again while he was building a wall. He said, 'A Muslim gets rewarded for spending money on anything except building.'

title: Good Deeds Don't Guarantee Heaven
content: I heard the Prophet say that good actions alone won't get you into heaven. His companions asked him if he was excluded, and he said no, not even himself. He said to be moderate in your good deeds and do what you can. None of us should wish for death because it might give us a chance to do more good or make up for past mistakes.

title: Prophet's Prayer in Rest
content: I was resting with the Prophet. He said to Allah: 'Forgive me and be kind to me. Let me join the best people in Paradise.'

title: Prophet's Prayer for the Sick
content: When Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) visited a sick person or they came to him, he would say: 'Remove this sickness, O God. You are the One Who heals. There is no healing except what comes from You.'

title: Prophet Visits Jabir When Ill
content: The Prophet (ﷺ) came to visit me when I was sick. He washed his hands and face, then poured the leftover water on me. When I woke up, I asked him about my inheritance since I didn't have a son or father to leave it to. Then Allah revealed a verse about how inheritances should be divided.

title: Abu Bakr and Bilal's Fever
content: When the Prophet moved to Medina, Abu Bakr and his friend Bilal were sick with a fever. I visited them and asked how they were feeling. When Abu Bakr had a fever, he would say that death is closer to him than his shoelaces. When Bilal got better, he recited two lines of poetry about wanting to stay in a valley surrounded by nice grass and drink from a certain well. I told the Prophet what was happening, and he prayed: 'God, make us love Medina as much or more than Mecca, make it healthy, and give its people good food and water. Remove its sicknesses and replace them with peace.'

title: No Disease Without Cure
content: The Prophet (ﷺ) said: There is no sickness that Allah has created, except He also made a cure for it.

title: Women in Military Expeditions
content: Rubai bint Mu`adh bin Afra said: We went on military trips with the Prophet. We helped people by giving them water, serving them, and bringing back the dead or those who were hurt to Medina.

title: Healing is in Three Things
content: The Prophet (ﷺ) said that there are three things that can heal: eating a small amount of honey, getting cupping done, and using fire to stop bleeding. However, he told us not to use branding with fire as a treatment.

title: Healing from the Prophet
content: The Prophet (ﷺ) said that there are three things that can help you feel better when you're sick. These are cupping, eating a little honey, or using fire to burn away an illness. But he told us not to use fire to burn away an illness.

title: Prophet Muhammad liked sweets
content: The Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) used to enjoy eating sweet foods and honey.

title: Medicines and Healing
content: Jabir bin Abdullah said the Prophet said: 'If some medicines can cure you, then cupping, drinking honey or burning a small area of your skin with fire might help. But I don't like to get burned with fire.'

title: Curing Abdominal Trouble
content: A man came to the Prophet and said his brother had a stomach problem. The Prophet (ﷺ) told him to give his brother honey to drink. He came back three times, each time the Prophet said the same thing: 'Give your brother honey.' Finally, he gave his brother honey and he got better.

title: People who didn't appreciate help
content: Some people were sick and asked the Prophet for food and shelter. When they got better, they said Medina's weather wasn't good for them. The Prophet (ﷺ) sent them to a place called Al-Harra with some camels. He told them to drink their milk. But when they recovered again, they killed the Prophet's shepherd and took his camels. The Prophet (ﷺ) sent people to catch them. When they were caught, their hands and feet were cut off and hot iron was put on their eyes. I saw one of them licking the ground with his tongue until he died.

title: Medina's Unhealthy Climate
content: Some people in Medina didn't like the climate. The Prophet (ﷺ) told them to follow his camel herd and drink their milk and urine, which would make them healthy again. They did this until they felt better. But then they killed the camels and ran away with them. When the Prophet found out, he sent some men to catch them. When they were brought back, the Prophet punished them by cutting off their hands and feet and branding hot iron on their eyes.

title: Black Cumin for Healing
content: Khalid bin Sa'd and his friends were traveling. One of them, Ghalib, got sick on the way to Medina. When they arrived, he was still feeling unwell. A doctor visited him and said, 'Try using black cumin. Crush some seeds into a powder and mix it with oil. Put a few drops up each nostril.' He told them this because the Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) had said that black cumin can cure many illnesses, except one: death.

title: Healing in Black Cumin
content: Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) said: 'Black cumin has healing powers for all illnesses except death.'

title: Aisha's Advice on at-Talbina
content: 'Aisha said that the Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) told her that eating at-Talbina can help a sick person feel better and calm their heart. It also helps with sadness and grief after losing someone.

title: Aisha's Advice on Medicine
content: Aisha said that her mother used to recommend a special medicine called at-Talbina. She would say it was good for the patient, even though they might not like taking it.

title: Prophet Muhammad Gets Cupping
content: Ibn Abbas said the Prophet got cupped. He paid the person who did it and then took some medicine by sniffing it up his nose.

title: Using Indian Incense
content: Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) said: 'Use Indian incense. It can help with seven different illnesses. If you have a sore throat, sniff it. If you have pleurisy, put some in your mouth on one side.' I took my son to the Prophet because he wouldn't eat. My son had an accident and wet his father's clothes. The Prophet (ﷺ) got water and cleaned the area.

title: Healing with Indian Incense
content: The Prophet (ﷺ) said: 'Use Indian incense to help seven different illnesses. If someone has a sore throat, they should sniff it. If someone has pleurisy, put some in their mouth on one side. I had a son who wouldn't eat and he urinated on me. I got water and cleaned the area with it.'

title: Prophet Fasts While Cupped
content: Ibn Abbas said that the Prophet was cupped while he was fasting.

title: Prophet Muhammad Gets Cupping
content: Ibn Abbas said the Prophet was cupped while he was in a state of Ihram.

title: Cupping and Medicine
content: Anas was asked about people who get cupped. He said the Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) got cupped by a man named Abd Taiba, and gave him food and helped him with his masters. The Prophet (ﷺ) then said that cupping and special incense are good medicine for us. He also warned not to hurt children's throats by pressing them with our fingers.

title: Healing in Cupping
content: Jabir visited Al-Muqanna when he was ill. Jabir said, 'I won't leave until he gets a cupping treatment.' He remembered the Prophet saying, 'There is healing in cupping'.

title: Prophet Muhammad Gets Cupped
content: Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) was cupped on the middle of his head while he was in a state of Ihram. This happened at Lahl Jamal, on his way to Mecca. Ibn `Abbas also said that Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) was cupped on his head.

title: Prophet Muhammad Gets Cupping
content: Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) was cupped on his head while he was in a special state for pilgrimage to Mecca. This happened at Lahl Jamal, and it also happened another time when someone else did the cupping.

title: Prophet's Cupping Treatment
content: Ibn Abbas said the Prophet had a treatment called cupping done on his head. He was in a special state for pilgrimage, and it helped with a headache he had.

title: Prophet's Cupping While in Ihram
content: Ibn Abbas said the Prophet was cupped on his head because he had a headache. This happened while he was traveling and not allowed to cut his hair or nails, which is what it means to be in a state of Ihram.

title: Medicines and Cures
content: Jabir bin Abdullah said the Prophet said: 'If there's good in some medicines, it's honey, cupping, or branding. But I don't like being branded.'

title: Shaving Head and Fasting
content: During the Al-Hudaibiya period, the Prophet came to me. I was cooking food and had lice on my head. He asked if they were hurting me. I said yes. He told me to shave my head or do one of three things: fast for three days, feed six poor people, or sacrifice a sheep.

title: Cupping and Branding for Healing
content: Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) said: 'If any medicine helps, it's either cupping or branding. But I don't like being branded.'

title: The Future of Islam
content: Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) saw a vision of many nations. He saw one or two prophets with just a few followers. Then he saw a prophet alone, and then a big group passed by. Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) asked who they were. They said it was Moses and his followers. He looked at the horizon and saw even more people filling the view. It was said to him that this large crowd is his own nation, and 70,000 of them will go to Paradise without being judged. The Prophet (ﷺ) didn't tell his friends who these people were. They started guessing and thought it might be themselves or their children who believed in Allah and followed His Messenger. When the Prophet heard this, he came out and said that those people don't believe in bad luck or good luck from birds, they don't get branded with hot irons, and they only trust in Allah. One man asked if he was one of them, and the Prophet said yes. Another man asked the same question, but the Prophet just pointed to the first man and said he had already been chosen.

title: Widow's Care After Husband Dies
content: Um Salama's husband died. People told the Prophet about her situation. She had eye problems and wanted to use kohl. The Prophet (ﷺ) said she should wait for four months and ten days after her husband's death before doing anything else.

title: No Contagious Diseases
content: Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) said: There's no disease that can be spread without Allah's permission. Birds don't bring bad luck, and the month of Safar isn't unlucky. Leprosy is as scary as a lion, but it doesn't harm you unless Allah allows it.

title: Truffles are like Manna
content: The Prophet (ﷺ) said that truffles grow naturally and their water can heal eye problems.

title: Prophet's Reaction to Medicine
content: Ibn Abbas and Aisha said: When the Prophet was dead, Abu Bakr kissed him. Aisha added: We put medicine in one side of his mouth but he started waving us away. We thought he just didn't like taking medicine because patients usually don't. But when he came to, he scolded us for putting it in his mouth without permission. He said that everyone in the house would have to take medicine if they were sick, except Al-Abbas because he wasn't there.

title: Prophet's Advice on Coughs
content: Um Qais came to the Prophet with her son who was sick. She had pressed his throat and tonsils to try to cure him. The Prophet (ﷺ) said, 'Don't press your children's throats like that. Instead, use a special incense called Ud Al-Hindi. It can help with seven different illnesses, including pleurisy.'

title: The Prophet's Illness
content: When the Prophet was very sick and weak, he asked his wives for permission to stay in my house. They agreed. He came out with two men holding him up because he couldn't walk properly. When he got to my house, he told us to pour seven big water skins over him so he could give advice to the people. We poured the water on him until he said stop. Then he went outside and led everyone in prayer.

title: Caring for Children's Health
content: Um Qais took her son to the Prophet. He had a sore throat. She had pressed his palate and tonsils to try to help him. The Prophet (ﷺ) said, 'Don't do that. It hurts your children. Instead, use Indian incense. It can cure seven diseases, including pleurisy.'

title: Honey for Diarrhea
content: A man came to the Prophet and said his brother had diarrhea. The Prophet (ﷺ) told him to give honey to drink. But when he did, it made the brother's condition worse. The Prophet (ﷺ) then said that Allah's words are true, but the brother's stomach was lying.

title: No Disease is Conveyed
content: The Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) said, 'There's no way a disease can jump from one person to another without Allah's permission. It doesn't matter if you're traveling or staying in one place. A man came and asked about his camels getting sick when they mixed with an infected camel. The Prophet (ﷺ) replied, 'So who made the first camel sick?'

title: Tonsils and Child Health
content: Um Oais told me that she took her son to the Prophet. She had pressed his throat to try to cure it, but the Prophet said: 'Be careful of Allah! Why are you hurting your child like this? Use Ud Al-Hindi incense instead - it can cure seven diseases, including pleurisy'.

title: Ruqya for Poison and Ear Ailment
content: Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) allowed some families to use Ruqya to help people who have taken poison or are suffering from ear problems. Anas bin Malik got a treatment called cauterization to cure his pleurisy, which was witnessed by Abu Talha, Anas bin An-Nadr, and Zaid bin Thabit when the Prophet was still alive.

title: Ruqya for Poison and Ear Problems
content: The Prophet (ﷺ) allowed some families to use Ruqya to help people who took poison or had ear problems. I, Anas, also used it when I had pleurisy. Abu Talha branded my chest with a hot iron to treat the illness.

title: Ruqya for Poison and Ear Ailment
content: Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) allowed some families to use Ruqya to help people who took poison or had ear problems. Anas got a special treatment, called cauterization, from Abu Talha when he was sick with pleurisy. This happened while Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) was still alive.

title: Prophet's Injury at Uhud
content: During a battle, the Prophet's helmet broke and he was hurt. His face got cut and one of his teeth broke. Ali brought water to clean him up. But when they used water, the bleeding got worse. Fatima took a mat, burned it, and put the ashes on the wound. The bleeding stopped.

title: Cooling Down Fever
content: Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) said: 'Fever is a sign of the heat from Hell. To reduce it, use water.' When Abdullah bin Umar had fever, he would pray: 'O Allah, please take away this punishment.'

title: Helping Someone with Fever
content: Fatima bint Al-Mundhir said: When someone with a fever came to Asma' bint Abu Bakr, she would ask Allah for help and then sprinkle water on the person's chest. She did this because the Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) used to tell them to use water to reduce fever.

title: Abating Fever with Water
content: Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) said to his wife Aisha: 'Fever is a sign of the heat from Hell. To reduce it, use water.'

title: Abating Fever
content: Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) said: 'Fever is from the heat of Hell. To reduce fever, use water.'

title: People Leave Islam and Get Punished
content: Some people from the tribes of `Ukl and `Uraina came to the Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ). They were farmers, but they said Medina's climate was not good for them. The Prophet (ﷺ) gave them some camels and a shepherd. He told them to drink the milk and urine of the camels. But when they got to Al-Harra, they went back to their old ways and left Islam. They killed the shepherd and took the camels. When the Prophet found out, he sent people after them. They were caught and brought back. The Prophet (ﷺ) ordered that their eyes be hurt with hot iron bars and their hands be cut off. They were left at Al-Harra until they died.

title: Plague: Stay or Leave
content: The Prophet (ﷺ) said, 'If you hear there's a plague in another land, don't go there. If the plague starts where you are, stay put.'

title: Umar's Decision on Plague
content: Umar bin Al-Khattab went to a place called Sham. When he arrived, the commanders of the army told him that there was an outbreak of sickness in the area. Umar asked for advice from some early Muslim leaders who had traveled with him. They disagreed about what to do. Some said they should stay and complete their mission. Others said it would be safer to leave. Umar then asked for advice from another group, but they also disagreed. He finally asked for advice from older men from the tribe of Quraish. They all agreed that it was best to return home. Umar announced that he would go back to Medina and everyone should follow him. One leader, Abu 'Ubaida, questioned this decision, saying they were running away from what Allah had ordained. But Umar explained that if they had a choice between two places, one with food and one without, they would choose the place with food if Allah wanted them to eat there. He said they should follow Allah's will and return home. Just then, another leader, 'Abdur-Rahman bin 'Auf, arrived and reminded everyone of a saying from the Prophet: 'If you hear about sickness in an area, don't go there. But if sickness breaks out where you are, don't run away.' Umar thanked Allah and returned to Medina.

title: Don't Go to Epidemic Areas
content: Umar went to a place called Sham. When he got close to Sargh, someone told him there was an illness spreading in Sham. Abdur-Rahman bin Auf reminded Umar of what the Prophet said: 'If you hear about a sickness in another land, don't go there. If it happens where you are, stay and don't run away.'

title: Medina Safe from Dajjal
content: Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) said: 'Neither the Antichrist nor a plague will enter Medina.'

title: Plague is a Martyr's Death
content: Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) said: 'For every Muslim, death from plague is like being martyred.'

title: Dying from Abdominal Disease
content: The Prophet (ﷺ) said that if a Muslim dies from an illness in their stomach, they are considered a martyr. And if someone dies from the plague, they too are considered a martyr.

title: Aisha Asks About Plague
content: Aisha asked the Prophet about plague. He said it's a punishment from Allah that can affect anyone. But for believers, it's a blessing if they stay patient and know their fate is in Allah's hands. If they do, Allah will reward them like a martyr.

title: Prophet's Last Illness
content: When the Prophet was very sick, he would read two special chapters from the Quran: Surat An-Nas and Surat Al-Falaq. He would then blow on his body to get better. When he got even sicker, I (Aisha) would read these chapters and blow on him too. Then I would help him rub his body with his own hands so that it gets the blessings.

title: Companions Help a Tribe
content: The Prophet 's (ﷺ) companions visited another tribe. The tribe didn't welcome them well. One of the tribe's leaders got bitten by a snake. They asked the companions if they had any medicine or someone who could help. The companions said, 'You won't treat us nicely, so we want payment.' The tribe agreed to give them some sheep. One of the companions used a special prayer from the Quran (Surat-al-Fatiha) and spit on the bite. The leader got better. The tribe gave them the sheep, but the companions asked the Prophet if it was okay to take it. He smiled and said, 'You know Surat-al-Fatiha is a healing prayer? Take the sheep and give me some.'

title: Companion Takes Fee for Reciting Quran
content: Some of the Prophet's companions visited a group near water. A man had been stung by a scorpion and needed help. One companion offered to do Ruqya (a prayer) to heal him, but asked for a sheep as payment. The patient got better, and they brought the sheep back. When they told the Prophet about it, he said that the companion was right to take payment because he used the Quran to help the man.

title: Protecting Against the Evil Eye
content: The Prophet (ﷺ) told me or someone else to do a special prayer if there was danger from an evil eye.

title: Prophet's Advice on Evil Eye
content: Um Salama told us that the Prophet saw a girl in her house with a black spot on her face. He said, 'This is because of an evil eye.' He advised treating her with a Ruqya.

title: Evil Eye and Tattoos
content: Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) said that the evil eye is real. He also told us not to get tattoos.

title: Treating Snake or Scorpion Bites
content: I asked Aisha about treating snake or scorpion bites with a Ruqya. She said the Prophet allowed it.

title: Anas' Healing Prayer
content: Thabit and I visited Anas bin Malik. Thabit said he was sick. Anas asked if we wanted him to say a prayer from the Prophet's words. Thabit agreed, so Anas recited: 'O Allah, you are the Lord of people and the one who removes trouble. Please heal this person because only you can heal, with a healing that will leave no sickness behind.'

title: Prophet's Healing Method
content: The Prophet (ﷺ) used to touch his wives' sick spots with his right hand and say, 'O Allah, You are the One who heals. Remove this sickness and heal her.' He believed that only Allah can truly heal.

title: Prophet's Treatment for Illness
content: The Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) used to treat illnesses by saying a prayer. He would say: 'O Lord of all people, please remove this trouble from me. The cure is in Your power and only You can help.'

title: Prophet's Cure for Patients
content: The Prophet (ﷺ) told a patient: 'In the Name of Allah. The earth and our saliva can cure you.'

title: Prophet's Treatment Method
content: The Prophet (ﷺ) used to say 'In the Name of Allah' when treating someone with Ruqya. He would use saliva and say: 'With permission from our Lord, the earth of our land and the saliva of some of us can cure this patient'.

title: Good Dreams Come from Allah
content: The Prophet (ﷺ) said: A good dream is from Allah. A bad dream is from Satan. If you see a bad dream, wake up and blow three times on your left side. Then ask Allah to protect you from its harm.

title: Prophet's Evening Routine
content: When the Prophet went to bed, he would read three chapters from the Quran: Surat-al-Ikhlas, Surat-al-Falaq, and Surat-an-Nas. Then he would blow on his hands and rub them over his face and body.

title: Guests Refused Help
content: Some of the Prophet's companions visited an Arab tribe and asked to be their guests. The tribe refused, but later their leader was bitten by a snake. They came back to the travelers and asked if they knew how to treat the bite. One of them said he could use a Ruqya (a treatment method) but wanted payment for his help. The tribe agreed to pay him with some sheep. He treated the patient by spitting on the bite and reciting Surat-al-Fatiha, and the leader got better. When they were paid, the travelers asked if they should share the sheep among themselves. But one of them said they should first tell the Prophet about what happened and ask for his advice.

title: Prophet's Treatment for Ailments
content: The Prophet (ﷺ) used to help his wives when they were sick. He would put his right hand on the painful area and say, 'God of all people, make things easier and heal them.' He would remind everyone that God is the one who heals, and there's no healing without His help.

title: Prophet's Illness Treatment
content: When the Prophet was sick, he would blow on his hands and then pass them over his body while reciting two special Quranic prayers: Surat-an-Nas and Surat-al-Falaq. When he got worse, I would read these prayers for him and let him use my blown-on hands to touch his face.

title: Prophet's Vision of Followers
content: The Prophet (ﷺ) came out to us and said he had seen many nations. He saw a prophet with one man, another with two men, and another with no one. Then he saw a huge crowd covering the horizon. It was said that this was Moses and his followers. The Prophet (ﷺ) looked again and saw an even bigger crowd. He was told these were his own followers, including 70,000 who would go to Paradise without being asked about their actions. The people dispersed, but the Prophet didn't say who those 70,000 were. His companions talked about it and thought they might be their children. But the Prophet said that group doesn't believe in bad omens or use certain treatments for illness. They trust only in Allah. 'Ukasha bin Muhsin asked if he was one of them, and the Prophet said yes. Another person asked too, but the Prophet just said 'Ukasha had answered him first.

title: No Contagious Disease
content: Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) said: 'There is no disease that can be passed from one person to another without Allah's permission. However, a bad omen can come from three things: a woman, a house, or an animal.'

title: No Bad Omens
content: Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) said: 'There is no such thing as a bad omen. The best good luck is when you hear something good.'

title: Good Omens and Words
content: Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) said: There is no such thing as a bad omen. A good sign is when you hear something nice that makes you feel good.

title: No Contagious Disease Spreads
content: The Prophet (ﷺ) said: 'There's no disease that spreads to others without Allah's permission. I like it when people say good things.'

title: No Evil Eye or Magic
content: Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) said: 'There is no evil eye, nor magic, nor bad luck from the stars, nor bad influence from someone's presence.'

title: Pregnant Woman's Case
content: Two women from the Hudhail tribe fought and one hit the other with a stone. The stone hurt her stomach, which caused her unborn baby to die. They took their case to Allah's Messenger (ﷺ). He decided that the woman who was fined had to pay for the life of the unborn child by giving up a slave or a female servant. The guardian of the woman who was fined said this was unfair because the unborn child couldn't eat, drink, speak, or cry. Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) replied, 'This is like what soothsayers do.'

title: Killing a Fetus in Womb
content: Two women had a fight and one hit the other with a stone. The woman's unborn child died. The Prophet (ﷺ) said that to make up for this, the person who caused it should give the mother either a slave or another woman as payment.

title: Killing a Fetus in Islam
content: Two women had a fight. One of them hit the other with a stone and caused her to lose her unborn baby. The Prophet (ﷺ) decided that the person who did this should give the mother either a slave or another woman as compensation. When the offender complained, saying it's unfair to be punished for killing someone who didn't eat, drink, speak, or cry, the Prophet said: 'He is one of those who think they can predict the future'.

title: Prophet's Warning on Bad Earnings
content: Abu Masud said: The Prophet (ﷺ) forbade using money earned from selling a dog, or from prostitution, or from fortune-telling.

title: Prophet Muhammad on Fore-tellers
content: Some people asked the Prophet about fortune tellers. He said they are nothing. They said, 'But sometimes what they say comes true.' The Prophet (ﷺ) replied, 'A Jinn (spirit) takes a true word and tells it to a fortune teller. Then the fortune teller mixes it with many lies.

title: Labid's Magic on Prophet
content: A man named Labid did magic on the Prophet. The Prophet (ﷺ) started to think he had done something wrong when he hadn't. He asked Allah for help and said, 'Do you know that Allah has told me what was happening? Two angels came to him. One sat by his head and one by his feet. They talked about the Prophet's problem. One angel said,

title: Avoid Shirk and Witchcraft
content: Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) said to Abu Huraira: 'Stay away from shirk and witchcraft.'

title: Magic was cast on the Prophet
content: Aisha said: Magic was done to the Prophet. He thought he had sex with his wives when he didn't. One day, he told me that Allah answered a question he asked. Two men came to him in a dream. One sat by his head and one by his feet. The man near his head asked, 'What's wrong with this man?' The other replied, 'He's under magic.' They asked who cast the spell. The answer was Labid bin Al-A'sam, an ally of the Jews and a hypocrite. He used a comb with hair stuck to it. The Prophet (ﷺ) went to find the well where the magic things were kept. It was in Dharwan. When he took them out, he said the water looked like henna infusion and the date palms looked like devils' heads. The Prophet (ﷺ) then threw away the magic things. I suggested that he use Nashra to cure himself, but he said Allah had already cured him. He didn't want evil to spread among his people.

title: Magic on the Prophet
content: Aisha said: Magic was done to the Prophet. He started thinking he did something wrong when he hadn't. One day, while with Aisha, he prayed for a long time and then said, 'Allah has answered my question.' Aisha asked what it was. The Prophet (ﷺ) said two men came to him in a dream. One sat by his head, the other by his feet. They talked about the Prophet's problem. One of them said, 'He is under magic.' The other replied, 'Labid bin A'sam, a Jew from Bani Zuraiq tribe, did it with a comb and date palm pollen.' The Prophet (ﷺ) went to the well Dharwan with some friends. He looked at it and saw date palms nearby. Then he returned to Aisha and said, 'The water was red like henna leaves and the date palms were like devils' heads.' Aisha asked if he took the magic materials out of the pollen skin. The Prophet (ﷺ) replied, 'No, Allah healed me. I didn't want to scare people by showing them what happened. So Allah ordered the well to be filled with earth, and it was done.'

title: Eloquent Speech Can Be Magic
content: Two men from the East came and gave impressive speeches. The Prophet (ﷺ) said that some people's words can be as powerful as magic.

title: Ajwa Dates and Protection
content: The Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) said that eating some Ajwa dates every morning will protect you from being affected by poison or magic until night time. You need to eat at least seven of these dates for this protection to work.

title: Seven Ajwa Dates for Protection
content: Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) said: If someone eats seven 'Ajwa dates in the morning, they will be safe from magic and poison that day.

title: No Contagious Diseases Spread
content: Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) said: There's no disease that spreads to others without Allah's permission. A bedouin asked, 'What about when a mangy camel joins healthy ones and they all get infected?' The Prophet (ﷺ) replied, 'Then who gave the first mangy camel the disease?'

title: Don't Mix Sick Animals
content: Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) said: Don't mix animals that are sick with healthy ones. It's a precaution to keep them separate.

title: No Evil Omens
content: Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) said: 'There is no such thing as bad luck or evil omens. However, three things can be considered unlucky: a horse, a woman, and a house.'

title: No Mixing Sick and Healthy Animals
content: Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) said: 'Don't mix sick animals with healthy ones.' A man asked, 'What happens if a sick animal is mixed with others?' The Prophet (ﷺ) replied, 'Then who gave the disease to the first animal?'

title: No Bad Omen in Islam
content: The Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) said to his companions: 'There is no such thing as a bad omen. But I like saying something good.' His companions asked, 'What's a good word?' He replied, 'A kind and positive statement'.

title: Conquering Khaibar: A Test
content: After conquering Khaibar, the Prophet was given a poisoned sheep. He asked to gather all the Jews there. The Prophet (ﷺ) said, 'I'll ask you something, will you tell me the truth?' They agreed. He then asked, 'Who is your father?' They lied about it. The Prophet (ﷺ) told them they were wrong and their real father was so-and-so. They admitted it. The Prophet (ﷺ) asked again if they would tell the truth. They said yes. Then he asked, 'Who will go to Hell?' They said the Muslims would replace them in Hell. The Prophet (ﷺ) disagreed and said that wouldn't happen. He then asked about the poisoned sheep. They confessed to putting poison in it. The Prophet (ﷺ) asked why they did it. They said they wanted to see if he was a liar or a true prophet.

title: Self-Harm is Forbidden
content: The Prophet (ﷺ) said: If someone intentionally jumps from a mountain and kills themselves, they will go to Hell forever. If someone drinks poison to kill themselves, in the afterlife they'll be holding that poison and drinking it in Hell. If someone uses an iron object to hurt themselves, they'll hold that object and use it to harm themselves in Hell.

title: Protection from Magic and Poison
content: Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) said: If you eat seven 'Ajwa dates in the morning, you will be safe from magic or poison on that day.

title: Forbidden Foods: Wild Animals
content: The Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) forbade eating wild animals with fangs. He also said we cannot drink the milk of donkeys or eat their meat. If you get hurt from an animal, you can use its bile to heal yourself.

title: Forbidden Foods: Wild Animals
content: The Prophet (ﷺ) forbade eating wild animals with fangs. He also said not to eat their meat. As for drinking their milk, we don't know if it's allowed or forbidden. But we do know that the bile of wild animals is not good for us.

title: Throw Away a Fly
content: Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) said: If a fly falls into your food or drink, dip the whole container in it and then throw it away. One of its wings can have a sickness, but the other wing has medicine that can cure it.

title: Don't Walk Behind with Pride
content: Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) said: Allah will not look at the person who walks behind him dragging his clothes because of pride.

title: Don't Walk with Pride
content: The Prophet (ﷺ) said: Allah will not look kindly on someone who walks with their clothes dragging behind them because they want to show off. Abu Bakr said, 'Sometimes my lower garment hangs down if I'm not careful.' The Prophet (ﷺ) replied, 'You're not doing it for pride'.

title: Sun Eclipse Prayer
content: Abu Bakra said the Prophet got up quickly when a solar eclipse happened. He went to the mosque and prayed for two units of prayer. The people followed him, and after he finished praying, the eclipse ended. The Prophet (ﷺ) told us that the sun and moon are signs from Allah, so if we see an eclipse, we should pray and ask Allah to remove it.

title: Bilal's Prayer Setup
content: Abu Juhaifa said: I saw Bilal set up a small stick in the ground. He then called out to signal the prayer time. The Prophet (ﷺ) came out, wearing a long cloak with rolled-up sleeves. He prayed two units of prayer while facing the stick. People and animals walked past him beyond the stick.

title: An Izar Below Ankles
content: Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) said: 'Wearing an izar that hangs below your ankles is a path to the Fire.'

title: Pride in Dressing
content: Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) said: Allah will not look at a person on the Day of Resurrection who walks with pride, dragging his lower garment behind him.

title: Pride Brings Sinking
content: The Prophet (ﷺ) said: A man was walking with a two-piece garment and his hair well-combed. He was proud of himself. Allah made him sink into the ground, and he will keep sinking until the Day of Resurrection.

title: Don't Walk Behind Your Clothes
content: The Prophet (ﷺ) said: A man was walking behind his clothes on the ground. Allah made him sink into the earth and he will keep sinking until the Day of Judgment.

title: Don't Walk with Pride
content: The Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) said: If someone walks with their clothes dragging on the ground because of pride or being arrogant, Allah will not look at them on the Day of Judgment.

title: Aisha's Story About Divorce
content: Aisha was with the Prophet and Abu Bakr when a woman came in. She said she had been divorced by her husband Rifa'a, but now married to AbdurRahman bin Az-Zubair. Khalid heard this and thought it was wrong for her to talk about it openly. But the Prophet just smiled and asked if she wanted to go back to Rifa'a. He said that wouldn't be possible unless AbdurRahman had consummated their marriage.

title: Prophet's Visit to Harnza
content: The Prophet (ﷺ) asked Ali for his shirt. He put it on and went out with Zaid bin Haritha following him. They walked until they reached a house where Harnza was staying. The Prophet (ﷺ) asked permission to enter, and he was allowed in.

title: What to Wear as a Muhrim
content: A man asked the Prophet what clothes a person should wear when they are in a state of Ihram, which is a special state for pilgrimage. The Prophet (ﷺ) said that a person in this state should not wear a shirt or trousers. They can wear a hooded cloak, but no socks unless they have no sandals.

title: The Prophet Visits Abdullah
content: Jabir bin Abdullah said that the Prophet came to visit a man named Abdullah who had been buried. The Prophet (ﷺ) ordered Abdullah's body to be taken out of the grave, and it was placed on his knees. The Prophet (ﷺ) then blew air over Abdullah's body and put one of his own shirts on him.

title: Abdullah's Son Asks for Help
content: `Abdullah bin `Umar said: When his friend `Abdullah bin Ubdi died, his son came to the Prophet and asked for his shirt to wrap his father's body. The Prophet (ﷺ) gave him the shirt and told him to let them know when they could join in the funeral procession. After finishing the preparations, the son told the Prophet, who then went to lead the funeral prayer. But `Umar stopped him and said, 'The Quran says not to pray for hypocrites when they die.' The Prophet (ﷺ) remembered a verse that said this, so he didn't lead the prayer.

title: The Miser and the Generous
content: Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) compared two men to people wearing iron cloaks that cover their bodies. When a generous person wants to give charity, his cloak expands so it covers his hands. But when a miser tries to give charity, his cloak gets tighter and doesn't move. He tried to widen the opening of his shirt but it didn't work.

title: Prophet's Ablution Routine
content: The Prophet (ﷺ) went to the bathroom. When he came back, I gave him water and he washed his face with it. He also cleaned his mouth and nose. Then he washed his hands, but they were stuck in his sleeves, so he pulled them out from under his chest and washed them again. Finally, he wiped his head with his wet hands.

title: Prophet's Ablution on Journey
content: One night, I was traveling with the Prophet. He asked if I had water. I said yes. He got down from his camel and walked away until he disappeared in the dark. Then he came back. I poured water for him to wash his face and hands. He was wearing a woolen cloak that made it hard to take off his arms, so he took them out from underneath. Then he washed his forearms and wiped his head with wet hands. I tried to remove his thick socks, but he said no, because he had already done ablution before putting them on.

title: The Prophet's Kindness to Makhrama
content: Makhrama was not given any Qaba by the Prophet. He went with his son to ask for one. The Prophet (ﷺ) came out wearing a Qaba and said, 'I kept this one for you.' Makhrama looked at it and said he was satisfied.

title: Wearing Silk in Prayer
content: Uqba bin Amir said that a silk garment called Farruj was given to the Prophet. He wore it and prayed, then took it off quickly. He said, 'This kind of clothing is not suitable for those who fear Allah.'

title: Anas Wears Yellow Cloak
content: I asked my father about Anas. He said he saw Anas wearing a yellow hooded cloak made of Khazz material.

title: Muhrim's Clothing
content: A man asked the Prophet what clothes a Muhrim should wear. The Prophet (ﷺ) said: 'Don't wear shirts, turbans, trousers or hooded cloaks. You can only wear sandals or cut your socks short below the ankles if you don't have sandals. Also, don't wear clothes that have been touched by saffron or war perfume.'

title: Wearing Clothes for Prayer
content: The Prophet (ﷺ) said: If you don't have an Izar, wear trousers. If you can't wear sandals, wear socks instead.

title: What to Wear in Ihram
content: A man asked the Prophet: 'What should we wear when going on a pilgrimage?' The Prophet (ﷺ) said: 'Don't wear shirts, trousers, or turbans. Don't wear hooded cloaks or special socks called Khuffs. But if you don't have shoes, you can cut your Khuffs short and wear them. Also, don't wear clothes with saffron or war perfume on them.'

title: What a Muhrim Can Wear
content: The Prophet (ﷺ) said: A person who is in a state of Ihram should not wear a shirt, turban, or long trousers. They also shouldn't wear special cloaks or clothes with perfume on them, like saffron or musk. If they don't have shoes, their socks should be cut short below the ankle.

title: Abu Bakr Waits for the Prophet
content: The Prophet (ﷺ) told Abu Bakr to wait in Mecca while he hoped to emigrate too. Abu Bakr waited four months, feeding his two she-camels leaves from a tree every day. One day, the Prophet came home with a cloth over his head and face. He said it was an urgent matter that brought him there at this unusual hour. The Prophet (ﷺ) asked Abu Bakr's family to leave, but Abu Bakr said they were not strangers, they were his family. The Prophet (ﷺ) said he had been allowed to leave Mecca. Abu Bakr wanted to go with the Prophet and offered one of his she-camels for sale. The Prophet (ﷺ) agreed to take it after paying its price. They prepared their bags and food, and Asma' tied a leather bag shut with her girdle. Then they went to a cave in Thour mountain and stayed there for three nights. Abu Bakr's son would stay with them at night and leave before dawn. He would inform the Prophet of any plots against him when it got dark. A slave named Amir would take their sheep to graze, then wake them up when it was still dark each night.

title: Prophet Enters Mecca
content: In the year of the conquest of Mecca, the Prophet entered the city wearing a helmet on his head.

title: Allah's Messenger meets a Bedouin
content: I was walking with the Prophet. He wore a special cloak called a Najram Burd. A man from the desert followed him and grabbed his cloak tightly. The Prophet 's (ﷺ) shoulder got hurt because of it. The Bedouin asked for some of Allah's wealth, but the Prophet just smiled and told someone to give him something.

title: Prophet Muhammad's Burda Gift
content: A woman gave the Prophet a special shirt she had made for him to wear. He put it on and then took it off again, folding it up to give to another man who wanted it. The man was very sad when he died, but his family found out that the folded-up shirt was actually his shroud.

title: 70,000 People Enter Paradise
content: Abu Huraira said he heard the Prophet say that 70,000 of his followers will go to Paradise without being asked questions about their actions. Their faces will shine like the moon. A man named Ukasha stood up and asked the Prophet to pray for him to be included with them. The Prophet (ﷺ) prayed for Ukasha. Another man from a group called Al-Ansar also stood up and asked the Prophet to pray for him. The Prophet (ﷺ) said that Ukasha had already been chosen before this man.

title: Prophet's Favorite Clothes
content: I asked Anas what kind of clothes the Prophet liked. He said the Prophet loved to wear Hibra cloth from Yemen.

title: Prophet's Favorite Garment
content: Anas bin Malik said that the Prophet liked to wear a special cloth from Yemen called Hibra.

title: Prophet's Funeral Garment
content: When the Prophet died, he was covered with a green square decorated garment called Hibra Burd.

title: Prophet's Warning About Imitation
content: When the Prophet was ill, he covered his face with a cloth. When he had trouble breathing, he would take it off and say: 'This is what happens when people make graves into places of worship.' He warned us not to imitate others by doing the same thing.

title: Prophet's Warning About Graves
content: When the Prophet was ill, he covered his face with a cloth. When he had trouble breathing, he would take it off and say: 'This is what happens! May Allah curse the Jews and Christians for turning their prophets' graves into places of worship.' He warned us not to do the same.

title: Prophet Muhammad's Prayer Disturbed
content: The Prophet (ﷺ) was praying while wearing a shirt with patterns. He looked at the patterns during prayer and when he finished, he said to take it away because it distracted him. He asked for a plain sheet from Abu Jahm.

title: Aisha Describes Prophet's Clothing
content: Aisha brought out two pieces of clothing to us. She said the Prophet was wearing a black square piece of woolen cloth and a sheet garment when he died.

title: Prophet's Rules for Daily Life
content: The Prophet (ﷺ) forbade some things. He said it is not allowed to make deals where you touch something and then say you won't buy it, or offer two prayers at the same time - one in the morning until the sun comes up, and another after the afternoon prayer until sunset. He also said it's not right to sit outside wearing only one garment that doesn't cover your private parts. And he said it's not allowed to expose yourself to the sky by sitting like this.

title: Forbidden Deals and Clothes
content: Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) forbade two ways of buying clothes. One way was called Mulamasa. If you touched a garment, you had to buy it, even if you didn't want to. The other way was Munabadha. Someone would throw their garment at someone else, and they would throw theirs back. It was a deal without checking the goods. He also forbade two ways of wearing clothes. One way was Ishtimal-as-Samma. You covered one shoulder with your garment but left the other bare. The other way was wrapping yourself in a garment while sitting down, so nothing covered your private parts.

title: Prophet's Dress Code
content: Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) forbade wearing two types of clothes. First, sitting in one garment with nothing covering your private parts. Second, wearing a single garment that covers one side of your body but leaves the other side bare. He also forbade taking something found and throwing something away.

title: Forbidden Postures
content: The Prophet (ﷺ) said that it's not allowed to sit in a way that your private parts are exposed. He also forbade wearing only one garment, even if you're sitting with your legs together and covered.

title: The Prophet's Gift to Um Khalid
content: The Prophet (ﷺ) was given some clothes. He asked who should wear a black Khamisa. The people were quiet, so he said, 'Get Um Khalid.' I was brought to him. He put the Khamisa on me and said, 'I hope you live long enough for your dress to get old and worn out.' On the Khamisa, there were green designs. He said, 'Um Khalid, these are called Sanah - they're beautiful'.

title: Taking a Newborn to the Prophet
content: Anas said: Um Sulaim had a baby. She asked me to take care of him and not give him food or drink until we went to see the Prophet in the morning for a special ritual called Tahnik. The next day, I took the baby to the Prophet who was sitting in a garden wearing a simple shirt. He was also branding his camel.

title: AbdurRahman's Wife Complains
content: `Ikrima said that a woman came to Aisha. She was wearing a green veil and showed her a green mark on her skin from being beaten by her husband, AbdurRahman. Aisha said this was common for believing women. When the Prophet came, he saw the woman's skin was greener than her clothes. The woman said she had done nothing wrong to AbdurRahman but that he was unable to have sex with her. He denied it and said his wife wanted to go back to her previous husband, Rifa`a. The Prophet (ﷺ) told the woman that if that was true, she couldn't marry Rifa`a again unless AbdurRahman had sex with her first. Then the Prophet saw two boys with AbdurRahman and asked him if they were his sons. AbdurRahman said yes. The Prophet (ﷺ) said that it seemed unlikely he was impotent since the boys looked like him.

title: Two Men in White at Uhud
content: Sa'd said that on the day of the battle of Uhud, two men wearing white clothes stood next to the Prophet. He had never seen them before and didn't see them again after that.

title: Forgiveness for Those Who Repent
content: Abu Dharr met the Prophet while he was sleeping. The Prophet (ﷺ) woke up and said: 'If someone says

title: Prophet forbids silk
content: We were with `Utba bin Farqad at Adharbijan. A letter from `Umar arrived saying the Prophet had forbidden wearing silk, except for embroidery. The Prophet (ﷺ) pointed to how much is allowed with his index and middle fingers.

title: Prophet forbids wearing silk
content: Abu Uthman was at Adharbijan. He got a letter from Umar saying that the Prophet had forbidden wearing silk, except for a small amount. The Prophet (ﷺ) showed us how much this is by holding up two fingers - his index and middle fingers.

title: Wearing Silk is Forbidden
content: The Prophet (ﷺ) said: 'Anyone who wears silk in this world will not wear it in the Hereafter.' Abu `Uthman pointed to his fingers, showing that he was wearing something made of silk.

title: Hudhaifa's Silver Cup
content: Hudhaifa was at a village. He asked for water and the chief gave it to him in a silver cup. Hudhaifa threw the water away because he had told the chief not to use it, but the chief didn't listen. The Prophet (ﷺ) said: 'Gold, silver, silk, and some other fabrics are for non-Muslims in this life, but they will be yours in the afterlife.'

title: No Silk in Paradise
content: The Prophet (ﷺ) said: If someone wears silk in this life, they won't be able to wear it in the afterlife.

title: No Silk in Paradise
content: Ibn Az-Zubair said that the Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) said: 'If you wear silk in this life, you won't be able to wear it in the Hereafter.'

title: No Silk in the Hereafter
content: I heard Umar say that the Prophet said: 'If you wear silk in this life, you won't be able to wear it in the next life.'

title: No Silk for Heaven
content: 'Umar bin Al-Khattab asked the Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ): 'Can people wear silk?' The Prophet (ﷺ) replied, 'Only those who will have no share in the Hereafter will wear silk.'

title: Gift of Silk Garment
content: The Prophet (ﷺ) was given a silk garment as a gift. Some companions touched it and admired it. The Prophet (ﷺ) asked if they were surprised by it. They said yes. He then said that the handkerchiefs of Sa'd bin Mu'adh in Paradise are better than this.

title: Prophet's Rules for Living
content: The Prophet (ﷺ) told Hudhaifa not to drink from cups made of gold or silver. He also said it's not allowed to eat in those cups. Additionally, the Prophet forbade wearing clothes made of silk and Dibaj, and sitting on them.

title: Prophet's Advice on Shoes
content: The Prophet (ﷺ) told Ibn Azib not to wear red shoes called Mayathir and not to use a type of shoe called Al-Qassiy.

title: Wearing Silk Allowed
content: Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) allowed Az-Zubair and Abdur-Rahman to wear silk because they had an itch.

title: Prophet's Gift: A Lesson
content: The Prophet (ﷺ) gave me a silk suit. I wore it outside, but he looked angry. So I tore the suit and shared it with my wives.

title: Prophet's Advice on Silk
content: `Umar saw a silk suit for sale. He asked the Prophet if he should buy it to wear when visitors came or on Fridays. The Prophet (ﷺ) said that only those with no share in the Hereafter wore such clothes. Later, the Prophet sent `Umar a different silk suit. `Umar was confused and asked why he had been given something the Prophet had criticized. The Prophet (ﷺ) replied that `Umar could either sell it or give it to someone else to wear.

title: Um Kulthum's Red Dress
content: Anas bin Malik saw Um Kulthum, the daughter of the Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ), wearing a red silk garment.

title: Umar's Story About Aisha
content: Ibn Abbas wanted to ask Umar about two women who argued with the Prophet. He was afraid of Umar, but one day he saw him walking around and asked him. Umar said the women were Aisha and Hafsa. In the past, men didn't think much of women's opinions, but Islam changed that. Umar had a disagreement with his wife and she spoke back to him loudly. He went to Hafsa and told her not to disobey Allah or the Prophet. She refused to listen. An Ansari man helped Umar stay informed about what was happening in the Prophet's life. One day, he came to Umar and said that a big event had happened: the Prophet had divorced his wives. Umar went to see them and found them crying. He entered the Prophet's room and saw him lying on a mat, with some hides and grass for tanning nearby. The Prophet (ﷺ) smiled when Umar told him about Hafsa and Um Salama. He stayed in this room for 29 days before coming down.

title: Prophet's Midnight Reflection
content: One night, the Prophet woke up and said, 'There is no god but Allah. Many troubles have come tonight, and many secrets have been revealed. Who will wake up the women sleeping in these rooms? People who look rich now may be poor on Judgment Day.'

title: Giving a Gift to Um Khalid
content: Some clothes were given to the Prophet as a gift. There was a black shirt with it. The Prophet (ﷺ) asked his companions who should wear it, but they didn't say anything. He said, 'Bring me Um Khalid.' She came and he dressed her in the shirt himself. He said twice, 'May you live a long life so that you can wear many clothes.' Then he looked at the embroidery on the shirt and said, 'This is beautiful.'

title: Prophet Forbids Saffron Use
content: The Prophet (ﷺ) forbade men from using saffron.

title: No Dye for Pilgrims
content: Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) told Ibn Umar that people on pilgrimage should not wear clothes dyed with Wars or saffron.

title: The Prophet's Modest Appearance
content: Al-Bara said the Prophet was not very tall. He saw the Prophet wearing a red suit and thought he looked great.

title: Prophet's Orders and Prohibitions
content: The Prophet (ﷺ) ordered us to visit the sick, follow funeral processions, and say 'May Allah bestow His Mercy on you' when someone says 'Praise be to Allah!' after sneezing. He also told us not to wear certain types of silk clothing or use red cushions.

title: Prophet's Prayer Shoes
content: I asked Anas if the Prophet used to pray with his shoes on. He said yes.

title: Abdullah bin Umar's Practices
content: One day, 'Ubai bin Juraij asked Abdullah bin Umar about four things he did differently from others. Abdullah said these were: not touching the corners of the Ka'ba except the two Yemenite ones; wearing shoes with no hair on them; dyeing his hair with Sufra; and only assuming Ihram when his camel was ready to leave Mecca on the 8th day of Dhul-Hijja. Abdullah said he saw the Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) doing these things, so he followed their example.

title: No Dyeed Clothes for Muhrim
content: Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) told Ibn Umar that a person in Ihram (Muhrim) should not wear clothes dyed with Saffron or Wars. If someone doesn't have shoes, they can put on Khuffs, but only after cutting them below the ankles.

title: Wearing Clothes in Islam
content: The Prophet (ﷺ) said: If you don't have a waist sheet, wear trousers. And if you don't have sandals, wear socks that are cut short below your ankles.

title: Prophet's Daily Habits
content: The Prophet (ﷺ) used to start from the right when doing his ablution, combing his hair, and putting on his shoes.

title: Wearing Shoes Properly
content: The Prophet (ﷺ) said: When you put on your shoes, start with the right one. And when you take them off, remove the left shoe first. Always wear your right shoe first and last.

title: Wearing One Shoe
content: The Prophet (ﷺ) said: Don't walk around with one shoe on. Either put both shoes on or don't wear any shoes at all.

title: Prophet's Sandal Had Two Straps
content: Anas said the Prophet's sandal had two straps.

title: Anas Shows Us Muhammad's Sandals
content: Anas bin Malik brought out two sandals with straps. Thabit Al-Banani said they belonged to the Prophet.

title: Prophet's Ablution Water
content: I was with the Prophet in a red tent. I saw Bilal taking the remaining water from his ablution. People were using that water to wash their faces, and if they couldn't get any, they would share the moisture from their friend's hand.

title: The Prophet Calls the Ansar
content: The Prophet (ﷺ) called together the people of Medina who had helped him when he first came to the city. He gathered them in a tent made from animal skin.

title: Praying at Night
content: The Prophet (ﷺ) used to make a special loom for prayer. At night, he would pray on it and people would join him. When more people came, the Prophet faced them and said: 'Do only what you can do. Allah doesn't get tired of giving reward. The best deeds are those that keep going, even if they're not many.'

title: Makhrama's Visit to the Prophet
content: My father Makhrama told me he wanted to see the Prophet. We went to his house and found him there. My father asked me to call the Prophet, but I was shy. He said it was okay, so I called him. The Prophet (ﷺ) came out wearing a special cloak with gold buttons. He gave it to my father as a gift.

title: Prophet's Guidance on Daily Life
content: The Prophet (ﷺ) forbade us from using seven things: gold rings, silk clothes, a special type of fabric called Istabraq, Dibaj, red Mayathir, Al-Qassiy, and silver plates. He also ordered us to do seven good deeds: visit the sick when they're ill, attend funerals, say 'May Allah be merciful' if someone says 'Praise be to Allah' after sneezing, return greetings, accept invitations, help others keep their promises, and support those who are being treated unfairly.

title: Prophet Forbids Gold Rings
content: Abu Huraira said the Prophet forbade wearing a gold ring.

title: Prophet Muhammad's Ring
content: The Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) wore a gold or silver ring. He placed the stone on his palm. People started wearing similar rings, but when the Prophet saw this, he threw away the gold ring and wore a silver one instead.

title: Prophet Muhammad's Ring
content: Ibn Umar said that the Prophet wore a ring with his name 'Muhammad (ﷺ), the Messenger of Allah' on it. He would place the stone towards his palm. People started wearing similar gold rings, but the Prophet saw this and threw away his own ring. He then wore a silver ring instead. The people followed suit and wore silver rings too. After the Prophet's time, Abu Bakr, Umar, and Uthman all wore the ring until it fell into a well.

title: Prophet Muhammad Rejects Gold Rings
content: Abdullah bin Umar said that the Prophet wore a gold ring. He then threw it away and said he would never wear one again. The people who had been wearing similar rings also got rid of theirs.

title: Prophet's Silver Ring
content: Anas bin Malik said the Prophet wore a silver ring for one day. People made their own rings and wore them, but the Prophet took theirs away.

title: Prophet Muhammad's Late Prayer
content: One day, Anas asked if the Prophet wore a ring. Anas said that one night, the Prophet delayed the late-night prayer until midnight. When he came to pray, his ring caught some light and Anas saw it shining. The Prophet (ﷺ) then said, 'The people have prayed and gone to sleep, but you were waiting for the prayer.'

title: Prophet's Ring Details
content: Anas said the Prophet's ring was made of silver. The stone in it was also silver.

title: Marriage and Mahr
content: A woman came to the Prophet. She wanted to get married. The Prophet (ﷺ) looked at her carefully but didn't say yes or no right away. A man said, 'If you're not interested in marrying her, I'll take her.' The Prophet (ﷺ) asked if he had anything to give her as a gift when they got married. He said no. The Prophet (ﷺ) told him to go home and find something, even if it was just an iron ring. But the man couldn't find anything. Then he offered to give his only clothes to her as a gift. The Prophet (ﷺ) said this wouldn't work because she would wear them and then he would have nothing left. Later, the Prophet asked the man how much of the Quran he knew by heart. He named some chapters. The Prophet (ﷺ) then married the woman to him for the amount of Quran he knew.

title: Prophet's Silver Ring
content: The Prophet (ﷺ) wanted to write a letter to some people. They said they wouldn't accept it unless it was stamped. So, the Prophet made a silver ring with his name and title on it: 'Muhammad (ﷺ), the Messenger of Allah'.

title: Allah's Messenger's Ring
content: Ibn Umar said that the Prophet had a silver ring made with his name and title. He wore it on his hand, then Abu Bakr, then Umar, and finally Uthman. The ring fell into a well called Aris.

title: Prophet's Ring Warning
content: The Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) got a new ring made. He said not to get the same design on any other ring. I saw him wearing it on his little finger.

title: The Prophet's Official Seal
content: Anas bin Malik said the Prophet wanted to write a letter to the Byzantines. They told him they wouldn't read it unless it had an official stamp. So, the Prophet got his name and title engraved on a silver ring.

title: The Prophet's Golden Ring
content: The Prophet (ﷺ) had a golden ring made. When he wore it, he would turn the stone towards his palm. People started making gold rings too. The Prophet (ﷺ) then got up and said: 'I had this made for myself, but I won't wear it again.' He threw it away, so people threw their rings away too.

title: Prophet's Silver Ring
content: The Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) had a silver ring made with his name and title. He told us not to have the same engraving on our rings.

title: Abu Bakr's Letter with Muhammad's Ring
content: When Abu Bakr became the leader after Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ), he wrote a letter and used his ring to seal it. The ring had three lines: 'Muhammad (ﷺ)', 'Apostle of Allah', and 'Allah'. This ring was passed down from Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) to Abu Bakr, then to Umar, and later to Uthman. One day, while Uthman was sitting by a well called Aris, he took off the ring and dropped it into the water. They searched for three days but couldn't find it, even after draining the well.

title: The Prophet's Eid Prayer
content: Ibn Abbas said he prayed with the Prophet on a special day. The Prophet (ﷺ) prayed first and then gave a talk. After the prayer, he went to the women and asked them to give some money for charity. The women took off their jewelry and put it in Bilal's cloak.

title: The Prophet's Eid Day Prayer
content: One day, the Prophet came out to pray on Eid. He prayed a two-rak'at prayer. Before and after this prayer, he didn't pray anything else. Then he went to the women and told them to give some of their belongings as charity. The women started giving their earrings and necklaces.

title: Lost Necklace and Prayer
content: Asma's necklace was lost. The Prophet (ﷺ) sent men to find it. They couldn't find water for prayer, so they prayed without washing first. When they told the Prophet, Allah revealed a new rule about praying when you can't wash.

title: Prophet's Eid Day Prayer
content: The Prophet (ﷺ) offered a two-rak'at prayer on Eid day. He didn't pray any extra prayers before or after this one. Then he went to the women with Bilal, and asked them to give charity. The women started giving their earrings and other things.

title: The Prophet Loves Hasan
content: I was with the Prophet in a market in Medina. He left and I followed him. He asked three times where a small child was. Then he said to call Al-Hasan bin Ali. Hasan got up, wearing a necklace around his neck. The Prophet (ﷺ) stretched out his hand like this, and Hasan did the same. The Prophet (ﷺ) hugged him and said, 'O Allah! I love him, so please love him and those who love him.' Since then, nothing has been dearer to me than Hasan.

title: Men acting like Women
content: Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) cursed men who behave like women and women who behave like men.

title: Men Acting Like Women
content: Ibn Abbas said the Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) told him to get rid of men who act like women and women who act like men. He said, 'Throw them out of your homes.' The Prophet (ﷺ) threw one man out, and Umar threw another woman out.

title: Effeminate Men in the House
content: The Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) was visiting Um Salama's house. An effeminate man was there too. He told Abdullah, Um Salama's brother, that if Ta'if was conquered, he should marry a woman named Ghailan's daughter because she had extra weight. The Prophet (ﷺ) then said to his wives, 'Men like this shouldn't enter our homes.'

title: Cutting Moustache Hair
content: The Prophet (ﷺ) said that cutting moustache hair short is a natural way of life.

title: Five Practices of Fitra
content: Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) said: Circumcision is one of the natural ways to please Allah. We should also trim our pubic hair, cut our nails, and keep our moustaches short.

title: Characteristics of Fitra
content: Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) said that shaving pubic hair, clipping nails, and cutting moustaches short are natural habits for humans.

title: Five Practices of Fitra
content: The Prophet (ﷺ) said: 'Circumcision is a natural practice. So are shaving pubic hair, cutting moustaches short, clipping nails, and removing armpit hair.'

title: Beards and Moustaches
content: Ibn Umar said the Prophet told him to do the opposite of what non-Muslims did. He should keep his beard long and cut his moustache short. When Ibn Umar went for Hajj or Umra, he would hold his beard with one hand and cut any hair that was outside his grasp.

title: Shorten Moustaches
content: The Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) said to Ibn Umar: 'Cut your moustache short. Leave your beard as it is.'

title: Prophet Muhammad's Hair
content: I asked Anas if the Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) dyed his hair. He said the Prophet did not have much grey hair, just a few.

title: Did Prophet Muhammad Dye His Hair?
content: Anas was asked if the Prophet used a hair dye. He said no, because the Prophet didn't have enough grey hair to need it.

title: Hair of the Prophet
content: Uthman bin Abdullah went to Um Salama with a small bowl of water. He said it was used for people who were ill or had the evil eye. Uthman looked into the bowl and saw some red hairs from the Prophet's head.

title: Um Salama shows Prophet's Hair
content: I went to see Um Salama. She showed me some of the Prophet's hair that had been dyed red.

title: Don't Copy Non-Muslims
content: The Prophet (ﷺ) said to Abu Huraira: 'Jews and Christians don't dye their hair. You should do the opposite of what they do.'

title: Prophet Muhammad's Physical Description
content: Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) was not very tall or short. He had average hair that wasn't curly or straight. Allah chose him to be a messenger at the age of 40. He lived in Mecca for ten years and then moved to Medina for another ten years. Allah took him back to Him when he was 60 years old, and he only had a few grey hairs on his head and beard.

title: The Prophet's Physical Appearance
content: Al-Bara' said he never saw anyone as handsome as the Prophet when he was wearing a red cloak. Malik said that the Prophet's hair hung down to his shoulders. Shu'ba also said this, and the Prophet often laughed when talking about it.

title: Prophets in a Dream
content: Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) saw himself in a dream near the Kaaba. He saw two men: one was Jesus, the son of Mary, who had long hair and was performing Tawaf around the Kaaba with his hands on the shoulders of two other men. The second man was the Dajjal, who had curly hair and was blind in one eye.

title: Prophet Muhammad's Hair
content: Anas said the Prophet's hair used to hang down up to his shoulders.

title: Prophet Muhammad's Hair Length
content: Anas said the Prophet's hair hung down to his shoulders.

title: Allah's Messenger's Hair
content: I asked Anas bin Malik about the hair of Allah's Messenger (ﷺ). He said it was not very straight or very curly. It hung down to between his shoulders and earlobes.

title: Prophet Muhammad's Physical Appearance
content: Anas said the Prophet had big hands. His hair was wavy and not curly or straight.

title: Prophet Muhammad's Physical Appearance
content: Anas said the Prophet had big hands and feet. He never saw anyone like him before or after. His palms were soft.

title: Prophet Muhammad's Physical Appearance
content: Abu Huraira said the Prophet had big feet and a good-looking face. He said no one else looked like him after that.

title: Prophet Muhammad's Physical Appearance
content: Abu Huraira said that the Prophet had big feet and a good-looking face. He said he had never seen anyone else like him after the Prophet passed away.

title: The Prophet's Physical Appearance
content: Anas said the Prophet had big feet and hands.

title: The Prophet's Physical Appearance
content: Anas or Jabir said the Prophet had big hands and feet. No one else looked like him after he passed away.

title: The Prophet's Physical Appearance
content: The Prophet (ﷺ) had big hands and feet. No one has been like him since then.

title: Ibn Abbas Talks About Dajjal
