content: We were with Ibn Abbas when people started talking about Ad-Dajjal. Someone said that the word 'Kafir' (unbeliever) is written between his eyes. Ibn Abbas replied, 'The Prophet (ﷺ) never said this.' He did say that Abraham looks like the Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ), and Moses has curly brown hair, rides a camel, and is tied with a strong rope.

title: Braiding Hair in Ihram
content: I heard `Umar say that anyone who braids their hair while in a state of Ihram should shave it. He also said not to do something like 'Talbid'. I, Ibn `Umar, saw the Prophet with his hair stuck together with gum.

title: Ibn Umar's Story
content: Ibn Umar heard the Prophet say 'Labbaik, Allahumma Labbaik' while he was in a special state for pilgrimage. His hair was stuck together with gum. The Prophet (ﷺ) didn't add anything else to these words.

title: Why the Prophet Didn't Finish Ihram
content: Hafsa asked the Prophet why he hadn't finished his special state of purity after performing Umra. He replied that he had put perfume on his hair and decorated it with garlands, so he wouldn't finish his Ihram until he had sacrificed an animal.

title: Prophet Muhammad's Hair Style
content: Ibn Abbas said the Prophet followed people of Scriptures in matters not clearly stated by Allah. They let their hair hang down, but pagans parted it. The Prophet (ﷺ) first let his hair hang down, then later he also parted it.

title: Prophet's Hair Parting
content: I remember looking at the Prophet when he was in a state of Ihram. He had his hair parted, and I can still see how it looked.

title: Prophet Muhammad's Prayer
content: Ibn Abbas stayed with his aunt Maimuna. The Prophet (ﷺ) came to pray at night. Ibn Abbas stood on the left, but the Prophet took hold of his hair and moved him to stand on the right.

title: Prohibition of Al-Qaza'
content: Umar said the Prophet forbade a haircut where some hair is left on top and sides. It's when you shave most of your head, but leave small tufts of hair on your forehead and temples.

title: No Leaving Hairs After Shave
content: Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) forbade leaving tufts of hair after shaving one's head. This is based on a narration by Abdullah bin Umar.

title: Perfuming the Prophet
content: My husband, the Prophet, wanted to go on a special journey. I put perfume on him with my own hands before he left. Later, when we were at Mina, I perfumed him again.

title: Perfuming the Prophet
content: I used to perfume the Messenger of Allah with good-smelling perfume. I could see the scent shining on his head and beard.

title: Looking without Permission
content: A man looked into the Prophet's house through a hole. The Prophet (ﷺ) was scratching his head with a comb. He said to the man, 'If I had known you were looking, I would have hurt your eye. We need permission so we don't see things that are not allowed.'

title: Combing the Prophet's Hair
content: I used to comb the hair of the Prophet during my periods. This is also reported by another chain of narrators.

title: Starting with the Right Hand
content: The Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) used to prefer starting from the right side when combing his hair and performing ablution.

title: Fasting is for Allah
content: The Prophet (ﷺ) said that God told Adam's children: 'Every good deed you do is yours, except fasting. Fasting is just between you and Me.' And God likes the smell of a person who is fasting more than the smell of musk.

title: Aisha Prepares Prophet's Perfume
content: Aisha would perfume the Prophet with the best scent available before he prayed.

title: Anas and Scent Gifts
content: Anas said the Prophet never refused a gift of perfume. He also didn't refuse such gifts himself.

title: Aisha Perfumes the Prophet
content: During a special Hajj, Aisha used perfume called Dharira to smell good for Allah's Messenger (ﷺ). She did this when he started wearing Ihram clothes and again when he finished his pilgrimage.

title: Women Who Change Their Appearance
content: Allah has cursed women who get tattoos or have them removed. He also curses those who remove their facial hair, change the shape of their teeth to look more attractive, or alter God's creation. The Prophet (ﷺ) (SAW) has also cursed these actions, which are mentioned in Allah's Book: 'Follow what the Prophet says and do not go against him.'

title: Mu'awiya Warns Against False Hair
content: Mu'awiya bin Abi Sufyan stood on a pulpit and said, 'Where are the knowledgeable people? I heard the Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) forbidding false hair. He said it was one of the reasons the children of Israel were destroyed.'

title: Prophet's Warning on Beauty
content: The Prophet (ﷺ) said: Allah has cursed the woman who changes someone else's hair and the one whose hair is changed, the woman who gets a tattoo and the one who gives her a tattoo.

title: False Hair is Forbidden
content: An Ansari girl got married and became ill. She lost all her hair. Her family wanted to give her fake hair. They asked the Prophet about this. He said, 'Allah curses women who put false hair on themselves or others.'

title: Using False Hair is Forbidden
content: A woman asked the Prophet if she could let her daughter wear false hair because her real hair had fallen out. The Prophet (ﷺ) said that anyone who artificially lengthens their own or someone else's hair is cursed.

title: Cursing Artificial Hair Lengthening
content: Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) said that a woman who artificially lengthens her own hair or someone else's has been cursed by Allah.

title: Women and Artificial Beauty
content: Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) said: Allah curses a woman who artificially lengthens her hair or gets it lengthened. He also curses a woman who tattoos herself or has someone else tattoo her.

title: Mu'awiya Warns Against Cheating
content: Sa'id bin Al-Musaiyab said that Mu'awiya came to Medina and gave a speech. He showed everyone a tuft of hair and said, 'I thought only Jews used false hair.' The Prophet (ﷺ) had called using fake hair cheating.

title: Abdullah's Warning to Women
content: 'Alqama said that Abdullah cursed women who get tattoos, remove facial hair, or change their teeth shape. Um Ya'qub asked him why he was doing this and he replied that he was following the Prophet's curse mentioned in the Quran. He reminded her of Allah's saying: 'Follow what the Messenger gives you and avoid what he forbids.'

title: Prophet's Warning on Beauty
content: The Prophet (ﷺ) said that he curses women who artificially lengthen their hair and those who get it done. He also curses women who tattoo themselves or others, and those who get tattoos.

title: Measles and False Hair
content: A woman asked the Prophet about her daughter who had measles. Her hair had fallen out. The woman wanted to know if it was okay to use false hair for her wedding. The Prophet (ﷺ) said, 'Allah has cursed anyone who artificially lengthens their hair or gets someone else's hair lengthened.'

title: Tattoos and Artificial Hair
content: The Prophet (ﷺ) said: Allah has cursed women who get tattoos or have them done for themselves. He also cursed women who artificially lengthen their hair, and those who have it done for them.

title: Women Who Change Their Appearance
content: Allah has cursed women who get tattoos or have them done. He also curses those who remove hair from their faces and those who change the shape of their teeth to look good. The Prophet (ﷺ) said that Allah has already cursed these people in His Book.

title: The Evil Eye Exists
content: Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) said that the evil eye is real. He also told us not to get tattoos.

title: Forbidden Activities
content: The Prophet (ﷺ) said that it is not allowed to take money for selling a person's blood or for killing an animal. It is also not allowed to give or receive interest on loans, to get tattoos or to let someone else get tattoos.

title: Prophet's Warning on Tattoos
content: Abu Huraira said that a woman who did tattoos was brought to the leader Umar. He asked if anyone had heard the Prophet say anything about tattoos. I, Abu Huraira, stood up and said I remembered something. Umar asked me what it was. I replied that I had heard the Prophet tell women not to get tattoos or have them.

title: Prophet's Warning on Beauty
content: The Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) said that he curses women who artificially lengthen their hair and those who get it done. He also curses women who get tattoos and those who give them tattoos.

title: Women Who Change Their Bodies
content: Allah has cursed women who get tattoos or have them removed. He also curses those who remove hair from their faces, or change the shape of their teeth to look more attractive. This is because they are changing the way Allah created them. The Prophet (ﷺ) has also cursed these people and it's written in Allah's Book.

title: No Dogs or Pictures Allowed
content: Abu Talha said the Prophet said: Angels will not enter a house with a dog inside. They also won't go in if there are pictures on the walls.

title: Picture Makers and Punishment
content: We were with Masruq at Yasar's house. He saw pictures on the roof and said he heard Abdullah say that the Prophet said: 'Those who make pictures will get a very harsh punishment from Allah.'

title: Pictures on the Day of Judgement
content: Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) said that people who make pictures will be punished on the Day of Resurrection. They will be told to bring their pictures to life.

title: Prophet Muhammad and Images
content: I never left the Prophet's house with anything that had pictures or crosses on it. He would always remove them.

title: Abu Huraira's Ablution Advice
content: I was with Abu Huraira in Medina. He saw a man drawing pictures and said: 'Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) said that Allah is angry with those who try to make things like Him.' Then he washed his arms up to his armpits using a water container. I asked him if this was something the Prophet (ﷺ) had said, and he replied: 'The limit for washing your hands is up to where you wear ornaments on the Day of Resurrection'.

title: Allah's Messenger Destroys Idolatrous Curtain
content: When the Prophet returned from a journey, he saw a curtain with pictures in my room. He tore it and said that people who try to make things like Allah's creations will be punished severely on Judgment Day. We turned the curtain into cushions.

title: Prophet Muhammad removes curtain
content: The Prophet (ﷺ) returned home from a journey. He saw a thick curtain with pictures hanging in front of the door. He told Aisha to take it down, so she removed it. Aisha also said that they used to share one container for bathing.

title: Prophet's Warning on Pictures
content: I bought a cushion with pictures. The Prophet (ﷺ) came to our house but didn't go inside. I felt guilty and said, 'I'm sorry to Allah for what I did.' He asked about the cushion. I told him it was for him to sit or lie down on. He said that people who make these pictures will be punished on Judgment Day. They'll be asked to bring their creations to life. Also, angels won't enter a house with pictures.

title: Angels Don't Enter Pictured Homes
content: Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) said: 'Angels of mercy don't enter a house with pictures.' When Zaid fell ill, we visited him and saw a curtain with a picture at his door. We asked if he had told us about the rule before, and he explained that it's okay to have designs on clothing.

title: Remove Pictures from Prayer
content: Aisha had a curtain with pictures. She put it in front of her house. The Prophet (ﷺ) told her to take it away because the pictures kept coming into his mind when he prayed.

title: Gabriel's Visit to the Prophet
content: Salim's father told us that Gabriel promised to visit the Prophet. But he was late and the Prophet got worried. When Gabriel finally arrived, the Prophet asked him why he was delayed. Gabriel said, 'We don't enter a place with pictures or dogs.'

title: Prophet Muhammad Dislikes Pictures
content: I bought a cushion with pictures on it. The Prophet (ﷺ) saw it and didn't enter the house. I asked him what was wrong. He said, 'People who make these pictures will be punished badly on Judgment Day.' He also said, 'Angels don't come into homes with pictures.'

title: Forbidden Professions
content: Abu Juhaifa said that he bought a slave who was a cupper. The Prophet (ﷺ) told him not to take money for blood, or for selling dogs, or for a prostitute's earnings. He also cursed anyone who takes or gives usury, and anyone who gets tattoos or gives them to others, and anyone who makes pictures.

title: Don't Make Pictures
content: Ibn Abbas heard the Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) saying: 'If someone creates a picture in this world, they will be asked on the Day of Resurrection to bring it to life. But they won't be able to do that.'

title: Allah's Messenger Rides a Donkey
content: Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) rode a donkey with a special saddle. He made me ride behind him, Usama bin Zaid.

title: Prophet Muhammad Arrives in Mecca
content: When Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) arrived in Mecca, the children of his relatives welcomed him. He then sat one child on a camel in front of him and another behind him.

title: Riding a Camel Together
content: A man named Ibn `Abbas said the Prophet came to him with two men on a camel. One of them was in front and one behind. The question is, who had it worse?

title: Allah's Right and Our Duty
content: I was riding behind the Prophet. He asked me if I knew Allah's right on his slaves. I said, 'Allah knows best.' He replied that Allah's right is for us to worship Him alone. Then he asked again what our right would be if we do that. I said, 'Allah knows best.' He said it means Allah won't punish us.

title: The Prophet's Kindness to His Wife
content: We were traveling with the Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) from Khaibar. I was riding behind Abu Talha when his camel suddenly slipped. A woman, who was riding behind the Prophet, fell off too. I quickly got down and said 'The woman!' The Prophet (ﷺ) said, 'She is your mother.' He helped her get back on the camel and then he mounted it again. When we were near Medina, he said a prayer: 'We are those who have come seeking forgiveness, repentant, worshipers of our Lord, praising Him'.

title: Prophet Muhammad Lying Down
content: Abbad bin Tamim's uncle saw the Prophet lying down in the mosque. He had one leg on top of the other.

title: Prayer Times Most Loved
content: Abu Amr Shaibani said the Prophet told him that Allah loves most when people pray at their earliest times. Abdullah asked what's next, and the Prophet said to be good to one's parents. Abdullah asked again, and the Prophet said to join Jihad for Allah's cause.

title: Treat Your Mother Well
content: A man asked the Prophet who he should treat with kindness. The Prophet (ﷺ) said his mother. He asked again and got the same answer three times. Then he asked about his father, and the Prophet said him.

title: Jihad is for Family
content: A man asked the Prophet if he could join a battle. The Prophet (ﷺ) asked if his parents were alive. When the man said yes, the Prophet told him to fight for their benefit.

title: Cursing Parents is a Sin
content: Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) said that it's one of the biggest sins to speak badly about your parents. Someone asked, 'How do you mean?' The Prophet (ﷺ) replied, 'When someone insults another person's father and then that other person insults the first person's father and mother.'

title: Three Travelers in a Cave
content: Three friends were traveling together when it started raining. They took shelter in a cave but a big rock fell and blocked the entrance. They thought about good things they had done for Allah's sake, like helping their families and being fair to others. One of them remembered a time he gave his parents milk before his children, even though his kids were crying from hunger. Another person remembered paying 100 Dinars to marry his cousin after she refused him unless he did it properly. The third friend thought about how he had given back money that was owed to him by a worker. They asked Allah to help them if they had done these things for His sake, and Allah made the rock move so they could see outside.

title: Forbidden Actions
content: The Prophet (ﷺ) said: Allah has forbidden us to be unkind to our mothers. We must not withhold what we should give or demand what is not ours. We are also forbidden from killing our daughters. Allah dislikes it when we gossip about others, ask too many questions in religion, or waste our money.

title: Biggest Sins of Mankind
content: Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) asked his friends if he should tell them about the biggest sins. They said yes. He said two main things are wrong: worshiping anyone but Allah and not being kind to your parents. He also warned against lying under oath and giving false witness.

title: Three Big Sins
content: Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) was asked about the biggest sins. He said joining other gods with Allah is a big sin. Killing someone who shouldn't be killed is also very wrong. Disobeying or being unkind to your parents is another serious mistake. The Prophet (ﷺ) added that giving false witness is one of the worst things you can do.

title: Treat Your Mother Kindly
content: My mother came to me when the Prophet was alive. I asked him if I could be nice to her and he said yes. Later, Allah revealed a verse saying we should show kindness and fairness to those who didn't fight against us or make us leave our homes.

title: Be Good to Your Mother
content: Asma' told the Prophet about her pagan mother who had come with her father. Asma' asked for advice, and the Prophet said, 'Yes, be good to your mother'.

title: Heraclius Asks About Islam
content: Abu Sufyan told Heraclius that the Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) orders people to pray, give money to those in need, be honest and respectful to their families.

title: Silk Cloaks and the Prophet
content: Ibn Umar's father saw a silk cloak being sold. He asked the Prophet to buy it for special occasions, like Fridays or when guests came. The Prophet (ﷺ) said that only someone without a share in the afterlife would wear such clothes. Later, some silk cloaks were given as gifts to the Prophet. He sent one to Ibn Umar's father, but he didn't want to wear it because of what the Prophet had said. The Prophet (ﷺ) explained that he meant for Ibn Umar's father to sell or give the cloak to someone else.

title: Enter Paradise Easily
content: Abu Ayyub Al-Ansari asked the Prophet: 'Tell me a deed that will get me into Paradise.'

title: Entering Paradise
content: A man asked the Prophet: 'What can I do to enter Paradise?' The Prophet (ﷺ) said: 'Worship only Allah. Pray regularly, give charity when it's due, and be kind to your family.'

title: No Kinship, No Paradise
content: The Prophet (ﷺ) said: 'If someone breaks the connection with their family, they won't enter Heaven.'

title: Take Care of Family
content: Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) said: If you want more wealth and a longer life, take care of your family and keep good relationships with them.

title: Love for Wealth and Life
content: The Prophet (ﷺ) said, 'If you want more wealth and a longer life, take care of your family.'

title: Allah's Promise to Ar-Rahm
content: The Prophet (ﷺ) said: Allah created everything. When He finished creating, the womb spoke up and asked for protection from those who break family ties. Allah promised that if someone breaks ties with Him, He will also cut them off. But if someone keeps good relations with Allah, He will keep good relations with them too.

title: Allah's Love for Family
content: The Prophet (ﷺ) said: 'The word

title: Respect Your Family
content: The Prophet (ﷺ) said: 'The word for womb comes from Allah. If you get along with your family, Allah will be kind to you too. But if you don't respect them, Allah won't either.'

title: Protecting the Righteous
content: `Amr bin Al-'As said he heard the Prophet saying openly, 'The family of Abu Talib are not among my protectors.' The Prophet 's (ﷺ) protector is Allah and good people who believe. But the family of Abu Talib have a special connection to him and he will be kind to them.

title: Keeping Good Relations
content: The Prophet (ﷺ) said that being kind to those who don't want to be kind back is what matters. It's not about repaying good deeds, but about staying connected with family members who have turned against you.

title: Good Deeds Before Islam
content: Hakim bin Hizam asked the Prophet: 'Will I get a reward for my good actions before becoming Muslim? I used to help my family, free slaves, and give charity.' The Prophet (ﷺ) said: 'You became Muslim with all those good deeds still in your account'.

title: Um Khalid's Visit to the Prophet
content: Um Khalid came with her father to see Allah's Messenger (ﷺ). She was wearing a yellow shirt and he said, 'Nice, nice!' Um Khalid played with his seal of prophethood, but her father scolded her. The Prophet (ﷺ) told her father to leave her alone. Then the Prophet said to Um Khalid, 'May you live a long life, so your clothes get worn out many times and you have to mend them.'

title: Mosquitoes' Blood and Prophets' Sons
content: Ibn Abi Na'm was present when a man asked Ibn Umar about mosquitoes. The man said he came from Iraq. Ibn Umar replied, 'You're asking me about mosquito bites? People in Iraq killed the Prophet's grandsons.' He reminded the man that the Prophet said, 'Hasan and Husain are my two precious sons'.

title: Generosity towards Children
content: A woman with two daughters came to me asking for help. I only had one date left, so I gave it to her and she divided it between the girls. She then left. The Prophet (ﷺ) came in and I told him what happened. He said that if someone takes care of their children well, they will protect them from going to Hell.

title: Prophet's Prayer with Granddaughter
content: The Prophet (ﷺ) came out to us. He had his granddaughter Umamah on his shoulder. He prayed. When he wanted to bow down, he put her down first. Then when he stood up again, he lifted her back up.

title: Kissing Al-Hasan bin Ali
content: Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) was sitting with Abu Huraira. He kissed his grandson Al-Hasan bin Ali. A man named Al-Aqra' said he had ten children but never kissed them. The Prophet (ﷺ) looked at him and said, 'Those who don't show kindness to others won't be treated kindly themselves'.

title: Kissing Children is Mercy
content: A Bedouin man came to the Prophet. He said, 'You people kiss your children.' The Prophet (ﷺ) replied, 'I cannot make you feel kind towards them if Allah has already taken kindness from your hearts'.

title: Mercy of Allah
content: Some prisoners were brought before the Prophet. A woman was nursing her child and taking care of other children. The Prophet (ﷺ) asked if she would throw her son into the fire. We said no, because she wouldn't do that. The Prophet (ﷺ) then said that Allah is even more merciful to His slaves than this mother is to her son.

title: Mercy is Shared Among All
content: Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) said that Allah has divided mercy into one hundred parts. He kept ninety nine parts for Himself and sent down one part to the earth. Because of this, His creations are kind to each other. Even a mare will lift its hooves away from its baby so it doesn't get hurt.

title: Greatest Sins
content: I asked the Prophet which sin is the greatest. He said it's to worship someone or something other than Allah, who created us. I asked again and he said it's to kill your own child so they don't share what you have. I asked once more and he said it's to have sex with another man's wife.

title: Prophet Muhammad with a Child
content: The Prophet (ﷺ) took a child in his lap and gave the child a date to chew. The child then urinated on him, so he asked for water and washed the area clean.

title: Allah's Messenger with His Sons
content: Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) would sit with me on one thigh and his son Hasan on the other. He'd hug us both and say, 'O Allah, be kind to them as I am being kind.'

title: Aisha's Jealousy of Khadija
content: I, Aisha, never felt jealous of any woman as much as I did of Khadija. She had passed away three years before the Prophet married me. I was jealous because he often talked about her and because Allah told him that she would have a special palace in Paradise made of Qasab wood. He also used to sacrifice a sheep and share its meat with her friends.

title: Helping Orphans Leads to Paradise
content: The Prophet (ﷺ) said, 'I and someone who takes care of an orphan and gives them food will be in heaven together.' He showed with his fingers how close they would be.

title: Helping Widows and Poor
content: The Prophet (ﷺ) said that helping a widow or someone who is poor is like fighting for Allah's cause. It's also like fasting during the day and praying all night.

title: Helping Widows and Poor
content: Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) said that helping a widow or a poor person is like fighting for Allah. He also mentioned that someone who prays all night without stopping and fasts every day, never breaking their fast.

title: Teach Your Families Prayer
content: Some young men visited the Prophet. They stayed with him for twenty nights. He asked them about their families and if they were worried. He said, 'Go back to your families and teach them good things. Tell them to pray like you saw me praying. When it's time to pray, one of you should call out to start the prayer and the oldest person there should lead.

title: Helping Animals Gets Reward
content: One day, the Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) said that a man was walking on a road when he became very thirsty. He found a well and drank from it. Then he saw a dog that was also very thirsty. The man felt sorry for the dog and went back down into the well to get more water. He filled his shoe with water and gave some to the dog. Allah was pleased with this kind action and forgave the man's sins.

title: Bedouin's Prayer Request
content: Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) stood up for prayer. A Bedouin shouted a prayer during the prayer: 'O Allah, have mercy on me and Muhammad (ﷺ).' After the prayer, Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) said to the Bedouin, 'You've limited something very big - Allah's Mercy'.

title: Believers are Like One Body
content: The Prophet (ﷺ) said: If one part of the Muslim community is not well, all Muslims will feel its pain. They should be kind and loving to each other, like different parts of a single body.

title: Planting for Charity
content: The Prophet (ﷺ) said, 'If you plant a tree and someone or something eats from it, you will get the reward as if you had given that amount in charity.'

title: Treat Others with Kindness
content: The Prophet (ﷺ) said: If you don't show mercy to others, they won't show mercy to you.

title: Treat Neighbors with Kindness
content: The Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) said Gabriel kept telling him to be kind and polite to his neighbors. He recommended it so much that the Prophet thought he would even ask him to leave his own family and make his neighbors his heirs.

title: Belief is Not Just Words
content: The Prophet (ﷺ) said, 'He does not believe.' Someone asked, 'Who is that?' He replied, 'A person whose neighbor feels threatened by him'.

title: Respect for Neighbour's Gift
content: The Prophet (ﷺ) said to Muslim ladies: 'Don't look down on a gift from your neighbour, even if it's just the hooves of a sheep.'

title: Treat Your Neighbors Well
content: Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) said: If you believe in Allah and the Day of Judgment, don't harm your neighbors. Also, if you believe in Allah and the Day of Judgment, be kind to your guests. And remember, if you believe in Allah and the Day of Judgment, only say good things or stay quiet.

title: Treat Your Neighbors Well
content: The Prophet (ﷺ) said: If you believe in Allah and the Day of Judgment, be kind to your neighbors. Give them good food for a day and a night if they visit. They can stay with ordinary food for three days. After that, what you give them is like charity. Also, only say good things or keep quiet.

title: Gifts for Neighbors
content: I asked the Prophet about what to do with gifts. He said, 'Give them to your closer neighbor'.

title: Encourage Good Deeds
content: The Prophet (ﷺ) said, 'Doing good and telling others to do good is a kind act.'

title: Compulsory Charity for Every Muslim
content: Abu Musa asked the Prophet: 'Is there a compulsory charity that every Muslim must do?' The Prophet (ﷺ) replied, 'Yes, it is.' They asked, 'But what if someone has no money?' He said, 'Then they should work to earn some and give some in charity.' If they can't work or don't want to, he said, 'Help those who are being treated unfairly.' If they can't do that, he said, 'Tell others to do good.' And finally, if they can't even do that, the Prophet said, 'Then at least don't do bad things. That will be considered as a charity for you'.

title: Avoiding the Fire
content: Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) talked about Hell. He asked Allah to protect him from it and turned his face away twice. Then he said, 'Stay safe from Hell, even if you give a small date in charity. If that's not possible, say something kind to someone.'

title: Jews Visit the Prophet
content: Some Jews visited the Prophet. They said 'death be upon you'. I replied 'death and Allah's curse be upon you'. The Prophet (ﷺ) told me to calm down, saying Allah likes kindness in all situations. I asked if he had heard what they said, and he just smiled.

title: Respect in the Mosque
content: Anas bin Malik said that a man urinated in the mosque. The people were about to hit him. The Prophet (ﷺ) told them not to interrupt him until he finished. Then, the Prophet got some water and poured it over the urine.

title: Supporting a Fellow Believer
content: The Prophet (ﷺ) said that when believers help each other, they are like strong building blocks holding together. He clasped his hands to show how connected we should be. When someone asked for help, the Prophet told us to support them and get a reward from Allah.

title: Believers Help Each Other
content: The Prophet (ﷺ) said that a believer is like a strong building where all parts support each other. He clasped his hands together to show this. A man came asking for help, so the Prophet told us to assist him and get a reward. Allah will do what He wants through His message.

title: Help Those in Need
content: When a beggar or someone in need came to the Prophet, he would say: 'Support him and recommend him. You will get a reward for it.' Then Allah would help them through what the Prophet said.

title: Prophet's Character Matters
content: Abdullah bin 'Amr said the Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) was not a troublemaker. He said the best people are those with good manners and character.

title: Jews Meet the Prophet
content: A group of Jews visited the Prophet. They said 'Death be on you'. Aisha replied with a similar message, but the Prophet told her to stay calm and be kind. He reminded her that he had responded in the same way, and his prayer against them would be accepted by Allah.

title: The Prophet's Gentle Admonition
content: The Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) was not a person who would insult others or use bad language. If he wanted to tell someone off, he would say: 'What's wrong with you? May your forehead be dusted'.

title: Prophet's Behavior with a Man
content: 'Aisha said a man asked to see the Prophet. When the Prophet saw him, he said some negative things about his family. But when they sat down together, the Prophet was kind and polite. After the man left, 'Aisha asked the Prophet why he had spoken badly of the man first. The Prophet (ﷺ) replied that he never speaks badly or uses bad language. He said on Judgment Day, those who do evil but are not stopped by others will be punished.

title: Prophet Muhammad's Generosity
content: The Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) was kind and generous. He was also very brave. One night, people in Medina were scared by a noise. They went to see what was happening, but the Prophet had already gone there. He met them on his horse, which belonged to Abu Talha. The horse didn't have a saddle, and the Prophet was carrying a sword around his neck. He told the people not to be afraid. He said that the horse felt like a big ocean.

title: Prophet Muhammad's Generosity
content: Jabir said the Prophet never refused a request for something he was asked to give.

title: Prophet Muhammad's Character
content: Abdullah bin Amr told us that the Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) was not a bad person or someone who did wrong things. He said, 'Those with good manners are the best people'.

title: The Prophet's Burda
content: A woman brought a sheet to the Prophet. Sahl asked if anyone knew what it was called. They said it was a 'Shamla', with a fringe. The woman said she wanted the Prophet to wear it because he needed it. He took it and wore it. A companion saw him wearing it and asked for it. The Prophet (ﷺ) gave it to him. When they left, the companions scolded the man for asking for something the Prophet needed. But the man explained that he just wanted the blessings of being near the Prophet's clothing.

title: Time Will Pass Quickly
content: Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) said: 'As time goes by, good actions will become less common. People's hearts will also become more selfish and greedy. Unfortunately, there will be more murders.' They asked him what 'murders' meant. He replied, 'Murdering someone, killing another person'.

title: Prophet Muhammad's Kind Treatment
content: I served the Prophet for ten years. He never said to me, 'Be patient!' or blamed me for something I did or didn't do.

title: Prophet's Home Life
content: I asked Aisha about the Prophet's daily routine at home. She said he spent his time helping his family and only got up for prayer when it was time to pray.

title: Allah's Love for His Servants
content: The Prophet (ﷺ) said: If Allah loves a person, He tells Gabriel to love them too. Then Gabriel announces it in Heaven so everyone there loves them as well. Finally, the people on earth also start loving them.

title: What Faith Really Means
content: The Prophet (ﷺ) said: 'To truly believe means loving someone only because of Allah. It's better to be thrown into fire than to go back to not believing in Allah after you've started. Allah and the Prophet must be loved more than anything else.'

title: Respect in Public and Marriage
content: Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) forbade laughing at someone who passes gas. He also said it's not right to beat your wife like you would a wild camel, because after beating her, you might want to be with her.

title: Prophet's Reminder at Mina
content: At Mina, the Prophet asked his companions if they knew it was the 10th of Dhul-Hijja. They said they didn't know. He told them it was a sacred day. He also asked if they knew which town they were in, and they replied that Allah and His Apostle knew better. The Prophet (ﷺ) said Mecca is a sanctuary. Then he asked about the month, and again they said they didn't know. The Prophet (ﷺ) said this is a sacred month. He reminded them that their blood, properties, and honor are all protected from each other, just like this day, month, and town.

title: Abusing a Muslim is Wrong
content: Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) said, 'Abusing a Muslim is bad behavior and killing one is rejecting Allah.'

title: Accusing Someone of Wrongdoing
content: The Prophet (ﷺ) said: If someone calls another person 'bad' or says they don't believe in God when the other person is actually good, that accusation will come back to the one who made it.

title: Prophet Muhammad's Gentle Nature
content: Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) was not a person who spoke badly about others. He would say 'What is wrong with him?' when he saw someone behaving wrongly.

title: Islam is the True Path
content: The Prophet (ﷺ) said: If someone swears by a different religion than Islam and lies, they are lying. We don't have to keep promises about things we can't give. If someone hurts themselves on purpose, they'll be hurt with that same thing on Judgment Day. Cursing a Muslim is like killing them. Accusing a Muslim of not believing in God is like killing them too.

title: Anger and Seeking Help
content: Two men argued in front of the Prophet. One man got very angry and his face became swollen. The Prophet (ﷺ) said, 'I know a word that can calm him down.' A companion told the angry man to say 'Seek refuge with Allah from Satan'. But he refused, saying 'What's wrong with me? Am I crazy?'

title: Finding the Night of Decree
content: Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) went out to tell people about a special night called Al-Qadr. However, two Muslim men started arguing, so he didn't share the news. He said it might be better that way and suggested looking for this night in the 9th, 7th, or 5th day of the last ten days of Ramadan.

title: Treat Your Slaves Kindly
content: Abu Dhar was wearing a nice garment. I suggested he wear it with his slave's similar one to make a good suit. Abu Dhar said, 'I once argued with someone and insulted their mother. The Prophet (ﷺ) asked me if I did that. I said yes. He told me I still had old habits from before Islam. He said my slaves are like brothers, and Allah made them depend on me. So, I should feed them what I eat, give them clothes like mine, and not ask them to do hard work unless I help them.

title: Prophet's Forgotten Prayer
content: The Prophet (ﷺ) led us in the Zuhr prayer. He only prayed two rak'at and finished with a sign of respect. Then he went to a piece of wood outside the mosque and put his hand on it. Abu Bakr and Umar were there, but they didn't say anything because they knew not to interrupt him. Some people thought maybe the Prophet had forgotten something or that the prayer was shorter than usual. One man, whom the Prophet used to call Dhul-Yadain, said, 'Prophet, have you forgotten or is the prayer shorter?' The Prophet (ﷺ) replied, 'No, I haven't forgotten and it's not shorter.' But then he said, 'Dhul-Yadain is right. I did forget something.' So the Prophet prayed two more rak'at and finished his prayer with a sign of respect. Then he stood up and performed two special prostrations to make up for forgetting.

title: Two People in Pain
content: Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) saw two graves. He said the people inside were being punished, but not for a big sin. One person didn't clean himself properly after using the bathroom. The other spread lies about others to cause trouble. The Prophet (ﷺ) got a green leaf from a palm tree and put one piece on each grave. He hoped this would make their punishment easier until the leaves dried out.

title: Best Family Among Ansar
content: Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) said that the best family among his supporters in Medina were the Banu An-Najjar. He was praising them for their good character and behavior.

title: Allah's Messenger and a Visitor
content: A man asked to see the Prophet. The Prophet (ﷺ) said, 'Let him in.' He thought badly of the man because he was known for being rude and disobedient. But when the man came in, the Prophet spoke kindly to him. Aisha asked the Prophet why he had been so polite after saying bad things about the man. The Prophet (ﷺ) replied, 'The worst people are those who use bad language or disobey their parents.'

title: Punishment in Graveyards
content: One day, the Prophet went to a graveyard in Medina. He heard two people crying out in pain from their graves. The Prophet (ﷺ) said they were being punished, but not for a big sin. Their sins were bad, though. One person didn't take care of his body when he urinated, and the other spread false stories about others. The Prophet (ﷺ) got a green leaf, cut it into two pieces, and put one on each grave. He hoped this would make their punishment less until the leaves dried out.

title: No Qattats in Paradise
content: The Prophet (ﷺ) said: A person who steals will not enter Paradise.

title: Fasting without Good Deeds
content: The Prophet (ﷺ) said, 'If someone doesn't stop lying and doing bad things, and speaking badly to others, Allah won't accept their fasting from food and drink.'

title: Beware of Double-Faced People
content: The Prophet (ﷺ) said that people who act differently with different groups will be the worst on the Day of Resurrection. They pretend to be one thing in front of some people, but another thing in front of others.

title: Allah's Messenger and War Booty
content: Ibn Mas'ud told me that the Prophet divided some war spoils among his followers. One man from the Ansar group said, 'Muhammad (ﷺ) didn't share this out to please Allah.' I went to the Prophet and told him what the man had said. He got very angry and said, 'May Allah be kind to Moses because he was treated unfairly even more than that, but he stayed patient'.

title: Don't Exaggerate in Praise
content: Abu Musa said the Prophet heard a man praising another. The man was saying too much. The Prophet (ﷺ) said, 'You've hurt this person's reputation.'

title: Praising Others with Care
content: The Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) was talking to his companions. A man praised another man greatly in front of him. The Prophet (ﷺ) said, 'May Allah be kind to you! You have hurt your friend's feelings.' He repeated this a few times and said, 'If you must praise someone, say what you really think about them. If you don't know them well, just say that. Only Allah knows the truth about people.'

title: Abu Bakr's Waist Sheet
content: Salim's father said that Abu Bakr told the Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) that his waist sheet was hanging loose on one side. The Prophet (ﷺ) replied, 'You're not like those who deliberately let their clothes drag behind them.'

title: Prophet Muhammad's Magic Cure
content: The Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) told me that he had been imagining he was having sex with his wives when in fact he wasn't. He said two men came to him in a dream, one near his head and the other near his feet. The man near his feet asked about him and the other replied that he was under magic's effect. They asked who did it and the answer was Lubaid bin Asam. The Prophet (ﷺ) then went to the well of Dharwan where Lubaid had put the magic object, a comb with hair stuck to it, hidden under a stone. He ordered it to be taken out.

title: Beware of Suspicion
content: The Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) said: Be careful with suspicion. It's a bad habit to talk about others behind their backs. Don't look for faults in your friends, don't spy on them, and don't be jealous. Stay close to each other and respect one another.

title: Don't Hate or Desert Each Other
content: Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) said: 'Don't hate each other and don't be jealous. Don't stop talking to your Muslim brother for more than three days.'

title: Beware of Suspicion
content: Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) said: 'Be careful with suspicion. It's the worst kind of lie. Don't look for others' mistakes, don't spy on each other, and don't try to outdo one another. Also, don't be jealous or hate each other. And don't stop talking to one another. Be brothers to each other.'

title: Prophet's Opinion on Two People
content: The Prophet (ﷺ) said he didn't think two people understood Islam. Al-Laith said these two were among the hypocrites.

title: Prophet's Concern About Knowledge
content: One day, the Prophet entered Aisha's room and said, 'I don't think so-and-so and so-and-so understand our way of life.'

title: Openly Committing Sins
content: Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) said: 'All the sins of my followers will be forgiven except those who openly commit sins. For example, someone does something wrong at night and Allah hides it from others. But in the morning, they tell people what they did. This is like removing a screen that Allah put over them to hide their sin.'

title: Secret Talk with Allah
content: Ibn Umar was asked about what the Prophet said about a secret talk between Allah and a believer on Judgment Day. He replied, 'Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) said that one of you will come close to your Lord. Your Lord will shelter you in His protection and ask if you committed certain sins. You'll say yes. Then your Lord will ask again and you'll say yes. Finally, your Lord will make you admit all your sins, but then He will forgive them because He protected them for you in the world.

title: People of Paradise and Hell
content: The Prophet (ﷺ) said: 'Those who go to Paradise are ordinary people. If they promise Allah something, He will keep His promise. Those who go to Hell are cruel, violent, proud, and arrogant people. A woman in Medina could take the Prophet's hand and lead him wherever she wanted.'

title: Aisha and Abdullah's Dispute
content: `Aisha was told that Abdullah bin Az-Zubair said she should not be in charge of her own money. `Aisha vowed not to talk to him again. When this went on for a long time, Abdullah asked people to help him make peace with `Aisha. Two men from their tribe went to see `Aisha and asked if they could come in. She said yes, but didn't know Abdullah was also there. The two men told `Aisha that the Prophet forbade Muslims from not talking to each other for more than three days. They reminded her of this until she finally spoke with Abdullah and freed 40 slaves as a way to make up for breaking her vow.

title: Don't Hate Each Other
content: Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) said: Do not hate each other. Don't be jealous of one another. If you have a problem with someone, don't ignore them for more than three days. Instead, treat your fellow Muslims like brothers and sisters.

title: Don't Ignore Your Brother
content: The Prophet (ﷺ) said: If a Muslim doesn't talk to his brother for more than three nights, it's not good. When they meet, one should greet the other first. The one who greets first is better.

title: Allah's Messenger Knows Our Feelings
content: I was talking to the Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ). I asked him how he knew when I was happy or sad. He said, 'When you're pleased, you say

title: Allah's Messenger Visits Aisha
content: Aisha said: I don't remember my parents believing in any other religion than Islam. Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) would visit us twice a day, morning and evening. One day, while we were at Abu Bakr's house during the hottest part of the day, someone said, 'The Prophet (ﷺ) is coming.' Abu Bakr thought something important must have brought him. The Prophet (ﷺ) said, 'I've been given permission to leave Mecca and migrate'.

title: Allah's Messenger Visits a Home
content: Anas bin Malik said that Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) visited a family in the Ansar community. He ate with them and then asked to pray in their home. A mat was prepared for him, sprinkled with water. He prayed on it and asked Allah to bless his hosts.

title: Prophet Muhammad's Advice
content: `Umar saw a man selling a silk cloak. He took it to the Prophet and said, 'Buy this for when visitors come.' The Prophet (ﷺ) replied, 'Silk is worn by those with no share in the afterlife.' Later, the Prophet sent `Umar a similar cloak saying, 'Sell this to get some money.' Because of this, `Umar disliked silk patterns on clothes.

title: Marriage and Giving to Others
content: When `Abdur-Rahman came to the Prophet's group, he was paired with Sa`d bin Ar-Rabi' as brothers. The Prophet (ﷺ) said, 'Now that you're married, give a wedding feast - even if it's just one sheep'.

title: No Brotherhood Treaty
content: I asked Anas if the Prophet said there's no brotherhood in Islam. He replied that the Prophet made a treaty of friendship between the Ansar and Quraish in his home.

title: Divorce and Remarriage
content: Aisha told the Prophet that her ex-husband Rifa'a had divorced her three times. She was now married to Abdur-Rahman bin Az-Zubair, but she showed the Prophet a piece of cloth from her clothes as if to say 'my new husband is poor'. Abu Bakr was with the Prophet and Khalid Ibn Sa'id bin Al-As was waiting outside. Khalid told Abu Bakr to speak up against Aisha for saying this in front of the Prophet, but the Prophet just smiled and said that Aisha wanted to go back to Rifa'a unless she had a sexual relationship with Abdur-Rahman.

title: Umar Meets the Prophet
content: One day, Umar asked permission to see the Prophet. Some women from the Quraishi tribe were with him, asking for more money. When Umar arrived, they quickly hid behind a screen. The Prophet (ﷺ) was smiling when he let Umar in. Umar said, 'May Allah always keep you smiling.' The Prophet (ﷺ) replied, 'I'm surprised these women are afraid of me, not you.' Umar turned to them and said, 'You should be afraid of the Prophet, not me!' They explained that they were scared because Umar was harsher than the Prophet. The Prophet (ﷺ) then said, 'Whenever Satan sees you doing something good, he tries to find a different path to follow.'

title: Conquering Ta'if
content: Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) and his companions were trying to conquer the city of Ta'if. He told them they would return to Medina if Allah wanted. Some companions said they wouldn't leave until they conquered it. The Prophet (ﷺ) prepared for battle. They fought hard, but got hurt badly. Next day, the Prophet said again that they might go back to Medina, but this time his companions didn't say anything. The Prophet (ﷺ) smiled.

title: Fasting in Ramadan
content: A man came to the Prophet and said he had broken his fast by having sex with his wife. The Prophet (ﷺ) told him to free a slave, but the man couldn't afford it. Then he was asked to fast for two months, but that was too hard. Finally, he was told to feed sixty poor people, but he didn't have enough food. A big basket of dates arrived, and the Prophet said to give them away in charity. The man said there wasn't anyone poorer than him, so the Prophet smiled and said to feed his own family with the dates.

title: The Prophet's Robe is Pulled
content: The Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) was wearing a special sheet with a thick border. A Bedouin man caught up to him and grabbed his robe, pulling it hard. I saw that the edge of the robe had left a mark on the Prophet's shoulder because of the force used. The Bedouin asked the Prophet for some food from Allah's property. The Prophet (ﷺ) smiled and told them to give him something.

title: Prophet's Kindness to Jarir
content: Jarir said the Prophet never stopped me from visiting him since I became Muslim. Whenever he saw me, he would smile and welcome me. One day, I told him I couldn't ride horses well. He put his hand on my chest and said, 'God, make him strong and guide him.'

title: The Prophet's Kindness to Jarir
content: Jarir said the Prophet never stopped him from visiting. When they met, the Prophet would smile. Jarir told the Prophet he was not good at riding horses. The Prophet (ﷺ) put his hand on Jarir's chest and prayed: 'Make him strong and guide him'.

title: Bathing after a Wet Dream
content: Um Sulaim asked the Prophet if a woman needs to take a bath after having a wet dream. The Prophet (ﷺ) said yes, if she notices discharge. Um Salama laughed and asked how a son can resemble his mother if women don't get nocturnal discharges.

title: Prophet Muhammad's Laugh
content: I never saw the Prophet laugh so much that you could see his tongue. He usually just smiled.

title: Rain for a Drought
content: A man came to the Prophet while he was giving a sermon in Medina. The man asked the Prophet to pray for rain because there wasn't enough water. The Prophet (ﷺ) looked up at the sky and saw no clouds, but then he prayed for rain anyway. Clouds gathered and it started raining heavily. Water flowed through the valleys of Medina. It rained for two weeks until the next Friday. Then another man stood up during the sermon and said, 'We're drowning! Please stop the rain!' The Prophet (ﷺ) smiled and said, 'O Allah, let it rain around us, not on top of us.' The clouds moved away from Medina and it rained on the surrounding areas, but not in Medina itself.

title: Truthfulness Leads to Paradise
content: The Prophet (ﷺ) said: 'Being truthful leads to being good. Being good leads to going to Heaven. A person keeps telling the truth until they become a honest person. Lying leads to bad behavior, and bad behavior leads to Hell. A person can keep lying until it's written in their record that they are a liar.'

title: Signs of a Hypocrite
content: Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) said: A hypocrite has three signs. They lie when they talk. They don't keep their promises. And if you trust them with something, they'll be dishonest.

title: Two Men in a Dream
content: The Prophet (ﷺ) saw two men in a dream. They said that the man whose cheek was torn away from his mouth to his ear was a liar who spread false information. He will be punished like this until the Day of Resurrection.

title: Ibn Um Abd's Behavior
content: Hudhaifa said that Ibn Um Abd looked like the Prophet when he was outside. He seemed very pious and calm. But we don't know how he acted with his family at home.

title: Best Talk and Guidance
content: Abdullah said that the best thing to talk about is the Quran. The best way to be guided is by following Muhammad 's (ﷺ) teachings.

title: Allah's Patience is Unmatched
content: The Prophet (ﷺ) said: Allah is more patient than anyone else. He hears people saying things that are not true about Him, but He still gives them good health and provides for their needs.

title: Prophet's Fair Distribution
content: The Prophet (ﷺ) divided some food among his companions. A man from the Ansar said that Allah was not pleased with this distribution. I told the Prophet about it, but he got very angry and his face changed color. He then reminded me that even Moses faced more harm than this, yet he remained patient.

title: The Prophet's Sermon
content: The Prophet (ﷺ) did something and allowed his people to do it too. But some people didn't follow him. When he found out, he gave a sermon. He said: 'What's wrong with those who don't do what I do? I know Allah better than they do, and I'm more afraid of Him than they are.'

title: Prophet Muhammad's Shyness
content: Abu Sa'id Al-Khudri said: The Prophet (ﷺ) was very shy. If he saw something he didn't like, we could see it on his face.

title: Don't Call Your Brother Disbeliever
content: Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) said: If a man calls his brother a disbeliever, then one of them is indeed a disbeliever.

title: Don't Call Your Brother a Disbeliever
content: 'Abdullah bin 'Umar said the Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) said: If someone calls another Muslim a disbeliever, then one of them is actually speaking the truth.

title: Consequences of False Oaths
content: The Prophet (ﷺ) said: If someone swears by another religion instead of Islam and lies, they will be treated as if their oath is true. Anyone who hurts themselves with something will face the same punishment in Hell. Calling a Muslim bad names is like killing them. Accusing a Muslim of not believing in God is also like killing them.

title: Mu`adh Accuses a Man
content: Jabir bin Abdullah told us that Mu`adh prayed with the Prophet and then led his people in prayer. One day, he recited Surat-al-Baqara to them. A man left the row of praying people and offered a separate prayer. When Mu`adh found out, he said the man was a hypocrite. The man heard this and went to the Prophet. He explained that he worked hard with his hands and irrigated his farm with camels. Last night, Mu`adh led them in prayer and recited Surat-al-Baqara, so the man offered his own separate prayer. Because of this, Mu`adh accused him of being a hypocrite. The Prophet (ﷺ) called Mu`adh and said three times: 'Don't put people to the test by accusing them of being hypocrites. Instead, recite short chapters like Surah Al-Shams or Surah Al-A'la.'

title: Correcting Sworn Oaths
content: The Prophet (ﷺ) said: If you swear by mistake using false gods like Al-Lat and Al-Uzza, say 'Only Allah is worthy of worship.' And if you invite friends to gamble, give charity to make up for it.

title: Swearing by Parents
content: Ibn Umar saw Umar with a group of people. He was swearing by his father. The Prophet (ﷺ) called them and said, 'Allah doesn't want you to swear by your parents. If you need to make an oath, use Allah's name or stay quiet.'

title: Prophet Muhammad Destroys Pictures
content: One day, Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) entered my home. He saw a curtain with pictures of animals on it. He got angry and tore the curtain into pieces. Then he said: 'Those who make such pictures will be punished severely on Judgment Day.'

title: Don't Dislike Congregational Prayer
content: A man told the Prophet that he didn't want to pray in the morning because another person would lead them in a long prayer. The Prophet (ﷺ) got upset and said, 'Some of you are making others dislike praying together. When leading prayers, don't make it too long, because some people may be sick or old.'

title: Don't Spit During Prayer
content: The Prophet (ﷺ) was praying when he saw spit on the wall in front of him. He wiped it away with his hand and said, 'When you pray, don't spit in front of you because Allah is facing you.'

title: Lost Property Rules
content: A man asked the Prophet about what to do with lost property. The Prophet (ﷺ) said that if you find something, announce it publicly for a year. If you remember where it came from, you can keep it and spend its value. But if the owner comes back, give them their property back. For a lost sheep or goat, you can take it because it might belong to someone else. However, if you find a camel, leave it alone because it has food and water with it until its owner finds it.

title: Praying in a Small Room
content: Zaid bin Thabit said that the Prophet made a small room with a palm leaf mat. He prayed there one night, and some men joined him. The next night, they came again to pray, but the Prophet was late. They knocked on the door, and he came out angry. He said that he thought this prayer might be required for everyone. So, he told them to pray at home instead of in the mosque, except for the regular prayers.

title: Controlling Anger is Strength
content: Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) said: The strong person isn't the one who beats others up. A strong person controls their anger and stays calm.

title: Two Men Argue in Front of the Prophet
content: Two men were arguing with each other in front of the Prophet. One man was very angry and his face turned red. The Prophet (ﷺ) said, 'If this man says

title: Don't Get Angry Easily
content: A man asked the Prophet for advice. The Prophet (ﷺ) said, 'Try not to get angry and furious.' The man asked again, and the Prophet gave the same answer: 'Try not to get angry and furious'.

title: Pious Shyness Brings Good
content: Imran bin Husain said the Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) said: 'Being shy of doing something wrong is good.' Bashir bin Ka'b said, 'It's written that shyness brings seriousness and peace of mind.' Imran replied, 'I'm telling you what the Prophet said, not my book.'

title: Importance of Modesty
content: Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) saw a man scolding his brother for being too shy. The Prophet (ﷺ) said, 'Leave him alone. Being humble is part of having faith.'

title: Prophet's Modesty
content: Abu Sa'id said the Prophet was more shy about doing something wrong than a young woman who is not married and keeps to herself.

title: Shyness is a Blessing
content: The Prophet (ﷺ) said that one of the sayings of early Prophets is: 'If you don't feel ashamed, do whatever you like.'

title: Wet Dreams and Bathing
content: Um Sulaim asked the Prophet: 'If a woman has a wet dream at night, does she need to take a bath?' The Prophet (ﷺ) replied: 'Yes, if she notices any discharge.'

title: Believer's Example
content: The Prophet (ﷺ) said that a believer is like a green tree with leaves that don't fall. People asked what kind of tree it was, but he didn't answer. Later, the Prophet said it was a date-palm tree.

title: A Woman Offers Herself
content: A woman came to the Prophet and said, 'Will you marry me?' Anas thought she was being shameless. But the Prophet didn't think so. He said that this woman was better than Anas's own daughter because she had offered herself to him for marriage.

title: Treat People with Kindness
content: When the Prophet sent Abu Musa and Mu`adh to Yemen, he told them: 'Make things easy for people. Don't make it hard for them. Give them good news and don't make them dislike doing good deeds. Work together and listen to each other.' Abu Musa asked about a drink made from honey and another from barley. The Prophet (ﷺ) said: 'All drinks that get you drunk are forbidden'.

title: Be Kind to People
content: The Prophet (ﷺ) said: 'Make things easy for people. Don't make it hard for them. Give them good news and don't push them away.'

title: Allah's Messenger and Easier Choice
content: Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) would choose the easier option if it wasn't against Islamic law. But if something was wrong, he wouldn't do it. He only took revenge when someone broke Allah's rules.

title: Abu Barza's Prayer Interrupted
content: We were in a city near a dried-up river. Abu Barza came on horseback and started praying, but then let his horse go free. The horse ran away, so Abu Barza stopped praying and chased after it until he caught it. He brought the horse back and continued his prayer. A man from our group said, 'Look at this old man! He left his prayer for a horse.' Abu Barza replied, 'My house is far away, and if I'd kept praying, I wouldn't have reached home till night.' Abu Barza told us that he had been with the Prophet and saw how kind and understanding he was.

title: Don't Beat the Urinator
content: Abu Huraira said that a man urinated in the mosque. The people wanted to hit him. But Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) told them to leave him alone and pour water over the spot where he had urinated. He then said, 'You were sent to make things easy for people, not hard.'

title: Prophet's Friendly Nature
content: Anas bin Malik said that the Prophet would often play with him and his friends. He'd ask one of them, 'What did the Nughair bird do?'

title: Aisha and her Dolls
content: `Aisha used to play with dolls in front of the Prophet. When he came into the room, her friends would hide. But the Prophet would call them to join in and play with `Aisha.

title: The Prophet's Gentle Manners
content: A man asked to see the Prophet. The Prophet (ﷺ) said he could come in, but then spoke to him kindly when he arrived. Aisha was surprised by this contrast and asked why. The Prophet (ﷺ) explained that some people are disliked because of their bad language.

title: Gift of Cloaks Distributed
content: The Prophet (ﷺ) received some gifts with silk cloaks and gold buttons. He gave them to his companions and kept one for Makhrama. When Makhrama came, the Prophet said, 'I saved this one for you.'

title: Don't Get Stung Twice
content: The Prophet (ﷺ) said, 'A believer is not hurt twice by the same problem.'

title: Balance Your Fasting
content: The Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) visited me and said, 'I've heard you pray all night and fast every day.' I replied, 'Yes, that's true.' He told me not to do this. Instead, he advised me to pray at night but also get some rest. He said my body needs time off too, just like my eyes need rest, guests need food, and my wife needs attention. He suggested fasting for three days a month because it's enough to earn good rewards. If I insisted on more, he warned me that the rules would become stricter. I kept asking if I could fast even more, so he told me to fast like Prophet David did: half of each year.

title: Treat Your Guest with Respect
content: If you believe in Allah and the Last Day, be kind to your guests. Give them good food for a night and a day. If you give them food for three days, that's like giving charity. Don't stay too long as a guest so you don't cause trouble for your host. Also, only say good things or keep quiet.

title: Treat Your Neighbors Well
content: The Prophet (ﷺ) said: If you believe in Allah and the Day of Judgment, don't hurt your neighbors. Show kindness to guests who visit you. Only say good things or stay quiet.

title: Guest Rights in Islam
content: We asked the Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) about what to do when we visit people and they don't treat us well. He said: 'If you stay with someone who treats you kindly, be grateful. But if they don't, take what's rightfully yours as a guest.'

title: Treat Your Guest Well
content: The Prophet (ﷺ) said: If you believe in Allah and the Day of Judgment, be kind to your guests. Show them respect and generosity. Also, take care of your family relationships. Be good to those who are related to you. And when talking to others, only say something good or stay quiet.

title: Abu Darda' and Salman
content: The Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) told Abu Juhaifa to be friends with Salman. Salman visited Abu Darda', who was dressed in old clothes, and asked why he wasn't taking care of himself. Abu Darda said his friend didn't like fancy things. When they ate together, Abu Darda said he was fasting, but Salman wouldn't eat unless he did too. At night, Abu Darda got up for prayer three times, but Salman told him to sleep each time. Finally, they both prayed together and Salman reminded Abu Darda that God, his own soul, and his family all have rights over him.

title: Abu Bakr's Guests
content: Abu Bakr invited some people to his house and told me to take care of them. He said he was going to visit the Prophet, so I should serve them first. They asked for Abu Bakr, but I told them to eat because they were hungry. They refused, saying they wouldn't eat until Abu Bakr arrived. When Abu Bakr came back, they told him what happened. He called me three times, and when I finally answered, he asked about the guests. They said I had brought them food, so Abu Bakr decided not to eat that night unless his guests did first. His guests also refused to eat until Abu Bakr ate with them. Abu Bakr then put his hand in their meal and said 'In the name of Allah.' He started eating, and so did his guests.

title: Abu Bakr's Guest Night
content: One night Abu Bakr visited the Prophet. His wife was worried because their guest had refused to eat dinner. Abu Bakr got angry and said some bad words. He thought it was Satan's fault that the food wasn't being eaten. The Prophet (ﷺ) asked for the leftover food and ate with his guests. To everyone's surprise, the amount of food didn't decrease even though they were eating more.

title: Murder at Khaibar
content: `Abdullah bin Sahl and Muhaiyisa went to Khaibar. They were separated in the date-palm gardens, but `Abdullah was killed. His friends, including his brother `Abdur-Rahman, came to the Prophet to talk about what happened. The Prophet (ﷺ) asked them if they wanted to take an oath that would allow them to get money for their friend's death. But then he said maybe 50 Jews could take a different oath and disagree with theirs. The friends were worried because the Jews might lie in their oath. So, the Prophet paid the money himself.

title: Murder at Khaibar
content: Two friends, Abdullah and Muhaiyisa, went to a garden in Khaibar. Abdullah was killed. The other two friends, Abdur-Rahman, Huwaiyisa, and Muhaiyisa, told the Prophet about what happened. The Prophet (ﷺ) said for the older one to speak first. They explained that they didn't see who killed Abdullah. The Prophet (ﷺ) suggested fifty of them take an oath so they could get money for Abdullah's death. But the friends were worried because the Jews would likely lie under oath. The Prophet (ﷺ) then paid the money himself.

title: Date Palm Tree Like a Muslim
content: The Prophet (ﷺ) said to Ibn Umar, 'Tell me about a tree that always gives fruit and never loses its leaves.' Ibn Umar thought of the date palm tree but was shy because Abu Bakr and Umar were there. The Prophet (ﷺ) then said, 'It's the date palm tree.' When Ibn Umar went out with his father, he asked him if it was correct to think the date palm tree was like a Muslim. His father replied that it would have been even better if he had spoken up.

title: Poetry Can Hold Wisdom
content: Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) said that some poems can have useful ideas and teachings.

title: Prophet's Injury in Allah's Cause
content: Jundub said the Prophet was walking when a stone hit his foot. He stumbled and hurt his toe. The Prophet (ﷺ) then said, 'You're just one small part of me that got hurt for Allah's sake.'

title: Labid's True Words
content: Abu Huraira said the Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) said that Labid, a poet, once said something true. He said everything in this world will eventually disappear except for Allah. Umaiya bin Abi As-Salt was close to becoming Muslim.

title: 'Amir's Poetry and Sacrifice
content: We were on a trip with the Prophet to Khaibar. A man asked Amir bin Al-Aqwa, 'Can we hear your poetry?' Amir was a poet and started reciting for us. He said, 'Without Allah, we wouldn't be guided or give charity or pray.' He asked Allah to forgive them and make their feet firm when facing the enemy. The Prophet (ﷺ) saw him and said, 'May Allah have mercy on him.' When we reached Khaibar, we besieged them but were very hungry. Allah helped us win the battle. After winning, people made fires for cooking donkey meat. The Prophet (ﷺ) told them to throw away the meat and break the pots. A man asked if they could wash the pots instead. During the battle, Amir's sword turned back and hit his knee, killing him. When we returned, I was pale because people said all of Amir's good deeds were cancelled out. The Prophet (ﷺ) said that wasn't true. He said Amir would get double reward in Jannah for being a hard worker and devoted fighter.

title: The Prophet's Gentle Warning
content: One day, the Prophet visited some of his wives. He saw Um Sulaim and said to her servant Anjasha, 'Be gentle with the camels. They're carrying delicate things.' If someone else had spoken like that, people would have scolded them for being silly.

title: Hassan bin Thabit and Poetry
content: Hassan asked the Prophet if he could make fun of non-Muslims in his poetry. The Prophet (ﷺ) said, 'What about my family?' Hassan replied that he would take the Prophet out of them like a hair is removed from dough. Later, `Aisha told her father not to insult Hassan because he used to defend the Prophet.

title: Prophet's Nighttime Worship
content: The Prophet (ﷺ) said: A Muslim brother of yours who does not speak badly will be with Allah's Messenger (ﷺ). He meant Ibn Rawaha. The Prophet (ﷺ) would wake up early to recite the Quran. He guided us and gave us light when we were lost. Our hearts are sure that what he says will happen. He doesn't sleep at night because he is busy praying to Allah while others are sleeping.

title: Abu Huraira's Answer
content: Hassan bin Thabit asked Abu Huraira if he had heard the Prophet say: 'O Hassan, speak on my behalf. O Allah, help him with Gabriel.' Abu Huraira said yes.

title: Encourage Hassan to Write Poetry
content: The Prophet (ﷺ) told Al-Bara that he had said to Hassan: 'Use your poetry to tease the pagans, and Gabriel is with you.'

title: Poetry vs. Pus in the Body
content: The Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) said it's better for a person to have pus inside their body than to fill it with poetry.

title: Poetry is Better Than Illness
content: The Prophet (ﷺ) said: It's better for you to have pus inside your body that can kill you than to be full of poetry. He wanted us to know that loving and reciting poetry too much is not good.

title: Aisha's Decision on Her Uncle
content: Aisha was asked by Abu Al-Qu'ais to visit her after a new rule about women covering themselves was revealed. Aisha said she wouldn't let him in unless the Prophet agreed, because it wasn't actually his wife who had nursed her as a baby, but another woman. The Prophet (ﷺ) came and explained that Abu Al-Qu'ais is like an uncle to Aisha because of the nursing relationship, so he should be allowed to visit.

title: Prophet's Advice to Safiya
content: After the Hajj, Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) saw Safiya at her tent. She was sad because she had her period. He asked if she had done a special walk around the Kaaba on the day of sacrifice. When she said yes, he told her it was okay to leave with him.

title: Um Hani Visits Prophet Muhammad
content: I visited the Prophet in Mecca after it was conquered. He was taking a bath with his daughter Fatima covering him. I greeted him and he said, 'Who is there?' I replied, 'It's me, Um Hani.' After bathing, he stood up and prayed while wearing one garment. When he finished praying, I told him about my brother who threatened to harm someone I was protecting. The Prophet (ﷺ) said, 'We will protect the person you are helping.' This happened in the morning.

title: Ride the Sacrificial Camel
content: Anas narrated that the Prophet saw a man with a camel meant for sacrifice. He told the man to ride it, but the man said it was a special camel and couldn't be ridden. The Prophet (ﷺ) repeated his order, then added, 'It's bad luck if you don't.'

title: Riding a Sacrificial Camel
content: Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) saw a man leading a camel meant for sacrifice. He told the man to ride on it. The man said, 'It's a sacrificial camel.' The Prophet (ﷺ) replied, 'Still, ride on it, may you be punished if you don't!'

title: Traveling with Women
content: Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) was on a journey. He had a slave named Anjasha who was driving the camels very fast. There were women riding on those camels. The Prophet (ﷺ) said to Anjasha, 'Slow down, Anjasha! Be gentle with the glass vessels' (the women).

title: Praising Others in Front of the Prophet
content: A man praised someone to the Prophet. The Prophet (ﷺ) said three times, 'You've hurt your brother!' He then said, 'If you must praise someone, say what you think about them and leave it up to Allah to know their true character.'

title: Dhul Khawaisira's Warning
content: One day, the Prophet was dividing some spoils among his followers. A man from Bani Tamim said to him, 'Act justly.' The Prophet (ﷺ) replied, 'Who else would act justly if I don't?' Umar wanted to kill the man for speaking out of turn, but the Prophet stopped him. He explained that this man and his friends looked very pious on the outside, but they would leave Islam when disagreements arose among Muslims. They would be recognized by a distinctive sign: one hand would look like a woman's breast or a loose lump of flesh.

title: Fasting and Forgiveness
content: A man came to the Prophet. He said he had broken his fast in Ramadan by having sex with his wife. The Prophet (ﷺ) told him to free a slave, but the man couldn't afford it. Then the Prophet asked him to fast for two months, but the man said that was too hard. Finally, the Prophet said to feed sixty poor people. But the man didn't have enough food. Later, some dates were brought to the Prophet and he told the man to give them away in charity. The man said his family needed it most. The Prophet (ﷺ) smiled and said to take the dates.

title: Emigration and Zakat
content: A man asked the Prophet: 'What is emigration?' The Prophet (ﷺ) said: 'It's a big decision. Do you have camels? And do you pay their tax?' The man said: 'Yes.' The Prophet (ﷺ) said: 'Keep doing that, and Allah will not waste your good deeds'.

title: Don't Fight Each Other
content: The Prophet (ﷺ) said: 'Woe to you' or 'May Allah have mercy on you.' Don't become disbelievers by killing each other after I'm gone.

title: Preparing for the End
content: A bedouin came to the Prophet and asked when the Day of Judgment would come. The Prophet (ﷺ) replied, 'What have you prepared for it?' The bedouin said he loved Allah and the Prophet. The Prophet (ﷺ) said, 'You will be with those you love.' We were happy to hear this. A slave passed by who was about my age. The Prophet (ﷺ) said that if the slave lived long, he would not live a very old life, but the Day of Judgment would still come.

title: Love is a Bond
content: The Prophet (ﷺ) said: 'Everyone will be with those they love.'

title: Love and Good Deeds
content: A man asked the Prophet: 'What if someone loves good people but can't do good deeds like them?' The Prophet (ﷺ) replied, 'You will be with those you love'.

title: Love and Good Deeds
content: Abu Musa asked the Prophet: 'Can a person love others but not be like them in good actions?' The Prophet (ﷺ) said, 'Everyone will be with those they love.'

title: Preparing for the Hour
content: A man asked the Prophet when the Day of Judgment would come. The Prophet (ﷺ) asked him what he had prepared for that day in terms of prayer, fasting, and charity. The man said he hadn't done much but loved Allah and the Prophet. The Prophet (ﷺ) replied that on that day, he would be with those he loved.

title: What is the Dukh?
content: Ibn 'Abbas said that the Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) asked him: 'I have been thinking about something. What do you think it is?' Ibn Saiyad replied, 'It's Ad-Dukh.' The Prophet (ﷺ) then said, 'No, it's Ikhsa'.

title: Meeting with Ibn Saiyad
content: `Umar and the Prophet went to see a man named Ibn Saiyad. They found him playing with other boys in a fort. The Prophet (ﷺ) gently touched Ibn Saiyad's back and asked if he believed that the Prophet was Allah's Messenger (ﷺ). Ibn Saiyad said yes, but then asked the Prophet if he believed in him. The Prophet (ﷺ) said no, because only Allah can send Messengers. Ibn Saiyad said some people visit him who are true or false. The Prophet (ﷺ) told him this made sense, and said he had a secret thought about him. Ibn Saiyad said it was something called Ad-Dukh, but the Prophet said that was not right. `Umar wanted to hurt Ibn Saiyad because he might be the Dajjal (a bad person), but the Prophet stopped him. Later, the Prophet and another man went back to see Ibn Saiyad in a garden. The Prophet (ﷺ) hid behind some palm trees so he could listen without being seen. He heard Ibn Saiyad talking to himself, and his mother saw the Prophet and told Ibn Saiyad. The Prophet (ﷺ) wanted to hear more from Ibn Saiyad, but his mother's warning stopped him.

title: Prophet's Advice to Visitors
content: When a group from the tribe of Ar-Rabi'a visited the Prophet, he welcomed them and said they would not be ashamed or regret their visit. They asked for something good to do so they could enter Paradise. The Prophet (ﷺ) replied: 'Do four things: pray regularly, give charity, fast during Ramadan, and share one-fifth of any war spoils you get. And don't drink from special cups.'

title: Betrayers on Judgement Day
content: The Prophet (ﷺ) said that on the Day of Resurrection, a flag will be raised for every person who has betrayed others. Their name and family will be announced publicly as a betrayer.

title: Betrayers on Judgement Day
content: Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) said: On the Day of Resurrection, a flag will be raised for every person who betrays others. It will show their name and the names of their parents, announcing publicly that they are betrayers.

title: Don't Say Negative Things
content: Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) said to Aisha: Don't say 'I'm bad' about yourself. Instead, say 'I made a mistake'.

title: Don't Say This About Yourself
content: The Prophet (ﷺ) said: Don't say 'My soul is ruined'. Instead, say 'I've been weak' or 'I've made a mistake'.

title: Allah's Time is in His Hands
content: Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) said that Allah told him, 'Adam's children often complain about time. But I am the one who controls time - it is in My power to give you day and night'.

title: Don't Misname Grapes
content: Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) said: Don't call grapes 'Al-Karm' and don't say 'Khaibat-ad-Dahri'. Allah is the one who gives life and death.

title: What is Al-Karim?
content: Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) said that Al-Karm means the heart of a believer. It's not just about being generous, it's about having a kind and compassionate heart like a true Muslim.

title: Ali's Story About Sa'd
