content: I, Ali, never heard the Prophet say 'Let my father and mother be sacrificed for you' to anyone except Sa'd. I did hear him say it to Sa'd during a battle, saying 'Throw arrows! Let my father and mother be sacrificed for you!'

title: Prophet's Journey to Medina
content: Anas bin Malik and Abu Talha were traveling with the Prophet. Safiya, the Prophet's wife, was riding behind him on a camel. The camel's foot slipped, and both the Prophet and Safiya fell down. Abu Talha quickly jumped off his camel and helped the Prophet. He asked if the Prophet was hurt, but he said no. Instead, he told Abu Talha to take care of Safiya. Abu Talha covered her with his garment and prepared their camel. They all continued their journey until they saw Medina. The Prophet (ﷺ) then said, 'We are returning with repentance, worshiping our Lord, and praising Him.' He repeated these words as they entered the city.

title: Naming a Newborn Son
content: Jabir said: A man in our group had a baby boy. They named him Al-Qasim. We told the father, 'We won't call you Abu-l-Qasim or treat you differently because of this name.' The Prophet (ﷺ) was informed about what we said. He then told the father, 'Name your son Abdur-Rahman instead'.

title: Naming Children after the Prophet
content: A man asked the Prophet about naming himself 'Abu-l-Qasim'. The Prophet (ﷺ) said: 'You can name yourselves by my name, but don't call yourself

title: Prophet's Advice on Names
content: The Prophet (ﷺ) said: 'You can name yourselves after me, but don't use my special nickname.'

title: Naming a Child
content: A man had a baby boy and named him Al-Qasim. People said they wouldn't call him Abul-l-Qasim, which is what his father wanted. The father told the Prophet about this. The Prophet (ﷺ) said to name the baby 'Abdur-Rahman'.

title: Changing a Name is Allowed
content: Hazn's father went to the Prophet and said his name was Hazn. The Prophet (ﷺ) asked if he wanted a new name, Sahl. But Hazn refused to change it. Since then, they have had some rough times.

title: Prophet Muhammad meets a baby
content: Sahl said: When Al-Mundhir was born, his father Abu Usaid brought him to the Prophet. The Prophet (ﷺ) put Al-Mundhir on his thigh while he worked with something in his hands. Abu Usaid asked someone to take the baby away. Later, the Prophet asked, 'Where is the boy?' Abu Usaid said, 'We sent him home.' The Prophet (ﷺ) said, 'What's his name?' Abu Usaid replied, 'His name is so-and-so.' The Prophet (ﷺ) said, 'No, his name is Al-Mundhir.' From then on, they called him Al-Mundhir.

title: Changing a Name for Piety
content: Abu Huraira said that the Prophet changed Zainab's original name from Barrah because people thought it meant she was showing off her piety. The Prophet (ﷺ) wanted to change it to something more meaningful.

title: Changing a Name
content: Hazn visited the Prophet. The Prophet (ﷺ) asked Hazn's name. Hazn said it was Hazn. The Prophet (ﷺ) said, 'You are Sahl.' Hazn refused to change his name. Since then, Hazn's family has had a tough character.

title: Ibrahim's Son and the Prophets
content: Isma`il asked Abi `Aufa if he had seen Ibrahim, the Prophet's son. Abi `Aufa said yes, but that Ibrahim died when he was very young. He explained that if there were another prophet after Muhammad (ﷺ), then his son would have lived longer.

title: Ibrahim's Wet Nurse in Heaven
content: When Ibrahim died, the Prophet said: 'There is a wet nurse for him in Paradise'.

title: Don't Use My Kuniya
content: Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) said to his followers: 'You can name yourselves after me, but don't use my special nickname. I'm Al-Qasim, which means I share Allah's blessings with you.'

title: Don't Impersonate Me
content: The Prophet (ﷺ) said: 'You can name your children after me. But don't use my special names. If you see me in a dream, it's really me. Satan can't pretend to be me. And if someone lies about something I said or did, they will go to Hell.'

title: Prophet Muhammad Names a Child
content: Abu Musa took his newborn son to the Prophet. The Prophet (ﷺ) named him Ibrahim and gave him a date fruit to suck on, which he had chewed himself first. He then prayed for Allah's blessing upon the child.

title: Death of Ibrahim bin Muhammad
content: Al-Mughira bin Shuba said that a solar eclipse happened on the day Prophet Muhammad 's (ﷺ) son, Ibrahim, died.

title: Prophet's Prayer for Help
content: When the Prophet stood up after bowing in prayer, he said: 'O Allah, protect Al-Walid bin Al-Walid and Salama bin Hisham and 'Aiyyash bin Abu Rabi'a. And help the weak believers in Makkah. Be hard on the tribe of Mudar. Send them years like those of Prophet Yusuf.'

title: Gabriel Sends Greetings
content: Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) said to Aisha: 'This is Gabriel sending his greetings to you.' Aisha replied: 'Peace, and Allah's Mercy be on him.' The Prophet (ﷺ) could see things that we couldn't.

title: Drive Slowly with Women
content: One day, Um Sulaim was in charge of the luggage on a trip. Anjashah, the Prophet's slave, was driving their camels very fast. The Prophet (ﷺ) told him, 'Slow down when you're carrying women.'

title: Prophet Muhammad's Good Character
content: The Prophet (ﷺ) was known for being the best person in character. My brother Abu Umar was a young boy who loved to play with his toy nightingale. When he visited the Prophet, he would ask the nightingale what it did. Sometimes, when it was time for prayer, the Prophet would get up and lead us in prayer. He would first clean the carpet where we were sitting by sweeping and spraying water on it.

title: Ali's Love for a Name
content: Ali liked being called 'Abu Turab'. The Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) was the first to give him this name. One day, Ali and his wife Fatima argued. He left their house and slept in the mosque near a wall. The Prophet (ﷺ) looked for him and found him lying there with dust on his back. The Prophet (ﷺ) gently cleaned off the dust and said, 'Get up, Abu Turab.'

title: The Worst Name on Judgement Day
content: Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) said: The worst name in Allah's sight on the Day of Resurrection is a man who calls himself 'King of Kings'.

title: The Most Awful Name
content: The Prophet (ﷺ) said that the worst name in Allah's sight is when someone calls themselves 'King of Kings'. This means they think they're above everyone else, but it's actually a sign of arrogance and pride.

title: Allah's Messenger Visits Sa'd
content: Usama bin Zaid said that the Prophet rode a donkey with a velvet sheet on it. Usama was behind him. They were visiting Sa'd bin 'Ubada, who was sick. Before they arrived, they passed by a group where Abdullah bin Ubai bin Salul was present. This happened before he became Muslim. In this group, there were Muslims, people who didn't believe in Allah, and Jews. When the donkey kicked up dust, Abdullah bin Ubai covered his nose with his garment and said, 'Don't make us dusty.' The Prophet (ﷺ) greeted them, got off the donkey, and invited them to become Muslim. He recited some of the Quran to them. Abdullah bin Ubai said, 'What you're saying is good if it's true. But please don't talk about this in our gatherings.' Abdullah bin Rawaha said, 'Yes, invite us when we're together.' The group started arguing and were almost fighting. The Prophet (ﷺ) stayed quiet until they calmed down. Then he got back on the donkey and went to visit Sa'd. When he arrived, he asked if Sa'd had heard what Abdullah bin Ubai had said. Sa'd said, 'Let my father be sacrificed for you! Forgive him.' He explained that Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) was sent at a time when people were planning to make Abdullah bin Ubai their leader. When Allah prevented this from happening, Abdullah bin Ubai felt choked and behaved badly. The Prophet (ﷺ) forgave him. It was the custom of the Prophet and his companions to forgive people who didn't believe in Allah, as Allah ordered them to be patient with those who annoyed them. After the battle of Badr, when Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) fought against the pagans and killed some of their leaders, Abdullah bin Ubai and others said, 'This matter has triumphed. So give the Prophet your pledge of allegiance.' They became Muslims.

title: Abu Talib's Place in Hell
content: Abbas asked the Prophet if he had helped Abu Talib. The Prophet (ﷺ) said yes, but that without him, Abu Talib would be in a worse place in Hell.

title: Drive Slowly with Care
content: One day, the Prophet was on a journey. The driver of his camels started making loud noises to make them go faster. The Prophet (ﷺ) told him, 'Be careful and drive slowly when carrying glass containers.' He then said, 'May Allah be merciful to you'.

title: Prophet's Advice on Travel
content: The Prophet (ﷺ) was traveling with his companions. A slave named Anjasha was singing to help the camels move faster. The Prophet (ﷺ) told him, 'Drive slowly, especially when women are riding.'

title: Prophet's Gentle Warning
content: The Prophet (ﷺ) had a camel driver named Anjasha. He told him to drive slowly and not hurt any weak women who might be carrying glass containers on the journey.

title: Medina Felt Fearful
content: Anas bin Malik said that Medina was feeling scared. The Prophet (ﷺ) rode a horse from Abu Talha to see what was happening. He couldn't find anything wrong, but the horse was very fast.

title: Prophet Muhammad on Fortune Tellers
content: Some people asked the Prophet about fortune tellers. He said they are liars. They said, 'But sometimes they say things that come true.' The Prophet (ﷺ) replied, 'Any truth they speak is just stolen from others and then mixed with a hundred lies by their helpers.

title: Angel's Visit to Prophet
content: Jabir bin Abdullah said that he heard the Prophet say: 'There was a time when I didn't receive any more messages from Allah. One day, while I was walking, I heard a voice coming from above. I looked up and saw the angel who had visited me in Hira cave sitting on a chair between the sky and the earth.'

title: Prophet's Midnight Prayer
content: Ibn Abbas stayed overnight at Maimuna's house. The Prophet (ﷺ) was there too. When it was late at night, the Prophet got up and looked towards the sky. He then recited a verse from the Quran: 'In creation of heavens and earth, and day and night, are signs for those who understand'.

title: Prophet Muhammad's Garden Visit
content: The Prophet (ﷺ) was in a garden in Medina. He had a stick and was slowly hitting the water with it. A man came to the gate and asked permission to enter. The Prophet (ﷺ) said, 'Let him in and tell him he'll go to Paradise.' I let Abu Bakr in and told him the good news. Another man came and asked permission. The Prophet (ﷺ) said, 'Let him in and tell him he'll go to Paradise.' It was Umar this time. Then another man came. The Prophet (ﷺ) sat up straight and said, 'Let him in and tell him he'll enter Paradise but something bad will happen to him.' I let Uthman in and told him the good news. He also told me that Allah would help him through it.

title: Good Deeds Lead to Destiny
content: We were with the Prophet in a funeral procession. He used a stick to scrape the ground and said: 'Each of you will go to either Paradise or Hell.' People asked if they should just rely on this. The Prophet (ﷺ) said, 'Keep doing good deeds because it's easy to do what leads you to your destiny.' He then read from the Quran: 'Those who give charity and are faithful to Allah'.

title: Wake Up for Prayer
content: One night, the Prophet woke up and said, 'Praise be to God! Many good things have been sent down, but also many problems. Who will wake up my wives so they can pray?' He meant his wives who were sleeping at home. The Prophet (ﷺ) added, 'A person may look great in this life, but actually be poor in the next.' Umar asked him if he had divorced his wives, and the Prophet said no.

title: The Prophet's Companion
content: Safiya bint Huyai went to the mosque where the Prophet was staying during Ramadan. She talked to him for a while at night, then left. The Prophet (ﷺ) got up to walk her home. When they reached the gate near Um Salama's house, two men greeted the Prophet and quickly walked ahead. The Prophet (ﷺ) said, 'Don't hurry.' They explained they didn't suspect anything wrong. He told them that Satan is always present in a person's body, trying to make bad thoughts appear.

title: Prophet Forbids Throwing Stones
content: The Prophet (ﷺ) said to Abdullah bin Mughaffal: Do not throw stones with your thumb and index or middle finger. This does not hunt animals or harm enemies, but it can hurt people by gouging out their eyes or breaking their teeth.

title: Sneezing and Praising Allah
content: Two men sneezed in front of the Prophet. He said 'May Allah be merciful to you' to one, but not the other. When asked why, he explained that one man praised Allah when he sneezed, but the other did not.

title: Prophet's Orders and Prohibitions
content: The Prophet (ﷺ) ordered us to do seven things: visit the sick, follow funeral processions, say 'May Allah be merciful' when someone sneezes, accept invitations, return greetings, help those being oppressed, and help others keep their promises. He also forbade us from wearing golden rings or bangles, silk clothes, Dibaj, Sundus, and Mayathir.

title: Sneezing and Yawning
content: The Prophet (ﷺ) said: Allah likes it when we sneeze. If someone sneezes, they should say 'Praise be to Allah'. When we hear this, we must reply with 'May Allah have mercy on you'. But yawning is from Satan. When we yawn and say 'Ah', Satan laughs at us. We should try not to yawn.

title: Sneezing in Islam
content: When someone sneezes, they should say 'Praise be to Allah'. Their friend or companion should then say 'May Allah show you mercy'. When the companion says this, the person who sneezed should respond with 'May Allah guide and improve your life'.

title: Two Men Sneezed Before Prophet
content: Anas said that two men sneezed in front of the Prophet. One man was told to say 'Alhamdulillah' (praise Allah), but the other wasn't. The second man asked why, and the Prophet said: 'The first man praised Allah when he sneezed, but you didn't.'

title: Sneezing and Yawning
content: The Prophet (ﷺ) said: Allah likes it when we sneeze. If someone sneezes, they should say thank you to Allah. This makes other Muslims happy too. But yawning is not good - it's from the devil. When you yawn, try to stop it because Satan laughs at us then.

title: Adam's Height and Greeting
content: The Prophet (ﷺ) said that Allah created Adam in His image, making him very tall - about 30 meters high. He told Adam to greet a group of angels and listen to their response. Adam greeted them with 'Peace be upon you', and they replied with 'Peace and Allah's Mercy be on you'. They added more words of mercy. The Prophet (ﷺ) said that people will enter Paradise looking like Adam, but since then, humans have been getting shorter.

title: Al-Fadl's Gaze at a Woman
content: Abdullah bin Abbas said that on the day of Eid al-Adha, Al-Fadl rode behind the Prophet. The Prophet (ﷺ) stopped to give verdicts. A woman from the tribe of Khath'am came and asked for the Prophet's decision. Al-Fadl looked at her because she was beautiful. The Prophet (ﷺ) noticed this and turned Al-Fadl's face away. She asked if it was okay for her to do Hajj on behalf of her old father who couldn't travel. The Prophet (ﷺ) said yes, it would be sufficient.

title: Respect the Road
content: The Prophet (ﷺ) said: 'Be careful not to sit on roads.' They asked, 'Why?' He replied, 'If you must sit, show respect by lowering your gaze, being kind to others, greeting those who pass by, and encouraging good behavior. Avoid harming anyone or doing anything bad.'

title: Prayer Greetings and Peace
content: When we prayed with the Prophet, we said: 'Peace be on Allah's worshipers, peace be on Gabriel, peace be on Michael.' After finishing his prayer, he turned to us and said, 'Allah is Peace itself. When you sit in prayer, say: 'We praise Allah, we send blessings on Him, and we thank Him for His good gift. Peace be on you, O Prophet, and may Allah's mercy and blessings be with you.' Then say: 'I declare that there is no god but Allah, and I confirm that Muhammad (ﷺ) is His servant and messenger.' After this, you can choose any other prayer or words you want to say.

title: Greeting Others with Respect
content: The Prophet (ﷺ) said, 'Young people should greet older people. People passing by should say hello to those sitting down. A small group of people should greet a larger group of people.'

title: Greeting Others in Islam
content: The Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) said: When you're riding a horse or camel, greet someone who's walking. If you're walking, greet someone who's sitting down. And if there are fewer people with you, greet the larger group.

title: Greeting Others on the Road
content: Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) said: When you're riding a horse or a camel, greet someone who is walking. If you're walking, greet someone who is sitting down. And if there are fewer people with you, greet those who have more people with them.

title: Respect for Older People
content: Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) said: When you meet someone older than you, greet them first. If you're walking and see someone sitting, say hello to them. And if there are a few of you meeting a larger group, be polite and greet the bigger group.

title: Allah's Messenger's Orders
content: Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) ordered us to do seven things: visit the sick when they're ill, follow funerals to show respect, say 'peace be upon you' when someone sneezes, help people who are weak or being treated unfairly, spread greetings like 'as-salamu alaykum', and help others keep their promises. He also told us not to use silver cups for drinking, wear gold rings, ride on fancy saddles made of silk, or wear clothes made from thick silk, Qassiy, or Istabraq.

title: Best Islamic Traits
content: A man asked the Prophet what good qualities a Muslim should have. The Prophet (ﷺ) said to feed others and greet people you know and those you don't know.

title: Don't Ignore Your Brother
content: The Prophet (ﷺ) said: A Muslim should not ignore his brother for more than three days. If they meet, one of them should speak first to greet the other.

title: Anas' Story of Hijab
content: I was a boy when the Prophet moved to Medina. I served him for ten years and remember when Allah ordered men and women to be separated in mosques. This happened during the Prophet's wedding with Zainab bint Jahsh. After the meal, some guests stayed longer than they should have. The Prophet (ﷺ) went out twice to make sure they left, but they were still there. Then a verse from Allah was revealed, and the Prophet put up a screen between me and his family.

title: Prophet Muhammad's Home Etiquette
content: Anas said the Prophet married Zainab. People came to his home for a meal and then sat down chatting. The Prophet (ﷺ) wanted to get up, but they didn't stand up with him. He got up anyway, and some people left while others stayed sitting. When he returned, they still hadn't gotten up. I told the Prophet about this, so he went in alone. Allah revealed a verse saying: 'Don't enter the Prophet's homes without permission.'

title: Umar's Concern about Veiling
content: `Umar bin Al-Khattab often told the Prophet to make his wives wear veils. But the Prophet didn't do it. The Prophet 's (ﷺ) wives would go out at night to use the bathroom, but only in a specific area called Al-Manasi. One time, Sauda, a tall woman, went out and `Umar saw her. He said, 'I know who you are, Sauda!' He was worried about getting a new rule from Allah about women wearing veils. So Allah sent down a verse saying that women should cover themselves completely except for their eyes.

title: Looking without permission
content: A man looked through a hole into the Prophet's home while he was combing his hair. The Prophet (ﷺ) said he would have hurt the man if he had known. This is why we must ask for permission before entering someone else's space.

title: Prophet stands up for privacy
content: Anas bin Malik said: A man looked into the Prophet's room. The Prophet (ﷺ) stood up and held an arrowhead, as if he was about to hurt the man who had looked in on him.

title: Minor Sins: What Allah Has Written
content: Ibn Abbas said he never saw anything like 'lamam' (minor sins) than what Abu Huraira told him from the Prophet. The Prophet (ﷺ) said, 'Allah has written for Adam's children their share of sinning. Gazing at something you shouldn't is a kind of sin. Talking about something forbidden is also a sin. Your inner self can want and desire things that are not good. And your body parts will either agree with or deny these desires.'

title: How the Prophet Greeted People
content: Anas said that whenever the Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) greeted someone, he would say 'As-salamu alaykum' three times. If he wanted to repeat something, he would do it three times too.

title: Abu Musa's Permission Request
content: Abu Sa'id was with the Ansar when Abu Musa arrived looking worried. He said he asked permission to see Umar three times, but wasn't allowed in. Umar asked why he didn't enter. Abu Musa explained that he had heard from the Prophet: 'If you ask permission three times and it's not given, go back.' Umar decided to find witnesses for this. Abu Musa went to the Ansar and asked if anyone remembered the Prophet saying this. Ubai bin Ka'b said only the youngest person should go with him as a witness. Abu Sa'id was the youngest, so he went with Abu Musa to tell Umar what the Prophet had said.

title: Allah's Messenger Visits Abu Huraira
content: Abu Huraira was with Allah's Messenger (ﷺ). He found milk in a basin and said to me, 'Go and call the people of Suffa.' I invited them and they came.

title: Greeting the Young Boys
content: Anas bin Malik saw some boys and said hello to them. He reminded them that the Prophet used to do the same when he met young people.

title: Friday Meal Tradition
content: Sahl said he and his friends loved Fridays. I asked him why. He said there was a kind old woman who lived nearby. She would cook a special meal using silq (a type of vegetable) and barley, and give it to them after the Friday prayer. They felt happy because they got food together as a community.

title: Gabriel Sends Greetings
content: Aisha said to the Prophet: 'You see Gabriel?' The Prophet (ﷺ) replied: 'Yes, he's sending his greetings.' Aisha said: 'Peace be on him and Allah's Mercy.'

title: Consulting the Prophet
content: Jabir visited the Prophet. He wanted advice about his father's debt. When Jabir knocked on the door, the Prophet asked who it was. Jabir said 'I'. The Prophet (ﷺ) repeated 'I' as if he didn't like it.

title: Prophet Muhammad Teaches Prayer
content: A man came into the mosque where Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) was sitting. He prayed and then greeted the Prophet. The Prophet (ﷺ) told him to go back and pray again because he hadn't done it right. The man did this a few times, but still didn't do it correctly. So he asked the Prophet to teach him how to pray properly. The Prophet (ﷺ) said: 'First, wash your hands and face before praying. Then turn towards the Kaaba in Mecca. Say

title: Raising Your Head in Prayer
content: The Prophet (ﷺ) said: 'And then raise your head till you feel at ease while sitting.'

title: Gabriel Sends Greetings
content: Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) said to Aisha: 'Gabriel sends greetings to you.' She replied: 'And on him be peace and God's mercy'.

title: The Prophet Visits Sa'd bin Ubada
content: Usama bin Zaid rode with the Prophet on a donkey. They had a soft sheet under the saddle. The Prophet (ﷺ) was going to visit Sa'd bin Ubada, who was sick. As they passed by a gathering of Muslims, Jews, and pagans, `Abdullah bin Ubai covered his nose with his sheet when dust from the donkey hit them. He asked the Prophet not to disturb their meeting. But `Abdullah bin Rawaha invited the Prophet to come and share what he wanted to say in their gathering. The people started arguing until they were about to fight. The Prophet (ﷺ) calmed them down, then rode away and visited Sa'd bin Ubada. Sa'd explained that `Abdullah bin Ubai was once chosen as leader but Allah gave the Prophet the truth instead. This made `Abdullah behave badly. The Prophet (ﷺ) excused him.

title: Ka'b bin Malik's Repentance
content: Abdullah bin Ka'b said he heard Ka'b bin Malik talking about not joining the battle of Tabuk. The Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) forbade everyone from speaking to them. Abdullah would greet the Prophet, but couldn't tell if he was responding or not for 50 nights. After a prayer, the Prophet announced that Allah had forgiven them.

title: The Prophet's Kindness to Jews
content: `Aisha said a group of Jews came to the Prophet. They said something rude, and I replied with the same thing. The Prophet (ﷺ) told me to calm down because Allah likes kindness in all situations.

title: Replying to Jewish Greetings
content: When the Jews greet us by saying 'Death be on you', we should reply with 'And also on you'.

title: Greeting People of the Scripture
content: The Prophet (ﷺ) said: If people who follow a different scripture greet you, say 'And on you' in reply.

title: Hatib's Letter to Mecca
content: Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) sent Ali, Zubair, and Abu Marthad on a mission. They found a woman carrying a letter from Hatib bin Abi Balta'a to the people of Mecca. The men asked her about the letter, but she denied having it. After searching her camel, they still couldn't find anything. But Ali was sure that Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) wouldn't lie. He threatened to take off her clothes if she didn't show them the letter. She finally brought out the letter and they took it back to the Prophet. The Prophet (ﷺ) asked Hatib why he did this. Hatib said he wanted to help his family in Mecca, just like other companions did. The Prophet (ﷺ) said that was okay. But when Umar saw the letter, he got angry and wanted to punish Hatib. The Prophet (ﷺ) stopped him, saying that Allah might have already decided where Hatib would go after death.

title: Abu Sufyan Meets Heraclius
content: Abu Sufyan bin Harb was with a group of Quraish traders in Sha'm. Heraclius called them to meet him. Abu Sufyan told Heraclius about the letter from Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ). When the letter was read, it said: 'In the name of Allah, the Merciful and Compassionate.' It continued: 'From Muhammad (ﷺ), a slave of Allah and His Messenger, to Heraclius, Chief of Byzantines. Peace be upon those who follow the right path...'

title: A Man Hides Money
content: Abu Hurairah said that the Prophet mentioned a man from Bani Israel who took a piece of wood. He made a hole in it and put one thousand Dinar inside, along with a letter to his friend. The Prophet (ﷺ) said this is what he did.

title: Sa'd Gives Judgment
content: Abu Sa'id said that the people of Quraiza agreed to accept a decision from Sa'd. The Prophet (ﷺ) called for Sa'd and he came. The Prophet (ﷺ) told them to stand up for their leader, Sa'd sat next to him. The Prophet (ﷺ) said these people have agreed to follow your judgment. Sa'd decided that the men should be killed and the women and children taken as prisoners. The Prophet (ﷺ) said this was a fair decision, like Allah's own judgment.

title: Companions Shook Hands
content: I asked Anas if the companions of the Prophet used to shake hands with each other. He said yes, they did.

title: Prophet Muhammad with Umar
content: The Prophet (ﷺ) was with us and he held the hand of Umar bin Al-Khattab.

title: Learning the Tashah-hud Prayer
content: Ibn Mas`ud said that Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) taught him how to say a special prayer called the Tashah-hud. This prayer says good things about Allah and sends peace to the Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ). It also says that only Allah is worthy of worship, and that Muhammad (ﷺ) is His messenger. When saying this prayer, you should send peace to the Prophet and to all good people who follow Allah.

title: Ali Asks the Prophet
content: Ali bin Abu Talib came out of the house where the Prophet was ill. People asked him how the Prophet was, and Ali said he was a bit better thanks to Allah's mercy. Al-Abbas took Ali's hand and said, 'Don't you see that the Prophet is dying? Within three days, you'll be under someone else's rule.' He thought they should ask the Prophet who would take over as leader. If it was them, great; if not, they'd ask the new leader to recommend them. Ali refused, saying they wouldn't ask the Prophet for the leadership and that people wouldn't give it to them anyway.

title: Mu`adh's Conversation with the Prophet
content: I was riding with the Prophet. He said to me, 'Do you know what Allah wants from us?' I replied, 'No.' He said, 'Allah wants us to worship Him alone and not share our worship with anyone else.' He asked again, 'Do you know what we get if we do that?' I said, 'No.' He said, 'If we worship Him alone, Allah promises not to punish us.'

title: Spending Wealth for Allah
content: Abu Dhar was walking with the Prophet in Medina. They saw the mountain of Uhud. The Prophet (ﷺ) said, 'I don't want a lot of gold like this mountain's worth. If I had it, I would spend it all within three days. One day's worth is for paying debts, and the rest goes to those who need it.' He showed how he would give some money to one person, then another, and another. The Prophet (ﷺ) said, 'Those with a lot of wealth will get less reward in the next life, unless they spend like this.' Then he told Abu Dhar to stay at his place until he came back. When the Prophet returned, he said that Gabriel had visited him. Gabriel told the Prophet that anyone who dies without worshiping anything but Allah goes straight to Paradise. Abu Dhar asked if it even mattered if someone had committed sins like adultery and theft. The Prophet (ﷺ) said yes, it still matters.

title: Respect Others' Seats
content: The Prophet (ﷺ) said: A man should not ask someone to get up from their seat so he can sit there. It's not necessary for him to take that seat.

title: Respect Each Other's Space
content: The Prophet (ﷺ) said that when someone is sitting in a place, don't make them get up so you can sit down. Instead, spread out and make room for others to join you. Ibn Umar also thought it was not good manners to make someone else leave their seat just because you want to sit there.

title: Prophet Muhammad's House Etiquette
content: When the Prophet married Zainab bint Jahsh, he invited people to a meal. After eating, they stayed sitting and talking. The Prophet (ﷺ) pretended to get up, but no one stood up with him. He got up alone, then some people followed. Three men remained seated. The Prophet (ﷺ) went back in, and I told him the three men had left. The Prophet (ﷺ) entered his house, and I wanted to go in too, but he put a curtain between us. Allah revealed a verse saying: 'Don't enter the Prophet's houses without permission.'

title: Allah's Messenger at Ka'ba
content: Ibn Umar saw the Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) in the courtyard of the Ka'ba. He was sitting with his hand around his legs, in a position called 'Ihtiba'.

title: Biggest Sins: Idolatry and Disobedience
content: Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) asked his companions if they wanted to know about the biggest sins. They said yes. He replied, 'Associating partners with Allah in worship is a big sin. And not being kind to your parents is also very wrong'.

title: Warning against Lying
content: The Prophet (ﷺ) was sitting. He sat up and said, 'I warn you not to tell lies.' He kept saying this until we wished he would stop.

title: Prophet's Quick Walk Home
content: The Prophet (ﷺ) offered the Asr prayer and then walked quickly to his house.

title: Praying while lying down
content: Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) used to pray standing up in the middle of our bed. I would lie in front of him facing the Qibla direction. If I needed to get up, I'd try not to disturb him by quietly moving away from the bed.

title: Fasting with the Prophet
content: Abdullah bin Amr told me that the Prophet came to visit him when he was fasting. The Prophet (ﷺ) sat on the floor, and Abdullah offered him a cushion. The Prophet (ﷺ) asked Abdullah if three days of fasting per month were enough for him. Abdullah said no, so the Prophet suggested five days. When Abdullah said no again, the Prophet suggested seven, then nine, then eleven days. Finally, the Prophet mentioned that David (peace be upon him) used to fast half a year and alternate days.

title: Alqama Meets Abu Ad-Darda'
content: Alaqama visited the mosque in Sham and prayed. He asked Allah for a good friend. Then he sat next to Abu Ad-Darda'. Abu Ad-Darda' asked where Alaqama was from, and he said Kufa. Abu Ad-Darda' mentioned three people from Kufa: Hudhaifa who kept secrets, Ammar whom Allah protected through the Prophet's prayer, and Ibn Masud who carried the Prophet's Siwak and cushion. He asked how Ibn Masud recited a specific verse in Surah 92. Alaqama said he had heard it from the Prophet himself.

title: Midday Naps in Islam
content: Sahl bin Sa'd said: We used to take a nap during the day and eat after Friday prayer.

title: Ali's Nickname and Allah's Messenger
content: Sahl bin Sa'd said that Ali was happy when people called him Abu Turab. One day, the Prophet visited Fatima but couldn't find Ali at home. He asked where Ali was, and Fatima said they had a disagreement. The Prophet (ﷺ) sent someone to look for Ali in the mosque. They found him sleeping there, uncovered and covered in dust. The Prophet (ﷺ) cleaned off the dust and called out to Ali, 'Get up, Abu Turab!'

title: Um Sulaim's Special Care
content: Anas said that Um Sulaim would spread a leather sheet for the Prophet to sleep on at her home. When he slept, she would collect his sweat in a bottle and mix it with perfume. Later, when Anas was dying, he asked them to add some of this mixture to his embalming perfume.

title: Prophet's Happy Vision
content: Anas bin Malik said that the Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) went to visit Um Haram. She offered him food and he slept afterwards. When he woke up, he was smiling. Um Haram asked him what made him happy. The Prophet (ﷺ) said that some of his followers were shown to him as brave warriors fighting for Allah's cause and sailing on a sea. They looked like kings sitting on thrones. Um Haram asked the Prophet to pray for her to be one of them. He prayed, but then fell asleep again. When he woke up, he smiled again. Um Haram asked him what made him happy this time too. The Prophet (ﷺ) said that his followers were shown to him as warriors fighting for Allah's cause and sailing on a sea. They looked like kings sitting on thrones. Um Haram asked the Prophet to pray for her to be one of them. He said she would be among the first ones.

title: Prophet's Happy Vision
content: One day, the Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) visited his friend Um Haram in Quba. She offered him food and he ate. Then he fell asleep and woke up smiling. Um Haram asked him what made him happy. He said that he had seen some of his followers fighting for Allah and sailing on a sea. They were like kings sitting on thrones. Um Haram asked the Prophet to pray for her to be one of them. The Prophet (ﷺ) prayed for her, then fell asleep again. When he woke up, he smiled again and said that she would be among the first ones to join them. Later, Um Haram sailed over a sea during the time of Muawiya and died soon after.

title: Forbidden Clothing and Deals
content: The Prophet (ﷺ) said that two types of clothing are not allowed. One is wearing a single garment in such a way that your private parts are exposed. The other is Al-Ihtiba, where you sit with one leg wrapped in the garment. He also forbade two kinds of deals: Al-Mulamasa and Al-Munabadha.

title: Fatima's Secret Talk with Prophet
content: One day, the wives of the Prophet were sitting together. Fatima came in and the Prophet welcomed her warmly. He asked her to sit next to him and told her a secret. She started crying. The Prophet (ﷺ) noticed this and shared another secret with her. This time she laughed. I was curious about what they talked about, so I asked Fatima later. She said she wouldn't tell me because it's the Prophet's secret. But after he died, she finally told me what happened. The Prophet (ﷺ) had a special meeting with Gabriel once a year to review the Quran. This year, however, Gabriel reviewed it twice, which made the Prophet think his time was coming soon. He asked Fatima and her family to be brave and patient because they would face many challenges after him. When he saw Fatima crying, he shared another secret with her. He told her she would be a leader among all believing women in the future.

title: Fatima's Secret Talk with Prophet
content: One day, the wives of the Prophet were sitting together. Fatima came in and the Prophet welcomed her warmly. He asked her to sit next to him and shared a secret. When he saw that she was crying, he told her something else that made her laugh. Only I, Aisha, noticed that the Prophet chose Fatima for this private talk. After the Prophet left, I asked Fatima what he had said. She refused to tell me at first but later revealed it when I asked again. The Prophet (ﷺ) told Fatima that Gabriel reviewed the Quran with him twice in one year, which meant his death was near. He advised her to be patient and afraid of Allah. When she cried, he shared another secret: that she would be the leader of all believing women after him.

title: Prophet Muhammad's Resting Position
content: I saw the Prophet lying on his back in the mosque. He had one leg over the other.

title: Don't Exclude Others
content: When three people are together, no two of them should talk secretly without telling the third person.

title: The Prophet's Secret
content: The Prophet (ﷺ) told me a secret. I didn't tell anyone else about it. Even Um Sulaim asked me, but I kept it to myself.

title: Don't Exclude Others
content: When you're with two friends, don't talk secretly about something that might hurt the third person who's also there. This can make them feel sad or left out. So, be kind and include everyone in your conversations.

title: Prophet's Reaction to Criticism
content: The Prophet (ﷺ) divided some things among the people. An Ansari man said his share was unfair. I told him about it, and he got very angry. He said that Moses had been treated unfairly too, but he stayed patient.

title: Man Talks During Prayer Time
content: Anas said that a man was talking to the Prophet when it was time for prayer. The man kept talking until everyone else fell asleep. Then, the Prophet got up and prayed with his companions.

title: Don't Leave Fire Burning
content: The Prophet (ﷺ) said, 'When you go to bed, turn off the fire in your homes.'

title: Protect Your Homes from Fire
content: One night in Medina, a house caught fire and its people were trapped inside. The Prophet (ﷺ) said, 'This fire is your enemy. When you go to bed, make sure to put it out so you're safe.'

title: Cover Utensils at Night
content: Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) said to Jabir: When it's bedtime, cover your cooking pots and pans. Close the doors of your house and turn off the lights. This is so that a rat can't knock over a candle and start a fire.

title: Before Going to Sleep
content: When you're going to bed at night, turn off the lights. Close all doors and windows. Make sure water containers are tightly sealed. Cover your food and drinks so they don't get spoiled overnight.

title: Prophetic Traditions of Purity
content: The Prophet (ﷺ) said: 'Five things are natural and right. A man should be circumcised, shave his private area, remove hair from under his arms, trim his moustache, and cut his fingernails short.'

title: Abraham's Circumcision at 80
content: Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) said that Prophet Abraham circumcised himself when he was over 80 years old. He used an adze to do it.

title: Ibn Abbas' Age at Prophet's Death
content: Someone asked Ibn Abbas how old he was when the Prophet died. He said he had already been circumcised. At that time, boys weren't circumcised until they were grown up.

title: Oaths and Gambling Forbidden
content: Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) said: If you take an oath saying 'By Al-Lat and Al-Uzza', say instead 'There is no God but Allah'. And if you invite someone to gamble, give something to charity.

title: Ibn Umar Builds His House
content: Ibn Umar built a house with his own hands. He wanted it to protect him from the rain and shade from the sun. No one else helped him build it during the time of the Prophet.

title: Ibn Umar's Promise
content: After the Prophet died, Ibn Umar said he would not build anything or plant a date palm tree. When someone asked him about it later, he confirmed that he had indeed made this promise.

title: Prophet's Special Prayer
content: The Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) said: 'Each prophet has a special prayer that Allah will always answer. I want to keep this prayer for helping my followers in the Hereafter.'

title: Prophets' Special Prayers
content: The Prophet (ﷺ) said that every prophet has a special prayer to Allah. This prayer is always answered by Allah. But the Prophet kept his own special prayer for himself, so he could ask Allah to forgive and help his followers on Judgment Day.

title: Best Way to Ask for Forgiveness
content: The Prophet (ﷺ) said: 'The best way to ask Allah for forgiveness is:

title: Abu Huraira's Repentance
content: I heard the Prophet say: 'By God, I ask for forgiveness from Allah and turn to Him in repentance more than seventy times a day.'

title: Believers and Their Sins
content: Abdullah bin Mas'ud said that the Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) told him: A believer feels like he's under a big mountain of sins, worried it might fall on him. But a bad person thinks his sins are just flies buzzing around his nose - he waves them away easily. The Prophet (ﷺ) also said: Allah likes repentance more than someone who camps in a place where they're not safe. They have their food and water with them, but then their animal runs away. They look for it, get very hot and thirsty, and think about going back home.

title: Allah's Pleasure with Repentance
content: Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) said: Allah is happier when his slave repents than a person is happy to find their lost camel in the desert.

title: Prophet's Night Prayer Routine
content: The Prophet (ﷺ) used to pray eleven rak'at at night. When dawn came, he would pray two more rak'at and then lie on his right side until the Muadhdhin called him for Fajr prayer.

title: Before Going to Sleep
content: When you want to go to bed, wash your hands and face like you do for prayer. Then lie down on your right side and say: 'I turn my face to You, Allah. I put my life in Your control. I give my body to You, willingly and unwillingly. There's no escape or refuge from You except through You. I believe in the Book You sent down and in the Prophet You sent.' If you die after saying this, you will be a Muslim when you die. Say these words before going to sleep.

title: Prophet's Morning and Night Prayers
content: When the Prophet went to sleep, he would say: 'In your name I live and die.' When he woke up, he would say: 'Praise be to God who gives life after death and returns us to Him'.

title: Before Going to Sleep
content: The Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) advised a man: 'When you go to bed, say this prayer:

title: Prophet's Night and Morning Prayers
content: When the Prophet went to bed at night, he would put his hand under his cheek and say 'In Allah's name I die and come back to life.' When he woke up in the morning, he would thank Allah for giving him life again after He had taken it.

title: Prayer Before Sleeping
content: When Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) went to bed, he would sleep on his right side and say: 'I put my life in Your hands, I turn my face towards You, I give you control over my decisions. I surrender myself completely to You, with hope and fear of You alone. There is no escape or refuge from You except through You. I believe in the Book You sent down and the Prophet You sent.' If someone says this prayer before going to bed and dies that night, they will die as a Muslim.

title: Prophet's Night Prayer Routine
content: One night, I slept at Maimuna's house. The Prophet (ﷺ) woke up to go to the bathroom, washed his face and hands, then went back to sleep. He got up later, went to a water skin, performed ablution with not too much water, but made sure to wash all parts properly. Then he prayed. I got up quietly so I wouldn't disturb him, performed my own ablution, and stood on his left side when he prayed. The Prophet (ﷺ) took hold of my ear and moved me to his right side. He prayed thirteen times, then lay down and slept until morning. Bilal reminded the Prophet it was time for Fajr prayer, so he got up without washing again. In his prayer, the Prophet said: 'Make light in my heart, sight, hearing, right arm, left arm, top of my head, bottom of my head, front of me, back of me, and body.' He also mentioned two other things I forgot.

title: Prophet's Night Prayer
content: When the Prophet got up at night to pray, he would say: 'All praise is for You, Allah. You are the light of the sky and earth and everything in them. All praise is for You, Allah. You hold up the sky and earth and everything in them. All praise is for You, Allah. You are the Truth, Your promise is true, Your word is true, Your meeting with us will be true, Paradise is true, Hellfire is true, the Day of Judgment is true, and all prophets are true, including Muhammad (ﷺ). He is true, Allah. I have surrendered to You, relied on You, believed in You, come to You, and judged by Your law. Forgive me for what I did before, what I will do, what I hide, and what I forget. You are the One who brings things near and far away. There is no god but You.'

title: Fatima's Request for a Servant
content: Fatima had blisters on her hand from grinding grain. She asked the Prophet for help with a servant, but he wasn't home. When she told Aisha, Aisha informed the Prophet when he returned. The Prophet (ﷺ) said to Ali and Fatima, 'Stay in your beds.' He sat between them until they felt his feet on their chests. Then he said, 'I'll tell you something better than having a servant. Before bed, say Allahu Akbar 33 times, Subhan Allah 33 times, and Alhamdu Lillah 33 times. It's better for you than having a servant.'

title: Prophet's Bedtime Routine
content: When the Prophet went to sleep, he would read two chapters from the Quran: Surah Falaq and Surah Nas. He would then blow on his hands and rub them over his body.

title: Clean Your Bed Before Sleep
content: When you go to bed, shake out your blanket or sheet with the inside of it. You don't know what might have landed on it after you got up. Then say: 'In your name, my Lord, I lay down and in your name I get up. If you take my soul, be merciful to it. And if you return it to me, protect it with the protection you give to your righteous servants.'

title: Allah's Messenger Visits Heaven
content: Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) said: 'When it is almost midnight, Allah descends to the sky of the world. He asks if anyone is praying, and if so, He will answer their prayer. If anyone is asking for something, He will give it to them. And if anyone wants forgiveness, He will forgive them.'

title: Prophet's Toilet Prayer
content: When the Prophet went to the toilet, he would say: 'God, I ask for your protection from evil and filth.'

title: Hadith 6323
content: Narrated Shaddad bin 'Aus: The Prophet (ﷺ) said, "The most superior way of asking for forgiveness from Allah is: 'Allahumma anta Rabbi la ilaha illa anta. Khalaqtani wa ana `Abduka, wa ana 'ala 'ahdika wa Wa'dika mastata'tu abu'u Laka bi ni 'matika wa abu'u Laka bidhanbi; faghfirli fa'innahu la yaghfiru-dh-dhunuba ill a ant a. A'uidhu bika min sharri ma sana'tu.' If somebody recites this invocation during the night, and if he should die then, he will go to Paradise (or he will be from the people of Paradise). And if he recites it in the morning, and if he should die on the same day, he will have the same fate

title: Prophet's Bedtime Prayer
content: When the Prophet wanted to sleep, he would say: 'With Your name, Allah, I die and live.' When he woke up, he said: 'All praise is for Allah Who brought us back to life after He made us sleep. And all return to Him'.

title: Prophet's Morning and Night Prayers
content: Abu Dhar said that whenever the Prophet lay down to sleep, he would say 'In Allah's name I die and come back to life.' When he woke up, he would say 'Praise be to God who brought us back to life after He had given us death. All praise is due to Him for the Resurrection'.

title: Abu Bakr's Prayer Request
content: Abu Bakr asked the Prophet to teach him a prayer he could say during his daily prayers. The Prophet (ﷺ) said, 'Say: O Allah, I have done many wrong things to myself. Only you can forgive my sins. Please forgive me with your mercy and be kind to me. You are the Forgiver, the Merciful.'

title: Prayer Should Be Moderate
content: Aisha said that the verse 'Neither say your prayer aloud, nor say it in a low tone' was revealed about how to make du'a (prayer).

title: Saying Salam in Prayer
content: Abdullah told us that we used to say 'As-Salam be on Allah' and 'As-Salam be on so-and-so' during prayer. One day the Prophet said, 'Allah is As-Salam.' When you sit for prayer, say: 'at-tah, iyyatu-li l-lahi' up to 'As-Salihin'. This way, you greet all righteous people in heaven and earth. Then say, 'I testify that only Allah deserves worship, and Muhammad (ﷺ) is His slave and Messenger.' Finally, praise Allah as you like.

title: Reciting After Every Prayer
content: Some people said to the Prophet: 'The rich have more status and happiness.' He asked how. They said because they pray like us, work for Allah's cause like us, and give charity from their extra money. We don't have any extra money to give. The Prophet (ﷺ) said: 'I can tell you something that will help you catch up with those who are ahead of you and do better than those who come after you.' He then told them to say three things ten times each after every prayer: 'God is perfect', 'Praise be to God', and 'God is great'.

title: Prophet's Final Prayer Phrase
content: Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) used to say after every prayer: 'There is no god but Allah alone. He has no partner. All power and praise belong to Him. He is capable of everything.' Then he would pray, 'God, nothing can stop what You have decided. Nothing can change what You have planned. No wealth or family can benefit anyone against Your will.'

title: Prophet visits Khaibar
content: The Prophet (ﷺ) went to Khaibar with his companions. A man asked Amir to recite some poetry. Amir said, 'We wouldn't be guided if Allah didn't guide us.' The Prophet (ﷺ) asked who was the camel driver and was told it was Amir. He said, 'May Allah have mercy on him.' When they lined up for battle, Amir accidentally killed himself with his own sword. Later, the Muslims made fires to cook their food. The Prophet (ﷺ) saw them cooking donkey meat and ordered them to throw away the food and break the pots.

title: Prophet's Prayer for Donors
content: When someone brought their charity to the Prophet, he would say a prayer asking Allah to bless that person's family. When my father came with his charity, the Prophet said, 'O Allah! Bless the family of Abi Aufa'.

title: Dhi-al-Khalasa Destroyed
content: The Prophet (ﷺ) asked Jarir to destroy an idol called Dhi-al-Khalasa. Jarir said he couldn't ride horses well, so the Prophet prayed for him to be strong and guided. Jarir went with a group of men from his tribe and destroyed the idol. When he returned, the Prophet blessed Ahmas and their fighters.

title: Blessing for Anas
content: Um Sulaim told the Prophet that Anas was his servant. The Prophet (ﷺ) said to Allah, 'Increase Anas's wealth and family, and bless what you give him.'

title: Prophet remembers a verse
content: The Prophet (ﷺ) was in the mosque when he heard someone reciting the Quran. He said that this person reminded him of a verse from the Quran that he had forgotten to read.

title: The Prophet's Anger
content: The Prophet (ﷺ) divided some things among the Muslims. A man said that wasn't fair. When I told the Prophet about it, he got very angry. He then said that Moses was treated unfairly too, but he stayed calm.

title: Preaching to the People
content: Ibn Abbas said: 'Tell people about Islam once a week. If you want to tell them more often, do it twice or three times a week, but don't make them tired of listening to the Quran. When you meet people talking, don't start preaching right away. Wait for them to ask you and then share your message when they're ready to listen. Also, avoid using rhyming words in your prayers because the Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) and his friends never used it.'

title: Ask Allah with Confidence
content: When you pray to Allah for something, ask clearly and don't say 'if You wish'. Nobody can force Allah to do something against His Will.

title: Don't Say 'If You Wish'
content: Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) said: Don't say to Allah, 'Forgive me if you want' or 'Be merciful to me if you want'. Instead, ask with determination. No one can force Allah to do something He doesn't want.

title: Prayer is Always Answered
content: Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) said: If you pray to Allah and He doesn't answer your request right away, don't get impatient. Anas saw the Prophet praying with his hands raised high, until he could see the white skin under his arms.

title: Rain in Medina
content: One Friday, a man asked the Prophet to pray for rain. The Prophet (ﷺ) prayed and it started raining heavily. A week later, the same man stood up again and said, 'Please ask Allah to stop the rain.' The Prophet (ﷺ) prayed, 'O Allah, let the rain go around us, not on us.' And the clouds moved away from Medina.

title: Prophet's Prayer for Rain
content: The Prophet (ﷺ) went to a prayer area. He asked Allah for rain. Then he turned his shirt inside out and faced the direction of the Kaaba.

title: Messenger's Prayer for Anas
content: Anas' mother asked the Prophet to pray for her son. The Prophet (ﷺ) said, 'O Allah, increase his wealth and children, and bless whatever You give him.'

title: Prophet's Prayer in Distress
content: When the Prophet was worried or upset, he would say: 'There is no god but Allah, He is great and patient. There is no god but Allah, He is the Lord of heaven and earth and the Lord of the mighty throne.'

title: Prayer in Times of Distress
content: When he was feeling worried or upset, the Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) would say: 'There is no god but Allah. He is the Lord of the great throne. There is no god but Allah. He is the Lord of the heavens and the earth. He is the Lord of the noble throne.'

title: Prophet's Prayer for Protection
content: The Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) used to ask Allah for protection from a difficult time in life, being destroyed, and having an evil end. He also asked Allah to protect him from the happiness of his enemies when they see something bad happening to him.

title: Prophet's Last Words
content: When the Prophet was ill, he said to Allah: 'Let me join the best companions.' I thought this meant he didn't want to leave us. But then I remembered what he used to say when he was healthy: that prophets are shown their place in Paradise before they die and can choose whether to live or die. So his last words were a prayer to be with the best companions.

title: Khabbab's Painful Condition
content: Qais visited Khabbab who had been burned with seven brands. Khabbab said that if Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) hadn't forbidden praying for death, he would have prayed for it.

title: Khabbab's Pain and Prayer
content: Qais visited Khabbab who was badly hurt from being burned with seven hot brands on his stomach. Qais heard Khabbab saying, 'If the Prophet had not forbidden us to ask Allah for death, I would have asked Him for it'.

title: Don't Wish for Death
content: Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) said: Don't wish to die because of a problem. If you must wish to die, say: 'God, let me live if it's good for me. Take my life if death is better.'

title: Prophet's Blessing and Ablution
content: My aunt took me to the Prophet. She said he was my sister's son was sick. The Prophet (ﷺ) put his hand on my head and asked Allah for a blessing. Then he washed his face, arms, and rest of his body. I drank from the water he used. After that, I stood behind him and saw a mark between his shoulders.

title: Trading with Ibn Zubair
content: Abu Aqil's grandfather, Abdullah bin Hisham, would buy grain from the market. When he met Ibn Az-Zubair and Ibn Umar, they'd ask to be his partners in trading because the Prophet had blessed him. They'd work together and sometimes get a whole load of goods that Abu Aqil could send home.

title: Allah's Messenger Helps Boy
content: Once, Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) threw water from his mouth on a young boy. The water was taken from the boy's family well when he was still too young to be considered an adult.

title: Prophet's Reaction to Urine
content: Aisha said: Boys were often brought to the Prophet. One day, a baby was brought and it urinated on his clothes. The Prophet (ﷺ) asked for water and poured it over the spot. He didn't wash his clothes.

title: Sa'd's Witr Prayer
content: Abdullah bin Tha'laba saw Sa'd bin Abi Waqqas praying only one rak'a for the witr prayer. The Prophet (ﷺ) had touched Abdullah's eye, and he was a witness to this.

title: How to Send Salat on the Prophet
content: Ka'b bin 'Ujra met me and asked if he could give me a gift. He said, 'I want to teach you something important.' The Prophet (ﷺ) came to them once and they asked how to send blessings on him. He said, 'Say: Allah, bless Muhammad (ﷺ) and the family of Muhammad (ﷺ), just like You blessed Ibrahim and his family. And say: Allah, send peace on Muhammad (ﷺ) and the family of Muhammad (ﷺ), just like You sent peace on Ibrahim and his family.'

title: How to Send Salat on the Prophet
content: Abu Sa'id asked the Prophet how to send Salat. The Prophet (ﷺ) said: 'Say: Allah, bless Muhammad (ﷺ) and his message like you blessed Abraham. And give peace to Muhammad (ﷺ) and all of his followers as you gave peace to Abraham.'

title: Prophet's Prayer for Donors
content: When someone gave charity to the Prophet, he would say, 'O Allah, send blessings on him.' One time, when my father brought his charity, the Prophet said, 'O Allah, send blessings on the family of Abi Aufa'.

title: How to Send Prayers on the Prophet
content: Some people asked the Prophet how they could send their prayers to him. He said: 'Say this prayer for me: O Allah, give blessings to Muhammad (ﷺ) and his wife and family as you give blessings to Abraham. And give peace to Muhammad (ﷺ) and his wife and family as you gave peace to Abraham. You are worthy of praise and glory.'

title: Abuse and Forgiveness
content: The Prophet (ﷺ) said: 'If I ever speak badly about a believer, use it to bring him closer to You on the Day of Judgement.'

title: Prophet Muhammad Answers Questions
content: Some people asked the Prophet many questions. He got angry and said he would answer all their questions that day. I looked around and saw everyone covering their faces with their clothes, crying. A man stood up and said, 'Who is my father?' The Prophet (ﷺ) replied, 'Your father is Hudhaifa.' Then Umar stood up and said, 'We believe in Allah as our Lord, Islam as our way of life, and Muhammad (ﷺ) as our Messenger. We ask for protection from troubles.' The Prophet (ﷺ) said that on this day he saw both heaven and hell, right next to us.

title: The Prophet's Servant
content: The Prophet (ﷺ) asked Abu Talha to bring me to serve him. I rode behind Abu Talha on his camel and served the Prophet whenever he stayed somewhere. I heard him say, 'I seek refuge with God from worries and grief.' I kept serving him until he returned from Khaibar. He brought Safiya, a woman he had taken as war booty, and made her sit behind him on a cushion. When we reached As-Sahba', he prepared food called Hais and invited the men to eat. This was his wedding feast with Safiya. On our way back, the Prophet said that the mountain of Uhud loved us and we loved it. When we approached Medina, he prayed for its people, asking God to bless them in their daily needs.

title: Prophet seeks refuge from grave
content: Um Khalid bint Khalid heard the Prophet seeking help from Allah to avoid punishment in the grave.

title: Sa'd's Recommended Prayers
content: Mus'ab said that Sa'd used to recommend five prayers. He would say: 'O Allah, protect me from being stingy. Protect me from being a coward. Protect me from growing old and weak. Protect me from the troubles of this world. Protect me from punishment in the grave.'

title: Two Old Jewish Women
content: Two old Jewish women came to visit me. They said the dead are punished in their graves. I didn't believe them at first, but when they left, I told the Prophet about it. He said they were telling the truth: the dead do get punished so badly that even animals can hear it. After that, I saw him often pray for protection from the punishment of the grave.

title: Prophet's Daily Prayer
content: The Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) used to say: 'O Allah, I ask for Your protection from being weak and lazy. I also ask for Your protection from being afraid or old when I'm supposed to be strong. Protect me from the punishment in the grave and from all troubles in life and death.'

title: Prophet's Daily Prayer
content: The Prophet (ﷺ) used to say: 'O Allah, I ask for Your protection from laziness and old age. Protect me from all sins, debt, and the punishment of the grave. Keep me safe from poverty and the evil influence of Al-Masih Ad-Dajjal. Wash away my sins with snow and hail water. Cleanse my heart like a white garment is cleaned. Put distance between me and my sins, just as You made East and West far apart.'

title: Prophet's Daily Prayer
content: The Prophet (ﷺ) used to say: 'O Allah, I ask for Your protection from worry and sadness. Protect me from being weak or lazy, cowardly or stingy. Keep me safe from debt and from being overpowered by others.'

title: Seeking Refuge in Prayer
content: Sa'd bin Abi Waqqas said the Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) said: 'O Allah, I ask for your protection from being stingy, and from being afraid, and from growing old, and from the troubles of life, and from punishment after death.'

title: Seeking Allah's Protection
content: Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) used to say: 'O Allah, protect me from laziness. Protect me from being cowardly. Protect me from growing old too quickly. Protect me from being stingy.'

title: Prophet's Prayer for Medina
content: The Prophet (ﷺ) said to Allah: 'Make us love Medina as much as we love Mecca. Remove the sickness from Medina and move it to Al-Juhfa. Bless our measurements of food and drink.'

title: Prophet's Advice on Charity
content: 'Amir bin Sa'd said his father was ill. The Prophet (ﷺ) visited him and asked about his daughter. He wanted to give her a lot of money, but the Prophet said no. He said it's better for children to inherit wealth than beg from others. Whatever good you do for Allah will be rewarded, even if it's just food for your family. The Prophet (ﷺ) also prayed that he would live longer and help his companions.

title: Seeking Refuge with Allah
content: Sa'd said that the Prophet used to say: 'O Allah, I seek your protection from being cowardly. I seek your protection from being stingy. I seek your protection from growing old and weak. I seek your protection from the troubles of this life and from punishment in the grave.'

title: Prophet's Daily Prayer
content: The Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) used to say: 'I ask Allah for protection from laziness and old age. I also ask for protection from debt, sins, the punishment of Hellfire, and grave afflictions. I ask for protection from poverty and the evil effects of Al-Masih Ad-Dajjal. I ask Allah to wash away my sins with snow and hail, clean my heart like a white garment is cleaned, and keep me far away from my sins as You have kept East and West apart'.

title: Prophet's Daily Prayers
content: Aisha said the Prophet used to say: 'O Allah, I ask for Your protection from being punished in the Fire. I also ask for Your protection from the troubles of poverty and wealth. And I ask for Your protection from the troubles caused by Al-Masih Ad-Dajjal.'

title: Prophet's Prayer for Protection
content: The Prophet (ﷺ) used to say: 'O Allah, I ask you to protect me from the punishment of Hellfire and the suffering of the grave. Protect me from poverty and the evil influence of Al-Masih Ad-Dajjal. Cleanse my heart with pure water, just like a white cloth is cleaned. Keep me far away from sins as You have made the East and West far apart. I ask you to protect me from laziness, sinning, and debt.'

title: Blessing for Anas
content: Um Sulaim asked the Prophet to pray for blessings for his servant Anas. The Prophet (ﷺ) said, 'O Allah, increase Anas's wealth and family, and bless him with what You give him.'

title: Blessing for Anas
content: Um Sulaim asked the Prophet to pray for blessings for his servant Anas. The Prophet (ﷺ) said, 'O Allah, increase Anas's wealth and family, and bless what You give him.'

title: Blessings for Anas
content: Um Sulaim asked the Prophet to ask Allah to bless Anas with more wealth and children. The Prophet (ﷺ) said, 'O Allah! Increase his wealth and family, and be happy with whatever you give him'.

title: Blessings for Anas
content: Um Sulaim asked the Prophet to ask Allah to bless Anas with more wealth and children. The Prophet (ﷺ) said, 'O Allah! Give Anas more money and kids, and be happy with whatever You give him'.

title: Istikhara Prayer for Guidance
content: The Prophet (ﷺ) taught us a prayer to ask Allah for guidance in any matter. If you want to do something, first pray two rak'ats (units of prayer) that are not part of your regular prayers. Then say: 'Allah, I ask for Your knowledge and power. I ask for Your great favor. You have the power to decide what is best, and only You truly know everything. If this thing I want to do will be good for me in my life and after I die, then make it easy for me to do. But if it's bad for me, take it away from me and guide me to something better.' Then mention the specific thing you're asking about.

title: Prophet's Prayer for a Friend
content: The Prophet (ﷺ) asked for water and washed his face. He then raised his hands to the sky and said, 'O Allah, forgive Ubaid Abi Amir.' I saw his armpits as he raised his hands. He added, 'O Allah, make him better than many people on Judgment Day'.

title: Be Kind When You Pray
content: When we were traveling with the Prophet, we would say 'God is great' loudly when we climbed a high place. The Prophet (ﷺ) said, 'Remember to be kind to yourselves when you pray. God hears and sees everything.' He saw me quietly saying a prayer: 'There's no power except from God.' He said, 'That's one of the special prayers from Paradise. Say it out loud: There's no power except from God.'

title: Prophet's Return Prayer
content: When the Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) returned from a war or pilgrimage, he would say 'Allah is great' three times. When he went up to a high place, he would say: 'There is no god but Allah alone, with no partner. All power and praise belong to Him. He has control over everything. Our Lord, we are sorry for our sins, we worship You, we thank You. God's promise was true, He helped His servant and defeated the enemy on his own.'

title: Marriage and Giving Thanks
content: Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) saw a yellow mark on Abdur-Rahman's clothes. He asked what it was. Abdur-Rahman said he had married a woman with a small amount of gold as her dowry. The Prophet (ﷺ) said, 'May Allah bless you in your marriage.' He told Abdur-Rahman to give a wedding feast, even if it's just one sheep.

title: Marriage Advice from the Prophet
content: Jabir's father died leaving him many young daughters. Jabir married a woman who could take care of them, as he didn't want to bring another young girl into their lives. The Prophet (ﷺ) asked why he hadn't married a virgin, so they could play and laugh together. But Jabir explained his situation, and the Prophet blessed him for taking responsibility for his sisters.

title: Protecting Your Child from Evil
content: When you want to have a baby with your wife, say 'In the name of Allah. Allah, keep us and our child safe from Satan.' If you do this and you have a child, then Satan can't harm that child.

title: Prophet's Daily Prayer
content: Anas said that the Prophet often prayed: 'O Allah, give us good things in this life and good things in the next life. Protect us from the punishment of Hell.'

title: Seeking Refuge with Allah
content: The Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) used to teach us a prayer. He would say: 'O Allah, protect me from being stingy and from being afraid. Keep me safe from getting old and weak. Protect me from the troubles of this life and from punishment in the afterlife.'

title: Prophet Muhammad was bewitched
content: Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) was affected by magic. He thought he had done something wrong when he hadn't. He prayed to Allah for help. One day, he told his wife Aisha that Allah had given him advice about the problem. Two men came to him and talked about how someone named Labid bin Al-A'sam used a comb with hair stuck in it and some date-palm pollen to cast magic on him. The men said this was done at a well called Dharwan. Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) went to the well, saw that the water was red like henna, and thought the date-palm trees looked strange. He came back to Aisha and told her what happened. She asked why he didn't take out the skin of pollen, but he said Allah had already cured him and he didn't want people to know about it.

title: Defeating the Enemy
content: Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) asked Allah to defeat the enemy confederates. He said: 'O Allah, you who sent down the Holy Book and are quick in judging, defeat them. Defeat them and shake them up.'

title: Prayer for Safety and Justice
content: When the Prophet finished his evening prayer, he would say 'Allah heard him who praised Him'. He would then ask Allah to protect Aiyash bin Abi Rabi'a, Al-Walid bin Al-Walid, and all weak believers. He also asked Allah to be harsh on the people from the Tribe of Mudar, and to send them years of drought like those in the time of Prophet Joseph.

title: Prophet's Sadness Over Martyrs
content: The Prophet (ﷺ) sent a group of men called Al-Qurra' to fight. They were all killed in battle. The Prophet (ﷺ) was very sad about it. He asked Allah to be angry with the people who did this, and he said so in his morning prayer for one month.

title: Greeting the Prophet
content: `Aisha said that one day some Jews greeted the Prophet with a greeting that meant 'death be upon you'. She replied in the same way. The Prophet (ﷺ) told her to be gentle and calm, as Allah likes gentleness. When she asked if he had heard what they said, he said yes, but also pointed out that his reply was the same.

title: Prophet's Frustration with Infidels
content: We were with the Prophet on a day of battle. He said, 'May Allah fill their graves and homes with fire. They kept us busy so we missed our middle prayer until sunset. That prayer was the Asr prayer.'

title: Prayer for Guidance
content: Abu Huraira told me that a man named at-Tufail came to the Prophet. He said, 'The people of Daus won't listen and won't become Muslims.' The Prophet (ﷺ) didn't curse them. Instead, he prayed, 'O Allah, guide the tribe of Daus and let them come to us'.

title: The Prophet's Prayer
content: Abu Musa said that the Prophet used to say: 'My Lord, forgive me for my mistakes and ignorance. Forgive me for being wasteful with Your blessings. You know what I have done better than I do. Forgive me for all my wrongdoings, past and future. You are the One who brings things into existence and ends them. You are powerful over everything.'

title: Prophet's Prayer for Forgiveness
content: Abu Musa Al-Ash'ari said the Prophet used to pray: 'God, forgive me for my mistakes and ignorance. Forgive me for wasting your blessings in my life. I don't know what else I've done wrong. God, forgive me for my bad actions, good intentions, and all my mistakes.'

title: Friday's Special Time
content: The Prophet (ﷺ) said: 'On Fridays, there is a special time when you pray for something good. If you're praying during this time, Allah will definitely answer your prayer.' He pointed with his hand to show how short that time was.

title: The Prophet Responds to Insults
content: Some Jews came to the Prophet and said 'Death be upon you.' The Prophet (ﷺ) replied, 'The same on you.' Aisha was angry with them and said some harsh words. The Prophet (ﷺ) told her to calm down and not respond in kind.

title: Say Amin to Forgive Sins
content: When the Imam says 'Amin', you should all say it too. The angels also say 'Amin' at that time. If your 'Amin' matches theirs, God will forgive all your past sins.

title: Saying a Special Prayer
content: Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) said: If someone says 'There is no god but Allah alone, with no partner. All power and praise belong to Him. He has control over everything' one hundred times, they will get the same reward as freeing ten slaves. One hundred good things will be written for them, and one hundred bad things will be forgiven. This prayer will protect them from Satan until night. No one can do a better deed unless they say it more than that person.

title: Reciting for Freedom
content: If you recite this prayer ten times, it's like freeing a descendant of Ishmael from slavery. The Prophet (ﷺ) said that doing so is the same as giving someone their freedom.

title: Forgiveness for Saying a Prayer
content: The Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) said: If someone says 'God is perfect and I praise Him' one hundred times a day, God will forgive all their sins, no matter how many they are.

title: Two Easy Phrases
content: The Prophet (ﷺ) said: 'There are two phrases that are easy to say but very important. They are: 'God is great and mighty' and 'Praise be to God, and blessings are His'.

title: Praising Allah is Life
content: The Prophet (ﷺ) said that praising Allah is like being alive. Not praising Allah is like being dead.

title: Angels Watch People Pray
content: Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) said that Allah has angels who look for people praying on roads and paths. When they find someone praying, the angels call each other to come and surround them with their wings. After the prayer, Allah asks His angels what those people were saying. The angels reply that they were saying 'God is perfect', 'God is greater than everything', and 'Praise be to God'. Allah then asks if those people saw Him, but the angels say no. He says it would have been better for them if they had seen Him because they would have prayed more sincerely and praised Him more deeply. The angels ask what those people asked Allah for, and reply that they asked for Paradise. Allah asks if they saw Paradise, and again the angels say no. He says it would have been even better for them if they had seen Paradise because they would have wanted it even more and sought it with greater zeal. The angels then ask what those people were seeking refuge from, and reply that they were seeking refuge from Hellfire. Allah asks if they saw Hellfire, but the angels say no. He says it would have been better for them if they had seen Hellfire because they would have run away from it even more quickly and feared it more. Then Allah forgives those people and makes His angels witnesses to this forgiveness.

title: Prophet's Response to Call
content: The Prophet (ﷺ) was riding his mule when a companion shouted 'There is no god but Allah. Allah is the greatest.' The Prophet (ﷺ) said, 'You're not calling someone who can't hear you or isn't there.' He then asked Abu Musa if he wanted to know a special phrase from Paradise. Abu Musa agreed and the Prophet told him, 'There's no power or strength except with Allah'.

title: Believing in Allah's Names
content: Allah has ninety-nine names. If you believe in their meanings and act on them, you'll go to Paradise. Allah is one, and He likes odd numbers.

title: Waiting for Abdullah
content: We were waiting for a teacher named Abdullah. Yazid came and said he wouldn't sit with us. He went into the house to get Abdullah, who then came out holding Yazid's hand. Abdullah told us that his teacher, the Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ), used to preach at different times during the day so they didn't get bored.

title: Two Important Blessings
content: The Prophet (ﷺ) said that many people lose two important things: good health and free time to do what they want.

title: The Prophet's Prayer for the People
content: The Prophet (ﷺ) said to Allah, 'There is no good life except the one in the Hereafter. Please make the Ansar and Emigrants do what is right.'

title: Allah's Messenger Digs Trench
content: We were with Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) in the battle of Al-Khandaq. He was digging a trench and we were carrying away dirt. He looked at us and said, 'O Allah! There is no life as good as the life after death. Please forgive the Ansar and Emigrants.'

title: Paradise vs. The World
content: The Prophet (ﷺ) said, 'Even a small area in Paradise is better than the whole world and everything in it. And going on a journey for Allah's cause, either morning or afternoon, is also better than the whole world and everything in it.'

title: Be Like a Traveler
content: Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) told Abdullah bin Umar: 'Live in this world like you're just passing through. If you make it to evening, don't assume you'll be alive tomorrow. And if you wake up in the morning, don't think you'll see tonight. Use your good health for when you might get sick, and use some of your life now for when you might die.'

title: Human Life is Like This
content: The Prophet (ﷺ) drew a square to show how life is. He then drew a line in the middle and outside the square, saying it represents our hope for the future. He also drew small lines attached to this central line, explaining that these are troubles and problems that come our way. He said if one problem goes away, another will take its place.

title: Hope and Death
content: The Prophet (ﷺ) drew some lines on the ground. He said these lines show how a person's life is. One line shows hope, but another line shows that death can come at any time, even when you think everything is fine.

title: Death at 60: No Excuse
content: The Prophet (ﷺ) said that Allah will not accept excuses from anyone whose life is extended beyond the age of sixty. If a person lives to be sixty, they have no excuse for not following Allah's commands.

title: Old Men's Hearts Remain Young
content: Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) said: The heart of an old man stays young in two ways. He still loves the world and its things, and he always hopes for more.

title: Two Things Grow Old
content: The Prophet (ﷺ) said: A person grows old and so do two things with them. These are a love for wealth and a wish to live long.

title: Prophet Muhammad's Kindness
content: One day, the Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) took water from a bucket in our home and threw it on my face to help me clean up.

title: Sincerely Saying 'La ilaha illallah'
content: Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) came to me and said: If someone says 'There is no god but Allah' with a sincere heart, wanting to please Allah, then on the Day of Resurrection, Hell will be forbidden for them.

title: Patience in Grief is Rewarded
content: Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) said: Allah says, 'If I cause a loved one to die, and you remain patient, hoping for my reward, then Paradise will be your reward.'
