title: Prophet's Warning about Wealth
content: The Prophet (ﷺ) sent Abu Ubaida to Bahrain to collect taxes. When he arrived with the money, some of the Ansar came to the Prophet during morning prayer. The Prophet (ﷺ) smiled and said, 'You've heard that Abu Ubaida has brought something.' They replied, 'Yes, O Prophet!' He said, 'Be happy and hope for good things. I'm not worried you'll become poor, but I'm afraid wealth will come your way like it did to other nations. You might start competing with each other for it, just like they did, and it could distract you from what's right.'

title: Prophet's Warning after Uhud
content: The Prophet (ﷺ) went out to pray for the martyrs of Uhud. After praying, he stood on the pulpit and said: 'I will come before you in death, and I am a witness against you. I can see my special well, Al-Kauthar, and I have been given keys to the earth's treasures. I'm not worried that you'll worship other gods after me, but I'm afraid you'll fight over worldly things.'

title: Beware of Worldly Wealth
content: The Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) said to his companions: 'I'm worried about something for your sake.' They asked what it was. He replied, 'Worldly blessings that Allah will give you.' One person asked, 'What are these blessings?' The Prophet (ﷺ) said, 'Pleasures of the world.' Another person asked, 'Can good things bring bad consequences?' The Prophet (ﷺ) stayed quiet for a moment and then said to the questioner, 'Good never brings anything but good. Worldly wealth is like sweet fruit. If you earn it honestly and use it wisely, it's helpful. But if you get it unfairly, you'll always want more.'

title: Best People in Islam
content: The Prophet (ﷺ) said: 'My generation is the best. Then come those who follow them.' He also said: 'After that, there will be people who give witness without being asked. They are untrustworthy and break promises. They make vows but don't keep them. And they become overweight.'

title: Generations of Muslims
content: The Prophet (ﷺ) said that the best people are those who came first. Then come those who follow them, and then others after them. But later, there will be people whose words are not trusted. They might say something is true, but it's not. Or they might promise to do something, but don't.

title: Companions' Reward in Heaven
content: Khabbab had been badly hurt. He said that if the Prophet hadn't stopped people from asking Allah to take them away, he would have asked for death. The companions of the Prophet didn't get any reward on earth, but they will get a perfect reward in heaven. Khabbab and others collected wealth, but it's hard for them to spend it all.

title: Khabbab's Concern about Wealth
content: I visited Khabbab while he was building a wall. He said, 'Our friends who passed away didn't enjoy their reward in the next life. We've collected a lot of wealth after them, but we can only use it here on earth.'

title: Migrating with the Prophet
content: Khabbab said: We migrated with the Prophet. This story is about migration.

title: Uthman's Ablution and Prayer
content: Ibn Abbas brought water to Uthman bin Affan so he could wash his face and hands. Uthman washed himself perfectly, just like the Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) did in this same place. The Prophet (ﷺ) said that if someone does a two-rak'at prayer after washing like this, then sits down waiting for the next prayer, all their past sins will be forgiven.

title: Righteous People Leave First
content: The Prophet (ﷺ) said: 'Pious people will die one by one. Then only useless people will be left on earth, like the empty husks of barley seeds or bad dates.'

title: Don't Love Money and Clothes
content: The Prophet (ﷺ) said: 'People who love money and clothes are unhappy. If they get more, they're happy. But if they don't, they're sad.'

title: Don't Love Money Too Much
content: Ibn Abbas said the Prophet told him: 'If a person has two valleys full of money, they will still want more. Nothing can fill their belly except dust. Allah forgives those who turn back to Him.'

title: Adam's Son and Wealth
content: Ibn Abbas said he heard the Prophet say: 'If someone has a lot of money, they will always want more. Nothing can make them happy except dust. But if they ask Allah for forgiveness, He will forgive them.' Ibn Abbas wasn't sure if this was from the Quran or not.

title: Love for Wealth is a Disease
content: Ibn Az-Zubair said: The Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) used to say that if someone was given a lot of money, they would always want more. He said nothing can fill the person's life except dust. And Allah forgives those who turn back to Him.

title: Adam's Son and Greed
content: Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) said to Anas bin Malik: 'If someone had a valley full of gold, they would want even more. The only thing that fills their mouth is dust.' Allah forgives those who repent to Him.

title: Giving and Taking Wealth
content: Hakim bin Hizam asked the Prophet for money. The Prophet (ﷺ) gave it to him three times. Then he said, 'This wealth is like fresh fruit. If you take it without wanting more than you need, Allah will make it grow. But if you take it with greed, Allah won't bless it. You'll be like someone who eats but never feels full. Giving is better than taking.'

title: Love for Wealth and Heirs
content: Some people asked the Prophet: 'Who among you loves his own wealth more than what he leaves for his family?' They said, 'We all love our own money more.' The Prophet (ﷺ) replied, 'So, your true wealth is what you spend on good things during your life. What's left after you die belongs to your heirs.'

title: Abu Dhar's Nighttime Encounter
content: One night, I went out and saw the Prophet walking alone. I thought he might not want anyone with him, so I walked in the shade. He looked back and said, 'Who is there?' I replied, 'It's me, Abu Dhar.' He said, 'Come here.' We walked together for a bit. Then he said, 'The rich are actually poor on Judgment Day unless Allah gives them wealth to use for good.' We kept walking until he stopped in an open area surrounded by rocks and told me to sit down. He went off towards Al-Harra and stayed away for a while. I couldn't stay patient and asked him who he was talking to. He said, 'It was Gabriel who came to me and said that anyone who dies without worshiping anything but Allah will go to Paradise.' I asked if this included people who had committed theft or adultery. Gabriel said yes each time.

title: Spending Wealth for Allah's Sake
content: I was walking with the Prophet in Medina. He saw Mount Uhud and said, 'O Abu Dhar!' I replied, 'Here I am, O Messenger of Allah.' He said, 'If I had all the gold on this mountain, I wouldn't keep any for myself for more than three days, except what's needed to pay debts. I'd spend it among Allah's slaves like this, and like this, and like this.' The Prophet (ﷺ) pointed with his hand to his right, left, and back. He said, 'The rich are poor on the Day of Resurrection, except those who give their wealth generously in all directions, but they're few. Stay at your place until I come back.' Later, he went out into the night and disappeared from sight. I heard a loud voice and was worried something might have happened to him. But then I remembered what he said, so I stayed put. When he returned, I told him about hearing the voice. He asked if I really heard it, and I said yes. He said, 'It was Gabriel who came to me. He said that whoever dies without worshiping anyone but Allah will enter Paradise.' I asked, 'Even if they committed theft or adultery?' Gabriel replied, 'Yes, even if they did those things'

title: Spending Wealth for Allah
content: Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) said: If I had a lot of gold as big as the mountain of Uhud, I would spend all of it in three days to help people in need. The only thing I wouldn't spend is what's needed to pay back debts.

title: True Wealth Comes from Within
content: The Prophet (ﷺ) said: 'Wealth is not about having many things. True wealth comes when you feel happy and content with what you have.'

title: Rich vs Poor in Islam
content: Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) asked a man what he thought of a wealthy passer-by. The man said the rich person was noble and would be respected if he asked for someone's hand in marriage or helped someone. Another man passed by, and Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) asked again what he thought. This time, the man said the poor person wouldn't be accepted if he asked for someone's hand in marriage or tried to help. Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) said the poor man was better than many wealthy people.

title: Khabbab's Story of Migration
content: Abu Wail visited Khabbab who was sick. Khabbab said they migrated with the Prophet for Allah's sake and were owed something in return. Some friends died without getting anything, like Mus'ab bin 'Umair who was martyred at Uhud. He had only one cloth to bury him. The Prophet (ﷺ) told them to cover his head with it and put some grass on his feet. Khabbab said some of their friends got what they deserved in this life.

title: Majority in Paradise
content: The Prophet (ﷺ) said that most people in Heaven are poor. He also said that most women are in Hell.

title: Prophet Muhammad's Eating Habits
content: The Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) did not eat at a table until he died. He also never ate thin bread that was baked in the oven until his death.

title: Prophet Muhammad's Last Food
content: When the Prophet died, Aisha looked at her food storage and saw only some barley left. She ate it for a while until it was all gone.

title: Abu Huraira's Hunger Alleviated
content: Abu Huraira was very hungry. He sat by the road where the Prophet and his companions used to pass by. When Abu Bakr passed, he asked him about a verse from the Quran to get food, but Abu Bakr didn't help. Then Umar passed by, but he also didn't help. Finally, the Prophet smiled when he saw Abu Huraira and said, 'Follow me.' The Prophet (ﷺ) went home and found milk in a bowl. He asked who it was for and then told Abu Huraira to call the people of Suffa to come and drink from the milk. Abu Huraira thought the milk wouldn't be enough for them all, but he obeyed the Prophet. He gave the milk to the people of Suffa one by one until they had all drunk their fill. Then the Prophet took the bowl and drank what was left.

title: Sa'd's Early Struggle
content: Sa'd was the first Arab to fight for Allah. He and his companions fought without food, eating only desert tree leaves. They went hungry and had loose stools. Now, as an adult, Sa'd is learning about Islam from the Bani Asad tribe.

title: Prophet's Family and Bread
content: Aisha said: The family of Muhammad (ﷺ) never had three days in a row with enough wheat bread to eat until the Prophet died.

title: Muhammad's Family and Dates
content: Aisha said that Muhammad 's (ﷺ) family never went a whole day without eating dates at least once. One of their two meals was always dates.

title: Prophet's Bed Mattress
content: The Prophet 's (ﷺ) bed mattress was made of a leather case stuffed with palm fibres.

title: Anas' Bread Story
content: We would visit Anas bin Malik and see his baker working. Anas said, 'Eat the bread I have.' He told us that the Prophet never saw thin, well-baked bread in his lifetime. He also never saw a roasted sheep with his own eyes.

title: No Cooking for a Month
content: My husband and I would go without cooking food for a whole month. We only ate dates and drank water unless we received some meat as a gift.

title: Aisha's Life in Medina
content: `Aisha told `Urwa that during the time of the Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ), they would see three crescent moons in just two months. They didn't have fires burning in their homes because they were poor. `Aisha said they mostly ate dates and drank water. But sometimes, some neighbors from the Ansar tribe would give them milk from their camels.

title: Muhammad's Family Prays for Food
content: Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) said to Allah: 'Please give food to my family.'

title: Prophet's Favourite Deed
content: I asked Aisha about the Prophet's favourite deed. She said it was doing something regularly and constantly. I asked when he used to wake up at night for prayer. Aisha replied that he would get up after hearing the cock crow in the last part of the night.

title: Allah's Messenger' Favorite Action
content: The Prophet (ﷺ) liked actions done regularly and often.

title: Deeds Won't Save You
content: Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) said: 'Your good actions won't save you from Hell unless Allah shows mercy. So do good deeds honestly, moderately, and at different times of the day and night.'

title: Do Good Deeds Properly
content: Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) said to Aisha: 'Do good things with a sincere heart and in moderation. Remember that even if you do small acts of kindness regularly, they are more beloved to Allah than big deeds done occasionally.'

title: Regular Deeds Please Allah
content: The Prophet (ﷺ) was asked what deeds Allah likes most. He said that doing regular good deeds, even if they are few, is best. He also said not to take on more than you can handle.

title: Prophet's Daily Worship
content: 'Alqama asked Aisha about the Prophet's daily life. She said he didn't do extra worship on special days, but his regular prayers and actions were constant. No one can match what the Prophet did.

title: Do Good Deeds Properly
content: The Prophet (ﷺ) said: 'Do good things with a sincere heart and don't overdo it. Your good actions won't get you into Heaven on their own.' They asked, 'Even you, Messenger of Allah?' He replied, 'Even me, unless Allah forgives me and shows mercy'.

title: Paradise and Hell Appear
content: Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) led us in prayer. After finishing, he stood on the pulpit and pointed to the mosque's direction. He said that while praying, both Paradise and Hell were shown to him. They looked very different from what he had seen before.

title: Mercy Created by Allah
content: Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) said: 'God created mercy. He divided it into 100 parts and kept 99 for Himself. He sent one part to all of His creatures. If a non-believer knew how much mercy is with God, they wouldn't lose hope of going to heaven. And if a believer knew about the punishments that exist with God, they wouldn't think they're safe from hell.'

title: Giving to Those in Need
content: Some people from the Ansar asked the Prophet for help. He gave each of them what they needed until he had nothing left. Then he said: 'If I have any money, I won't keep it for myself. If you don't ask others for help, Allah will make you happy and not need anything else. If you're patient, Allah will give you patience too. And if you're content with what you have, Allah will make you independent. The best gift is being patient.'

title: Why the Prophet Prayed So Much
content: The Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) prayed a lot. His feet would swell from standing for so long. When asked why he prayed so much, he said, 'I'm just being thankful to Allah.'

title: No Ruqya or Omens
content: Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) said: 'Seventy thousand of my followers will go to Paradise without being asked questions. They are those who don't use magic and don't think something bad is happening just because it happens, and they trust in Allah.'

title: Muawiya Asks for Hadith
content: Al-Mughira wrote to Muawiya: 'I heard the Prophet say this after every prayer: God is one, with no partner. All power and praise belong to Him. He has control over everything.' The Prophet (ﷺ) also told us not to waste time talking about nothing, ask too many questions in religion, spend money unnecessarily, take what doesn't belong to you, be unkind to your mothers, or bury your daughters alive.

title: Guarantee Your Chastity
content: The Prophet (ﷺ) said: If you can keep your tongue and private parts pure, I promise you a place in Paradise.

title: Believe in Allah
content: Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) said: If you believe in Allah and the Day of Judgment, speak good or stay quiet. Don't hurt your neighbors if you believe in Allah and the Last Day. Treat your guests with kindness.

title: Treat Your Guest Well
content: The Prophet (ﷺ) said: 'When you have a guest, take care of them for three days. Give them good food and drink on the first night. If you believe in Allah and the Day of Judgment, be kind to your guest. Say something nice or stay quiet.'

title: Slip into Hell with Words
content: Abu Huraira heard the Prophet say: 'If a person says something without thinking if it's right or wrong, they can go far down in Hell. It's as far away as from the east to the west.'

title: Words Have Power
content: The Prophet (ﷺ) said: A person can say something that pleases Allah without thinking much about it. Because of this, Allah will give them more reward. On the other hand, a person might say something thoughtlessly that displeases Allah. This could lead to being sent to Hell.

title: Seven People Given Shade
content: The Prophet (ﷺ) said that Allah will give special protection to seven types of people on the Day of Judgment. One of these is a person who remembers Allah and then cries because of it.

title: Forgiveness for a Good Reason
content: A man was worried about his good deeds. He told his family to burn his body and scatter the ashes in the sea on a windy day if he died. They did that, but Allah gathered all the parts of his body back together. Then Allah asked him why he had done it. The man said he was afraid of Allah's punishment. So Allah forgave him.

title: A Father's Last Request
content: Abu Sa'id said the Prophet mentioned a man who had wealth and children. When he was dying, he asked his children if they thought he was a good father. They said yes, but he replied that he didn't do any good deeds for Allah, so he would be punished when he died. He told them to burn his body after he died, grind it into powder, and then throw the ashes in a strong wind. His children promised to do this. When they did, Allah brought him back to life and asked why he had done what he did. The man said he was afraid of Allah's punishment, so Allah forgave him.

title: Trust the Messenger's Warning
content: Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) said: 'My message is like a man who warned people about an enemy. He said,

title: Protecting You from Hellfire
content: Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) said: 'I am like a man who made a fire. When it lit up, moths and insects started falling into the flames. The owner tried to stop them but they kept going in. I take care of you by reminding you of good actions, but some people still do bad things and fall into trouble.'

title: What Makes a Muslim
content: The Prophet (ﷺ) said: A Muslim is someone who doesn't hurt others with their words or actions. A Muhajir is someone who gives up everything Allah has forbidden.

title: Laugh Little, Weep Much
content: Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) said to Abu Huraira: 'If you knew what I know, you would laugh very little and cry a lot.'

title: Laugh Little, Weep Much
content: The Prophet (ﷺ) said to his companions, 'If you knew what I know, you would laugh very little and cry a lot.'

title: Paradise and Hell's Surroundings
content: Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) said: 'Hell is surrounded by things people usually like. Paradise is surrounded by things people don't want to do.'

title: Paradise is Very Close
content: The Prophet (ﷺ) said, 'Paradise is closer to you than the strap on your shoe. And so is Hellfire.'

title: Perishable Things
content: Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) said: 'Everything except Allah will come to an end.'

title: Look at Others Too
content: Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) said: If you see someone who has more wealth and looks better than you, also look at someone who is poorer and less well-off. This helps keep things in perspective.

title: God's Writing of Deeds
content: The Prophet (ﷺ) said: Allah told the angels to record good and bad actions. He showed them how to write it down. If someone wants to do a good deed but doesn't, Allah writes one good deed for them. If they actually do a good deed, Allah writes a reward of ten to seven hundred times more good deeds in their account. If someone wants to do something bad but doesn't, Allah still writes one good deed for them. But if they do something bad, only that one bad action is recorded.

title: Small Sins Can Be Big
content: Anas said that people do bad things that seem small to them. But during the Prophet's time, we thought those same actions were very serious sins.

title: Deeds Can Be Deceptive
content: The Prophet (ﷺ) looked at a man fighting for the Muslims. He said, 'If you want to see someone from Hell, look at him.' The man followed this fighter and was injured. To end his life quickly, he put his sword between his chest and leaned on it until it passed through. The Prophet (ﷺ) said that people's actions can seem good but actually be bad, and vice versa. What matters is the last thing you do.

title: Who is the Best Person?
content: A Bedouin asked the Prophet who was the best person. The Prophet (ﷺ) said that it's someone who fights for Allah and uses their life and money to help others, or a person who lives alone in the mountains and worships Allah.

title: Protecting Faith in Hard Times
content: Abu Sa'id said the Prophet told him: 'In the future, a Muslim's best wealth will be his sheep. He'll take them to high mountains and places where it rains. People will abandon their faith to escape troubles.'

title: Losing Honesty Brings Doom
content: Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) said: When people stop being honest, the end of time will come. Someone asked him how this would happen. He replied: When those who shouldn't be in charge get power.

title: Honesty in the Heart
content: Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) told us that honesty was originally in people's hearts. They learned it from the Quran and then from his teachings. He said that one day, people will lose their honesty completely, leaving only a small reminder. Eventually, no one will be trustworthy. People will be known for being smart, polite, or strong, but not for being honest. The narrator said he used to trust anyone, as long as they were Muslim or had a Muslim leader. But now, he can only trust certain people.

title: Finding the Right Companion
content: Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) said that out of one hundred people, you might find only one who is good to be around. He compared people to camels, saying it's hard to find a suitable one to ride.

title: Don't Seek Praise for Good Deeds
content: The Prophet (ﷺ) said: If someone tells people about their good actions just to get praised, Allah will reveal their true intentions on the Day of Judgment. And if someone does good things in public only to be admired by others, Allah will show everyone what's really in their heart.

title: Mu`adh and the Prophet's Teaching
content: I was riding with the Prophet. He said to me, 'Do you know what Allah wants from us?' I said, 'Allah knows best.' He said, 'We should only worship Allah, not any other gods.' Then he asked again, 'And do you know what we get from Allah if we do that?' Again, I said, 'Allah knows best.' He said, 'If we worship only Him, Allah will not punish us.'

title: Prophet's She-Camel Outrun
content: The Prophet (ﷺ) had a camel called Al-'Adba'. It was very fast. A Bedouin rode his camel, and it went even faster than Al-'Adba'. The Muslims were sad because their camel wasn't the fastest anymore. The Prophet (ﷺ) said, 'Allah can make something great in this world, but then He can also bring it down to nothing.'

title: Allah's Love for His Servant
content: Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) said that Allah said: 'I will protect anyone who is kind to one of My good servants. The things I like most about a servant are the good deeds they do because I told them to. If someone does extra good deeds, I get closer and closer to them until I love them very much. Then I help them in many ways: I give them hearing, sight, strength in their hands, and the ability to walk. If they ask for something, I will give it to them. And if they want My protection, I will protect them. The only thing that makes Me hesitant is taking a believer's life because they don't like to die, and I don't like disappointing them.'

title: The Hour is Near
content: Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) said, 'I have been sent and the Day of Judgment will come soon. It's as close as these two fingers.' He showed his two fingers apart.

title: The Hour is Near
content: Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) said: 'I have been sent as a messenger and the end of time is close. This will happen soon, just like how these two fingers can be brought together quickly.'

title: The Prophet's Message
content: The Prophet (ﷺ) said to Abu Huraira: 'I have been sent as a warning and the end of time is near. It will come quickly, just like these two fingers closing together.'

title: The Signs Before Judgment Day
content: Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) said: The Hour will not come until the sun rises from the west. When it does rise, people will believe in Allah. But that time is too late for anyone to benefit from believing then. It will happen so quickly that two people trying to share a blanket won't be able to finish their task or fold it up. People will be busy with daily tasks when Judgment Day arrives: one man carrying milk for his camel can't drink it, another person preparing water for animals can't finish the job, and someone about to eat food can't take a bite.

title: Loving to Meet Allah
content: The Prophet (ﷺ) said: If someone loves meeting Allah, Allah will love meeting them. And if someone hates meeting Allah, Allah will hate meeting them. Aisha asked, 'But we don't like dying.' The Prophet (ﷺ) explained that when a believer is about to die, they receive good news from Allah and feel happy because of His blessings. They then love meeting Allah. But when a disbeliever is about to die, they get bad news from Allah and are unhappy with what's happening. So, they hate meeting Allah, and Allah hates meeting them too.

title: Allah Loves Those Who Love Him
content: The Prophet (ﷺ) said: 'If someone likes to meet Allah, Allah will like meeting them. If someone dislikes meeting Allah, Allah will dislike meeting them.'

title: Prophet's Last Words
content: When the Prophet was healthy, he said that no prophet's soul is taken unless they see their place in Paradise and are given a choice. When his death approached, he became unconscious but then looked up at the ceiling and said 'O Allah, with the highest companions'. I thought this meant he wouldn't choose us to be with him.

title: Allah's Messenger at Death
content: When Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) was dying, there was a container of water in front of him. He would dip his hand into the water and wipe his face with it. He said, 'There is no god but Allah.' He also repeated, 'I want to be with the best companions,' until he died.

title: Visiting Bedouins Ask About Hour
content: Some rough bedouin visitors would ask the Prophet when the end of time would come. He would look at the youngest one and say, 'If this person lives a long life, you will all die.'

title: Death and Its Relief
content: One day, a funeral procession passed by the Prophet. He asked, 'Is it good or bad news?' People asked what he meant. The Prophet (ﷺ) said, 'When a good person dies, they leave behind troubles in this world but go to Allah's mercy. When a bad person dies, people and animals are relieved because that person is no longer causing problems.'

title: Death Brings Relief
content: The Prophet (ﷺ) said that a believer is relieved when they die. This means death brings an end to problems and suffering.

title: What Happens After Burial
content: When a person dies and is buried, three things follow them to their grave. Two of these things go back: the relatives who came to say goodbye and the property they left behind. But one thing stays with them forever: the good or bad deeds they did in life.

title: Death's Destination Revealed
content: When someone dies, Allah shows them where they will go after judgment. It could be either Hell or Paradise. They are told, 'This is your place until you're brought back to life and sent there'.

title: Respect the Dead
content: The Prophet (ﷺ) said: 'Don't speak badly about someone who has died. They have reached their final destination based on what they did in life.'

title: Two Men Argue About Muhammad
content: Two men, one Muslim and one Jew, got into a fight. The Muslim said something about Muhammad (ﷺ) being special. The Jew replied by saying Moses was special too. The Muslim became angry and slapped the Jew. The Jew went to see the Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ). He told him what happened. The Prophet (ﷺ) said not to compare him to Moses. On Judgment Day, everyone will fall asleep except for a few people who won't. Even then, he might not know if Moses is awake or not because Moses will be holding onto God's throne.

title: The Day of Resurrection
content: The Prophet (ﷺ) said, 'At the time of Judgment, people will faint. I'll be the first to wake up and see Moses holding Allah's Throne. I won't know if he was among those who fainted.'

title: Allah's Power and Dominion
content: The Prophet (ﷺ) said: Allah will hold the earth in His hand. He will roll up the sky with his right hand. Then He will say, 'I am the King. Where are the leaders of the world?'

title: Earth as Bread on Judgement Day
content: The Prophet (ﷺ) said, 'On the Day of Resurrection, the earth will be like a big loaf of bread. Allah will turn it over with His Hand like you would flip a bread when preparing for a journey. The people of Paradise will eat from this bread.' A Jewish man came and said, 'I can tell you what they'll have to eat with their bread.' The Prophet (ﷺ) asked him to go on. The Jew said, 'They will have Balam (an ox) and Nun (a fish). 70,000 people will share the liver of one of these animals.'

title: Day of Resurrection
content: The Prophet (ﷺ) said: On the Day of Judgement, people will stand on a land that looks like fresh white bread. This land won't have any signs or landmarks to help anyone find their way.

title: Three Ways of Gathering
content: The Prophet (ﷺ) said: People will gather in three groups. The first group is those who want to go to Paradise but are also afraid of punishment. The second group will arrive together on a camel, some riding two, others three, and still others ten. The third group will be led by the Fire, which will follow them from their afternoon nap until they sleep at night, and then in the morning wherever they may be.

title: Can a Disbeliever be Gathered Face Down?
content: A man asked the Prophet: 'Will a person who doesn't believe in Allah be gathered on their face?' The Prophet (ﷺ) replied: 'If Allah can make them walk with their legs in this world, why can't He make them walk on their face on Judgment Day?'

title: Meeting Allah on Judgement Day
content: The Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) said to Ibn Abbas: 'When you meet Allah, you will be barefoot, without clothes, walking on your feet, and not circumcised.'

title: Meeting Allah Naked
content: Ibn Abbas heard the Prophet say: 'When you meet Allah, you will be without shoes, clothes, and circumcision.'

title: The Day of Resurrection
content: The Prophet (ﷺ) stood up and said: 'You will be gathered on the Day of Resurrection in a state of nakedness, without shoes or circumcision. The first person to be dressed will be Abraham. Then some of my followers will be taken away from me, and I will ask Allah about them. He will say that they did something wrong after I left them. They will have turned their backs on Islam.'

title: Judgment Day: Naked and Uncircumcised
content: Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) said to Aisha: 'On Judgment Day, people will be gathered without clothes, shoes, or circumcision. Aisha asked if men and women would look at each other, but the Prophet said they'd be too busy dealing with that situation to notice.

title: Prophet's Hope for Paradise
content: We were with the Prophet in a tent. He asked if we'd like to be one fourth of people in Paradise, then one third, and finally half. We said yes each time. The Prophet (ﷺ) said he hoped we would be half of those in Paradise because only Muslim souls can enter. Compared to others who worship idols, we are like a small white hair on black skin or a small black hair on red skin.

title: Adam's Call on Judgement Day
content: Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) said: Adam will be the first person called on the Day of Resurrection. He'll see his children and say, 'Here I am.' Allah will ask him to bring out people who go to Hell from his children. Adam asks how many, and Allah says take ninety-nine out of every hundred. The Prophet 's (ﷺ) companions asked what would remain if that happened. He said his followers are like a white hair on a black ox compared to other nations.

title: Adam's Answer to Allah
content: The Prophet (ﷺ) said: 'On the Day of Judgment, Allah will ask Adam,

title: Standing Before Allah
content: The Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) said that on a certain day, all people will stand before God. They will be covered in sweat up to their ears.

title: Sweat on Judgement Day
content: Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) said: On the Day of Resurrection, people will sweat so much that their sweat will sink deep into the earth. It will rise up to their mouths and ears.

title: Blood-Shedding Cases First
content: Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) said that the first cases to be decided on Judgment Day will be those involving bloodshed.

title: Forgive Your Brother
content: If you have wronged someone, ask them to forgive you before you die. In the afterlife, there won't be any money or wealth. If you don't ask for forgiveness, some of your good deeds might be taken from you and given to the person you wronged. Or, if you did no good deeds, their bad deeds will be added to yours.

title: Believers Face Justice
content: Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) said that after believers are saved from Hell, they will be stopped at a bridge between Paradise and Hell. There, they will make things right with each other for any wrongs done in the world. After this is settled, they will be cleaned up and allowed into Paradise. And when they get there, everyone will know exactly where their home is, just like how we knew our homes on earth.

title: Punishment for Questioning Account
content: Aisha asked the Prophet about a verse in the Quran. The Prophet (ﷺ) said that when Allah asks someone to explain their actions, they will be punished. Aisha then asked if it doesn't say in the Quran that punishment is easy. The Prophet (ﷺ) explained that this means only presenting the account of one's actions.

title: Day of Judgement
content: Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) said to Aisha: 'On the Day of Resurrection, no one will be questioned and then ruined.' Aisha asked, 'But hasn't Allah said that those who receive their records in their right hand will have an easy reckoning?' The Prophet (ﷺ) replied, 'That means only showing them their accounts. Anyone whose account is questioned on the Day of Resurrection will definitely be punished.'

title: Ransom on the Day of Judgement
content: Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) said that a non-believer will be brought to life on the Day of Resurrection. He will be asked if he would trade all the gold in the world to save himself. The person says yes, but then is told that accepting Islam was an easier choice.

title: Allah will speak to each person
content: The Prophet (ﷺ) said: On the Day of Resurrection, Allah will talk directly to every single one of you. You'll look ahead and see nothing but then again, and that's when you'll face the Fire. So, try to save yourself from it by doing even a small act of kindness.

title: Protect Yourself from the Fire
content: The Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) said to his companions: 'Be careful and protect yourselves from going into the Fire.' He looked at it as if he was seeing it right in front of him. He repeated this warning three times, then said: 'Even with just a small amount, like half a date, or by saying something kind, try to stay away from the Fire.'

title: Prophets and Their Followers
content: The Prophet (ﷺ) saw many prophets passing by with different numbers of followers. One had a large group, another had only ten people, and one was alone. Gabriel told the Prophet that those who were far away on the horizon were his followers. They were seventy thousand people who would not be punished or have to answer for their actions because they didn't hurt themselves or seek help from others when they felt sick, and they trusted in Allah.

title: Seventy Thousand Will Enter Paradise
content: Abu Huraira said he heard the Prophet say that a big group of his followers will go to Heaven. There are seventy thousand people in this group, and their faces will shine like the full moon. When someone named 'Ukasha heard this, he stood up and asked the Prophet to pray for him to be one of them. The Prophet (ﷺ) prayed for him. Another man from a group called Ansar also stood up and asked the Prophet to pray for him too. But the Prophet said that 'Ukasha had already been chosen before him.

title: Seventy Thousand Enter Paradise
content: The Prophet (ﷺ) said, 'Seventy thousand of my followers will enter Paradise together. They'll be holding hands with each other. Their faces will shine like the full moon at night when they all enter together.'

title: Paradise and Hell's Eternal Fate
content: The Prophet (ﷺ) said: The people of Paradise will go to Paradise, and the people of Hell will go to Hell. Then a caller will say: People of Hell, you won't die anymore! And people of Paradise, you won't die either - only live forever.

title: Paradise and Hell's Eternal Fate
content: The Prophet (ﷺ) said to Abu Huraira: 'In Paradise, people will be told,

title: Majority in Paradise
content: The Prophet (ﷺ) said, 'I looked into paradise and saw that most people there are poor. I also looked into the Fire and found that most of its people are women.'

title: Poor People in Paradise
content: The Prophet (ﷺ) said that when he stood at the gate of Paradise, most people entering were poor. Rich people couldn't enter with them because they had to settle their accounts first. At the gate of Fire, most people going in were women.

title: Death after Judgment Day
content: Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) said: When people in Paradise and those in the Fire are settled, death will be brought between them. It will then be killed, and a message will be announced saying 'No more death for you who are in Paradise!' and 'No more death for you who are in the Fire!' This means that those in Paradise will get even happier, while those in the Fire will suffer even more sorrow.

title: Paradise: Allah's Pleasure
content: Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) said, 'One day in Paradise, Allah will call out to the people. They'll say they're ready. Allah will ask if they're happy. They'll say yes because He gave them something special. Allah will say there's more to come. They'll ask what it is. Allah will say He'll be pleased with them and never get angry again.'

title: Haritha's Mother's Faith
content: Anas said that Haritha was killed in the battle of Badr when he was still young. His mother came to the Prophet and said, 'If my son is in Paradise, I will be patient.' The Prophet (ﷺ) replied, 'There are many Paradises, and your son is in the best one, Al-Firdaus'.

title: Disbelievers' Punishment
content: Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) said that the distance between a disbeliever's shoulders will be as wide as what a fast rider can cover in three days.

title: Paradise's Huge Tree
content: Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) said: In Paradise there is a huge tree. A rider can travel in its shade for one hundred years without crossing it.

title: Paradise's Huge Tree
content: The Prophet (ﷺ) said: There is a tree in Paradise that is so big. A rider can travel for one hundred years and still not cross it.

title: Seventy Thousand Enter Paradise
content: Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) said: 'About seventy thousand of my followers will go to Heaven. They'll be walking together, holding hands, and their faces will shine like the full moon on a clear night.'

title: Paradise's Special Abodes
content: The Prophet (ﷺ) said: 'People in Paradise will see their special homes like a star shining in the sky. They'll stay in the east and west forever.'

title: Punishment in the Fire
content: The Prophet (ﷺ) said, 'On Judgment Day, Allah will ask someone who gets a small punishment:

title: People Saved from Hell
content: The Prophet (ﷺ) said: Some people will be saved from the Fire through prayer. I asked someone about this and he told me it means those who look like old men with no teeth. He had lost his teeth by then.

title: People Leave Hell for Paradise
content: The Prophet (ﷺ) said: Some people will leave the Fire after being touched by it. They'll change color and enter Paradise. The people of Paradise will call them 'those who came from Hell'.

title: Paradise for Those with Faith
content: Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) said: When people are in Paradise and Hell, Allah will say to take out those who have faith. They come out of the fire, burnt like coal, but then they're thrown into a river that brings them back to life. The Prophet (ﷺ) compared it to a seed growing on a stream bank.

title: Least Punishment in Hell
content: The Prophet (ﷺ) said: A person will be punished the least in Hell. He will have a burning coal under his feet, which will make his brain boil.

title: Punishment in the Fire
content: The Prophet (ﷺ) said: A person will be punished in Hell because of two hot coals under their feet. The heat from these coals will make their brain boil like a pot boiling with water.

title: Protecting Ourselves from Hell
content: Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) mentioned the Fire and turned away. He asked Allah to protect him from it twice. Then he said, 'Do whatever you can to stay safe from the Fire, even if it's just half a date. If that's not possible, say something kind.'

title: Abu Talib's Fate
content: I heard the Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) say that his uncle Abu Talib might be helped by him on Judgment Day. This could mean Abu Talib gets a lighter punishment, being in a part of Hell where fire only reaches up to his ankles, and it makes his brain boil.

title: Muhammad's Role on Judgment Day
content: On the Day of Resurrection, all people will gather and ask for someone to intercede with Allah. They will go to Adam, but he says he is not fit because of his sin. He sends them to Noah, who also refuses due to his own sin. Then they go to Abraham, Moses, and Jesus, each saying the same thing. Finally, they are sent to Muhammad (ﷺ). When they come to him, he asks Allah's permission and falls into prostration. Allah tells him to speak up, and Muhammad (ﷺ) will be granted what he asks for. He will then intercede with Allah, taking out some people from Hell and letting them enter Paradise. This process is repeated three times until only those who have been imprisoned in Hell by the Quran remain.

title: Muhammad's Intercession
content: Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) said: Some people will be taken out of Hell because of his intercession. They will enter Paradise and be called the people who came from Hell.

title: Paradise for Haritha's Mother
content: Um Haritha visited the Prophet. Her son Haritha had been killed in battle at Badr. She said, 'If my son is in Paradise, I won't cry.' The Prophet (ﷺ) replied, 'There are many Paradises, and he's in a special one called Firdaus.' He also said that helping Allah is more important than all the world's wealth. A small area of Paradise can be better than everything on earth. If a woman from Paradise looks at the earth, it would shine with light.

title: Paradise Has Many Levels
content: Um Haritha came to the Prophet after her son was killed in battle. She said she wouldn't cry if he was in Paradise, but would otherwise show her sadness. The Prophet (ﷺ) told her there are many levels of Paradise and her son is in the highest one called Firdaus. He also said that helping Allah's cause is more valuable than all the world has to offer. Even a small space in Paradise is better than everything on earth. If a woman from Paradise looked at the earth, she would shine so brightly it would fill the space between them.

title: Paradise and Hellfire
content: The Prophet (ﷺ) said: 'When someone enters Paradise, they will see where in the Fire they would have been if they had not believed. This helps them be more thankful. When someone goes into the Fire, they will see where in Paradise they could have been if they had believed. This makes them sad.'

title: Who Will Get Prophet's Help
content: Abu Huraira asked the Prophet: 'Who will be lucky enough to get your help on the Day of Resurrection?' The Prophet (ﷺ) said, 'I thought no one would ask me this before you. I know how much you love learning Hadiths.' He then said, 'The person who says

title: Last to Leave Hell
content: The Prophet (ﷺ) said that he knows a man who will be the last to leave the Fire and enter Paradise. This person will come out of the Fire crawling, and Allah will tell him to go into Paradise. But when he gets there, he'll think it's full. He'll ask Allah if it's really empty, and Allah will say yes. Then Allah will give him as much wealth as ten times the world's worth. The man will be surprised and ask why Allah is joking with him.

title: Abu Talib's Last Request
content: `Abbas asked the Prophet if he had helped his uncle Abu Talib with anything. The Prophet (ﷺ) said no, but that Abu Talib would be rewarded for protecting him when people were against Islam.

title: Seeing Allah on Judgment Day
content: Some people asked the Prophet: 'Will we see our Lord on the Day of Resurrection?' He said, 'Do you crowd and squeeze each other when looking at the sun or the moon? They replied, 'No.' He said, 'You will see Him similarly. Allah will gather all people and say, 'Those who worshiped idols should follow them.' Those who worshiped the sun will follow it, those who worshiped the moon will follow it, and so on. Only Muslims and their hypocrites will remain. Allah will come to them in a form they don't know and say, 'I am your Lord.' They will say, 'We seek refuge with Allah from you!' Then Allah will come to them in a form they do recognize and say, 'I am your Lord.' They will agree and follow Him. A bridge will be laid over the Hell Fire. I will cross it first. The prophets will pray: 'O Allah, save us!' On that bridge, hooks like thorns will snatch people according to their deeds. Some will fall into Hell but then be saved when Allah finishes judging His slaves. We will order angels to take them out, and they will know who to rescue by the mark of prostration on their foreheads. They will burn as coal, but water called Ma'ul Hayat will revive them. One man will remain facing the Fire, asking Allah to turn his face away. He will promise not to ask for anything else. Then he will ask to enter Paradise near its gate. Allah will scold him for breaking his promise and remind him of his covenant. The man will keep praying until Allah smiles at him. When Allah smiles, He allows the man to enter Paradise. When he enters, people will wish things for him, but Allah will say: 'All this and more is yours.'

title: Abu Sa'id Corrects Abu Huraira
content: Abu Huraira was telling a story about the Prophet. He said that all this and even more is for you. Abu Sa'id corrected him, saying he heard the Prophet say 'This is for you and ten times as much'. Abu Huraira agreed, saying in his memory it's like Abu Sa'id said.

title: Prophet's Warning at the Lake
content: The Prophet (ﷺ) said: 'I will be waiting for you all at a special lake. Some of you will come to me, and I'll see you before being taken away. Then, I'll ask God,

title: A Tank of Water
content: The Prophet (ﷺ) said: 'There will be a big tank in front of you. It's as far away as from Jarba to Adhruh.'

title: What is Al-Kauthar?
content: Ibn Abbas said that 'Al-Kauthar' means the many good things Allah gave to the Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ). Some people think it's a river in Paradise, but Sa'id said it's just one part of the good things Allah gave to him.

title: The Prophet's Lake-Fount
content: The Prophet (ﷺ) said: 'My lake is so big that it takes a month to cross. The water is white and smells nice, like perfume. There are cups as many as the stars in the sky. Whoever drinks from it will never be thirsty again.'

title: Size of My Lake-Fount
content: Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) said: 'My lake is as wide as the distance between Aila and Sana'. It has many containers, just like the number of stars in the sky.

title: Prophet's Journey to Paradise
content: The Prophet (ﷺ) was walking in a beautiful place called Paradise. He saw a river with houses made of pearls on its banks. Gabriel said, 'This is Kauthar, a special gift from Allah.' The river smelled like musk.

title: Companions at the Lake Fount
content: The Prophet (ﷺ) said: 'Some of my friends will come to me at a special lake. I'll recognize them, but then they'll be taken away from me. When I ask for them, it will be said that they did new things in Islam after I was gone.'

title: The Lake-Fount on Judgement Day
content: The Prophet (ﷺ) said: 'I will be at the Lake-Fount. Whoever passes by it can drink from it and never feel thirsty again. Some people who follow me will come, but a barrier will stop them from reaching me. They will say they are my followers, but I won't know what new things they have done in Islam after I left.'

title: Prophet's Companions and the Lake-Fount
content: Some of the Prophet's companions will come to a special lake. They'll be sent away because they turned against Islam after he left. The Prophet (ﷺ) will ask, 'Lord, what about my friends?' He'll be told, 'You don't know what they did after you went.'

title: The Prophet's Warning
content: The Prophet (ﷺ) said, 'I was sleeping when I saw some of my followers brought to me. An angel came and said,

title: Paradise Garden Near My House
content: Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) said: 'There's a garden from the gardens of Paradise between my house and where I preach. And my place of preaching is above a special lake.'

title: Prophet's Promise at Al-Kauthar
content: Jundab said the Prophet told him: 'I will be waiting for you at a special lake called Al-Kauthar. It's where I'll meet all of you again.'

title: Prophet's Warning to Followers
content: The Prophet (ﷺ) went out and led prayers for the martyrs of Uhud. He then spoke from the pulpit, 'I will be your example and witness. I can see my place in Paradise right now. The keys to the world's riches have been given to me. I'm not worried that you'll worship other gods after me. But I fear you might fight over these worldly treasures.'

title: The Lake-Fount of Prophet Muhammad
content: Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) mentioned a special lake called Al-Kauthar. He said its width is as far as from Medina to Sana', the capital of Yemen. Haritha, who heard this, didn't see any vessels in it, but Al-Mustaurid told him that many vessels are there, like stars in the sky.

title: The Prophet's Warning
content: Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) said: 'I'll be at a big lake. I'll see who comes to me, but some people will be taken away. I'll ask God,

title: Life Begins Before Birth
content: Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) said: 'Each person is in the womb for forty days as a tiny cluster of cells. Then it turns into a clot and stays like that for another forty days. After that, it becomes flesh again for forty more days. An angel comes from Allah and writes four things about each person: how much they will have to live on, how long they will live, whether they will be happy or unhappy in the next life, and what their final destination will be. Then Allah gives them a soul. A person may do good deeds until it's almost too late, but then they start doing bad things instead. Or they might do bad things most of the time, but then they change and do good deeds just before they die.'

title: Allah Creates Life
content: The Prophet (ﷺ) said that Allah puts an angel in charge of the womb. The angel says to Allah: 'It's just semen', then a clot, and finally flesh. If Allah wants the baby to be born, the angel asks: 'Will it be a boy or girl? Will it be good or bad? How much will they have? What age will they live?' All this is decided while the baby is still in the womb.

title: Paradise and Hell: How We're Judged
content: A man asked the Prophet: 'Can we tell who's in Paradise and who's in Hell?' The Prophet (ﷺ) said, 'Yes.' The man then asked, 'Why do people try to do good deeds?' The Prophet (ﷺ) replied, 'Each person will either do what they were meant to do or find it easy to do what leads them to their final destination.'

title: Prophet's Answer About Pagans
content: Ibn Abbas asked the Prophet about what would happen to the children of non-Muslims. The Prophet (ﷺ) said, 'Allah knows what they would have done if they were alive'.

title: What Allah Knows About Pagans
content: Abu Huraira asked the Prophet about what would happen to the children of non-Muslims. The Prophet (ﷺ) replied, 'Allah knows their future actions'.

title: Children are born Muslim
content: Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) said: No child is born without being a Muslim. Their parents then make them Jewish or Christian. It's like when animals give birth, do you find any of their babies already hurt before you harm them? People asked the Prophet about children who die young. He replied that Allah knows what they would have done if they had lived.

title: Children are born Muslim
content: Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) said: No child is born without having the Islamic faith. But their parents can change this by raising them as Jews or Christians. It's like when animals give birth, do you find any of their babies already hurt? The Prophet (ﷺ) was asked about children who die young and he said that Allah knows what they would have done if they had lived.

title: Don't Ask for Divorce
content: Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) said: A woman should not ask her husband to divorce his other wife so she can marry him. Instead, she should wait and see if Allah has planned something better for her.

title: A Child is Sick
content: Usama was with the Prophet. Sa'd, Ubai bin Ka'b, and Mu'adh were also there. A messenger came from one of the Prophet's daughters. She said her child was very sick. The Prophet (ﷺ) sent a message back to her: 'What happens is Allah's will. What He gives or takes is His choice. Everything has its time. Be patient and look for Allah's reward.'

title: Coitus Interruptus and Creation
content: Abu Sa'id was sitting with the Prophet. A man from the Ansar came and asked, 'We get slave girls from war captives and we like having children. What do you think about stopping sperm from reaching the woman?' The Prophet (ﷺ) said, 'Do you really do that? It's better not to. Allah creates every soul He wants to create'.

title: Prophet's Detailed Speech
content: The Prophet (ﷺ) once gave a speech to his followers. He talked about everything that would happen until the end of time. Some people remembered what he said, but others forgot. I was one of those who forgot. But when events happened as he had described, I recognized them like recognizing someone you know.

title: Places in Heaven or Hell
content: Ali was with the Prophet. The Prophet (ﷺ) had a stick and was scraping the ground. He said, 'Each of you will go to either Paradise or Hell.' A man asked, 'Should we just rely on this?' The Prophet (ﷺ) replied, 'No, keep doing good deeds. It's easy to do what is right.' Then he read from the Quran: 'Those who give charity and are faithful to Allah'

title: The Prophet's Warning at Khaibar
content: The Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) was with his companions during the battle of Khaibar. He said a man who claimed to be Muslim would end up in Hellfire. During the fight, this man bravely fought and got many wounds. A companion asked the Prophet if he knew what this man had done. The Prophet (ﷺ) replied that it didn't change the fact that he was from the people of Hellfire. The man was so hurt that he took an arrow and killed himself. Some Muslims were unsure about the Prophet's words, but soon they saw the truth. The Prophet (ﷺ) then said: 'Only a true believer will enter Paradise.'

title: A Brave Warrior's Fate
content: A man fought very bravely in a battle with the Prophet. The Prophet (ﷺ) pointed to him and said, 'If you want to see someone from the people of Hell, look at this man.' A Muslim followed him and saw how he was fighting fiercely against the enemy until he got hurt. Then he killed himself by pressing his sword into his chest. The Muslim who watched this went back to the Prophet and said, 'I believe in you as a messenger of God!' The Prophet (ﷺ) asked why he believed this. He explained that the brave man had fought well for Islam but then killed himself instead of waiting for death naturally. The Prophet (ﷺ) replied, 'A person can do things that seem like they belong to people who go to Hell, but actually they are going to Paradise. And a person can do good deeds that seem like they should take them to Paradise, but actually they will go to Hell. The final actions decide what happens in the end.'

title: Prophet Forbids Vowing
content: Ibn Umar said the Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) forbade making vows. He said vowing doesn't stop anything from happening, but it can make a person who is tight with money spend their wealth.

title: Vowing and Fate
content: The Prophet (ﷺ) said that Allah told him: Vowing doesn't change what's already written for a person. But vowing can make someone spend their money, even if they're tight with it.

title: Takbir in Battle
content: We were fighting alongside the Prophet. Whenever we climbed a hill or walked down a valley, we shouted 'Allahu Akbar' (God is Great). The Prophet (ﷺ) came to us and said, 'Don't shout so loudly because you're not calling someone who can't hear you.' He then said, 'I'll teach you a phrase from the best things in life:

title: Two Types of Advisors
content: The Prophet (ﷺ) said: A leader has two groups that give advice. One group tells the leader to do good things and encourages them to follow it. The other group tells the leader to do bad things and tries to get them to follow that too. The one who is protected by Allah will make the right choice.

title: Minor Sins and Adultery
content: The Prophet (ﷺ) said: Allah has decided that every person will commit some kind of sin in their life. This can be looking at something you shouldn't, saying something wrong, or wanting to do something bad. Your body might even try to make it happen.

title: Muhammad's Night Journey
content: Ibn Abbas said that the Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) actually saw with his own eyes the things shown to him during his journey to Jerusalem and then to heaven. The tree of Az-Zaqqum, which is cursed in the Quran, was also seen by the Prophet.

title: Adam and Moses Argue
content: Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) said that Adam and Moses argued. Moses blamed Adam for getting them kicked out of Paradise. But Adam replied, 'Allah talked to you directly and wrote the Torah with His own hand. I was already meant to do what I did, 40 years before I was even created.' Adam won the argument.

title: Muawiya Asks About Prophet's Prayer
content: Muawiya wrote to Mughira. He asked what the Prophet said after his prayer. Mughira told me, 'I heard the Prophet say:

title: Protect Yourself from Calamities
content: The Prophet (ﷺ) said: 'Ask Allah to protect you from big problems. Ask Him to save you from a bad death and an unlucky life. And ask Him to stop your enemies from being happy when something bad happens to you.'

title: Taking an Oath
content: When taking an oath, the Prophet often said: 'No, by God Who changes people's hearts'.

title: The Prophet's Warning to Ibn Saiyad
content: The Prophet (ﷺ) told Ibn Saiyad that he had a secret for him. Ibn Saiyad said 'Ad-Dukh'. The Prophet (ﷺ) told him to be quiet because he couldn't go beyond what was already planned. Umar wanted to kill him, but the Prophet stopped him, saying if he's the bad person (Dajjal), they can't defeat him, and if not, killing him won't help.

title: Patience During Plague
content: I asked the Prophet about the plague. He said it's a test from Allah that can be hard for anyone. But if you stay in a town with the plague, be patient and trust Allah will reward you. If you know your fate is already decided by Allah, then staying there is like being a martyr.

title: Prophet Carries Earth in Battle
content: I saw the Prophet on a day of war. He was carrying earth with us and said: 'We wouldn't be guided, or fast, or pray without Allah's help.' He asked Allah to give us calmness and strong feet when we met the enemy. The pagans had rebelled against us, but if they wanted to fight, we would not run away.

title: Abu Bakr's Oath
content: 'Aisha said: Abu Bakr never broke his promises until Allah revealed a way to make up for broken oaths. Then he said, 'If I promise to do something and later find something better, I will do the better thing and make amends for my promise'.

title: Don't Seek Power
content: The Prophet (ﷺ) said to `Abdur-Rahman bin Samura: 'Don't want to be in charge. If you get power, you'll be responsible for it. But if it comes without asking, Allah will help you. And if you promise to do something and then find a better option, do the better one and make things right with Allah.'

title: The Prophet's Promise
content: Abu Musa and a group of people went to the Prophet. They asked for horses to ride on, but he said, 'I won't give you any.' They stayed there until three nice camels arrived. The Prophet (ﷺ) let them ride these camels. When they left, some of them thought, 'We came asking for horses, and the Prophet swore he wouldn't give us any, but then he did. We should go back and remind him of his promise.' So they went back to the Prophet and reminded him. He said, 'I didn't give you horses. Allah gave you camels instead. If I make a promise and find something better, I'll do what's better and ask for forgiveness for breaking my promise'.

title: Last but First on Judgement Day
content: The Prophet (ﷺ) said: 'We Muslims will be the last people in this world, but we will be at the front of everyone else on the Day of Resurrection. If you make a promise that might harm your family, it's worse to keep it than to break it and make things right with Allah.'

title: Breaking an Unfair Oath
content: Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) said: If someone makes a promise that could hurt their family and still keeps it, they have done something very wrong. It's better to make things right by doing something good instead.

title: Allah's Messenger Defends Usama
content: Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) sent an army with Usama bin Zaid as commander. Some people complained about Usama's leadership. The Prophet (ﷺ) stood up and said, 'If you criticize Usama, you also criticized his father before him. By Allah, Zaid deserved to be a leader and was very dear to me. Now Usama is just as dear to me.'

title: Prophet's Oath
content: Ibn Umar said that the Prophet's usual oath was: 'No, by Him who turns hearts'.

title: Caesar and Khosrau's Fate
content: Jabir bin Samura said the Prophet said: 'If Caesar is defeated, there will be no one like him. If Khosrau is defeated, there will be no one like him either. I swear by Allah, you will use their wealth to help spread Islam.'

title: Muhammad's Prophecy About Leaders
content: Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) said to Abu Huraira: 'If the ruler Khosrau is defeated, there will be no one like him. If Caesar is defeated, there will be no one like him either. Allah promises that you will use their wealth for His cause.'

title: The Prophet's Words of Wisdom
content: The Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) said to his followers: 'If you knew what I know, you would cry a lot and smile little.'

title: Faith and Love for the Prophet
content: `Umar was with the Prophet. He said to him, 'You are more important to me than anything.' The Prophet (ﷺ) replied, 'No, I must be more important to you than yourself.' `Umar said again, 'Now, by Allah, you are more important to me than myself.' The Prophet (ﷺ) said, 'Now you have faith'.

title: Two Men Dispute Allah's Laws
content: Abu Huraira and Zaid bin Khalid told us about two men who had a disagreement in front of the Prophet. One man asked the Prophet to judge them according to Allah's laws. The other man said, 'Yes, let me speak.' The Prophet (ﷺ) said, 'Go ahead.' He explained that his son was a worker for the other man and had an affair with his wife. The people wanted to stone the son to death, but the father paid 100 sheep and a slave girl as ransom. The learned men told him to give his son 100 lashes and exile him for one year, and stone the wife to death. The Prophet (ﷺ) said he would judge according to Allah's laws. He ordered the return of the sheep and slave girl to their original owner. Then he gave the son 100 lashes and exiled him for a year. Finally, he told Unais Al-Aslami to take the other man's wife to her death by stoning if she confessed. She did confess, so Unais stoned her to death.

title: Two Men Dispute Allah's Laws
content: Abu Huraira and Zaid bin Khalid told us that two men had a disagreement in front of the Prophet. One man asked for the case to be decided according to Allah's laws. The other man said, 'Yes, let me speak.' The Prophet (ﷺ) allowed him to talk. He explained that his son was working for this man, but he had sex with his employer's wife. Some people wanted the son to be stoned to death, but the father paid a ransom of 100 sheep and a slave girl instead. Later, he asked some learned men who said the son should get 100 lashes and be away from home for one year. The man's wife should be stoned to death. The Prophet (ﷺ) decided that according to Allah's laws: the father had to return his sheep and slave girl. Then, the Prophet gave the son 100 lashes and made him stay away from home for a year. He also told someone named Unais Al-Aslami to take the man's wife and stone her to death if she confessed. She did confess, so he stoned her.

title: Better Tribes Than Others
content: The Prophet (ﷺ) said, 'Do you think the tribes of Aslam, Ghifar, Muzaina and Juhaina are better than Tamim, Amir bin Sa'sa'a, Ghatfan and Asad? They said yes. The Prophet (ﷺ) replied, 'By God, they are better'.

title: Zakat and Stealing
content: The Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) had an employee who collected Zakat. The employee came back with some money and said it was for the Prophet, but he also kept some as a gift. The Prophet (ﷺ) asked him why he didn't stay at home to see if he would get gifts there instead of taking from the Zakat. He warned that anyone who takes something they shouldn't from the Zakat will have to carry it on their own neck on Judgment Day. If it's an animal, it will be making noise as you carry it.

title: The Prophet's Words of Wisdom
content: The Prophet (ﷺ) said: 'If you knew what I know, you would cry often and laugh little.'

title: Wealthy People Who Lose
content: I was with the Prophet near the Ka'ba. He said, 'They are the losers.' I didn't know who he meant. So I asked him, 'Who are they?' He replied, 'The wealthy people, unless they give their money to help others in need.'

title: Solomon's Unwise Decision
content: Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) said that Solomon once wanted to sleep with many women. He thought this would give him strong sons who could fight for Allah. His companion reminded him to say 'if Allah wills' before doing something important. But Solomon didn't listen and slept with all the women. Only one woman got pregnant, and she had a baby boy. If Solomon had said 'if Allah wills', all his wives would have had sons who could fight for Allah.

title: Silk Cloth Gift
content: Some people gave the Prophet a piece of silk cloth as a gift. They were amazed by its beauty and softness. The Prophet (ﷺ) asked, 'Are you surprised?' They said yes. He replied, 'The handkerchiefs in Paradise are even better than this'.

title: Hind's Honesty and Generosity
content: `Aisha said that Hind bint `Utba told the Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ): 'Before I became Muslim, I wished to have treated your family badly. But now, I wish to honor them more than any other family.' The Prophet (ﷺ) replied, 'I felt the same way about my family.' Hind asked, 'Is it wrong for me to use some of my husband's money to feed our children?' The Prophet (ﷺ) said, 'No, as long as you only take what is fair and reasonable for your needs.'

title: Muhammad's Promise to His Companions
content: Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) was sitting with his friends. He asked them if they would be happy to make up one-fourth of the people who go to Paradise. They said yes. Then he asked again, and they said yes again. He said that Allah might even want them to make up half of those going to Paradise.

title: Reciting Surat-ul-Ikhlas
content: Abu Sa'id Al-Khudri said a man came to the Prophet. He told him he had been reciting Surat-ul-Ikhlas, but thought it wasn't enough on its own. The Prophet (ﷺ) replied: 'That Sura is worth one-third of the whole Quran'.

title: Proper Bowing and Prostration
content: The Prophet (ﷺ) said: 'When you bow down in prayer, do it properly. When you lower your forehead to the ground in prostration, make sure you are calm. I can see what you're doing from behind me.'

title: Prophet's Love for Ansari Women
content: An Ansari woman came to the Prophet with her children. The Prophet (ﷺ) said she and her people were very dear to him. He said this three times.

title: Swearing by Allah
content: One day, the Prophet met Umar while he was traveling with some people. Umar was swearing by his father. The Prophet (ﷺ) said to him, 'Don't swear by your family members. If you need to take an oath, say it's by Allah or don't make a promise at all'.

title: Prophet forbids swearing
content: Ibn Umar said that the Prophet told him, 'God does not like it when you swear by your parents.' After hearing this from the Prophet, Umar never swore by his parents again, either on purpose or while repeating someone else's oath.

title: Don't Swear by Your Family
content: The Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) said, 'Do not swear by your fathers. Instead, speak truthfully and be honest.'

title: Abu Musa's Lesson on Oaths
content: There was a man from the tribe of Taimillah who didn't eat chicken because he thought it was dirty. Abu Musa invited him to share a meal with them, and when he explained why he wouldn't eat chicken, Abu Musa told him about a time they went to the Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) (SAW) asking for horses. The Prophet (ﷺ) said he couldn't give them any horses or camels because he had taken an oath not to. Later, some camels were brought as war booty and the Prophet gave them five nice ones instead. When Abu Musa's group left, they thought the Prophet had forgotten his oath, but when they went back to him, he explained that if he took an oath to do something and then found something better, he would do the better thing and make up for breaking the first oath.

title: Oaths and Gambling Forbidden
content: The Prophet (ﷺ) said: If someone takes an oath saying 'By Al-Lat and Al-Uzza', they should say 'There's no God but Allah'. Also, if you invite a friend to gamble with you, give something in charity instead.

title: Prophet Muhammad's Gold Ring
content: The Prophet (ﷺ) had a gold ring made. He wore it with the stone facing his palm. People copied him and made similar rings. The Prophet (ﷺ) then took the ring off, threw it away, and said he would never wear it again. Everyone else also threw their rings away.

title: Important Rules from the Prophet
content: The Prophet (ﷺ) said: If someone swears by a religion other than Islam, that's what they believe. If someone harms themselves to die, they will be punished in the same way in Hell. Cursing a Muslim is like killing them. Accusing a Muslim of not believing in God is like killing them too.

title: Help Others with Their Promises
content: The Prophet (ﷺ) told us to help people keep their promises and fulfill their oaths.

title: The Prophet's Visit to a Dying Child
content: Usama and some companions were with the Prophet when his daughter sent a message saying her child was going to die. The Prophet (ﷺ) told them to tell her that everything belongs to Allah, and she should be patient. But then he went to see her anyway. When they arrived, the child was brought to him, and he took the child into his lap. The child's breathing was weak, and the Prophet started crying. Sa'd asked why he was crying, and the Prophet said that it's because Allah has given mercy to some people, and He is only merciful to those who are kind to others.

title: Lost Children and Paradise
content: The Prophet (ﷺ) said that a Muslim who loses three of their children will not be punished in the Fire unless Allah's promise is fulfilled.

title: People of Paradise and Hell
content: The Prophet (ﷺ) said: 'I can tell you who are the people of Paradise. They are poor and humble people. If they promise to do something, Allah will help them keep their word. On the other hand, the people of Hell are those who are violent, cruel, and arrogant.'

title: Who are the best people?
content: Abdullah asked the Prophet who were the best people. The Prophet (ﷺ) said: My generation is the best, then those who come after them, and then others who will come later. But there will be some people whose words of promise (oaths) come before their witness (testimony). Ibrahim said that when they were young, older friends used to tell them not to swear oaths by saying 'I bear witness' first.

title: Lying to Get Money
content: The Prophet (ﷺ) said that if someone lies to get something from a Muslim's property, Allah will be angry with them when they meet. This is shown in the Quran where it says that those who trade their faith and oaths for a small gain are wrong.

title: Lying to Get Something
content: The Prophet (ﷺ) said: If someone tells a lie to get something from another Muslim, Allah will be angry with them when they meet Him. The Quran says that those who trade their faith and promises for a small gain will face trouble.

title: Hell Fire's Endless Question
content: The Prophet (ﷺ) said: 'The Hell Fire will keep asking if there are more people to come. But when Allah puts His Foot on it, the fire will say,

title: Prophet Relieved from Abdullah
content: I heard a story from Aisha, the Prophet's wife. Some people lied about her and said bad things. Allah then revealed that she was innocent. The Prophet (ﷺ) stood up and asked if anyone could help him deal with Abdullah bin Ubai. Usaid bin Hudair got up and said they would kill him.

title: Forgetting in Oaths
content: Prophet Muhammad 's (ﷺ) wife Aisha said that Allah will not punish us for mistakes we make when making promises or oaths. This is mentioned in the Quran, where it says we won't be blamed if we forget something and do something against our promise by mistake. Even Prophet Moses asked someone to forgive him for forgetting something.

title: Allah Forgives Our Mistakes
content: The Prophet (ﷺ) said: Allah forgives our mistakes if we don't act on them or tell others about them.

title: Prophet's Guidance on Hajj
content: On the day of sacrifice, a man asked the Prophet about some actions. Another man also asked about three things related to Hajj. The Prophet (ﷺ) said, 'Do them and there is no problem.' He repeated this for every question that day.

title: Prophet's Words on Sacrifice
content: A man told the Prophet that he had walked around the Ka'ba before throwing stones at a certain spot. The Prophet (ﷺ) said, 'That's okay.' Another man said he had shaved his head before slaughtering an animal for sacrifice. The Prophet (ﷺ) again said, 'No problem.' A third man said he had slaughtered the animal before throwing stones at the spot. Again, the Prophet said, 'It doesn't matter'.

title: Prophet Muhammad Teaches Prayer
content: A man entered the mosque and started praying while Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) was sitting there. He finished his prayer and went to greet the Prophet, but the Prophet told him to go back and pray again because he hadn't done it right. The man did this twice more before asking the Prophet to teach him how to pray properly. The Prophet (ﷺ) said: 'When you get up for prayer, wash your hands and face, then turn towards the Qibla (the direction of Mecca). Say

title: Satan's Deception at Uhud
content: When the pagans were defeated during the battle of Uhud, Satan shouted a warning to the Muslims. He said: 'Be careful what's behind you!' The front lines of the Muslim army attacked their own back lines in confusion. Hudhaifa bin Al-Yaman saw his father being killed and shouted for him. Unfortunately, the people didn't stop fighting until his father was dead. Hudhaifa then asked Allah to forgive those who killed his father. He kept asking for forgiveness until he died.

title: Eating by Mistake While Fasting
content: The Prophet (ﷺ) said: If someone eats something while fasting without meaning to, they must finish their fast. Allah has allowed them to eat and drink.

title: Prophet's Prayer Example
content: Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) led us in prayer. After the first two parts of the prayer, he stood up instead of sitting and continued with the rest of the prayer. When finished, people waited for him to say 'peace be upon you' (Taslim). But before saying Taslim, he said a special phrase and prostrated twice, then raised his head and ended the prayer with Taslim.

title: Prayer with Extra Prostrations
content: Allah's Prophet led the Zuhr prayer. He prayed either more or less rak'at than usual. People asked, 'Has the prayer been shortened? Did you forget?' The Prophet (ﷺ) asked what they meant. They said he had prayed many extra rak'at. So he added two prostrations and said: 'If you're not sure if you've prayed too much or too little, do two extra prostrations to be safe. Then finish the rest of your prayer with two more prostrations.'

title: Moses' Excuse and Sacrifice
content: Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) said: 'Moses asked God not to blame him for things he forgets.' This was Moses' first excuse. Al-Bara bin Azib had a guest at home on the day of Eid al-Adha. He told his family to slaughter an animal before they went to pray, so their guest could eat. His family did what he said. When Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) found out, he ordered Al-Bara to sacrifice another animal. Al-Bara said he had a young goat that was better than two sheep for sacrificing.

title: Slaughter Your Sacrifice
content: I saw the Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) offer the Eid prayer. After finishing, he gave a sermon and said: 'If you've already slaughtered your animal before praying, you need to slaughter another one. If not, then do it now and say Allah's name over it.'

title: Biggest Sins According to the Prophet
content: The Prophet (ﷺ) said that the biggest sins are: worshiping anyone other than Allah, not taking care of your parents, killing someone without a good reason, and making false promises you don't intend to keep.

title: Taking a False Oath
content: Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) said: If someone is ordered to take an oath and they lie to get something from another Muslim, Allah will be angry with them when they meet Him. The Quran says: 'Those who trade their faith for a small gain.' Al-Ash'ath bin Qais said this verse was about him. He had a dispute over a well and was told by the Prophet to give evidence. If he didn't, his opponent's false oath would win.

title: Taking False Oaths
content: Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) said, 'If someone is told to take an oath and they lie to get something from a Muslim, Allah will be angry with them when they meet Him. The Quran says:

title: Prophet Refuses to Mount
