content: Abu Musa's friends asked him to ask the Prophet for some horses. The Prophet (ﷺ) said he wouldn't give them any animals. When Abu Musa met him again, the Prophet told him to tell his friends that Allah or He would provide them with what they needed.

title: Prophet's Wife Cleared of Slander
content: Aisha was falsely accused by some people. They said bad things about her. Allah revealed a passage in the Quran to prove she was innocent. This passage says that those who spread false rumors will be punished. Abu Bakr, Aisha's husband, used to help his relative Mistah financially. But when he heard the accusations, he stopped helping him. Then Allah revealed another verse saying it's okay for good people to help their relatives even if they've done something wrong. Abu Bakr was happy with this and started giving money to Mistah again.

title: Breaking an Oath
content: Abu Musa and some men from the Ash'ariyin visited the Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ). They asked him for horses, but he was angry and said no. Later, he explained that if he makes a promise and finds something better, he will do the better thing and make up for breaking his promise.

title: Abu Talib's Last Words
content: When Abu Talib was dying, the Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) visited him and said: 'Say there is no God but Allah. This will protect you in front of Allah.'

title: Two Easy Words
content: Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) said: 'There are two phrases that are easy to say but very important. They are: Glorifying Allah and thanking Him, and Glorifying the Great Allah.'

title: Dying without Shirk
content: Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) said to Abdullah: 'If someone dies while worshiping others besides Allah, they will go to Hell.' Abdullah replied, 'And if someone dies not worshiping anyone but Allah, they will go to Paradise'.

title: Prophet's Oath and Abstinence
content: The Prophet (ﷺ) took an oath to stay away from his wives for a month. During this time, he hurt his foot and stayed in a room on the top floor for 29 nights. When it was over, people asked him why he had stayed away for so long. He said that a lunar month can be either 29 or 30 days.

title: Abu Usaid's Wedding
content: Abu Usaid invited the Prophet to his wedding. His wife served them a drink made from dates that she had soaked overnight.

title: Storing Dates in Animal Skin
content: Sauda said: One of our sheep died. We used its skin to store dates and kept putting more dates into it until the skin was old and worn out.

title: Prophet Muhammad's Simple Life
content: The Prophet Muhammad 's (ﷺ) family never ate wheat bread with meat for three days in a row until they were full. This was before he met Allah.

title: Prophet Muhammad Receives Food
content: Anas bin Malik told us that Abu Talha said to Um Sulaim, 'I heard the Prophet's voice was weak. I think it's because he's hungry.' She replied, 'Yes, we have food.' She wrapped some bread in a veil and sent me to the Prophet with it. When I arrived at the mosque, I found the Prophet sitting with others. He asked if Abu Talha had sent me. I said yes. The Prophet (ﷺ) told his companions to get up and follow me. I went ahead of them and met Abu Talha. He was worried because they didn't have food for everyone. Um Sulaim said, 'Allah knows best.' Abu Talha went out to meet the Prophet. When they arrived, the Prophet asked Um Sulaim to bring what she had. She brought some bread and butter. The Prophet (ﷺ) blessed the food and told Abu Talha to let in ten men at a time. They ate until everyone was full. There were about seventy or eighty men.

title: Reward of Our Actions
content: Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) said: What we do is rewarded based on our intentions. If someone moves to a new place because of Allah and His message, that move will be counted as for Allah and His message. But if someone moves for money or to get married, it will only count for what they moved for.

title: Repentance and Wealth
content: I told the Prophet I would give up all my money as a way to show how sorry I was for not joining the battle. The Prophet (ﷺ) said, 'No, keep some of your wealth, it's better for you'.

title: Prophet's Honey Incident
content: The Prophet (ﷺ) used to visit his wife Zainab bint Jahsh and drink honey in her house. Aisha and Hafsa thought he might have eaten something bad, so they asked him if he had eaten Maghafir raisins when he visited them. He said no, but that he had drunk honey at Zainab's house and wouldn't do it again. The Quran then revealed a verse saying the Prophet didn't need to stop eating honey. It also mentioned how the Prophet shared something private with one of his wives by telling her about drinking the honey.

title: Vows Don't Change Fate
content: Ibn Umar asked the Prophet if people were allowed to make vows. The Prophet (ﷺ) said that making a vow doesn't speed up or slow down anything. But it can help someone who is very stingy by getting them to give some of their money.

title: Prophet Forbids Making Vows
content: Abdullah bin Umar said the Prophet forbade making promises to Allah. He said that a promise doesn't stop anything from happening, but it can be used to take something from a person who is very stingy with their money.

title: Vows and Allah's Decree
content: The Prophet (ﷺ) said: 'Allah says that a person's vow doesn't change what He has already planned for them. But if they make a vow, it can be part of what Allah had already decided. This makes the miserly person give some of their wealth to charity, which they wouldn't have done otherwise.'

title: Best Generations of Muslims
content: The Prophet (ﷺ) said: 'My generation is the best. The next ones who follow them are also good. Then come people who make promises but don't keep them. They lie and aren't trustworthy. They give witness without being asked to, and they will become overweight.'

title: Be True to Your Vows
content: The Prophet (ﷺ) said: If you make a promise to be obedient to Allah, then stay true to it. And if you made a vow to disobey Him, don't do it.

title: Umar's Vow in the Mosque
content: Ibn `Umar said that Umar told the Prophet: 'I made a promise to spend one night in prayer at the mosque before I became Muslim.' The Prophet (ﷺ) said, 'Keep your promise.' Ibn `Umar then asked someone to pray on behalf of his wife.

title: Fulfilling a Mother's Vow
content: Sa'id bin 'Ubada asked the Prophet about his mother's vow. She had made it but died without doing it. The Prophet (ﷺ) said Sa'id should do it for her. This became a rule that we follow.

title: Paying for a Sister's Hajj
content: A man told the Prophet that his sister had vowed to go on Hajj but died before she could. The Prophet (ﷺ) asked if he would pay her debts if she owed any, and the man said yes. The Prophet (ﷺ) then said to pay Allah's rights first.

title: Obedience is a Vow
content: The Prophet (ﷺ) said, 'If someone vows to be good and obey Allah, they must be obedient. If someone vows to do something bad and disobey Allah, they should not do it.'

title: Allah Does Not Need Self-Torture
content: The Prophet (ﷺ) saw a man being supported by his two sons while walking. The Prophet (ﷺ) said that Allah does not need people to torture themselves like this.

title: Prophet Muhammad Stops Tawaf
content: Ibn Abbas said the Prophet saw a man doing Tawaf around the Kaaba. The man was tied to someone else with a rope. The Prophet (ﷺ) cut that rope so the man could walk freely.

title: Prophet Muhammad Helps a Man
content: The Prophet (ﷺ) was walking around the Kaaba with Ibn Abbas. They saw someone leading another person by a rope tied to his nose ring. The Prophet (ﷺ) cut the rope and told the man to lead him instead.

title: Abu Israil's Vow
content: The Prophet (ﷺ) was giving a sermon when he saw a man standing. He asked who the man was and what he was doing. They told him that Abu Israil had made a vow to stand up all the time, not sit down, and never talk to anyone or go in the shade. The Prophet (ﷺ) said, 'Let him speak, but let him stay in the shade and sit down. He can finish his fast.'

title: Fasting on Eid Days
content: Abdullah bin Umar was asked about a man who vowed to fast every day of his life. But what if it's an Eid day, like Eid al-Adha or Eid-al-Fitr? Abdullah said: 'Look at the example of Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ). He didn't fast on these special days. We don't intend to fast on them either.'

title: Fulfilling Vows and Fasting
content: Ibn Umar was asked about a man who vowed to fast every Tuesday or Wednesday. If his fasting day fell on the first day of Eid al-Adha, what should he do? Ibn Umar said that Allah orders us to keep our vows, but we are not allowed to fast on the day of Nahr.

title: Prophet Muhammad's War Booty
content: Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) went on a trip with his companions. They didn't get much gold or silver as spoils of war, but they did get some property and clothes. A man named Rifa'a gave the Prophet a slave named Mid'am. The Prophet (ﷺ) was walking through a valley when an arrow hit Mid'am, who was helping the Prophet's camel kneel down. People thought Mid'am had gone to heaven because he died as a martyr. But the Prophet said that Mid'am had actually stolen something from the war booty earlier and now it was burning him in hell. A man brought some leather straps to the Prophet as an offering, but the Prophet just mentioned fire again.

title: Shaving Head for Lice
content: I visited the Prophet. He asked if my lice were bothering me. I said yes. He told me to shave my head and make up for it by fasting, giving money to poor people, or sacrificing a sheep.

title: Fasting and Breaking Vow
content: A man came to the Prophet. He said he had broken his fast by having sex with his wife during Ramadan. The Prophet (ﷺ) asked if he could free a slave, but the man said no. Then he was asked if he could fast for two months or feed sixty poor people, and again the answer was no. The Prophet (ﷺ) told him to take some food from a basket and give it to those in need. The man asked about poorer families than his own, and the Prophet smiled and said to use it to feed his family.

title: Fasting in Ramadan
content: A man came to the Prophet and said he had broken his fast by having sex with his wife. The Prophet (ﷺ) asked him if he could free a slave, but he couldn't. Then he asked if he could fast for two months, but he couldn't do that either. Finally, he asked if he could feed 60 poor people, but again, no. An Ansari man then brought some dates and the Prophet told him to give them away in charity. The Ansari said there was no one poorer than his family, so the Prophet said to feed them instead.

title: Fasting in Ramadan
content: A man came to the Prophet and said he had broken his fast by having a relationship with his wife. The Prophet (ﷺ) asked if he could free a slave, but he couldn't. He also asked if he could fast for two months, but that was too much. Then he asked if he could feed sixty poor people, but he didn't have enough money. Later, the Prophet gave him a big basket of food and told him to use it to feed his family.

title: Measuring Dry Goods
content: As-Sa'ib bin Yazid said that during the time of the Prophet, one Sa' was equal to one Mudd plus one-third of a Mudd. Later, in the time of Caliph `Umar bin `Abdul `Aziz, this measurement increased.

title: Ibn Umar's Zakat and Oaths
content: Nafi' said that Ibn 'Umar gave money for Ramadan charity and to make up for broken oaths. He used the same amount as the Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) did. Malik, another scholar, agreed with this. If a ruler made the amount smaller, they would still use the original amount from the Prophet.

title: Blessing Measures in Medina
content: The Prophet (ﷺ) said to Allah: 'Give blessings to the people of Medina's measures of food and weight.'

title: Freeing a Slave is Liberating
content: The Prophet (ﷺ) said that if someone sets free a Muslim slave, Allah will save the person's body parts from Hellfire. This means their hands, feet, and even private parts will be saved because they freed the corresponding parts of the slave.

title: Prophet Buys an Unfree Slave
content: An Ansari man made his slave a free servant. The Prophet (ﷺ) heard about it and asked if anyone wanted to sell the slave to him for eight hundred Dirhams. Nu'aim bought the slave, who was from Egypt, and sold him to the Prophet.

title: Aisha Buys a Slave Girl
content: Aisha wanted to buy a slave girl named Barira. The owners said they would keep control over her after she was freed. Aisha told the Prophet about this. He said, 'Buy her anyway, because freedom is what matters.'

title: Prophet's Promise to Mounts
content: Abu Musa and a group of people from Al-Ash'ari went to the Prophet asking for mounts. The Prophet (ﷺ) said he wouldn't give them anything to ride, but then some camels were brought and they gave three to Abu Musa's group. When they returned, they told the Prophet that they thought it was strange that he had given them mounts after saying no. The Prophet (ﷺ) explained that he hadn't actually given them mounts - Allah had. He said that if he takes an oath and then finds something better, he'll make amends for his oath by doing what's better.

title: Making Up for Broken Promises
content: If I make a promise and then break it, I will do something good to make up for it. If I can, I will also do even more good or make up for the broken promise.

title: Solomon and His Wives
content: Prophet Solomon said he would sleep with his ninety wives. He wanted each of them to have a son who would fight for Allah's cause. A companion, an angel, reminded him to say 'if Allah wills' before doing anything important. But Solomon forgot. He slept with all his wives, but only one had a baby boy. The Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) said that if Solomon had said 'if Allah wills', he wouldn't have failed and would have gotten what he wanted.

title: Abu Musa and Chicken
content: Abu Musa was eating with his friends. There was chicken in the food. A man from a different tribe didn't eat it because he thought chickens ate dirty things. Abu Musa said, 'The Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) ate chicken.' The man said he had sworn not to eat chicken because of that. Abu Musa asked him about his oath and told him what happened next. They went to the Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) once with some friends, asking for horses. He refused at first, but later gave them five good camels instead. One of them thought maybe the Prophet forgot to keep his promise. So they went back to him and reminded him. The Prophet (ﷺ) said, 'If I take an oath and then find something better, I do what's better and make up for the oath.'

title: Don't Seek to Rule
content: Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) said to `Abdur-Rahman: Don't want to be a leader. If you're given power without asking, Allah will help you. But if you ask for it, you'll be responsible for your actions. And if you promise to do something and find a better option, do the better thing and make things right with Allah.

title: Prophet visits a sick friend
content: Jabir bin Abdullah was very ill. The Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) and Abu Bakr came to visit him on foot. When they arrived, Jabir was unconscious. The Prophet (ﷺ) performed ablution (washed his face and hands) and poured the water over Jabir's body. Jabir woke up and asked the Prophet about how to divide his property fairly. But the Prophet didn't answer yet. Later, Allah revealed some verses of the Quran that explained how to share inheritance.

title: Beware of Suspicion
content: Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) said: 'Be careful about making false accusations. Don't look for problems in others and don't spy on them. Don't be angry with each other, and don't stop talking to one another. You are all brothers.'

title: Fatima's Request for Fadak
content: Fatima and her brother Al Abbas went to Abu Bakr. They wanted their share of the Prophet Muhammad 's (ﷺ) property, including land in Fadak and a share from Khaibar. Abu Bakr said he remembered the Prophet saying that his belongings couldn't be inherited. He said they could take what they needed for themselves but no more. Fatima was unhappy with this decision and stopped talking to Abu Bakr until she died.

title: Fatima's Share of Prophet's Property
content: Fatima and her cousin Al Abbas went to Abu Bakr. They wanted their share from the property left by the Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ). They asked for a specific piece of land called Fadak and some money from a place called Khaibar. Abu Bakr said he remembered the Prophet saying that his own family could take what they needed from this property, but it couldn't be inherited like regular wealth. He said he would follow the same rules as the Prophet. Fatima left Abu Bakr and didn't talk to him again until she died.

title: Prophets' Property Should Not Be Inherited
content: The Prophet (ﷺ) said to his wife Aisha: 'We apostles should not leave our belongings for others. Whatever we have, it should be used for charity.'

title: Umar's Decision on Fai' Property
content: Malik bin Aus visited Umar. His doorman said some important people were waiting to see him. Umar let them in. They asked for permission to talk to Ali and Abbas, but Umar didn't know what they wanted to say. Abbas spoke up, 'Umar, judge between me and this man.' Umar said he would decide fairly. He reminded them that the Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) said his property wouldn't be inherited. Whatever he left behind should be spent on charity. The group agreed with this. Umar then explained how the Prophet used to manage the Fai' (booty) won by the Muslims at war. It was only for him, but he didn't keep it all for himself. He gave its income to the people and distributed it among them. When there was still some left over, he spent it on his family's needs and then on other good causes. Umar asked Ali and Abbas if they knew this. They said yes. Umar explained how Abu Bakr took charge of the property after the Prophet died and managed it in the same way. Then Umar took charge for two years and did the same. Now, Ali and Abbas were asking for their shares from the property. Umar told them that if they wanted to follow the Prophet's example, he would give them what they asked for. But if they wanted a different decision, he wouldn't give in until the end of time.

title: Prophet's Will: Leaving Legacy
content: Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) said, 'After I die, my family should not get any of my money. What I leave behind should be used to help others, except for what I need to support my wives and servants.'

title: Aisha Remembers the Prophet's Words
content: `Aisha said to her fellow wives of the Prophet: 'Remember what he said about his belongings? He told us that prophets' property is not inherited. Whatever we leave behind should be given to charity.'

title: Prophet's Promise to Believers
content: The Prophet (ﷺ) said: 'I am closer to believers than they are to themselves. If a believer dies with debts and no one is left to pay them, we will pay the debt on their behalf. If a believer leaves property behind when they die, it belongs to their family.'

title: Inheritance Shares
content: The Prophet (ﷺ) said: Give the shares of inheritance to those who are supposed to get them. Then give what's left to the closest male relative of the person who died.

title: Giving in Charity
content: Sa'd bin Abi Waqqas was very sick. The Prophet (ﷺ) visited him and asked about his wealth. Sa'd wanted to give most of it away, but the Prophet said no. He suggested giving one-third, saying that's enough. It's better for his family to have some money than to be poor and ask others for help. The Prophet (ﷺ) also told Sa'd that if he stayed behind after him, good deeds would still bring him reward.

title: Mu'adh's Ruling on Inheritance
content: Mu'adh bin Jabal was a teacher and leader in Yemen. Some people asked him about the inheritance of a man who had died. The man left behind a daughter and a sister. Mu'adh said that the daughter should get half of the property, and the sister should also get half.

title: Giving Inheritance Shares
content: Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) said: Give the shares of inheritance to those who are supposed to get them. Any extra should be given to the closest male relative of the person who died.

title: Daughter's Inheritance
content: Abu Musa was asked about a daughter's inheritance. He said the daughter would get one-half and the sister would also get one-half. But Ibn Mas`ud said, 'That's not right.' He explained that the Prophet (ﷺ) taught him to give the daughter one-half and the son's daughter one-sixth. This makes two-thirds of the total property for them. The rest goes to the sister.

title: Giving Inheritance Shares
content: The Prophet (ﷺ) said: Give the shares mentioned in the Quran to those who are supposed to get them. Then give what's left to the closest male relative of the person who died.

title: Abu Bakr and Inheritance
content: Ibn Abbas said that the Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) said: 'If I had to choose a close friend from my followers, it would be Abu Bakr. But being part of this Muslim community is even better.' Ibn Abbas then explained that in some cases, a grandfather can be considered as the father for inheritance purposes.

title: Inheritance Laws Explained
content: Ibn Abbas said that in the early days of Islam, inheritance was given to children and parents. But Allah changed this rule. Now, a male gets twice as much as a female in inheritance. Parents get one-sixth each. If there are no children, a wife gets half of what her husband leaves behind. If there are children, she gets one-eighth. And if the deceased has no children, their husband gets half.

title: Abortion: Blood Money Judgment
content: Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) gave a judgment. If a woman has an abortion, the family of the unborn child should be given money as compensation. But if the woman who had the abortion dies before paying the money, her property will go to her children and husband. They must also pay the compensation.

title: Mu`adh bin Jabal's Ruling
content: Mu`adh bin Jabal told us that in the time of the Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ), a daughter gets half of her father's inheritance and the other half goes to her sister.

title: Inheritance Judgment
content: Abdullah said that his judgment in this matter would be the same as the Prophet's. He decided to give half of the inheritance to the daughter, one-sixth to her son's daughter, and the rest to the sister.

title: Prophet's Visit to a Sick Friend
content: Jabir was sick. The Prophet (ﷺ) came to visit him and asked for water to wash his hands and face. After washing, he poured some of the water over Jabir, who then woke up. Jabir told the Prophet he had sisters. Later, Allah revealed rules about how to divide property among family members when someone dies.

title: Last Verse Revealed
content: Al-Bara said the last verse of the Quran revealed to the Prophet was from Surat-an-Nisa. It says: 'When someone dies without any family, Allah decides what happens to their belongings'.

title: Supporting Believers' Families
content: Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) said: 'I am closer to believers than their own families. If someone dies and leaves behind property, it will go to his relatives. But if he has debts or children who need care, I will take responsibility for them.'

title: Inheritance Shares
content: The Prophet (ﷺ) said: Give the inheritance shares to those who are supposed to get them. Any leftover should go to the closest male relative of the person who died.

title: Brotherhood and Inheritance
content: When the Prophet established a bond of brotherhood between the emigrants and Ansar in Medina, it meant that they would inherit from each other instead of their own family members. However, when Allah revealed a new verse saying 'We have appointed heirs for everyone', it cancelled out an earlier rule that said those who pledged loyalty to someone else would inherit from them.

title: Divorce and Child Custody
content: A man and his wife had a problem. They disagreed about the father of their child. The Prophet (ﷺ) said they should get divorced, and then the child would be with the mother only.

title: Who is the Child's Guardian
content: A man named `Utba told his brother Sa`d to take care of a child. The child was born to a slave girl who belonged to `Utba. When they conquered Mecca, Sa`d took the child and said he was his nephew. But another man, Abu bin Zam`a, said the child was his brother because he was born on his father's bed. They both went to see the Prophet. The Prophet (ﷺ) decided that the child belonged to Abu bin Zam`a because he is the owner of the bed where the child was born.

title: Who Owns a Child
content: The Prophet (ﷺ) said, 'A child belongs to the man whose bed they were born in'.

title: Barira's Wala' and Charity
content: I bought Barira as a slave. The Prophet (ﷺ) said to me, 'You can free her because the right to manumit is hers.' Later, someone gave her a sheep in charity. The Prophet (ﷺ) said, 'The sheep is for her benefit and also for us.'

title: Wala' is for Freed Slaves
content: The Prophet (ﷺ) said that when a slave is freed, the right to their loyalty and support belongs to them, not their previous owner.

title: Freeing Slaves in Islam
content: Before Islam, people would free slaves as a way to show kindness. But Muslims did not do this practice called Sa'iba.

title: Manumitting Barira
content: `Aisha bought a slave named Barira to set her free. But the slave's owners said that after she was freed, they would still have control over her. `Aisha asked the Prophet for advice. He said that whoever buys and sets someone free has the right to decide what happens to them afterwards. So `Aisha paid for Barira and set her free. Later, the Prophet gave Barira a choice: stay with her husband or leave him. She chose to leave because she didn't want to be with him even if he gave her a lot of money.

title: Medina's Sanctuary and Asylum
content: Ali said that we have no book to read except the Quran. He then showed a paper with some rules written on it. These rules included how to punish people for hurting others, how much money is owed if someone kills a camel, and that Medina is a safe place from Air mountain to Thaur mountain. Anyone who brings new ideas against Islam or does something bad in Medina will be cursed by Allah, the angels, and all people. Their good deeds won't be accepted on Judgment Day. If a freed slave chooses friends without his master's permission, he'll also be cursed. A Muslim's protection of another Muslim is important, even if they're not rich. Anyone who breaks this rule will be cursed too.

title: Prophet Forbids Selling Slaves
content: The Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) forbade selling or giving away the right to freedom of slaves. This means that a slave's owner cannot sell this right, nor can they give it as a gift.

title: Aisha and the Slave Girl
content: Aisha wanted to buy a slave girl to set her free. The master said she could only sell it to Aisha if they kept control over the slave after she was freed. Aisha told this to the Prophet, who said that shouldn't stop her from buying the slave. He explained that whoever sets someone free gets control over them.

title: Barira's Freedom and Choice
content: Aisha bought a slave named Barira. The owner said that if Aisha freed her, the right to take care of them would belong to him. Aisha told this to the Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ). He said, 'Free her because when you pay for someone's freedom, they are yours.' Aisha freed Barira. Then the Prophet called Barira and asked her what she wanted to do. She chose not to go back to her husband.

title: Buying a Slave Girl
content: Ibn Umar said that Aisha wanted to buy Barira. She asked the Prophet about something called 'Wala'. The Prophet (ﷺ) said, 'You can buy her, and Wala is for the one who sets her free.'

title: Wala is for the Giver
content: The Prophet (ﷺ) said: The right to wala belongs to the person who pays the price and frees a slave.

title: Freed Slave's New Family
content: The Prophet (ﷺ) said that a freed slave belongs to the people who set them free.

title: Family Ties are Strong
content: The Prophet (ﷺ) said, 'If someone's aunt has a son, he is considered one of their family or even like one of themselves.'

title: Taking Care of Debt and Family
content: The Prophet (ﷺ) said: If someone dies leaving behind property, their family gets it. But if they leave debts or dependents, we take care of them.

title: No Heirs Between Faiths
content: The Prophet (ﷺ) said: A Muslim cannot inherit from a non-Muslim. And a non-Muslim cannot inherit from a Muslim.

title: Dispute over a Boy
content: Sauda's husband and Sa'd had a disagreement about a boy. Sauda said her son was the Prophet's cousin, born on his father's bed to a slave girl. But Sa'd claimed the boy was his brother Utba's son, and he should be in charge of him. The Prophet (ﷺ) looked at the boy and saw that he looked like Utba. He decided the boy belonged to Sauda's husband because he was born on his father's bed. The Prophet (ﷺ) told Sauda to keep herself away from the boy.

title: Claiming a False Father
content: The Prophet (ﷺ) said: If someone says they are the son of someone who is not their father, and they know it's not true, then they will be kept out of Paradise. I heard this from the Prophet and remembered it.

title: Claiming a False Father
content: The Prophet (ﷺ) said: If someone says their father is not who they really are, and they know it's true, then they will be stopped from going to Paradise. I heard this from the Prophet and remembered it.

title: Respect Your Family Roots
content: The Prophet (ﷺ) said: Don't pretend to be someone else's son. If you deny your real father, it means you don't believe in God.

title: Two Women and Their Sons
content: The Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) said: Two women had a problem. A wolf took one of their sons. They went to the Prophet David for help. He decided the older woman's son should stay with her. The women then went to the Prophet Solomon, who is David's son. They told him about the case. Solomon said he would cut the child in half and give each woman a piece. But one of the women said: 'Please don't do that.' She said it was the other woman's son. So Solomon gave the child back to her.

title: Allah's Messenger Visits Aisha
content: One day Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) came to visit me. He was very happy and his face showed it. He said, 'Aisha, have you seen what Mujazziz just did? He looked at Zaid bin Haritha and Usama bin Zaid and said that their feet were similar.'

title: Prophet Muhammad's Happy Moment
content: One day, the Prophet entered my room in a happy mood. He said to me: 'Don't you know what happened? A man named Mujazziz saw Usama and Zaid with a blanket over them. Their heads were covered but their feet were not. He thought they were husband and wife.'

title: Believers and Sinful Actions
content: Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) said: When someone commits adultery, they are not a believer at that moment. The same is true for drinking alcohol or stealing something. A person who robs while being seen by others is also not a believer when doing it.

title: Drunkards Punished by the Prophet
content: The Prophet (ﷺ) saw a man who was drunk. He beat him with palm-leaf stalks and shoes to stop his drinking. Abu Bakr also punished another drunkard, giving them 40 lashes.

title: The Prophet's Order to Beat
content: An-Nu'man was brought to the Prophet because he had been drinking too much. The Prophet (ﷺ) told all the men in the house to hit him, so they did. I was one of them and we used our shoes.

title: Beating a Drunk Man
content: An-Nu'man was brought to the Prophet in a state of drunkenness. The Prophet (ﷺ) was unhappy and told everyone present to hit him with palm-leaf stalks or shoes. I, 'Uqba bin Al-Harith, was among those who beat him.

title: Drinking and Punishment
content: The Prophet (ﷺ) saw a man who was drunk. He used dateleaf stalks and shoes to lash the man. Later, Abu Bakr also punished another drunk person with forty lashes.

title: Beating a Drunk Man
content: Abu Huraira said the Prophet was shown a man who had drunk wine. The Prophet (ﷺ) told us to beat him. Some of us hit him with our hands, some with shoes, and some used their clothes like a whip. After we finished, someone insulted the man, saying 'May Allah be ashamed of you!' The Prophet (ﷺ) then said, 'Don't say that. You're helping Satan.'

title: Drinking and Punishment
content: Ali said: I don't feel sad when someone dies because of a punishment from the law. But if it's for being drunk, then his family should get blood money. Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) didn't set a fixed punishment for drinkers.

title: Dealing with Drunkenness
content: During the time of Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ), his companions Abu Bakr and Umar, people used to punish those who got drunk. At first, they would hit them lightly with their hands or shoes. But later on, Umar decided that drunk people should get 40 lashes as a punishment. If they were very disobedient, he even increased the number of lashes to 80.

title: Donkey's Story: A Lesson
content: There was a man named Abdullah. He was known as 'Donkey' because he made the Prophet laugh often. The Prophet (ﷺ) had to lash him for drinking alcohol once, and it happened again. Someone said, 'Curse him! He's been brought here so many times!' But the Prophet said, 'No, don't curse him. I know he loves Allah and me.'

title: Drunk Man and the Prophet
content: A man was brought to the Prophet because he was drunk. The Prophet (ﷺ) told his companions to beat him gently with their hands, shoes, or clothes. After the man left, one of the companions said something bad about him. The Prophet (ﷺ) said, 'Don't help Satan against your brother.'

title: Adultery and Theft are Not Islam
content: The Prophet (ﷺ) said: When someone commits adultery, they are not a Muslim at that moment. And when someone steals, they are not a Muslim while stealing.

title: Stealing and Punishment
content: The Prophet (ﷺ) said that Allah curses a person who steals something small like an egg or a rope. If they get caught, their hand might be cut off as punishment.

title: Pledge of Allegiance
content: The Prophet (ﷺ) said: 'I want you to promise me that you will only worship Allah. Don't steal and don't have any kind of relationship with someone who is not your wife. If you keep this promise, you'll get a great reward from Allah. If you break the rules and get caught, it's like making up for what you did wrong. But if you break the rules and nobody finds out, it's up to Allah whether to forgive or punish you.'

title: Protection in Islam
content: Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) asked his followers which month, town, and day they thought was most sacred. They said the current month of Dhull-Hijja, Mecca, and today. He replied that Allah has made their blood, property, and honor as sacred as this time and place. This protection cannot be broken except for a good reason. The Prophet (ﷺ) asked three times if he had explained Allah's message clearly, and his followers said yes each time. Then the Prophet warned them not to go back to disbelief by hurting each other.

title: The Prophet's Decisions
content: Aisha said that when the Prophet had a choice between two things, he would choose the easier one as long as it wasn't against Allah's rules. But if someone broke those rules, he would stand up for what was right.

title: Justice for the Poor
content: A woman asked a man to ask the Prophet about her punishment. The Prophet (ﷺ) said that people in the past were punished unfairly because they cut off the hands of poor thieves but let rich ones go free. He swore by Allah, saying he would cut off his own daughter Fatima's hand if she stole.

title: Usama Speaks Up for a Lady
content: The Quraish people were worried about a Makhzumiya lady who had stolen something. They thought only Usama, whom the Prophet liked, could talk to him about it. When Usama spoke up, the Prophet asked if he was asking him to go against Allah's rules. The Prophet (ﷺ) then stood up and said: 'People used to be unfair in the past. If a rich person stole, they wouldn't punish them, but if a poor person stole, they would punish them. I swear by Allah that even if my daughter Fatima stole something, I would cut off her hand.'

title: Stealing: A Serious Crime
content: Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) said that if someone steals something worth at least a quarter of a Dinar or more, their hand should be cut off as punishment.

title: Cutting Off the Thief
content: The Prophet (ﷺ) said that if someone steals a quarter of a Dinar, their hand should be cut off as punishment.

title: Stealing: A Serious Crime
content: Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) said that if someone steals a quarter of a Dinar, their hand should be cut off as punishment.

title: Cutting off a Thief's Hand
content: During the time of the Prophet, someone's hand was cut off only if they stole something worth as much as a shield. This is what happened with thieves during his lifetime.

title: Thief's Hand Not Cut Off
content: Aisha said: A thief's hand was not cut off for stealing something worth less than a Hajafa or a Turs, which are expensive shields.

title: Thief's Hand Not Cut Off
content: Hazrat Aisha said: If a thief steals something worth less than the price of a shield, their hand is not cut off. This rule applies even if it's a small or big shield.

title: Thief's Hand Cut Off
content: Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) cut off the hand of a thief who stole a shield worth three Dirhams.

title: Cutting Off Thief's Hand
content: The Prophet (ﷺ) cut off the hand of a man who stole a shield worth three Dirhams.

title: Cutting Off Thief's Hand
content: Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) cut off the hand of a man who stole a shield worth three Dirhams. This was done as punishment for stealing, according to Islamic law.

title: Cutting off a Thief's Hand
content: Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) cut off the hand of a man who stole a shield worth three Dirhams. This was done as punishment for stealing, according to Islamic law.

title: Stealing and the Punishment
content: The Prophet (ﷺ) said: 'Allah curses the person who steals something small, like an egg or a helmet. If they get caught, their hand will be cut off.'

title: Cutting off a thief's hand
content: The Prophet (ﷺ) cut off the hand of a woman who had stolen something. She would often visit me and I would tell the Prophet about her situation. When he found out, she was sorry for what she did and truly regretted it.

title: Pledge of Allegiance
content: I gave the pledge to the Prophet with a group. He said: 'Don't worship anything but Allah, don't steal, don't kill your children, and don't lie about others. If you do these things and get punished in this life, it's okay. But if Allah forgives you, that's up to Him. If someone repents after being punished, their apology is accepted.'

title: People from Ukl Tribe
content: Some people from the tribe of `Ukl came to the Prophet and became Muslims. They didn't like the climate in Medina, so the Prophet told them to drink milk and urine from charity camels to get better. After they felt healthy again, they left Islam, killed a camel shepherd, and took the camels. The Prophet (ﷺ) sent people to catch them. When they were caught, the Prophet ordered that their hands and legs should be cut off, their eyes branded with hot metal, and not treated until they died.

title: Cutting off Hands and Feet
content: The Prophet (ﷺ) cut off the hands and feet of some men from a tribe called `Uraina. He didn't stop the bleeding until they died.

title: People from Ukl Tribe Visit Prophet
content: A group of people from the tribe of Ukl came to visit the Prophet. They were living with some other people in Medina, but they got sick because of the climate. They asked the Prophet for milk. He said they could use the camels that belonged to him. The people drank the milk and urine of the camels and got better. Then they killed the camel's shepherd and took the camels away. When someone told the Prophet about this, he sent some men to catch them. They were caught and brought back before noon. The Prophet (ﷺ) ordered hot iron pieces to be made and used to brand their eyes. He also cut off their hands and feet without treating the wounds. Finally, they were left in a place called Al-Harra without water until they died.

title: People from Ukl Tribe Get Sick
content: A group of people from the tribe of 'Ukl came to Medina. They got sick and Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) told them to drink camel milk and urine as medicine. When they got better, they killed a shepherd and took some camels. The Prophet (ﷺ) found out what they did and sent men to catch them. He punished them by cutting off their hands and legs, burning their eyes with hot metal, and throwing them away without giving them water.

title: Seven People Shaded by Allah
content: The Prophet (ﷺ) said that seven people will be protected by Allah's Shade on the Day of Resurrection. They are: a fair ruler, a young man who was raised to worship Allah, someone who prays alone and cries from remembering Allah, someone who loves mosques and attends prayers there, two friends who love each other for Allah's sake, a man who is asked to do something wrong by a woman but says no because he fears Allah, and someone who gives charity secretly without anyone knowing.

title: Guaranteeing Chastity for Paradise
content: The Prophet (ﷺ) said: 'If you promise me to control your private parts and what you say with your tongue, I will promise you a place in Paradise.'

title: Signs of the End Times
content: I heard the Prophet say that before the Day of Judgment, there will be a time when people don't know much about Islam. Many scholars will die and no one will teach the right way to live. People will drink alcohol and have affairs openly. There will be fewer men than women, so for every 50 women, only one man will take care of them.

title: Faith and Sinful Actions
content: Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) said: When someone commits a sin like having an affair, stealing, or drinking alcohol, they are not a believer at that moment. If they kill someone, they're also not a believer then. Ibn Abbas explained that faith is taken away when the person does the wrong thing, and it comes back if they repent.

title: Believers and Sinful Actions
content: The Prophet (ﷺ) said: If someone has sex outside of marriage, they are not a believer at that moment. The same goes for someone who steals or drinks alcohol - they are not a believer when they do those things. But if they ask for forgiveness afterwards, they can still become believers again.

title: Biggest Sins According to Allah
content: Abdullah bin Mas'ud asked the Prophet: 'What is the biggest sin?' The Prophet (ﷺ) replied, 'Worshipping others as if they created you.' Abdullah asked again, 'What's next?' The Prophet (ﷺ) said, 'Killing your own child so it doesn't share your food.' He asked once more, 'What's next?' The Prophet (ﷺ) answered, 'Having sex with another man's wife'.

title: Ali Stoned a Woman
content: Ali stoned a woman to death on a Friday. He said he was following the tradition of Allah's Messenger (ﷺ).

title: Stoning to Death in Islam
content: Ash Shaibani asked Abdullah bin Abi Aufa if the Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) carried out the punishment of stoning to death. Abdullah said yes, but didn't know if it was before or after a specific Quranic chapter called Surat-an-Nur was revealed.

title: Man Admits Zina, Stoned
content: A man from the tribe of Bani Aslam came to the Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ). He said he had committed adultery and admitted it four times. The Prophet (ﷺ) ordered him to be stoned to death because he was married.

title: Man Admits Zina in Mosque
content: A man went to the Prophet while he was praying. The man said four times that he had committed adultery. The Prophet (ﷺ) asked if he was sane and married, and the man said yes to both. Then the Prophet ordered his execution by stoning.

title: Man Admits Zina in Mosque
content: A man went to the Prophet while he was praying. He said, 'I have had sex outside of marriage.' The Prophet (ﷺ) ignored him at first, but when he admitted it four times, the Prophet asked if he was crazy or married. The man said no and yes. Then the Prophet told people to take him away and stone him to death.

title: Child Custody and Adultery
content: Sa'd bin Abi Waqqas and Abd bin Zam'a had a disagreement about a child. The Prophet (ﷺ) said, 'The boy belongs to Abd bin Zam'a because he was the one sleeping in the bed.' He also told Sauda to stay away from the boy. Additionally, he said that if someone commits adultery, they should be stoned.

title: Who Owns a Child?
content: Abu Huraira said the Prophet said: A child belongs to its father. If someone has sex with another person's wife, they will be stoned to death.

title: Punishment for Adultery
content: Two Jews were brought to the Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ). They had committed adultery and their priests said they should be punished by blackening their faces with charcoal. The Prophet (ﷺ) asked them about their punishment in the Torah, their holy book. A man named Abdullah bin Salam suggested bringing the Torah. When it was brought, a Jew tried to hide the verse that says adulterers should be stoned to death. But when he lifted his hand, the verse was still there. So the Prophet ordered them to be stoned to death.

title: Man Admits to Zina
content: A man from the Aslam tribe came to the Prophet. He confessed to having an affair. The Prophet (ﷺ) turned his back on him until he said it four times. The Prophet (ﷺ) asked if he was crazy, and then if he was married. The man said no and yes. The Prophet (ﷺ) ordered that he be stoned to death. This happened at a place where people gather for prayer. When the stones hurt him, he ran away but was caught again. He was stoned until he died. The Prophet (ﷺ) praised him and led his funeral prayer.

title: Fasting and Compensation
content: Abu Huraira told us about a man who had sex with his wife during Ramadan while he was fasting. He went to the Prophet for advice. The Prophet (ﷺ) asked if he could free a slave, but the man said no. Then he asked if he could fast for two months, and again the man said no. Finally, the Prophet said: 'Feed sixty poor people instead.'

title: Man Fasts and Breaks Rule
content: A man came to the Prophet in the mosque. He said he had ruined himself by having sex with his wife while fasting during Ramadan. The Prophet (ﷺ) asked him what he meant, and the man explained. The Prophet (ﷺ) told him to give some food in charity. But when a person brought food for the Prophet, the Prophet asked where the man was. When the man replied, the Prophet said: 'Take this food and give it to someone poorer than you.' The man said his family had no food. So the Prophet said: 'Then eat it yourselves.'

title: Forgiveness for Sinful Acts
content: Anas was with the Prophet when a man came and said he had committed a sin that needed punishment. The Prophet (ﷺ) didn't ask what it was. When prayer time came, the man prayed with the Prophet. After prayer, he asked again to be punished for his sin. The Prophet (ﷺ) asked if he had just prayed with him. He said yes. The Prophet (ﷺ) then forgave his sin.

title: Ma'iz bin Malik's Confession
content: Ibn Abbas said that when Ma'iz bin Malik came to the Prophet, he asked him if he had kissed a woman, winked at her, or looked at her. But Ma'iz said no. The Prophet (ﷺ) then directly asked if he had sex with her. Ma'iz confessed and the Prophet ordered his stoning.

title: Man Admits Zina in Mosque
content: A man went to the Prophet while he was sitting in the mosque. He said, 'I have committed adultery.' The Prophet (ﷺ) turned his face away. The man came back and confessed again. This time the Prophet asked him if he was sane. The man said yes. Then the Prophet asked if he was married. The man said yes. The Prophet (ﷺ) then told the people to take the man away and stone him to death.

title: Man Admits Zina
content: A man came to the Prophet in the mosque and said he had committed adultery. The Prophet (ﷺ) turned his face away each time the man approached him, until the man confessed four times. Then the Prophet asked if he was sane and married. When the man said yes, the Prophet ordered that he be taken outside and stoned to death.

title: Judging according to Allah's Laws
content: Abu Huraira and Zaid bin Khalid were with the Prophet. A man asked him to judge them based on Allah's laws. Another man stood up, saying he wanted to speak. The Prophet (ﷺ) allowed him to talk. This man explained that his son had committed adultery with another man's wife. He gave 100 sheep and a slave as a ransom for his son's sin. He was told by a learned man that his son should get 100 lashes and be exiled, while the woman should be stoned to death. The Prophet (ﷺ) said he would judge them according to Allah's laws. He ordered the man to return his sheep and slave. The son had to receive 100 lashes and be exiled for one year. The Prophet (ﷺ) told Unais to go to the woman and if she confessed, she should be stoned to death. Unais went and she confessed. She was then stoned to death.

title: Judging According to Allah's Law
content: Abu Huraira and Zaid bin Khalid were with the Prophet. A man stood up and asked him to judge them according to Allah's Laws. The other man, who was wiser, spoke up too. He said his son had committed a serious sin by having an affair with another man's wife. To make things right, he gave 100 sheep and a slave as payment. Then he asked a learned man what the punishment should be. The learned man said the son should get 100 lashes and be away for a year, and the woman should be stoned to death. The Prophet (ﷺ) listened carefully and then made his decision. He said the payment would be returned to the wise man, but his son had to take the punishment. The Prophet (ﷺ) also told Unais to go to the woman and ask her what she wanted to do. If she confessed, he was to stone her to death.

title: Umar's Concern about Stoning
content: Ibn Abbas said that Umar was worried. He thought people might forget the rule of stoning to death for married people who commit adultery. Umar confirmed that this punishment should be applied if there are witnesses, or if someone is pregnant with a child from another man, or if the person admits to doing it.

title: Umar's Last Warning
content: Ibn Abbas was teaching the Quran to some people in Mina. One of them, Abdur Rahman, told him about a man who came to Umar and said that if he died, they would give allegiance to another person instead of Abu Bakr. Umar got angry and decided to warn the people against those who wanted to take power for themselves. But Abdur Rahman advised him not to do it in Mina because many bad people were there and might misinterpret what he said. He suggested that Umar wait until they reached Medina, where there were wise and learned people who could understand his words correctly. When they arrived in Medina, Umar gave a speech to the people. He reminded them of the punishment for adultery, which was mentioned in the Quran, and warned against giving allegiance to someone without consulting others. He also told them about the disagreement between the emigrants and the Ansar after the Prophet's death, but how Abu Bakr had been chosen as the new leader. Umar said that if anyone gave allegiance to someone without consulting others, both the giver and the receiver would be killed.

title: Unmarried Person's Punishment
content: The Prophet (ﷺ) ordered that an unmarried person who has had illegal sex should be given 100 lashes and sent away for a year. This was also done by Umar, the second Muslim leader, and it is still a rule today.

title: Unmarried Person's Punishment
content: The Prophet (ﷺ) said that an unmarried person who has sex outside of marriage should be given one hundred lashes and sent away for a year. This rule was also followed by Umar bin Al-Khattab, and it is still in place today.

title: Punishment for Adultery
content: Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) said that an unmarried person who has illegal sex should be sent away from their home for one year. They will also get a punishment of being beaten with 100 lashes.

title: Men acting like women
content: The Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) said: 'I curse men who act like women and women who act like men.' He also told people to remove such individuals from their homes. He did this with one person, and later Umar did the same with another.

title: Bedouin's Case Decided
content: A Bedouin came to the Prophet while he was sitting. The Bedouin asked for a decision based on Allah's Laws in his case. His opponent explained that their son had committed adultery with the other man's wife, and they were unsure what punishment to give him. They offered a ransom of 100 sheep and a slave girl, but the scholars said he should be flogged and exiled. The Prophet (ﷺ) decided to follow Allah's Laws: the Bedouin got his animals back, their son was punished with 100 lashes and one year in exile. Then the Prophet told Unais to go to the wife of the other man and if she confessed, stone her to death. In the morning, Unais stoned her to death after she had confessed.

title: Bedouin's Case Decided
content: A Bedouin came to the Prophet while he was sitting. He asked for a verdict based on Allah's Laws. A man stood up and said his son had committed adultery with another man's wife. The people wanted to stone him, but the father offered one hundred sheep and a slave girl as a ransom. The Prophet (ﷺ) decided that the sheep and slave girl should be returned. The son would be flogged one hundred times and exiled for a year. Unais was told to go to the woman and ask her about the adultery. She confessed, so Unais stoned her to death.

title: Flogging and Selling a Slave
content: Abu Huraira and Zaid bin Khalid reported that the Prophet's decision was asked about an unmarried slave girl who had sex outside of marriage. He said, 'If she does this again, flog her with fifty lashes. If she does it twice more, flog her again with fifty lashes each time. And if she does it a third or fourth time, sell her.'

title: Flogging and Selling a Slave
content: Abu Huraira and Zaid bin Khalid reported that the Prophet's verdict was sought about an unmarried slave girl who had committed adultery. The Prophet (ﷺ) said: 'If she commits adultery, flog her with fifty lashes. If she does it again, flog her with fifty lashes. And if she does it a third time, flog her with fifty lashes and then sell her.'

title: Punishment for Adultery
content: The Prophet (ﷺ) said: If a female slave commits adultery and is proven guilty, she should be given 50 lashes. She won't be warned or told to change her behavior. If she does it again, she'll get more lashes but no warning. If she does it three times, she can be sold as a slave.

title: Stoning to Death for Adultery
content: Ash-Shaibani asked Abdullah bin Abi Aufa about stoning people who have committed adultery. Abdullah said the Prophet did carry out this punishment. Ash-Shaibani asked if it was before or after a specific Quranic verse was revealed, but Abdullah didn't know.

title: Jews Ask About Stoning
content: The Jews came to Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) and told him about a man and woman who had done something wrong. The Prophet (ﷺ) asked them what the Torah said about stoning people for this kind of behavior. They said it only says to flog them, but Abdullah bin Salam said that was not true. He made one of the Jews read from the Torah, and when he lifted his hand away, the verse about stoning appeared. The Prophet (ﷺ) then ordered the man and woman to be stoned to death.

title: Two Men Dispute Allah's Laws
content: Abu Huraira and Zaid bin Khalid were present when two men had a disagreement in front of the Prophet. One man asked for judgment based on Allah's laws, but the other man wanted to speak first. The wise man said, 'Let me explain.' He told the Prophet that his son was a laborer for the other man and had an affair with his wife. People thought the son should be stoned to death, but the father paid a ransom of 100 sheep and a slave girl instead. He asked scholars what to do next, and they said the son should be flogged 100 times and exiled for a year, while the other man's wife should be stoned to death if she confessed. The Prophet (ﷺ) promised to judge fairly and ordered the wise man's son to be punished as the scholars suggested. The Prophet (ﷺ) also told Unais Al-Aslami to take the other man's wife to a place where she could confess her sin, and if she did, she would be stoned to death.

title: Two Men Dispute Allah's Laws
content: Abu Huraira and Zaid bin Khalid reported a story. Two men had a disagreement in front of the Prophet. One man said, 'Judge us according to God's laws.' The other man said, 'Yes, I want you to judge us by God's laws, but let me speak first.' The Prophet (ﷺ) said, 'Go ahead and speak.' The second man said, 'My son worked for this man, and he had an affair with his wife. People told me my son should be stoned to death, so I gave the other man 100 sheep and a slave girl as payment for my son's mistake. Then I asked some learned people what to do, and they said my son should get 100 lashes and be away from home for a year. Only the other man's wife should be stoned.' The Prophet (ﷺ) said, 'I will judge you according to God's laws.' He told the first man to return his sheep and slave girl. Then he had the second man's son beaten with 100 lashes and sent him away for a year. He also asked Unais Al-Aslami to go to the other man's wife and stone her if she confessed. She confessed, so she was stoned.

title: Abu Bakr's Concern
content: Abu Bakr came to me while the Prophet was sleeping with his head on my thigh. Abu Bakr said, 'You're holding up the Prophet and the people. There's no water here.' He scolded me and gently hit my sides. But I couldn't move because the Prophet was resting on me. Then Allah revealed a verse about making do without water.

title: Abu Bakr hits Aisha
content: Aisha's husband Abu Bakr came to her and hit her with his fist. He said she had kept the people waiting because of a necklace. But Aisha stayed still, as if asleep, so she wouldn't wake up the Prophet.

title: Sa'd's Sense of Pride
content: Sa'd bin Ubada said he would kill someone if he found them with his wife. The Prophet (ﷺ) said, 'I have more sense of pride than Sa'd.' He also said, 'Allah has even more sense of pride than I do.'

title: Color Inheritance and Allah's Messenger
content: A man came to the Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ). He said his wife had a baby with dark skin. The Prophet (ﷺ) asked if he had camels. He said yes, they were red. The Prophet (ﷺ) asked if any of them were gray. He said yes. The Prophet (ﷺ) asked how that happened. The man thought it was from their ancestors. The Prophet (ﷺ) said the child probably got his color from his ancestors too.

title: Prophet's Rule for Flogging
content: The Prophet (ﷺ) said that no one should be beaten more than ten times unless they have committed a crime where Allah has set the punishment.

title: No Punishment Exceeds Ten Stripes
content: The Prophet (ﷺ) said: No punishment is worse than being beaten with ten lashes, unless the person has committed a crime that Allah has ordered to be punished in a certain way.

title: Flogging: A Limit Set
content: The Prophet (ﷺ) said, 'Do not hit anyone more than ten times unless they have done something that deserves a punishment from Allah.'

title: Prophet Muhammad forbids extreme fasting
content: Abu Huraira said that the Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) forbade a type of fasting where people go without food or water for more than one day. A Muslim man asked, 'But you do this, O Prophet?' The Prophet (ﷺ) replied, 'I sleep and my Lord gives me food and drink.' When some Muslims still refused to stop this extreme fasting, the Prophet fasted with them for a day, but then continued his own fast for another day. He said that if he hadn't seen the new moon, he would have made them continue their fast.

title: Buying Food Without Measuring
content: Abdullah bin Umar said that in the time of the Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ), people who bought food without measuring it would be punished if they sold it at the same place. They had to take it home before selling.

title: Prophet Muhammad's Revenge
content: Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) never took revenge for himself. He only took revenge when someone broke Allah's rules. Then he would take action to protect Allah's laws.

title: Divorced for False Accusation
content: When I was 15 years old, I saw a man who falsely accused his wife of adultery. The Prophet (ﷺ) ordered them to divorce. The husband said he would be lying if he kept her. A condition was set: if the child looked like one thing, the husband's accusation would be true; but if it looked like another, he would be lying. Eventually, the woman gave birth to a child that matched the second description.

title: Woman Stoned Without Witnesses
content: Ibn Abbas mentioned a couple who took an oath called Lian. Abdullah bin Shaddad asked him if this was the woman about whom the Prophet said he would have stoned her to death without witnesses. Ibn Abbas replied that it wasn't, but she had exposed herself by behaving suspiciously.

title: Lian: A Test of Truth
content: Ibn 'Abbas was with the Prophet. Someone mentioned Lian, a way to prove if someone is telling the truth or not. A man from his tribe came and said he saw another man with his wife. The accused man said he was being unfairly blamed because of what he had said earlier. He took the man who complained to the Prophet. The Prophet (ﷺ) asked them to describe the men they were talking about. One was thin, yellow-skinned, and had lank hair. The other was reddish-brown with fat legs and a big body. The Prophet (ﷺ) prayed for Allah to reveal the truth. Later, the woman gave birth to a child who looked like the man she accused of being with her. So the Prophet made them take an oath called Lian. Someone in the gathering asked Ibn 'Abbas if this was the same lady the Prophet had talked about earlier. The Prophet (ﷺ) said that if he didn't have witnesses, he would stone someone to death for committing adultery. Ibn 'Abbas replied that it wasn't the same woman, but another one who often behaved suspiciously among the Muslims.

title: Seven Destructive Sins
content: The Prophet (ﷺ) said to avoid seven big sins. People asked what they were. He replied: Don't worship anyone except Allah; don't use magic; don't kill someone unless it's allowed by law; don't take money that has extra interest; don't take something that doesn't belong to you, especially from an orphan; don't run away from a fight when you're supposed to be there; and don't accuse a good woman of doing something bad.

title: Lying about a Slave
content: The Prophet (ﷺ) said: If someone falsely accuses their slave of something and the slave is actually innocent, they will be punished on Judgment Day unless what they accused them of is true.

title: Judging according to Allah's Laws
content: A man came to the Prophet and asked him to judge a case based on Allah's laws. The other party agreed, saying 'Judge us fairly'. The Prophet (ﷺ) said, 'Speak' and the man explained that his son had committed adultery with another man's wife. He paid a ransom of one hundred sheep and a slave for his son, but was told by scholars that his son should be flogged 100 times and exiled for a year, while the woman should be stoned to death. The Prophet (ﷺ) agreed with this judgment, saying he would judge according to Allah's laws. The man's punishment was carried out, and Unais was asked to go to the woman in the morning and ask her if she confessed. She did confess, so she was stoned to death.

title: Judging According to Allah's Laws
content: A man came to the Prophet and asked him to judge a case according to Allah's laws. The other man explained that his son had committed adultery with another man's wife, and he had paid a ransom of one hundred sheep and a slave. He said that Islamic scholars told him his son should be beaten 100 times and sent away for a year, while the woman should be stoned to death. The Prophet (ﷺ) agreed with this judgment.

title: Greatest Sin in Allah's Sight
content: A man asked the Prophet, 'What is the greatest sin in Allah's sight?' The Prophet (ﷺ) replied, 'Associating partners with Allah.' The man asked again, and the Prophet said, 'Killing your own child so they don't share what you have.' He was asked again, and the Prophet said, 'Having sex with someone else's wife.' Allah revealed a verse confirming this: 'Do not worship anyone besides Allah. Do not kill any life unless it is to protect yourself. And do not have sex with someone else's wife. Anyone who does these things will be punished'.

title: Faith and Unlawful Killing
content: Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) said: A true believer is free to practice their faith unless they kill someone without a good reason.

title: Killing Unlawfully is Evil
content: Abdullah bin Umar said: One bad thing that can't be undone is killing someone without a good reason.

title: First Cases on Judgment Day
content: Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) said: 'The first cases to be decided on the Day of Resurrection will be those involving bloodshed.'

title: Don't Kill a New Muslim
content: Al-Miqdad asked the Prophet: 'If I meet an enemy and we fight. If he cuts off my hand, then says

title: Don't Kill a New Muslim
content: Al-Miqdad asked the Prophet: 'If an unbeliever hurts me and I cut off their hand, can I kill them if they say

title: Adam's Responsibility for Murder
content: The Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) said: 'If someone is killed unfairly, a part of the blame goes to Adam. He was the first person on earth to kill another human being.'

title: Don't Fight Each Other
content: The Prophet (ﷺ) said: 'After I'm gone, don't become disbelievers by fighting and killing each other.'

title: Don't Fight Each Other
content: During his last Hajj, the Prophet said: 'Be quiet and listen to me. After I'm gone, don't become disbelievers by killing each other.'

title: Biggest Sins According to the Prophet
content: The Prophet (ﷺ) said that the biggest sins are: joining others in worship with Allah, taking a false oath, and being unkind to one's parents. Mu`adh also mentioned murder as one of the biggest sins.

title: Biggest Sins in Islam
content: The Prophet (ﷺ) said the biggest sins are: joining others with Allah in worship, killing someone, not taking care of your parents, and lying under oath.

title: Usama's Questionable Killing
content: Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) sent Usama and me to fight against Al-Huraqa people. We won the battle in the morning. While chasing one of their men, he said 'There is no God but Allah'. The Ansari stopped attacking him, but I killed him with my spear. When we returned, the Prophet asked me why I killed him after he said that. I said he was trying to save himself. The Prophet (ﷺ) repeated what I did was wrong several times.

title: Pledge of Allegiance
content: 'Ubada bin As-Samat was a leader who gave his promise to Allah's Messenger (ﷺ). He and others promised not to worship anything but Allah, to not steal, have sex outside marriage, kill anyone Allah says not to, take things that don't belong to them, or disobey Allah. If they kept their promise, they would go to Paradise. But if they broke any of these rules, their fate would be decided by Allah.

title: Don't Fight Against Us
content: The Prophet (ﷺ) said, 'If someone fights against us, they are not one of us.'

title: Two Muslims Fighting
content: Al-Ahnaf bin Qais went to help a man named Ali. On the way, he met Abu Bakra and told him about his plan. Abu Bakra said, 'Don't go. I heard the Prophet say that if two Muslims fight each other with swords, both will go to Hell.' Al-Ahnaf asked, 'But what about the one who gets killed?' The Prophet (ﷺ) replied, 'The person who got killed was eager to kill their opponent too'.

title: Crushing a Girl's Head
content: Anas bin Malik said: A Jewish man hurt a girl very badly. The Prophet (ﷺ) asked her who did it, and she named the man. He was brought to the Prophet, questioned, and eventually confessed. As punishment, his head was crushed with stones.

title: Girl Attacked in Medina
content: A girl wearing ornaments was attacked with a stone at Medina. She was brought to the Prophet while still alive. The Prophet (ﷺ) asked her who hit her, but she denied it three times. On his third question, she said yes. The Prophet (ﷺ) then sent for the attacker and had him killed between two stones.

title: Protection of Muslim Life
content: Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) said that a Muslim's blood cannot be taken unless they have done one of three things: They killed someone and the family wants revenge, or they had sex with their married partner, or they left Islam.

title: Killing for Jewelry
content: Anas told us that a Jew hit a girl with a stone to steal her jewelry. The Prophet (ﷺ) saw the girl and asked if the Jew had hurt her. She shook her head twice, saying no. When he asked again, she nodded yes. The Prophet (ﷺ) then killed the Jew with two stones.

title: Protecting Mecca's Sanctuary
content: After the Conquest of Mecca, a man from the tribe of Khuza`a was killed by a member of Bani Laith. The Prophet (ﷺ) said: 'Mecca is a safe place. Fighting here was not allowed before me or after me. It was only allowed for a short time on this one day. Now it's safe again. Don't cut down trees, pull out thorny bushes, or take things that have been lost unless you're trying to find the owner. If someone is killed, their family can choose between money or revenge. A man from Yemen asked me to write this down, so I did. Another man from Quraish added: 'Except for Al-Idhkhir grass, which we use in our homes and graves.'

title: Punishment for Crime in Islam
content: For the children of Israel, if someone committed a crime, they could only get equal punishment. But Allah said to Muslims: 'Believers, if someone is murdered, you can choose between two things: give them equal punishment or accept money as compensation.' Ibn Abbas explained that this means if it was an intentional murder, you can forgive and take the money instead of punishing equally.

title: Three Things Allah Hates
content: The Prophet (ﷺ) said that there are three things Allah hates. The first is someone who does bad things in a holy place like Mecca or Medina. The second is someone who wants to keep old, bad ways of doing things in Islam. The third is someone who hurts another person without any good reason.

title: Satan's Deception at Uhud
content: On the day of the battle of Uhud, the pagans were defeated. Satan shouted to the Muslims, 'Be careful behind you!' The front line of Muslim fighters mistakenly attacked their own backline and killed Al-Yaman. Hudhaifa bin Al-Yaman cried out for his father, but it was too late. His father had been killed. Hudhaifa said, 'May Allah forgive them.'

title: Crushing a Man for Cruelty
content: A Jewish man hurt a girl badly by crushing her head with two stones. When people asked her who did it, she nodded when they said the name of the Jewish man. He was brought and confessed. The Prophet (ﷺ) ordered that he be punished in the same way.

title: Prophet's Justice
content: The Prophet (ﷺ) saw a Jew kill a girl just to take her jewelry. The Prophet (ﷺ) punished the man for his crime.

title: Prophet's Reaction to Medicine
content: I, Aisha, was giving medicine to the Prophet when he said, 'Don't put this in my mouth.' We thought he didn't want it because sick people often dislike medicine. Later, when he felt better, he explained that everyone will have to take medicine at some point, except for Al-`Abbas who wasn't there.

title: Last but First in Judgment
content: Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) said: We Muslims will be the last to come on earth, but we'll be first when it comes to being judged. If someone is secretly looking into your house without permission and you throw a stone at them and hurt their eyes, there's no blame on you.

title: Last but First in Judgment
content: Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) said: We Muslims will be the last to come on earth, but we'll be first when it comes to being judged by Allah. If someone is spying on your house without permission and you defend yourself by throwing a stone that blinds them, there's no blame on you.

title: Prophet Muhammad Protects Home
content: A man looked into the Prophet's house. The Prophet (ﷺ) aimed an arrow at him to stop him from looking in. Anas bin Malik told Humaid about this incident.

title: Satan's Deception at Uhud
content: When the battle of Uhud was over and the pagans were defeated, Satan shouted to the Muslims: 'Be careful behind you!' The front lines turned around and attacked their own comrades. Hudhaifa saw his father being killed by his fellow Muslims. He cried out, 'My father! My father!' But they didn't stop fighting until he died. Hudhaifa then asked Allah for forgiveness for those who had killed his father.

title: 'Amir's Good Deeds
content: The Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) went to Khaibar with his companions. One of them, Amir, started singing a song while driving the camels. The Prophet (ﷺ) asked who was driving and they said it was Amir. He then blessed Amir. Some people wished they could stay longer with Amir because he was killed the next morning. They thought his good deeds were lost because he died fighting. I told the Prophet about this and he said that whoever says so is lying. Amir will get a double reward for obeying Allah and fighting in His cause, no matter how he dies.

title: Biting Someone's Hand
content: Two men had a fight. One bit the other's hand and made two of his teeth fall out. They went to see the Prophet for help. He said, 'You bit your brother like a camel bites. You don't get any money.'

title: No Fighting in Battles
content: I was on a trip with the Prophet. A man hit another man and broke one of his front teeth. The Prophet (ﷺ) said, 'This case is cancelled'.

title: Slapping a Child
content: Anas said that the Prophet was told about a girl whose incisor tooth was broken by another girl's mother. The Prophet (ﷺ) ordered that the punishment be the same for both girls, as an eye for an eye.

title: Equality in Punishment
content: Ibn Abbas said the Prophet said that slapping someone with a hand is the same as hitting them with any other part of the body. This means if you slap someone, they can hit you back. 'Umar was told about a boy who was killed and he said he would kill everyone in San'a if they were involved. He actually carried out equality in punishment for someone who hit another person with a stick. Ali did the same for three lashes with a whip, Shuraih for one lash, and Suwaid bin Muqarrin for scratching.

title: Allah's Messenger Refuses Medicine
content: Aisha said that when Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) was ill, they poured medicine into his mouth. He pointed to them, meaning 'don't do this'. They thought he didn't want medicine because patients often dislike it. When he got a bit better, he asked if they had taken him seriously. Aisha explained that they thought he just disliked the taste of medicine. Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) said that everyone will have to take medicine at some point, but Al-Abbas was exempt because he wasn't present.

title: Finding a Murdered Companion
content: Some people from the Ansar tribe went to Khaibar. They found one of their own men dead. They said, 'You killed our friend!' The other group said, 'No, we didn't kill him.' The Prophet (ﷺ) asked them to speak up and find proof against the killer. But they had no evidence. Then the Prophet suggested that the defendants take an oath. However, the Ansar people refused to accept their oaths because they were Jews. So, the Prophet decided to pay 100 camels from his charity funds as compensation for the dead man.

title: Umar's Question on Al-Qasama
content: Umar bin Abdul Aziz sat in his courtyard and asked people about Al-Qasama. They said it was allowed to use it for Qisas, like the previous Muslim leaders did. He then asked Abu Qilaba what he thought. Abu Qilaba said, 'If fifty army chiefs testified that a man committed adultery without seeing him, would you stone him?' Umar said no. Abu Qilaba continued, 'And if they testified that someone stole in Hums, would you cut off his hand even though they didn't see it?' Again, Umar said no. Abu Qilaba then explained what the Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) did in three situations: when someone killed unjustly, a married person committed adultery, or someone fought against Allah and His Messenger. The people mentioned that Anas bin Malik narrated that the Prophet cut off thieves' hands and branded their eyes. Abu Qilaba said he would explain this narration. He told them about eight people from the tribe of 'Ukl who became sick in Medina and drank camel's milk and urine as medicine, but then killed the Messenger's shepherd and took his camels. The Prophet (ﷺ) ordered to cut off their hands and feet, brand their eyes with hot iron, and leave them in the sun until they died. Abu Qilaba said this was a tradition set by Allah's Messenger (ﷺ). He also told about a group of Ansari people who found one of their companions killed and suspected the Jews. The Prophet (ﷺ) sent for the Jews and asked if they had killed him, but they denied it. He then offered to let 50 Jews take an oath that they didn't kill him, but the Ansars refused. The Prophet (ﷺ) himself paid the blood-money instead. Abu Qilaba also mentioned a case where the tribe of Hudhail repudiated one of their men and later accused a Yemenite family of killing him. They asked Umar to let 50 people from Hudhail swear that they hadn't repudiated him, but one person paid money instead of taking the oath. Later, Abdul Malik bin Marwan sentenced someone to death in Qisas based on Al-Qasama but later regretted it and ordered the names of those who took the oath to be erased.

title: Prophet Protects His Home
content: One day, a man looked into the Prophet's home without permission. The Prophet (ﷺ) stood up and quietly aimed an arrowhead at him to gently poke him back out.

title: Looking through a hole
content: A man looked through a small opening in the Messenger's house. The Messenger was using an iron bar to rub his hair. When he saw the man, he said, 'If I had known you were looking at me, I would have poked your eye with this.' He added, 'We need to ask permission before entering someone's home so we don't look without their permission'.

title: Protecing Your Privacy
content: Abu Huraira said that the Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) said: 'If someone looks at you without your permission and you defend yourself by hitting them with a stick, even if it hurts their eye, you won't be blamed.'

title: Ali's Knowledge of Islam
content: I asked Ali about any special knowledge from God apart from the Quran. He said, 'We have nothing except what is in the Quran and understanding it.' I asked him to explain. He showed me a paper with rules for paying ransom to freed captives and that Muslims should not be punished like disbelievers.

title: Two Women Fight and One Loses Baby
content: Abu Huraira said that two women from the tribe of Hudhail were fighting. One woman threw a stone at the other, causing her to have a miscarriage. The Prophet (ﷺ) decided that the woman who caused the miscarriage should give another slave as compensation.

title: Abortion and Compensation
content: One day, 'Umar asked the companions about what to do in a case where someone else caused a woman to have an abortion.
