Al-Mughira said that the Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) had given a verdict: if it's a boy or girl, give a slave as compensation. Muhammad (ﷺ) bin Maslama confirmed that he saw the Prophet make this decision.

title: Abortion and Compensation
content: Umar asked the companions about what to do with a woman who had an abortion. Al-Mughira said that the Prophet decided that if it was a boy or girl, a slave should be given as compensation. Muhammad (ﷺ) bin Maslama confirmed that he saw the Prophet make this decision.

title: Abortion Judgement by Prophet
content: Umar asked people if they knew about the Prophet's decision on abortion. Al-Mughira said he heard the Prophet say that a slave should be given as punishment. Umar wanted another witness, and Muhammad (ﷺ) bin Maslama agreed with Al-Mughira.

title: Abortion Judgement by Prophet
content: 'Umar asked people if they knew about the Prophet's decision on abortion. Al-Mughira said he heard the Prophet say that a person who causes an abortion should pay a fine, either for a boy or a girl. 'Umar asked for proof and Muhammad (ﷺ) bin Maslama confirmed what Al-Mughira said.

title: Aborted Fetus: Compensation
content: Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) gave a verdict about an unborn baby that was accidentally killed. The person responsible had to give a slave as compensation. But the woman who was supposed to receive the compensation died before it could be given to her. So, Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) decided that her inheritance should go to her children and husband, and the compensation for the unborn baby should still be paid.

title: Killing in a Fight
content: Two women from Hudhail were fighting. One hit the other with a stone that killed her and her unborn baby. The Prophet (ﷺ) was told about it. He said, 'For the baby, pay a slave as compensation. For the woman, the killer's family must pay.'

title: Anas Serves the Prophet
content: When the Prophet arrived in Medina, Abu Talha brought Anas to him. He said, 'This boy is clever, let him help you.' So I served the Prophet at home and on trips. The Prophet (ﷺ) never scolded me for anything I did or didn't do.

title: No Compensation for Accidental Deaths
content: Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) said: There is no payment to the family if someone dies from an animal attack. No payment also if they die by accident, like falling into a well or getting hurt in a mine. But if you find hidden treasures, one-fifth of it goes to the government.

title: No Compensation for Accidents
content: The Prophet (ﷺ) said: If someone is hurt or killed by an animal that's not being controlled, there's no payment needed. The same goes if someone falls and dies in a well, or in a mine. But if you find buried treasure, the government gets one-fifth of it.

title: Protection for Non-Muslims
content: The Prophet (ﷺ) said: If someone kills a person who has made peace with Muslims, they will not be able to smell the good scent of Paradise. This good scent can be smelled from far away - as far as it takes forty years to walk.

title: Ali's Answer to Abu Juhaifa
content: Abu Juhaifa asked Ali about any other important Islamic teachings besides the Quran. Ali said that there is nothing else, but people can understand Allah's Book if He gives them the gift of understanding. He also mentioned a piece of paper with rules on it: how to pay blood money, release captives, and punish Muslims who kill non-Muslims.

title: Don't Favor Some Prophets
content: The Prophet (ﷺ) said: Don't think some prophets are better than others. Treat all of them equally.

title: Prophet Muhammad's Response
content: Abu Sa'id Al-Khudri said a Jew came to the Prophet. The Jew said someone from the Ansari companions slapped him. The Prophet (ﷺ) asked, 'Why did you slap him?' He said he was passing by and heard the companion say, 'Moses is chosen above all people.' He replied, 'Even above Muhammad (ﷺ)?' and got angry, slapping him. The Prophet (ﷺ) said not to think he's better than other prophets. On Judgment Day, everyone will be unconscious, but I'll wake up first. When I do, I might see Moses holding a pillar of God's Throne.

title: Companions' Concern about Faith
content: When the Prophet's companions heard a verse that said some of them might have mixed good and bad actions, they were worried. They asked the Prophet if this meant any of them had done wrong. The Prophet (ﷺ) replied, 'No, it's talking about something else. Remember what Luqman said: 'Worshipping others besides Allah is very wrong'.

title: Three Big Sins
content: Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) said: The biggest sins are to worship anyone except Allah, not being kind to your parents, and lying in court. He kept saying this until we wished he would stop.

title: Biggest Sins According to the Prophet
content: A bedouin asked the Prophet what the biggest sins are. The Prophet (ﷺ) said that joining others in worship with Allah is a big sin. The bedouin asked again and the Prophet said being unkind to one's parents is another big sin. When asked once more, the Prophet said taking an oath falsely to take someone else's property is also very wrong.

title: Punishment for Past Actions
content: A man asked the Prophet, 'Will we be punished for what we did before Islam?' The Prophet (ﷺ) said, 'If you do good in Islam, your past mistakes won't hurt you. But if you do bad in Islam, you'll be punished for both.'

title: Ali Burns Atheists
content: Some people who didn't believe in God were brought to Ali. He burned them. Ibn Abbas heard about this and said, 'If I had been there, I wouldn't have burned them. The Prophet (ﷺ) said not to punish anyone with fire. Instead, he would have killed them because the Prophet said that if someone leaves Islam, they should be killed.'

title: Employment and Night Prayers
content: Abu Musa visited the Prophet with two men from Ash'ariyin. The Prophet (ﷺ) was brushing his teeth when they asked for a job. He said, 'We don't hire people who ask for work.' Then he sent Abu Musa to Yemen. When Muadh arrived, he saw a man tied up beside Abu Musa. This man had been a Jew but became Muslim and then went back to being Jewish. Muadh wanted the man killed because it's Allah's law. The Prophet (ﷺ) agreed that the man should be punished for changing his faith. Later, they talked about night prayers and one of them said he prays at night and hopes Allah will reward him for sleeping as well.

title: Abu Bakr Decides to Fight
content: After the Prophet died and Abu Bakr became leader, some Arabs stopped believing in Allah. Umar said to Abu Bakr, 'How can we fight them? The Prophet (ﷺ) said we should only fight people who don't say

title: Abu Bakr Decides to Fight
content: After the Prophet's death, some Arabs stopped believing in Allah. 'Umar asked Abu Bakr how he could fight them when the Prophet said to fight those who don't say 'There is no god but Allah'. Abu Bakr replied that he would fight anyone who doesn't pay their Zakat (a part of their wealth given to help others). He even said he'd fight if they didn't give him as much as they used to give the Prophet. 'Umar agreed with Abu Bakr's decision, saying it was clear Allah had guided him.

title: Greeting a Jew
content: Anas bin Malik told us that a Jew passed by the Prophet. The Jew said 'As-Samu 'Alaika' which means 'Death be upon you'. The Prophet (ﷺ) replied with the same words. He then asked his companions what the Jew had said, and they repeated it. They wanted to kill the Jew, but the Prophet said no. When people from other religions greet us, we should say 'Wa 'Alaikum', meaning 'And upon you too'.

title: Jews Visit the Prophet
content: Some Jews came to visit the Prophet. They said 'Death be upon you'. I replied 'May death and Allah's curse be upon you!' The Prophet (ﷺ) told me, 'Allah is kind and gentle, so we should always be kind too.' When I asked if he'd heard their insult, he just smiled and said 'And may it also be on you'.

title: Responding to Jewish Greetings
content: When the Jews greet us, they say 'death be upon you'. We should respond with 'and upon you too'.

title: Prophet Forgives His People
content: The Prophet (ﷺ) said that one of the prophets was beaten and hurt by his people. The prophet wiped away the blood from his face and prayed, 'Forgive my people because they don't know.'

title: Warning About False Believers
content: Ali said: I promise to never lie about the Prophet's words. If I tell you something not from a Hadith, it might be a trick. The Prophet (ﷺ) said that in the future, some young people will say good things but their faith won't be real. They'll leave Islam like an arrow leaves its target. If you find them, kill them. Whoever kills them will get a reward on Judgment Day.

title: Warning about False Believers
content: Abu Sa'id was asked if he knew anything about Al-Harauriyya. He said he didn't know what they were, but the Prophet had said that a group of people would appear in Islam who seem very pious. They might even make you think your prayers are not as good as theirs. But they only read the Quran without truly understanding it. And when they leave Islam, it will be like an arrow leaving its target - fast and sudden.

title: Leaving Islam is like an Arrow
content: The Prophet (ﷺ) said that people who follow Al-Harauriyya will leave Islam completely. They will go out of the Muslim community quickly, just like an arrow leaves its target.

title: The Prophet's Warning to Umar
content: The Prophet (ﷺ) was giving something to the people. Abdullah bin Dhil Khawaisira at-Tamimi came and said, 'Be fair, Messenger of Allah.' The Prophet (ﷺ) replied, 'Who can be fair if I am not?' Umar suggested cutting off Abdullah's head, but the Prophet stopped him. He said that Abdullah has friends who pray a lot and fast often. If you compare your prayers with theirs, you will think yours are weak. But these people will leave Islam quickly. They will be like an arrow shot from a bow. When we examine their actions closely, we won't find any good in them. The Prophet (ﷺ) said that one of the signs of their arrival will be a man who has a hand or chest like a woman's. This happened when Muslims started to disagree with each other. Abu Sa'id confirmed that he heard this from the Prophet and also saw Ali kill these people, including Abdullah.

title: Warning about Al-Khawarij
content: I asked Sahl bin Hunaif if he had heard the Prophet say anything about Al-Khawarij. He said, 'Yes, I remember him saying that some people will appear in Iraq who recite the Quran but it doesn't change their hearts. They leave Islam like an arrow shoots through a target.'

title: Two Groups Before the Hour
content: Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) said: The Day of Judgment will not come until two big groups fight each other. They both believe in one God, but they disagree on something else. Umar told me that he saw Hisham reciting a chapter from the Quran differently than how Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) taught him. Umar was about to stop Hisham during prayer, but then let him finish. He took Hisham to Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) and said: 'Hisham is reciting this chapter in a way you didn't teach me.' Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) asked Umar to release Hisham and let him read it again. When Hisham did, Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) said: 'It's been revealed like that.' Then he told Umar to read it too, and when he did, Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) said: 'It's been revealed like that too.' He added: 'The Quran can be recited in seven different ways. Read it however is easiest for you.'

title: Companions Understand the Verse
content: When the Prophet's companions heard a verse that said 'Those who believe and did not confuse their belief with wrong', they thought it meant none of them had done anything wrong. They asked the Prophet, but he explained that the verse was actually saying what Luqman told his son: don't worship anyone besides Allah, because that is very wrong.

title: Ali and Hatib's Letter
content: One day, the Prophet came to me in the morning. A man said, 'Where is Malik bin Ad-Dukhshun?' Another man replied, 'He's a hypocrite.' The Prophet (ﷺ) asked, 'Does he say

title: Prophet's Prayer for Companions
content: The Prophet (ﷺ) used to pray in his prayers: 'O Allah, save Aiyash bin Abi Rabi'a and Salama bin Hisham and Al-Walid bin Al-Walid. O Allah, help the weak believers. O Allah, be harsh on the people of Mudar and make them suffer like Joseph's time.'

title: Three Signs of True Faith
content: Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) said, 'If someone has these three qualities, they will have the sweetness of faith. First, they love Allah and me more than anything else. Second, when they love someone, it's only because of their love for Allah. Third, they hate going back to not believing in Allah as much as they hate being thrown into Hell.'

title: Sa'id bin Zaid's Story
content: I was tied and forced to leave Islam by Umar. But before that, he himself became Muslim. If the mountain of Uhud fell because of what you did to Uthman, it would be right.

title: Complaints to the Prophet
content: We complained to the Messenger of Allah about our situation while he was resting in the shade of the Ka'ba. We asked him to pray for us and ask Allah to help us. He said that people before us were tortured, but they didn't give up their faith. He told us that Islam will be successful until a traveler can ride from San'a to Hadramout without worrying about anyone except Allah and wild animals.

title: The Prophet Visits the Jews
content: The Prophet (ﷺ) came to a mosque where the Jews were gathered. He said, 'Become Muslims and you will be safe.' The Jews replied that he had already told them this message. The Prophet (ﷺ) repeated his request twice more. Each time, they said he had delivered Allah's message. On the third time, he added: 'The earth belongs to Allah and His Messenger. If any of you own property, sell it. Otherwise, know that the earth belongs to Allah and His Messenger.'

title: Invalid Marriage Declared
content: Khansa' bint Khidam's father married her off when she was already a grown woman. She didn't want the marriage, so she went to see the Prophet and he said it wasn't valid.

title: Women's Consent in Marriage
content: I asked the Prophet if women should be asked for their consent to marry. He said yes. I then mentioned that a shy virgin might stay quiet, but he replied that her silence means she agrees.

title: Buying a Slave for Freedom
content: Jabir told us about an Ansari man who owned one slave. The man had no other property. When the Prophet found out, he asked if anyone would buy this slave from him. Nu'aim bin An-Nahham bought the slave for 800 Dirhams. This slave was Egyptian and died that year.

title: Forced Inheritance and Marriage
content: Ibn Abbas explained a Quranic verse that says Muslims are not allowed to force women into marriage against their will. Before Islam, if a man died, his relatives could inherit his wife and even marry her themselves or give her to someone else. They had more power over her than she did herself. This was why the verse was revealed. In another case, a government slave tried to force himself on a slave girl from war spoils. The caliph Umar punished him with flogging and exile, but not the girl because the man committed a crime against her will. If a free man rapes a virgin slave girl, he must pay a fine equal to the slave's price and be flogged. But if she is a married woman, only the man gets punished.

title: Abraham's Wife Sent to a King
content: Prophet Abraham and his wife Sarah migrated to a new town. The king of the town sent a message asking for Sarah. Abraham agreed, but then the king wanted to harm her. Sarah got up, washed herself, prayed, and said 'God, if I believe in You and Your messenger, don't let this cruel man hurt me.' The king suddenly had an epileptic fit and started shaking.

title: Treat Your Muslim Brother Well
content: Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) said: A Muslim is like a brother to another Muslim. He should not hurt him or leave him to someone who will hurt him. If you help your Muslim brother, Allah will help you.

title: Help Your Brother
content: Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) said: 'Support your brother, whether he's hurting others or being hurt himself.' A man asked, 'If he's the one causing harm, how can I help him?' The Prophet (ﷺ) replied, 'By stopping him from doing wrong. That's what it means to help someone'.

title: Emigration and Good Intentions
content: The Prophet (ﷺ) said: 'Good deeds are rewarded based on our intentions. If someone moves to a new place for Allah's sake, their move is for Allah. But if they do it for money or marriage, then that's what they're really after.'

title: Prayer and Passing Wind
content: The Prophet (ﷺ) said: Allah does not accept a person's prayer if they pass gas without washing their hands again.

title: Zakat Rules Explained
content: Abu Bakr wrote down the rules for Zakat, which are based on what Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) taught. The rules say you shouldn't divide your property into parts to avoid paying Zakat. You should also not collect different amounts of money or goods to avoid paying it.

title: Prayer, Fasting, and Zakat
content: A man came to the Prophet. He asked about prayer: 'What must I do?' The Prophet (ﷺ) said, 'You must pray five times a day.' The man asked, 'And fasting?' The Prophet (ﷺ) replied, 'Fast during Ramadan.' The man then asked about giving money to help others (Zakat). The Prophet (ﷺ) explained what is required. The man said, 'I will only do what is needed and not more.' The Prophet (ﷺ) said, 'If he's being honest, he'll be successful.' Some people later discussed Zakat: if you have 120 camels, you must give two Hiqqas of food or money to help others. If you try to cheat by giving them away as gifts or killing them, it doesn't matter.

title: Zakat and Wealth on Judgment Day
content: Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) said: On the Day of Resurrection, a person's wealth that hasn't been given to charity will appear as a huge snake. The owner will run from it, but it'll follow him and say, 'I'm your wealth.' The Prophet (ﷺ) said this snake will keep following until the owner lets it swallow his hand. If someone owns camels and doesn't pay their Zakat, those camels will come to them on Judgment Day and hit their face with their hooves. Some people thought they could avoid paying Zakat by selling their animals just before the due date, but this is not allowed.

title: Zakat and the Day of Judgment
content: Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) said: On the Day of Resurrection, a person's hidden treasure or wealth that hasn't been given to charity will appear as a huge snake. The owner will try to run away from it, but it will follow him and say, 'I'm your hidden treasure.' The Prophet (ﷺ) said, if you don't pay Zakat for your animals, they'll come back to you on the Day of Judgment and hurt your face with their hooves. Some people thought that if they sold their animals before Zakat was due, they wouldn't have to pay anything. But Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) said, paying Zakat even a year early is still valid.

title: Fulfilling a Mother's Vow
content: Sa'd bin 'Ubada asked the Prophet about his mother's vow. She had promised to do something but died before doing it. The Prophet (ﷺ) said, 'Do it for her.' Some people thought that if you have too many camels, you don't need to pay Zakat (charity). But the Prophet said that even if you give them away or sell them, you still have to pay Zakat at the end of a year. If you slaughter them and then die, your family doesn't owe any more charity.

title: Prohibition of Shighar Marriage
content: 'Abdullah said the Prophet forbade a type of marriage called Shighar. I asked Nafi' what it was, and he said it's when you marry someone's daughter without paying any money, and at the same time, they marry your own daughter to that person without paying any money too. Some people thought if you tricked them into doing this, the marriage would still be valid but the condition of not paying any money is wrong. Others said both Shighar and another type called Mut'a are not allowed because their conditions are wrong.

title: Mut'a Marriage Forbidden
content: Ali was asked about temporary marriage. He said that the Prophet forbade it on the Day of Khaibar and also eating donkey's meat. Some people thought that if they did a temporary marriage in secret, it would still be wrong. Others thought the marriage itself was okay, but the condition of being temporary was not.

title: Help Others with Water
content: The Prophet (ﷺ) said: Don't stop others from giving water to their animals if you have extra. Let them also benefit from the extra grass that will grow because of it.

title: Prophet forbids Najsh
content: Ibn Umar said the Prophet forbade a practice called An-Najsh.

title: Bargaining with Honesty
content: A man told the Prophet that he often got cheated in deals. The Prophet (ﷺ) said, 'When you bargain, say

title: Guardians and Orphan Girls
content: `Urwa asked Aisha about a verse in the Quran. The verse says: 'If you think it's hard to be fair with orphan girls, marry other women.' Aisha explained that this is about a guardian who wants to marry an orphan girl because of her wealth or beauty. He might want to give her less money than usual. This was not allowed unless he treated her fairly and gave her the full amount she deserved. The people asked the Prophet for advice on how to handle these cases, so Allah revealed more guidance in the Quran.

title: Betrayers Will Be Recognized
content: The Prophet (ﷺ) said that on the Day of Resurrection, every person who betrays others will have a flag to show they are a betrayer.

title: The Prophet is Human
content: The Prophet (ﷺ) said: 'I'm only a human being. If you have disagreements and one of you presents their case better, I'll give my decision based on what I hear. Remember, if I make a mistake and give someone something that doesn't belong to them, it's like giving them a piece of fire.'

title: Marriage Consent for Women
content: The Prophet (ﷺ) said: A woman should not be married without her permission. If a virgin is silent when asked, it means she agrees to marry. But if someone tricks the system and gets false witnesses to say she agreed, and later finds out they lied, he can still have a valid marriage with her.

title: Guardian's Marriage Decision
content: A woman from Ja'far's family was worried that her guardian would marry her without her consent. She asked two Ansar men, `AbdurRahman and Mujammi', for advice. They told her not to worry because the Prophet had cancelled a marriage arranged by Khansa' bint Khidam against her will.

title: Marriage Consent for Women
content: Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) said: A woman should be asked if she wants to marry someone. If she's a virgin, she must agree first. Some people asked how she would say yes. The Prophet (ﷺ) said that silence means agreement. But what if someone tricks the judge and says the woman agreed? Even if it's a lie, the marriage is still valid.

title: Marriage Consent for Virgins
content: Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) said that a woman's silence means she agrees to marriage. If someone tricks her into marrying by lying about witnesses, and later the truth comes out, he can still get married to her.

title: Prophet Muhammad's Love for Honey
content: Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) liked sweets and honey. He would visit his wives after the afternoon prayer. One day, he stayed longer with Hafsa than usual. Aisha asked her why this happened. Hafsa had received a gift of honey from one of her tribe members. Aisha and Sauda planned to trick him by asking if he had eaten Maghafir (a type of plant) when he visited them. When the Prophet came to visit Sauda, she asked him if he had eaten Maghafir, but he said no. She then asked about a bad smell on his body, and he said Hafsa gave him honey to drink. Aisha and Safiya did the same thing when the Prophet visited them. When he went back to Hafsa, she offered him more honey, but he refused it.

title: Avoid Epidemics
content: `Umar bin Al-Khattab went to Sham. He heard that there was a big illness spreading in the area. `AbdurRahman bin `Auf reminded him of what the Prophet said: 'If you hear about an illness somewhere, don't go there. If an illness starts where you are, stay put.' So `Umar turned back from Sargh.

title: Avoid Places with Plague
content: Usama bin Zaid said to Sa'd: The Prophet (ﷺ) told us about the plague. He said it's a punishment that some nations faced and some of its effects remain today. It appears sometimes in different places. If someone hears there's an outbreak somewhere, they shouldn't go there. And if the plague starts where you are, don't try to leave.

title: Don't Take Back a Gift
content: The Prophet (ﷺ) said that someone who takes back something they gave to another person is like a dog eating its own vomit. We shouldn't act like this, it's not good behavior.

title: Preemption in Real Estate
content: The Prophet (ﷺ) said that preemption is allowed if a house hasn't been divided. But if the boundaries are clear and paths are made, there's no preemption. A man thought preemption only applied to neighbors, but it doesn't work like that. If someone buys one share of a house and then the rest, the neighbor can only stop them from buying the first share.

title: Neighbors and Preemption Rights
content: Al-Miswar bin Makhrama went to Sa'd with a friend. Abu Rafi' asked Al-Miswar to buy his house, but Sa'd said he would only pay four hundred Dirhams in installments. Abu Rafi' had been offered five hundred cash, but he refused because the Prophet said that neighbors should take care of each other. Some people thought it was okay to trick someone out of their preemption rights by giving them a house as a gift and then taking compensation for it.

title: Neighbor's Right is Priority
content: 'Amr bin Ash-Sharid told me that Abu Rafi' was offered four hundred Mithqal of gold for a house. He said he wouldn't sell because the Prophet said, 'A neighbor has more right to be taken care of by his neighbor.' Some people thought they could avoid giving their neighbor the right to buy back their share by giving it to their child instead.

title: Zakat Collector's Warning
content: Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) appointed a man to collect Zakat from the Bani Sulaim tribe. When he returned, the Prophet asked him to explain his actions. The collector said some of the money was given as a gift. The Prophet (ﷺ) replied, 'Why didn't you stay with your parents to see if they would give you gifts? If you're telling the truth.' He then warned us: 'If someone takes something that doesn't belong to them, they'll carry it on Judgment Day. I don't want to see anyone carrying a camel, cow or sheep on that day.' The Prophet (ﷺ) raised his hands and asked Allah if he had delivered His message.

title: Respecting Neighbors' Rights
content: The Prophet (ﷺ) said that neighbors have the right to be taken care of by their neighbors. Some people thought it was okay to trick someone out of buying a house by only paying part of the price and then agreeing to pay the rest later. But if the house doesn't belong to the seller, or if there's something wrong with the house, the buyer should get their money back.

title: Abu Rafi's Decision
content: Abu Rafi` sold a house to Sa`d bin Malik for four-hundred Mithqal of gold. He said he wouldn't have sold it if the Prophet hadn't said, 'Take care of your neighbors.'

title: Muhammad's First Revelation
content: Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) Muhammad (ﷺ) had good dreams that always came true. He would go to a cave called Hira to worship alone for many nights. One day, the angel Gabriel appeared in the cave and asked Muhammad (ﷺ) to read. But Muhammad (ﷺ) said he didn't know how to read. The angel caught him three times and pressed him hard until Muhammad (ﷺ) was scared. Then the angel released him and said, 'Read: In the Name of your Lord, Who has created (all that exists)'. Muhammad (ﷺ) returned home with the angel's words in his heart. He told his wife Khadija what had happened and she covered him until he felt better. She then took him to her cousin Waraqa bin Naufal, who was a Christian and could read Arabic. Waraqa recognized Gabriel as the same angel who helped Moses. He said Muhammad 's (ﷺ) people would reject him, but if he lived longer, he would support Muhammad (ﷺ) strongly. Unfortunately, Waraqa died soon after. The revelation stopped for a while, and Muhammad (ﷺ) became sad. He wanted to throw himself from mountains, but Gabriel kept appearing to him and saying, 'You are indeed Allah's Messenger (ﷺ)'. This made Muhammad (ﷺ) calm down and return home.

title: Good Dreams and Prophetism
content: Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) said: A good dream that comes true for a good person is like one part in forty-six parts of being a prophet.

title: Good Dreams Come from Allah
content: Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) said: A good dream is a message from God. A bad dream comes from Satan.

title: Dreams: Good or Bad?
content: The Prophet (ﷺ) said, 'If you have a good dream, thank Allah and tell others about it. If you have a bad dream, ask Allah to protect you from its harm, and don't share it with anyone.'

title: Good Dreams Come from Allah
content: The Prophet (ﷺ) said: A good dream is a message from Allah. A bad dream comes from Satan. If you have a bad dream, say 'I seek protection from Allah' and spit to the left. This will keep you safe.

title: Good Dreams are from Allah
content: The Prophet (ﷺ) said that good dreams of a Muslim are part of the special gifts given to prophets. These gifts come from Allah.

title: Good Dreams are from Allah
content: Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) said: A good dream of a Muslim is one of the special gifts given to prophets.

title: Good Dreams are from Allah
content: Abu Sa'id Al-Khudri said that the Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) said: A good dream is one of the special gifts given to prophets, like him.

title: Prophets and Good Dreams
content: Abu Huraira said he heard the Prophet say that nothing is left of being a prophet except having true good dreams. When asked what these dreams are, the Prophet replied: 'True good dreams that give glad tidings'.

title: Last Seven Days of Ramadan
content: Ibn Umar said the Prophet told people to look for Laylat al-Qadr in the last seven days of Ramadan.

title: Prisoners and Messengers
content: Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) said: 'If I had to stay in prison as long as Joseph stayed, and then a messenger came, I would answer his call.'

title: Dreams of the Prophet
content: Abu Huraira said he heard the Prophet say: 'If you see me in a dream, I'll be with you when you wake up. Satan can't look like me.' Abu Abdullah added that Ibn Seereen said: 'You must see the Prophet as he really is'.

title: Dreams of the Prophet
content: Anas said that the Prophet said: If someone sees me in a dream, it's definitely me. Satan can't look like me.

title: Good Dreams vs Bad Dreams
content: The Prophet (ﷺ) said: A good dream comes from Allah. A bad dream is from Satan. If you have a bad dream, spit three times on your left side and ask Allah for protection from Satan. This won't harm you, and Satan can't appear in my shape.

title: Seeing the Prophet in Dreams
content: The Prophet (ﷺ) said, 'If someone sees me in a dream, they have seen something true.'

title: Dreams of the Prophet
content: Abu Sa'id said that the Prophet said: If you see me in a dream, it is true. Satan can never look like me.

title: Prophet's Gift of Eloquence
content: The Prophet (ﷺ) said: 'I have been given the power to speak clearly and to win battles easily. Last night, I was given the keys to all the treasures on earth.' Abu Huraira added: 'After the Prophet left us, we are now moving those treasures around.'

title: Dream about the Ka'ba
content: Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) said he had a dream near the Ka'ba. In his dream, he saw two men. One man was white with red skin, had long hair, and was performing a ritual walk around the Ka'ba while leaning on two other men. He was told this man was Jesus, son of Mary. The Prophet (ﷺ) also saw another man with curly hair who was blind in one eye. He was told this man was the Dajjal (a false prophet).

title: Man's Dream About Prophet
content: A man came to the Prophet and said he had a dream. He told the Prophet about it.

title: Prophet's Dream of Fighters
content: Anas bin Malik narrated that the Prophet visited his friend Um Haram. She gave him food and looked for lice in his hair. The Prophet (ﷺ) fell asleep, then woke up smiling. Um Haram asked what made him smile. He said he had a dream about some Muslims fighting for Allah's cause. They were sailing on seas like kings sitting on thrones. Um Haram asked the Prophet to pray that she could join them. He prayed for her and went back to sleep. When he woke up again, he smiled and said it was another group of Muslims fighting for Allah's cause. Um Haram asked him to pray for her again, and this time he said she would be among the first ones to fight for Allah's cause. Later, during Muawiya bin Abu Sufyan's caliphate, Um Haram sailed across the sea but fell off her animal when it landed and died.

title: Prophet's Dream of Fighters
content: Anas bin Malik told us that the Prophet visited his friend Um Haram. She gave him food and looked for lice in his hair. The Prophet (ﷺ) then fell asleep, woke up smiling, and said: 'In my dream, I saw some of my followers fighting for Allah's cause.' They were sailing on the sea like kings sitting on thrones. Um Haram asked the Prophet to pray for her to be with them. He prayed, and then slept again. When he woke up, he smiled and said the same thing about his followers. Um Haram went on a journey by sea during Muawiya's rule and fell off her animal when she got ashore. She died.

title: Uthman bin Maz'un's Death
content: Um Al-'Ala said: The Prophet (ﷺ) distributed the Muhajirin among us by chance. We got Uthman with us, but he fell ill and died. When we washed and wrapped him in his clothes, the Prophet came. I said to the body, 'May Allah be merciful to you.' The Prophet (ﷺ) asked, 'How do you know Allah has honored him?' I replied, 'Only Allah can give honor.' The Prophet (ﷺ) said, 'Death is inevitable for all of us. I wish Uthman good from Allah.' He added, 'I don't know what Allah will do with me either.' Um Al-'Ala said: After that, she never believed anyone was righteous.

title: Uthman's Good Deeds
content: Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) said he didn't know what Allah would do to Uthman bin Maz'un. Um Al-'Ala was sad and had a dream about a flowing spring for Uthman. She told the Prophet, who said that the spring meant good deeds.

title: Good Dreams Come from God
content: Abu Qatada heard the Prophet say: 'A good dream comes from Allah. A bad dream is from Satan. If you have a bad dream, spit on your left side and ask Allah to protect you. The bad dream won't harm you.'

title: Drinking Milk in a Dream
content: Ibn `Umar said he heard the Prophet say: 'I had a dream where I was given a bowl of milk. I drank it until my body felt wet, even from my nails. Then I gave what was left to Umar.' They asked him about the meaning of the dream. He replied, 'It means knowledge of Islam'.

title: Dream of Milk and Knowledge
content: Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) said, 'I had a dream where I was given a bowl of milk. I drank it all until my body felt wet from the inside out. Then I gave the rest to Umar bin Al-Khattab.' The people asked him what his dream meant. He replied, 'It means knowledge'.

title: Dream about People Wearing Shirts
content: Abu Sa'id Al-Khudri said that the Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) told him: 'I had a dream where some people passed before me. They were wearing shirts, but some of them only covered their chests and others wore longer ones. Then I saw Umar bin Al-Khattab in a shirt that was dragging on the ground behind him. People asked the Prophet what his dream meant, and he said:

title: Dream about Shirts and Umar
content: Abu Sa'id Al-Khudri said he heard the Prophet say: 'I had a dream. I saw people wearing shirts, some short and some longer. Then I saw Umar wearing a shirt that was dragging on the ground.' They asked him what it meant. He said, 'It's about the state of religion.'

title: A Man's Dream and Faith
content: Qais bin 'Ubada was with Sa'd bin Malik and Ibn Umar. Abdullah bin Salam passed by, and they said he would go to Paradise. Qais asked Abdullah about this. Abdullah replied that the men didn't know what they were talking about. He told them about a dream where he climbed a post in a green garden. There was a servant below and a handhold at the top. Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) said that Abdullah would die holding onto Islam, like the handhold.

title: Prophet's Dream about Aisha
content: The Prophet (ﷺ) said to me, 'I had a dream where I saw you twice. In the dream, someone was carrying you in a piece of cloth and told me you are my wife. When I woke up, I thought if this is from Allah, then it will happen.

title: Prophet Muhammad's Dream
content: Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) said to me: 'I had a dream about you twice before we got married. In the dream, I saw an angel carrying you in a cloth. I told him to uncover you and it was really you. The same thing happened again. If this is from Allah, then it will happen.'

title: Muhammad's Gift of Short Words
content: Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) said that he was sent with a special gift: to say just a few words and have them mean many things. He also said that when he slept, the keys to all treasures were given to him.

title: Climbing the Pillar of Faith
content: Abdullah bin Salam had a dream where he was in a garden with a pillar and a handhold at the top. He was asked to climb it, but said he couldn't. A servant helped him, and he climbed the pillar and held onto the handhold. When he woke up, he told the Prophet about his dream. The Prophet (ﷺ) explained that the garden represented Islam, and the handhold meant Abdullah would stay firm in his faith until he died.

title: Ibn Umar's Dream of Paradise
content: Ibn Umar had a dream where he held a piece of silk cloth. In his dream, whenever he waved it in any direction, the cloth flew and took him to Paradise. He told his sister Hafsa about this dream. She shared it with the Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ), who said that Ibn Umar is a righteous man.

title: Ibn Umar's Dream of Paradise
content: Ibn Umar had a dream where he held a piece of silk cloth. In his dream, wherever he waved it in Paradise, it took him there. He told his sister Hafsa about the dream. She shared it with the Prophet, who said that Ibn Umar is a good man.

title: True Dreams and Their Meaning
content: Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) said that when the Day of Resurrection comes, a believer's dreams will mostly come true. A dream of a believer is like a small part of being a prophet. If something good happens in a dream, it's from Allah. But if you have a bad dream, don't tell anyone about it. Get up and pray instead. A dream that shows chains on your feet means you're strong in your faith. Chains around your neck are not good.

title: Um Al-Ala's Story
content: An Ansari woman named Um Al-Ala said that a man named Uthman bin Maz'un was given to her family when the Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) (SAW) asked them to share their homes with immigrants. He got sick and they took care of him until he died. They wrapped his body in clothes, and then the Prophet came. Um Al-Ala said, 'May Allah have mercy on you, O Uthman.' The Prophet (ﷺ) asked her how she knew that Uthman was a good person. She said she didn't know. He replied, 'Death has come for him, but I wish him well from Allah. Even as the Prophet, I don't know what will happen to me or anyone else.' Um Al-Ala said she would never say someone is good after that. Later, she had a dream about a flowing spring for Uthman and told the Prophet. He said it was because of his good deeds.

title: Dream of Drawing Water
content: Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) said: I had a dream where I was at a well drawing water. Abu Bakr and Umar came to me. Abu Bakr took the bucket but struggled to pull it up. Allah forgave him for his weakness. Then Umar took the bucket from Abu Bakr and made it very large in his hands. He pulled it up easily, filling many buckets of water so people could drink and give their camels enough water too.

title: Prophet's Dream About Abu Bakr
content: The Prophet (ﷺ) had a dream where he saw many people gathered. He saw Abu Bakr trying to pull out water from a well, but it was hard for him. Then he saw Umar standing up and pulling out huge amounts of water with ease. The people drank their fill and watered their camels. After that, they sat by the water.

title: The Prophet's Dream About Water
content: Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) said that he had a dream where he was standing near a well. He pulled out buckets of water until Abu Bakr took the bucket from him and pulled out one or two more full buckets, but with less strength. Then the bucket got bigger and Umar took it. In his dream, Umar drew so much water that everyone drank their fill and even watered their camels.

title: Allah's Messenger Helps People
content: Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) had a dream where he was standing next to a big tank of water. He was giving water to people to drink from it. Then Abu Bakr came and took the bucket from him so he could rest. Abu Bakr pulled out some water, but struggled a bit because he was weak. Later, Ibn Al-Khattab took the bucket from Abu Bakr and kept drawing water until everyone had enough. The tank was still full of water.

title: Umar's Palace in Paradise
content: Abu Huraira said that the Prophet was with him and some others. The Prophet (ﷺ) said he had a dream where he saw himself in Paradise. He saw a woman washing her hands near a palace. He asked who owned the palace, and they told him it was for Umar bin Al-Khattab. The Prophet (ﷺ) woke up quickly because he remembered that Umar is very protective of his family's honor. When Umar heard about this, he started crying and said how much he trusted the Prophet.

title: Prophet's Dream of Paradise
content: Jabir bin Abdullah said the Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) saw a dream. In the dream, he entered Paradise and saw a palace made of gold. He asked who it was for. The angels replied that it was for someone from the Quraish tribe. The Prophet (ﷺ) then said that nothing stopped him from entering it except his respect for Umar's feelings.

title: Abu Huraira's Dream
content: We were sitting with the Prophet when he said, 'I had a dream. I was in Paradise and saw a woman washing near a palace. I asked who it belonged to and they told me it was for Umar. I remembered that Umar gets upset easily and woke up right away.' When Umar heard this, he started crying and said, 'My parents be sacrificed for you, Prophet! How could I think you would offend my pride?'

title: Meeting the Dajjal
content: Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) said he saw himself walking around the Kaaba in a dream. He saw Jesus, the son of Mary, with long hair and water dripping from it. Then he saw the Dajjal, a man with red skin, curly hair, and one eye that looked like a grape. The Prophet (ﷺ) asked who they were, and people told him their names.

title: Drinking Milk in a Dream
content: I, the Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ), had a dream where I was given a bowl of milk. I drank it until I felt full and could see its wetness inside me. After waking up, I gave what was left to my friend Umar. When asked about the meaning of this dream, I said that it meant gaining knowledge.

title: Ibn Umar's Good Dream
content: One of the Prophet's companions, Ibn Umar, was a young man who stayed in the mosque before he got married. He wanted to see good dreams like others, so he prayed to Allah for a good dream. That night, two angels came to him with iron maces and took him to Hell. But another angel stopped them and said, 'Don't be afraid, you'll be a great person if you pray more.' Ibn Umar saw many people hanging upside down in chains, including some from the Quraish tribe. The next morning, he told his sister Hafsa about the dream, and she shared it with the Prophet. The Prophet (ﷺ) said, 'Ibn Umar is a good man.' After that, Ibn Umar started praying more often.

title: Ibn Umar's Good Dream
content: Ibn Umar was a young man who stayed in the mosque. He wanted to see good dreams like his friends, so he asked Allah for a good dream. That night, two angels came to him with iron maces and took him to Hell. But another angel stopped them and said Ibn Umar would be a good person if he prayed more often. They showed him people hanging upside down in chains and some men from the Quraish. Then they took him to the right side. Ibn Umar told his sister Hafsa about the dream, and she told it to the Prophet. The Prophet (ﷺ) said Ibn Umar was a good man.

title: Ibn Umar's Dream
content: Ibn Umar was a young man who slept in the mosque. He wanted to have a good dream so he could tell it to the Prophet for interpretation. One night, two angels took him on a journey and showed him people suffering in the Fire. They then took him to safety. In the morning, Ibn Umar told his wife Hafsa about the dream. She shared it with the Prophet, who said that Ibn Umar was a good man but needed to pray more at night.

title: Ibn Umar's Dream
content: Ibn Umar was a young man who slept in the mosque. He wanted to have a good dream so he could share it with the Prophet. One night, two angels came and took him on a journey. They showed him people he knew were being punished in the Fire. The angels then took him to the right side. When Ibn Umar woke up, he told his friend Hafsa about the dream. She shared it with the Prophet, who said that Ibn Umar was a good man and should pray more at night.

title: Drinking Milk in a Dream
content: Abdullah bin Umar said he heard the Prophet say: 'I had a dream where I was given a cup of milk. I drank it and then gave what was left to Umar.' They asked him about the meaning of the dream, and the Prophet replied: 'It means knowledge will be shared with Umar.'

title: Two Liars Will Appear
content: Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) said: I was sleeping and two golden bangles were put in my hands. I didn't like them, but then I could blow them away. They flew off. This is a sign of two liars who will appear. One of them was Al-`Ansi from Yemen, and the other was Musailama from Najd.

title: Prophet's Dream About Migration
content: Abu Musa said the Prophet told him: 'I had a dream where I was leaving Mecca and going to a place with date palm trees. At first, I thought it might be Al-Yamama or Hajar, but it turned out to be Medina. In my dream, I saw cows being slaughtered there. Allah's reward is better than any worldly gain. The cows in the dream were like the believers who died at Uhud. What I saw as good in the dream was the truth and blessings Allah gave us after Badr and the victories we had at Khaibar and Mecca.'

title: Last but First on Judgement Day
content: Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) said: 'We Muslims will be the last to come, but we'll be first in a good way on the Day of Resurrection.' He also said that while he was sleeping, he was given many treasures and two golden bangles. But they made him feel uncomfortable, so he blew them away and they disappeared. He explained that these bangles were like people who tell lies between others.

title: We Are Last but First
content: Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) said: 'As Muslims, we come last in the world, but we will be among the first on Judgment Day. He also had a dream where he was given all the wealth of the world and two golden bangles, but they were too heavy for him to carry. He was told to blow them away, which he did. The bangles represented the people who lied about each other - one in San'a' and another in Yamama'.

title: Prophet's Dream about an Epidemic
content: The Prophet (ﷺ) saw a black woman with messy hair leaving Medina and going to Al-Juhfa. He thought this meant the sickness in Medina would spread to that place.

title: Prophet's Dream in Medina
content: The Prophet (ﷺ) saw a black woman with messy hair leaving Medina and settling in Al-Juhfa. He thought it meant the sickness that was in Medina would move to Al-Juhfa.

title: Prophet's Dream Interpretation
content: The Prophet (ﷺ) saw a black woman with messy hair leaving Medina and going to Mahai'a. He thought this meant an illness in Medina would spread to Mahai'a, which is Al-Juhfa.

title: Dreams and Battles
content: Abu Musa said that the Prophet told him: 'I had a dream where I waved a sword. The sword broke in half, which meant many believers were hurt on the Day of Uhud. But then I waved the sword again, and it got stronger than before. This meant that Allah helped us win Mecca and bring the believers together.'

title: Consequences of False Claims
content: The Prophet (ﷺ) said, 'If someone claims to have seen a dream that didn't happen, they will be asked to tie a knot between two barley grains, which is impossible. If someone listens to people who don't want them to listen or run away from them, molten lead will be poured into their ears on the Day of Judgment. And if someone makes a picture, they will be punished and told to give it life, but that's not possible.'

title: Lying About Dreams
content: The Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) said that the worst lie is when someone says they had a dream when they really didn't. He was teaching us to be honest about our dreams and not make things up.

title: Good Dreams Come from Allah
content: Abu Salama said he used to have dreams that made him feel unwell. Abu Qatada told him the Prophet said good dreams come from Allah. If you see a nice dream, don't tell anyone except someone you love. If you see an unpleasant dream, ask Allah for protection and spit three times on your left side. Don't talk about it to anyone.

title: Good Dreams Come from Allah
content: Abu Sa'id said that the Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) said: If you see a dream and it's good, thank Allah for it. Share it with others. But if your dream is bad, it comes from Satan. Ask Allah to protect you from it. Don't tell anyone about it.

title: Abu Bakr Interprets a Dream
content: A man came to the Prophet and told him about his dream. He saw a cloud with shade, dropping butter and honey. People were gathering it in their hands, some more than others. The Prophet (ﷺ) had a rope that went from the earth to the sky. He held it and went up, then another person did the same, and another, and another. But when the fourth person tried, the rope broke. Abu Bakr asked if he could explain the dream. The Prophet (ﷺ) said yes. Abu Bakr said: 'The cloud is Islam, the butter and honey are the Quran. Some people learn a lot of it, some just a little.' He explained that the rope was the truth that the Prophet followed. When he went up with it, Allah would raise him high. Then another person would follow and go up too. But when the fourth person tried, the rope broke. Abu Bakr asked if his explanation was correct or not. The Prophet (ﷺ) said some of it was right, but some was wrong. Abu Bakr wanted to know what he got wrong.

title: Dreams and the Afterlife
content: One day, the Prophet asked his companions if anyone had seen a dream. One morning, he said two people came to him in a dream and told him to follow them. They took him to see a man being hit on the head with a rock. The rock rolled away, but when it was picked up again, the man's head returned to normal. They then saw another man who was tearing his face, nose, and eye apart, only for them to return to normal. The Prophet (ﷺ) asked who these people were, but they just told him to keep following. Next, he came across a group of naked men and women in an oven-like place. A flame was burning underneath, and when it reached them, they cried out in pain. He then saw a man swimming in a river with stones being thrown into his mouth. The Prophet (ﷺ) asked again who these people were, but his companions just told him to keep going. Finally, he came across a garden with a tall man and many children playing around him. His companions said it was Abraham and the children who died as Muslims. They then took him to a city made of gold and silver bricks. Inside, they saw men who were half handsome and half ugly. The Prophet 's (ﷺ) companions told them to jump into a river that flowed through the city, and when they did, their ugliness disappeared. The Prophet (ﷺ) realized this was Paradise and his own place in it. He asked his companions what all these things meant. They explained each scene: one man represented someone who studied the Quran but didn't act on it; another man represented someone who told many lies; naked men and women were adulterers; a man eating stones was an usurer; and a bad-looking man near a fire was the gatekeeper of Hell. The tall man in the garden was Abraham, and the children around him were those who died as Muslims. The Prophet 's (ﷺ) companions also explained that the half handsome and half ugly men had mixed good and bad actions but were forgiven by Allah.

title: Waiting at Kauthar Lake
content: The Prophet (ﷺ) said, 'I will be waiting at my special lake for those who want to come to me. Some people will leave with me, but then it's discovered they had left Islam behind.'

title: The Prophet's Warning at Kauthar
content: The Prophet (ﷺ) said, 'I will be waiting for some of you at a special lake called Kauthar. Some people among you will come to me, but when I try to give them water, they'll be taken away. I'll ask Allah, 'These are my friends?' But He'll say, 'You don't know what happened after you left. They started doing new things in the religion that wasn't from us.'

title: Drinking from the Lake-Fount
content: The Prophet (ﷺ) said: 'I will be at a special lake called Kauthar. Anyone who comes to it can drink from it and will never feel thirsty again. Some people I know will come, but there will be a barrier between us. They are still my friends, so I'll say they're with me. But then someone will ask, 'What about the changes they made after you?' And I'll say those who changed their ways after me have no mercy.'

title: After the Prophet's Time
content: Abdullah said that the Prophet told them: 'You will see selfishness and things you don't like after I'm gone.' They asked what to do. The Prophet (ﷺ) said, 'Give your rights to those in charge and ask Allah for your right'.

title: Respect Your Leader
content: If you don't like something your leader does, be patient. Disobeying them even a little bit is the same as being disobedient in the time before Islam. That's a bad way to die.

title: Be Patient with Your Ruler
content: The Prophet (ﷺ) said: If you see something bad happening in your community and you don't like it, be patient. If you leave the Muslim group for any reason and then die, you will have died as someone who rejected Islam.

title: Obedience to the Ruler
content: Junada bin Abi Umaiya visited 'Ubada bin As-Samit when he was ill. They asked him to share a Hadith from the Prophet that could help him. He said, 'The Prophet (ﷺ) called us and we gave him our pledge for Islam. One condition of the pledge was to listen and obey at all times: when we're strong or weak, easy or hard. We must be obedient to the ruler and give them their rights even if they don't give us ours. We should only fight against a ruler who openly rejects Allah's message and has proof of it.

title: Obedience to the Ruler
content: Junada bin Abi Umaiya visited 'Ubada bin As-Samit when he was sick. They asked him to share a Hadith from the Prophet that would benefit him. 'Ubada said, 'The Prophet (ﷺ) called us and we took an oath to follow Islam. He told us to listen and obey at all times - when we're strong or weak, easy or hard. We must be obedient to our leader and give them their rights even if they don't give us ours. The only time we can fight against the ruler is if we see clear proof of disbelief from Allah.'

title: Be Patient with Leaders
content: A man came to the Prophet and said, 'You chose someone else for a job. Why not me?' The Prophet (ﷺ) replied, 'In the future, leaders will make mistakes and not give you what's right. Be patient until we meet again.'

title: Destruction of My Followers
content: I heard the Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) say that his followers will be destroyed by young men from the Quraish tribe.

title: Gog and Magog's Barrier Broken
content: Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) woke up looking worried. He said, 'There is no God but Allah.' He warned the Arabs about a great evil coming their way. He compared it to a huge gap in a wall, as big as his hands held apart (about 90-100 cm). Someone asked if they would be destroyed despite having good people among them. The Prophet (ﷺ) replied, 'Yes, if evil keeps growing'.

title: Prophet Sees Afflictions Coming
content: Usama bin Zaid said the Prophet stood on a high building in Medina and asked if anyone could see what he saw. They said no, so he told them that he was seeing troubles coming to their homes like raindrops falling.

title: Time Will Pass Quickly
content: Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) said: 'As time goes by, people will do fewer good deeds. Some will become very stingy and selfish. Bad things will happen more often. There will be a lot of fighting.' They asked him what 'fighting' meant. He replied, 'Killing each other.'

title: Before the Hour Arrives
content: The Prophet (ﷺ) said: 'As the Day of Judgment gets closer, there will be times when people don't know much about their faith. Knowledge will disappear and many people will die in fights.'

title: Days Before the Hour
content: Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) said: 'Before Judgment Day, there will be times when people don't know much about Islam. Knowledge and understanding will disappear, and many people will die in fights.'

title: Knowledge Will Vanish
content: Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) said: 'Before the end of time comes, there will be days when knowledge disappears and people become very ignorant. There will also be a lot of fighting and killing.'

title: Killing is a Great Sin
content: Abu Musa said the Prophet said: 'Harj' in the Ethiopian language means killing. It's a great sin to kill people.

title: Days Before the End
content: The Prophet (ﷺ) said that before the end of time, there will be a period called Al-Harj. During this time, many people will die and knowledge about Islam will disappear. There will be a lot of killing and general ignorance will spread.

title: Be Patient in Hard Times
content: We went to see Anas bin Malik and told him about the problems we were facing with Al-Hajjaj. He said, 'Keep calm until you meet Allah. Every difficult time will be followed by an even harder one.' He had heard this from the Prophet.

title: Prophet's Night of Fear
content: One night, the Prophet woke up feeling scared. He said, 'Praise be to Allah! Many good things and bad things have been sent from Allah.' He asked someone to wake his wives so they could pray. He also said that a person who looks great in this life might be empty inside in the next life.

title: Don't Fight Against Us
content: Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) said: Whoever fights against us is not one of us.

title: Don't Fight with Us
content: The Prophet (ﷺ) said: Whoever fights against us is not one of us. He was saying this about people who are against Muslims, fighting them.

title: Don't Point a Gun at Brother
content: The Prophet (ﷺ) said: Don't point a gun at your Muslim brother. You don't know what will happen, and Satan might trick you into hurting him. If that happens, he could go to Hell.

title: Holding Arrows in Mosque
content: I asked Amr if he had heard Jabir say that a man carrying arrows walked through the mosque. The Prophet (ﷺ) told him to hold the arrows by their heads.

title: Prophet Orders Man to Hold Arrows
content: Jabir said a man walked through the mosque with arrows. The Prophet (ﷺ) told him to hold the sharp ends so they wouldn't hurt anyone else.

title: Carrying Arrows in Mosque
content: The Prophet (ﷺ) said: If you're carrying arrows and walking through our mosque or market, hold the iron tips with your hand. This is to prevent hurting someone else with them.

title: Abusing a Muslim
content: The Prophet (ﷺ) said, 'Abusing someone who follows Islam is wrong and killing them is not believing in God.'

title: Don't Fight Each Other
content: Ibn Umar said he heard the Prophet say: 'Do not go back to disbelief after I'm gone by cutting each other's necks.'

title: Protecting Life and Honor
content: Abu Bakra said that the Prophet asked his followers if they knew what day it was. They replied that only Allah and the Prophet knew. The Prophet (ﷺ) told them, 'This is the day of An-Nahr.' He then asked about their location and confirmed that it was Mecca, a forbidden town. He reminded them that their lives, properties, and honor were sacred to each other, just like this special day in this holy month and city. He asked if he had made Allah's message clear to them, and they replied yes. The Prophet (ﷺ) then prayed to Allah to be witness to what he said. He told those present to pass on his message to those who were absent, because it might be easier for the person receiving the message to understand. Finally, he warned his followers not to turn against each other after he was gone.

title: Don't Fight Each Other
content: The Prophet (ﷺ) said: 'Be careful not to turn against each other after I'm gone. Don't cut each other's throats.'

title: Don't Fight Each Other
content: During his last Hajj, the Prophet told me to keep quiet and listen. Then he said: 'Be careful not to fight each other after I'm gone.'

title: Protecting Yourself from Hard Times
content: Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) said: There will be difficult times coming soon. In those times, it's better to sit than stand, and better to stand than walk, and better to walk than run. If you can find a safe place, go there for protection.

title: Protecting Yourself from Hard Times
content: Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) said: 'In the future, it will be better to stay sitting than standing. It will be better to stand than walk. And it will be better to walk than run. If you face these hard times, they can hurt you badly. So if you find a safe place, go there and protect yourself.'

title: Fighting Between Muslims
content: Al-Ahnaf was carrying his arms at night during a war. Abu Bakra met him and asked where he was going. Al-Ahnaf said he wanted to help Ali, the cousin of the Prophet. Abu Bakra reminded Al-Ahnaf that the Prophet said: 'If two Muslims fight with swords, both will go to Hell.' Al-Ahnaf asked about the person who is killed, and the Prophet replied that they had intended to kill their opponent.

title: Good and Evil in Islam
content: Hudhaifa bin Al-Yaman asked the Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) about good things. He said, 'There will be evil after this good.' Hudhaifa asked again, 'Will there be good after that evil?' The Prophet (ﷺ) replied, 'Yes, but it won't be pure.' Some people will guide others in a way that's not following my teachings. You'll agree with some of their actions and disagree with others. The Prophet (ﷺ) said, 'There will be people who call to the Hell Fire, and if you follow them, they'll throw you into the fire.' Hudhaifa asked what these people would look like. The Prophet (ﷺ) said, 'They'll be from our own people and speak our language.' If this happens in your life, stick with the group of Muslims and their leader. If there's no group or leader, stay away from all other groups until you die.

title: Recruitment and Muslims in Enemy Ranks
content: Abu Al-Aswad was recruited to join an army unit from Medina. He met Ikrima, who told him not to go because some Muslims were secretly fighting with the pagans to make their numbers seem bigger against the Prophet's army. This made Allah reveal a verse saying that angels take away those who harm themselves by staying among disbelievers.

title: Honesty in the Heart
content: The Prophet (ﷺ) said that honesty comes from Allah and is taught through the Quran and his own teachings. But one day, people will sleep and wake up without honesty in their hearts. It will be like a dark spot that fades away, then an ember that leaves no swelling but just a memory. People will not trust each other, and even if someone seems wise and strong, they might not have faith at all. The Prophet (ﷺ) said he used to deal with anyone who owed him money, whether Muslim or Christian, because the law would make them pay up. But now he only deals with certain people.

title: Salama bin Al-Akwa's Story
content: Salama visited a man named Al-Hajjaj. Al-Hajjaj said Salama had left Islam by staying with Bedouin tribes in the desert. But Salama said, 'No, the Prophet allowed me to stay with them.' When Uthman was killed, Salama went to a place called Ar-Rabadha and got married. He stayed there until he came back to Medina just before he died.

title: Fleeing with Your Faith
content: Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) said: 'There will be a time when the best thing for a Muslim is their sheep. They will take them to high mountains and areas where it rains, so they can escape problems with their faith.'

title: Prophet's Advice on Questions
content: The Prophet (ﷺ) was getting too many questions. He said from the pulpit, 'I'll answer all your questions.' Everyone looked down and cried. A man stood up who often got into fights. He asked, 'Who is my father?' The Prophet (ﷺ) replied, 'Your father is Hudhaifa.' Then Umar stood up and said, 'We believe in Allah as our Lord, Islam as our way of life, and Muhammad (ﷺ) as our guide. We ask for protection from bad things that might happen to us.' The Prophet (ﷺ) said he had never seen so many good people and bad people at the same time. He saw Paradise and Hell right in front of him.

title: Seek Refuge in Hard Times
content: Anas said: When we were going through a difficult time, we would seek Allah's protection from harm and suffering.

title: Prophet Warns About Afflictions
content: The Prophet (ﷺ) stood beside a raised platform and pointed to the East. He said, 'Troubles are coming from that direction.'

title: Where Satan's Trouble Comes From
content: Ibn Umar heard the Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) saying that troubles come from a specific direction. He was facing east when he said this.

title: Blessings for Our Regions
content: The Prophet (ﷺ) said to Allah, 'Please bless our north and Yemen.' People asked him to include Najd. The Prophet (ﷺ) repeated his request twice, then said, 'Najd is where earthquakes happen and evil comes from.'

title: Fighting in Islam
content: Abdullah bin Umar came to visit us. A man asked him about the battles during difficult times. Abdullah said, 'Do you know what

title: Protecting from Afflictions
content: Hudhaifa said that the Prophet told him to pray, give Zakat, and be good to others. This will help with problems in his family, property, children, and neighbors. `Umar asked about a bigger problem that would come like a big wave. Hudhaifa said not to worry, there's a strong door between them. When `Umar asked if the door would break or stay closed, Hudhaifa said it would break. But when he said it would never be closed again, Hudhaifa agreed. Later, we found out that `Umar knew what the door meant and it was him.

title: The Prophet's Visit to a Garden
content: Abu Musa Al-Ash'ari went with the Prophet to a garden in Medina. The Prophet (ﷺ) sat by a well and hung his legs in it. Abu Bakr came, but Abu Musa said he had to ask permission first. The Prophet (ﷺ) said to let him in and give him good news about entering Paradise. Abu Bakr sat next to the Prophet and hung his legs too. Then 'Umar came and Abu Musa asked for permission again. The Prophet (ﷺ) let him in and gave him good news of entering Paradise. 'Umar sat on the other side of the Prophet, but there was no room left. When 'Uthman arrived, Abu Musa said he had to wait. The Prophet (ﷺ) told him to come in and give him good news about entering Paradise with a difficult time ahead.

title: Don't be a hypocrite
content: Usama said he would never praise a ruler who rules over many people. He remembered the Prophet saying that someone will be punished in Hell for ordering others to do good but not doing it himself, and for forbidding others from evil while doing evil.

title: Women in Leadership
content: Abu Bakra said the Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) heard that a woman was made leader of Persia. He said: 'A nation that chooses a woman as its leader will not be successful.'

title: Ali's Message in Kufa
content: Abu Maryam said that when Talha, Zubair, and Aisha went to Basra, Ali sent Ammar bin Yasir and Hasan bin Ali to Kufa. They stood on a platform, with Hasan at the top and Ammar below him. Many people gathered around them. Ammar spoke up, saying: 'Aisha has gone to Basra. By Allah, she is the Prophet's wife in this life and the next. But now Allah is testing you: will you follow Him or her?'

title: Ammar's Speech at Kufa
content: Abu Wail said that Ammar stood on a high platform in Kufa. He talked about Aisha and how she was coming to Busra. Ammar said, 'She is the Prophet Muhammad 's (ﷺ) wife in this life and the next. But you people are being tested by this issue.'

title: Abu Musa and Abu Masud Visit Ammar
content: Two friends, Abu Musa and Abu Masud, went to see their friend Ammar. They told him that they were unhappy with his decision to fight on the side of Ali. Ammar replied that he was unhappy with their decision to stay away from the fight. The two friends then gave Ammar some new clothes to wear, and one of them went to the mosque in Kufa.

title: Abu Musa and Abu Masud Visit Ammar
content: Abu Musa and Abu Masud went to see Ammar. They told him that Ali had sent him to Kufa to encourage people to fight on his side. Abu Musa and Abu Masud said, 'Since you became a Muslim, we've never seen you do something more wrong than rushing into this.' Ammar replied, 'I've never seen you two doing something more wrong than staying away from it.' Then Abu Masud gave them some clothes to wear, and one of them went to the mosque in Kufa.

title: Abu Musa and Abu Masud
content: Abu Musa and Abu Masud visited Ammar in Kufa. They said to him, 'We don't like how you're rushing into this fight.' Ammar replied, 'I don't like it when you two stay away from the fight.' Then Abu Masud gave them some clothes to wear, and one of them went to the mosque.

title: Abu Mas`ud's Gift to Companions
content: I was with Abu Mas`ud and two other companions. He said to Ammar, 'If I wanted, I could find fault with you all except for one thing.' Ammar replied, 'And I can find fault with what you did.' Abu Mas`ud then gave each of them a new suit to wear before going to the Friday prayer.

title: Abu Mas'ud's Generous Gift
content: I was sitting with Abu Musa and 'Ammar. Abu Mas'ud said to 'Ammar, 'You're the only one I wouldn't criticize if I wanted to.' He then said that he had never seen anything wrong with 'Ammar's actions since joining the Prophet. 'Ammar replied that he too had never seen anything wrong with Abu Mas'ud's actions, except for his decision not to join a particular issue. Abu Mas'ud gave each of them two suits to wear before going to Friday prayer.

title: Abu Masud's Generous Gift
content: I was sitting with Abu Musa and Ammar. Abu Masud said to Ammar, 'You're the only one of our friends I wouldn't criticize. When you joined the Prophet, I never saw you do anything wrong except this one thing.' Ammar replied, 'Abu Masud, I think your decision not to join us in this issue is more questionable than mine.' Abu Musad was a rich man and said to his servant, 'Bring me two new suits.' He gave one to Abu Musa and the other to Ammar and told them to wear these suits before going for Friday prayer.

title: Punishment Affects Everyone
content: The Prophet (ﷺ) said: If Allah sends punishment to a nation, it will affect everyone in the country. Then, on Judgment Day, people will be judged based on their actions.

title: Al-Hasan bin Ali's Leadership
content: When Al-Hasan bin `Ali led an army against Muawiya, `Amr bin Al-As said to Muawiya that the opposing army would not retreat unless they did. Muawiya was worried about who would take care of the children if Muslims were killed. `Amr said he would look after them. Some companions suggested meeting with Muawiya to propose peace. The Prophet (ﷺ) had once said that Al-Hasan bin `Ali would be a leader and might help make peace between two groups of Muslims.

title: Usama's Message to Ali
content: Usama sent me to Ali. He said: 'Ali will ask you why your companion didn't join him. Tell him, 'If Ali were in danger, I'd want to be with him. But in this case, I won't get involved.' When I gave the message to Ali, he didn't give me anything. So I went to Hasan, Hussain, and Ibn Ja'far. They loaded my camels with a lot of wealth.

title: Fighting a Leader
content: Ibn Umar gathered his friends and children. He said he remembered the Prophet saying that on Judgment Day, a flag will be raised for each person who breaks their promise. We gave an oath to Yazid, following Allah's rules. Ibn Umar didn't know of anything worse than fighting someone we promised to support. If anyone among them agreed to remove Yazid and give allegiance to another, there would be no friendship between that person and him.

title: Abu Barza's Advice
content: I went to visit Abu Barza with my father. We sat with him in his house and my father asked, 'Don't you see how bad things are?' Abu Barza said, 'I'm angry at the Quraish tribe.' He explained that Islam had brought them from a hard life to one of prosperity. But now, worldly wealth is causing problems. Marwan in Sham, Ibn Az-Zubair in Mecca, and those fighting in our area - they're all fighting for worldly gain.

title: Hypocrites Today Are Worse
content: Hudhaifa bin Al-Yaman said that today's hypocrites are worse than those who lived during the Prophet's time. In the past, they did bad things secretly. Now they do them openly.

title: Hudhaifa Warns About Disbelief
content: Hudhaifa said that in the time of the Prophet, people were pretending to be good when they weren't. Now, he says, it's even worse - some people believe but then reject their faith.

title: Waiting for Death
content: The Prophet (ﷺ) said, 'Before the Day of Judgment comes, a person will walk by a grave and wish they were in that person's place.'

title: Women and the Hour
content: Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) said: The Day of Judgment will not come until women from a certain tribe walk around an old idol called Dhi-al-Khalasa, which was once worshipped by their ancestors.

title: The Hour Will Not Come
content: Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) said that before the Day of Judgment, a man from Qahtan will appear and lead people with his stick.

title: Fire in Hijaz Before Hour
content: Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) said: 'Before the Day of Judgment, a fire will come from the land of Hijaz. It will shine light on the necks of camels at Busra.'

title: The River Euphrates' Hidden Gold
content: Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) said that the river Euphrates will one day reveal a hidden mountain of gold. If anyone is present when this happens, they should not take any of it.

title: Give in Charity
content: The Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) said: 'Give charity because one day people will go out to give alms but won't find anyone to accept it.'

title: Signs of the End Times
content: The Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) said: The Day of Judgment will not come until two big groups fight each other. Many people will die in this fight, but they will all be following the same religion. Thirty false prophets will appear and claim to be from God. Most scholars will die, making it hard for people to learn about Islam. There will be many earthquakes, time will pass quickly, and bad things will happen. People will kill each other more often, and there will be so much wealth that rich people won't know what to do with their charity. People will build tall buildings just to show off. When someone walks by a grave, they'll wish they were the one buried. The sun will rise from the west, and everyone will believe in Islam then. But it's too late for those who didn't believe before or live good lives. Some signs of the end times are: when two men can't sell or fold a piece of cloth, when someone milks their camel but can't drink the milk, when someone fixes a water tank but can't use it, and when someone puts food in their mouth but can't eat it.

title: Ad-Dajjal's False Promises
content: Al-Mughira bin Shu`ba asked the Prophet many questions about Ad-Dajjal. The Prophet (ﷺ) asked Al-Mughira, 'What worries you about him?' Al-Mughira said people think Ad-Dajjal will have a lot of food and water with him. The Prophet (ﷺ) said, 'No, Allah won't give him that much. It's just to test if people believe in Allah or Ad-Dajjal.'

title: The One-Eyed Dajjal
content: Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) said that the Dajjal will have one eye. His right eye will look like a grape bulging out of its skin.

title: Dajjal's Arrival Near Medina
content: The Prophet (ﷺ) said: Dajjal will come and stay near Medina. Then Medina will shake three times. Every non-believer and hypocrite in Medina will leave to join him.

title: Medina's Protection from Dajjal
content: The Prophet (ﷺ) said that Medina will be safe from the fear caused by Al-Masih Ad-Dajjal. At that time, Medina will have seven gates and two angels will guard each gate.

title: Walking around the Ka'ba
content: Abu Bakra said that the Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) said: 'Do not walk around the Ka'ba with your shoulders bare. If you do, pray two rakats (units of prayer) near it.'

title: Warning about the Dajjal
content: Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) stood up and praised Allah. He talked about a man called Ad-Dajjal who will come. The Prophet (ﷺ) said, 'I want to warn you about him.' He added that Ad-Dajjal is one-eyed, but Allah is not.

title: Dream about Ka'ba and Dajjal
content: The Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) was sleeping. He had a dream where he saw himself walking around the Ka'ba. In his dream, he saw two men. One man was fair-skinned with long hair, and water was dripping from his head. The Prophet (ﷺ) asked who this man was. They said it was Jesus (the son of Mary). Then he saw another man with a big body, red skin, curly hair, and one eye that looked like a grape. He was blind in that eye. People told the Prophet that this man was Dajjal (the Antichrist). The Prophet (ﷺ) said that Dajjal looked most like Ibn Qatan, a man from the tribe of Khuza'a.

title: Prophet's Prayer Against Dajjal
content: I, Aisha, heard the Prophet praying and asking Allah to protect him from the troubles of a man called Ad-Dajjal.

title: Dajjal's Deceptive Water
content: The Prophet (ﷺ) said that Ad-Dajjal would have water and fire with him. But what looked like fire was actually cold water, and what looked like water was actually fire.

title: Beware of the One-Eyed Deceiver
content: The Prophet (ﷺ) said: No prophet was sent without warning people about a one-eyed liar. Be careful! He has one eye that doesn't work, and God is not like that. Between his eyes will be written 'disbeliever'.

title: Ad-Dajjal's Deception
content: Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) told us about Ad-Dajjal. He said that Ad-Dajjal will come to Medina, but he won't be allowed inside the city. Instead, he'll camp near Medina in a salty area. A man from among the best people will appear and say, 'I know you're Ad-Dajjal.' Ad-Dajjal will ask his followers if they doubt him after killing this man and bringing him back to life. They'll say no. Then Ad-Dajjal will kill the man again, but he won't be able to bring him back to life.

title: Angels Protect Medina
content: Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) said that there are angels at the entrances of Medina. They stop any plague or the Dajjal from entering the city.

title: Dajjal won't reach Medina
