content: Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) said: The Antichrist will come to Medina. He'll find angels protecting it. If Allah wants, the Antichrist and plague won't be able to get close to it.

title: Gog and Magog's Escape
content: One day the Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) entered Zainab bint Jahsh's house in a worried state. He said, 'No one is worthy of worship except Allah!' He warned, 'The Arabs are in danger from a great evil that's coming.' He explained that a hole had opened in the barrier between Gog and Magog, like this.' He made a circle with his thumb and index finger. Zainab asked, 'Will we be destroyed even though there will still be good people among us?' The Prophet (ﷺ) replied, 'Yes, if bad people become more than good ones.'

title: Gog and Magog's Barrier Broken
content: The Prophet (ﷺ) said: A hole has been made in the wall that keeps Gog and Magog from escaping. Abu Huraira counted on his fingers, saying it was a gap of about 90.

title: Obedience to the Messenger
content: Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) said, 'If you follow me, you're following Allah. If you disobey me, you're disobeying Allah. And if you obey the leader I appoint, it's like obeying me. If you disobey him, it's like disobeying me.'

title: Everyone is Responsible
content: Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) said: Every person is in charge of something. A leader is responsible for his people. A man is responsible for his family. A woman takes care of her home and children. Even a slave is responsible for taking care of their master's things.

title: Muawiya Warns Against False Claims
content: Muhammad (ﷺ) bin Jubair was with a group of Quraish leaders visiting Muawiya. They told him that Abdullah bin Amr said there would be a king from the Qahtan tribe. Muawiya got angry and stood up to speak. He praised Allah, then said: 'Some people are sharing false information that's not in the Quran or what the Prophet taught. These people don't know what they're talking about. Be careful of desires that can lead you astray. I've heard the Prophet say: The leadership will stay with Quraish and no one will rebel against them as long as they follow Islam's rules.'

title: Caliphate Will Remain
content: Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) said, 'Even if only two Quraish people are left, this matter of leadership will still be with them.'

title: Don't Wish to Be Like Others
content: Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) said: 'Do not wish to be like anyone except two people. First, someone who has a lot of money and uses it for good. Second, someone who knows a lot about Allah's words and teachings, and shares that knowledge with others.'

title: Listen to and Obey
content: Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) said: 'You should listen to and obey your ruler, even if he is a black slave with a small head.'

title: Respect Your Muslim Leader
content: The Prophet (ﷺ) said: If you see your leader doing something wrong, be patient. If you leave the group and die, it's like dying as a sinner in the time before Islam.

title: Obedience to the Ruler
content: The Prophet (ﷺ) said: A Muslim must listen and obey their leader. But if a leader tells you to do something that goes against Allah's rules, don't listen or follow it.

title: Obedience to a Bad Order
content: The Prophet (ﷺ) sent an army with a commander from the Ansar. He ordered them to obey him. The commander got angry and told them to collect wood, make a fire, and jump into it. They did as they were told, but just before jumping in, they remembered that they followed the Prophet to escape the fire. Their commander's anger went away, and the fire went out. When this happened, the Prophet said that obedience is only required when doing something good.

title: Seeking Power: A Warning
content: Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) said to `Abdur-Rahman: Don't ask for power. If you get it, you'll be responsible for it. But if you don't ask, Allah will help you with it. And remember, if you promise to do something and then find a better way, break your promise and do the better thing.

title: Seeking Power Wisely
content: Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) said to `Abdur-Rahman bin Samura: Don't ask for a leadership position. If you get it because you asked, you'll be responsible for everything that happens under your rule. But if you're given power without asking, Allah will help you with it. If you make a promise and then find something better to do, keep the new plan and make amends for breaking your promise.

title: Ruling Authority: A Warning
content: The Prophet (ﷺ) said, 'You will want to be in charge of ruling, but it will bring you regret on the Day of Resurrection. It's a good thing for now, but a bad thing when it's taken away.'

title: Don't Ask for Power
content: Two men from Abu Musa's tribe visited the Prophet. One of them asked to be a leader, and so did the other. The Prophet (ﷺ) said, 'We don't give power to those who ask for it or want it badly.'

title: Honest Leadership and Paradise
content: The Prophet (ﷺ) said: If Allah gives someone the job of leading people but they don't act honestly with them, that person will never smell the scent of Paradise.

title: Ruler's Deception and Heaven
content: Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) said: If a leader who rules Muslims dies while cheating them, Allah will not let him enter Paradise.

title: Don't Show Off or Harm Others
content: Jundab told some people that the Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) said: 'If you do good to show off, Allah will expose your true intentions on Judgement Day. And if you cause trouble for others, Allah will make life difficult for you too.' They asked Jundab for advice and he said: 'First, keep your body clean by eating only halal food. Also, try not to harm anyone, even a little bit, so that you can reach Paradise safely.'

title: Preparing for Judgment Day
content: One day, while I was with the Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) outside a mosque, we met a man. He asked when the Day of Judgment would come. The Prophet (ﷺ) asked him what he had prepared for that day. The man felt embarrassed and said he hadn't done much good like fasting or giving to charity, but he loved Allah and the Prophet. The Prophet (ﷺ) replied, 'You will be with those you love'.

title: Patience in Calamity
content: Anas bin Malik told his family about a woman who was crying over a grave. The Prophet (ﷺ) passed by her and said, 'Be afraid of Allah and be patient.' But the woman didn't recognize him and asked him to leave. Later, someone else told her it was the Prophet. She went to the gate where the Prophet was but didn't see anyone in charge. So she said, 'I didn't know you were the Prophet!' The Prophet (ﷺ) replied, 'Patience is most important when a problem first starts.'

title: Qais bin Sa'd's Relationship
content: Anas said that Qais bin Sa'd was like a police chief to the Prophet. He was very close and trusted by the Prophet.

title: Prophet Sends Rulers to Yemen
content: The Prophet (ﷺ) sent Abu Musa and then Muadh to be in charge of Yemen.

title: Man Reverts to Judaism
content: Abu Musa had a friend who became Muslim but then went back to being Jewish. Muadh saw him and asked Abu Musa what was wrong. Abu Musa said the man had left Islam for Judaism. Muadh said he wouldn't sit with him unless he was killed, because that's what Allah and His Prophet taught.

title: Judge with a Clear Mind
content: Abu Bakra wrote to his son: 'Don't judge between two people when you're angry. The Prophet (ﷺ) said, 'A judge should not make decisions while feeling angry'.

title: Shorten the Congregational Prayer
content: A man told the Prophet that Mu`adh was making the morning prayer too long. The Prophet (ﷺ) said: 'Some of you make others dislike good deeds like praying together. If someone leads a group in prayer, they should keep it short because some people are old, weak or busy.'

title: Divorce During Menses
content: Abdullah bin Umar divorced his wife while she was on her period. He told Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) about it. The Prophet (ﷺ) got upset and said, 'He must take her back and keep her until she's clean from her bleeding. Then wait for another period to pass and she'll be clean again. Only then can he divorce her if he wants.'

title: Hind's Question about Food
content: Hind said to the Prophet: 'I see no family I'd rather see in a low position than yours, but now I see none I'd rather see honored.' She asked if it was wrong for her to take food from her husband Abu Sufyan's property to feed their children. The Prophet (ﷺ) replied: 'It's not wrong to feed them as long as you do it fairly and reasonably'.

title: Sealing Letters
content: Anas bin Malik said the Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) wanted to send a letter to the Byzantines. People told him that they wouldn't read it unless it was sealed with a stamp. So, the Prophet took a silver ring and used it as a seal. The ring had his name engraved on it: 'Muhammad (ﷺ), Apostle of Allah'.

title: Umar and Abdullah's Gift
content: 'Abdullah bin As-Sa'di visited 'Umar during his time as Caliph. 'Umar asked him, 'I've been told you do work for people but don't take payment.' 'Abdullah said yes. 'Umar asked why. 'Abdullah said he had horses and slaves, was living well, and wanted to keep the payment as a gift for Muslims. 'Umar said not to do that. He explained that Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) used to give him gifts, but 'Umar would say, 'Give it to someone who needs it more.' One time, the Prophet gave him money and he said, 'Give it to someone else.' The Prophet (ﷺ) replied, 'Keep it for yourself and then give it in charity. If it comes to you, take it. But if not, don't ask for it.'

title: Prophet Muhammad's Advice
content: 'Umar said that the Prophet gave him some money and he asked to give it to someone more in need. The Prophet (ﷺ) said, 'Keep it for now and then use it to help others. If you get something extra, take it but don't ask for things you're not given.'

title: Witness to a Divorce
content: Sahl bin Sa'd saw a husband and wife in court. They were involved in a case where the woman accused her husband of not being with her at night, but he denied it. The judge decided they should be divorced. Sahl was only 15 years old when this happened.

title: Sleeping with Another Man's Wife
content: A man from the Ansar came to the Prophet and asked if he should kill someone who sleeps with his wife. The man and his wife then went through a process called Lian in front of the Prophet while I was there.

title: Man Admits to Zina
content: A man came to the Prophet in the mosque and said he had committed adultery. The Prophet (ﷺ) ignored him at first, but when four people confirmed it, he asked if the man was crazy. The man said no. Then the Prophet told his companions to take the man away and stone him to death.

title: I'm Just a Human Being
content: Um Salama said that the Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) said: 'I am only human. When you come to me with problems, one of you might explain it better than another. I make my decisions based on what I hear. If I make a mistake and give someone something that doesn't belong to them, they should not take it because I'm giving them a piece of fire.'

title: War Booty Distribution
content: Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) said on the Day of Hunain: 'If you have proof or a witness that you killed an enemy, you get their arms and belongings.' I stood up to find a witness but couldn't. Then someone else spoke up, saying they had the arms. Abu Bakr said no, it should go to one of Allah's fighters. The Prophet (ﷺ) gave me the arms, which I used to buy a garden with its value.

title: Prophet's Warning about Satan
content: Safiya bint Huyai came to the mosque. The Prophet (ﷺ) accompanied her home. Two men from the Ansar saw them and said, 'Praise be to God!' The Prophet (ﷺ) said, 'Satan is in every person, just like blood flows through their body.'

title: Make Things Easy for People
content: The Prophet (ﷺ) sent Abu Burda and Mu`adh to Yemen. He told them to make things easy for people, not hard. They should give good news and not make people dislike good actions. The two men were also told to work together and understand each other. Later, Abu Musa asked the Prophet about a drink called Al-Bit'. The Prophet (ﷺ) said that all intoxicants are forbidden.

title: Free Captives, Accept Invitations
content: The Prophet (ﷺ) said to Abu Musa: 'Release the people who are being held captive and accept any invitations you receive.'

title: Prophet's Warning on Zakat
content: The Prophet (ﷺ) appointed a man to collect Zakat. When the man returned with some money, he said it was for the Prophet and some of it was a gift. The Prophet (ﷺ) stood up on the pulpit and said: 'Why did you take something that wasn't yours? Why didn't you stay at home and see if your family would give you gifts? If someone takes something they shouldn't have, they will carry it on their neck on Judgment Day. A camel will bleat, a cow will moo, and a sheep will baah.' The Prophet (ﷺ) raised his hands and said: 'I've clearly told people Allah's message.' He repeated this three times.

title: Salim Leads Prayer in Quba
content: Salim, a freed slave of Abu Hudhaifa, led prayers at the Quba mosque. People like Abu Bakr, Umar, and Amir bin Rabi'a would pray behind him.

title: Freed Captives of Hawazin
content: When Muslims were allowed to free captives from the Hawazin tribe, the Prophet said: 'I don't know who agrees or disagrees. Go back and ask your leaders if they want to set them free.' The people went back, talked among themselves, and then came back to the Prophet. They told him that everyone agreed happily to let their captives go.

title: Setting Free Captive Slaves
content: When the Prophet allowed Muslims to free captives from Hawazin, he asked them to go back and discuss it with their leaders. The leaders talked to the people and then came back to tell the Prophet that everyone agreed happily to set the slaves free.

title: Hypocrisy in Praising Rulers
content: Some people told Ibn 'Umar that when they meet their leaders, they say nice things about them. But when they leave, they say bad things behind their backs. Ibn 'Umar said this is hypocrisy.

title: Double-Faced People Are Worst
content: Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) said: The worst people are those who show one face to some and another face to others.

title: Hind's Request to the Prophet
content: `Aisha said that Hind told the Prophet she needed some money from her husband Abu Sufyan. The Prophet (ﷺ) said, 'Take what you need for yourself and your children.'

title: Don't Take What's Not Yours
content: The Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) heard people arguing outside his house. He went out to them and said, 'I'm just a normal person, not a judge. People come to me with problems, and one of you might be better at explaining your side than the other. If I make a decision that's unfair to someone else, what they take is like fire - it can either help or hurt them.

title: Custody of the Boy
content: `Utba bin Abi Waqqas said to his brother Sa`d, 'Take care of this boy.' But `Abd bin Zam`a claimed the boy was his brother. They both went to the Prophet. The Prophet (ﷺ) asked them about their relationship and decided that the boy belonged to `Abd bin Zam`a because he was born on his father's bed. The Prophet (ﷺ) told Sauda bint Zam`a to cover herself when she saw the boy, as he looked like her husband `Utba.

title: Taking False Oaths
content: The Prophet (ﷺ) said: If someone takes an oath to get something from another Muslim and lies about it, Allah will be angry with them. This happened to a man who had a dispute over a well. The Prophet (ﷺ) asked him if he had any proof, but he didn't. So the Prophet told his opponent to take an oath instead. The man knew his opponent would lie, so this is why Allah revealed: 'Those who trade their faith for a small gain will be punished.'

title: Lying in Court is Wrong
content: The Prophet (ﷺ) said: If someone lies under oath to take something that belongs to a Muslim, Allah will be angry with them. The Quran says: Those who trade their faith for a small gain and lie under oath will face Allah's anger.

title: The Prophet's Warning
content: The Prophet (ﷺ) heard people arguing near his gate. He went to them and said, 'I'm only a human being. People come to me with their problems. One person might tell their story in a way that sounds more believable than the other. I give my decision based on what they say. If I make a mistake and take something from one Muslim by error, it's like taking fire. The person can choose to accept or leave it.'

title: Freeing a Slave's Promise
content: The Prophet (ﷺ) came across one of his companions who had promised to free his slave after he died. However, the companion didn't have any other property except for that slave. The Prophet (ﷺ) found out about this and sold the slave for 800 dirhams. He then sent the money to the companion.

title: The Prophet's Support for Usama
content: The Prophet (ﷺ) sent an army unit led by Usama bin Zaid. Some people criticized his leadership. The Prophet (ﷺ) said, 'If you criticize him now, you also criticized his father before me. His father was a great leader and one of my closest friends. Now his son is one of my closest friends too.'

title: Most Quarrelsome Person
content: Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) said, 'Allah dislikes the person who argues a lot.'

title: Khalid's Order to Kill Captives
content: Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) sent Khalid bin Al-Walid to fight against the tribe of Bani Jadhima. When Khalid killed some and took others as prisoners, he gave a prisoner to each soldier and told them to kill their own prisoner. I, Ibn Umar, refused to do this because it didn't feel right. We told Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) about it, and he said, 'I am not responsible for what Khalid has done.' He repeated this twice.

title: Prophet's Guidance on Prayer
content: There was a disagreement between some people. The Prophet (ﷺ) heard about it and went to help them settle their problem after he finished his Zuhr prayer. When the time for Asr prayer came, Bilal called out the Adhan and then the Iqama for prayer. Abu Bakr led the prayer. Meanwhile, the Prophet arrived while Abu Bakr was still praying. The people clapped when they saw the Prophet standing behind Abu Bakr. Abu Bakr normally didn't look around during prayer, but he glanced back this time because of the clapping. He saw the Prophet and stopped praying. The Prophet (ﷺ) signaled to Abu Bakr to continue, but Abu Bakr stepped back instead. When the Prophet finished his prayer, he asked Abu Bakr why he hadn't kept going after being told to do so. Abu Bakr said it was not right for him to lead the Prophet in prayer. The Prophet (ﷺ) then told everyone what to do if a problem comes up during prayer: men should say 'Praise be to Allah', and women should clap.

title: Collecting the Quran
content: After a big battle in Al-Yamama, many people who knew the Quran by heart were killed. Umar was worried that more of them would die and some parts of the Quran might be lost forever. He asked Abu Bakr to collect all the Quran's verses into one book. Zaid bin Thabit was chosen for this task because he used to write down the Quran's revelations for the Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ). At first, Zaid thought it was too big a job, but Umar and Abu Bakr kept encouraging him. They said it was very important to do this. Eventually, Allah helped Zaid understand why it was necessary. He started gathering all the available pieces of the Quran from palm leaves, leather scrolls, stones, and people's memories. The last verses of Surah Tauba were found in a village called Khuza'ima, and Zaid added them to the rest of the surah.

title: Killing at Khaibar
content: Two friends, Abdullah and Muhaiyisa, went to Khaibar because they were very poor. But then Muhaiyisa was told that his friend had been killed and thrown into a pit or well. He went back to the Jews who lived there and said, 'You've killed my friend.' They denied it, but Muhaiyisa came back to his people and told them what happened. His brother Huwaiyisa and their uncle `Abdur-Rahman went with him to see the Prophet. The Prophet (ﷺ) asked the eldest person to speak first, so Huwaiyisa spoke, then Muhaiyisa. The Prophet (ﷺ) said that either the Jews had to pay money for killing Abdullah or be ready for a fight. He wrote a letter to the Jews saying they hadn't killed him. But the Prophet still wanted to help his friends, so he asked them if they could make an oath to prove it was true. They said no, because oaths only work with Muslims. So the Prophet gave them 100 female camels as money for their friend's death from himself.

title: Justice According to Allah's Laws
content: A man from the desert came to the Prophet and said, 'Judge between us according to Allah's Book.' His opponent agreed. The bedouin explained that his son had worked for this other man, but had an affair with his wife. The people wanted to stone the son to death, so the father paid a ransom of 100 sheep and a slave girl. Later, scholars advised the father to give his son 100 lashes and exile him for one year. The Prophet (ﷺ) agreed with their advice. He ordered Unais to take the slave girl and the sheep back from the other man. In the morning, Unais was told to go to the wife of the other man and stone her to death.

title: Judging a Case of Adultery
content: A man from the desert came to the Prophet and asked him to judge their case according to Allah's laws. The other man agreed that this should happen. The bedouin explained that his son had worked for this man, but then committed adultery with his wife. People said the son should be stoned to death, so the father paid a ransom of 100 sheep and a slave girl to save him. Then he asked some scholars what should happen next, and they said the son should get 100 lashes and be exiled for one year. The Prophet (ﷺ) agreed with this decision. He ordered that the slave girl and the sheep should be returned to the bedouin, but his son should still receive the punishment. The Prophet (ﷺ) then told a man named Unais to go to the wife of the other man in the morning and stone her to death.

title: Heraclius Asks Abu Sufyan
content: Abu Sufyan bin Harb was with a Quraish caravan when Heraclius called him. Heraclius said to his interpreter, 'Ask Abu Sufyan a question and if he lies, the others should correct him.' Abu Sufyan told Heraclius about the Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ). Heraclius then asked his interpreter to tell Abu Sufyan, 'If what you say is true, the Prophet will take over where I'm standing'.

title: Prophet Muhammad on Zakat
content: The Prophet (ﷺ) employed a man to collect charity from the Bani Sulaim tribe. When he returned with the money, the Prophet asked him to explain where some of it came from. The man said some was for himself and some was a gift. The Prophet (ﷺ) told him to stay at his family's house and see if they would give him gifts if he was telling the truth. He then addressed the people, saying that anyone who takes charity for themselves will have to answer to Allah on Judgment Day with what they took. He warned them not to take anything from the charity for themselves.

title: Two Groups of Advisors
content: The Prophet (ﷺ) said that whenever a new leader is chosen by Allah, there are always two groups giving advice. One group tells the leader to do good and encourages them to follow it. The other group advises the leader to do bad things and tries to convince them to do so. But only those protected by Allah will be safe from these bad advisors.

title: Oath of Allegiance
content: 'Ubada bin As-Samit said: We promised Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) that we would listen to and follow him when we were strong or tired. We also promised not to fight against the leader or disobey them. We vowed to stand up for what is right, even if it means speaking the truth in front of others. And we said we wouldn't be afraid of people judging us for following Allah's way.

title: Oath of Allegiance to Prophet Muhammad
content: 'Ubada bin As-Samit said: We promised Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) that we would listen and obey him when we were active or tired. We wouldn't fight against a leader or disobey them. We'd stand up for the truth wherever we were, even if it meant being blamed by others. We wouldn't be afraid of what others thought in our actions for Allah.

title: Prophet's Prayer in Trench
content: Anas said the Prophet went out on a cold morning when the Muhajirin and Ansar were digging a trench. The Prophet (ﷺ) prayed, 'God, true happiness is what comes after death, forgive the Ansar and Muhajirin.' They replied, 'We're those who pledged to fight for Islam as long as we live.'

title: Abdullah bin Umar's Story
content: When we gave our promise to follow Allah's Messenger (ﷺ), he would say: 'Listen and obey as much as you can.'

title: Ibn Umar's Pledge of Allegiance
content: Ibn Umar wrote a pledge to listen and obey Abdul Malik. He said he would follow Allah's laws and the Prophet Muhammad 's (ﷺ) teachings as much as possible. His sons also gave the same promise.

title: Jabir's Pledge of Allegiance
content: I gave the Prophet a promise to listen and obey him. He told me to also give good advice to every Muslim whenever I can.

title: Abdullah bin Umar's Oath
content: `Abdullah bin `Umar wrote to `Abdul Malik: 'I promise to follow Allah's laws and the teachings of His Prophet. I will listen and obey you as long as it is within my power, and so will my sons.'

title: Salama's Pledge at Hudaibiya
content: Yazid asked Salama why he gave his pledge to the Prophet on the Day of Hudaibiya. Salama said, 'I pledged for death.'

title: Choosing a New Leader
content: After `Umar died, some people were chosen to decide who should be the new leader. They asked `Abdur-Rahman to choose from among them. The people followed `Abdur-Rahman's advice and consulted him for three nights. He called on several leaders, including `Ali, Az-Zubair, Sa`d, and `Uthman. Finally, he decided that `Uthman should be the new leader. Before giving the oath of allegiance to `Uthman, `Abdur-Rahman reminded everyone that they must follow Allah's laws and the traditions of the Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) and his two previous successors.

title: Giving Oath of Allegiance
content: Salama was asked by the Prophet to give his oath of allegiance again. Salama said he had already done it once, but the Prophet told him to do it a second time.

title: Canceling the Pledge
content: Jabir bin Abdullah told us that a bedouin man made a promise to follow Islam and be loyal to the Prophet. But then he got sick with a fever and asked the Prophet to cancel his promise. The Prophet (ﷺ) said no both times. Then the bedouin left Medina. The Prophet (ﷺ) said, 'Medina is like a furnace that gets rid of its bad things and keeps its good ones.'

title: Abdullah's Pledge of Allegiance
content: `Abdullah bin Hisham's mother took him to the Prophet. She said, 'Make him promise to follow Islam.' The Prophet (ﷺ) said, 'He's too young,' and blessed him with his hand. Abdullah used to sacrifice a sheep for his whole family each year.

title: Bedouin's Pledge of Allegiance
content: Jabir bin Abdullah told me that a bedouin man became Muslim and promised to follow Allah's Messenger (ﷺ). But when the bedouin got sick with fever in Medina, he asked the Prophet to cancel his promise. The Prophet (ﷺ) said no three times. Finally, the bedouin left Medina. Then the Prophet said: 'Medina is like a special furnace that gets rid of its bad people and keeps only the good ones.'

title: Three Types of Sinners
content: Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) said there will be three types of people who will not be forgiven by Allah on the Day of Resurrection. They are: a man who has extra water but doesn't give it to thirsty travelers, a man who only makes promises for personal gain and breaks them if he doesn't get what he wants, and a seller who lies about an item's price to trick someone into buying it.

title: Pledge of Allegiance
content: The Prophet (ﷺ) said to us: 'Promise me you won't worship anything but Allah, steal, have sex outside marriage, kill your children, falsely accuse someone, or disobey when I tell you to do good. Whoever keeps this promise will get a reward from Allah. If you break one of these rules and get punished in this life, that punishment will make up for the sin. But if you don't get caught, it's up to Allah whether He punishes you or forgives you.' We made this promise.

title: The Prophet's Pledge to Women
content: Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) would take a pledge from women by saying they wouldn't worship anything except Allah. He only touched the hand of his wife or slave, not any other woman's hand.

title: Women's Pledge of Allegiance
content: Um Atiyya said: We made a promise to the Prophet. He read us a verse from the Quran that says we should only worship Allah. He also told us not to cry and wail over dead people. A woman asked if she could help another woman who was crying for her family member, but the Prophet didn't say anything. Only three women kept their promise: Um Sulaim, Um Al-'Ala', and the daughter of Abi Sabra.

title: Bedouin's Pledge of Allegiance
content: A bedouin came to the Prophet and asked him to take his pledge for Islam. The Prophet (ﷺ) agreed, but the next day the bedouin returned with a fever and asked to cancel it. The Prophet (ﷺ) refused, saying: 'Medina is like a furnace that gets rid of its bad things and keeps its good ones.'

title: Aisha's Concern for Death
content: `Aisha said to the Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ), 'My head is going to be lost!' The Prophet (ﷺ) replied that if she died while he was still alive, he would ask Allah to forgive her and pray for her. `Aisha thought the Prophet wanted her to die so he could spend time with another wife later in the day. The Prophet (ﷺ) said he felt like choosing Abu Bakr as his successor instead of letting people choose someone else.

title: Umar's Decision on Succession
content: `Umar was asked if he would appoint a successor. He said that if he did, it would be like Abu Bakr who chose him as the next leader. If he didn't, it would be like Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) who left no clear instructions. The people praised `Umar for his decision. He explained that there are two types of people: those who want to take on leadership and those who don't want the responsibility. `Umar said he wished he could leave the job without being responsible for its consequences, but as a leader, he would face both reward and punishment in this life and the next.

title: Umar's Speech After Prophet's Death
content: Anas bin Malik heard Umar give a speech after the Prophet passed away. Umar said he wished the Prophet had lived longer, but since he was gone, Allah still guided people through the light of the Prophet's teachings. He said Abu Bakr was like the Prophet, and one of the two who hid in a cave together. Umar thought Abu Bakr should lead the Muslims, so he encouraged him to stand on the pulpit where everyone could swear allegiance to him.

title: Woman's Question about the Prophet
content: A woman asked the Prophet what to do if she came and he was not there. The Prophet (ﷺ) said that if she couldn't find him, she should go to Abu Bakr instead.

title: Abu Bakr's Advice
content: Abu Bakr told the people from Buzakha to follow the camels until Allah shows them a reason to choose their new leader, the successor of the Prophet and the emigrants.

title: Twelve Muslim Leaders
content: Jabir bin Samura heard the Prophet say that there will be twelve Muslim leaders who rule the Islamic world. The Prophet (ﷺ) then said something, but Jabir didn't hear it. His father later told him that all these leaders would come from the Quraish tribe.

title: Twelve Muslim Rulers
content: Jabir bin Samura heard the Prophet say: 'There will be twelve Muslim leaders who rule over all Muslims.' The Prophet (ﷺ) also said something else, but Jabir didn't hear it. His father told him that all these leaders would come from the Quraish tribe.

title: Burn Houses of Absentees
content: Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) said: 'I almost ordered people to collect firewood and then I would lead the prayer. If someone didn't come, their houses would be burned. If you knew how much reward there is for attending the late-night prayer, you would go.'

title: Ka'b bin Malik's Repentance
content: I heard Ka'b bin Malik say: When some people stayed behind from the battle of Tabuk, they didn't join the Prophet. They were punished for fifty nights because they didn't speak to anyone during that time. Then the Prophet announced that Allah accepted their repentance.

title: Martyrdom in Allah's Cause
content: Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) said: 'If I didn't have to leave some people behind and couldn't provide them with a way to join me, I would go to every battle. I wish to be killed for Allah and come back to life, then be killed again and brought back to life, and keep doing that until the Day of Judgment.'

title: Allah's Messenger on Martyrdom
content: Abu Huraira said the Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) said: 'I wish to fight for Allah and be killed. Then I want to come back to life, be killed again, and come back to life again.' Abu Huraira repeated these words three times.

title: Giving Away Wealth
content: The Prophet (ﷺ) said: If I had a huge amount of gold, like the mountain of Uhud, I would give it all away in three days. I wouldn't keep any money for myself unless I needed it to pay my debts.

title: Prophet Muhammad's Decision
content: The Prophet (ﷺ) said to Aisha: 'If I had known what I know now, I would not have taken the Hadi with me. I would have ended my special state of Ihram when everyone else did.'

title: Hajj Rules Explained
content: We were with Allah's Messenger (ﷺ). We put on Ihram clothes for Hajj and arrived in Mecca on the fourth of Dhul-Hijja. The Prophet (ﷺ) told us to walk around the Kaaba, go between Safa and Marwa, and only use our Ihram for Umra if we didn't have a Hadi animal with us. Only the Prophet and Talha had a Hadi animal. Ali came from Yemen with his Hadi animal. He said he assumed Ihram with the same intention as the Prophet. People asked how they could go to Mina with their private parts wet. The Prophet (ﷺ) said if he knew then what he knew now, he wouldn't have brought a Hadi animal. If there was no Hadi animal, he would finish his Ihram. Suraqa met the Prophet while he was throwing pebbles at Jamrat-Al-Aqaba and asked if this was only for them. The Prophet (ﷺ) said it's allowed forever. Aisha arrived in Mecca while menstruating, so the Prophet told her to do all Hajj ceremonies except walking around the Kaaba. He also told her not to pray until she was clean. When they camped at Al-Batha, Aisha asked why the Prophet did both Hajj and Umra while she only did Hajj. The Prophet (ﷺ) sent Abdur-Rahman with her to Tan'im, where she performed Umra in Dhul-Hijja after the Hajj days.

title: Prophet's Sleepless Night
content: One night, the Prophet was awake. He said he wished a good companion was guarding him. Suddenly, Sa'd arrived with his sword. The Prophet (ﷺ) slept so deeply that we heard him snoring. Bilal told the Prophet about how much he loved staying in a valley surrounded by Idhkhir and Jalil grass.

title: Two Types of People
content: Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) said: There are two kinds of people you should not wish to be like. One is a person who has been given the Quran and reads it day and night. If someone else sees this, they might say, 'If I had the same knowledge, I would do what he does.' The other kind of person is one who has wealth but uses it wisely. If someone sees them spending their money well, they might say, 'If I had the same amount of money, I would use it like them.'

title: Don't Long for Death
content: Anas said he wouldn't have longed for death if the Prophet hadn't told him not to wish for it.

title: Khabbab's Painful Branding
content: Qais visited Khabbab who had been branded on his body. Khabbab said he would have prayed for death if the Prophet hadn't forbidden it.

title: Don't Wish for Death
content: Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) said: Don't wish to die. If you're good, you can do more good things. If you're bad, you can stop doing wrong and ask for forgiveness.

title: Prophet's Prayer in Battle
content: On the day of the battle of Al-Ahzab, the Prophet was carrying earth with his companions. He said: 'We wouldn't be guided or give charity without Allah. Send us peace and calm.'

title: Don't Long for Enemies
content: Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) said to Abdullah bin Abi Aufa: Don't wish to meet your enemy. Ask Allah for protection from harm.

title: Lian Judgment Explained
content: Ibn `Abbas talked about a couple who were punished for Lian. Abdullah bin Shaddad asked if this was the same woman the Prophet said he would stone without proof. Ibn `Abbas replied, 'No, it's about a Muslim woman who behaved badly and caused suspicion.'

title: Prophet's Delayed Prayer
content: 'Umar went to the Prophet one night because he was late with the evening prayer. The women and children had already gone to sleep. The Prophet (ﷺ) came out, his head still wet from washing, and said he would have liked to pray at that time but didn't want it to be hard for people.

title: Clean Your Teeth
content: The Prophet (ﷺ) said, 'If I ordered people to use a toothbrush, it would be hard for them. But they should clean their teeth regularly.'

title: Fasting for a Long Time
content: Anas said the Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) fasted until the end of the month. Some people followed him, but when they told the Prophet about it, he said: 'If I could choose, I would fast like this all the time. But my Lord always makes me eat and drink.'

title: Prophet Muhammad's Fasting Rule
content: Abu Huraira said the Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) forbade a type of fasting called Al-Wisal. The people asked him, 'But you do this kind of fasting.' He replied, 'I'm different from you. When I sleep at night, Allah gives me food and drink. But when they still refused to stop Al-Wisal, he fasted with them for two days. Then the crescent moon appeared, so the Prophet said that if it hadn't been seen, he would have kept fasting longer.'

title: Aisha Asks About the Wall
content: Aisha asked the Prophet about a wall outside the Kaaba. The Prophet (ﷺ) said it was part of the Kaaba. Aisha asked why people didn't include it in the Kaaba when building it. The Prophet (ﷺ) replied that her people were short of money at the time. She then asked why the gate to this area was so high. The Prophet (ﷺ) explained that her people built it that way so they could control who entered and left the Kaaba.

title: Emigration and the Ansar
content: Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) said: 'If I didn't have to move from Mecca, I would live among the Ansar. If people travel through a valley or mountain pass, I would choose the Ansar's route.'

title: Prophet Muhammad's Preference
content: The Prophet (ﷺ) said that if he hadn't migrated to Medina, he would have stayed with the Ansar tribe. If people were traveling through a valley or mountain pass, he would choose the Ansar's route.

title: Prophet's Advice to Young Men
content: We young men visited the Prophet. We stayed with him for twenty nights. He was a kind man and noticed we missed our families. He asked us about them. We told him, so he said: 'Go back to your families. Teach them about Islam and encourage good deeds. When it's time to pray, do as you've seen me praying. One of you should call the prayer and the eldest person should lead it.'

title: Bilal's Call to Prayer
content: Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) said: 'Don't stop eating your pre-dawn meal because of Bilal's call to prayer. He calls out so people praying at night can eat and those sleeping can wake up, since it's not yet dawn.'

title: Eat and Drink Before Fajr
content: The Prophet (ﷺ) said to Bilal, 'Call the Adhan at night so people can eat and drink until Ibn Um Maktum calls it for the morning prayer'.

title: Prophet's Prayer Adjustment
content: The Prophet (ﷺ) led us in a prayer. Someone asked if the number of rak'at had been changed. He said, 'What do you mean?' They replied, 'You prayed five rak'at.' The Prophet (ﷺ) then added two prostrations after finishing his prayer with a sign of respect.

title: Prophet's Shortened Prayer
content: Abu Huraira said the Prophet finished his prayer after only two rak'at. Dhul-Yaddain asked if the prayer was shortened or forgotten. The Prophet (ﷺ) asked if Dhul-Yaddain spoke the truth, and people said yes. Then the Prophet stood up and added another two rak'at. He finished the prayer with Taslim, then said Takbir and did a longer-than-usual prostration, followed by another one.

title: Turning to Face the Ka'ba
content: Some people were praying at Quba. A man came and said that Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) had been told to face the Ka'ba in prayers. They were facing a different direction, so they turned their faces towards Mecca.

title: Prophet's Qibla Change
content: When Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) arrived in Medina, he prayed towards Jerusalem for 16 months. He wanted to pray towards the Kaaba instead. Allah revealed a message saying He would change the direction of prayer to please him. The Prophet (ﷺ) was directed to face the Kaaba. A man who prayed with the Prophet told some people from the Ansar that the Prophet had changed the direction of prayer. These people were praying and heard this news, so they turned their faces towards the Kaaba.

title: Prohibition of Alcoholic Drinks
content: I used to make drinks from dates for Abu Talha and his friends. One day a person told them that drinking alcohol was now forbidden. Abu Talha said, 'Anas, break all these jars.' So I got up and hit the jars with a mortar until they broke.

title: Prophet Sends Trustworthy Person
content: The Prophet (ﷺ) said to the people of Najran, 'I will send you a trustworthy person.' Each Companion wanted to be that person, but the Prophet sent Abu Ubaida instead.

title: Prophet's Trustworthy Helper
content: The Prophet (ﷺ) said, 'Every nation has a trustworthy person. The trustworthy person of our nation is Abu Ubaida.'

title: Sharing Knowledge with a Friend
content: I was friends with an Ansari man. If he wasn't there when the Prophet was speaking, I would tell him what the Prophet said later. And if I wasn't there, he would share what the Prophet said with me.

title: Soldiers and the Fire
content: The Prophet (ﷺ) sent an army with a commander. The commander made a fire and told the soldiers to enter it. Some wanted to go in, but others said they had left the fire (meaning Islam) for their own safety. They told the Prophet about this. He said that those who wanted to go into the fire would have stayed there forever. Then he reminded everyone: 'We only follow orders when they are good.'

title: Two Men in Dispute
content: Abu Huraira and Zaid bin Khalid told a story about two men who went to the Prophet. They had a disagreement that they wanted him to settle.

title: Two Men Dispute Before Prophet
content: Abu Huraira and Zaid bin Khalid told that two men went to the Prophet to settle a dispute between them.

title: Justice According to Allah's Book
content: A man came to the Prophet and said, 'Judge my case according to Allah's laws.' His opponent agreed. The man explained that his son had committed adultery with another man's wife. He paid a ransom for his son, but the learned people told him to punish the woman by stoning her to death and give his son 100 lashes and exile for a year. The Prophet (ﷺ) said he would judge according to Allah's laws. He ordered the slave girl and sheep to be returned. The man's son was given 100 lashes and one-year exile. Unais was told to take the wife of the other man to her husband in the morning, and if she confessed, she should be stoned to death.

title: Prophet Muhammad's Helper
content: During the Battle of the Trench, Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) called for volunteers to bring news about the enemy. Az-Zubair responded each time he was called. The Prophet (ﷺ) said that every prophet has a helper, and Az-Zubair is my helper.

title: Guarding a Garden Gate
content: The Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) entered a garden and told me to watch its entrance. A man came and asked if he could go in. The Prophet (ﷺ) said, 'Let him in and tell him good news: he will enter Paradise.' It was Abu Bakr. Then Umar arrived, and the Prophet said the same thing. Next, Uthman came, and again the Prophet gave him the good news that he would enter Paradise.

title: Umar Meets the Prophet
content: I, `Umar, went to visit the Prophet. I saw him in a small room on top of the stairs. His black slave was standing at the bottom of the stairs. I told the slave to tell the Prophet that I, `Umar, had arrived and wanted to enter.

title: Allah's Messenger Teaches Patience
content: Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) sent a message to the ruler of Persia, Khosrau. He asked his messenger to give it first to the ruler of Bahrain and then have him deliver it to Khosrau. When Khosrau read the message, he tore it up. The Prophet (ﷺ) prayed that Allah would tear down those who disobey Him.

title: Fasting on Ashura Day
content: The Prophet (ﷺ) told a man from the tribe of Al-Aslam: 'Tell your people that if someone has eaten something, they should fast for the rest of the day. And if someone hasn't eaten anything, they should finish their fasting.'

title: Welcome, O People
content: Some visitors from the tribe of Rabi'a came to see the Prophet. They said they were worried about being treated unfairly because there were people who didn't believe in Allah between them and the Prophet's community. The Prophet (ﷺ) welcomed them and told them not to worry. He asked if they knew what it meant to believe in Allah, and they said only Allah and the Prophet knew best. The Prophet (ﷺ) then explained that believing in Allah means saying that no one is worthy of worship except Allah, and that Muhammad (ﷺ) is His Messenger. He also told them to pray regularly, give money to those who need it (called Zakat), fast during Ramadan, and give one-fifth of any money they won from war to the community. The Prophet (ﷺ) then told them not to drink from four things: Ad-Duba', Al-Hantam, Al-Mazaffat, An-Naqir, or possibly Al-Muqaiyar.

title: Ibn Umar's Story
content: Ash-Shu'bi asked Tauba Al-'Anbari about how Al-Hasan narrated Hadiths. He said he stayed with Ibn 'Umar for a year or more and never heard him say anything from the Prophet except one story. Ibn 'Umar told them that some of the Prophet's companions, including Sa'd, were eating meat when one of the Prophet's wives said it was from a Mastigure animal. They stopped eating until the Prophet said, 'Keep eating, it is allowed.'

title: Umar and the Perfect Religion
content: A Jewish man told Umar that if a certain verse had been revealed to them, they would have celebrated it as a special day. The verse said Islam is the perfect religion for us. Umar knew exactly when this verse was revealed: on a Friday at Arafat.

title: Umar's Advice to Abu Bakr
content: Anas bin Malik heard Umar speak after the Prophet's death. He said: 'After this, Allah chose for His Apostle what is with Him (Paradise) rather than what is with you (the world). Stick to this Book (Quran), which guided your Apostle. Following it will guide you on the right path.'

title: Prophet Teaches Ibn Abbas
content: The Prophet (ﷺ) hugged me and said to Allah: 'Teach him the Quran.'

title: Allah's Blessings through Islam
content: Abu Barza said: Allah makes some people self-sufficient and others successful because of Islam and Muhammad (ﷺ).

title: Abdullah's Oath to Ruler
content: `Abdullah bin `Umar wrote a letter to the ruler. He said: 'I promise to listen and follow Allah's laws and what the Prophet taught, as much as I can.'

title: Muhammad's Special Gift
content: Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) Muhammad (ﷺ) said that he was sent with a special gift: to say things that have big meanings and are easy to understand. He also had the power to make people feel scared of him, which helped him win battles. One night, while sleeping, Muhammad (ﷺ) saw that he had been given the keys to many treasures around the world. After he passed away, his followers used these treasures.

title: Prophets and Their Miracles
content: The Prophet (ﷺ) said: 'Every prophet was given a miracle to show people what they believed in. But I got the Quran, which Allah revealed to me. I hope my followers will be more than any other prophet's on Judgment Day.'

title: Umar's Thoughts on Charity
content: Abu Wail sat with Shaiba in the Mosque of Al-Masjid-Al-Haram. Shaiba said that 'Umar once sat beside him and said he wanted to share all the gold and silver inside the Ka'ba with Muslims. Abu Wail told 'Umar it wasn't possible because the Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) and his companion Abu Bakr didn't do it. 'Umar replied, 'They are the ones we should follow.'

title: Honesty Comes from Allah
content: Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) said to us: Honesty came from heaven and settled in the hearts of good people. Then the Quran was revealed, and we learned about honesty from it and from his way of living (the Sunna). The Quran and the Sunna helped make us honest.

title: Best Talk and Way
content: Allah's Book is the best talk. The way of Muhammad (ﷺ) is the best way to follow. New ideas that go against Islam are bad. What Allah promises will definitely happen, and there's no escaping it.

title: Two Men Seek Justice
content: Abu Huraira and Zaid bin Khalid were with the Prophet. He said to two men: 'I will judge between you according to Allah's Laws.'

title: Two Men Seek Justice
content: Abu Huraira and Zaid bin Khalid were with the Prophet. He said to two men: 'I will make a decision between you based on Allah's laws.'

title: Who Will Enter Paradise
content: Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) said: 'All my followers will go to Heaven except those who don't listen to me. They asked, 'Who won't listen?' He replied, 'Those who disobey me.'

title: Angels Visit the Prophet
content: Some angels visited the Prophet while he was sleeping. They discussed whether his heart was awake or not. One of them said, 'Let's give him an example.' They compared the Prophet to a man who invites people to a party in his house. If someone accepts the invitation, they can enter and eat. But if they don't accept, they stay outside. The angels explained that this means the Prophet is like the host inviting people to Paradise. Those who follow the Prophet are obeying Allah. And those who disobey the Prophet are disobeying Allah.

title: Follow the Straight Path
content: Hudhaifa told a group of people who read the Quran: 'Stay on the right path. If you go off track, you will get lost.'

title: Following the Prophet's Warning
content: The Prophet (ﷺ) said: 'My message is like a man who warns his people about an enemy he has seen. Some listen and leave at night to be safe, while others don't believe him and stay home until the enemy arrives and destroys them. This is what happens when you follow me or ignore my warning.'

title: Abu Bakr Fights Disbelievers
content: When Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) died, Abu Bakr became the new leader. Some Arabs stopped believing in Islam. 'Umar said to Abu Bakr, 'How can you fight these people? The Prophet (ﷺ) said we should keep fighting until they say there is no God but Allah.' Abu Bakr replied, 'I will fight anyone who doesn't follow the rules of Zakat and prayer. Zakat is a right that must be taken from wealth. If they don't give me even a rope for charity like they used to give to the Prophet, I'll fight them for not sharing their wealth.' 'Umar said he saw Allah open Abu Bakr's heart to fight for what was right.

title: Abu Bakr Fights Disbelievers
content: When Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) died, Abu Bakr became the leader. Some Arabs stopped believing in Islam. 'Umar said to Abu Bakr, 'Why are you fighting these people? The Prophet (ﷺ) said we should fight until they say there is no god but Allah.' Abu Bakr replied, 'I will fight those who don't give Zakat (a part of their wealth) or pray properly. Zakat is a right that must be given from our wealth. If they won't share what they gave to the Prophet, I'll fight them for not sharing it.' 'Umar said, 'I saw that Allah made Abu Bakr's heart open to fighting and I knew he was right'.

title: Uyaina meets Umar
content: Uyaina came to Medina and stayed with his nephew Al-Hurr. Uyaina asked Al-Hurr to get permission for him to see 'Umar, the leader of the Muslims. Al-Hurr got the permission and took Uyaina to meet 'Umar. When they met, Uyaina complained that 'Umar didn't give them enough food or judge fairly between them. 'Umar became very angry and wanted to punish Uyaina. But Al-Hurr reminded him of a verse from the Quran: 'Hold to forgiveness, command what is good, and leave the foolish.' He said Uyaina was one of those who needed mercy. 'Umar remembered the verse and decided to be more careful in following Allah's rules.

title: Solar Eclipse: Aisha's Story
content: I visited my friend 'Aisha during a solar eclipse. People were praying in the street and she was also praying. I asked her, 'What's going on?' She pointed to the sky and said, 'Praise be to God!' I asked if it meant something important. She nodded yes. After the prayer, the Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) came out and praised God. He said he had seen many things, including Paradise and Hell. A message from God told him that people would face a big test in their graves, similar to the test of the Antichrist. For true believers, it will be easy: they'll say they accepted the Prophet's teachings and believed in them. They'll be allowed to rest peacefully. But for those who are not sure or pretend to believe, it will be hard: they'll just repeat what others said.

title: Follow the Prophet's Advice
content: The Prophet (ﷺ) said to Abu Huraira: 'Do what I do. The people before you were ruined because they argued a lot and disagreed with their prophets. If I tell you not to do something, don't do it. And if I ask you to do something, try your best to do it.'

title: Don't Ask About Something
content: The Prophet (ﷺ) said: The person who asks about something that hasn't been forbidden, but then it's forbidden because of their question, is the most sinful Muslim.

title: Tarawih Prayer in Mosque
content: The Prophet (ﷺ) took a room made of date palm leaves mats in the mosque. He prayed there for a few nights, and people started gathering to pray behind him. On the fourth night, they thought he had fallen asleep, so they hummed to wake him up. The Prophet (ﷺ) said, 'I saw you doing this, and I was worried that it might become compulsory. So, pray at home whenever possible, except for the required congregational prayers.'

title: Anger and Repentance
content: Some people asked the Prophet about things he disliked. They kept asking too many questions, which made him angry. He said, 'Ask me anything.' A man stood up and asked, 'Who is my father?' The Prophet (ﷺ) replied, 'Your father is Hudhaifa.' Another man stood up and asked the same question. The Prophet (ﷺ) answered, 'Your father is Salim, a freed slave of Shaiba.' When the Prophet's face showed he was angry, Umar said, 'We ask Allah for forgiveness'.

title: Prophet's Final Prayer and Advice
content: When Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) prayed, he would say: 'There is no god but Allah, alone with no partner. All power and praise are His, and He has control over everything.' He also told people to be careful about talking too much or gossiping, not asking too many questions that cause disputes, wasting money by being extravagant, not disrespecting their mothers, not killing their daughters, and not refusing to help others when they need it.

title: Umar's Advice on Ablution
content: Anas was with Umar. Umar said: 'We're not allowed to do something very hard during prayer, like cleaning the inside of our eyes while washing for prayer.'

title: The Prophet's Final Warning
content: The Prophet (ﷺ) came out after the sun had gone down and led a prayer. After finishing, he stood on a raised platform and talked about the Day of Judgment and big events that would happen before it. He said anyone could ask him questions, so long as he was there. The Ansar people started crying, but the Prophet kept saying 'Ask me! Ask me!' A man asked where his entrance to heaven would be, and the Prophet replied 'The Fire'. Another man asked who his father was, and the Prophet said 'Hudhaifa'. The Prophet (ﷺ) kept saying 'Ask me!' until Umar stood up and said they accepted Allah as their Lord, Islam as their religion, and Muhammad (ﷺ) as their Messenger. The Prophet (ﷺ) calmed down when he heard that. Then he said, 'By the One who owns my life, I saw Paradise and Hell in front of me while I was praying, and I've never seen good and evil like what I'm seeing today'.

title: Who is My Father?
content: A man asked the Prophet, 'Who is my father?' The Prophet (ﷺ) replied, 'Your father is so-and-so.' Then Allah revealed a verse: 'Don't ask questions about things you don't need to know.'

title: Who Created Allah?
content: The Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) said: People will keep asking questions until they ask, 'If God created everything, then who created God?'

title: The Prophet Explains the Spirit
content: Ibn Masud was with the Prophet at a farm in Medina. Some Jews asked him about the spirit. The Prophet (ﷺ) stood up, waiting for guidance from Allah. Ibn Masud realized he was being inspired and stepped back. After the inspiration ended, the Prophet said that knowledge of the spirit is only known to Allah.

title: The Prophet's Gold Ring
content: Ibn Umar said the Prophet wore a gold ring. People started wearing them too. The Prophet (ﷺ) then threw his away and said he wouldn't wear it again. So, people also got rid of their rings.

title: Don't Fast Too Much
content: Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) told his friends not to fast for too long. They said he did it, but he explained that Allah feeds him at night. He still joined them in fasting for two days, but then they saw the new moon and stopped.

title: Ali's Important Message
content: Ali stood on a brick pulpit and held a sword with a scroll hanging from it. He said we only have two books: the Quran and this scroll. He unrolled it and showed us what it said. It mentioned how much money to pay for camel blood, that Medina is a safe place, and that if someone breaks these rules they will be cursed by Allah, angels, and people. It also said that when one Muslim helps another, everyone must respect them, and if not, they will face Allah's curse. Finally, it warned against freed slaves choosing new masters without permission.

title: The Prophet's Permission
content: Aisha said the Prophet did something that was allowed. But some people didn't do it. When he found out, he praised Allah and said: 'Why don't they follow me? I know Allah better than them.'

title: Abu Bakr and Umar's Argument
content: Two important men, Abu Bakr and Umar, were almost in trouble. They disagreed about who should be the leader of a group from Bani Tamim. One suggested Al-Aqra' bin H`Abis, while the other had someone else in mind. They argued loudly in front of the Prophet. This made Allah reveal a message: 'Don't speak louder than the Prophet.' From then on, when Umar talked to the Prophet, he spoke quietly and sometimes even whispered so softly that the Prophet couldn't hear him.

title: Prophet's Last Prayer Instructions
content: When Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) was ill, he told Aisha to ask Abu Bakr to lead the people in prayer. Aisha thought it would be hard for everyone to hear because Abu Bakr would cry too much. She asked Hafsa to tell the Prophet this, but instead of saying what she wanted, Hafsa said something else. The Prophet (ﷺ) then said that Aisha and Hafsa were like Joseph's companions, who didn't listen to their sister. He again told Aisha to ask Abu Bakr to lead the people in prayer.

title: Divorce and Accusation
content: 'Uwaimir came to a scholar named `Asim and asked about what should happen if he found his wife with another man. `Asim asked the Prophet, but he didn't like the question. 'Uwaimir went to the Prophet himself. The Prophet (ﷺ) said that Allah had already sent down rules for cases like this. He called for 'Uwaimir's wife and they did a test called Lian. After that, 'Uwaimir divorced his wife because people might think he was lying if he kept her. The Prophet (ﷺ) said to wait and see what their child would be like. If it was red and small, the Prophet thought 'Uwaimir was lying. But if it was black with big eyes and buttocks, he thought 'Uwaimir was telling the truth.

title: Umar's Decision on Property
content: Malik bin Aus visited Umar at his home. Some people asked to enter, and then Ali and Abbas also came in. They had a dispute over the property of Bani Nadir. Umar said that Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) said our property is not for inheritance, but should be given as charity. He reminded them that he had distributed some wealth among them, which was left after their battles. When the Prophet died, Abu Bakr took care of his property and spent it wisely. After Abu Bakr passed away, Umar took over and managed the property in the same way for two years. Then Ali and Abbas came to him asking for their shares, but he told them that if they agreed to manage it as Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) and Abu Bakr did, he would give it to them. They agreed, so Umar gave it to them on that condition.

title: Medina is a Sacred Sanctuary
content: I asked Anas if the Prophet made Medina a safe place. He said yes, it's protected from one point to another. It's not allowed to cut its trees. Anyone who starts a bad idea or does something wrong there will be cursed by Allah, the angels, and everyone else.

title: Knowledge After the Scholars
content: The Prophet (ﷺ) said: 'Allah will not stop giving us knowledge. But it will disappear when the wise and knowledgeable people die. Then only foolish people will be left, making decisions based on their own opinions. They will lead others astray.'

title: Abu Wail Remembers Siffin
content: I asked Abu Wail if he saw the battle between Ali and Muawiya at Siffin. He said yes, then told me about something Sahl bin Hunaif said on that day. Sahl said: 'Don't blame your own thoughts for what's happening in Islam. I remember when we were with the Prophet. If I had a choice, I wouldn't have done it. We never used our swords to get into trouble, but they helped us win and be safe - until this time.' Abu Wail agreed that Siffin was a bad experience.

title: Prophet visits a sick friend
content: Jabir bin Abdullah fell ill. The Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) and Abu Bakr came to visit him on foot. When the Prophet arrived, Jabir was unconscious. The Prophet (ﷺ) performed ablution and poured some of the water over Jabir's body. Jabir woke up and asked the Prophet about how to spend his wealth. But the Prophet didn't answer until a new law about inheritance was revealed.

title: Women's Day with the Prophet
content: A woman asked the Prophet to teach her and other women. He agreed and they met on a specific day. The Prophet (ﷺ) taught them what Allah had taught him. Then he said that any woman who lost two or more children would be protected from Hellfire.

title: Victory Until the End
content: The Prophet (ﷺ) said: Some of my followers will stay strong and successful until Allah's final order comes. They will still be strong and successful when it arrives.

title: Understanding the Quran and Sunna
content: Muawiya bin Abi Sufyan said that he heard the Prophet say: 'If Allah wants to help someone, He gives them a good understanding of the Quran and how we live our lives according to it. I am just passing on what I know, but Allah is the one who truly gives knowledge. The state of this Muslim community will stay good until the Day of Judgment comes or until Allah's order arrives.'

title: Prophet's Refuge in Hard Times
content: Jabir bin Abdullah said that when the Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) received a verse about Allah sending punishment from above or below, he prayed: 'I seek refuge with Your Face, O Allah.' When another verse came about confusion and violence among Muslims, the Prophet said: 'These two warnings are easier than the previous ones'.

title: Prophet confirms a child's parentage
content: A bedouin man came to the Prophet. He said his wife had given birth to a black boy, and he suspected the boy wasn't his son. The Prophet (ﷺ) asked if he had camels. The bedouin said yes. The Prophet (ﷺ) asked about their color. The bedouin said they were red, with some grey ones too. The Prophet (ﷺ) asked where the grey came from. The bedouin said it was because of hereditary traits. The Prophet (ﷺ) said that's why the boy is black - he inherited his color from his ancestors. The Prophet (ﷺ) told him not to deny being the boy's father.

title: Pay Debt to Allah
content: A woman asked the Prophet about her mother's vow. Her mother had promised to go on Hajj but died before she could do it. The Prophet (ﷺ) said, 'Yes, you should still go on Hajj for your mother.' He explained that just like we pay off our parents' debts when they die, we should also fulfill their vows to Allah.

title: Don't Compare Yourself
content: Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) said: Don't wish to be like anyone except two people. First, someone who has money and uses it correctly. Second, someone who knows a lot about Islam and teaches others what they know.

title: Abortion and Blood Money
content: Umar asked us about a woman who has an abortion. I said I knew the answer because I heard the Prophet say that its blood money is either one male slave or one female slave. Umar told me to find someone to witness this, so I found Muhammad (ﷺ) bin Maslama and he confirmed what I said.

title: Blood Money for Abortion
content: Umar asked about the punishment for a woman who has an abortion. I said I remembered something from the Prophet. He said, 'What is it?' I said, 'I heard the Prophet say that if someone beats a pregnant woman and causes her to have an abortion, the family of the woman must give either a male or female slave as blood money.' Umar told me to find a witness to confirm this.

title: The Hour Will Not Come
content: The Prophet (ﷺ) said: The Day of Judgment will not happen until my followers do exactly what the people before them did. They will follow their actions step by step and measure for measure. Someone asked, 'Do you mean the Persians and Byzantines?' The Prophet (ﷺ) replied, 'Who else could it be?'

title: Following Previous Nations
content: The Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) said to his companions: 'You will follow the ways of those people who lived before you. You'll do things exactly like them, step by step and little by little. Even if they go into a small hole, you'll follow them.' His companions asked, 'Do you mean the Jews and Christians?' The Prophet (ﷺ) replied, 'Who else would it be?'

title: Adam's Son Shares Guilt
content: The Prophet (ﷺ) said that if someone is killed unfairly, the first son of Adam will share some responsibility for it. This is because he started the tradition of taking people's lives unjustly.

title: Bedouin's Pledge in Medina
content: A bedouin man became Muslim and promised to follow Allah's Messenger (ﷺ). Later, he got sick with a fever in Medina and asked the Prophet to cancel his promise. The Prophet (ﷺ) said no three times, but finally explained that Medina is like a place where bad things are removed and good things stay.

title: Umar's Wise Decision
content: 'Abdur-Rahman bin Auf told me that when Umar came back from his last Hajj, he said something that could be misunderstood. 'Abdur-Rahman advised him not to talk about it in Mina because the crowd might not understand and spread false information. Instead, they should wait until they reached Medina where the companions of the Prophet would be able to understand and explain Umar's words correctly.

title: Abu Huraira's Story
content: We were with Abu Huraira. He was wearing two linen clothes dyed red. He used his cloth to wipe his nose and said, 'Look at me cleaning my nose!' In the past, I would often faint from hunger between the mosque where Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) preached and Aisha's house. People thought I was crazy, but I wasn't. They just didn't know I was hungry.

title: Ibn Abbas' Eid Prayer
content: Ibn Abbas was asked if he had prayed with the Prophet on Eid. He said yes, but only because of their family connection. The Prophet (ﷺ) went to a spot near Kathir bin As-Salt's house and led the prayer without calling out for Adhan or Iqama. After the prayer, the Prophet ordered women to give charity, and they gave their jewelry to Bilal to collect.

title: The Prophet's Visit to Quba'
content: The Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) would visit the Quba' mosque. He sometimes walked there and sometimes rode a horse or other animal.

title: Aisha's Request for Burial
content: `Aisha asked Abdullah bin Az-Zubair to bury her with the other wives of the Prophet. She didn't want to be buried in the house where the Prophet is, because she didn't want people to think she was special just because she was there. Later, `Umar asked permission to be buried with the Prophet and Abu Bakr, but `Aisha agreed.

title: Aisha's Request for Burial
content: 'Aisha told Abdullah bin Az-Zubair to bury her with the other wives of the Prophet. She didn't want to be buried in the house where the Prophet was, because she didn't want people to think she was special just because she was there. Later, 'Umar asked 'Aisha if he could be buried with the Prophet and Abu Bakr. She said yes.

title: Prophet Muhammad's Prayer Time
content: Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) would pray the Asr prayer. After that, it was still daylight and you could walk to a place called Awali, which is about four or three miles from Medina.

title: Measuring Units in Prophet's Time
content: The Prophet 's (ﷺ) time used a measure called Sa' that was equal to one Mudd and one third of the Mudd we use today. But now, the Sa' has become bigger.

title: Blessing Measures in Medina
content: The Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) said to Allah: 'Please bless the people of Medina with good measures and weights.' He was talking about their Sa' and Mudd, which are units used to measure things like food.

title: Stoning of Adulterers
content: Ibn Umar said: The Jews brought a man and woman who had committed adultery to the Prophet. He ordered them to be stoned to death, which was done near the mosque where coffins were placed.

title: Uhud Mountain is Loved
content: Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) saw the Mountain of Uhud and said it loves us and we love it. He then made an area between two mountains in Medina a sacred place, just like Abraham made Mecca a sacred place.

title: Mosque Size and Space
content: Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) said that the space between his pulpit and the mosque wall was just big enough for a sheep to walk through, showing how small it was.

title: Prophet's House and Pulpit
content: Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) said: There is a special garden from Paradise between my house and where I preach. My pulpit is above the tank of Kauthar.

title: Horse Racing for Charity
content: The Prophet (ﷺ) arranged a horse racing event. Some horses were given less food before the race to make them faster. They ran from Al-Hafya to Thaniyat-al-Wada`. Other horses, which weren't prepared, ran between Thaniyat-al-Wada` and the mosque of Bani Zuraiq. Abdullah was one of the participants in this event.

title: Ibn Umar Remembers Omar's Sermon
content: Ibn Umar was present when his friend and companion, Omar, gave a sermon on the Prophet's pulpit.

title: Uthman's Sermon
content: As-Sa'ib bin Yazid heard Uthman bin Affan giving a sermon from the Prophet's pulpit.

title: Aisha's Copper Water Vessel
content: Aisha said that there was a big copper container used for her and the Prophet to take water from when they bathed together.

title: Prophet's Alliance and Prayer
content: The Prophet (ﷺ) brought together the Ansar and Quraish people in my house at Medina. He asked Allah to protect us from Bani Sulaim for one month, every time we finish our daily prayers.

title: Prophet's Alliance with Ansar
content: The Prophet (ﷺ) brought the people from Medina and Mecca together in my house. He asked Allah to help them against their enemies during prayer for one month.

title: Abdullah meets Abu Burda
content: When Abu Burda arrived in Medina, Abdullah bin Salam met him and said, 'Come to my house. I'll give you a bowl that the Prophet used to drink from.' He took Abu Burda home, gave him a special drink called Sawiq with dates, then they went to the mosque where the Prophet prayed.

title: Prayer in Aqiq Valley
content: Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) told me, 'Someone came to me from God while I was in the Aqiq valley. He said,

title: Miqat Points for Pilgrims
content: Ibn Umar said the Prophet told him to use Qarn as a meeting point for people from Najd. For those from Sham, it's Al-Juhfa. And for Medina, Dhul-Hulaifa is the place. He also said Yemenites should go to Yalamlam. When he mentioned Iraq, he said it wasn't Muslim at that time.

title: Prophet's Blessed Dream
content: Abdullah bin Umar said the Prophet had a dream in Dhul-Hulaifa. In his dream, he was told: 'You are in a blessed valley.'

title: Prayer and Allah's Decree
content: Ibn Umar said the Prophet prayed in the morning. After bowing down, he said 'Praise is all yours, Allah.' In his final prayer, he said 'Curse so-and-so' (two names). Then Allah revealed a message: 'It's not for you to decide if they get mercy or punished. They are wrongdoers'.

title: Prayer at Night
content: One night, the Prophet came to Ali's house with Fatima. He said, 'Don't you pray?' Ali replied, 'Our souls are in Allah's hands. When He wants us to get up, we will.' The Prophet (ﷺ) left without saying anything else. As he was leaving, Ali heard him say, 'Humans are more argumentative than anything else'.

title: Prophet Muhammad Meets Jews
content: One day in the mosque, Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) came out and said, 'Let's go to the Jewish place of worship.' We followed him until we arrived. He stood up and called out to them, saying, 'Jews, become Muslims and you'll be safe!' They replied, 'You've told us God's message, Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ).' The Prophet (ﷺ) then said, 'That's what I want: become Muslims and you'll be safe.' They said the same thing back. The Prophet (ﷺ) repeated his words a third time and added, 'Remember that the earth belongs to God. If any of you own property here, sell it because I want to force you out of this land. The earth is for God and His Messenger.'

title: Noah's Message on Judgement Day
content: Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) said: 'On the Day of Resurrection, Noah will be asked if he delivered Allah's message. He'll say yes. Then his people will be asked if they received it, and they'll say no one warned them. Noah will ask for witnesses, and he'll name me and my followers as his witnesses. We Muslims will then be brought forward to confirm this.'

title: Fair Trade for Dates
content: The Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) sent a governor to Khaibar. The governor brought back some good dates and said they were rare. The Prophet (ﷺ) asked if all the dates in Khaibar were like this. The governor replied, no, they mixed good dates with bad ones. The Prophet (ﷺ) told them not to do that. He said either take one measure of good dates for one measure of bad ones, or sell the good ones and use the money to buy the bad ones.

title: Fair Trade for Dates
content: The Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) sent a governor to Khaibar. The governor brought some good dates back to the Prophet. The Prophet (ﷺ) asked if all the dates in Khaibar were like that. The governor said no, they would trade one Sa' of good dates for two Sas of mixed dates. The Prophet (ﷺ) told them not to do that. He said either take one Sa' of each kind or sell one and use its money to buy the other.

title: Judges Get Reward
content: Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) said: 'If a judge makes a fair decision based on what he knows, and it's correct, he'll get double the reward. If he makes a wrong decision but tries his best, he still gets some reward.'

title: Abu Musa's Request to Enter
content: Abu Musa asked permission to see Umar but was told to wait. Umar then said, 'Let Abdullah bin Qais come in.' When he arrived, Umar asked him why he did something specific. Abdullah replied that the Prophet had instructed them to do it. Umar said, 'Show me proof for this or I'll take action against you.' Abdullah went to find witnesses and found Abu Sa'id Al-Khudri, who confirmed what Abdullah had done. Umar said he was unaware of this instruction from the Prophet because he was busy with business.

title: Abu Huraira's Special Gift
content: Abu Huraira said that people think he shares many stories about the Prophet. He was a poor man who stuck with the Prophet, happy to have enough food. The Muhajirin traded in markets and the Ansar took care of their properties. One day, the Prophet said: 'If you wear your cloak while listening to me, then fold it over yourself, you'll never forget what I say.' Abu Huraira did this and since then he has never forgotten anything the Prophet told him.

title: Jabir's Belief in Dajjal
content: Muhammad (ﷺ) bin Al-Munkadir said he saw Jabir swearing by Allah that Ibn Sayyad was the Dajjal. When asked, Jabir explained that he had heard Umar swear by Allah about this matter in front of the Prophet and the Prophet didn't disagree.

title: Horses and Their Purpose
content: Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) said that horses can be used for three things: to get a reward in the next life, as protection from harm, or as a source of sin. If someone keeps horses for Allah's Cause and lets them roam free, everything they eat will be counted as good deeds. Even if the horses break their ropes and run around, it will still count as good deeds. If the horses drink water from a river without being asked to, it will also be counted as good deeds. Horses kept for a person's livelihood but with the intention of using them for Allah's Cause are like a shelter from poverty. But if someone keeps horses just to show off or feel proud, they become a source of sin. When asked about donkeys, Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) said that anyone who does good things, no matter how small, will see it in the next life, and so will those who do bad things.

title: Bathing after Menstruation
content: A woman asked the Prophet about bathing after her periods. He said to use a perfumed cloth to clean herself. She didn't understand, so she asked again. The Prophet (ﷺ) explained that she should use it to clean herself. Aisha then realized what he meant and told the woman.

title: Gifts and Aversion
content: Ibn Abbas said that Um Hufaid gave the Prophet some butter, dried yoghurt, and meat. The Prophet (ﷺ) asked to have it served on a tablecloth, but he didn't eat any of it because he didn't like it. If eating it was forbidden, people wouldn't have eaten it in front of him.

title: Garlic and Onions Near the Prophet
content: Jabir bin Abdullah said that the Prophet told him to stay away from our mosque if he had eaten garlic or onions. He also said this when a plate of cooked vegetables was brought to him at Badr, but it smelled bad because of some strong-smelling foods inside. The Prophet (ﷺ) didn't eat it and instead told one of his companions to eat it.

title: A Lady Asks for Advice
content: A woman came to the Prophet and talked about something. He gave her a task. She said, 'What if I don't find you?' The Prophet (ﷺ) replied, 'If you can't find me, go to Abu Bakr.'

title: Believe in Allah's Message
content: When the people of the Book read from their book in Hebrew and then explained it to us in Arabic, the Prophet said: 'Don't believe or disbelieve what they say. Instead, say: We believe in Allah and what is revealed to us, and also in what is revealed to you.'

title: Ask the Quran First
