content: Ibn Abbas said: 'Why do you ask people of other faiths about things? You have the Quran, which is newer and more accurate. It's pure and unchanged. Allah told us that others changed their scriptures to make money. Doesn't knowing what's in the Quran stop you from asking them?'

title: Recite the Quran Together
content: Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) said: When you and others agree on what the Quran means, keep reading it together. But if you disagree about its meaning, stop reading it for now until you can agree again.

title: When to Stop Reading Quran
content: Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) said: Read the Quran as long as you agree on its meaning. If you disagree, stop reading it for now.

title: Prophet's Last Request
content: When the Prophet was near death, some men were in his house. He said to them, 'Come closer so I can write something for you.' `Umar said, 'You're very sick and we have the Quran, which is enough for us.' The people disagreed. Some wanted him to write something down, while others agreed with `Umar. The Prophet (ﷺ) got upset and told them to leave him alone.

title: Jabir's Story About Ihram
content: I heard Jabir say that when we were on our way to Mecca for Hajj, the Prophet told us to stop being in a state of Ihram. He said we could go back to our normal lives and be with our wives again. But some people were worried because they thought if they did this, they wouldn't be able to perform their Hajj correctly. The Prophet (ﷺ) stood up and explained that he would have done the same thing if he hadn't brought a special animal for sacrifice. He told us to stop being in Ihram and follow his instructions.

title: Pray before Maghrib
content: The Prophet (ﷺ) said to perform a prayer before the evening prayer. He repeated this three times, then said that anyone who wants to pray can do so, because he did not want people to think it was something they had to do.

title: Prophet Muhammad's Innocence
content: After people spread false rumors about me, the Prophet called two men to ask their advice. They were Ali and Usama. Usama said I was innocent, but Ali suggested asking my slave girl Barira what she knew. The Prophet (ﷺ) asked Barira if she had seen anything suspicious. She said no, just that I sometimes left dough unattended and goats ate it. Then the Prophet stood on a platform and called for help against those who had hurt me with false rumors. He said he only knew good about his family.

title: Abuse of the Prophet's Wife
content: The Prophet (ﷺ) spoke to his people. He said he was proud of Allah and thanked Him. Then he asked, 'What do you think I should do about people who are saying bad things about my wife? I have never found anything wrong with her.' Aisha told someone that she wanted to go back to her parents' house. The Prophet (ﷺ) allowed it and sent a slave with her. An Ansari man said, 'This is not right for us to talk about. This is a big lie.'

title: Prophet's Messenger to Yemen
content: The Prophet (ﷺ) sent his companion Mu'adh to Yemen

title: Inviting People to Islam
content: When Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) sent Mu'adh to Yemen, he said: 'You are going to a people who already have a scripture. First, tell them about Allah's oneness. If they agree with that, then teach them to pray five times a day and night. Also, tell them to give some of their wealth to the poor. If they accept this, take some of their wealth as charity from the rich ones, but don't take everything.'

title: Allah's Right and Our Duty
content: Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) asked Mu`adh, 'What does Allah want from us?' Mu`adh said he didn't know. The Prophet (ﷺ) replied, 'We must only worship Allah and not add anything else.' He then asked Mu`adh what our right is to Allah if we do that. Mu`adh said he didn't know again. The Prophet (ﷺ) said, 'Then Allah will not punish us for it.'

title: One-third of the Quran
content: Abu Sa'id Al-Khudri told us that a man was reciting 'Say: He is Allah, the One' many times in his prayer. In the morning, he went to the Prophet and said it wasn't enough on its own. The Prophet (ﷺ) replied, 'This is equal to one-third of the Quran'.

title: The Prophet's Approval
content: A companion led his friends in prayer and finished with a special verse from the Quran. When he got back, they told the Prophet about it. The Prophet (ﷺ) asked him why he did that. He said because it talks about Allah's good qualities and he loves to recite it. The Prophet (ﷺ) then said to tell him that Allah loves him too.

title: Be Merciful, Allah Will
content: Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) said: Allah will not be kind to those who do not show kindness to others.

title: The Prophet Visits a Dying Child
content: Usama bin Zaid said the Prophet got a message from his daughter. Her son was dying and she wanted him to come see him. The Prophet (ﷺ) told her messenger to tell her that everything belongs to Allah, and He decides when someone's time is up. But she sent another message saying the Prophet must come. So he went with Sa'd and Mu'adh. When they got there, the child was struggling to breathe. The Prophet (ﷺ) started crying. Sa'd asked him why he was crying. The Prophet (ﷺ) said it's because Allah put mercy in his heart, and He only shows mercy to those who are kind to others.

title: God's Patience with People
content: The Prophet (ﷺ) said: 'Allah is more patient than anyone when people say bad things about Him. They think He has children, but He still gives them good health and food.'

title: Five Secrets of Allah
content: Ibn Umar said the Prophet said: The keys to things that are hidden from us are five. Only Allah knows them. These secrets are: (1) What is in a woman's womb, only Allah knows. (2) What will happen tomorrow, only Allah knows. (3) When it will rain, only Allah knows. (4) Where and when we will die, only Allah knows. (5) When the Day of Judgment will come, only Allah knows.

title: Don't Believe False Claims
content: Aisha said that if someone tells you Muhammad (ﷺ) has seen Allah or knows the Unseen, they are lying. The Quran says no one can see Allah (6:103) and only Allah knows the Unseen.

title: Prophet's Guidance on Prayer
content: We used to pray behind the Prophet. We would say 'As-Salamu 'Al-Allah'. The Prophet (ﷺ) said, 'Say: at-Tahiyatu lil-lahi was-sala-watu wattaiyibatu.' He also taught us to say: 'as-salamu `alaika aiyyuha-n-nabiyyu wa rahmatu-l-lahi wa barakatuhu. as-salamu `alaina wa `ala `ibadi-l-lahi as-salihin.' Then he said, 'I bear witness that there is no god but Allah, and I bear witness that Muhammad (ﷺ) is His servant and Messenger.'

title: The Day of Judgement
content: The Prophet (ﷺ) said that on the Day of Resurrection, Allah will hold the earth with one hand and fold the heaven with the other. Then He will ask, 'Where are the leaders of the world?'

title: Seeking Refuge with Allah
content: The Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) used to say: 'I seek refuge in You. There is no one worthy of worship except You, and nothing dies but humans and jinn.'

title: Hell's Fire Will Be Full
content: The Prophet (ﷺ) said: 'People will be thrown into Hell and it will keep asking if there are more. The Lord of the world will put His foot on it, and its sides will come close together. It will say, 'Enough! Enough!' because of God's honor and generosity.' Paradise will stay big enough for people until God creates more and lets them live in its extra space.

title: The Prophet's Night Prayer
content: Ibn 'Abbas said that the Prophet used to say a prayer at night. He would say: 'O Allah, all praise is for you. You are the Lord of heaven and earth. All praise is for you, because you take care of everything in them. All praise is for you, because you are the light that shines everywhere. Your word is true, your promise is true, meeting you is true, paradise is true, hellfire is true, and the Day of Judgment is true. O Allah, I give myself to you, I believe in you, and I depend on you. I ask for forgiveness for my past and future sins, both secret and public ones. You are my only God, and there's no one else I worship.'

title: Don't Boast in Prayer
content: We were on a journey with the Prophet. When we climbed high places, we'd say 'Allahu Akbar'. The Prophet (ﷺ) said, 'Don't strain yourselves too much. You're not calling someone who can't hear or see you.' He then told me to say 'La hawla wala quwwata illa billah' because it's a treasure from Paradise.

title: Abu Bakr's Prayer Request
content: Abu Bakr asked the Prophet to teach him a prayer. The Prophet (ﷺ) said: 'Say: I've hurt myself badly, only Allah can forgive me. Please forgive me.'

title: Abu Bakr's Prayer Request
content: Abu Bakr asked the Prophet to teach him a prayer he could say during his daily prayers. The Prophet (ﷺ) said, 'Say: O Allah, I have done wrong to myself many times. Only you can forgive sins. Please forgive me.'

title: Gabriel's Message to the Prophet
content: Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) said that Gabriel came and told him that Allah had heard what his people were saying in response to him.

title: Praying for Good Decisions
content: The Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) taught his friends to pray before making important decisions. He said: 'If you want to do something, first pray a two-rak'at prayer that's not required. Then say: O Allah, I ask You for guidance because You know everything. Help me with Your power and give me what's best. If this thing is good for me now and in the future, make it happen easily. Give me blessings in this matter. But if it's not good for me, take it away and show me something better that I'll be happy with.'

title: The Prophet's Oath
content: The Prophet (ﷺ) often said, 'I swear by the One Who changes people's hearts'.

title: Memorizing Allah's Names
content: Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) said that Allah has ninety-nine names. If someone remembers all of these names, they will go to Paradise. To remember something means to know it by heart.

title: Before Sleeping, Say This
content: When you go to bed, gently sweep the dust off your blanket three times with the edge of your clothes. Then say: 'In Your name, my Lord, I lay down and get up. If You take my soul, forgive it. And if You return it to me, protect it as You protect Your righteous servants.'

title: Morning and Night Prayers
content: When the Prophet went to sleep, he would say 'In Allah's name I live and die.' When he woke up in the morning, he would say 'Praise be to God who gives us life after death and back to life again.'

title: The Prophet's Morning and Night Prayers
content: Abu Dharr said that the Prophet used to say 'In Your name we die and live' when he went to bed at night. And in the morning, he would say 'Praise be to God who gives us life after He has taken it from us, and to Him is our return'.

title: Protecting the Unborn Child
content: When a couple wants to have a child, they should say 'Bismillah' and 'Allahumma jannibna ash-Shaitan, wa Jannib ash-Shaitana ma razaqtana'. This will keep Satan away from their unborn child.

title: Hunting with Dogs
content: I asked the Prophet about my trained hunting dogs. He said: 'If you let them go and say Allah's name, eat what they catch. If your tool hits an animal but doesn't kill it, you can still eat it.'

title: Mention Allah's Name While Eating
content: Some new Muslims were bringing meat to the Prophet. People were worried that they might not have said 'In the name of Allah' when slaughtering the animals. The Prophet (ﷺ) told them to say it and then eat.

title: Sacrificing Animals to Allah
content: Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) slaughtered two rams as a sacrifice. He mentioned the name of Allah and said 'Allahu-Akbar' while slaughtering them.

title: Sacrificing on Eid Day
content: Jundab saw the Prophet on a special day. The Prophet (ﷺ) prayed and then gave a talk. He said: If you slaughtered your animal before praying, get another one to replace it. And if you haven't slaughtered yet, do so now and remember Allah's name.

title: Swearing by Allah
content: Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) said: Do not take your family members' names when swearing. If you want to swear, use the name of Allah instead.

title: Khubaib's Last Moments
content: Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) sent ten people to gather information from the enemy. Khubaib Al-Ansari was one of them. When they were caught, he asked for a razor to clean himself. They took him outside Mecca and killed him. Before dying, Khubaib said: 'I don't care how I'm killed as a Muslim. If Allah wants, He'll bless my body parts.' The Prophet (ﷺ) told his companions about the deaths of those ten men on the same day they happened.

title: Allah's Sense of Pride
content: The Prophet (ﷺ) said: Allah has a strong sense of pride. He doesn't like shameful actions or sins, and He loves praise more than anyone else does.

title: Mercy Overcomes Allah's Anger
content: The Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) said: When Allah created the world, He wrote a message in His book. This message is about Himself and it's kept with Him on His throne. The message says: 'My mercy is greater than My anger'.

title: Allah's Promise of Nearness
content: The Prophet (ﷺ) said: Allah says, 'I am like what my slave thinks I am. If he remembers me when alone, I remember him too. If he remembers me with others, I remember him with even more people. If he comes closer to me a little bit, I come closer to him a lot. And if he walks towards me, I run towards him.'

title: Prophet's Refuge with Allah
content: Jabir bin Abdullah said: When the Verse 'Say: He has Power to send torments on you from above' was revealed, the Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) said, 'I take refuge with Your Face.' Then Allah revealed 'or from underneath your feet'. The Prophet (ﷺ) said again, 'I seek refuge with Your Face!' After that, Allah revealed 'or confuse you in party-strife'. The Prophet (ﷺ) then said, 'This is easier'.

title: The Prophet Denies Dajjal's Claim
content: Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) was talking about Ad-Dajjal. He said Allah is not hidden from us and doesn't have one eye. He pointed to his own eye to show this. The Prophet (ﷺ) also said that Ad-Dajjal will be blind in one eye, but the other eye will look like a big grape.

title: Warning about the Dajjal
content: Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) said that Allah always warns his people about a one-eyed liar called Ad-Dajjal. This person is one-eyed, but Allah is not. The word 'unbeliever' is written between this man's eyes.

title: Coitus Interruptus and Fate
content: During a battle with Bani Al-Mustaliq, some Muslim men captured women and wanted to have sex with them without getting them pregnant. They asked the Prophet about this. The Prophet (ﷺ) said it's better not to do that because Allah already knows who will be born until the Day of Judgment.

title: Muhammad's Intercession on Judgement Day
content: On the Day of Resurrection, believers will gather and ask Adam to intercede for them. But Adam says he's not fit because of his mistakes. He tells them to go to Noah, who also refuses due to his own mistakes. They then go to Abraham, Moses, and Jesus, each of whom also declines. Finally, they come to the Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) (PBUH), who asks Allah for permission to intercede. When he's allowed to speak, he praises Allah and asks for forgiveness for those who say 'La ilaha illallah' with good intentions in their hearts, no matter how small.

title: Allah's Hand is Full
content: Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) said that Allah's hand is always full. His wealth doesn't decrease even when He spends a lot every day and night. Everything He has created, from the heavens to the earth, hasn't reduced what He has in His hand. Allah's throne is above water, and with one of His hands, He balances justice. With the other hand, He raises or lowers people as He wishes.

title: The Day of Resurrection
content: Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) said: On the Day of Judgement, Allah will hold the Earth in His left hand and the Heavens in His right. Then He will say, 'I am the King.'

title: The Day of Judgement
content: On the Day of Resurrection, Allah will take hold of the Earth with one hand and the Heavens with the other. Then He will say, 'I am the King.'

title: Prophet smiles at a Jewish man
content: A Jewish man came to the Prophet and said that Allah would hold all creation on one finger. The Prophet (ﷺ) smiled, showing he was amazed by this idea, and then recited a verse from the Quran that says people don't understand Allah's greatness.

title: Prophet Smiles at Misguided Man
content: A man from the people of scripture came to the Prophet and said that Allah will hold the heavens on one finger, the earth on another, and all creation on a third. He would say 'I am the King'. The Prophet (ﷺ) smiled when he heard this and then recited: 'They have not made a fair judgment about Allah.'

title: Sa'd's Strong Sense of Honour
content: Saad said he would kill anyone caught with his wife. This news reached the Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ). He explained that Saad had a strong sense of honour, but Allah has even more honour than him. Allah is so proud that He made shameful acts and sins wrong. No one likes people to apologize and ask for forgiveness more than Allah does. That's why Allah sent prophets to warn us and bring good news. Allah loves praise and promised paradise to those who do good.

title: Prophet Asks for Quran
content: The Prophet (ﷺ) asked a man if he had any parts of the Quran. The man said yes and named some Suras.

title: Prophet Muhammad's Good News
content: The Prophet (ﷺ) was with his companion Imran bin Hussain when some people from Bani Tamim came. He told them, 'You have good news!' They asked for more. Later, some Yemenites arrived and the Prophet said, 'You accept the good news because Bani Tamim refused it.' The Yemenites said they accepted the good news to learn about Islam. They asked the Prophet about creation. He replied that Allah was alone before creating the universe. His Throne is above water. He created the heavens and earth and wrote everything in a Book. Meanwhile, Imran's she-camel ran away while he was with the Prophet. He went to find it but it had gone beyond a mirage.

title: Allah's Right Hand is Full
content: The Prophet (ﷺ) said: Allah's right hand is always full. It doesn't get less no matter how much He gives to people every day and night. Think about all the things He has given since creating the sky and earth, but it hasn't reduced what's in His right hand. His throne is above water, and with His other hand, He decides who lives or dies.

title: Zainab's Marriage to the Prophet
content: Anas said that Zaid bin Haritha came to the Prophet complaining about his wife. The Prophet (ﷺ) told him, 'Be afraid of Allah and take care of your wife.' Aisha thought the Prophet wouldn't hide a secret verse from the Quran if he was hiding something about Zainab's marriage. Zainab used to brag to the other wives that she was married by Allah himself, not her family. Thabit said a verse (33:37) was revealed because of Zainab and Zaid's situation.

title: Zainab's Marriage and Veiling
content: Anas bin Malik said: The Prophet (ﷺ) gave a wedding feast for Zainab when he married her. She would often boast to the other wives, saying she was chosen by Allah in heaven. A verse about veiling women was revealed because of this.

title: Mercy Precedes Anger
content: The Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) said to Abu Huraira: When Allah finished creating the world, He wrote on His throne that His mercy comes before His anger.

title: Paradise for Believers
content: The Prophet (ﷺ) said: If someone believes in Allah and follows me by praying regularly and fasting during Ramadan, they will go to Paradise. It doesn't matter if they move to a new place or stay where they were born. The companions asked the Prophet if they should tell others about this good news. He replied that there are 100 levels of happiness in Paradise for those who fight for Allah's cause. The distance between each level is huge, like from the sky to the Earth. If you ask Allah for something, ask for Firdaus, which is the highest and best part of Paradise. It has a special throne where rivers flow.

title: Sun's Movement Explained
content: I was in the mosque with the Prophet. When the sun went down, he asked me where it goes. I said I didn't know. He explained that the sun sets and asks permission to bow down, then is allowed to do so. It will eventually rise from the west. The Prophet (ﷺ) recited a verse from the Quran: 'The sun moves in its set path'.

title: Finding the Last Part of Surat-at-Tauba
content: Abu Bakr sent for me, Zaid bin Thabit. I collected the Quran until I found the last part of Surat Tauba with Abu Khuza'ima Al-Ansari. No one else had it. The verses are: 'There has come to you a messenger from among yourselves...'

title: Prophet's Prayer in Difficulty
content: When the Prophet faced a problem, he would say: 'There is no god but Allah. He knows everything.' 'There is no god but Allah. The Lord of the great throne is mighty.' 'There is no god but Allah. The Lord of the heavens and earth is kind.'

title: Moses on the Day of Judgement
content: On the Day of Resurrection, people will fall asleep. Then I will wake up first and see Moses holding one of the pillars of God's Throne.

title: Moses on the Day of Judgement
content: On the Day of Resurrection, people will suddenly fall asleep. Then I, the Prophet, will be the first to wake up and see Moses holding one of the pillars of God's Throne.

title: Angels Watch Over Us
content: Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) said that angels stay with us at night and during the day. They gather before Asr and Fajr prayers. The angels who stayed overnight ask Allah about us, but He already knows everything. They ask, 'What state did you leave our slaves in?' The angels reply, 'We found them praying when we left, and they were still praying when we returned'.

title: Charity is Rewarded
content: Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) said: If someone gives a small amount of money in charity from their own earnings, Allah will accept it and reward them greatly. The Prophet (ﷺ) also said that only good things are accepted by Allah.

title: Difficult Times, Allah's Reminders
content: When things get hard, the Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) would say: 'There is no one worthy of worship except Allah. He is great and patient. There is no one worthy of worship except Allah, the owner of a powerful throne. There is no one worthy of worship except Allah, the owner of the heavens and the owner of a noble throne.'

title: Ali Sends Gold to Prophet
content: The Prophet (ﷺ) received some gold from Ali in Yemen. He gave it to four men: Al-Aqra' bin H`Abis, Uyaina bin Badr, Alqama bin 'Ulatha, and Zaid AI-Khail. The Quraish and Ansar were unhappy because the men came from Najd. They thought the Prophet was giving too much power to outsiders. The Prophet (ﷺ) said he wanted to make friends with them. A man with a strange appearance spoke out against the Prophet, saying 'Be afraid of Allah!' The Prophet (ﷺ) replied that if he disobeyed Allah, who would obey Him? He trusted himself over others, but this man didn't trust him. Someone asked permission to kill the man, but the Prophet stopped them. After the man left, the Prophet said some people from his family would one day read the Quran but not understand it. They would leave Islam and hurt Muslims.

title: Abu Dharr asks about the Sun
content: I asked the Prophet about a verse in the Quran. He said that when it says 'the sun runs on its fixed course', it means the sun moves under Allah's Throne.

title: Prayer Times and Seeing Allah
content: Jarir was sitting with the Prophet. He looked at the full moon and said: 'You will see your Lord like you see this moon, without any trouble. If you can, pray before sunrise and before sunset.'

title: Seeing Allah in the Hereafter
content: The Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) said to Jarir bin Abdullah: 'You will definitely see your Lord with your own eyes.'

title: Seeing Allah on Judgement Day
content: Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) came out to us one night when the moon was full. He said, 'You will see your Lord on the Day of Resurrection just like you can see this full moon now.'

title: Seeing Allah on Judgment Day
content: Some people asked the Prophet: 'Will we see our Lord on the Day of Resurrection?' He said: 'Do you have trouble seeing the moon at night or the sun when it's clear?' They said no. He said: 'You will see Him like that.' Allah will gather all people and say: 'Whoever worshipped something in life, follow it.' Those who worshipped the sun will follow it, those who worshipped the moon will follow it, and so on. Only one group of good people will remain. Allah will come to them and say: 'I am your Lord.' They will deny Him and wait for their Lord to come. When He comes in His true form, they will recognize Him and say: 'You are our Lord.' Then a bridge will be laid across Hell, and only the Prophet and his followers will cross it first. The Apostles will pray on that day: 'O Allah, save us!' In Hell, there are hooks like thorns that will punish people according to their deeds. Some people will stay in Hell because of their bad actions, some will be torn by the hooks, and some will be punished but then relieved. When Allah finishes judging people, He will take out those who worshipped only Him from Hell through His Mercy. The angels will recognize them by the marks on their foreheads where they used to prostrate. They will come out of Hell completely burnt, but then water will bring them back to life and they will grow like seeds in mud. Allah will finish judging people, and one man will be left facing Hell. He will ask Allah to turn his face away from the fire because it's hurting him. If Allah grants this, He will ask if he wants anything else. The man will promise not to ask for more. So Allah will turn his face away from Hell. When he faces Paradise, he'll stay quiet until Allah asks him: 'Didn't you promise not to ask for more?' The man will say no and keep asking till Allah laughs at his words. Then He will say: 'Enter Paradise.' When the man enters, Allah will tell him: 'Wish for anything.' So he will ask, and Allah will remind him to wish for certain things. When there's nothing left to wish for, Allah will say: 'This is yours, and its equal as well.'

title: Seeing Allah on Judgment Day
content: Some people asked the Prophet: 'Will we see our Lord on Judgment Day?' He said: 'Do you have trouble seeing the moon at night or the sun when it's clear?' They said no. He said: 'Then you will be able to see Him like that.' On Judgment Day, Allah will gather all people and say: 'Whoever worshipped something other than Me should follow it.' Some people will follow the sun, some the moon, and others false gods. Only believers will remain. Then Allah will come and say: 'I am your Lord.' They will deny Him until He shows Himself in a way they know. They will then accept Him. A bridge will be laid over Hell, and only prophets will speak on that day. They will pray for mercy. In Hell, there are hooks like thorny plants. People's deeds will determine how long they stay in Hell or get cut by the hooks. Allah will show mercy to some people and take them out of Hell. Angels will recognize believers in Hell by their foreheads, which won't burn because of prostration. They will come out, be given water that makes them grow like seeds, and enter Paradise. One man will remain until he enters Paradise last. He will ask Allah to turn his face away from the fire and promise not to ask for anything else. When he faces Paradise, he'll stay quiet and then ask to enter. Allah will remind him to wish for things and say: 'That is for you, and its equal as well.'

title: Seeing Allah on Judgment Day
content: Some of the companions asked the Prophet if they would see their Lord on Judgment Day. He said that it would be as easy for them to see Him as seeing the sun and moon in a clear sky. On that day, people will follow what they used to worship. The Christians with their crosses, the Jews with their idols, and others with their gods will go to Hell. Only those who worshipped Allah will remain. They will be asked if they want water, but when they drink, they will fall into Hell instead. When only those who truly believed in Allah are left, He will come to them in a different form than before. They will say He is not their Lord, and only the Prophets will speak up for Him. Then Allah will ask if they know any sign that can help them recognize Him. They will say it's the Shin, and then every believer will prostrate before Him. Those who used to pretend to worship Allah just for show will try but won't be able to. The bridge over Hell will be laid out, with hooks and thorns on both sides. Some believers will cross quickly, while others will get scratched or fall into Hell. The last person will be dragged across. On that day, the believers will ask Allah to save their brothers who used to pray and fast with them. Allah will tell them to take out those in whose hearts they find faith equal to a Dinar, then half a Dinar, and finally an atom's weight of faith. The prophets and angels will intercede, and finally Allah's Intercession will remain. He will take some people from the Fire and throw them into the River of Life, where they will grow like seeds carried by a torrent. They will come out as pearls with golden necklaces and enter Paradise.

title: Prophet Muhammad's Intercession
content: On the Day of Resurrection, believers will be kept waiting and worried. They'll ask Adam to intercede for them, but he says he's not fit because of his mistakes. He sends them to Noah, who also refuses due to his own mistake. Then they go to Abraham, Moses, and Jesus, each of whom declines due to their past mistakes. Finally, they come to Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ), who asks Allah's permission to enter His House. When allowed in, he falls into prostration before Allah, who tells him to speak and intercede. Muhammad (ﷺ) will be granted the power to take people out of Hell and let them enter Paradise.

title: Patience for Ansar
content: Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) gathered the Ansar in a tent and told them to be patient until they meet Allah and him. He said he would be at Al-Kauthar lake when that time comes.

title: Prophet's Tahajjud Prayer
content: When the Prophet prayed at night, he would say: 'O Allah, all praise is for You. You take care of the heavens and the earth. All praise is for You. You are the light in the world. Your words are true. You will do what you promised. Meeting you is true. Paradise is real. The fire is real. I trust only in You. I complain to You about my enemies, using your evidence. Forgive me for past and future sins, both public and secret ones that you know of. There's no one worthy of worship but You.'

title: God Speaks Directly to Us
content: Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) said: 'On the Day of Judgment, every person will hear God speaking directly to them. There won't be anyone between them to translate or a barrier to hide Him.'

title: Two Types of Paradise
content: The Prophet (ﷺ) said that there will be two types of paradise. One is made of silver and the other of gold. Everything in these parades, including utensils, will also be made of silver or gold. However, people won't be able to see Allah directly because of a special cover over His face.

title: Lying to Take Something
content: The Prophet (ﷺ) said that if someone takes something from a Muslim by lying and saying it's theirs, Allah will be angry with them. He then read a verse from the Quran that says people who lie to get something they want won't have any good things in the next life. They won't even be able to talk to or see Allah.

title: Three Types of People Allah Will Not Speak To
content: The Prophet (ﷺ) said there are three types of people who will not be spoken to by Allah on the Day of Resurrection. They are: a person who lies about getting a better price for something, a person who lies after the afternoon prayer to take someone else's property, and a person who stops others from using extra water. On that day, Allah will say to this last type of person, 'Today I will stop giving you blessings because you stopped others from using what they didn't need'.

title: Sacred Months and Protection
content: The Prophet (ﷺ) said: 'Time has come back to its original state. The year is twelve months, with four sacred months in a row: Dhul-Qa'da, Dhul-Hijja, Muharram, and Rajab Mudar. He asked us which month it was, but we didn't know. Then he said 'Isn't it Dhul-Hijja?' We said yes. He asked about the town, and we said Allah and His Apostle knew better. Then he said 'Isn't it Mecca?' He asked what day it was, and we said Allah and His Apostle knew better. Then he said 'Isn't it the Day of An-Nahr (slaughtering of sacrifices) for your animals?' The Prophet (ﷺ) then reminded us that our lives, properties, and honor are sacred to each other. We should meet our Lord with good deeds and not go astray by harming one another.

title: Patience and Mercy
content: A woman whose son was dying asked the Prophet for help. He sent a message saying that everything has its time and she should be patient and hope for Allah's reward. When he visited her, the child was given to him while still breathing. The Prophet (ﷺ) started crying, so Sa'd bin 'Ubada asked why. The Prophet (ﷺ) said that Allah is merciful only to those who are kind to others.

title: Paradise and Hell Argue
content: The Prophet (ﷺ) said that one day Paradise and Hell argued in front of Allah. Paradise asked why only poor people entered it, while Hell said it was filled with arrogant people. Allah replied that Paradise is His Mercy and Hell is His Punishment. He creates some people for Hell and throws them into it. When Hell is full, it will say 'Enough!' three times before Allah puts His Foot on it.

title: People from Hell Enter Paradise
content: The Prophet (ﷺ) said that some people will be punished in Hell for their sins. But Allah's mercy is so great that He will forgive them and let them enter Paradise. These people are called Al-Jahannamiyyin, which means 'the people of Hell'.

title: A Jewish Rabbi Visits the Prophet
content: A Jewish Rabbi came to see the Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ). He said that Allah would put all of creation on one finger and then say, 'I am the King.' The Prophet (ﷺ) smiled and said, 'They don't understand how great Allah is'.

title: Prophet's Night Prayer Routine
content: Ibn Abbas stayed overnight at his aunt Maimuna's house. The Prophet (ﷺ) was with her. He talked to his wife and then fell asleep. When it was late at night, the Prophet woke up and looked at the sky. He recited a verse from the Quran: 'In the creation of the heavens and earth...' (3:190). Then he performed wudu (ablution), brushed his teeth, and prayed 11 rakats. Bilal gave the adhan call, so the Prophet led the Fajr prayer.

title: Mercy Precedes Anger
content: Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) said: When Allah created the world and all living things, He wrote on His special chair: 'My mercy comes before My anger.'

title: Creation and Destiny
content: Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) said: 'When a person is created in the womb of their mother, it takes 40 days to form their body. Then they become a clot of blood for another 40 days, and then like flesh for another 40 days. An angel is sent to them by Allah to write four things: how long they will live, when they will die, what good or bad deeds they will do in life, and whether they will be happy or unhappy after death. Then the soul is given to them. A person may start doing good deeds that are like those of people who go to Paradise, but then their destiny takes over and they start doing bad things. They can end up going to Hell even if they were close to Paradise. The same thing happens in reverse: a person may do many bad things, but then their destiny changes and they start doing good deeds that get them into Paradise.'

title: Gabriel's Visits Explained
content: Ibn Abbas said the Prophet asked Gabriel why he didn't visit them more often. Then a verse was revealed explaining that angels only come when God tells them to, and they have no control over their own movements.

title: Prophet's Answer about Spirit
content: I was walking with the Prophet in a field near Medina. He leaned on a stick because he was old. We passed by some Jews who asked him, 'What is the spirit?' Some of them said not to ask, but they did anyway. The Prophet (ﷺ) stood up straight and I thought he was thinking deeply. Then he said, 'The knowledge about the spirit belongs to God. You have only been given a little bit of knowledge.' After that, some Jews said to each other, 'We told you not to ask him!'

title: Jihad and Its Rewards
content: Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) said: If you go to war for Allah's cause without being forced, He promises that either you'll enter Paradise or return home with what you earned as a reward or the money you took.

title: Fighting for the Right Reason
content: A man asked the Prophet: 'Some people fight because of pride, some for bravery, and others to show off. Which one is fighting for Allah?' The Prophet (ﷺ) replied: 'The person who fights so that Islam becomes stronger, is fighting for Allah.'

title: Victory for Some Muslims
content: The Prophet (ﷺ) said some of his followers will keep winning over others until the Day of Judgment comes.

title: Following Allah's Laws
content: I heard the Prophet say: A group of my followers will keep following Allah's laws. They won't be harmed by those who disagree with them or try to stop them, until the Day of Judgment comes.

title: The Prophet Meets Musailama
content: The Prophet (ﷺ) stood in front of Musailama and his friends. He said to Musailama: 'Even if you ask me for this piece, I won't give it to you.' The Prophet (ﷺ) told him that he couldn't escape what Allah had planned for him. If Musailama turned away from Islam, Allah would punish him.

title: Prophet's Answer About Spirit
content: Ibn Masud was walking with the Prophet in a field near Medina. The Jews saw them and asked each other not to ask the Prophet about the spirit, fearing he might say something they wouldn't like. But one of them stood up and said, 'O Abal-Qasim, what is the spirit?' The Prophet (ﷺ) stayed quiet for a moment, then answered: 'They're asking you about the Spirit. Say that the Spirit's knowledge belongs to my Lord. You've only been given a little bit of knowledge.'

title: Jihad: Paradise or Return
content: The Prophet (ﷺ) said, 'Allah promises that if you go to fight for Him and believe in His word, He will either let you enter Paradise as a martyr, or bring you back home with rewards and what you earned.'

title: Be Firm in Your Prayer
content: When you ask Allah for something, be clear and direct. Don't say 'if You wish' because no one can force Allah to do something He doesn't want to do.

title: Visiting Ali and Fatima
content: One night, the Prophet visited me and my wife Fatima. He said, 'Why don't you pray tonight?' I replied, 'Our lives are in Allah's hands. When He wants us to live, we will.' The Prophet (ﷺ) left without answering. As he walked away, I heard him say, 'People are more argumentative than anything else'.

title: Believers are like Fresh Plants
content: Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) said: A believer is like a fresh green plant that bends in the wind. When the wind stops, it stands straight again. This shows how believers deal with problems - they get upset but soon calm down. An unbeliever is like a strong pine tree that stays stiff until Allah takes it away.

title: Nations Before You
content: Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) was speaking to the people. He said that the time left for us on earth is like the time between the afternoon prayer and sunset. The people who got the Torah worked hard with it until midday, then they were tired and given one share each. Then the people who got the Gospel worked with it until almost the afternoon prayer, then they were tired and given one share each too. Now you have the Quran and you've worked with it until sunset, so you get two shares each. The people of the Torah said to Allah, 'These people did less work but got more reward.' Allah asked them if He had taken away anything from their reward, and they said no. Then Allah said that this is His favor given to whoever He chooses.

title: Pledge of Allegiance
content: I, 'Ubada bin As-Samit, and some others gave a promise to Allah's Messenger (ﷺ). He said: 'I want you to promise me that (1) you will only worship Allah, (2) you won't steal, (3) you won't have sex outside marriage, (4) you won't kill your children, (5) you won't spread false rumors about people, and (6) you'll do what I tell you to do when it's good. If you keep this promise, you'll get a reward from Allah. If you break one of these rules and get punished here on earth, that punishment will make up for your sin. But if Allah forgives you, then He decides whether to punish or forgive you.'

title: Solomon and His Wives
content: Prophet Solomon had sixty wives. He said he would sleep with them all so each could have a baby boy to fight for Allah. But only one of his wives gave birth, and her child was deformed. If Solomon had said 'If Allah wills,' maybe all the other wives would have had healthy sons.

title: Visiting a Sick Bedouin
content: The Prophet (ﷺ) visited a sick bedouin and said to him, 'Don't worry, your illness might be a way for Allah to forgive your sins.' The bedouin replied, 'No, it's just an old man's fever that will make him die soon.' The Prophet (ﷺ) agreed with him.

title: Sleeping in Late is Allah's Will
content: Abu Qatada said the Prophet told people that when they sleep late and miss their morning prayer, it's because Allah has taken control of their souls. He lets them rest until He decides to wake them up again. When the sun rises, the Prophet got up and prayed.

title: Two Men Argue and Fight
content: A Muslim man and a Jewish man argued. The Muslim said, 'I swear by the One who made Muhammad (ﷺ) special.' The Jew replied, 'I swear by the One who made Moses special.' The Muslim got angry and hit the Jew. The Jew went to see the Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) and told him what happened. The Prophet (ﷺ) said, 'Don't say I'm better than Moses. On Judgment Day, everyone will faint except me. When I wake up, I'll see Moses standing near God's throne. I won't know if he fainted like others or was spared by God.'

title: Dajjal Will Not Enter Medina
content: Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) said that Dajjal will come to Medina. But the angels will be guarding it. If Allah wants, neither Dajjal nor a plague can reach Medina.

title: Prophet's Special Prayer
content: The Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) said, 'Each prophet has a special prayer that Allah always answers. I wish to keep my special prayer so I can use it to help my followers on the Day of Judgment.'

title: Dream of a Well
content: Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) said: I had a dream where I was standing by a well. I drew water from it until Allah told me to stop. Then Abu Bakr took the bucket and drew some more, but he struggled a bit. Umar took the bucket next and it turned into a big drum. He drew so much water that people could drink their fill and give water to their camels.

title: Help Those in Need
content: When a beggar or someone who needs something comes to the Prophet, he tells his companions to help that person and they will be rewarded. The Prophet (ﷺ) believes Allah will also do what He wants through him.

title: Be Clear in Your Prayers
content: The Prophet (ﷺ) said: Don't say 'If Allah wishes' when asking for something. Be firm and direct in your prayer. Allah does what He wants, no one can change His mind.

title: Moses Meets Khadir
content: Ibn Abbas and Al-Hurr disagreed about a companion of Moses. Ibn Abbas asked Ubai bin Ka'b if he knew anything about it. Ubai said he heard the Prophet say that while Moses was with some Israelites, someone came to him and asked if there was anyone more knowledgeable than him. Moses said no. Then Allah told Moses that Khadir was more learned. Moses wanted to meet Khadir, so Allah gave him a sign: a fish. When Moses lost the fish, he went back to where it happened and met Khadir. A servant of Moses forgot to tell him about the fish, but then they found Khadir and something important happened between them.

title: Prophet's Planned Campsite
content: Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) said that if Allah wills, they would camp in Khaif Bani Kinana the next day. This is where the pagans had taken an oath against him, specifically at Al-Muhassab.

title: Conquering Ta'if
content: Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) besieged the people of Ta'if but didn't conquer it. He said they would return home if Allah wanted. The next day, many Muslims were injured in battle. Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) said they might return home again. This made them happy and he smiled.

title: Angels React to Allah's Decree
content: The Prophet (ﷺ) said: When Allah decides something in the heavens, the angels beat their wings in agreement. They do this because of what Allah says next: 'Until when fear is gone from people's hearts.' Then the angels ask, 'What did your Lord say?' And people reply, 'He spoke the truth. He is the Most High and Great'.

title: Allah Listens to Prophet's Recitation
content: The Prophet (ﷺ) said that Allah listens more carefully when he recites the Quran in a clear and pleasant voice. A companion explained that this means reciting out loud.

title: Adam's Response on Judgment Day
content: The Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) said: 'On the Day of Resurrection, Allah will call out to Adam. Adam will say,

title: Aisha's Jealousy for Khadija
content: I, Aisha, never felt jealous of any woman as much as I did of Khadija. Allah told the Prophet to give her good news about a special palace in Paradise.

title: Allah's Love for a Person
content: The Prophet (ﷺ) said that if Allah loves someone, He tells Gabriel to love them too. Then Gabriel makes an announcement in the heavens saying everyone should love this person. As a result, all the people in heaven and on earth love them.

title: Angels Visit Us at Night
content: Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) said that angels visit us in the day and night. They gather before Asr and Fajr prayers. The angels who stay with us overnight go up to Allah and tell Him how we are doing. They say, 'When we left them, they were praying, and when we came back, they were still praying'.

title: Paradise for Those Who Repent
content: Abu Dharr said the Prophet told him that Gabriel came and gave good news. The news was that anyone who dies without worshiping anything but Allah will go to Paradise. Abu Dharr asked, 'Even if they commit theft or have illegal sex?' Gabriel replied, 'Yes, even if they do those things.'

title: Before Sleeping, Say This
content: When you go to bed, say: 'God, I trust in You. I leave all my problems with You. I believe in the Quran and in Muhammad (ﷺ) as Your Prophet.' If you die that night, you will be a good Muslim. If you wake up alive, you will get a reward.

title: Allah's Messenger Prays for Victory
content: Abdullah bin Abi Aufa said that the Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) said on the Day of the Clans: 'O Allah, defeat the clans and shake them.'

title: Praying with a Balanced Voice
content: Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) was in Mecca when he recited the Quran. The pagans heard him and criticized the Quran. Allah said, 'Don't pray loudly so they can hear you, but also don't whisper so your friends can't hear.' Find a middle ground where your friends can hear you, but not too loudly that others outside notice.

title: Time is in Allah's Hands
content: Allah said that the son of Adam hurts Him by wasting time. Allah is Time and He controls everything, including day and night.

title: Fasting is a Reward
content: The Prophet (ﷺ) said that Allah told him: Fasting is for Me. I will give a reward to those who fast, as they leave their desires and food for My sake. Fasting protects us from Hell and brings two rewards: one when we break our fast, and another when we meet Allah in the afterlife. The smell of someone's mouth while fasting is better than musk in Allah's sight.

title: Job's Story: A Lesson
content: Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) said to his friend Abu Huraira: 'One day Job was washing himself. Suddenly gold locusts started falling from the sky and he collected them in his clothes. His Lord spoke to him, saying, 'Job, didn't I make you rich?' Job replied, 'Yes, but I don't want to stop receiving Your blessings'.

title: Last Third of the Night
content: Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) said: Every night when it's almost morning, God descends to the nearest heaven and asks if anyone is praying, asking for something, or seeking forgiveness. If someone does, He answers their prayer, grants their request, or forgives them.

title: We Are Last but First
content: Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) said: 'Muslims are the last to come on earth, but we will be the first to enter Paradise on Judgment Day. Allah says: 'Spend in charity and I will give you more back.''

title: We Are Last but First
content: Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) said: 'Muslims are the last people to come, but we will be the first on the Day of Judgement. Allah says to us: 'Spend your money in helping others, and I will give you even more.''

title: Gabriel's Message to the Prophet
content: Abu Huraira said that Gabriel told the Prophet: 'Khadija is coming with food or a drink. Tell her that Allah says hello and that she will have a special palace in Paradise made of Qasab, where it will be quiet and peaceful.'

title: Allah's Reward for the Righteous
content: The Prophet (ﷺ) said that Allah told him He has prepared a great reward for His good slaves. This reward is so amazing, no one can imagine it: not even their eyes can see it, nor their ears hear it, nor their minds think of it.

title: Prophet's Night Prayer
content: When the Prophet prayed at night, he would say: 'Praise be to You, Allah. You are the light of the world and the universe. Praise be to You for keeping everything in order. Praise be to You as the ruler of all that exists. Your words are true, Your promises are true, meeting You is true, Paradise is true, Hell is true, prophets are true, and the Day of Judgment will come. I surrender to You, believe in You, depend on You, and ask for forgiveness for my past and future sins, both public and secret. I worship only You, no one else deserves to be worshipped.'

title: Aisha's Innocence Revealed
content: `Aisha said she didn't think Allah would reveal a special message to prove her innocence. She hoped the Prophet might have a dream showing she was innocent. Allah revealed: 'Those who spread false rumors are a group among you...'

title: Allah's Reward for Good Intentions
content: Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) said: Allah says that if a person intends to do something bad but doesn't do it, He writes it as a good deed. If someone intends to do something good but doesn't do it, Allah still writes it as a good deed. But if they actually do the good deed, Allah rewards them with ten good deeds for every one they do.

title: Allah's Promise to the Womb
content: Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) said that Allah created all things. When He finished creating, the womb stood up and asked Allah for protection from people who break family ties. Allah promised the womb: 'I will be kind to those who are kind to you, and I will not be kind to those who break ties with you.' The Quran says: 'Would you cause trouble in the world if you had power? Would you break your family ties?'

title: Rain Comes After Prayer
content: Zaid bin Khalid said that it rained after the Prophet prayed for rain. The Prophet (ﷺ) then said: 'Allah says,

title: Allah Loves Those Who Love Him
content: Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) said that Allah told him: 'If My slaves love meeting Me, I also love meeting them. And if they dislike meeting Me, I too dislike it.'

title: Allah is as We Think
content: Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) said: Allah told us, 'I am like what my slave thinks of Me. I can do for him what he believes I can do.'

title: Allah Forgives a Sinner
content: Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) said: A man who never did any good deeds thought that if he died, his family should burn him. They would throw half of the ashes in the sea and half on land. He believed Allah would punish him severely if He found out. But Allah ordered the sea and earth to collect the ashes. Then Allah asked the recreated man why he had done this. The man said it was because he was afraid of Allah. So Allah forgave him.

title: Forgiveness and Repentance
content: The Prophet (ﷺ) said: If someone does something wrong and then says 'I have made a mistake, please forgive me', Allah will say 'My slave knows I forgive sins and punish for them. So I forgive him.' Then the person might do something wrong again and ask for forgiveness. Allah will say the same thing. This can happen many times.

title: The Man Who Faced Judgment
content: One day, the Prophet told a story about a man from long ago. This man had wealth and children, but when he was dying, he asked his sons what kind of father he was to them. They said he was good. But then he confessed that he hadn't done any good deeds in front of Allah. He worried that if Allah punished him, it would be very bad. So, he told his sons to do something strange when he died: burn his body, crush the ashes into dust, and scatter the dust on a windy day. His children promised to do this, and they did. When they scattered his ashes, Allah brought them back together and made him a living person again. Then Allah asked him why he had done what he did, and the man said it was because of fear of Allah's punishment. But Allah forgave him because of mercy.

title: Faith as Small as a Seed
content: The Prophet (ﷺ) said: 'On the Day of Judgment, I will ask Allah to let people with even a tiny bit of faith in their hearts enter Paradise. It doesn't matter how small it is - just one mustard seed's worth. Then I'll ask again for those who have any amount of faith at all.'

title: Muhammad's Intercession on Judgment Day
content: Some people from Basra visited Anas bin Malik. They asked him about the Hadith of Intercession, and he told them a story. On the Day of Resurrection, people will rush to Adam like waves. He'll say they should go to Abraham because he's close to Allah. Then they'll go to Moses, who spoke directly with Allah. Moses says they should go to Jesus, who is special. Jesus says they should go to Muhammad (ﷺ). When they come to me, I'll agree to help them. I'll ask Allah for permission and praise Him with words He doesn't know now. Then I'll be given the power to speak and my requests will be granted. I'll say 'My followers!' and then some people will be taken out of Hell because of their faith. This will happen three times, each time more people being saved. Finally, Allah will say that anyone who said 'There is no god but Allah' will be saved.

title: Last to Enter Paradise
content: Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) said: A person will come out of Hell crawling. His Lord says, 'Enter Paradise.' The man replies, 'Paradise is full.' This happens three times. Each time he gives the same answer. Allah then says, 'Ten worlds are yours'.

title: What Happens After Death
content: When you die, your Lord will talk to you directly. There won't be anyone between you and Allah. You'll look at the good things you've done in life on your right side, but they won't help you now. You'll look at the bad things you've done on your left side, but they still can't save you. And when you look ahead, you'll see the Fire of Hell waiting for you. So try to avoid going there by doing good deeds and giving charity, even if it's just a small thing like a date.

title: The Prophet's Encounter with a Jew
content: A Jewish priest came to the Prophet. He said that on Judgment Day, Allah will hold all creation in one hand and say 'I am the King!' The Prophet (ﷺ) smiled at this idea, showing he believed it was true. Then the Prophet recited a verse from the Quran: 'They don't understand Allah's greatness.'

title: Allah's Judgment on Judgement Day
content: Ibn Umar said that the Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) told him that when a person dies, Allah will ask them about their actions in life. Allah will screen them from others and ask if they did certain things. The person will reply 'yes'. Then Allah will ask again and the person will say 'yes' again. Finally, Allah will forgive all their sins.

title: Adam and Moses Debate
content: Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) said that Adam and Moses argued. Moses said to Adam, 'You made your children leave paradise.' Adam replied, 'Moses, you were chosen by Allah for a special job and He spoke directly to you. But I was created before my children were born. This problem was already decided for me.' Adam won the argument.

title: Believers Seek Adam's Help
content: On the Day of Resurrection, believers will gather and ask each other to find someone to pray for them to Allah. They'll go to Adam and say: 'You're Adam, created by Allah with His own hands, taught everything. Please help us.' Adam will say he's not suitable, then explain that he made a mistake.

title: Prophet Muhammad's Journey
content: Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) was sleeping in the Sacred Mosque when three angels came to him. One of them said, 'Which one is he?' The second angel replied, 'He is the best of them.' The third angel said, 'Take the best of them.' They took Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) and placed him beside the well of Zamzam. Gabriel was in charge of him. He cut open his chest and washed it with Zamzam water. Then he filled his chest with gold and wisdom. Gabriel ascended with him to the heavens, where they met different prophets, including Adam, Abraham, Moses, and others. They asked about Allah's Messenger (ﷺ), and when they found out who he was, they welcomed him. On each heaven, they said, 'Who is it?' and 'Has he been sent for?' Gabriel replied that he was Muhammad (ﷺ), and that he had been sent. When they reached the seventh heaven, Moses asked Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) how many prayers his followers were required to perform. The Prophet (ﷺ) replied that they were 50 in a day and night. Moses said this was too much for them, so the Prophet went back to Allah to ask him to reduce it. This happened five times until the number of prayers was reduced to five. Allah said that every good deed would be rewarded as tenfold, but his followers only had to perform five prayers.

title: Paradise's People are Satisfied
content: The Prophet (ﷺ) said: Allah will speak to the people of Paradise. They will say 'We're here, our Lord.' Allah will ask if they're happy. They'll say yes because He gave them what no one else has. Then Allah will offer something even better. They'll ask what that is. Allah will give His pleasure and never be angry with them again.

title: Paradise and the Farmer
content: The Prophet (ﷺ) was teaching a group of people when a Bedouin joined them. The Prophet (ﷺ) said that someone from Paradise would ask Allah if he could work on some land. Allah would say, 'Don't you have everything you need?' The man would reply, 'Yes, but I want to work.' Allah would let him and he would plant seeds. Within seconds, the plants would grow, ripen, be harvested, and piled up like mountains. Then Allah would say, 'Take it all, O son of Adam, because nothing satisfies you.' A Bedouin in the group said, 'That man must be from Quraish or Ansar, they are farmers after all.' The Prophet (ﷺ) smiled.

title: Biggest Sins in Islam
content: Abdullah asked the Prophet what Allah considers to be the biggest sin. The Prophet (ﷺ) said it's when people think someone else is like Allah and should be worshipped instead of Him. Abdullah thought about this for a moment, then asked what the next big sin was. The Prophet (ﷺ) replied that it's when someone kills their own child because they're afraid the child will take food from them. Abdullah asked again, and the Prophet said the next big sin is having sex with someone else's wife.

title: Allah Hears All Our Words
content: Three men met near the Kaaba. Two of them had big bellies but not much sense. One said, 'Does Allah hear everything we say?' The other replied, 'Only if we speak loudly.' But a third man disagreed and said, 'If He hears us when we're loud, then He must also hear us when we whisper.' This led to the revelation of a verse from the Quran: 'Your ears, eyes, and skin will testify against you unless you remember that Allah is always listening'.

title: Ibn Abbas on the Quran
content: Ibn Abbas said, 'Why ask people about their books when you have Allah's Book, which is the latest and purest revelation from Allah? You read it as it is written.'

title: Ask Allah's Book First
content: 'Abdullah bin 'Abbas said to the Muslims: You can find all the answers in your own book. The people who came before you changed some of God's words and wrote their own. Your book is complete and correct, so why ask them? It has everything you need.

title: Prophet Muhammad's Revelation
content: Ibn Abbas said the Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) had trouble receiving messages from Allah. He would move his lips as if reciting, but he wasn't actually reading yet. Allah revealed a verse saying it was His job to collect and give the Prophet the ability to read. When Gabriel came with the message, the Prophet would listen quietly. Then, when Gabriel left, the Prophet would recite what Gabriel had said.

title: Praying with the Right Voice
content: Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) was hiding in Mecca. When he led his friends in prayer, he would normally speak loudly while reading from the Quran. If the non-Muslims heard him, they would insult the Quran and its message. Allah told Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) to pray quietly so that others wouldn't hear and mock the Quran. But He also said not to whisper too softly, because then his friends might not be able to hear him. So, Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) was advised to find a balance between speaking clearly and quietly.

title: Prayer Should be Quiet
content: Aisha said that a verse was revealed about prayer. The verse says not to pray too loudly and not to whisper. It's about finding a quiet way to pray.

title: Reciting the Quran Loudly
content: Abu Huraira said that the Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) said: 'Whoever does not recite the Quran in a clear voice is not one of us.'

title: Two Men to Admire
content: The Prophet (ﷺ) said: Do not wish to be like anyone except two people. The first is someone who has the Quran and reads it day and night. If you had what he has, you would do the same as him. The second is someone who has wealth and uses it correctly. If you had what he has, you would use it the same way.

title: Two Types to Imitate
content: The Prophet (ﷺ) said: Don't wish to be like anyone except two people. One is a person who knows the Quran and recites it day and night. The other is someone with wealth, who spends it for Allah's sake during the day and at night.

title: Martyrs Go Straight to Heaven
content: Our Prophet told us that whoever is killed in battle will go directly to Paradise.

title: Don't Believe False Claims
content: Aisha said: If someone tells you that the Prophet hid some of Allah's message, don't believe them. Allah said to the Prophet: 'Tell the people what I have sent down to you. If you don't, then you haven't really shared My message.'

title: Biggest Sin in Allah's Sight
content: A man asked the Prophet: 'What is the biggest sin in Allah's sight?' The Prophet (ﷺ) replied: 'To think that someone else is equal to Allah, who created you.' The man asked again: 'What's next?' The Prophet (ﷺ) said: 'Killing your own child so they don't share your food.' Again, the man asked: 'What's next?' The Prophet (ﷺ) answered: 'Having an affair with your neighbor's wife.' Then Allah revealed a verse confirming this.

title: Comparing Our Time
content: The Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) said: 'Your time in the world is like the time between the Asr prayer and sunset. The people who had the Torah worked with it until midday, but couldn't do more. They got a reward of one Qirat each. Then the people who had the Gospel did the same until the Asr prayer. They also got a reward of one Qirat each. You Muslims were given the Quran and you followed it until sunset. So, you get two Qirats as a reward. The people with the old books said, 'The Muslims worked less but got more.' Allah asked them if He had been unfair to them. They said no. Then Allah said, 'This is My blessing that I give to whoever I choose.'

title: Best Deeds According to the Prophet
content: A man asked the Prophet what good deeds are. The Prophet (ﷺ) said: 'First, pray at the right time every day. Second, take care of your parents. Third, join a fight for Allah's cause.'

title: Why Allah's Messenger Gave Some People More
content: The Prophet (ﷺ) received some property and gave it to some people. He didn't give it to others, even though they were unhappy about this. The Prophet (ﷺ) explained that he gave more to those who were impatient and dissatisfied in their hearts. He left out those who were content with what they had, because Allah had blessed them already. `Amr bin Taghlib was one of the people who received less property.

title: The Prophet's Promise
content: The Prophet (ﷺ) said: 'My Lord says that if a person comes closer to Him, He will come closer too. If the person takes one step forward, Allah will take two steps forward. And if the person walks towards Him, Allah will run towards them.'

title: Getting Closer to Allah
content: The Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) said that if a person comes closer to Allah in prayer or good actions, Allah will come even closer to them. If they take one step forward, Allah takes two steps towards them. And if they move an arm's length closer, Allah moves a whole body length closer.

title: Fasting is a Reward
content: The Prophet (ﷺ) said that God says: 'Every wrong thing you do can be forgiven. Fasting is for me, so I will reward it. The smell of someone who is fasting is better to me than the smell of musk.'

title: Don't think you're better
content: The Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) said that God told him: 'It's not right for a servant to say they are better than Jonah, the son of Matta.'

title: Prophet's Recitation in Mecca
content: Abdullah bin Al-Maghaffal saw the Prophet riding his camel on the day of Conquest. He was reciting Surat-al-Fath or part of it with a strong and pleasant voice. Mu'awiya also tried to imitate this style, but said he didn't want people to gather around him.

title: Don't Trust or Reject
content: The people of the Torah would read it in Hebrew and explain it to Muslims in Arabic. The Prophet (ﷺ) said, 'Do not believe them completely or reject their words. Instead, say: We believe in Allah and what He has revealed.'

title: Jews Brought to Prophet
content: Ibn Umar said that two Jews were brought to the Prophet. They had committed a serious crime. The Prophet (ﷺ) asked the Jews what they usually did with people who broke this law. They replied, 'We shame them and mark their faces.' The Prophet (ﷺ) said, 'Bring the Torah.' They got it and asked a one-eyed man to read from it. He kept reading until he stopped at a part where he put his hand on it. The Prophet (ﷺ) told him to lift his hand up. When he did, they saw the verse about stoning people who break this law. The Jews said, 'We know about this verse but we hide it.' The Prophet (ﷺ) then ordered that the two sinners be stoned to death.

title: Allah Loves Quran Recitation
content: The Prophet (ﷺ) said: Allah does not listen to anything as much as He listens when a Prophet recites the Quran in a clear and pleasant voice.

title: Aisha's Innocence Revealed
content: When people said bad things about Aisha, she went to sleep knowing she was innocent. She didn't think Allah would make a special revelation just for her. But then Allah revealed the Quranic verses that proved her innocence: 'Those who spread false rumors'.

title: Prophet's Beautiful Recitation
content: Al-Bara' heard the Prophet reciting Surat at-Tin waz Zaitun during the night prayer. He said he had never heard anyone with a better voice or way of reading than the Prophet.

title: Praying Out Loud
content: The Prophet (ﷺ) was hiding in Mecca. He would read the Quran out loud. The non-Muslims heard him and insulted the Quran and its message. Allah told the Prophet not to pray too loudly or too quietly.

title: Calling the Adhan in Open Spaces
content: Abu Sa'id said to Abdullah bin Abdur-Rahman, 'When you're with your sheep or in a desert and want to call the prayer time, speak loudly. This way, no one - human or Jinn - will hear it without being a witness for you on Judgment Day.' He heard this from the Prophet.

title: Prophet's Recitation During Menses
content: The Prophet (ﷺ) used to read the Quran while sitting with his head in my lap. This was when I had my period.

title: Umar and Hisham's Recitation
content: Umar bin Al-Khattab heard Hisham reciting Surat-al-Furqan. Umar noticed it was different from how the Prophet taught him. He waited until Hisham finished praying, then asked who had taught him to recite like that. Hisham said the Prophet did. Umar wasn't sure if he was telling the truth. So, he took Hisham to the Prophet and said, 'I heard this man reciting Surat-al-Furqan differently.' The Prophet (ﷺ) told Umar to let Hisham go and recite again. When Hisham did, the Prophet said it was revealed like that. Then the Prophet asked Umar to recite his way. The Prophet (ﷺ) said it was also correct. He explained that the Quran can be recited in seven different ways.

title: Why Do Good Deeds
content: Imran asked the Prophet, 'Why should I do good things?' The Prophet (ﷺ) replied, 'You'll find it easy to do what leads you to your destiny.'

title: Prophet's Words on Good Deeds
content: The Prophet (ﷺ) was at a funeral. He took a stick and scraped the ground with it. He said, 'Each of you will go to either Hell or Paradise.' People asked if they should just rely on this and not do good deeds. The Prophet (ﷺ) replied, 'Keep doing good deeds because it's easy to do what is meant for each person.' He then read from the Quran: 'Those who give charity and are faithful to Allah'.

title: Mercy Precedes Allah's Anger
content: The Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) said: I heard him say that before He created anything, Allah wrote a book. In this book, it says that His mercy comes before His anger. This book is written on the Throne.

title: Allah's Mercy Precedes Anger
content: Abu Hurairah said he heard the Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) say: 'Before creating anything, Allah wrote a book that says His mercy comes before His anger. This is written on the Throne.'

title: Abu Musa's Story About Oaths
content: There was a man from the tribe of Bani Taimul-lah who sat with Abu Musa Al-Ash'ari. They were eating together when he refused to eat chicken because he had taken an oath not to eat it. Abu Musa told him about a time when they asked the Prophet for mounts, but he said he didn't have any. Later, some camels from war booty arrived and the Prophet gave them five fat camels instead. The men were surprised that the Prophet broke his own oath by giving them better mounts. He explained to them that if something better comes along, it's okay to do that and make up for the broken oath.

title: Delegates from Abdul Qais
content: Some people from the tribe of Mudar came to see the Prophet. They said they couldn't visit him often because their enemies blocked the way. The Prophet (ﷺ) told them to do four good things: believe in Allah, pray regularly, give charity, and share one-fifth of any war spoils with the poor. He also told them not to drink certain types of wine.

title: Painters on the Day of Judgement
content: Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) said that people who draw pictures will be punished on the Day of Resurrection. They will be told to bring their drawings to life, but they won't be able to do it.

title: Painters on the Day of Judgement
content: Ibn Umar said that the Prophet said: 'People who paint pictures will be punished on the Day of Resurrection. They will be told,

title: Challenge of Creation
content: The Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) said: Allah says that people who try to create something like Him are very unfair. He challenges them to make even the smallest things, such as an ant or a grain of wheat or barley.

title: Believers and the Quran
content: The Prophet (ﷺ) said: A person who reads the Quran is like a citron - good to eat and smells nice. If someone reads the Quran but doesn't act on it, they're like an aromatic plant that smells good but tastes bitter. Someone who doesn't read the Quran at all is like a colocynth - it's bitter and has no smell.

title: Prophet's View on Soothsayers
content: Some people asked the Prophet about soothsayers. He said they are nothing. They replied that sometimes their predictions come true. The Prophet (ﷺ) explained that when a Jinn (a supernatural being) secretly takes information from heaven and shares it with a soothsayer, the soothsayer mixes this truth with 100 lies.

title: People Who Misuse the Quran
content: The Prophet (ﷺ) said that some people from the East will come who read the Quran but it doesn't stay in their hearts. They leave Islam like an arrow goes through its target and never go back unless the arrow somehow returns to the bow on its own. People asked for signs of these people, and the Prophet said they will be known by shaving their beards and heads.

title: Two Important Phrases
content: The Prophet (ﷺ) said that there are two phrases that Allah loves very much and are easy to say. These phrases are 'Glory be to Allah, and praise is due to Him' and 'Glory be to the Great Allah'. He also said that if someone recites these phrases in their daily prayers, it will bring them great reward.
